Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: EstaHouston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a meeting. At first I was worried because i knew it was very large. I asked for my room to be close to where the meeting rooms were located. This worked out perfectly. It only took me a few minutes each day to get to my meeting. As I started exploring the hotel i realized it was very well laid out even thougfh it was large.It was actually easy to make your way around the beautiful hotel and had so many wonderful restaurants easily accessible to you. Of course the Forum shops and restaurants were great also.The conceirge was very helpful in planning my dinners and shows before I came to Vegas. This was my first real visit to Vegas and i really wanted to maximize my free time from the meeting.I would be very happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed 3rd time round”
Reviews.Author: Nadia911
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Caesars Palace on every visit to Vegas. On this particular visit I wanted it to run smoothly because it was a surprise for my boyfriend's 30th and I love the location and shops onsite. I emailed several times to confirm and requested early check in ahead of time. Reservations advised that they could not guarantee early check in and that I could not book an additional night as the booking was made through Travelocity. I took my chances and turned up hoping to get in early. We arrived and were assigned a room upon arrival. No-one offered to assist with luggage to our rooms, so we hauled them across the entire hotel til we reached our room. Once we reached the room, it was already occupied and was due to be vacated by the couple as the view was of a roof (giving me a view of a roof even though I had told them it was for a surprise 30th is quite poor on service but I understand views cannot be guaranteed). I called down to Reception who moved me to another room which they did, I waited over 20 minutes for Security to be sent up to open the door for me. No keys to the room were sent up with Security, we waited an additional hour (freshened up in this time) and I then called down to ask when our keys would be delivered, we then waited at least another 30 minutes to receive these. The Forum Tower Room was neat, but in need of attention, tv stand needed repainting and the surface was dusty, never mind, we're in Vegas. The hairdryer provided in the room blew up and it took quite some time to receive another one delaying us in reaching our dinner reservation. WI-FI- $14.99 per person for wifi access in your ROOM ONLY. If you want wifi on the entire property its $24.99, when I asked if my partner and I could both use the one wifi, I was advised that was not an option and we would have to pay for two separate accounts. Ridiculous! Upon checking out, I gave this feedback nicely to the Receptionist and asked that some of the items on the bill be waived (there were also items on the bill for which we were billed and did not use), we had 3 days of the wifi waived and were still charged for 2 days. She seemed to show little care about my experience even though I had explained that this was my third visit, I would of expected a few kind words to apologise for any inconveniences, but instead a blank "I dont care" expression and that was it. With so many other beautiful hotels in Vegas, I will definitely stay elsewhere next time. The Cosmopolitan is absolutely amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay, watch the valet”
Reviews.Author: econ0513
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conferance in the palace tower. The room was clean and large. This was must better than the stay that I had at the Bellagio. For anyone who has been to Vegas before you know how many things are availble at caesar's (lots). I would recommend that you self park, the valet is free however they did put a large scratch and a dent on my rental car. I used the GPS suction cup to pull the dent. I was able to go to a local car store and use polish compound to get the scratch out, since I did get the rental insurance. No problem, cleared the rental inspection. This is why I gave 4/5 instead of 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “OK but Not as Clean as Expected, No Flat Screen TV”
Reviews.Author: PAtraveler109
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business in the Roman Towers & was disappointed to see the extremely thick, grey-black soot/dust that didn't seem to be cleaned in the large, square vent outside the bathroom. Also noticed a lot of dust behind the bed and in the bathroom on the metal stand on the vanity. Also you need to hang your clothes in an open area in the bathroom, which of course gets your clothes damp when you shower---very poor design. The bed cover is very thin--not at all a quilt of any kind. The TV was old and not a flat-screen. In addition there was no refrigerator in the room---it's all an extra, extra upgrade if you want a flat-screen TV and a refrigerator in your room. You could hear your neighboring guest run the water through the walls, which was a disappointment too. Pool was nice but isn't open late at night. If you want to use the business center there is a minimum charge--not complimentary. Overall ok but expected better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel for Business Visitors”
Reviews.Author: RamanaGenX
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesar's palace once again while on a business trip to Las Vegas. The hotel limo punctually picked me at the airport, offered refreshments and beverage before setting foot at the hotel! The suite was amazing as usual. Had a great view of the fountains of Bellagio. Room service was exceptional. The room service menu was better than menu's at top 5 star restaurants. Seriously these guys are the best in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Slow service.....”
Reviews.Author: LaurenB2010
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Service is unbelievably slow for such a large place. Rented a cabana at pool for top dollar. Had to hunt the servers down for food and drinks and we are big tippers.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service, Beautiful Place, As Long as You Dont Mind the Walking”
Reviews.Author: RedLily1968
Reviews.Content: Although I've been going to Vegas for 20+ years this was my first time staying at Caesars. The front desk staff was professional and friendly. Everyone we encountered from the dealers, cashiers and random employees walking by were friendly and helpful. We were in the Palace Tower and although it wasnt a spectacular room or great view it was clean. Only two negatives for me as someone who likes to use the rewards card and charge meals to the room, etc was the buffet was closed due to remodeling and not every restaurant on Caesars property lets you charge your meal to the room. Secondly, this place is HUGE. If you dont mind walking this will not be a negative. You really never have to leave Caesars during your stay as there are plenty restaurants, shopping, etc but trust me theres a reason they pass out maps when you check in. Overall nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars...smokey but nice!”
Reviews.Author: mmrjgolden
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful (the new tower) and spacious. The casinos were mobbed and very smokey. The pool area is also very crowded. We were able to get a cabana for one day and it was well worth the $600+ per day. The pool opens at 9 a.m. so you need to be there to grab seats together....otherwise, it's completely full by 10 a.m. Service at the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty R
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I've ever stopped in ! When we arrived we were given a free upgrade to a suite and it was outstanding . We had an amazing view of the strip and the bellagio fountains .the pool area was also beautiful. Once in a lifetime experience!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace Forum Tower”
Reviews.Author: gmkinhawaii
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Forum Tower for 4 nights in November 2011 and returned for 5 nights in April 2012 (this review). Again, I was offered an upgrade to a room with jacuzzi in the Palace Tower; but declined due to my preference for the Forum Tower location within Caesars Palace (across from The Colosium, proximity to self parking elevators, Cypress Market, sports book area, Appian Way corridor to Palace Casino area of hotel, etc). Last stay, I had a west facing room on floor 58; this stay, I had an east facing room on floor 69. The elevator ride to floor 69 was noticably longer than the one to floor 58, but it wasn't something that was a negative. Just as I did last November, I really enjoyed my stay at Caesars Palace. However, after this stay, the fact that the beds in Caesars Palace feel really good stayed with me after I got back home and I wanted to know what made those beds feel sooo good. Turns out one of the reasons for the luxurious feel of the beds is Anachini linens on pillow top beds and down pillows. I was told by a co-worker after getting back that these are available for purchase in the Caesars store on the main floor. Just as an additional note, there will be a Nobu restaurant and boutique hotel opening within Caesars later this year (it will be replace the Centurion Tower). I didn't have a clue about who / what Nobu was so after looking this up, found he's a 'celebrity chef' and has partnered with Robert DeNiro (and others) in this venture.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoverLondon_on
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, the staff are friendly and helpful. But... The mattress was as old as the hotel and hard as a rock. The pools have general admission meaning they are open to everybody not just hotel guests. This makes it impossible to get a lounger after about 10am(which is way early in Vegas) By mid afternoon there were so many people at the pool that the walkways were packed with people laying on towels on concrete. and this was in April I can only imagine how bad it is in summer. The ice machine was empty the one night but there is ice on every floor so it was not far to get more ice. I must add again all of the staff were great but next time I would save my money and stay at the Flamingo across the street and get the same location and same hard beds and have access to Caesars palace anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed April 15-22 Augustus Tower Rm2384”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegBlondie1966
Reviews.Content: We chose Vegas as it seemed to have a little of everything , fun, romance and relaxation. Our cab driver to the hotel charged us double the going rate (we found this out later) and this set the stage for our vacation in Vegas, which just happened to be our 25th Anniversary( we were @ Ceasars 7 nights). It took an hour to check in (there were 2 lines-4 others were sitting behind the registration desk chatting about how busy it was going to be next month) we get to our turn and sigh the room booked (non-smoking King) is not available but they upgraded us to a smoking optional room with double beds in the Augustus tower 23rd floor rm2384….this is an upgrade? And to add insult to it all they neglected to inform us that we were on the 23rd floor on the PET FRIENDLY floor. Room was appeared nice …. Found hair in the tub long black and I have short blonde hair def not mine and only one set of towels , thin walls got to listen to dogs whine, bark and the comings and goings of their owners @ 4am and then there is that particular smell….(and yes we are dog lovers). Beds were horrible, bad enough we were now in a double bed when we booked a KING but the bed was lumpy, feather pillows (my husband is allergic to them) had feathers coming through and the comforter that looked so good was scratchy. Coffee maker was in room (was only going to cost $12 a day as it was a pod coffee maker) fridge was in room fully stocked so you couldn’t put your own drink it to keep it cold, there was a charge for internet and what channels we did receive on the TV would cut in and out and change on there own??? We asked about the tubs at the pool thinking we would just soak away our trouble and were told they were under renovations by the doorman only to find out later that they were actually open…sigh. Lets just go for the Buffet dinner then right so at least you can choose what you want and have a variety ….nope under renovations. I was completely let down by this trip the hotel def did not give us that caring feeling that so many others seemed to experience and yes we did try to call the front desk 4 separate occasions to speak to someone about it but the line rang 20x with no answer (either they all went home or it was the longest coffee break in history). We did check out our friends accommodations at the Flamingo and it appears that this hotel would have been a better bet as the room was spotless, had a wonderful area to sit to have coffee beginning of the day or end of a long day and they seems to have more staff on hand. Long story short the hotel fell well below our expectations and we really did not know what to expect this being our first trip we feel the hotel would be ok if you are a hard core gambler and did not expect much for amenities, comfort or if you are looking for a place for the night. Would not recommend for a special occasion it just did not measure up and it didn’t appear that the staff were up to date on things going on in the hotel and did not seem to either care or perhaps they were too short staffed (like I said we could not locate anyone to talk to on phone and the desks were lined up) we just wished we had tried it before booking for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “My first time here”
Reviews.Author: firedawg007
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that I had not stayed on the main strip before as I usually stay down on freemont street. I'm kind of an old soul and things are quite a bit cheaper there. So Caesers was overall a beautiful hotel that has lots of amenities within one really large resort. The room I paid for was a deluxe room but in all honesty didn't seem very deluxe like at all. The jet tub was broken and the air in the room did not cool properly. The room itself had a fairly comfortable bed and the bathroom was roomy. Seemed a little dated but overall not a terrible stay just not why I felt like I paid for. The concierge was quite helpful and very kind to my requests prior to arrival. Upon check in things went smoothly and not much of a wait. Room service was excellent and the room was cleaned timely while we were away each afternoon. The pools are beautiful and staff was nice and accomadating. Overall not a bad stay but for the money spent not someplace I would likely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Napier1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Las Vegas and a stay at Caesars Palace, the hotel, Casino, restaurant and shops within the complex were outstanding, we walked the strip and visited most other well known properties and we are sure Casears tops them all

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace Roman Tower”
Reviews.Author: EdMLaGrange_IL
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of the strip. Room check in was great. They got us in at 11:00 AM when normal check in was at 3:00 PM. Very clean and classy. Lots of action going on throughout the day and night. Would definitely stay here again. Restaraunts are very pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a bit threadbare and the extra charges added up”
Reviews.Author: M L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a recent weekend with friends. The price was excellent at less than $100 per night for a mid-sized room with two double beds. The best part of the staying here is the prime location on the Las Vegas strip and the famed Caesers shopping, gambling, and pools. Stepping out puts you halfway between the MGM Grand, Aria, and Luxor on one end and the new Wynn properties, the Venetian, and some of the newer buildouts on the other end of the road. The pool is huge and features less of a cheeseball scene like you might find at the Palms. Top at the list of negatives are the chintzy charges for pretty much everything. It is a $30 fee for access to a mediocre workout facility. Internet is $17 per day. There is just not much value to be had so people staying here should judge whether this complex is the best higher end option or if they should try some of the newer, shinier places that have sprung in the last ten years.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing upgraded suite!”
Reviews.Author: 604smittenkitten
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars in January with a few girlfriends and we mentioned to the front desk as we were checking in that we all had milestone events happening. $20 later and we were upgraded to an amazing suite! I'm pretty sure the bathroom was as big as the main portion of the room. Minor problem with door keys, delicious food from the cafe and noodle place. All-in-all a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “A weekend among the Gods”
Reviews.Author: Donitta21
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Caesar's Palace. Rooms were very large, recently renovated, and very comfortable. Staff was friendly, and assisted with directions to find things as this is a pretty large casino/hotel. The only negative is that since this is a fairly high end casino/hotel you won't find average gambling. Slots, tables, and restaurants for that matter are pretty high end. Not a big deal you can just go across the street and find many places near Flamingo or Margaritavile. We REALLY loved the fairly new restaurant on Caeser's property, just outside called Serendipity. A fantastic place for breakfast, great coffee, a nice menu and if you are in the mood for dessert they have some pretty awesome one of a kind choices. Also paid a visit to the spa, top notch, comfortable, clean, and great attention to detail and service. Again not cheap, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “No room at the pool & Line too long for Pure Nightclub”
Reviews.Author: DianeDZ
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at Ceasars Palace in April. Pros: 1. We stayed in the Octavius Tower which was breathtaking. 2. The staff was professional, helpful & top notch Cons: 1.There is NO room at the pools. There are SIX pools! There is a line that forms at 8:30am & you litterally have to run to snag a chair. The worst part is that they allow you as many towels as you like so people were lining up chairs with towels for thier friends who didnt arrive at the pool until noon which is incredibly inconsiderate. 2. We put our name on the list to get into Pure Nightclub at 3pm & we were assured that we would not have to pay a cover charge because we were staying at Ceasars. I asked about the music selection & was assured it was my taste. We arrived at 11pm to find a huge crowd of people waiting to get in. They were all jumbled together so there was no clear "line". We were told to go to 2 different lines by 2 different bouncers. We stood in line for 30 minutes before being let in AND were charged a $60 cover charge which was supposed to be free by showing our room key. This club is way too overhyped & marketed as the exclusive high-end hotspot & it is not. The music was lame. There was a long line at the bar & bathroom. There was also no room on the dancefloor, not that I cared to dance to the crappy pop music that they were playing. 3. The food was not very good & way overpriced. We ate all meals elsewhere after the 1st day. My Advice: If you want a fun day at the pool, get there early. The right hand side has the best sun exposure. Dont waste your time or money at Pure. We had a blast a the Palms. You spend $20 & get into Ghostbar on the roof overlooking the strip. It also has exceptional music with lots of old school jams & it a great lounge spot. That $20 also gets you into the Playboy Club which was superfun to dance at. Our favorite restaurant was The Eiffel Tower restaurant which boasts breathtaking views of the Bellagio fountain show. You can ride to the top (which is 1/2 size of the real Eiffel Tower in Paris) for an additional $10 to enjoy a panoramac view of the strip & mountains beyond. I my good, bad & ugly story will help someone out their have a more pleasurable stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “When I have to write about public safety.... Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Scott G
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a disappointment. I travel alot for work and have never been so let down by such a large hotel. My wife and I travelled to Vegas for a couples weekend and Caesars was one of a handful of hotel there I had not stayed at. Thinking my wife would enjoy the shops I booked the trip. The first day by the pool we watched the wait staff break up a fight between some sixty something's that were drunk in the middle of the day and pissed off when they came back to the pool to find someone else in their lounge chair. The wait staff did fine and told security about it when they came by hours later to document the incident. I won't elaborate about the hour plus waits for food at the pool side snack shop not the absence of wait staff to bring over priced drinks. The absolute kicker was the staff failure to help a passed out cop. I men drunk. At 3 AM my wife and I woke to what I thought was someone playing basket ball in the hall. When I went to look out the door peep hole it was just intime to witness a drunk on the hall floor in front of my room throw up. Nice. I called the front desk who patched me throught to security and we tried to talk to the guy to make sure he was OK. 30 minutes later he is still in the hall and now dry heaving. Again this is nice (sarcasm). I called the front desk again and asked for security and for someone to come clean up the vomit in front of my room. A security officer eventually made it up and got the ID from the guy (still laying on his side) on,y to find out he was a sheriff on vacation. The officer verified who he as and let him into his room, right across from ours. About 8:30 we left for breakfast only to see the vomit was still not cleaned up. I'll spare the details but it needed to be addressed and this time it was. But to get it cleaned up it took 3 employees to not give enough of a care to address it (Cameron at the front desk, the security operator and the security officer that got the drunk into his room). Not a single acknowledgement by management about the ordeal. Had I had time before my flight I would have camped out in the managers office stating my concern for public safety let alone customer service. I don't normally write reviews, good or bad, but I don't wish concerns for public safety on anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great locaton and rooms”
Reviews.Author: mayablossomprince
Reviews.Content: Clean nicely decorated great poker room rooms very big beds are very comfortable only cons are that restaurant and bars higher price but if u walk across street there is cheap drinks and reasonable meals also local calls are 150 make sure if u stay here u join there players club u get discounts at a majority of locations and u get a coupon book

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Bling average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: BluePacDog
Reviews.Content: O.K. I will admit I am not a gambler. So when I recently travelled to Vegas for a meeting I thought I would be going with a sure bet when I booked a room at Caesars. I learned that there is no such thing as a sure bet. While the property is expansive the rooms were very average. My room was large- very large. With just a bed and two chairs an armoire and a desk the place looked like it was furnished with old hotel 6 rejects and the scale too small for a large room. Rug was worn, bordering on shabby and the shower had hair ( not mine) on the floor, clearly not cleaned prior to my arrival. In addition, the lovely soaker tub had no drain plug, so no lounging in a hot bath. If you are looking for an overpriced average room but like to gamble and will spend most of your time in the casino, this is the spot for you! However, I know that you can get a similarly priced room at the Bellagio that will meet your expectations for a 285$ room. ( conference price). Clean, fresh and modern. Caesars felt old, tired and worn. Also of note. No or little sound proofing. I could hear everything the folks next door were saying when they came in at 4a.m.,loud music from the suite down the hall etc. Service excellent however, as my room was cleaned right away. Staff friendly and helpful. Plenty of amenities i.e. pools, spa, shows, etc. So there is lots to do. Average room. Gambling areas huge but dated. Think next year I will be back at Ballagio.

Reviews.Title: “Want to love it, but some caveats”
Reviews.Author: steptravel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights at the Augustus Tower in Caesar's, which is very nice and convenient to the lobby, spa and fitness center. The room was very spacious with a partial pool view. Beautiful bath with full jacuzzi tub and separate shower and toilet. When we went to the pool in the early afternoon, could not find a single lounge chair-- all were either taken or had towels draped on them to save them. Ended up sitting on ground next to pool, and we were not the only ones who had to do that. But there were plenty of the pay-to-lay bed-size lounge beds that you have to rent. Guess management figures they'd rather rent out some of those than provide enough chairs for guests. And the regular lounge chairs are crammed side by side with no space in between. OK, next day, go to the fitness center (which I love), then mosey over to pool. Knew it was a risk to not go there first thing in the morning, but still got there around maybe 11:30 and, sure enough, there were no more chairs and we ended up sitting poolside again. Kind of ridiculous. They really need to add more chairs or subtract some of the rental beds/cabanas. Love, love, love the spa - it's so relaxing and pure escape. The slots were very tight. If pool time is important to you, either get there very early, rent a cabana, or stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The bits that werent good we're made up by the willingness of staff to go beyond and make it right.”
Reviews.Author: Sean073
Reviews.Content: This place is breath taking. But after a beyond poor experience at Beijing noodle number 9 I told the front desk. Simply because I was angry and thought the message should get through. The response: "sir you should expect the best at Caesars palace, we apologise, here is a $50 credit on your bill. Eat somewhere tomorrow on us". Beautiful service. Again after room service neglected to clean the spa. On check out " we apologise we will take $30 of your bill". Besides all this, it is luxury plus.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: Fletch28_12
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday the 13th and "luckily" were given a room in the Octavius Tower. We are Diamond Members but were not guaranteed which tower we would be in other than it would be Palace and higher. Seeing it was a weekend, I didn't think we would get upgraded. There is a separate check-in for Augustus and Octavius and there was never a line-up. The room was gorgeous with a stunning view of the pools. I loved soaking in the tub after a long day of walking. (Plan on walking a further distance from Octavious to the casino, although it is closer to the pool area). All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to make our stay awesome! Lounged by the pool and there was no problem getting chairs and towels. Ate at Central Cafe for breakfast which was very good. Also, had great food at Munch-er Bar and fun times at the Seahorse Bar. You wouldn't even have to leave Caesar's if you didn't want to. Its centrally located on the strip and a bridge walk over to the Bellagio. We will be planning another trip to Caesar's!

Reviews.Title: “I came, I saw, I was disgusted”
Reviews.Author: KarenD506
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, so I was excited to stay at Caesar's Palace for the first time. I just returned from my trip yesterday. I stayed in this hotel for a conference, and I must say that the rooms in the Roman Towers was disgusting. I slept with my sweatshirt on my pillow! The staff treated me poorly whenever I needed something, and I must say that I have never had such a poor experience with a hotel stay. My family stayed at the Palazzo two weeks ago, and if I ever go back to Las Vegas, that is the hotel that I will stay at. Caesars was terrible and I would highly encourage others to find a different hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Issues and Problems But Resolution is Key”
Reviews.Author: Ohana3D
Reviews.Content: On a recent stay at Caesar's Palace my room was not available upon check-in. I was offered an upgraded smoking room at no additional charge but declined due to allergies. I was told that I would be called soon when my room was ready. Approximately 3 hours later I called and asked if the room was ready and advised that it was and to come down and pick up the keys. I was given a very nice upgraded suite. Immediately upon entering the suite there was trash everywhere, the bathroom was a mess with trash cans overflowing and the bed was unmade and covered with food. I called the front desk and told them about the room condition. They sent up security with a set of keys to a new room and escorted me to same. This room was perfect. My luggage that had been checked with valet services was another issue. Upon relocation to my new room, I began calling about sending up my bag. I was told that it was on its to my first room. I can understand that. I was told it would be rerouted. After about 30 minutes or more I still did not have my bag. I called the Bell Hop and was told they couldn't find my bag and they hanged up on me. I had one of the Bell Captains come to my room to inquire what my bag looked like. After another 30 minutes I called guest services and spoke with a delightful young lady - Ashley. She was very sympathetic and personally went to check on my bag. She advised me that the supervisor would call me with an update. A short while passed and the supervisor did in fact call me and apologized and advised that the bag had been found and was on its way up to me. For all of my trouble, Caesar's gave me a $100 credit on my bill. The room itself was very nice, a little dated in the furnishings area but certainly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Visited Again, upgraded property, good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: SarasotaTrav
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 20+ plus stay at Caesars Palace - hosted a meeting of 500+. Much improved service and venue from prior years. New restaurants are outstanding (Old Homestead Steak House, Beijing Noodle, Central), areas are being renovated and overall this property is still a great value. We have held meetings at this venue for 10+ years. Returning next year. All in all, still a great place to stay in Vegas. Don't miss Old Homestead Steakhouse. had one of my best meals ever there . . .

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's to the Rescue”
Reviews.Author: F6Driver
Reviews.Content: 1st, let me say that no hotel has ever paid more attention to my plight than Caesar's. I'm almost tempted to say that I`m glad I had trouble. The consolation was that good! And it wasn`t even their fault. Now on to the bit about the trouble. If you book through Orbitz, and your arrival is delayed, even if you try to notify the hotel by phone, all you`ll get told is that you have to contact Orbitz. And they don`t seem to care, one way or another. Even after finally arriving, all Orbitz would do about the problem was to offer us an extra night for about $250. Our front desk clerk had already offered us a SIGNIFICANTLY UPGRADED room for $175. I`ll cut to the chase, here. If you want to think you`re getting the best deal, go Orbitz. If you actually want the best deal, forget them. By the way, as a further example, the round trip airport to resort shuttle price through Orbitz was $4.00 more expensive than it would have been had we just gotten on at the airport and paid the posted rate. If you think we`ll bother campaigning for a rebate from Orbitz, after what we went through at the front desk, give your head a shake. I would block their e-mails, but in some way I like to think I`m wasting their resources by just deleting them. In the meantime, the upgrade was so fantastic, that we`re definetly going back. There`s just nothing else like it, that I`m aware of. For another example, when it became apparent that our attempts to deal with the problem via telephone to Orbitz wasn`t going to be a smooth operation, ( both the desk clerk and my wife tried to resolve the situation on the phone, and neither could get any satisfaction), they put a security guard behind us, who politely guided any subsequent guests to another line, so we were never made to feel like we were keeping anybody waiting. How`s that for consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but boring casino.”
Reviews.Author: hollyhock40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Augustus Tower at Caesars in Las Vegas. The room was very nice. Check in was wonderful and the front desk clerks were nice. We were given an upgrade for free..the room was comped from play anyway. But it does not hurt to ask for the free upgrade while holding a ten or twenty in your hand. The machines are not as exciting as other hotels on the strip and way to far spred out. I love the forum shops though. Nice selection of high end shopping. I do not know if we would ever stay there again because we are way too fond of Bellagio. I did win a little money there though.

Reviews.Title: “I expected a better experience”
Reviews.Author: RowerPower
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas for 3 nights. We usually always stay at the Bellagio but to be honest the last time we were there we felt like it was a little dated and really needs a facelift. We heard that Caesars had gone thru an exstensive renovation and we wanted to give it a try. We also enjoy the European pools that Las Vegas hotels offer and we wanted to try the Venus Pool at the hotel. When I called to make a reservation I specifically asked if the Venus Pool was open and I was assured that it was and I made our reservation. It also states on their website that it was open. So I felt comfortable that we would be able to enjoy that part of the hotel.......BOY WAS I WRONG!!! The weather the week we were there was in the mid eighties and beautiful. So when we walked down to the pool we were told by several of the people that work there that the Venus Pool would not be open for several more weeeks and there was nothing they could do. One employee even suggested that they tell people it is open only to get them to make a reservation because once you are there you are not going to leave. In addition at the normal pool if you wanted a lounge chair you had to get up at the crack of dawn to find one available and if you came down any time after that you had to pay $150 for a elevated lounge chair with a $50 min. on food and drink. Talk about a ripoff!! This was the first bad item on our list. The hotel does have some very nice restaurants and places to hangout but seems to be very smokey and it is waaaaaay to large...we kept getting lost trying to find our way back tot he room!!! Seriously!!! LOL and no it was not the alcohol!!! The Homestead restaurant at the hotel was exceptional and I highly recommend it. Not cheap but great service and food! The rooms were very nice and the staff was just ok. Overall the experience was just so so if you take our pool issue out of the equation. I would not go back that is for sure.

Reviews.Title: “the most amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharp66
Reviews.Content: stayed at caesars palace with my husband had the most amazing time the rooms are nice and clean the staff love to help you. the shops in the hotel are amazing they have jimmy choo, gucci and every designe you can think of . we went to see celien dion who was singing in the hotel was well worth seeing. There is lots of things going on around you people walking around in wedding outfits it is a fun place to be. There is a chocolate shop in caesars which is a must visit if you like chocolate it is called branigans. there is also a great ugg shop so get the latest ugg boots so take empty suite cases with you lol.the swimming pool is lovley very relaxing there is a small resturant at the entrance of the hotel were you can grab a quick sandwich.i will be going back there

Reviews.Title: “Great time, a very well run hotel. They do everything right”
Reviews.Author: Marie527
Reviews.Content: We arrived late had a fast check in. The desk clerk Emma was very pleasant ,lovely welcoming smile. The suite was beautiful. The hotel is so clean. I just can't say enough about our stay. Had a wonderful afternoon at the pool. Once again was so impressed by the staff. It was very busy and they kept smiling and looking after all the guests as they would if they were in there homes. Our whole visit was just grand.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: casalatasa
Reviews.Content: While I have stayed at nicer hotels in Las Vegas, Caesar's location makes it one of the most appealing resorts on The Strip. You can easily walk anywhere from Caesar's without issue. We recently spent a long weekend in Las Vegas, and enjoyed our stay at Caesar's. Our room was clean, well appointed and had a nice view of the mountains. We booked our room on bookit.com, and were very pleased with not only the room, but also the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and stay”
Reviews.Author: Pierchen
Reviews.Content: We booked one double queen room and 2 single rooms. Check-in was easy and smooth. One of the single rooms was not cleaned yet. As compensation the recepetion desk offered me an upgrade to a deluxe room with whirlpool and bigger bathroom. Nice. I also got a better view. Room was huge, very clean, overall a great stay. Would come back

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jga831
Reviews.Content: I came to Las Vegas to meet up with my sister and niether one of us had stayed at Ceasers before. I usally stay at the Bellagio and I was expecting a lower rent version of that hotel. I was pleasantly surprised that both the staff and the physical plant was better than expected. I would stay here again. I was also given a free upgrade to a suite which was a nice room with a sideways view of the strip. The only negative that was that the staff tried to sell me the upgrade first and only gave it to me when I declined. It would have been nice to have simply been given it or not. But, there was a nice mix of restaurants and it managed to have a smaller hotel feel than the Bellagio. And the shows have always been best at Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag!”
Reviews.Author: tuscanytwin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at Caesar's Palace. We chose the hotel for it's central location on the strip. We had specifically booked a room with two beds in the Forum Tower. Upon arrival we were told there were no rooms with 2 beds available in that tower. We were offered a room in the Octavius Tower at an additional $50 a night or a roll-away cot in a room in the Forum Tower. I didn't want to add an extra $200 plus tax to the trip and didn't fancy sleeping on a cot so we opted to just spend the first night in the Octavius. The fact that we were charged for the upgrade put me off staying there in the future. That said, the room in the Octavius was beautiful and it was hard to move into the Forum tower on night two. The second room was just okay ( parking lot view) and the air smelled stale and slightly smoky. Considering the money they are making in the casino, it seems totally ridiculous to charge $12 to use the coffee maker in the rooms. On the positve side we loved the pool area. There are a lot of lounge chairs as long as you get there in the morning. Poolside drinks are expensive - $16 plus tip for a tropical drink (but it was good!) We enjoyed the happy hour at the Trevi restaurant. If you sit at the bar from 2 to 6 pm all drinks are half price and they have delicious appies for $6.00 each. For burgers we went next door to BLT at The Mirage. Very reasonable. Would I stay there again? - doubtful because of the excessive smoke in the hotel and the charge for the "enforced" upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new tower”
Reviews.Author: dcm123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars Palace for the first time in the end of March and booked a room in their new Octavious Tower which was beautiful. The tower had just opened a few months prior so everything was immaculate. The room was huge with all the amenities, including large flat screen TVs and over bed reading lights (this is actually a big deal because the rooms in the Roman Tower have neither. The pool area was huge with multiple different pools, very relaxing. One thing we were very disappointed with was the no free wifi. The daily cost of wifi was $25/day which we thought was rather steep, especially because if you signed into the wifi on your computer you would have to pay another $25 to use your wifi on your phone. Not a big deal for most people but when we are in Vegas we like to use the computer to decide on shows to see and restaurants to visit so just beware! Though we enjoyed our stay at Caesars Palace, we will likely try a different hotel on our next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel/Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sheila c
Reviews.Content: We originally chose Caesars because they comped us for three nights. At check in, asked if an upgrade to the Octavious Tower was possible. The desk clerk, I believe her name was Tramy, was wonderful. Gave us a free upgrade to a beautiful room in the Octavious Tower with views of the pool. We ate almost all of our meals at the restaurants in Ceasars, loved Spago, Joes Crab and Prime Steakhouse, Munchbar was fun, The customer service we experienced in Ceasars was inpeccable. Even the gambling was pretty good. Normally we like to stay somewhere new every time we visit but not anymore. It will be Caesars every time!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome as awlways”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: stayed there twice in all my trips to Vegas, the last time for my honey moon and it was just amazing. The rooms are always a great size, clean, service was amazing. being a reward member ACTUALLY pays off!!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good wins, good food!”
Reviews.Author: Alek2Travel
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to find a deal for $111 for Caesars. Won some money. Ate great noodles, we had a nice room. Will deffinetily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Decadent decor, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Marianne C
Reviews.Content: Kids wanted to stay at Caesars because of its fame. It had such mixed reviews that I really researched to get the best deal and room at the resort. The deluxe rooms in the Augustus tower are really comfortable, large and offer great views of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. Watching them from your bedroom window with Paris just opposite is a treat. For the price though you would expect complimentary water, coffee or tea in the room, but its $12 a pop. Don't expect to get what you actually booked without a fight. We booked two deluxe rooms and requested adjoining rooms because of the children. At check in the claimed not to have any, tried to get us to take a suite (maybe they thought that as it was our 20th wedding anniversary we would be willing to splash out), then miraculously found 2 rooms on the same floor close to each other. Except the adjoining room next to ours never had anyone in it so we could have had it. Food is expensive, pool is really busy, staff unhelpful, spa luxurious but over priced and nothing is complimentary. If we go back to Vegas - we'll go for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the legendary Caesars Palace!”
Reviews.Author: ola3rd
Reviews.Content: This was hands down one of the best hotels I ever stayed at, in fact I didn't want to leave ever lol. We were able to get an amazing deal; only $100/ night for 4 girls. And luckily enough, they gave up a free suite upgrade at check-in. Positives: - Got free suite upgrade - Good location on the strip - The rooms actually have a DOORBELL, I have never seen this anywhere else and found it soo cool lol - Very comfy beds - Absolutely loved the walk-in shower - Gorgeous architecture and design throughout the hotel/ casino - The pool center was amazing and pretty big for a hotel; felt like I was in Cabo or something Negatives: - Because Caesars is soo huge, its a long walk and takes forever to get anywhere including the rooms - EVERYTHING is extremely expensive EVERYWHERE inside the resort - I'm sure the hotel cost is usually very pricey, we were just lucky to be able to get a deal Caesars is one of those places every Vegas lover should have on their bucket list to stay at; even though it is one for the high end crowd. It is just beautiful and absolutely breathtaking. If Hangover did not convince you enough to stay here, trust me you would really want to!

Reviews.Title: “Decent room - Roman Tower”
Reviews.Author: FamilyAdventuresMN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference, so got a pretty cheap rate. Room was in the Roman tower, which is older. Had an old-school tube TV, but a huge bathroom, desk, and great service. A bit dated in the decor, but not horrible. I've only stayed at Mandalay Bay near the strip, so I don't have much to compare this to. I really appreciated that the room was truly non-smoking (which is rare), and the location of the hotel is perfect. The Caesar's complex is pretty impressive--tons of great places to eat and hang out. Definitely seems like a popular place for those who gamble, as well. Overall, enjoyed it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: pjfan73
Reviews.Content: Just left today after a 4 night stay at Caesars. Check-in was easy and I was upgraded to a suite (thanks Zandra!). This was my second stay and was not disappointed. The hotel is kept spotless, the staff were friendly and helpful. The suite was spacious and cleaned every day. Great view over looking the pools (Palace Tower). Tons of food options-from bar food in the casino to P.J. Clarkes, Joe's Crab Shack and Max Brenner's in the Forum Shops. All fantastic. The pools were great, chairs were tough to come by though if you didn't arrive earlier. Drinks were super expensive but after you tried a few "Black Dragons" the price didn't seem to matter! The Sports Book was a decent place to watch the hockey games (don't get your beers there though, 2 for 1 beers in the food court 2 minutes away). Although the concert we flew down for (Eddie Vedder) was cancelled there was no shortage of things to do as the hotel is immense and the Strip is always active. We checked out Freemont which I was glad to have seen but would not go back. It reminded me of the carnivals that pass through every summer.... All in all a great experience and I can't wait to go back! One last note, make sure you sign up for the Rewards Card as it gives you discounts in the hotel and points towards future stays!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: pjerseyyy
Reviews.Content: Decided to head to Vegas for the easter long weekend with a buddy and booked 3 nights at Caesers Palace. The property itself is HUGE and amazing. The casino was great, tons of great places to eat at (mostly on the pricey side of things though) and the pool(s) were ridiculous. We stayed in a pretty basic room in the roman tower but even that was great ( i mean who spends that much time in their room when in Vegas anyway??) Comfortable beds and good housekeeping so no complaints there. Weekend rates were pretty pricey but you can get some great deals throughout the week! Would recommend to anyone who wants a nice spot on the strip central to a lot of action, but quiet enough in the hotel to get a little rest (If sleep is in your plans)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mickspicks
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 4 times now and just love it. The property has everything you need so if you didn't want to leave you don't have to. The rooms are nice and clean and the pools are wonderful. The mid-strip location is also great. There are many restaurant choices too. After visiting Vegas about 14 times I can tell you that properties come (City Center) and go (Boardwalk, Westward Ho) and some change (The Trop., Luxor) but CP remains consistent and classy. One big plus; CP does NOT charge a "Resort Fee". Watch out for that elsewhere! It can add up to a tidy sum that will help diminish your bankroll before you even enter the casino!

Reviews.Title: “A Definate Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Julmich
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to Las Vegas and was abit wary of booking Caesars based on some reviews on TripAdvisor. But it's Vegas ... and it's Caesars ... so took the risk and got us a room in their Palace Tower. One word ... impressive !! Very happy with our decision. Check in took about 20 minutes. We were offered an upgrade to a Bellagio Fountain facing room for an extra $30 a night - but settled for our room which overlooked the city and Stratosphere end of The Strip. Massive room with comfortable bed, clean roomy bathroom with shower & spa bath. The Casino itself was really nice, with attentive drink staff. The Forum Shops were mind blowing. Great feed had at the Cheesecake Factory within the Shops. Great location along the Strip. Very central to everything and you can't miss it if you're abit disoriented during night time visits to other casinos / clubs etc. Not sure about the other towers, but I would definately recommend the Palace Tower accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place, Horrible Customer Service and hidden fees.”
Reviews.Author: Val C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new Octavious Tower which was fabulous, the view of the pools was breathtaking. We removed a few items from the small refridgerator which was a huge mistake! These items are all on sensors so if you lift it up or move it, you pay for it. There were 4 of us who looked in the fridge and NONE of us saw any sign or plaque saying that it is "NOT FOR PERSONAL USE". the purpose of that fridge is for the Casino to make more money above and beyond what you already pay for the room which was $179. for one night! They were trying to charge us about $60bucks more for the stuff that was moved, then put back into the fridge. Checkout was a nightmare. We had to stand in line to inquire about all the extra charges on our bill. The clerk was very rude. We also got charged almot $12 bucks just for reserving our room by phone. If you book a room with Caesars, be sure you dont have to talk with a real person or they will charge you for using their employees time. Seems like Caesars hires idiots who they dont really want to pay to do the job. Maybe Caesars should rething their customer service policies, oh wait, do they have any? We asked why their big fountain wasn't working and got told that it doesnt belong to the hotel, the Forum shops own it... but its in the hotel on the same property? Go Figure! The employees are uninformed about what is going on at the hotel. They should know if the fountain is working or not. The employees who we had to deal with acted as if they hated their jobs, and it was obvious that they were miserable being employed there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel- Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SN1184
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, outdated rooms. We stayed in 777 and won 732$! So I guess it was lucky. But the rooms are okay. We stayed in the basic room. Location was great, and casino was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on 7 April and loved it the place is so over the top you can't help smiling at it all. If we ever come to Las Vegas again we would definitely stay there again. The best bit from our point of view was the garden and swimming pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here but play here?”
Reviews.Author: Jackie155042
Reviews.Content: Arrived with a $40 tip for desk clerk hoping to upgrade. Had 5 nights comped in the augustus tower. Were told we had been bumped as they 102% capacity. The Roman tower...forget it. we will go back to The Mirage where they asked us to stay longer and would comp our rooms. But we were here for Rod Stewart and after doing some research, wanted to stay in the Forum Tower. Now, this is not an upgrade from the Augustus, it is a down grade. But the forum tower has no baths, just showers. We really wanted this tower because you come out of elevators right into the casino and to the left is the food court and to the left of that is the forum shops. Straight ahead out of the elevators is the colesseum. We were there to gamble, eat, shop and see Rod. But no bath? Only the suites....hence my $40 tip. After hearing we were being bumped, and I said we would go back to The Mirage, the clerk managed to get us a room in the forum tower....not a suite, but a room. Hmmmm, what to do? Handed him $20 and said thanks I will go without a tub. Missed it but the room was perfect for us location wise. Nice room too...very clean. Staff were great throughout . Great cocktail service(which is more than can say for the Mirage).Slots were extremely tight(which is consistant for all Harrah's casinos!) Even though the $25 and up blackjack tables are all smoking, I had a dealer complain about the smoke and ask to turn and blow it away from her....we moved to another table and made sure I told the pit boss why. Other dealers were super nice...but hot the night we played. Never made a dime and the desk clerk even told us how much money we dropped when we checked out based on our comps. Hopefully after this visit, next time we will have no problem getting a suite or have to worry about being bumped! Rod Stewart was awesome, the food court was good, Central Cafe was really good(pricey), and Rao's was just ok for the money it cost it should have been super. Resort is big so make sure you scope out what you plan to do there and book room accordingly....hopefully you won't get bumped!

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace”
Reviews.Author: mellengal
Reviews.Content: I was there attending a conference & book through my company travel group rather than the conference becuase the rates were so much cheaper. I was in placed in the Roman Tower which has not yet been renovated. I have stayed in better Motel 6 rooms! The bed has no support, the furniture & carpet were deeply worn,scarred and stained, and the air conditioner was very noisy. When I called to complain, I was told there were no other rooms available that evening. Really-on a Monday night??? The next day day, I called again & was told they would upgrade me to the Palace tower for $30 a night more. I took it - although I noticed at check-out that I was charged a higher rate + and upgrade fee-making ~ $50 per night. The difference in rooms was incredible!!!! I rated the Roman tower room low but I would rate the Palace rooms very high with the nearly the best bathroom I had ever seen. My other problem with Caesar's is there is no where in the Casino that Coke (not Pepsi) is available. When I asked the concierge if there was any place that Coke was available, he directed me to a Sundry shop which only carried Pepsi. I understand contracts are signed to provide one soda in restaurants and in bars, but can you not at least put the other soda in a discreet corner in a one of the small Sundry stores? I walked over to Mirage every day to buy diet coke. Having traveled to Las Vegas many times & staying at many casinos-I was disappointed in my experience Caesar's. My next trip for fun 3 weeks later, I stayed at the Mirage & liked it much better.

Reviews.Title: “Ceasar's Palace is a bust?”
Reviews.Author: Margoes
Reviews.Content: So not impressed with Cesears! Will not return! 1. Housekeeping never cleaned our room! 2. Closet light turns on and off whenever you go to the bathroom at night! 3. Hair dryers are un-useable if you want to style your hair. 4. They charge you to sit by the pool! 5. $12.00 to make coffee in your room during our stay! 6. bed was marginal to uncomfortable! 7. It was an upgraded room? Not much space! 8. Tattered thin robes 9. Outrageous mini bar charges! We will Stay at the Wynn Encore in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: MITOMAD
Reviews.Content: I believe the Caesars Palace is nowadays a classic in Vegas, so I thought it would be just another huge hotel with a theme. It exceeded my expectations. It was a place where you can wander aimlessly for hours, discovering new corners and things to do. Our room had a very nice view and was quite lavish. It was kept very clean and it was very quiet as well. The few drawbacks is that you can very easily get lost in the maze of casino and shops, and that, wherever you are, it is usually a long walk back to your room. What I would definitely NOT recommend is their CENTRAL restaurant. We had breakfast there one morning and we found it overpriced and had to wait before, during and after the mail extremely long times, way above the average. AVOID IT if you can.

Reviews.Title: “If you get at lower price go for it. Its an experience to stay here. As when prices are high service doesnt match”
Reviews.Author: INDIAOUTSOURCES
Reviews.Content: Hi I booker Casear through there website only got Monday rate which is cheap. I was upgraded to a big size room. Thats it Big Size room means big size nothing else. But came to know that this was for disablity or old age. May be . So ther was no bath tub for day end relaxation. Caesar has a very good Spa and i didnt tried but had a feedback from cusyomers. Caesar does not have a personalised service . They are very Big and so they have different class of customers. So do not expect one time kind customers service levels. I am happy with what they have Build but felt for the first time that they do not treat fair to all customers. They would not even care to ask if everythig is ok. . May be again big hotel . Checkin was ok. Took 2 min but que was unexpected. Check out was also.simple as the lady carries ipad for express checkout Its a very big Hotel and have Casino downstairs. All areas near strip are beautiful.And specially the fountain show near Bellys. Shows are all nearby and opposite you have walgreens . Food and other pubs, Go enjoy Caesar in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at Caesars. Joined Total Rewards program and got Friends & Family rate for the first 5 nights. Well worth the money. We stayed in Roman Towers which looked like the oldest part of the building but the rooms were huge, had separate bath and shower. Housekeeping were brilliant. No tea/coffee facilities in room. Drinks around pool and in hotel restaurants/ coffee shops expensice but only to be expected. Essential shops in hotel sold alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks at more reasonable prices. All staff friendly and efficient, nothing too much trouble. The Collesium is a great venue for any show. We saw Rod Stewart and enjoyed it so much we went again before we came home. No discount on late bookings for shows. The buffet was close during our stay which was a bit disappointing.Will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the classic vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: a1110
Reviews.Content: you have to stay here at least once amazing huge crazy hotel, great food places, fab shopping, when we were there cher was playing and her bizarre costumes were on display. pool is gorgeous. totally over the top craziness. didn't go to the club but your room passes get you to the front of the queue and in for free before 9pm top tip - ask if any upgrades are available when you check in, you can give them a bribe (which works) but we were too english and chickened out. but we just asked and got offered the room that was in the hangover for a fantastically reduced price anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Service”
Reviews.Author: BrianS S
Reviews.Content: Had a conferance at the Mirage, price was to high for a room, so I stayed at Caesars; glad I did. Not only did I get a great room that was clean and confortable, I was treated to great service. From check in to the room attendants to check out, I never had a single issue or complaint. And, they stock the mini-bars, an option that is appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday EVER....”
Reviews.Author: Loz407
Reviews.Content: Had A week stay at the caesars palace.. and it has to be said it is the most amazing hotel i have ever stayed in.. we had a but of a hiccup in the beginning with rooms not being up to stanard but with a bit of complaining we had the room of our dreams.. seperate living area, bar, sauna the full works!!! we also had a Massive Jacuzzi in the room which was absolutely amazing after walking all day long.. and couldnt imagine not having it now we had it.. definately upgrade too have a jacuzzi.. (thats fits 2 people easy!!) the location is perfect smack bang in the centre of the strip, Staff are really friendly and will tell you anything you need to know.. The forum shops are absolutely to die for.. with all the big named shops.. food wise we eat at 'the cheese cake factory' because it was excellent value for money and the portion sizde was HUGEEE!!! would really recommend to eat thier.. Vegas lived up to my expectations and more... definately will be returning very soon.. :)

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace - Augustus Tower - Classic! Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: BTraveler70
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in March. 2nd time staying at Caesars. Quiet spacious room. Excellent view of the strip. Great room and maid service. Had a great time at the tables! Caesars is a classic! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, great location but expensive for extras”
Reviews.Author: marktheshark
Reviews.Content: The room that we had in the Palace tower was massive and well appointed, two bathrooms, jacuzzi bath tub, couch and arm chair and views over the pools far below. Check in was surprisingly quick given the number of guests arriving and departing and the room was certainly as grand as expected - we were happy with the room. The only thing that we found let this hotel down was the cost of everything else, considering the cost of the room per night I would not have expected to to then have to pay $6 for a bottle of water in the room or $12 for coffee, and internet access at something like $30 was just an insult. We even found when attempting to get cash out of an ATM in the lobby that it wanted to charge $5 we declined and found a charge of less than half that at another casino! Overall a great hotel just let down a little by the expensive extras but I guess thats Vegas for ya!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Time4Scuba
Reviews.Content: Overall Caesars was a great stay. Room was comfortable. We had plenty of space in the room and bathroom. Loved the shower, separate jetted tub, double vanity, tv in the vanity area. Huge full body mirror was beautiful and a nice addition to decor and functional. We were on the 29th floor of the Augustus Tower. I would've loved to have been on the 35th floor overlooking the Bellagio Fountain, but over looking the pool was nice. The only negatives I can say about the stay here was when we checked in we found the carpet had crumbs all over near the bed and couch, obviously missed by housekeeping. The windows were so water spotted that it showed up in our pictures. Finally, after our checkin around 2PM we wanted to catch a quick cat nap and about 20 mins after we laid down their was a knock at the door- housekeep wanted to fill the mini bar....ummmm shouldn't you do that before we checkin?! He apologized for interrupting our nap- it took him a few mins to inventory the whole mini bar and then scolded us for not having our "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door...Really?! Pool area was beautiful, the name Garden Of The Gods is very fitting. We went down one afternoon just to lay in the sun and they had just removed the "RESERVED" signs on the blue mattresses around the pool and we cozied up and enjoyed the last hour or 2 of sunshine for the day. The casino was busy, and not very generous to us, but overall I think it was one of the most appealing casinos to play in. Had a very nice floor attendant at 2AM notice that my players club card wasn't registering in the machine I was playing. I knew it was demagnetized earlier, but the Reward desk was closed but this attendant went out of her way to reprint me not one but 2 cards right then and there! Above & beyond in my opinion. We also stayed at Treasure Island this trip and between the 2 resorts I would say that Caesars was hands down a better overall stay, but the beds at Treasure Island were hard to beat. If you have any questions about this resort feel free to send me a message.

Reviews.Title: “What can I write about Caesars that hasn't been said.....huge, huge, huge! But wooonderful, just as Vegas should be! I love it h”
Reviews.Author: Barti_Ddu
Reviews.Content: What can I write about Caesars that hasn't been said.....huge, huge, huge! But wooonderful, just as Vegas should be! I love it here!!! When you compare rates between MGM group and CET properties without a resort fee you'd have to be crazy to opt for the former!! With a rate of $100 a night an no resort fee this was way below what I paid for at the Monte Carlo! Can that be right? Check in was quick with plenty of desks open and an upgrade to the Palace Tower with a wonderful pool view it was a welcome reminder of how good customer service is in Vegas after the disaster of the Monte Carlo! Is the hotel too big? Well big is beautiful, especially in Las Vegas! The tower is situated at the start of Forum Shops, next to the pool! The room was beautiful, spacious and offered a fantastic view of the pool. The living area, huge, the bed, huge the bathroom (well 2, his and hers),  with a jacuzzi joined with a walk in double shower. You commit all sorts of sin in this room! It was to die for!!! Everything was thought of, even protection (nudge, nudge, wink, wink) in the mini bar!  The pool is sprawling with a huge amount of cabanas and day beds, it's where the pretty people come to relax in the sun! With a swim up bar and blackjack and smaller pools breaking off what more could you ask for? its a tranquil oasis in the desert! It's by far the nicest of all pools I've seen here, plenty of choice of beds and even grass verges for lounging! The food choice is more upscale with a Cyprus Marketplace, small food serving Chinese, burgers etc. The bars classy but pricey, the cocktail waitresses the best I found on the strip this year! Thank you Debbie for looking after us during our stay here! My wife and I planned to do so much for the night we stayed here, but were so well looked after we stayed all night. Credit to Caesars for keeping us there what surely all casinos should be hoping to do! This hotel is huge, I could go on forever but you should already know about the shops, bars etc. I will say one thing....the Gossy Room???? No, the self proclaimed 'voice' of the UK Matt Goss has NEVER been a star over here despite what he claims! When will he be famous, amazingly he already is in Vegas, how unreal!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Food, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne R
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was disappointed because I did not receive a room in the Octavius Tower, but the check-in representative quickly resolved the issue. The room was delightful and comfortable with a beautiful view. Room service was delicious and hot; The Noodle Shop was yummy and Serendipity was sweet but the ice cream items were way too big. Once again I have had horrible service from the casino host. I waited patiently to speak with the host but he never recognized me and just let other ladies walk up to him and sit down. It's a good thing I didn't have too much to drink cause it could have gotten ugly. I eventually called casino host , Nancy, at Paris to resolve my issue; Nancy is "The Best". Thank you Caesar's for the great Total Reward Offers, keep them coming!

Reviews.Title: “Conference at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: Yellowstone61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars Palace for 2 nights while I attended a conference. The check in was pretty easy, and the front desk staff was friendly. When I got to the room that I was assigned I learned that it was a long ways from where the other members of the conference were staying. I went back to the front desk and advised them that I would like a room close to the other members of the conference. They said that they could change me, but I would have to pay an additional fee. I stayed where I was, even though it was an inconvenience for me. The room was clean and well appointed. There were not a lot of free channels on the TV. The hotel staff setting up food for our conference seemed like they had an attitude problem and were not very helpful. Most of the hotel staff and security on the Casino level were customer service oriented and were good about giving directions and other information. The restaurants were good, but too expensive. Caesars Palace was a very interesting place and I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Arrival not so hot, but redeemed itself...”
Reviews.Author: TravelGinRN
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Caesars to find they had cancelled our reservation due to a no-show. We came in for a conference and had decided a few months prior to not stay the first night, so we called and changed the reservation. After about 20 mins, they gave us an upgraded room in the Octavius tower. We arrived to the room, and found it had not been cleaned from the previous guest. Called guest services and no other rooms available, so we left our things in the room and wandered about until it was clean. The pools were nice, the room fantastic! The internet service was pricy, but the conference covered those costs, and you had to pay for each device. My fiancee and I each had iphones, ipads and a small laptop, which would've added up quickly. The previous guest had taken some things from the minibar which were charged to our room. When checking out, the man behind the counter reserved just for the Octavius/Augustus tower removed the charges without even asking. The weird thing was some lady knocked on our door after we had been there two days - to check the minibar and replace items, just walked right in??? Anyway, it was a good experience, the staff setting up the luncheons were fantastic, food was great, and a great place for a conference. Thank goodness we paid conference prices for the Octavius tower, it would have been triple the price, at which point I would have been unhappy about the extra charges for everything. There was also construction going on underneath our room, which made it near impossible to sleep in. I would have been upset about this if we had come to party, but having to be up for the conference starting at 0700, it was no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms. Not a place if you abhor cigarette smell”
Reviews.Author: Jonnyb155
Reviews.Content: Stary here twice. Rooms are luxurious, cheap and very clean. However, would only go here for business, if attending a convention in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,don't bother with the rest.”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here on a comp last month after not having stayed here in exactly two years. I was given a room in the Augustus tower overlooking Flamingo Road and the Bellagio Fountains beyond. The room was immaculately clean, relatively quiet except for occasional traffic noise from Flamingo Road and very comfortable. This would be the most positive aspect of a stay here. Otherwise the casino is is a waste of time in terms of fair play for your money and most of the restaurants outrageously overpriced and overall quite mediocre. The three I tried this visit were Cafe Central for breakfast, which is a new coffee shop/restaurant with spotty service and undistinguished expensive food. For lunch I tried Beijing Noodle No.9 which had possibly the worst blandest chinese food I have ever had. My third misadventure was the japanese restaurant Hyakumi, which has been a Caesar's mainstay for many years and which served me sushi and sushi rolls which I could describe only in one word. Disgusting. I was shocked at how bad it was I wanted to go to Bradley Ogden's where I had eaten well before, but it was closed on the monday night I was there and so I went and had a wonderful meal at the Palm Restaurant which has nothing to do with Caesar's in the Forum Shops. As I have stated before, Caesars Palace is a shadow of it's former glorious self before Harrah's took it over in 2005. It's real successors are either Wynn or the Venetian which combine well Las Vegas gaudy hearty action with luxury and excitement. Caesar's Palace is still grand in design, yet heartless in substance, but it still sports a luxurious hotel in which to stay, if one only does so for it's ideal location and comfortable hotel amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Truly 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: WestIndian4ever
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel several times over the past 4 years for a few conferences. It is what you would expect from a place called Caesars palace. Let me start with the bathroom which is just fantastic :) Flat screen TV in bathroom, bath & body works toiletries (not small 1 oz bottles but large ones) refreshed every day, what seemed to be marble tiles throughout, just absolutely stunning. Rooms are spacious, extremely comfortable bed. Large flat screen TV, work desk/chair and and pull out sofa. The casino, forum shops, restaurants and food court all give lots of things to do and eat. When I stay at other hotels in Vegas, I always visit Caesars for their food and gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: charlotte8682
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at caesars Palace. No problems at check in, Bell boy took our cases to our Palace tower room on floor 6 room number 622. Nice view of the main pool for our room. Our room was large with a huge bathroom, comfy beds! Room was cleaned everyday towels changed when we requested! Caesars Palace is a huge hotel with loads of things on offer. Would say this is one of the high end hotels on the strip and would 100% stay here again. Having stayed at the Monte Carlo in December 2011 Caesars knocks the socks of the Monte Carlo! Will defo be heading back to Caesars Palace when I visit Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome pool! Nice rooms, too.”
Reviews.Author: nnnick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite in the 14th floor of the Roman tower and our room was super nice with 1 and a half baths (normal bathroom plus a powder room with sink and jacuzzi). The room was great, my only complaint is the TV was really crappy, but who stays in their room and watches TV in Vegas? haha. The bed was super comfy, almost to the point where it was hard to get out of bed in the morning... The hotel itself was great, my dad was there for a conference so we crashed the reception and the conference facilities were top notch and HUGE. Great location, especially if you're not a huge gambler as you can go to the forum shops or just walk around the strip, you're pretty much right in the middle of the strip so it's easy to walk just about anywhere you want... The pool was my favorite part, in a gaudy yet awesome Vegas-way. Tons of statues and greek architecture along with five pools, one of which has swim-up Blackjack tables. We ate at MESA which was great and the bartenders were super nice, letting us sample things before deciding on our elixirs of choice. We also drank at a few of the other bars there, and while not the cheapest place to get drunk in Vegas, they all had great service.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: smitten10
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at Ceasars in February, it is one of the fInest places I have stayed. The location is right on the strip in Vegas and ideal for visiting the sites. The rooms are of the highest standard and very clean. On the downside some of the bars are pricey especially the one on the lobby. Restaurants offer a good price range from burgers to fine dining, check the menus first, we paid almost a hundred dollars for a steak. We booked through last minute. com and thought it was excellent value overall. There are cheaper places to stay but if you like some luxury as I do, this would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: mitulg
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas hotels are difficult to rate as they are not your conventional hotel. I had to queue at check-in and out even though a Platinum guest. Feels really mass market, but thats the nature of the beast. The suite in Forum Tower was lovely and we were well taken care of by housekeeping, who took good care of the place. The service was generally very good. Many of the staff at Caesar's seem to be "lifers" who are loyal to the brand and were generally very well-informed and helpful. The pool, restaurants etc were lovely with a good choice for everyone. Pure, the nightclub, was a 4/5, where I would rate Tryst, XS, Surrender, Marquee as 5/5. The Casino host comped out stay which was very kind of them. Going back this year and staying at Encore

Reviews.Title: “Not deluxe room”
Reviews.Author: OlderEd
Reviews.Content: Reserved deluxe room. Room was large and had some deluxe features, like TV in the bathroom mirror. However, view was a roof with maze of air conditioning ducts. Also, room had coffee maker and condiments, but no coffee. There was a charge of over $13 for the coffee (which is more than breakfast at some places). In addition, a daily charge of over $15 for wifi, which is often free! Never heard of a deluxe room with such poor features.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: kgems1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a real estate conference. Found the room to be ordinary at best and the hotel was one big smoke cloud. With all of the other great and new venues in Vegas, why would you stay here if you didn't have to? The room was free to me courtesy of the conference, otherwise I would have stayed elsewhere. Love the Caesar's Sports Book and the Forum shops but that is not enough to get me to stay here willingly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaBurgex
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels i've ever stayed in around the world. Great location, clean and spacious room and friendly staff! Highly recommended if you're staying in vegas! The forum shopping center was out of this world and the casino was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding night before”
Reviews.Author: Eddie1977
Reviews.Content: We were staying at another hotel in Vegas & was getting married at Caesars so we received one nights accommodation in the palace tower as part of our package..the room was very nice and the hotel/ casino is great.. only issue is check in..we waited over an hour at 5pm to check in..had plans at 6 which we had to change as we didn't even have our room yet...only two front office staff working. For a hotel of this size ( one of the top five largest in the world) there should be a small army checking guests in.. Besides this in las vegas it is a beautiful hotel with plenty to do,,,

Reviews.Title: “Octavius Tower - Affordable Luxury in a Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: gafferroche
Reviews.Content: When in Vegas I normally stay at MGM casinos but this time decided to stay at Caesars Palace due to its great strip location.
