I stayed in the recently opened Octavius Tower at Caesars Palace for 5 nights last month in a luxury King room . The rate was pretty good and averaged under $200 per night including taxes. One benefit of the Octavius tower is you can use the exclusive Augustus VIP entrance and registration, which meant no queues at checkin or checkout. The Octavius tower room was huge and the in room technology was impressive and not too over the top. I think I got lost in the room at least once. The bed was very big and comfortable with massive pillows & cushions, there was an in room safe, large closet and mini bar. My room had floor to ceiling windows with a spectacular view of the garden of the gods pool area. There was no coffee machine in the room and there was a $25 charge to have it delivered & another €12 for coffee, so I declined. All in all the room was modern, clean, new, nice, bright and big. The large marble tiled bathroom had dual sinks, large jacuzzi bathtub(try it !!), a separate glass shower cubicle with oversized shower head. Very impressive. It is a long walk from the Octavius rooms to the casino floor or strip so you might want to consider the Augustus or another tower if walking longish distances presents a challenge for you. I tried a couple of the dining options at Ceasars (Bejing Noodle No 9), Raos , Central by Michel Richard, Payard Express, Joes Stone Crab & Seafood Restaurant(Forum Shops), and Java coast coffee at the Cypress Street market place. I had no complaints about any of these and would recommend Joes Stone Crab in particular for the excellent service and food quality. The buffet is currently under renovation at Caesars Palace. The casino floor is big and took a while to get used to the layout. It has all the usual table games, poker machines& slot machines, so theres something there to cater for everyone, whatever your budget is. In summary I would highly recommend the Octavius tower for quality of accomodation, location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Octavius Tower - Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: AE88
Reviews.Content: I had a five day stay here for a work trip and was very pleased with every aspect of the room. Very spacious, incredibly clean and everyone at the hotel was very helpful. The room included an L shaped couch, jacuzzi tub, even a TV in the bathroom to watch while you get ready. As a frequent traveler, I have to say I was impressed with this new tower. A few hints - there is a specific check in for the Octavius Tower - use it, it is much faster. Same with a specific valet - I found it to be not nearly as fast, but it was always open where the main valet often filled up.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: Jenda29
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Caesars Palace for many years and can honestly say I have never had a bad experience. My wife and I always stay in the Palace Towers as the rooms are always clean, the bathroom large and well appointed with lots of granite and seperate showers and whirlpool tubs. Flat screen TVs, fully stocked fridge, safe in closets, anything you could want. Also, the Palace Towers has easy and quick access to the pool area which offers many pools and lots of seating. We use to go in September but since building the Octavias Tower, the sun is blocked for most ot the pool area at that time so if you like to lay in the sun, don't go to Caesars after mid August.We now go in mid May which is a great time to go. No kids, plenty of sunshine and less crowds. I have stayed at other hotels but would recommend Caesars to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Like Disneyland on Steroids!”
Reviews.Author: dfscot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a conference. On check in we were allocated a room in the old Forum tower with now view other than the A/C plant. After the inevitable 15 min walk back to reception we were able to buy an upgrade to a room in the Augustus tower facing the Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel Tower which was much better. Hotel is massive (4000+ rooms) and very busy day and night. Probably the only hotel in Las Vegas that doesn't have a buffet breakfast! Plenty of restaurants but very busy and long queues for most. Even Starbucks was queued all day. Wi-Fi / Wired internet was very expensive at $15 per device/day in the room and $25 per day/device to use throughout the hotel. Everything costs money to do from the "touch anything in the minibar and the charge is automatic" through the $12 to use the in-room coffee maker. Never been in a hotel anywhere in the world that charges money to use the in-room coffee making facilities. Given that Caesars Palace isn't inexpensive, charging for this seems over greedy. Service generally was very good in the hotel. Hotel shops seemed to be more for show than use - certainly unless one had beaten the casino, most were outwith the reach of most guests. Strange that indoor smoking is still permitted and people were drinking and carrying drink about in all parts of the hotel, but perhaps that is just Vegas? Whole experience is somewhat surreal, but that really sums up the whole city!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Solbonita
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful, clean and well designed room in the Octavus tower. Plenty of space for four people. The bathroom was very nice and a great size for all of us to get ready. The beds and linens were very nice. We ordered room service and the burgers were cooked inconsistently, but still good. I think Caesars is a great, central location on the strip. Our tower was furthest from the lobby, it's a walk, but that is the way of Vegas. I would stay here again and for sure in this tower.

Reviews.Title: “Started off shaky ended very well”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to vegas once a year for our annaversary and we love to stay at Ceasars in the Augustus Tower. We were really dissappointed when we were told that all the rooms were sold out and and that we would have to take a standard room. The first customer service worker wasn't friendly at all. She told us someone would call us between 4-6pm when our standard room was ready. We were very dissapointed. We decided to go back to the check in desk around 3pm and a very nice gentlemen helped us. We told him we were trying to get into our room as soon as possible because we had dinner reservations. He made some calls and no one ansewered...Then he decided to put us in the New Octavious Suite! We were so thankful and grateful for him. He really made our trip delightful.Thank you again from the The Bakers.

Reviews.Title: “uncomfortable beds...”
Reviews.Author: KikiMira
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, the room was good (we were in the Palace tower over looking the pool), the pool was nice. The forum shops are handy. We thought the beds were really uncomfortable and the wifi was definitely not resort wide for the resort roaming option, complete rip off at $25 a day per a device. No free wifi at the resort. We won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars is Outrageous”
Reviews.Author: Kelly C
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Caesars - Augustus Towers from March 15-19, 2012 and have had numerous billing issues. Originally I was offered 3 comp nights and 2 paid nights, however, 2-days into my stay I was told that they were comping ALL of my nights (I was playing quite a bit!). The room charges were removed from my bill and on checkout, I received a final bill which showed all nights were comped. This same final bill was emailed to me the following day. 8 days after I checked out my card was charged for the 2 nights they advised they were comped. After speaking with several incredibly rude billing people I have been advised that they cannot determine who comped my room charges and or why they were taken off my bill or even why they were not included in my final bill, however, they have determined that I now owe them and that I signed a card authorizing them to charge my card at will when I checked in. Completely outrageous! While it is a lovely casino and I had a beautiful room but I will not be staying and or playing at any Caesars properties in the future. If you stay here be prepared as they are going to place significant holds on your credit card which take about 10-days to come off after they release them (after check out). They will also bill you for any charges on top of the holds placed. This was annoying but not a huge issue. It seems to me that they offer to comp you to get you to play and spend more and then slam you with the charge backs after you have done so. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: michellelagan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Caesars last week for "holiday of a lifetime" trip to Vegas from Ireland. I honestly could not fault one thing, even if I tried. The hotel is outstanding, the features, the detail, the elegance, everything about it just had wow factor. I honestly cant believe some of the poor comments about this hotel, like "its noisy, its busy, its expensive,its huge.... isnt that what Vegas is all about?? We stayed in Roman tower, its on 8th floor, no problems with lifts or distance, 2mins took us from casino to room.Service was great, rooms cleaned daily, staff very friendly, check in was quick and easy although we possibly just got lucky with that as we did see some huge check in queues over few days we were there. There was no noise what so ever in the rooms, we also got the $700 worth of coupons when we booked our room(an offer they were running) and they included things like 2 for 1 on meals and drinks, free entry to car museum, money of helicopter trips, free entrees etc. They could also be used in certain other hotels, not just Caesars. Shops were lovely, Some really expensive like Gucci, Louis Vuiton etc. but also had the biggest H&M and a MAC make-up store which was great. The ladies at the customer service desk in the forum shops were also great for booking trips, shows etc. with. We went to Rod Stewart to in the Colosseum, great show but only played for an hour and a half, we would have loved a bit more of him. Outdoor pools were fabulous, like something from a film, fountains, lovely cushioned loungers- pure tranquillity. The Location of the hotel is also ideal, in the heart of everything. I really wish I was going back to Caesars again.

Reviews.Title: “Great last minute stay, even with kids”
Reviews.Author: Cheriejay
Reviews.Content: We planned to spend spring break in Arizona and California this year. Fortunately, we were able to be flexible. An unseasonably cool cold front came through and keep us from heading to San Diego so we drove up to Las Vegas instead. We have gambled at Caesars many times but never stayed here. We found a very good last minute rate on hotels.com. We stayed in the Augustus tower and had an incredible view of the Bellagio fountains and the "Eiffel tower" at Paris. We had to scramble a little to find things for our teenage boys to do in Vegas besides shop but they loved staying at the hotel from "The Hangover" the movie. "Does Caesar really live here"? The pool area was great, they did enjoy that and of course the room service. Our boys have eaten at Mesa Grill at Atlantis, Bahamas so they were very excited to eat at Mesa Grill inside Caesar's. My husband and I have eaten here several times on our trips to Vegas and it is always spot on. I cannot wait until Nobu opens, we will come back for that! We dined at Rao's and were disappointed in the quality of food and in the service. I still can't figure out if they keep their Christmas decorations up all year....but I thought it was odd that it was still decorated with Christmas ornaments and poinsettia's in March. I like the location of this hotel because you can easily walk to other hotels and shopping without having to take a taxi. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mad Weekend”
Reviews.Author: swiss-mike
Reviews.Content: In a moment of madness we decided to go to Las Vegas to see Rod Stewart at the Coloseum, Caesars Palace. We booked Caesars Palace having wandered around it and several other Hotels on a previous visit to Las Vegas. On arrival the check-in procedure was reasonably fast although we later saw that at busy times it can be a nightmare, taking anything up to an hour. No fun after an eleven hour flight. To be fare this seems to be true of all the other large hotels on the strip. We were given a room on the penthouse level of the Palace Tower. The room was well equipped and quiet. It is also neccessary to use your room "key" to get the lift to go to the top two levels in this tower,this caused a problem later when the key stopped working and it took me over an hour to get back to the room and three trips back to reception to get the key reprogramed before it eventually worked. The staff were all very professional and helpful. Caesars Palace seems to be one of the lively casinos amongst the top rank establishments, by comparison the Belagio next door seemed quite subdued by comparison. Everything about Las Vegas is crazy and pretty expensive, even the immigation officers are friendly!!!!! But the place is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: PETER K
Reviews.Content: Over rated. Nothing wrong with it but nothing out of this world. Could not breath in Casino from all the smokers - NO non smoking rooms. Stayed at Treasure Island last time - far better value for money. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be afraid to Tip at Reception”
Reviews.Author: EimearT
Reviews.Content: Stayed in both Bellagio and Caesars for my holiday, and Caesars really came out on top, rooms were of a slightly higher standard, I had been booked into the Forum Tower, when I arrived, I asked if we could have a view of the Strip, slipped a tip to the receptionist, and got upgraded to a beautiful room in the Octavius Tower, view of the Fountain show and the Strip. The room it'self was superior, Jacuzzi bath, tv in bathroom, really could not fault this hotel, but I have been told not all the Towers are so modern, I think the Octavious Tower was one of the more modern additions to the hotel. Ordered food one evening, very professional service, and food was delicious, which is not always the case with room service. The shops, the Casino, this hotels defines all that Vegas has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Beautiful Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugMissouri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at this hotel for our anniversary. They were VERY accomodating. We arrived early to check in (around 11am) and they didn't have our room ready so they upgraded us for free! The rooms are very clean; the jacuzzi tub VERY large and relaxing; the bathroom has a TV on the wall and a very large shower. I was very impressed. I only paid $100 for the night. I thought that was very reasonable! They honored a price I saw online w/out even asking me what site I saw it on!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace EXCELLENT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: acemanda
Reviews.Content: The most fantastic hotel and holiday experience I have had to date!! Well worth visiting and the room and bed!! WOW!!

Reviews.Title: “So good!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahafc22
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Caesars and loved every minute of it. The rooms are massive, clean and there were 4 of us in one room. We stayed in the Octavius Tower which apparently had only been opened for 2 months. We had a view of the many swimming pools which was cool. Be careful with the fridge as the items are on a sensor so if you move them it will register that you've taken them. Caesars in slap bang in the middle of the strip so great location. We visited a few of the other themed hotels during our 5 night stay. All great in their own little way but Caesars is by far the best. It has a lot of personality and character. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: QuietKP
Reviews.Content: Tagged along with my husband who was attending a conference at Caesars. Had very large room in Augustus tower. Never having been to Las Vegas before, I did not expect the room to rival that of other upscale & luxury resorts we've visited. It did. Same goes for service. Every employee I encountered from the front desk to the casino floor to the spa and restaurants was very friendly and helpful. My one complaint is the smokiness, but that seemed to be the norm at the other hotels/casinos that I wandered through. Good central location.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Facilities and Service”
Reviews.Author: amasland
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many Vegas hotels for conferences over the past five years. I'd put Caesars Palace at the top of the list. Service was great. The room was clean and well serviced. I'd look forward to going back to Caesars again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carla P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful and very expensive. Rooms are spacious and stunning. The only issue I had was with their late night dining options - the restaurant is very expensive for chicken wings and an order of french fries $26! The food was good but not worth $26. The machines are very tight - no jackpots heard anywhere around me. Back to the restaurant unfortunately I had to eat there again so I ordered the same thing. Well first the bar tender totally ignored my present; he actually turned his back to me completely - he was a total jerk. There was another party drinking and having a good time. Well there were 2 bar tenders and one was working that party the other one was just like hanging out backing him up. So after I set for about 5 minutes - I go to the host and complain, she walked right over and told him about it and of course he had an attitude - he was like "you should have waved me down"; I told him you totally ignored me - that is your job to attend to all the people not just some! I proceed to place my order, now I wait and the other bar tender takes over because the first one was just a jerk. Well when they bring my order out - they give it to someone else - I'm like you got to be kidding me, of course he offers me the wrong order free of charge - I abruptly declined. You would think they would offer me my order on the house - oh no they put in the new order, gave it to me and that was it. That was a horrible experience and I would never dine there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a first time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Maggie P
Reviews.Content: A lot of things about Caesar's Palace are good, plus it was my husband's and my first time in Las Vegas, so everything was pretty exciting. Good: The rooms were clean, hotel personnel were friendly and professional, and the "Forum Shops" (mall of high-end stores attached to the Caesar's Palace complex) were wonderful, even if one is not in a shopping mood. Bad: check in took forever, with only three stations open when we started, and about twenty people/groups in each line. You would think with at least one major convention in the hotel, and knowledge of when the main flights from the East Coast get in, they could anticipate and staff appriately. We were offered a small plastic bottle of water as a "thank you" for our trouble and our patience. Also in the "bad" column: I know when you're on the ground floor they want you to gamble, I got that. However, if you don't want to gamble, or if you are just waiting for someone, there is nowhere to set down! And everything is very loud. I would have been a lot happier if there was a quiet place with lots of room for non-gamblers to sit.

Reviews.Title: “What the hail, Caesar? Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: AlanMAF55
Reviews.Content: "Wretched excess? What's that?" may not be the motto of Caesar's Palace, but it sure seems to be the guiding principle. Nothing is too gaudy or grandiose for the place, which was apparently built to resemble what the owners thought the ruler of ancient Rome would have built if he'd had (1) absolute power, (2) unlimited wealth, (3) lots of slave labor, and (4) no concept of subtlety whatsoever. I was there recently for a meeting that lasted several days. For me, the negatives outweighed the positives. In no particular order, the negatives for me were: 1) The place is huge, which is great for conveying a sense of grandeur, etc., but makes it really hard to get quickly from one place to another quickly. It's also not very logically laid out (at least from an ease-of-movement viewpoint) and meeting rooms were not well labeled, although the group I was with could have done a better job on that also. 2) Everything is about twice as expensive as you'd expect. 3) All roads lead to a casino. Seriously, I'm not sure it's even possible to exit the place without going through a casino. It may have been, but I never learned how. 4) You'd better like noise, because there's a lot of it everywhere except in your hotel room. 5) You'd better like to breathe in smoke, especially cigar smoke, because there's a lot of that too. 6) You'd better have a lot of patience, because you're going to need it. One night, my room keycard wouldn't work. I was very tired from walking around the Strip, and it was about a 10-15 minute walk from my room to the front desk (I'm telling you, the place is big!), so I called to see if they could send someone up with a new key. 40 minutes and another call later, someone finally came. Another night, I went to a Caesar's restaurant for dinner with four friends. We got there early so we got right in. But start to finish for dinner was more than two hours, including 25 minutes waiting for the checks to arrive. 7) In more than 30 years of going to hotels, I had never been denied a request for a one-hour late checkout, until Caesar's did just that. They said it was because of their incoming customers that day, but the message it conveyed to me was "Now that we have your money, we don't give a fig about your convenience." There were some good parts too: 1) My hotel room, which was in the Palace Tower, was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The bathroom in particular was big and luxurious. 2) The staff were courteous without fail. They obviously are well-drilled, which can lead to inappropriate responses. When you've just turned down a guest's request for a one-hour delay in checkout, don't then ask what else you can do for him. You haven't done anything for him yet -- at least, anything he wants done. 3) The hotel room, unlike any other part of the complex, was quiet. 4) The people-watching was terrific. Overall, though, I won't be in a hurry to return. The whole experience made me wonder if, instead of his political opponents, Caesar was actually done in by his guests? :)

Reviews.Title: “Twice the charm...”
Reviews.Author: travelduchess25
Reviews.Content: This is the second visit to Caesars Palace this month, and I cant think of a better place to stay , first visit we stayed in the Forum Tower, beautiful modern room, most comfortable beds ever, my only complaint about this stay was there was no bath only a HUGE shower stall, the tv built into the mirror was a nice touch, also only one pool was open, second stay, a week later, was at the new Octavius Tower, beautiful BIG room, with a couch, table , chairs, and a great view of the pools ,all were open by this time, but construction going on for the hot tubs, We had a few problems with this room, and I cannot mention enough, how the staff and management helped us out, they are just the friendliest and most understanding people I have ever met, and because of this I will only stay at Caesars Palace for all our future trips to LV, we have stayed at the Aria, and the BEllagio...., also, staying at this tower, gave us separate check-in entrance, avoiding the VERY LONG line-up that I witnessed at the main registration area, boy, if there is one are they have to fix, it would be that, as I would have hated to stand in that line, I believe there were quite a few conventions that week, there is a great atmosphere in the casino area,and I did not find it to be as smoky as the other casinos, there is a fantastic shopping centre, with a mixture of high end and middle end shops, restuarants plenty of, we ate at Spago;s, EXCELLENT, and Rao;s, also very good. I hope to be back soon as we had an amazing time, also! no resort fee, love that!, I totally agree with other trip advisor Norcal/..........Could be world Class.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, with a couple glitches”
Reviews.Author: Diabla454
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends at Caesar's the third week of March, 2012. We checked in at 10 PM, and was surprised to learn that our rooms weren't ready. (Huh, Really? at 10 PM?). Anyway, she said we could get rooms with queen beds as opposed to King beds in the Palace Tower. Fine, good to go. Once I got up to my room, the temp must've been 75 degrees. The thermostat was digital and I could not figure out how the heck to lower it (no, I'm not a moron, please believe, this thing required a NASA engineer to get it figured out. It was like Darth Vader's chest buttons). Then the toilet handle was not working so unable to flush. Called reception and someone fixed it while I went out for drinks. As suggested by other reviewers, I brought those K-Cup coffee things (so I didn't have to pay $12 for four cups of coffee), only to discover the next morning that the coffee maker was broken. Ah well, did find a express line for getting coffee at a small pastry/coffee place near the Palace Tower. The pools are really nice, and there are comfy lounge chairs and beds to relax on. Before streching out on one of the lounge chairs, I went straight to an outdoor bar near one of the pools to grab a drink. Super sized mojitos are always a good thing!. Didn't try any of the restaurants at Caesar's. I do however recommend the Oyster Bar at Harrah's. If you get a chance to be here before the end of April, check out O'Shea's across the street from Caesar's. Cheap drink prices, and Vince Neil Ink tattoo shop. O'Shea's will be closed at the end of April, and will be completely torn down at some point. I've stayed at The Mirage and Aria in the past two or so years. Out of The Mirage, Caesar's and Aria, I liked Aria the best in terms of room quality and the swimming pools with great cocktail service. All in all, Caesar's was OK. It is a HUGE hotel/casino, so be prepared for lots of walking. Next time I go to Las Vegas, I will try another casino to stay at just to try somewhere different.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TriggerMN
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at Harrah's, Flamingo, or Imperial Palace. We know what to expect out of these places. Last week we stayed at Caesars Palace as part of the Pure Romance National Convention. Check-in lines were about 40 minutes long and nobody was even allowed to try to check in until 1:00 PM. We got a 1-king room on the 8th floor of the Roman Tower. We ended up having a number of people hang out in our room, as all of the double queens were not ready. Pure Romance meetings began at 5:30, and many correspondents were not able to even get into their rooms by then, much less be dressed and ready. Our room was quite spacious, only the suites at the Rio compared to square footage in the places we have stayed. The bathroom was tiny, however did have a television in the sink area. Our tub did not drain properly--it would take 15-20 minutes to drain all the water out after a shower. The convention took place mostly in (I believe) the Octavian Room, and it was a wonderful, large setting. Drink service on the casino floor was quite slow, except for one Asian waitress who would come back with drinks for us even before we had ordered them. We gave her a few bucks extra, and she would come back with two at a time. Thank you!!! I do realize that this was the opening weekend of the NCAA basketball tournament, so that may have affected the pace of drink service. The sports book was a zoo--I mean that in a good way. Tons of people cheering on their teams. If you didn't get there early, you were standing the majority of the day. I made my bets early, and I know many people could not get their bets in on time, especially halftime wagers, because of the long lines at the counter. After we checked out of our room, we had our bags held at the bell desk. They obviously do not treat bags well there, because they broke the LCD screen on our laptop, which we did not realize until we got home. All in all I expected more out of Caesars, considering it is supposed to be one of the finer places on the strip. We still had a good time, but not exactly wonderful. We will mostly likely go back across the street in our future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: juneroses
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caesars Palace(Augustus tower) Mar.19-21 and had a suite w/two beds and a view of the Bellagio fountains and strip! Thanks to the wonderful lady that gave us the ´complimentary upgrade´ 8) The room was clean but be very careful with the ´fridge´ as the items, when moved, are sensored and the front desk will charge you if the items were removed. When entering the hotel..the smell was a bit ´smokey´ compared to the other few hotels we checked out but the hotel is beautiful(same with the Bellagio next door). The inside was just what we expected and everyone there was very friendly. The only disappointment was that the weather wasn´t very warm as we hoped for..only two of the 8 pools were open but what a great place to lounge when the weather becomes warmer. Definitely will return but not during Spring season. Tip:..expect to pay a high price for drinks and food as I couldn´t believe how expensive it was to vacation in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be World Class”
Reviews.Author: NorcalWanderlust
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent two nights at Caesar's Palace in connection with a professional convention at the hotel. The hotel complex is huge and one of the best spots on the strip. But at 6:30 on a Wednesday night, check-in took just over 40 minutes! Not a good start. We were upgraded to a 600 square foot room in the Augustus tower that had been recently renovated. It was quiet and very tastefully furnished. The bed was fine, but we expected something better. The bathroom was luxurious with abundant marble, a jacuzzi tub and his and her sinks. Strangely, there were no extra towels and on both days, our drinking glasses were obviously not clean with grease and lipstick smudges. The Circle restaurant had superbly prepared food for the price and cheerful wait staff. The convention facilities were upscale, but a good 10-minute walk from our room through the hyperactive and smoke-filled casinos. If you like large hotels and casinos in Las Vegas, you could be happy here. We are not Vegas lovers so the next comment should be taken in context. The reason we will never return to Ceasar's is that the casinos and other public areas were like being trapped in a crowded mall with the omnipresent noise, smoke, poorly dressed revelers, casino bars and the like. To each his own.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: annmareegrant
Reviews.Content: Everything in Vegas is so big so take your walking shoes. This is beautiful hotel we bought as a package with flights so it was excellent value from Los angelas. Super clean and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “where there's smoke..........”
Reviews.Author: Sahali
Reviews.Content: After a 12 year hiatus, a friend + I returned to Vegas to fulfil a 'bucket list' wish to see Celine Dion perform in person.More about that later. We were greeted in a friendly + professional manner...as expected from the [usually] very well-trained staff in Las Vegas. Our room was upgraded and I must say, it was lovely + big. Past experience has left me with the opinion the older hotels have larger rooms than the new ones.....unless, of course you have buckets of money + can afford to pay the whopping fees for the homes-within-a-hotel. We cannot. That said, the room was expensive enough what with the fluctuating room charges....Wed. is $200, Fri is $500 and so on. Even though I didn't use it, I thought the TV in the bathroom was a nice touch! And it was a beautiful bathroom! Celine's show was as awesome as it gets + I highly recommend it. Very intimate setting in spite of this being a 5000 seat venue. Incredible. Brought right back down to earth immediately upon stepping foot outside into the smoky casino!!! I cannot believe, in this day + age, you can still smoke in the casinos!!! One can't even smoke in the pubs in IRELAND any more,for Pete's sake, but smoking is allowed in the casinos. I shake my head just thinking about it. Needless to say, this severely inhibited my gambling as I could only stay in the casino for a short period of time. My friend had better staying power. At check-out an employee offered to check us out the quick + easy method + assured us our points would be applied to the bill. They weren't ,so they are lost as we won't be going back any time soon. We tried several restaurants in the hotel + they were excellent, both in food quality + service. There is a nice little bar as you enter the Forum Shops which has food specials at the bar.....the sliders are terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: Adam P
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent trip here. Check in was quick. I was allocated a corner room in the Augustus tower (3393)... I think that the corner rooms are bigger than the standard rooms, it was HUGE and came with an unexpected view of the Bellagio fountains. Furnishings were of good quality. Room service was prompt and the room service guy was amazingly friendly (even though the tip was included and he made a point of saying this). Cleaning was to a very good standard and there was a good choice of channels on the TV. I wanted to extend my stay by 1 night and thought there may be problems doing this as I booked via British Airways and not direct with the hotel. Reception were exceptionally helpful in helping me extend the trip and made an excellent effort to make sure that I didn't have to change rooms. I had previously stayed at Aria, I felt that Caesars Palace was of better quality with more friendly staff and in a better location. The trip could have been better with inclusive WiFi although I would rather pay for WiFi than have a mandatory resort fee (as charged by many other hotels on the strip). WiFi speed was fast with a strong connection.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: flagitious_mystic
Reviews.Content: Nice suite, looked a little tired though. Although, they are in the process of refurbishing I believe. 'New' rooms are available in one of the towers. Very central and perfectly placed on The Strip for all the attractions. An upgrade was negotiated upon check in for a reduced rate and the staff very helpful. Would stay at Caesars again.

Reviews.Title: “It's overrated!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at caesars for four nights & it was the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel. Check in was fine. Didnt take very long, but once I arrived in my room I discovered the bathroom lights were not working, and the toilet was running. Not only that but one of the lightbulbs in the lamps by the bed were out as well. So had to call a maintenance guy up to repair everything. Turns out it was the breaker that caused the lights from turning on and needed to be resetted. This happen more than once to me.Then my keycard stop working randomly and had to wait in line for half an hour to get a new one. And the shower door leaked as well. I tell you i'm never staying at caesars again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: AdamVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great service. The employees are very friendly and helpful. There was a booking error and we even got upgraded! Location is central on the strip and shopping is at the forum shops.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel with Some Flaws”
Reviews.Author: Spalaw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from staying a couple of nights at Caesars Palace. We have stayed at 9 major strip properties in the last four years ranging from NYNY on the low end to Encore on the high end, and have walked through nearly every strip and major non-strip hotel. We don’t really gamble, so we look to stay at fun hotels just to have a good time. Unlike many other people who seem to complain about everything, we have yet to stay at a Vegas hotel that I would say “never again.” We had a really good time at Caesars. It’s a large hotel with a lot of people and a lot going on, and has a great center-strip location. We had a great time having drinks at the Shadow Bar and had a few dances at Cleopatra’s Barge. The staff for the most part was friendly and helpful. We stayed in a Forum Tower room on a high floor with a great view of the north strip. The Forum Tower rooms have been renovated and are nicely decorated. The bathroom has a TV built right in to the glass mirror and is one of the cooler things we’ve seen in a room. The Forum Tower is also a great location if you like to stay closer to the action than you get with the other towers. We did not eat at the hotel because the food choices were either pricy restaurants or lower-end food court options. Caesars did have it’s flaws. The casino has a stronger smoke smell than most other hotels. The casino and hotel is also pretty spread out so plan on walking a little more than smaller hotels. During our stay, there seemed to be more of a “convention crowd” than I’ve seen at other hotels. My biggest criticism was our room. Although more recently renovated, the furnishings had a lot of wear and tear. The furniture surprisingly was very scratched and scuffed up. The chair and couch were not very clean so we didn’t even use them. I thought the general cleanliness of the room and hallways was not up to par with other comparable hotels. Overall, I would give Caesars a 3 ½ star rating. I wouldn’t mind staying there again if I can get a good rate (my rate for this trip was about 40% off the normal rate and there was no resort fee like at MGM properties). However, for a comparable rate, there are other hotels I would rather stay at such as MGM Grand, Mirage, Mandalay Bay, and probably even Planet Hollywood or Treasure Island. My review may have been a little higher if we had stayed in one of the other towers, but we weren’t able to get a complimentary upgrade to the Augustus Tower which was the only other location I would have liked. My review might have been a little lower if I had paid a normal rate for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the center of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Dan7667
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Venetian, New York New York, and now Caesars. For pure luxury, go for the Venetian, but for the money, stay at Caesars. We booked the cheapest room we could get. We got automatically upgraded to the Augustus Tower (tried the $20 trick but was told by the clerk that we had already been upgraded to a better room and she slid me my $20 back). We had walked through Caesars in the past and thought that we may enjoy staying here. We were not disappointed. The room was huge. We love the entire property. Plenty to do here as well as great food and shopping. Caesars in smack in the middle of the strip so you are relatively convenient to everything. A tip I learned on this trip, if you have a rental car, use the free VIP valet on the south side Flamingo Rd. entrance if you are staying in Augustus or Octavius.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: NancyGail
Reviews.Content: My family of four had two beautiful hotel rooms in the Palace Tower on the 24th floor. My grown children had a huge room with two double (or queen size?) beds, and huge bathroom. My husband's and my room had a king size bed and was not as big as my children's room. The decor was the same in both rooms and was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: OKCgirl
Reviews.Content: After seven days on a family road trip (with three kids - 11, 13, 15), we decided to splurge our last night and stay at Caesar's Palace before flying home the next day. The room was extremely large and well appointed with a great view of the Strip. We were even more impressed with the oversized bathroom, complete with large, walk-in shower and monstrous jacuzzi tub. Needless to say, everyone made good use of the tub (the first time the kiddos were excited to bathe in seven days), then we wandered around taking in the sights all evening until we couldn't take another step and headed back to our beautiful room. I've stayed in Vegas several times in different places along the Strip (Paris, Balley's, Flamingo, Venetian), and the room at Caesar's was, by far, the largest and most luxurious I've seen. I'll definitely encourage my husband to make reservations there the next time we take off for a romantic weekend to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Last show I will see at Ceasars”
Reviews.Author: Caltraveler981
Reviews.Content: Each time I see a show at the coliseum I say this will be the last time I do that but I am drawn back by the headliners. The venue is large and if you are not in the lower seats the experience is diminished. Ticket prices are high for the seating experience. My first show I had third row seats on a wing and spent the entire show looking through a camera man for special effects. Although I had presale tickets I was never able to get in the central seating close to the show. I watched Middler, Cher, and Rod Stewart from the upper orchestra. The last show I was unfortunate enough to sit behind three women who decided to stand up and dance the entire show. This behavior happened at previous shows but not to me. Although we protested the ushers did nothing. If you tried to take a picture of the show there was immediate action. If you are not wealthy or lucky enough to get a good seat you are better off buying an album or watching them on TV. If you are rude and inconsiderate and like to stand up and dance through the entire show this is your venue.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Vegas by far”
Reviews.Author: kkroe77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. they upgraded us to the octavius tower and my goodness was it beautiful. Not only was it clean but impecibly clean! Even that gross spot behind the toilet and in the corner of the showers! It was beautiful. the service was great and all the food in every restaraunt was fabulous. Bit pricey, but no more prcey then any other hotel! The pool complex is great, beautiful and unique. Lots of pools with swim up poker! Really liked this place! NO BED BUGS for my stay! I sooo recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, had some problems”
Reviews.Author: bradyhalse
Reviews.Content: We arrived at caesars last week for march madness and were greeted by a great staff on the front drive. Every one was very helpful and took care of everything for us. We went in to check in at 7:45pm and everything started off great. We asked if they might have any upgrades available and were told they found one room left that we could stay in. Unfortunately they said the room wasn't cleaned because the person staying in it just checked out. We had no problem waiting because they said it was a free upgrade and said it wouldn't be long before it was ready. After checking in with the front desk three different times we finally got in. AT 12:45 AM! Once we arrived at the room in the new octavius tower we realized that it was the exact same room we booked and paid for online. The property offered us a $50 food credit for waiting the whole time. This is not the way you want to start your trip out. The casino in Caesars is always great and there is no better place to watch March Madness. The location is in the middle of the strip, very close to city center, bellagio, wynn and everything else. I liked the property overall but was not pleased with how everything was handled at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Sportsbook a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Katie M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met some friends in Vegas for March Madness 2012. We spent the first day watching the games at Caesars' Sportsbook, which we couldn't get a seat at unless we had camped out there the night before. We knew it would be crowded (everyone said it was "the place to be"), but we thought that getting there 3 hours early would be enough time to get a seat. Boy were we wrong. We practically had to throw elbows to get to the bar nearest the screens, where we continually experienced horrible service from the bartending staff. In fact, the whole crowd at the bar was in an uproar, because people just couldn't get drinks, and if/when they did, they got a whole lot of attitude along with them. The only good part was that the horrible service at the bar brought us patrons together, despite our different team rivalries and opposing bets.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: MarriageDoc
Reviews.Content: The pool area is breathtaking! We stayed in the new Octavia tower, which boasts some of the biggest rooms available. Security is great, as they checked room keys in order to get to elevator area. Close to other major hotels also. Forum shops are the best, with every major brand available. Dining was amazingly good! Try the seafood pasta at Rao's. If it was socially acceptable, I would have licked the bowl clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. Good casino. Unfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: JPCJR
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the wee hours of the morning to obnoxious front desk staff. Knew enough to ask for a supervisor who made up for the hassle with a suite for the night. Even though we had to move into the room we had booked for the rest of our stay, the room was very nice. Never found any hotel staff that treated us well. Casino was exact opposite, great crowd, accomodating hostesses. True Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Vice43
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here at least 10 times and is our favorite hotel when in Vegas. The Augustus and Palace towers are sweet and for our upcoming trip we are booked in the new Octavious tower and are looking so forward to that. The service we have received of the years has always been first rate from the Valet to the checkin to the maids.

Reviews.Title: “A superb upgrade!!”
Reviews.Author: Diorgirl71
Reviews.Content: After a very long day, 3 flights from the UK, we arrived at Caesars Palace on Saturday 3 March 2012 at 7.30pm. No queue...straight to the desk where we had a lovely greeting from TOM, he was courteous and asked if we had visited before?? My husbands 4th time, my first!! "I will try and get you a nice room", he said....after a few minutes of formalities..he said he had upgraded us from the forum tower, which we had booked to the Palace Tower..Honeymoon suite Tom was duly tipped by my husband as we did not try the $20 trick, the suite was a beautiful room, all new furnishings, 2 huge bathrooms, oversized jet tub gorgeous views over the magnificent pools...it was a shame we were only spending 2 nights there...an extremely pleasant stay..would definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to the expectation!”
Reviews.Author: RuthAnneFergie
Reviews.Content: We had asked to be in the new Octavius wing but the front desk guy, trying to do us a favor, upgraded us to the Palace tower. We had a 1200 sq foot suite on the 28th floor but still it was lacking in so many things, it was only a nice gesture! Two things...if you're in a 1200 sq. ft luxury suite, do they really have to charge you $3.00 each for a cup of coffee?? Can they not absorb that cost somewhere and make you think you're getting the coffee for free?? And 14.99 for internet for 24 hours?? in this day and age?? It's ridiculous! Plus, the room was quite dated and in bad need of upgrades. The windows were covered in bird poop and the ledge outside the window was filthy! (photos will be added soon) I had to call to customer service 3 times for problems yet they couldn't even comp me a cup of coffee of free internet for a day! Will definitely try some place else next time! Oh yeah...the smoking in the room is bad (the previous customers)..the front desk never asked us and we didn't think to ask(for non-smoking)...it seems so unusual to have to ask, but.......the smoking everywhere is so gross!

Reviews.Title: “The New Octavius tower room is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Moonlight
Reviews.Content: Writing this review from from our room at the Caesars. Have stayed in the Forum, Palace, Augustus towers at the Caesars- mostly at the Augustus (the nicest of all the towers several months ago, ranking from 3 to 4 stars amenities). The new Octavius tower is the best of all Caesar towers with its own VIP checkin and valet entry. We have two connecting rooms with brand new designer bedding (super high and comfy beds), Qua toiletries, fluffy towels, whirlpool tub and separate shower, USB connector, flat screen t.v. in room and in bathroom, iphone charger, and modern decor. Our 66th floor room gave us great view of the pool, and there is a new shortcut from our elevators to the casino, which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: KristinaTXNJ
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at Caesars Palace in mid-February, and my husband went with me. I think (but won't swear) we had a room in the Palace Tower, and it was very nice. I booked the room through the group hosting the conference, and the rate was less than the conference group rate I usually get at much lesser properties. The room was HUGE...not necessarily that unusual for comparable properties in Vegas, but still really enjoyable. Not only did the room have a coffeemaker, it had a KEURIG, so I didn't have to try to figure out anything in the early morning, pre-caffeine dark (while trying not to wake my husband). There was a separate vanity area outside the bathroom with a nice lighted mirror and outlet. Good water pressure in the shower. The conference rooms were nice as well, and the wifi - while not free - was easy to use, and the bandwidth was good enough that I didn't have problems. Of course the restaurants, shopping, casino, etc were all added bonuses. We did not rent a car and it was too chilly to try the pool. All the hotel staff we dealt with were pleasant and helpful,and overall we were quite impressed at what we got for the price, especially compared to conference hotels in cities like Houston, Austin, or San Antonio. My husband was impressed by the sports book. Overall, we liked it well enough that we just went to Atlantic City and spent two nights at the CP there.....

Reviews.Title: “An all around good time”
Reviews.Author: Cheeser08
Reviews.Content: Brand new octavius tower is beautiful. Furnishings were updated and tasteful. A little hard to get to, but well worth the walk. Very nice bathroom, with a TV in it. Room was hot and even with thermo set to 60 seemed very warm. It's vegas so u expect everything to be top notch. A minor inconvenience. We would definetely stay again. Great selection of restaurants from very pricey to the best food court in Vegas. Clubs are overpriced and crowded, but again it's vegas and u expect it. Sportsbook and casino are fantastic. Pool is another very pleasant experience. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, but nice”
Reviews.Author: lomimu
Reviews.Content: Here for a conference, received a complimentary upgrade to a suite in the Forum Tower. Older section, but it didn't show, as the room was massive and gorgeous. No coffee in room (unless you spent $12 for 4 pods for the machine), and quite the hike to get coffee somewhere in the main area of the hotel. The whole place is MASSIVE (uh, full sized marble replica of 'David' anyone??) which may either appeal to you - or not. Staff was quite helpful but waits everywhere for everything are long, given the scale of the place.

Reviews.Title: “CAESARS PALACE 5TH STRAIGHT STAY AND THEY STILL OUTDUE THEMSELVES EVERYTIME”
Reviews.Author: a1copyguy
Reviews.Content: this was our 5th straight stay at caesars palace,again,they just seem to keep out doing themselves. yes,I am a loyal player with them,and enjoy the perks of being a diamond card holder. but just the same we are just avg ppl who just enjoy going to vegas twice a year. we have not considered sstaying anywhere else in teh last 2 or 3 years. they floored me on this trip.we always use the caesars limo service( it just adds to the excitment and good feeling of arriving in vegas) anyway,we were greeted at the limo by a man from vip services,trust me,I dont consider myself a vip kind of guy, but they said our room was all ready, no need to check in and took us directly up to our augustuce tower room. did all of our paperwork there no need to even use diamond check in. we always prefer augustuce tower,even over what is supposed to be the wonderfull new oct? (sorry cant spell it) tower. we enjoy the chance to get a bellagio fountain view if you get a high floor with an even numbered rooom. they now have security checking room keys on weekends which i think is a nice touch. the augustuce tower is just the perfect distance from the elevators to or across the main lobby into the casino. palace and newest tower are closer to the pools andjust a bit of a longer walk yes, many will say they dont like having to buy the kurig coffee maker package, if this is a problem,bring your own,or order room service or better yet, they just added a newer payard coffee station just within the casino entrance near the bellhop, never had more than 1 person in front of me. there is another location closer to the actual payard rest that seems to alway have longer line.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms... but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: GerdSchenkel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the (new?) Octavius tower. Rooms are nice, large enough etc. But ... No coffee maker in the room, so you're held prisoner by the slow and expensive room "service" (1 coffee, 1 hour, $13) No food served by the pool (must be a world first).... but you can have plenty to drink (I guess the margins are better on alcohol). Pool closes at 6pm, so you gotta get in early.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but $$$$$$”
Reviews.Author: litew8t
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel after picking up our car at the airport. When we pulled up to the front the valet was very rude and told us we could not park there. We were told to go around back,the front was for gold and diamond members. Not staying there before,how were we to know? So told hubby to go park and I would check in. Check in only had a few people in front so it did not take long(we lucked out cause we noticed huge lines all weekend). I asked for an upgrade and it was no problem and no extra charge,although I figured a $20.00 tip was in order. We got a room in the Augustus tower. It was very nice and over looked the Bellagio fountains. The room it self was nice but DO NOT touch the mini bar unless you are going to use that item, it will charge you as soon as you pick it up.I heard that it was costly for coffee too, so we brought our own keruig coffee pods thinking that would help.....nope. As soon as you touch the coffee maker, it has a sensor and it will charge you auto. Good think I called the desk before I tried. Other than that good rooms. The hotel restaurants are very pricey...so eat somewhere else. But saying this if you want to spend, there are some good ones there. The service from all the staff was great. I don't know if we would stay there again, not because of the prices but we like to try different place. All in all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Tarnold8200
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here well over 10 times, and will be back many more times. I have stayed in all of the major hotels in Las Vegas at one time or another, and nothing evokes the sensation of being in Las Vegas like arriving at Caesars Palace. The service is great and the rooms are excellent. Being a meeting planner, I can also say that they have the best meeting space in the entire city. It works great for my large groups or my smaller groups, as it is very flexible. The restaurants are amazing. Rao's is as good as it gets for me in Las Vegas. Amazing food. They have several towers, so pick the one you want to be in based on what you are doing, and you will cut out a lot of walking. Augustus is near the spa, Roman and Palace are near the meeting space. Forum is close to the entrance and Pure nightclub.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the experience”
Reviews.Author: kw6289
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Caesars for 1 night, after a long flight from New York, we arrived before check in, but asked anyway incase our room was ready, it wasn't ready so we decided to leave our things with the bag drop and go have a walk around to pass a couple of hours, the bag drop people were really friendly towards everyone. A couple of hours later we came back for check in and the room still wasn't ready which was after the check in time so we had a look around the hotel while we waited. Eventually we got to go to our room, which was very very basic, the bathroom was quite spacious and clean, but contained the only mirror in the whole room! So this was obviously annoying when 4 girls are trying to get ready! the main room had quite an old looking tv, and 2 smallish double beds. There was also only 1 plug for the whole room?! Having said all that, the room was really clean, and the hotel itself and the facilities are amazing - we could have spent all day at the pool area! The location of Caesars is great, and the staff we came across were all friendly although (due to how busy they were) the reception staff seemed to rush people along. We stayed in another hotel for our 2nd 2 nights and to be honest if I went to Vegas again I would probably stay in the 2nd one and not Caesars, as people are allowed to walk freely through Caesars and use the facilities anyway!

Reviews.Title: “wish I could tell you I'm joking but I can't! : (”
Reviews.Author: Valerie K
Reviews.Content: This was our first time here and will be our last! Upon checking into our room (Palace Tower) we found that 1/4 of the in-room bar was empty, the phone next to the bed wasn't working, the AC was not working, the toilet flushed but wouldn't stop running until you manually lifted the handle, the remote control obviously needed new batteries and within 10 minutes learned that the ice machine on our floor was also not working. I called guest services immediately and was kind of laughing because I thought candid camera had to be somewhere nearby. Guess I was really surprised considering the price per night at this hotel. Anyway, I notified guest services... They said someone from maintenance would be up to our room the following morning. They had a bell boy deliver ice to us and he suggested that we use the ice machine on one of the other floors.. seriously?! Wow! So maintenance came by the following morning (we were not in the room at the time he came by) but he did leave a card letting us know that the items were fixed. Well… we found out the hard way ... nothing was fixed! We didn't realize it until we returned to our room, late in the evening and were fast asleep when we both woke up sweating our butts off!! The only thing that was fixed was the phone next to the bed. Thank God we were only there 2 nights! Once we were home and unpacked, my husband realized that he left 2 pairs of shoes behind (men!) … I was/am stumped because we are very anal about checking, double checking & triple checking the room before we leave. We both checked the room, closets, drawers etc.. and do not recall seeing his shoes anywhere (not small feet so they can’t hide very easily, lol). Anyway, I called the hotel/lost & found to let them know about the shoes. I was told that they would check lost & found inventory and would get a phone call within 10 minutes. Ha! I’m still waiting for a return phone call! I’ve since called 4 additional times and also went online to file an incident report, with lost & found and a second with customer service to let them know of our bad experience. I have not heard anything from this hotel on any of these issues. I can’t help but wonder…. Did we really leave 2 pairs of shoes behind (which would mean we are both partially blind) or did someone take them? (cleaning people? I doubt it … maintenance man – maybe? Hmmm….. I guess we’ll never know. My husband and I are not young kids – we stayed here because we were told it was a very nice hotel compared to others. The hotel IS nice but the service is terrible – the worst I have ever experienced!! Everyone has different experiences but I just can’t get over how bad ours was. I’m aggravated due to how much this hotel costs us but laughing because I can’t believe the problems we had – it’s a joke! We normally stay at Excalibur – I know, it’s a kiddie hotel and it’s not the latest and greatest but I have never experienced anything bad at the Excalibur. If you choose to stay at Caesars Palace - - - I can only hope your experience is a lot better than ours!! I’m still keeping hope that someone from Caesars Palace will actually care about their guests and will acknowledge my complaint(s) but I highly doubt it.

Reviews.Title: “A stellar property!”
Reviews.Author: qhdesigner
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel for a 2-night stay. We were sent to the Octavius Tower. We had a beautiful suite with a view of the Bellagio Hotel Fountains, the Paris Hotel... We were told that the tower in which we stayed had only recently opened. It was quite pristine. There was a powder room and a full bathroom. The bathroom had fully amenities: a large shower, a spa bathtub, 2 sinks and a small flat-screened tv. The towels were large and lush. There was a lighted mirror that was actually well-magnified. There was another lighted mirror in the dressing table. The bedroom had a large, high bed. I thought that the pillows were too firm, but that was my only complaint. The room was well lit and had a large flat screen tv. There was a chaise lounge in the bedroom as well. A particularly nice touch are the reading lights attached to the headboard on either side of the bed. The living room offered a couch and table and chairs. There was also a large flat screened tv and 2 chests. One was below the tv and the other was adjacent to it in the room with all kinds of high-end goodies that one could purchase for exorbitant sums of money. And there is the requisite refrigerator filled with more goods. There was not a refrigerator available to stores any items, although apparently one can request one be placed in the room. There was an entry way with a coat closet and the powder room was located off of it. We were on the 66th floor. The only downside would be (or a plus for some) was that it was a very lengthy walk from the elevator to get anywhere in the hotel from this tower. The Forum, a shopping mall offering virtually every designer desirable is represented here. The layout is in a spiral form. It is very attractive and a place that someone who is looking for that type of shopping experience will have a wonderful time. I enjoyed the casino. I do not play table games and so I cannot comment on them. I did enjoy the variety of slot machines. The staff in the casino was very courteous and kept the facility clean. We did visit the Diamond Lounge and it was a pleasant and relaxing place to be. The food that they served was very eye appealing and quite good. The service was excellent. The only restaurant in the hotel where we dined was one off of the lobby: Central. Our meal was good. There are many choices or renowned restaurants in the hotel. We were going to have lunch at Serendipity when we arrived, but when we walked in the music was too loud for us and left. The pool area looked lovely. The pool was closed during our visit. It was cool and windy during our stay. This hotel clearly trains its staff well because I only experienced one service glitch and that was upon check in. I did the registration myself in the VIP area, but I did not receive VIP treatment. I was ignored. One person was assisting a guest when I arrived and another person behind the counter was on the telephone. However a man came behind the counter and never offered to assist me. When 2 young women arrived he immediately walked up to them and offered assistance. Instead, another woman walked behind the counter and helped the young women. This man never asked me if I could use some help. Since I do not suffer fools well, I went to the office and made my feelings known. The woman who helped me was very kind and efficient. I would highly recommend this hotel for someone looking for an elegant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience at Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyMBSC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at Caesar's Palace, and had originally booked a Palace Tower Deluxe Room (which was a conference special). We were upgraded upon arrival to the Octavius Tower, and were pleasantly surprised, but had confirmed a king sized bed, and had two queen sized beds. They told us to check back in the morning and they'd find a king room for us. They didn't have any in the Octavius tower immediately and said we could either wait a few hours to change rooms or we could have an Executive Suite in the Forum Tower. We thought it was a trick question, but of course we chose the suite. It was fabulous, everything about it, other than the view (of the mountains, not of the strip). It was amazing and I highly recommend the Forum tower over the Octavius Tower. So easy to get to and around for conferences and the casino. We really preferred the bars here to most of the other casinos. We even stayed at the Venetian for a night and completely preferred our room AND the casino & bar to the Venetian. Awesome restaurants (highly recommend Joe's Stone Crabs in the Forum Shops) and highly recommend the Seahorse Bar. The bartenders will ceratinly take care of you, even if you play the quarter video poker machines with $10! We are already planning our next trip back to Vegas and WILL DEFINITELY be staying at Caesar's for sure. I really can't say enough about it. Also, the location is PERFECTION to me! Right smack dab in the middle of the strip. Serendipity 3 is a MUST--just get there early b/c they're ALWAYS BUSY, but seriously well worth the wait. Promise you'll LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it, LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: Steph H
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas & having returned only this morning I can safely say that we cannot wait to go back to Ceasars! We could not fault the staff, the service here is second to none. As soon as our host at reception found out that we were travelling for my partner's 30th Birthday we were immediately upgraded to the Palace Tower with amazing views of the pool complex. The room was nothing less than stunning, spa jet bath, twin bathroom & queen size bed! Per square foot our suite at Ceasars was bigger than our 2 bed flat at home! My only disappointment from the room was the minibar, it is VERY expensive. There was a vending machine on our floor which charged a reasonable $2.50 for a bottle of Water / Pepsi, versus almost $8.00 for a bottle of water from the minibar; we found it best just to forget it was there! Housekeeping was fabulous & all the staff very polite. Our towels and sheets were changed every night for the 7 nights we stayed. We requested fresh towels one afternoon & they were delivered to our door within 10 minutes! Pretty impressive. Dining was good although expensive. The breakfast buffet at RAO'S was just under $50.00 per couple & the spread wasn't great. Most mornings we skipped breakfast in favour of lunch, it worked out a lot better value for money. We only dined at Caesars 3 nights out of the 7, but there is thousands of great places to eat in Vegas, it seemed a shame to only eat in our hotel! Margaritaville across the street was one of our favourites! I would 100% recommend Caesars Palace if you're looking for a Vegas hotel with the WOW factor, it's right in the heart of things & the hotel grounds are nothing less than stunning - they even make building works look good! We can't wait to visit again! xoxoxox

Reviews.Title: “It's Caesars, it's excellent of course!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan S
Reviews.Content: Not much I can say about this really. It is of course one of the world's most famous and prestigious hotels. The staff were very helpful and dispute the sheer volume of people continuously checking in check in was as quick as it could be. The room itself was excellent of course and we got a view of the strip that we requested. Nothing bad to say at all!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable, classy; great location”
Reviews.Author: ParisFans44
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our third stay at Caesars Palace, and once again we are extremely satisfied customers! It was hard not to be on our second stay, since we'd actually gotten married at Caesars in the Venus Garden in 2008 (which I highly recommend if you are planning to have a small but formal wedding in Vegas - it was beautiful). We had booked this trip through Travelocity, planning to stay in the Forum Tower this time (the last two times we had stayed in the Palace Tower, which is slightly more expensive). Upon our arrival, we were told that there were no rooms ready in the Forum (it was about 4 p.m.), but the gentleman at the desk immediately made a call and gave us a complimentary upgrade to a room in the Palace Tower, no "special tip" necessary. The rooms in the Palace Tower are lovely and quite spacious. The bed was so comfortable and was piled high with extra long pillows (great for me as a traveling pregnant woman!). It was also nice and quiet. The bathroom is large, with a nice shower (although last visit our shower was even nicer, with a dual shower head), double vanity, separate toilet, and 2-person jacuzzi tub. Bath robes are provided. Everything about the room is just comfortable and classy, and very clean. The resort itself is massive, but the signs are very clear and it is easy to find your way around. A special treat are the Forum Shops, where the ceiling is painted to look like the sky at dusk and the wide hallways have comfortable, cushioned benches to sit on if you need a break while shopping. We strolled through the shops on our way further south on the Strip, which was a nice shortcut that helped avoid the crowds on the sidewalk outside. There is a fantastic selection of places to eat at Caesars. Our favorite is actually Payard, which has a small restaurant space that adjoins a larger area where you can pick up to-go items including sandwiches, crepes, ice cream, and gourmet desserts and pastries. In fact, Chef Francois Payard himself was in town during this visit, and it was fun watching him in action while we snacked on crepes in the afternoon and ate a delicious breakfast on our last morning. The pool is absolutely gorgeous, and seating is more than ample. We have stayed at resorts where you have to stake a claim on a pool chair at extremely early hours of the morning, but that is not the case at Caesars (although we haven't stayed there during the summer). Another bonus is the location. We were able to walk everywhere from Caesars (in comfortable shoes!), even all the way down to the MGM Grand and back (it helped that the weather was quite nice during this visit). I highly recommend staying at Caesars. We would definitely stay there a fourth time!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience---Twice”
Reviews.Author: 1968Travelgirl
Reviews.Content: I only gave it a second chance because we were having a business conference there and we HAD to stay at Caesars to participate in the conference. Everything about this hotel is bad. We were there for seven nights, in the Roman Tower. The furnishing are so old and beat up it looks like a low rent furnished apartment. The a/c didn't work correctly, the light fixture in the bathroom was broken, the vanity sink was cracked, the paint and wall paper were peeling off the walls and woodwork. I usually try to over look little things but I had a feeling the maid service wasn't cleaning our room very well so I marked the sheets and pillowcase with pen after the first night and I was right, our sheets never got changed the whole time we were there the seven nights. They never cleaned the shower, sinks, or vanity tops. This is really not what you would expect from a hotel that costs this much, or any hotel for that matter. We had food catered by the hotel at our conference several times and there was not one good meal out of all of them. Our last night we had a sit-down dinner in the ballroom and had steak and chicken, the chicken was cold and rubbery and the steak appeared to have been cooked the day before. The service from the waitstaff was also terrible, they were rude and didn't care that all of your table got served except for 2 that had to wait 25 minutes to get their dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: babysladkaya
Reviews.Content: I was here during a professional conference, so the company paid for the hotel which was twice as nice. We had a regular room and it was pretty large, with a huge bathroom and very clean. The only thing that bothered me was even though we had a non-smoking room, there was still a heavy smell of smoke in the hallways from the other smoking rooms, which means that there is no proper ventilation to get rid of the smell. There is abundance of great restaurants, we had a meal at the very elegant and pricey Chinese restarant on the second floor. The hotel's location on the strip is also great-you have Belaggio with its fountains right next door and Paris across the street. The pool at the hotel is also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Augustus tower”
Reviews.Author: DetK
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in a deluxe room located in the Augustus Tower. As the concierge said, this is the newest tower of the Caesars, however I found that lots of detail of decoration were not well finished. The television in the bathroom was hard to use and the remoter was broken as well. As big as a casino resort, they don't have a sound guide of the hotel in the room and guests can easily get lost in the hotel. Location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, NEVER again, Check your bill before you leave.”
Reviews.Author: mustangbonnieCanada
Reviews.Content: First I must tell you I am a seasoned traveler to Las Vegas. More over I am a frequent guest at Harrah's properties. I have given Caesars Place only one stay before and swore I would never return. I am handicapped and can not travel alone. On my previous stay I had asked for and pre-booked adjoining rooms for myself and my helper. Upon check in I was told none were available. I am not about to grease anyones palm, as other reviewers say they do, just to get a room that is medically required. Finally after waiting hours they booked us into the OLD Roman Tower. The room was so old. I was afraid to remove my shoes as the carpet was so stained and very dirty. A 3 days stay resulted in no room service what so ever. No clean towels, no bed service, no clean up of my room. Upon requesting room service my helpers room was cleaned and even though the door was open between our rooms mine was left untouched. There is no ice machine in this tower and if you want ice you have to call room service and of course tip for it. Now for my recent stay. A massive mess up. I had requested the Forum Tower as it is closest to the Colossuem and I had tickets to see Celine Dion. Upon check in at the Diamond center I was informed that Celine was cancelled due to illness. No fault of Caesars I agree. I was given an upgraded room in the Augustus Tower and tickets to Absinthe in place for the Celine Tickets. Just go to the box office to pick up your tickets I was told. We went for dinner and then to the box office only to be informed no tickets had been left in my name. So I trecked back to my room and started making phone calls. By the time all was said and done we missed the first show. So they gave me tickets to the second show, just go to the box office and pick up your tickets. Once again I made the long walk to the box office only to be told once again that no tickets were left in my name. The girl there tried to find out for me but to no avail. I went into the Concierge and spent a long time explaining again to a very nice girl trying to resolve my problem. She was very helpful but became frustrated as well as she was given the run around from department to department. She asked us to sit and wait then told me a supervisor would come and speak to me in 2 minutes. Almost 20 minutes later no one had come so I gave up. I thanked the girl for trying to help me but told her I was not waiting any longer. Poor service to be sure. Though I suppose they really don't care as they have lots of suckers walking through the door. I will never be a sucker again for this property. Now about the room etc. Be very aware that if you are staying at Caesars don't go there on a budget. The restaurants are very, very pricey. If you want coffee or a pop in your room make sure you read the price menu. To have a morning cup of coffee will cost you $12.00. As I have said I have stayed at many properties and most will provide you with at least coffee for the room. EVERYTHING on the counter and in the the fridge are on pressure sensors. So if you remove it you are charged for it. I have included pictures of the price menu. Upon check out I was informed that my confirmation for my tickets was on my bill. So once again I had to explain the whole situation over again and have charges for comped tickets removed from my bill. Comped is suppose to be free not charged to your room. Every item that was lifted and examined from the counter and the fridge was also on the room charge. We never used any of it. So Caesars Place gets a big thumbs down from me.

Reviews.Title: “How could you not love it..”
Reviews.Author: mymisfit
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another great trip to Vegas. This was my second stay at Ceasers and I enjoyed it just as much this time as I did the last...Went for a Slot Turnament and got 3 nites free, but needed 2 extra days so was comped these days as well..only problem was that my first nite was booked in the Forum Tower, the next 3 nites were in the Augustas Tower and then the last nite was booked back into the Forum Tower. Knowing this going in, I knew if I wanted to unpack only once and keep the same room all 5 nites I was going to have to as they say "grease" the palm of whoever checked me in..Hey it's Vegas, this is the way things are done...Anyway at check-in I asked if it would be possible to get checked in to the Augustas Tower for all 5 nites then handed the gentleman my credit card, I.D. and a $50 dollar bill...He took the items and layed them on the counter and went to work on the computer..after a few seconds he looked at me and said "are you afraid of heights?"
