I told him no, and with that I had 5 nites in the Augustas Tower...with a North Strip view that was out of this world...I guess to some $50 may be more then what may have been necessary, and I most likely could have gotten the room with a $20, but after going to the room and seeing what the $50 got me, I have no complants what so ever....After all, all 5 nites were comped. and all I spent was $50 bucks, I would say I got a great deal and only had to unpack and pack one time, not 3...by the way this is the second time I have staryed in the Augustas Tower and again I heard no noise from the hallways, or rooms next door...And believe me it was a packed week with Nascar being in town, you would expect rowdy people...But the young rowdy ones stay over in the cheaper towers so if you like a good nites sleep go for the Augustas Tower, it's right off the lobby and you won't be sorry you went for it...

Reviews.Title: “Had My Wedding Here!”
Reviews.Author: H_Rod88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at Caesrs Palace on June 21st 2011. The wedding packge we booked included a 2 night stay in a petite suite in the Agustus Tower. We loved the room. We had a pool view which was pretty nice.The actual room was amazing. It was huge with a Plush pillow topped bed, clean carpet, floor to celing windows, smelled great, a huge bathroom with his and her toilets and showers. I loved the jetted bath tub. Our wedding night was amazing. The hotel provided us with a bottle of champgne and glasses. The mini bar was fully stalked. We enjoyed everything about our stay. Our wedding was beautiful. The best day of my life, and I will never forget it thanks to Caesars Palace. We visited the pools, and loved them. We gambled a little bit, and actually won a little bit of money. My husband and I enjoyed everything about Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: SP0208
Reviews.Content: went last summer and loved it!..best location!..going back this year, but staying next door at the Bellagio!..great rooms with TV in the MIRROR!! nuts!! cant go wrong with CP ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, food and entertainment in the heart of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: mrsq1030
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Caesar's, and I was impressed with the overall quality. The room was spacious and clean. I didn't do much gambling but saw Elton John at the Colusseum. His performance was incredible and I highly recommend it. We ate at Bobby Flay's restaurant. The pork tenderloid was delicious. Caesar's central location made it easy to see the sights. The only (slightly) negative thing I have to say is that check in was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Augustus Tower Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mainstream_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Wow, what can be said about Caesar’s that hasn’t been said before? Vegas is one of my favorite “fun” cities, and I’ve stayed there dozens of times before. Pinning down what Caesar’s is, and who its ideal for, is not an easy task. Thoughts: • Over the last decade, they have done all the smart improvements to take this property back to its status as best-in-class. Highlights: The lobby is stunning o The new towers are modern, stylish, and upscale o The pool is beautiful o They have several world class culinary offerings, and several more interesting offerings. o The spa is brand new and cool o The mall is still cool and interesting o Many of the areas of the casino are state-of-the art o Having a quick serve, food court is super convenient. Sometimes you just want a simple lunch o Lunch at Payards is one of my favorites in town o The location is great for walking around the strip • Though the improvements are great, there are some elements that prevent this from being a top tier property: o It is sprawling, confusing, and a bit eclectic - o Retaining the original “gambling dome” is kind of cool, in a retro way. Its also kind of weird. o Check in can be a nightmare o It felt big, too crowded. o No resort fees is good, but they are all about the nickel and dime mentality. $12 for in-room coffee is a bit of a turn off. $23 for a red bull vodka was no joy either. o The Augustus rooms are solid, I hear some of the others can be pretty weak Parts of it are nice, as nice as any property. But its just not a cohesive, service oriented experience. If it’s your first time staying in Vegas, you will probably love it (if you have the right budget for incidentals). If you’ve been there before, and stayed at a lessor property, you will probably love it (if you don't order vodka red bull). If you love giant cruise ship experiences, you will feel at home. But if you been to Vegas and stayed at Wynn, Encore, Venetian, Cosmo, or even Bellagio, you might be disappointed. If you are there for a conference, and work is paying for it, you won’t complain. Finally, if you are a gambler, I would label this place as “gambler friendly” for mid-stakes table players. Many of the dealers, particularly in the “dome”, are long term professionals. They know what its about, and they have some great stories. AND, OMG, they let me use my cell phone while at the table (for texting – talking would be rude). R-E-F-R-E-S-H-I-N-G. As far as comps for table goes, who knows these days. Some of our group did some substantial gambling, and only received a portion of “consideration” that they would have years ago. But I suspect that’s a sign of the times, not particular to just Caesar’s.

Reviews.Title: “Hail Caesar”
Reviews.Author: Damian G
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Very fast check in, very fast check out, the place is massive, room was big, clean, well maintained and the shower was extraordinary. I upgraded my room to forum deluxe. The restaurants were great with Spago being absolutely delicious. I was there by myself, but sat at the bar and was well looked after. I had to check out the pool area as all vegas pools are built up on TV, and it did not disappoint. How you picture it is how it really is. The onsite club Pure gets very busy, and is a bit fun if you can be bothered lining up. The club is also right next to a PCD gambling area, so if the lineup is long you can lose money playing 3 card poker or black jack to burlesque themed dealers. Overall Caesars was a fantastic experience and located near all the major hotels, so you can see the Bellagio water show next door or wander across to the venetian and palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at another Hotel...Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: MsCovington
Reviews.Content: I have travelled many places and I must say Caesars Palace Las Vegas was my worst experience yet. I've been to third world countries with better amenities and services. Okay where to begin...Let's start with something positive about the hotel...the "junior suite" was a nice room, however I've been to hotels that their regular rooms offers the same type set-up for much less. It's sad to say that was the only positive thing about Caesars Palace, I experienced. Now to the traveler beware and please read this prior to going to Las Vegas and especially if you are considering Caesars Palace. I arrived on a Thursday evening to what I thought was a full PRE-PAID (Booked through personal travel agent) Las Vegas trip to arrive at a crowded check in area with only, oh maybe 3 desk agents servicing 300 people, it was unbelievable that I was having a "Wal-Mart" moment at Caesars Palace! You know the moment when the line is to the back of the store with only one register open??? I was thinking I paid too much money and I am sure all these other people paid just as much not to have everyone of the agent booth manned! Strike one! Next I get to the counter and the agent informs me "Yes your room expenses are fully paid, however you are only in a deluxe room, it you pay an additional $40 a night we will upgrade you to a junior suite with flat screen TV and jetted tub". I chuckled because again I am in Vegas having to pay additional for a flat screen TV and jetted tub? I get that at Holiday Inn or Crowne Plaza or the Marriott in standard room. So with that being said, I was scared as to what I would get in the "deluxe" room I pre-paid for so the Las Vegas novice in me took the bait and paid for the upgrade no problem. The property is huge, so it is best practice if it is your first time to Caesars Palace to consult someone that has been there to know where everything is otherwise when you get there you will miss out on a lot because there is no welcome service at Caesar’s! There is a concierge lobby that the line stays out the door with and coming in on a late East Coast to West Coast flight trying to gather your bearings waiting for someone to help you at Caesars will make you want to act out so please please checkout Trip advisor prior to your trip! Next thing please please please be advised that although you may have paid thousands of dollars for your accommodations, nothing, I mean nothing, is complimentary at Caesar Palace! Internet is a $14.99 charge for a 24 hour period and for my fellow fitness junkies, be prepared to pay $25 a day to use the fitness center or pack your mace to fight off the bandits, drunks, and panhandlers while you run the strip. Every other Casino I visited while there had a buffet available but not Caesar! The restaurant staff was not friendly at all and I started to think that it was because I was paying with my visa instead of the black amex? I would hate to think that was the case Caesar. I ordered room service the first morning I was there and it came over an hour late, it was freezing cold and items were missing but charged, however I did dispute the charge at checkout and it was removed from my bill. The Casinos had no air ventilation to take out the smoking that was going on so if you are sensitive to smoke do not I repeat do not go to Caesar Casino! I could not enjoy the casino because of their inability to properly ventilate the smoking. I've been to Casinos in other places and have never experienced the second hand smoke that was going on in Caesars! To make a long story with so many disappointments short, I would not recommend Caesar Palace. It is way over priced for what you will get. I would recommend MGM, Mirage or Treasure Island as a first timer choice and I so wish someone would have told me.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kelly W
Reviews.Content: Great, wonderful, fantastic etc....My husband and I spent a week at Caesars Las Vegas Feb./March 2012 for a expo and stayed in the Augustus Tower. The expo was for 4 days but we stayed 3 extra to be able to see other sites L.V. has to offer. During out entire stay we received the ROYAL TREATMENT....I wish to thank the entire staff (I wont list any names in case I forget someone) but starting at the front desk to, valet, concierge, room service, housekeeping, bar & cocktail staff, dealers, host staff, bellstaff, and pit & cage staff. They were all professional and gracious. They made us feel as if we were super super VIPS. We look forward to the chance of visiting again. If I was able to give 10 stars I would.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to look around”
Reviews.Author: Marrowboy
Reviews.Content: Did not stay here but spent time looking around. I associated Caesars with the boxing matches back in the 70s and imagined it to be dated & tatty. How wrong could I be. It was a magnificent building with plenty of style. There are loads of shops if you can afford to shop there, a fake ceiling which makes indoors look like its outside and plenty to see. I rate Caesars as the soul of Vegas and probably occupying the centre of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms! Huge property though lots of walking.”
Reviews.Author: Fusebuddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Forum Tower last week of Feb. My room was very nice. Nice Sony flat screen TV, but only standard definition programming. Hi Def would have kicked this to a 5 star review. Power curtains was very nice too, push button open and close was a kick! TV screen in the bathroom mirror was a nice touch with Bose speakers too. The shower was beautiful tile with two shower heads, a first for this frequent traveler. The bed was very comfortable, slept great. Nice furniture in the room, mini bar. This is a very fine hotel, the restaurants were very good too. But $12 for an in-room coffee? $15 for wifi? In my opinion, just add it to the room price and bill me for the convenience. All in all, you won't regret the rooms, very nice. Another reason I can't give 5 star...the guest before me left a half eaten sandwich and orange in the mini bar refrigerator. The cleaner was not checking this obviously. Huge resort, long walks to get anywhere, but I guess that goes with the territory (strip).

Reviews.Title: “Check in nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Selectone
Reviews.Content: Overall a good hotel with a good location and amenities. The only issue we found was checking in and out. It took over half an hour on both occassions which really needs to be sorted out. When we got to the front there was not even an apology. The time taken was not due to the size of the que but the inefficient way customers are upgrading. They offered us an upgrade for 1000 a night by showing us a plastic wallet with one photo of the room. Not even an offer to show us around first. Overall i found the Venetian to offer a much better level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Room in Roman Tower”
Reviews.Author: AlessandraRB
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 days, and it was great. Service was very good and staff super helpful. Rooms were dated, didn't like them at all, we could hear EVERYTHING from the hall, other rooms, ice dispenser...and the bathroom made a loud noise that couldn't be repaired. Tv didn't work too well, one night the remote just stopped functioning and the TV turned very loud! They helped us twice, and the we just unplugged it so we wouldn't have any more troubles with that. The breakfast at the food court wasn't good, too crowded and a little bit "too fast food" for me, i prefer buffet or menu breakfasts than what they have now.

Reviews.Title: “Some good and bad”
Reviews.Author: EBABWBMB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a corporate conference. Overall the experience was good but there are some things to watch out for good and bad: Good: 1) Lots to do and see here; Fourm Shops are amazing; lots of choices of food and entertainment 2) Conference facilities were excellent and the food they provided for our conference from breakfast to dinner was really good. 3) Good location Bad: 1) Roman Tower is outdated; my modest townhouse is kept in better condition. Carpet ripping in doorway; grout on floor stained, etc. Stay away from Roman Tower!!!! 2) If you don't smoke be prepared to come back with lung cancer; that place has no ventilation. 3) Food court and some other locations get way overloaded during peak hours so plan accordingly 3) Central - It's a bar and restaurant in the main lobby; breakfast was too expensive and service was ssslllooowwww. 4) Ask to have your room cleaned and don't leave it to chance; I came back at 5pm one day to change and they were cleaning it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brown_Sugar2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is HUGE!! So many places to eat and top end shopping is a bonus. I would get tired of walking back to my room after shopping. This hotel is beautiful and located sort of the middle of the strip. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “First time at Caesar's and certainly my last.”
Reviews.Author: 1oc
Reviews.Content: Checked in after booking a non-smoking room. They gave me a smoking room without telling me, and once I trekked to my room (seemed like it was 15 minutes walk from the front desk), I found ash-trays in my room. I called the front desk and they told me that they "only try to give non-smoking rooms" and they are "not guaranteed". They could not change me to another room and were quite rude about it. I ended up leaving the hotel at 8 p.m. on Friday night and checked into another hotel. (In addition to the smoking room, there was a significant party in the room next to mine - perhaps 50 guests being super loud... Caesar's is just a horrible place... never, ever going back there).

Reviews.Title: “Nice room in new wing, still giant Vegas mega-hotel”
Reviews.Author: fozzetti
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice room in the new Octavius wing. Very reasonable price. The service was decent, but this is still a Vegas mega-plex. It compares well to most of the other offerings on the strip, but not much comes to mind that screams "this is the place." On the other hand, for the $100/night I paid, it's hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Ceasars is vegas”
Reviews.Author: Martin R
Reviews.Content: Having been to vegas several times ceasars is still my favourite. Ceasars provides the true vegas experience. Its also in the middle of everything so makes it easier to get around. The pool area is fantastic. Rooms on the roman and forum towers are big but old and dated. Pay the extra for one of the new towers like augustus. The spa is also amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but not my favorite in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: robyn620
Reviews.Content: Was upgraded upon arrival (so they tell me). Room was in the new Octavius Tower which is a hike...from everywhere, must have put on 40 walking miles during my 4 day stay. I personally don't like Caesars casino or the property in general. Just my personal opinion. My hotel decision was made due to the fact all conference sessions I was attending were held at Caesar's. The hotel is very central in location on the strip. Staff was helpful and attentive. Room price discounted for the conference was $179. Bellagio was less expensive..I did not know they are almost connected or I would have stayed there. $14.99 per pay for internet is a rip off. Beware you also will get charged the same price for your phone too. Be careful

Reviews.Title: “Crap service and crap room.”
Reviews.Author: lana_marie_x
Reviews.Content: The service is the worst I have had of any place! Front desk rude, staff on the phone is rude. WiFi is an extra $10 per device per day which is a joke. Room was old and not all that clean but the location is basically the best you can get. I don't recommend this hotel but google the ones close by.. Probably the Bellagio is worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Big big Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonymous-john
Reviews.Content: This hotel (like most in Vegas) is huge. Huge rooms with luxurious appointments. I was here for a conference which was very convenient. I still don't like that the pools in Vegas all seem to close at 5 or 6pm (just as the conference is ending). I also think it is funny that my room on the 28th floor was actually on about the 6th floor (I think they skip 20 floors to make you feel important). Overall a great Vegas destination.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed with this place”
Reviews.Author: daai
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with this place. We had a room in the Roman tower and I thought it was really quite bland and unexciting for Las Vegas. Yes it’s big but there was just nothing special about the room. It didn’t even have a fridge or tea/coffee making facilities in the room. I could not help feeling this was to squeeze every last dollar out of you by making you buy the extremely over priced drinks downstairs. The view we had was through a dirty window behind another tower and it was all very underwhelming. Check in was very slow, a really big queue for each receptionist. In hindsight, I think it might be better to spend a bit more money on your room and get a better one in a more modern tower. The good aspect of our stay in Caesars Palace was its location, so central making accessing all the areas very easy. If you are driving and want to save some money, it’s very easy to Self Park for free. A Las Vegas highlight for me was the Beatles Love show. I thought it was just amazing, if you like the Beatles, you’ll love it! We also had dinner in the Eiffel Tower restaurant, it’s pricey and while the views were brilliant and the service excellent, the food was just not that memorable. Overall I did not love Caesars Palace or Las Vegas, for me both are a rip off and I think there’s much better night life in places like Dublin or Ibiza.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! The room you think you're booking probably won't be the room you get.”
Reviews.Author: KrisinKennewick
Reviews.Content: BEWARE! As you book your reservation for Caesar's Palace, please note that what you see on the website in regards to the room you are booking is not necessarily what you are going to get when you get there. I had stayed previously at Caesar's Palace in an Augustus Tower Deluxe Room. That room was beautiful--clean and remodeled--absolutely gorgeous. I was so impressed, that for the next trip I booked to Vegas, I went online to the Caesar's Palace website and specifically booked and PAID IN FULL for an Augustus Tower Deluxe Room. At check-in I was told there were no Augustus Tower Deluxe Rooms available, but they did have a Palace Tower room available. When I got to my Palace Tower room, I was mortified--it was a standard room--remodeled, but clearly smaller and not the same quality or appearance as the Augustus Tower Deluxe Room. In speaking with management to request the room I had originally reserved and paid for, I was told they have the right to substitute based on availability and pointed out the fine print on my paid reservation stating the same thing. They offered no resolve and kept quoting the previous statement over and over and over. I demanded a credit and booked a stay at a different hotel. What makes me so mad is the principle. Not only is it sad to think anyone going to Vegas for an anniversary, a honeymoon, or other special event may book and pay for the room of their choice and then upon arrival get switched to a lesser quality, smaller room "based on availability," but also when booking the reservation, I paid for an Augustus Tower Deluxe Room which was quite higher in price than the Palace Tower (standard) room. When I brought this up to management, no effort was made to monetarily adjust my reservation. I am definitely a small fish in the sea of Caesar's Palace guests, but I can sincerely say I will NEVER give them (or any Total Rewards property) my business again. I hope that after reading this review, you strongly consider your options. I sincerely wish I would have known prior to making my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: TamieLee
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ Caesars in 2011. We stayed in the Forum Towers room... a little more$ then the basic but ohh so worth it! Quiet, Clean, and awesome rooms. Huge shower, bathroom with tv in mirror and seperate water closet ( toilet) Loved the view and the window even had a small vent you could open for fresh air! If you are going to see Celine, the Forum towers is in the same *wing* This hotel is huge,.... It took me about 30 minutes to get to the spa. Lots of walking.. they even have little road sign "posts" which were very usefull compared to other large hotels in Vegas. We booked through the hotel site itself.. in which after shopping a lot on-line found the best prices on the hotel sites itself. Also , Caesars does NOT have any added fees like many on the strip. 20+ per night ... ( the only negative would be the size.. huge for someone who does'nt like to walk ...) Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Octavius Tower Very Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: kh100
Reviews.Content: Just stayed a couple nights in the brand new Octavius Tower. I'd really give this review just 4.5 stars, because a major downside is the very long walk to the elevators from anywhere else in the hotel, especially the parking garage. But the room itself is nicely equipped, including a modern HD tv with external HDMI and iPhone connectors. I also appreciate that Caesars doesn't charge a resort fee (wifi is $15 per day, though, but thankfully very fast). Huge bathroom with separate rain shower and jacuzzi tub. Very solid stay for a convention trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool property”
Reviews.Author: Chad M
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in almost every hotel on the strip. Caesars is a good hotel. Location is perfect. Forum shops are connected, the property is really cool. The rooms are getting tired. TV's are from way back when Tupac was murdered on the property (god rest his soul. He was a great artist). But lets be honest, you rarely be in the room anyway!!Don't hesitate to book it.

Reviews.Title: “Just arrived to Ceasars and the dissapointment started...the real rate for the spa is $45 bucks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LioSuss
Reviews.Content: I was told when I made the reservation that spa+fitness was $24.99. I was told at check in that spa+fitness was $24.99. I get to the spa and now it is $45. Manager on duty at the spa was all I could talk to and he was helpless. I work for a very large company and we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: joe s
Reviews.Content: ive just recently visited vegas and stayed in caesars,checked in got an upgrade straight away from the forum tower to the newly opened octavius tower despite the walk from the desk to the lifts our room was the best ive ever stayed in 2 huge queen size beds 42"telly at the end table ,chairs ,setee,the bathroom was huge jucuzzi bath double sinks walk in shower and seperate toilet if i do have 1 fault there was no instruction how to use the phone other than that it was brilliant i would definatly book it again if i was going back

Reviews.Title: “Continues to impress”
Reviews.Author: McGeepers
Reviews.Content: Room type; Palace Tower junior suite: Beds; comfy, plenty of pillows Bathroom; luxurious, spa bath, dual head walkthrough shower, 2 toilets (separate) Room size; really big with plenty of space. Check in; Professional and fast. Overall impression; floor to ceiling windows overlooking the pool, modern furnishings and a great bathroom. The spa bath actually worked! So many hotels have a spa bath that sprays everywhere but the bath but this was a beauty. I stayed here a few years ago and they have maintained the same high standards from that visit. It's the pick of the Caears Group properties by the length of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FunFamily44
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. We booked it through expedia and when we arrived they upgraded us to the Palace Tower. It was very nice and very clean. The bathroom had marble flooring with a huge tub and separate shower. We were very happy. The reservations clerk was exceptionally nice as was the bell staff. They were very helpful. A few minor disappointments: I asked if the room had a refrigerator so that we could put our soda in them and were told that to use the refrigerator there was a $20/day fee. That's ridiculous!!! Also we ate at the Munch Bar and there was a waitress there that was incredibly rude. After spending $96 on hamburgers and grilled cheese (yes, you heard me right) she automatically got a $14 gratuity because there were 5 of us. She certainly didn't deserve it. I was appalled at the way she treated us. I sure wish the hotels wouldn't charge so much for their food. We really couldn't find anything affordable to eat and were forced to go outside the hotel in search of more reasonably priced food. Other than that, I would definitely return to Caesars Palace. Very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Security at its worst”
Reviews.Author: Krissy M
Reviews.Content: On our most recent stay we did not stay at Caesars, rather my mom & step-dad did and we were there when they checked in. We went up with them when they went up to their room, to find out the front desk had checked them into a room that was already occupied by someone else. In the room there was in iPAD sitting out, toiletries, and all of the rest of their belongings. How does this even happen. After this incident I would not trust staying at Caesars, at most of the towers they do not even have security checking for room keys. For a hotel this nice you would think the security would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Exhausted from keys not working”
Reviews.Author: AestheticDoctor
Reviews.Content: Our family came to town March 20 for a wedding with plans to stay through March 25. We had a penthouse suite and adjoining room. The only time our keys worked was the first evening. That was the first and only time our keys worked the entire stay. We never entered our room with our keys thereafter. We had security let us in our rooms 4 different times. We went to the front desk for keys four times. Also you can't get on the elevator to the penthouse level without keys working. We routinely got off on the 27th floor and walked the stairs or took the service elevator to our floor. I was given garbage excuses such as were my keys in my pocket with coins or cell phones, so 90's. And BS that if one key deactivates then they all deactivate. Imagine not being able to get into your room once with a 3 and 5 year old. Thank goodness we had a babysitter with us to keep them company while we walked back and forth to the front desk; which seemed smug, arrogant and non caring. We did not encounter Aaron whom was given accolades by security and other staff members. With children and fear of being locked out again we basically ordered room service for all our meals. We will never stay at Caesars again. Sorry to the amazing butlers, maids and security guards for listening to our complaints. Shame on you customer service for your behavior. I will take my cash, line of credit and friends to Venetian or Wynn properties next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay and good location”
Reviews.Author: cdn_vygr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference at the hotel in August 2011. Overall it was a good hotel, and one of my favourite casinos on the Strip (next to The Venetian). Restaurants and bars in the hotel on the pricey side, although we found the Cheesecake Factory in the Forum Shops connected to the hotel to be solid value (although always a long wait). Also the hotel is centrally located mid-Strip. I had an adjoining room here and (like my experience in other hotels), it was like sharing a room with those next door. Try to avoid. Also, watch your hotel bill. As part of our conference package we had a special one-time payment for Internet and gym access during our whole stay -- but a daily Internet fee still showed up on my bill which I had to call to have corrected -- which seemed to cause quite a bit of confusion on the hotel's part. I also had charges on my bill for the mini-bar which I did not use. So be careful and keep a good eye on your hotel charges. Caesars and its affiliate hotels make advertise about having no resort fees, but then you are charged daily for Internet usage, gym usage, and so on, services which are usually covered in other hotels' resort fees. So, in my mind, six of one, half dozen of another (unless you're not making use of these 'a la carte' options). I would definitely stay here again if the price was right, although as I've noted in my other review, the new Tropicana Las Vegas has moved to the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: docriffel
Reviews.Content: Although Caesars was an icon of old Vegas, there are far better places to stay now. We brought our niece out here for her 21st birthday. We had seven rooms. They couldn't even get us in the same tower let alone get our own daughter in an adjoining room to us. We went through booking.com and we paid 50 dollars a night more per room than the rest of the family who went through hotels.com. Not one single person in our group won anything at Caesars but we all won at other casinos. We won big too so this isn't a sore loser talking. Everyone is going home with more money than we came with. We will never stay at Caesars again and never use booking.com. Someone is lying about me not calling to request rooms together and they couldn't even find my reservation for an hour when we got here. I travel 220 days a year. I know how things work.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars for business is a gamble”
Reviews.Author: WinsorTraveler
Reviews.Content: Sitting in my room as I wait, still, for the laundry pickup to come 30 minutes before cutoff. This is after I tried to get a coffee returning from the spa gym (very nice) but could not do so without a picture ID. Yes, I steal room keys so I can exercise. Caesars needs to realize that not everybody comes here to gamble and drink. Have a program for business travelers, like putting us in the same tower with the health club, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: DRPETE24
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Forum Tower, primarily to attend the superb Elton John concert. Awfully nice to cross the casino, take the elevator up and go to bed!! The rooms are really getting tired-----the mattress is very overused, the furniture is scratched up and everything needs refurbishing. The main complaint is the lack of water pressure--not possible to get a really good shower. It takes forever for warm water to arrive. Our friends staying in 2 other rooms had the same issue. This desperately needs attention. We would never stay here again in spite of the convenience to the concert location.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Phil S
Reviews.Content: This is the second year in a row that I've stayed at Caesars and I know precisely why I keep coming back. My friends have stayed at a variety of hotels, on and off the strip, but nobody can claim complete satisfaction. Except me. From the ambiance to the professional staff at every turn, I highly recommend this property. The concierge office can adroitly handle almost any request. The front desk staff are friendly and personable. If you wish to spend some time at the tables, check out the P*****cat Dolls section. Yes, the music is a bit loud but if, like me, you enjoy contemporary music, then the ladies here will greet you warmly and make your gaming experience relatively painless. As to the room, I always book in the Augustus tower and the rooms are just "sick". The area has to be close to 900 square feet (perhaps even more) but the bathrooms are simply over-the-top. Twin basins, a whirlpool tub, glassed-in shower and a separate small room containing the toilet with the obligatory telephone on the wall. There's even a television in the bathroom, with remote, which you can watch while enjoying a bath. Unlike other hotels on the strip, the walls here are solid and I didn't hear my neighbors or traffic in the hallway. Room and maid service is just what you'd expect from a hotel of this caliber: respectful, considerate and consummately professional. They're also very friendly if you take a moment to stop and chat with them. I suggest doing so anyway to demonstrate respect for the jobs they do. Given my busy schedule, I didn't get to enjoy the pool this time around but thoroughly enjoyed it last time. It's heated and I was able to put in a good number of laps before some other people decided to join in and it was time to return to my room. Unfortunately, the restaurant I usually select for the brunch buffet was undergoing renovations so I had to hit the strip for sustenance but I'm sure it will be better and brighter once they reopen. One important point: some people think that a stay here will cost an arm and a leg. The reality is that, if you book through the website far enough in advance, you can get some truly incredible deals. I paid less per night (not all nights) on the Presidents Day weekend than the $200/night it costs for a lesser room at the Hyatt on King in Toronto. In most cases "you get what you pay for", but at Caesars you can get SO much more. I'm already planning on booking this hotel for next year; why stay anywhere else?!

Reviews.Title: “A free room upgrade maketh the trip. All hail Caesar!”
Reviews.Author: MissKrislovesLeo
Reviews.Content: My expectations when booking 2 standard rooms at Caesars were pretty low. Caesars is one of the older casinos on the Strip, but my buddy and I wanted to have a Rainman / Hangover experience so, of the gazillion casinos in Vegas, this is the one we went with. Valet parking was easy and excellent ... at no point did I feel rushed into getting my stuff out of the car. Check-in was painfully, painfully slow. I am guessing the standard procedure is for the check-in clerk to call someone ... somewhere else ... to get a room allocated. I had visions of a massive, NASA-style mission control centre with a heap of dudes standing over a massive Battleship-style gameboard, trying to fit everyone in. We did ask for two rooms on the same floor but these were not available. So instead, we were given two rooms in the Forum Tower and ... wait for it ... upgraded to suites! YAY! Nothing like a free upgrade to perk up the spirits of a weary traveller. Lucky we were in the same tower because getting to them from the reservation area is quite a trip. But so worth it ... massive room with separate TV and dining area. Powder room, massive king bed in a separate bedroom, huge bathroom with double vanity, spa tub, huge shower and separate toilet. The vanity even had a tv in it. Hell, I could have sub-let the walk-in wardrobe and made some money off the deal. The Forum Tower was tastefully decorated and in excellent condtion. The bed was comfortable. Most importantly, the room was so, so, so quiet. My room had sort-of Strip views, with massive windows and a window ledge to sit on to watch it all unfold. I don't have any complaints at all and would certainly stay at Caesars again. It's centrally-located on the Strip, right in the middle of everything. And the value for money was superb. The room at Caesars was spectacular, the rest of the trip to Vegas - not so much. But that's what you get when you enter the Devil's playground!

Reviews.Title: “The Octavious Tower is superb!”
Reviews.Author: loveitcold
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars Palace for a convention that was at that hotel, so there was little choice since the distances are so far away even in the same hotel, you couldn't realistically stay somewhere else. I was there for the same conference two years ago, and stayed in the Roman Tower - which was very plain and not impressive. This year I stayed in the Octavious Tower, and was very impressed. The service was also very good from the reservationist, bellmen, and Guest Service person on the phone. The front desk service wasn't as good, but the hotel was also sold out the day I was checking in, and likely a very tough night for the desk staff. I'll definitely be back - but will request non-Roman Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking truly shocking!”
Reviews.Author: markhusted
Reviews.Content: On my ninth trip to Vegas on business I thought I would go old school. What a huge mistake! After being spoilt at the Wynn Encore the Bellagio and even the Mirage this iconic hotel sucks. From the moment we arrived there were problems, we had booked and paid for two rooms in full via Expedia We paid for a single occupancy and a twin room only to be told on arrival that there were no twins available to resolve the matter they made us pay an extra $1000 for an extra room on top of what we had already paid in advance. I found this amazing! We weren't even offered a special reduction it was take it or leave it. On arriving in my room I was bitterly disappointed, they are tired and drab with none if the usual over the top opulence that you expect from a Vegas hotel room. The toilet in my room blocked four times in the ten days I was there in the middle of the night and I awoke to a very sinister smelling bathroom and once again no apologies or offers to move me. Simply do not stay at Caesars palace it's overpriced overhyped and truly depressing to be honest. Sorry caesars but you will not be getting my business on my twice yearly visits to your town. Yuk!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, want to go back already!”
Reviews.Author: bumbabee32
Reviews.Content: This was my 7th time to Vegas but my first time staying at Caesars and I absolutely loved it! We had booked a Forum Tower room but were upgraded to a Palace Tower Premier room on the 23rd floor which was so awesome, the room was huge and had two bathrooms. The room was in great condition and had a great view of the pools and the mountains. We kept the room pretty messy so we didn't have housekeeping come at all during the stay but we did call for towels/toiletries and they brought them immediately and they even call back later to make sure you got everything you requested. Great customer service with everyone we encountered! Caesars is HUGE but the plus to this is not having to go outside to get food or find a place to drink as there are so many choices inside. Would definitely try and stay here again on a future trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not friendly to the first time gambler”
Reviews.Author: Heath71Hampton
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I need to state that this review is only about the gambling facilities. I did NOT stay at Caesars! Over all, the place looked clean and efficient however when compared to other casinos I found them to be very stiff with someone who has not gambled a whole lot. Rules were barked out at me, and basically a very unfriendly experience when compared to the other casinos on the strip, such as Paris, New York New York, MGM Grand and Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Tower = Disgusting and Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: millmd5
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler to Las Vegas I have to say that Caesars palace is totally disappointing. I checked in to the Roman Tower to find a disgusting, outdated and unclean room with mostly nonworking power outlets.. I couldn't plug in a laptop and a lamp at the same time..then spent 2 hours the first day with the IT dept trying to get the internet to work.. which it worked for the first day and then not again.. the tv is a huge outdated nonflat screen in a huge outdated wooden entertainment center.. and then an uncomfortable bed with no blankets. I have to say I have stayed for other conferences at the Palazzo and Trump and this is by bar the worst, actually worse than a La Quinta or Motel 8. I would never stay at Ceasars again but if forced to by my hotel blocks by work I will sit in the lobby and wait until there is a another room in an updated tower because Roman Tower is ISGUSTING!!! Oh and by the way it will cost you $5 just to print your boarding pass and if you bother to work out while you're here that will cost you another $25 per day..completely ridiculous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Augustus & Octavious rooms amazing & superior customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels in Las Vegas over the years and this trip we reserved our comped Augustus Deluxe room for 3 nights over Valentine's Day using our Total Rewards Card credits. Upon check in our wait was less than 5 minutes since we pulled right into the private valet for Augustus and Octavious Towers with their own personal hotel desk (awesome). Once in our room it was large, nicely decorated and very clean only down it did not have a view. The next morning my back was hurting due to my scoliosis and so I asked the desk if they had any other rooms available with maybe a different bed that may help he offered me the Octavious Tower Deluxe room since they are newer and at no extra charge. We moved our stuff over and again the room was gorgeous and this time with a pool view. Only downside was the Octavious Tower is further from the casino floor and we got a room at the very end of the hall for the next 2 nights. But I will not complain. The bed was about the same no matter there. The room service was pricey but prompt and hosts were quite courteous we enjoyed the oversized soaker jetted tub with the tv in the bathroom as well. Our service on the casino floor was excellent with everyone we encountered. Caesars is quite large and we had to learn our way around but the availability and choices of games was nice. (didnt hurt that I won a nice jackpot on a dollar slot, pennies paid well too) My husband appreciated the Poker room for it's availability of games and tournaments as well. For Valentine's dinner we ate at the Homestead had a wonderful meal and again our waiter was very professional and personable. The same night we had a casino host come visit my husband while he played at a slot machine which made us feel a little VIP... At which she told us to visit the host office upon checking out. The morning we checked out we did go see a host and based upon our play all room charges were additionally comped! Summed up overall experience was Excellent and we actually have already booked our next trip back this time it will be in the Augustus Tower Luxury Room with a guaranteed view of the Bellagio fountains I can't wait. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ATLBob
Reviews.Content: Caesars is what you'd expect from a classic but modern Las Vegas hotel/casino: lots of rooms in a variety of price ranges, tons of gambling options and restaurant options within the massive footprint of the hotel/casino complex, with the added bonus of the shopping/dining area called 'The Forum Shops', where you'll find over 100 places to shop and a dozen additional places to eat. If you so choose, you wouldn't ever need to leave the building to find food, shopping, a comfortable walk, people watching and gambling. Obviously, the vibe throughout the hotel/casino/shopping areas is essentially ancient Rome as envisioned during its heyday. You'll find lots of fountains, columns, statues (including a reproduction of Michaelangelo's David and a very noisy homage to the Trevi Fountain), and many other grandiose architectural reproductions that mimic many of the sites you'd find in Rome. For those who've never been to Italy, it can be a jaw-dropper and a perpetual photo-op (not so much for those who have been to Rome and around Italy.) In any event, the whole ancient Roman theme works well, including the costumes of many of the Caesar's staff that you'll see throughout the property. We recently stayed in the Forum Tower and found our room to be good size, with a king-bed, a walk-in shower big enough for two and lots of counter space around the sink. There is an in-room safe in the closet for your valuables. As noted by other reviewers: there isn't anything 'Free' in your room--coffee costs $12 and the mini-bar has weight sensors to detect when something might be moved/missing...and that move can be exceptionally costly if you're not careful. FWIW, don't expect to find lots of movies or HD channels on the flat screen TV--remember that this is Vegas, and the hotel wants you to be out of your room, in the casinos, restaurants, and shopping areas---not glued to a nice HD picture in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Maxwell222
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights in December 2011. It was like a city within a city as it had shops, restaurants, cafes, pools, and hotel rooms, all of a very high standard. When we checked in, we up-graded from a basic room to the AUGUSTUS Wing. It was out of this world!!! Everything in the room was of the highest standard; there was even a flat-screen TV in the bathroom and the rooms overlook The Bellagio fountains...an added bonus. We could have spent the whole 3 days just in Caesars Place as there is so much to do. The pool was amazing too.

Reviews.Title: “Great first trip and room”
Reviews.Author: funinthesunshine4
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded from a forum room to the Palace Tower overlooking the pools on the 24th floor. The room was very nice with a large bathroom and huge jacuzzi tub. Bring your own K-paks for the in room Keurig coffee maker. Otherwise $12 for 4. Pools were gorgeous and beds very comfy. If you have an extra day rent a car and go see Hoover dam and drive up along Lake Mead to the Valley of Fire. Awesome landscape!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it for the average traveler”
Reviews.Author: debz719
Reviews.Content: We went in Sept 2011 for my daughters wedding. First of all, the check in process was long and grueling. As a whole, the staff was not helpful. One problem, I believe was that they were booked to capacity and didn't have ample staff available to deal with all the people that had reserved that weekend. After finally getting our room, we were brought to the wrong room and asked to change rooms because of their error and was a big hassle for us after waiting all day. The room was actually very nice and clean. We rented a poolside gazebo and that was verY nice also. The value is terrible, tho. I would expect that after making thousands of dollars on the wedding, the hotel would have been a little more accomodating. Not so. The pool staff is very strict about what is brought in to the pool area. I can understand this, but when I buy a soda for $4 a pop at the gazebo and canot bring it back in later (security followed me to the garbage and made sure I dumped it out, even after I explained that I had purchased it there),I find this offensive, ridiculous and embarrasing. On check out, we again had problems. When reviewing our bill, we realized we were charged twice for the gazebo. After an hour on an extremely frustrating phone call while the bellman waited patiently in the hallway, the dilemma was resolved. They had indeed overcharged us. Another problem: the show we had booked was closed due to. "technical difficulties" and we had a hard time getting our money back. They were more than willing to booked us on a later show, however. I think my husband finally got the $ back on his credit card, but it was a week or more later, and another big hassle of waiting on the phone after long busy signals. also, they charge a$50 safety deposit for each room at check in, and actually charge the credit card for several days after you leave. I feel that this establishment is all about getting the most$$$ for their guests, other hotels do it too but much less obviously. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good value, if you are wealthy and money is no object, this may the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: msrad210
Reviews.Content: I was flying to CA Jan 4th and decided to spend two nights at Caesars to relieve stress from the holidays and the flights. I was offered a nice amount of cash, free rooms, and free buffets. I arrived at night and check-in was fast and friendly. I showed the clerk my mail offers for perks and she said I would have to see Total Rewards in the morning. The next afternoon I went to TR and was told my room was booked under the wrong offer code. They sent me to Casino Host office where other upset people were waiting. They had the same issue as me. The host told me she could not fix the problem and give me any perks. If I had seen her at check-in, she might have been able to do something. I have been a card member of Total Rewards for about fifteen years. I have an account on-line and always book on-line through my account. I will not be going to Vegas again for a long time. I will never stay at Caesars again. After I got past being angry, I decided to relax with a jacuzzi bath. I ran the water, got in, and no power from the jets. Another big disappointment. The room was clean, quiet, and very nice. However, they have changed their coffee service, They have Keurig single cup dispensers with tiny paper cups.When I travel, I love a good cup of coffee in bed in the morning. I read the instructions and found I would be charged $4.00 per tiny cup. Caesars has really lost me as a customer now.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace --great amenities and location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Mamabear99
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace was a perfect choice for our Las Vegas trip. It was centrally located on "the strip" to other casinos, restaurants and attractions. It also housed a main theatre, the one built for Celine Dion, where we enjoyed an Elton John concert. We ate at two Caesar's restaurants: Payards and Raos, and they were excellent. The Seahorse Lounge was also a great place to enjoy a cocktail. The room was nicely decorated with a picture window with views of the beautiful garden/pool area. This outdoor, large courtyard area featured fountains, and an elaborate aray of pools (including an indoor pool). Our only complaint was that the room was a little too open, lacking a door between the bathroom and bedroom area. It was, however, in keeping with the Roman theme. Despite this slight inconvenience, we would definetly return to Caesars Palace. We had a great time and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus tower - senators room is awesome”
Reviews.Author: nav2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 39th floor of this newest tower in a faboulous room called Senators suite(was a free upgrade to this expensive suite as our original room preference was not available). It is a massive 1250 sq ft corner suite with sweeping views of a long stretch of the strip. Watch the Bellagio fountains and Eiffel tower from the bed !! Suite has 3 bathrooms and 4 TVs !! We visited Las Vegas last in 2007 and since then we have found that you cannot walk straight on the strip anymore. Have to take endless hikes up and down escalators and elevators, very tiring. In that sense, location of Caesars is great as it is in the middle of all the good casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!!! and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: mediagirldallas
Reviews.Content: Have been to Vegas many times, however, this was my first time staying at Caesar's and it was great. We were in the Palace Towers which are much newer than some of the other towers and it showed. Room was nice and large with a big bathroom and beds were really comfy. We were there in the winter so didn't check out the pools. The location on the strip is fantastic...you're basically right in the middle of everything. The mall is nice with a great variety of stores and there's a food court in the hotel that has a good selection of food. Only complaint is that there is a keurig coffee maker in the room...HOWEVER, you have to pay $12 to get the k-cups. But...guess that's Vegas for you...everything has a price tag on it ;-) Overall, really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Forum tower”
Reviews.Author: anamgarcia
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Caesars and I just loved it! The hotel is huge and you get lost is normal. Our room was in the Forum tower. The room was big, corfortable, very clean and with a great view of the north Strip. The hotel has a lot of "glamour": the decoration, the swimming pools, the casino area.... Absolutely amazing!!!! Forum shops area is great! And at Caesars you have a great location: you are in the middle of the Strip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: waqasgondal
Reviews.Content: Thats real vegas. Its a beautiful , huge & clean hotel . its right on the strip . Its awesome .

Reviews.Title: “They nickel and dime you to death.”
Reviews.Author: gtaustin
Reviews.Content: Overall it was ok, but I left with a really bad taste in my mouth and I won't ever come back. They charged me $15 a day for Internet access PER DEVICE! So, my wife and I got online with both of our laptops and both iPads. They charged us $60 for the day. Shame on me for not reading the tiny print, but that's ridiculous. I know Vegas is all about squeezing every last dollar out of you, but I thought they had a little more respect for their customers than that. I don't care how the rest of the stay was, if you screw me that bad, I won't ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “Employees are RUDE !!”
Reviews.Author: Gavin A
Reviews.Content: The hotel and casino were clean - nicely decorated. The employees were rude and flippant. At first we thought maybe someone was having a bad day; then realized it must be a job requirement!!! Not worth the extra $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: sweetcookie9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 7th to 10th of Feb and had the most amazing time. Check in was a lenghty process but we were prepared for that as we'd read up on it before hand. We were upgraded to the new Octavius Tower free of charge at check in as we were celebrating a birthday. The room was so big and comfortable and had a fantastic view of the pools. Would have liked a coffee maker in the room but there were so many places on site to get it. ALL STAFF were friendly and courteous and nothing was too much trouble for any of them. I have to give a big shout about Serendipity.....THE FOOD IS AMAZING and worth at least one visit while you are here. All in all it was a fantastic stay from start to finish and thank you to all the staff who go above and beyond the call of duty to make this such a wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “caesars a class act”
Reviews.Author: Elliott Y
Reviews.Content: i dont usually write reviews but i have just returned to ireland after an 8 day stay at caesars palace las vagas & i felt obliged to let people know that this hotel is a total class act a 1st class hotel with 1st class staff thankyou caesars for ruining every vacation that i take that is not with you guys :( as arnie said " i will be back"

Reviews.Title: “lovely except check in”
Reviews.Author: rikkiandleah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Feb 11-15th 2012 for our last part of our honeymoon. The casino and all its facilities are beautiful & the casino has really relaxed and fun atmosphere, really enjoyed the banter at the roulette table with a lady called Bobbi. Now the negative after waiting over an hour to check in when we finally got to the desk we were told our room wasnt available, it had only been booked for 8 months! So we were downgraded for a night, we asked why their response you are lucky you have a room at all! I wasnt very happy, they gave us a food voucher which I thought wasnt good ednough they didnt treat us very well at all I doubt I would stay here next year

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: Adelep83
Reviews.Content: Amazing place, amazing veiw of the strip, room was unbelivable, very clean and service was excellent

Reviews.Title: “beautiful pools and gardens and Elton John rocks the house”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen3317
Reviews.Content: We had a swift and efficient check-in experience and were even upgraded to Augustus Tower, which was extremely quiet and we had a wonderful view of pools and gardens, along with nighttime view of the Mirage's "volcano spectacle". Hotel property is very large and the only complaint we had was that the self-park garage is so very far from hotel check-in and most rooms that we got weary of the hike. Saw a fabulous show at their theater, The Colloseum, which was Elton John's Million Dollar Piano. That was the best concert we have ever attended and made our trip perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace was great!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoElkheart
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the Palace tower, the room was everything we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: jlstew
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were upgraded (for free and with out asking) to a suite. That was a nice suprise. The room was nice. I wasn't happy with the fact that there is coffee in the room only if you purchace it. We have stayed in Vegas numerous times and I always thought that Caesars Palace would be more fancy. It was comparable to most of the other places we have stayed. All the staff was friendly and heplful.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a first time visit”
Reviews.Author: BstevensA
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based off a few friends recommendations and the fact that, hey its Ceasars Palace. This hotel in basically in the center of everything. We walked to everything we wanted to do from this hotel, except of course Freemount street. The hotel it self is nice. When we first got there we were blown away but after spending a day or 2 walking around and seeing other hotels we realized, although it was nice, it wasnt the nicest. I give it 5 starts basically because there is nothing wrong with the hotel, our room was really nice just a little dated, but because of its location. With the Forum Shops connected to the hotel and it being located in the heart of the strip I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great pool”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaKat
Reviews.Content: The pool at Caesars Palace is the most amazing pool I have ever been in!

Reviews.Title: “Had a decent time but have had better experiences”
Reviews.Author: moonjaker
Reviews.Content: The bad... Check in was very long and frustrating. Distance from self park to get to check in was literally a 20 min+ walk...farthest of any hotel we've stayed at on the strip. Access to self park was also a bit frustrating as compared to other properties. Pit bosses were rude multiple times during my table play. The ok... Room in Palace tower was decent but there was some dated issues with grout missing on tile, rust on bathroom door, brass fixtures...room was clean but just felt a bit dated. Ate at food court and japanese restaurants they were acceptable but didn't wow us. The good... Large casino with multiple pit areas and slot sections. Location is center strip so when we didn't drive it was nice to be in the center of everything. If we decided to stay here again it would be without a rental car...we've gotten a car several times before when coming to vegas and have enjoyed having the freedom with the car at resorts like Aria, Mandalay Bay, Harrahs where it's easy to get in/out and close to hotel casino. Having a car at Caesars was beyond frustrating and would never do that again. Service was so much below what we've experienced at other properties like Aria, Harrahs, Mandalay Bay from the check in process to the casino mgmt staff. Decent trip but would not go out of our way to stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “A Vegas favorite with a spectacular new tower”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: I stay here for a 5 nights almost every month. This trip I was in the new Octavius Tower. Its basically the same as Augustus Tower just newer and a little more deluxe. The other towers are not as nice as one would expect so it might be worth upgrading your room. Usually a decent tip or paid upgrade does the trick. {ET OWNERS: This , like all caesars properties has a Pet Stay program where they issue a bowl, bedding, treats etc. FOOD: has gone up in price from my visit last month. I suggest you budget for that. Almost all of the food outlets owned by Caesars are very good. In fact one of the finest in Vegas if not the country is Guy Savoy! Payard has a restaurant and bistro, both are great and offers a fixed price menu for dinner. Rao's is great or awful depending on the time and their mood... Central, Caesars take on a coffe shop is great 24/7. Waiter Laurant is very personable and professional. Bradley Ogden is awful with service to match..hopefully the new Gordon Ramsay will be there by your visit. The food court is vegas reasonable. General service is great throughout. Youd think will all the visitors no one would know you however we get a "welcome Back!" almost everywhere thru the property. If this review is helpful please click the yes button so I know im being coherent. Thanks and enjoy your trip This world famous property will not let you down

Reviews.Title: “See Review of my Experience”
Reviews.Author: D R
Reviews.Content: I thought about writing a review regarding the hotel for a long time but I didn’t bother, I actually wrote a letter to the hotel and they didn’t care to answer so now I have thought about it and I wanted to write this review after reading some of the other ones as this is what prompted me to write this review. When arriving in Las Vegas for a 5 night stay, we were excited as we were going to be seeing Elton John. Upon our arrival we saw huge check-in lines but there was a “invited guest’s line”. We went to the invited guests line and after 3 or 4 minutes of line the guy in front of me started to chat me up and tell me how everything takes so long to get at Caesars and he was down here to change rooms because he had bedbugs and said to me “but don’t worry if you come close to me because they are not catching” We were still waiting as there were still 2 customers in front of me another lady came over and I asked “is there anyway you can get me checked-in in the next 2 minutes” and she said to me “well maybe not 2 minutes but come with me” We moved all the way over to the other side of the desk, we got checked in. Upon check-in” I had asked if there was anyway we could be escorted to our room as it is quite a large hotel with many towers – I’m not used to this” She made a phone call and mentioned to me it would be 20 minutes before someone could escort us to our room – we both laughed and she showed me on a map where our room was. We went up to the room where everything was fine until we called down to room service as there weren’t any glasses in our suite room. The lady on the phone told us if were ordering 4 champagne glasses – 4 regular glasses and a bucket of ice there would be a $10.00 charge. I thought this was ridiculous but we needed the glasses and we didn’t have a choice. The next day was a beautiful sunny day and we were looking forward to going to the pool. When we went out to the pool area we noticed that most of it was in shade so we walked all the way to the back and we saw one beautiful empty pool that was roped off. We noticed that there was a lot of tension in the air and upon looking around and asking more questions we realized why as everyone was crammed into one little edge of the large pool where the sun was coming around behind the building but the pool that was in full sun view was not open. I guess people were trying to go over there and sit there and there was security kicking them out, this was quite an interesting scene. When I found out this was going on I started walking around and I realized there was another pool up some stairs and this pool was open although you had to rent a cabana for $200.00 a day and for that you get free food. We decided this would be our best option because it was easy, the sun was shining and our cabana also over looked the other empty pool. Right away when we settled down we decided to order some food and this is where the tricky part came in. The food order for the first item, which was a 7up took 45 minutes and from there on it was a catastrophe and even after talking to management they couldn’t get anything right as all they had was a lot of excuses. After a day of being ripped off at the pool and poor service we decided to go Nobu at the Hard Rock – it was a great dinner. Then we went back and went to Elton John and his show was fantastic. Instead of staying at Caesars next time we will stay somewhere else and still go to Elton John, that was the best part of our trip. Dealing with the check out was another major hassle, even trying to get a cab away from the hotel, it’s just not worth it, there’s nothing great there and it’s not a happening scene.

Reviews.Title: “Planning a Vegas trip? Stay here and you won't regret it!”
Reviews.Author: RJKESQ
Reviews.Content: We tipped the person at check in $100.00 and got upgraded to a suite. The suite was the most amazing hotel room I had ever been in up to that point. Clean...spacious...gorgeous...view of the pool (but high up and concrete columns slightly obstructing the view). The service here was amazing and so much to do if you didn't want to leave and explore the rest of Vegas. I thought Bobby Flay's restaurant was a little disappointing but there was an Italian place on the 2nd floor in the mall that was AMAZING! A must try for anyone. Also, a nice enough sports book, but the waitresses at times can be slow. To the contrary, occasionally we had this young woman who really hustled and we rewarded her for it. I would suggest to anyone to stay here. Great location on the strip, very popular in pop culture and among Vegas regulars. I will tell you, there is CERTAINLY a reason for that!

Reviews.Title: “A grand, luxurious hotel!”
Reviews.Author: petalpage
Reviews.Content: When we choose a Las Vegas hotel we look for quality, luxury and location. Caesar's lived up to our expectations and its reputation. We had 3 rooms in 2 different towers. Ours was in the palace tower and our room and bath were fabulous. Almost too big, if that's possible! Our adult children stayed in tower rooms which they found to be lovely too. Gorgeous bathrooms, they said! The service is impeccable, the casino is always buzzing and the restaurants outstanding. Our children were hoping to stay in one of the newer, glitzier hotels but we all agreed we would stay here again. Caesar's has a classy ambiance with luxurious accommodations and that's what Las Vegas is all about!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay watch the rates!”
Reviews.Author: Mohawk1975
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and very good quality - the hotel is central to the strip so easy to get around to the other hotels - the hotel itself has lots to do with plenty of places to eat and shop. If you can get a good rate for a room here I would highly recommend it - a day after we were to leave the rate tripled.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BAMKO
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were very excited to stay at Caesars Palace because it's one of the most iconic and luxurious looking hotels on the strip. We booked their classic room and were shocked when we arrived. The room was very big, but the furnishings and bathroom were extremely old, stained and dated! Aside from the size, the room looked like a dingy motel that I wouldn't have wanted to stay in at any price, let alone the price per night for Caesars. It's possible that some of the more upgraded rooms are nicer and newly renovated - but I expect a certain quality from Caesars no matter what room I am assigned.

Reviews.Title: “Huge”
Reviews.Author: gmann117
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge. I've stayed in all of them over 25 years but caesars seems to dwarf the rest even the venetian. It is very pricey though. First day we arrived I only found 50 dollar tables in the pit. Overall a very nice place but wouldn't stay there again only because of its size.

Reviews.Title: “What's the DIFF?”
Reviews.Author: rkStinger
Reviews.Content: I thought that spending the extra $, so I could brag to others about having stayed at Caesars Palace & spending my trip at Caesars Palace - instead of my usual places (Flamingo, GN, Monte Carlo) would be worth the experience? I stayed in the Forum Tower (recently renovated w/ flat screen TVs, new beds, etc.) I thought it would be different, BUT... I closed my eyes, walked into the room &... seriously, I could not tell the difference! Sure the furniture was slightly different style, but not any better or worse, the rest was the SAME! The staff was no different at CP, not better or worse, The room was just as clean as the others, not better or worse! The only difference I found was in the Poker room! CP has their Texas Holdem games geared for the Professional or Very Above Average players - they had NOTHING for the average player - NO 3/6 or 2/4 limit, in fact they only had 1/2 NL half the time, it was mostly 2/5 NL & 4/8 Limit! I had to play my Poker elsewhere, thank goodness Flamingo is right across the street! Save your $ - go stay at the Flamingo or Golden Nugget & spend the price difference on a good Steak dinner for two!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay will return”
Reviews.Author: Irene085
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Palace Tower overlooking the pool area. The room was lovely and very quiet. The staff were all very polite and helpful. We have been to Vegas many times but our first time at Caesars Palace and hopefully we will return we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CarolineSchally
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited Las Vegas for the first time in December 2011. We booked a standard room via Booking.com, but read that for 40$ we could upgrade to a very good room. When we got to the reception, just for 40$, we were upgraded to a huuuuge room in the Augustus Tower (best tower), and had a view of the entire Strip with the Bellagio fountains. We also had a jacuzzi tub in the room. Caesar's is very luxurious, that old fashion luxury. It's very clean, veryyyy large, and it also has the Forum Shops, a galleria that has shops from Converse and Adidas to Gucci and Louis Vuitton. The entire architecture is very spectacular without being too kitsch. It is as luxurious as the Bellagio, the Palazzo and the Venetian, but unlike the latter two, it has a better location. A PLUS: Parking was free. A MINUS: You have to carry all your luggage from the parking, THROUGH the entire Casino until you reach the Reception. It takes about 10 minutes, of course unless you choose the valet.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lucy C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace with a group of 8 of us, all separate rooms. We were very disappointed as far as the rooms were concerned. We must have been put in the oldest tower and oldest rooms of the hotel. We were paying a high price compared with other hotels on the strip and didn't get value for our money at all. The bathroom was average and the view atrocious (airconditioning vents and thats all). We were assured as well that we were being looked after and put in good rooms by the man behind the check in desk as well which was quite insulting when we saw the rooms. All 4 of our rooms were disappointing and would definately choose a different hotel when returning. The restaurants were all expensive in the hotel and were not offered any deals for hotel patrons to dine here, so we didnt. Out of 7 different hotels on our USA trip, this was the worst when we expected it to be the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jstigs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at CP for business last week and it was great. Clean, great service, food, and fun! I had access to the entire strip with no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Hail, Caesar”
Reviews.Author: WesParkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars Palace Feb 6-9th. My wife and I had reserved a Forum Tower deluxe room, but at arrival I requested a room in the new Octavius Tower, and my request was granted! When the bellhop arrived to our room with our luggage, he told us that our floor had only been open for a day or two and we may have been the first guest to stay in the room. I must say, the new rooms are very nice,and the bed was plush, indeed. If that bed would have fit into my bag, it would be at home with me = ). All kidding aside, try the new tower if you have a chance, it won't be a regretful choice. The hotel staff was over accommodating, you can't get much better. The casino dealers however were a different story - trying to build some kind of rapport with them was like talking to a wall, just indifferent and seeming like they were just doing their time before leaving. I spent most of my gaming time at Bally's, Hard Rock, The Palms and Flamingo, all of which had friendly dealers you could enjoy time with.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort.”
Reviews.Author: CavaHoo22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Caesar's Palace twice now and have not been disappointed either time. We stayed in the Augustus Tower and the rooms are incredible. Very luxurious. The bathroom is huge...has a seperate room with the toilet, a walk in shower, a jacuzzi tub, a flatscreen tv, marble counters, etc...and that's just the bathroom. Very comfortable beds and lots of space in the room. Our floor to ceiling window looked out over the Bellagio Fountains, which was a neat sight. The casino is very large and has tons of very nice restaurants and bars. The PCDL is a cool place to gamble late at night too...very nice dealers. The pool complex is huge and has several different pools with their own scene at each one. There is even a swim up black jack table in one of them. Nice bars and waitress service at the pools as well. If you're looking for a cheaper place to gamble, Bills and Flamingo are right across the road as well. This casino is located in the middle of the strip, so you have relatively easy access to several other casinos as well. I highly recommend this resort if the budget allows it.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: BobbyNSue
Reviews.Content: Agree with other reviews that the hotel was okay. Because of a conference we had a special room--larger suite with two shower heads in the shower which adjoined two bathrooms. The flat screen tv was small compared to others--only one in this large room compared to 3 in Palazzo suites. The plumbing in the sinks were bad--one side backed up a lot, the other the faucet would not quite turn off. Room service was dependent on the person--one day excellent, other days just the basics were done. The beds seemed more like 2 full size instead of Queens. Service in the restaurants, Diamond lounge, etc were excellent however.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Gooner_and_Fudge
Reviews.Content: We got married at Caesars Palace in the Venus Garden and stayed for 6 nights. The wedding was perfect and very well organised and the hotel was fantastic. The room was very spacious well equipped and was topped off with a wonderful view over the Bellagio fountains. Would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...BUT..”
Reviews.Author: darlene65000
Reviews.Content: Ceasars is a beautiful hotel and Casino. The forum shoppes, the entire hotel and casino area aredefinitely worth seeing. The rooms.... last time I stayed (in Feb) was in the new Octavius towers and the room were beautiful. The bed was very very comfortable. The Jacuzzi is marvelous. Now the BUT... the walking distances to all the hotel towers are very long. If you have any heart or leg trouble, this is not the hotel for you. The very comfortable bed was high with nothing to assist you in getting up into bed. I reccommend going to the casino and playing and making a leisurely once through the forum shoppes. But if you have health or walking impairments, leave it at that. The casino is roomy and a nice selection of slots including the indivisual jackpot slots like Cashman II and Outback Jack.. If you can walk miles without any problem then Ceasars is a great place BUT (here goes the but again) If you are not in the greatest shape of your life, don't stay just visit this magnificent casino.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not very good either”
Reviews.Author: giovanp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palace Tower at the Caesar Hotel for 4 night in February for a conference and was not impressed. For starter when I arrived the room telephone did not work. The room itself was ok, but kind of old and unimpressive. Several amenities that I expected in this class of hotel wereeither missing or not working as I would have expected. The TV was small and the remote did not work very well.The lights were weirdly located around the room and there was no master light control next to the bed. The decor was ... meh. Staying at the Palace Tower meant that it took me about 10 minutes to get from my door to the strip. And that was if I did not get lost in the process :) All in all i would not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Grand on the outside, but cheap on the inside”
Reviews.Author: engmu
Reviews.Content: I had an opportunity to stay at its new Octavius Tower at Caesars Palace. The room is well decorated and comfortable.
