What ruined the whole experience is that the only drinking cups they provided were two plastic cups. I could not even have a hot tea. It reminded me of a third rate hotel. That bean counter should be fired for ruining this hotel's reputation. You may want to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Travel in style. Travel smart.”
Reviews.Author: justonetaste203
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in the Octavius tower thanks to upgrade (Mr. Andrew Jackson) at check-in. Bring your own K-Cup coffees to save some dough on coffee. Or grease the room service lady for a few extra K-Cups to score a few more for cheap. Eat dim sum at Noodle 9 to avoid long walks, waits and hassles. Skip the buffet or otherwise big ordeal to find breakfast...Breakfast at Central (next to front desk) is fine. Room in great condition. Bathroom is as expected. Learn to use the outside "short cuts" to avoid the casino and get where you need to get going. All in all - a fine Vegas experience for a working weekend. Enjoy ya'll.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SHTraveler46819
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two sons, ages 17 and 19 stayed in the Augustus Tower from Oct 19-24 2011. This tower was recently upgraded and is magnificent. Upon check-in, we received a complementary upgrade (without asking) to a room on the 39th floor overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The hotel is in a great location on the strip, adjacent to all shops and restaurants. The service in the hotel was outstanding and everyone was friendly and helpful. We would most likely return to this property, but there were a few issues. First, there is a steep charge for the fitness center ( I believe $25/day). Second, in Oct after the summer season, the pools close at 5:00 pm every day, which was early considering that you had several hours of daylight left. The pools themselves see very little sunlight as a result of the massive hotel towers surrounding them. For breakfast, try the Cheesecake Factory rather than the restaurants on property. For dinner, try Il Mulino for a special, albeit expensive dinner. They do have a pre-fixe early seating at 5:00 pm which is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Octavias Tower- Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Fletch1310
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Feb. 3, 2012, in the evening. Greeted by wonderful staff and was advised that we would be up-graded to the Octavias Tower...no charge! Guarded hallways led us to a private elevator. The decor in the hallways was superb and made us wonder what was next. Jaw dropping when we opened the door to our room, absolutely beautiful. The 65th floor looking over the Belagio water fountain on the main drag was not to shabby to look at for 5 nights of accomodations. The whirlpool tub was to die for. You felt like a million bucks just being in the room. The only thing was for a luxurious room, no hair dryer and what's with the plastic glasses? We were told by guest services that the rooms just opened Jan. 2, 2012 and they are still fitting rooms with these items, which apparently are on back-order....go figure! Would recommend this hotel of Ceasar's any day, it was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: k8alx
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've ever stayed in, highly recommended, perfect location on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Run Down”
Reviews.Author: Hilljohnd
Reviews.Content: Won't be back much nicer hotels on the strip. Rooms show lots of wear.

Reviews.Title: “NICE FREE UPGRADE”
Reviews.Author: Dan G
Reviews.Content: My wife and i just returned from our 5 day vacation to Caesar's Palace Las Vegas. We arrived on Sunday afternoon and didn't have to wait very long to check in which was a big surprise.When we got to the front desk the girl who waited on us couldn't have been more pleasant or helpful(i beleive her name was Zendra).The room that we had reserved was in the Forum Tower and was comped for the 5 nights.I asked if we could possibly have a room on a high floor with a view of the strip,we were informed that the Forum Tower did not have views of the strip but without any prompting from us she starting looking for a different room with a view and high floor.After about a minute or two she told us that we could have a Petite Suite in the Palace Tower and that it would be a free upgrade but that it wouldn't be ready for about 1 hour and she would call us when it was ready,we checked back about an hour later and received our keys to our suite.When we went up to the 24th floor and entered our room we couldn't have been more pleased.The room was just unbelievable with a large living area with his and hers bathrooms with a jacuzzi tub and a very large shower that connected between both bathrooms.It was definately the nicest room we have stayed in while in vegas.The only drawback to our wonderful stay was that the buffet was closed for renovation and a temporary buffet was set up in Raos.The buffet was a little disappointing because the selection was a bit scarce and the price was a bit high at $22 a person but then again all the food prices at Caesars are a bit on the high side.All in all our 5 days were some of the best we have ever spent in Vegas and we plan on staying at Caesars on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying”
Reviews.Author: mdonatelli
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with nice pool and fantastic gambling. Next door Forum shops are a great stop for professional shoppers.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool place to stay but expect to pay extra for EVERYTHING else”
Reviews.Author: flyingkiwi84
Reviews.Content: After staying in Europe for two and a half months in hostels I was pretty surprised to pay for internet at a place like this and not only that to get a poor map to find our room from the front desk. There was no one around to point us in the right direction. Also you have to pay for the loungers by the pool - come on. Apart from that it is a pretty cool place to stay. The staff are pretty helpful and it's a cool place to stay on the strip. We had a lot of fun there. Our room was amazing with a spa and two bedrooms and a great view over the pools so can't complain there it was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas vet stays at caesars palace.”
Reviews.Author: dstone444
Reviews.Content: Stayed in forum tower. No water pressure in shower. Automated curtains did not eork. Low ceilings. Rude service. Smokey casino. Do not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the new Octavius Tower!!”
Reviews.Author: lisandbri
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the newly opened Octavius Tower and it was lovely. Absolutely beautiful room with whirlpool bathtub, television in bathroom, beautiful seating area, and view of the pools below. Dedicated reception area for guests of this tower with much faster check in and personal service. Security personnel monitor the elevators and check that only guests can access the tower. Very close to the entrance of the pool areas and Rao's Restaurant. Bring your walking shoes to walk through the shopping areas connected to the hotel. Be aware that some restaurants are closed on Monday and Tuesday and even when open may close for a while between lunch and dinner. I was off on my timing due to jet lag and couldn't get an early dinner at one restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: charm0408
Reviews.Content: Booked through expedia and got ourselves a great rate. When check in, the staff was really kind and gave us an upgrade for free. The upgrade was 100% better than what we have originally booked. We stayed at the newest tower with a beautiful strip view and a huge room. Great locations with lots of options for food and shopping of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rvats
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to be booked in the new Octavius tower. It is magnificent! Beautiful room, excellent service. Outstanding stay.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you want”
Reviews.Author: ADMA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Check in was inefficient, but staff were really nice. Was not offered help with my luggage which I then had to lug for 30 sweaty frustrating minutes through the maze that is the casino--and still COULD NOT FIND MY HOTEL TOWER. Found a security desk and stood in front of the guard Nate for at least 5 minutes clearing my throat asking for help before he looked up to ask what I wanted. The room was very nice and clean and large. The sheets were thin and scratchy. Nice toiletries. I had a non-smoking room which was truly non-smoking and was really a relief from the smoky casino. I know I know--no one comes to Vegas to work out, but it's an important part of my day--the workout facility fee was $25 daily. Really????? What an amazing rip off, and the hours weren't convenient either--I was told they opened at 8am and closed at 10 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Farles82
Reviews.Content: Fabulous casino hotel right in the middle of the strip. Outstanding room in the Forum Tower. Only negative is that the mini bar is motion activated and I was not told that. I picked up a snack and put it back,but still was charged for it. Don't touch any of the food or beverage items unless you are going to consume!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: AdilAG
Reviews.Content: We bought our flight+hotel package on expedia for Jan 2012 and stayed at the Caesar's Palace. The location cannot be beat !! You are bang in the middle of the strip. On an earlier trip we had stayed up north on the strip since we got a great rate - but anytime we wanted to come to the happening part of Vegas, we had to catch a bus. We did not gamble at the Caesar's casino as we found the Bellagio, Paris and Planet Hollywood (which are all next door) to be more inviting for that. The rooms are clean and well maintained. Our room did not have a view but we were hardly in it for a few hours a night. The staff is friendly. would surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about the Palace part!”
Reviews.Author: c4sper21
Reviews.Content: We booked Caesar's Palace on lastminute.com on a special offer. In short, we paid £290 for four nights from the 5th-9th Jan 2012 with no resort fees. We have been to Vegas many times before and always dreamed of staying at Caesar's, it's one of the more expensive hotels. We arrived at around 7.30pm and surprisingly there was no Q at Check-in! Result! The guest service girl was excellent, very knowledgeable and pleasant. We gave her $20 and asked if there were any upgrades available. Low and behld, we ended up in the Augustus tower in a massive room with a jacuzzi over looking the pool. The room was the best part of the stay. We found the staff, other than the girl at check-in, to be extremely rude. We ate in Rao's on our second last night. The food was amazing, the service was as bad as we've ever experienced. We had to repeatedly ask for our glasses to be topped up with Prosecco (they don't allow the bottle to remain at the table) we waited 20 minutes for our plates to be cleared and had to walk up to the hostess staion to request dessert menus. We also ate at the Munchbar. Good food, massive portions, terrible service. We didn't try the pool as only a tiny part of it was opened due to the time of year. We did go out to have a look at it though. We thought that it was really small for the size of the property and number of guest rooms. Good stay all in all but much prefer the MGM or the Monte Carlo. Better location and service

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, after all it is vegas”
Reviews.Author: choz_man
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a deluxe room in the palace tower, I wouldnt say the rooms are super for the money that was spent, but it is vegas and everything does cost more. Great pool, great atmosphere, and you could easily just spend a few days in caesars palace. If you after a quite hotel or a place to take the kids, then caesars probably isnt the best place, but if you are there to enjoy yourself and be in a great vibrant atmosphere, then I'd highly recommended staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: ltodd
Reviews.Content: A really good location on the strip to give you a real Vegas experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: 29Kayleigh
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at Caesars with 3 other friends. We shared a room together which had two small-ish double beds and a large bathroom. The room was quite small so it was a squeeze with 4 people in and our main problem was that there was only one plug for 4 of us to use and no mirrors in the room to use while the bathroom was occupied. The room was clean though. Caesars Palace is Huge and we got lost a few times but it was a great experience and it was good that there is so much to do. The pool is amazing, I couldve spent everyday there if I could. The staff where friendly especially the bag drop off, they would do anything for you, whether you was staying there or not. If your wanting to experience what its like to stay in an extremely popular hotel then stay here but the basic rooms are quite small for a lot of money. Its got a great location and pool but some of the staff (at reception) where too busy to talk or offer advice, and didnt seem to care too much about moving you along.

Reviews.Title: “Living the dream...”
Reviews.Author: Clare R
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a friend and I were attending a Jazzercise routine taping here. We got a special room rate because of the convention. The room was disappointing but the hotel itself lived up to expectations :-) Pools are amazing, staff were top notch, amazing choice of restaurants and shops. Keep the map they give you at reception: the place is vast and you will need it!

Reviews.Title: “January 2012 Las Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: We Arrived to Las Vegas tired from a New York flight and waited 45 minutes to check in at the front desk only to have terrible rooms in some far off tower with no views, This Place is to big for it's own good and can't control itself. Despite no view the rooms were satisfactory, nothing special, we booked two as there were four of us. Gym is not complementary for guests and is abotu $30.00 a day and no complimentary wi-fi either. NO Buffet either and not to mention the que to get a taxi. Stay somewhere quieter and less gaudy, Wynn and Encore or Paris seem to be the go.

Reviews.Title: “You get your bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: TayMayS
Reviews.Content: After recently visiting Ceasars Palace, I can say I was very impressed. The hotel itself is huge and if you are not too worried about the view the rooms can be quite affordable. The decor is beautiful with a lot of classical roman appeal. The pool is lovely with a swim-up bar and plenty of places to rest outside the pool. The drinks are $10-15 so it isn't too bad. The casino is huge with a wide variety of gambling. There are plenty of slot machines as well as many dealer tables with an average minimums of about $20. Overall the hotel is exactly what you expect from a high class Las Vegas hotel. The staff is great, the visuals are astonishing and the experience is unforgettable. Hope this helps, good luck.

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: PaulP007
Reviews.Content: was at downtown hotel for few days and then decided to stay here since everything is close by, this place is great and huge, rooms are very very nice and service is super fast on everything, we bought a 5 day bus pass, well the bus drops off at the hotel but to pick up a bus you have to cross over all the way on the other side of venetian, the pool was always closed for some reason and also the fitness center not that I had time to work out or go swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Too big”
Reviews.Author: gwill29
Reviews.Content: I gave the hotel 4 stars because I couldn't give 3.5 stars which is more accurate. The Room: Our room was very nice. I asked for a quite room at check-in, and thats what we got. The bathroom was very nice, had a tv built into the bathroom mirror so you don't miss anything while getting ready. comfortable big bed, lots of pillows, and the staff did a good job of cleaning the room while we were out every day. Location: Caesars is in a great spot for bouncing around the strip. the mirage, bellagio, and mandalay bay aren't too far away. It is a long way from the other end of the strip, but having made the mistake of staying at Circus Circus my first trip to vegas I can say there's nothing to see at that end anyway. Food: The restaurants at caesars were pretty good. I didn't like the food or service at Mesa Grill, but Rao's was good, Lago buffet was suprisingly good. We really enjoyed Bradley Ogden, and serendipity 3 was great. I had a footlong chili dog that was only ok but I also ordered a fudge sunday that was Huge and wonderful, and Kobe sliders with chipotle aioli that was better than any of the $200 dinners we had out there. Bad: The place is enormous, the first two days you get lost trying to find your way, at check-in customer service told us we need a gps to find our way around the place and they were right. There's so much to do in vegas you dont want to waste time walking around the hotel trying to find places. and any time spent gambling at caesars is a waste too. You can have a great time in vegas and even win doing it, you just cant do it at caesars. Everybody loses. All in all Caesars is a nice place, good food, and good service but its too big, the gambling is too tight, and we wont be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible accommodations and service.”
Reviews.Author: Joxroswell
Reviews.Content: I was first told my room would be ready at three - but it was more like 7pm. When I got to my room, in the Roman tower I was extremely upset that a paying customer would be assigned such a dirty, disgusting room. Beyond being old, the bathroom was dirty, room smelled like an ashtray and overlooked the HVAC units. The next morning, they were to switch me to a better room. They did not, but checked me out of my crappy room and did not remove my luggage. Fortunately, for me, no one was assigned that room (could not even give that nasty room to anyone else). I was finally given a room in the Centaur tower - another old & gross room. At that point, with only one more night I stayed and hoped the bugs did not get me. They tried that same game - pay a lot more for a better room - but was not willing to bait and switch with them. I have also never, in all my travels, experienced this level of poor service. NEVER will I stay at this or another Caesar's property again.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: Great rooms that are tastefully furnished! Amazing pool area! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms - Gym is NOT FREE - Its $25 to go to the Gym”
Reviews.Author: Jay201146
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palace Tower - VERY NICE room. Took 30 minutes to check in. Staff is always VERY BUSY. They do not have much time to interact/assist the customers. Check out time is 11 am. I asked for an extra hour as the outbound flight did not depart until 3:15 pm. Boy did they give me the run around ! I know they had plenty of rooms available because when I walked into my room there were dust bunnies everywhere and you could tell that the room has been unoccupied for a while. Again, despite couple of negatives I list, I must repeat, ROOMS ARE HUGE with very nice views !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel........But Overall Vegas Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: hangus_8
Reviews.Content: caesars Palace is a huge lovely hotel based pretty much in the middle of the strip. But beware anything in the place costs a small fortune The Nightclub Pure is worth a visit and you get in there for free if your stopping here But expect to pay top dollar for everything food, coffee, alcohol and most of the shops in the forum are designer louis vutton etc The restaurants are also very expensive which may indicate why they were mainly empty when we passed them Plus if your not a gambler the non-stop ching may eventually get you down But hey maybe that's my fault for thinking it wasn't just about the gambling but pretty much it is

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Petra M
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, spacious room. Cons: No door on the bathroom, buffet was weak, view from room was facing a wall, smoke in the hallways. I have stayed in many other hotels in Las Vegas so I know what to expect. I probably won't stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired decor, airport hanger scale resort that really should do better.”
Reviews.Author: Eldob
Reviews.Content: Checkin was quick and efficient. Staff were polite but not friendly. Given the scale of the hotel, it definitely felt like the staff wanted to move me on as quick as possible. Original room booking was in the Roman tower. When I arrived in my room, it had someone elses suitcases and a jumper on the bed. I called the reception and then had to treck back to get a new room with my bags. New room was in the centurion tower. Again another trek. For 3 of the 4 days that I was there, only one of the 3 lifts was working. Decor was very tired.. Probably lovely 15 years ago. Room had a huge CRT TV in a big wardrobe like cabinet. Beds were not great with a mattress that seemed to overhang the base a bit. Bathroom was large but there were a few tiles missing from the skirting which was a bit shabby. Lights were odd and there was no switch near the bed for turning on/off. There was no desk/mini-bar/standard bottle of water. This is not normally an issue but a regular sized coffee downstairs cost $5! There was no easy socket near a table to charge mobile phones. Wifi is a total rip off. It is per device and really quite expensive. Most of the other hotels that I visited there had free wifi. As a non smoker, the hotel stank of smoke, even in my non smoking room. I found it very unpleasant. Caesars seem to be all about status with every queue in the place having 2 lines, one for the "high" status people. I didn't notice this in other hotels but it was a real turnoff. In summary, I would definitely not stay at Caesars again. There are much nice hotels nearby on the strip and if you really want to see it, just spend the 40 minutes or so that it takes to walk around the place. There is no benifit to actually staying in the hotel so I wouldn't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs few improvements”
Reviews.Author: Hitesh P
Reviews.Content: I took my wife with me. Everything was gre8 except that I did not receive the king size bed I asked for when I booked my hotel. Their policy was that they do not give the booked room until person checks in but at that time they did not have it available. But overall it was good experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a palace to stay”
Reviews.Author: DubsPeople
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay in Vegas. Staff very friendly for such a very large Hotel (when the Octavius tower opens it will the biggest in the world?). It’s located right in the middle of the strip it is big but hey its Vegas, we stayed in the Augustus Tower overlooking the Belllagio fountains. The rooms were fantastic and huge, we took an upgrade deal and it was well worth it. The pool area is magnificent towels provided free of charge (as many as you like) there are deals for eating in the restaurants over a few nights for breakfast, lunch & dinner sort of thing; but we didn't find this out until it was to late. Don’t worry there and many many good restaurants within walking distance. Staying in Caesars Palace is a great way to experience Vegas. Would recommend it, remember it is a Casino so you will see a lot Casino ‘activities’ everywhere – as I said its Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: the Concierge told us Caesars is now a 3 Star Hotel (for $300 a night?)”
Reviews.Author: Ryanstubbs
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel you need to know a few things about before coming. First of all, there are almost 4,000 rooms. Second, because of the gigantic size and volume of all those people, it's really like Disneworld, and there is effectively VERY LITTLE SERVICE AND LINES for most services, like Check-in, which can be 30 minutes + waiting time. Room service was 1 HOUR 30 MINUTES for a cappuccino. Also, BEWARE: you can get stuck with your room if there are problems. The rooms are large, clean and nice, but there is very little insulation between them, meaning you can hear into your neighbors' room very easily. We had very loud partiers in the adjoining room from 4 p.m. into the wee hours and despite several calls, they continued. We asked to be changed, and though the hotel was obviously not full (Wed. night) the shift manager Sharia/Shania? refused to change us stating the hotel was sold out. I'm sorry, any hotel charging $300 per night + and of that size would allot a certain number of rooms to be vacant for problems such as ours. But again, it was Wednesday night and it definitely didn't appear that they were full, but we assumed it was probably a hotel policy not to switch rooms for anyone. So this is what you're in for if you spend that much money. Because of all the problems, I finally called Guest Services to ask "HOW MANY STARS IS THIS HOTEL?". " IT'S 3 STARS," he said. So there you have it: CAESARS IS A 3 STAR HOTEL. You need to be aware of these things before you come here.

Reviews.Title: “Service levels of a Motel 6... In VEGAS??? Get you acts together...”
Reviews.Author: BBoschetti
Reviews.Content: Late night arrival to a "used room"...towels on floor, bed a mess, garbage on desktop and sinks, etc. I called guest services expecting quick remidiation to keep my mood flying high. NOT AT ALL. Instead I get a read statement of "we are booked full, there are no other rooms, and that they offered me a choice...wait in the room for housekeeping (est. 30mins) and watch them clean, or go spend my $ in their casino while I waited for them to do their jobs. I'm very disappointed in Caesars Palace, the guest services rep Joanna and the manager Aaron Ebada (sp?) Whom didn't have the management know-how to even get on the phone with me. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE that will offer better service and give you the SAME ODDS.

Reviews.Title: “not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: Bellepotter
Reviews.Content: While it has an awesome location in the center strip, we felt it was terribly overpriced. ESPECIALLY the "food court". It cost us $15-20 per person to eat there, the portions were small and the food was TERRIBLE!!! For example, a slice of pizza was $9.00! The pork fried rice (from the Chinese restaurant) was not even the color of meat. And my $14 salad wrap was awful. The $5 ice tea was the only tasty part of the meal. We stayed two nights, rooms were clean

Reviews.Title: “Always Terrific”
Reviews.Author: marcs1Nyc_Ny
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 2861 in the Augustus Tower. Entering you find a spacious bathroom on your left. Inside that room is a shower stall and a large separate jacuzzi. There are two sinks and a separate toilet with door. The bathroom has a TV and a remote. Leaving the bathroom you come to the closet on the left with a full mirror opposite the closet. The closet contained two robes and two pairs of slippers. Further on and on the left is the king size bed with comfortable bedding. Opposite the bed is a dresser and the TV. Past the bed, in a large area, are a couch and a cocktail table and further in is a table with chairs near the floor to ceiling windows. Service is always great and everyone is always friendly. The only complaint is that the casino has many smokers. The ash trays around the slot machines and video poker machines need to be cleaned more often.

Reviews.Title: “Not the wow factor”
Reviews.Author: 94Andys
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed in Caesars Palace stayed three nights in Oct 11 room not very clean and staff not helpful balcony falling away and only secured by a rope

Reviews.Title: “Hotel California.”
Reviews.Author: judyb_ATL
Reviews.Content: Pack your walking shoes, make sure to ask for a non-smoking room and bring your best attitude. Cesar's IS Hotel California. There is no reason to go outside the complex. Unless you want fresh air, see the Hoover Dam or explore Red Rocks. But if you just want fantastic food, good beds, delish shopping... You can check in any time you like.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Tower”
Reviews.Author: Vajinder T
Reviews.Content: Third time to Las Vegas from the UK but first time with the family and decided to stay at Caesars Palace this time. I tried the $20 trick to get a complimentary upgrade but the clerk made a point of putting the $20 to one side whilst she checked availability and once booked she pocketed it. Our room was upgraded (which I think we could have got without the $20) to a 2 king size bed one, jacuzzi, twin sinks and LCD TV on the 12th floor of the Palace tower with a view of the pool. It was a good size but I hate to think what the original one was like as this one was meant to be twice the size. The room looked good but we soon found problems, tap not working, heating not working, piece of metal sticking out of the bed. The next morning I made a polite complaint at reception (different clerk) and they were really apologetic. They gave us a $50 credit to our account and also changed the room to the 25th floor in the same tower. Same size room but 100 times better, looked newer and with a view of the Strip looking north over The Mirage, The Palace, Venetian, etc. House keeping on the 12th floor was not as good as the 25th floor, I guess that's the luck of the draw. Hotel is big and grand but we got our bearings pretty quick, probably because my wife used the shops as landmarks while mine were fixed on the flashing lights. Restaurants range in price and the food is good across the board. Internet was $15 for 24 hours which I thought should have been free for guests. Friendly staff and central location makes this a great place to stay and defintely worth staying for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, dreadful service, expensive food”
Reviews.Author: ta323
Reviews.Content: Terrific check-in. Allocated room 3154 in the Augustus Tower which has THE most fantastic view of the Bellagio fountains, plus the Eiffel Tower and Planet Hollywood. Enormous bed, sitting area, dining area. Bathroom had double sized shower, plus spa bath and his/her sinks, with a separate toilet. This represented excellent value as we had paid just £60 per night. If you're arriving from the UK, there are extremely limited options in respect of very early breakfast on your first day. It is not easy 24/7 food. The Roman theming throughout is first class, right down to the pool area. The hotel is enormous, but easy to find your way around as it is sectioned off into Towers. We had a problem on our penultimate night, which included a serious breach of security combined with an appalling level of service, so we left one day early because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Room upgrades.”
Reviews.Author: al1cante
Reviews.Content: We went on a short trip to L.V last year and registered at the desk to be offerred an upgrade when questioned how much they told us a price but I said it was ok I would just stick to the room booked then they upgraded us free of charge to a room with a jacuzzie bath !! Loved Las Vegas and would recommend Hotel Rio for the seafood buffet delic..

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy enough to tell you”
Reviews.Author: Wineteacher
Reviews.Content: I have written hundreds of reviews in my life. I have never given a 1 before ... I think you need to earn a 1. A 4 is a bad score in my book ... I don't bother to review a 4... a 5 - I love to give 5's. Here is why I'm giving a one... First - I was shorted change... I had a great run and turned in a pocket full of chips. I knew how much was there - I gave it to the cashier. She counted short.... I asked her to recount... she said the same thing. I asked her - can i count it for you? She shorted me by 1000.00 dollars. Yes... seriously. I was so angry... I think she has a good gig until someone catch's her... when I complained to boss... nothing. I regrouped... back to the craps tables... no mojo this time... speedy... the roller - was on fire.... but in a hurry and the dice were flying. The dealer didn't protect my position.... I called him on it. Two seconds later I thru 25 at the six... he said that is 30.. and the rapid roller threw... If he his six.... no F-ing way they were going to pay me. But they were not going to give me the 25 back. I checked out of the hotel 5 minutes later.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE PLACE BUT WAY TO HUGE”
Reviews.Author: hooglesnorpus
Reviews.Content: EVERTHING ABOUT CAESERS IS TOP SHELF. FROM THE CHECKIN TO THE FOOD TO THE ROOM VIEWS. Every employee was curteous and helpful. Statues are throughout the facility and are quite nice. The Range steakhouse was top notch. The one detraction I had was that it was HUUUGE! There are 5 valets I was told, it was a major journey just to find my correct valet each time. I had to ask where so and so is each time I wanted to go somewhere. The High Limit Casino rooms is very cool. It is the Pinnacle of play in US Casinos. Many Asians betting thousands a hand, was cool to play my $100 and to watch them. I recommend Caesarsto stay and play but bring a compass and your GPS. Overall Grade I give them is an A-

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: thejedeye
Reviews.Content: Location was great for exploring the strip. Was in town for a trade show at the Sands Convention Center and Caesars was one of the official hotels offering reduced rates. It's an easy walk over to the Convention Center. Older property but very well kept up, everything was in good working order, and clean. Yes some stains on the carpet in places, but very minor. Bathroom was hugh, roomy shower, spa tub, TV. Out the main entrance you can cross the street on the overhead walk to Bill's Gambling Hall or on the right to the Bellagio. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: pnmbn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Augustus Tower. Had a fountain view room (3156). Beautiful room. Loved the jacuzzi tub! Everything was spotless. The staff was friendly and helpful. Caesar's is HUGE! We could have spent the entire 4 days just exploring Caesar's!

Reviews.Title: “total disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: bencase
Reviews.Content: The only thing nice at this place is the rooms. The rest of it flat out is terrible. Has a large casino with not to many tables ever open. Slot machines are very outdated, hey catch up with times ceasars. Most dealers there have huge attitude problems not all a few were nice but the majority were acting as if they were doing you a favor just for dealing cards. The food was mediocre at best. All in all i was very disappointed with this place, i expected much much more. The sports book hasn't changed in 20 years. i must say ceasars thinks they can live off of their name alone, i for one would never stay there again or even walk in there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casino on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: thomas624
Reviews.Content: Caesar's is an excellent place to stay while in Vegas. Caesar's staff are always friendly and helpful. The property is well cared for and kept very clean, this is in contrast to many of the strip hotels that seem to have lost the desire to keep their property looking nice. There are also plenty of nice restaurants within the hotel and the forum shops are only a few steps away. One issue that we have had in past visits was taking a taxi from the airport. Some less than reputable drivers find ways to stretch out the ride by taking different routes. We had one a couple of years ago that was going the wrong direction on freeway and we kept telling him to shut the meter off, which he refused saying he would take some off the trip when we arrive. He offered to take one dollar off what should of been about ten. We didn't pay that and gave him what we thought was fair. I have heard that others have had similar experiences. Taxi ride from the hotel to Caesar's should be about $15.

Reviews.Title: “Keep a map with you!”
Reviews.Author: bjplou
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 4 day stay at Caesars. When you check in they give you a map of the hotel...keep it with you at all times. It is really easy to get turned around in there. Also, bring your own K-cups if you want coffee in the moring without paying $12 for 4. Our deluxe room was big and comfortable, the bathrooms are awesome. There is a TV in the mirror of the bathroom. There is a variety of restaurants within the palace covering every food group and nationality. Most reasonable dinners for two are $125 or more is you have more then one drink. There is some fast food places but for two you are still lookling a $20 to $25. The staff is very professional and helpfull. The spa out of this world!! Wish it was warmer when we were there so we could go to the pool area - WOW! We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Take the "Hangover" tour and stay at a hotel that likes guests”
Reviews.Author: Bobwphilly
Reviews.Content: With 4000 rooms, you would think one would be open to check in at noon. The hotel is a beautiful place and the rooms were large and well furnished, but none of that matters if the staff can't or won't help. Not only could they not get me in at midday, when I got into a room at 2, I lugged my bags through the casino, and long hallways, only to find that the person staying in the room was as shocked as myself that we both had the same room. In addition, they will nickel and ten dollar you for everything from a cup of bad coffee in your room to internet. So join the crowds who want to see where the Hangover movie was shot, but stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as expected”
Reviews.Author: Lee D
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace was a big part of a great experience in Vegas. The hotel is centrally located in the middle of the strip. We had a spacious room on the 32nd floor with a view of the strip (that could be blocked out with heavy curtains if we wanted). Two queen beds and a full bathroom with spa, double sinks and TV. Great service from everyone we came into contact with in the hotel, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “8 splendid stays at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: hugobar
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff superb. Love the Augustus tower. Luxurious in every sense of the word. Maid service was superb. Love the hotel, great spot in Vegas. Close to everything exciting but expect to do lots of walking because everything in Vegas is huge. Lots of great shows, particularly Celine. Have seen her show about 4 times, well worth the money. There is definitely something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Forum Tower”
Reviews.Author: migajon23
Reviews.Content: Room was excellent. Shower was great, two shower heads. Tower is close to sports book and shops. Furthest from registration and main entrance. Had good view of Mirage and strip. Everyone at the hotel was extremely nice and helpful. Hotel has perfect location, center strip. Easy walking distance to TI, Mirage, Bellagio and can catch the Monorail right across the street at Flamingo. ShadowBar was nice, good place to pre-drink.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.. great three-days”
Reviews.Author: advidtravler
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas monthly... just for fun... I am fortunate to live close by in San Diego and the Southwest flight of 50 min is easy and inexpensive. I find that three nights in Vegas is plenty. Even if I did not go so often, I think those packages that sell 5-7 nites would be horrible. Well, maybe you could stretch 5 nights if you were flying a long distance and felt you needed to try to get your money's worth. (silly silly silly)... Caesar's Palace is the nicest of the Total Rewards remaining hotels. Paris Hotel is a close second, then Planet Hollywood... All of the "Total Rewards" properties offer rates with NO RESORT FEES!! This is a major plus! Other hotels charge between $15-22 (per night) additional resort fees. Be sure to check on that before booking. The amenities, lodging, staff, restaurants at all of the Total Rewards Hotels are all more than sufficient. Rooms are large... ask for one close to the elevator unless you don't mind hiking long hallways every time to return to your room. Caesar's Palace Hotel offers a central "Strip" location and is walkable in either direction to cover the whole strip. A car is not needed... plus parking garages(unless you valet) is a long distance from each hotel casino. The inside giant shopping area is great! You never have to go outside if its 100+ degrees or any type of inclement weather... (which is rare). Plan to walk, take a taxi or use the easy bus service... buy the bus pass if you plan to be roaming for few days. Enjoy Caesar's... it's a fun place....

Reviews.Title: “I hate to complain about a comped room, but....”
Reviews.Author: VegasLoverDallas
Reviews.Content: It was a little disappointing. The room was very large but completely empty. I think it was the largest room under a suite and it was so empty! The tv was a tube tv, the carpet and furniture was from the early 90's and the bathroom was downright gross. The toilet area smelled of urine as soon as we arrived. When I went to turn on the bath the water ran brown for about 5 seconds and there was mold/mildew everywhere. That particular tower was obviously the oldest in the hotel and is in desperate need of renovations. Plus, the hostess at Beijing Noodle was by far the most rude person I have ever encountered in Las Vegas. I placed a to-go order and apparently asking her to include cutlery was entirely too difficult and not her job. Oh well. We will still stay at Caesar's in the future since the rooms are free but we will ask to be put in a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Marrissa99
Reviews.Content: The best of all the hotels we stayed at during our vacation! We scored a free upgrade - not sure which tower, but it was very nice. We had booked an economy room, but with the free upgrade we received a great room. Best part was that it was not only beautifully appointed - the room was CLEAN. The location is central to the strip. Right outside you can catch a city bus that will take you up and down the strip - as well as take you to the downtown show. Tickets can be purchased at the bus stops. The bus does get packed during weekend nights though. The service throughout Caesars is outstanding. The restaurants included. I highly recommend this hotel! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: kkidd
Reviews.Content: The room was ok but caesars palace was awesome.The best spot on las vegas Blvd.We had a great trip . I gave caesars palace a very good but the room was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower”
Reviews.Author: vegasgirl6
Reviews.Content: Nice room overlooking the fountains and the strip. Clean, good location and very roomy. Jacuzzi tub and tv in bathroom. Flat screen tv. Sofa, chair and table and chairs. Would stay there again for sure. Casear's had added several new restaurants. Enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Service going downhill - everyone's a sucker”
Reviews.Author: pflagdad
Reviews.Content: In 2008, Caesar's got everything right. Four years ago, for our anniversary weekend, their service was spot on. This past weekend, they lost my "anniversary surprise" order, recorded a week in advance. The next morning, they "remembered" it and tried to deliver it while we were still sleeping. Net: morons. Today, the day of checkout, the cleaning staff tried to enter and again woke us up from a sound sleep - even Holiday Inn knows better. Don't be a sucker, there are much better places to stay - we are going to the Wynn or Bellagio from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SimCity_AU
Reviews.Content: Our family of four originally were booked in for 2 rooms in the Forum tower, but reception couldn't place us on the same floor, so we were kindly upgraded to the palace tower. 27 floors up we were facing north and had a small strip view, better than what we ever expected. The rooms were very nice, spacious enough with a fabulous bathroom, double vanity, spa and separate shower. The mini bar is well stocked, but be careful because all the items are sitting on electronic sensors, so if you move anything, your room will be auto charged. Caesars is a fantastic casino with a really impressive pool area and gaming floor. Plenty of food options and great (but expensive) shopping in the Forum Shops. The location is also great, pretty much right in the middle of the strip where all the action is. No hesitation in recommending this place to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower”
Reviews.Author: darrell1486
Reviews.Content: First timers to Vegas and could not have chosen a more convenient location! We arrived on January 4th and had a speedy check-in with a complimentary upgrade. Our room was a corner room so had two different views from the floor-to-ceiling windows. One sightline was to the Bellagio and the other to the Rio. Staff were courteous and helpful. Really enjoyed staying at this hotel and will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service and Room”
Reviews.Author: cplayson
Reviews.Content: I don't take the time to write reviews but our trip to Caesars was well-worth writing about. I would like to first say that Samira, the young lady who checked us in, was absolutely WONDERFUL! We arrived very early and was tired, and, was told that check in was not until 3pm. However, Samira went through hoops with housekeeping and got us checked in by 1pm. We had an absolutely beautiful room in the Augustus Tower with a view of the Bellagio fountains. The beds were heaven! So much so that when we got home and got into our own bed my husband said we need to get a bed like the one we slept in at Caesars Palace. If you want a great room and view ask for a luxury room in the Augustus Tower on floors 26 and up with even numbers from 72-82. You will not be disappointed! "Lots of Hugs to Samira for making our trip extra special! Thank You!" Mrs. Williamson.

Reviews.Title: “"You are not a customer" feeling”
Reviews.Author: Manuel P
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of hotel where they never make you feel as valuable customers, it looks like they don't appreciate you as a guest and they never treat as you deserve. Service is very average a sometime you can feel they are rude. However they have high standards facilities and some good restaurants. I tried to order room service and the waiting time was 1.30h!!!

Reviews.Title: “glitzy throwback”
Reviews.Author: DanAtlantic
Reviews.Content: Caesar's - nothing says old-school Vegas like this classic. And it doesn't disappoint. From the mad-men era Cleopatra's Lounge to the sparkly lit bangles over the table game area, this place is all Vegas, baby. The place is in need of some better ventilation; the smoke level here is pretty rough, and be alert to reserve a no-smoking room unless you want to inhale heavy nicotine air all night long. Decent dealers and tables, tons of bars, all in the smack dab center of the strip.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great location with a lot of fun”
Reviews.Author: Rieko770
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at Caesars for 5nights in December. The hotel staff were very professional and the room was amazing with a beautiful strip view. This hotel is located in the center of the area and very easy to access other hotels in walking distance. It is recommended especially if it is first time for you to visit Las Vegas and you will not regret even though you might have a hard time to win gamblings. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: cmang17
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of it all in Las Vegas then this is the place to stay. Caesar's is placed right in the middle of Las Vegas Blvd. and it has everything you need right inside of it. It has great restaurants, shopping, pools and nightlife. The rooms were nice and the service was good. This place is huge and you may very well get lost in there once or twice during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: R0nniepurple
Reviews.Content: We chose Caesars firstly because of the great deal we got (£250 for 5 nights for 2 people, including $18 a day for breakfast from Java Coffee in the Cypress Street food court). Secondly because of the central location on the strip and thirdly because they do not charge an additional daily resort fee. It is a very pretty hotel with a lovely spa and great pools (although only 1 open in the winter, unsurprisingly. We found that the staff were friendly, welcoming and helpful on both the concierge, bell and main reception desk. The only reason I have not given an excellent score is due to the terrible service we had at check in where an employee called Sergio gave us our worst Vegas experience. Unfortunately we picked the wrong queue to stand in, but not only did all the other queues move faster than ours, the lady looking after the queue right next to us turned her whole queue of around 10 people around 3 times in the time the 7 people in front of me were served. We queued for 1.5 hours while the 7 people in front of us were served by Sergio. Why did we not move queues you ask? Beleive me we wish we did but we convinced ourselves that Sergio was spending extra time and effort on each customer and giving them lots of help and advice for their Vegas experience, helping them book good deals etc etc so we decided we would like to have the extra service. Alas, when we got to the front we realised that Sergio was in appearence completely computer illiterate and was only typing around 6 words a minute. twice while he was serving us, a guy who appeared to be his manager had a word in his ear and appeared to by trying to speed him up. My advice, avoid the queue with the guy with the Sergio name tag and you should be fine. The spa was a dissappointment to us also but not because it was not nice to use but because they seperate men and women due to clothing being optional. This was dissappointing for us as we expected to have a coupld of hours relaxing as a couple together and chatting in the jacizzi and steam rooms. Apparently all hotel spas in vegas are the same however so clearly the demand for separation is high but I wish Caesars would put in a special couples section also to cater to couples who want to do spa stuff together. There are couples treatments however so you can have a massage with your other half. Other than this, for any Vegas virgins, my advice is book your tickets for shows and grand canyon trips online as the deals are cheaper than anything we found in vegas. If you book a ticket to one show however and you want another for another show at the same hotel, check at the box office to see if they will give you the 2-4 1 discount for already booking 1 of their shows. Caesars give you a booklet of vouchers with some 2-4-1s but not for anything we wanted to see (mainly the cheap and not very popular shows). Absinthe is a Ceasars Palace based show and is absolutely hilarious so I highly recommend it to anyone not easily offended. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: barneybearhugs
Reviews.Content: This was my first ever time in Vegas and Caesars was booked by me boyfriend for a 7 night stay. We arrived in the afternoon of New Years Eve and I just thought 'Wow'!! I wasn't disappointed at all! We stayed in the Palace Tower, room 526, it had a super king size bed which was extremely comfortable. We had a very large bathroom with double sink units, shower, jacuzzi and separate wc. The whole place was very clean and spacious. Mini bar was expensive and coffee making facility ($12 for 4 coffees) but that is the same in any hotel. Due to the time of year the outdoor pool was closed, but still looked amazing. The hotel is absolutely enormous and it was quite easy to get lost, but well worth it as there was so much to see in there including The Forum mall with every designer shop you could think of. Restaurants in the hotel were quite pricey, but excellent food so well worth it for a special night out. Caesars is in a fantastic location right on the strip and I certainly hope I will be going back there in the near future, the only difference would be the time of year so I could sunbathe!! All in all a 10/10 experience. Look forward to seeing you again!

Reviews.Title: “Palace Tower Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: 2niteshow
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Stayed in the tower palace section of the hotel where the pool area is. Didn't get a. Chance to use the pool even though it's heated, but the view was spectacular. Smoking room however needs to be ventilated to extract the smell and the aircoditioning seemed not to work properly or poorly.

Reviews.Title: “First time to visit Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Roger R
Reviews.Content: This was our first time going to Vegas. We are so glad we chose to stay at Caesars. We stayed four nights and enjoyed every moment. The hotel staff was very nice and the room was one of the nicest I've ever stayed in. I usually find it difficult to sleep in a bed that is not mine but I had no problem, these beds are very comfortable. Great location making it easy to check out the other casinos in the area. We have already scheduled another trip in about a month and will be staying at Caesars again.

Reviews.Title: “Life at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: Sue_Dave2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars the first week of January 2012. There was some confusion regarding our reservation and our party was split up (we requested adjoining rooms). The rooms we did end up in were not even close together but the staff at the desk worked hard and were able to upgrade us to a nice suite which adjoined the other room - very nice. This hotel is well maintained but is becoming dated, for the money we paid for our rooms you can pretty much stay in any hotel along the strip and have your meals paid for. That being said, we ate at The Cheese Cake Factory in the hotel and it was very good. We also ate at The Old Homestead Restaurant, the best presentation of a meal I have ever seen and the food tasted fabulous - a little pricey but well worth it. We spent the entire four days inside the casino floor and I am told that the weather outside was beautiful -who knew. Upon our departure we needed a late checkout but were told at the front desk that it was not possible, but, after speaking with a casino host we were given a room to hold our luggage and a limo to the airport - first rate customer service that guarantees we will be back. Overall Caesars is worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “too freakin huge”
Reviews.Author: Dan V
Reviews.Content: All of the "big" casinos are huge, but this one is ridiculous. Takes "forever" to walk by the place and took us 20 minutes to find the "statues" (not real impressive).

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Las Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki B
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas.....it is bigger than life!! Caesar's Palace was fantastic....very big....very accomodating! Room was great....very clean. Pool was great.....lots of place to lounge. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “It has everything inside”
Reviews.Author: Isa B
Reviews.Content: It's huge, and i really got tired of walking in the Forum shops! The service was great as well as the pool. Didn't have a lot of options for a late breakfast (10AM/11AM).

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: irish_blueeyes2001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Harrahs, Rio, Ballys, PH and Paris so when we had the opportunity to stay at Caesars, fully comp'd because my husband is a Total Rewards Member, we jumped at the chance to stay there. Not only did we find the hotel far too big, it took 15 mins to walk from our room in the Palace Tower to the front door, but the rooms were aging, customer service (not the front desk staff they were awesome), and the casino were severely lacking in our minds. The room was very large; we got upgraded from the Forum Tower to the Palace Tower by the front desk staff member (thank you!). There was a separate shower, tub and a water closet. The baseboards in the bathroom were grubby and were falling apart, the hallway was dingy, but the sheets were clean and the view was excellent from the 5th floor. We called down as soon as we checked in to ask for Non-down pillows because I am really allergic, and I was asked how many I needed. I advised the staff member that 4 would be needed because we'd be replacing all the pillows on the bed. About 1 hr later, 1 pillow showed up. We didn't want to cause a fuss but it was pretty annoying sleeping on one pillow all 4 days and sneezing at night because my husband had to sleep with the down filled ones. I was told to head to the spa, which I did and it was nice but the infamous snow room is something you can definitely skip. It's loud and really lack-lustre, but the baths, steam and sauna rooms make up for it. Don't go to the cafe, it's a waste of money. I had the lemon chicken at the chinese food place there and I felt sick later that night, an order of lemon chicken and a Smirnoff Ice cost me $18. A bit excessive, even for Vegas. There were very few tables open for blackjack, and those that were had high minimums ($25) so if you aren't a higher roller, you'll need to head somewhere else to gamble. Serendipity 3 was amazing though. Have the "High Heel Pump", best sandwich ever! Pros: Good location, central to everything and having the shops close is nice Cons: Too big, lack lustre service, high gambling minimums, expensive in house food choices Save your money, or your comp points, and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and poor VFM”
Reviews.Author: Jinky67
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a week in the Palace Tower.Room was good with without being brillant (Augustus Tower seems the place to be but strangely doesn't have a bath instead offers a walk in shower);the bathroom is the best part about the room .Overall,we were aghast about the costs of everything, notably food which is expensive even in the fast food eating area.The cost of food in the restaurants is high without being top end in quality.The MESA Grill is the best of them but staff attitude is poor to the point of being condescending.The Palm Restaurant in the Forum Shpping Centre is better than any restuarant in the hotel.The cost of wine at all the eating spots is just plain silly which may explain why so few people seemed to have a full bottle on their table over dinner . Remarkably,there is a $25 dollar daily charge to use the fitness facility which is well provided for in terms of equipment.There is no free more modest gym for those who simply want to use a running machine and a multi gym.Wi-fi likewise incurs a charge. The lines at check-in are very long (it took them nearly 30 minutes to process us) . Overall,we left with the impression of an hotel which feels it doesn't need to go the extra mile to please its customers and believes in extracting every dime from them .Some staff were helpful most were indifferent.A disappointing experience. We were last there about 10 years ago and there is no doubt in my mind that it has deteriorated in diret relation to its growth.

Reviews.Title: “not a Vegas fan”
Reviews.Author: travelmum
Reviews.Content: First time to Las Vegas and we only stayed there as we were in the area doing a more extensive vacation, and thought it was a good opportunity to see the place. Not a fan, but interesting to see it. Caesars was a very nice hotel, way bigger than I'd normally pick but it had a good rate for the newer tower (sorry, forget the name, but apparently the other rooms in other parts of the hotel are not as nice) and a central location as we like to walk everywhere. There's an entrance right by the new tower too, so you don't have to wander all through the hotel if you don't want to. Very 'fake' type of decorating, which is totally Vegas I guess, not really our style, but again, fun to see. . Room was very nice, huge with huge bathroom. It was a quiet time of year, which was busy enough for us, but can't imagine going there in high season, yuk! Our room came with a coffee pod-machine but you paid for the pods you used. They really should put up the price by a couple of dollars and include the coffee!! Toilet didn't work well one morning, and was fixed quickly. Chocs on the bed in the evening. Good location, nice hotel, and I just reviewed the Paris where we stayed on the way back from our trip. Think we got a great rate at Caesars as couldn't find the same rate on the way home, which is why we ended up at the Paris which was a let down after Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Cigar and cigarette smoke!”
Reviews.Author: mizloi
Reviews.Content: Nice room, nice view, stayed there only because we had tickets to see Celine Dion's show. Took over 30 minutes, in line, to check in. $12 room charge for 4 cups of coffee that you make yourself in your room-if you choose to! Plan on a minimum of $25 per person for breakfast in any of the hotel restaurants. Good food and huge portions. Booked directly thru the hotel, no resort fees but I probably could have gotten the room for half booking thru the internet. The hotel was very busy, the smoke in the entire public area was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: DavidJessica2012
Reviews.Content: This hotel being one of the strips most famous does not disappoint. We stayed in the Roman Tower and only booked a double room however we were put into a king room and the bed was huge and very comfortable. Our bathroom was the biggest I have seen in a hotel room, especially the shower and was always spotlessly clean. There were two downsides: first was the view from our room, all we could see was the tower opposite, but with a hotel the size of Caesars it's understandable not every room can have a strip or pool view. Secondly was that the restaurants are all very expensive, even a buffet breakfast was $47 per person, and was nothing special. If you want somewhere cheap-ish to eat I recommend the restaurant at Bills Gamblin Hall across the street, basic food but approx $30 for a couple to eat. If Caesars had a small 'snack' shop/restaurant that you could eat in for $10 it would complete it. Above all I would highly recommend staying here, bang in the middle of the strip with everything in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “OLD Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ashleyuno1
Reviews.Content: Never stayed at Ceasars before but thought we'd give it a try because The Hangover movie made it look updated. HOWEVER, Ceasars is nothing more than a hyped-up OLD Vegas casino. Here is a short list of my biggest complaints: •Valet was full EVEN FOR HOTEL GUESTS •Check-in wait time over 25 mins. •Centurion Tower where our room was located was not listed anywhere on the hotel map and we couldn't find any hotel staff to help direct us •Centurion tower hotel room was outdated, filthy, meagerly appointed and utterly disappointing •Casino is outdated, lacks imagination, doesn't have enough new games, no entertainment value, not enough drink waitresses, disgusting bathrooms •Hotel staff was unfriendly and unhelpful and in most cases MIA Overall this hotel AND casino is not worth your money. Only stop by for the Forum Shops and Cheesecake Factory and spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Octavius Tower”
Reviews.Author: LZS_RM
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the Caesars Palace. Our party of 5 had two rooms at the Octavius Tower, their newest tower, looking at their pools area (a panoramic view). Accommodations are excellent. However, you have to be careful about touching their minibar and its amenities. Just by lifting anything over a 20 second period, you'll be charged. Of course, as we did not know that and complained about, they have written off the respective debts. In summary, you want to verify your final bill to make sure you are not been overcharged. The hotel has an excellent location (mid strip) and a well deserved reputation. The Appian Way (an arcade of shops) and the Forum Shops (a mall) offer you a very convenient shopping opportunity. We definitively recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst check-in system”
Reviews.Author: fchen12
Reviews.Content: They have the worst checking system. Got stuck behind a line that did not move while people in other lines were checking in. What a nightmare. Should have one single line so one can go to the next available check in agent. Hello Management. Who is the one that came up with this system. Should be fired!

Reviews.Title: “everything we hoped it would be”
Reviews.Author: 186400Caroline
Reviews.Content: having been to las Vegas many times and always wanted to stay here we were really pleased to say it lived up to our expectations. the rooms were huge and the spa tub amazing. we were in the palace tower it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory...”
Reviews.Author: Danno_99
Reviews.Content: I cannot really complain as I stayed in a comped room and was upgraded via the $20 trick (on slow midweek nights). I ended up in a corner suite in the Augustus tower. The suite itself was very large and roomy, the bed comfortable. The bathroom was large as well, with a separate toilet, and twin (his-and-hers) washbasins and mirrors. The bath was an oversize tub with a separate shower. Service was excellent - all employees were always courteous and happy to help. However, there was a feeling that the room could have done with better maintenance. The tub was actually a jacuzzi that was not working. The small LCD TV in the bathroom had terrible reception. The bed, the carpets and the furniture, while very clean and in good condition, did look a touch old. Also the Qua toiletries definitely need improving - not impressive at all. Nice coffee maker in the room - expensive coffee capsules, though. Good, large (laptop size) personal safe in the wardrobe. One other minus is the self-parking. Using the valet is good idea (if not full....) otherwise I had to walk a full 8-10 minutes to get to my car - and I'm a fast walker..

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for Celine Dion Concert”
Reviews.Author: whatupdude
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas to see Celine Dion. Caesars was convenient as the Colosseum is on the property. The great location, restaurants, and service make Caesar's better than average. We had a Deluxe Room in the Palace Tower. It was nice and modern with a huge bathroom. We paid $103. It is a big place and there are always a ton of people around. The crowd is very diverse. Of course you can't escape the smoke. Overall it worked for what we wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Maximus5110
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed in the lack of service. I was overbilled 4 times while I was staying there.Then after I got back home they billed my credit card for expenses on dates after I had checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Be wary of the "No resort fee" rooms”
Reviews.Author: isy_01
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at Caesar's Palace, i booked 2 rooms, over the Christmas holidays, i got a really good deal...a little bit under $900 (total) for basically 8 nights (2 rooms x 4 nights), and no resort fees. I thought that it was a pretty good deal, but by the time we left, i thought it was not THAT great of a deal. The guy who checked us in, oh boy he must have been having a bad day, because he was very snippy, and not very friendly. He informed us that since we had 2 ppl in each room, that only 1 king bed rooms were available...and that we would have to pay $30/night if we want a room with 2 beds, what a rip off!!! We got connecting rooms, which was great, but no fridge, no kettle, no coffee maker, and CRT TV! Last time we were in Vegas (May 2011) we stayed in Excalibur, and they had CRT TVs...granted, Excalibur is not as nice of a hotel as Caesar's Palace...but come on!! They even have LCDs at Holiday Inns! We could get a Keurig coffeemaker, but like everything else in vegas, it would cost...we ended up getting a coffee maker at CVS, and we were set for coffee in the morning, better than paying $3/cup at the hotel. Oh, and housekeeping...each evening's housekeeping brought something new...one night we didn't have new glasses, another night, they took away our blanket. On the bright side, the bell hop who brought up our luggage was very helpful, and told us about the coffee maker trick. Next time i will think about getting a room at TI or Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Nickle & Dimed with Inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: Umfrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Forum Tower. The room was “OK”, a bit worn with the heat lamp in the bathroom not working, almost no power outlets available, and a wet spot in the carpet that ‘oddly’ never went away. The bed was quite comfortable though. The big downer with Caesars is that they nickel and dime you and getting to various amenities is very inconvenient. There was no coffee maker in the room forcing you to go down to the shops, wait in line and bring it back to the room. You have to walk through quite a bit of the casino to get to the pools. The hot tubs one might expect in the pool complex were closed forcing you to pay $45 to use those in the Spa, which was also only accessible by walking through quite a bit of the casino. Lastly, many of the better dance clubs and restaurants are not in Caesars. It is also not one of the better places to gamble. This was our first time at Caesars and we were the guest of friends. We won’t be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.good location”
Reviews.Author: lpandsm
Reviews.Content: Caesers is in the best location on the strip in my opinion. The hotel is beautiful. The room was nice and comfortable. We didn't have a view of the strip however that was my choice. All in all the experience was great, my only criticism would be that we did have to walk a long long way to get to our room but that isnt major. Would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Makes ya feel like a gladiator!”
Reviews.Author: jhw349
Reviews.Content: This place is so nicely kept. We enjoyed going around and looking at all the decor in this place. We spent a day here spending money in the casino and eating. We did not stay just played here. The decor is great, the food court was great, and the gaming and wait staff was also very quick and spot on. When your in Vegas no matter where you stay, be sure to check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “New Octavius Tower is nice but thy are not structured for the addition.”
Reviews.Author: Bobbynishi
Reviews.Content: With their recently opened Octavius Tower, Ceasars Palace is back on the map. But with this new change, it is the staff that is lacking. Too few people to manage such an enormous facility. Got in their new "Deluxe" Octavius Tower room to find a WET spot on the bed! The bed sheets weren't changed and it only took then THREE hours to send over one of their two housekeepers that are on call at night for their whole resort. At 2 AM I was transferred to a lesser room at the Augustus Tower. Sooooo... If you are going to Vegas to argue on the phone, stay here. Otherwise, Bellagio across the street? Yes, I was unlucky. Yes I wanted to stay in the new tower. But you have to agree that it is not fun to spend a whole evening on the phone. For what it is worth, the new tower is nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Las vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: siebie22
Reviews.Content: This hotel,although slightly more expensive is the perfect Las Vegas spot. Over the top massive resort,solid gambling and helpful/friendly staff. Location right in the middle of the action. Great nightclub,great sportsbook and good poker room. Was brought here for my Bachelors 2 years ago and now with my wife. Not once was I disappointed. If you frequent Las Vegas you would know that it is the place that it is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for NYE”
Reviews.Author: TravelsHereNthere
Reviews.Content: Hotel and hotel employees were great! I had reserved a room in the Forum tower, but was upgraded at check-in to the Palace tower, which meant a bigger room with a jacuzzi tub. The room also had a great view of the New Year's fireworks show on the strip. We enjoyed walking around the Vegas strip and even had time to see the pool (heated to 82 degrees). The only complaints are that the coffee in the room was $12 and they required guests to purchase a day pass for access to the spa (usually guests have free access, but this was probably due to the holiday period). Great location, rooms, and service.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great experience”
Reviews.Author: kukrusher
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Vegas so I was in shock to begin with. Being dazzled by all the lights and noise is probably making my review a little more positive. But my experience was great. I opted to self park. This means that in order to reach hotel registration you have to walk through the entire casino. I figured that would be the case. No big deal, get the lay of the land inside Caesar's. Entry was quick and easy. They said the upgraded me and my co-worker and were nice enough to put us in rooms that were across the hall from each other. The rooms were very nice, I had a view of the roof and a peak at the strip. I was on the 5th floor and it wasn't bad. The room was clean, had a cool motorized curtain, TV in the bathroom, and a phone next to the toilet. The shower was massive but the water pressure was a little low coming out of the shower head. Bed was comfy and warm. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Octavian Tower - Brand new and spacious”
Reviews.Author: scoobski
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights during the holiday and were the first occupants of this room in the new tower. The room was beautiful, spacious, the bed comfortable, the linens luxurious, and everything was in working order. The staff was friendly. It's a good "stretch of the legs" to the casino, but I only mention that to anyone who has difficulty walking. (When in Vegas, I expect to do a lot of walking ;) .

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Hotel worth the stay.”
Reviews.Author: Scags217
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Outstanding service. NO resort fees . I give this hotel an "A" Nice big rooms. Bed was comfy , big bathroom, flat screen TV. Also the room was clean. Casino was good. Overall a good trip. Well worth the price. The only down side which was not a deal breaker is the room I had was attached to another with those connecting door. I didn't like that but, wasn't a big deal because the people in the next room wasen't really loud. Also not a big deal because there is an abundance of buffets in las vegas , is that the Caesars buffet was closed due to renovations. i was kinda bummed about that ,but I know in the long run its going to be really good by the time its done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Caesar's Palace!”
Reviews.Author: JennShio
Reviews.Content: My husband, 10 year old daughter, and I stayed at Caesar’s palace 12/25 – 12/28/11. This is the 3rd time I stayed here. The first time, I stayed here with my girlfriends for a bachelorette party in July 2008. The second time, I stayed here with my family in December 2010. We stayed in a Deluxe August Tower room on the 31st floor. There were two queen beds with a night stand in between, alarm clock/CD player and phone, a desk with a lamp and phone (wi-fi is $14.99 per day), 32” flat screen TV on top of dresser drawers. There’s a mini bar refrigerator. There’s no room to put any of your personal food items in the refrigerator. On top of the dresser is a refreshment center with snacks for an extra charge of course. There’s a table with two chairs, 2 drinking glasses, an ice bucket. There’s also a Keurig coffee maker, but you have to pay $12 for the coffee. So you can bring your own coffee bags or tea. There’s also a sitting area with a sofa, coffee table, and sofa chair. We had a great view of the Bellagio Fountains, facing Flamingo Ave. There’s a hallway closet with two Caesar’s Palace bath robes, an iron, ironing board, luggage valet, and an electronic safe on the right side of the closet wall. There’s a huge full size framed mirror on the opposite wall of the closet. The bathrooms are beautiful with marble floors. A walk-in shower with a clear glass door, an over-sized sunken spa tub with jets, dual sinks, magnified vanity mirror, 2 glasses, and tissue box. There’s also a 17” flat screen TV viewable from the spa tub. The toilet is in a separate room with a door you can close. Toiletries include: Qua Baths & Spa brand shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, body lotion, skin bar, and bath bar. The drawer contained a hair dryer, a beauty kit with two cotton balls and two cotton tips, a sewing kit, and a shoe polishing kit. The beds are really comfortable. Be careful of some of the pillows with prickly feathers. I would have loved the comforters to be softer though. Valet parking could be a good wait unless you’re a Seven Star, Diamond, or VIP member. You can self-park, but it’s on the far end from the Augustus Tower. If you take the Appian Way walkway to the left of the hotel registration, it cuts a little of your walk time. As far as gambling, it was the usual holiday bump in the limits. You can’t find anything under a $25 minimum table. The casino itself wasn’t crowded. There were pits that were not in use. I love staying at Caesar’s Palace. The rooms are spacious, the beds are so comfortable, and the location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tanya P
Reviews.Content: Palace Tower Suite...was AMAZING! We loved our stay, the room was clean, The bathrooms were amazing, beds comfy, and a beautiful view on the pool! Love Caesars Palace! Can't wait for our next stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela B
Reviews.Content: We booked a three night stay after Christmas months in advance. When we arrived, we found that the room was old and unkept. The carpet was dirty and the beds were had no bedspread or comforter. The room looked nothing remotely like the picture on the Caesar's website. I will not stay at Caesar's again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite”
Reviews.Author: jasatt
Reviews.Content: I was able to find a great deal for this hotel on their website. My husband and I go to Las Vegas once a year for an "us" get-away. After staying at atleast 9, we loved this one as number one. There are other great hotels, but if you want to feel pampered, even in the cheapest rooms, this is the place. And the pool area is fantastic! Even an adult pool!

Reviews.Title: “December Trip Palace Tower”
Reviews.Author: Teach1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days Dec. 22,23. The room was clean,bathroom was a good size with great light. We asked for a mini frig and it was delivered. When I made the reservation, I was told there was a coffee maker in the room. Yes, there was a mini Kerug. There was a 12.00 charge for the k cups. I did think that information should have been shared with me at reservation time. Our room was on the 21 St floor, nice view of the mountains, we didn't care. Caesars has many places for coffee and fast food. Great food court. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It sure looks pretty”
Reviews.Author: brysal
