Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Caesars many times over the years and it's nice to see the continued investment in room updates, new restaurants, spa, and overall general hard product upgrades. The property does have great amenities overall. But the service, both speed and friendliness, are completely lacking compared to many of the other properties in Vegas. No smiles from most of the staff, miserable restaurant staff at the buffet (and no fresh fruit to be found for breakfast), 45 minutes to have luggage delivered to the room after checking-in (and multiple calls), a running toilet reported to maintenance but never fixed...... We have recently stayed at the Wynn, the Encore, the Four Seasons at Mandalay, and the Bellagio and there is just a large gap in overall timeliness and quality of the experience. Too many better choices for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “A vacation of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Kirby303
Reviews.Content: Anyone can feel like a VIP at Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas. The room in the Augustus Tower was actually a junior suite, with amenities such as jacuzzi tub and multiple flat screen televisions. Check in was painless. Pools are gorgeous. Food choices a very varied, both in cuisine and price. Third year here and definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons for sure”
Reviews.Author: Madison L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I usually spring for cheaper hotels in vegas as we visit a minimum of twice a year and we really dont spend much time in our room. However, we decided to "splurge" on caesars. The hotel itself is a great location Central to everything on the strip and very nice to look at. However, we stayed in the "Roman Tower" which is old and dingy. My room at The Orleans was nicer than this room. The halls smelled of mildew and shampoo. I am a registered dietitian for a living. So naturally my husband and I enjoy quality healthy food. This is pretty much impossible to find on premises of caesars. It is also very expensive! Room service for hardboiled eggs (2), turkey bacon, rye toast, wheat toast, and a pitcher of iced tea was $52.80! It was hot and delicious but a 50 dollar breakfast? Seriously? Also, we are very active. We figured since caesars is considered "upscale" they would have a fitness center on premisis. They do, but what they fail to tell you at check in when you ask is that they charge you $25 a day to use it. That is a complete rip off and we ended up running up and down the strip every morning instead. The poker room is great. My husband and I spend a lot of time in poker rooms and we absolutely hate the Bellagio. Caesars is the nicest poker room on the strip by far. However, for the money we spent I'll be staying at the Venetian next time. Not as central, but absolutely gorgeous and a pristine fitness center that is included in the room rate! I'll just walk to caesars for the poker room... overall pretty disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room @ Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: ahca818
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace at the Forum Tower, 56th floor. Love the suite, I'd love to stay there for at least a week! Excellent customer services, nice and clean room. Love every moment that we spent during the Christmas at Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Moved from Room #530 to Room #2210 after seeing first room and without Vegas gimmick”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights: 23 December – 26 December 2011. We checked in about an hour before official check-in time and were told that the only room ready in our category was room #503 in Palace Tower. We were tired and still on eastern time so we said ok. I had heard about a $20 trick (wrap your credit card with $20 bill at check in) to get a “complimentary” upgrade in Vegas but didn’t try. When we found our floor and were walking toward the room, a housekeeping supervisor greeted us and asked us how we were. I said ok but not too happy about being on the lowest floor with guest rooms. She walked with us to the room. I looked out the window and saw a gravel roof just below with spotlights. I was not amused at the thought of bright lights plus there were ballrooms and such just below us. She called the front desk and room #2210 was miraculously available; perhaps, it would have been available earlier with “$20 trick”! She walked with us and took us to our new room. It had a view to the south and was much improved! It had the same, exact interior floor plan. I did not get her name, but she went above and beyond-a rare 5 in our stay at Caesars. The only slight inconvenience was that she said a bellman would be by in about 15 minutes, maybe a little longer she warned due to the check-in traffic, with our new room keys. Over an hour later, no room keys so I called. A very friendly and energetic bellman showed up about 20 minutes later and said he was bringing our luggage. I said we were waiting for our keys, and he then remembered his side task that he had been given while delivering someone else’s luggage. I kidded him and said is this “Let’s make a Deal”? Can I exchange a key for the luggage and see if I get a zonk? He laughed! The room, which was not as deep and large as the website’s pictures made it appear, had an entry way with closets (including a very welcome safe) on the left and the bathroom on the right followed by a vanity area. The closet had hangers, a luggage rack, and an iron with board. Once past the corridor, the mostly square room had a king-sized bed with end tables on each side. Each had a lamp, with a clock on the left table and a phone on the right table. The phone book and Gideon Bible were in the one with the phone. The bed was not as comfortable as many others where I’ve stayed at similar priced hotels like Intercontinental, Hiltons, and Melia boutiques, or even at lower priced ones like Hampton Inn and Staybridge. There were several pillows but the main ones were lumpy. There were ample electrical outlets for those that need them. The bed was on the right as you entered the main room, and there was an etagere with flat screen tv (the television always came on very loud so be prepared with hand on volume button so you can turn down quickly to save your ears and those in the next rooms) and small cabinets above. On the flat part, there were overpriced mini-bar snacks and souvenirs (i.e. snacks $8-$12 except for one tiny can of Pringles for $3, and an ice bucket. Ice was conveniently available and amazingly free just past the elevators on the left. Under the flat part were drawers and cubby holes for clothes. On the left was the mini-fridge with items from $4 (a can of soda) to $35 (premium 375ml liquor). Some other examples included an intimacy package for $20, an underwater camera (in Vegas?) for $24, domestic beer for $6, and a 4 serving coffee package for $12. The desk just past the etagere had another phone, a lamp, and a coffee pot. (No free coffee or tea-this was a first even at the finest hotels that had a kettle or similar) Not sure if I could have used my own coffee or tea-probably sensored and would charge another fee! On the right past the end table there was a nice chair and a small round table. There was also a small coffee table and sofa in the center. The sofa did not have a bed. The window was floor to ceiling and was the center ¾ or so of the wall. It had a fantastic view, especially after dark, as I mentioned earlier. The bathroom was very nice. Upon arrival, we found the light burned out in the toilet room. When I called about the keys not arriving after over an hour, I also mentioned this. When we returned from our early dinner, the light had been changed and a nice note was left on the ledge by the room entrance that it had been done. The bathroom had a Jacuzzi, which I used often, a separate shower with good showerhead and great pressure, a double sink area, and plenty of counter space in between the sinks. The left sink didn’t drain when I shaved the second morning so I left a note for the maid. Upon our return that evening, there was a voice message on the phone, as was also the case with the light on the first day, but no note. The sink seemed to drain much better but the fix seemed temporary so I would expect the next guest to have a similar issue if filling the sink. There were several nice amenities provided, some on the counter and some in the drawer with a blow dryer. One big positive about the bathroom was that the tile floor wasn’t slippery, even when wet. One negative was that when one of the nearby rooms was filling their hot tub, there was a lot of pipe noise. I wonder how much our neighbors enjoyed my late night or early morning luxury baths although I heard no other guest noise during my stay, and this was another positive. All in all to sum up my stay, I doubt I would stay at Caesars again. It wasn’t worth the price with everything being a la carte. My overall rating of 3 is based on my expectations at this caliber of hotel. The internet was $15 per 24 hour period, which I refused to pay, so I was unable to check my email, look at Vegas options, etc. Harrah’s group, which includes Caesars, Paris, Flamingo, Rio, and more advertises that they charge no resort fee. I had rather pay a small resort fee and get some extras. The mini-bar items were also all monitored by sensor so if you moved anything, you would be charged within 30 seconds. I had to be very careful walking to the bathroom at night so I didn’t accidentally bump into the etagere. I also would breathe in the opposite direction when in that area. There was no space in the fridge for any personal items, although they did offer an extra one. I’m not sure if there would have been a charge since I didn’t really need one, but given all the other fees, I would not be surprised. It’s sort of like tax free state in New England that charges fees on everything. I stayed at Tuscany last year, which also charges an Internet fee for access from hotel rooms and does also have a resort fee, but you can use you computer with free wifi in common areas so at least you can check email while eating. You also get a coupon package which offsets most of the fee. I also have stayed at the Holiday Inn just down Flamingo from Tuscany near Terribles and got free Internet and a free shuttle to the strip, but they have no upgrade rooms even for Platinum Priority Club members. You have to look at the overall picture and decide what is most important to you for a pleasant stay in Vegas. It’s a subjective decision depending on the traveler. Next time, I’m going to try Venetian or Palazzo since I’ve joined their Grazie program. I still highly recommend the $29.95 brunch buffet on Sunday at Envy in the Renaissance near the convention center and monorail stop, although we walked both ways. Harrah’s advertises their 24 hour super buffet pass for about $45, but in small print, it says black-out dates apply, and guess what, I was there over Christmas weekend, which was blacked out! I had built up a good amount of Total Rewards points from my slot machine play at the Harrah’s properties plus my Total Rewards credit card, so I did have lunch at Paris in the Brasserie and did try the Saturday night buffet at Caesars, both for just rewards points and nothing out of pocket except tip. The lunch at the Paris was fantastic with great service, and I enjoyed my lamb burger. 80% of the guests at the buffet were Asian, and the buffet choices were Asian/Christmas and included sushi, Chinese ribs, steamed rice and more along with turkey, overcooked lamb, prime rib, ham, mashed sweet potatoes, green bean casserole, and stuffing. There weren’t many other vegetable selections. The highlight for most of the guests seemed to be the crab legs. Peel and eat shrimp plus lobster bisque or clam chowder and others were offered as well. The dessert selection was fantastic and included a strawberry chocolate dipping station. I didn’t have crab legs since they weren’t precracked as they were at the Envy brunch in May. (this was the one thing missing when I was there this time) Knife and fork were in napkin at table, but crab crackers and spoons were hard to find. I did find a bowl of various sized spoons by the carving station! I had the breakfast buffet at Caesars a year or so ago, when the buffet pass wasn’t blacked out, and enjoyed it more than any of the other Harrah buffets. I so recommend their breakfast buffet but not their dinner one. The greeter also seemed annoyed that we didn't want to sit next to rambunctious children so she sat us in the very back! I wish I had gone to Paris’ buffet for dinner. Rio has the largest selection but requires a free shuttle from Paris or Harrah’s to reach. The ceilings in the casino at Caesars, except for the newer Coliseum area, were low. This meant poor ventilation and very smoky. My throat itched after my visits. Paris and Venetian were the best ventilated that I visited. I also found the machines not as friendly at Caesars but that’s hit or miss anywhere. I get too nervous to do the gaming tables. On the way to checkout, I saw a lady pushing a baby carriage with her Pomeranian (no baby) so dogs were allowed. I did see a few other pampered pooches there also. Checkout was quick and efficient, but it was just after 7 am so no rush of people. I applied the remaining balance on my Total Rewards account to my bill so it was $20 less than it would have been. Lady at desk was very courteous and made my last memory a pleasant one. We took a taxi to Tuscany for breakfast before heading to the airport. I’m glad I stayed at Caesars since it was one of those items on my “bucket” list. Now, that’s done! If I were to stay at a Harrah’s property again, I would probably pick one where I have not stayed: Bally’s, Harrah’s or Rio. The only one where I would stay again is Paris, but none of the others merits a repeat visit unless there is a really great offer. Paris, I think, is the best of their Las Vegas properties. I try to get to Vegas twice a year so check back for future reviews! It’s a nice change of scenery and is fun once or twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “tower determines room quality”
Reviews.Author: lifeisshortOhio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 4 nights in dec and was traveling with family. Each of the 3 groups were put in various towers and there is a big difference in quality.We were in the forum tower and bed quality,bathroom size was all fine. It had an overhaul 2 years ago according to staff. No fridge.great strip location.Except for very sour person that checked us in all was well Room was clean and this is the closest tower to self park. No veiw at all.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Tower rooms showing their age”
Reviews.Author: orangebloodtraveler
Reviews.Content: Years ago my wife and I stayed at Caesar's Palace in one of their Palace Tower rooms for the first time and were extremely impressed. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said for our recent stay. We stayed in a Palace Tower premium suite and wish we had gotten a room in the Augustus Tower instead. The room in the Palace Tower had a carpet with snags that were visible in both the entry lobby and the living area. The caulk around the jacuzzi tub was cracked and had noticeable mildew stains. The bottom of the wood door trim in the bathroom also had brown stains which I assume were from water or cleaning agents. In addition, the television was not working and it took three calls and several hours to get it taken care of. We've stayed plenty of times at Caesar's Palace and If you opt to stay here I recommend you get a room in either the Augustus Tower or Octavius Tower that is scheduled to open early 202.

Reviews.Title: “Old School Grandma type Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Brit O
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Roman Tower. This is the place for you if you like Old School Grandma type rooms. Everything is outdated. Old tv, no coffee maker, old furnishings, old heater - it's like a trip back in time. So if you want to pay a high price for crap, this is the place to go. Have fun... (I would much rather stay at another place on the strip, this was very dissapointing)

Reviews.Title: “Impresssive!”
Reviews.Author: Cubagirl1998
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas and I will definitely come back. I stayed at this hotel for 4 days and we stayed in the Palace Tower. The room was huge and spotless. I liked the Forum Shops and spent a great deal of money there. I am not a huge gambler so I spent my time in the malls. We ate at Raos for dinner one night. It is a little expensive but worth every penny. Caesars is in the perfect spot on the strip. It is in the middle of everything. We were in walking distance of all the beautiful hotels. The water show at the Bellagio was amazing. The best place for breakfast was Mon Ami Gabi at the Paris Hotel. I loved the lemon pancakes!! I was overwhelmed by the opulence of Las Vegas and Caesars. I have to say I will definitely miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service!”
Reviews.Author: DBIOWA
Reviews.Content: When we are planning a trip, I read the Trip Advisor reviews of the hotels and restaurants. I want to comment on our recent 5 night stay at Caesars. Our room was in the Palace Tower and we were completely satisfied. The room was nicely appointed, the bathroom was large with a spa tub, a nice walk-in shower, double sinks, and the room was very clean. We arrived early and checked in at the desk. By the time we gave our luggage to the Bell Desk, they called and had a room ready for us. Employees from all areas of the hotel were very friendly and helpful. While gambling at Caesars and some of thier other properties, there was always excellent cocktail service. We have stayed at many of the other nicer properties in Vegas, but really consider this best all-around for service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Rick V
Reviews.Content: Checked in on 12/18/11 with Michael, excellent service, tipped him $20 and he was able to upgrade our room to a higher floor. We arrived at 11am so the higher floor room wasn't available, Michael took our cell number and called us when the room was available. The room on the 42nd floor had a great view of the Bellagio fountains. Would definitely stay at Caesars again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: jajd123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights during our overall 14 days in Las Vegas. We managed to get a good deal on a superior room prior to our departure so thought we'd give it a try. The reception area is huge and very busy, so we did have to wait quite a while to check in, the staff were also in no rush and spent too much time making small talk to guests which meant a longer wait. We were in the Palace Tower on the 18th floor with a view of the pools which was amazing. The room itself was ok, nothing special with a large bathroom which comprised of a jacuzzi bath, seperate shower and a double sink. The outside pool area was the best part of the hotel for us, we counted 7 pools and a very large jacuzzi, however not all the pools were open to all guests. But its huge and there was plenty of space for you to get some quiet relaxation and sun. As with all Casinos in Las Vegas, the one in Caesars Palace is huge and took us a while to get our bearings, however the towers are clearly signed so its a case of keeping your eyes open ! Overall, although we liked this hotel we would not stay here again as we have experienced far better in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DuraMater
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility, awesome shopping, cheesy 'Fall of Atlantis' show. Absinthe show in the big tent=awesome show!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: DebbieOWells
Reviews.Content: Deluxe room in the palace tower was perfect. Jacuzzi tub and everything you would expect in a deluxe room, huge living space. Very comfortable. Hotel staff were courteous and friendly. Vegas not quite as glamorous as you would image though as most people wear jeans throughout the day and night. We dressed up one night to see Donny and Marie at the Flamingo and were surrounded by old ladies in fleeces. Flamingo theatre is a dump alround! Food excellent in all eating places we visited - Serendipity 3 (onion rings and burgers), Munch ( Ruben wraps and Po boys), Margheritaville (Margheritas and taco mountains), Hard Rock cafe (beer and the view of the strip), Main Street Station hotel, (Thanksgiving dinner).

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: kate413
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week to celebrate my birthday and enoyed the resort, location and great restaurants and night clubs. Upon arrival I upgraded to a premium room in the Palace Tower - the room and tower looked a bit tired and is need of updates compared to the newer towers. The room was very spacious with two baths and double shower and jacuzzi. Bed was comfortable but pillows very uncomfortable. I had a view of the beautiful pool and grounds. Casino was nice and clean but a tad on the smoky side but I have seen much worse on the strip. The Forum Shops and restaurants were convenient to get to through the casino as were other resorts and casinos on the strip. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Caesar actually lives here.”
Reviews.Author: Slicer6
Reviews.Content: Well, My son bought his grandmother, my mom, a trip to Caesars for her birthday. We were there December 11th through the 15th. The hotel is absolutely amazing! Never been to a place with nicer people. The room was updated to the Palace tower and two queens. Not a big upgrade, but hey, your just sleeping right? There was a Kuerig coffee machine in our room.......not free! HINT... take some Kuerig coffee with you! If you don't, its $12.00 for 4 cups. I found that nothing in Vegas is complimentary. The buffet was very good, about $18.00 for breakfast. never made it for dinner. We bought the 24 hr. pass for $44.00 and i'll tell you, it was worth every penny. Had a great time and will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “What? No bathroom door?”
Reviews.Author: Worldcitizen
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds are great, but you don't need to stay there to see them. The rooms are very plain though: no coffee facilities, no fridge, though that may be the case in all Vegas hotels as I know they don't want you to stay in the room. The room is showing its age too and there was some mold in the tiles. I'm not that picky and thought that was fine, but not for the premium you pay for Caesar's. But what struck me the most was the fact there was bo bathroom door in a room with a king bed. Seriously? I don't know what most couples think about this, but do you really want to take care of business in front of your spouse? Also, I went in December, so didn't use the pool, but saw the pool area and it looks great, so I would consider staying there again when the pool is open.

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms as old as Caesar”
Reviews.Author: bts_going
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal of $89 bucks for Caesars Palace over the weekend. I assume it was one of the older rooms. Still decent and the the price i would go back. but I would not pay a lot more when you can stay at the Mirage for around $100. I must say the buffet was really a disappointment. horrible set up that creates long lines and So, So food with a long wait to get in. Go to the Mirage or spend the money and go to Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Stay at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBeachCitiesUSA
Reviews.Content: Our first time at Caesars Palace and we brought the dog with us. The Pet Stay rooms are on the 23rd floor of the Augustus Tower. The 23rd floor is actually the 3rd floor. The pet relief area is just outside the Augustus Tower valet entrance which is just steps from the elevators and a very quick walk and extremely convenient. A+ for this. VIP check in is also just a few steps from the Augustus Tower entrance and next to the elevators, also very convenient! On the other hand the Self Park Garage is on the other side of the property and it is a long walk, very inconvenient! The room itself was clean and spacious, the bed was a comfortable pillow top. The furniture, carpet and walls were all in very good condition. The bath had lots of marble, a whirlpool tub which did not work and a separate glass enclosed shower. We were pleased with the accommodations and will stay at Caesars again. We requested the pet goodies at VIP check and were told that house keeping would be sending them to the room. Two calls and two hours later still no bowls or treats so I cancelled the request. There is a mini bar with the usual over priced goodies, $4.00 for a can of soda? Please. We like to have food in the room and our rooms at our usual place, Rio, have always had refrigerators. But there was no refrigerator for our use in our Augustus Tower room. I did see a refrigerator out in the hall so I assumed that if requested a frige would be brought to the room. That was confirmed when we checked out, next time I'll ask for a frige but we'll bring our own water and food bowls for the dog. The casino was "tight", we paid for the comp room with our play. I noticed that recently here on Trip Advisor the buffet at Caesars has garnered some poor reviews, we didn't eat at the Lago Buffet at Caesars but we did have breakfast at Harrah's across the street and noted a decline in what was a favorite of ours in the past.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: mudd_stuffin
Reviews.Content: Checked in at the Caesar's Palace recently and was given a room in the Roman Tower. I must say the property is somewhat disappointing - room was older and they are still using tube TVs! But for $79/nt under the family and friends rate including a Saturday night, it was acceptable. Also, the check-in counter staff offered to upsell me a better room for $40/nt but I declined.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Experience”
Reviews.Author: marktodandtravel
Reviews.Content: The Vegas experience is excellently done from Caesar's. I do however have a few gripes to go along more accolades. Checkin - Not bad, but the service was barely passable. The entrance way is nice to look at, but on my walk to my room/elevator I was less then impressed with the quality of the hotel. Room - Stayed in the new towers. It was nice. We had 3 big screen TVs including two in the bathroom. I can't argue with a marble bathroom with two jacuzzis and two big screen tvs. Pools - Amazing. Food - Weak. Caesar's really needs a good buffet. Location - Can't get better. I had a good time at Caesar's Palace and would be willing to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ruined by one rude dealer.”
Reviews.Author: 2knowledgebank
Reviews.Content: I joined a $25 minimum Pai-gow table at the Palace Casino around 3 a.m. on 12/17/11. The older asian female dealer, I believe her name was Vicki, greeted me with a scowl. I should have left then but I wanted to play Pai-gow. She was very rude from the beginning to the very end. After I sat down, one of the players lost a few hands in a row. The dealer, several times, spoke to her in Chinese or Vietnamese and kept glancing at me which made me annoyed me very much. When a new player joined the table, he asked a question about the game, she was busy so I started to explain but was interrupted with a nasty, "He asked me, not you. I can handle this." I attempted to ignore her since I was getting along with the other players. She basically told me to keep my mouth shut and not to talk to her so I did not. When one of the players won a big hand, I told him, "----, nice hand." I was immediately scolded for swearing. I know profanity is unnecessary but I wasn't using it to degrade anyone or even talking to the dealer. I was congratulating the player. Anyways, I said, "Whatever." Then after about 15 minutes the player next to me won another big hand. I told him, "Shoot, nice hand," and we high-five'd. She immediately called the floor manager who came over and chastised me like a little school-boy. I tried to explain to him what had happened but he walked away. I know I don't gamble as much as some people do but I don't think I should be treated in that manner. I talked to the floor manager later and he explained that he has to take the word of his dealers which made sense to me since the boss should support his staff. However, the dealer had no excuse for being so rude. I am not a saint but I usually get along with most people. I normally have a great time in Vegas and have had people I played with the day before greet me by name when we run into each other. I have had my share of rude dealers, but she was by far the worse dealer and one of the rudest people I have ever met. Since I had had a few drinks, I thought it might have been my fault so I slept on it without filing a complaint right away. When I mentioned the story to another blackjack dealer the next day, I was asked, "Was her name Vicki?" which told me this was not her first incident. I told the story to two other dealers to see what they would say and her name was the first name they both guessed. I have never had any problems with any of the Caesar's staff or even any other casino's staff for that matter. I slept on in for two nights to get a more objective perspective. I am still fuming as I write this. She not only ruined this one trip but I don't think I'll ever stay at Caesars because of this. Out of all the Harrah's properties, my wife likes Caesars the best which is why we stayed there. I will probably stay at Bellagio or Aria next time. No one should be treated the way she treated me. I did not think I was going to file a complaint so I did not write her name down. I should have because like I said, it has been a couple of days and I am still very upset. This was really a surprise because I did not expect this type of treatment from dealer at Caesars. I should stop now because I feel like I can go on forever.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms ok by Vegas standards”
Reviews.Author: srwolffy
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location in Las Vegas. There is everything you need without leaving the building. The check in was timely and polite they even gave me a water while I waited. That was a nice touch. I have not stayed here before as they usually are on the high side for a room compared to other LV properties. This week they were within reason due to the Christmas holiday week. As far as the room it is very nice by normal hotel standards but as far as Las Vegas you can get a much nicer suite at other properties for a better price. But as I said you can't beat this location. Its the best in Vegas. For example...The Wynn, Encore, Pallazzio, Venetian and Vdara have a much nicer suite for the same or less money than a standard Ceasers Palace room. BTW...Vdara is the best kept secret in Las Vegas. Best suites and location for the money. My room at Ceasers... Very clean, nice, average, nothing special. The bed is too soft, aichy back every morning. The goose down pillows poke through and stick you every night. The sheets are ok. The bath towels (only three!) Are of motel six quality. The flat screen TV in the bath is nice but the one in the main room is tiny! Summery....as I said, great location but if you want a nice suite for a good price there are better places as I mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay on strip”
Reviews.Author: mcleana
Reviews.Content: stayed in premium room in palace tower facing pool. The room was very nice with big bathroom. the room had couch and desk with king size bed.we were on the 25th floor.The palace tower was very quiet,we have stayed at other hotels on the strip where we had trouble sleeping because of the noise in the hallways .would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: quayvt01
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. I'm very disappointed at this what they called four stars hotel. Nothing is working in the room. HEAT DOESN'T work, toilet keep getting stuck and they charge you internet access 14.99 per a device. Meaning $30 for two labtops.

Reviews.Title: “Very Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Monkey56
Reviews.Content: During our recent visit to Las Vegas my husband and I spent 4 nights at Caesars Palace and 3 nights at the Wynn Encore, since we wanted to break up our 7 night stay. We checked into Caesars on a Sunday afternoon and we did not get off to a good start. There was a huge check-in queue which we were expecting after reading all the other trip advisor reviews. However what we weren’t expecting was to receive an upgrade to the Centurion Tower since the Augustus and the Palace Tower which we were booked into were full due to a conference…we were checking in at 3pm, why was our room already given away? Regardless Adam at check in built up the upgrade so much we accepted the upgraded room. Unlike my husband I was very put off by the upgraded room (which apparently runs for an extra US$300.00 a night on top of what we were paying for a deluxe room!!!). Firstly you have to walk the whole casino floor to get to the lifts for the Centurion Tower; the Centurion Tower is a very old and tired tower, when you walk out of the lift onto the non-smoking floor it smelt of smoke. Don’t get me wrong the actual room was bigger than my house (it had a theater room, etc), but everything in the room was warn, out of date, loud to operate (air-conditioner & Spa) and there was no instructions on how to use anything (ie: the tv in the theater room). Needless to say I wanted out of this “upgraded” room. We went to reception and after 15 minutes of complaining, they finally agreed to move us the next day. The next day we moved into a room in the Augustus Tower. Absolutely gorgeous! The room & bathroom was huge, clean, well appointed, did not smell of smoke and you did not have to walk through the whole casino to get to your room. The location of the hotel was great it was right in the heart of the strip and you were quite easily able to go to a few different hotels for dinner or shows without too much of a hassle. Pool area was great, just a shame it took forever to get a drink! We ate in several restaurants; Rao’s being the worst (overpriced, appalling service, and very very average food!) and Noodle 9 (expensive but great menu and food) being the best. We also visited the bar near the reception area for drinks and breakfast and the service and choice was outstanding. Caesars Palace is a ridiculously big hotel, which is what we were looking to experience during our first 4 nights in Vegas. It is a very Vegas hotel. We would definitely recommend it particularly if you stay in the new towers.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay of my life”
Reviews.Author: vampslayer01
Reviews.Content: me and my partner had been having trouble with all our hotel rooms on our USA trip, and were very tired when we got to Carsars so when we arrived we were expecting the worse however nothing could be further from the truth, the staff were so friendly and we got our room compd and upgraded to one of the best rooms i have ever been in, it was clean, massive, luxurious and had a great view, the room had everything we needed an could have hoped for.....the hotel itself was massive and the pool was very nice, all the staff were friendly and helpful...thanks for giving us an unforgettable Vegas trip

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Jeff V
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here for a concert and it was my first time to Vegas. The service was horrible and I had to wait hours (after normal c/in time) for my room. Arrived at hotel early and checked in with the desk. Room not ready, stored bags and left the front desk agent my phone # to call when room is ready. Went back to front desk around 6pm and room still not ready. Somehow there was a broken light fixture that needed to be addressed before I could check-in. Asked to move rooms and after 15 minutes was able to get a different room. I waited in the room for my luggage for over 45 minutes. That got the wrong room number and then called me to say they lost it, but wait, we just found it. Major lack of resposibility for any associate. No compensation offered. I called after I returned home to speak to the MOD about my experience, a lady took down my info and said someone will follow up. Guess what? There was never any follow up. Much better options in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Suites”
Reviews.Author: RIchard G
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable beds and great location near most locations. Many cafes and shops. Nightclubs are great inside the hotel. The Forum Shops are very close. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: tash_nat_27
Reviews.Content: We ended up upgrading to the newer tower and were very happy we did. Had a pool facing room and enjoyed it great! Caesars is great because of its location. You can walk to the mall, or to Bellagio within 15 minutes. Central location so works well if you want to enjoy the entire strip.

Reviews.Title: “CAESARS PALACE IS THE PLACE TO STAY !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Juttie1923
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I recently stayed at Caesars Palace again , and once again we wer treated very nice. There was not a long line when we came in and check in went great. I had a great time the rooms is always Gorgeous, they are clean and I never had any problems. The first night we arrived I rested and went dowstairs to the Casino. I won $1800.00 in total while playing the slots. I tried the next day to go back to it and someone was always on it because that machine was a good machine to win off of., The slots in Caesars are up to date and not out dated games and for that reason is why we decided to stay there again. My Money was not stolen or my bags searched when I was out of the room. I love that place. I would definitely reccomend Caesars Palace for your vacation stay. The rooms are beautiful the bathroom was very pretty with double sinks and a separate toilet room with your own door to close. Loved it. Don't forget to always ask for your free Upgrade too. We stayed at the Planet HOllywood in September of 2010 and we got our Free Upgrade too. THey are one of Caesars Properties. That HOtel is also very nice and Pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay.......”
Reviews.Author: 864Terri63
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas in July. Our first trip to Vegas and we were there for a week long business convention. Our stay at Ceasars sat the bar high for any other trips we will make to Vegas. Everything was very clean and new in the suite that we stayed in. Any time we needed anything thing it was taken care of , never having to ask twice. We ate once at the Mesa Grille,and I was disapointed in the meal, considering the price we paid for the meal. We did have several meals served by Caesars(convention banquets) and the food was wonderful. One of the best part of Ceasars was the pools and the outside area of the hotel. It was just paradise......Can't say enough about that area. For our experience, Caesars was a wonderful place to stay, and we were there for seven days. By the end of the stay I wasn't really ready to leave. I would highly recommend Caesars Palace for your Vegas stay. Pricey but "Paradise".........

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with Caesars room and blackjack dealers”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from a 3 night stay in Caesars. I believe at the time of the booking it was listed as 4.5 or maybe even 5 stars. I am rather disappointed with the rooms since for the same $$$ I could have stayed in Aria or Cosmo. Both of which we have stayed in and the rooms are excellent. At the time of check-in we were offered to upgrade to the new tower for a price of $40 per night, I declined since I figure the rooms are probably just bigger. To my disappointment the rooms are old, small and their idea of 4.5 stars is a phone in the washroom...how outdated is that? The bad: 1. Rooms are outdated, as mentioned you can get a much better room in Aria or Cosmoplitan. 2. I find the dealers there very unprofessional. Perhaps because they have been there for a long time since they all seem to be older. I was quite offended when the dealer and the pit-boss are having a conversation when I am trying to play blackjack. Sorry but I am playing on a $50 per hand table and I expect full attention to card dealing and not mingling with your co-worker. Why would you pause to talk to your pitboss when I double down on a $50 hand?...do your job properly!!! 3. The buffet is not very good compare to say....Planet Hollywood or even Paris. The good: 1. On our last day we always go to the spa and massage since we no longer have the room and it makes it a relaxing day. The spa and massage were excellent, we only wish we went earlier and stayed longer. 2. Convenient location. Not going back there again, I will spend my money else where.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad”
Reviews.Author: Ana C
Reviews.Content: We got a good rato from web, where the hotel was adversities as one of the best in Las Vegas, but the reality is that is one of the worst. First they try to sell us an upgrade. Now, we understand why, the hotel is barely 3 stars hotel. My kids said that any Holiday Inn has better rooms, and we agree. Also, they adversities free breakfast, but again this was not true, they supposed to give 18 dollars for day per room for breakfast, but the buffet per person is about 20 dollars. His is a very poor hotel that advertise as a great one. Don't believe that ! I will never come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Lost its luster”
Reviews.Author: LBOskiBear
Reviews.Content: Caesars used to be a prime property on the Strip. Unfortunately, it has not aged well. Part of the problem is its older designs. This was originally a much smaller property so all the additions to expand the property have been shoehorned wherever they could find space. It ends up being a maze and has a bit of a feel of the Winchester Mystery House. I had a room in the "Centurion Tower" which was very tired and old. Rooms looked out onto rooms about 30 feet opposite from my room in an interior "courtyard". It was a discounted rate but for a similar rate, I could have had a new room in a new proper. One of the other ones it was apparent we were in an older property was the cigarette smell. Caesars has lower ceilings and doesn't have the stronger vents of the newer properties where the cigarette smell isn't as overwhelming. I doubt I will be choosing Caesars in the future when there are so many nicer, newer properties at a comparable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Tower - very average”
Reviews.Author: betsybo
Reviews.Content: We have almost always stayed at Flamingo. This time we splurged. In the Roman Tower our room was very much like the Flamingo - just OK. No HDTV or even flatscreen. No coffeemaker. Rroom was quiet and very convenient to casino and restaurants but very tired. restaurants are excellent. Casino is a bit strange. You would think this is a place for high-rollers, however, $10 tables were the norm. The layout is confusing and there is no good way to find out what is where. There are a lot better places to stay in Vegas and there is no reason to pay more to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get lost !”
Reviews.Author: NYtraveller1212
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. Stayed in a "tower" on a floor in the 50's, thinking I would get a view. The view was a parking lot. Location is perfect. Place is huge & very nice, but for the price, average.

Reviews.Title: “Forum shops help make the resort a wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ITravel286
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Las Vegas. Caesar's was beautiful. Our room was similar to a motel room, definitely not what we expected from Caesar's. We spent additional dollars upgrading to a tower room and were very disappointed in what room was assigned to us.

Reviews.Title: “casesar really does have it all”
Reviews.Author: ScottKolb
Reviews.Content: Was in Vegas for 10 days (bit too many for the liver) for a work and personal trip. Caesars is masssive but even in its size I found it very friendly and in line with all the other old Harrahs properties. Great restaurants, even better location and rooms are nice. Qua Spa is still the best I have eve used

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping inside of a nicotine patch”
Reviews.Author: K&SRanch
Reviews.Content: I've been staying in hotels for 35 years and the room I had last night (3914) wins the "worst smelling room ever" award. It smelled like someone had lit a truck-load of cigarettes on fire in the room for the last five years and then coated every available nook and cranny with tar and nicotine. It was so bad you could smell the room the minute you stepped off the elevator and onto the hall. I had asked for a King non smoking room. When I checked in the desk clerk said they didn't have anymore (really? in all of Caesars?) but I could either take a twin or take this smoking room. Which she reassured me they had aired out with an ozinator and I wouldn't be able to tell the difference. They truly ought to give tours of this room. If you're in Las Vegas and are trying to quit smoking be sure to drop by Caesars Palace, Centurion Tower room 3914. It's like sleeping inside of a nicotine patch.

Reviews.Title: “Can't really complain since my room was comped”
Reviews.Author: affluent_traveler
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers there is no WOW factor within this property compared to bellagio,Wynn... My room was comped and we had a Palace deluxe room which looks exactly like the Augustus Tower rooms. It is a big room with a huge marble tiled bathroom with a soaking jacuzzi tub for two. I still like the rooms in the Augustus tower better then any rms located in the Palace tower. If I had to pay for the room,I would not stay at this property but next door where I use to stay,Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: DeDeRN04
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Caesar's. I've been to Vegas 3 times now and have always wanted to stay here. We were offered a great rate that we couldn't pass up. We were there celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. Overall we were disappointed with our stay. We stayed in the Centurion tower. The room decor is very old and tired along with the TV, however the bathroom was very large and beautiful. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. We were mostly disappointed in the lack of internet/wi-fi, which costs 14.95-24.95 per day. Or you have the option to go to the Munch Bar and buy something in the afternoon and you can get wi-fi. We would hike down to Planet Hollywood and sit in Starbucks to have breakfast and get free internet. The buffet was much better at Planet Hollywood also. Overall, I would probably not return to Caesar's Palace, but would instead stay at Planet Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “caesars palace outstanding property”
Reviews.Author: hank1172
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars for 3 nites in the palace tower right by the pools. The room was spotless bed was great view from room was the whole pool area, which was unbeliveable always got a chair but i did not like all the rental chairs surronding the pool they wre always empty, i guess people do not want to spend money to lay down this was the only thing i did not like.Everything esle about the hotel was first class ,my new favorite hotel in vegas .

Reviews.Title: “Whirlwind”
Reviews.Author: sasknordicskier
Reviews.Content: Had a whirlwind weekend September long weekend. Pool was excellent. Even a homeless guy appeared to enjoy it but he was quietly and quickly removed. We stayed in Augustus tower. Rooms were large and clean. My only beef is they made us walk around the whole casino and couldn't use the 5 star or whatever they call it pool entrance at the foot of the Augustus tower. It was a bit annoying. I actually had one of the staff member follow me almost into the pool to make me go around to the other entrance. Hardly a big deal but whatever. Most of the staff didn't seem to care if you used this pool entance. Like Caesar central location and the forum shops.

Reviews.Title: “This was an Incredible Experience”
Reviews.Author: drleon6
Reviews.Content: Vegas Itself is quite a fascinating adventure , but Caesar's Palace just takes it to a whole different Level , Not enough words to describe how amazing this was , and very well educated employees , the Buffet was something to Highlight, I will be back :D

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ManitobaLass
Reviews.Content: For my first time in Vegas, this hotel was such a treat. I've never seen so much marble and our room was so clean and spacious with an excellent view. We walked through all the hotels and I'm glad we ended up in this one. The Bellagio looked comparable to Caesar's and I definitely would stay away from the older hotels that appear to have done no upgrades in decades (like the dumpy Imperial Palace). I loved the French pastry place in the hotel. Would definitely stay again! Note: This hotel is central on the strip so a perfect location. We also were in one of the 'new' towers.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of possible wrong accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Olga S
Reviews.Content: We came to the hotel with prelimenary reservation of two Palace Tower Premium Rooms done through the hotel web-site. Instead we were accommodated in Deluxe Rooms or may be it was even Standard Rooms. We've recognized that only when we entered the rooms. We were forced to come back to the reception, where nervous lady told that she DIDN'T KNOW what exactly rooms we've reserved (although she knew total price we shoud pay and managed to accommodate us in cheaper rooms for the same price as Premium ones!). After 24 hours on the way we were "very glad" to spend one more hour in the hotel to demand correct rooms we originally reserved. And finally, when we got keys for our new rooms this lady told that she is not sure that we'll get requested pool view - that is for what we paid extra money! And it was the second time in this hotel when they tried to accommodate us in wrong rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Jacalope
Reviews.Content: November 20 - 25th 2011 room on the 11th floor of the Palace Tower - good view of the pools. On check-in we asked Tucker if it was possible to upgrade the tower we were in. He told us our group had paid for the Forum Tower (the least expensive) when we had infact paid for Palace. He didn't tell the truth and let me tip him for upgrading to the tower we had paid for. Other than the high cost of coffee (in the room and at the market place) it is our only complaint. The deluxe room is very large. King bed with sofa, desk and chair. Lovely bathroom - double soaker jet tub and large shower. Double sinks. I enjoyed the hotel and casino - great location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Much Nicer Places To Stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Hotelwanderer
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a trip to this hotel and there are much nicer places to stay than here. The hotel is very tired and the furnishings in our room were either damaged or engrained with dirt. In comparison to other hotels e.g Bellagio, Venetian, Mandalay Bay etc this hotel is the poor relation. Also there is smoking everywhere in the gaming areas which just makes it not a nice place to be and also has a cigarette aroma engrained in it. Additionally, I would not eat in the hotel. We tried the buffet one day and it was very poor - its like sitting in a work canteen and the staff are rude.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ganative
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of November on a totally free stay with my Total Rewards points. The room in the palace tower was nice and clean. Pros: Clean, and free stay. Really good restaurants, Raos and Mesa Grill. Cons: Huge property. Nothing is convenient as far as walking to get a cup of coffee in the morning. The inroom coffee was the little Keurig cups which you could make, a 4 pack for $12. I just couldn't bring myself to do that so I walked a mile each day for a cup of coffee. If money is no object, stay at Caesar's.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Tower Classic room was lovely.”
Reviews.Author: mbmommy
Reviews.Content: We booked our first trip to Vegas at Caesars Palace because that's where my husband was attending a conference. Got a great rate online because we were traveling at a slow time of year. Booked a Classic room in the Roman Tower and I was a bit concerned about the reviews here, but our room was fine. We arrived on a Sunday at 2:30 pm and could check into a room on a low floor then or wait a couple hours for a room on the top floor. We opted to wait and were pleased with the view of the room we were given which overlooked the pool area. Our room was large with a king bed, whirlpool tub and separate shower and toilet. The room was clean, the linens were in great shape and the decor was fine. Yes, it's an older room and the furniture has the odd ding in it, but the carpet was good and the wallpaper was solidly on the walls :) There was no closet, but there was an armoire in the room with two separate areas to hang clothes. The hotel itself is just as large as I imagined. Lots to do there and in the attached Forum Shops. Great location at the centre of the Strip. I was able to walk everywhere. Would have been nice to have a coffee maker in the room. That's my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Tower”
Reviews.Author: Mini_the_Minx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in October and found the hotel to be pretty average. We were an hour early checking in and could have had a 2 double bedded room but chose to wait until our requested king-size room was ready. Reception was a completely disorganised affair with no proper queueing system in place. Our room was on the 13th floor of the Roman Tower (thank goodness we're not superstitious!) and was nice, but tired looking with great views of the pool area. There was no wardrobe in the room, just a rail behind the bathroom door. Having previously stayed in the Bellagio and the Palazzo I think I may have been spoiled by the friendliness and service of the staff there. Caesers felt completely impersonal. My husband went down to Payard's Patisserie one morning to get breakfast to bring back to the room - 2 coffees and 2 yoghurt parfaits - $28! Horrendously overpriced - the same breakfast was less than half that at Earl of Sandwich in Planet Hollywood. I can understand why first timers to LV find this hotel impressive but would not choose to stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: luckygirl8596
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to stay at caesars as this was my first visit to Vegas. My first impression was great as it is a nice looking hotel. After spending three days there I will never stay again. The staff was very rude and when we got locked out of our room as both of our key cards did not work they blamed it on us saying we had improperly stored our key cards. This was incorrect and I was appalled that I would be treated as such by an employee. Our room was not cleaned we had spilled something in the bathroom and the spill was still there after the maid came. It appeared that all she did was make the beds. All interactions with employees were rude and ungracious. The only person that treated us like valued customers was the bellhop. I can not believe that a hotel would treat their guests this bad and think they would return. I for one will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: ahill03
Reviews.Content: Went to Caesar's during Thanksgiving. We were treated rudely by the front desk. Told us they had no idea when our room would be ready, then proceeded to put my son on a separate floor from the rest of the family. They did fix it, but the rooms were really old and outdated. We were in the Roman tower and I am sure there are newer rooms but they said they would have to charge us more to be in the newer rooms. Our view faced another building and it seemed dark all the time. The remote on our TV was broken and they took forever to fix it. The other thing I noticed is the minute I walked into the lobby, the smoke was unbearable. I went to several of the other large hotels and it was not as prevalent. With so many other options, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property and rooms with some customer service issues”
Reviews.Author: 1WorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on business. Nice place. Big, Spacious. Updated. Rooms are nice too. I stayed at the Palace Tower. At first, when I walked into my room it was a smoking room. Called front desk and they said they couldn't do anything about it and there were no other rooms available. When I complained because I had requested a non-smoking room in my reservation, they offered an air purifier in my room, but I would need to leave the room for one hour. This was unacceptable! So they suggested (over the phone) I come down to the front desk to discuss options. So I left the room and walked all the way back to the registration check-in desk with my luggage. I got a new non-smoking room and walked all the way back again. There was no "Sorry for the inconvenience. We can have your bag delivered to your room. We have upgraded your room. Here is a voucher for a meal at our restaurants". How about free wi-fi? Nothing. I paid $14.99 per day for Internet access in my room. Beds are not that great. They probably need an upgrade for their beds. But overall good place, customer focus needs to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel except classic rooms”
Reviews.Author: chiragk k
Reviews.Content: Booked the caesars classic room through some promotion on their website and got a great price. I would say everything about this room is great but the classic rooms. They are really really basic rooms and you would not feel like staying in caesars. I don't mind as its vegas and u hardly stay in your room but then could have picked any other hotel in this price. Everything else in hotel including their pools, casino, new roulette tables is great. Gym/Fitness center costs some 25 bucks a day, just in case.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in town!”
Reviews.Author: rachelbaby83
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the staff were so friendly & helpful, the room (standard room) was fabulous and it was cleaned daily with fresh towels, toiletries etc. The food in the restaurants were of a high standard & the hotel was maintained to a high standard. The staff on the poker/roulette/black jack tables were more than happy to guide us through the games as we were first times and whilst you are playing the waitresses bring you free drinks. All in all we had the most fantastic time and we will be definitely going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: 1GirlWolfPack
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. Once again, Caesars is first class. This time we had a Palace Tower room that was not as large or luxurious as the Augustus Tower rooms we have enjoyed for our past two stays. The Palace Tower was more than okay with us though, with a large marble bathroom with tub and glassed-in shower and great pool view. We really appreciated that one heated pool (the Venus pool) was open during our late November stay. Where we are from it was fine weather (high 60's) for swimming! Be prepared to do A LOT of walking, it is just a huge property. If you intend to use self parking (which we did) you would be much better off in the Forum Tower rather than Palace or Augustus.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace Forum Tower room”
Reviews.Author: gmkinhawaii
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars Palace over the Veterans Day weekend (4 nights). Booked the room several months early and got a good room rate. My room was on floor 58 with a west facing view (over the parking structure). I chose to keep my reservation in the Forum Tower due to location; I was offered an upgrade to a Palace Tower room, but declined. Long story short, I like my room and enjoyed my stay at Casears Palace. The room is smaller than a Ballys North Tower Deluxe room, but has nicer features. The point of staying in the Forum Tower is location. If your preference is for a nicer room, upgrade to Palace, Augustus or (after January 2012) Octavius Towers. I suspect the Forum Tower is all about its location within Caesars Palace. For the single travel, a smaller room is not an issue; this may not be the case for a couple or group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “No wow factor”
Reviews.Author: sweetdejavu
Reviews.Content: One thing for sure, my phone had the worst reception ever. I couldn't even connect using my 2g, yet alone 4g, I had to turn on wi-fii also, and that was even still slow. It was horrible. I had reception staying at other casinos. I booked the Forum Tower after reading all the great review, but upon getting there, I was so disappointed by the size of the room. T.V stations sucks, because there's not even HBO, or any movie channels at all. I've always been fascinated by the beauty of Caesar's Palace and it's high image it held, but the Forum Tower room I got was a big disappointment. The only that was cool was the tv in the bathroom mirror, but even that still sucked a bit, because no channels really work except for their 702 channel showcasing their las vegas hotels. Also, it had such horrible reception because the channels were full of statics and was so unclear. The bathroom was very clean though, I will give the bathroom a 5+ because it has double shower head and is super clean. The room decor was mediocre, and I hated that the closet was in the bathroom, but loved that the toilet was separated in its own next room to the bathroom sink and shower. I will say their customer service was superb and is 5+. Everyone was very friendly and nice, and helpful. They were so helpful in switching rooms for me from a one bed to a two bed. But the hotel was clean, fresh, and nice. I didn't feel disgusted using anything. Anything snacks or drinks you touch or just pick up have sensors in them and will charge to your room if it's out of place for more than 30 or 60 seconds. But if you just looked at it, and put it back and you get charged to your room, just call front desk and they will help you.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded Room In Augustus Tower”
Reviews.Author: DuaneT
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving at Caesars Palace as part of a promotion package. We were very pleased that we got upgraded to a room in the Augustus Tower. The room was large with a view facing North on the 38th floor. We had stayed at Caesars on several occasions over the past 16 years and even stayed in a suite, but this room was quiet with a jacuzzi so we didn't miss the suite that had big elevated round bed with mirrors on the ceiling. We also were given extra amenities and welcome gifts (chocolates and nuts). We went to the buffet as well as the food court. But this time we also tried the Beijing Noodle Company and found the food selections very tasty with great portions. The Hotel is going to add another wing in 2012 so they haven't stopped building and improving.

Reviews.Title: “Too generous a star rating”
Reviews.Author: Jayne_WM
Reviews.Content: 9th trip to Vegas, stayed in 12 different hotels from 3 to 5 star. Considering Caesar's is billed as a 4 1/2 star it is NOT! Nowhere near the standard of the Wynn, Venetian, Bellagio, Aria - just about matched NY NY for the room. Good location but i'll stay elsewhere next visit. Staff not particularly friendly either - run of the mill. Fell below my expectations. We did stay in the Roman Tower, which is the oldest one but a few scatter cushions and a counter payne wouldn't go amiss and cost little just to improve the room slightly.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ash756
Reviews.Content: Whilst we didn't have a strip view, the room itself was beautiful and very spacious (Palace Tower). Yes, Caesars is large, but we didn't have any difficulty getting around, and its size adds to its magnificence.

Reviews.Title: “Huge iconic property that lives up to its name”
Reviews.Author: vnsb
Reviews.Content: Booked the Caesar's Palace Hotel as we were going to watch a Rod Stewart concert at the same hotel and felt that it would be convenient and were certainly not disappointed at all. The reception upgraded us from the Forum Tower to the Augustus tower at no charge and no tip but just because we asked and the room was very very nice. Large with a view of the fountains at the Bellagio. The bathroom had a shower and a jacuzzi and twin sinks - very nice. Did not touch the mini bar or the coffee maker as had read previous reviews. Breakfast was okay at the food court which was a fair walk but was fine for us. Hotel is well located on the strip and has a lot going on inside so there is always a good buzz

Reviews.Title: “out of this world”
Reviews.Author: DianeBolton
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be one of the best in the world. you could spend a full day in the casino/shopping complex and still not see everything - it would take a few weeks to experience everything and a lot of money. The Pool area was closed when we were there but it still looked fantastic. Bought some Ugg boots as my feet got absolutely worn out with all the walking round. We won in the casino so that was a bonus, food and drinks very nice and you dont mind paying a bit more for the surroundings. Fountains and Atlantis display fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....But”
Reviews.Author: 2togo45
Reviews.Content: We had a Palace 9th. floor room. Good view of mountains but over the parking lot. The room was large, clean and comfortable. Bathroom with jacuzzi, double sinks was great. Casino and restaurants offered lots of variety. Only complaint was that they seemed to nickle and dime you to death. The internet was $15 per day (Comfort Inns are free), coffee machine in room was $12, toll free calls were $1.50. Seems inconsistant with 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Fun Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: harrylaw
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about , stayed the weekend 18th to 21st November , everything was perfect from check in to check out . We did the $20 trick at check in....with a $50 ( if you don't know about this , google it , its a must !!) & were upgraded from a classic room to a premium room with a great view of the pools on the 24th floor, walk through shower , oversize tub , bidet .......awesome !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DaniAlves7
Reviews.Content: This was my girlfriend and I's first visit to Las Vegas and we booked 10 days here. An unreal experience and a place which has to be seen to be belived! On our arrival to Vegas we were taken by a limo which i had booked from Mccurran Airport to Caesars Palace which was a nice start. On arrival at Caesars we were greeted by a baggage carrier who took our bags into the hotel for us. Check in was quick and we were located in the Forum Tower on floor 67 of 69 looking out onto the strip which was a great view. The room was spaceous, modern and extremly well cleaned on a daily basis by the cleaners. The bathroom was very nice and clean. The hotel is huge and constantly busy and every member of staff is very good with you. This hotel is located right in the heart of the Las Vegas strip which was perfect. The strip in general is huge and I would say it takes a good 10 minutes to walk from hotel to hotel but there are always plenty of taxis available outside the hotel lobby which to be fair we didnt really use we just did a lot of walking. There is so much choice of food and shops within Caesars, the Forum shops at Ceasars are fantastic. I could go on all day at how much there is to do within this hotel never mind the rest of Las Vegas!! but I would go back to this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone who is thinking of going to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “I Heart Caesars”
Reviews.Author: TumbleWeed4
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Caesars Palace on our 4th trip to Vegas. We stayed in the Forum tower which was easy to get to from the casino floor. We had a view of the Coloseum. Our room was clean and spacious, the bed and pillows were super comfy. The bathroom had a nice big shower with 2 shower heads (no tub) and a tv in the mirror. I loved the mid strip location as well as the easy access to the Forum Shops to get my shopping fix & for more dining options. Payard's was perfect for our morning coffee and had sinfully delicious pastry. Joe's Stone Crab & The Cheesecake Factory in the Forum Shops were excellent. We loved the whole property & will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace is a Classic”
Reviews.Author: PAF
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Caesars, definitely won’t be the last. The service is top notch, from the time we checked in to check out. We were in Vegas for the week celebrating my wife’s birthday. On previous visits we had stayed at the Palazzo and enjoyed it; but it isn’t in the middle of the strip, like Caesars Palace. We checked in and requested a room overlooking the Bellagio fountains; best views are from the south side of the Augustus Tower. We checked our bags, did a pre check in and walked around the Forum shops while our room was being cleaned. After about 2 hours we checked back at the front desk, but our room wasn’t ready, so we took another room (petite suite) room 3096. These rooms are located on the corners of the tower and are slightly larger. The room overlooked the pools and had windows on two sides of the room. Great room, but at 6:00 am the next morning construction started between the Augustus Tower and the new Octavius Tower. All we heard was the beeping of the truck backing up every 2 minutes; to say the least we were furious. I went down immediately to the front desk to complain. Management apologized, comped the room and set us up a new room on the 31st floor, overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Caesars Palace is a top notch resort with everything you would need for a fantastic vacation. Request a room in the Augustus or the soon to open Octavius Towers; these are the newer rooms with great views of the strip and the Bellagio fountains.

Reviews.Title: “Could be great”
Reviews.Author: travlife
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at about 6:30 pm we were told there were no non smoking rooms. We had requested a nonsmoking room when we made our reservation. The clerk said these were requests not guarantees . If you have been in a Vegas hotell room you know that a lot of the guests smoke. We found this response totally unacceptable. We also had dinner plans at 7:30 & needed to change. So after much searching the clerk just walked away. Another employee came over,found us a room. She called it a suite . I would say just a large room with a nice bath . Our window faced a wall. Obviously why it was available . There were no non smoking signs in the hallways or in the room. I definitely smelled smoke in the hallways . Thankfully not in the room. The room decor was attractive and the bathroom had a whirlpool,shower,two sinks and a TV. I thought the hotel common areas were attractive and well maintained. Caesar's is very large and there are many towers. Takes a day or two to get your bearings. We've stayed in many of the Vegas hotels and enjoyed our stay at Caesar's. Most of the other hotels have security at night to access the guest elevators . This was lacking at Caesar's. Just to address the other review about the pool closing at 5 pm This is the norm for all the Vegas hotels we've used . I find it annoying ,assume it is a liability issue.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Majong
Reviews.Content: We had 5 comped nights which we were really shocked about. Got to hotel Sun. around 2pm. Walked right up to reception and were assigned a great room. Not a good view but who goes to sit in the room and look outside anyways. Room was huge, 2 TV's (one in bathroom mirror) and 3 phones. Comfy king size bed! Everyone we came in contact with in the hotel was very friendly. Didn't eat just at Caesars but we ate at mostly Caesars properties. If they are going to comp your room, then you should patronize their properties. Would stay here again! We were just learning our way around when it was time to go home!

Reviews.Title: “Stinky room”
Reviews.Author: carrie h
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times, but this was my first time staying at Caesars. I was so looking forward to a grand room. I was very disappointed. We asked for non smoking room. Which they told us that is what we got. But it smelled of old stale smoke and something else, not to sure what it was. Broken bathroom mirror. A very large ugly couch stuck in the middle of the room. We could write our names in dust on the TV. There was three of us sharing the room but they only gave us towels for two plus two drinking glasses. We are sure mold was growing on the wall paper just outside of the shower. Just a old room, no sparkles of any kind. Will stay some place else next trip down.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic property, disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: stealthnc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when my company had our National Sales Meeting here. I was really looking forward to staying at this property given its iconic name and impressive shopping and casino infrastructure. I must say that in the end I was disappointed with the experience. My room was in poor shape, and brought to mind the words "protracted neglect". A carpet that was stained and threadbare near the transition to the bathroom, marks and holes in the walls, a TV in the bathroom with a poor picture, a dated bathroom, and other little things that were unbecoming of the Caesar's Palace brand. I also found the service to be average at best. Example: when I called down to the Bell Desk to provide my luggage tag info to get my bag sent to the room, I got put on indefinite hold and had to call the operator to try to patch me through. Also, I had a flashing message light on my phone but when I tried to receive the message, I never got through to anyone or any message (undetected system issue?). I don't have any issue with the casino, Forum Shops, nightclubs, or other aspects of the property. However, I would stay here again only if I got a phenomenal room rate, otherwise I'd look at other options. I understand the casino owners not wanting guests to spend much time in the room, but as a business traveler there is a minimum standard of room quality that I will accept.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room in the Augustus tower”
Reviews.Author: DEW5245
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars for a work conference and got put on the opposite side of the hotel from the conference center in the Augustus tower. At first I was bummed at the long woke but after I got to my room I forgot all about the long walk. The room was huge, at least twice the size of a normal hotel room. The bathroom was also very nice with a glass shower and a separate Jacuzzi tub, double sinks and a separate room for the toilet. The room also had a couch, two person table and a chase lounge as well as a very large window. Caesars is a huge property which I normally try to avoid but given how nice this room was I may be tempted to stay here if the price was right for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Still one of the best”
Reviews.Author: TexasTrecker
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a work meeting and was delighted with the accomodations. The property is huge and we had to walk long ways to and from the conference center area. This place can certainly accommodate large companies as I work for one of the world's largest global companies. I'm not much of a gambler, so can't comment on that. The property like all looks to have been recently updated to keep with the times. Our company rented out the Pure nightclub for us one evening and I can only imagine this place on a weekend. Very upscale and nice with a decent view of the strip from the roof level. The only eye soar for me was the Serendipity which obscures the property and seems out of place. Check out the Forum shops for some window shopping. All in all a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “just as i knew it would be,another fantastic stay at caesars palace”
Reviews.Author: a1copyguy
Reviews.Content: my wife and i have started to pass on our summer junkets to atlantic city and have been lucky enough to fly to vegas instaed twice a year. caesars palace may as well be considered our 2nd home by now. I will have to admit i am biased since my stay is always fully comped as far as the room,and since we enjoy playing alot and have an excellant host so has pretty much everything we have eaten or had to drink as far as adult beverages.. we always stay in the augustuce tower, we love its location,furnishings,large bathroom and friendlt staff when using the diamond check in. arrival is always fun since we like to use the c e t limo service and arrive in style haha, just makes you feel like a winer from the start. cost is only around $70 ,charged to your room(dont forget to tip your driver) its pretty much a no frills ride,but just the same we are hooked. to many ,caesars palace may seem too big,but once you adjust to what direction to use, you soon know how to navigate thru its 2 named casinos,forum and palace. we are not big foodies so we mostly enjoy using the 24 hour buffet deal. in the past if there was a weak link to caesars it was their buffet but on this last trip we found they added a few more italian dishes which was nice. at night it can get loud, but if you stay closer to the forum shops area of the casino it gets a bit less noisey. i have tread many posters complain about the staff but i cant disagree more. from smiling housekeeping staff, to very fast cocktail service and some of the best slot attendants on the casino floor i really dont know what its going to take to make us even consider staying anywhere other than caesars palace while in vegas. I know my review may not offer too many details but i am a regular poster on the trip adviser forum and would be more than happy to answer any specific questions i can about the prperty on there if you want,feel free to send me a message . ps if it shows how much we enjoy sttaying there,let me just add this trip over hallowen weekend was the 4th straight stay at caesars palace without even considering staying anywhere else.. but i wont argue with you if huge resorts bother you because it is huge. wife fell in love with the friendly staff at the pandora shop inside the forum shopps as well

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed but still had a good time”
Reviews.Author: Saraht83_11
Reviews.Content: My expectations were high when i booked for Caesars Palace, especially considering how much we paid! We stayed for 2 nights on our way to the Cook Islands to get married. First impressions of the hotel were great. Clean, professional and very big! Our room was lovely too. The hotel itself was fantastic although it is hard getting used to people smoking again! My parents were also staying at the hotel and they experienced noice from the people next door, there was an adjoining door so the noise was magnified by that. The 2nd night was terrible, they only got 2 hours sleep and we had an 11 hour flight to get on. We were also up for several hours during the night due to the same couple as we were unfortunate to be on the other side from them! They were shouting and swearing, throwing things, slamming doors. I rang security twice and still no one showed up for about 1 hour. People were out in the corridor including my parent complaining about the noise and eventually security turned up.
