We wanted to keep our room on for an extra few hours as we weren't leaving until 4pm to go to the airport but we were told that it was going to be $380!!! We complained at reception about the noise and explained that my parents had only had 2 hours sleep and we shouldn't have to pay $380 to get the sleep we were derprived of last night. They insisted they couldn't do that. We were eventually offered $50 to spend in the hotel on food!! JOKE! She kept going to see the manager, the manager never came to see us. We finally got offered the room for an extra few hours (after initially telling us there were none available) BUT we could not have the food voucher as well... shocking customer service. If i went back to Vegas I wouldn't stay there agin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Food and Fun”
Reviews.Author: BenfromBoston
Reviews.Content: Went to Caesars for a conference. Was not my first time, but this was probably the best experience. The room, in the Augustus Tower, was well appointed, flawlessly clean and very well maintained. I ended up getting breakfast several times and was amazed at how fast the food came and the quality. I did use the fitness center and spa, which are both very nice. The equipment in the gym are all from the same vendor and are not the best out there, but worked just fine. There is a significant fee for the gym and spa, but I think this works to keep out people who shouldn't be there. All of the technology worked great and I felt totally comfortable at this hotel. Now, next time I will try to lose less money at blackjack.

Reviews.Title: “YOU GOTTA STAY AT CAESARS PALACE”
Reviews.Author: sivled
Reviews.Content: We just returned from five nights in Las Vegas where for the first time we stayed at Caesars on the strip. We had the stay comped by Total Rewards but that was just for a standard room. As we checked in I told the girl behind the desk we were in Vegas celeberating our 44th anniversary and we decided to stat at Caesars. I then asked her if there were any free upgrades for those five nights. Now after a few minutes of checking she said that al of the upgrades for that day were filled but if we spent the night in the standard room she could upgrade us to a very nice room for the rest of our stay. We did and they did keep their promise. We love Caesars and are telling all of our friends who are going to Las Vegas to give them a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good Full Service Hotel”
Reviews.Author: curlergirl
Reviews.Content: Was at the hotel for a conference November 7 - 13th. We started out for the conference in a Palace Tower Deluxe room. This room was really nice and large with a beautiful bathroom and a jacuzzie tub. Our view however was terrible as we looked out to the parking garage. Our room was on the 9th floor. Didn't mind too much about the view as we were hardly in the room. The Palace tower was nice and close to the Conference area of the hotel. My last 3 nights I moved rooms into a Classic Room in the Roman Tower. I must admit that I was nervous about this change after reading reviews on line. I was pleasantly surprised. Yes it was not a nice as the Palace room, and the decor was dated, but the room was large, clean and we had a view of the strip. Again we didn't spend much time in the room. This time we were on the 13th floor. The Beijing Noodle 9 restaurant was very good. Not a big fan of the Payard Patisserie & Bistro (small sandwiches big prices). Central restaurant was good. The conference facility is very large and oddly laid out. It took us about 10 minutes from the entry to the conference area to get to our seminar location. This included up escalators, down and around a hall, up some stairs, then down another escalator and then down and around another hall. Would have been nice to have free coffee in our rooms. The coffee in the conference area was terrible, very weak. Overall it was a nice hotel and we feel we received good value for our money. This is a very large hotel and it was only after 5 days that I began to feel I knew where I was going. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good”
Reviews.Author: JeanPierreCork
Reviews.Content: First Visit to Las Vegas, a magical experience that everyone must do, but do your research. Caesars is a centre strip location, our room was modern, clean & comfortable. Hotel facilities were good but can be abit expensive. A show is a must. Like other review, the only negative that we had was $100 dollar note was taken out of a pair of jeans which was in our luggage while the room was being cleaned and the response from the staff when we reported it was extremely rude so do be cautious. They do provide room safes, so do use them as if you don't you have no comeback even if you do have a do not disturb sign on the door. Other that this though, a good experience. There are many superb restaurants & bars but don't be bullied into leaving an enormous large tip either when eating out unless its deserved. Our highlight of our trip was a helicopter trip into the gran canyon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Way to Celebrate a Milestone Birthday!!”
Reviews.Author: Magentis
Reviews.Content: Bought my husband a 4-day trip to Las Vegas as a birthday gift in Sep 2011. Having never been to LV before there were many choices when it came to hotels. For me, when I think of LV I think of Caesars Palace. Boy we weren't disappointed. The hotel is amazing! The staff was so helpful and friendly. We were given an upgraded room without even asking. There is so much to choose from when it comes to food and entertainment. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to those who are planning their first trip to LV. Caesars won't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Classic luxury in vegas”
Reviews.Author: Colesjr
Reviews.Content: Cool propriety and tons of beautiful statues and waterfalls. Check in and out smooth. Stayed in pAlace tower and I think I rather stay in forum tower. Closer to casino and tv in the mirror of the other room. Enjoyed Caesars but expect to walk some distances....great casino

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and room”
Reviews.Author: bluidechik
Reviews.Content: Most hotels in Vegas, you have to walk so far to the elevators then to your room. This hotel has easy access to the elevators, not a long walk to the rooms, and easy short distance to the street. Love the location and hotel. Bathroom is very large and nice. Seperate shower which is excellent. Jacuzzi tub and lots of mirrors and space. Excellent time to visit is halloween if you like crazy fun.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bluide26
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other hotels in Las Vegas, but this is the best hotel so far. Easy access to the elevators which take you to your room. Not a long walk as most hotels. Easy access and short walk to street from elevators. Very elegant and connected to other hotels and sky walks. Rooms are very nice. Stayed in the Roman tower which is the older one but very nice. the bathroom is excellent. large mirrors, great shower, and jacuzzi tub. Went for halloween 2011. Excellent time to go to Vegas if you like crazy fun.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by not getting room we booked!”
Reviews.Author: simone211
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 1.30pm to check in for 3 nights in the Augustus tower. We specifically booked this room nearly 1 yr ago to ensure we have a view of the fountain show at the Balagio. We are told that a room in that tower is not ready yet and someone will call when our room is ready. We leave the hotel returning at 4pm (check in time) thinking the room is ready. It is still not and are not called until 6pm. We get our keys to our room in the Roman tower and ask why this is as we are booked in to the Augustus tower. The guy informs us that there are no rooms in the tower and they have upgraded us to a suite, we are very pissed off that we had to wait so long only to be told we can not get into the room we had book - they obviously double/over book. We get to the suite and it is massive and is not suitable for us, the tower is older and dated. We visit the Augustus tower a few days later and can tell from the door frames that it is newer and nicer. The smell of cigarette smoke throughout the hotel is horrible and should not be allowed. Staff were somewhat helpful but you seem to be just a number to them. The hotel is the best location on the strip. Food is very average and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “"Disappointing Palace from start to finish"”
Reviews.Author: Globe58Trotter
Reviews.Content: Our Golf Trip coordinator booked us into this Hotel as part of our package. The problems began at check-in, we were tired after a seven hour journey from Boston and the lline at check-in was huge at midnight. We saw one clerk leave even though the line was almost to the door leaving only two people for the crowd. When we finally got to the desk 35 minutes later they did not have our reservation and said that they were full. The request for a manager had us wait another ten minutes. The manager found our reservation and we finally got to our rooms after 1 am. This Palace is dated and shows some pretty significant wear and tear. The rooms are drab and colorless with few working amenities. Stained carpets, non-functional remote control, overpowering room deodorizer odor and little place for two adults to put luggage etc. As part of our package we had the breakfast buffet which was lackluster on a par with Denny's. The casino was so understaffed we had trouble finding an open roulette table on Saturday night. This hotel is ready for demo and a new one in its place. I would find somewhere else to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's (not so) Palace”
Reviews.Author: GatorPrincess
Reviews.Content: Arrived at midnight (3 AM East Coast time) for a 4 night stay for a conference on property. Booking was made several months ago via conference reservations. Upon check in, we were told our conference rate king room was not available - even though it was on a credit card guarantee! They then told us all they had left was a room with 2 beds at a lesser rate and we could move to what we reserved " if one became available" tomorrow. Tired and disappointed with the inconvenience, we hiked to our Fourm tower room (which on their web site look decievingly nice). The room was totally unacceptable - Motel 6 at best: low, worn out beds, tired decor, view of a parking garage. We called the front desk to be relocated and were told they were full and there was nothing else available. It was not until we returned to the front desk and spoke to a supervisor that we were given an only slightly better sub-standard room and a $50 dining credit. The following day we were given a "Jr Suite" in the Palace tower which was very nice: a large comfortable contemporary room with 2 bathrooms. The rest of the stay was more enjoyable. The conference rooms and catering were done well. The dining venues on property were all good. Only other complaint was the inability to get away from the Vegas commotion after being indoors in the conference all day. The entire pool area closed @ 5 PM each day. We were even discouraged from sitting on the outside steps leading to the pool area by a security guard. On the last day when we could get outside before 5, all guests were corraled into just 1 of the many pool areas, with all the rest off limits. Would have expected a much higher level of hospitality and accessibility from such a renowned property. Got the overall feeling they were more focused on stock answers and liability than hospitality. Unless there for a conference again, will stay elsewhere in future.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I was on expense report”
Reviews.Author: jongable
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at Caesars Palace, but I never had because the room rates were always higher than other hotels I equally wanted to stay at. While the common areas at Caesars are very nice looking, I was disappointed in my room. Unlike newer hotels Caesars has numerous towers they have built over the years. My room had a view looking at another tower. It also showed its age. I enjoyed my recent stays at Bellagio and Aria for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's - a timeless classic hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Holidays013
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a premium suite in the Palace Tower - absolutely beautiful room with two showers, two toilets, two vanity rooms and a jacuzzi bath. Bed was a delight to sleep in, huge in size with high quality bedding to snuggle into. ' Mini ' bar was biggest we have ever seen in a hotel room and very well stocked ! Carpets and decoration in suite were really plush. Watched Rod Stewart in the Colisseum theatre and was extremely impressed with the seating, stage and the whole ambience not to mention the man himself who was awesome ! We had watched The Eagles at MGM Grand Garden Arena the previous evening but Caesar's theatre was of a much higher standard with much more class. The Forum Shops within the hotel are a must if you want to spend some of your winnings ! So many lovely dining options there too, we ate at Spagos which was very enjoyable. We saw Evander Holyfield just strolling through the casino on his own and asked him if we could take a photograph and he said yes ! Still can't quite believe it really but have the evidence in a frame back home now. The staff at Caesar's on the reception desk were extremely customer caring and we dealt with a couple of them. So polite, welcoming and happily took time to discuss everything you wanted to know. Very obliging in meeting our requests e.g. allowed to check in at 10.00 am instead of waiting until 3 pm (normal check in time). All in all, a classy hotel with every amenity on site which makes it hard to leave the place to go elsewhere ! We were very happy indeed with our stay and can't praise the staff enough, loved it and will definitely go back !! You shouldn't worry about booking this hotel, go for it !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: twinkle63
Reviews.Content: When you first drive up to the Hotel first impression WOW. Inside WOW staff on reception very pleasant. Were shown to our rooms WOW we had a view of the pool area. Everything about the hotel was fab would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with convenience of a shopping mall”
Reviews.Author: bharris123
Reviews.Content: When choosing a place to stay in Las Vegas, don't overlook Caesars Palace. The hotel rooms are beautifully done and are very clean and modern. The staff is very helpful and efficient. The added bonus of having numerous restaurants from which to choose conveniently located in the same building is great. Las Vegas can be crowded and hard to navigate with all the traffic. Besides the shopping is terrific. If you can't find it at the Form Shops, you truly do not need it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: rodgersfamily
Reviews.Content: We traveled here November 5th to 10th. Bring a coat, because it's quite cold in Vegas at this time of the year. When we were checking in (which took all of about 10 minutes) I passed the clerk $20 and asked if there was a "complimentary upgrade" she could choose for us. I'd read on trip advisor to do this. I'm not certain if it worked, as we'd never stayed there before to have a room to compare ours with, but we were certainly pleased with our room. My only complaint about Caesars palace was trying to get a drink!! There was clearly not enough waitresses out on the floor. We've traveled enough to know to start their tip high, and calm it down somewhat after that, but that still didn't work. We were very disappointed with how rarely they'd come around to offer a drink. We were even charged $4.00 one evening for 2 little bottles of water, as we were going back to our room. This is after spending several hundreds of dollars gambling, with only 2 drinks each....then to be charged for water was quite frustrating. I put a call into the "Drinks Manager" when we returned to our room, but didn't get a call back. But, don't let that throw you off this place. Caesars palace is absolutely gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “A vacation of decadence!!”
Reviews.Author: PhotoWendy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night stay in Caesars Palace. It was amazing. The rooms were large, the beds comfortable, bathrooms HUGE! I loved the Kureg (sp?) coffee maker in the rooms as well. While there I ate at the buffet, it was amazing. And spent an entire day in the spa. It was heaven! The only downside was it is SO large we had a difficult finding our way out a few times. :) I was finally finding my way around (a bit) when it was time to go. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: le_fino
Reviews.Content: I only stayed two nights here for a conference with high hopes but was disappointed. The wifi is particularly horrendous. The rooms all overlook alleys or other towers. Mine was large but had no network, mediocre TV, aging wall paper and uncomfortable pillows. I guess I was expecting far more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: netcrazy
Reviews.Content: The location is simply the best. You've the best of the best hotels in the walking distance. This saved a lot of time for us. Venetian, Bellagio, TI are all in walking distance. The room service and cleanliness was high quality. Using online websites and some coupons, I could get a very low price for the room and since I was flexible with my dates, the overall hotel expense came out to be not too high.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace”
Reviews.Author: chefriendy
Reviews.Content: We booked 1 night at the Caesar's Palace last sunday. We payed 289 for an upgraded room with a jet tub. We were very disappointed in the quality of the room. The bed seemed old the carpet was very old. We called the front desk to get another room. We were switched into 3 other rooms. All of these were dirty! I was finally able to speak to a manager who put us into a king suite. It was a huge upgrade but still one of the lamps in the master bed room was not working. We will never stay at the Caesar's Palace again. We checked out the next day and checked into the Vdara. What a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: rick h
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip through Marlin travel and Ceasars is the first time we have been dissapointed in a Las Vagas hotel. When we checked in, we asked about an upgrade, (the $20. trick) and were told there was nothing else available. We were given a room in the Roman tower and it was a dump! There is no better way to describe it. It was small, dingy, the shower was crumbling and the shower door looked like it was ready to fall off, the wall paper in the bathroom was peeling off, the sink was cracked and every piece of furnature was so battered it looked like it should have been replaced 10 years ago. Even the television was an old 25" tube-type unit. We stayed at Balleys last year and got a nicer room with a better view for half the money. 5-star hotel? What a bad joke! We went down the second day and ended up paying another $56. per night to get one of there "premium" rooms in the Augustas tower. It might have been on par with the Mirage, but compared to the room we had last time at the Palazzo, which is a true 5-star hotel, it was still far below what we expected. All of the people raving about how grand this place is must be used to staying at Super-8, because this place is not worth the hype or the money. Lastly, this is the onley "high end" hotel I have been in that had no security near the elevators at night, and two nights in a row, I had two different, and skanky, hookers get on the elevators with me and ask me if I "wanted so company". Go somewhere else! You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to classify because the hotel is so large”
Reviews.Author: TahoeScout
Reviews.Content: Caesars is one of oldest of the hotels on Las Vegas Boulevard and the "central core" of the casino dates back to its beginnings. Think "Classic Hotel" The various towers are different ages, with the oldest towers in locations closest to the casino, the Palace Tower close to the pool, but furthest from any parking access, Augustus with the best access to Vatet parking, the spa and check-in, but quite far from the casino and dining (save the one generic coffee shop). You get the idea. The newer hotels have addressed some of these issues in the original design (especially Venetian/Palazzo), with parking elevators next to hotel towers, but the present day Caesers was not even imagined when the original hotel opened years ago. Over the past several years and perhaps 20 stays, we have had amazing visits (New Year's Eve 2010-2011 and the parties hosted by the casino/Total Rewards rate a 10+) and some not so great. We have experienced a couple of extraordinary difficult check-ins, as reported by other reviewers, had our booked tower changed upon arrival, and have had to request new bath linens because he ones wer got were old and near threadbare. It is a big hotel that does a basically good job most of the time. As any frequent visitor to Las Vegas can tell you, there are some tricks to navigating large Las Vegas hotels, and once you master them, it is hard to switch hotels and loyalties and start over. As a casino player (and we have hotel comps at the very least at some of the top properties---Wynn, Venetian, etc.) I can say that the hosts are great and the Total Rewards comp system takes out most of the guess work and the old process of "negotiting the hotel bill at the end" is a thing of the past at the Harrahs hotels. In sum, I feel there is validity to the "across the board" reviews that Caesars receives. However, we come back over and over because most of the time we have a great stay and love Rao's and (Bobby Flay's) Mesa Grill as well as the special events. But when things have gone wrong, we have had experiences similar to those noted by other reveiwers: long waits to get into rooms, some rudeness, tired furnishings, distance to exits and parking, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Smells like someone's basement”
Reviews.Author: michele030
Reviews.Content: The first thing you notice when you walk into the lobby of Caesars is the smell of cigarette smoke and stale beer. I know smoking is allowed everywhere in Vegas but it doesn't smell like this in Bellagio so they must have a better air filter system. We've stayed in Caesars before because my husband has a conference there every year. The rooms range from absolutely horrible, broken down, shabby to absolutely beautiful. So some of it is luck of the draw. But even in the nice rooms you are expected to pay $12 just to brew coffee in your room! I have never been to a hotel that charges you for the in room coffee maker. As you can tell I am not a fan of Caesars, it's too big and feels like it needs a renovation. We got in at 3:00 PM, check in is 4:00, but they made us wait until 5:30 to get into our room. The pool isn't bad but it's way too crowded for the little guy that doesn't want to pay a lot of money for a cabana or more expensive cushioned chair. The chairs are crammed together so you don't have any room on either side and have to climb in from the foot of the chair. The one bright spot of staying there is the Spa. It is absolutely beautiful and I had one of the best massages I have ever had. I highly recommend Misty as an "artisan" as they call them, she was great. I do not recommend this hotel, if you have a choice stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice ...well maybe”
Reviews.Author: CancunPair
Reviews.Content: We went to this resort on the notion that our rooms would be very nice like the Caesars in WIndsor Canada. WOW...we were surprised. There is an old wing...what a dump. We were finally moved after a Diamond member friend of ours (we are platinum) complained. The new room was awesome. Later in the week I talked to the Casino host and they said that wing was going to be totally gutted and turned into another "japenese" style casino... None-the-less... gheez. The rest of the place is very nice. Very expensive too, but that's to be expected. We like table games but wow was our luck bad... check out the pu$$ycat doll table game pit... very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Choose your room wisely!”
Reviews.Author: LolovesZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars Palace for a work conference Nov 7-9, 2011. In Las Vegas, you can pretty much expect the same thing of the casinos - the rooms, however, are so varying. For example, on the website of Caesar's you'll notice the "cheap" rooms are in the Roman Tower (and another Tower too, I believe) and unless you are totally okay with dated rooms, don't stay in these rooms. First of all, the floor my co-worker and I stayed on was a ghost town.... almost literally. Totally eerie, never saw another soul on our floor, very old and beat up - what a strange experience. Nothing bad per say, but had I been on vacation and spent my own money on this hotel I would have been pretty upset. Our company saves money where we can and in this case, it meant staying in the cheap rooms. I suppose it was clean enough but the closet was located in the bathroom (?) and there were no extra blankets, pillows, etc. Everything seemed tired and old - the walls were dinged up like crazy. Again, not bad but just odd. The convention center was nice - bathrooms located very close to the convention hall, everything was clean and huge. One thing to be aware of that it is a HIKE from the rooms so wear comfortable shoes, or at least be okay with the fact that your feet will be killing you after a few trips back and forth to your room. The food served in the ball room was decent, nothing more special than your average hotel banquet. We ate at Mesa Grill, Bobby Flay's new restaurant - check out my review for that! It was delicious but a bit overpriced. Overall, I'm not sure how different Caesar's is from all of the other casinos but know what you're paying for!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: OhioBob2
Reviews.Content: I was there on 11-2-11 for an ESOP Conference and was really disappointed with the room, service and condition of Caesars. When we checked in there were no available rooms so they took my cell phone number and said they would call when a room was ready! At 4:00 PM and having waited several hours with no call, I went to the registration and saw they were checking in quests so I inquired about my room. I got the story that my room was still not cleaned which I said was unexceptable! After waiting another 20 minutes they found a dumpy room in the Forum Tower! Never again at Caesars!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Vegas”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaGoSooners
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Caesars and had a nice room with a fantastic view. We looked out on the Bellagio fountains from our room in the Augustus tower. It was spacious and nicely decorated, the temperature was easy to adjust, and the service was good. The mattress was less than perfect was my only complaint. The bathroom is nice with a very comfortable spa tub and separate shower. My only complaint about bathroom would be it needs more storage space and maybe a vanity with a chair. The casino seemed smokier than some of the newer upscale hotels. The sports book was extremely smoky and crowded on a big college football day. Almost all of the tables are reserved, so get there early if you don't have a reservation. We didn't and my husband went and got a table at 7:30 am. The restaurants that we eat in at Caesars were all pretty good, nothing exceptional. Rao's had a nice atmosphere and our dishes were pretty good. The drink service at the tables and slots, as well as the sports book, was good. We saw the new show at Caesars, Absinthe, and thought it was funny, (R rated.) The Forum shops are convenient and offer a variety of shops from H & M to Versace. The new Qua spa is beautiful and well worth a visit. My massage was very good and the facility is fantastic. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very old rooms...”
Reviews.Author: GZMOA
Reviews.Content: I do not like the hotel despite being that famous. The standard rooms are very old with no view. If you want to stay at this hotel try other rooms not the standard ones. I do not like the pool area as well. The ceiling of the gampling place is very low and stifling. There are other newly build hotels around which should be prefered. The most advantages part of the hotel is famous PURE CLUB for the night life - You dont have to pay for the cover charge. additionally there are nice restaurants as well like Rao's. Nobu-the famous japanese restaurant - will also be opened in the hotel soon. The location of the hoptel is also a big advantage as being just in the middle of the strip...

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: joannec75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in mid September, from start to finish this hotel was amazing, that staff were helpful, efficiant and very polite, pleasant & happy. At check in we asked about the chance of a complimentary upgrade & we got one, the room was HUGE, beautiful & spotless. The hotel is massive, we only found our way to the pool on the last day!! I would recommend Caesars to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Tom M
Reviews.Content: We rented a two bedroom suite to entertain family members attending a wedding. The room was a big disappointment. Service was poor... several requests had to be made to get a coffee maker and a light bulb, among other problems. it took three tries to get a functional coffee maker and we never got that darn light bulb! We never used the jacuzzi tub, but we woke up one morning to find black sludge in the tub which was brought up through the drain. We had to fix the toilet in the master bedroom three times ourselves... it kept running and running. The last night of our stay we woke up to find an area of the bedroom and a bathroom closet rug wet and some of our clothes wet as well. We called maintenance three times... the response by the maintenance staff was week. At first we thought the problem was caused by the toilet, but we discovered ourselves that water was dripping from the closet ceiling and ruining the walls, floors and furniture... no one seemed to care. The smell of the water was terrible, making most of the suite stink and us sneeze. Housekeeping took some clothes that had a terrible smell from the dripping water and we never saw them again and no one could locate those clothes when we checked out. No one we spoke to seemed to care and no one offered to move us to another room. My family crammed into the other bedroom for our last night and I slept on the couch. The room was poorly cleaned as well. In 10 trips to Las Vegas I had never seen such a poorly run hotel operation. When a person rents a standard room, they don't expect much in the way of service, except for a clean room. However when a person rents a suite for 5 nights, one expects a higher level of service and quality. What we experience in our stay was pathetic and unnecessary. I had stayed at Caesar's Palace in the past, but I won't ever again.

Reviews.Title: “C'mon Caesar - You can do better!”
Reviews.Author: rachel717
Reviews.Content: We stay at Caesar's normally when we go to Vegas. This time, we were surprised with the level of service. We got to the hotel at 7pm Vegas time and our room was "not ready". I was encouraged to upgrade, for a fee of $100 per night. I noticed the reservation clerk waited awhile while he was tapping keys on the computer. He was waiting on a personal tip to place us in a room, I suppose. When we declined, he said come back in an hour. We checked the bags with the Bellman and walked across the street for dinner. We did get a room in a hour, in the dreaded Roman Tower. We walked a LONG way from the elevator to a sub-standard room for a hotel like Caesar's. Our luggage had been sent to the basement per the Bellman so we sat and waited on it. This was on a Tuesday night, and the hotel was not that crowded. It was clear the methods and procedures have changed there. I have always loved Caesar's and sent many Vegas visitors there. Now, I have to rethink my loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “A good time had by all”
Reviews.Author: marknic63
Reviews.Content: We had an upgraded room, large enough for a football team, with an amazing view of the Garden of the Gods and the Vegas sky line. The bathroom was huge! Where do we start? This is an amazing hotel, absolutely stunning. The staff we met were courteous and very helpful. Well worth the price we paid. There was plenty of choice for dining in the hotel, whether you wanted a full meal or just a snack, but be prepared to pay hotel prices. Excellent pool and shopping. Will definitely stay again on our return visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower”
Reviews.Author: UsedtoliveinLV
Reviews.Content: Room was beautiful but a very nice Escada black shawl/wrap went missing from our room thursday after housekeeping was done. Lost and found was contacted and simply said: "sorry, not here." Additionally, the same day we noticed charges from the minifridge on our bill that were not ours and the housekeeper left her dirty rubber gloves lying beside the bed. All of this was reported to the front desk. NO Response other than Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: formykids135
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Caesar's with a convention for an industry group, but we were really going for romance. We called the night before to make reservations at Rao's Restaurant (separate review) and later found out the reservations representative relayed to the front desk that it was our anniversary. We arrived at about 1pm on a Friday, prepared to wait for check in until after 3. It took maybe 15 minutes to get to the desk, and the hotel staff seemed to be very concerned with moving the line quickly. Got to the desk, told them we would wait for a room if necessary since we were in business "block" of rooms. The clerk commented it was our anniversary, made some calls and put us on the 36th floor of the Augustus Tower. Sweet!! (We did tip him AFTER he did that, not before). We were there for 5 days, got wonderful service like that every day! The room was very modern and spacious. It was incredibly relaxing and romantic, LOVED the pool areas and the heated pool. It is about in the middle of the strip, and we love to walk and people watch, so it was perfect location for us. The only possible complaint I can give is that the pool closes at 5pm and we would have liked to stay a little later, but I understand -- they want you to go get dressed and be ready to spend. It's OK Caesar's, we love you anyway

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: flying-olive
Reviews.Content: We got comped at Caesar's for 3 out of the 4 nigths of our trip. Based on reviews, I was a little unsettled when they booked us in the Roman tower. Contrary to other reviews, we were quite satisfied with Room 777. Although it was right next to the storage room, we were seldom disturbed by noise. It was clean & well maintained (not much of a view though). It was also located pretty much in the middle of everything, which was a plus. We frequent Las Vegas and stayed at 10 other hotels and Caesar's ranks well above average (love the Venetian). The Casino is clean with a variety of gaming and restaurants. The location on the strip is perfect. The pool area was awesome!. All in all, we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “So much to see and do!”
Reviews.Author: JeannieChiliBeanie
Reviews.Content: Caesars is the perfect blend of elegance and fun. You do not need to leave the property to experience so much of Vegas. The forum shops are a great mix of retail and fine restaurants. The casino has a nice old school elegant vibe. Rooms lovely. We happened to catch a show at the colloseum while there--great venue and we were lucky to see the Americas got talent live show and were thrilled to see the Silhouettes in person!

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lorilee86
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews about the roman tower rooms was considering upgrading but glad i didnt the room was perfect unfortunately our room was one of those with no bathroom door! believe me sounds worse then it is and the rest of room more then makes up for this!we had a large bath,shower, two sinks, small tv, an infra red light to make the room nice and warm! and the bedroom was very spacious. On arriving my lock jammed on the suitcase and housekeeping sent someone up in less then ten mins and fixed the prob straight away. The casino wasnt as smokey as ppl make it out to be, Minium bets on most tables is $15 in other hotels/casinos you will get as low as $5 bets.Drinking in hotel is expensive $7 bottle beer $10 vodka $18 draught beer! cheaper to play slots or tables and get the hostess to look after you! Ideal location within walking distance of everything but be warned places are not as close as they look!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Palace”
Reviews.Author: GA_Travel_Lover2008
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas so I can't compare to other resorts but in my opinion, Caesars Palace was first class. I stayed in the Roman Tower (the oldest tower but has been renovated) and it was beautiful. The bathroom was done in marble and glass and was very spacious with a jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The room was large with a king size bed and a couch and table. The bed was so comfortable that I hated leaving it! The casino was very large as was the forum (shops). There were many restaurants to choose from as well as bars/clubs, etc. Check-in went smoothly and the staff was very pleasant. All in all, I would definitely return here and would recommend this resort to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC FANTASTIC FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: vegasbaby22
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone, I stayed here with my mum in august, we were in the palace tower, which has direct access to the pool, which is at the bottom of the lift, so no trecking through the casino/shops in your pool gear. The palace tower is the only tower located on or close to the pool. I asked upon checkin if there were any rooms with 2 bathrooms available as i was there with my mum, the girl on the desk said she would see what she could do, but there would be a wait as check in was not till around 4pm and this was around 2pm, so to keep checking with reception. So that was fine, we rang the front desk to see if our room was ready from many free hotel phones around every half hour, when they said it was ready we picked up our swipe key and went up. The room was on the 14th floor, overlooking the amazing pool complex. The room did have 2 bathrooms, perfect. That night we went down to thank the receptionist who checked us in but she must of left, so we couldn't tip her. But just shows all you need to do is be polite and ask if there are any upgrades available. :) The room was spotless, with replenished bathroom products. Also had bathrobes-i was there for 2 weeks and asked for a new robe after about the 10th day via hotel note paper left on top of the dirty robe in the bathroom, the new one i got was ripped write across the chest!, I didnt think this was very professional or appropriate, and would of easy been noticed by the maid. The room had a large flatscreen tv, and minibar DO NOT EVEN THINK ABOUT TOUCHING IT!, DONT EVEN BREATH ON IT YOU WILL BE CHARGED! The only negative about the room was that the air con pumped out cigarette smoke, which you breathed in all night, not good for an asthma sufferer, i left with a bad cough, so it wasnt on much. I had a fridge at an extra charge which was outside the room when we arrived, after the 2nd day the fridge still wasnt cold, it was replaced the next day. The hotel is spotless with around a dozen shops, very expensive though, and not particually my cup of tea, for example cigar shops and watch shops. The forum shops through the casino where much better you could spend a whole day in there. The pool was exceptional, however what i did found was that when guests left they would leave there towels-lazy arses and they would be there all day, so new guests would not know if they were available or not. We always found a space around the venus pool which is a quiet rectangle pool in the corner, as we had a pool view we could see where the spaces were. You could never get a space around the 2 main pools, which were full with people but mostly reserved towels by 10am. These 2 pools were very noisy with music, so i wouldnt of gone there anyway. The venus pool was in the shade by 3.30-4pm that is why not many people went there, but we go up then anyway to that was perfect for us. The first time we went down the pool we ordered 2 slushes, which are like strawberry ice drinks for those who dont no, i think americans call them mr freeze, anyway 2 (non alcholic ones) cost $24!, in walgreens there less than $2 each. Needless to say we didnt bother again and had to smuggle in our own drinks as no food/drinks from the outside world is not allowed, even though there is a little shop just before the entrance to the pool, very odd. Saw Terry Fator, fantastic, CSI the experience and David Spade who had 90% of the same material from when we saw him 2 years ago! Only had one buffet tea in the hotel it was the most expensive one we went to and had the least variety very few dishes. All i had was rice, spring rolls and bread which cost around $25!, no plain ice cream for desert, very disappointing large queue waited bout 30min to get in, but the place was empty. We paid £1300 each for a 2 week stay in the palace tower, with included separate Thomas cook flights (premium)and booking hotel separate, the hotel company has now gone bust though and im not surprised though as the price was unbeatable. BEST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN, ALWAYS CHECK FOR ROOM/TOWER TYPE BEFORE TAKING THE REVIEW INTO CONSIDERATION, THE CLASSIC IS BASIC, AND I WOULD NEVER STAY THERE, CHECK CAESERS OWN WEBSITE FOR ROOM TYPES. Questions welcome Stayed in the Palace Tower I dont no how to download photos onto here sorry

Reviews.Title: “Very cool!!!”
Reviews.Author: styli6726
Reviews.Content: The room was crazy, we had a room with a hot tub in the living room. The mirror on the ceiling was a nice touch as well. Huge hotel with a great mall.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, terrible rooms, terrible value.”
Reviews.Author: daddytoocool
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Roman tower back in July 2011 for 1 week. Firstly from parking our car in the car park to the hotel reception, theres about a 20 min walk as you have to come the whole way through the casino with your luggage in tow. When you get to the reception, you then have another rediclous wait to get seen. Our room was in the Roman tower, when hearing this the receptionist tried to get us to upgrade, we didn't understand why until we seen the room. Speaking as someone who spent the summer staying in hostels, the room is BASIC. Everything is ancient in the room, its like staying in a hotel room from the 50's. Oh, and if your like me and you've read reviews and thought basic is usually good enough, well let me know how you feel about a hotel cutting back on things such as a bathroom door. Yep, you have no bathroom door, awkward as hell. Tried to get a room with a toilet or bathroom door, but to no avail as i refused to pay the upgrade price for the door, which is frankly ridiculous. Save your money and stay in a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “$5 here,$15 there soon its real money”
Reviews.Author: ljgok
Reviews.Content: First let me say the service and people are fine, the room generously sized but in need of structural maintainence (the prehung door frames in bath were rusted through) but the "no resort fee" mantra of Harrah's Resorts leads to a cost at every turn. In room internet $15, $25 if you want whole hotel access, that of course is per day and per device used so if you had a laptop and an iPad is $30 a day. 4 K cups for the in room coffee --$12, bottle of water at the coffee shop near the elevator $7.50 and on and on.Pool area most beautiful in LAS. Wouldn't stay here again unless I had too.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome pools, blahh rooms”
Reviews.Author: YDWestcoast_fan
Reviews.Content: The room in the Palace Tower was disappointing. I was expecting to be floored like I was at the Palazzo/Venetian. This ain't the Palazzo. Room was only slightly larger than any other holiday Inn type hotel. Tub was filthy. Toilet door was chipped in several places. Beds were comfy, however. NO free Internet! I could still smell smoke on our Non smoking floor. Service was good, front staff and concierge were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected! BEAUTIFUL...the gawdy is gone!”
Reviews.Author: SMUMOM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the newly renovated Caesar's palace and truly had an enjoyable experience. The hotel has been beautifully renovated and the gauche decor of Caesar's past has been replaced with classic details and upscale touches. Our room was in the Augustus tower and was a nicely decorated, well -appointed suite. The hotel spa was FABULOUS and the pool area was serene and beautiful. The lobby and common areas of the hotel are gorgeous and look brand new....it's just too bad they still allow smoking in the hotel :( The CENTRAL bar/restaurant made the BEST drinks and the food was excellent. I was a little dissapointed in the other hotel restaurants...RAU, and Bejing 9 (loved the decor in the restaurant) were just so,so and very pricey. Overall it was a GREAT weekend...next time we are in Vegas, I will be staying at Caesars again. We saw Jersey Boys (a must see!) at the Palazzo...I thought the inside of Caesar's was even nicer than the newer Palazzo. You'd never know Caesar's has been on the strip for over 40 years!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: Mayhem72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently attended a conference at Caesar's Palace and stayed in the Palace Towers. While the Palace Tower rooms were reviewed as 'older' on this site, we were perfectly pleased. Large, comfortable King Size bed, couldn't have been closer to the pool, jacuzzi tub and separate shower, large double sink vanity... ample closet space. No complaints there. The pools were amazing. Water temperature was great. Sadly, only the Apollo pool gets any sun in the morning so we spent most of our time there. Be sure to get there early to get your spot. Although at this time of year it might not be an issue! The restaurants in Casears were very good. The Bejing noodle house was delicious, as was Max Brenner's in the "Forum Shops" section. Mesa (Bobby Flay's restaurant) is WORTH the wait. Amazing. Go for lunch and get an easy reservation. We also really enjoyed Bradley Ogden. Skip Rao's... very salty and disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Opulence without gaudiness”
Reviews.Author: FoodEpicure
Reviews.Content: Many have called Caesars Palace the classic Las Vegas venue. That term doesn't do this wonderland justice. I'm sure the issues of slow check-in have merit, but once you're in - Wow. The casino is endless, the restaurants go from Michelin stars (Guy Savoy) to upscale buffets. Some reviewers say that it's a long hike to get from one destination to the next. But that's because there is just so much to do here. Swim in the lavish pools and huge jaccuzzis, get a ridiculously decadent massage at Qua, see a show, gamble, shop in a gazillion stores at the Forum shops. Everything is clean, lavish, and at the same time, understated -- seems like an oxymoron when speaking about such an enormous resort, in Vegas; but check it out. I think you'll agree.

Reviews.Title: “Way too expensive for a "5 Star" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janet H
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had planned my mother's 60th Birthday Family gathering for a 1 1/2 years and decided to take her to Vegas and decided to stay in a luxurious hotel. Caesars Palace is what we decided on and also due to the fact it is centrally located. We've stayed at MGM, Luxor, Mandalay Bay & Flamingo and staying at Caesars was a huge, huge disappointment. We had a connecting room with 2 double beds, no dressor, no coffee machine, no ice bucket, no full length mirror in the room, no magnifying mirror for makeup in the bathroom, no extra blanket in the closet, the TV's were grainy, wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling, the rugs were pulling away from under the baseboards, no mini bar or fridge...should I continue... This was our mother's first time in Vegas and the experience was not great. My daughter said she perferred the Flamingo...that says something. We wanted this to be very special gethering for our mom/grandma and the hotel was not as it advertises itself.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite trip to Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: RacingGirl71
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Las Vegas since 1992 and this last trip was probably about my 20th visit, so I know the town pretty well. I received a great deal through my Players Club status for a Forum Tower room and I booked it immediately as I've dreamed of staying in a room near the Forum Shops since I was 21 years old! Kevin at the front desk was FABULOUS and gave my husband and I a room on the top floor and all the way in the corner. I did not see another guest in three nights and did not hear a sound from anyone either. The room was not large but extremely plush and had a great view of The Mirage and Venetian, etc. I loved the TV in the bathroom because I would put the music channel on that they pipe through the elevators and casino as I was getting ready and heard songs from the 70s & 80s to the current day which gave me lots of good memories. I won some money in the casino and we relaxed by the pool for couple of days. My only complaints are the food in the food court was insanely expensive and not worth the price (at least not at the Mexican place) and the coffee I ordered at the breakfast cafe was so hot it burned my tongue which hurt for days. Otherwise I thought the staff at Caesars was wonderful and I really enjoyed the atmosphere there, My husband and I now have a new favorite hotel in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Caesar might have stabbed himself waiting in line to check-in”
Reviews.Author: legalgal80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars last weekend for a conference. I must say that my review is biased by our initial experience checking in, in which it took us SIX (6) HOURS to check-in. That’s right! When we went to the lobby to check in, we got on a long line, about 20 minutes into waiting on that line, a hotel employee came up to us and the people behind us and told us we had to move to another line since we were on the wrong line. So she moved us to the end of an even longer line. When she left, we moved back to that initial line, since it turns out we were on the right line after all. After another half an hour of waiting, we finally made it to the front counter and were told that our hotel room was being prepared and would be ready in an hour and to come back then. We then went onto a different line to check our luggage so that we could get something to eat. After an hour we went back on line to get our luggage and then went on another long line to get our room key. We were told that our room wasn’t ready yet and they would call us when it was. They didn’t call us for another four more hours after that. In the meantime, my husband had to get ready for his conference and there was no where he could change and they don’t have courtesy rooms, so we had to DRAG all our luggage to the pool restroom. When we finally checked-in and questioned the front desk as to what took so long, we didn’t even get a simple apology. Our room was in the Palace Towers (which is supposed to be one of the nicer towers). I would say our room was just average, although we had a nice big bathroom (almost the size of our room) with a jacuzzi tub. Our view was of a big parking lot and our television was broken. We called up maintenance workers twice, who advised us, it wasn’t even a television but a computer screen with a chip in it and that the chip had died. Talk about CHEAP! What kind of a hotel doesn’t even have real tvs?!? Several people we met who stayed in the Roman Towers said it was very dated, and I can’t imagine what those rooms looked like if our rooms were just okay. Another complaint about this hotel is that it is so large and the signage was very poor so it was very easy to get lost. In terms of food, we ate at three locations at the hotel: 1) a French pastry restaurant which was quite good, 2) a Japanese restaurant (which was not that great), and 3) serendipity (which had a very LARGE and good breakfast but make sure you get there before 11 a.m. or they will stop selling the breakfast menu). The day we went to the pool, it wasn’t warm enough to go in, but it looked nice. The casino at this hotel was the least impressive of all the casinos we visited while in Vegas since it had very low ceilings (making it feel claustrophobic). The best thing this hotel had going for it, was the location in the middle of the strip. If I had a choice of places to stay in Vegas, I would have picked the Venetian hotel, which was much more charming.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much Hype!”
Reviews.Author: qmask
Reviews.Content: This place is way overrated! The check-in wait took way too long and there were no staff people to help speed the process while we waited. The pools are nice but unless you are staying in the Palace Tower ( not for long as it soon will become Nobu) you've got a long hike through hallways and casinos. Although the room was "Deluxe" there was clanking in the walls during the entire stay. A serviceman was sent up but couldn't do anything about it. The hotel did take a little off the total bill though. The pools are attractive but there is no food service. If you are hot or thirsty, you're in trouble..there are no water fountains or coolers..just overpriced drinks. With so many hotels to choose from I suggest having fun somewhere else and get more for your money!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room but other issues”
Reviews.Author: lx8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a conference and were given a room in the Augustus tower, which was huge and beautiful. The only problem was the long walk to the conference facilities and the massiveness of those facilities themselves. The layout of the place is extremely (intentionally) confusing. If you ask the staff for directions, they will direct you through the casino floor regardless of where you're going, which can be frustrating. The most annoying thing was the food situation! I waited 45 minutes to get fast food (at the food court and at Payard) because these places were so grossly understaffed. You'd think they could hire extra workers when they know there is a conference going on, but apparently not. Also, something as simple as a mediocre slice of pizza and a soda costs $10! A pastry, coffee, and juice for breakfast costs $20! The casinos are designed to make it impossible for you to have time to leave them and get food elsewhere so you're basically their captive. Oh - and DO NOT plan to do anything at the business center. It's $5 just to touch the computer then $1 per page you print! Disgusting! For these reasons, I would give the place 2 stars. But the high quality of the room for the low conference rate we paid made up for a lot!

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel, 5 Star Fees”
Reviews.Author: SoftWalker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 6 nights here while attending a conference. The service was mediocre, the room was clean, but the furnishings in the room were spartan and old. If it weren't for the fact that my conference was in the same hotel for convience sake, we would have checked out after one night. The prices are outrageous for Las Vegas and I was born and raised in Las Vegas. I saw reviews like this on Trip Advisor but closed my eyes to them. I should have listened.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is Free”
Reviews.Author: RGoody38
Reviews.Content: I guess I expected too much from my stay at Caesars Palace, Las Vegas, but I certainly didn't expect to be nickel and dimed. I stayed in the Palace tower, Run of House, which was a 2-double room. The room itself was very spacious and nice. Double sink bathroom with whirlpool and separate shower. Great view of all the pools Caesars has to offer. However, be sure to read all materials provided before brewing a pot of coffee, which has always been complimentary in every other hotel I ever stayed, but cost around $12 for maybe 2-12oz cups. There also was a snack/liquor bar, which is expected in a hotel like this. Of course I also expected to be charged for consuming any of these snacks/liquors, although I didn't. But I didn't realize the sophistication of being charged by just browsing the snacks/liquors. Apparently there is some sort of sensor that automatically charges to your room if you so much as pick up and look at any of the items offered. I guess the time limit is 30 seconds (per hotel staff). We were charged for some of these very overpriced items, but hotel staff was courteous to remove from our bill considering our ignorance of the billing system and the fact that we didn't actually consume any of the items. The hotel itself is pretty nice, I guess. Although hotels of this caliber have the appearance of being trashy when you first walk in and are surrounded by the casino and a thick cloud of smoke. I guess I'm not all that impressed with the decor, although some of it was pretty neat, and we did take lots of pictures. But I found myself wondering, why am I taking pictures of replica statutes. But still, its not something you see in any other hotel. The food was extremely expensive, including the small food court. I'd recommend dining elsewhere. We tried Serendipty (spell?), a very overpriced, busy, and very slow service restaurant within Caesars Palace. The food was fine, but $60 for dinner for two with only 2 alcoholic beverages made it just ok ... definitely not something to write home about. The popular item at the restaurant is a frozen hot chocolate, which we wanted to order, but opted not to given the fact that it would have taken an additional 30 minutes just to be served. I was somewhat shocked when I stopped by the front desk one evening to inquire about the location of the workout facility. The front desk pointed me in the right direction, but also mentioned it cost $25 a day to use the facility. I decided not to use the facility. The hotel connects to an upscale indoor shopping area, which includes the likes of Gucci, Louis Vutton (spell?), True Religion, etc. Overall, navigating the hotel was very difficult. On a positive note, whatever food/liquor you consume you can find comfort in knowing you'll work it off making your way back to your room or some other area of the hotel. A lot of walking was involved. Which is perfectly fine by me, but can also be aggravating when all you want is a decently priced cup of coffee. By comparison to the Balaggio and Vinitian (both Spell?), we liked the Venitian the most. Although it was still very big, the atmosphere was much more comfortable and seemed even nicer. I should point out, we didn't go to Las Vegas to gamble, we were there for a business convention, so I can't comment on any of the gambling here. Overall, my opinion of Caesars Palace is that it is extremely overpriced, overcrowded, and simply not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful one night stay”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelfreek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar's for one night to see the new Elton John show. They gave us a free upgrade to a lovely suite. Had two full bathrooms- so hubby and I each had our own. That made getting ready for the concert a breeze as we were a bit pressed for time. The staff is very nice- respectful and professional. I was a bit disapponted in the buffett- limited selections and not quite the quality of other Vegas buffetts we have enjoyed. Otherwise, the trip was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Priscilla04
Reviews.Content: Oh wow! Must be the best hotel I've evey stayed in. The staff were great, really warm and welcoming, not to mention helpful. Room service etc was second to none. You reported a problem and they fixed it immediately! The beds were so comfy - most unusual in a hotel I've found. On checking in, the receptionist offered us an upgrade to a juniior suite at a discounted rate. We were well chuffed. The hotel is so plush and clean. The only downside is restaurant prices. A small bottle of mineral water cost $5.00 plus tax! Bit extreme but hey, it is one of the top hotels. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel. It's in the heart of Vegas. You couldn't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Strip”
Reviews.Author: candy b
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property to stay at on "The Strip". It's located in the middle of the action of the action and everything is within walking distance. We like the Roman theme and the room we had in the Palace Tower was really nice. We got a mini suite and had a great view of the pool area, which is beautiful. The inside is huge and requires a lot of walking to get to and from hotel room, but I kind of liked that. The mall is awesome to walk through, even though there weren't many stores I would shop in (way too pricey for my taste). The casino is large and has a good variety of games available. If you are a video poker player like we are, you will be a little dissappointed with the selection of machines and very dissappointed with the pay tables. Of course you are on the strip, and there are no good pay tables, except for $1.00 machines. All the employee's we had any contact with were super friendly and helpful. My one complaint about Caeser's is the food choices. All the restaurants are really expensive for our taste and the buffet is not good. We had lunch at The Mesa Grill, and the food was really good, but overpriced. I guess if you don't mind spending $50.00 for lunch, you will probably like the restaurants. Even the food court was a little pricey. We ended up walking over to Planet Hollywood for most of our meals. We used to stay there, but prefer the property and rooms at Caesar's.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: mbunak
Reviews.Content: I just spent a weekend at Caesars Palace for a business conference. Although the Palace tower room was nice I would not go back. The cost of in-room coffee was $12.00, a major rip off. When you are paying the kind of price they charge for the room, coffee should be complimentary. Another turn off was the Chinese restaurant we went for dinner. Bejing noodle #9 was a big mistake. At twice the cost of Vancouver Chinese food and half the portion and quality, it was another rip off.

Reviews.Title: “The famous mega resort still stands”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: a massive entity upon itself ceasars palace still remains top in variety of choices. Located next to the forum shops the food options are endless. I read another review and yes prices are not cheap however you pay for teh experience, location, name and you ARE in Vegas...baby.. Rooms vary with Tower however all are pretty much what you expect. Not a bargain property for sure however you are paying for the name, location and huge facility. There is EVERYTHING here you seriously need not leave the property. Pools are amazing as is the health spa. RAO's Italian was one of the best means Ive ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Maggie1270
Reviews.Content: We made four room changes in two days despite having booked and paid for a non smoking deluxe room. Our stay consisted of changing rooms, arguing with hotel staff and waiting for someone to get it right. Only good thing about it was the show we had come to see. Elton John was great, but Caesars is off the list of places I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great!”
Reviews.Author: TrevellingDuo
Reviews.Content: I love staying at Caesar's Palace. Every stay the rooms have been great. It's a very safe hotel for singles and couples! Lago Buffet - Champagne Brunch was wonderful! Mimosa's were a perfect touch to the buffet. Messa Grill - Bobby Flay's Grill was super good! Race & Sports Book - Has tons of seating- plenty of room for all the sport fans in the Palace Cafe by the tables is a great place to enjoy a coffee in the morning 'recouping' and planning for another day's adventures. I love the location- sky bridge to the Barbary Coast & Bellagio. A short walk to Margaritaville… love the hotel & casino. Shoppers heaven in the Coliseum, too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Vegas Virgins!”
Reviews.Author: niamunna
Reviews.Content: Location is superb, palace tower deluxe rooms were superb but the best part of all was the pools. At least 5 pools which are clean and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “very nice, food is expensive,casino too spread out”
Reviews.Author: TheScanian
Reviews.Content: A first class hotel,excellent staff,very clean and safe.The food prices are very high. Not crazy about the casino, it is very spread out, and it's hard to figure out where things are.The negatives brings it down to a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Paid for a "view" and got the Casino Rooftop”
Reviews.Author: bambis37664
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with 3 other couples to Vegas, our second trip. We all booked with the same service and were told that we were paying for and upgrade to the Forum Tower, CITY VIEW. Checked in with Gary the front desk guy, who had no PR skills whatsoever. I told him we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary, asked if the room had a good "view" and I was told UP FRONT: "No, we are booked and this is the best we have but you are not gonna like it." Well, needless to say, we were in Forum Tower, Room 5210 and the City View I paid for was a view of the back wall of the Colliseum and the rooftop of the Casino. NO I DID NOT LIKE IT!!! While we went on to our room the others in my party were checking in and as LUCK would have it, they were placed in rooms on the 64, 67 and 68th floors. AND GUESS WHAT.....THEY ALL HAD A CITY VIEW! I guess it sounds like sour grapes but we all booked at the same time, checked in at the same time, PAID THE SAME FEES and were not given the "same" room status. Anyway, after my friends saw the difference in our "VIEWS" we all went back to the front desk to see what happened and we were told, nicely, that they were booked and I could not be moved. Also, Douglas, another front desk guy, told us that a City View in the Forum Tower was rare and not many guests could get it. SURPRISE, SURPRISE!! Three out of the four couples that registered got the RARE City View. Hmmm. Then I was told that after checkout on Sunday, if there was a room available they would "gladly upgrade us". Thought I had already upgraded??? The call to my room for the upgrade NEVER came and when I checked back the next evening I was told again.....Sorry....well yes it was sorry!! The room was comfortable, bed was good, hair dryer worked, we brought our own Keureg (?) coffee to use in their coffee maker (took 3 days to get new coffee cups though). We had a good time with our friends and wanted to make the best of the situation. I was just very disappointed that Ceasars did not seem to care where we were roomwise and no one contacted me the entire duration of our stay. They knew the room number!! If you stay in the Forum tower, you need the higher floor!! OH, BTY, NO ONE IN OUR PARTY DID THE TIP THING FOR AN UPGRADE!!! We Did not use the safe or the refrigerator, we took a collapsible cooler and walked to Walgreen's for the guys beer. Slots were tight and the server only came by one time during 45 mins of playing, she said she was busy and would be with us in a little while. We just cashed out and left. We especially liked the Cheesecake Factory in the Shops of the Forum. Red Velvet Cheescake saved my sanity!!! I look forward to another try at Vegas and the "view", as we hope to go back in the spring with neighbors. I just don't think I will try for the view at Caesar's again. I usually learn my lesson after getting burned the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace - Gotta love it!”
Reviews.Author: h6525
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palce Las Vegas is an icon that is still on top. Great room, great view and wonderful food. There are so many restaurants to choose from and everyone we ate at was delicious. Rao's has excellent Italian dishes. And for something a little different try Beijing Noodle Co. If you can, try to get a room in the Augustus tower - a little far from the casino; but great room and close to pool complex.

Reviews.Title: “great adventure”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea0001
Reviews.Content: Caesars is all that the advertisements say. A little confusing to get around but it has everyrthing

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time we will return”
Reviews.Author: kingpin5
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Las Vegas for many years now. Our recent stay at Caesars Palace exceeded all of my expectations. Check in and out was friendly and fast. Our room in the Augustus Tower was lovely and as nice as my stays at the Bellagio, Wynn or Venetian. The pool area was great. We ate at several restaurants and the service and food at all of them was wonderful. Our experience with gambling was good. The dealers were professional and friendly and if we played slots we were offered drinks all of the time with fast service. We also took in the Elton John concert and the venue and his performance were outstanding. We plan to return and stay at Caesars in the near future. If you do not want to be charged for the mini bar I do suggest that you do not open the door. If you are charged just call down and they will reverse it with no issue. I will be recommending Caesars to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: itinerary
Reviews.Content: We checked in late to Caesars Palace (11pm) after a horrible delayed flight with Hawaiian Airlines from Honolulu to Las Vegas (package booked via Travelocity). Caesars was a welcome sight after the flight from hell! Upon check-in we were greetede by a very friendly attendant who upgraded us for 3 nights at no extra charge (we had booked a classic room). The room we were allocated was on the 18th floor and had a stunning view over the Caesars pool area and the southern 'strip'. The room was magnificent and no '$$ sandwich' was required to secure the upgrade. The room was a mini suite with 2 bathrooms, 2 beds and had enough space for a party! Located in the Palace Tower, this room was a short walk from the main Caesars complex (shopping, gaming and entertainment etc). We found all staff to be friendly and courteous. The hotel does not charge a resort fee per day however there are additional charges for using the internet and also the coffee machine in the room. Caesars is a huge complex with loads of facilities for guests and is located in the heart of the Las Vegas strip; acrosss from Ballys, Flamingo, Bellagio and not far from Paris. We broke even in the casino on our 3 day visit to Caesars but had an excellent time and would thoroughly recommend this hotel to visitors who want a memorable Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fiona M
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6 y o and myself had a classic room booked but by staying during the week and by just chatting and being friendly to the desk staff we were upgraded to the Augustus Tower at no charge! We tipped the desk attendant after she had upgraded us, so I don't think it made a difference to our overall room location. We could not believe our amazing room it overlooked the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains. We really enjoyed our stay, and found the staff to be very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awash in luxury”
Reviews.Author: BeachPug11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly amazing--no detail is left unattended. Prepare to stay a few days just to get the lay of the land--it is a sprawling "estate-like" hotel. The architecture is phenomenal--really impressive. You really wouldn't need to leave Caesar's if you didn't want to--it is that comprehensive. However, we did want to get out and about! The concierges are worth their weight in gold. We are not gamblers and were looking for other forms or entertainment, tours, shows, and the like. They really came through even in a pinch when Carrot Top cancelled at the last minute, we were able to purchase tickets to another show without a problem. The shopping in the Forum Shoppes is first rate--but hold on to your wallet! The location is wonderful, too, with so much within walking distance. We had a "standard" room, but even so, it was well appointed, comfortable, and best of all--quiet! If we visit LV again, we will without a doubt stay at Caesar's.

Reviews.Title: “Ready to go back”
Reviews.Author: kimbmiller
Reviews.Content: I took a weekend trip with my girlfriends and we stayed at Caesars. They put us in an amazing room in the Augustus Tower that looked out over the strip and right at the Bellagio fountain. The shopping center is fabulous. We ate dinner at Trevi the first night and it was DELICIOUS! We all managed to clean our plates! They have the best calamari appetizer! Our room was huge, clean and very nice. There is so much to do in Caesars that we didn't even leave our hotel the first night. The pool area is beautiful, however you have to get down there early to get a chair and then you have to wait a few hours before you get direct sunlight. That is the only reason I am only giving 4 out of 5. We checked out the bars/clubs and had a great time dancing at Pure. I would definitely stay at Caesars again!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars - poor”
Reviews.Author: bridges1111
Reviews.Content: The walls were so thin, we could hear the guy next door yawning. The pools are in between two tall towers so it was hard to find a sunny spot. The pools had the usual cabanas you could rent but also had upholstered lounges around the edge of each pool that you had to pay for. They also closed the whole pool complex for a private party. Would NOT stay here again. We had a much better experience at Mandolay Bay and Mirage. Carpet worn and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice BIG room, clean and friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: Casey D
Reviews.Content: Had a great room! The bathroom was the size of a normal hotel room. One negative about the property is its so BIG. It took me a half hour to locate the correct bank of elevators that would take me up to my room. This is not a place where you want your room key card not to work. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel just a couple of negatives”
Reviews.Author: Benidorm_fanUk
Reviews.Content: Well I read loads about the hotel before I left and the last few reviews are very accurate.I want to add some different things I found rather than repeating what's been said. We did use the $20 tip and it worked for us getting an upgrade to the Palace tower suite. The Hotel is the best in terms of location and facilities although we like the feel of New York New York as it felt it appealed to the younger market. The cons it is expensive for anything in th room or around the hotel although we ate at the French Restuarant and it was nice and $80 for a main course and a drink. Pure nightclub, well great place but the line(que) is terrible ruins the night! My biggest disapointment was the Pool.We went use it on Saturday only to find the closed it at 3.00 for a private function, this is the whole pool area not just part of it! I have never been any where let alone a 5star hotel where the guests are treated so badley, I did complain but they told me this was a comon occurence which meant I would not go back or recommend staying there, such a shame as there are so many good things to say.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not a good value”
Reviews.Author: mjruffell
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel with fabulous sculptors and amenities. Full of luxury shops and high end restaurants. The only problem is value for simple items. A rum and coke cost $11 at the bar, or $18 at the pool, and it was not that special. A big plastic cup full of ice and and little rum and coke. Same with all other drinks like mai-tai, cosmo, and margaritas. The $8 dollar drinks you get in the Bahamas are much cheaper and way better. Same thing with finger foods and snacks. $14 for a basic burger, $7 for a lousy pizza slice. If you willing to pay more you can get excellent food. Our meal at MESA was great but cost $800 for 8 people. My point is Caesar Place (and all other Vegas Mega hotels) are nice, but a terrible value for the money. My recommendation is to stay in Caesars Palace for only a few days, blow away your money and have fun, then get the heck out of there.

Reviews.Title: “augustus tower”
Reviews.Author: cinkso
Reviews.Content: we originally booked a room from forum tower, but we got upgraded to augustus tower at the registration. i must say, we loved the room, it was very spacious, clean and comfortable. we would definetely stay there again, everything was perfect with our stay. and the location is i think one of the best of vegas, it is very central, if you dont want to walk too much ceasar's is the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Less than pleased”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: The property itself is gorgeous but the level of service was mediocre at best. We were greeted nicely and from there the service went downhill. We had planned on staying fro Thursday through Sunday but were considering tacking an extra day onto our trip so when we checked in we inquired as to how much the last night would cost. We were told what we considered to be a fair price and on Sunday morning decided to exercise our option. When my girlfriend went down to inform them we'd be staying an extra night she was told that the price would be more than double what we were quoted. I then went to the desk and spoke with a manager, voicing my concern. After making me feel like I was a total nuisance, the manager relented and told me he would honor the price I was quoted with one catch. We would have to switch rooms. As it turned out not only did we have to move to another room but also to a completely different tower. We were moved from the Augustas Tower to the Roman Tower which is basically a Holiday Inn. The room was horrible and we paid the same rate that we had been paying for the extremely nice room. On top of that housekeeping didn't even clean our room on one of the days of our stay. When we arrived back and called the front desk they acted annoyed and asked me if I wanted it cleaned then. It was 9:00 pm so I declined but they're attitude was terrible. This year alone we've stayed at some nice hotels (Ritz Carlton) and some average hotels (Marriott), typically the level of service is commensurate with the cost of the hotel. By no means is that the case here. One of the beauties of Las Vegas is the amount of choices that are available for accomodations. My suggestion would be to try someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this place.... just not my style”
Reviews.Author: gatine
Reviews.Content: We stay in a range of different hotels, I wanted on 'on-the-strip' experience and picked Caesars.
