When we arrived, I considered doing the '20 dollar trick' for a moment but instead, was nice, pleasant and simply asked the desk staff for the best room in my category since it was part of our honeymoon and they offered a free upgrade (after kind of sneering at the fact I had booked a classic room for a honeymoon. He then told us the classic room is not very nice, which I thought was a bit weird coming from staff). The room in the Palace tower was very big, decor was very nice. The double shower was a nice touch and there were also two bathrooms. The bed linen were soft and comfortable. However, the downside of those fancy hotels is that nothing is free. Opening the fridge cost something, wifi cost something, k-cups are $12. I never find that you get much value... We were at MGM Signatures the night before, for almost half the price and much more amenities. We tried the buffet at Lago. Again, meh... didn't taste anything in that whole buffet that made me think 'ummm... that's good'. It was mostly okay, some not so good. Nothing to write home about. There was only one robe in the closet. We found the other, obviously used, hung in the bathroom. Wouldn't be in a hurry to come back. If you have unlimited funds, you may like this place though. I personally prefer a better value, mostly when you consider how little time we spend in the rooms while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back tomorrow!!”
Reviews.Author: holidays24England
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for half of our holiday and the MGM grand for the other half. Both amazing hotels. This one is gorgeous, the shopping centre is excellent!! We had a good shop and watched rod stewart. If he is on watch him, you will not be dissapointed we loved it!! Cheesecake factory in here is good. Our bedroom was gorgeous we had a masisve bath and then a seperate shower with a heat lamp shining down for when you get out the bath so its not cold. The pool area is gorgeous and walking round seeing bits out of the hangover film is very fun. I would deffo stop here again and reccomend it to my best friend. Eat over the road in the eiffel tower restuarant its gorgoeus. A little more expensive, but worth it for the views. we were sat directly over the bellagio fountains!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Nice rooms but watch out for hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: IrishGalwayLady
Reviews.Content: Number of travellers - 4 Room - Palace Tower Deluxe Room - 2 King Beds. Arrived at the hotel and was checked in very quickly. A good long walk to the hotel elevators for the room. Not easy with luggage. Room: Positives: Nice size. Jacuzzi, Walk-in shower & Dual sinks. Plenty of closet space. Comfy beds. Very clean. Negatives: DO NOT OPEN MINI BAR. We put in a sandwich & they charged us for everytime we opened it. They said there was a sensor. We were not going to pay $21 for opening it 3 times. Also, it does not have room for you to put in your own stuff. All of the items in mini-bar over priced. On the hotel itself: Big and expensive. Like most of vegas. Pools were nice and slighly warm, so no freezing cold water :) The Forum shops is big and has alot of the more expensive shops with top brand items. If this is for you, you will be in your element ! As for the staff, we only had one major issue with a handyman. He called to our room, saying that a door (where the mini bar was) had been missing for over a month. We told him we were getting ready to check out and asked him to come back later. He did come back but within half an hour (this was around 10am) and he put his key in the door and tried to get in. We had the latch on. This is totally against any hotel policy. He did not say he was coming in. He came around a third time (around 10.45) and we had to shout at him to leave. Very ignorant. Complaint at front reception but got no appology. Another morning we were woken up for house keeping at 8am. So all in all, keep the latch on. You never know who might come in. Next time i visit vegas, i would stay in a different hotel. Mainly for a change but i would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Forum Tower is nice”
Reviews.Author: ILoveVacation29
Reviews.Content: We were comped a room in the Forum Tower. The elevator is convenient. The view wasn’t much, but the room was plenty nice. The room could have used a good vacuuming, but I think that about most hotel rooms. I’m going to repeat the best advice I found on tripadvisor. We arrived at Caesars at 10:00 AM. The front desk was not busy. There was a worker directing line traffic. She asked if we were checking out. I said yes knowing she would not let me check in. We got to the front desk and asked the clerk if we could check in. We were in our room by 10:15.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TheNextNewt
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace is one of the nicest places in Vegas. The reproductions of Greek architecture and artwork are amazing. Room was just the right size, and factilities are wonderful. The restauruants, while not cheap, have great food. Location is central with lots of things to see and do within a very short walk. I must say the Forum Shops are all high end and quite expensive, but that is to be expected. For less expensive shopping, just get a cab and have them take you to the outlet shops. Be prepared to pay even for coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelaChris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as a one off treat and we weren't disappointed. The whole place is brilliant, absolutely beautiful from the second you walk in to the lobby! Check in is 4pm but we turned up hopeful at 12:30pm after moving out of our previous hotel and upon arrival we were greeted with a smile and told we could get a free upgrade from a deluxe room in the Forum Tower to a suite in the Forum Tower and check in then! We were in love with our room from the second we walked in, it was clean with everything we could need and more (I'm still trying to figure out how to incorporate a tv in the bathroom mirror at home!)! The room looked out on to the car park but to be honest I wouldnt have spent my time looking out the window anyway! The shopping part of the casino is huge and although embarassing to admit I did get lost when I ventured off on my own but staff were happy to help point me in the right direction. The casino staff were also friendly, Nancy on the roulette table was wonderful and looked after us on our first time gambling at a table! The wifi isnt free which was probably the only drawback considering we'd spent a lot for our stay in the first place but it wouldn't stop us going back! The valet in the morning was incredibly busy and we had to wait about 15 minutes for our car to arrive but they had allowed us a later check out time for free and it was pleasant waiting in the sun looking at the fountains so we didnt mind. You can check out using the tv in your room so that even gives you a few more minutes to get out if you're running late (considering it takes about 15 minutes to walk to the lobby!). We were very happy with our stay and we'll defintiely return on our next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “bad service!”
Reviews.Author: lauren j
Reviews.Content: We stayed at caesars palace while on our first american holiday. The hotel is quite beautiful, however we had 2 complaints. The first was that there was a vent of some sort on the wall next to the bed, that contstantly made an annoying buzzing sound, it was that annoying that my husband ended up covering the vent with one of his t shirts so it woud stop bothering us at night. The second complaint we have, is that on the last night, we were woken by noise in the room next to us at 4am, follwed by a maintenance man standing outside our room door with his 2 way, talking at the top of his voice, the door in the room next to us was constantly opening and closing, and we could hear work being done in the room. we layed awake for an hour, and eventually called the front desk who adivsed there had been a flood in the room next to us. the work continued on until we checked out - at which point we made a complaint which was fobbed off by the guy - Sean - we then asked for the manager who claims he had spoken to the maintenance manager and they knew nothing of the flood and pretty much told us he didnt beleive us. we asked for a refund for the night, he refused at first, and eventually gave us half the nightly rate. Sean then checked us out and was very rude and unfirendly. woudlnt stay again due to these two issues. also charged us $25 for a beer and a midori at the pool bar...our advice- take a bag in with alcohol in it, we bought a bottle of bourbon at the shop for $12, can of pepsi and the ice bucket from our room and had plenty of drinks for next to nothing!! also one day we left the privacy sign on the door as we didnt want the cleaners going in, when we returned we found they went in anyway. they also threw out any food we had left in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: amy m
Reviews.Content: Stayed with ceasars as my bachelorette weekend. the trip advice I got from here was great! Loved my upgraded room! Great stay aand courteous staff! The city made me almost want to elope!

Reviews.Title: “Total Rewards Diamond Players - Do Not Arrive Late”
Reviews.Author: 777player
Reviews.Content: Believe every review you read when they say you have to tip the front desk clerks for a decent room. I arrived to check in and missed the Diamond registration by 2 minutes. (10:02pm due to flight delay in Atlanta). Signs directed us to the 7 Stars check-in area which was also closed. Staff walking out of the 7 Stars registration area very rudly stated that they were closed and offered no check in assistance. After another 30 minute wait we reached the front desk and found the whole "tip the front desk" thing to be true. I can not believe this is how the "premier resort" in Vegas operates. Still kind of bitter, can you tell. If the clerk won't take your license and credit card at the same time, just know that they expect a tip folded under one or the other. (And they will also tell you that they have to go ask a manager about room availability....while they continue to wait for your tip) As a TR member I didn't really believe I had to do such an abusrd antic. DO IT! You will regret the room you are assigned otherwise. We were in Vegas for a week and I really wish at this point that Mandalay Bay was in the TR family. The views are 1,000 x's better. Major plus of the week - Donny and Marie, Elton John and David Foster shows. Major negatives - not tipping the damn front desk clerk :( I will give props where they are due. Grounds teams are on top of the cleaning. The marble does shine, it's what Caesars is all about.

Reviews.Title: “classic is the right title to this hotel~”
Reviews.Author: navawritz
Reviews.Content: love the old style of posh las vegas so many hotels came after but he is standing tall with a style of old classic. we arrived to the hotel at 7 pm on monday its was great time as not to many were in line at the front desk. we got room 2022 it was great room i am sharing images. dubble bath room great touch. the pool area the lobby the shopping area what can i say lovely~ the breakfast was perfect with great fresh juice and fresh baked muffins. loved our short stay. will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an old, filthy, outrageously overpriced, poorly-maintained hotel in a glamorous disguise”
Reviews.Author: Lilmcnugget
Reviews.Content: Terribly weak shower. Water temp problem. Hot shower NOT available at nite after 9pm. Stained dirty carpet. 80s CRT TV. If you want 2 star-worth motel quality room at a 4 star hotel price, be my guest, Caesar will deliver it. My husband was attending a wk-long conference at the Caesar palace. They offered a standard room to us at a special rate of $190 which made it an apparent choice for the stay. We didn't have much expectation as we knew it is going to be a standard room after all. But as an acclaimed 4 star hotel in Vegas, we expect their most basic room quality to be, if not above standard, at least decent. The hotel is big and glamorous from the strip but that's all. All hell breaks loose once you check in. At first they checked us into a room on the 5th flr in the Roman tower right next to service elevators which was so noisy that we demanded a room change right a way. This time they switched us to another room on a higher floor on the 14th in the same tower. To our pleasant surprise, they are thoughtful enough to provide, not 1 but 2 shower caps, vanity kit (2 cotton balls, few Q tips, a rubber band), sewing kit. It has a walkin shower with 2 weaker-than-your-home shower heads, mini TV in the washroom, light shutout blinds, a safe, weak but working hairdryer, but no tub, no bathrobe, no slipper - o well, no big deal; but the lack of a fridge, coffee/ tea, coffee marker and 80s CRT TV just are not acceptable by today's standard. Even a 3star Hilton std rm has them. The sluggish in-rm wifi costs you as much as $14.99 per day and is only applicable to 1 device.. But here comes the WORST part - we tried to take a shower at 11pm. And guess what, the water came out of shower at the max hottest setting was COLD. It was so cold that it generated absolutely NO steam at all. We let it ran for 5min at the max but still no change. While we were half dripping wet, it took us 4 calls to the front desk, every 10mins before a rather handyman-looking "engineer" showed up at our room. He looked at the shower and was not all surprised, and said the most ridicious thing i have ever heard, "sometimes the water temperature does drop thru out the night. It takes time to pump hot water to this (14th) floor. Just wait and let it run for 5-10mins until the temperature is ok for shower.". What?! Are you kidding?!!! This is NOT a Motel 8!! We just couldn't believe our ears! At the end we had to let it run at max setting for as long as 10mins before the water got warm enough to shower (yes, still NOT hot!). Obviously this boiler / water temp issue is a known problem to them. Possibly this is some lowlife hotel management's idea to keep the boiler off as much as possible or they are just too cheap get a new / additional boilers, at just to save money. We called to complain but receive no compensation or treatment of any kind. The hotel management should have offered us another room, or even a free upgrade, instead of having this problem dragged on for 1 whole hour and produce some very unhappy customers. Plus their crappy, non-existent service, impolite, unfriendly, useless staff - this is just plainly ridiculous for a 4 star hotel and is a total rip off. Others had mentioned how filthy the carpet. I watched them serviced my room on 3 separate days. For some reasons their maids are trained to vacuum the carpet ONLY at the spot beside the bed but no where else. Why they were trained not to vacuum the entire room is beyond me. May be another brilliant penny-pinching measure from another management folk?! Regarding noise from the club, we could still hear some faint thumping disco every night from 1 till 4am in the morning. But the noise level was within acceptable limit as we are heavy sleepers. Cannot imagine how is it like for lower levels. 99% of the sitdown restaurants in Caesar is criminally over-priced just like anywhere else in vegas but not necessary good quality, unless you live on food court food. The Cheese Cake factory in the Forum shop is actually a gem. Price is reasonable for a sitdown restaurant. Speed is efficient. Food quality ax the board is consistent and is above and beyond other restaurants in the same franchise. We like their salmon lunch special (miso, simply grilled) so much that we went there almost for every day we stayed here. Conclusion: Shame on you Caesar Palace. It should be renamed to RIP-U-OFF MOTEL PALACE. Our money will be better spent else where should we be in Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: deadxlikexme
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my honeymoon around christmas of last year. It's a pretty overwhelming site to see considering the entire grounds of the hotel takes up almost an entire city block. The inside is very elegant looking and decorated in a roman theme. Full of amazing restaurants, shopping, nightlife. It's like its own little city within itself. We found ourselves lost in there more than a few times. It's location to everything else is perfect as well. Dead center strip, across the street from the flamingo, between the mirage and bellagio. So youre in perfect walking distance of almost anything, unless you want to go to freemont street, or visit the older casinos like the riviera, circus circus etc. The rooms were very clean, the bathroom walls were all made of glass, so not much uh "privacy" in that department. We had an older style tv, but who really goes to las vegas to watch televisioin. The only thing that is somewhat mildy irritating is that it takes a good 10 minutes to get to the strip from your room. Other than that, I'd reccomend it to anyone that doesn't mind paying a little extra.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but nice.”
Reviews.Author: AronB
Reviews.Content: Very nice, elegant hotel. More geared towards the older crowd. Way overpriced on everything. If you are like us (25-34 age group) I would suggest another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: The first time we had visited Vegas celebrating my wife's 50th.Excellent room.Only problem,we should have used the bell boy,weas dragging luggage through casino to Forum tower lift.We were not the only ones who did this!! Loungers by swimming pool a little cramped,you got to know your neighbour well.Munch bunch eaterie large portions,advise to share.Even with a map of the place you can easily get lost also the signs can be a bit of a maze.Ground floor restaurant being refurbished during our time.Ideal base to explore the Strip etc.Cannot wait to return.Very friendly taxi drivers who do not rip you off

Reviews.Title: “thankyou caesars palace”
Reviews.Author: BRUMMIENICK
Reviews.Content: we had a 10 night stay in september - no problem with check in arrived 3.30pm no lines asked for the complimentry up-grade as we had only booked standard room-given a deluxe room in the palace tower on the 24th floor over looking the garden of the gods-fantastic room and great view all for a $30.00 tip. room was large -clean -a/c was working-could not fault room at all- shops and resturants great - not to expensive if you shop around -casino was full most of the time as we went during the labour day weekend great atmosphere. caesaers comes in for alot of stick on t.a. -but i must admit the place was fantastic and would not hesitate to stay there again-saving already.

Reviews.Title: “A huge hotel, with a great nightclub!”
Reviews.Author: GizzyKelly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars Palace hotel on the strip last year with my girlfriends on a girly holiday. The hotel is huge and will take 10 minutes to walk from one end to the other. It is the same size as most of the hotels on the strip. The hotel is modern and the rooms (even though I was sharing with 2 other girls) were huge and the bathroom was a good enought size to allow us to get ready. The pool area was great and you could hire large sunbeds to share with your friends. It was more like a pool party every day rather than a quiet relaxing sun bathing area but that is Vegas for you! Our room over looked the pool and had a nice view. The only gripe was that at the time they were doing some construction work so the view was not as nice, but at the end of the day you don't spend much time in your hotel room apart from sleeping. If you are going to get a room a the Caesars Palace hotel check whether there is any on-going construction before you book. We did enjoy going to Caesars Palace nightclub 'Pure' which has it own roof top bar over looking the strip. It was one of our favourite clubs in Vegas and was heaving on a Friday and Saturday night. If you are staying at the hotel then you get free entry. The conceriege also booked our helicopter trip over the Grand Canyon which was one of my highlights of the stay. All in all this hotel was pretty much what we expected, and I said you don't spend much time in the room so anywhere you book on the Strip will be fab. Other advice, we went to see the 'O' show at the Ballagio which was brilliant, the Grand Canyon helicopter trip is a must, (book through information at Caesars) we had dinner at the Mandalay Bay Hotel which was very nice and Tao nightclub (at the Venitian) and XS (at the Wynn) were also good clubs. Breakfast in the Paris Hotel is also a must!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but service was less than expected”
Reviews.Author: mrjanto
Reviews.Content: The entire facility is a great place to stay. With such a great facility, I expect excellent customer service. That was not the case. We had reserved a room for 2 nights. Before we arrived, we received an email asking if we'd like to upgrade our room at a discounted rate. I called to ask about the amenities in the upgraded room. I would have passed on most of the upgrade, but when I heard that we'd have a Jacuzzi tub and an extra sink, I felt like the upgrade was worth it. When we checked in, we were given a room for a handicapped person. There was no tub. The shower was very handicap friendly - no door, a wand instead of a showerhead. There was only one sink in the bathroom. I called the front desk to ask about our room. They told us that we were in a deluxe room like we had requested. I mentioned the amenities that I was expecting, and they told us that the larger size room made it qualify as a deluxe room. The room was very large, but I had no need for all the floor space. I just needed a place to sleep. She told me that they were sold out and there was no way that they could give me another room. I asked if there was something available for the next night, and she said I'd have to call back the next day and ask. When I asked the next day, they found a room for me. They told me to pack my belongings and wait in the room until someone arrived. They might not arrive for 2 hours. Eventually she agreed to an upgraded room change where we wouldn't have to be there when our belongings were moved. All in all, I was very frustrated with the service. No one cared whether anything worked out for us. Without going through all the details, they were very stingy in their efforts to help us. I expect a lot more from a place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Neptune POOL Cabana Rental”
Reviews.Author: Nic R
Reviews.Content: The poolside service at the Cabana was Horrible. First thing: we entered the wrong code into the safe. Our fault, but at 9 am we asked them to send an engineer to open the safe so that we may have access ot our belongings. At 1:45 pm we still did not have access to our belongings. We had to make a second and third request to get the safe open. When help arrived they were b@@ching at us about not receiving the order. That is an internal problem that a guest should not have to listen to. Nevertheless we had to smile and pretend that life was great so that they could stop b@@ching and do their job. Gee whiz, now I have to play mediator between the staff and management. That is outrageous. Five hours after later we have our purses. yeah! Second huge problem: horrible, horrible, horrible, service at my cabana. We rented the cabana for $500 dollars and were committed to ordering $1000 in food and drinks. $1500 to have a tent by a pool. ok. There were 10 of us so that will not be a problem. The problem is we could only order service from the deisgnated cabana boys or waitress, none of which were available. Our waitress showed up an hour late because she was confused with what time her shift started. The Cabana boys were available the first hour before they disappeared. We waited to order food and drinks one whole hour before I walked around to find a manager. The manager promised to handle the situation and comp. a round of drink and to restock our refridg with water. ok, all is well..maybe not. The waitress finally arrived and waited on us only to get the order wrong!! It was an additional 45 min before I received what I wanted. In addition, our drinks were never removed from our bill! Also, the water arrived in a case and the waiter needed to be told to put the water in ther refrig. He looked at us as if to ask where do you want this hot case of water to go. It is 97 degrees F, you tell me where you think it should go! If guests are required to purchase 1 grand of food and beverages and order directly from the staff then we should have dedicated staff for the cabana. Instead the staff was servicing the cabana and the rest of the 2 pools. An additional waitress came to assist us around 4 pm (we have been at the pool for 7 hours at this time) only to roll her eyes before asking if we needed help and explain that she knew our waitress was swamped and needed assistance, but management just gave her the ok. Again, internal problems, not mine. Overall, I expected a higher level of service from CP. This service along with the customer service at the pool, will make me consider other properties! In fact, returning in October, and my reservation is not here!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Disappointing...to say the least!”
Reviews.Author: Mary G
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Vegas, and we were excited that we had reservations at Caesars having read about the room accommodations there and other nearby hotels. What a disappointment when we finally found our run-down room at the end of a very long hall--with none of the luxuries noted on Caesars website. After a phone call to the front desk, we were offered a room in the Centurion Tower. We should have known we were in for another disappointment when TWICE when asking hotel employees for directions to the tower we were asked if the Centurion Tower was open again. This room was older looking than the last. In fact, I think the red velvet couch was probably from the days of Elvis. The good news was the room was closer to the elevator, the bathroom was clean and everything worked properly, and despite the bedding was unusual (there was no bed spread or comforter), the bed was extremely comfortable....I slept like a baby with no annoying backache in the morning. I appreciated that Caesars was centrally located, but I doubt that I would stay there again, Oh yes, upon returning to our room day three of our four day stay, we discovered one of the doors to the tv cabinet had been removed. It was the side that had a broken hinge and cracked wood. Housekeeping must have had problems with it that day and decided it was easier to just remove the broken door leaving us with quite an eyesore. That's life.

Reviews.Title: “Always the Best”
Reviews.Author: dmarruth
Reviews.Content: Our executive host, Danielle Castranelli, is the best. Limo to/from airport, chocolate strawberries waiting in the room. Augustus Tower, great view, restaurants all outstanding. Have visited 10 times, the best on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to Vegas just not sure if it would be here.”
Reviews.Author: Jelly32
Reviews.Content: Although my title would lead You to believe I/we didn't have a good time that would be untrue.We had a great time it is just that the hotel is so big you almost want to give up and not bother trying to find the exit and just stay there.our room was very basic and I thought it was just ok , I'm guessing we should have upgraded but we didn't . Your in the middle of it all, it is one hell of a crazy place and I can't wait to go again. The ladies provided us drinks as quick as we needed them, people working the tables helped a great feat during play.Vegas is wicked , the palace is wicked I'm just not sure if it's for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would stay again at some point...”
Reviews.Author: bbattle00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar's for 3 nights on our first trip to Vegas. Upon arrival we were taken aback at the size of this hotel, it is MASSIVE! We arrived around noon and our room wasn't quite ready and we were told to come back around 3. We ventured around the pool area after lunch to pass the time. My fiance' and I got engaged on the overlook of the Garden pools, which was amazing. Originally we were told we were going to be in the Roman Tower (older rooms), but we explained to the clerk that we had just been engaged and were upgraded to a room in the Augustus Tower overlooking the Belagio Fountains (room 3860). It was amazing! Beautiful views of the strip. The location of this hotel is perfect as it is right in the middle of the strip. We explored most all of the major hotels on the strip and found that others might be more our style (Mandalay Bay, NYNY) on our next visit. All in all, Caesar's is a super nice hotel and we found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Would definately reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Killer Location”
Reviews.Author: wildone
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Vegas over the years....this hotel was picked this trip for its great central strip location......for friends and family to walk around,without taking cabs etc everywhere. BUT...it IS BIG...and somewhat a maze..........no flow, and easy to get lost inside. Rooms are very good...Dining can be $$$...room bar prices $$$. GREAT SHOPPING.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-No complaints”
Reviews.Author: cmank
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9/26-9/29/2011. Booked thru Priceline. Checked in and was given a room in the Forum Tower. From reading other reviews, we knew we wanted the Augustus Tower. Asked and received an upgrade. Tipped a twenty. Our room was stunning. Huge corner room with view out one window of the Strip, mountains and pool out the other. Our room was so big it had a friggin doorbell! Bed very comfy. Bathroom great. Housekeeping was professional and discreet. Ask for room 4093. You won't regret it. Pools were very cool. Drinks expensive but what isn't in Vegas.Was never too crowded and the music wasn't too loud as others have complained. Hotel building and grounds are beautiful but unbelievably huge and spread out. Everything is a walk and a half. Casino expensive by my standards. We were there during the week. Ten to fifteen dollar minimums daytime. We went downtown (Binions) and across the street (Flamingo). Ate at Serendipity3. Not bad food, excellent service. Planet Hollywood in the Forum Shops was average at best. Central Grill in the lobby, good food and value Caesars centrally located on the Strip but everything is still not close by. Would definitively stay at Ceasars again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the "Liquid Police" upon entering Ceasar's Pool”
Reviews.Author: PortCoquitlamDave
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days at Caesars Hotel in L Vegas, had a great time, great facility EXCEPT the pool issue. A couple of days we tried to enter the pool area and were turned back as we had purchased pop, water. I had purchased a $ 32.00 Adult Slurpee in a plastic holder at a NUMB bar, which is approximately 450 ft to the pool area and was promptly told that I could not take it into the pool area. The "LIQUID POLICE" stated that no guests can bring in any liquids, water, pop, beer into the pool area and the individual stated that it is plainly stated in small print just adjacent to the pool area. He indicated that for sanitary reasons, etc, etc, the hotel wanted to ensure that no glass, bottles, etc were being brought into the pool area. Which is quite odd, that the bars inside the pool area, sold bottles, beer cans, and plastic cups which seem to be okay. The pool even had emply plastic cups in the pool! A vendor which is just outside the pool area, had a very small sign that was not facing the paying public, also saying that you could not bring drinks into the pool area. The NUMB bar had vIRTUALLY NO SIGNS indicating that you could not take their drinks into the pool area!! On the weekend, it seemed to change as theire was no "water police" there???!!! We did ask to speak to the Managment, but this request was simply ignored!!! The six of us attend Las Vegas on an annual basis, and this hotel unfortunately be on our list of places that we would return to!!! Port Coquitlam Dave

Reviews.Title: “Standard Vegas-Nice but average Vegas room”
Reviews.Author: okcJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Palace tower room for 3 nights. Big spacious room with decent amenities. Double bathroom with shared shower between the two. Had Jacuzzi tub but didn't work. AC worked fine, water pressure fine, bed fine and room clean. Carpet in the hallway getting a little worn and frayed at the seams. Good- Little tip to the front desk and was upgraded. We ordered room service for an in room meeting in the forum tower and even though it was for ten....was on time and was a fantastic meal with plenty of condiments, etc. Beer in mini fridge only $7.00 for Heineken or Peroni and didn't appear to have stocking or gratuity fee added. The spa is fantastic and is the forum tower so a little bit of hike. Bad- Arrived early and even though hotel was fairly empty the night before (friend stayed night before and said the casino was empty), was headed off from the front desk by a what appeared to be supervisor who told me that check in was at 1. Asked if anyway to get into a room earlier as I had a business conference call at 1230 and without even trying to see if I could be accomodated...told me no. More disappointed at the lack of attempt to accommodate. Came back at 130 and the line to check in was approx 8-10 people in each line. Tip-If you are a coffee drinker, bring your own Kuerig k-cups from home. They have the standard machine to use but if you use their k-cups, it is $12.00 for four K-Cups. If you use the spa, ask for a razor. The razors are top quality razors that give you a nice shave and you get to keep. It was so nice, I brought it home and got blade refills switching brands.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Pools”
Reviews.Author: wendym001
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas at the beginning of September. Check in was seamless with virtually no line up and the staff were attentive and friendly. Our room had not been cleaned upon check in and the front desk staff moved us very quickly with apology to a different room. We did have to call one of the days to ask to have the room cleaned as it had not been done when we returned to our room late in the day. Again they responded promptly. Location on the strip is great as it is very central. The pools are absolutely stunning and beautiful. With the wide number of pools there is plenty of room to find your spot but they did have two of the pools closed on the week days and this made it a little more crowded. Bar service was very good and Maria was outstanding. Check out was as smooth and quick as check in.

Reviews.Title: “It's just too big”
Reviews.Author: BusinessHouston
Reviews.Content: I'm not commenting on the rooms because a lot of others have. This place is just too big. It is exhausting just getting from your room to other places in the hotel. Trying to get out of the hotel is a nightmare. To get to the casinos across the street is a real ordeal. Although the Flamingo is right across the street, to get there requires a walk through a large plaza, up stairs or escalators and then down on the other side of the strip. It takes forever. I appreciate convenience and for that reason alone would not stay at Caesar's again. In 3 days the most I ever was was a hundred dollars and that was with a gambling budget 3 times that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At Caesars”
Reviews.Author: TravelMonster71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars in September for four nights. He was there longer for a conference. It was great! All of the hotel staff seemed very friendly. We stayed in the Palace Tower. The room was very nice. Great view from the 25th floor. The bathroom has a shower and a jacuzzi tub, dual sinks and a vanity area outside the bathroom to do your hair and put on makeup. The bed was comfortable. Our TV remote didn't work, but we didn't care enough about it to let them know. Who watches TV while you are in Vegas anyway! Except for the last day we were there, it was very quiet on our floor. It wasn't a big deal or the hotel's fault, but the people in the room next to us sounded like it was full of people talking very loudly. Annoying, but not the hotel's fault. I guess if someone is being really loud in their room, you might hear it. We had easy access to the pool (pool entrance right off Palace Tower) and casino floor. Also to the conference centers. Caesars is huge, therefore it's not like you'll be close to everything, but we didn't find any problems getting anywhere. I shopped, ate at the restaturants, used the pool, had a massage at the spa and gambled. Everything was wonderful. Pool: There are a few pools, but I just laid out by the one directly out the door from Palace Towers. I went once in the morning and once in the afternoon. No problems finding a lounge chair either day. Pool was very relaxing. Spa: I had a swedish massage and used the "snow room" and steam room while I was there. You could use the facilities all day long and come back to use them or use the gym. Gambling: The casinos at Caesars are very fancy to look at and very large and spacious. They have great bars where you can get a lot of different kinds of beers that can't be found everyone else. We play slots and there is a good choice of machines. Downside- slots seem very tight at Caesars. Seemed I had better luck at New York/New York and the Palazzo. Waitstaff = very friendly. Some days we had no problems getting served, other days there wasn't a waitress to be found on the floor it seemed. I think because the casino is so huge there seems to be some "dead spots" in it as far as service for free cocktails Restaurants: We ate at Spago twice for lunch and Mesa Grill once for dinner. Spago is in the Forum Shops. It's great because you can sit and people watch. Service is incrediable, food is great. Mesa Grill was overpriced for what you get. We had a really great corn soup, but we had a bone in ribeye which honestly was really bad. Shame on you Bobby Flay. All in all Caesars is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: sioski86
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace was amazing...the stuff were helpful and Friendly and really couldnt do enough for us!!...We stayed here for 4 nights on our honeymoon and had the most amazing time (looking to go back next year)..!!..We stayed in the Augustus tower and the room was much bigger than we expected with twin showers two bathrooms and a Jacuzzi..!!..It was cleaned every day and the view from our room over looked the pool area!! If i had to complain about one thing it would be that on our 1st day we went for a massage at the spa in Caesars (lovely amazing new spa)...but we were 2 minutes late (if that) and the receptionist was very rude and snobby about this (if we were 20 minutes late then yes i can see why)...massage was lovely and the guy (think his name was Greg) who gave me a massge was so very sweet!!..But this is just a tiny little thing and didnt effect our stay here!! I would very much recommend staying here if you are looking at going to Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “First Time Is A Charm”
Reviews.Author: mymisfit
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Augustus tower for 5 nights, loved the room. Arrived to hotel at about 11 a.m. on Monday Sept. 19, 2011. Check in line was very short, only one person in front of me. I was scheduled to be in the Fourm Tower but gave a small tip to the gentleman checking me in and was placed in the Augustus Tower with the most wonderful view I have ever had of Vegas. He gave me a room on the 40th. floor and I have never stayed in a hotel room as quite as this. The 5 days I was there the only noise I ever heard was maybe a door close in the hallway once in awhile and of course the outside noise, but you can't stop that. Housekeeping was amazing, just left them a tip everyday and anything I asked them for they were always there to help me out. Let's face it, Vegas runs on tips, if you want alittle extra you have to be willing to give alittle extra. Think I slept better in this room then I have ever slept in any room I have stayed in Vegas, the bed was great. Everyone I came across that works there was very nice, and usually had a smile on their face. It can't be easy to deal with as many people as they have to everyday and keep that smile. And I for one enjoy seeing people smile. So thank you Caesars for the great stay, and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: MRH800
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms, quite comfy, well cleaned.... to tell you the truth as it is expectable

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...”
Reviews.Author: lisalefteye
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at Caesars Palace with my boyfriend in September. We stayed in a forum tower deluxe room. I checked in at 11am on a Thursday of a busy weekend and check in lines were long - but there was a member of staff keeping the lines in order and another giving out bottles of water so the half hour wait passed quickly. We were checked in by Alan who was very pleasant and efficient. I asked for a nice view and he stated that he would try his best. Our room was not ready so we left our bags with the bell desk. We called back to a separate MUCH shorter line at 3pm called "keys and mail" and were off to our room in minutes. The room was very nice. As you entered the bathroom was to your right. It had a large frosted glass shower with two rain shower heads. It had a large vanity area with sink, large mirror, with built in tv (which you controlled from a panel on the wall). There was a separate toilet area with it's own door. The closet was also located in the bathroom - adequate size with built in safe. The bathroom products were good and there was also a hair dryer and lighted magnifying mirror. The bedroom was well appointed with king size bed with mirrored head board. The bed was very comfortable and the bedding was of good quality. There was a desk and flat screen tv. Under the window was a small sofa and arm chair with desk. There was also two full length mirrors in the room, which were useful. The decor was to my taste and the room was spotless every day. The view from the room was partially of another tower, partially of the eiffel tower. Facilities at the hotel are vast, numerous bars, restaurants and shops which I won't go into detail about, you can check them out on the hotel website or here on TA. I visited many other hotels during my trip and Caesars was my favourite. It's a beautiful hotel, at every turn there's a more impressive fountain or statue. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It seemed to attract a mixed crowd, old and young and the casino areas were beautiful. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Pick the Towers and wear your comfy shoes!”
Reviews.Author: asiapointriders
Reviews.Content: I have been at Caesar's Palace for the past 5 days, 2 more to go! Palace rooms are large, spacious, with a double walk-in shower and huge jacuzzi tub. You might want to bring your own mini-coffeemaker and bag of Starbucks. It is a looooong way to a coffee shop and the room service pods are $12 for 4. I can drink all 4 paper cups cups in a morning, so I bring my own. Higher floors have nice views but mine had lower water pressure. If effcient flushing and brisk showers matter, consider a lower floor. If you are with a conference, beware the "Do Not Disturb" signs on the doorknob are meaningless to hotel staff. At least 4 of my colleagues had their DND sign ignored by the Amenity Fairy dropping off a welcome gift. If DND matters to you, bolt the door from the inside but if you are in your meeting, well...I can't help you. Pool is lovely and LOUD. this is wonderful if you are down there with your little umbrella drink soaking up the sun in party mood. If you are stuck in a meeting, like me, trying to concentrate...hey, that music will put you in a travel kind of mind so why not see what's up on TripAdvisor? (grin) My experience has been 72 degrees and flourescent 16 hours/day but there is much to see in the Forum Shops, if you can find your way out of the hotel. The signage is tad crooked, so arrows pointing generally that-a-way are about as much help as the Cheshire Cat.The staff is used to it though; hunt up a uniform and tell them where you want to go. Free drinks in the casino at the slots are quite diluted, but they're free so what do you expect? Staff is friendly and helpful. have a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Love it !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jacky417
Reviews.Content: Great service, love the food, We had an amazing weekend there. Stayed at Palace Tower with pool view and we fall in love of it. We will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “HAS BEEN GREAT FOR MANY YEARS !”
Reviews.Author: MISTERBALI
Reviews.Content: When I first visited Vegas in 1957, Caesar's had not yet been built. Since then, I've stayed there many, many times along with a wide variety of other places, all of which offered casinos as well as rooms. Years ago, I used to stay at non-Harrah's group properties, but since joining the Total Rewards program, I found the benefits so valuable, I simply stay at one of their properties. Harrah's owns quite a few casino-hotels around the U.S. and many in Vegas, not all of which are as nice as Caesar's. For a complete listing, go to www.Harrah's.com, which also explains the benefits available to gamblers who join the program; the more one gambles (puts at risk of loss), the greater the benefits. For anyone who views gambling as sinful or undesirable, they should avoid staying at a casino-hotel in the first place as that activity is unavoidable. This review is not to promote gambling, but rather only to point out to those interested in it, the substantial side benefits available to participants. Harrah's and most "gaming" enterprises, as those businesses call themselves, also counsel their customers not to put at risk any funds which one's financial circumstances should not be affordable as entertainment value. They also offer an 800 number for those who see gambling as becoming addictive or unwise for them.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD SERVICE - AVOID THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SalinaAthens_Greece
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ceasars Palace last August (8/14 – 8/21). We booked our room 3 months ago, directly with the hotel. After reading a lot of reviews I asked the lady at the phone to book my room only if they had availability in Augustus Tower. She told me that it was OK so I booked a Premium room with Bellagio View. We arrived at the hotel at about 10 am but the lady at the front desk told us that we cannot make the check in before 3 pm. (The front desk at the time was totally empty). Anyway, I asked her at least to check our reservation, to verify that everything was OK. She agreed, but she was not pleasant, and then she told me that we had a reservation at ROMAN Tower. I had a prepay reservation (total 1.800$) for Augustus Tower when a room in ROMAN Tower costs about 800 $ for the same nights. She tried to tell me that when you book a room at Ceasars they could give you room in any available Tower. If this is the case then, I believe that all the rooms should have the same price. We were very tired, after a 30 hours trip from Europe, but I was no ready to accept that attitude, so I asked for the manager. She came after 30 minutes, she checked the computer and she told me That they were fully booked and they have room only in ROMAN Tower. At that moment I remembered the reviews from TripAdvisor about the 20 $ tip and I slept to her a 20 $ and Oh my God!! She just found a nice room for us in Augustus Tower with Bellagio view. This is totally unacceptable from a hotel with this reputation, like you are in a hotel in Congo. Anyway we went to our room, which was nice, and we asked for our luggages. They arrived and two of them were broken, one very bad. We complaint to the front desk. He ask if we wanted to file a complaint with the security and when the inspector arrives, after a week, he will make an investigation to find out who did it. I found this very nice us a jock so we did nothing, we just decided to never stay at Ceasars again. The whole week we stayed there we did not see security at all. Even late at night nobody checked keys at the elevators, us they do at other hotels. This hotel is full of Prostitutes and they do nothing about it. We stayed at MIRAGE next week and we did not pass the elevator once without checking our keys by the security. Last but not least we had their TOTAL REWARDS Card. We spend, during our stay, about 2.000 -3.000$ at the Casino. The night before we leave we asked if we have some rewards and OUAOU!! my husband had 6$ and I had 3$ reward. We spend half the money when we stayed at Treasure Island and our rewards were about 160$ from food and 2 nights free of charge. And with that good memory we left Ceasars FOR EVER!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ann889
Reviews.Content: Pet friendly hotel. But must pay extra fee. Staff very friendly and Accomm

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: JFsB
Reviews.Content: Stayed to attend a conference that was on site; the conference organization negotiated a deal, so my perception of value may skew in favor of the hotel. Unlike some fellow reviewers, check in was very efficient, and the front desk clerk was helpful in pointing out where things were. The room itself was spacious, comfortable and spotlessly clean. The bathroom is generously sized with double sinks, jacuzzi tub and the shower had fantastic water pressure. Appreciated the many dining options (best stuffed baked potato ever at the BBQ place in Cypress Street Marketplace), representing both a vast selection of cuisines and price ranges. On the whole, I would heartily recommend for business.

Reviews.Title: “much better than expected !!”
Reviews.Author: janiepoos
Reviews.Content: was a bit anxious about going after reading all the negative reviews - well, I NEEDN'T HAVE BEEN !! Everything was great. We arrived, and were seen almost straightaway at check-in. Tried the "$20 tip trick", it didn't work, so I kept the money. However, we were given a deluxe room in the forum tower, with a phone in the toilet, a TV in the bathroom mirror, and the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in !! Staff were helpful. Slots were tight (no surpirise there). We went and checked out the other hotels. Got to say, in my honest opinion, Caesars Palace is the best !! Restaurants, well, we went to Mesa Grill, great, Beijing Noodle good, Payards nice, Cheesecake factory good-sized portions,but we went to Mon Ami Gabi (Paris) one night - the best steak ever, and I'm fussy with my food !! Had a great time here with my husband and daughter (they were celebrating their birthdays out there). Would we go back to vegas - the answer is yes, we would. Would we stay at Caesars Palace again? - Like a shot - infact we wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “One of the popular places but little quality service.”
Reviews.Author: Aaroncox
Reviews.Content: Its a nice place to stay and one of thew most popular places but the service is not so good and by this I mean the personel,I think some of them are abit rude.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: nando2
Reviews.Content: Nothing to point out negatively, except that the front desk could be a bit more quicker.Anyway, we stayed at a hotel at the Caesar Tower, and we were ravished: wonderful area, wonderful bathroom, with jacuzzi, shower toilet, a wonderful mini-bar and tv, wonderful sights, and a wonderful gigantic bed. As to the hotel facilities, a must!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fun!”
Reviews.Author: NoriW
Reviews.Content: Went for a hen weekend- the room was comfortable, with huge giant beds, and excellent stocked mini bar. Was a tad surprised that on a Thursday evening at 1am- we could find nowhere open (RESTAURANT) to dine in the hotel. I know it was a weekday- but in the CITY THAT NEVER SLEEPS! Didnt spend much time in the hotel- so cant comment on much else

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a Vegas staple”
Reviews.Author: kfraher
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I were staying in Caesar's this last weekend and were appalled at the poor service. Our night started by standing at the front desk for 20 minutes waiting to check in behind a family only to be told once we stepped up that the hotel clerk's shift was over. Wow thanks for letting me stand here and waste my time in this line only to have to go and wait in another one. Then when we finally start to check in we are quoted room prices that are $30 more per night than what was confirmed in an email. Luckily we had the email on hand and they corrected it, but it left a bad taste in my mouth like I was being scammed. Our first night we stayed in the Roman tower which must be one of the oldest because it was very outdated. It was clean but very run down, you had to pay to use the safe (????). I would have said that it reminded me of a Motel 6, the bathroom tub was chipped, the room was small, I mean we could have saved a $100 and stayed across the street at Imperial. However, one of our friends requested an upgrade and Caesar's did accommodate us (YEAH!!) which was extremely nice of them but appropriate as well, and the new room in the Palace tower was awesome, and what I felt was more on par with a nice hotel in Vegas. We booked the Mesa Grill through the Caesar's booking company for a party of 12 several months in advance even calling the week before our trip to confirm the reservation. We booked for Friday night, we get a late voicemail (due to flying) on Thursday that they were expecting us that night. Friday morning we called to sort the reservation out and sure enough they made a mistake and got the reservation wrong. So now we have no reservation for Mesa Grill, it's Friday morning and we have to come up with a place for 12 people to eat dinner Friday night. So instead of creating a reservation for us at Mesa Grill we were told that the only place that would take us is Nero's. I'm sorry but if I have a reservation for 12 people booked months in advance and you screw it up at least buy me a bottle of wine, especially if I'm forced to go somewhere I don't really want to out of desperation. So the next day I had a cabana reserved at the pool for my party. We were told to get there at 9am to confirm and hold the cabana, which we did. We waited an hour and a half to order our first drink because one of the cocktail waitresses called in, and the other thought her shift started an hour later. What are we on island time or something? I didn't get the memo. We were told we were not allowed to order at the bar because they can't transfer it to the cabana...whatever... basically we pay over a $1000 for cabana service to stand around for 2 hours waiting on a waitress to order a drink when we could have spent nothing and gotten the drinks ourselves. Our cabana got restocked once but we were there for around 6 hours and no one took out the trash or cleaned up any old cups. Oh and we stupidly locked ourselves out of our safe and it took someone 3 hours to get there and open it in 3 seconds. Really? I expected a lot more from Caesar's, the location is prime, but I think it's gotten too big to give exceptional service to the number of guests that stay there, and they are charging way too much for terrible service. For the same price there are many other options on the strip, and I will not give any more of my money to Caesar's Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Grand As Imagined”
Reviews.Author: cuetxpie
Reviews.Content: This review is for the hotel & pool only (excluding the Forum and casino floors): We got a comp room in the Forum Tower. For some reason, I always imagined Cesar's room to be magnificent and grandeur. But sad to say, it was just any other room. I was not going " Wooo " and " Ahhh" like I thought I would be when I opened the door. The sleeping area was very spacious. The beds were comfortable. The blinds were dark enough to make the room pitch black (a MUST when I want to get some shut eye!). You got your standard desk, chair, closet w/safe, and television (that for some reason the remote decided to stop functioning and we were unable to turn off the television; there was no off button on the TV). The restroom was very roomy as well. It had a 2 sink counter, standing shower, and a separate jacuzzi bathtub. The toilet was off to the side in a room by itself, which freed up the rest of the bathroom to be used when the toilet was occupied. The only thing bad about the restroom was that the hair dryer didnt work. We had an opportunity to visit the pool on Sunday morning. There were a good amount of people there at 9am. They had multiple pools. All great for splashing around, but definitely not meant for a workout swim :)

Reviews.Title: “Still shining after all this time”
Reviews.Author: FierceTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on business, and was very impressed overall witht he quality of this place. The casino area shows some signs of aging but the rooms have been renovated for the most part and you still feel the mystic of being in such traditional hotel. The Hotel is very well located, right on the center of this, you can basically walk to a bunch of hotels and restaurants. Check in was fast and were given a complementary upgrade to a tower suite facing the pools and the Bellagio on a very high floor. Room was extremely big, with very nice decor. bathroom was huge with separate shower and tub, 2 sinks and plenty of space to wonder around. There are 2 flat screens, and all the amenities you would expect from a Hotel of this stature. The restaurants are great and there are some of the best stores in all of Vegas at the Forum Shops. Service is still very good even though they have Unions on everything. Pools are nice, one of them topless. I would recommend this Hotel if you want a Vegas down to earth experience and dont want to feel chic. On the other hand, it is never cheap so you could stay for the same amount at the Aria, Wynn, Bellagio, Palazzo or Cosmopolitan, all of them better options for the price.

Reviews.Title: “tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: hildales
Reviews.Content: we had to request a new room after being given a very tired and obviously old room which smelt as if a stag party had been held in it. The hotel upgraded us free of charge but still was nowhere as nice or spacious as the Venetion we stayed at last time for a cheaper price.The management need to refurbish the old rooms which i suspect havent been done for a long time. For a 5* hotel not good Caesars Palace. We wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for group attending wedding”
Reviews.Author: midwestbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: Got upgrade to a jr suite in Palace Tower since it was our anniv & hubby frequents this hotel(we know to avoid the old rooms). Large, well-appointed rm in modern minimalist decor w/couch & seating area - loads of closets, separate vanity outside bathroom w/make-up mirror, 1.5 baths--each w/large vanity but shared shower, 1 w/whirpool bath - great pool view requested. Could walk from elevator doors to pool area in a few min and wedding garden just outside those doors. Lovely setting for wedding--did great job on food at reception: beautiful sushi/seafood/fruit displays w/chicken/beef on skewers. Bobby Flay's restaurant = superb dinner. Room service quick & food proper temps. Loads of towels/ toiletries & very clean. Most people know giant pool area is wonderful w/loads of cushioned chairs to rent & we had great service in cabana day after weddding w/very lg group. Only negatives: $23 for lg drink at pool ridiculous -- cab line would go faster if 2 taxis could pull up at same time - getting general areas on 1st fl difficult w/all the add-ons over the yrs--not a straight shot to walk anywhere -- long way to Augustus Tower to use workout rm which costs $25 day per person! Would stay again for a wknd that was mainy for pool lounging and great dinners. Oh, I did win on slots--seem looser than other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable Beds, Poor Shower”
Reviews.Author: anmold
Reviews.Content: I unfortunately stayed in one of the older rooms at Caesars, and was very disappointed. I had to change rooms because the bed was so uncomfortable....only to be moved to a bed that was no better. I was told all the rooms were going to have the same type of bed....to get a better bed I would need to upgrade. I offered to pay for an upgrade to get into a better room, but the only one was was available was $500 more...a price I was unwilling to pay. To me, a hotel is only as good as it's bed and it's shower. The shower was the same quality as the bed...poor. While in the room I felt like I was staying at the Motel 6 and not the Majestic Caesar's Palace. Next time, I'm staying at the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit to Caesar's not so good”
Reviews.Author: sleepinjesus
Reviews.Content: I booked thru one of the best known vacation web sites. I upgraded the room several steps up. They stuck us in a room that was old, overlooked the parking garage and was not very clean looking. I thought that we were in the Imperial Palace. Yuck. We did make a call down to let them know what we thought and the reply was It's the only room we have. Oh well. Live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Crosby07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars with my husband and two other couples. We booked a deluxe room and told them it was my Birthday and our first time to Vegas and got upgraded to an amazing Junior Suite in the Augustus Tower with a fabulous view. We got there at 11 am and it was too early to check in so we checked our bags and hit the strip! We came back around 3 and checked in. It took about 15 mins. Housekeeping did a good job straightening up our room and giving us fresh towels and we made sure to tip everyday. The concierge gave us passes to PURE and one of the staff even got us on the VIP guest list at Marquee, which was amazing!!!!! We also rented a cabana at the Neptune pool and had a fabulous time!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Palace on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: gao1014
Reviews.Content: I have to let you all know that before this trip, I really wasn't a Vegas person. This was actually a last minute switch, as we were originally scheduled to go to New Orleans on Labor Day. My mind (and taste buds) were already salivating over Oysters, Crawdads and Beignets. Unfortunately, there was a storm named Lee which sprung up suddenly in the Gulf and was due to hit New Orleans the day we arrived. No thank you. Eating the foods of the Gods is one thing, doing it under 10" of rain, quite another. Fortunately, our travel agent was able to make the switch, get us great airfare and a good deal at Caesars. ***I have always tried to make travel arrangements myself, figuring that I could always get a better deal. This trip taught me a great lesson. Only a good agent would have been able to make this switch and save a vacation. We use AMEX Travel and it pays...in more than one way. We arrived in Vegas the day before Labor Day and was greeted with a temperature of 104. Low humidity? Right. It's hot. Don't let anyone tell you different. In fact, the thermometer went below 100 only once during our stay. I was so glad I brought my Shearling.. :). Anyway, during our check-in, we found out that we could up-grade our room for only $30/day. This would be a room almost doubled in size. I negotiated the rate down to $20/day. Tip - Always, always try to get the price lower. The only thing they can say is no. I saved $70.00 by doing this, which went towards a great lunch at Bobby Flay's restaurant. The room was great...However, the bed was not a King as we were told. Well, in their eyes it was a King, but not ours. We were, however, able to change to another room with 2 Queens and a double bathroom. Hmm. Maybe I should have complained again and we could have gotten a suite. No...This was fine. You have to learn when to push it and when to stay quiet. The room also had a nice sized flat screen T.V. (important to us). If you're not into walking...do yourself a favor and don't stay here (or at any Hotel/Casino on the strip. Caesars was huge..I mean it was a 1/4 mile walk from the room to the Casino. But I have to tell you that my wife and I were impressed. The place was great. The staff were helpful and aimed to please. I have a bad back and leg and after walking through a number of shopping places, I couldn't get back all the way to my room. Within 5 minutes, a security guard arrived with a wheelchair and took me all the way to the room. I don't care if it has wheels or not; I not a small guy and this was a workout for the guard. But he was very personable, chatted up a storm and was concerned that I was able to get out of the chair and into the room. Was my wife upset? No...She was off to the penny slots. All of the Hotels have their own shopping malls, but the Forum shops at Caesars took it to another level. The stores were all high quality, interesting and well laid out. Yes, it was another walking marathon, but it was well worth it. Are the prices discounted? Of course not...But trust me. The Forum is great to walk through even though you don't purchase anything. Again, every Hotel has its' own celebrity restaurants and Caesars was no exception. Once again, the prices were high (well, very high) but the portions were mammouth and we ended up sharing just one entree and we were stuffed. You can't take it with you so it's a great idea to share. Lowers the price and gives you the opportunity to dine at great places. Also, we're not gamblers..thank God...We paid for everything which is just fine. I don't have to lose $1,000.00 and get a dinner on them, thank you very much. We lucked out in that it was Restaurant Week and every celebrity place had its' own special. At Mesa, we were able to have a price fixed lunch for $30/person. It was fabulous and we were not hungry for the rest of the day. Another meal found us at Beijing 9, a small place right off the Casino. The decor was very pleasing...large aquarium tanks filled with goldfish. They also made their own noodles out in the open. Quite entertaining. No review of a Vegas hotel is complete without talking about the Casino. Again, we are not gamblers, but we do love to play the penny slots. Caesars had at least two different Casinos which were loaded with penny slots. We only wagered $.40 per spin and were able to play a couple of hours each time we sat down. Yes, we won. Not a lot, but at least $15-20 per day. What a great time. We budgeted ourselves to no more than $20 per machine. If we lost, we went to another. I didn't realize this but coins are no longer used. When you're done and cash out, they print you a ticket which you can later exchange for money at a certain machine, or use to play again. During our stay, we never cashed out a ticket, but waited until the day we left. It was kind of a game for us to see how much we could accumulate. Oh yeah...Don't forget to take out all of your tickets at the end. On the way to the airport, my wife discovered a $20 ticket that was in her pocketbook. Fortunately, the cabbie was kind enough to take the ticket in lieu of cash..But what a tip she was left. Finally, know this. Las Vegas is just not about the Strip. We rented a car for a couple of days and had a fantastic time driving around. We went to Hoover Dam and drove through Red Rock Canyon. We even went down to the Pawn Shop that is featured in Pawn Stars (what a disappointment that place was.) Renting the car was a great idea. There is a lot to see outside of the Strip and it breaks up the monotony of going from one Casino to the next. We stayed for one week and never thought that we were bored. Next time you go to Las Vegas, stay at Caesars. You will feel like an Emperor

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace Classic Hotel in Las Vegas, NV”
Reviews.Author: Steves557
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms and service were impeccable. Every member of the staff from Bellhops to Management were there to service our every need. In such a grand hotel, I thought a need for road bicycle storage may have been a issue, but they made every effort to accomodate my needs and did it with a smile. I was able to visit the Caesar's Coliseum and see Rod Stewart in concert. The show was spectacular and the every seat had an excellent view. On my next visit to LV, I will surely plan to stay again at Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelulu77
Reviews.Content: So we arrived in Las Vegas. It was my husband's first time in Vegas. Since it was the same weekend as CES and other major events, when we arrived at Caesars, the lady at the front desk told us we can stay there for two nights but we'd have to move to a sister hotel for the other two nights. We declined since we had paid for the trip to stay exclusively at Caesars. She went on to say there was some sort of flooding in some of the rooms. We still declined. Glad we did. Our room was just fine. The stores and restaurants in the hotel were great. We had no problems, except for the fact our door to our hotel room not locking properly. Thankfully, we alerted housekeeping and were told someone would come up and fix it. Sure enough, they did. The room itself was clean and well kept. The view was amazing, we were facing the pools. The bed, after a long day of walking along the strip, was so soft and comfortable. The hotel is pretty much on the centre of the strip and is a good choice. It can be costly but if you find a good deal, it is worth staying there. All in all, it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty without substance”
Reviews.Author: texaspath
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was a Christmas present from my son. The statues are beautiful, pool area breathtaking. It was clean. all restuarants were crowded. Shopping was great! Staff was not helpful or friendly. Room service was pricey. I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Best..”
Reviews.Author: bgib21
Reviews.Content: If you are going to do it right in Vegas, stay at Caesars. It's just the best. From the facilities, to the rooms, and to top it all off, the pool. You don't get any better than their pool. All you need is you room key and your in. If you plan on laying out at the pool most of the day, I'd get their early, 9ish, to reserve a seat because they fill up really fast. Drinks are pretty expensive, but as for the special deals and your waitress will hook you up. If you're on a budget, but want to stay somewhere nice, go with Caesars, but just gamble somewhere else because their tables are very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WallabyGold
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in one of the rooms in the Forum tower. First up the room was great, clean, modern and very comfortable. It's vegas, and it's a big hotel, so you expect it to be expensive (hey if i wanted to save I would have gone to the Riviera) but it wasn't over the top so like the Wynn. I thought it was a very good middle/upper level Vegas Hotel. Location wise it's fantastic, your right in the middle of the strip and can get around very easily. The pools were great, but very busy - here is a tip, if your looking for a sun lounger and there is just a towel on it but no belongings, feel free to take the towel off and move your stuff in. We were told this by one of the attendants by the pool on the first day when we couldn't find seats. We didnt use hte hotel facilities much beyond the pool, so cant really comment on that, but I certainly had no problems at all, it was a great palace to stay and I suspect I will stay there on my next trip to vegas! Tip - If your not a big gambler like me head over the road to the Flamingo where there are a lot of $10 tables. $15 seemed to be the minimum at Caesers....

Reviews.Title: “Pampered”
Reviews.Author: IowaTraveler50021
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a long weekend to get pampered and Caesars delivered. Our room was in the Palace Towers, overlooking the pools, and was amazing (two bathrooms!) The service was top notch and there are SO MANY options for things to do, from great shopping to restaurants to clubs, without leaving the hotel. If you want to spend time at the pool, definitely stay in the Palace Tower, as other rooms would take you through the casino. Definitely arrange ($$) for a daybed at the pools. Also - if you are flexble on when you go, there is a wide range of per night charges, and you can get great deals if your date is flexible. I'm going to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Rid Stewart”
Reviews.Author: Formulaonefans
Reviews.Content: Saw Rod Stewart perform here on7th sept . One word fabulous

Reviews.Title: “Room Was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: skoala
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Tuesday afternoon and had a very nice clerk. We had reserved a palace tower room and he must have upgraded us to the palace tower premium room. WOW! It had 2 bathrooms with a connecting shower and a jetted tub(HEAVEN). The view was of the pools which was great. We had family staying at Bally's so we didn't stay at Caesar's very much since we were so busy doing other things.. If you are a pool person then stay in the Palace Tower. It is so close! I went to the pool every day. Luckily I'm on east coast time so I was down there by 8:30 and could get my favorite chair. The chairs do fill up quickly though. During the week they don't open all of the pools and they don't check ID or ask if you have food or beverage with you, but on Friday they do all of those things. They also open all of the pools. I loved our room and the pools but I didn't like the casino vibe. The slot machines are very close to each other and it is crowded and really loud. I'm not like most people. I prefer a more sedate area. I have stayed at the Wynn and that is my favorite hotel but Caesar's is a close second. I would stay here again if the price was right. We had a great deal where the room was only $110 a night.

Reviews.Title: “great vegas hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: delacourt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a whole week at caesars palace (sat - sat) so saw both sides to the hotel. The weekends are really party party pretty college kids, service goes down unless you pay extra and things like pool cabanas go up in price. Plus you have to start proving you are actually staying in the hotel something you don't have to do during the week when the hotel is mainly full of conferences. On the whole it is a good hotel with quality restaurants and a nice pool area (though not much shade). The rooms are of a reasonable size and nicely decorated. The hotel is kept very clean. Yes it's a huge hotel but that is Vegas, everything to excess. I would recommend this hotel to friends, I probably wouldn't stay here again mainly just cause i'd try one of the other many hotels that are available in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal, But Some Maintenance Issues”
Reviews.Author: MemphisProfessor
Reviews.Content: Caesar's is Caesar's! Everything you expect in a Vegas casino, and then some. When I checked in, I asked if an upgrade was possible. Was offered a 1400 square foot suite which normally goes for $1,500 a night, at least according to the clerk, for an extra $150 a night over my average booking at about $115 a night. I said no, I think I'll stick with what I have. He replied, how about $100 a night extra? I said DONE! The suite was beautiful. Dining area for 6, living area for many more, guest bathroom, beautiful master bedroom, great master bath with Jacquzzi, TV built in to the mirror, great shower, etc. Great view. Very comfortable. Was there for 5 nights. So what is wrong? Upon arrival, the LCD TV in the living area had no sound and the phones would not work. Called for help. About 2 hours later, someone came and fixed the TV. The fix lasted four days. About 3 hours later and after several phone calls made with my cell phone because the room phones would not work, someone came, changed out the instrument. It was better for a bit and then deteriorated again. I finally gave up on the phone. Next problem was the guest bathroom. When I entered it for the first time I found that the commode had, evidently, not been working correctly. They did fix that, but one would have thought that the cleaning folks would have noticed it and reported it before I even checked in. The cleaning was erratic. Some days they did fine. Others they didn't replace the glasses they removed, did not clean out the ice bucket, etc. Don't misunderstand. I loved the deal and overall was pretty happy with what I got for my money. Just a shame that they overlooked the little details that might have made it spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Tons of Fun, But it Will Cost You”
Reviews.Author: Jonny_Midnight
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I spent five nights at Caesars Palace in late March. We booked the run-of-the-house king bed room, and while we had absolutley no view, the room was large and fairly comfortable. It really is all you need in Vegas since you really won't be spending a whole lot time there. Caesars is in an execellent location and actually contains enough variety in resaurants, shops (above and below ground), casino space, clubs, etc that you almost have no need to leave the Palace. However, by far the most inviting aspect of Caesars is the pool area. Few swimming pools have as much grandeur! With its Roman columns, statues and fountains all colored in gold and white with clear blue waters, it is without a doubt the hotels centerpiece. This is where we spent most of our daylight hours. And the weather was perfect! And if you are feeling a bit more daring, there is the adult-only, European-style Venus Pool. We loved this pool! For the most part it was quiet and very relaxing. Guy/girl ratio was usually close to 50/50 overall (would vary by time of day). Everyone was very cool and laidback. It really only got "busy" on the weekend after noon...during the week it was only moderately busy. The only complaints we had were that bar service was understaffed for the weekend crowds and the prices were certainly top-shelf, even if the drinks weren't. Even though we did venture out at night to various shows around Vegas, we really enjoyed all that Caesars has to offer. The undergound mall, the choices for dining and nighttime entertainment are more than sufficient. Staff was always courteous and the hotel clean and well-maintained. We can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Start to Finish”
Reviews.Author: kevem
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Caesars. I was there for 5 days for a business conference and I was thoroughly impressed with the facility, the staff, and the overall spectacle of the resort. I just kept remarking how immense and all inclusive the property is. With 5 star restaurants, excellent pool area, and amazing convention facilities they hit a home run in my book. Caesars is not a budget choice, but if you do have the means, I highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “A-mazing Room”
Reviews.Author: simonfinds
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for 3 nights in August for a conference and was randomly put in the Augustus Tower...what a lucky thing for me!
