Conference attendees paid a discounted rate, but not all of us were placed in Augustus, so I don't know if there is a general upcharge for this tower. If the rates are all the same...CHOOSE AUGUSTUS! CLEAN, HUGE, comfortable bed, good pillows...amazing bathroom! Had I been there for other than a conference, I would not have wanted to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myakkalady
Reviews.Content: We purchased a Southwest Vacation pkg. and chose Caesar's as we had tickets for Rod Stewart and didn't want hassle of cabs to/from show. Never stayed at Caesar's so very excited to stay at hotel. Massive crowds checking in and our check in was very easy and smooth. Rioom was in Roman Tower. Very clean room but that area of rooms needs to definitely be closed and updated. There is no resort fee but there are pros and cons about that. No free anything including the in room safe...hard to believe. The bathroom shower area had no liner so when you showered the curtain would hug you...mildew around tub grout. Matress needed to be thrown out. Only good thing about the area was it was quiet for two nights at least. Lesson be learned that you need to "upgrade" when you purchase pkg. but always had good luck keeping the type room offered at other destinations. We had breakfast in Nero's each day and food was good. Last day "orange juice" on bill... we told server we didn't have it. Waitress came right back and said you did....got manager...that was table next to us. Glass we had was cereal milk....hate when someone challenges a guest. After Rod's show we ate at Spago's and food was excellent. Used Show Time shuttle service ($13. rd. trip) we bought thru South West pkg. from/to airport. Right on time. No waiting in line for a cab. We are going back to Vegas in Sept. and have chosen another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a palace anymore”
Reviews.Author: TiPi35
Reviews.Content: For our fourth time at the Caesar Palace, we were so enthusiastic while booking. But the front desk was unfriendly. The room (at the Palace Tower) she gave us was ok but not as good as last time (Augustus Tower) Pool is too small for such a resort and if you don't want to pay at least $100 we may not have a chair. Next time we will try a better hotel. Caesar Palace is over for us.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: atrd86
Reviews.Content: I was blown away having never been to Vegas before! This hotel is truly amazing and the Pool could be an attraction in itself! I only stayed two nights but we did a lot of walking around and you could spend a whole 12hrs just checking out this one Hotel with its endless array of shops and restaurants with statues, paintings and displays everywhere. I'm 25yrs old and a friend and I went on a last minute weekend trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A real 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: karol_michel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are just coming back from our first time in Las Vegas. We spent the week (sept. 3rd - 10th) at the Cesaer's Palace. Check-in: The check-in process is very simple and fast. Once you gave your credit card and basic information, they will give you your room keys and direction to the proper towers. Speaking of finding your tower, be prepare for a good walk! Room: We were staying in the Palace tower on the 19th floor with a view on the pools. There are 5 pools, including a more private/adult one called Venus. The size of the room is very nice with all the commodities you can want. The bathroom is very large with a shower big enough for two. You have to be very careful with the minibar as it is electronically connected to your room number for any charges. In another way, as soon as you remove something from the shelf, the charge is instant. Restaurants: There are so many of them scatter everywhere. There is a huge buffet open until late in the evening, many small coffee shops, specialty restaurants for all the tastes. In any case you don't find what you're looking for, you can cross the streets and go the any other ones found in others hotels. Prices ranges from cheap to extremely expensive. Location: The Cesaer's Palace is nicely located in the middle of the strip. You have an almost direct access to the Bellagio, Bally, Mirage and Flamingo. In a walking distance, you can get to the Monorail that goes between the MGM and the old Sahara. There is also two buses that stops in front of the hotel. Even if there are many options for going from place to place (taxi, bus, tram and monorail), bring a good pair of walking shoes. Even if you know you'll be walking, it's nothing compare to what you'll really do. With the monorail, tram and bus you can purchase a 3 days pass (24hrs day) which is really useful to go around. Shopping: Are you ready to spend some money? If the answer is yes, you have a direct access to the Forum Shops with more than 160 boutiques. The Fashion Show Mall is just minutes away from the hotel. Casino: the only thing I can say is you'll find and available spot 24/7. When playing, the drinks are free and delivered by a very fast personnel. For the smoking people, this is allowed in the casino's sections only. Nightlife: Las Vegas is the city that never sleep. Nightclubs, bars and lounges are found everywhere and the usual crouwd. Some of the bars are open 24hrs. If you thinking about attending some of the numerous shows in the evening, allow a minimum of 1 hour to get there; people and traffic will slow you down. Overall, we enjoy our stay at the Cesaer's Palace and we recommend it to anyone. It's a true 5 stars hotel/resort with good deals available on the Internet with some researches.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: pkouzm
Reviews.Content: They check in starting only at 4 PM. It is said in confirmation they sent me. But in fact even at 4 pm they didn't check us in because "we don't have clean rooms now, leave your phone number we'll call you when it is ready". After some time we can't wait any more and insisted to give us a room. They do, when we saw the room we were shocked - no door between main room and bathroom, and ugly view to roof of other building from window... We asked to change room, because it is ridiculous not having door to lavatory, and they change the room. It had door, but it has smoke smell though it was non-smoking. Just one meter from window there was ... wall of other hotel building - you can't even understand what is the weather - is it sunny or not because you see nothing except the wall...

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Marie-LouiseJ
Reviews.Content: We had made a reservation for a non-smoking room. At the arrival we were asked if we would like to upgrade our room - we said no. We had paid 230 $ for a standard room. The room was really nice, but it really had a smell of smoke! :( They had to clean it, which took an hour. At check-out we were charged almost 50 $ (!) for wifi!!! They said it was because we had used 3 devices to go online which was true, but we were NEVER told that we would be charged per item! Really bad service. The hotel is way too big. We will never stay there again and wont recommend it! Only positive thing was the room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: bonzaAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed aug 22 to 1st sept. Beautiful room, staff really nice. No check in queue, the only downside was the buffet - it was a bit ordinary. Forum shops terrific, must do the cheescake factory. All in all brilliant

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace, Still the Class of Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: GDSROCK
Reviews.Content: On aug. 21st my wife and I met our friends at Caesars Palace for 6 nights. We stayed at Caesar's because we were comped through our Total Rewards card. The place is really fabulous! The only problem we encountered was we arrived late about 10:30pm and we booked a room in the Forum tower and when we checked in we were given a room in the Centurion tower. The room was ok for one of the other Harrah's properties but not Caesar Palace as I told the front desk clerk. We were told it was because we arrived late and we stayed there 1 night and changed to the Forum tower the following day, and it was well worth the change. The Fourm rooms are what we expected form Caesars. Very nice room with very modern amenities. Not a great view, but an awesome room! On monday my friend rented a cabana at one of the pools and it was top notch! The pools were all nice and not over crowded like some of the other Vegas pools I have been at. The cabana was a little pricey but very nice and relaxing. Never ate at any of the restaurants only the buffet and it was alot of money compared to other comparable buffets and nothing special. They do have a nice food court where you can get about anything you want. The Munch Bar was a nice place for a burger or a light meal. The casino is still classic old Vegas with a very modern touch of new Vegas. Perfect! Did not see any shows at Caesars, but did see David Copperfield at MGM and it is was a great show! Like I said before, there are plenty of nice hotels in Vegas, but Caesars Palace is still the class of Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - will definately come back.”
Reviews.Author: slg40
Reviews.Content: We (family & friends) stayed at Caesars from 25th - 29th Aug as my brother was getting married in the hotel. To say we had a fab time is quite an under statement. I still can't get my head around the size of the place. It took us10 mins to walk to our room from the main entrance but there is so much to admire along the way. We asked for and got an upgrade from the Forum Tower to the Palace Tower and although the rooms there didn't have the electric curtains and TV in the bathroom mirror we were right beside the pool when we came out the elevator so that was an added bonus as it meant we didn't have to walk through the hotel to get to the pool each time. The room was big and very comfortable and we had the option of having towels and bedding changed daily or as we requested. On the day od the wedding we were in and out the room all day so it was never cleaned that day and we had to call up for more towels at bedtime as we'd none left to use. They were delivered quickly with the offer of having the room / bed cleaned but we were shattered so decided to make do ourselves. Lots of place to eat in the hotel - LOVED the Cheesecake Factory. Def not one to be missed. Would've loved to see Rod Stewart who was on there during our stay but didn't have the time or money to do it. Hotel was central to most things on the Strip but due to the hotel's size places that appeard to be close took ages to walk to and in temps of 47 deg seemed to take forever to get there. Taxis are handy!!! Cannot recommend this hotel enough. My brother stayed a night in the Aria Hotel after the wedding and said his room was much more luxurious than the one he had for his wedding night in the Augustus Torwe in Caesars but for me it was the immense size and oppulence of Caesars that was so magical and I can honestly say if I ever get the chance to return to Vegas then it'd be Caesars Palace EVERY time for me.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: thejoanmom
Reviews.Content: The room in the Palace Tower was beautiful. The bathroom was huge and had all the Amendities. The only drawback was the "Single Cup" coffee maker for $2.00 per cup.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional hotel, but never again”
Reviews.Author: KarinaGerman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of high recommendations. I have to say I'm not impressed by the hotel at all. I mean, it is amazing to look at, the rooms are ok, although we had a really crappy ironing board and the hygiene products never got refilled. Calling the front desk for help was not helpful at all. We stayed here Monday until Thursday at the end of August 2011. Only two of the 8 pools were available, one more for additional costs. We have heard a lot about the gym there, so we wanted to check it out. Surprisingly, it is not included in the room rate. They are charging you 20$ per day extra. I thought that is ridiculous. I'm sorry to be hard on that hotel, but I just expected way more.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace is Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: dindan
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Caesars. We are by no means high rollers but without our making a request they upgraded us from a classic room to an amazing Augustus suite. For dining we purchased tickets for the 24hr buffet, which also allows you to eat at other caesar owned casinos, as well as the Caesars buffet which was good, we tried dinner at Planet Hollywood which was also good, we did not enjoy dinner at Paris, the dining experience had a down Market feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Hlondon99
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Caesars Palace in Vegas, the Augustus Tower. The room was large, comfortable and clean. The property is just too big, requiring too much walking to get through it. Also, since there are numerous towers at numerous price points, some of the clientele you see in the common areas is not always very upstanding. I find it difficult to see people sitting on a casino floor eating a sandwich, there are places for them to go to do that, but many times we saw individuals or groups, just sitting around - not a good look! Also, the pool is so crowded you need to get on the chair at the foot and scoot up, they are on top of each other.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower is a winner again”
Reviews.Author: babygoon
Reviews.Content: Second time to stay in an Augustus Tower, Bellagio fountain and strip view jr. suite. Beautiful extra large room, comfy bed, nice seating area and dining table, fabulous bathroom. Can't say enough good things about the room. Check in is great for Diamond members, private check in area away from the overcrowded main check in desk. We had a Palace Tower room booked but we got there a few hours early and needed to get into a room to work (staying there for a convention). So they took my cell number and called as soon as they could get an upgraded Augustus Tower room cleaned. I think they felt sorry for me as we had a horrible time with the valet, NO parking available. Had to drive "around the block" ending up back on the freeway! Finally got to the self-park garage, had to park on the top, uncovered floor of the garage and had to haul our own luggage (more than just carry-ons since this was a business trip and we had all our supplies with us). Once we got to the room had no more problems with the hotel. Since this was our second time in this type room I knew to bring our own coffee pods however, they didn't replenish the paper cups. Just go to the ABC Store or Walgreens and buy a $2 coffee mug and bring your own pods if you want inexpensive coffee. Housekeeping service was mostly good, it was rather late a few days, but they did a great job and replenished all the bathroom amenities daily. Breakfast buffet was very good. Used the quick take-away food stands next to the casino several times. A bit pricey but good portion size so we could share. Didn't use the pool, spa or gym. The internet rates are outrageous. Needed to use it in both the convention area and the room and $25 for each device is highway robbery! Found a couple of lucky machines in the casino. Great bar service at the piano bar. We've stayed at Caesars about half dozen times over the years. Used to love it more but now really don't like the very smoky atmosphere and impersonal service. Would return only if we got a great rate on an Augustus Tower room. The views from that tower are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Render unto Caesar's what is Caesar's...”
Reviews.Author: ejhArlington
Reviews.Content: In other words, let's give the place its due. We stayed 4 nights in late August for the annual meetings of the American Sociological Association, so the place was crawling with our friends and colleagues, and we were mostly working day and night. Having read reviews here I was somewhat concerned about what our "run of the house" ($100-$150) room would be like, but there was little to fear: even in the Plebeian (err, Forum?) Tower, which I understand is not particularly new or updated (corrections, anyone?) the room was quite lovely, spacious, and worked well. It was perfectly clean and fresh, quiet enough (some young folks across the hall), and offered a view of the Mirage as seen over some nearby rooftops. (I think we were on the 11th floor.) Service was superb--everyone from parking to security was as friendly and helpful as possible. Really. The conference organizers cut some deal with the hotel to bundle internet and fitness room costs, but the letter describing the deal was ambiguous and 3 staff attempting to explain it gave 3 different stories. In the end we got a good deal and were happy. Food was quite expensive. Someone (here? Frommer's?) recommended the breakfast buffet at Payard (the in-house, French-style coffee house) BUT I do NOT recommend it. Great coffee, and the pastries are excellent, but the $22 buffet was a poor deal--VERY little food. My best recommendations are to buy your coffee at Payard (NOT at the little coffee place in the food court near the Forum Tower elevators--that stuff is very weak but costs $4). For lunch, however, the salad bar in the food court is great: one a slip of paper choose some basic greens and add any of a wide range of mix-ins, choose a dressing, and for about $10 someone will mix it and toss it and hand it to you--healthy, refreshing, and nicely priced (by Caesar's standards). Bottom line: Caesar's is iconic and huge, impressively warm and caring staff, clean and neat and a bit more. Not cheap. Oh, security on entry to the pools was obnoxious--basically, nothing from outside is allowed inside--buy on site. But the pools themselves are elegant, in the Caesar's over-the-top sort of way. We'd probably stay again, but will likely try THE Hotel, Bellagio, and Four Seasons before we do. Didn't gamble, except for wasting $20 on the Diamondbacks in the sports book.

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay here at least once in your life!”
Reviews.Author: Caesarslover
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I try to visit Las Vegas once a year. We have stayed at a different hotel each time, Bally's was one of the best with the best service, is reasonable and very clean! However, this year we decided to splurge and try Caesars! We booked a room in the Palace Towers. Room was very nice-had a great view of the pool, and it was a short walk off the elevator to the beautiful pool areas. We stayed four days and the room service was excellent-responded to "extra towels" and any requests I had quickly and without any problems. Everything is a little more expensive here, - the vending machines had bottled water for $2.50 (better than getting it anywhere else). Didn't use the Keurig coffee maker, as the pods were too expensive. But it is such a beautiful hotel, you have to visit there at least once in your lifetime as there is so much to see! We ate at Trevi, and the food and service was excellent! We would definitely eat there again, even if we don't stay at Caesar's. Took a pix with "Cleopatra and her guards"-everyone was so nice at this hotel. It was worth the extra money. Save up and go!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: SearchN4BestVacation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars Palace from 8/18 to 8/24. We tried the tip trick as mentioned by other reviewers and it WORKED!!! We arrived about 11:30am, there was a short line (one person in front of us), I tried to find the friendliest face available. We walked up to the counter went through the standard lines then offered a tip with our credit card and id, and politely asked if there were any Complimentary room upgrades. This is key folks, I've read on here sometimes when people ask for an upgrade they say that you can get an upgrade but at a price, the tip I found useful said to say "COMPLIMENTARY", and it worked for us. Our clerk really had to work hard to get us the upgrade as she typed away on her computer vigorously then had to make a phone call but it all worked out. We got an amazing room in the Augustus Tower on the 36th floor with a perfect view of the Bellagio fountains and part of the south strip. The whole checking in process only took about 15min. Housekeeping was great, always came by and gave us new towels and shampoo and conditioner etc. if we were running low, they were very quick we left for breakfast and came back just an hour or so later and the room had been done up already, very impressed. We took advantage of the buffet of buffet's deal, if you are a total rewards member it's like $45 for 24hrs access to all 7 Harrah's buffets on the strip. If you time it right you can get 4 meals out of it which makes each meal less then $12 bucks in Vegas that's a real bargain. This is the order in which I would recommend the buffets, Rio #1, Planet Hollywood #2, Paris #3(however for breakfast #1), The buffet in Caesars is no good, it's ok but not good, compared to the others it's terrible, I wouldn't recommend it except for convenience. Also ate at Mesa Grill, very good, we've been to Mesa 4 times now and it never disappoints, we ate at Rao too, the food was great, the service was not so good. Munch Bar was good for late night snacks pretty reasonable considering it's hotel prices and my husband and I just shared a snack which was the perfect size for the both of us. There were a lot of comments about the cocktails at the pool and how they had the best mojitos but that was not the experience I had they were way over priced and I was not wowed by them at all, Tao over in the Venetian had the BEST cocktails I had while in Vegas, just FYI. Oh and there have been some reviews about not getting access to the pools unless you go through security that was not my experience you can walk right in and in fact I even walked in with my beer from the casino and no on stopped me. All in all it was a great trip, and a wonderful time, I would definitely stay at Caesars again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here! Terrible service, much better hotels with better prices”
Reviews.Author: kimg604
Reviews.Content: I come to Vegas usually 2-3 times a year. This was my first time staying at Caesars Palace which should be renamed Caesars Dump. I was very excited to be staying here, considering its history and it is a staple hotel in Las Vegas. I was bitterly disappointed. Unfortunately when we booked we unknowingly booked a classic room which means Roman Tower. It is disgusting, when you walk down the hall, it reeks, like cigarettes, mold, and possibly throw-up. The Roman Tower has a creepy old musty feel. Def not something you would expect at this sort of hotel. I’m hoping the other towers are better but due to my experience on this trip I would rather sleep in a sleeping bag on the strip than to stay at this hotel. I did read the reviews on the Roman Tower but thought people were exaggerating. THEY WERE NOT!!!. Our room was quite big, but I would have taken a room half the size as long as it was newer, cleaner and the bathroom didn’t leak water and the toilet always flushed. Yes that is what we dealt with. Probably the best part is when we saw a cricket or some sort of bug casually making its way across the carpet. 5 star indeed!!! Upon check in we were offered a room at the Roman Tower or Forum Tower which wouldn’t be ready until 4-6. We decided to take a look at the Roman Tower room which was available right away. The second we walking in we called the front desk and said we would happily wait for the Forum Tower, We were told that the Forum Towers was sold out, literally we left the desk 7 mins before that, and now they were sold out???????????? It appears our check in clerk made an error in quoting us the Forum Tower. Management apologized and said there was nothing they could do, perhaps we could talk to the desk clerk, which we did and his response was Sorry it was miscommunication. We then called and asked to be upgraded to any other room, any other tower at any price. Apparently ALL of Caesars was sold out in every other tower for that night. But we could be moved the next morning to the Palace Tower at an additional upgrade cost. We happily accepted because we could not handle that ugly room. She said everything was set all we had to do was go down to the check in desk between 11-1 and say we had a room change and it was all taken care of. The next morning I called and was told that unfortunately they had nothing available because they were completely sold out AGAIN until the Tuesday (we checked out on Monday). I found this hard to believe considering 10 hours earlier we had our choice of whatever tower we wanted at a cost. She then went on to apologize for the miscommunication. I think Caesars needs to look up the definition of that word; miscommunication is not when you say/promise to do one thing and then change your mind. In this industry that is called POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. I will never ever stay at this hotel again and I recommend to all travelers’ pick a different hotel! Planet Hollywood is nearby, cheaper, better rooms and their customer service is 100 times better. You would think with a hotel of this apparent caliber they would have better customer service! Only good thing I can say is that their pool is extremely nice. I actually went out and slept by the pool during the day because I couldn’t stand sleeping in the room. Even for the price it is not worth it!!! The Venetian; amazing, Wynn: amazing. Even my stay at Treasure Island was 1000 times better and they aren’t even rated as high. I seriously felt like this room was comparable to what maybe Imperial Palace stayers deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience in Vegas so far”
Reviews.Author: Igorica
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas 8 times before this trip. I have never had a bad experience with a hotel here before. And I have stayed at dumps like Circus Circus and Stratosphere. Well, Caesar's Palace takes the cake for first bad experience. We arrived at the hotel at 11am, which is before their posted check-in time. Usually, every hotel will try to accommodate you and let you check in early. Not Caesar's Palace. The girl that was directing people in the lobby told us that even the early check-in started at 1pm and even then we may or may not get a room. She was not pleasant about it either. So, we came back at 3 to check in. We got in a line that seemed to be the shortest. Some old lady that was working there pulled us out of our line and told us to get in front of the line to the next agent and promptly walked off. We did as she told us. However, right next to us was already a line to the same agent. They looked at us like we were trying to cut and when I brought it up to the workers in the lobby, they basically told us that they couldn't place us in front of anybody, so we had to get back to the back of the line. Once again, they were not nice about it at all. They made us look like a-holes in front of other people and made our experience with the hotel memorable in a really crappy way. Not staying here again!!! 9/5/11

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as bad as some reviews here”
Reviews.Author: propita
Reviews.Content: We went for a yahoo.com deal, $79/night. Needless to say, we were not in the penthouse. Having read some reviews here, I was a bit wary and even asked at the front desk if the room was going to be horrendous. I was told that, at $79/night, these were basic rooms. We were in Centurion Tower, one of the older towers. Yes, the thermostat was ancient, the tv was neither "huge" nor flat-screen, and the bathroom was not marble. But the thermostat worked perfectly, the tv was fine (and we weren't in Vegas to watch anyway), and the bathroom--and room in general--was very clean, with a separate tub and shower. And the king-sized bed was very nice. While not the Wynn/Encore, where we had previously stayed during a promotional $100/night (yes!!), it was very comfortable and centrally located. No complaints here!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and Disappointed - Will NOT Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: lildragon
Reviews.Content: Very nice looking hotel from the outside but service and inside was disappointing! Smelly from cigarette smoke in reception area and hallways. We were a party of 13 and all booked our rooms through the airline. One family of four booked a deluxe room and got it. Our family of two booked a classic room and got it. The other two families each booked a classic room but got upgraded by paying a $20 "tip" (bribery fee) to the reception guy - the rooms they got were even nicer (bigger and nicer view) than the deluxe room one family had to pay an extra over $200 for. Our family had requested a complimentary upgrade at check-in immediately BEFORE the two families who "tipped" the receptionist but was told that no rooms other than a smoking one (we required non-smoking) was available. We thus turned it down. But the two families who "tipped" (bribed) who checked in right AFTER we did each got a non-smoking, even better than deluxe room with a nice view. We tried talking to the reception people again but were again told there was "no room" available for upgrade, bla bla, bla... of course, we knew the reception girl was waiting for the $20 "tip". Disgraceful! Upon return to hometown and after talking to other people, we were told that the $20 trick "always" works with the reception at check-in. What a disgrace to the hotel industry and how unfair it is for guests who "honestly" pay an upgrade fee at booking but who end up having a room not even as nice as the ones offered by staff for FREE to people who "tip" (bribe)! When we were once again told that there was no room available for upgrade, we requested a coffee-maker and a mini fridge for our room. We were simply told that there was NONE available except for a fee - even though the outside temperature was like 45C!!! One more note: this hotel is such a money grabber that for rooms with the snacks and mini fridge, if you PICK UP the snacks from the tray or the drinks in the fridge for 20 seconds or more, the hotel would CHARGE the room as if the food/drink has been consumed! In short, poor service by the staff unless you tip e.g. we asked for extra bath towels (only two were provided in the room) but none was given until the next morning when they see a "tip" left in the room for housekeeping! The classic room in the Roman Tower we got - bathroom in particular, was extremely run down with rust around the sink and bathroom taps. Bathroom floor, carpets, wall paper and furniture in general were all from the 80s. Ridiculously high fees for wi-fi and gym. Overall, not impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room... but”
Reviews.Author: 82nd_Airborne
Reviews.Content: I was happy with my stay @ Ceasar's, but had some concerns. The conference that I was attending was in the hotel, and I like to be able to zip up to my room during breaks, so I decided to stay @ Ceasar's. I found, yet again, that the "special conference rate", as a LOT more than I would pay by using an online reservation site. This is not the first time that I have noticed this phenomenon. I think that the conference organizers must get a deal on their own rates, by pushing us to the expensive rates. The room was AWESOME! It had a jacuzzi tub, separate shower, couch, dining table for two, and the room was big! I was pretty TICKED that I couldn't even use the treadmill UNLESS I PAID $25/DAY, YES, PER DAY, TO USE THEIR FREAKING TREADMILL! It is in the "spa". I stopped a security guard and asked him what he recommended, he said that most people ran the strip ~ 0600 hrs. My conference started at 0630 hrs and I wasn't flipping getting up at 0500 hrs. A friend of mine, a petite young gal, ran on the road that runs along I-15, but she got spooked for some reason, and later decided to just run up and down the stairs. [I'm glad that she told me on the last day, so she didn't ruin my excuse] I only had the afternoon of my first day to hit the pool, which looked great. It was RIDICULOUS! They stuffed the lounge chairs in loooooong rows, literally touching each other. I found a place to lounge and soak up the sun and 106 degree direct sunshine, when people moved into the lounge chairs next to mine. I suppose that I would give it 5-stars if my neighbors were Vegas showgirls or something, but they weren't and one spilled over into my lounge chair. You had to crawl in and out, at that point! If you had a drink, you had no place to put it. I suspect that it was all to pressure you to RENT one of their lounge pads or cabanas [I didn't even ask the price]. $15 for a pot of coffee you make yourself [I was told], and $15/day for internet, man did they "nickel and dime" you... although I think that phrase has long since gone the way of the Edsel. They had mobile check-in and check-out which made getting in and out easy. When you do a mobile check-in, you pick up the key at the Bell Station. The surly bellhop basically just shoved me the key and waved in a general direction of the elevator, which was actually fine with me, my hand with the tip money in it stayed in my pocket. FYI, in the conference room, ATT wireless was HORRIBLE, just downloading email to my Iphone took a couple minutes. Most of the time the web pages wouldn't even load! I wonder how much Caesar's paid ATT NOT to put in a local cell tower! [to their credit, I imagine that there are a LOT of users on the property. Hint: take a map with you, the place if freaking HUGE, and since they want you to be diverted by the slots/tables, they WANT you to wander around. Hint: If you take an airport shuttle in, DON'T pay for the round trip. It saves you a couple bucks, BUT you end waiting outside for "your" shuttle to drive up, while telling the other shuttles that ask you if you want to go with them that you've already paid for the shuttle. FYI, the airport shuttle waiting area is OUT IN THE SUN, although we got off the sidewalk and found a tree, it was still > 100.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: flobo5
Reviews.Content: Ignore all of the negative reviews this hotel is the best ever! We arrived at around 3:30pm on a Saturday and waited 10 minutes to check-in which is perfectly reasonable. We got a great guy and check-in who upgraded us from a Forum Tower room to an Augustus Toer room on the 43rd floo with stunning views of the Bellagio fountains. Tipping check-in staff definitely helps!! The room itself was great with the most comfortable bed i've ever slept in! The bathroom was enormous with a jacuzzi tub and seperate shower. The second TV in the bathroom is definitely a novelty. The hotel itself is enormous....but what do you expect, this is Vegas, they are all enormous?! The Forum shops are great as are the restaurants. The food and drink is quite expensive but we were expecting this. The pools are really good although quite busy when we were there as it was peak season. The drinks and food are also expensive but again this is Vegas so it's pretty normal! The only thing that I would change about the pools is putting in some umbrellas for extra shade as it is very sunny and there is only limited shade at certain times. The casinos in Caesar's are huge and i didn't find the drinks service but be as good in other locations (Wynn is definitely the best for prompt and efficient service) however we didn't spend that much time gambling here anyway. The other places in the strip that I would recommend exploring are Wynn, Venetian, Paris, Mandalay Bay, Luxor and Mirage.....although they're probably all worth a look! The worst place in Vegas is definitely the mile shopping mall in Planet Hollywood, we kept getting bugged by people trying to sell things and it felt really seedy in parts. The thing that you have to do whilst in Vegas is definitely a helicopter trip, we went over the grand canyon but even if you just go over the strip it would still be amazing! Anyway in conclusion this hotel is certainly the best hotel in Vegas and i would love to come back one day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we keep going back”
Reviews.Author: MM78758
Reviews.Content: We came to Las Vegas to celebrate my son's 21st birthday. He brought 3 of his friends to join him. We all had a blast. I would say that we could check in right away, which was fine since we got there at 8am. But when we tried around 11am, we stood in line for about 30 minutes when a lady comes around and ask checking in or out, we said in she told us not now come back after 2pm. Well we waited till 12pm and I watched the lines, as people were checking in, which kind of mad me upset. So we checked in around 12:30pm or so. We had 3 rooms in the Palace Tower, which we stayed the year before. It was great , the view outside the window was not so grand not like the one we had the year before- but it was great. The only complaint that I have about the room is the A/C, my goodness it was warm and stuffy in the room, even putting the temp to 68. The casinos were rather comfortable sometimes really cold, I dont understand why the rooms would be stuffy and hot. We had this problem the year before as well. Well waitress do not come around often in the am or lunch time, I was dieing of thrist and went to one of their little coffee shops- I paid $5.00 for a 20oz Pepsi drink! I mean really do we have to overprice everything there! And I noticed that was every where for food and drinks. that is a bit overboard in my opinion, but they now people will pay it if they want to eat and drink. The staff at Caesar's is very nice ! And we plan to stay there again for New Years!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Nettaluvstravel
Reviews.Content: We caught a specail on SW Vacations and were in Vegas for 1 week. The location is great! Our room wasn't. The plugs didn't work or so we thought and after they sent someone up to check it we were told we had to leave the lights on in ordee for the sockets to work....Really! Can you say waste of energy and I don't want lights at night. CRAZY. Anyway, our view was fabulous, I woke up every morning with a viee of the pools. I found the inside mall the day we were leaving, someone should tell you about that on day one! Anyway, I thought it was great other than the room. Oh no fridge in room, they are really outdated rooms but you can pay extra to get the newer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “About our triplets birthday celebration---”
Reviews.Author: bandaidslsJerusalem
Reviews.Content: As a middle of the country getaway, this hotel went overboard to help all of us celebrate this momentous occasion: the 21st birthday of our triplets. Kids came from all over the country, and the staff was very acomodating. All of the rooms were wonderful and the buffet was nicely presented.

Reviews.Title: “For us: not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Snugg-ee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas a few times and this was our first time staying at Caesars Palace. We prepared for this trip months in advance and, after reading reviews online I was not expecting much. We booked a Forum Tower room for 5 nights comped via Total Rewards, which is a renovated tower, but like many others on here, upon check-in we didn't get the room we booked, we were put in the Centurion Tower, which I didn't even know they had it because it doesn't show up on their booking system. Check-in was smooth, on a Wednesday at around 10:30pm, no lines at all and the staff member was friendly, but he didn't tell us up front that we weren't getting the room we booked, only after the did the check-in and I asked if we got a room at the Forum Tower he said no. I had call Caesars a few days before and expressed my concerns about not getting the room and confirmed that we were definitely coming and yes I understand that the reservation and room types are not a guaranteed, but there are way too many bad reviews for them on this topic, considering that they are supposed to be a 5 star hotel. Anyway, the Centurion Tower was well located, right next to the main casino floor, a very short walk, which was nice. It was also the tower that had access to the Penthouse, the middle elevator was private and had a security guard outside of it. One thing we were very surprised was that the Centurion Tower didn’t have an ice machine! That’s right, no ice machine in any floor and we discovered from a staff member that we had to call room service for ice, which we did and it took just over 30 minutes to get a small bucket of ice; it was at around 11:30pm (I know it was late at night), the staff member apologized for the delay and said that it shouldn’t have taken that long. When we came back to the room after being out for the night, there was a message at the answering machine apologizing again, it was timed at 2am, it was nice of them but good thing we weren’t in the room sleeping, otherwise that would have been another inconvenience. The room was average and not what we would expect from Caesars, not to be negative but like I said, I had already lowered my expectations. Nothing special in the room, there was a couch which we took a look behind it and it was all dirty and dusty. The room was very damp, had an old tube style tv (which is no big deal since we are not in Vegas to watch tv anyway, but it does add to the look and style of the room), the bathroom had some mold in the shower and the shower handle was half broken, other than that everything else in the bathroom was fine and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were very clean. The casino was large and well ventilated (we are non smokers and, as much as we love Vegas, sometimes the smoke can get to us), great location next to the Forum Shops, if you like to shop at expensive and brand name stores this is the place for you! Caesars has a food market which had some good food options and you will also find more options around the Forum Shops. The Market buffet at Caesars was very disappointing; we bought the 24 hours TR buffet deal once and I was looking forward to try out the buffet there but will not go back; good thing we didn’t pay regular price, it is expensive and the food options (very few) and quality were not desirable. We enjoyed other TR properties buffets, like Paris and Planet Hollywood, waaaaaaay nicer! The pool area is beautiful as you can see from the pictures, very classy! There were very few chairs available, not because they were busy, there is just not much room next to the pools....very nice cabanas and comfy chairs and beds for rent (the blue ones). The sports book is very nice, actually one of our favorites in Vegas (we had been there before), it is VERY spacious compared to other casinos in Vegas, has lots of tvs and big screens, individual seats and tables with monitors and you get well compensated for betting as far as drink coupons and we only bet $2 to $5 here and there; when talking to the staff member, she said that they watch to make sure that you are not intoxicated, otherwise they hold on to the drink coupons. At the end we felt that Caesars was just average and we would not pay to stay there, we would only go back if they are our only comp option, otherwise we would stay at another TR property.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: lyndsWales
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the first leg of our honeymoon (16th-20th aug). After a very long flight we were met with a very helpful lady who offered us an upgrade for a reasonable price, which we declined. Who goes to Vegas to sit in their room?! However, after reading several reviews I did ask if it was a refurbished room and she assured me that it was. Our room was in the forum tower, and we were definitely not disappointed! Huge bed, huge tv, huge walk in shower. Not much of a view, but that's ok! The room was cleaned thoroughly every day. We were impressed with the public areas too, considering how many visitors must go through every day. Location is excellent, right in the middle of it all! We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Vegas! Just to update on the pool/food/beverages situation - we were allowed to take in pastries for breakfast and water, but not orange juice (in a sealed container)?! The staff agreed that they couldn't understand it either!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wildcat83
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. We went with another couple and stayed in the Augustus Tower. The rooms were large and luxurious. The bathroom is over the top. The size of the hotel could be a positive or a negative depending on what you are looking for. Make no mistake about it, this place is huge. There are lots of places to eat and shop here. I would not recommend the buffet, if that is one thing you are looking for. However, the Wynn and Bellagio both had excellent buffets. Not extremely helpful on the service side. Arrived a bit before the official check-in time and they were not about to let us have a room yet. In fact, when tho official check-in time arrived it was probably another hour before we got our room due to the long line of people waiting for their rooms. If they would just go ahead and give people their rooms when they arrived a bit early rather then making them wait in a long line they would likely have happier customers. I suppose they are hoping by refusing to give you your room, you will slide on over to the casino and drop a few hundred before check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Listen to everyone about the Augustus Tower!”
Reviews.Author: Autophysn
Reviews.Content: Ok, I had read all the reviews on Roman tower, they all sucked! When we arrived, I asked for an upgrade, & was so estatic when I got it. Stayed in the Augustus tower, and had the time of my life!!! My wife and I both loved the room, loved the view, awesome jacuzzi tub, bathroom was the best! Just can't thank trip advisor and yelp enough for publishing reviews. Others in the convention had said, well, lets just say they confirmed what others had to say about the Roman Tower. If you can get in the Augustus Tower, you have got it made! Oh, and the buffet does suck! Never been to a buffet that I actually spit the food out, Lagos, no bueno!!!

Reviews.Title: “Caesar Palache..yeah haha like the salad”
Reviews.Author: damien c
Reviews.Content: Just came home from a long tip to Vegas. We stayed at a few different hotels but Caesars was where we were the majority of the time. We got upgraded to a jacuzzi suite which was plenty big and offered a nice window view of The Mirage, Wynn, Encore and other hotels on the strip. The pool area was absolutely amazing. Great to spend a day at relaxing and enjoying a few drinks, not to mention the other visitors were nice to look at lol. We only dined at Hyakumi, but the food was great and reasonably priced. Took a trip to Pure during the week as well and enjoyed the sights it had to offer. Overall I was super pleased with my stay at Caesars. It's in a great spot on the strip, offered great food and sights and was reasonably priced too! I'm already looking into a room for next year and I'm hoping to see a show or two while I'm out there. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone as I feel it gives you everything you could need in a vegas hotel...me and my friend even joked that you could literally spend your vacation just in Caesars, that's how much we enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Nice Ending to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: VASoleil
Reviews.Content: After traveling throughout Southwest we ended in Las Vegas. After numerous days of driving and changing hotels it was nice to be pampered. We were upgraded in the Augustus Tower and it was our most luxurious accomodation. The staff was very friendly. Nothing is inexpensive in Las Vegas. You even have to pay for coffee in the room. Thank goodness the bellhop warned us not to remove the snack items or we would instantly be charged. The pool area is beautiful. Nice to wander around the shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it ... everything was great !!”
Reviews.Author: lmk626
Reviews.Content: Although this place is huge and the largest hotel I have ever stayed in everything run like clockwork ... how do they do it ? What can I say but everything was excellent from cleanliness , comfort , room service , pool , choice of food I cannot fault it . Location was spot on .... when staying in Vegas there is no where better to stay .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: cantrav10
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I just got back from 4 great days spent at Caesar's Palace. We had no issues, no wait, at check -in, and received a compliementary upgrade to a junior suite in the Palace Tower. (yes - I did use the "sandwich technique" mentioned in previous reviews) We had a great view of the pools, no issues at all with billing at check-out. BTW - You can check out using the TV guest services option - really don't understand other reviews complaining about check-out lineups) Caesar's is a great place to stay. Our room was spacious, with an incredible bathroom, including a jacuzzi tub and a huge walk-in shower with dual shower heads. The bed was super comfortable. The room itself was probably the quietest I've ever had. You could not hear any noise at all from the hallway - very rare for most hotels. The pools are amazing. No issue getting a chair if you go early, no cost for the chairs. Party type atmosphere, but not stupid or crazy. The casinos are large, something for everyone. The food options are fantastic. Must go to Mesa - Bobby Flay's southwest style food. Really tasty and not something you get easily where I'm from up here in the North. All staff we dealt with were incredibly friendly and helpful. Anytime you travel, I suggest to do your research first, and it helped tremendously for this trip. Go to Caesar's - you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “My best Holiday so far”
Reviews.Author: Burton33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars Palace with my boyfriend for my firends wedding, it was a party of 16. the weather when we went was amazing so we were down buy the pool for most of daytime, the pool is beauitful but the only tip would be at the weekends all the Free beds are taken by 10!! and if you go down early you can't just reserve with a towel, but the friut pools that they sell at the pool are sooo good and only $14. we upgraded our room to the mini suit which was an extra $50 per night, the room was excellent and i can't fault it or the room staff in any way, but make sure you ask to be put in palace tower as this is the newest one and our friends stayed in the rowan tower and the rooms were dated. Overall i had a great holiday and would go back

Reviews.Title: “4,5* hotel in the center of everything! Definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: marqoos_pl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed three nights during my US trip. That was prize I won, so I didn't have to pay for my stay. Being honest, that was my first time in Vegas and I didn't know what to expect. I was amazed with size of the hotel. It's huge. Maybe even too big. Check-in was quick and hassle free. Our room was allocated before recommended check-in time, so I was really happy. Room was very spacious, bright, and spotless clean, with nice colours and furniture. Beds were so comfortable, although maybe a little bit too soft. Anyway, room was very comfortable and we enjoyed that all the time. Only two issues I had was price of Wi-Fi (far too much!) and small sharp metal part of working desk which I was hitting every single time I wanted to sit or stand up. Bathroom was enormous. I could actually live in this bathroom, haha. Good quality toiletries and fluffy towels were provided. As I mentioned before, all hotel is enormous. From our room to self car park (yes, there is one on the back of the hotel) took like 10-15 min walking. You need to have some plan or map of the property. Swimming pools are great. Of course, casino and boutique shops are there to make a use of your money. Anyway, I was really happy with Caesars Palace and I recommend it to everybody. Good value for money in 4,5-star hotel. Close to every attraction in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, not great”
Reviews.Author: Soctraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife attending a conference. The hotel is a big resort and feels huge, but is a good central connection to other hotels and shopping areas. Our room was in the Roman Tower and was decent for the conference price (no views of the strip, but the side of the pool area and other towers). The staff was friendly and we did not have any issues with check-in or check-out. Wifi was slow at times, but overall was decent. Be careful during check in as they will charge your credit card for incidentals (almost $300 dollars or so), make sure you have sufficient credit in your card. Overall, it was a nice stay, the hotel is very good, but there are newer, better hotels on the strip. As I said in the tittle the hotel is very good, but I wouldn't call it great. As for food, there are reasonable alternatives across the street at Harrah's and next door in the Mirage, that is if you don't mind paying $6.00 for a cup of coffee at the Caesars or the Forum shops!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel,like a casino you have to play before you go to sleep”
Reviews.Author: igkostas
Reviews.Content: Nice pools,nice jacuzzi in the room and comfortable beds to sleep for hours,good choice to go directly for shopping through the casino

Reviews.Title: “The pool the room everthing is great here”
Reviews.Author: marajoe
Reviews.Content: I have been to vegas three times this year. Twice i have stayed at Caesars during business trips. I loved this hotel. I have stayed at many of the Las Vegas places but i did like this place. My room was in one of the new towers and it was so nice. I have many fav hotels and places i love to eat. I will be writing more reviews. This is worth a stay, o and go to Pure. Fun Fun Fun.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: scottie02
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great location. Great shopping within hotel. Great restaurants. Would definately reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with a problem”
Reviews.Author: SANDRO S
Reviews.Content: I have spent five nights in this Hotel. Overall, my impression has been positive, leaving aside the kitsch and ridiculous idea of imitating a palace of Ancient Rome. An unpleasant event somewhat diminished this impression. Some laundry, which I left in my room for the housekeeping department after notifying them and filling out the order (with my name and room number), was never returned. It was either lost or stolen. I let the manager know about this problem, and also notified the Security, but I was forced to buy new laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Rubrducky999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Aug 14th-17th for a convention. Our room was in the Palace Tower. The room was nice, clean and roomy. The bathroom was huge with two sinks and separate room for toilet. If you stay here be sure to throw the safety lock on your door because the maids don't knock. They just come into your room. I was showering one morning when the maid entered. They don't speak any english so communication is very hard. The beds were horrible. Don't plan on sleeping too much. Wifi is 14.99 PER computer PER night. Yikes! We paid $45.00 for two burgers and fries. I've stayed in several hotels in Vegas and Caesars is by far the biggest drain on the wallet for what you get. The Mandalay Bay is still at the top of my list for value and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with Caesars”
Reviews.Author: vwieland
Reviews.Content: We have taken at least 4 trips to Vegas and stayed on the strip. We took 2 of our adult children with us for a four day trip and decided to treat them to a "nice" hotel....boy, were we disappointed. I'll try to keep this short. The rooms are very run down. Lots of stained and worn carpet/furniture. A lot of the outlets were not working. We had to unplug some of their lights to be able to plug in our things. On our last day, housekeeping hadn't come to our room to take out dirty towels and bring in new, empty garbage, etc. I finally called housekeeping before we left for a show and asked if they could come up while we were out. We got back later that night to find nothing done. When I called management, he asked what he could do to make this better and I said I just want my room supplied with our essentials. He insisted on giving us a food voucher. As I told him, we were leaving only hours later to catch an early flight but I told him that I'd call room service to get a few breakfast items brought up before we headed out. When the order was placed, I was told the total (which included tax and service fee) and commented on being within $1 of what the voucher was for. When delivered, it was $12 over what I was told on the phone. VERY unhappy and disappointed with Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Older, run down room, wet carpet but the bed was comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pienyereye01
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas several times. I've stayed at the Venetian and the Luxor in the past. This trip was for a conference and we wanted to stay at the conference hotel. The room was in the older "towers" section so expectations were low. It was a really odd room. It seemed like there was missing furniture. One corner was obviously missing a chair or something large and there were extension cords strewn about. On the cords, my beside table had a lamp that had a cord that ran alllll the way down the wall next to me to get AC power. The room was tacky-looking because of all these weird cords running everywhere. The bed was comfortable and clean. The floor carpet was completely wet on the other side of the bed..curious and something that makes your imagination churn. Other than these oddities, the room was spacious. The bathroom was all marble and quite large as well with a huge soaking tub and separate shower. I imagine that this room was luxurious in its heyday years ago. I did hear that the rooms were nicer in the newer parts of the hotel. We had a view of the casino ceiling next door but didn't expect a good view so no problem. The pool was fantastic - or "pools" I should say. I cannot comment on any of the drinks or food in the pool area since I heard the pricing was astronomical so I drank/dined elsewhere. The cigarette smoke seemed out of control in the casino area. In other casinos, it just didn't seem that bad. Personally, I thought the servers were really adequate in the casino areas. I don't understand why the these poor ladies have been criticized in other posts. They are on their feet all day, have to deal with obnoxious people, smoke, MUST wear silly, uncomfortable uniforms and shoes. HINT: if you tip them, they will come back and keep taking care of you. I have paid lots of slots in other places. It really seemed like NO ONE was winning anything. The casino in Caesar's seem really cavernous because of the low ceilings. Definitely seemed like an older crowd and vibe. The worst part of staying at Caesar's is that there were so few places to grab a cup of coffee and each place had looong lines. No coffee pot in our room but I heard other rooms have in-room, pay as you drink coffee service. A small coffee at each place was about $4. This may seem silly but I will not stay here again because of the coffee situation. If you stay here, make sure to get a newer room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: UkJetlag
Reviews.Content: Caesars has a great central position on the strip making all the other hotels within easy reach (if you don't mind walking a bit). We were booked in a classic room and asked if there was the option to upgrade. As it was a saturday, room was limited and we were told it would be possible tomorrow. Upon seeing our room in the Roman tower we were more than happy with what we had. The reception is stunning as is the rest of the hotel. The Forum shops are huge with restaurants as well for good eating. We booked through Booking.com and the lady on check in remarked what a good price we had got. The outside towards the strip is a great place to watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace is . . . well . . . Caesar's Palace”
Reviews.Author: sbabones
Reviews.Content: Caesar's Palace is not the most expense or luxurious hotel on the strip, but it is the most fabulous. If you've never been to Las Vegas before, this is the place to start. It's simply the most over-the-top place in an over-the-top city. It's what the Roman emperors would have built had they lived to become 21st century hotel promoters. It's fabulous. Unfortunately, like everywhere in Vegas smoking is allowed everywhere (including the pools), but there's no escape from that. Speaking of the pools, the pools are fabulous but loud and crowded. The dance music from the (pay for entry) Venus pool spills over to the rest. If Caesar's wants to do one thing to improve its experience, it could turn down the Venus pool music -- or build a sound wall. Highlights: the fountains and statues at the Forum Shops. Mall shopping was never so much fun. One tip: you CAN buy a newpaper. They're well hidden, but ask at the main gift shop at reception. They're hard to find, but they're there. Rooms are comfortable, food is overpriced, etc. -- everything you would expect from Las Vegas, just more of it. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's was the perfect fit for experiencing Vegas as a couple”
Reviews.Author: pfed
Reviews.Content: Unlike most other trips to L.V. where we've experienced the nightlife for bachelor and bachelorette parties, this time I really wanted to experience Las Vegas with my husband and take advantage of the restaurants, the strip and the pool and see the romantic side of Vegas. We did some homework prior to booking and because we were going to be spending so much time on the strip, a central location was our top priority and Caesars is as central as you can get. Cafe Lago (Buffet)...not entirely impressed given the price point. Be weary lining up around 11am as they switch from breakfast to lunch at that time and they won't warn you about the price change or the fact that the food turnover may take a while so you can likely expect a pretty empty variety at the buffet for $30 pp. Instead try Payard (a cute little french bakery/restaurant) just a little further from the buffet. The express line for coffee to go will have a line, definately experience this place by going striaght to the restaurant and order the Eggs Benedict on fresh croissants...they will be the very best you've ever tasted. Everything is made rediculously fresh and you can taste it. Also for a fancy lunch, check out Spago in the forum shoppes. their pizza's are fantastic. Some other tips. If you are arriving on a Saturday be weary of the check in line, it is absolutely outrageous. It took us nearly 1.5 hours just to check in. When we arrived in our room I was reading the Caesar's Palace magazine that mentions that to avoid a long wait at check in to visit the bell desk as they can check you in as well. (would have been nice to know before I reached my room but if it can help all of you that's great too) This review would have received a 5 out of 5 if it weren't for the check in line. Also, if you want a central room that's somewhat close to everything (pool, L.V. boulevard, Taxi's, forum shoppes and Casino) request to stay in the Augustus tower. Very Very central and brand spankin new. The rooms are massive, the washroom is massive and there is a great view. If you like lively music with a great beat, check out the Venus pool club on Saturday's and Sundays. Their DJ is phenominal! You can negotiate a daybed for around $200 food and beveridge guarentee (which you will spend in no time, believe me) on Mondays or anytime of the week negotiate for $100 for the same daybed. Definately worth it! The larger pool at Caesars is free for chairs but they are crammed right next to each other and you will be elbow to elbow with other people and the drinks and food aren't cheap so you'll spend the same regardless. Bellagio water show is right next door and is every 15 minutes from 7 until midnight. Planet Hollywood is across the street as well as Flamingo, Paris, Bally's etc. Definately register for a Rewards Card with Caesars palace (you can collect points at all their other properties in Vegas, Flamingo, PH etc.) these points will accumulate nicely which will give you some comps when you return back. Make sure you swipe it when you buy anything from the gift shops, when you use the slots and when you eat at the restaurants etc. Good luck and Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Talee48
Reviews.Content: everyone who has been concerned with the Classic Rooms at Caesars - just returned and I have to say we were more than pleased - the room was very spacious with a sofa, coffee table and two end tables and chair and ottoman (0ur room had a king bed) - very clean and our room was always cleaned for the day after we returned from breakfast (about one hour or so) I have stayed at many of the strip hotels (including Belligio) and have never had our room cleaned so quickly - while the furniture was not brand new- it showed no wear - no chips on the wood surfaces and the fabric on the sofa and chair was in great shape - no flat screen TV - big deal - if I need to watch that much TV I will stay home. The TV worked and when I wanted to catch up on the news it was great. The check in was speedy and our room was ready at 8:30am - it was unfortunate that we required a smoking room, because the tower I booked was non smoking (was surprised the site let me do that) We did have to wait until about 11:30AM to get a smoking room - our choice - plenty to do - stored our bags and had breakfast and picked our show tickets up. I asked the cost of an upgrade - and to the hotels credit, they did not try to upsell me - it was my choice. I cannot say enough about the staff - always friendly and offering to help - very impressive - excellent front desk staff - two thumbs up to Joanie - friendly and gracious and took the time to explain about the location of our room. There are no ice machines on the floors of the Centurion Tower - room service will bring it to you at no charge - (they do appreciate a tip for the effort) and they were speedy

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel in fabulous Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mammasuellanelli
Reviews.Content: We began our trip with a visit to the V-room [ For Virgin Customers ] at Gatwick, which was a fabulous start to the morning before our flight. besides unlimited food and non-alcoholic drinks, they do a wonderful eggs benedict and selection of pastries which is all included in the admission. Caesars Palace has a great central location on the strip, easy , although hot-walking to all hotels and attractions [ it was in the 100s every day ] wonderfully spacious and well equipped room in the Forum Tower overlooking the amazing pool area , with spa -bath,seperate shower, plasma tv, iron and board and a coffee maker . Staff friendly, lovely restaurants and mind-blowing Forum shopping area with changing synthetic sky from night to day and continental ambience [ there is even a mock Trevi fountain!! ]. besides lots of designer and interesting shops, the Forum also has an animatronic show [ statues that move to music, fire and water ] telling the story of the fall of Atlatis- well worth seeing, on the hour every hour. We managed to see Penn and Teller show at Rio, where the two stars meet and have photos with guests afterwards- a fabulous evening of entertainment, and what a lovely pair of celebrities. Mike Tyson was at the sports shop in the Forum, signing autographs- catch being you had to buy a hundred or more dollar piece of memorabilia beforehand. He looked very relaxed and friendly and was in great shape! Attractions not to be missed- Titanic exhibition at the Luxor [ eerie and very interesting ] The body arts exhibition also at the Luxor [ incredible and informative, especially as my kids are doing bilology for their studies ] The aquarium at Mandalay Bay, dolphins and tigers at the Mirage, the roller coaster at new York and the fountains at bellagio, volcano at the Mirage and Treasure Island show worth a visit. For a truely magical place to eat, try the Rain Forest Cafe at Mandalay Bay. A beautiful envionment with great food to suit all tastes and ages- the kids will especially love the indoor rain, star studded ceiling with shooting stars thunder and lightning and moving animatronic jungle animals. Planet Hollywood at caesars is a great place for a cooked English breakfast for $10- and the Virgin rep is located there each morning at 9.30am for any queries. A real disappointment was Freemont St [ old down town vegas ]. It looked cheap and our family felt a little unsafe. The shops were all souvenier-types, and the food outlets unappetising. The area seemed to be better suited to younger groups of people on stag or hen nights, that was also our impression of the Golden nugget Hotel [ situated next to Freemont st ]. The strip however is fabulous and safe, a real adults playground!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but wouldn't choose it again”
Reviews.Author: rwells745
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas for a conference. Stayed in the Palace tower in a very nice room. It's like a maze though because there are so many towers, and it's rather inconvenient to have to always walk through the casino to get out of the place. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful as should be expected. The pools are super nice. There's a very exclusive feel; they always ask for your key to prove that you are really staying there - like getting into the pool. It was a little irritating though to always have to dig for my key. The rooms were priced reasonably, but the cost of everything else was exorbitant - much like everything else in Las Vegas. In room coffee was $12.00 for a set of 4 k-cups. Snacks and items in the various gift shops were also expensive. Take snacks with you if you're on a budget like me. It is right in the middle of everything, but I would choose to stay somewhere else next time because of the cost of "necessities" like food or coffee, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Needing a major refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: isobelmalloy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 years ago and was shocked at the demise of this hotel. Our room was dull and grotty and there was a charge via credt card for the room safe. Visited newer hotels and Caesars need to up their game. The Forum shopping centre is still looking good. Don't rest on your laurels or you will go out of business. Room upgrades very expensive. The golf resevation desk was not open at specified times and hotel staff not helpful. Very limited sun cover by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: znn786
Reviews.Content: First class hotel with excellent service..attended a convention with 6000 others and logistics were handled nicely by the hotel staff. Rooms were large and bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “It may be a Palace, but that dependings what room you're in”
Reviews.Author: readytogoagain
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed Caesars. The pool area was very nice for relaxation and swimming. Food and beverages by the pool were a total ripoff. As for the rooms, we were initially given a room in the Centurion Tower, both the halls and the room had a musty odor and we immediately rejected that room. We were forced to go back and wait at the pool for a Forum Tower room that our front desk host was nice enough to offer us. That was no fancier, but just fine on the furnishings and atmosphere with no odor. It was also closer to the Forum Shops mall were reasonable food can be had and walking around is a pleasure. So when staying here caution is advised as to avoid the two older towers as you might not be happy with the basic accommodation and odors.. Caesars was built in sections over many years and is something of a maze to get around. Bring a compass or map too!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace - Love the hotels but the room was a little tired looking”
Reviews.Author: Disney2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace in the Forum Towers room and whilst the room was nice we were expecting alot more for the price. Over the years be have stayed at several other hotels on the strip with cheaper rates and a more modern, less tired looking room. On the upside we loved the shopping, architecture, restaurants and pools at Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars still one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: jasanti7
Reviews.Content: Caesars is Caesars. The location is still one of the best on the strip, the shops are still the best, and the pool is still the best. A lot of the newer hotels are 'newer', but Caesars still can compete with the flash. The Shadow bar is pricey (Sky Vodka & 1/4 can of Redbull for $27),Cleopatra's Barge plays various top 40 music throughout the night with reasonable drink prices, and the Numb bar looked "cool". We were given discounted tickets for PURE and waited in the line, but decided not to wait, but have drinks instead. Beds-super comfy! Buffet-one of the better ones in their chain. When we return to Vegas, we'll probably stay at Caesars again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible!”
Reviews.Author: gypsyisroaming
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small, broken tile in the bathroom, mildew, dirty carpets, no pictures on the wall, and the TV was older than my 15 year old son. They moved us to another room which had the smell of cigarette smoke so they then moved us a third time. Terrible service and if you book through a source such as Expedia/Priceline etc. they will treat you as a "third class" citizen. The casino, shops and dining. was nice. If you stay insist on a room that faces the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Kspahl
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at Caesar's Palace's Augustus Tower August 15-18th and loved it! Well worth the $$$, very spacious room, comfortable bed and wonderful view of the Bellagio fountains. The entire hotel was very clean and customer service was always a 10. The only gripe I have was the gambling in house, one night ( granted it was late) there was only two craps table open and it was all full. The drinks while gambling were also not top notch, it was hard to get a drink as readily as other casinos ( Bills, NY and Paris could get you a drink in less then 5 min total) But besides this everything was wonderful. We were so close to so many other great casinos too, all within walking distance. I know my group loved Vegas and Caesar's and cannot wait to stay there again. Ps Try the Venus pool if you are staying there ;)

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy my stay at Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: soonergirl23
Reviews.Content: In July 2011, my husband and I along with 5 other couples traveled to Las Vegas, NV, and stayed at Caesar's Palace. We stayed in a suite in the Augustus Tower with another couple. The suite had a living room, dining room, and half-bath in the living area. Off to each side, the suite had two master bedroom suites. My husband and I stayed in the Master bedroom suite that had two bathrooms that were attached by a walk-through shower. Plus, our bedroom area had it's own living room. The other master bedroom had one bathroom suite and a bedroom area with living room as well. The view from the main living area was of the strip-The Flamingo, Bally's, and The Paris. Amazing! Our bedroom suite had a view of Bellagio Casino/Hotel and their fountains. Awesome! The rooms are always very clean, and the housekeeping staff does an excellent job. Why do I enjoy my stay at Caesars? First of all, it is centrally located on the strip. It is within walking distance to other fun casinos (Bill's Gambling Hall, formerly known as The Barbary Coast, and O'Shea's), great restaurants (Mon Ami Gabi's in The Paris-the best restaurant in Vegas), fun nightlife (Margaritteville-have live bands usually and Napolean's, the piano bar inside The Paris), and cheap(er) gambling (O'Shea's and Bill's). Second, Caesar's has plenty of good restaurants and nightlife within the hotel. Our favorite restaurant is the sushi bar/Japanese steakhouse (cannot remember name but we always eat there). We have tried Rao's twice, and it is okay. You are not guaranteed a good meal or good service. Their meatballs are delicious though! Third, Caesar's has an attached shopping center, The Forum Shops. We always stop in there at our favorite shops-Coach, Luck Brand Jeans. We now have a restaurant in the Forum Shops that we will add to our "Must-Visit" list-Max Brunner's Restaurant. All the items contain chocolate in them, sweet as well as savory. Try the chocolate fondue! Fourth, the nightlife is happening in Caesar's. Between Pure Nightclub and the tables with the dancers, there is always fun to be found! Fifth, the pool area is very nice. Lots of sun and cool water. Try the pina coladas with a shot of Myer's Dark Rum. Pricey, but delicious! One problem we did have this trip was checking in. Our room took forever to get ready, and we did not get in it until after 4 p.m. When we went back to get our room keys, another clerk tried to give us a different suite. We checked it out, and it was not as nice as the one we were supposed to get (and ended up getting).). We were exhausted by the time we got to the correct room.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good but bit of a let down!”
Reviews.Author: rubydubey
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to Ceasers Palace Hotel a good six months in advance, enough time you would think to organize two rooms on the same floor, when we arrived with our friends we were told we would have to stay in different towers for one night, then move rooms so we could have rooms on the same floor for the rest of our stay, we agreed only to find the next day the only rooms for us were ten floors apart!! Not a good start!! This hotel is huge in case anyone is thinking 'whats the problem'. Staff on the front desk were mostly indifferent and appeared rather snooty!! Expect great rooms with exellent housekeeping staff who will go that little bit extra for you, just for being pleasent and acknowledging them. Beware of the computerised mini bar, you get charged when you haven't had anything, just moving thing's around to put our own fruit juice in an already packed fridge got us a hefty bar bill. This only came to light when we were back in the UK, contacted the hotel and had to argue our point before they gave in and refunded our money!! No tea or coffee facilities in rooms nor cups The hotel has some great restaurants and shopping as you would expect. On the whole we enjoyed our stay, not sure if we woud go back, as we could have been in a hotel anywhere in the world, maybe a smaller hotel would be more welcoming and friendly, perhaps we expected too much from the famous Ceasars Palace Hotel Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Wifi $25 per day:( group bookings split up”
Reviews.Author: alexa310168
Reviews.Content: Huge place. Do NOT self park.  Free valet parking (but 45 min wait at 'chk out' times) Pay for wifi :( $25 PER DAY!! All smaller cheaper hotels hv internet for free!! No kettle in room, unless upgrade @ $50 per night Chk in fine BUT why do they not organise grp bookings & get rooms together in advance? We were very far apart with 2 senior mothers :( Casino is everywhere thriughtiut property Strip was gridlock at 930pm.
