Car/taxi entrance gridlocked fri/sat's Pools lovely, but 2 were closed for no apparent reason other than 'cost cutting' Buffet deal $46 for 24hrs across 7 hotels. Excellent value!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the middle of strip”
Reviews.Author: Where_to_travel_next
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at this hotel, both times in the Palace Tower. The room is nicely appointed with dual bathrooms and a shared shower. The beds are very comfortable. My only complaint is that each time it was a different room but one facet handle would not work. Like many of the hotels you have a bit of a walk to get to your room. The pool area is beautiful and you need to show your guest card to get in or pay the daily fee. No outside food or drinks but there is walk up or poolside service to fix your hunger or thirst. Drinks are a bit expensive but lunch was very reasonable. Shopping in the forum shops is nearby as well as plenty of restaurants. No fridge in the room but there is a digital safe for your belongings and if you are lucky to hold your winnings.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst stays in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: QueenOfTropics
Reviews.Content: First I want to say that I live in Los Angeles, and we travel to Las Vegas every year, sometimes twice or more per year. I have stayed at a lot of hotels on the strip. I stayed at this hotel, because I was attending a conference. When I went to my room, I was shocked with what I found. There were no sheets or cover on the bed. The bathroom had no soap, and was full of used towels, on the floor, in the tub and in the sink. I called the front desk, and the gentleman told me the hotel was completely booked, to upgrade to another tower would cost an additional $75 per night, however he was willing to reduce that amount to $50 per night. At that point, I would have paid anything to get out of that room. I went back to the front desk, and realized their standard check in form, already has the upgrade for $50 option pre printed on it (he wasn't doing me any favors. that is the usual fee to upgrade for everyone.) There was no apology or explanation for giving us a dirty room. Check out was another disaster. We checked out at 11 a.m. Within 45 minutes of check out, I realized I had forgotten my diamond earrings in the room. I called them immediately and asked if I could go back to the room, as I knew exactly where I had left them. They refused to let me back in the room, even with the security person present. Their reason was that someone had already checked into the room. Yeah, right! They expected me to believe they had cleaned the room and someone else had checked in right away. Need I say more, why I will never go back to This hotel ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars”
Reviews.Author: danielle d
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from a five day stay at Caesars Vegas. We are a couple in our mid forties and traveled with a 21, 22 and two 23 year olds. Stayed in the Augustus tower. Fabulous rooms. You get what you pay for. Went to the Cirque Beatles Love show and absolutely loved it!!!!! Got tickets across the street from Caesars at discounted rate. Went to the Minus 5 ice bar at the Monte Carlo, which was a really fun experience. The 21 and 23 year old did the indoor sky diving and loved it. The twenty year old crew went to Pure, XS and Tryst. They enjoyed them all but said XS was the best club. The pools at Caesars are beautiful and we did not have any trouble getting lounge chairs. The atmosphere at the pools is great and we will be spending more time there next time. Drinks are expensive, but very tasty! Try the Jolly Rancher Mohito and Tropical Twist. Caesars was absolutely beautiful and amazing. Loved our stay here and will be returning to stay at Caesars. Thank you to everyone that has posted. It really helped us plan our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Let's call it 4 1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: Nredra
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Caesars last week. I had a business conference for the first half of the week - then stayed to have some fun in Las Vegas. Caesars has so many positives going for it, that it offset the very few issues we had. When we checked in, our room wasn't ready - no problem, they upgraded us to a junior sweet in the Augustus tower for free. We had a nice corner room overlooking the pool. Speaking of the pool -well, it's actually pools - we visited a few other properties and actually used the pools at the Rio and Flamingo - Caesars pools are the best. Great atmosphere, great drinks and service - not overly crowded. The restaurants in Caesars are all top notch, too. Ate at Rao's, Mesa and Beijing Noodle #9 - all great. We also saw the Absinthe show that they have right out in front of Caesar's - awesome show and a must see if staying at Caesars. The central location of the hotel is also a huge plus -after dinner and drinks every night, my wife and I would take off down the strip and just explore - inevitably ending up at some new bar/restaurant that we can't wait to revisit. The forum shoppes are fairly impressive, too. You really can't go wrong at Caesar's. The only reason i didn't give it 5 stars is that it is pricey and I feel like there might be some better deals out there - but i would easily return to Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Hard to Navigate”
Reviews.Author: RobinLovesCats
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to attend an onsite seminar. The hotel was beautiful, we loved the pools, the coffee/tea/snacks provided by the hotel for the event were excellent as was our room and maid service. The only issue we had was the difficulty of getting around inside the hotel. We were there for a week and it was an ordeal to find our way to the parking garage and to the front door of the hotel. The pastry/coffee shop in the hotel was superb. The pastries were fresh and the coffee rivaled leading coffee shops.

Reviews.Title: “Very Big, Almost too big.”
Reviews.Author: ivylarocque
Reviews.Content: Went with my sister-in-law & asked for 2 beds on reservation. They tried to give us 1 bed on arrival but gave us 2 when pushed slightly. Stayed at this hotel cause Celine Dion was performing there. Was told on the phone we were staying in the newest tower (Palace Tower) which was 2 years old but it was pretty well used & was not as clean as it could be. Coffee maker was left dirty, it didn't work anyway; took a day to get it exchanged. The restroom smelled really bad, sulphur in the water or something but only from the toilet. No fridge, only a mini bar, watch out for extra charges. Beds were comfortable, room spacious enough. Walls were thin. If going, book online & take a package deal if going to a perfomance. We paid double for one less night than a couple with exaclty the same room & concert tickets. They took a package deal although over the phone. The concert was amazing & the Colliseum great!! Get the rewards card @ no cost. Eat at the buffet, great food & choices & a whole lot cheaper. Paynards Bistro has wonderful food but expensive. Serendity Restaurant- very overpriced - Margherita $14.00 each plus tax & the food was not worth it; would not eat there again.

Reviews.Title: “Forum Shops and Qua Spa entice but would stay elsewhere next time.”
Reviews.Author: ILove2Travel95
Reviews.Content: Our room in the Augustus Tower was spacious and had a striking view of the Caesar's complex and Las Vegas Strip, looking to the north with the Mirage, Wynn and Encore in the distance. We opted to try the text check-in which went very smoothly, even better than expected! We registered ahead of time and received a text the day before checking in. I responded to the text and got a response saying we're all set, and to go to the bell desk at check-in. We arrived at the bell desk and were immediately handed our room key which was waiting for us in an envelope. Literally took 10 seconds! The Augustus tower is amazing, and our room was clean and comfortable. The only odd thing was that when we first came into the room, everything was great except, in the bathroom, there was a lighter laying on the counter next to the sink, and all of the little bottles of shampoo, conditioner and soaps (about 8-10 of them) were tossed all over the counter, randomly lying around. Everything else was perfectly tidy! We left the lighter on the counter and it was gone the next day. Assume it belonged to housekeeping staff. I agree with other reviewers in that you don't necessarily get much value for what you pay for the room, as far as other hotel amenities. The best spots at the pool come at a price. It was difficult to find lounge chairs, and the pool bar and food service was slow and ridiculously priced, but, that's Vegas! The buffet at breakfast time was a bit of a disappointment as far as poor selection and the rudeness of the staff at the front. I did have some type of credit for free breakfast, and can't remember exactly what happened, but I was rudely scolded at the desk because I didn't immediately know the proper words to say to the woman about how our breakfast was to be paid for. I'm on vacation, I was being polite. There is no such thing as gracious guest service anymore. You're a cog in a machine there (as with many of these massive Strip hotels) and they can't deal with any deviation, or human interaction that deviates from the script they recite all day. I guess some places excel in this area better than others, and Caesars doesn't seem to be one. Where they do excel is with the proximity to the Forum Shops, and the wonderfully easy trip from my room in the Augustus Tower down to the Qua Spa, which is part of that tower. The spa was excellent, all of the staff was cordial and attentive, and it was a very relaxing spa experience with beautiful and meticulously clean facilities. Oh, and one more note on breakfast, skip the buffet and head to Payard just across the hall. There you'll find amazing, freshly made real fruit smoothies and breakfast crepes and pastries, and friendly staff. Definitely a highlight! Overall, Ceasar's was fine, but nothing that stood out to me as special, mostly due to just a very impersonal feeling that I seemed to get from the little interaction we had with staff. With the selection of hotels in Las Vegas I will look to try others before considering a return to Caesar's.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: yankanuck
Reviews.Content: Booked a classic room and was upgraded to deluxe at no cost. When I noticed that the desk clerk was really pushing me to upgrade to a more modern room at check-in I started to get a bad feeing about this place. After I told him that I didn't want to pay the extra $50 per night and would take the room that I booked - he "upgraded" us for nothing! I gave him a twenty for this bonus which was well worth it. My advice is to keep quiet when they push upgrades at you in front of your spouse in an effort to get you to spend more money with them. You can always change rooms if you want after you've checked in anyway. We had a great time there. Made many trips to Walgreens for snacks, beers, etc. Not a very far walk. Use the free internet at McDonalds just up the strip a little next to Harrah's whenever you need the web.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: travjud
Reviews.Content: We got comped for this hotel but if you can get a deal for it, it would be ideal. The location is very central. We stayed in the Augusta wing and it was very nice-looked like it was recently updated. The buffet though wasn't great compared to other Harrah's properties ie. Planet Hollywood or Rios.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...I'll chosee another hotel next time.”
Reviews.Author: sbenjamen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen based on price. That was the hook. Upon arrival we were told that we would need to wait up to 6 hours to check in -- unless - we upgraded to another room for $75 a nite. And of course that would was ready immediately. An up front bait/switch. If our room was available. we obviously would not have taken the upgrade.. The room is very nice - facing the hotel..which has a pool party going on righ now - so it's very loud. The bathtub is a plus (it's got jets). Wifi costs $14.99 for a 24 hours period. Another nickle and dime. The casino is not very cohesive. Fractured. Would definitely stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Vegas”
Reviews.Author: pikachu014
Reviews.Content: If you ever want to stay on the 13th floor of a hotel, Caesars has it in their Roman Tower... I'm giving average ratings for their rooms and service because that is what the Roman Tower room was like. Nothing fancy, just a basic, standard hotel room. I actually booked the Augustus Tower, which is supposed to be newer and nicer. But my room for the weekend was comp'd. I've read reviews and forums where people had issues using others comps when that person was not present, but I had no issues. So, I won't complain about the room downgrade... It was free. Only thing I'd ask for, is a designated smoking area at the pools. If you're outside at the pool, guests should be able to get some fresher air without having people blow their smoke around. Plus, it would keep the smoker's butts out of the pool (which my wife and I did see one floating around).

Reviews.Title: “Great in the movies - pretty crap in real life...”
Reviews.Author: Misha J
Reviews.Content: I confess myself being swayed by the 'hype' surrounding this hotel. When it was decided that we would spend 5 days in Vegas, after a journey to Mexico, I had it in my head to stay in either Caesars, Venetian, Bellagio or some other behemoth. What a mistake that was. Yes I will admit it - having seen The Hangover - why would I want to stay anywhere else? The hotel is easy enough to find - the carpark too. Trying to find the bleeding reception from the carpark (how many lifts and how many hundreds of metres of casino can one walk whilst lugging around their baggage?) requires a compass and degree in orienteering however. At check in (and my isn't that reception area amazing?) together with the best "I am so glad to meet you" smile I could muster, I also presented the check in agent with a $60 tip. She was very appreciative and suggested we would really love our room. Up we went to find a room that was older than the Grand Canyon that lies just across the border in Arizona. The room actually smelled - stale cigarettes and mould. The furnishings were ancient and covered in dust - not one piece of wood was unchipped, and the beds hard as rocks. The wardrobe (a stand alone style best viewed at the local tip) was on four legs about 30 cms high. The carpet underneath the wardrobe was blood red. The rest was a pale orange, which is never a good sign. The bathroom itself looked like one you may find at a train station. I noted that the towels were so hard and stiff - I wold wager my gambling rations (which were not insignificant) that the towels had been hanging there for many, many months - and no one had been in this room in a while. The fact that Jesus (the friendly, if somewhat time-ravaged porter) had to use his shoulder and some hard pushes to open the room in the first place set the scene. I immediately phoned reception to advise them of the absolute shocking state of the room and was asked to come down stairs to see if they could do something. Upon returning to the reception desk, we were immediately switched to a different tower. The room was a mile apart from the first one. I must admit it was smaller than I thought it would be, but at least we had a view of the strip as opposed to a car park/construction zone this time. The bathroom was also a modern affair, including a TV screen set within the mirror. It also had the very American phenomenon of a phone in the WC. I am yet to imagine a scenario (apart from an Elvis or Mama Cass situation) where I would possibly want to talk on a phone whilst sitting on the khazi, the thought of the things it had seen enough to get one's hand sanitizer out of your carry on baggage. The casino at Caesars was shockingly disappointing. Looking run down, it had none of the pezazz I expected it to. Anyone familiar with the concept of a 'Leagues Club' would be surprised to hear it is less impressive than those. After visiting other casinos/hotels I am sure I would only stay at the Wynn/Encore upon any return to Vegas - though even with the eventual upgrade to a more suitable room, I would not be tempted to return to Caesars. On the plus side, the Forum shops are absolutely amazing, and the location is pretty good - being further down towards the 'quieter' part of the strip and away from the tattoo parlours/biker bars at the other end. I imagine this place would be appropriate for a group of young guys out for a boys-weekend without the girls. Looking for luxury - perhaps the Venetian would better suit?

Reviews.Title: “Quite a Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad19
Reviews.Content: First let me state that I am not a Vegas fan. I only travel there for business, and this was the third time this year! I stayed in the Palace Tower, and what a treat. The room was nicely appointed and spacious. I had a king size bed, lounge chair, desk area, flat screen TV. The bathroom was large with a jetted tub and separate shower. Very nice. Downside -- you do have to pay for the coffee that you drink in the room, so no free coffee at this hotel. Did think was a bit over the top. While there are no resort fees, you still have to pay if you want to use the fitness center -- the pools are free. The fitness center is very very nice. Lots of equipment kept in very good shape. Then, there is the spa area. As my group had a discount, I splurged on both the fitness pass and the spa area - and really did NOT regret it at all. Very nice. They have a series of Roman Baths, and as they have a separate spa for men and women -- very nice indeed. Also have access to steam, sauna and arctic ice room! As with all the hotels, you have the casinos. They do have the Forum Shops with a food court for a more reasonably priced meal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and classy”
Reviews.Author: old_metalhed
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an excellent 4-night stay at Caesars Palace. I booked the hotel about 6 months ago via Caesar's website & their Friends and Family offer, I booked 2 Roman Tower rooms Sun-Thu for $89 / $89 / $89 / $119 each and was very pleased with the rate (I checked frequently for months after booking and only saw the room prices increase. And just before we arrived, the same rooms were being offered upwards of $240 per night via same Caesars site promotion). We arrived Sunday evening at 6:00pm for check-in and walked right up to the desk. There was no line at all. Tried the $50 sandwich trick and was not able to get an upgrade. So, I took my $50 back and thanked him for trying. Notables: 9th floor Roman Tower room was perfectly acceptable. Clean and comfortable and really a great value compared to other tower room rates. We spent less than 8 hours per day in our room so we did not feel we missed out on a suite option. Our room overlooked the strip with a view of Flamingo, Bally's and Bills, our other party's room overlooked the pools with a view of the Rio and mountains. Pool is fantastic! We visited every morning 8-1:00pm and noticed plenty of chairs available for all guests on Mon, with increased traffic as the week progressed. By Wed morning, all available chairs were gone by 10:00. No one asked for our room key or checked our bags upon entering the pool. We walked to the towel counter and grabbed 2 towels per person and just walked right in to find open chairs. I believe anyone could walk right in with food and beverages and spend the day at the pools. All casino and hotel staff are very professional and courteous. Good drink service while gambling and great service overall. Navigating around the property was easy after the first day. It is a very large campus but laid out well. Good ventilation and a little colder temperature compared to other casinos. Caesars has 2 completely separate casinos - main Caesars Casino with table games (as you enter the front doors to the resort) and the Forum Casino with table games, sports book, and poker room (back to the right as you walk past a few bars and restaurants). Great restaurants offered in the resort. All meals were great. We did not try the buffet. Can't comment on the spa or gym as we did not use those facilities. Caesars has many partner resorts close by and you can use your member card at them all. This is a wonderful resort in central proximity on the strip. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother....”
Reviews.Author: Dstar007
Reviews.Content: I got an email offering an upgraded room weeks before we arrived. It was a reasonable price so I paid for the upgrade. When we arrived to check in, we were told there were no upgrades available although we pre-paid for it. Therefore, we were put in a room in the "old" Caesar's tower, the one that's been there since the 60's. The room was terrible, everything, except the bed, looked like it was still in the 60's. The only good thing I can say about the room was the bed, very comfortable. The worst part was no coffee maker in the room. What hotel in Vegas doesn't offer at least 2 free cups of coffee in the rooms ? If you're staying at Caesar's and they try to put you in the "old tower", tell them no and go stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awesome!”
Reviews.Author: RachandLil
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and arrived a couple hours early for checkin. Our room wasn't ready so we were upgraded to a suite in the palace towers. The room was wonderful, large and roomy with an amazing view over the 9 pools! The service staff were great and generally a welcoming and friendly attitude from all. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Chelle67
Reviews.Content: We loved our Junior Suite at Caesar's Palace. It was beautiful with its calming colors and his and hers bathrooms! My husband loved the Sports Book (make a $5.00 bet and get a coupon for a free drink). I loved the beautiful spa! The pools were very nice, but not all of the pools were open and most chairs were taken. We did do the buffet for Rewards members for 44.95.....we were stuffed. We did a late breakfast, late lunch, late dinner, and then early breakfast to get 4 meals out of the deal. I don't think we could have done it two days in a row !! All in all it was a VERY fun trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Sandi106
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2,000 square foot suite - wonderful accommodations in the Palace Tower. Nice proximity to the convention center, and no smoking on that side of the facility. The casino was very smoky (other, newer casinos have better ventilation). Great shopping at the Forum Shops. Close to bus stops for the shuttles that take you up & down the strip. Also enjoyed being able to walk over to the Bellagio to see the fountains. Wonderful pools at Caesars, but be extremely careful walking around them. The surfaces can be very slick at time, and I fell pretty hard onto my knee on the cement. They were good about bringing an ice pack immediately. Here's a tip though: if you drink coffee, bring your own Keurig coffee pods. There are Keurig machines in the rooms, but the pods are $12 for 4 pods. We went to a grocery store and bought some.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite place -”
Reviews.Author: Franki00
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I go to Vegas about 3 times a year and our usual place to stay is Caesars Palace- we stay in the Palace Tower and love the room. It's a great size, the room is always clean, housekeeping is terrific - we have never yet had to wait for our room to be cleaned, we usually get a fantastic view of most of the pools, no problem with noise for any extended periods of time, always treated great. Check in is sometimes a bit of a wait but usually no more than 25 minutes, check out sometimes is a whole different story not sure what the problem is there. Not a problem though if you just check out online. Lots of places to eat - the food court is not bad and the prices are fair. The casino is well laid out - we never feel crowded. I love the fact that the shopping is right outside the casino and if I'm loaded down with packages I don't have to go outside just take an elevator to my room. Plus then my hubby can't see all the money I've spent. There is a new H&M in the forum shops that is 3 floors and they are big floors - lots to look at and buy. It's very new so still all nice and clean and shiny inside. We are off again in September and will be staying at Caesars again and I'm sure it will be one heck of a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: GerardoVargas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in many Hotels in Las Vegas like Paris, MandalaY Bay, Winn and Tresure Island and Caesar´s is by far the coolest, nicest, and excitest of all...

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MadrileÃ±a
Reviews.Content: My second time in Las Vegas and decided to do it in style. We booked the deluxe room for a very good price (this was a Monday, of course), and it was all we expected it to be, elegant, spacious & clean. The hotel is beautiful. We'll definitely stay there next time, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view, great pools, great shops”
Reviews.Author: gioia26
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our get away. Ceasars has a beautiful pool area, great location on the strip, great food at Rao's-highly recommend the seafood salad!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Mauifreaks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars beginning of August for 5 days for a family reunion. Check in took a long time. They did not have enough reception staff working to make things run smoother. The hotel is very pretty and gigantic. You really don't have to venture out of this hotel if you don't want to. It has the Forum shops, which by the way does have some decently priced shops. So if you don't want to shop at Gucci you can shop at Guess, or Ed Hardy.. etc. Large casino, great shows and great resturants. My family went to see Celine and said that she was amazing and a must see. I chose a cirque show which was great also. But there is so much to see in Vegas, so please venture out and bring some good walking shoes or sandals. Pool area was probably one of my favorite parts of this hotel. It gets confusing at times to get around ( due to all of the additions to hotel over the years). However, they have plenty of signs to help you out as long as you are sober enough to read them lol!. Yes its about 6 bucks for a coffee and 26 bucks for a poolside margarita, but thats Vegas for you. Its not cheap to eat and consume alcohol especially if you are not gambling. The rooms were very nice, I'd recommend staying in the deluxe rooms in the palace towers if you can. They are close to pool and main lobby. Weather in vegas was just way too hot for my liking. If it weren't for having a family reunion there in August I would never have gone in the summer months. Weather is much better in early fall or spring. Overall it is a nice hotel, friendly staff, but would prefer to stay at the much nicer Venetian for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice room, but stuffy”
Reviews.Author: Apljavaman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a business trip. We had a room in the palace tower. Since my family was with me, I upgraded the room. Had two queen beds and a large bathroom w/ jacuzzi. The room was nice, clean and had a great view. The only negative I had with the room, was with the air conditioning. This wasn't a "problem" but a design flaw. This is one of those rooms with motion sensor that cuts back air when you aren't moving in the room. After about 5-10 minutes of no-motion, the fan is kicked back to low, which made the room stuffy. Thermostat could be set to 65, but even at best, the room never made it past 70. Made it very difficult to sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars is Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Blueonblue21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Caesars a few times. They always comp my room (and upgrade me to a suite). EVERYone (from the check-in staff to the housekeeping staff) is always friendly and professional. It's a HUGE casino/hotel, and easy to get lost once you're inside. Overall, I do 95% of my gambling at Caesars (the other 5% at one of Caesars Entertainment's other properties), so they always treat me good. The rooms that I've stayed in have been large, extra clean, and beautifully furnished. The beds are large and comfortable. The bathrooms are large and classy. The showers are large and relaxing. In the future, I will ONLY stay at Caesars!

Reviews.Title: “The Good Outweighs The Bad”
Reviews.Author: JournieJunkie
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying in Las Vegas but my first time staying at Caesars Palace. Because of gambling I ended up getting a complimentary 2 night stay at the hotel. I was pretty grumpy after flying through 3 timezones and being on a 5 hour flight that was in thunderstorms the entire time. We were supposed to get the most basic room valued at $200/night for our stay. When we got there and I assume because we were checking in at midnight that they were all booked up. I was told that hotel policy states in this scenario they would upgrade you to the next level up however there were no rooms available in the next level up. The clerk then said "I don't know what we're going to do but it looks like we have no rooms available so I guess I'll have to consult with my manager." The manager and the clerk deliberated and decided to bump us from what was supposed to be a $200/night room to a $1,500/night room. We were bumped from a Deluxe Room to a Senator's Suite. You can imagine how happy we were but at the same time we were just beyond tired. However I was pretty insulted when it came to checking out. The front desk is beyond large and people were confused and how where to form a line. At 8:45am a woman with an iPad came up to us asking if were checking out, I said yes and asked if I was standing at the right place, she said yes and that somebody would be with me shortly. At 9:15am I went back up to that same woman with the iPad and asked for her to get a manger because waiting 30 minutes to check out was ridiculous. The woman with the iPad told me she could check me out using her iPad. Why did I have to wait 30 minutes to find that out, why didn't she tell me she had that ability and make that same offer before I wasted 30 minutes of my life? I understand the room was complimentary but that doesn't entitle me to receive lesser service. I know this is supposed to be one of the nicest hotels on the strip but the checking out process was brutal. I stay in several hotels every year and I thought this would be the last hotel this would happen at!

Reviews.Title: “Massive and Comfortable.....yet Personable”
Reviews.Author: tradecomm
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in the Palace Tower. Room was well appointed, modern and functional. The bed very comfortable. Housekeeping was pretty good although I note that they did not do a daily vacuum. It appears only every couple of days and when a guest checks out. Towels - a couple of more would have been nice. In-room jacuzzi unfortunately did not work but not that we had a lot of time for it! Pools - wow- at least 8 of them plus a hot tub. Restaurants - many to choose from. I would suggest that a visitor go to the Forum shops (i believe that is what it is called) and seek out the Cheesecake Factory or something else as food can be expensive - Breakfast at the "buffet restaurant is about $29.00 pp. Shows - went to see Celine Dionne - Although not a big fan - her show was amazing and well worth seeing. She did a duet with Stevie Wonder and feature a set of songs from various James Bond theme songs and some Michael Jackson. - if you get tickets - I don't think there is a bad seat in the auditorium. Staff - always very helpful Casino - what can one say about the casino? A wide variety of both slots and card games available in various $$$ amounts including a "high rollers area". Recommendation - definitely would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Things have changed a bit at the Venus Pool”
Reviews.Author: heeler1
Reviews.Content: We went back to Caesar's again this year for our annual 3 couples road trip. All is well at Caesar's for the most part but there have been a few changes worth knowing about. Check in went fairly well, we arrived early in the morning and were lucky to be able to check in to three rooms right away when the normal wait would have been until 6 pm. Seemed OK, the price we paid for that checkin was adequate rooms but in the worst wing of the Forum Towers where there is NO view. You might be better off stashing your bags until 6 pm if a view of the strip is what you want. Good to specifically ask about getting a view. While we love the Venus pool for its small adults only atmosphere with close monitoring of guest behavior so no one gets out of control; it is important to note that things have changed. You must bring ID to the pool with you regardless of your age. Your hotel key alone will not do. You may NOT bring any food or drink, no not even water, into the Venus Pool with you. You MUST have your bag searched prior to entry and you may not have any medications with you. Clearly they have had a problem with drugs in the pool area, since even marked Advil and prescription drugs are not allowed. IF you have a prescription that for some odd reason you must have with you, then it must be in a pharmacy container with your name on it and security will hold it for you until you need it. It cannot come into the pool space with you. I think this is understandable policy, but many will not like it and you should "know before you go" if you have issues with this sort of thing. Once you are in the venus pool, the same exorbitant rates apply for renting day beds or cabanas, nothing new there. What is new is a 400 dollar minimum bar/food tab for our group of 6. Wow! Easy to achieve as drinks are EXPENSIVE, but a pretty high limit given the current economy in Vegas. They did not seem to have much trouble having people agree to the limit, the pool was nicely full although not packed. Service at the pool was friendly, efficient and good. Food quality is good and served in a timely manner. The pool is well looked after by busboys and security and remains tidy and well kept. The regular pool was also busy, I have no idea about the cost of anything there. Overall, though, we enjoyed our stay again, the rooms were clean and comfortable and 5 of 6 of us thought the beds particularly comfy. One of our group was easily able to request non down pillows. It was wonderfully quiet in our hallways of the hotel and cleaning staff were pleasant and accommodating. We will go again.

Reviews.Title: “still superb”
Reviews.Author: politepete
Reviews.Content: Back again after 2 years ,,,All i can say is that the upgraded pool area makes this the best in Vegas ,,So what if some of the older rooms are a bit untidy ,the location more than makes up for it , Check in was easy ,prices are fair ,service was good, Pool as stated is the best in Vegas , Oh and if there are 2 shows you should see in vegas ?,they are both here Absinthe & Matt Goss .

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but Vegas has better to offer”
Reviews.Author: travelwitsam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here right after the July 4th weekend..it was a great place to go to after watching the movie the Hangover shot there. Sadly that is the highlight.The hotel is very good overall but its rooms were not as good as the venetian..they were rather old although we did get a good deal. It has lost its charm and small things like the carpet etc are old and run down...it needs to do a lot more(i stayed in the Roman tower) dont know if they have better but it was comfortable..might go to another place the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Babyyyy!!! Celebrating my 30th Birthday in Vegas was the best birthday EVER!”
Reviews.Author: mandy70
Reviews.Content: WOW a hotel/place I will never forget! Vegas Baby!!!!! and I was also celebrating my 30th Birthday!!!!! It was such a treat to stay at Caesars. We walked into the hotel reception area and we were greeted by the glamorous layout including the famous Caesar painting on the wall from the Hangover movie! My friend and I were in awe and we were so happy to be staying at Caesars. I mentioned to the reception man that us girls “were celebrating my 30th birthday and maybe you could upgrade our room.. we flew all the way from Australia”!! And to my surprise he upgraded us to the “Palace Tower Suite”! oh la la! We had a smile from ear to ear on our faces!! Caesars is great in every aspect.. great location, absolutely beautiful and huge huge huge hotel. There is always something to do and many options to eat. Try out the MUNCH BAR – great snack food and meals – also have free WIFI! The Forum Shops are also great – a big selection of shopping options and also at your convenience since it is a part of the hotel. Try the Cheesecake Factory for dinner one night – very nice food. You cant help feeling you are in Rome by all the Roman statues and Italian influence. PURE nightclub is a must! Remember to head up to the roof upstairs to party under the Vegas lights! The pools are also great – a DJ hits up some tunes during the day.. you feel like you are at a little party enjoying the sun, having a cocktail and excited to see what the night brings ahead! Definitely recommend Caesars!!

Reviews.Title: “frustrating check in experience, otherwise a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KPL0228
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very busy the day we checked in (June 2011) and the wait was quite long perhaps 45 minutes. We were told our rooms were not ready, nor would they be ready for several hours. We had booked two rooms and were told there was no way to get the rooms even remotely near one another unless we upgraded, and then we could at least have rooms on the same floor. Traveling with teenage children, proximity was paramount. Agreeing to upgrade out of necessity, we then had one room that was available at the time we were checking in (3 p.m.) but the second room would be several hours before it was cleaned and ready. They said they would call when the room was available, we waited until about 7:30 p.m. and finally asked at the desk and the room was finally available. The upgraded rooms were lovely, and the service as quite good. We had a wonderful day around the pool with outstanding service there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Classic Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleCJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars Palace during a business trip this past April, and thoroughly enjoyed being there. I have been to many of the hotels in Vegas, but the Caesars properties are by far my favorite. From the locations to the staff, everything is a pleasure. Being at Caesars, you are basically self contained with many restaurants for every palate, as well as numerous bars, etc. You can eat and do something different each night of your stay, and never be bored!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Economy Definitely Affecting This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LightTraveler33
Reviews.Content: I've been here in the past and was really impressed. This time, they have taken the ice machines and water off of the floors. You have to call room service. There was no room at the pool because they let the public in, and no umbrellas for shade in the 105 degree heat. There was no beverage service around the pool unless you rented a $400 cabana. They made us wait for over six hours to check-in and they have NO sitting areas in the lobby to wait. Instead, they force you into the smokey casino. Kids were sitting on the floor of the lobby (dirty marble) because there was no where else for them to sit. They charged $14.99 per 24 hours for unsecured internet. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Trip”
Reviews.Author: docg1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars from July 24th-29th. Check in went farily quick despite long lines and we had a wonderful room in the Augstus Tower. Buffet for breakfast was nice on the days we woke early enough to attend. Cypress Street had fairly qualtiy food at "reasonable" prices. Overall a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best beds ever”
Reviews.Author: janet11120
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas several times a year, and I can tell you this Caesars Palace has the best beds I have ever sleep in. The rooms are very nice also, alittle pricey for a room, but a deal so decided to stay. You won't be disappointed, plus Caesara is located right in the middle of the strip. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “VERY GRAND”
Reviews.Author: jacknrus
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days, it is a lovely hotel, huge, grand, nice rooms and super bathroom. For such a large place (absolutely huge place), the staff are lovely. Just a wonder to look around the Hotel. Has just about every shop you could want and great eating places to choose from. Hotel is reasonably priced for such grandeur. An experience, stay, even if you only do once in your lifetime. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “best 4 star hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: robkat1
Reviews.Content: we stayed 7-24-11 to 7-26-11. this was our 2nd stay, it was great. we were in the august tower 2772 this hotel is best of harrahs resorts on the strip, the paris is number 2 planet hollywood is 3, flamingo is number4 rooms are large and clean. the only negative is self park which is a long walking dstance

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay, hope to repeat it soon.”
Reviews.Author: boilermaker502
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 24-July 29,2011. Our upgraded was great. It did'nt cost much more,but put us on the 16th floor of the Palace Tower. The room over looked the entire cluster of swimming pools even the European Pool (wow). The room was clean large and luxurious. The staff from the reception desk to house keeping and wait persons were always courteous and sincerely friendly. I wish the slot machines were as friendly. Good stay had lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: lowroll3r
Reviews.Content: Reading mixed reviews, I wasn't sure what to expect. Everyone we encountered in this hotel was friendly and helpful. I felt all the staff, from the cocktail waitresses, to the front desk, treated us wonderfully and that was a huge plus for me. Drink service on the casino floor and the breakfast buffet were very good here. Room was clean and stocked well with plenty of towels and bathroom supplies. Checking out by phone was very convenient and I thought it was great that I was asked if we enjoyed our stay when we checked out. Would stay here again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rager999
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great. Stay in the Forum rooms or up for the best of the best. Rooms are clean, well stocked and cleaned everyday. The food stations are very good but are pricey but well worth it, the food is very good. The Hotel staff is outstanding, they even smile. We stayed three nights and it was very, very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at Caesars Palace...Truly a Palace!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clevelandcutie
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I loved it here....Quick and hassle free check -in. Our room was so nice, great view of the strip. It really had everything - I mean a tv in the bathroom ! What else could you ask for . We went to Pure which was fun. Also, Serendipity was very nice- the food was great ! My first trip to Vegas was awesome, and when we do return I plan on staying here again :)

Reviews.Title: “The WOW factor...”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of a Road Trip across the states... Quite a finish... Vegas is immense... Amazing place... Definitely a place to put on the "bucket list", although I think 3 or 4 days is more than enough time to set aside for a visit... I wouldn't fall over myself to return, unless it was for a 'stag do' (bachelor party) or something like that. We were in Vegas for 6 days, in an RV, The Travel Lodge, The Flamingo and Caeser's. We arrived at Caesars Palace, and because of a conference the night before, we were told that rooms would not be ready and to leave our bags with the bell and come back after 4pm... Not ideal after a long day... We didn't make a fuss and did as we were told... Came back later and it took 45 minutes for the bell to get our cases!... Lined up for 20 mins to check in... (I don't think its always like this to check in, just bad timing maybe) Then upgraded to a suite in Palace Tower for €67 per night... Very very nice room with a beautiful view of the pool (pics and vid to be uploaded)... Although it was nice, I regret upgrading... Our friend had a normal double room in the Forum Tower, which was not as nice, with a bad view... BUT... Its Vegas, and you will only be in the room for short periods of time... I was a sucker, and it was a nice surprise for my wife, but we both agreed that in this day and age, and they way things are, we could have spent the money more wisely... Besides... Our lovely suite had the neighbours from hell... The walls are like paper, and they partied LOUD all night when they got back to the room... I suppose the big room was great for them, and if you intend to drink or stay a lot in the room... Still... We were happy with the Hotel... We had three good nights there... The pool is excellent... Everything has the wow factor... The place is huge... Lots of places to eat and drink... It's all about the money... There is nowhere, bar the pool, that you can sit and rest without spending money... Its all geared towards you being foolish with your cash... So be careful... There is a reason they give you free drinks when you gamble... After sticking €15 into a one armed bandit before you get your drink, its not really free is it? Just be sneaky and the odd time you'll get freebies :-)... The rest of the time, be prepared to spend! Its an experience, and I'm glad we went... Grand Canyon in a helicopter was nice... the heat was extreme all the time... There is so much to take in all around you... the bellagio fountain display (close to the Hotel) is romantic, and great to watch... Not a place for families or kids... lots of people handing out prostitute cards all the time, everywhere you go... lots of scantily clad ladies pole dancing in the casino's... An Adults playground, but not for kids. There is no point trying to give out much more advice on Caesar's or Vegas, I could write a book, but feel free to contact me if you have any questions... Being from Ireland, I know it can be nice to get the opinion from someone Irish or from the UK since we are on the same wavelength! Enjoy Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suite”
Reviews.Author: Dev13LosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I initially booked a classic room but after reading some good reviews about the suite, asked for an upgrade. Was offered an upgrade for $50 per night to a suite in the Augustus tower and was worth. The room is not as nice as the suite at Plazzao though it was same area. The amenities and comfort was not even close to what Plazzao offered but the room as clean with a nice view of the Bellagio fountain. I watched the music fountain from my room window. The staff is very friendly. One advice is to use Valet parking instead of self parking as it's a long walk. One more thing, don't fall for the extras that Expedia offers. Expedia gave 4 tickets to Nathan Butron show but when I went to Flamingo box office I was told that the free tickets are not available and I have to pay $15 dollars per ticket to watch the show.

Reviews.Title: “well worth it,”
Reviews.Author: dgiese
Reviews.Content: caesars palace is by far one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in they treat you like royalty no matter whether you are staying in a regular room or a suite we stayed in the augustas tower everything was first class, this room comes with a jaccuzi tub nice no complaints at all. do the 24 hour buffet well worth it. note do not touch anything, on the in room snack tray or the mini bar unless you are going to purchase just picking the item up off the tray will cause you to be billed for it, they have sensors for automatic billing.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas is everything and more”
Reviews.Author: Dodmartins
Reviews.Content: When you walk in its as if it's another world, the casino is amazing, must go before one dies

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel/Resort”
Reviews.Author: Faithlyn44
Reviews.Content: Beautuful room, very clean, great service, amazing pool and WONDERFUL spa!!. Hope to go back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcbarkr
Reviews.Content: Caesars has the reputation of being the best in Vegas. The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are spacious. We had a room in Augustus Tower and it overlooked Bellagio fountains, which was a real treat. The bathroom was huge, with over the top marble with separate toilet room. Not much for affordable food choices, Augustus Cafe food was horrible. Busy casino with a lot of choices. One of the better Diamond Lounges in Vegas. Close to everything on the strip. We like a little more action, Caesars is more of a classic hotel, probably best suited to those over age 30.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, potential long walk to room”
Reviews.Author: ht137
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Caesar's for the 2nd time recently and was very happy with the choice. The first trip was in the Forum Tower, this past one was in the Augustus Tower. Both of the rooms were excellent, with the newer Augustus Tower being slightly larger. The food options in the casino itself are fairly limited and/or rather pricey, even for Vegas standards. But if you don't mind taking a stroll, many more options of every level are located in the Forum Shops. The pool area is vastly expanded from what I remember back in the day. Multiple smaller pools adjacent to the largest main pool. Even have an area with "swim-up" blackjack that I may try next time. Expect to walk quite a bit to get to your room depending which tower you are in. This in itself, can be quite a maze if you don't know exactly where you're going. Valet service is fairly slow and often limited to only diamond/seven star members at night. This can be quite an inconvenience as the walk from the back valet is quite lengthy. Probably one of the few downsides of my stay. Also if you plan to go to the pool, get there early. Otherwise, definitely would return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel4funRA
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at the hotel to see Celine Dion. The rooms were very large and quite comfortable. The hotel is really quite beautiful both inside and out. The many statues are a great photo op, as well as the garden area in front of the hotel. Remember to take your camera with you. We ate at the Lido Buffet. We found it to be disappointing. The price was very high, and the number of choices offered were minimal. We ended up eating at another hotel that was close by.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Melis74
Reviews.Content: Upon checkin we upgraded to a mini-suite in the Palace Towers. Let me start by saying Caesars is HUGE. I knew it was big, but you don't realize how big until you start trying to find your way around! Seriously though, once you get the lay of the land it is very easy to navigate. I received a very good rate on SouthWest to stay here, saying that I think it was absolutely worth it. Had I paid full price I would have preferred to go to the Wynn. The reasoning isn't anything bad, just that Caesars showed its age a little bit and I like the less crowded feel of the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Room in a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: D0nna3
Reviews.Content: We thought we were getting a fantastic online price for a room in a 4 star hotel. We were so excited to go. What we got was a 2 star room in a 4 star hotel. Old, bare bones room (similar to what you may find at a roadside Motel) with a view of an enclosed cement area with pipes and ventilation, etc. and an old mattress that went "sprong" when I rolled over. I don't think it should be presented on the internet that you are getting a 4 star experience when you are not. We made a point of not being in our room much. Good thing it was Las Vegas with tons to do.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel089
Reviews.Content: Be forewarned--there were "construction crews" working on the floor in our tower well before 6:00 a.m. with hammers and LOUD powertools. When we called the front desk their response was basically, "too bad". We ended up checking out before 7:00 a.m. because we couldn't tolerate the noise anymore. Not what I expect for over $150/night. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok!”
Reviews.Author: ssmidnight
Reviews.Content: First time staying at caesars, and we go to vegas a couple times a year. Over all it is a nice place to stay. the pools were really nice. they need to open them all! two of them were closed. We had to walk around waiting for someone leave to get a lounge chair. Open the pools when its that busy. Ask a staff member why they were closed, they didn't know. Stayed 3 days there the last day we were there they never made up our room, I had to ask for clean towels. should never have to do that, for the cost of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “My third stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: CantWaitF0rNextTrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Forum Tower a few years ago and it was a clean, spacious room. This time the room looked like it needed some updating. The carpet was a little worn and the grout in the shower needed a good cleaning. The staff was even more courteous this trip though. I like staying at Caesars because it is in a good central location and the atmosphere isn't too young or too stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Pros”
Reviews.Author: violeto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Las Vegas several times a year and over the past five years have been there probably 25 times. We have our favorite hotels but this time decided to try something new so we chose Ceasar's Palace. We were supposed to get a suite but there was a mix up with the reservation and there weren't any available. The room was pretty small but all of the furnishings modern and sleek. I did notice that even though the furniture looked fairly new it was pretty beat up. The bathroom was nice but did not have the big seperate tub I was looking for. The casino at Caesar's is average and has a bit of a nostalgic feel to it. An absolute must for anyone vacationing in Vegas is the Mesa Grill. It is in Caesar's Palace and is probably the best meal I have ever had. Make sure to make reservations because it is very popular. The spa at Caesar's is also a must.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: yesss43
Reviews.Content: Been to Caesars a few times and this stay was another great one. Normally stay @ the Flamingo but this time around wanted a jacuzzi tub so across the street I go. Little worried about the pool...sounded a little uptight....Well EVERYONE do not worry....You CAN bring in your own beverages food etc...weekends included...They never checked our bags and I purposely went in with a beverage in my hand...NO PROBLEMS...that includes a saturday and sunday...Did see a guy having to chug a beer before they let him in but put it in your bag or have mixed drinks like me and go right in. Once the week starts you do not even have to show a key. So disregard all this junk about no water etc...If you do need water it cost you a dollar and you get free refills. I stayed 7/16/11-7/22/11. Pool is fantastic a little calmer than the flamingo pool and the variety of pools was nice. The room (palace Tower) was great...Offered an upgrade to the augustus tower but declined mainly because the pool entrance is @ elevators of the palace towers and besides the tv in the bathroom basically the same room. One thing though, bring your own music player because they did not have a docking station for your ipod or mp3. Overall great stay everyone was nice and I will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Caesars !”
Reviews.Author: dwife921
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Caesars many times. I never forget to write a review! A beautiful week, with truely wonderful staff. I am a total rewaeds card holder, and it is the best card in Vegas. From check-in,till check out, a terrific staff of wonderful, and friendly staff. I have just returned on July 26th, and it never fails to amaze me. If you are not satisfied with the room, simply ask for another. Always tip at checkin!!! The concierge people will work to obtain what you want. The bad reviews on this site, are unbelievable to me!!! You could not ask for a better location, and staff. Incredible ,is the best word to describe Caesars. please get a total rewards card, and host, no matter what you spend. See a casino host ,night before you leave, and will be quite pleased. My home away from home, will always remain CAESARS PALACE!

Reviews.Title: “SCAM - NEVER accept an upgrade in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Taloucha
Reviews.Content: We had booked 3 rooms with 2 double beds in advance to have the best price. We were 3 couples travelling with 4 children so we needed the 2 double beds. When we arrived, the front desk announced to us that the hotel was "overbooked" and that double bed rooms were not available anymore. As a compensation, the front clerk (with her manager's approval) offered us a Suite for the same price where we could all fit in. We then signed the paper agreeing to the upgrade. When we checked out the front clerk told us again not to worry and that the price was not additional. When we came back from holidays, our credit card was debited with an additonal 1680 dollars for the Suite (which was the amount we had already payed for the 3 double bedrooms)!!!! When we called the Caesar's Palace for the refund, a very unfriendly manager told us that we had misunderstood and that by signing for the upgrade, we were accepting to pay for the whole amount of the Suite. He then added that the hotel was willing to make a "gesture" of 200 dollars! Lesson learned: NEVER trust the Caesar's palace front clerks and certainly NEVER accept an upgrade from those people. They will ruin your holidays. Go to the Bellagio next door... better price and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel at Best Price”
Reviews.Author: ASDFLKJH1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in July. Its a grand property with beautifully designed Reception area and Great Rooms. We stayed in Forum Rooms and those were recently designed Rooms. The hotel is in the center of the Strip which makes moving around very convenient for family like us. We were with Kids and They enjoyed stay at hotel, as all facilities were great

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - far beyond what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: theoryofthirds
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Forum Tower and were pleasantly surprised with the great room and overall cleanliness. It was easy to get to shows and events at others hotels. The casino staff was very friendly and the food was very tasty. The pool was great! Everything was rather pricey and it was rather confusing to navigate the massive facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mangocatpurring
Reviews.Content: Prefect location in the middle of the strip. Good casino, lots of restaurant choices and shopping. The room was good. Get a strip view if you can. We especially enjoyed the areas from The Hangover. Check in and out was extremely slow.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Property”
Reviews.Author: SueAB
Reviews.Content: I was a little unsettled for our trip to Caesar's Palace, Las Vegas, after reading several negative posts on this site. I should not have wasted my time worrying - Caesar's really wowed us! We were upgraded to a room in the Augustus Tower, which we would have described as a suite - couch, coffee table, upholstered chair and ottoman, flatt screen TV, desk and jacuzzi tub. Every employee we encounted was helpful and customer service oriented, The buffet was a tad small for the size the the property but it was well worth the price. We found shrimp, crab legs, a turkey and roast beef carving station even on the lunch menu. Cypress Street offers many restaurants and even though they were pricey, the food was good. The Forum Shops were out of our price range but were fun to visit. There are two large casinos and we could play anything we wanted anytime and the cocktail servers did a great job. The only down side we could find was that Caesar's charged for internett service and the Keurig coffee system in the room was $12 per pot. We will definitely return to Caesar's Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: duckworths5
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recieved an upgraded suit, with a view of the strip and the Bellagio falls. It was one of the best hotel rooms I have stayed in, from decor to cleanliness. Staying in that wing of the hotel you are also able to use the VIP taxi pick up and drop off (no lines). I don't gamble so the pool area was very important. After visiting the Venus (adult pool) we never returned to the main pool, though they were lovely. The Venus pool has a party atmoshphere 7 days a week, opens at 11'ish, have better towels, service, a DJ etc.... It gets very busy on the weekends, so arrive early or miss out on seating (or even a spot on the cement). There are no photos allowed which is a shame, I would have loved to capture some of our time there. The quality of guests was much better than other hotels. The guests were mature and very few children, therefore the service was perfect. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Whispery
Reviews.Content: I stayed at ceasars via my Comps for 5 nights versus staying at Paris as I have not been impressed the last few stays there. Even though the convention I was in town for was at paris I preferred to walk across the street ( not as easy as it sounds..) When I checked in I asked nicely for an upgrade to the augustus tower & we received a suite with whirlpool & a crappy view but it was a very nice room! Everything was clean & comfy. Plenty of room for entertaining & just relaxing. I filled the whirlpool with piping hot water & could not get in for like 4 hrs as I waited for it to cool down LOL! hey must have some good insulation in those things! he hotel & casino is gorgeous, I have been there many times but never stayed there. I would stay there again no problem, we were at the end of the hall & was quiet. We used the pool for a couple days, it was warm, not all of them were open due to the season but it was nice to just relax there for a while. Casino I actually WON for once. We did a little shopping in the forum shops, I found some good deals, & got a nice candle at bath & body for $5 compared to the gift shop for $25 for almost the same candle so I could scent up the bathroom while i took my spas. The staff was very accomodating & let us check out late also. Wish I had been able to ENJOY the place more but was there for work so did not get too much pleasure time unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “VEGAS, BABY”
Reviews.Author: Patti4554
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Vegas to be married on 7-17-2011. We stayed at Caesars Palace from July 16 thru July 21. This was our first trip to Vegas and we were told that we should stay at Caesars for the ultimate "Vegas" experience. We were booked in the Forum Towers, but was upgraded to the Augustus Towers after we told them that we were getting married and that it was my husband's birthday (got married on his birthday - he will never forget our anniversary)! Check-in was smooth and the room was great! The only problem we had was when we asked if we could have my wedding dress steamed and my husband's shirt pressed. They were happy to oblige, but charged $115 for the dress and an additional $15 for a rush (we asked for this on Saturday to have it ready on Sunday, so I don't understand the "rush" charge)! My dress was more of a formal gown that a full-blown wedding dress, so we could not understand the charge. My husband spoke with the manager and the charge was reduced by 50%. We were okay with that. The room was neat and roomy, the bathroom was great with the jacuzzi tub and separate shower and we had a great view of the strip. All in all it was a great trip and I married the man of my dreams!!

Reviews.Title: “This is it. Real Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: merchus
Reviews.Content: Don't even doubt about it, yo have to stay here at least one night if you go to Vegas! Amazing and spacious rooms with awesome views, delicious beds, royalty bathrooms with all the amenities you can imagine. The Casino is one of the best at Vegas. The restaurants and stores center is beautifully arranged as if you where in Rome. Just excellent. Definitely a to-do in Vegas. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: KZBB
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay here even before The Hangover made it so popular. The basic room is terrible! Everything is VERY old and stuck in the 80's... Along with the 'tube tv'... For a price they will upgrade your room... This is a must, but like I said it's NOT A FREE UPGRADE!!! The food is overpriced, the staff is rude, and the managers on duty are even worse!!! We had a horrible experience at the "slice" located in casino, and let me tell you this... At Caesars palace the customer is always wrong! WE WILL NEVER BE BACK!!!!! I will be happy to take my business somewhere else... Such a let down!

Reviews.Title: “Living Large at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: jrosborne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a bachelor party weekend. Had three rooms as booked by a friend who is a diamond status member of Harrah's hotels. It was my first time at this resort and any Harrah's resort. I've stayed at MGM Grand, Luxor and New York, New York in the past and Caesars takes the crown as my favorite. Lets take a look at the pros and cons: PROS: The property is beautiful and the staff is friendly. I don't recall the name of the room we stayed in but I believe we stayed in the Augutus tower. The rooms were spacious with some nice touches of luxury without going over the top. The view from our window (floor to ceiling) was over the strip and the Bellagio water show. We spent a lot of time at the pools, which were absolutely amazing. The location is hard to beat in the middle of the strip with easy access to many other resorts and almost anything else you could need. Many good to great food options availble within the resort too. CONS: The resort is huge, so it may require a lot of walking. At times, if you are there to gamble, the table limits can be pretty high for the average gamer. Those are probably the two biggest (if you want to consider them that) drawbacks to Caesers Palace. Again, I've been to Vegas many times, been to several resorts and this resort really blew me away. If within the budget, I would strongly recommend the resort to anyone who would listen. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: tigertraveler28
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Caesars for a conference. We stayed in a Palace Tower room, overlooking the pool complex. What a view! The room was spacious and plush, and the bathroom was a spa in itself. Jacuzzi tub, large shower, plenty of floor space. We arrived at 8:30 in the morning, and to our amazement, were able to get checked in. Customer service guy was great! Out only complaint was the room next to us was a little out of control. Our adjoining door didn't offer much noise insulation when they filled their room with at least 6 people screaming and yelling at 3:30 a.m. The smoke (from their "non-smoking" room) was rolling under the door until I put a wet towel in front of it. The noise eventually subsided, and we were back in slumberland (no complaining to the front desk, they were obviously having fun in Vegas) Overall a great trip, with a super location on the strip in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “In my top 3 hotels for Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: katediva
Reviews.Content: I had last stayed at Caesar's about 8 years ago and was not a fan. It seemed run down and not worth the money. This time it was great. Room was beautiful, bed comfortable, and the bathroom to die for, including a spa tub and a 12" rain shower head positioned in the middle of a huge shower. Heaven. Only draw back is there was a terrible view but that I can live with. Huge variation of food types and cost. I highly highly recommend Mesa Grill, Bobby Flay's restaurant. It was pricey but exceptional. The food court is good value and the food quality--especially the salads--was very good. It's in my top 3--Bellagio is #1 and the Wynn is #2. For those on a budget I always enjoy Paris Hotel. Small and convenient with cute rooms. to Me

Reviews.Title: “Slept Like a Baby”
Reviews.Author: lakehuronlover4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband while he had a work conferece. It was by far the most luxurious place I've stayed. That may not saying since we don't travel a lot, but the room was large, comfortable and I enjoyed the spacious bathroom and amazing amenities. I watched t.v. on the mirror while getting ready. I stayed here for a week and didn't want to leave. Breakfast was good at the Augusta Cafe downstairs. You may wait awhile until sitting- at peak times I expected this, so it was no issue for me. Bradley Ogden's restaurant in the hotel is a MUST! Overall, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: FrannieT89
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars for 5 nights and loved it. The location is as good as you can get on the strip! Our room was large, clean and comfortable. Room service was delicious and the restaurants throughout the casino are great. The pool was a lot of fun also. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry to say had not a good experience although the hotel was lovely”
Reviews.Author: squireOmagh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars Palace Hotel at the start of this month. Left my blackberry phone and watch in the room while I went out thinking it would be safer, unfortunately when we returned to the room they were both missing. Reported to management and security but as yet have had no response.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience, Okay Conference Experience”
Reviews.Author: JMUstu01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work conference. The hotel is fantastic! Everyone is happy and excited to have you stay at the property. The rooms were quite nice and they have some amazing suites! Good restaurants and bars/hangouts as well. The Conference Center was nice but our sessions had continually audio/visual problems. The projectors would cut out and there was tons of cross-talk from the wireless mics. The food being served in the conference center was so/so. Overall the experience was pretty good. We had hundreds of engineers on-site so we overcame the technical problems ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Room was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: I booked a Classic Room and was a little worried when I read the negative reviews. I called ahead and asked for a high floor which they confirmed. My room was on the 12th (of 15) floors in the Roman Tower, facing the pool. The room was fine - okay so it had an old large television, but you don't go to Vegas to watch the television. The pool area was fabulous - plenty of beds. No one checking though that it was only registered guests using the pool space. One day the pool closed at 3pm which was a little annoying for a private event. The hotel's location cannot be faulted - it is right in the centre of the action. Caesars rarely have deals, but its worth taking a chance on their classic room - they really are pretty good. And you have the Forum shops only 5 minutes from your room! I just wish the internet was free!

Reviews.Title: “Too bad for the ruined memories...”
Reviews.Author: taipeirose
Reviews.Content: This could be a really beautiful hotel but...We stayed in one of the tower suites. It was enormous, with plenty of room and a large fold-out sofa that the kids had all to their own in the cavernous livingroom. Too bad the wall-mounted TV set was not working. We had to wait 2 hours for the friendly maintenance man to come and check it, only to find that it was not plugged in. When we went swimming, one of the beautiful side pools was full of broken plastic bottle shards. My kids had fun retrieving them and handing them to the life guard, who seemed more intent on making sure that the chaises longues were properly aligned than being concerned about the quality of the pool water. After a while, I couldn't take it anymore and we fled to the central pool which was too shallow and crowded to swim in. Although I liked the suite very much, these unpleasant memories have left a bad taste in my mouth! I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite trips EVER!”
Reviews.Author: cturp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesar's Palace on our honeymoon. We had a Royal Suite in the Forum Tower and it was beautiful. Check-in staff and other employees we encountered were extremely nice. We also enjoyed eating at Serendipity--a restaurant within the hotel. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: budlady
Reviews.Content: When we arrived I tried the $20 tip but the guy booking me in ignored it! so he booked us into the Classic room and then told me it wasnt ready yet and to come back in 1 hour. Well it was over 100 degrees we were desperate for a shower and a beer after the flight from London so I upgraded to Palace Tower for $56 a night extra. The room was great and the bathroom fab. Jacuzzi and big shower. Bed was massive and a sofa to. We were ovberlooking the pools which was ok and didnt hear any noise from them. Would defo recommend this hotel but would say defo upgarde. Its on a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Qua Spa was Incredible”
Reviews.Author: TomM55
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fitness center / Qua Spa day pass uasge. It was well worth the $45 as I spent 4 hours with my workout and relaxation. The water pool options were nice with the addition of drinks and fruit a bonus after the workout.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms do not match the star rating of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: errrre
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here July 5 - July 8, 2 couples. In the Roman tower. The rooms were very disappointing, this is a 4 and a half star hotel, for the room I would give not more than 3 star. There is no closet in the room, something that reminds it in the bathroom, the rooms and the bathrooms decor is very old. There is a charge for the safe and for the internet usage on their computer. The rooms need a huge renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace Great Room”
Reviews.Author: VLCinNC
Reviews.Content: Stay at Caesar Palace last week. We had never stayed there before, although we have stayed at several other hotels on the strip. First the room # 4485 ,was very high up. Had a great view of the strip and the Fireworks were on monday night and the view was amazing. The room was spacious and the bathroom was very nice. But there were somethings I could have done without like the Charge to drink a cup of coffee??? You had to pay $12 for a 4 cup serving. Don't waste time asking the maid service for extra sugar or creamer because they dont carry it on the cart. The drink waitress that work at the Keno lounge feet must hurt because it too FOREVER for her to come around with drinks. I even saw people get up and walk and look for her. Maybe they need to add ladies to the floor or watch the ones they have. Lago Buffet was NOT worth the money. The buffet selection is not much bigger than the Imperial Palace buffet. And, if you have every ate there you know how big that is (not knocking Imperial but Caesars was small). We got the 24 pass buffet but I can under stand why you have to stand in line when you have already paid for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Summer Vacation”
Reviews.Author: avidGolfer26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ceasars from 6/28/2011 thru 07/02/2011.Got there around 4pm line was long but they were quick: we were upgraded to Palace tower and it's right in front of the pool entrance, front desk staff were nice from check in to check out. Nice and clean upgraded room with comfy bed and jacuzzi was a plus. My warning is: DO NOT TOUCH anything on the minibar its got sensor so if you take one item out it automatically charges you, even if you put it back. ceasars is really huge, nice hotel, plenty of things to see,a great place to shop and most of all great location on the strip. Slots are tight so as the other hotels we visited to play. Food are expensive but then again this is Vegas, your bound to spend $$$. You can go out and eat, but for convenience they do have alot of restaurant ranging from budget price to most expensive ones. Their pool is far best compared to the ones we saw from other hotels, I think they have 4 or 5 different pools, as for the outside drink being not able to bring it, not sure about that co'z we were able to bring our own drink everytime, and by the way if youre a coffee person in the morning they do have keureg coffee maker and its $12 for 4 individual coffee to make, I thought it was cheap since its like $3 a cup, compared to their prayard coffee shop. Overall it was a very nice and fun summer for us can't wait to go back next summer, and definitely staying at Ceasars again. So if your looking for a hotel in Vegas with a class, resort style, friendly staff and be able to enjoy yourself then try Ceasars.

Reviews.Title: “Unless your high class”
Reviews.Author: zstriker
Reviews.Content: Recently, my girlfriend and I stayed for a week at Caesars Palace. A week before we were to go I received an email about an upgrade to the Augustus or Palace towers for a low fee from the CEO/President of Caesars. In an effort to make our trip more exciting we decided to do the upgrade. When we arrived, they did not have a note on the account about the upgrade (the confirmation I received from booking was the same as the first one) and when we checked in the front desk person said he would like to give us a complimentary upgrade to the towers that we wanted to stay in (not an upgrade to the Forum towers that I had already booked). We even double checked with the person checking us in that we would not get charged for the upgrade and he said no, you wold only be charged for the room you already prepaid for. Great we thought, until we checked out and we were charged for each night. We tried to make the front desk understand and the manager told us that this has happened before to others. When all was said and done all we got was a little food we charged to the room comped back, the managers word she would speak to who checked us in and we still had to PAY for the upgrade. Even then we were looked at like we were the ones who made a mistake and they did not want to work with us to resolve the situation. Wouldn't you think if this has happened before and has happened again that we should get more than a little food. We were very frustrated with the stay and felt as though unless you are gambling 100 dollars a hand you do not get paid much attention to. We ended up playing more in the M-Life casinos becuase they were courteous and we did not get pushed aside.
