We were very frustrated with our stay and will look to stay elsewhere for our future visits to Atlantic City and Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MMRDalton_Georgia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Palace tower in a junior suite. The room was great and had a view of the pool area - 26th floor. Room appeared to be recently updated and had 2 bathrooms joined by a double shower head, glass shower. Beautiful pools, but were extremely crowded :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: TrnrMom
Reviews.Content: We stay at Caesar's 3-4 times a year, but I have never reviewed it. Since we are Platinum Total Rewards members we do get a comped room. We request the Augustus Tower (the newest one) and have found the rooms to be uniformly large, spotlessly clean and in good repair. Occasionally we will be placed in the Forum or Palace Towers which are not quite as roomy, but are still nice. Be aware that the Forum Tower is above the night club, and you may be disturbed by the noise on the lower floors. We understand that the Octavian Tower will be opening by the end of the year, and the older towers are scheduled for renovation as well. Its the service that keeps us returning to Caesar's - employees here go out of their way to make sure everything is all right, and will remember your name and face on return visits. This is true even if you are not staying in the hotel, but in the casino as well. The spaces at Caesar's are vast and the amenities quite spread out, so you will need to learn the layout quickly to avoid going in circles. One minus: food on the Strip is at best above average unless one is prepared to spend a lot of $$, and the offerings at Caesar's tend to be high end. The Market Place (food court) is the closest Caesar's has to fast food. If you are in the Augustus Tower you have to walk a long way for a cup of coffee since the charge to use the coffee maker is $12. It is worth it to get a Total Rewards Card since you will get hotel offers at all Harrah's properties and at the Platinum level, parking and the gym are free. Here's a tip: there is now free wifi in the Diamond Lounge, and you can pick up a signal just outside of it, so you can at least download your email & other time dependent apps.

Reviews.Title: “everything as advertised..”
Reviews.Author: cjw1
Reviews.Content: stayed here first week of july 2011 its is a first class resort hotel and you pay for it. mini bar has the weights on it so if you take anything you get charges, $12 to buy 4-k cups for the coffeemaker you get the drift. the pools "garden of the gods" were outstanding a little trouble getting chairs to sit on, but the sun the water, great. Food is expensive!!! you are on the strip, the restaurants in the hotel are top notch but again, you pay for it. rooms were great, shower connecting 2 bathrooms, 2 individual shower heads, jacuzzi tub. there are also plenty of stores to spend your $$ other then in the casino-which was not very crowded--maybe packed on the wknds,but not bad weekdays. the shops are located next door in a mall connected to the property and they are a sight to see. it was a great time, but bring your wallet!! nice hotel/resort would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great colossal hotel. Great Strip Location.”
Reviews.Author: PistolPete1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars palace from 29/6/11 until 5/7/11. Firstly on check in we discovered they had no twin queen bed rooms left as we had requested so subsequently we had to take a King room with another bed bought in for my friend which apparently wasn't the most comfortable. We were put in the Augustus Tower upon my request which was a great tower with great views of the strip and the pools. The room itself was big and of very good quality. The bathroom had a whirlpool bath and fully marbled interior. It even had a TV in the bathroom for watching whilst in the bath. Be careful not to touch anything in or above the minibar as it will be charged at a steep rate. We called a toll free number to arrange pick up for a helicopter tour from the room phone but somehow got charged $1.50 not sure how that works. There was no free wifi but this unfortunately is standard on the strip. The buffet here is OK but not the best. There are no signposts for the buffet which is called the Lago buffet. We found it by chance by walking towards the forum casino. The casino itself is good but has a higher minimum at the weekends of £25 per hand on blackjack, craps , roulette etc. I would recommend getting the players card which is a Total rewards card which can be used at many casino's. There are 2 main cards the total rewards card and the M life card which you can apply for next door in the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but crowded”
Reviews.Author: penjimop
Reviews.Content: The decor, rooms, and pool are great, but the pool area is extremely crowded. Two of the pools are only open on Fri and Sat. Every chair is taken. The music is very loud and thumping. It is a party atmosphere. If you like that, it is great, but I prefer peace and quiet. Also beware, we were overcharged for things in our room right after we checked in! They told us that it was because we held the items for more than 30 seconds and there is a sensor on it, so we were charged just as if we took it! I am not kidding. Check your bill, because I think that they are getting away with murder and ripping off people. Other than that, I enjoyed the decor and cleanliness of the hotel. One quick story: we were told that we could not bring in any drink or food to the pool. We saw a family with two huge coolers, so we said something. The waitress told us that it was the wife of the owner! She did not even have the hotel towels. Give me a break. It was obviously one of the hotel workers guests! We did not fall for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Caesar's”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddy5519
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day trip to Caesar's--had a great time. Upon check-in, our comped room in Forum Tower was not ready so guy upgraded us to a room in Augustus Tower--have stayed in many strip casinos and this room was up there with the best--I know the newer casinos are nice but Caesar's is still my favorite- they treat me good and something for everyone. Slots were tighter than some and looser than others-typical 2011 slots. Had great time and hope to stay at Caesar's again next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 2je
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Forum Towers. The room had a king size bed which was really comfortable. no bath tub though to soak in after a lot of walking. Was disappointed no complimentary tea or coffee. $12.00 for coffee is a bit over the top. Apart from that would stay at Ceaser's again.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I upgraded”
Reviews.Author: co11mrmark
Reviews.Content: I planned my Vegas trip through my total rewards. I originally booked a 5 night stay in a Forum Deluxe room 6/26/11-7/1/11. Room: I've read some reviews about the rooms, and I was actually excited to stay in an newly remodeled room, but I did want to have a nice view (not just a view of the side of the coliseum). Upon my arrival I asked for a corner room on a high level in the Forum Tower, but the person I that was helping me said that there was not anything available with that criteria. He kindly offered me if I would like to upgrade to the newer Augustus tower for $20 a night, the room would have an excellent view of the Bellagio fountains, and "Eiffel Tower". At first I was a little hesitant, but I agreed to the extra charges, and I couldn't be happier! We were on the 32nd floor with the best view I've ever had in Vegas. The room was nice and clean, we got a king size bed. The bathroom was wonderful, the room reminded me of the Luxury room at the Palazzo, but smaller of course. If I had one complaint about the room, it would be the noise from the street, during the course of our stay we must have heard about 7 ambulances/police cars go by a day at all kinds of hours. Food: Even though the hotel lacked places to eat late at night, We did enjoy eating at Nero's which is now open 24 hours (I had the Garden burger with Caesar salad). We also really enjoyed Lago, I really don't know why people don't like this place, I loved it! The only thing that bothered me about Lago was the incorrect or lack of signs in front of the food, but I still could tell that the food was by just looking at it, but I guess it could be frustrating for people with allergies or that can't eat pork. Pool: We did not go to the pools although it was really hot during our visit, but since it was during the week we did see a lot of empty chairs, and we did not see any security guarding the entrances and checking bags. Overall we had a great stay, and we would recommend this hotel to anyone. And if you are offered a upgrade the one I got at a reasonable price, I say take it! It will be worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wenni_Xu
Reviews.Content: We had so much fun gambling there. The service in the casino was better than other casinos that we went to. They are so nice and helpful. We stayed at the Forum Tower, we had no view, we can only see a rooftop.However, the room was nice, we appreciated that they have Hongkong chanels, and also have a TV in the bathroom. After a day of intensive sightseeing and gambling, it's really nice to watch some Cantonese dramas. The chair near the pool is very limited, you need to get there early to be able to find one. The Checkout line was really long though.

Reviews.Title: “Room was old, Did not like the cage staff”
Reviews.Author: travellingcasinos
Reviews.Content: Mind you it was a comped room, but there were holes in the carpet and internet connection was broken, I had to actually fix the cable that was falling out of the wall and modem. I called for service and they were going to send IT staff up to fix it but wasn't sure when they could get to my room. My wife plays low denominations slots 1 cent / 5 cent. When she asked the cage staff if you could just cash in all the nickles she accumulated the guy in the cage was rude and ignorant. He told her they don't take nickles and when she asked why have the machines that pay out nickles he told her it was her problem.My wife actually got to cash the nickles at a store in the Planet Hollywood shopping mall. the manager there gladly took all of her change and my wife paid for gifts with $70.00 in change. The wait staff was pretty efficient.The cleaning staff did a great job cleaning and setting the towels, etc. The restaurants were very good Mesa Grill had great food and the food court in the middle had very good food for a fast lunch.I would never stay/play at this casino again because of the one guy in the cage.

Reviews.Title: “Met and Exceeded My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Cam2317
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at Caesars at 1130 a.m. to check in on a Wednesday. Thinking it would be slow since it was midweek I didn't anticipate a crowd. However when we arrived at the check-in area after using the valet and bell hop we were told check-in would start at 1:00. This of course was a bit of a surprise however we quickly handled the situation with some gaming in the casino. This was nice because I got paid to wait since i won $15 dollars on Alice In Wonderland. We returned to check-in at 1:00 and of course everyone and there mother were trying to check-in. Lines were about 6 people deep and it took about 30 minutes to check-in. We unfortunately were in the slow line because there was a middle aged man checking in two young ladies that were giving him some attention (probably to get an upgraded room). Luckily this man was relieved and the line picked up pace. I actually had my 4 nights comped with Caesars however I did not want to stay in an older room so I requested an upgrade and was quickly accommodated. The room was on the 27th Floor of the Palace Tower. The room overlooked the strip on the Mirage side. I must say the bathroom was huge. The jacuzzi tub was massive and could easily fit two of me. FYI, I am a large man! It was awesome. The room was well appointed and even had robes. The TV was smaller but who is in Vegas to watch TV. The casino was great and managed to win $450 while staying there. The building is massive so there is nothing that is "easy" to get to. We have stayed at Paris numerous times and I think for the convenience and location of hotel amenities I would recommend Paris, however the rooms at Caesars are FAR superior to Paris. Even a Red Room (P) at Paris is not equivalent to the room at Caesars in the Palace Tower. I recommend skipping their buffet because it really wasn't great. Matter of fact it was just as bad as the Harrah's dinner buffet. Their breakfast buffet wasn't that good either. Just skip it. We ate at Nero's and that was decent in my opinion however the kitchen is located a great distance from the dinning room which means food does not arrive quickly and means service is a little below average. Also, my wife did not feel well after eating. Not sure if it's the food but..... Two days of our trip we went to the pools. #1 Get their early, like no later than 845. #2 The pools are awesome #3 Order the Large Mojito (BEST I EVER HAD) #4 Pools close early #5 This is a young "hip" crowd of people who want to be seen soooo not necessarily a pool area for you and the kids. In summary our trip was amazing! I loved Caesars and it is easily a favorite place to stay. OH!!! Almost forgot.....you have to go to QUA. It is the best deal in Vegas. $45 dollars for a day pass from 8 to 8. I would try to write to explain however I know you will not be disappointed. No matter where you stay in Vegas make your first day a trip to QU

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: lulu026
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in June and it was just wonderful! When we arrived our room wasn't ready so we had a walk around the hotel and the shops. We met Smokin' Joe Frazier in a shop in the forum shops while we were waiting for our room to be ready! It was just amazing. When we went back to check in we were offered to upgrade our room to the Augustus Tower which we did and we were glad we did! We had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains. The room was very spacious and comfortable. We had a king size bed, a flat screen t.v and a jacuzzi bath. The hotel itself is huge. There's a big selection of food in the hotel. They have a food court that serves everything like pizza, burgers, tacos etc. The forum shops are great to walk around and some of the shops even sell hangover t-shirts! The only downside to the hotel is that it is very expensive. The first morning we were there we had breakfast in the food court and it cost us $28. Overall the hotel and the staff was amazing and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “great trip- crowded hotel”
Reviews.Author: torland8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars during the last wk in June for our vacation. The hotel was BEAUTIFUL, clean, a lot to do, but VERY busy. We checked in immediately and were upgraded to the Palace Tower. The palace tower was nice, clean, maid service was great, always had new towels. Make sure not to touch the drinks or food in the room, b/c they are sensored and you will be charged if the items are moved out of place. Pool Our room was close to the pool, which was nice b/c we spend most of our afternoons there cooling off . It was over 100 deg (and yes it was dry heat, but it didn't matter). The pool gets packed so finding a chair was tough, the employees were good about clearing off the unused chairs and allowing others to use them. They do have poolside blackjack in the adult pool where you can play in the pool, my husband was there most of the time. Drinks at the pool are expensive ($10-$20), the jolly rancher mojito was delicious! During the wk the staff doesn't check your pool bag so you could bring in water, food, or other stuff. However on the wkends (fri-sun) your bag will be checked and no outside food/drinks are allowed, which was crazy b/c they charge for everything there. There are 9 different pools not all are opened, however there was always a spot in the pool to cool off. Excursions/Shows We saw Carrot Top and he was hilarious! This guy doesn't receive enough credit, he was hands down one of the best performers I've seen. We laughed from when we sat down to when we left. If I could have seen this show for a second time I would. Make sure you do not leave the show to use the restroom b/c he will make fun of you. Our seats were front row A and center, the best seats in the room. We booked all our shows through expedia- it's a discounted rate and you are given the best seats when you book. Blue Man- good show, wouldn't see it again, but it was definitely a cool experience. The guys get you to think, have cool special effects, and choose 2 audience members to assist w/ the show. Our seats were in the "blue" section and the 2 members were also chosen from this section to go on stage. Pawn Stars- we took a cab ($15) to see the store. The old man, big hos, rick and chumly weren't there (boooo). We are fans of this show so my husband and I wanted to take a cab to the store and check it out. It was a cool experience, if you're a fan definitely go. You wait in line (about 20 min) to enter the store, about 50 people go in at a time. I bought a t-shirt to bring home w/ me. Restaurants The food in Vegas is out of this world! We ate at Mesa Grill, Spago, the Bellagio Buffet, Marguaritaville and Serendipity. All the food was great! If you go to Serendipity you MUST save room for dessert, it's amazing! Many places on the strip take the rewards card to accumulate pts. so don't forget to show the card, even starbucks took it...... Overall the trip was great, we did a lot of walking in and out of many of the malls and hotels. Caesars is huge especially when you get through the Forum Shops so don't forget to venture out. All the hotels on the strip have different themes and are very cool t explore. We did gamble at a lot of different hotels, not just Caesars. Needless to say we donated to the strip, Vegas was GREAT but we aren't going to return anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “FAB Time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rc38554
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caesar's Augustus Tower and was blown away with our beautiful room and fantastic view. We will be staying at this Tower from now on. Also, was very excited that we were so close to the Spa (same tower). We didn't have to walk all over the Casino after having a Fantastic Relaxing Massage. We had dinner at Bejing Noodle 9 and it was fantastic. The General Tso's chicken was incredible. Also, we had the Breakfast and Dinner Buffet at Caesar's. YUMMY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of amenities on this property!”
Reviews.Author: TopekaDucky
Reviews.Content: We booked a Forum Tower but received a complimentary upgrade to Palace Tower when we checked in, and the elevators are right by the entrance to the pool area so convenient if that is important to you. The room was the perfect size for us, we had a great north view of the Mirage and TI and also northwest toward Red Rock. We don’t have mountains in Kansas, so we like a mountain rather than strip front view anyway, and it was a good view in our opinion. There was a Keurig coffee maker in the room, but we didn’t use it since there was a cost for the cups and didn’t have time to go buy some at a store. There was a dressing stand and little stool for me to use, and there was also a stocked fridge and snacks but with a cost so never used them. There were dual sinks, and a large shower and also a Jacuzzi tub, and the toilet was in a separate room with door that closed it from the rest of the bathroom. There were two robes in the closet to use during our stay, and there was a nice safe that would have held my little laptop had I brought it with me. There was a also a three shelf unit for our shoes and my bags which was very convenient and plenty of hangers in the closet for our clothes. Laundry and room service were also available at the property. We also had a nice sized desk and chair and also a lounge chair and ottoman in the room, and the bed was comfortable. The dresser had two large and two small drawers so plenty of room for our clothes. The bars, restaurants, and Forum shops allow enough options that a person really wouldn’t need to leave the hotel if there wasn’t enough time to visit the other strip properties.

Reviews.Title: “amazing -- great time !!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaTraveler317
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our 3 night stay at Caesars Palace -- Our room in the Palace Tower was great - comfortable, clean, great location to the pool. Great pool !!! Great Bars!!! Amazing Spa !!! Great location!!! You can't go wrong with a few nights at Caesars !!! Looking forward to a return trip !!!! the ONLY negative - the girl working in the check in lobby on 6/26 at noon was by far one of the rudest people I have met in my life --- WOW -- an entire resort full of super nice people and great customer service, where did this girl come from?? I'd skip the Caesars buffet -- not really worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: acbliss1386
Reviews.Content: The hotel's customer service was excellent. Free upgrade for our anniversary. Staff friendly. Good value especially for being located on the strip. Beautiful hotel and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars epitomizes the glitz and glamour of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: travelingfun101
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to have scored free tickets to Celine Dion's show so it was an obvious choice to stay at Caesar's. After touring several other hotels, my traveling companions and I agreed that this was the classiest in terms of the beautiful statuary, lovely pools, etc. For $20 more, we upgraded to the Augustus Tower which was the newest of all their accomodations. The room was spacious and very clean although there are no extras. Coffee in the room is $12 / there's no free wifi / no complimentary water. There are quite a variety of restaurants in this hotel, but the buffet is actually the best deal. We purchased a 24 hour pass for somewhere around $50 (?). We capitalized on this by having four meals... Dinner/Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner. What a bargain! The buffet is first class all the way... not the old cafeteria style buffets that one might think of. If you tire of the buffet and are looking for a good breakfast, try Nero's... it doesn't break the bank. Rao's Italian Restaurant is also reasonably priced for lunch or dinner All in all it was a great stay and the icing on the cake... Celine was phenomenal!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars's didn't disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: crauto1
Reviews.Content: First, let me tell you we hadn't stayed at Caesars in over 4 years and was a little worried because of some of the reviews from here. Once again, they went above and beyond what was expected. Wonderful people working for this huge place. Loved all of it including new games in the casino. Rooms were wonderful. Check in was over 40 minutes but they were kind and brought bottled water while we waited. Beds were still great and the views were outstanding. We were there for a convention and everyone was so professional and kind. Had never been to that part of the hotel and it is amazing!! thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “O.K”
Reviews.Author: Spenchewy
Reviews.Content: There was no wait at the check in, that really got are vacation going. Becuase coming from the parking garge was not easy. We had about a 15 minute walk to are room which was terribe. The room was nice and really big. It had a nice hot tube in the room. The internet was not free, it was about 14.99 a day/per laptop or phone. The buffet was very small and little to choose from. But it was very well made, but there nothing for the kids. The pool wasnt that intersenting but the kids went any way. Overall it was 7 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bearland53
Reviews.Content: As a Harrahs Diamond Player, we stayed 4 nights free at the Palace in early May. The casino offers lots of new penny machines, but it does tend to be very noisy with the young crowd. We were there for Cinco de Mayo and it wa party time that night. We found the restaurants to be a bit more pricey than the other Harrah's properties. However, the food court in the middle of the casino offered fast service, moderately priced food and lots of choices

Reviews.Title: “Average.”
Reviews.Author: gopoets
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Roman Tower at Caesars Palace, it was just OK. The hotel is big and busy (think lines every place) with a good casino. The pool was packed and it was hard to get a spot if you weren't there early in the day. Empty towels are left all over the place so its hard to know whether the chair is taken or not. You cannot bring into the pool your own water so be prepared to pay extra for water in the pool area. Room was OK - comfy bed but some wear and tear in the room. Galleria Lounge was a good spot to have a drink and watch the casino action.

Reviews.Title: “The best Birthday EVER!”
Reviews.Author: The_Travelling_Fairy
Reviews.Content: We went here courtesy of Caesars Entertainment and Virgin Atlantic in June for my 25th Birthday and I still cant believe how fantastic it is!. Thank you soo much Giovanna! Caesars Palace really is old school Las Vegas at it's finest! It's the perfect location, slap bang in the centre of the strip. The forum shops are fantastic and I was gobsmacked to look up and see blue sky and clouds.... it's all indoors! Absolutely amazing, you really do feel like you're in Rome! I'm gutted we didn't have time to fit in PURE nightclub, we were only there for 3 nights but if you get the chance please do it because it's the no.1 rated club in the USA I think. The casinos are great, we were totally addicted to The Hangover slots! Which are pager friendly by the way! haha The Pools are out of this world, honestly I've never seen anything more beautiful than these. Imacculately kept and completely jaw dropping. You will understand what I mean when you are laying on your thick fluffy Caesars pool towels on your lounger in the boiling Las Vegas sunshine! We went over to Planet Hollywood to see Peepshow starring Holly Madison..... It was fab! Josh Strickland has an amazing singing voice, the girls put on a brilliant show and Holly is so small in real life! My husband could barely control himself! haha Our room was ABSOLUTELY STUNNING! We were on the 26th floor in Augustus Tower which is the new one (and the one 'The Hangover' was filmed in). We had the most comfy big bed, enough seating for 8 and a flat screen wall mounted TV. Truly, the room was bigger than the whole downstairs of my house, massive! We had a gorgeous marble bathroom with a hot tub bath, massive shower that easily fitted the both of us, wall mounted TV and double vanity. Plenty of wardrobe space, fab floor to ceiling mirror in the hallway and gorgeous floor to ceiling windows overlooking the strip. I really can't say enough, I was very impressed and would definately stay here again! We fell in love with Vegas and are already thinking about going back! If Caesars Palace is out of you're budget then try Planet Hollywood, Paris or Imperial Palace. All three are in prime locations it just depends on how much you want to spend.

Reviews.Title: “needs to renew”
Reviews.Author: APMN
Reviews.Content: I was in CP many years ago and just comeback to remind old times.It was a fabulous place in the past but it urgently needs to renew - A/C first Staff strives hard, but the place ain't good. Is not a hotel to bear in mind. For a slightly higher price i felt like a gentleman in Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: chego121
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here the first weekend of June for a girls weekend because of the prime location and the great promotion that they have going on- "routinely spectacular". Unfortunately, under that package, they place you in the older tower- Roman and you need to use up the dining credits before you check out. In our case, we lost them and management would not budge or give us a voucher for our next visit. Aside from that, the facilities are clean and the POOLS are fabulous but you need to get there early so you will be able to get a bed! PURE nightclub is located in this hotel and it's one of my fav places to go dancing. There are so many things to do and see at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome View-Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: KellyJameson
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family and boyfriend last year and it was AMAZING! We were upgraded to a larger room with the most SPECTACULAR view of the Belagio fountains and the Paris Eiffel Tower across the street. We ordered room service twice and it was surprisingly fast and they brought everything we needed. The concierge staff were all very nice and check in and out went smoothly. The location of this resort is ideal because in the middle of ths strip you can get to any other major casino easily. The pool(s) were all very nice and the poolside bar was well staffed. I wish they had towels more readily available, but that wasn't a huge issue. The Forum shops and restaurants are nice, especiallly in the summer because you have plenty to do right at the hotel without going into that heat! I have stayed at a few hotels on the strip, but Caesar's Palace was definitely my favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Great classic vegas hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yogahunter
Reviews.Content: I thought Caesar's was great! It was exactly what I expected it to be..a litttle corny and maybe not as sophisticated as the Bellagio, but really fun. Also the forum shops were great!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: mchase92
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, you can get around very easily from the hotel's central location. The rooms are georgeous, the restaurants to die for and the shopping is incredible!! We have stayed here many times and the service is always top notch!

Reviews.Title: “City in itself”
Reviews.Author: pkane
Reviews.Content: You don't need to leave Caesars to have an amazing time in Vegas. However, I don't recommend doing that. The hotel has EVERYTHING. World class restaurants, hours of shopping, amazing pool, some of the best shows in Vegas, great clubs/lounges and of course, tons of gambling. Stayed here for a friends bachelor party and had a great time. We did leave the hotel, but just for clubs and restaurants. I called in advance to ask for the renovated tower, and not the old tower. They said no problem. Arrived and were put in the old tower(I forget the name). The elevator,floor and room smelled musky, like a seedy 2 star hotel. The room looked like a 2 star room. Not sure how this was ever considered 5+ star. The next morning we complained and were upgraded to the Augustus tower. What a difference! Crazy how these two rooms are in the same hotel. Augustus is right next to the pool. amazing location. The pool area is really nice. You need to get there early to get chairs, especially if you're a group of 5 or more. Early being no later then 9am(thats on the late side). Not a problem. I can't sleep in Vegas anyways. On Saturday we got a pool bed at Venus(private pool party at Ceasars). Had a great time there and not that expensive. I used the concierge service a couple times and they were extremely helpful! Made dinner reservations(for resto's outside the hotel) and got contacts for bottle service at different clubs. I'd recommend this hotel for anybody. It really does have it all!

Reviews.Title: “Hail Caesar!”
Reviews.Author: gamblingggirl
Reviews.Content: Once again - we had a sensational time at Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas! Though Harrah's Total Rewards Program, our stay was comped. We've stayed there several times and never have been disappointed. We stayed in a Palace Tower Premium room with two bathrooms, large spa tub, and view of the pools below. Wonderful! I love the pools there, the prompt drink service - and customer service was great eveywhere within the property. The restaurants are also excellent within the hotel - but there are also many more fine restaurants in the Forum shops - something for everyone! My only disappointment is not with the hotel - but with the casino gambling. We've come to Las Vegas a few times a year for quite a while now- and it seems like the slots are getting tighter and tighter every time we come...not just Caesar's casino but all the Harrah's properties...used to be you could play a little while on your money - but not so anymore...of course, that means you lose more so spend more...guess that is how they are making up for the long term bad economy. My only other gripe is that you have to pay $14 for high speed internet - that is just plain wrong when so many other hotels offer it for free. But the room was free so I can't really gripe too much... We used to take cruises...and maybe we'll have to consider going back to that for our vacations...

Reviews.Title: “we wont stay here again”
Reviews.Author: 5ragen
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the roman tower. there was loud banging all night long. maybe the elavators. the rooms dont have a fridge or coffee and you have to pay to use the safe & wi fi....and the gym. we ate at nero"s, $60 for a steak and it was chewy and full of gristle. empress court & hyakumi were excelent! it was over 100* every day so the pool was full. get there early to get a chair and enjoy "urine free" water. PS. you cant bring your own bottled water in to pool area.

Reviews.Title: “one word, "AMAZING" !!”
Reviews.Author: villere01
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and I have to say that Caesars Palace blew us away with service, the room and the overall ambience of the place. We were there for the week of 6-13 to 6-17 and wish we could have stayed longer. Will stay at Caesars again when we return to Vegas again some day. The Villere's

Reviews.Title: “Truly Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Roshy10
Reviews.Content: $40 sandwich trick = upgrade to suite overlooking Bellagio fountains = heaven! My god, what an amazing hotel, truly remarkable experience. Helpful concierge & shops galore. Loved the Cheesecake factory Best location on strip. Will always go back.

Reviews.Title: “So far our favorite on the strip”
Reviews.Author: kris621
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vegas for 10 nights during our last trip, and decided to switch it up and stay at a few different hotels on the strip. We booked Caesars for our last 2 nights of our vacation and it's safe to say we wish we had stayed there for longer! Check In - Check in was a breeze. We arrived at 11am and there was only one person ahead of us in line. The lady who helped us was very friendly and joked around with us about people who make comments to her about the Hangover and think they're so witty (haha). We were given our room keys and off we went. Room - We were comp'd in the Forum Tower room which we really enjoyed. Nice decor, great view of the strip, THE MOST COMFORTABLE HOTEL BED I have ever felt (we actually slept in both days because we just didn't want to get out of bed), and a huge shower with a regular showerhead & a rain shower (hubby was in heaven). Pool - Loved the pool. We had previously, in this trip, stayed at Planet Hollywood and then Mandalay Bay, and we felt that Ceasars had the best pool complex. Perfect water temperature and so many different styles of pools to choose from. However, it was *packed* and always hard to find a seat. But this is most likely a result of the time of year we went, and the fact that it was a Thursday-Saturday stay. I'm sure weekdays are much quieter. Location - Like Planet Hollywood, can't be beat. However we didn't leave the hotel much for those last few days - you really don't need to. Caesars is like its' own little (big) world. Restaurants - Ridiculous amount of options for food! There's a food court in the Forum Casino for quick eats, Caesars has several restaurants (some hosted by famous chefs), and then you have the Forum Shops with lots more options. If I hadn't researched beforehand where we wanted to eat, we probably would have been overwhelmed. Our favorite meals were at the Cheesecake Factory (huge portions, and affordable - you must try the red velvet cheesecake!) and Hyakumi (one of their summer rolls, the Baked Scallop Roll, still makes my mouth water at the mere thought of it) Staff - No rude staff members - not sure why some of you say they're rude there? Perhaps your bad attitudes reflect on to them. *Shrug* - we loved the Caesars staff. Casino - Huge. Can't comment on much else as we didn't gamble much this trip. All in all, we have zero complaints about our stay at Caesars and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! The only place I want to stay.”
Reviews.Author: AgentM99
Reviews.Content: We divided a 5 night stay in Vegas between Caesars and Aria because it was our first trip there and we wanted to experience more than one hotel. While Aria was nice I wish we had stayed at Caesars the whole time. Check in was effecient and pretty quick considering the number of people they need to get through every day. We had a Palace tower pool room view and were upgraded to a Junior Suite because our room type wasn't going to be available for some hours. Room was massive! Gorgeous! Had his and hers baths, a double shower, was clean and well equipped. I don't think the place is pretensious and there was a good mix of people around. Casino, dining options, shopping and shows (Absinsthe was awesome) are on site and the location is unbeatable. I understand why they do it but I don't like that the items in the mini bar are censored so if you remove something to just look at it, consider you have bought it and that you can't use the fridge for your own purposes so need to rent another one if you want a fridge. Free wi fi would have been handy also. I guess these issues are standard for Vegas strip hotels though. I definitely want to stay at Caesars for my next trip to Vegas. The only thing that may put me off though is the hefty weekend prices.

Reviews.Title: “Some was good, some was bad... The pool was great!”
Reviews.Author: JeDiAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Okay, the hotel is beautiful, the staff are all extremely polite. BUT, 1. be leery of some of the rooms that have awkward roofside views. Ask for Poolside or at least a high up view, so you can somewhat lookout on the city or pool. But, getting a map and looking at the location of your room is key. 2. do not leave anything valuable laying out and not in a safe. i was getting ready in my best man's room for my wedding, and I forgot my diamond ear rings on the counter next to the sink in the bathroom, well after being "handled" and lied to about the situation being taken care of by two different people in security, i was finally taken care and allowed to properly file a report. They assured me that a "lockdown key check" procedure would be implemented, but i have not heard anything since, and this was done on May 30th. It is now June 23rd, and no word. 3. The front desk is not 100% truthful about room availability. My parents and other family came after we checked in, and we were attempting to get a room upgrade because of the bad view. They gave us a room with a better view, and were willing to pay for a better tower and view, but they "weren't available." we were moved to another room a few floors higher, but we made it clear we wanted a nice room because of our wedding. then, family came in and checked in less than an hour later and were given rooms with a better views and accommodations than ours. So, they were in deed available, and it took my mother calling the front desk and demanding that we be put in a room near hers in order to help my bride get ready for the wedding, made a room miraculously become available. 4. All three rooms we were in had furnace closets with very old filters that had not been changed in months. they said they were on a schedule to be changed, but when rooms are occupied, they get missed, and they are not able to get to them all... this was a bogus excuse to me bc i want to know what person would deny them access to change out a filter that takes less than 10 seconds to change to help them breathe cleaner more filtered air. there were a total of 6 room furnace filters changed between my family and friend's rooms. so, it would be smart of you to check your filter upon check-in. 5. No free internet service. No free local phone calls. You will be nickeled and dimed at this hotel, like many in Vegas, so always ask. Never assume they will not charge you because you are charged for things you may never have been charged for elsewhere. The Good: 1. The main good thing i must say about Caesar's is that everything is located in the hotel. and, if i didn't want to go outside and see the rest of Vegas, i would be able to go to the Forum Shops, which is a beautiful Saks 5th Avenue store type mall. There are also clubs and restaurants in the hotel and mall... I would suggest going to the mall and not pay $15 for a hamburger though, but that is up to you. 2. The architecture throughout the hotel and Roman soldiers, along with "Cleopatra" for photo ops, is an added plus. 3. The pool scene is great! The Venus pool has guest performances, and it is a "European style" (topless) pool. They normally charge for admittance to this, but during the week, all you need is your i.d. You will not be disappointed. The waitresses alone are dressed to kill, but sorry to disappoint, they don't go topless. Aside from the stolen ear rings and poor view, we had an enjoyable stay...

Reviews.Title: “Love Caesars Palace !”
Reviews.Author: ShariL0u
Reviews.Content: Love Caesars Palace, beautiful room, great location, lovely pools.

Reviews.Title: “Still one of the nicer hotels on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: KHolder
Reviews.Content: Even though Caesar's is one of the older hotels, our room was quite large, very clean, and had a very nice bed. We enjoyed the Forum Shops and the Casino very much, and Nero's is still our favorite restaurant in Vegas. The Munch Bar has sweet potato fries that are out of this world! Thanks to the front desk staff for getting all three of our groups in the same tower, this made it much easier to meet up for meals, shopping, etc. Maybe next time we will actually win some money too!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tunagold
Reviews.Content: More than 20 of us staying as a group. Not only were we on different floors, but a third of the group was not even in the same tower. Pros and Cons: Pros: Beautiful hotel and pool area Cons: 1) No refrigerator in room. There is one, but it is fully stocked with overpriced junk. And if you just TOUCH anything, they will charge you, so be VERY carefull, especially if you have kids. LOCK the refrigerator. 2) Food and drink at every place is way over priced. Much better values if you go to old Vegas along Fremont Street. Bus ride is $7 for 24 hours, and still a better deal to pay that and eat elsewhere. 3) POOL Warning: if you are like us and like to get a cup of coffee and go to the pool early, make sure you buy your coffee at Paynard only! We bought coffee and a breakfast sandwich at the Forum Food court and walked over to the pool. We were denied access because our coffee was not from Paynard and no food is allowed period. I can understand about the food, but the coffee?? And you cannot take any bottled water, gatorage, or anything out there. In the half hour it took us to drink our hot coffee in front of the pool doors, there were many people rapidly drinking gatorade or Aquafina water, rather than throwing it away or taking it back to their room. They want you to be a captive audience. 4) while at the pool we bought 3 drinks...two mojitos for my wife and a rum punch for me. I will say the drinks were excellent, but then we got the bill and they were $20 each! Most expensive drinks I have ever had! 5) Even with all the folks behind the desk (must have had about 10 lines going), check in was lengthy. 6) did not care for the slots or tables in Caesars, so spent most of our time either in 4 Queens (old Vegas), or Harrahs (across the street). We were in Vegas 4 years ago on vacation and stayed at Golden Nugget. I would rate that trip much higher than this trip just because of expenses. While Caesars room and hotel was classy, the Golden Nugget was also very nice. And who wants to use all their gambling money on hotel and food? The prices were crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Food, Shopping, Pool & Casino Games. Good Service.”
Reviews.Author: annilizzi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights after our wedding (a mini honeymoon). Our check-in time was pushed back a couple hours and when we were finally given access the room smelled overwhelmingly like smoke. After complaining the staff did something to get rid of the smell (they didn't cover it up, it's like they filter or iodized it or something). After this initially confusion, our stay was great. Caeser's offers EVERYTHING. Awesome food, great casino games, clubs, INCREDIBLE shopping, and the pool is fabulous. We rented a poolside cabana for 2 days - this was such a great idea. Service to the cabana was amazing, the pool was beautiful, and the cabana was great. I almost didn't want to leave the casino... and I really didn't need to: Caeser's had SO much to offer. But I'll warn you - "The Hangover" quotes are rampant. You'll hear probably a hundred times, "Wolf pack!" and people asking, "So, did Caeser actually live here?" Ha. Funny at first, but it got old fast. Overall, I loved it here. Beautiful, a lot of fun, so much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Mourgi
Reviews.Content: Stayed in forum tower royal suite. Room big and clean with an over sized bathroom. Checked in at 2pm 5 minute wait and got room immediately. House keeping kept the room clean great job! Internet wifi was cheap at $14.99 for 24hrs in room only. Restaurants and food reasonably priced for Vegas standards. Would definitely stay again good job Caesars!

Reviews.Title: “Large Room”
Reviews.Author: stephparisoli
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars last weekend. The hotel was busy which made it difficult to get chairs by the pool but from what I've heard that is standard in Vegas. We stayed in Augustus Tower which was newly renovated and had the most beautiful bathroom. Skip the hotel Buffett-not good quality in my opinion but I've never been to any other vegas buffets so I can't compare. Go see the Celine Dion show....AMAZING! They have a fun slot game too called The Hangover which is a blast and this hotel is the only one that has the game.

Reviews.Title: “Hail Caesar - an excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Schnitzel_Konig
Reviews.Content: Booked through Caesar's Total Experience program for us and 4 other couples. Great rates/service booking everything and they still accommodated us even after one of our couples had to drop out last minute due to unforeseen circumstances (supposed to be a 5 room minimum). We lost out on potential perks associated with the program but they honored our severely discounted room rates which we were thrilled with. From check-in to check out we were treated royally despite the initial inconvenience of their computers crashing that afternoon (all computers at all Caesars properties we were told). Once things were up and going (an hour or two later) they called us to return and promptly assigned us our rooms which were all upgraded from Forum Tower to Palace Tower rooms. Because we booked with Total Experience we were able to check-in/out at the VIP Diamond desk which may have helped, but everyone was smiley, friendly and genuinely helpful in accommodating our request for all 4 rooms in the same tower. The Palace Tower rooms we received were scattered from floor 13 to 27, a couple of which had great views overlooking the pools. All of them were very clean, quiet, comfortable and had a decent sized bathroom with separate jacuzzi tub. Nothing over the top but we generally don't need too much as we don't spend a lot of time in the rooms when in Vegas. We ate several times on the property (Payard, Lago, Serendipity3, Munchar) but the highlight was definitely Bradley Ogden. All 8 of us had an amazing meal - everyone's best meal in a long, long time. A sizable bill to be sure but worth every single penny. Our service from Chris was impeccable and professional to a 'T'. Thanks Chris! The Garden of the Gods pool complex was part of the reason we wanted to stay at Caesar's and it did not disappoint. Difficult at first to get 8 chairs together if you don't book and you don't get there early but with a little patience we snagged some. Lifeguards seemed to come around relatively often to remove towels by those looking to save chairs ahead of time. Wife commented many times about just how dang good her poolside cranberry coconut mojito was. Gaming wise the casino was pretty decent. Didn't really hit the tables much and the slots were average. One of our highlights though was spending a night in the Sports book watching the NHL/NBA playoffs and playing the ponies. Great venue and with some time/patience we ended up getting enough seats for everyone. All in all everyone thoroughly enjoyed Caesars Palace and would highly recommend it anyone. Aside from Caesars we've stayed at the TI and Paris, and by far the entire Caesars experience was a cut above. It can be a much more expensive stay but if you keep your eyes open and/or take advantage of the Total Experience program then deals do pop up and make it a great value. We kept our eyes on deals to the Venetian/Palazzo and the Bellagio but for the dates we were there the Total Experience rates were MUCH better than the other resorts. For reference sake, we generally stay at Best Western, Holiday Inn Express, Sheratons, etc), to give you an idea as to the price point and level of service/property we're used to. Cause lets face it, Caesars would seem amazing if we only stayed at Motel 6's and similarly much worse if St. Regis and Continentals were our norm. Caesars...we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...You get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: SallyandDarren
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at about 7pm on a Sunday. There was a very small queue at check-in and we were attended to within 10 mins. The man at the desk was polite and friendly and checked our reservation. He noted that we had pre booked a 'deluxe' room for a weeks stay. He asked if we wanted to upgrade this room to a luxury room in the Augustus Tower overlooking the Bellagio Fountains for an extra $30 per night. We were happy to do this as that was the room we were hoping to be allocated. We were allocated room 2572. This room was larger than the deluxe rooms but not worth $30 more per night. The view of the Bellagio Fountains was OK but would have been better if we had been on a higher floor. Although we were on floor 25, this was actually only about 4-5 floors from the ground...very confusing. The room itself was nicely furnished and designed. There were some signs of wear and tear but overall it was very nice. There was an easy chair with a footrest in the room along with an armchair and a sofa. We positioned the chairs in front of the floor to ceiling windows to catch the view and chill out with a drink at the end of our evening. The room was quite dark, even with all of the lights on. This didnt cause us any problems. The bathroom was nice, with a jacuzzi bath, twin sinks, separate shower and toilet. Ameneties were lovely (Gilchrist and Soames) and relplenished every day. Housekeeping was efficient. The hotel is huge and sprawling. You can easily get lost within the interior of the hotel and casino. There are lots of places to eat and drink but some of the places can be quite expensive so it pays to shop around a little. There is a food court where inexpensive breakfast items can be purchased. We tried the buffet one morning and although the food was pleasant, the variety was poor and there are much better places to eat if you like buffet style food. The casino is fab, lots of roulette, craps and blackjack tables, the minimum is usually $10 but this can go up to $15 at busy periods. The sports book is fairly quiet most of the time. The poker room is nice but absolutely freezing inside. Take a jacket with you if you are in a tournament or cash game. Its quite bright in there too. The location of the hotel is its main attraction, really fantastic, right in the middle of all the action and the grounds of the hotel are beautiful, lots of white marble pillars and statues. Its a sight to behold when viewed from the opposite side of the road at dusk. The pool area is stunning visually, but you have to get there early to get a decent bed. We didnt experience any security at the pool whatsoever but we always went early before 10am. The day beds are rarely in use because they have to be paid for which we felt was a waste of space. The one compalint we had about the hotel was the VIP areas for Platinum 7 star holders. There were areas where only these members could go into, or taxi lines only they could stand in. It was a bit insulting to us 'regular' guests who have paid good money but choose not to blow thousands of dollars every night gambling. Caesars should drop this policy. Its a little crass and condescending. We had a wonderful time in Vegas (3rd time) and Caesars played a part in that but as the title says, you do get what you pay for. Dont pay for the coffee in the room, take a travel kettle and make your own. Also there is free wifi connection in the munchbar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to stay at Caesars.”
Reviews.Author: kittkitty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars May 8th to the 14th. 2011. I was in The Augustus Tower and the room was clean and very spacious. Housekeeping arrived early in the morning and always left everything clean and replenished. I always find the staff at Caesars to be very welcoming and polite. The pools are some of the best that Vegas has to offer.I have stayed at Caesars around 7 times now and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great 40th birthday”
Reviews.Author: sabbywabby1971
Reviews.Content: My 3 girlfriends and I booked Caesar's for my 40th bday as it has always been my dream to stay there. Since each of us has travelled quite extensively, we knew it would be best to prebook everything to ensure that we had non smoking rooms(I have severe allergies) and that they were adjoining. Upon arrival, we were told that adjoining rooms were not available and that it was simply a request-not guarantee. So not only did we not end up side by side but we were placed in smoking rooms(apparently the rooms we booked were not available until the next day). Within 15 minutes of being in my room my allergies flared up so badly that I could hardly breathe. We immediately went to the front desk and stated that I could not stay in that room but the clerk was unfazed by my medical condition and stated that there wasn't anything she could do. It was not until I insisted that I could die did she make any effort to help us. My room buddy+I were then placed on a non-smoking floor while the other 2 were forced to stay in the smoking room. The next day we went downstairs to be moved to our booked rooms and when my 2 friends walked into their room and there was still the previous occupants luggage inside. My gf called down to the front desk and the clerk seemed confused and stated that the previous occupant had checked out. She told them to leave the "extra" luggage at the front door and the bellman would pick it up. Since we had a full schedule for the day, we left to check out the various other hotels and went shopping. We arrived back at Caesar's around 5 because we had tickets for a 6pm show and when my gf went back into her room, not only was the "extra" luggage gone, but their luggage had also been taken. So now the hunt is on for their luggage that had their ID and show tickets in it. It wasn't until 45 minutes later that their luggage was located but by that time they ended up being late for the show. Once again we complained and the female front desk clerk said there was nothing she could do. Thankfully the hotel manager(I think his name was Alex) came out to find out what the problem was and once we spoke to him, he immediately sensed our frustration and made every effort to help. He even gave us a $250.00 food+beverage credit to use for the remainder of our trip and followed up to ensure that we were doing well. If it wasn't for him, I would rate this hotel a 1 but he did try to help and it was appreciated. I think next time though, I will pick a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CILover
Reviews.Content: After my daughter turned 21 she wanted to go to Caesar's Palace. We found great rates through LV Advisor web page and booked a room in the forum tower. Found out later that these rooms didn't have a view, thus the reasonble cost. When we arrived at the front desk I said I was wondering if any of the forum towers had a good view, a few clicks later and we were upgraded to a room in the tower overlooking the pool at no extra charge. Caesar's is huge and amazing. We got lost several times, and the buffet was not a favorite, but the room value at the rate we received was great. If you ever have an opportunity to go to Caesar's at a reasonable rate, do it...you'll enjoy the atmosphere even if you do walk for a day through the lobby! It was Vegas at its best!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money!”
Reviews.Author: Kimhembree
Reviews.Content: The room we received was pouted with smoke and so dated that the didn't even have flat screen TVS companied to the front desk and they offered to change our room for an extra fee. This was insulting since we already paid for an upgrade on our original registration . Our first night in Vegas we stayed at the Venetion which is just across the street. We paid half the price and got a far superior room. Wealso ordered room service for breakfast this morning and they lost our first order, we ultimately had to reoder and ended waiting over an hour to get room service. My recommendation is to stay at the Venetion for better rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jeanniepep
Reviews.Content: My husband's company sent us to Las Vegas for 6 days for a convention/event, and we were so excited that they were going to let us stay at Caesars! After a bit of research here on TA, we requested a room in the Augustus Tower. Upon check-in, the desk clerk asked if we'd like to have a "view" for an extra $30/night (out of our own pocket - the company doesn't care if we have a view). In all fairness, nearly all the rooms in the Augustus Tower have a nice view of something; the extra $30 gets you a high floor overlooking the Bellagio fountains. So after we agreed to the upgrade, he told us that the room would not be ready for a few hours! Obviously we were bummed out, and my father (staying across the street at Bills) had been wandering around for hours and needed to sit down so I "expressed some concern" (a.k.a. got real whiny). He called the cleaning crew to see if anything was available yet, and VERY LUCKY!!!! A fresh room was available instantly on the 45th floor! And I must say, the view was epic. Easily worth the extra $$, we spent many a happy hour gawking at those beautiful fountains and the rest of the Strip. The rest of the room was huge and gorgeous. Bed was very comfortable, though I'm not a big fan of feather pillows, they were nice ones and the sheets were lovely. There was a small couch & easy chair with a coffee table by the window, a little table with extra chairs, a big dresser with shelves & a mounted flat-screen TV, honor bar (we did not partake), and a closet with the usual iron & hangers. The floor was VERY quiet, I know we had neighbors because I saw Do Not Disturb signs on their doors, but didn't hear a thing. Nice thick walls are a very good thing in Vegas. The bathroom was FANTASTIC! Double marble sinks, super deep jacuzzi tub with room for two (or three if you're small and kinky), separate glass-walled shower, separate toilet room with it's own telephone, and of course a wall-mounted TV. If you haven't had breakfast in a jacuzzi while watching Japanese soap operas, well you should certainly do that as soon as possible. Not sure if this is a benefit or a drawback, but Kendra Wilkinson and Hank Baskett were staying on our floor while we were there, we actually bumped into them twice. The Caesars complex overall is absolutely huge and it is pretty easy to get lost. The pools are amazing but after people have been getting drunk in there all day, don't be too horrified to see a few spilled drinks floating by. The bars & restaurants inside are expensive, but the service was unfailingly gracious. With the exception of the food court (yuck), every place we tried was lovely. We ate at Rau's one evening ($$$ but delicious) and at Snackus Maximus by the pool (pretty good for pub-type food). We enjoyed drinks & ambiance at the Galleria Bar, the Seahorse Bar, Numb, and the Shadow Bar; all were pricey but plenty of fun. We also had a few beverages and LOTS of fun in the outdoor courtyard that's all set up for the Absinthe show - actual seats that don't require you to play slots if you sit down, plus free shuffleboard & cornhole! We just hung out there one evening, then went back another night to see the show. If you get to Vegas while that's still running, it's incredibly fun and entertaining and the VIP tickets are beyond worth the extra cost!

Reviews.Title: “conference at caesars”
Reviews.Author: teshaCalgary_Canada
Reviews.Content: In Vegas for conference held at Caesars. Good choice to stay there, as it started at 8 AM. Stayed in forum room. Bed was VERY comfortable, king sized. Noisy from PURE nightclub. No fridge or coffee maker in room. Great toiletries, nice large bathroom. Late checkout charge was pricey - chose not to do it, and had bell man hold our bags for free. Pool area drinks are pricey, like all of Vegas. Ate at Trevi in forum shops, good value, all other restaurant menus did not appeal to us. Coffee at conference in conference centre was the wrost I have ever had in my life.. Also, conference ran out of breakfast food all 3 AMs and kept bringing food, but not as much selection - they were not prepared for 2000 people.Caesars location great for sites, shopping. Would stay there again, but in a different tower. Ask for no connecting rooom.

Reviews.Title: “Funny”
Reviews.Author: NaniAlicante
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good for the price I pay. Great location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tdl119
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a business conference at Caesars Palace. The conference logistics were great. Good food for both breakfast and lunch. Our room in the Palace Tower as fine, but nothing special. Good separate shower and whirlpool tub. Nice selection of restaurants at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “make sure your shoes are comfortable”
Reviews.Author: amazinggrace042
Reviews.Content: Just got back from week in Vegas. Last time stayed in TI, Caesars palace is a cut above! We were booked into a deluxe room in old part (only type Virgin hols do) I asked at reception for an upgrade for which I was quite willing to pay-guess what got upgraded by Kevin at front desk (lovely young man)for free into palace tower huge room with jacuzzi.Spotlessly clean, beds comfortable our room maid was Milena from Bosnia who was wonderful. Our stay coincided with Memorial Day holiday and boy it was MENTAL, Americans really know how to party. Hotel is right in centre of strip and quite frankly us Brits could learn a thing or two from Yanks about customer service .I would definitely stay here again my friend on her first visit to States was amazed at the helpfulness of hotel staff and friendly attitude of Yanks. The pool area has been done up and is fantastic I do not swim or sunbathe but my friend does and she certainly made the most of it. Wonderful holiday I walked my legs off, Las Vegas is much bigger than you think!

Reviews.Title: “expected better”
Reviews.Author: santhony74
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Ventian but had to stay here because the Ventian was full. The hotel was kind of dirty and run down. Expected better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “wedding and stay”
Reviews.Author: julzyq
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace was a great spot for our small, immediate family wedding! Their Venus Garden was a beautiful spot for our ceremony and the staff were very organized with the planning and details-officiant, flowers and garden were all perfect! The hotel rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. We'd recommend if coming with a large party to all pick the same tower for your room. We were spread out between towers (due to choosing different upgrades) and it was quite the walk to get from one tower to the next to get to anyone's rooms. The Forum tower actually seemed like the newest upgraded decor for the room, though our room in the Palace Tower was a bit more spacious. Some of our guests had trouble with their room keys not working, which meant a lot of time and energy getting back to the front desk to correct the issue. Also wish there were more lounges to gather with a group that didn't require cover charges etc. But, overall, great place to stay, awesome location on the strip and nice service.

Reviews.Title: “Still rockin in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Cheeky_Porky
Reviews.Content: Ceasars is still one of the hotels in Las vegas that is worth staying and partying. It is located in the heart of blvd.Rooms are renovated, big, comfy. We stayed in a room with the best view of the fountains. There are lot's of restaurants to choose from. Mesa Grill by Booby Flay is superb. we had very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “CÉLINE DION AT THE COLOSSEUM OF CAESAR'S PALACE”
Reviews.Author: Lucie1
Reviews.Content: COLOSSEUM SATURDAY APRIL 2ND 2011 par Lucie Sauriol, 5 avril 2011, à 17:22 MY DREAM COMING TRUE AND MUCH MORE… CÉLINE IS SO GENEROUS. I love her more than I ever did. As we first got to the Box Office to pick up our tickets Saturday April 2nd 2011, the 2 people that were there told me "just a second please". So I told my husband " I hope nothing is wrong" as I was so nervous and happy at the same time. Then they came back and they told me and I quote "these are the exact word" YOUR TICKETS HAVE BEEN UPGRADED TO THE FIRST ROW, SECTION 3 FOLLOWING CÉLINE'S DION NOTE. THEY ALSO TOLD ME THOSE SEATS BELONG TO CÉLINE AND SHE DECIDES WHO SITS THERE WHEN SHE SINGS HER SONG 17 (SINGING SITTING DOWN THE STAIR WITH ONE OF HER GUITARISTS). SO I STARTED TO SHAKE AND CRY AND HAVING A HARD TIME TO TALK BECAUSE I HAD BEEN WAITING FOR 20 YEARS FOR THIS MOMENT..... I HAD BEEN CRYING EVER SINCE I HAD THE TICKETS. (AT THAT TIME J.C. THERE WAS NO DOUBT IN MY HEART, I HAD FAITH AND I KEPT ON REPEATING THE WORDS "this is what I want most in life. There is nothing else more important is to be close to Céline and our eyes did connect. When the show started I was living a miracle, I had no pain from my (fibromyalgia or headaches) just her voice and the depth of the words she sang were medicine to me. WHEN SHE CAME DOWN THE AISLE, SHE WAS WEARING HER BEAUTIFUL WHITE DRESS, SHE LOOKED LIKE AN ANGEL, ELEGANT WITH POSITIVE ENERGY, THEN SHE SHOOK MY HUSBAND'S HAND,THEN MINE AND SHE LOOKED AT ME AND THERE WAS THE EYE CONTACT WHICH I WILL NEVER FORGET. SHE SAT AT ABOUT 2 FEET FROM ME AND LOOKING AT ME WHILE SHE WAS SINGING. I HAD A HARD TIME BELIEVING IT. This I will never forget, the look she had when she looked at me and when she shooked my hand is forever in my heart. For me this was better that to have met her with the other fans and have a picture taken. As she did receive my letter and in my letter I tell her that her music eases my pain, and the eye contact we exchanged was more personnal for me. BELIEVE IT THAT SATURDAY APRIL 2ND 2011 MY LIFE CHANGED, AND I HAD NO PAIN DURING HER SHOW. I have also met Patrick Angelil who said "you are the woman THAT TOOK THE TIME TO WRITE ( SO ENJOYED THE SHOW…. (WOW)......") took a picture, and also my husband took a picture with René. I WILL PUT UP THE PICTURES ON FACEBOOK THIS WEEK ! THANK YOU CÉLINE…… ILOVE YOU… BELIEVE IN YOUR DREAMS: THANKS J.C. Jane Terpel Claypol and Lindsey Stricklin Conner which were sitting close to me and shared my happiness. Thank you Jane and Lindsey, you are two special friends. Ramona was also there. Sunday we went back, I felt less nervous as we we sitting in section 5 so we can see the show from another angle as the previous night was a DREAM...... It was great… God BLESS Céline and her family as they are blessing others. (Boutique Céline)beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: sh0lt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights after staying at another Vegas hotel for 2 nights before (which was dreadful). It was a breath of fresh air. We stayed in the Forum Tower and could not fault our stay. The room was great, bed was super comfy and bathroom divine. The room was so quiet also, we couldn't hear anything outside our room. Housekeeping was great, and staff were friendly and very helpful. The only downside was the length of time for check-in, however there was a staff member at almost every desk so it was fine. We checked in really early and our room was ready which was great. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the just ok”
Reviews.Author: webtravelreview
Reviews.Content: We were in the Palace tower over looking the pools which was a nice view. The room itself was pretty nice, spacious and had what we needed. I do wish you could get some space in the refrigerator but it's only for the mini-bar. The coffee maker in the room had a charge to make yourself a cup of coffee. I have never heard of this before and was annoyed since a cup of coffee on the Casino level was $5. The place really wants to nickel and dime you or worse really. The bathroom was a bit dated. The tiles in the shower had cracks and some mold or permanent dirt on the edges. The water pressure in the shower was good. The bathroom was large. They had the tiniest little hair dryer, which actually did the trick but come on. There was plenty of closet space, nice robes but not enough hangers. The bed was comfy and so were the pillows. The wall indeed were paper thin. We heard the family come in next door just past midnight, clapping, laughing and carrying on. I waited a few minutes and called security and asked them to please have them quiet down. My husband had a 8 am meeting in the am and not everyone in Vegas is there to party past midnight. Security came very quickly and handled it very quickly as well which is really all they can do. The property itself was not my favorite. The pool area is nice but there are FAR too few lounge chairs, plenty for a cost but the free ones are taken right away. They had one of the pools closed and another roped off. So there was the "adult" area open which I didn't want then the 2 big pools open plus one small one as well. There were tons of people as it was in the upper 90's and they had 2 pools roped off. Can't understand that. The casino is very smoky. I noticed overall in Vegas that it is smokier this time than in 2009 when we last visited. I think the properties must figure out ways to help with this. It kept me out of casinos. The Qua spa was by far the best thing this property had to offer. Lovely facility, amazing service and quite relaxing. I recommend it. The last thing we noticed was no quick checkout. We had to leave before 6 am, we expected a bill under our door like we receive in most all other hotels, but instead we had to go to the front desk and check out the old fashioned way. I found some staff there to be friendly and some not so friendly, but mostly had very little contact with staff.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously?”
Reviews.Author: Alewis2
Reviews.Content: So we stayed at Caesars June 2-5. We had to wait to check in, which was fine because they told us our room was being cleaned (this was around noon). They said they would call when it was ready. Of course they never called. We went back around 4:45 and they said our room was being cleaned. SERIOUSLY??? I asked for a manager. She quickly typed like a mad woman and gave us our room. It was in the palace tower. Decent room but the bathroom wasn't very clean. We had an okay time at Caesars but spent most of our time gambling other places. La Salsa ( in the forum shop area) was fabulous but I'd definitely recommend Joes Seafood. Amazing food! Also, Serendipity 3 was great! Check-in needs to be better or at least they need to tell the truth!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but the pool rules would make me stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: RogerNAndy
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Las Vegas with 4 other people, this was our 2nd trip in 6 months. The hotel overall was decent, but not what I expected for a Las Vegas landmark. The room in the Augustus tower was large, clean, and had everything we needed and wanted; however the 24th floor was clearly not the 24th floor, more likely the 10th, a strange discrepancy. The one major downfall was the pool area; we arrived at the pool just after 11 am and it was impossible to find a "free" chair, and by free I don't mean available, I mean a chair you don't have to pay for. We were informed that the loungers, lounge beds, covered beds, and cabanas ranged from $100 rental to over $1500 not including the "obligatory" food & beverage charge. As there were 6 of us we rented a covered lounge bed cost us $400 including food and beverage and it was "cheaper" as it wasn't at the busy pool. All we wanted was a bit of sun and a swim, we certainly didn't bargain to have to rent a chair that cost more than most rooms in the hotel. On top of that, they had security at each entrance to the pool areas checking bags for food and beverage. It struck us as odd that one can drink for free in the casino, carry ones drink out the front door, yet you were not allowed to bring a bottle of water that was purchased in the hotel gift shop into the pool area...both of these "policies" were an egregious cash grab. The lack of available pool seating is the only reason I wouldn't stay again. The "Munch Bar" snack restaurant was great for a quick bite, and Mindy our waitress was a blast..love her! The buffet lacked choice and freshness, we all agreed that it was the least appealing buffet we had eaten at on the strip (we have tried about half a dozen) One last tip...be sure to check your bill on the in-room tv service; we had several unexplained charges that after some convincing, the front desk attendant reversed.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas baby vegas.........”
Reviews.Author: CardiffBrycey
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, right in the middle of the strip. We stayed in the roman tower and although it was a little dated the room was huge, clean and quiet. The casino was great and I recommend you play Teax hold em. $100 to sit down and it was a real experience. Service is great all over the US. Food was good pretty much everywhere and the portion sizes were huge. Only main meals required in almost all the places I ate. The tax and 18% tips are a killer though but they do provide great service. The swimming pool is awsome and you HAVE to spend a day there. Went to the Gun Club Las Vegas which was ace.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower - spacious!”
Reviews.Author: bXMi
Reviews.Content: Location of Caesar's Palace can hardly be beaten, right in the middle of the strip. I attended a conference that was held at the hotel and it was quite a walk from the Augustus Tower to the conference center and the parking. The room was spacious, clean and had a spa tub, shower, double sinks and a separate toilet inside the bathroom. I had a nice view north to the strip and I could see the mountains north of Las Vegas. The interior was not my kind of style, I prefer the modern and more minimalistic style. The parcel service of this hotel is not good. You have to call them to have parcels delivered to the business center and it can take a while. They even delivered the wrong parcel to me, it was shipped to another guest that had a similar name!

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: henryschoice
Reviews.Content: Always worth the money to go to Vegas if you like gamble evrything is free and if not big choice of food and rooms

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: rosamum
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay on the strip! Checking in with two other ladies meant we needed as much bathroom space as possible, and the front desk agent completely hooked us up by upgrading us to a suite w/ 2 full size bathrooms and a fantastic view of the pool. The room and hotel was gorgeous and shopping was a dream there! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Center Court on Strip - First Class”
Reviews.Author: Pottstown_PAKevinS
Reviews.Content: 5/25 - 5/29 - Relocated to Caesars after conclusion of ICSC convention and a brief stay at a neighboring casino. Caesars continues to "ROCK THE HOUSE". One of the best locations on center court. No isues on check in and greeted by friendly staff. Stayed inside the Palace Tower and the room accomodations were exactly what was reserved. The pool is fabulous. The lounge chair situation could be improved to include more of them and less of the day beds. Seating is sometime at a premium. My conclusion....everything about Las Vegas is great.

Reviews.Title: “reviews clarified”
Reviews.Author: pambam_11
Reviews.Content: Made reservation several months ago. after making reservation I read many review on this site. About half loved this hotel the the half hated it. The first complaint was about check in time. I checked in early on a Wednesday. we were to have two rooms for a week for 4 adults .We got up to the check in clerk very quickly.I tried the 20 dollar trick only i gave the check in clerk 50 i asked for an upgrade which he gave us for no additional charge for both rooms.
