Great tip i got from reveiws on this site. they gave in palace tower room was great.So in my opinion book your room ahead of the crowd and be willing to grease the wheels.If you come in late on a Friday you probably get the left overs the rooms that are the oldest .they are going to take care of the people that are right in front of them not ones yet to come.They give better than average drink on the casino floor. ie grey goose or Guiness beer.I didn't have anything else but you probably can get any top shelf.The pool was really nice the only complaint is the prices for drinks.46 dollars for 6 beers.Don't think about getting anything in to pool area they protect it like a fort.Not even a bottle of water gets by.As for gaming the slots are kind of tight and poker room not a good place to play .There are not many table going and local pros waiting to pick off weak players. some team play here but in general there are easier places to play.I rate my self a pretty good player for a non pro.I could hold my own but prefer to go where softer play and more fun.Dealers were pretty good.As in most rooms around vegas buy in for max or close to max and trap,trap trap and you will get payed often.Once last note on the gaming is the sports book which is very nice, big tv's and some table with tvs on them. good location to get food and drink near by.sometimes hard to find waitress but bar was close so no problem getting a drink.They give you a free drink coupon for every 100 bet .I didn't go to any shows here but they have have big name singers here.Now the number one reason i like this hotel was location is great.I think i would stay here again if i get a reasonable rate.Oh ya one last thing this town runs on tips so if you want something and want good service in future just splash a little cash and you probably get back more than you think.Stronger drink,better rooms,faster service ect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but would never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Dudenchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights in May 2011. Everything was difficult. For starters, when we checked in, it took Forever, we asked for a non adjoining room and after a lot of time, hemming and hahing from the front desk person, and keystrokes, or request was granted...NOT...we ended up with an adjoining room and didn't want or need any more hassles so we just stayed put. We tried not once, but twice to eat at the snack bar near the pool and neither time was successful. The first time it was closed (at 5:15pm, while there were still hundreds of people at the pool). The second time a private party had reserved all seating and we were told AFTER we ordered that it would be at least 30min for our food. It took another 15 min to void our order (my husband was attending a conference and had a limited amount of time to eat lunch. Not one, but both, of our keys stopped working the second day. It took 4 hours to get new ones. We had to wait for security to let us in, which took forever. Then they said they would bring us new keys in 15-20min, we stopped waiting after about an hour. That all said, the room was nice- deluxe tower room. The pool was nice, too. But, i will never stay there again if i can avoid it...

Reviews.Title: “They ruined my wedding”
Reviews.Author: dblebubble242
Reviews.Content: They ruined my wedding day!! I reserved a suite for my wedding to get ready in and have for after the wedding and they GAVE IT AWAY. My wedding party (8 people)and i hand to get ready in a small room together. We called every hour that day to see if our room was ready and they keept telling us no. At the last minute they told us they gave the room to someone else. They finally put us in another suite 3 hours after my wedding. I had an appointment to have my makeup done in the main salon and they were over booked and sent me to their other salon which made me 15 min late for my wedding. I had to write to several manager just to get my money back, but the day was still ruined and it cannot be replaced!!! Go somewere else !!!

Reviews.Title: “One-Year Wedding Anniversary Trip - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: travelbug7733
Reviews.Content: This was my Husband's first time visiting Las Vegas (April 9 -14) and our first stay at Cesar's Palace. We arrived at the hotel around 5:30pm and walked right up to the counter, no waiting and fast check-in. Do take advantage of the Bell Desk. They will take your luggage to your room and pick it up upon departure, no fee. Not knowing how far the room was, we lugged our bags to the room. Never again! (Side note: We booked our room online through an email special and paid $1400 for five nights, $280 a night, in the Forum Tower Deluxe Room. Upon check-in, we were offered a $40 a night upgrade since we booked online, which we declined.) Our room was located in the Forum Tower, 5th floor, Deluxe Room at the very end of the hall. The new decor was gorgeous, in purples, greens and white. Our view was the side of The Colosseum which didn't bother us. There was a single-cup Keurig coffee maker in the room! If I'd known I would have brought my own k-cups. They do offer their k-cups ($6 each), other treats and frig drinks but for a price. PLEASE NOTE: Although we didn't have any "neighbor noise" other than the ppl across the hall coming and going, we did hear "lovemaking" from a room as we walked down the hall. ;-) The layout of the hotel took some getting used too. In the Forum Shoppes, we recommend dining at Wolfgang Puck's Spago and Joe's Seafood, Prime Steak & Stone Crab. Every staff person we encountered was friendly and helpful. The pool areas were posh! It was too cool to get in but a very nice area. They do have a whirlpool out there so take advantage of that. If you are a Total Rewards Member (or want to register for free) AND you "Like" Caesars Palace on FB, they were offering a BOGO at Lago Buffet. It's worth the savings ($17.95 breakfast). Remember that on Sunday's the breakfast buffet is more expensive (a champagne brunch). All in all, a great place to stay, right in the heart of The Strip. Thank you Caesars Palace for being a great host and making our one-year wedding anniversary trip memorable!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel with top notch amenities!”
Reviews.Author: thomasons
Reviews.Content: Caesars is a classy hotel. The rooms are pretty large, with large bathrooms (phones in toilet area!). The beds are nice and comfy and the overall atmosphere of the whole hotel is very inviting and exciting. We ate at Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill and were very pleased! Reservations are strongly suggested, however, we did get lucky at catch a couple of seats at the first come, first serve bar area. Of all the casinos we visited while staying in Vegas, Caesars had the most friendly dealers at the tables. This made our gambling time alot more enjoyable! Hotel is very large and easy to get lost, but, so much to see! Can't wait to stay there again! Pools are amazing also!!

Reviews.Title: “Meh. Unless you get a great deal don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: ilovethebeach09
Reviews.Content: Friends and I headed to Vegas for 4 days in May. I found a great deal (Friends & Family promo) online for aprox $130/night so we booked right away. The room we booked was a classic, but a week prior to leaving I received an email from the hotel offering an upgrade to a Augustus Tower Deluxe Room or a Palace Tower Deluxe Room for an additional fee (I think it was $30.00?) Anyways, after reading the horrible reviews regarding the classic rooms we called and got the upgrade. Too bad we wasted that money. The "upgrade" apparently is actually upgrading from a craptastic motel 6 room to a motel 6 suite. Either way, they both are gross. Seriously, I have stayed at much nicer *3 hotels.... the headboards were stained (ew), the lamp shades were gross (dust and stains), the bathroom- although it was probably nice 10 years ago is dated. We were on floor 28? I think it was actually maybe 8 stories up- definitely not really 28 floors up and could hear the music from the bar... at 5am. Nice. I will give it one thing- I found the bathroom and the carpet very clean- and the sheets were also clean. If the only thing I can really say is that the carpet, bathroom and sheets were clean I wouldn't recommend you waste your money on this place. We tried to go to the pool 3 days in a row but the chairs were always reserved... people play the "towel game" here and get up at the crack of dawn to reserve seats at the pool. I have never experienced this at any other Vegas hotels... there are usually an abundance of chairs... I wish the staff there spent more time cleaning up these towels and less time digging through everyone's bags (seriously, they will not let you bring in a sealed bottle of water or a granola bar- everything is searched and thrown out)... as well as trying to get the girls to go to their topless pool... although if you want a seat go there, there was no one in there (but that was probably because a lousy beach chair there will cost you $50.00!!) Oh, one last thing, the day and night we were there the tv didn't work... not a big deal, but it's kind of nice to have the option to turn on the tv and watch a movie since you're usually exhausted and no one working there seemed to care. And there is no free wifi. Actually, nothing is free. I'll be heading back to the Wynn my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: slbmaduro
Reviews.Content: Nice Location, Nice Room and staff. Quiet, Elegant, Comfortable, Charming and Beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Poor Customer Service.....”
Reviews.Author: pedsotr
Reviews.Content: It is with much regret that I would have to write such a poor review for such an icon of a hotel on the Las Vegas Strip. My associate and I were attending and exhibiting at a major pharmaceutical convention that Caesars was hosting. Everythng seemed to be fine up through check-in. Then things began to turn. My major complaint was the friendliness and hosptitality of the staff. Extremely poor. Poor in their attitudes, and commitment to customer service. After 2 nights, my business associate was required to return home for some urgent meetings. At check-in we had stated to the clerk that we were to check out on the 19th of May which he stated was "no problem" and was as far as we knew, all set. Much to my surprise when I went to return to my room and my key didn't work. I proceeded to go back to the lobby desk with arms full of materials that I had to take back from the show. I was met by a woman who stands in the lobby and what appears to "direct traffic." I explained the situation to her. She brought me to the counter at which time I explained again that my key wasn't working and I wasn't sure if I was also on the reservation. I explained to this woman and the counter help the situation. No one could tell me anything about the reservation and the woman continually asked me if I had any "identification" in the room because it was a "liability" for Caesars if they let me back into MY ROOM! I explained at least a half a dozen times to the woman that I have my driver's liscence in my wallet and my wallet was in my pocket with me. She continually asked me if I had my passport with me?! I asked her "why would I have my passport with me when im a US citizen and I have my driver's liscence!" By this time my nerves were frazzeled with her. I stated I had travel tags on all my bags that matched the one on my backpack I had with me. I was told by the desk staff to go up to my room where security will meet me. Security finally arrived and wouldn't you know.....he only asked me for my identification (driver's liscence) and checked NOTHING else!!! According to the traffic police woman in the lobby, I needed my passport and whatever else!!!! Prior to leaving the desk, I was told that I needed my business associate to call to verify who I was to get another key. When I completed getting cleaned up to meet some clients for dinner, I stopped at the front desk again. It was amazing that the new desk clerk found my name on the reservation. He also discovered that the clerk who checked us in only checked us in until the 18th and NOT the 19 that he said was "taken care of." I was told at this time by the manager that I had to vacate the room becasue Caesars was "overbooked." I told the manager "Brian" that I was supposed to be there for one more night and that I was attending the conference that the room was booked under; BEING HOSTED BY CAESARS!!! He said that all he could do was to" find me (at an additional charge) another room at a sister property." I told hom that this was unacceptable seeing that it was his desk clerk that made the error! He did not budge not care that the error was on his employee. I had to make reservations for 1 night acros the street at the Flamingo. I had asked if I could get assistance because I had my luggage and show materials. He stated that there was no assistance available to help with the move. As a frequent business traveller, and one who travels to Vegas 3 to 4 times a year on business, this has been by far THE WORST experience I have ever had. I have been to many of the strip hotels and have ALWAYS been welcomed and helped in any way. Caesars Palace I feel has gotten "too big for it's britches" and where they may have the name and location, the certainly DO NOT have the quality care and commitment to their customers. I can say wholeheartedly that I will NEVER stay at Caesars Palace EVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel. Rude staff. Not for us...”
Reviews.Author: TIpperGee13
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Caesars Palace with friends in April 2011. On arrival to the hotel the reception staff were pretty busy and we had to wait to be checked in. Staff were less than useless. Any questions we asked about the hotel or services etc took them an age to answer, often having to check with other members of staff before coming back to us with some useless answer. We asked for a bellboy to help with our bags (we had two massive suitcases and two rucksacks) we were told there weren't any to help. What????? We stayed in the Palace tower. These are suppose to be the better newer rooms at the resort. The room was average. Cleanliness was also average. Toiletries were not refilled when needed. Often toilet rolls and soap were not replaced. The hotel is huge. Not an east place to get around. The walk to the room from lobby, pool, casino, forum shops etc was a good work out! The food at the hotel is less than perfect. We tried many of the different food outlets. Staff in all were average. Food was less than average. If you are looking for a nice meal as a treat...go to the Bellagio next door. Food is a different level there. Fresh and tasty. The pool area was clean but very busy. There are lots of loungers and the waitresses come to you for drink orders etc. There are security guards on the doors to the pool area who go through your bags looking for food/drinks you may have purchased elsewhere (annoying!) and also checking your room card as confirmation that you are a guest of the hotel. This was all very tedious. There is loud music being played all day at the pool area. Take an iPod unless you like american pop, rap and r'n'b. Casino is very big. I'm not a fan of gambling but many in our party were and really enjoyed themselves. Free drinks if you are gambling. Forum shops are worth a visit. All high end stores and the odd H&M. Bars in the hotel are very expensive!! They offer little entertainment and are pretty soul less. The hotel location is right on the Strip. Go out and have a walk about...interesting to see the other hotels and mix with the mass of tourists! It is very busy day and night. A real experience. Overall, we didn't really like this hotel. Plus points are the rooms are cheap and the location is good. Bad points, the staff are rude, everything is very expensive. If you are going to stay at the this hotel...be sure to pay the extra for the better rooms. They are better. The rooms in the Roman tower are pretty shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sweetlu4
Reviews.Content: Love everything about this place. Great location in the middle of the strip, great rooms, and the best swimming pool in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars - first class”
Reviews.Author: jacki52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights at Caesars we stayed in the Augustus Tower and couldn't believe my eyes when I looked out the window and saw the Bellagio fountains right outside. My sons stayed at Bellagio and I think the room that we had at Caesars was just as good if not a bit better, separate toilet and tv and jacuzzi. the staff were very friendly and helpful the room was clean, couldn't fault it would go back again in a heartbeat. I was glad to see that they also catered for cheaper eating as well as high dining. Hope to see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great - Expensive - Pool doors guarded!”
Reviews.Author: astempuzis
Reviews.Content: I love Casears, I love Caesars...just returned from another week long stay. Upgraded to a room in Augustus Tower. The "mini-suites" are end/corner rooms which are very quiet. While the tower is showing a little age, it is still a great place to stay. Beds are getting lumpy, they could use a change. It definitely is expensive to go to Vegas these days. This is the first time I stopped at a supermarket on the way to the hotel and bought a 35 pack of water (for the price of one bottle $5.00 at the hotel). This was actually a great savings. This location is the best in Vegas! They finally wised up and have a few "express" places to get coffee in the morning. The service has improved. People are friendlier and it is a nice change from the last several years. My beef has always been the pools. They are inconsistent in how they allow access. There are a lot more "pay" beds where you have to pay upwards of $175.00 for a bed next to the pool. This dimishes the amount for chairs. People really get angry about this. Surely they could come up with a better plan with more regular chairs poolside. But some people pay for these (or are comped) so anything to make a buck. Here's the beef - from Augustus Tower there are two doorways to the pool area, one by the snack bar, the other across the buffet. They now have guards - either pool guys or whatever - that stop you from accessing the pool area through these door UNLESS you are a seven star (whatever that is - I'm not). So, pretty much NOBODY goes through these doors and you must walk all the way around to get to the main pool entrance. They actually pay people to man these doors. Sorry, but the suit who thought of that has no clue. I pay for my room and food and goodies and whatever, but I can't walk through these doors to get to the pool. The pool people at Casesars have always made the pool experience, which should be relaxful, everything but that. Sorry management, but this is just wrong. Go see for yourselves how many people DON'T use these doors! Otherwise, I still love the place! Oh yes, I finally decided to use the Spa and went down there to discuss the options I read about in the brochure. All the ladies could do is read verbatim from the brochure! I can read also, but needed some guidance. Got none. So, didn't indulge.

Reviews.Title: “What else could I ask for...”
Reviews.Author: StellaGrace
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at Caesar's earlier this month. We stayed in the Palace Tower. The tower was a little far from the strip but it was not a bad walk. Next time I may want to stay in the August Tower. The room was very nice and up to date. The jets in the tub did not work but it was not a big deal. The room and bath were a great size. When we checked in our room was not ready and they did say they would call. We did not get a call so checked back and got a room a few hours later. I would say that if you try to check in and your room is not ready I would check back. The pool was awesome. Found chairs with no problem. The service was also very good. The casino was nice. Most of the tables did have a higher limit, at time it was hard to find a seat at a blackjack table under $25 and sometime even $50. The service in the casino was very slow. I went to the bar a few times. One time when my husband was playing and the pit boss was upset that I had to get up to get a drink. It was not a big deal to me. I wanted to have a good time and did not care if I had to buy a drink or two. Overall it was fun and I can't complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cabtrin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for two females on business. It's conveniently connected to the Forum Shops, which allows one to spend hours shopping during seminars. The hotel room itself was nice. I really liked the TV in the bathroom mirror. It made getting dressed even more entertaining! Also, the sculptures and statues in the common areas were beautiful. One more thing, we arrived very early in the morning, and the person at the front desk was nice enough to give a us a room way in advance. Weary travelers really appreciated that. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars was great!”
Reviews.Author: ColdinOhio071908
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars for 5 nights, May 8-13th. I checked us in around 8:30 pm and requested an upgrade with a jetted tub and a view. We were graciously upgraded and I tipped our host $50 for such great service. Our room was beautiful! Bathroom was great, double vanity, jetted tub, large glass enclosed shower, toilet room, with a TV in there as well. It was great for me to get ready in; I just pulled up on one of the chairs from the sitting area and had plenty of space to get ready while watching Rachael Ray in the mornings! The room was in the Augustus tower, facing the Bellagio fountains. We were on the 43rd floor. Room was 700 sq feet, flat screen TV, king size bed, couch, sitting area with 2 chairs and a table. We turned the chairs so we could watch the fountains at night in the room. A great view. My husband loved the bed, it was pretty hard for me, but I guess I am sensitive. We brought our own Kcups with us and the room had cardboard cups to use with it. We had great service at the hotel as well, I requested the foam pillows instead of the feather and they were brought up immediately. Also, we could not figure out how to turn on the shower and the front desk was very patient and explained it to us (you have to pull the knob out). They brought us anything that we needed. On one particularly tough morning I ordered room service toast, on the menu it was not priced to bad, I did not realize there is a $5.00 fee for room service. It was the best $10 toast I've ever had! Lol! Our room was very clean, and our maids were very helpful. Also we tipped them every morning before we left but they did not take the tip a few days (they only took it on days we requested something extra). I requested more cups and a pad of paper on separate occasions. The location of Caesars can't be beat. We were very glad with how close our tower was to the entrance and exit though. We were a bit concerned about that at first. Also we booked through the friends and family event that Harrah's was having, so we got our room for $90 a night. I have no complaints and our stay was great. Great service, great room!

Reviews.Title: “The Best time I have ever had in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: giggylynn
Reviews.Content: From the moment my husband and I arrived, we were treated royally. I must say that the employees of Caesars Palace could not do enough for us. Everyone seemed to really enjoy working there. Our room in the August Tower overlooked the Bellagio fountains. Very large room and so comfortable. We were tiring of Vegas being there so many times, but this experience was so good that we can't wait to go back next year. We ate at PJ Clarke's in the Forum shops and the food (hamburger and a BLT with Main Lobster) was perfectly cooked. Service, while a little slow, was very attentive. Will definitely go back. And hey when you are on vacation you shouldn't be in a hurry. The buffet (breakfast) left a lot to be desire, but I am not one that likes buffets anyway. We ate a few meals at the Agustus Cafe and while everything we had was very good, I think it is a bit pricey and they need a bigger menu. We have stayed at Luxor many times, Paris, and this was our 2nd time at Caesars. We feel that Caesars was by far the best. Can't wait till next year!! For the diamond players, the diamond lounge is good. The alcohol keeps coming. Don't expect a meal though, just some snacks, but the bartender made it so much fun. No negatives from us at all for Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “what a misserable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tzili
Reviews.Content: The hotel was picked up by the company that arranged my convention in this facility. I made the reservation ahead of time asking for a none smoking room in the highest floor. First they gave me a tiny stinking room in the 3 floor were the closet is part of the bathroom. I have never seen such a stupidity before. (I am a 58 year old doctor). Then they impolitely agreed to move me to another tiny (this time nonsmoking) room in the same floor. Both room were facing the air-condition machinery of the hotel without any view or a a piece of green or sky. The condition of the rooms was terrible, grey, noisy and neglected. The armchair was tearing apart. (see photo) The cleaning staff did not bother to clean the shower since an empty can of a shower jell was not removed from the floor for 4 days...the reception stuff was impolite, nervous impatient and forgot to smile. The price of the room was ridiculously expensive, average of 300$ per night. If you have a convention at the Caesars you'd better stay at the Mirage and walk to the convention center through the shopping arcade. It is much cheaper and much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again... even though they cheap out with charging for wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: Quaris
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in April. Had booked a classic room and was upgraded to a Palace Tower room overlooking the pool - and it was just a perfect room. HUGE bathroom. Plush furnishings. The entrance to the pool was just a few steps from the elevator which was fantastic. My only complaint was the lack of wi-fi, or having to spend $20 or $30 for access to it. A little cheap on their end considering hotels like Aria and Cosmopolitan offer it free throughout the hotel & casino. Also a bit disappointed to hear casino servers say that they no longer serve Patron or other more 'premium' liquors, although I'm still spending the same amount in the casino. Little things like that may sway my decision next time where to stay and play. Pool was nice. But you can't pull up a lounger right to the pool's edge like you can at Mirage. Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room in Augustus Tower”
Reviews.Author: greenseahorse
Reviews.Content: We were booked in a Palace Tower and were given an upgrade to the Augustus Tower with a Bellagio fountain view. This was a great room in an unbelievable location. I think the Augustus Tower has the best location in Caesars since it is easy to get to from the strip. The room itself had a large bathroom with dual sinks, a glass shower, a spa tub a television, and a separate commode room. It was very clean and came equipped with bathrobes, a Keurig coffee maker, and a safe. The linens on the bed were fantastic, but both of the beds in our rooms were in need of replacement mattresses. All in all, very solid room, very clean with good housekeeping service. The pool is very nice, but gets crowded fast. Get there early to get a good spot. Many areas that have sun in the morning quickly lose it beacuse of the buildings surrounding it. The resort has fantastic amenities like restaurants and shopping. The spa is very nice, but I feel the casino is out of date. For the size and prestige of Caesars, the casino needs some upgrading to be up to par with the resort. It needs newer machines and a better atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: NOLA4us
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a Saturday. Arrived early so had to wait a couple of hours for room to be ready. We were booked in Palace Tower but were upgraded without asking to 41st floor of Augustus Tower. Our room faced north, exactly at the curve so we had a perfect view up the strip and also of all of the pools. Fun to watch volcano erupt every night at Mirage. After reading reviews, we were a little skeptical that Caesars was past it's prime. But, we found it exceeded every expectation and was the grandest facility on the strip. If you have any doubts, don't!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty!!!”
Reviews.Author: Caesars2good
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say, I just got home a few hours ago from staying 4 nights at Caesars. I loved it, it was great. From the time I walked in the door and checked in from the time I left. I had a very nice suite on the 35th floor of the Augustus Tower over looking the strip and water show at Billagio. I had the hang over suite! If u watched the movie u know what I'm talking about. The other name for it is senate suite. But it was great. Almost 3000sq ft, 3 bathrooms, huge bedroom, livingroom, dining room. A maid and butler always checked to ensure we had everything we needed. Although I can say I am 30 yrs old and love to gamble I still think it is a great place, right in the heart of the strip. I don't party and act up and carry on like I'm 19-21 but sure I like to go there and get away from everyday life and a great time. Caesars always provides excellent service to it's valued guests... Sorry for those that talk negatively about the place, I guess Las Vegas isn't a vacation spot for elders.... But I find it cheap to eat, great shopping, GREAT PENNY machines!!!! I visit there 3 times a year and will continue to stay at Caesars. Although the young people drinking and walking around drunk I didn't let that bother me from having a goodtime. I will definitely be back to stay there and already looking forward to my next trip!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: mlwattsy
Reviews.Content: Visited Vegas and stayed in the Palace Towers at Ceasar's. Our 25th floor room overlooked beautiful pool area. I previously lived in Vegas but never spent much time at Caesar's...passing it off as an old an outdated place. Boy- was I wrong! We were told that the Palace Towers was most recently renovated tower and we found the room decor was up to date with great jacuzzi tub and amenities. From the minute we arrived, we were pleased with level of guest service in both the hotel and the casino. Martha checked us in at registration and she was ever so helpful with directions and information. Our casino host James Bean was great as well. We ate at Cypress St. Market Place (food court), Hyakumi (Tommy was our hibachi chef), Rao's (bartender, David, gave impeccable service), and the breakfast buffet (would not have eaten at this one if it was not comp'd...but was still o.k.). Caesar's is conveniently located on Las Vegas Blvd at the Flamingo Road intersection, hence you can avoid strip traffic by coming to Caesar's via Flamingo from CR 215.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay! Love the Casino!”
Reviews.Author: WITRAVLR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace Saturday-Tuesday for our 7th Anniversary. We had a hard time finding where to enter from the strip to park. Once we figured out to enter on Caesars Palace Rd (or Way, I can't remember) and go to the right to the self-parking garage we found a parking space. We didn't want to do valet as the wait time is usually longer than it takes us to park our own car and walk. The parking garage is a bit confusing as well but after the first time through we figured that out also and then it required very little thought on how to get from our car to the Forum Casino. Check-in was quick. We arrived at 8PM and there was only a few people in line and 5 staff members working efficiently to help everyone. We had a reservation through Delta for a Deluxe room. The gentleman that checked us in was very quick and pleasant, not overly friendly but not rude either. He gave us our keys and gave us directions on how to get to our room. We were given a Palace Tower Premium Room on the 27th floor. The room was very large and very clean. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were magnificent! The view was of the pool but we could also see the strip to the left and an amazing view of the outer city to the right. The windows were very dirty though. Our room had 2 bathrooms with a connecting shower in the middle and a large whirlpool bath. We ordered room service at 11PM on Sunday. Pizza for my spouse and a garden salad for myself. Prices were very reasonable. The pizza was delicious, I highly recommend it. The salad was large and very fresh. They also included some fresh made dinner rolls which were crispy and chewy and yummy. The entire bill was under $40 including all charges and gratuity. The casino was by far the best lay-out of all the casinos we visited during our stay in Las Vegas. We liked the Forum Casino. Ventilation seemed superior in Caesars casinos compared to the rest, there were many people smoking but it did not smell of smoke. Other casinos had a heavy smoke smell and burned my eyes with the thickness of the smoke. The table games did not have an open seat from 4PM-2AM, it was a very busy casino. We did not have a chance to use the pool but it looked amazing. The Forum Shops were great with a large selection of shops. Vosges-Haut Chocolat is a must, they offer samples! Just walking through was an experience to see all the statues and fountains. One thing I didn't like was all the intoxicated young people roaming around our tower "checking things out". They are loud and obnoxious and left their empty drinks all over the place. They should have some way of preventing this from happening, like using a room key to access the elevator to the room towers. Check out was very quick on Tuesday morning at 7AM, no line and the bill was correct. We very much enjoyed our stay at Caesars and would happily return, although next visit I think we are going to try PH as we liked their dining options and the Miracle Mile Shops.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to spend and walk (long review)”
Reviews.Author: stewsu
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 3 nights at Caesars for my brother's wedding which was held there as well. While we got a good price for the rooms due to booking the wedding guests through the casino host, the rest of the stay cost a small fortune. Expect to be nickel and dimed at this beautiful but expensive hotel. Room coffee as stated in the review prior to mine is $12. It is a Keurig single cup machine for which you can ONLY purchase 4 cups (minimum) for $12. Although this sounds like a lot because most hotels give you the free coffee machine in the room, it pales in comparison to the $4.95 or $6.95 you will pay for a CUP of coffee in the food court. 2 pastries and 2 sm. coffees cost us $18 in the food court. This was the least expensive option for breakfast. A tea bag with hot water=$4.00. Just a tiny example of what you will pay to eat. The place is HUGE with more of a resort atmosphere than a classic hotel. You will walk miles to get from one place to another. Lots of young people getting drunk walking through the casinos and the hotel. Reminded me of a spring break destination. This certainly is not the Vegas of old. Dollar and quarter slots have been replaced with penny slots as these are now the majority on the casino floors. Obviously these hotels are not out to lure the gambler but have instead targeted a much younger generation whose interests are in drinking, partying at the expensive nightclubs and shopping at the high end boutiques. Glad I came for a wedding and saw this because if I had planned a trip to go to Vegas to gamble and eat cheaply as used to be done, I would have been very disappointed. I won't be returning anytime soon. My money will go a lot farther in Mexico or elsewhere.And yes, check in was over 30 minutes. Had to return 4 times to see if room was ready. We arrived at 12:00 and one of two rooms was ready at 4:30, the other not until 5:30pm! After traveling a whole day with my 86 yo father, we could have used the room much sooner.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: lulu1994
Reviews.Content: I was concerned with some of the reviews I read, but my experience was great. I attended with a friend who was registered for a conference. The person we worked with a check-in was fab! He was knowledgeable and helpful. He gave us a fantastic room on the 27th floor of the Palace Tower with an excellent view and two bathrooms! Great for women who need to dress and look cute every time we stepped out! Caesar's is massive and old when compared to the places at City Centre, but it is a great hotel. The decor is beautiful and you can have a great time. Check out The Gossy Room (inside of Caesar's) on Friday and Saturday nights! A freaking awesome time with an out of this world DJ AND a great, inexpensive way to avoid the lines and children at the clubs!

Reviews.Title: “caesars always us like royalty”
Reviews.Author: djcMontana
Reviews.Content: The suite that we had requested in the Augustus tower was not available.They told us that some high rollers had come in and management gave it to them.At least they were honest about it.They put us in a beautiful suite in the forum tower with no view,but it was still first class.Everyone from the housekeepers to the casino dealers and pit bosses treated us very well.We wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay ....a few tips”
Reviews.Author: firehouse1
Reviews.Content: I had a conference in the area and had been dying to stay at caesars , i was alittle nervous from the reviews.I have been to vegas about 6 times and have stayed always on the strip. We stayed in the palace tower which was great , nice room flat screen tv, jetted tub and close too the pool. You get either a pool view or strip view> Most people who did not stay in the augstus or palace tower were disapointed. The gym is $25 a day but the spa is a MUST DO for $40 a day even if you only do it once it was incredible> the fitness center was well equipped. The pool scene is great but the music can get loud. Grab a seat EARLY my husband was out there by 9a m and chairs were already going. They do rent chairs but they can get a bit pricey. Few suggestions we ate at scarpetta in the cosmopolitan awesome and you can get a view of the bellagio fountains. We also ate at otto in the venetian which was great , request scott f for a waiter he was very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. Saw cirque O and Love both were great . Definately see the bellagio fountains they run every 30 minutes staring at 3pm then at 8 every 15 minutes. The mirage volocano is very good on 8 pm hourly til midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Disappointed in Caesar's Palace"”
Reviews.Author: CubFan2106
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Vegas before and maybe my expectations were too high, but I can't tell you how disappointed I was with my stay at Caesars. I was expecting so much more. I stayed in the Centurion Tower, which is the second oldest tower in the Caesar's complex. It's highly obvious that the only money that Caesar's is putting into this tower is for maintenance only. My room was spacious, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was clean and roomy. But the negatives far outweighed these positives. The carpet was VERY dirty. "Gross" is not an understatement. Numerous stains all over the room. Room smelled of smoke -- even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room. I guess the room can switch from smoking to non-smoking depending on if the guest staying in the room is a smoker or not. The furniture was old and dinged-up. One of the handles on the TV cabinet was missing -- very cheap looking. The TV itself was a 27 inch tube TV -- best that 1995 could offer. My clock-radio looked like Caesar's picked it up at a garage sale -- in 1985 -- no joke. The rest of the furniture was also old and very dated. I was afraid to sit in it. And the room had no desk at all. I found out on my second day there that the lock on my door was not working at all. Had to have maintenance come up and literally replace the whole door handle/lock assembly. Also, the Centurion Tower has 3 elevators, but only 1 was working the entire time I was there -- 5 days. I found out later that Caesar's has actually sold the Centurion tower to another hotel chain, which is probably the reason why they are not putting any money into it. Also, if you want to get a work-out in while staying at Caesars, be prepared to pay $25 per day. That's how much it costs to access the fitness center. Lastly, when I checked out of the hotel, the person at the front desk did not even ask me how my stay was or if I had a good time. I felt like she was saying, "Just give me your money and get out." Gee, thanks. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not Really a Hotel More a Casino With Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: antongould
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Caesars for 10 nights in May. Check in was fine with no need for the 20 dollar trick. Room was fine excellent shower but no bath. We were in the Forum Tower. The hotel is noticeably busier at weekends. The pool whilst very ornate has not very luxurious sun beds all squashed together and the water in the pool itself is hot bath temperature. At busy times you have to show your room key to get into the pool and your bags are searched for drinks even water - all drinks must be bought at the pool. The hotel doesn't just nickel and time it 10s and 20sys!! No free Internet anywhere 15 dollars a day in your room. Coffee in room ridiculously expensive and avoid the minibar. Don't book shows or Tours in the hotel go to Kiosks on the Strip. There is nowhere in the hotel you can sit down other than at a slot machine!! Things to be aware of in Las Vegas - taxi drivers don't tell them you've never been to Vegas before we paid 30 dollars from the Airport 15 dollars going back. Study the guide books for where to eat the Bellgio Beffet is excellent and an Italian restaurant as you enter the Venetian shops

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay again.”
Reviews.Author: pilotmom90
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick - we arrived at 9:30 a.m. (early flight) with check-in at 3:00 p.m. They had a room for us in 45 minutes. I suffer from chronic leg pain and was very pleased to see the room had both a chair and ottoman and a couch. The bed was good and I slept well each night of my 5-night stay. We stayed at The Hotel last year and enjoyed the suite - it was larger than Caesar's rooms and included a separate living space with an extra 1/2 bath. However, the location of Caesar's more than makes up for the smaller space. It's next to the Bellagio fountains and an easy walk to so many attractions. The pool was AWESOME. I went in the mornings and there was almost no one else there. Beautiful and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: drdotbrown
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a long weekend w/ my staff and my husband! I had no problems at all! I read all reviews and was expecting a problem but their was none. Upon checkin, there was a line but it only took a half an hour and per someone's review, gave the gentleman a $20 and received both rooms right away. We stayed in the Augustus tower, which was wonderful. The room was clean and spacious! The bed was very comfortable. My staff stayed in a similiar room and I asked for a roll away, It was already in the room when then entered! The room was also pretty sound proof. We had lunch at the Mesa Grill(awesome)!! The only complaint was I could not win in the casino(but that is my own fault!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but not pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: purplefin
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice and the rooms are nice. They are definitely a good way to go in Las Vegas, but after seeing the other hotels on the Strip, you'll quickly see that Caesars isn't the best hotel. There are several that have nicer rooms, better restaurants, more bars/lounges, and better casinos. If you are looking to save a dime, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: WorldsTackyTourist
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative comments, I was relieved when I got into our hotel room. I loved our ROOM and it was very clean and quiet. We were told upon booking that it is worth the little extra to stay in the newer towers and we weren't disappointed what-so-ever. The SERVICE we experienced was top notch. Staff were friendly, attentive and responded quickly to requests. The POOL area was gorgeous, clean and relaxing. I was surprised to see that we did not have to pay for towel rentals. I do wish that the pool and pool side bar hours were extended as the focus for some is to relax and to not constantly be in the Casino's, shops or bars (how else would they make their money). SHOPS were open nice and late. I wasn't highly impressed with the BUFFET. We ate at the lunch and dinner buffet and found that they served the same menu, aside from a couple different entrees. CELINE DION was amazing (and I'm not her biggest fan). It doesn't take much to appreciate and respect such a powerful voice. With all of the above said, the beautiful hotel came at a price, as it was very expensive (coffee/breakfast shops, room service). It seemed that any extra service came at a cost (cot rental, fridge rental, etc). If you decide to book on the strip, expect and plan for the extra costs so you can focus on enjoying the experience instead of dwelling on the prices. It was a great location as it was very central to the other hotels. I would not hesitate to stay with Caesar's Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, luxurious, good location.”
Reviews.Author: anataman
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a deluxe room in the Augustus tower on business. The room was far larger than I had expected, well appointed and with no sign of needing to be refreshed. The hotel itself was impressive, not too large to feel daunting yet never feeling small. There was less of a 'party' atmosphere here than at other Vegas hotels which was pleasant relief for a business traveller. Also, if gambling isn't your thing, there are acres of shops to explore in the Forum mall and being located in the centre of the strip there are lots of other casinos and hotels to visit within a few minutes walk. I can certainly imagine coming here again and enjoying my stay, however with a few small improvements the hotel could be so much better. The cleaning staff hadn't paid enough attention to the bathroom, the spa bath tub came with complementary hairs from the previous occupant as did the floor corners. My biggest gripe was with the queue at check-in. Although check-in was swift and efficient (as was check out with a no hassle later check out time), the half hour queue to get to the check-in desk is not acceptable for a hotel of this calibre. Providing staff to offer free bottles of water, and a lady with a clipboard to politely listen to complaints about the length of the queues was nice, but I couldn't help but think that if these staff were working the desk, the queues would be less. I'd happily recommend this place, but management, you have to do something about the check-in queue. If a customer is waiting for more than 5 minutes even at peak times, you're failing your clients.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but wouldn't stay again; good location on strip”
Reviews.Author: sachlon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Forum tower as I had read in previous reviews that the standard rooms are quite dated. Our room was on the 6th floor, was quite bright but we didn’t really have a view (we could see the back of another tower opposite). The size of the room was not large but was sufficient, more the size of a standard room in a smart city hotel. The fittings were all new and nice. Modern bathroom with a TV on the bathroom mirror. The hotel felt impersonal (in line with what happens at very large hotels like this) – you are just another guest to them. They try to get you to pay for upgrades on everything. From the minute you check in (when they try to persuade you to upgrade your room) to the pool (where they ask you to pay for the sunbeds that are closest to the pool). We used the hotel pool – was nice but very crowded – not easy to get a sun lounger and all the sun loungers which you didn’t have to pay for were huddled together (there wasn’t much personal room). Restaurants in the hotel, as you’d expect are very expensive so we didn’t bother going there. The food court was ok – breakfast was only available between 6am and 10am. And then no food available between 10am and 11am until all the other eateries in the food court opened at 11am (around USD 10 per person). We also ate at the pool bar which was ok (around $10-15 per dish). We found the food court at the Venetian much better – more choice and better prices. Also, the Miracle Mile shopping centre has some good casual places to eat. PF Chang’s restaurant (in the Miracle mile shopping centre) was very good and good value for money. We also at at Cabo Wabo Cantina at the Miracle Mile shopping centre opposite the hotel, which has an outdoor seating area and is good value during happy hour (3-6pm). On our last night we wanted to check into our flight back to the UK. The concierge had told us that they had a machine where you could check in for free and also print off your boarding passes. This machine was unfortunately not working that day (it’s in the concierge section). At first the lady at concierge said that she could check us in her PC but then quickly made up a story that she couldn’t check us in for international flights as they would need to see our passports at the airport before we checked in. I asked whether we could at least get out seats allocated online and she asked us to go to one of the internet booths in the hotel (where they have very high charges for internet usage). Luckily we had a netbook with us and we went to the MunchBar in the hotel where they have free wifi (but you have to order something so the hotel still makes some money off you!) We checked in to our flight with no problems. The next day, just before we checked out, I saw that the machine in concierge for checking in and printing boarding passes was working so I printed off our boarding passes (its free to use this machine and printer but only for flight check in). My advice is don’t bother talking to the concierge about this.

Reviews.Title: “centurion tower”
Reviews.Author: salo0061
Reviews.Content: so when i arrived i thought check in was going to be easy since i tried that new text to check in where you text checkin the day before ur going to arrive and ur keys would be at the bell desk by noon. well when i got to the bell desk there was a lady in front of us who was also trying to do the same thing and they did not have her keys so surprise surprise when it was our turn they did not have our keys either. so we had to wait for like 5 min for our keys during which we got asked at least 10 times if we needed help with our bags by the bell hops which got a little irritating after like the 3rd time but once they got our keys they just told us the room number. well i had assumed since i booked the roman tower that thats where we were staying but we were wrong we called the front desk from one of the courtesy phones and we were informed that we were actually in the centurion tower. i had never heard of this tower even though ive stayed at ceasars 5 times. we eventually found it hidden behind a wall by cleopatras barge which ive passed a million times and have never noticed. only one elevator worked my whole time there and it was very shaky and i hated every min in that elevator. once i walked in my room i noticed that it was a smoking room. ugh. i not only booked a room in the roman tower but i also booked a non smoking room. i guess thats what i get for not going to the front desk to check in. lesson learned. the room seemed very run down since this is one of if not the oldest tower. the furniture looked old and the tv was an old tube tv that didnt get very many channels and the bathroom was horrible. when taking a shower the handle almost comes off. and the worst part about the room? theres no ice machines in the whole tower!!! i was informed that i would have to call room service to have it delivered. so not only would i have to wait for ice but i would also have to tip for something that should be just down the hall? ridiculous. right after my trip i found out that they are getting rid of this tower and making a new hotel/ restaurant in this tower.... thank god because that tower needed to go. it is so worth it to spend the extra money to stay in the forum tower!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! what ever u do do not stay in the centurion tower! oh and i gave it a 2 for value because it was a comped room but i would not ever stay in this tower again even if it was comped. but i love the forum, palace, and augustus tower!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: LilLaurs11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars for 4 nights. We stayed in the Forum tower which I thought was a good location in the hotel but the furniture is definitely beat up and old. The bathroom was very nice and we liked the TV built into the mirror. We arrived to our first room in the Forum tower to find the lid of the toilet was covered with water and water was all over the floor surrounding the toilet. My husband contacted the front desk and went down to the lobby to get a new room. They sent someone right up to check out the bathroom but he didn't have much to say about the issue so I was happy they gave us a new room and a $25 food credit which was thoughtful. I woke up everyday with a sore neck and back from the bed but other than that the room was fine. I think the customer service at the hotel was poor. Trying to have lunch at the pool was always a frustrating experience The first day we placed an order at Snackus Maximus and was told it would take 15 minutes for a pizza and chicken fingers. Meanwhile time is passing by and all these order #s after us are being called with similar food items. After 30 minutes my husband asks the counter why we are being skipped and the cashier says he just calls the numbers. After 45 minutes of waiting I spoke with the same cashier who said he must have gave our food to someone else and our order then was ready in under a minute. How could our order go to someone else if we paid for it? The next day we decided to order from one of the waitresses around the pool. We had to ask twice for a menu which took a good half hour, when we got the menu we ordered a soda to have while we looked at the choices. The menu had different things on it then at the physical food counter so we decided to take our soda and leave. Eventually we track her down and of course she didn't remember our soda. We ended up leaving the pool all together and eating overpriced pizza at the food court. Being from the east coast we were up pretty early and it still was always difficult to get a chair in the sun at the pool. I wasn't impressed with the pool area. All the towers of rooms block the sun so there are only so many good seats around the pools. Every morning we had breakfast at Payard. Very delicious crepes! Always a long line but worth it when they get your order correct. This is our 3rd time to Vegas in 3 years and I'd say our experiences at Mandalay and Encore were much better. The only good thing at Caesars, which was a main reason we picked this hotel, was its location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel - esp if u are here for a conference”
Reviews.Author: sam123123
Reviews.Content: The hotel cannot handle heavy traffic. Their maintenance staff gets backed up - their rooms are not ready on time. If you are coming for a conference (which I was), you want to get in on time. If you are arriving late, you will probably be stuck in one of the worse rooms - one which doesn't have a desk to work on, no fridge, no power receptacles - I had to pull get behind the relatively old couch to find one to charge my phone and computer. Also the staff is so busy that they tend be usually rude (guess they are under pressure).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly hotel - perfect for our garden wedding!!”
Reviews.Author: LasvegasApril2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace for two weeks and also held our wedding in the Venus Gardens. When we arrived and checked in, we mentioned that we were getting married in the hotel, we were immediately upgraded to a petite suite in the palace tower at no extra cost. Upon entering our suite, words are not enough to descibe how conveniently it was located to our wedding venue and how beautiful it was - 2 bathrooms, one with a jacuzzi and both connected by a double shower area. there was also a sittng area that overlooked the spectacular pool area. The suite was cleaned daily and nothing was too much trouble. We found our way around the hotel no trouble and all staff were very friendly. The actual wedding was fantastic and co-ordinated brilliantly - the location was excellent and our wedding co-ordinator was both proffesional and helpful. Caesars is located centrally on the strip and we would recommend this hotel to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: djosland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from Las Vegas, having spent 7 nights at Caesers Palace. Wow, what an amazing Hotel(if you can call it that!) It's more an experience! Arrived about 20:30, 21st April, day before good friday, no queue at check in at all, given an upgrade to the palace Tower, over looking the pool complex. Mini suite was fantastic! The bed is better than our own, had the best nights sleep ever!! Fantastic pool complex, (6 pools) but be aware, friday-sunday, its like trying to relax in a night club, you cannot escape the heavy base, loud booming club music coming from the venus pool area, I'm no prude, but after a long flight the day before, we really wanted to relax, gave me a terrible headache and had to leave the area, next time we will make sure we are out on those days! Central location, middle of the strip, Ballagio right next door. We walked the length of the strip, take good, comfy shoes!! So much to see, a must do is lunch/dinner in the Stratasphere, revolving restaurant, fantstic views across the strip, and the food was good too! The walk to the restaurant via the casino a bit ugly, but worth it. The Grand Canyon a must too, just fantastic, did the helicopter tour,which landed in the canyon, we did want the later time slot, where you fly back over the strip early evening, but all booked up, so book early if you want this tour! Great shopping malls in all the hotels, the bigger the hotel ie ballagio, caersers etc, really only cater for very rich, all shops designer, but stll great to window shop!! Million Mile mall, in Planet Hollywood, just across from caersers, suits all pockets! Fantastic shows, we saw Jersey Boys at the Palazzo, brilliant. The bigger shows ie Janet Jackson, celion dion, and kylie from may, hard to get tickets, suggest you book well in advince of your trip. Anyone who goes for 4/5 days, In my opinion is just not long enough, 10hr flight there and back takes up 2days of your trip! We met some great people, and already planning our next trip, with a group of our friends! There is something for all ages, except the very young! Hope this review helps, enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Wedgewood
Reviews.Content: Caesar's Palace is located in the center of the Strip, and is particularly close to Bellagio (for the dancing fountains at night) and Paris (which has one of the best buffets in town). It also is immediately next door to Mirage, and within a relatively easy walk of Venetian (although in the summer it might seem a lot further). You can catch the Las Vegas monorail right across the street at Bally's, which will let you get from one end of the Strip to the other. Caesars is an absolutely massive resort, however, and while the property has pretty much anything you could ever need, it takes a while to navigate out of the casino and make your way to the Strip itself. I stayed in the Palace Tower, which is relatively new and is the closest to the immense pool area. The Augustus Tower and the Octavius Towers are even newer. The Augustus Tower contains the Qua Spa (whose Roman baths are worth the cost of a day pass, even if you don't get a massage or other treatment), and also is the closest to the front door (because you don't have to navigate a casino area to enter or leave it). The Roman and Centurion Towers are older (I believe the Roman Tower is the oldest), but given the overall condition of the property even they are likely to be nicer than rooms at your average hotel in Las Vegas. Even though this is one of the older high end properties now, I would compare it favorably to the newer resorts I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: melissaMoorhead_MN
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews of horror stories of checking in and unsanitary rooms, I was nervous about staying at Ceasars, but was pleasantly surprised by our experience. Our flight arrived at 9 a.m., and check-in wasn't until 3 p.m. The bell staff was VERY accomidating and stored our bags for us until we had a room. A few people had posted that they did not get the room that they originally booked . . . so we swung by the front desk to verify our reservation before heading out to sight see. They told us that we could come back for an early check-in at 1 p.m., which was very nice. When we did come back at 1 p.m., they did try to get us to switch towers and take an "upgrade" for $60 more in the Augustus Tower, but we opted to stay with our cheaper Forum Tower Deluxe Room. The room was recently renovated. You could see the upgrades in the bathroom the most, with a very nice walk-in shower with two shower heads, and seperate toilet room. The bathroom also had a TV in the mirror, which was a nice touch. The room itself was a nice King Bed room, with a chaise and a chair. The wood furniture had seen better days, and was considerably nicked up. We did also have poor television reception . . . some stations were black and white, and others very grainy. Our Bell Man was very helpful, and let us know that all the items in the fridge and on display on the desk (crackers, chips, coffee) had sensors in the boxes . . . so if you picked one up for more than 10 seconds, it would automaticly be charged to your room. So good to know! Also . . . WiFi, and the coffee in the room were extra . . . So they have a Keurig Machine for your use, but it costs $17 (NO JOKE) for coffee to put in it . . . My suggestion is to bring your own K-Cups from home :-). Another "extra" to make note of . . . . use of the gym is $25 a day. Three-days for $50. The fact that you get "free" coffee, fruit, water, and yogurt in the gym sorta makes it worth it . . . considering a cup of coffee in your room is $17 . . . but besides that, the gym itself was very nice and well kept with a wide variety of aerobic, weight, yoga, and pilates equipment available . . . It was a joy to work out their during our stay. Above all, the highlight of the hotel has to be the pools. Get their early and stake out a place by Rao's (Then you don't have to move to find the sun the entire day! Full sun all day long!)

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PurdyOne
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked 2 classic rooms at their discounted rate, upon check in we were upgraded to the Palace tower. While we could not get adjoining rooms they accomadated us by putting us on the same floor. Check in was quick, there were no lines at 2PM. Room was on a high floor, clean and had a partial view of the North strip. Everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful. We had no issues with the size of the place (although if you have not stayed here before you might). The only downside I had was the walk from the Palace towers to Augustus to use the gym.... There were plenty of loungers in the pool and service was great. I would definitely stay here again. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to gamble and sleep...”
Reviews.Author: UrsvanOranje
Reviews.Content: We rented a suite for 6 poeples in the Caesar and stayed for 2 nights. We where in the Roman Tower, where rooms are old furnished but big and confortable. The TV is a very old model with a big black thing on the back,.... We just stayed in the room for sleeping and where most time downstairs in the Casino. When you stay at Caesar you hardly have to leave the complex for anything as everything is available there. It is nice and central but expensiv compare to other hotel. It is a one time experience.. The Valet parking was for free, thats a cool thing.

Reviews.Title: “O vegas!”
Reviews.Author: jaminfire
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in vegas as usual...first staying at Ceasers Palace. Great location on the strip. Venus Topless Pool was great. No kids and other easy going people. Drinks at both pools were not cheap. Expect to pay $6 for a coke and $15 for a 16oz adult beverage. Stayed in the roman tower and kept awake all night by a loud banging sound. Would not stay here again for the above reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but there are better”
Reviews.Author: BlackUnicorn1408
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Caesars for our honeymoon vacation for 7 nights (in vegas, and 2 other weeks in another locations). It was the first time of my husband's in Vegas, so it had to be special. We arrived late at night (around 10PM) after a long flight. I've ordered an Augustus tower king non-smoking room, and when we checked-in everything seemed alright - the check in lady was nice, but she said the room we wished for (being on a higher floor and with view to the Bellagio fountains) was not available until tomorrow, and that we should call the next morning and they'll give us the other room. Sounds wonderful, right? so we tipped her nicely (very nicely) and went upstairs. and from then on we spent too much time on bad service. She told us the room we are getting was king-smoking room with non view. Right. So we went in - the room was a twin bed room. (and we're on our honeymoon!). so down we went again. She appologizes, gives us a new room which is suppose to be "non smoking king, but no view" (until the one the day after), and sends us up again. Ofc it's the worst smoking smell you've ever smelled, but we were so tired that we didn't care. Not 20 minutes go by, and we get a call from her, saying the room that was saved for us for tomorrow, was no longer available. seriously? she said we'll have to stay there. Yeah, right! It was around 12 am at this point and we were dead tired. I went downstairs and asked to talk to a manager. I explained him the matter and it took him exactly 2 seconds to get us the room we wanted on the first place. All in all, it was just very bad service. At the end we switched rooms the day after, around 3pm (we were told it'll be at 1pm), which meant we had to get back to the hotel in the middle of our day. We felt like half a day was waisted on something that shouldn't have happened. We weren't offered any compensation (and didn't ask for one either). Luckily, the rest of the stay was nice - with good cleaning and great location of the hotel. If i'll ever come back, i'll probably choose Bellagio/Venetian or Wynn (though the latter is further from the strip, which is unfortunate). It was nice to put a "V" under being at Caesar's, but i'm not sure it's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Beware your belongings”
Reviews.Author: chefwin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the caesars palace for 4 nights in room 5203. Money was stolen from our table eventhough I left a generous tip. As well, my samsonite lite hardcase luggage was broken into and the balck rubber around the luggage had been torn. We complaint to the front desk while checking out. He ask if we wanted to file a complaint with the security but our airport limo was waiting outside.Other disappointments : no bath tubs, only shower. The heat/ ac made a raddling sound. Will never return to any of the properties and return to Wynn's.

Reviews.Title: “Grease the Wheel”
Reviews.Author: Billycarl65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a weekend conference and booked the "convention rate" room. We had lots of offers for "upgrades" for a fee. Room and facility reviews were mixed to say the least. I did read a small note about the art of tipping. Let me tell you IT WORKS!!! At check-in I presented my reservation along with a $20 bill and a big goofy smile. The clerk seemed to find a "nicer" room for us. WOW he put us in the newer tower/junior suite overlooking the fountians at the Belliago. If you come into a situation with a smile 'n mabye a 20 spot, good things might happen. Caeser's was fine for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace - Lite!”
Reviews.Author: cdmas93
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th stay at Caesars and have to say we were disappointed. This is not the same Caesars Palace from pre recession. Check in was smooth, but we were offered upgrades at an astronimical price. No thanks! We were in the Palace Tower. Been in this tower before. The clerk said it was the tower that faced the pools. We were excited because we have always faced a roof and Treasure Island - really no view at all. We got to our room (613) and guess what - roof and Treasure Island view. The room was nice - a Deluxe with King bed. Same kind of room we have stayed in in the past. Internet is $15/day and coffee is a Keurig machine with 4 K-cups that cost $12!! My best tip for you is to BRING YOUR OWN K-CUPS!!! $3 for a cup of hotel room coffee is crazy. We got our coffee each morning downstairs at Payard. Go to the express line if you are just getting coffee or a roll. Excellent croissants!!! It was kind of depressing to see so many stores boarded up in Caesars and the Forum. Restaurants: We went to Payard for breakfast every morning as I said above. Went to Rao's one night for dinner. Be prepared - the prices are absolutely ridiculous!!! $18 for a glass of wine. $15 for 2 meatballs. Pasta dinners all start around $25. There were plenty of people complaining about the prices in there the night we were there. It was good, but not that good. Went to Munch Bar for dinner one night. Very good Philly Cheesesteak and burger. Terrible service. There was always a huge line at the buffet. (Hint - if you check in on FB for the buffet you get buy one get one free). Casino: This was the most disappointing part of Caesars for us. I would say 90% of the slots are penny slots now. I play quarter and dollar slots and I had to hunt for machines and they were all very crappy and needed updating. People were really using the penny slots so I am sure it is just me wanting something that isn't in demand right now. Drinks were plentiful some days/nights and sometimes not so plentiful. Overall, will never stay anywhere other than Caesers, but was very disappointed in it this time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view from Augustine tower”
Reviews.Author: Jandt722
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect...perfect clean room, view of the water shows from belagio, jacuzi tub.

Reviews.Title: “Happy ending”
Reviews.Author: mhooker
Reviews.Content: I am a Total Rewards member and had a 5 night stay comped at Caesars. I had made my reservation months in advance of my stay. The day of our first night, I called to see how much adding 1 day to my stay would cost. It was a lot. I decided against it, but asked to get confirmation about our room in the Forum Tower. I was told I had been upgraded to the Augustus Tower. Upon arrival 1 hour later, I was told that we were going to be in a "classic" room. I was extremely disappointed, but they did give us $100 food and beveridge comp. As we trudged down the long hallway in the Roman Tower, Jonathan the manager called to ask if I "hated" him. I told him no, but that I hadn't yet seen the room. Good news was that they found us a room in the Palace Tower. Jonathan met us down in the lobby, swapped keys for us and off we went! The room was wonderful and the elevator was right at the pool entrance. While the initial check in clerk was less than helpful, the manager, Jonathan was wonderful! It is good to see Vegas so busy! The hotel was very crowded with conferences. PS the robes in the room are a wonderful touch! My girlfriends and I felt very pampered! Spa tub, separate shower, double sinks, private potty! Who could ask for anything more! Pool waitresses were wonderful too! Just wish we had 5 days of sun instead of 3, but I don't think even Caesar's can control that!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay at Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: veronica027
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fabulous stay at Caesars Palace! Spent 4 nights in the Augustus Tower - beautiful room overlooking fountains at Bellagio. Before departing I was concerned with some of the reviews on here. I can honestly not find one thing to complain about - the staff were very helpful and kind (front desk, pool and restaurant), the room was luxurious and very quiet and the hotel was so clean and well situated on the strip. The casino was busy, but never felt overly crowded as machines are spread out and there are wide aisles for walking. The pool was busy, so plan to get there early. It was nice to be able to go wander the Forum shops when the casino had taken all of my money. The restaurant in the main lobby is a great place for a quieter meal ... not very busy and a good selection of food. Overall, I highly recommend Caesars and would definitely go back there! And if you have the opportunity - go see Love at the Mirage ... spectacular!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent/average strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Supermac34
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Vegas, but this was my first time at Caesars. I came for a large conference and decided to stay at the hotel for convenience, despite usually being comped at MGM properties. During check in, they immediately tried the "room not ready" scam to try to get you to upgrade so you don't have to wait. I pulled out my cell phone and called the Bellagio right in front of the receptionist and suddenly the "found" a room that just happened to come available at that second. I slipped the lady a $20 an suddenly she "found" a mini suite that would be complimentary. The mini suite was excellent, and much nicer than the regular room that my coworkers were in, however, for the price, I could have stayed at any number of strip hotels that are as nice, if not nicer, and much newer. The hotel itself was decent, although it is so large, it actually turns into a pain to get from place to place when you are there. Overall, the hotel is very nice, but its just average relative to the othe strip mega hotels. I prefer Bellagio, Aria, Mandalay Bay and Wynn. I probably will not be going back to Caesars unless they email me some free nights. I can't really give a thumbs down on the recommendation, because its nice enough, but it is a half hearted thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Ansome !!!”
Reviews.Author: cornishblam
Reviews.Content: After deciding to get married in vegas the we didn't want a chapel wedding and looking through the strip chapels we set our heart on the venus garden in caesars, after reading reviews on here we booked the augustus tower after hearing bad things on the palace tower. We booked Caesars for a 2 week stay with the wedding being in the first week and honeymoon for the 2nd. It sounds like we got lucky with the checking in because we walked straight up to the desk and was checked in in 5 mins. When we got to the room we was more than happy with the room it was huge and had a view over looking the bellagio fountains, like everything else the bed was huge and nice and comfy, The bathroom was nice with huge tub and seperate shower and also had a telly to watch in the tub, We found the room service was excellent with towels changed everyday and bed always made, we also knocked one of the minibar snacks one day and it appeared on the bill we went to reception later in the day and they took it off right away. After dealing with the wedding planners months prior through emails we went to the wedding offices and were warmly greeted by the team and quickly put us at ease. The wedding itself went without problem the weather was 31 and not a cloud in the sky, when my now wife met the planner ashley on the day she was brilliant and set the day up proper, with the wedding we booked the additional photography time and was impressed with what we got, the photographer was very good at his job and we got some brilliant photos. For our wedding reception we went to joes seafood and steakhouse and had an excellent meal and finished the night off with a limo ride out to the vegas sign (supprising small) for some more photos and was let down by presidential limos after being 45mins late and the driver contacing me several times and still getting the pick up point wrong. The rest of the hoilday was awsome with helicopter ride to the grand canyon ( a must do) we seen penn and teller, nathan burton and mac king, all were excellent and you can get free tickets for the last 2, we also seen "O" at the bellagio which still i dont know what the story was but was mesmerising and celine dion was also great. Hopefully one day i,ll get back to vegas the shopping is like nothing else, we didnt have one bad meal and would definitely recommend caesars

Reviews.Title: “Can't sleep because of the smoke and noise”
Reviews.Author: travelbug200
Reviews.Content: We went to Caesar's Palace to have a good time. We chose to upgrade to the Forum Tower hoping to extend our vacation. We requested a non smoking room. While we were placed in a non smoking floor and room on the 62nd floor, the hallway and the room itself had a cigarrette smell. We don' know if it was the previous occupant or if the air filtration system was not working well. What made this lodging unacceptable was the base thumping of the same music that rattled into our room. The music was the same and lasted unttil 3 or 4 in the mornining. The room itself was large and clean with the required supplies. We did have to request for a new light to be replaced and the bathroom sink to be unclogged, which was done immediately. The spa services were very good and clean. Unfortantely the noise and smoke smell did sour our vacation and overpriced for what we received..

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace is Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: coast2coast255060
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my teenage daughter and she wanted to stay at CP for the ultimate Las Vegas experience (TV in bathroom and over the top luxury and opulence). We had tickets for Cher who was playing at the hotel so just an elevator ride away. CP is close to everything and completely over the top - which is what we were paying for. I was not really surprised that there was no coffee making machine, wi-fi or fridge. All the "extras" you had to pay for - but it is Las Vegas !

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace is the best hotel on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: queen417
Reviews.Content: Have traveled to Las Vegas 4 previous times, but have never stayed at Caesars.
