I kept trying to prepare my boyfriend that the check in was going to be a nightmare based on the posts I have read on Tripadvisor. It was Saturday and 5pm. I don't think I waited more than 2 minutes before I was greated by Maria, a sweetheart. I had reserved the Palace Tower deluxe suite, which they were comping for 5 nights and I was paying for 2 nights. I did the old "do you think you can upgrade me to the Augustus Tower because I heard it was the best" and without me even tipping her, she said sure! No additional charges and she said to check back next day and she might be able to move us to a room overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The room was gorgeous, sparkling clean, view of a roof. So we visited Maria the next day she came through. The rest of the week we had the best view on the strip. Watching the fountains from the 43th floor was beautiful. I did tip her 20 dollars, but that was after she upgraded us. The front desk staff was great, I don't know what some people were talking about. We didn't spend all our time at the hotel, but the time we did spend was great. Really felt we were treated great by every staff member we came in contact with. The pool area was beautiful. There was a great number of different t restaurants. The casino area is a little spread out, but you get use to where you are going after a couple of days. Did ok playing slots. We did spend about 18.00 in the morning for 2 cups of tea and 2 muffins which was a bit much, but it was very confinient. At the end of our stay, I spoke to a casino host, who comped me another night, so we only had to pay for one night. The trick to that is for both you and your significant other should play using the same comp card, so all your points show in one place. And go to the other Harrah properties to play like Paris and Planet Hollywood which were both great fun!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work to be above average”
Reviews.Author: dmoney72
Reviews.Content: First the good: Beds: clean and comfortable. Pool area: Spectacular Service people: Wonderful and helpful, especially the Concierge Forum Shops: Great to have right next store. Room size (Roman tower): Quite large for a standard. Air conditioning: perfect, never felt like it was too much or too little in terms of blowing on us while we slept Now the iffy: Furnishings: as mentioned by many others, in a terrible state of repair. Finishes peeling everywhere, table terribly stained (not dirty, just stained beyond being able to be cleaned), knobs missing on multiple drawers, carpets a bit dingy looking. We were in the oldest section, but we heard people in the elevators complaining about the same thing who were in "newer" towers. Gaps underneath doors to adjoining rooms: huge..like 2 inches high. Loud talkers next door sounded like they were in our room in the morning. They should supply some kind of door snake to seal off the gap if they can't put in a proper sized door.. Fitness center: $25 to use for one day? Give me a break. Food court:: very slow and very expensive. In between lunch and dinner they had one register servicing 3 sections of the court..huge line, I just walked out and went into the mall. When I'm on vacation I don't want to wait on lines to eat at a food court. Do yourself a favor when you come to Vegas: don't eat at the Hotel restaurants..you're paying a premium price for average food in most cases. The reason alone is a good enough one to rent a car. You can get a car for $150-200 and you will save a good chunk of that not eating their overpriced food. $12 for an omelet? Anyway, we slept well and the pool was fantastic, which is enough reason to give a mild thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars, what an incredible dump”
Reviews.Author: BobbyC
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write reviews, but this place really was so god awful that I am. I was there for work (meetings) and having stayed at this dump before I didn't expect much, but they didn't even meet by very low expectations. Check in/check out took forever The room's TV didn't work, the ice machine down the hall didn't work, the room was dirty, the staff rude and unhelpful, the elevator got stuck, and they were doing some sort of construction that made it impossible to conduct a business meeting They also nickel and dime you for everything like internet access, health club, etc. Just a horrible experience, I couldn't wait to leave. You would be better off sleeping under a bush. I only give it one star because TA won't let me go lower

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: anonymousMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This huge hotel sits in the center of The Strip. I booked a deluxe room several months ago at a conference rate (almost $200/night!) and was told check in was a 3pm. I arrived at 3:30. Check in desk was chaos. Hords of people, no lines etc. Was told my room wasn't ready. When asked when it would be ready, I was told "we can't tell you." "in 1/2 hr? In 2 hrs? at midnight? Is it a secret?" "We will call you. Give us your cell number". I checked hourly and was told multiple different check in times by various staff and by one person "check in BEGINS at 3, but that is NOT A GUARANTEE. We will call you." At 7pm and still wandering around with no room, I asked to speak to a manager. At that point my room suddenly became available. When I asked why they had not called me, the response was "we sometimes dont get to that" Got to my room. It was NOT the double room I had requested. Again, I made an enquiry and was told "When you make a request it is ONLY A REQUEST, NOT A GUARANTEE. Room preferences are done on a first come, first serve basis." I explained that I had booked months ago, that I had been wandering around in their hotel for 4 hours and found it hard to believe that this giant hotel had no double rooms. I was offered a cot. A cot at $200/night?!!! I had to raise a huge stink and was finally offered a change of room 2 days later and a $50 credit for food/drink. I was told that I would have to take all my luggage down to the bell desk the morning of the change as it would be inconvenient for the hotel to make the switch for me. $50 credit does not go far. I was shocked to see that the only coffee pot in the room used those coffee capsules which were selling for $12 for 4 servings! Thankfully, the room was clean and nicely furnished with a very large bathroom. Checkout a week later was chaos once again. There was a woman offering automatic electronic check out and was told that an email receipt would be sent. I opted for this, trying to avoid the crowds. The email arrived quickly on my smartphone and was illegible/scrambled. I had to stand in line again. When I informed the electronic check out woman that there was a problem with the email, she was dismissive and rude. When I said that probably people who needed a real receipt should not do the electronic check out, I was told "don't say that!" I was attending a conference at this facility and opted to stay here for convenience. Interestingly, the ceiling high scaffolding in the conference room all started falling down on one occasion. No one was hurt and the hotel did provide beer/wine for that mishap. I did visit some other hotels while there which appeared much newer, cleaner etc. It was overpriced (room, coffee! and guests need to pay $25 to use the gym!), incompetent staff, smelly/old casino facilities. I would not stay at this hotel again and would certainly not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Born Loser Visits Caesars.”
Reviews.Author: jtn123
Reviews.Content: I had reserved Forum Tower rooms online at least 2 months before our trip. We usually stay at Bally's but for our 48th Anniversary decided to stay at Caesars as a treat. Our rooms were to be comped. On check in at 5PM there was almost no line. When I asked the desk clerk if any of the Forum rooms had a strip view he replied " You won't be in the Forum Tower". He said based on our "level of play we were only entitled to a Roman Tower room". When I nicely asked why my reservation was for a Forum room he said that there was a convention and they were full so we were moved to a lower category room. When I asked him to check with a supervisor he picked up his phone. After about 15 seconds without ever saying a word he said "sorry, nothing we can do". I will say that when we got to the room (#1378) it was big. I estimated the room at about 350 sq. ft. plus the bath area that had a separate shower, tub, small room with both a toilet and bidet. The room had two windows of about 8 ft. wide by 4 ft. tall. One looked out over the swimming pool area the other looked at a blank wall of the next tower. There were lots of large tubes toiletries including Shampoo, Shower Gel, Conditioner and Lotion. There were also two large bars of nice scented soaps. The big find was the grand slam of freebies a Sewing Kit, Personal Needs Kit, Shoe Mitt and Shower Cap. According to CheapoVegas.com these are becoming very rare and elusive. There were also loads of nice fluffy towels. Now the Roman Tower is one of the older towers and has not been updated is ages. The carpet was getting a bit thin and had some spotting but was not nasty, just looked old. The TV was the old style CRT type but filled the needs. The king sized bed was GREAT, just right support and lots of pillows. Very comfy. The furniture, a love seat, two arm chairs, a work desk and various tables were in pretty good condition for their ages. The Bathroom besides being large was very clean. There was a small T.V. next to the sink so we could check out the Weather Channel while getting ready.The maid service kept it sparkling for our entire four day visit. In fact the service personnel were great. Evert time I asked a question they would always reply with a correct detailed answer and a genuine smile. One day the Ice Machine on our floor was empty, when I ask one of the maids where another was located she told me where another was. At that point she said "let me get the ice for you, you are the guest here". How Nice and pleasant. Bottom Line is that even though the front desk made me feel less than welcome almost everyone else were superb. I did relate my check in experience to Caesars and received a nice reply from a Ms. Sava. She said that she would "share my concerns with the front line staff". Overall after a less than stellar start we had a nice stay. Would I stay here again? Maybe. Caesars is huge, lots of walking. BUT it also has, along with the Forum Shops a lot of things to see and do. It also has a wide variety of eating choices that Bally's did not have. Deceisions, Decisions.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bborromeo
Reviews.Content: Loved the shopping options! Trying to find my room was very difficult. This place has so many towers...I got lost on the casino floor trying to figure out which elevator I was supposed to go to.

Reviews.Title: “If you go to Las Vegas, you need to try Caesars, otherwise you haven't been"”
Reviews.Author: janeabrown
Reviews.Content: I'm not saying it is the best hotel there but, you need to do it once so you can say you have been. It is the original iconic Las Vegas hotel. The rooms are at times no better than a decent motel but you feel a little old fashion history there. The pool is great if you can get down there and shopping is always great. I was down for the CES show but the line for cabs in the morning is teh same as any of the hotels!

Reviews.Title: “WORST VEGAS EXPERIENCE EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: Jollyewe
Reviews.Content: Worst Vegas experience ever. Where do I start? First of all, my husband was attending a conference & we made our reservations for a king room 4 months in advance at the conference price (which was in the end WAY overpriced). When we arrived we were checked into a double TWIN room. When we made the mistake known to the front desk, they told us; "We are busy with another big conference, & near sold out. We can see if tomorrow we can accomodate you better?" It was late & we were both very tired from the 8 hours drive, so we agreed. The next day in between my husband's very important conference, he attempted multiple times to remedy the mistake. Each time he was told "well, maybe we can change your room this afternoon after housekeeping? But we are near sold out, so we just don't know" At 1pm the 2nd day of our stay, we were given another room. We packed up all our stuff & made our day to the next, supposedly correct room.....much to our dismay, this room was also....you guessed it.....a double twin. So we slupped our luggage BACK down to the front desk to AGAIN attempt to rectify the mistake. FINALLY, on day 2 our our 3 day stay we obtained the correct room. Albeit, the worst king room they probably had. The view was the dusty, dirty roof of the "good" tower. The wall was paper thin, & the drunk guy next door was smoking in the clearly marked "no smoking" room. I could actually SEE the smoke wafting under the adjoining door (which incidentally his drunk butt kept trying to open day/night) Each time we encountered the front desk staff, we were met with a smile & "We're sorry" but nothing else. I mean seriously?? In the land of competentary hookers & cocaine, you'd think they'd toss us at least a spa or restaurant credit? Doesn't the computer know which rooms are TWIN & which are KING? Seems pretty simple to me?? Especially for what we paid?? I will NOT be planning another stay at this horrible place!! I've dubbed it "Caesar's Shack"....do yourself a favor & stay of the other outstanding places on the strip!! Perhaps you can get some ACTUAL customer service??

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: jnphick
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our six night stay at Caesars. This is the fifth year that we have stayed here,in the past we have stayed almost everywhere in vegas...I think we have found a home. We have never had a problem with the staff,food,housekeeping or anything else. When we arrived it was 8:00 pm there was no line at check in. We asked if there was any way to get upgraded to palace tower room with double shower. The person at the desk not only upgraded us but the other two couples in our party. Rooms are great,beds are the best and the two bathrooms with double showers are great. Don"t believe all of the bad reports, just remember you are there for vacation the people working there are doing exactly that working. Everyone has a bad day at work. Caesars is in much better shape now than it was 10 years ago. Go there, take your time and enjoy this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in LV”
Reviews.Author: rayandgabby
Reviews.Content: This was hands down the favorite hotel of me and my fiance. Personally I got a good deal for about 115 a night for a basic room so I was especially satisfied. We dont usually go for anything too fancy in vegas since we dont spend much time in the room, but this place is really nice for the price. Nice bed, nice bathroom, etc. most important to us though was the location on the strip. Couldnt really ask for a better place to be located. Plus the fact that there is a good nightclub, pure inside the hotel is really convenient. The place does have really long lines, but if u put yourself on the guestlist and arrive pretty early you should be fine.... Of course there is also the forum shops. Really nice, but not really my thing... Also didn't have a chance to check out any restaurants in the hotel...... No complaints.....

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Lubor
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8pm and our room was not ready. Had to wait another hour. After a long flight from Europe it was exhausting. In the bathroom: water did not flow out properly from the sink either the bathtub. Called maintenance, nobody came. There was no cabinet for the cloth in the room, only one hanger located in the bathroom!!! Complained at the front desk but no reaction. I will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, one of the strip's finest.”
Reviews.Author: sefjdl
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel, once I made it past the chaos of check-in. The lines to check-in were not surprising for Vegas, but the lack of organization was downright frustrating. Some people walked up and only had to wait a few minutes, and I waited for over 55. I had already purchased my room online and so it was irritating to have to wait behind people who took 20 minutes to pick their room and options. BUT, that aside, I have no other complaints about Caesars Palace! My room was spotless and everything worked just as it should. I had left my toothbrush and deoderant at home, and after a quick call to the front desk an attendant delivered some to my room within minutes! The pool area was clean and service excellent, as well as all the other common areas. I was (luckily and gratefully) able to check out over the phone, which luckily saved me from another round of front desk chaos. I will definately stay here again as it was overall a wonderful experience and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Each room looks like scratch & dent sale”
Reviews.Author: BluDragonFlyer
Reviews.Content: Ceasar's has a fabulous location a beautiful lobby and shopping. But staying at the hotel as a guest is not nearly as glamorous. The first room I was given was in the Palace Tower--for conference attendees. The room furniture and rugs were well worn room and damaged the website photos all are much nicer than the actual experience. I asked to change rooms and was move to the "newest" rooms in the Augustus Tower. Bigger bathroom, with a view of the fountains (loved the view), but same dinged, dented, paint-missing furniture, although the carpet was in better shape. The beds are nice and towels soft. The hotel room charge was incorrect and it took time to fix that. Overall Ceasar's is a great place to visit and not a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Only Place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: cr_od83
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place!!! we stayed in the Forum Towers and it was magnificent. The food was a bit pricey but if you have a Harrah's Total Rewards card and use it in the casino you can get most of your food comped. The bed was fantastic and the TV in the mirror of the bathroom was a nice touch. I loved the fact that we where in the middle of everything. Just a short walk from Planet Hollywood, the Bellagio, The Flamingo and Wild Bills...out of all the hotels I've stayed at in Vegas Caesars is by far my favorite!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: Minnesotan_11
Reviews.Content: We had 2 standard rooms in the Centurian Tower. At check in we were asked if we wanted to upgrade our rooms, but we just took the standard room. We were on the 11th floor facing the street with the view of the Flamingo across the street. Loved our rooms! Noise free. Spotless! Fresh linens in great supply appeared daily. Thick white bath robes were supplied. I'm in my 60's with a bad back but slept pain free in the comfortable bed with soothing white linens and lots and lots of pillows. Elevators to our rooms were available quickly. The little cafe in the lobby was a super place for a healthy, reasonably priced breakfast. Service cheerful and quick. Every staff member at the hotel was helpful and professional, even the outside staff were eager to make our stay problem free. We walked nearly everywhere we went and were always so proud to be returning each evening to Caesars Palace. It is more beautiful than I imagined and will remember this trip forever. Two very special nights out we ate at Rao's. What memories we will all take with us.

Reviews.Title: “I love going to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Cpjules
Reviews.Content: We saw the "O" show by Cirque. Worth every penny (lots of $$). We stayed at Caesars for the first time ever. Kind of spendy but thought why not we can afford it. Well the room didn't have a door for the bathroom......having fun in the bath tub is one thing but when one of us really needed to use the facilities, we really wanted a door ! The mgmt offered to upgared us (for an additional $70/nite) but we were already paying about $200/nite. The the wireless charge was close to $15 bucks a day and very slow. But the creme de creme was having to pay $15 for bacon & egss and an additional $5 for coffee! It is a nice place but the prices were outrageous, probably in line with the other "mega" places around there, but no thanks, next time we will go back to either the Tropicana or Riviera. Everything at the older places is about 50% less & the gaming is actually better too!

Reviews.Title: “Not very safe.”
Reviews.Author: oli1406
Reviews.Content: Check in was fine. Room was we already expected (not great!) and overall the whole experience was ok, except when we got our camera stolen by a group of young people in the casino. We confronted them, as it was quite clear they had been the ones stealing it. Caesar's security was called in. They supposedly checked the surveillance cameras and realised that someone took our camera, however they couldn't say whom. Immediately after that security treated my friend and I as some kind of criminals, discouraging us from filing a police report as we were foreigners, being extremely threatening towards us, telling us to forget all about it. We were not allowed to go back into the casino, we had no other option then going back to our rooms. We were never in any instance abusive or loud, so this simply makes no sense! We contacted customer service and spoke to some kind of supervisor, who seemed very sympathetic, however not apologetic or helpful at all. We could not believe that in a place like that (A CASINO IN VEGAS!!!) surveillance cameras are not good enough to spot petty crime like this. Although I lost all my holiday photos and a brand new camera, the worst of it all was being treated as a deranged person and being completely ignored by the hotel's security and staff. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Roman Tower”
Reviews.Author: ConferenceWife101
Reviews.Content: I had double checked to see which room we were reserved for a "conference" and found out it was the Roman Tower (oldest section of Caesars Palace). I rushed an e-mail to Caesars Palace requesting a free upgrade in the Augustus Tower with view of the Bellagio fountains. Unfortunately, they replied, that they cannot upgrade rooms booked by a third party (via a convention). Armed with my Total Rewards card number I requested the free upgrade. Not happening! The room has adequate space, view is awful unless you like looking at air conditioner units on roof-tops totally blocked in - no view of any streets. Room 691 - AVOID. Bed - too soft - permanently stained bathtub. Don't want to know what those stains are on the chairs. Mildew on celing above shower. Lunch was @ Beijing Noodle No. 9 in Caesars was $41 and all we ordered was two bowls of soup (very plain @ $7.09 each) and split an entree of kung po chicken @ $15.09, tea $3.09 each - oh and they charged us $3.09 for steamed rice to go with the entree. One wonders why they ever held a typical MidWest conference at this establishment at these prices! If I can attached photos - I will. As I guessed, this is not the "vacation" I thought it was going to be for me joining my husband for his conference. I'd love to return home right now before we have to fork out too much $ for dinner - and $5 for a bottle (small) of water. Where do all these people I see walking around go to eat around here? You'll see tons of people just walking up and down the strip - I'm thinking they are in search of better places (cheaper & better food) to eat. As I sit here shaking my head, I can hear doors closing around me (meaning this is not a very quiet place and I suspect that when it's evening, it will get worse.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty darn good”
Reviews.Author: BuddyMalloy
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights on business. I liked my room, I liked the location of the hotel (middle of the strip) and although I didn't find the food terrific, it was pretty darn good. Although I didn't get a chance to try the pool, I certainly sat by it a few times in between meetings and it is unbelievably beautiful. Service at the hotel was almost an "A", but I'll explain why I couldn't grade it that way in a moment. They must have a few thousand rooms to take care of each day, and I cannot fault housekeeping. I stayed in two different rooms over the course of my three nights, and they were spotless. The rooms come with a mini-bar and flat screen LCD, and the bathroom had a nice marble tub, separate shower and two sinks. Robes were included in both rooms. Rooms were very quiet. Hotel internet is $14.95 a day. If there was one thing I could change about the room? They need feather pillows. The Conceirge desk is terrific. i only have a couple of requests and they met them no problem. I ate at three restaurants: one off the lobby for breakfast, one japanese restaurant called "9" and another Italian restaurant whose name I can't remember. I also ordered room service. They all had terrific service. They try really hard here. Onto the 'issues'. One is the Front Desk, they are definitely understaffed. Lineups are enormous, and the front desk counter is so huge they could easily triple the staff at peak periods. I don't understand why they don't. I also had a problem with my bill, which I worked out over the phone for twenty minutes and they resolved it. Unfortunately when I called back less than an hour later to check out (you are allowed to check out over the phone), they had absolutely no record of my previous conversation on file, and my bill was backed to beung messed up again. They actually did not resolve it that time and told me there was nothing they could do (I won't get into the details of the problem but suffice to say it WILL be solved once i return to work and call the manager). The other issue, which I cannot excuse, is the business centre. Only one person staffs it and he is too busy to help, and the computers are hard to use. Yes, I can understand charging $7.50 for 15 minutes computer work - I cannot understand charging a $1.00 a page to print something out. Forget about bringing your own paper - when you send the print command to the printer, it charges you that way. Also, for some strange reason, although there's a number of computers there is only one printer. Lastly, you will see advertisements all over the building for Jerry Seinfeld and Celine Dion. I mean everywhere. What doesn't make sense is that Jerry only performs there FOUR times a year (this is what I was told at the Conceirge desk). Celine was performing the week I was there and although I didn't get to see her, I would have had I had the time. One other thing - there are plenty of SMOKING rooms in this building. I don't smoke, which was a problem as they gave me a SMOKING room on my first night. Now, they made this up to me on my second night by upgrading me. HOWEVER - be clear at the front desk that you want a non-smoking room. I was, and there was still a mistake made. So you should verify when they had you the room key. None of these issues would prevent me from staying there again, unless I knew I was going to need heavy usage of the business center (then I would definitely stay somewhere else). Like I said, the staff do try really hard and the place is spotless.

Reviews.Title: “WHY THIS HOTEL LORD WHY?”
Reviews.Author: blisteredheel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 4 friends decided to stay here. We thought the room was overpriced, considering we've stayed at other nicer places for the same amount or less. The tile was not clean in the bathroom, the sinks seemed dirty. The view was not good at all. When we booked, we upgraded and our friends didn't, but we all had about the same view. We asked to be moved 2 times and were declined. The noise is terrible, you can hear everything, including people fighting in the room next door. We gambled a bit here and was not offered a drink, untill playing on the tables. As for the service, WHAT SERVICE? We went to eat at Serendipity and my wife never got what she ordered but what she ordered was you guessed it ON THE BILL. We went to Planet Hollywood resturant to eat & ended up leaving because no one acknowleged we were sitting there. However, on the way out, the hostess said "Have a Nice Day!" I must say though when we checked out and we went to the bell hop he was very freindly and caring, that is the first time that we tipped that much for a bell hop. As you probably guessed, I will never stay there again and would not recommend this place. As for the amenities the hotel offers lots. The building is incredible, & I believe that must be what we are paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Spa”
Reviews.Author: capoxoxxo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Caesars. I was very pleased with the cleanliness and air purification in the casino area. Unless someone was smoking right next to you the smell was not that bad. Our rooms were great. We stayed in the Palace towers. Bathroom had a walk in shower and whirlpool tub. Pools were nice we did not use them on this trip. The Qua spa was fantastic. Beautifully done, bathhouse was very relaxing. Overall a great spa, but be prepared to spend some money. We ate at two celebrity chefs restaurants in the hotel and one in the forum. All were very good. There is plenty of things to do within the hotel. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In vegas its all about LOCATION... and this is right in the middle of everything.”
Reviews.Author: Jo1309
Reviews.Content: Location !! Location !!! Location !!!! The strip is huge.... it takes hours to walk it.... I am so glad we stayed here because it was right in the middle and easy to get to everything. My Teenage son picked this hotel because of the movie t he hangover... its Huge... It has everything you need and then some.. I dont think we saw it all... I even got lost one night walking around the shops... We booked at the last minute...got a great deal...worth every cent.. would go back without hesitation. ONLY draw back... u had to pay for internet in rooms...and it was NOT cheap :(

Reviews.Title: “Great stay :)”
Reviews.Author: PYO1818
Reviews.Content: Although the room we stayed did not have any fantastic view; but we can still be able to enjoy the lights from our room. The room was nice and the bed was really comfortable. I was expecting to have slippers in the room. Their bathroom was huge which I really love. The décor was classic but yet elegant to me. There are many different restaurants at Caesars Palace including buffet, Chinese restaurant, Payards, sushi restaurant, food court and many more. We were debating what to have since they pretty much all types of cuisines. So, we first tried Payards which is a sandwich, crepes, chocolate shop. They were out of the sandwiches around 10ish in the evening, so we tried their crepes. The crepe was not as good as I expected it to be. We usually have crepes at Fashion Show Mall and to be honest, theirs were way better than this. It was my first time but yet also my last for crepes at Caesars Palace. The staff was great and their customer service was excellent. One of the staff walked us to the restaurant that we were looking for. While walking, he also questioned us a couple of questions. I believe that he did care for our stays and their services.

Reviews.Title: “Roman tower not as bad as everyone says....”
Reviews.Author: yvrflyer
Reviews.Content: I can't speak for all the rooms in the Roman tower, ours was fine. Being it is the original tower in the hotel, the rest of the hotel/resort has grown around it, consequently there are a couple of drawbacks. Our view of the air conditioning system was fabulous (if you like that sort of thing) and the walk from the self park to check in is through the casino and quite a long walk, other than that, there aren't many complaints. The room was large, clean and well maintained. Yes it is an old tube T.V. but I had stayed at Paris the week before and they had a tube T.V. as well. If you're going to Vegas to watch T.V. then you should inquire before hand to find out the style and size of the Television. As for a coffee maker, very few hotels in Las Vegas provide one in the room. The bathroom was a nice size with nice amenities (large shampoo/conditioner/lotions/mini sewing kit etc.) and a small lcd T.V. on the wall. The closet was in the bathroom which is perfect, you could hang your clothes and the steam from the shower would remove the wrinkles. Because it's the original tower in the hotel, there aren't that may rooms per floor and only 14 or 15 floors (I think) so the the wait for an elevator is minimal and there isn't much traffic going up and down the hall so it's a bit quieter. All in all, not a bad experience. One of the benefits of the Roman tower is that there are fewer rooms per floor so that means

Reviews.Title: “What is happening to Caesars Palace????”
Reviews.Author: jchboss
Reviews.Content: We are Palazzo/Venetian people and tried Caesars for a change of scenery and Celine :). The room in the Augustus Tower was beautiful and overlooked the fountain at the Bellagio, but is a walk for a cup of coffee. Ate at the Augustus Cafe where the food was excellent, but had to use a hand sanitizer after touching the menus. They are in bad need of cleaning/replacement. Go outside to the Forum Shops or somewhere to eat for good food at much more reasonable prices. Not a bad place, but not the old Caesars of a few years back. Very inconsistent in quality, ambiance, prices and overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “sehr gut”
Reviews.Author: joaotomco
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central on the strip, nice rooms, service is very good, may be expensive. Nice pool makes you really feel on the sea side. Room are big and nicely decorated with great view on the Bellagio fountain. Nice jacuzzi in the room. Wifi expensive fees and per day only. Concirge has got an answer to all questions and reservation to any local possible therewith.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace Augustus Tower”
Reviews.Author: Bruno80799
Reviews.Content: I stay one night at the Caesars Palace in a deluxe room in the Augustus Tower. This tower is next to the lobby of the hotel and is also facing the bellagio hotel and Paris Paris. The windows in the room are very large and give you a nice panoramic view on the bellagio's fountaines. The room are very large for one person... you have a kind of jacuzzi in the bath, flat TV... There is a coffe machine in the room but they charge you 12 USD for a cup!! The pool area was not fully open but very very nice. The casino is large and you can have a lot of fun there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the middle of the strip - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: emg43
Reviews.Content: We had a room in the Forum Tower at Caesar's Palace and it was very clean and modern, but also really comfortable. The room wasn't huge, but there was definitely plenty of space the two of us. And the room was silent at all times which was great for sleeping and relaxing. The TV was good, bathroom was good and clean. Pefect location right on the strip, and we found the staff to be helpful and friendly. Restaurants inside the hotel were delightful, albeit quite pricey! The pool area was impressive, although out of action as it was winter.. We were very excited to be staying at the iconic Caesar's Palace and it didn't let us down.. Happy to go back there anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Eb2222
Reviews.Content: They promise you a premium room and then send you to a disgusting ancient tower that hasn't been renoed in 45 years. When you tell them what you booked, they don't believe what you tell them you've been promised. Extraordinarily poor customer relations. Clearly they have a plan and the customer is disposable.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in is a NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: momof2girlsArkansas
Reviews.Content: It took 4 hours to get checked into our rooms, long lines, standing for hours. The room was great, but the wait was awful. There's lots to do, shopping & good eats! Recommend because the room was so nice and elegant, but they need some serious work on their check-in system.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: justjoe2
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very kind. Room was clean and nice. Staff was very nice. Smoking pretty much everywhere in town. Pool is crowded.Nice location with nice places to eat. A very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Caesars Palace booking means absolutely nothing...stay away!”
Reviews.Author: DanWorldOyster
Reviews.Content: Booked a room months ahead. Arrived and told hotel overbooked. No apology and even tried to lie about the reason. Told us it was bad weather stopping departures, then Manager admitted this was a lie. Eventually moved to Planet Hollywood. They gave all rooms they had to a convention. Could not care less, and then tried to avoid paying for Planet Hollywood!! Pity because part of Caesars we used last time was modern and good service, but they are going to pieces and customers mean nothing to them. Do not take the risk, they are a lottery and customers deserve more than this for the money. Stay away.......

Reviews.Title: “OK but with significant reservations”
Reviews.Author: fleming
Reviews.Content: In general this was an OK place to stay. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well maintained even though it was in oldest tower of the hotel. I have the following reservations: 1. Noise: The room had connecting doors to other rooms. They provide no sound barrier so any conversion or TV in the next room was clearly audible even if not very loud. If I came back I would insist on a room without connecting doors. 2. Too soft mattress: I do not have back problems but had sore back after staying in this room. If I came again I would insist on a firm mattress. 3. Climate control: Difficult to regulate. Usually either too cold or stuffy if AC not on. 4. Cost of internet: $15/day and often slow probably due to heavy use. Charging extra is like charging extra for running water or TV. 5. Cost of fitness center: $25/day or 3 days for $50. Nice facility though. All in all, I would try another hotel if I came again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...would not stay at Caesars Palace again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kristine_LongIsland
Reviews.Content: Let me just preface this and say that we love Vegas. This was our third time in Vegas, but our first stay at Caesars Palace and will be our last. My husband and I stayed at Caesars Palace 2/20/11-2/24/11. We had all four night comped in a Classic Room using our Total Rewards players card. Upon arrival to the hotel, it was 2 p.m. and we were worried that there would be huge lines as described by other travelers. Nope, the lobby was empty. We walked right up to the front desk and were able to check in immediately. We inquired about complimentary upgrades, but were told that the hotel was actually overbooked due to it being President's week and the many conventions that were staying there. We were offered a suite upgrade between $100-$200 per night. Knowing we would not be spending a lot of time in the room, we declined and kept our free room. We were on the 12th floor of the Roman Tower. Very disappointing. It was an oversized standard room that is in definite need of upgrades. Flatscreen tv? No, instead an old tube style tv inside an old wooden armoire. Standard desk, small table with wooden chairs, two nightstands and a king size bed. There was no refrigerator or mini-bar. The only saving grace to this room was that the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. So the few hours of sleep a night we actually got was at least restful. The room was also very quiet and had no smoke odor at all. The bathroom was the strangest thing. No door...the entrance was a short hallway. The toilet was in a separate room near the entrance that had an old, rickety, wooden sliding door and a loud annoying fan. Next to that was the oversized shower stall that only had one small soap holder. There was no where to put other toiletries like shampoo. There was a long vanity with one sink and a separate makeup vanity that had poor lighting. A tiny flatscreen tv protruded from the wall near the mirror. Got excited for a moment when I saw a huge oversized tub with whirlpool jets, until I took a closer look. The tub was old and was in desperate need of some bleach. No privacy in the bathroom at all. Once you step out of the shower, you are in full view of anyone near the bed. Glad I was traveling with my husband. Also, all the lighting in the bathroom was on one circuit except for the shower,. So if you had to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, the whole bathroom lit up which then lit up the bedroom. The property itself was just average. Restaurants were overpriced. The bars were comparable in price to others on the strip. We were not impressed with the casino. Felt it lacked variety and availability of slot machines. We only spent the first evening exploring Caesars. The rest of the days we only returned to change and sleep. We enjoyed the many other casinos on the strip. Let me just say that I would have been very upset if we had paid for this Classic Room which can cost quite a bit if you don't have a promotion. If you're lucky enough to be guaranteed a suite or a nicer room, you'll probably have a more enjoyable experience than we did. We would definitely return to Vegas, but would stay at another property.

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy and dated hotel with poor service”
Reviews.Author: Lakeview038
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with friends on a relatively high budget trip. We didn't get into our rooms for several hours due to some "mix up" in our reservation despite having clear and confirmed reservations. No apologies were given and the staff from the front desk to cleaning staff were brisk, unfriendly and at times, unhelpful. The rooms were clean but dated and stained. Two of our tv's didn't work and in our room we ran out of basic supplies. We were told by people we met in Las Vegas that we could have gotten twice the room quality for half the price at other newer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “BAD!”
Reviews.Author: Micla
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars and regret it. The room was dirty, vents were dusty, I swear that the room was not CLEANED before we went in; it was probably just spot checked. Staying at Caesars was like staying at a mall. Everywhere you go you are surrounded by shops, and the best part of staying at Caesars is you can't find your way out. Everywhere you go leads to the forum shops. Like where is the out door. No phone books in the room so if you wanted to go somewhere else it's like they don't want you to. They did supply a one cup coffee pot that still had someone’s packet of coffee in it - gross!!! Oh if you want coffee it will cost you $12.00. I was so disappointed in my stay that I feel I wasted my time in Vegas. Do you self a favour and stay anywhere but here!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here...”
Reviews.Author: kcafwi
Reviews.Content: Words just don't express.. So they made a video.. I'll be spending my dollars some where else.. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z_A5A17yeTY

Reviews.Title: “review”
Reviews.Author: chengk9
Reviews.Content: great hotel lots to do and the shop is huge but little bit old.. over all nice

Reviews.Title: “Caesers Palace..the Fall of an Empire”
Reviews.Author: Runner56
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Caesars Place Las Vegas before and enjoyed it. Not any more and never again. What used to be one of the top class hotels has now fallen rapidly into 3rd rate shoddiness and disrepair. Our first clue should have been the complete lack of door service for our baggage. Our second clue should have been the scroungy looking guy in a tee shirt and dirty jeans drinking a bottle of budlight while sitting atop the concierge counter. Our third clue should have been the broken exit sign hanging sadly in the hallway with open electrical wires dangling. The suite we stayed in this time was devoid of any artwork rendering the room into a sterile cell. Inside the room, the TV was old box style with perhaps 12 non-premier stations to choose from, no HBO included. The bathroom faucet was completely broken off its base, the wallpaper peeling and crusty, the carpet ripped, torn and shredded in multiple areas. And don't even mention the smoking, every inch of room, the bedspreads, the furniture, the towels, the curtains reeked of heavy cigarette smoke.In the hallways, trays of discarded room service food lingered for more than a day. And then the nickel and diming started: whereas one can get full coffee service, a mini-fridge/bar and free WiFi in a Motel 6: not at Caesers Palace. No coffee service in the room, that requires extra payment. WifFi? Gotta pay for that. Mini-bar? No way unless you want to upgrade and pay extra. Can I print out my boarding pass? Sure, but we are going to charge you for it. Caesers Palace used to be great, but it is now a fallen empire, downtrodden, beaten and bedraggled as its gasps its last breath. One can readily visualize the demolition trucks lining up soon to put Caesers out of its dying misery. The faster the better.

Reviews.Title: “CAESARS PALACE IS FIRST CLASS ALL THE WAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: schnoobs
Reviews.Content: Absolutely everyone that we came into contact with went above and beyond in excellent service. Rooms were amazing, housekeeping was fantastic, cocktail waitresses were the best we have ever met and we have stayed at many casino's in Vegas over the years. We felt we made new friends in all the staff we met. Beverly and Tana were two of the cocktails waitresses that were so over the top accommodating and superb in their service. We met many other staff that was exceptional but didn't get their names. Mesa Grill was a highlight for us, food incredible and service was top notch. We were in the Agustus tower and loved it. The bed's were very comfortable, soaker tub amazing and quiteness of the floor exceptional. My husband and I have tried several hotels over the years but both feel that we have found something pretty darn amazing at Caesars and have already booked our trip back for the end of the year. Look no farther than this hotel! Any questions you have please don't hesitate to contact myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SarahinOR
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful long weekend to Las Vegas and stayed at Caesar's. Unfortunately, the night we arrived, Caesar's didn't have any non-smoking rooms available. We were sent to Planet Hollywood, and, although inconvenient, the front desk was wonderful in terms of compensating for it. Once we got back to Caesar's we had a wonderful time. We love the center strip location and love the Forum Shops. We were in a deluxe Augustus tower room and it was very nice - a few "dings" on the walls but overall enjoyable. My only complaint is that housekeeping isn't very well timed - we were out all day and room room hadn't been cleaned when we returned at 4pm. They did come while we were out at dinner but it would have been nicer had they come during the daytime. I would suggest calling on your way out of the room. We'll definitely be back to Caesar's.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, not cheesy”
Reviews.Author: mexicofiend
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband to Las Vegas on the 14th Feb 2011 for 5 days. We had been recommended to stay there by friends who had been there a few years ago and mentioned that it was a kitcsh place with people dressed as gladiators walking around. It sounded just what we wanted to experience Las Vegas! However, Caesar's Palace has changed a lot over the years and has been refurbished. We were pleasantly surprised to find that it is actually very classy and not cheesy at all. It is plush and elegant with no sign of people dressed as gladiators walking about. Upon arrival at the hotel (our flight arrived from London at 2pm and we got to the hotel around 3.15pm) we found out at the reception desk that our room wouldn't be ready until 5pm. We thought this odd as our confirmation email stated that check-in was at 3pm (we had booked through expedia). So, our choice was to either hang around in the reception for nearly 2 hours before the room was ready or pay $60 extra per night to get an upgrade and go immediately into the room. After a 10 hour flight, we were exhausted and felt forced to pay for the upgrade as we wanted to rest and freshen up straight away. We don't know if this was a one-off or if it is a common thing that they ask new guests to pay for upgrades upon arrival. Although we were annoyed about this, we soon found out that we had made the right decision (at the unforseeable extra cost though). Our room overlooked the water fountains at the Bellagio with magnificent views of the Strip too!! Caesar's Palace is located right in the middle of the strip next to the Bellagio hotel and opposite the Paris hotel. Very good location as you can walk everywhere from here. But the hotel is vast, as are the other hotels on the strip. It takes a good while to walk anywhere. The Deuce bus and the other 24 hour bus stops at or very near Caesar's Palace so there's no trouble getting to/from the hotel. There is also a constant stream of taxis outside the hotel. Our upgraded room was on the 42nd floor overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The room was huge with a king-size bed, plasma tv, mini-bar (don't buy anything from in there though.. it's really expensive!) an en-suite bathroom with jacuzzi, shower, double basins, hair-dryer and full amenities (shampoo, soaps, shower cap, towels etc). There was even a tv in the bathroom! There was also a large sofa area in the bedroom, coffee machine ($12 for 4 cups -very expensive!!), magazines and air conditioning. The hotel itself has a vast casino with the usual fruit machines, craps tables, blackjack, roulette etc. The cafes are a good place for snacks, hot/cold drinks, breakfast etc. There is also a spa, pool and treatment areas. The Forum shops have some high-street brands as well as a large array of designer brands. Fantastic shopping. They also have moving statues every hour in the Forum but this isn't worth seeing. Overall, we had a wonderful stay there and we would recommend this hotel to everyone who wants a comfortable and elegant stay in Vegas. It's a real treat to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: moocow2011
Reviews.Content: just back from 5 nights in vegas for mams 50th b-day group of 11. second time in vegas first in caesars stayed in excalibur last time 2 yrs ago. our room was in augutus tower. side view of strip. room huge with separate jacuzzi bath fit 2 easy and double power shower. hot water always. room was really nice newly decorated with fine furnishings. flat screen tv in bathroom and bedroom. toilet was separate to main bathroom. room spotless clean. towels and toiletries also. tea/coffee making facilities but we didnt use. never heard any noise in our room. a/c abit cold but nothing the press of a button cant solve. as we pulled up in our car there was crowds of ppl everywhere and lots of photographers we guessed something was going on but didnt realise what until we went to check-in. celine dion is due bk to caesars in march and was visiting for promo my mam and sis went bk out and believe it or not after just walking out they got to shake celine's hand!!! she was so nice and had new twins with her! ppl were there for hours to see her and we just arrived :) no headline in the colesseum at moment. we got free tickets from concierge to pure niteclub but never actually made it. check in was not too bad not super fast but not very slow either. check out great you just check out from your tv in the room. we ate in augutus cafe one night ok not amazing only 24 hour restaurant in caesars!! we also ate in burger place in caesars nice enough. all in all we had a lovely time in caesars i actually dont have any negatives. somebody had mentioned that the housekeeping trolley is left out all night we did notice this but it did not bother us at all. we were a group of 11 and had booked months ago and would have liked to have been on same floor as each other but we were not when we checked in no big deal really. i would highly recommend the cosmopolitan for buffet breakfast $16 it was devine. also wynns hotel for buffet dinner queues extremely bad 1hour 10mins when we went so we paid extra for vip which means you dont queue and you get a glass of champers. seafood amazing. i did not gamble all that much but went shopping alot. premium outlet the best (go online and register for discount with premium outlets vegas you get 20% off in lots of shops we got 30% off most clothes in tommy hilfiger along with our 20% so half price in total unbelievable value) coach has great sale on at mo too! also forum shops in caesars good (has ugg shop) and also fashion show mall great has a macys great sale on menswear and also tourists get 10% card from visitors centre! we went to see vegas the show in ph was enjoyable and half price tkts $50 with tix4tonight outlets all along the strip. did helicopter to grand canyon with maverick could not land in canyon as visibility was poor but they gave us a full refund which was very good as we did get a trip over hoover dam and lake meade for free. caesars great location. hope review is helpful and not too long. if you are buying duty free its better value in dublin airport i found. enjoy viva las vegas and dont expect to get much sleep it is not a relaxing holiday by any means its go go go! $1 drinks in o'sheas across the road $6 in caesars!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but left a bitter taste”
Reviews.Author: acb98sm
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Ceasars. There was a good selection of restaurants and the spa was good. The reason I have marked this hotel down was the extortionate rate I was charged for making a phone call from the hotel room. During my trip I lost my cell and was forced to use the room phone. I made 4 calls to a cell, hitting the voice mail each time and hanging up. I found out on checkout that I was charged $9.95 per call. This is completely unjustifiable gouging by the hotel and left an extremely bitter taste in my mouth. I am also frustrated by Vegas hotels using the gym / spa as another way to price gouge customers. No resort fee but I did pay $50 for a 3 day gym pass. This pass did not entitle me to use the showers and lockers in the spa. They asked me for another $20 for this. I left my bag in the gym but later found my phone had gone. I know I had it going into the spa area because I was checking Google maps as I was walking in. I can't be sure that not being able to leave my bag in a locker led to my phone disappearing but why didn't they just let me use the locker? Also, you pay for internet in the room. All Vegas hotels price gouge but this hotel is particularly efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh! Will Not Be Returning - Beware of Sofa Bed”
Reviews.Author: Jebxek
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Caesars for two nights in a Forum Tower Royal Suite. It advertises itself as being suitable for 4 people, with a sofa bed and a king sized bed. We checked in and my sister tried to get an upgrade, but the fellow at the front desk kindly took her $50 and we got the same room that we booked. I guess that's lesson learned for her. The room had a nice layout, but despite some obvious attempts at upgrades, it looked tired. I called to request that the sofa bed be made up so that I could sleep there. I was told, by a rather snippy woman, that they do not make up sofa beds, but they would leave off sheets for me. I was somewhat aghast. I am staying in a supposed luxury hotel and I am expected to make up my own bed? Anyway, we returned to our room later to find some clean, but stained sheets left for me to make up my own bed. When I pulled out the sofa bed, however, it was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever laid in - even by sofa bed standards. I wound up sleeping on the sofa. We also had a maintenance issue where the door was making a high pitched squealing noise all the time, not just when opening and closing. That was fixed promptly, which was surprising considering their make your own bed attitude. I guess that I am lucky that they didn't just send up a screw driver. After complaining to the front desk to a clerk who had never heard of the fact that the hotel does not make up sofa beds, we were provided with a cot and a credit. That was very nice, but it wasn't enough to get me to be a guest at their hotel again. I would imagine that the newer towers have less tired accommodations. I, however, will never know because I will not be returning due to the lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel4483
Reviews.Content: This hotel's only saving grace is the great location on the strip and the good restaurants, aside from that my experience was awful. The customer service was perhaps the worst I've experienced. The rooms are old and not clean, there were cigarette burns on the bathroom wall, our phone didn't work, the carpet was peeling up and there was sharp plastic sticking out that was very painful if accidentally stepped on. Our neighbors were having a party until 8am with what sounded like 20+ people in their room screaming at the top of their lungs, and nothing was done to stop this. The most annoying thing is when they swipe your credit card for incidentals they don't tell you they will be automatically charging you $200, which can be a serious problem if you use a debit card and they don't bother informing you what they are going to do with it like they failed to do with us. When I called about the charge they informed me it would instantly be placed back on my account. False. Two days after check out its still there and when I call Caesars to discuss how to fix it, I speak only with rude, unfriendly people who aren't willing to apologize for the shady tactics and instead try to blame me for not fully understanding and the policies written in 2 point font at the bottom of my receipt.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful...”
Reviews.Author: 4eyeed
Reviews.Content: It was first time for both of us to Vegas. Had no clue what to expect from the hotel. To keep it short, I would recommend this hotel to anyone for it's cleanliness, spacious rooms, good view (from augustus tower), customer service, and the fact that we found it central to everything that was happening on the strip. It's right next to Bellagio so a quick qalk out at night right next door for the fountain show. viva las vegas baby :)

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely visit.”
Reviews.Author: gingersmommy
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas on a whim. We called our Players card services and they told us we could get a free room at Caesar's. Given that I've alway's wanted to stay there we jumped on this offer! When we checked in (an hour early) they asked us if we wanted to upgrade to a 1050 sq ft suite for 150.00, after some consideration,we jumped on that offer as well. We stayed in a Forum royal executive suite and it was awesome! HUGE! Decorated well and many immenities! The hotel was fantastic and being connected to the Forum shops was a plus! BTW, try the burgers at Munchers in Caesar's, they are the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “We had the most fabulous time in Vegas. The hotel was amazing.”
Reviews.Author: foxpoppet
Reviews.Content: We had the best holiday ever in Vegas and would recommend everyone to go at least once. It is an incredible place and experience.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ROOM! GREAT VIEW!!”
Reviews.Author: aleahmarie
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip because we wanted to get away and do nothing on vacation and knew that this hotel would have everything. There happened to be some "conference" the same time we arrived and they were overbooked meaning they gave our room away which was the worst news ever!!! They relocated us to the Flamingo which sucked... however we did end up staying here for less than 24 hours...so We were on the 42nd floor in the Agustus Tower which overlooked Bellagio and the fountains and gave a magnificent view of the strip all the way around and down the way. The room was huge with small dining area, sitting couch, 2 queen beds, fully stocked mini bar. Be careful if you take stuff out as you get billed for it right away. The bathroom was all marble with stand up shower and jaccuzzi tub with jets...and there was a closed off toilet area. The bathroom was very tranquil and spa like and came with all the ammenities you would need including body wash. Over all we loved the location and the view from our room. However, there was nail clippings on the floor next to the bed & it's really hard to sleep at night because you can hear EVERYTHING going on in the street even being so high. There were a lot of sirens while we were there so that was annoying. Check in was very fast as it was a week day and the concierge desk was also very helpful. There was only one pool open at the time but that was enough because there was hardly anyone at the pool because it was only about 70 degrees out. I would definitely stay in the Agustus Tower again because it's the newest one and it is very easy to get to the lobby/casino from there. You don't have to haul your luggage clear across the casino. Everything at this hotel was enjoyable from the food to the shopping to our great room, except being relocated upon arriving...which I hope never happens again. Be sure to eat at Noodle No. 9 and I would highly recommend NERO. It has something for everyone. It's romantic, fun, trendy...you will love it! We will definitely stay at Ceasar's again if we need to and just hope they will not overbook and send us to a crappy sister hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in this Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quirdavi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and have to say that I enjoyed the experience. The Hotel room was very spacious and spotless. The staff were very friendly. A very central hotel, with easy access to everything. My only complaint is that they charge for Internet access per device. So if you want to have your laptop and phone on the internet, it is 2 charges.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Digs with a Couple of Issues - Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: KP&TP
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars in January for two nights - our room was in the Palace Tower with a partial strip view. Here are our impressions: The Good: Nice big room, comfortable bed with plenty of pillows, living area that included a desk and an easy chair. Decor was mellow and pretty. Huge bathroom with double jacuzzi tub (only used this to sit in and read when husband wanted to sleep in) and separate glass shower, plus two sinks, large counter area, drawer to put your stuff in (always love that) and a separate room for the toilet. Good water pressure in the shower. Palace Tower is in a central location within the property, so always easy to find and get to from casino or restaurants. Drink service in the casino was fast and efficient. While drinking the first cocktail I thought they were light on the booze, but nope, good pours for our drinks. Really LOVED eating at Rao's Italian Restaurant. It's expensive but soooo good. Loved everything we had (bread, calimari appetizer, salads, pasta and side of meatballs. I will be thinking about those meatballs until we return and I can have them again). We ordered too much and couldn't finish our meals but wished we could have. The coffee/pastry bar downstairs was good too, long lines but they moved fast. Again, expensive but that's what we expected. We love the location of Caesars, right in the middle of a bunch of nice properties that you can walk to. Saw the fountain show at the Bellagio, walked across to the Paris casino and steak house, etc. The Bad: There's a nice dressing area across from the closet with a lamp and a magnifying mirror. They didn't work, turns out the plug under the counter looked like it had burned - there were char marks coming out where the prongs would plug in. So, no good place to apply makeup. Good thing I don't wear much. Our room came equipped with a Sony Dream Machine alarm clock/CD player. Well, someone had preset BOTH alarms for like 5:00 am and then 6:30 am. I travel a lot and am usually really good with the gadgets in hotel rooms but for the life of me I could not figure out how to turn off the alarms. I did figure out that if you press snooze multiple times, each press gives you an extra 10 minutes. This was all going on during a hangover, so I blamed that for why neither of us could turn them off. The second night, I unplugged the Dream Machine and guess what?? It has batteries!!! We ended up putting the dream machine in the closet wrapped in towels until we checked out.....Neither one of us could figure it out, even without hangovers. Our room had a door to an adjoining room and those doors are VERY thin, we knew every time the man next door sneezed, etc. Luckily he wasn't a loud hotel guest, hopefully he felt the same about us. All in all, we felt the issues were minor and we really enjoyed our stay. Hoping to go back next month and do it again :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: merrychris
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and we were upgraded for free to the Augustus Tower. The room was spacious and beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. The location is perfect for walking to shows, restaurants and shopping. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. My only complaint was the coffee in the room was not free. Other than that, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous..extras with Total rewards”
Reviews.Author: LaniaB
Reviews.Content: I'm a new total rewards member. My first trip Oct. 2010 I stayed at Paris..fun. Then I asked what specials there were if I wanted to return for my Birhtday in January 2011 and wow we were given a deluxe room at Caesars Palace for 3nights(Wed. thru Sat..less expensive weekdays)..when we checked out on the 3rd night..the total including room service tax etc 125. They explained the first two nights complimentary and the 3rd would be 60 bucks so we had more spending money for fun. We saw several shows, the red carpet premiere of the Mechanic at Planet Hollywood, then Sin City Comedy(funny also sexy gal) and for my Birthday we ate at Nero's really gourmet food and we saw Matt Goss. I was impressed. You dont have to gamble much if at all but youre given credit with purchases you make as a reward member and thats why they offer specials. They are only good for 6 months so you'd have to visit Vegas atleast twice a year to take advantage of the offers and with Southwest (signup on email)having 29 oway tkt specials from Lax....who could pass this up. I will be returning in May using another special...mini vacation. Have fun when you visit..I forgot to mention they also give you a coupon book for discounts and the hotels have Chocolate/coffee stores too..yum. Also Caesars has a fabulous Spa called Qua this is a must. to visit..so relaxing. Many shops to visit too. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, especially for your first trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mwfWesternMass
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two of the renovated rooms in the Forum Tower ("Forum Tower Deluxe Room"). We had a promotion code and got a good deal for two rooms. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. I live in fear of bedbugs and we gave both rooms a full inspection--I'm happy to report there were no problems in that regard! The bathrooms were very nice and clean, with a separate toilet room and a large marble walk in shower with a sitting bench and a rain showerhead. A bath would have been great, but I can't really complain. The shower is big enough for a couple people if you're traveling with your sweetheart. Water pressure was a little low,but I think that's a water conservation measure. The beds were very soft and cushy with nice linens. I personally prefer a firmer mattress, and if you have back problems the soft bed may aggravate that. They were very nice at check in and let our friend who arrived five hours earlier than everyone else check into one room as soon as it was available at about 11:30 am. The other one could not be ready until about 3pm, which was about an hour later than they originally told her at the front desk, but still, they let her check in early so we can't complain. This is a great place to stay, especially for your first time in Vegas because you are right in the middle of everything and exploring Caesar's is really fun--great shops, fun casino, etc. My friends went to Pure and enjoyed it (except for a $9 bottle of water). The buffet was decent (we did Buffet of Buffets and ate there for one meal because it was convenient). Also, I highly recommend going to happy hour at Sushi Roku in the Forum Shops. Amazing deals and great service during happy hour from 4-6 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Donald1947
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out Caesars Palace was a joy. We are members of the Total Rewards program and at check in we were upgraded to a mini suite in the Palace Tower. The room to say the least was very nice. We did not use room service so we can't speak to that but all the personnel in the Casino and in the restaraunts were very cordial and extremely polite. Food prices are a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Your room will most likely be downgraded, or they will send you to the Flamingo”
Reviews.Author: fbassman2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars Palace and did not enjoy the experience at all. First off, do not expect to get to your room before 5 or 6:00pm, and that's if they even have a room for you. I booked about 2 months in advance. When I arrived in the afternoon, I was told that check in was not untill 4pm, so i should come back then. I waited untill 4 and tried to check in, and was told my room was still being cleaned, and to check back in half an hour. I came back, in half an hour, only to be told that I had to wait another half an hour. I came back agan, and was told to come back at 6:00, because they guarantee all rooms will be ready by then. I returned at 6:00, only to be told my room was not ready, and I could continue to wait, or be downgraded to a worse room than what i paid for. I had no idea if the room i paid for was ever going to get done, so I agreed to take a cheaper room. The next day, I went to the front desk and asked to be switched to the room I had paid for. I was given keys to a new room, however, when I walked in to the room, someone else's stuff was already in the room. I called down to the lobby and they sent up a person to take me to another room. I was kind of upset with this hotel, due to the fact that numerous hours of my vacation were wasted due to their poor management. I did end up talking to a manager, and they gave us a 50 dollar credit to our room, which we could spend on whatever we wished. This was nice, but to me it did not make up for how they treated us. While i was waiting in line trying to check into my room all those times, i overheard many people trying to check in get upset with various issues. One person's room was not ready, and it caused them to miss some sort of event they had planned. He got pretty upset and demaded to talk to a manager, and ended up yelling at the manager and walking away. Another person was told that the room they reserved was not available. they were sent to the Flamingo hotel for the first night and told to check in tomorrow. This person seemed quite upset as well. I could have never imagined that a hotel could treat it's guests so poorly and not be out of business. I would never ever stay at Caesar's Palace ever again, and I would advise everyone else to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AS ALWAYS”
Reviews.Author: biilljean
Reviews.Content: Been coming to CAESARS since 1988 twice A Year always check in with MARC MERCURY front desk great guy always smiling , CHERYL IPPOLITO booked our stay Bboth did A great job , WE'LL be back in JUNE for OUR 44TH WEDDING ANNYIVERSARY

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but rooms far from casino floor"”
Reviews.Author: Wendy74
Reviews.Content: I most recently stayed in the Augustus tower. The room was well appointed and quite large. Had floor to ceiling windows looking towards the Belagio fountains. Bathroom was big with tv, separate shower and spa tub. The room in the Palace tower on my previous trip was nicer, even bigger and had two bathrooms, with a pool view. Only thing is that unless you stay in the Forum Tower, it's quite a walk to the casino floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good thing I didn't pay for my hotel room”
Reviews.Author: cinnamon23
Reviews.Content: Went here on a business trip, and good thing I didn't pay for my hotel room. The rooms are very old, doesn't even have a mini-ref. The conference rooms are so far, and the layout is weird. You go up and down escalators to get to your destination. The TV isn't even flat screen. The plus side are the shops and the decent restaurants, the convenience of not having to go out of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: jbsun4442
Reviews.Content: The interior of the hotel is amazing and the service is fantastic.The staff was very kind and warming. The ambiance was amazing. We stayed in one of the suites which was very roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Augustus Tower-The Best Rooms In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Caesars Augustus Tower is absolutely amazing. I am noise sensitive and the room was absolutely quiet and it was a connecting room-the place is completely soundproofed. It was beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The bathroom was all marble and very lavish. They even turned down the room and left chocolates that looked like Roman coins. I have stayed at Wynn,Aria,Aria Sky Suites(Penthouse Suite),MGM Grand and Bellagio and none of These except Bellagio even comes close. Everything was great!! Dont miss out on Qua Baths or the excellent brunch buffet!!

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and past it's prime.”
Reviews.Author: cepada13
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nothing I couldn't find at any chain hotel anywghere. I don't know who designed the bathroom but you need climbing gear to get it in. I would hate to be any shorter or have any physical issues or we wouldn't have been able to take a shower. The casino was a dissappointment as there were a lot of closed tables and the ones that were open had a very high minimum. I think it is a hotel that is just living off the past and it will catch up to them eventually. We travel to vegas at least once a year and this is one casino we will not be staying in again

Reviews.Title: “Some good stuff, some bad stuff”
Reviews.Author: aanderso13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had scheduled a 4-day trip to Las Vegas for our first wedding anniversary. Given the occassion it was a very important trip to us and we booked it about five months in advance. When we arrived at Caesars they informed us that they were overbooked and that they would need to transfer us to the Flamingo hotel (one of the oldest hotels on the strip). They were transferring us there for the first two nights of the trip and the second two nights we could come back to Caesars (exactly what we wanted to have to do is move hotels midway through our trip). On the plus side, they paid for our first two nights at the Flamingo, gave us $100 in food vouchers at the Flamingo, upgraded our room upon checking back into Caesars Palace, and upon further complaining on our part provided us with another $100 food voucher for Caesars Palace. Caesars was a lovely hotel, but for all the trouble we had to deal with there are a lot of other lovely hotels in Vegas that probably would not have put us through the same back and forth. All in all we had a great trip because we made the most of our time there. I will say though that it was pretty disappointing to not get the trip we actually booked, especially on what was such a special occassion for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: RachelPeckham
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in October as we got a good deal with Buckshaw Travel.co.uk. Upon arrival, at 2pm after travelling for 20 hours, we waited to check in for 20 minutes, only to be told our room wasn't ready. 2pm was advertised as the check in time, so we weren't happy, but asked how long we would have to wait. The assistant said to come back around 6pm that evening! We went away and came back at around 4pm, and were told that we were in luck, a room had just become available. The staff were rude and unfriendly. We were in the Palace Tower, which was the furthest away from the main entrance, but our room was lovely, with a big bed, modern furniture and decor, and a big bathroom. The room was cleaned daily, the maid service was great. The only negative point was the length of time it took to get onto the Strip! Location wise, the hotel is great, right in the centre. We didn't go in the Casino at Caesars, preferring Casino Royale - the atmosphere was nicer. We also didn't eat in Caesars, although the restaurants did look nice. Overall, the hotel is lovely and in a great spot, but the poor service at check in lets it down!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hollinshead1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Palace Tower in a Jacuzzi Suite that was huge, clean, tastefully appointed and well maintained. What I Liked: - The Front Desk Personnel are very responsive when tipped at time of check in... -I felt like I stepped into a nice condominium when I entered my Jacuzzi Suite in the Palace Tower - Everything was CLEAN, including the all important Jacuzzi which has great water pressure for a fast fill - Separate Shower is upscale, great water pressure and the water is hot as soon as you turn the shower on. - Loved the separate (private) bathroom; it really helps maintain the Spa feeling you get in the opulent bathroom suite. Very Nice. - The View of the Vegas Strip speaks for itself. Awesome. - The bed had large, firm (newer memory foam type feel) pillows with a white, waffle weave pillow case that was very comforting and comfortable. The duvet is done in a matching waffle weave which I really like. Again, a clean, spa-like experience. - The colors in the room are very neutral and soothing but contemporary enough that there is no mistaking you are in Las Vegas. - The floor was super quiet and had a private, upscale feel. I heard others complain about noise and a view of the dumpster. Hint: You gotta pay to play in Vegas. Every thing and ever person is FOR SALE in Vegas. Tips go a long way including five or ten bucks to your Housekeeper. They do a great job and are appreciative of your thoughtfulness. - Wake Up Calls were on the money. - Heating/Cooling System works flawlessly - Room Service is outrageously fast, the fare is very acceptable and the wait staff are real professionals. Be aware that the $5 Room Service Fee and the 20% Gratuity are already included in your Room Service Bill... What I didn't like but I expected... - The Television Channel selection sucks. Naturally, they want you out of that room and in Casino spending money - Coffee is $14 for a 4 Pak of Coffee Pods and one is Decaf. Be prepared for that. Naturally, there is a Starbucks in the Lobby - The Mini Bar will eat you alive. Buyer Beware on that one - Don't expect to find Bottled Water in your room. There isn't any.
