My best bet was stocking up at The Casino where all beverages are complimentary or bring your own water. - No fans is you are one who sleeps with a fan. Download White Noise for your iPhone/iPad and you are set - No Garment Steamers available. Slight inconvenience. - Internet Access is not free. Be prepared for that or negotiate it into your package... Pick your taxi carefully. My ride from the Airport to the hotel (with gratuity) was $32. The ride from the Hotel to the Airport for my return home was $18 including gratuity. Hmm... All the restaurants and food in general at Caesars Palace is well above average. Not cheap, though and the Table Minimums are not cheap, either. If you want lower buy ins you are better served to hit other Casinos. PURE Nightclub in the property is very nice and off premise stops at The Cosmopolitan and Wynn were first class. Business in Vegas is on the weak side. That makes it a buyer's market. Keep your thinking cap on and ask for recommendations and you can come away with an exceptional experience at a mid tier price

Reviews.Title: “A Different World”
Reviews.Author: iac0n
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas, I had a connecting flight through Denver from Chicago that left me very tired but when I got a look at the lights of the strip for the first time I was pumped for it! Upon checkin I was upgraded to a huge room for free. It was a smoking room but had little smell. Even now I can't believe the size of the room! During my stay I wen't to most of the casinos to get a feel for the place and have to say that Caesars really has the best mix of food, gaming & shopping. Being halfway up the strip getting round was easy too. I would stay again but might try somewhere else next time just to see what it is like else where. Vegas and this place are like another world to me!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: txtraveler47
Reviews.Content: prepaid for a 3-night room & spa package; arrived around 10pm and they didn't want to honor the Augustus Tower part of our package but magically had an opening once I demanded to speak to a manager; got to the room and couldn't get in - because it was already occupied! took over 30 minutes for them to get us another room (different tower); not one apology from front desk staff; room was fine but we checked out the next morning and moved to the Bellagio; they did refund the unused part of our package; have stayed in many vegas hotels and won't be back here (cream of the crop is Bellagio)

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Ron5078
Reviews.Content: Caesars was really nice. Check -in went smoothy and our room was in the Augustus Tower. The room was really clean and our view of the strip was a plus. Their Concierge in the hotel was friendly and did a quick job of getting my airline boarding passes for my trip home. It is located were you can walk to most of the other Casinos. Food is really expensive but it is a short walk to the Miracle Mile shops at the Planet Hollwood Hotel were their are many Restaurants with reasonable pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower synonymous with Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Ophher
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience the absolute best, just make a reservation to the Augustus tower-this says it All!

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: ladyinred60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a package deal and were upgraded for $60 it was ok for the price we paid but I would never pay their regular rate as is totally not worth it. On the plus side the room was nice and we had a great view. Found the staff to be very rude and not at all helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I would definately stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: tkc22
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean. Everyone was helpful, and I have no complaints about this hotel. We never did gamble at this hotel... funny enough; so I don't know how the casinos were, but the restaurants, shops, and rooms were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but customer service could be improved”
Reviews.Author: DenverMagpie
Reviews.Content: This was a girls weekend. We had two adjoining suites. We tried to check out using the express process on the TV, but got conflicting information from the screen and the person at the desk. finally went downstairs to make sure. Tried to cancel a dinner reservation and after three phone calls and finally going to the restaurant, discovered it had been booked incorrectly for earlier in the week before we arrived. Had lots of discussion with many people about whether they were going to charge the no show fee. We THINK it will be refunded since it was their error. Beds were comfortable but had extremely heavy comforters. Coffee in the room was $12 for 4 cups (the only way to buy it) and then there were only paper cups to drink from ..... pretty tacky for a 5 star hotel. The bathroom was very nice and large. We had a great view of the fountains at Bellagio. We had a flatscreen TV and also a TV on the wall in the bathroom. It is very well located in the middle of the strip. Internet is an extra fee as is the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place all around!”
Reviews.Author: Domino916
Reviews.Content: The ambiance is fantastic through the place. And the atmosphere at the bar is phenomenal. The service is a little out of touch with the costumers. This goes for bartenders and reception.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, plush hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheYarralls
Reviews.Content: Caesar's Palace is in the prime spot on the strip, right in the middle (and the strip is much, much longer than it looks, so it's worth staying in the thick of the action). We checked in without a problem, to a deluxe room in the Forum tower. Yes it's a walk through the casino to get there, but that's part of staying in Vegas, right? Our room was very spacious, our bed wonderfully comfortable, and our bathroom huge. We loved the rainforest shower especially. As well as being in an excellent location, within the hotel is a large shopping complex and plenty of bars and restaurants (ranging from expensive to cheap and cheerful). The only downer was we could hear noise from the club below our room which stopped us getting to sleep as quickly as we would have liked (we were pretty jetlagged having flown from NZ) - but I guess that's part of staying in the middle of the action too. As it was winter, most of the pools were closed, but one was heated and still open. The pool area is beautiful, if we'd had more time we would have spent some time there. A tip - sign up for the rewards programme as soon as you arrive. Even if you're not going to gamble, you get a booklet with excellent discounts at surrounding hotels and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: norwaytravler
Reviews.Content: We had the nicer rooms, in the new tower- and were very happy!! The room was huge, with a super big bathroom, and GREAT view over the strip. We loved the pool area, but BE EARLY, it fills up quik.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sparerib61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars about 2 years ago and thought it was great but this time it was completely different - I will never stay here again. Firstly we had problems with check-in: arrived from airport and thought we would leave our baggage with the bellman until check-in at 3pm. We were told to leave it later if possible. We went for a walk and came back at 5pm to be told our room still wan't ready but they could offer us a room where smokers had been - big gong for that - we finally got into our room at 6pm. We had been given a family room on the 3rd floor over looking airconditioning units - two doors: one in the hallway then another one about 8metres in where the hallway split into 2 (and the other room could be accessed). The pillows were so soft and the bed uncomfortable - rang downstairs at about midnight requesting a blanket and some foam pillows. Was told it would take about 15 minutes. Half hour later still no pillows so I rang again and was assured it wouldn't be too much longer. Rang again another 15 minutes later and was told they were in transit. Rang again 20 minutes later and while on the phone heard some noise outside and assumed it was them but nothing outside my door. Rang back after another 10 minutes to be told they had put them outside the door - ended up putting them outside the main door in the hallway! The pillows were just as soft as the previous ones and were in very poor condition. The next morning I had a grizzle to the front desk and was assured that everything was under control and they would send up a mattress topper for more comfort and some better pillow - didn't happen. No offer of a refund/upgrade/drinks at the bar etc. The only positive was the Concierge - wonderful! Would never stay here again - it has become so large & impersonal. Not impressed that cleaning trolleys were constantly in the hall and the carpets were filthy. NEVER AGAIN. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Too much attitude!”
Reviews.Author: Zoombie99
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for about seven years. I booked an Augustus Towers rooom last summer and they tried to switch my room on arrival (in the afternoon) to another room telling me that the room wasn't guaranteed despite the fact that I paid more for the Augustus Towers. I asked to speak to a manager (which was ignored) and finally I was given a room in the Augustus Towers (with a horrible view). The room was very clean and was starting to show some aging. The breakfast buffet was overpriced. It went from $19.,00 to around $29.00 on the weekend .

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great either - and going downhill from previous stays”
Reviews.Author: LoveGrandHotels
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in the newest (occupied – see below for more info) Augustus tower. Room is already showing signs of wear. Cheap toiletries, nicked up furniture, lower quality bed linens (but nice mattresses), too small a TV for the massive size of the room. Bathroom did have the spa tub, except that the front panel was almost falling off (and it was cheap plastic). Towels were so thin that I’ve had better at a small town Holiday Inn – fraying edges and all. The room was quiet, however, so that was a big plus. The whole room experience was just odd. They have this huge room (probably 700 square feet or so), but yet there was just one couch, a chair, a small round table/chairs, and bed with a small dresser/storage unit. There was so much empty floor space that you could have done gymnastics and not bumped into anything. Casino was nice, and drink service there was good. Various bar service throughout was also good. In general, staff everywhere were always polite and attentive. Ate at Nero’s (steak/seafood) and I’d rate that as excellent. Property location is excellent - in the center of the strip. When it comes to Vegas itself… I have no idea how it will ever sustain itself with casinos a dime a dozen around the USA now. No matter where you looked – casinos, restaurants, bars, stores, traffic on the streets – the place was relatively empty. No lines for anything, anywhere. There were several newly constructed condo buildings that were completely dark at night – completely built but probably in bankruptcy with units that never settled. In fact, Caesar’s newest tower – the Octavius tower – is fully constructed from the outside but has been mothballed on the inside and is not accessible/blocked off from the lobby level. You would never know by looking at it from the pool area, but it is in fact sitting there empty! I used to love going to Vegas for a long weekend, but it’s now rather depressing and I have no idea who is EVER going to fill all those rooms, restaurants, shops etc. ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday of a life time”
Reviews.Author: herewego23
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Caesars Palace for 5nights with friends in June 2010 and we all had a fabulous time. Upon check in there was a huge queue so we were brought around to a second reception area/check in desk where we were upgraded to a nicer room in the Augustus Tower.... the room was simply amazing, VERY spacious, huge comfy bed, lots of pillows, thick duvet, big screen tv, MASSIVE bathroom with his and hers sinks, jacuzzi bath, big shower and a separate toilet room. I honestly couldnt fault it at all, I thought it was all very luxurious. The entire hotel was spotless. And it was in a great location too, the view from our room was of the Bellagio Fountains, a must see!! We bought the MealTicket every day for around $40 which meant you could have breakfast, lunch and dinner in any of the top casinos in Vegas (Paris, the flamingo, the bellagio, caesers etc.), well worth it. Breakfast each morning was a buffet with more choice than you could imagine. There was every kind of fruit, bread, cereal, eggs, you name it. The staff were very helpful and friendly, we became good friends with one of the casino staff, Kelso. We sat at his roulette table almost every night and he even got us on to the guestlist for Pure on our last night. There were about 5pool areas and all of them were always busy and the music was always pumping loud. I would have liked somewhere quiet to lay in the sun maybe for one day but i still had an amazing time here. Theres so much to do and see in Vegas, plenty of shopping, you wouldnt even need to leave you hotel as everything is provided. It is an expensive place to stay but was a trip of a lifetime, i cant wait to go back in possibly summer 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in this big name hotel/casino...”
Reviews.Author: basketgurlie
Reviews.Content: Caesars is huge and it takes a little while to see everything the hotel/casino has to offer. We liked the casino and shopping. There are tons of restaurants and bars to choose from. Pure nightclub was a disappointment. We were especially disappointed with our room in the Centurian Tower. The room was outdated, the heat/ac grates were loaded with dust and grime, walls were dirty, bathroom floor was disgusting, stains all over rug, and stains on sheets. Liked the rest of the place but the room was terrible! Therefore, I cannot recommend staying here. Try the Mirage instead!

Reviews.Title: “Not Amazing, Not Bad.”
Reviews.Author: Griz57
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to go on a great family vacation to Vegas in the middle of December. We stayed at Caesars. The hotel was very professionally ran. Check in was smooth/fast. My brother and I shared a classic room. The rooms are nothing to really write home about. I know the suites and the higher priced rooms are probably amazing but the basic rooms are, well....basic. They are average size with average fixtures. Bathrooms are nice with a TV in the mirror and a separate bathtub and shower. Location is wonderful as it is right in the middle of the strip. The sports book is a sports fan heaven. Definitely get a drink at NUMB. Hot bartenders and the drinks are really top notch. Ate at American Cheesecake Factory and it was delicious. Caesars is not a bad hotel at all but it is a little overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there again !”
Reviews.Author: Arma11
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and a family memeber stayed there from 1/10/11 to 1/13/11. 2 weeks before our trip, I called and told them we need two queen beds with the view of the strip. Their customer service told me; "Sure, I will put your request in there". Once we got there, they said they've reserved a classic room for us in Roman Tower and that tower does not have any strip view or 2 queen beds !!! They said they will give us a room with a view of mountains. When we got to our room, we couldn't believe the view we got ! There was a HUGE grey wall about 20 ft in front of us and a partial view of a parking lot !!! There was nothing else ! When we complained about this horrific room,the front desk clerk did not hesitate to offer an upgrade to another room for additional costs . The "additional costs" would make the price much more expensive than most LUXURY rooms in other great 5 stars hotels on the strip ! The front desk clerk was so rude in her communication that I had to ask for her supervisor. The so-called supervisor was even worse than the clerk herself and could not care less about our concerns ! So, we had to suck it up as our reservation at that point was non-refundable. Another interesting point that we had never seen before even in 2 star hotels, was the cleaning carts (at least 5-6 carts) on the hallway of our floor which was left at the middle of hallway overnight. They even didn't bother to put them by the wall. They just left them in the middle of the way. It wouldn't be a big deal if you pay for an economy hotel. But when you pay to stay at a luxury hotel with all those glamorous statues sitting outside and at the lobby, you really get upset to see such a poor service. Our room, didn't have anything special to talk about. The bathroom was not bad but the room was plain, boring and of course with the horrible view of the grey wall !!! The location of the hotel was the only plus we found at this hotel. It is pretty close to attractions and other hotels on the strip. We don't know about other towers in Ceasers Palace but based on below poor customer service experience we had at ceasers palace, we will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Luiz_Ferreira
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Vegas on a 4-night trip. We split it into 2 hotels. First two nights at Trump and the rest of it at Caesars. Man, I wish we had stick with Trump…. My wife always wanted to stay at Caesars, so I booked an Augustus Tower Deluxe Room. Since we had to leave Trump by 11am and the check in at Caesars wasn't until 3pm, we got our stuff in our rental car and went shopping. Around 4pm, we got to Caesars. Wow, the lines were huge! After waiting almost 40 minutes, the man gave me a Palace Tower deluxe room. So I told him I had booked an Augustus Tower Deluxe Room and I wanted it! After trying to convince me that the words written in my online prepaid reservation (AUGUSTUS TOWER DELUXE ROOM) didn’t mean that I would have that exact kind of room, he gave up and gave us the room originaly booked. “But”, he said, “you’ll have to wait until 8pm to get it.” So, we left our stuff with the bell captain and off to the strip we went. We had dinner and came back to the hotel and they gave us our keycards. When we got to our room, I was certain that we had made a bad choice moving from Trump. Here are our thoughts: - Yes, it’s a classic hotel, but this also means there will be many more people and probably not a great service; - The room we had was not well kept. - Had to call maintenance to fix the Bathtub; - Shower pressure was not ok . - Many dents on the walls; - Beds were confortable; - Probably the only thing we liked was the pool area. But, since there were many people, it was hard to find a chair. - Location (right in the middle of the strip) is terrific for sightseeing. As you can see, we really didn’t like our stay. It’s a beautiful hotel, but we found Trump to be way more classy and comfortable. Wouldn’t come back to this hotel. You pay (very well) for it’s name and that’s it.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: dalig3
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay in the Roman tower. Our room was fairly small and had what I can only assume was a puke stain on the carpet, a spot had been replaced but was fraying, the light switch to the bathroom was behind the giant door, and our window had huge metal bars blocking the subpar view (but that might have just been our room). We had to do repairs to our room to keep the handle to the shower from falling off and the towel rack was the same. This was AFTER housekeeping had been in. There was a hot water issue (the shower on our last day never got warm) and there was always the sound of water running in our room. The hotel and casino were ok, the forum shops were great. The service at the front desk was wonderful (we had an issue at check in that they were great about it), and wer ordered room service one night and that was great. Aside from that I was not impressed. Over all it was ok, but I would say explore the other hotels around for the price to stay and just explore the public areas of Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay with lots to see and do.”
Reviews.Author: LLB_11
Reviews.Content: Overall nice stay. Room did need some minor maintance...faucet at sink was broke. I was woke up during the night with a beeping sound. Not sure exactly where it was coming from. After second night of being woke up @ 4am I informed front desk and didn't have problem following night. Beds were good and room was clean. Was a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer hotels at the same price, very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: LifesAway
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels in Las Vegas (New York New York, Monte Carlo, Flamingo, Bellagios, Encore) and some more than once, but decided to try Caesars this time. Very disappointed from check-in to check-out. We had initially paid for an upgrade on our room and the extra for a strip view. I would have hated to have seen the rooms before the upgrade. We were given a room in the Palace Tower on the 9th floor with no view of anything other than rooftops and parkades. According to the front desk a strip view room cannot be guaranteed. So what did we pay the extra for????? Helpful they were not! The walls in the bathroom had rust on them, no water pressure, stained tiles, had to request towels as there was only one bath towel, two hand towels and no face cloths. There was still food on the carpet from the previous guest and some foreign sticky matter on the bed skirt. The pop machines on any of the floors did not work as they were supposedly upgrading their machines. They had a note telling you to purchase the pop from the fridge in your room or to order room service. Also, the smell of cigarette smoke is very noticeable through out the whole hotel. I think they need to do some major upgrading to bring this place back to what it once was for the dollars that they are charging. It was a mediocre room in a mediocre hotel which is becoming very dated.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace ruined our Christmas Holidays”
Reviews.Author: cinema57
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caesars’s Palace with my family and family friends during the Christmas holidays and I had the worst experience ever! Our family friends came from Toronto, Canada for 5 days to stay with us in Los Angeles and see Las Vegas. When I made our reservations, I asked for 2 non-smoking rooms that are beside each other, and got a confirmation for that. We were a total of 9 people. Before our arrival at Caesar’s, I received a phone call from their reception desk that our rooms are ready and asked us when we will be arriving. When we arrived at the hotel, one of our rooms wasn’t even ready, even though they already called us and asked us when we are getting there. We stayed in the Roman Tower, since we were told that the Roman Tower was entirely non-smoking. We had to kill one hour before we could go into our rooms. So we had to gather 9 people again, and go find somewhere to eat. When we got back to the hotel, the rooms were not beside each other, they were in front of each other, which wasn’t bad either, but one of the rooms was a smoking room, and still had an extremely strong scent from the last people that stayed there who were smoking, and there was a cigarette butt left outside of the room, which was very disgusting. We went back down to the front desk to tell them about the smoking in the room and they sent someone up to get rid of the smell with an ozone smell remover. It didn’t work the first time, but it worked the second time they tried. Unfortunately, even though they used the ozone smell remover, our bed sheets would still smell like cigarettes. The next day we went to the buffet and bought the 24-hour all you can eat buffet pass to seven different hotels, and this was a complete waste of money! We only used it once because its 24 hours from the time that you purchase the ticket, and all the lines of every hotel was so long that we needed up eating at restaurants instead. Each hotel’s buffet was over 4 hours long because they didn’t have enough space to accommodate everyone that bought the tickets, they probably didn’t account for the demand when they made this promotion available. So that was almost $500 (6 people had the player cards so they paid $50 each, and 3 people didn’t so they paid $60 each) to waste. Caesar’s Palace buffet was a waste of time! There was no cream cheese, not enough bagels, no cereal, and not much variety. It was a horrible buffet. Even the food tasted a little funny. I thought Caesar’s Palace was one of the Strip’s best hotels, but in fact it was probably the worst hotel I have ever visited. I will never be going back to Caesar’s ever! And I do not recommend it either!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, Great Sportsbook”
Reviews.Author: rockdaddy82
Reviews.Content: The Best things: Location Sportsbook Shops The Worst Things The rooms are just OK Most of the drinks are watered down

Reviews.Title: “If you want newly refurbished/luxury room, pay more or stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: EPSFOX
Reviews.Content: The location on the Strip is great, and it's nice to have the Forum Shops right there for it's restaurants etc. HOWEVER, if you want to have a true Las Vegas experience and want a luxurious room (or even a refurbished one) don't buy a Caesar's package with a standard room and hope to get upgraded. Caesar's has many, many rooms which haven't been refurbished in many years and they are a real dissappointment. Despite many effort to try to upgrade to a nicer room, I was told that "due to the economy, they haven't be able to refurbish alot of the rooms, but if you come back next year, things will be different". I won't want to come back next year and stay in a old, tired room when there are many newer hotels in the same price range with new amenities and decor. It was a real buzz kill to me and my teenage daughter after waiting 3+ hours to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace - Where They Treat You Like a King”
Reviews.Author: lovecaesars
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace for five nights. We got in really early, way too early to check-in to our room that afternoon, but thankfully they let us check-in a bit earlier. We were very grateful for that. We got a nice Palace Tower room. We asked for a refrigerator and a humidifier. Someone brought up both items very quickly, we were truly amazed!! I would highly recommend asking for a humidifier, especially if you have sinus issues with the desert heat. The room was amazing. We especially loved the large closet and beautiful bathroom, which came equipped with a large soaking tub. This tub came in handy to soak our poor tired feet after a long day of walking up and down the Strip!! We had a nice view of the Mirage and TI. I think we could even see the Rio from our room as well. Staff here was extremely helpful, especially at the Lago Buffet where someone tried to skip us in line. A gentleman came to our rescue before anything escalated and got us right into the buffet, with no delay. It was so nice of him to do that and we greatly appreciated it!! We loved the buffet, especially the breakfast one. We ate at Augustus Cafe many times, as we often do, as it is open 24 hours. The waitress who helped us was great, especially considering how crowded it was and all of the drunk, rowdy kids she had to deal with. We visited the Diamond Lounge frequently as well, the staff there were amazing and we always had a great time. We will be back later this year to stay at Caesars and we are really looking forward to it!!

Reviews.Title: “Large & Crowded”
Reviews.Author: Dzhugashvili
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the Christmas holiday. Although we've visited Vegas numerous times, this was our first visit to this particular hotel. I gave the desk clerk a $20 tip and we were given a whirlpool room on the 24th floor of the Palace Tower. The room was larger than most regular rooms we've stayed in. This property is really crowded including the casino, the buffet (2 hours in line for lunch) and the forum shops. On our second day, we bought the 24 hour buffet pass. During that 24 hour period, we ate 3 times at Caesars and once at Harrah's. I contracted food poisoning and the remaining two days of our trip was a complete bust. I would recommend this hotel but would stay away from the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: geoa5
Reviews.Content: Where do I start with Caesars Palace. This place is awesome. I stayed here in August, and loved it so much that I had to come back again. I was lucky to get both stays comped, thank you Harrah's Entertainment (now Caesars). OK, here is the review: The room I got was in the Palace tower, mini suite, a really nice room, probably the best room I ever had. The bed and pillows were super cofortable. The bathroom was phenomenal, two bathrooms in one really, with a great (and useful) jetted tub, in addition to a shower stall with dual shower heads. The television is good, flat screen. Stay away from mini fridge, everything sits on sensors and you will get charged if you just pick it up to inspect it. All phone calls, even local, cost money, so use your cell. The view we had was excellent, of the pool complex. The pool complex is one of the best in Vegas. During the winter, off season, only one pool is open, and it is heated. I actually used it one day, it was great. Hardly anyone used it during my stay, most of the time there was light rain. During summer months, the complex is very nice, gets very busy. The drinks at pool side are ridiculously expensive. The only restaurant I tried was their buffet. The food was good, but the service was terrible. The server we had seemed like she didn't care at all to provide any service. Her entire section had plates just piling up a the tables, without her collecting them. The porters in the restaurant were just chatting with each other and not working, my buddy overheard them making rude comments about some customers. One table next to us was left uncleared after customers left for about half hour. I worked in restaurants before and that is just horrible. Some good buffets in Vegas are at Rio, Planet Hollywood, Golden Nugget, MGM grand, and Bellagio. Both my stays I was originally booked in Forum tower, but got upgraded for free to the palace tower. Great night life in this hotel over the weekends. The key in vegas is to be genuinely nice to the employees and to be a bit generous (tip), and good things can happen to you. I checked out the prices of the rooms, if it wasn't comped and to be honest they are a bit too high, I don't think I would stay there if it wasn't comped. I would definitely stay at CP anytime I get the room comped or at a good rate, but would never pay the full advertised room rate. Definitely avoid staying in the classic or roman rooms, those are really outdated. Forum tower/palace tower/augustus tower, those are the better ones.

Reviews.Title: “no problems, great food, location”
Reviews.Author: JCL2001
Reviews.Content: stayed in the Roman Tower, a "classic" room -- spacious, clean. everything worked. good price. a couple of fine restaurants in the hotel, as in pricey and worth it. the casino is a casino, somewhat nicer in style and atmosphere than the usual. perfect location at the center of the Strip, which makes almost everything accessible walking. Bell Desk staff, Casino Host staff, cashiers, registration desk -- friendly, courteous, helpful. would stay again if the price was right, meaning in the $120 to $150 range.

Reviews.Title: “OH MY GOSH!!!! Best hotel experience of my life(the upgrade would have helped)! 5 star worthy”
Reviews.Author: zulujoe
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find an immaculate lobby. The best I have seen in my life. You know it's fake but it just doesn’t feel fake! We checked in at 8 so no waiting, the man on the front desk was perfect! we asked for an upgrade and he said '' sometimes in Vegas you loose all your money and go home unhappy, and other times you get lucky. Would you like a pool view or a strip view room''. Being naive Australian tourists we didn’t know we got the upgrade yet (looking back now I can't believe we didn’t know) and the moment we realized was when he handed us the key and pointed to the Augustus tower. OH MY GOD!!! Best hotel room of my life! I screamed when i saw how HUGE it was! Then when the curtain was pulled back the floor to ceiling windows revealed the best view in Vegas! We could the see the huge Bellagio fountains crashing down below us we stayed on about the 42nd floor and the strip lit up in all its glory! We could see as far as Planet Hollywood Other than that it had the most amazing bathroom in a hotel i have ever seen. marble?? the huge spa bath's water looked like it was dyed slightly blue! every little detail was perfect! If you want location (everybody dose on holiday) this is the hotel!! It's so big it takes up half the strip! haha! the pools wee mind blowing! i couldnt imagine a better stay anywhere in the world!!! Resturants were amazing Beiijing Noodle No. 9 was a trippy delicious experience! LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, lack of customer care and low level of problem solution”
Reviews.Author: CESvisitor
Reviews.Content: internet was charged 5 times, even it was nearly impossible to use if in thre days, casino attendants of the lower level of LV, some aspects in the room as lights which did not work In summary, we will use any other top hotel in LV to avoid ruin a trip with this frustation we expected from Caesar something great, is the last time we come to this hotel. guest room 3356, jan 5th

Reviews.Title: “2 words unbelievable & Fantastic,”
Reviews.Author: greyhavens1968
Reviews.Content: we went in october 2010 with friends & stayed in the foraum towers, rooms very clean, housekeeping very good, hotel fabulous, staff very good, resterants very good, all in all we had a fabulous time, everyone in hotel from maids, cocktail waitresses ,shop assistants, receptionists & bell boys there service was the best we have ever had, i would recomend this hotel all day long we are going back for this year for christmas & new year we enjoyed it that much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. . . but overated!”
Reviews.Author: kathyktemperance
Reviews.Content: Arrived at CP on Christmas Day around 7:30 p.m. Walked right up to the reservation desk. We were supposed to be comped 4 nights in the Forum Tower, but was told there were no rooms available in that tower. I just don't get how you have a confirmation for a certain tower and then there are no rooms in that tower. Anyway, the guy says we would get a room in the Roman Tower. Now I have heard on this web-site that those rooms were old and tired, so I was kinda upset that that's where they were putting us. He said we could move to the Palace Tower on Monday, so we said ok. Well went to our room in the Roman Tower, and what a pleasant surprise. The view was good, the room was very large, as was the bathroom. Bath did have a small tv by the mirror, which I do like to have on while getting ready. The only thing is that the tv in the room is an old style, but no problem. Monday I went to change our room to the Palace and this time the guy said "that's not going to happen". So he gave us a room in the Forum Tower, as we were originally were booked. The only reason we wanted to change rooms was to compare the two. Anyway, moved rooms. This room was alot smaller, but did have the tv in mirroe, and flat screen in the room. This room had no view. To tell you the truth, we should have just stayed in the original. room. When we moved rooms, I left my jeans (that I only wore once on the plane) and tried every way to get them back with no luck. Called lost and found, went to the room (they did have guests staying in it) knocked, no one answered, left them a note, called that room and left a message. So, I was out a brand new pair of jeans, grrrr. Ate at the cafe for breakfast, $50, yikes. Ate the breakfast buffet twice, which was pretty good, except very cold eggs the second time. Kept going around in circles in the casino. And they have a lot of wasted floor space. Table limits are too high. Saw Jerry Seinfield, very good show!! So we normally stay at Harrahs, and played our table games there. Now we have tried CP, but won't stay there again. Just wasn't the same as our beloved Harrah's. When we walk in Harrah's it's like we're "home again". Overall the rooms are nice, but didn't think they were any better than Harrah's refurbished rooms. Also, did go to Qua for a massage, that I got for Christmas. Lovely place and good massage. However, the mousse product for my hair was awful. Left it like straw, had to go back to my room and re-wash my hair. Also, the casino was not that fun and exciting, like Harrahs, which is always bustling with people. And, so many children. One lady sat her child in a chair in front of a slot machine, and proceded to play. Isn't that against the law?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, can't wait to go back one day!”
Reviews.Author: Dolly_Wood_2008
Reviews.Content: Fabulous, spectacular hotel. We'd never been to Vegas and this was definitely a great choice for our first stay -very central, contains absolutely everything you could ever want.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed, nicer and cleaner hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DPennington
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late in the evening do to airport delay, so we checked in and went straight to bed. When we woke up the next morning to get ready we noticed that there was hair and urine all over the bathroom floor. I have stayed in Vegas many times but never at Caesars, but as a gift for my wife who wanted to stay there because of the forum shops we did. NOT IMPRESSED. I have made my complaint to the hotel and have not received a response.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it so much, can't wait to go again.”
Reviews.Author: Joe-Snr
Reviews.Content: We arrived early evening after what seemed like we had been flying for ever (will never use USairways again). Check in had no queue and we were seen to right away, I asked if their were any upgrades available ( with a view of strip), YES we could upgrade to a mini suite (large room) for an extra $58 dollars per night, so glad w did. We got a room in the Augustus tower overlooking the Bellagio fountains & the strip. Large bathroom with Jacuzzi bath, large shower, 2 x sinks, separate wc, TV. Large kiing sized bed, TV, table/chairs, armchair & couch Iron & ironing board came in handy, when we found them! Safe in wardrobe easy to use. Room cleaned every day and towels changed when we wanted, not sure about bedding. Casino's ok but we wanted to check out other places so we didn't use it that much, we didn't eat their either. Their did appear to be some iffy people about, myself and my partner (woman) were approached in the casino by hookers (female & male!). Didn't do the pool as it was December. Caesars is right in the middle of the strip, across from Bills & Margaritaville, which we both found great places to go. I would happily go back to Caesars, although their were other great places too.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Much More!”
Reviews.Author: kld76
Reviews.Content: Our room in the Palace Tower was okay, but the shower flooded our bathroom floor, and there was an electrical cord with duct tape on it that hung outside our 16th floor window the entire 5 days we were there. The wallpaper was peeling off the wall in several places and our pillows on the bed smelled terribly of smoke. There was also dried food splatters on the wall. For the price we paid, I would have at least expected coffee in the room. While we did have a nice Keurig in our room, you had to buy the actual coffee from the mini bar - 4 pack was $12.00. Our tv always turned on to the loudest volume setting. Room service trays set in the hallway until the maid came through the next day. We just expected so much more, and have had much better service at Paris, Flamingo, Monte Carlo and New York, New York. I would strongly suggest staying at one of the other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not what expected.. but never been to USA before”
Reviews.Author: grantstar1
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Vegas on the 22nd December after our flight was cancelled on the 18th due to bad weather. We were quite excited about spending xmas there as previously we should have travelled back on the 24th December. We were booked to stay at the Venetian in a suite, but Virgin holidays changed us to Caesars due to availability. We were told that we would still have a suite. On arrival we waited just about 10 mins to check in, we were given a room rather than a suite, we said we had booked a suite, reception said if we wanted a suite we would have to pay an extra $80 a night, we took the key, and was going to ring Virgin. The room was lovely although not a suite, we were so tired from our journey we accepted the room, it was large and airy and gave a very good first impression. The next day we explored it is a beautiful large hotel, from what I can see, one of the best on the strip. The shopping mall within is huge, the attention to detail was fabulous. However I was a little disappointed, after paying for a five star hotel there seem to be no dress code or anything, there were quite a few homeless people wandering about in the casinos, I could see they were homeless/ tramps so why couldn't the security? All the eatries are so expensive, and not open 24 hours which we were lead to believe nor the bars. We ate in the food court a few times, $40 for two burgers, chips and coke in what really is just a cafe. I was very disappointed to see that most of the shows within the hotel weren't actually on over xmas, no Matt Goss, Cleopatras barge is a funny place the night we went it was rather than a pick up joint and had the most undesirable people inside, behaving like hoes and pimps. The shadow bar was open, all nights there were only about 4 people actually in it. The same with the Seahorse bar. The pure nightclub was also closed. Although drinks are very expensive $14 for two buds, $26 for two southern comforts. It was a lovely hotel by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in, but just lacked class and any kind of fun atmosphere. The maid didn't come for two days, our bed sheets were changed for the 5 days we were there. The tap leaks in the sink. Check out was easy, someone came to us in the line and took our room number, however I have returned home to find $250 has been charged to my credit card so now I have sort this out, as we did not use any room service/ telephones/ internet etc. Overall I think they just they just want your money.. once they have it they don't give a flying fig, unless you pay again for their advice which is tipping. Beautiful hotel, staff greedy

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service, scratch that "no customer service" and Poor Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: jane3nc
Reviews.Content: Check in very confusing someone trying to organise but not doing a good job, loads of people cutting in line and going to front of queue and they do nothing about it. Offered upgrade at $40 per night to Centurion Tower, we were staying 7 nights which worked out alot of money, so we said no. First Room - closet was hanging space inside bathroom, who wants to hang clothes there to get damp? Also loud noise from air con units outside. Asked to move. Second Room - same problem with noise from air con units from outside, no door on bathroom (inc toilet) I would not have been able to "go" without a door. Asked to move again. At this point front desk got a little annoyed with me, slightly understanding as already moved once, but customer is always right? wrong... offered upgrade again she made it sound like I would not be happy until we upgraded, she was probably right, she implied noone likes the basic rooms Third Room - different noise but we were tired. went to sleep but woken up by the noise. Also shower door hanging off, carpet soaking wet and tv cupboard door hanging off, plus this electrical buzzing noise which vibrated everything in the room (1471 Roman Tower). Raised with front desk on our way out in the morning, returned at night - nothing done, no maintenance visit. Called front desk, would send someone up, 1 1/2 hrs later maintenance person turned up, explained only 4 of them looking after whole complex, rooms, exterior and casino floor - poor chap. Anyway can't fix, so moved rooms again. Forth Room (still in Roman Tower again all 4 were) this one was OK apart from no door on the bathroom\toilet again, resigned to live with this and crazy shouting lady next door, agreed to live with this too. Connecting doors on either side of the room very noisy, could hear everything. Not at any point was there an apology, offer of a room upgrade at less cost than initial $40 pn, didn't want something for nothing, just the basic room I paid for, but peace and quiet to be able to sleep. On a positive note, was clean, no housekeeping trouble, air con worked, nice bath and lovely powerful shower. No maintenance issues in last room either, until the last day. Whether this had been happening all week we don;t know, we returned to our room and the door was not locked it was shut but the lock hadn't activited so the door pushed open. We fiddled with it for 5 mins and it finally locked, not worth complaning about on last night. So when left room that night had to really bang the door hard a few times to get the lock to kick in - i would worry about safety in this hotel. Very poor security generally, did not see any security, other hotels has key activiated lifts or security checking for room keys at lifts but not here. I felt I was treated without respect by the front desk staff. Bell staff, housekeeping and maintenance were fine. They have obviously made cut backs on staff and it shows particuarly with maintenance in the rooms. It was clear that room 1471 would just be cleaned and re-let, we shall see if someone else reviews it. Stay away unless you can get an upgrade, which to be honest if you can afford better to stay in one of the new hotels like Aria. I dont mind older rooms and less up to date decor it's a room who cares, but I want something safe, that works and that I can sleep in, not much to ask surely?

Reviews.Title: “Vegas IS cheesy.....but I LOVE it!!”
Reviews.Author: DanFromHades
Reviews.Content: Now THIS is a hotel!! I've stayed at the Bellagio, the Paris and Caesars Palace twice. All of them are fantastic....but the restaurant scene alone makes Caesars my favorite. The rooms make you feel like a rock star. The first time my wife and I stayed at Caesars we ONLY ate our meals in Caesars Palace.. There are THAT many great options on this one location. Of course the prices are a bit high, but you will find it hard to get a non-exceptional meal. Try and get a room with a view of the Bellagio fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all aspects!”
Reviews.Author: Coopsaremad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Forum Tower deluxe on a Harrah's Total Rewards special rate. The room was in great condition with a nice flat screen TV, fresh furnishings, a mini-TV in the bathroom mirror and nice private toilet within a room within the bathroom. Closet space was plentiful. The room was very clean, maid service was very efficient, and we had absolutely nothing to complain about. From reading past reviews on here, I was concerned that we might have bad luck but that doesn't seem to apply to the forum tower rooms...I definitely recommend these rooms. As for the casino, I was also very happy with the restaurants and gaming. I like to play poker and my wife likes penny slots...both of us were happy. The poker room runs great tournaments. In previous trips, my wife has really enjoyed shopping at the Forum shops so staying here made the shopping much more convenient. The Forum shops' Max Brenner Chocolate restaurant is definitely a good place to go for dinner and especially the fondue chocolate dessert. We also ate at Nero's which is a classic Vegas steak and seafood restaurant that was very good (not cheap but we were satisfied). Finally, the service from cocktail waitresses, the front desk, and other staff was all very good. I was concerned about this after reading past reviews and I didn't run into any issues. May luck be with you on your future stay here...we were very happy with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: power58
Reviews.Content: I consider myself a seasoned traveler. My wife and I have visited many hotels in different parts of the world during our 28 years together. I must say that our recent visit to Caesars has to be the best overall experience we have ever had. I will start with the service of the entire staff. The young man (Erick) who checked us in was very helpful in getting us the high floor we desired even though we arrived at 10:30 am. We stayed in the augustus tower royal suite (3455) and the view was outstanding. The suite itself was huge and my wife still talks about how comforable the bed was. Everything in the room was well kept and clean. Everyone we came in contact with during our three day stay wanted to know what they could do to make our visit better. It was something that had been missing in pass stays at the Bellagio, Mirage, Monte Carlo, and at sister property Bally's. Our next visit to Las Vegas will be at Caesars. We just hope they can meet the high standards they have set for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “A Vibrant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 18Titles
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel. We love this hotel. It is very vibrant! We were given a room facing the Bellagio. Awesome view and very spacious! The hotel looks busy but there were always staff at the lobby assisting hotel guests with queries.

Reviews.Title: “mixed emotions traveler”
Reviews.Author: chitowneucator
Reviews.Content: Overall our visit was good, because my cousin and I were excited about being in Las Vegas and having top of the line accommodations. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was generally helpful. The room was comfortable the first day, but there after we found that our sheets and linens and towels were not cleaned and the floor had not been vacuumed. Upon speaking with the housekeeping manager, I found her to not really understand how this affected us as travelers. She asked me if we had the "do not disturb" sign on the door. We did not. When I spoke with the hotel manager he was gracious and professional and was helpful. Overall, my cousin and I still enjoyed the hotel and of course being in Las Vegas, but it was definitely a disappointment to have to deal with that kind of situation.

Reviews.Title: “I wuld definitely come back again.”
Reviews.Author: liamMarysville
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine EXCEPT there was no door into the bathroom. We should have asked for a different room. Maybe they are all that way?

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Property”
Reviews.Author: peggysue930
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how anyone can write a bad review about Caesars Palace. We were ready to be disappointed in our room because it was comped and we didn't pay a dime to stay three nights (notfor the room anyway). But we were pleasantly surprised to find a very nicely appointed, extremely clean room with a decent view. The reception staff made sure our room was smoke-free with the appropriate bed arrangements- something many other hotels in Las Vegas have not done on our past trips. The hotel and casino are huge with multiple shops, restaurants, and gaming options. The spa was incredible. I am a germaphobe and even I was completely comforrtable using the pools and saunas. The staff was impeccable (except for the snarky counter girl at the French dessert place). The mini-bar was handy and the drink servers were out in force on the casino floors. As for bed-bugs (always a worry recently) fear not. We checked for them and took all the precautions. We didn't see a single critter or a single bite. Bravo Caesars!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: LuisA95
Reviews.Content: I went with mum. We stayed at a room in Roman Tower. The room was beautiful, very tidy, clean and with a nice view. It had two double beds, tv no LCD but with excellent image, two chairs, mirror, desk, and another chair. The bathroom had two washbasin, small tv, bath, and toilet; 3 face towell, 4 body towells, and 3 normal towells. Shampoo, acontioner, body cream and all those things. The hotel is located in the middle of the Strip, that allows u to go close places whenever u want. Also, it has nice shops at Forum Shops. People who work there are very kind and always want to help u. I have any complaint about this hotel. If I go to Las Vegas again, I will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: CajunCrawler
Reviews.Content: Went on a girls trip to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday. Room rates week of December 14 were fantantic. We were orginally assigned a room in Roman Tower, these are the older rooms. The room was clean, nicely decorated, but problems with the bathroom. First couldn't seem to get cold water in shower, then jazucci tub didn't work, plus toilet wouldn't flush. Called front desk twice to complain, but didn't stick around for maintenance, too much to do and see in Vegas. When we returned to the room at night, manager had left a message saying we could switch rooms, so waited until morning to do that. Beds were very comfortable with feather pillows, although my daughter preferred foam pillows. Management moved us to Augustus Tower to a Jr. Suite, twice the size of Roman Tower room -- it was like heaven on earth. Very spacious, wonderful view and everything in the bathroom worked, including flat screen tv which you could watch while in the jacuzzi tub. Requested foam pillows and they were delivered right away. Also forgot a telephone charger in first room. Security was able to retrieve the charger and returned it to us. Wasn't able to walk by the pools because they were closed for the summer. We ate often in the food court, very affordable and convenient. The Forum Shops had numerous restaurants too. We did a little gambling, but didn't win. Better winnings were found on Fremont Street. The location of Caesars was great, right in the middle of everything. Everyone on staff was friendly and helpful. Despite our room problems, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel room, but terrible food.”
Reviews.Author: happiijenny
Reviews.Content: Went with my parents and stayed for one night at one of the Palace Tower rooms. Breathtaking view not to mention we got exactly what we had asked for (two double beds plus a folded bad). Everything was great except for the Lago Buffet, which we had dinner at. Not only was the line horribly long (we waited for over an hour), but the food wasn't all that great (based on my taste). This wasn't the first time we've been to Vegas, and I have eaten at various casinos, but this has got to be the worst buffet ever. If you are tired and hungry from a long day's trip, do not try this place. There is actually a food court in the Forum Casino area, which is much better than this place. Just a fair warning.

Reviews.Title: “Unique”
Reviews.Author: RelaxMaxToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vegas from Nov.15 to 20 at Caesar's Palace - Forum Tower. I was amazed by the size and grandeur of all the hotels, the architecture, the different themes and decor in each. Booked a standard room, but read on Tripadvisor that you can ask for an upgrade and I did. Nice clerk gave us a deluxe room at no extra charge - the room was large, upscale decor, made you feel special, the bathroom was gorgeous - worth the extra money that one would have to pay. Cleaning lady was very nice, room was stocked fully everyday - great service. Convenient location beside Bellagio and across from Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfy bed.”
Reviews.Author: Kassi22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Dec 15-19th. It was a more quiet time of year I here. Atmosphere/Grounds: The Hotel is beautiful. It huge (as most hotels in Vegas) so you will need a map to get around. The parts that we saw where well kept up and clean. It was nicely decorated for the holidays as well. The location of the hotel is perfect. Its mid strip close to everything. Service: Valet parking was fantastic. We used it every day without any waits or issues. They always gave decoration or helped with anything we needed. We did tip them every time we picked up the car. I saw a lot of people not do this which I thought was a little odd.. but I guess they don’t get the etiquette. Check was fine. There was a little wait but nothing crazy. We originally booked a Classic room but upgraded to a Forum room before arriving. I hear there not so great. The lady asked us at check in if we would like to upgrade. We jokingly ask “Is it free?” she just gave us a blank series stare… wow.. easy. Ahahah. So I asked how much and she said $40 a night. We said “No Thanks” (I can spend that money on much better things then a room I won’t be in) The cleaning service was great. They came later in the day though for us. 2:00-4:30ish. Though, they did a great job. Any employees in the hall or elevator etc would make a point of checking to see that everything was ok. Room: The room was fine. Nothing really wrong with it. Glad we didn’t waste the money on an upgrade. The bathroom was large. It was one main room, with a closet, Basin sink, large standup shower with two rain heads and a mirror with built in TV. There was a small room off of this with the toilet. The bedroom was an ok size, not too small, but not huge. It had a desk and chair. King bed which was super comfortable except I found the pillows to thick. (That’s just me though) and two lounge chairs. We had a room at the end of the hall on a higher floor. The view wasn’t anything.. it over looked a parking lot at the back of the building. I didn’t care for this though as I can get a view from all there other places on the strip. You’re in Vegas. How much time do you spend in your room that you’re not asleep anyways?! Amenities: The hotel is filled with them, though, we didn’t really use any. We walked by the pool. The Venus pool was open. The water to me was like bath water. I wish I knew it was that warm beforehand as I would have used it. The power life guard looked bored out of his mind as it was empty. There was a spa which I didn’t use. There is also lots of shopping and restaurants which we never really used. All in all it was a good stay and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed, love the concept hated the staff, rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Columbus
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great facilities and right in the heart of the strip however dissapointed from the start. 1st they checked us into downgraded rooms, then charged us to upgrade until we found the paperwork & they refunded the upgrade fee after wasting our first 5 hours. the staff where extreamly rude. we also got a bonus night due to our large group booking however they kicked us out of our room in the am to move us to another downgraded room, we decided to leave early and go to Palms Place where we had a much better time, with far superior service and a short travelator ride to the palms casino. Ceasers palace has a great pool area and onsite shopping but the service and poor rooms really destroyed our stay. Hotel Manager if you read this review its time you guys make serious changes to your systems and staff training.

Reviews.Title: “Room was terrific, be ready to walk, and walk and walk”
Reviews.Author: dchicag0
Reviews.Content: Room was in Forum Tower which seems to have been renovated recently. All the perks, tv in bathroom mirror, lights on/off auto., drapes drawn by switch, beautifully decorated. Now the cons. Five minutes to get to tower, takes forever to get from a restaurant to room or another location. It is across from Flamingo, Harrah, Imperial, so location is good. Only negative comment would be their buffet. Very limited compared to other strip buffets, plus pastries did not taste fresh. Would not go back to this buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Caesars!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hanf06
Reviews.Content: Stayed at CP the begining of October, and could not fault a thing! On arrival we were given an upgrade to a Palace Tower Deluxe Room with a jacuzzi. Room was cleaned every day everything freshly replaced. The hotel was stunning loads of restaurants to choose from, though some are pricey. Massive pool area with about 8 pools and loads of sun loungers and waiter service. Staff are excellent had a quick check in, and check out with no problems! Love Las Vegas and CP we have rebooked CP for next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware - rude, run-down and too big for its own good”
Reviews.Author: liz978
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas in December 2010 for an industry conference being held at Caesar's conference center. I was offered a room at the hotel at a good "conference" rate and was pretty excited to be able to stay at Caesars - "oh, that will be really nice, Caesar's is one of the more upscale of the hotel/casinos in Vegas" everyone told me. Wow, what a miserable experience. After a 10-hour day of sightseeing/scenic driving on the way back to Vegas for my conference (I flew to Vegas from the east coast but had rented a car to do a bunch of sightseeing for a few days in Utah at Zion/Bryce/Capitol Reef) I tried to figure out where to park to check-in for Caesars and did nothing except upset the valets and taxis who shooed me "you can't stop here go park." So I had to go park in the big garage, walk approx. 8-10 minutes through two casino floors (and beg for directions from some casino floor worker through the meandering maze with vague wayfinding posts) to find my way from self-park to the registration desk. When I asked the woman at registration if there was a place to stop to unload my bags first and then go self-park she looked at me like I had three heads and snarled, "no, there's the valet but there's, like, no, there's no place to just park so you can drop off your bags, no. The bellman will help you with your bags." So I checking in was about a 45-50 minute ordeal walking back and forth to the car three times: car --> registration --> car --> hotel room with one heavy bag --> car --> hotel room with heavy bag #2, each time walking probably 1/3 mile. The Bell Desk had such a long line it would have been useless and I have to say that the entire 4 days I was there I never once saw a bellman helping a single guest with bags. I did notice later in the week many other poor, sad, tired, lost-looking folks dragging huge suitcases across the smoky, meandering casinos. They put me in the Roman Tower - which I later figured out from reviews here is one of the two dumpiest towers. Wish I had checked TripAdvisor ahead of time. My room hadn't been renovated in at least 15-20 years. Everything was old, banged up, cracked, the door rim on the bathroom door was falling off. Both beds were so old they had a dip in them and I could feel the springs. I ended up stripping the one bed and rotating and flipping the mattress to a side that was less worn so I could sleep. The one thing that I thought would redeem the room - the jetted tub - blew pieces of dark greenish mold into the tub when activated! Disgusting! I lept out of the tub dripping wet and nearly screaming. Truly vile. I had to call housekeeping to clean the tub and I was pretty skeeved taking a shower. The TV was ancient and picture was terrible. I know you're not supposed to be in your room watching TV in Vegas, but I wanted to unwind with it a couple of nights... and as you'll read if you search other reviews, there were adjoining doors to both sides and I could everything going on next to me. Finally, I understand perhaps no fridge or microwave but no coffeemaker? Seriously? I count on having a cup brewing while I'm in the shower. (I ended up going out to get some Starbucks Via and using the super hot water from the tap to make coffee the remaining mornings a mug I had with me.) Everything in Caesar's is overpriced. Thank goodness my company was paying. I also got hit with the "would you like to upgrade to an XYZ fancier room?" on check-in (umm, no, I'm here on the conference rate - a.k.a. my company is paying and they're not gonna approve an upgrade.) The "would you like to upgrade..." went on for four days straight. I couldn't request a wake-up call without having the operator ask me if I'd like to place a room service breakfast order. $15/day for internet. $20-something to use the fitness center... Caesar's nickel and dimes you at every turn. When I tried to ask the hostess at Beijing Noodle 9 for some suggestions from the menu, she acted like it was a big inconvenience, confused me into asking a dumb question (that I was pretty sure was a dumb question but she was the one making no sense), then went over to place my order and I noticed her talking to the cook and he was looking at me and laughing. After my horrible check-in experience and horrible experience at Beijing Noodle, I made sure that all of my discretionary spending on meals, gambling and entertainment went elsewhere - mostly the MGM Grand, and TI (where I took in Mystere and Ka) and New York, New York. I ended my stay at Caesars a day early (an extra day I was staying to sightsee on my own dime) to find something nicer and cheaper (half price!) for one night. I've been to Vegas before and stayed at Luxor, which was a great experience, and the Sahara, which despite being one of the cheaper strip establishments was still a better experience than Caesars. Unless you are a high-rolling VIP with money to burn stay away from Caesars. They ripped off my company for $149/night on a piece of crap room and when I later did some research I found out I could have gotten a nice deal at many of the other strip hotels for half that -- Luxor, MGM, Mirage, Monte Carlo etc. are all offering good deals to get your business -- and I would have probably had a better experience. Caesars treats their conference goers (and probably all the other everyday folks not paying their prime rates) like crap which is a shame because I was excited to be there and willing to spend my own personal money there shopping, eating and playing slots if they had treated me with a little more dignity.

Reviews.Title: “No Good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: flaviobp
Reviews.Content: Bealtiful but old. I had problems with internet and bill. The room is smaller than the other in the city. The hotel has more name than the amenities!

Reviews.Title: “lack of staff means lack of service”
Reviews.Author: Ikuzus
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often and this was one of the worst hotel experiences I can remember. First, when I tried to check in, they told me the room wasn't ready - it was still being cleaned. I was okay with this as it was about an hour prior to the hotel check-in time. I left my bags with the bell desk and went for a walk. I came back an hour and a half later (past check-in time) and was told my room was still not ready and to check back in a half hour. 30 minutes later, the room was finally ready. I asked the bell desk to bring my bags to my room. When I entered the room, there were someones baggage in the room and the room was not clean. It looked like they checked me into someone elses room. I called the front desk and they told me to go to another room and they would send security up with new keys. I told them that I had asked the bell desk to bring my bags up and that they would be delivered to the wrong room. The person at the front desk said she would let the bell desk know of the room change. I went to the new room and waited 20 minutes for security to arrive with the new keys. I went into the room and decided to call the bell desk to make sure my bags were being delivered to the right room. The bell desk told me they had already delivered my bags to the wrong room. I told them what had happened and they said they would get the bags. 25 minutes later, a bell desk person calls from the other room and asks me which bags are mine. I walked over and met him at the wrong room so I could make sure I got the right bags. I immediately checked them to make sure someone hadn't gone through my bags and taken something out - everything was still there. The room I was staying in was a mini suite. The in-room safe (important for Las Vegas) wasn't working. The sink handles in the bathroom did not stop so they would turn all the way around - you had to carefully position them to turn the water off. Internet access was $15 a day. Finally, every day it would take hours for the housekeeping staff to make up the room even though I would call down at 8 AM to ask for service. I was told that the housekeeping staff didn't start until 9 AM. Clearly Caesars has laid off a bunch of staff and service quality has gone to hell as a result. It's incredible to me that a hotel of Caesars' reputation would allow a guest to check into an occupied room!

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace - a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: michzuck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at Caesar's Palace. He was attending a conference which took place at the hotel and that's why we stayed there. The hotel is huge, but you learn the layout fairly quickly. There are a number of excellent restaurants to choose from. We tried Payard for breakfast - excellent food, but pricy. The breakfast buffet at Lago is reasonable for what you get and everything we tried was good. Warning: the price is jacked up on the weekend when it becomes "brunch" and the $11 differential is not worth it. We also ate at Rao (Italian) and at the sushi bar at Hayakumi - both were very good, though Rao was overpriced. You can walk directly through the hotel into the Forum Shops, which has excellent shopping (high end) and additional dining choices. Our room was in the Palace Tower and we couldn't have asked for a nicer room. It was extremely spacious and the bathroom was huge, with a Jacuzzi tub and a separate shower and a toilet closet. However, when we turned down the bed before going to sleep on our first night there, it was clear that the sheets had not been changed. It took housekeeping an hour to come up (after being told 3 times on the phone that someone would be right up). Service at the hotel is not what it should be for a hotel in that price range. Check-in and check-out were chaotic. The front desk seems very understaffed and there were no clear lines for people to stand on. We went for a drink at one of the lounges in the casino area. There was one waitress visible and after waiting for 15 minutes and not getting her attention, we gave up and went to another hotel. For those who need to use the hotel's wireless network - the charge is $15 per day and the network was very slow. In 2010, no hotel, and particularly no hotel with rooms at Caesar's prices, should charge its guests for Internet access. Caesar's is a very noisy hotel in the public areas. There is always loud music blaring through the casino area. The hotel lacks a quiet place to have a drink, unlike some of the other hotels. We chose to spend our evenings at the Bellagio, which for us had a much more pleasant atmosphere, nicer places to have a drink and $10 blackjack tables (absent at Caesar's). However, the room itself was extremely quiet. If you're looking for a beautiful hotel in the heart of the Strip with lots of restaurants, shopping and an energetic casino vibe, you'll like Caesar's. If you're looking for a hotel with restaurants and shopping, but with a more upscale feel and excellent customer service, try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace is gorgeous! Bring your bank with you!!!”
Reviews.Author: DesertCowboy60750
Reviews.Content: Caesar's Palace is beautiful and has fantastic restaurants. The prices are astronomical. Speaking with several staff members they admit its not the same since it became "corporate." Milking the customers instead of earning their loyalty is the new name of the game. We'll eat there and look, but NOT shop, gamble or stay. It's for the eyes and stomach only.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you get a nice room, otherwise...”
Reviews.Author: GinevraBenci
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week. The hotel was sold out the day of my arrival (my conference had several thousand attending) but checked-in at 1pm and asked for a complimentary upgrade, which I received. No wait to get my room key. The "classic" (aka economy) rooms are in the Roman and Centurian towers - don't stay in one of those. If you wonder why the reviews here range from poor to excellent - these towers are the source of many of the bad reviews (esp. Roman). All the service I personally experienced was top notch. My room was very clean. Included safe, ipod connector on stereo, large closet, desk. My Palace Tower room (8th floor) was small but extremely comfortable with double vanities, marble shower and jacuzzi tub, great amenities. Bed was wonderful and it was the quietest hotel room I've ever been in. Mini-bar is rigged with weight detection. Room service was the only bad experience - long waits and horrible food every time. The hotel is open 24hrs, so get restaurant takeout if you can instead. Internet connection is a rip off - $15 per day for LAN (500kb per min.), $25 per day for wireless. DO NOT get the wireless - it is literally unusable. Overall, as long as you can a good room, this is one of the best and most luxurious hotels in Las Vegas. I loved my stay - had fun and slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience!”
Reviews.Author: IndianGyrl23
Reviews.Content: My brother, a couple of friends and I stayed in the Forum Tower (classic rooms) and it was very nice. Very spacious and everything was clean. It was extremely hard to eat at the buffet for lunch/dinner, it was summer with many weddings going on so that was to be expected with so many people. But do not purchase an all-day pass for buffet if you do not get there in time enough to stand in line and eat. The only real downfall, in my opinion, was the casino being so smokey. Also since it was summer and crowded, the pools were crowded so I suggest making reservations ahead of time. The mall was lovely and the location is pretty much central to everything on the strip. I'm going back again early spring next year and staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Quite honestly the worst hotel experience I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: NathJam
Reviews.Content: I was recently at the property as we were attending a conference at a different place and had been told that that hotel (The Rio) wasn't all that nice so we chose to go to Caesar's instead since it wasn't that far to walk each morning. What a mistake that turned out to be. When I arrived at the hotel desk around 9 at night I was told that the room I had requested was not available and I would have to be given a different room. (Even though I had a confirmed late arrival reservation) Now correct me if I'm wrong but I would think that a hotel RESERVATION would mean that my room is RESERVED for me, but I digress. Since it was a long day and flight I took the room that they had and was given a room with 2 Queen beds in it, instead of the King I requested. When I arrived in the room, I found that there was NO ceiling lights in it, yes my friends, the only light you get is from a lamp in the corner. As well there was no closet to hang up clothes, there WAS however a bar located in the bathroom where you can hang up clothes. Just what every traveller wants right. I called the front desk and told them that this room wouldn't do and they told me I couldn't be moved that night as they were full (in a place that size I highly doubt that could EVER happen) and to call back in the morning to switch. I called back the next morning only to have them try and talk me into an "upgrade" to a room with a CLOSET in it. I said that this is unacceptable (I mean even a Motel 6 has a closet in it, not to mention lights and usually free Wifi in your room, AND it costs about 1/4 of the price) and after much hemming and hawing I was finally given another room at the property, I went to that room and while it had lights, the beds were now DOUBLES. (down from my original CONFIRMED King sized reservation). Oh yes, and there was no blanket ON the bed, just the sheet and top sheet. I guess I had to trade off for the closet and ceiling lights luxury I was getting. When I went to lie in the bed I found that there were blood stains (I kid you not) on the pillow and sheets. I left that bed and went to the other which seemed to be fine. I left a note for the staff that I would like the bloody sheets changed and blankets on the bed, I got blankets the next day, on the bed, folded and wrapped in plastic, I had to MAKE the bed myself. All in all I would really not advise anyone to go to this property when there are literally hundreds of other properties around the area and many of them with MUCH better rooms than this property. Or, if you DO choose this property, make sure you spend at least $500 a night to get a GOOD room (one that is clean, has lights, blankets, a closet, a decent sized bed, etc) because apparently the $160 a night rooms are dumps. The ONLY thing it has going for it is location.

Reviews.Title: “CP Nov. 2010”
Reviews.Author: LAURIEK2
Reviews.Content: Went with 6 other family members. Rented a scooter from Concierge for 80 year old MIL. Good deal. We stayed in Augustus tower (comped) added a night after finding cheaper flight. They wanted to put us in basic room first night, hubby said no way so they gave us a mini suite the first night. Both rooms were the nicest we have ever stayed in! Brought my own k cups coffee from home to use otherwise they charge too much in the mini bar for coffee. Ate at Augustus cafe', Serendiipity 3, and munchbar all were good. Was very disappointed in the slot selection. Alot of machines were out of service. It's a long walk to get around the casino. Great midstrip location!!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware this hotel has motion detectors in the rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara150
Reviews.Content: There are motion detectors in the rooms directed at the bed and surrounding area. These detectors flash a red light as they recognize movement, everytime there is movement ( very humiliating). At first Security lied and claimed they were for monitoring the heat/air. As I have the same system at home and know exactly what it is and how it works, I called them out on the lie. They then admitted the rooms did have motion detectors directed at the bed and told me not to worry as there were no cameras directed at the bed!! I explained how uncomfortable I was with them knowing each time my husband and I rolled over in bed, used the bathroom, or "other things...". I wanted them to turn it off but they claimed they couldn't. They offered to change our room but it would be a big down grade as they were full. We will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms. Awful smells”
Reviews.Author: JessieNix22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at CP 5 night nov 28-dec-03 check in was quick enough clerk was friendly. Got a deluxe room in palace tower, absolute beautiful room, gorgeous bathroom, room, veiw.
