Hotel: pros: great location , great room, lots of choice for dinning with good quality food. Cons: very perfumy/smoky, staff couldn't been more informative. Lots of walking involved in getting to and from rooms.. So wear comfy shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Sliding downhill”
Reviews.Author: MissDaisy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar's about two years ago. During that visit I found a very suspicious stain on the bed spread. Housekeeping replaced the bedspread but not the linens, if I remember right. This time we stayed again at Caesars as we appreciate being able to park our car and spend the weekend visiting the varied shops and restaurants found inside the Caesar's complex. We particularly enjoy eating at Rao's and the Cheesecake Factory both found inside Caesars. We also enjoy shopping at the Apple Store found in the Caesar's forums. This time we visited our three favorite spots. Rao's as always had good food. Unfortunately they placed us at a table near the kitchen. I made reservations about a month before our intended arrival. I was not happy as we were celebrating my husband's birthday. It would have been nice to eat somewhere away from the kitchen. The Cheesecake Factory. This time we enjoyed a light snack of stuffed mushrooms and corn fritters. The stuffed mushrooms were divine! As to the hotel: Housekeeping just isn't like it used to be. They did not get around to cleaning our rooms until 4 p.m. I asked for some fresh towels and nothing more. As it was so late in the day there was no need to make up the bed. By-the-way Caesars does not change sheets daily as there is a water conservation effort encouraging this effort. Casino: Do not expect to find any low cost Black Jack tables. The lowest minimum bid accepted at the Black Jack tables is $15. This was mid-week and in former days this was when you could find inexpensive tables to gamble at. Do not expect a 3 to 2 pay out either if you manage to get a Black Jack. Caesars does not pay out the 3 to 2 winnings anymore. Internet: Expect to pay $14.99 for 24 hours of Internet service. Also, I do believe the Internet connection is unsecured. Bring an ethernet cord as I think you can use an ethernet outlet. Ethernet cords are not provided by the hotel. Coffee: You can pay for the coffee as it's not free either. Friendliness: Both the hotel and casino seemed to lack the friendliness of yesteryear. Room: Both nights mysterious beeping sounds emitted presumably from the TV. The first night the hotel engineer could find nothing wrong and suggested Cox Cable was working on the cable system causing the beeps. One of the lamps never worked the whole time we were there and the curtains electronic system worked sporadically. We are re-thinking our trips to Las Vegas based on the above. It seems Las Vegas has missed the mark as it's no longer a low cost vacation destination. You'd best bring your wallet, if you want to have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower is the way to go...”
Reviews.Author: eponine7979
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at Caesar's, the previous time also being in the Augustus Tower. This trip was for my wedding, and friends and family were scattered throughout the property. As most say, the view is amazing from this tower...you can just sit on the couch or chair and watch the Bellagio Fountains from your room. The room is spacious, as is the bathroom. Stand up shower, 2 person whirlpool tub, double vanity, TV next to the vanity, and separate toilet room. Housekeeping was exceptional, handling all requests (more towels, etc) with no problem. The room was always very clean. From my experiences, it is also very quiet...I've never been bothered by boisterous parties coming down the halls!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamo_oink
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars between Nov 24-29 in the Palace Deluxe room, originally had booked the Forum Tower room but was offered the palace tower instead. The room is about 100 sq ft larger than the forum one so no complaints there. The upgrade was free, tried to ask for a strip view and none was available during time of check in. It would have been an extra $50/day for strip view.... (not worth it). The room and bathroom were big and nice, however when we walked in there was a towel on the floor? Other than that no other issues, everything was clean and it was very quiet on the 24th floor. Location of hotel is very good, close to everything however it took about 5mins to walk out of the hotel b/c it's so big. The casinos were big and nice, I did not appreciate the smoking but that's just how it is in Vegas. The Forum shops area was very beautiful. Enjoyed the stay a lot :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room to Avoid Like the Plague”
Reviews.Author: Chrispy2day
Reviews.Content: Take a cab to the shops and restaurants, but for the love of God, DO NOT STAY HERE! We just spent Thanksgiving weekend in Vegas where my wife's family lives. We thought we'd make it into a nice vacation too and got a room at Caesars. We'd never stayed here before and were really looking forward to it. It started off pretty good, then rapidly descended to one of the worst stays I've ever had. When we arrived, the Valet sign at registration said it was full. WTF?! I told my wife to just stay there and I ran in to get our room. I upgraded to the Augustus Tower Deluxe room and ran out. Luckily, the valet went ahead and took the car and it was a relatively short walk to the room. The room itself was actually really nice. Great jacuzzi tub and a nice bed. The pillows were worn out feather pillows that needed to be replaced, but the rest of it was nice and had a cool modern look. You have to pay for the coffee, which I thought was pretty ghetto considering every other hotel I've ever stayed in gives you free coffee, but that's the kind of crap I expect in Vegas. Then things start their rapid decent. We ordered room service. My stomach has still not fully forgiven me for that mistake. We got fried chicken and a chicken soup. The soup was good. The fried chicken was something that they pulled from a KFC dumpster, stuck under a heat lamp for 5 hours then took up to our room. It came with a discus... oh sorry, that's right, it was a biscuit. Took a bit and a liter of water later could finally resume conversation. Eating a tablespoon of all purpose flour would have been preferable. I got to spend most of the next morning in the bathroom thanks to that meal. Needless to say, we stuck to the restaurants from then on -- Payard is actually quite good. Then next batch of horror was coming and going to the resort, since we were visiting my wife's family we had some visiting to do everyday. Well, the valet at registration was ALWAYS full! So they made us go to the colosseum area -- on the opposite side of the resort from our room! It was at least a 15-20 minute walk every time we needed to go back and forth from the car. Had I not upgraded to the fancy new tower, maybe that would have been better, but as it was it made us dread coming back every day. Long day, exhausted, sleepy -- no worries, have a nice 20 minute walk, cross two separate elevators, go through two smoky casino areas to get to your room! Methinks not. We also discovered that we started feeling sick once we got there. After the second day we realized it was the heater in the room. Once we turned it off I started feeling better immediately. It was a little too late for my wife though who now has the flu that I blame completely on Caesars. Every time that heater kicked on I started feeling congested and a sore throat -- maybe because they are still doing construction? Don't know, don't care, it's just unacceptable. Sorry for the long review, but really there are lots of great places to stay in Vegas so why deal with this kind of BS. I know next time it's back to Bellagio for me...

Reviews.Title: “Failed to deliver on quality and service”
Reviews.Author: mikenyc1978
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace is not what it used to be, and that is supreme luxury resort casino. Here is why: initial impression - arrogant, pompous and shall we say - not the sharpest tool in the shed - the receptionist was far below standards for this resort. Ended up paying additional fee for the room we already reserved. Quality: our bed was tilted. As you can imagine, it was not easy to sleep well. This is in the junior suite room, Palace Towers. Simply unacceptable. The remote control did not work and the 26" LCD is truly subpar for the room. Lago Cafe and Rao restaurant were two exception for which I give thumbs up for both, quality and exceptional service. Overall, below expectations.

Reviews.Title: “OMG - it was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: GAVINEVAN
Reviews.Content: What a great place. We have stayed lots of places in Vegas, downtown also, for many years, but finally stayed at the best - Caesars. It was so clean, so pretty, so big, so much to do. And the slots were o.k. also. Play later in the night. We checked in early, and Nicole was wonderful!!!! I can not say enough about that experience. She gave us an upgrade, it was my husbands 62nd birhtday. The room was GREAT. Two baths, connecting shower, large room overlooking the pool, just beautiful. We enjoyed the experience so much! We ate at the Bejing Noodle #9 - it was spectacular. So good! The fish tanks were beautiful. We loved the whole experience, even though we fell for the facial products that they sell there - expensive - but good. I kinda wish I had not bought them, but the girl that demonstrated the products was such a good salesperson. I am enjoying them (OroGold). Just a lot more than I ever spend on myself. We had won a little money, so guess we just gave it all back to Caesars. I can not wait to return to Caesars Palace - I felt like a Princess! So clean, so nice, smelt so good also. The shopping was unbelievable too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: FL_or_bust
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Caesar's in November 2010! Our room wasn't ready when we arrived so they upgraded us to the Forum Towers. Very nice room with jucuzzi and views of the pool area. It was absolutely beautiful! Planning on returning in March and have our rooms booked at Caesar's! Did not plays the slots though - headed across the street to Flamingo's for that! Was surprised about the fridge full of their items but when I questioned a member of the staff, I was told that they would bring me a fridge for any items I had, if needed.

Reviews.Title: “great room with great view”
Reviews.Author: bigeck13
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal for this room on a website, paid £150 for 2 nights on a Wednesday and Thursday for a Forum Tower room. Wanted to stay the Friday as well, but were unwilling to pay the $300 that was quoted. Arrived at 20.30. Reception was quiet, check in took 10 minutes and were upgraded to a Palace Tower room with a view of the strip. Room was lovely and the bed was very comfortable. It had the added bonus of a jacuzzi bath. Sat by the pool for a couple of hours one day - plenty of available beds. Overall a good experience and would definitely recommend Ceasars. Just make search you search various websites for deals as when we booked this, other websites were charging up to 3 times more for the room

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed before and will return”
Reviews.Author: retropj
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling to Vegas for 12 years or so and have stayed at various hotels on the strip. Our last 6 or 7 visits have been with Caesars, and we will stay again. Yes most hotels belong to huge corporations so things can seem very impersonal from time to time and Caesars is no different. But the majority of our interactions with staff are very positive. We always stay in the Augustus Tower. It’s the newest tower and the rooms are large in comparison to others on the strip. Bathrooms are huge and have a Jacuzzi tub. If you like a view, ask for a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains. One of the things we like about Caesars is the location in the centre of the strip. If you plan to visit other properties or restaurants, many are within walking distance or a $6-7 cab ride away. The spa is also fantastic and the gym facilities are top notch. Restaurants are also great. A couple of our favorites are Rao’s for dinner and Payard for breakfast. Stay away from the Augustus Café. The forum shops are another positive, there is something for everyone, high and low end. Spago in the forum shops is fantastic. The Casino is open and not too crowded or smoky and the majority of the dealers are friendly. The poker room is very nice and separate from the rest of the casino, just next to the large sports book area.

Reviews.Title: “Just as expected.....perfect.”
Reviews.Author: gjerris
Reviews.Content: Had two nights at Caesars Palace, and it was just like we had seen it on aaallll the films we have seen from Vegas. Caesars is placed on The Strip and are close to everything. Staff were very kind and the hotel has everything, I guess we only got to see half of the hotel. Quite expencive but worth every dime:)

Reviews.Title: “Right by all the action!!”
Reviews.Author: KimmyB84
Reviews.Content: We were so excitied to find out we were staying in the hotel where "The Hangover" was filmed! And this hotel is stunning!! Walking distance to the shops and right by the Bellagio Fountains. The room we stayed in was huge and we had a stunning view of the strip. Some of the rooms have view of the pool area or the other hotels, so try request a room with a view of the strip. The pool are is amazing, really big and nicely designed. The hotel itself was huge (I guess all the hotels in Vegas are) but we had a conference and all the delegates managed to stay in the same hotel which was great. Pure Night Club is also fantastic, takes long to get drinks and they are pricey but I guess this is normal. There is a great selection of restaurants within the hotel. We had dinner at Rao's one night, this must be the best pasta I have ever had and the service was very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Casino - Incredible Staff & Dealers”
Reviews.Author: cjbesq
Reviews.Content: I was here November 7 - 14, 2010 on a combined business/pleasure trip. I choose to stay at Caesars, as I am a Harrah's Rewards card holder and got a great deal on a room for the week. Two years ago I was in Las Vegas for the same conference and stayed at Harrah's. There is absolutely no comparison between Harrah's and Caesars - Caesars is a much nicer place with better restaurants, facilities, rooms, a nicer casino, etcetera. My room in the Forum Tower was very clean, modern, and quiet. The bed was very comfortable. The "rain" shower was great. The TV built in to the bathroom mirror was a bit over the top. The thing I loved about Caesars was the staff. Everyone, and I mean everyone, bent over backward to make you feel welcome. It started from the moment you arrived on property. The bell staff; the front desk staff; the folks in the stores - everyone was pleasant and accomodating. A word about the dealers in the casino - they were, without exception, fantastic. These are "old time" Las Vegas dealers who talk to the players; give advice; teach the "rules" to to those who are new to the game. It was a joy to play with all of them. They keep things interesting - even when you may not be winning. They are a tremendous asset to Harrah's Corporation, and Harrah's should be mindful of that as they hire new dealers and train them. We ate at Bobby Flay's in Caesars. The food was very good. We also ate at Joe's Stone Crabs in the Forum Shops at Caesars where the food was incredible. Joe's is probably my favorite restaurant in the world, Off property restaurants we tried were: -Sea - Thai food at Bally's - very good and very reasonable; -The Range Steakhouse at Harrah's - excellent but expensive; -Mon Ami Gabi at Paris Hotel - food was ok, not great and fairly expensive; and -Zeffirino at the Venitian Hotel - excellent Italian food and great service. My one knock on Caesars is the way they nickle and dime you for everything - $15 per day for in room internet service; $5 for a cup of coffee in the food court; $25 per day if you want to use the gym; $7.00 handling fee to send a Fed Ex package from the business center back to my office. Come on guys! I know "comps" are dead and everything is tied to the "Rewards Card", but if you want people to be loyal don't be penny wise and pound foolish. It is this behavior which caused me to give Caesars only one star for value, and only four stars overall.

Reviews.Title: “Another good time at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: vadreamer
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at Caesars Palace in a Palace Tower room. Checked in very late in the evening/early morning, and was offered a Roman Tower room (reservation was for Forum Tower). Thanks, but no. Second offer was for a smoking Palace Tower room with the promise that housekeeping would come quickly to fumigate. We took the smoking room even though we are non-smokers. Room 1719 was nice and it didn't smell at all. In fact, even though it was a smoking floor, we never noticed any smell at all. When housekeeping showed up to spray the room deodorizer, we sent them away, as there was no need. The room was very clean and everything was in working order. The bathroom has a separate shower with a large spa type tub. Separate toilet area. The room was exactly the same as our room over the summer, except this room had a coffee maker. We never used it, but it could be handy for those that need their early AM java. Housekeeping showed up early each day and did a good job of providing us with enough towels. The only glitch in our stay was three days into our reservation, a CP hotel employee showed up at the door asking if I was "staying in the room". Um, why else would I be answering the door? He had a clip board and pointed to it stating that his records showed our room as being vacant and he wanted to know why I was there. I explained that we had two additional days to go before checking out and I didn't know why he showed us as having left. He talked to someone on his headset and they must have confirmed that yes, we were indeed still registered and were checking out in two days. I was annoyed by the visit and immediately called down to the front desk. The person answering the phone said "yes, Mrs. XYZ, we show you as checking out on Wednesday (not Monday)". Thought it was all over until I went to check out on Wednesday and was told by the front desk person that they had cleared my account/charged my credit card on the Monday of the weird visit. Still can't figure out what happened and the whole thing sorta left a bad impression on me. I guess it's a good thing we didn't try to charge anything to the room since my room charges had been closed??? Anyway, it was a good stay at Caesars and I'd definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms have no privacy at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: wedwicker
Reviews.Content: We eloped to Las Vegas and spent our honeymoon at Caesars Palace. We stayed for 4 nights. There were doors on each wall that went to other rooms. There was a 1 inch crack under each door. I was shocked the very first night that we could see the light from both rooms that were next to us on each side. But the worse part was that we could hear every thing that was said and done in each room next to us. The very first night we could hear every word and activity that was done and preformed in the rooms next to us. Shocking! This went on every night of our stay. Didnt' make for a peaceful, relaxing stay. I put towels at the bottom of each door. Sure could have used a load sound machine in the rooms. On a positive note, The grounds and hotel are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Trin55
Reviews.Content: With all the talk about bed bugs, upon arrival to Caesars Palace, we were given a room in the Augustus Towers. We checked the room and beds for bed bugs, and it looked to be very clean, and it was. Only report here is no Bed Bugs (in our room) and great service. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: ap2556
Reviews.Content: Over a period of 5hours of trying to check into a hotel room i reserved and paid for a month in advance, Caesars Palace was giving us the run around as to why our room was not ready and that it'd be one more hour & one more hour & yet one more hour. Seriously?!?!? The check-in process was a nightmare. They tried to 'upgrade' us to a room at Planet Hollywood, which i declined b/c i wanted to stay at Caesar's and i paid for a 'Caesars' not 'Planet Hollywood' hotel room. It seems their waiting game is a ploy where they either overbook with intention of making a profit on guests that go to 'upgraded' Planet Hollywood hotels, or to keep you waiting so you spend $$$ in their casino gambling, or at their restaurants & shops. The experience was a real shame and really shined a negative light on Caesars Palace. I would DEFINITELY NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!!! p.s. when we finally got a room after 5.5hrs the bathroom had not been cleaned; their were little black hairs in the tub & on the towels, and who knows what else was in the room. An overall bad experience : (

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cpaonessa
Reviews.Content: This will be a short and sweet review. Stayed here in November 2009 for my 25th birthday! -- Picked Caesars Palace because it looked great, and we got a killer deal! The hotel is GORGEOUS! The rooms are fantastic. Modern, Clean and Full of amentities. The location is fantastic and the staff are more than helpful. The food in the hotel (as well as on the strip) are MORE than up to par and the nightlife - in and out of the hotel - are FUN!!! I recommend this hotel to EVERYONE - as it suits the needs of any type of traveller. Note: The amentities in the room (ie: digital camera, and other things available you can purchase) are SENSORED! Each time you move them from the spot they originated from, the item is then charged to your room. Once put back on the spot - it's credited back. As long as everything is still in the room when you leave - you're not charged - but we had ONE HECK of a field day looking at our BILL during checkout. Just an fyi....

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in promises given then taken away”
Reviews.Author: BubbaTigerLily_AB
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for a week long stay. Our daughter was getting married at a house they had rented so we along with friends and family stayed on the strip. We had the spa booked for six the day of the wedding along with salon appointments and then everyone coming up to our room to get ready before catching a limo to the wedding. When we checked in we asked for an upgrade from a forum room to the augustus towers and were told not to unpack that we would be upgraded the next day. So we spent the night in our room which was nice but not overly clean (had part of a candy stuck to the bathroom floor that stayed there for the entire week). Checked at noon and were told to come back at three, checked at three and were told to come back at six. Told at six there was no possible way that we could get an upgrade and that we should go back to our original room. Very frustrating and a wasted day as we were told to be prompt on checking on our room or else it could be given away. I will say that the spa is the best I have been at.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, But many missing parts and I don't mean body.”
Reviews.Author: JRSears
Reviews.Content: Nov 8-12. Hotel is nice. But with hiding cost. At $250per night. NO coffee maker and NO frig in room. Then internet $15/day,$25 to use the gym. I told them “You’ve got to be kidding. I get more from my stay at a Hampton Inn”.

Reviews.Title: “Best location on the strip, rooms are standard”
Reviews.Author: Brittany12
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location to be able to walk to everything and see the main sites. The rooms are very standard and not recently updated. Within the hotel is a high end shopping center. You can do a lot within Caesars without even leaving the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Do Not Stay Here if Allergic to Cigarette Smoke”
Reviews.Author: jc531710
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in the Palace Tower. Room was very nice, clean, and large. Had jacuzzi and separate shower and two sinks in bathroom. My only complaint is that for some reason the sheets felt like sandpaper, although the comforter and pillows were just fine. Room was quiet and I slept well though. Beware the minibar. The cheapest item is $12, and we were told by the front desk that if you pick up an item for over 5 seconds you have bought it. Pricing is not on the items, so of course your instinct would be to pick up the item to see the price since they are all boxed and you cannot see what is in the box at a glance. Concierge was not very helpful and was unable to recommend a restaurant, except for the ones at Caesars. Was going to a show at Treasure Island (2 doors down) but concierge could not tell us anywhere to eat outside Caesars. She also was unable to provide any information on times for the volcano at the Mirage (next door) or the pirate show at Treasure Island. She did not seem very well informed. The main drawback here is the cigarette smoke. Due to the number of casinos and the fact that you have to go through them to get to your room or any of the shopping or eating places at Caesars, you are constantly breathing in cigarette smoke from the casinos. While eating in a restaurant, we could see thick smoke hanging in the air. I was there on business, and you could even smell cigarette smoke outside the meeting rooms. As an allergy/asthma sufferer I was miserable my entire stay, and came home with a nasty sinus infection. In addition, cost for Internet is $14.95 per day for in-room, and $24.95 per day for hotel-wide access. I would recommend this hotel to a friend who smoked, but definitely not to a non-smoker.

Reviews.Title: “bad policy at check in”
Reviews.Author: frogmoretiger
Reviews.Content: In August we booked a room with two beds for November. They said we were lucky, they had the room. At check in they saw our confirmation said two beds, but we were told they had no more rooms with two beds.. They gave us one bed in a room in Forum towers. We were told we could change rooms the next day around noon or one the next day. The Roman towers room is about equivalent to an average Marriott room. The next day we went back to check in at 12;30. They said come back after two but to bring our bags to the bell desk so they could make our room available at two. We did so and went back to check in. They said to check back between 3 and 6. We had to wait around so we played slots on their tight slot machine for two hours and lost $200. At 4 they gave us a room in the palace towers and said they upgraded us like they did us a favor. I just want the room I booked 3 months prior. They told us to go outside to get our bags we had checked in with the bell desk. After a 1/2 hr. wait, we got our bags and could go to a room with two beds. If I want to waste a half day of a vacation, I would rather go to a time share presentation and get free tickets; not waste money on their 'slot machines.' The room was larger with a nice bathroom. They had a coffee maker with four cups of coffee available for $12. The pool was impressive looking. In fact the place is impressive looking, but you can look for free and avoid check in. Judging from other reviews on tripadvisor, it is policy to over book to get people there, then give them anything available.

Reviews.Title: “Veeeery old rooms - won't go unless htey refurnish”
Reviews.Author: asmirnov
Reviews.Content: my worst stay in vegas out of four. 1) we booked king-size-beed room just one day before arrival but when we came they said there is no king-size available so we had to take twins 2) the room we were given was SOOOOO old - just like my grandma old house. May be it was 5 star room many years ago but not in 2010. 3) they were vacuum cleaning corridor early in the morning (smth like 9 or 10 am) and it was so loud so we could not sleep well, which is not the best option when you have a 5 hours flight on that day...... So all in all hotel itself is very beautiful, moving statues are nice and shopping is good. Location is perfect. So DO go here for a walk/shop but DO NOT stay here (unless they refurnish their rooms)

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy, but watch out for that minibar”
Reviews.Author: starshine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Oct 28 - Nov 5. Booked direct with the hotel on their website and got a discounted internet room rate in the Roman Tower but we upgraded at check-in to a room in the Palace Tower for an extra $56.00 (incl tax). Unfortunately I wasn't cheeky enough to ask for an upgrade at no charge. The only problem with the Palace Tower is that it's a bit of hike but I'm not surprised because it's a very large casino. The room was very large with two queen beds, desk, chair & stool, flat screen TV, sensored minibar, two toilets, extra large shower with two shower nozzles (wow), huge whirlpool bath and lovely amenities including a sewing kit. The room was spotless and the housekeeping was completed efficiently everyday. The bed & pillows were so comfortable that everynight we had a wonderful sleep. Our room was very clean and the sheets were spotless and felt lovely. Our room was on the 26th floor and we could not hear any noise from other rooms. Our view from our window was of the pools even though we were hardly ever in our room. The pools close at 5pm and there was only two pools open because of the season, so make sure you get in early or you won't get a lounger. My 9 year old son just loved swimming in the pools. My dissatisfaction with the room is the sensored minibar - We were charged $12 for something we didn't even drink and I only found this once I had paid the bill. When we arrived in our room my young son picked up a bottle of something and we didn't realise the minibar was sensored and that I had to pay $14.99 per 24 hrs for internet access which I think is a bit steep. The great thing about this casino is that parking is free and you can valet park for a tip. The best floor to park for the casino entrance is Level 3. We wouldn't recommend the Lago Buffet at Caesars it's not that great but definitely try the buffet at Planet Hollywood, it's wonderful! If you purchase the $39.95 + tax (24hr buffet pass) don't let your children take off the bracelet because we were told by the hostess that if they did take off the bracelet then all we would have to do is show our receipt. Well that was not true!! One of our son's took off his bracelet making the barcode unscannable and they made us buy another pass. If you have children under 21 then ask for a temporary card that they can give you at the counter outside the buffet. All in all, we had a very enjoyable time at Caesar's.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Tower = Not good”
Reviews.Author: Bracedoc
Reviews.Content: 2 Star rating is for the Roman Tower and for the service at the Front Desk. My wife and I stayed for 4 nights. We were at Caesars to attend a business seminar on Fri/Sat. We received an e-mail prior to arrival offering to upgrade our room for $20-$30 a night. We decided to take advantage of this at check in. Nicole at the front desk explained that the upgrade was not available the first night, but she locked in a room change, and we would be upgraded to the Augustus Tower on Friday, for the rest of our stay. She instucted us to call the front desk around lunch on Friday. So as I am on my lunch break from my meeting, I stop at the front desk, where I am helped by Jason. He checks our info and says we can have a room on the 45th floor or 30th floor in the Augustus Tower. Since I love the views, I said I would take the room on the 45th. He said the room was not ready yet, but I can come back as soon as my seminar is over to get the keys. So the seminar ends at 5pm and my wife and I return to our room in the dumpy Roman Tower, pack up our stuff, and lug our suitcase and bags down to the front desk. I see Jason is still there, and greet him, and tell him we are here get our keys for the room on the 45th floor. He gives me a vacant look, like he is not sure what I am referring to. I remind him he helped me just 3 hours ago. He checks his screen and without a word, disappears for about 10 minutes. So I know something is up...... He comes back saying that no room is available, that "the system" released my room. I calmly respond saying how I was confused, and that he and Nicole assured us a room change was set, and he even gave me a choice of rooms. My wife also calmly stated "that doesn't make sense." All of the sudden, the previously helpful Jason gets quite defensive and accuses my wife of "not listening to him" and asks her if she would rather "get upset and yell or listen to him." (she said just one sentence) This was totally uncalled for as my wife was calm. If she did get upset, believe me Jason and the entire lobby would have known it! So we ask for a manager, and he says "fine, but she is just going to say the same thing I told you." Another 10 minutes later she comes out to say no to the room change, and that when we checked in Nicole should not have told us we could upgrade. She completely blamed Nicole and said she would need to speak to her. I ask her why does Caesars send e-mails offering upgrades and she has no response other than "the system" released the room. She does give us $50 off that night for our trouble of packing up and lugging our stuff down to the lobby. I have read so many other reviews of people getting room changes here. I was most bothered by this Jason's attitude. He really got pricky. We were quite bummed to head back to the Roman tower as the room in the Roman tower was nothing special. The hair dryer was actually in 2 pieces and when I tried to put it back together, I actually got a nice shock. Also no door on the bathroom, which is bizarre....really dont like going in front of my wife. You can hear everything from the room next to you. The whole Roman Tower just has an old, dirty feel to it. To bad their website did not give a clue about the disparity of the different towers. I am sure if we did end up in the Augustus Tower I would be writing a much better review. Rooms are apparently much larger and it was built in 2005. I have stayed at the Venetian previously and wrongly assumed all rooms would be as nice as theirs. So if you must stay at Caesars, make sure you are in a new tower.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning pool area.”
Reviews.Author: maam41
Reviews.Content: You have to walk long distances to get to your room. Great shopping precinct. Rooms were spacious with nice beds not very glamourous for the money charged. Extremely busy hotel, if you need help by a staff member or anything be prepared to wait quite a while. Large queues for check in and check out. Large queues for Taxis although line does move quickly. Stunning pool and chapel.

Reviews.Title: “Hail Caesar......NOT!”
Reviews.Author: BankerNJ
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 days back in May, 3 nights were comped, paid 1 night for a deluxe room in the Palace Tower. I understand comped rooms can be a toss up, but as a loyal and lucrative Platinum Reward Card member paying for a deluxe room one of the nights I expected better treatment. We were give a room in the Centurion Tower with 2 full beds and a sofa that didn't open, no room for a rollaway. Asked to have the room changed.....was told they were over booked 40 rooms that night, but try back tomorrow (what a pain in the neck...packing, unpacking...we only had 4 days). So first night one of my sister's sleeps on the sofa. Next day try the front desk again...told they are overbooked 130 rooms and if I come back after 1PM and volunteer to be a "walking reservation" I would be moved to a bigger room at a sister hotel. I agreed to do this only to find out within the hour that they would not do this and would accomodate my original reservation for a deluxe room that would be ready after 3PM that day. HUh? What happend to being overbooked? Anyway, at 3PM go to the front desk , room is not ready, leave a cell phone number and they will call when ready. We left for an early dinner before the Terry Fator show. IT's now 5:45PM, no phone call. We stop at the front desk one last time before heading to our show.....yes the room is ready. WE drag our stuff to the new room in the Forum tower, which is a bigger room and we ask for a rollaway. Off we go to the show. When we get back to the room the rollaway was delivered.....and we have a message on the room phone stating if we don't claim our new room by 6PM they cannot hold it...HUH? It was exasperating dealing with the front desk......and then on the last day we had a very early flight and could not check out via the TV (my preferrece...no one to deal with) so I went to the front desk to check out and made a friendly comment about how busy the casino was at 4:30AM...the woman at the desk in a disgusted tone said it always like this. She should be thankful, it is keeping her employed! One final note...DON'T use the glasses in the room...lipstick stains, filthy!!!

Reviews.Title: “There are tons of better choices”
Reviews.Author: sushiactress
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several high-end hotels in Las Vegas. Bellagio, Aladdin (RIP), Paris, and Monte Carlo, and Caesar's was by far the most expensive and the worst experience. What a disappointment. We got suckered into the "upgraded" room after already paying what I felt was an outrageous rate. The upgraded room was in the Forum tower and had a view of the air conditioning system. The bed was too soft and also lower on one side than the other. I felt like I was rolling downhill all night. There were dirty dishes and carts in the hallways all the time, it doesn't seem anyone comes around to collect them until the maids come in the morning. Tacky. The room included a coffee maker, but the hotel charges $12 for the coffee. There is Wi-Fi available for $14.99, but it's only in your room, not the whole hotel. They claimed there was free wi-fi at the snack bar, but when we went, we were told it was only for customers. If you have to buy something to use the wi-fi, in what way is it free? We felt we were being nickel-and-dimed to death. Seriously, when you pay this much, you expect a little bit more, and Caesar's absolutely does not deliver. We also ate at Rao's within Caesar's, it fit right in, it was awful. Stay at the Bellagio next door, you'll have a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy room, great bathroom”
Reviews.Author: marctravis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Roman Tower. You could see the light from the next rooms under the connecting doors. You could also hear everything said in the next room. The room was no frills. No fridge. Just a big king size bed, armoire, old style tv, desk. The view was awful. They gave us a room so far down the hall, it took forever to get there. We had to make sure we didn't leave anything in the room b/c it was quite a hike to get back. The bathroom was very nice. It was large, with walkin shower, jacuzzi tub. All marble.

Reviews.Title: “not a five star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jollyhols47
Reviews.Content: the room was fairly clean apart from the dried splashes of blood in the bathroom which wrent ours! they remained there all week and were not clean. the room was only surface clean at times! there was heavy rust marks around the door frame in the bathroom which made it look tacky! the worst of all was the lack of pool availability during our stay, most days ALL the pools were closed by 2pm because of weddings! there was no information of this when we booked the hol!

Reviews.Title: “Classy all the way”
Reviews.Author: lidss
Reviews.Content: Stayed Oct 3-8 with my girlfriend. Had reservations at Forum Tower but they upgraded us to the Augustus Tower for no charge (with a perfect view of the Bellagio Fountains) why? who knows... I've been upgraded and downgraded so many times over the years, I've just learned to be grateful when it works out my way. The room has a TV in the bathroom with a 2 person whirlpool tub, but watch out for the obligatory minibar, dont move anything or you will be charged for it, although its a bit much when they now have minibar items on the counter, which cant be moved either, it would easy to accidentally move them. Hey the place is just classy looking even in the hallways, the pool area is out of this world ans triking looking, although one thing I noticed is that during the autumn with the sun not directly overhead anymore, vast stretches of the pool area are shaded most of the day which can be a problem when its 80 degrees or below as it was when I was there. Didnt try the buffet but the Augustus Cafe was a cut above most coffee shops. The food was better than average and they actually took the time to present the food in a pleasing way which I found shocking for a coffee shop. The Forum shops were excellent, ate one night at Trevi there which had slightly offbeat Italian food, quite good. The casino is a little disjointed looking in spots and slightly small but it otherwise ok (slots are definitely tight but then again we go to Sams Town for better odds anyway) My theory is always go for a room thats not a standard room especially at a casino hotel, since you get what you pay for. I've stayed at Caesars in atlantic city, tahoe and now here and when you pay the least, you can get the least. so dont do that , splurge a little and you will always get your moneys worth at caesars, even if it is a bit more than other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “No Palace in my book”
Reviews.Author: MitchFindlay
Reviews.Content: We were spending time with a group of friends celebrating a couple of birthdays. The organizer got us group rate rooms on a Friday and Saturday night for $189/night. Caesars later through email offered us a $20/night upgrade to a "tower" room, which we gladly signed up for. Check in was smooth and very friendly. We were assigned to room 5310. I as astonished to think any of the towers had 53 floors, so awaited a spectacular view. The elevator started at floor 50. Imagine our amazement to get a room on the 3rd floor of tower 5. We overlooked the airconditioning system of the casino. The room was very nice looking, and quite modern, but we immediately requested a higher room, but no dice. So. we saved our $40 and took a "classic" room on the 8th floor. Much older room, smelled smokey, but comfortable and a decent view. However, the next night. Saturday, our neighboring room had a party going at 3 AM when we called security to complain. Five calls later, and an hour of waiting, the party was finally quieted. Not a good night. Don't expect anything for free here. No coffee in the room or in the lobby. Costs $4/cup in the snack shop or cafes. Juice costs $6. Oh, and don't expect me ever to stay at Ceasars again.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars came through”
Reviews.Author: dudleywysong
Reviews.Content: I was at Caesars Palace for a conference. I had checked in by text and went to the bell desk as instructed. Keys were not ready. So, I then waited in line to check in. Not a long wait. I was given a room in the Roman Tower. I tipped the reservations agent $20, as I usually do. He said that if there was any porblem with the room that I should come back and see him. The room was disgusting. And the hallway leading to the room smelled like someone had died in it. I am not one to complain, so I took the room and chalked it up to bad timing. C'est la vie. I went out for a couple of hours and returned later. On returning through the lobby, the agent who gave me the room when I checked in was still on duty, so I stopped by to see him. I told him that the room was pretty gross and was there anything else that he could do for me. He was extremely apologetic and immediately changed my room to one of the newly refurbished ones on the upper floors of the Forum Tower. I told him that I would move myself and was off the inspect the new digs. It was a great room with a Strip view and very nicely appointed. I guess it pays to speak up; but Caesars really did accommodate me with a very nice room and a premium view. Frankly, it is time to do something with the rooms in the Roman Tower. If the room that I was given on the tenth floor is any indication of the conditions of the rooms in that tower, Caesars should be ashamed to claim them as their own. They are old, dull, worn and dated. No modern fixtures, torn wallpaper, aged furnishings and just plain old. I hope that they do something with those rooms (tower) as it spoils the ambiance of what Caesars aspires to be.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: LesleyF2010
Reviews.Content: We went to Caesers for a wedding, tis hotel was amazing, check in took a while but then we were upgrded to a suite which was fab! Rooms were clean and spacious ans ours overlooked to Fountains of the Belagio. No coffee facilites though which was a shame you had to pay for it via the mini bar or room service, also no free wi-fi this was $14.99 for 24hrs. All the staff were very polite and well mannered and made our stay unfogetable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay On The Strip”
Reviews.Author: DaliLama
Reviews.Content: Me and my wonderful wife arrived at Ceasers around noon and had no problems what so ever checking in and our room was ready at the Augusta Tower overlooking the Bellagio fountains as requested. The Resort and pool are to die for! Everybody was polite and helpful with every request we had. The bathrooms were clean very large with a nice Jacuzzi bath and seperate toilet area. I have one recommdition I can say do not remove the vending out of the refrigerator bar I had stopped and bought a few adult beverages and stored them in the frig. And sat their products on the table there is flap trip door on each bottle of booze then after 24 hours they charge it to your room it added a $250 to my room but they politely removed the charge. The Resort is centrally located on the strip and close to everything I had read on trip advisor about how far people had to walk from their rooms hey everything in Vegas is big so be ready to walk it’s good for you. The first night we were at Ceasers I took my wife to see Cher perform she was fantastic! We first had dinner at Bobby Flays Mesa Grill it was awesome! Be sure to grab a burger at the Munchies bar. Also when visiting Vegas be willing to pay the prices on menu’s breakfast and lunches will cost $50 and dinner will be anywhere from $125 to $200 including tips but if your gambling and winning who cares.

Reviews.Title: “Not what a luxary hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: mburton0000
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to Vegas to celebrate completing my degree. Although we have been before, we usually stay at a lower level hotel (Bally's, Excalibur, etc). This time, however, my husband booked on Hotwire and selected a 4.5 star level. When we arrived, there was a sign stating that valet was full. Looking back we probably could have let them know that we were guests of the hotel and they would have let us in, but we didn't want to push it. As it was the taxis were blocking us in and trying to fit. My husband rolled down the window to ask an attendant (who didn't bother acknowledging us when we drove up) the best way to get to self parking from where we were. The attendant was very short with us and told us to just “drive around”. We did and after some serious ally driving found our way to the parking garage. Upon entering the garage, the sign said that self parking was levels 3-5, however, on the way up the ramp, levels 3 and 4 were blocked off. When we got to level 5, it was completely full, so we thought we’d maybe be able to go down to 4 and have some way to get in. We actually ended up out of the garage and had to try again. We finally found a parking spot on level 4 and we thought it was close to the elevators. We unloaded the car and walked over. There was no signage telling which level had hotel/casino access so we tried our luck with level 1. Upon exiting the elevator we found ourselves behind the casino in the staff entrance area: back to the elevators. Some very nice ladies (I believe they worked in the spa) showed us that the elevators we needed were actually in the opposite corner of the parking structure, so we set off. This time, we saw signs that said Casino with an arrow, but the signs were about 3 feet off the ground and obscured by the parked cars. We finally arrived at what we thought was the correct elevator; a sign outside the elevator stated “Casino access Level 3”. We thought this must be the spot. Down to level 3, we found that we were still in the parking structure, still with no way to get into the casino and still with arrows pointing to another elevator. Finally to the 3rd elevator, which definitely felt more like a casino, however there was no signage telling us whether to go up or down, the elevators were all full and we finally just had to jump on one and ride up until we could go down. The only sign that pointed to casino access in the elevator was the letter “C” as one of the button options. We were not alone in our quandary and actually had 2 other couples in the same situation we were in the parking structure. Once in the casino, we needed to get to the front desk. Not every signpost has a sign pointing to registration so it was kind of hit and miss. We asked a bellman who was walking through the casino where we could find the front desk and were told, “It’s at the front,” before he hurried off. Finally, we reached the front desk and were, after several minutes of waiting, greeted by a concierge. We told her we did not plan on ever staying with Caesars again even though this was our first time. When we recounted the short version of our story, she told us that as a walking concierge, she walks all over the casino floor and there are signs everywhere. We decided not to push the issue any further with the lady who checked us in. Finally, after over an hour (from the time we tried to valet park) we were in our room. In my opinion, this is no 4.5 star hotel. The glasses had lipstick on them, the shower head was coming off the wall, the TV was a very old model, we had no view other than the roof of the casino, we could hear anyone in the hall as well as our neighbors on both sides, and it took over 20 minutes for room service to bring us a bucket of ice. I will be avoiding Caesar’s Palace in my future stays in Las Vegas. It really is a shame, because they have a lovely pool (one of the best I’ve seen in Vegas) and a great spa.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas”
Reviews.Author: attislorenzo
Reviews.Content: The most beautiful hotel, whereever I've been in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Caesar's!”
Reviews.Author: VegasSusie
Reviews.Content: We were comped in the Forum Tower for 3 nights. Check in was very quick, got the room we had booked over a month previously, king nonsmoking. The rooms in the Forum Tower have been recently renovated, unlike the Roman Tower. We found the room very nice, bed extremely comfortable, bathroom spacious with a bonus TV built into the mirror. The shower had 2 shower heads, one an overhead rainwater type. The TV was a flat screen 42 inch. Our housekeeping lady, Luisa, took very good care of us. We had absolutely no complaints at all. The room was quiet at night. We had no view at all, just some rooftops with vents. Minor thing, really. We did not eat at Caesar's as it is way too expensive. Tried Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill last time and found it expensive and not wonderful like we expected- not even close. Sorry, Bobby. Also the casinos in all the Harrah's properties are tight. Don't waste your money there! For restaurants, the Cheesecake Factory at the very end of the Forum Shops is very good. It's a good 15-20 minute walk from the registration area but worth the walk if you've never been there. The aquarium in front of it is a delight. Overall, beautiful hotel to walk through, staff good, room nice.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be”
Reviews.Author: colemanv
Reviews.Content: My extended family and I just returned from a great 4 night getaway to this property. We had a junior suite on the 27th floor facing the strip. The room was very clean and had all of the expected high end amenities and furnishings. There are too many great things about this place to list so I will just say that you will not regret booking this property. The only drawback I can think of is that due to the sheer size of this place, older travelers may have difficulty getting back and forth to their room depending on which tower they are staying in. Prepare to walk, walk and walk some more. The spa and fitness center was great and worth every penny. The food was pretty good and reasonably priced. The slots and tables were tight but there are tons of places to go lose money. :) Happy gambling!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is the BEST place in Vegas. Must See!”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaBrown8
Reviews.Content: You can gamble anywhere, But only at Caesars can you be constantly entertained on every level. THE BEST SHOPPING on the planet at thier "Fourum Shops" which is a shopping mall in steriods! Also some of the best restaurants are there. Even if you can't afford to stay here, make certain that you at least visit the place it is a feastrfor the eyes!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace is like any other Las Vegas hote;”
Reviews.Author: Ordeal_seeker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars Palace to attend a conference; my wife joined me for vacation. The conference rate for a room was $159/night which was for a room with separate men/women baths in the Palace Tower. I tipped the desk clerk $50 to get an upgrade; he made a phone call; told me he had pulled a few strings to get us a junior suite. When we arrived at the room; it was nothing more than the room that was originally reserved - so the $50 tip was a waste. I had requested a room with a king size bed, but the room had two queen size beds, but since it was already very late, any bed looked good. The room was a large room and my wife appreciated the separate bathrooms - it also had a large walk-in shower. The internet at an extra $15/day worked fine. Overall the room was very nice and was clean. My wife enjoyed sitting by the pool, but since it was cool and rainy most of the week, there were never many people at the pool. The pool closed in late afternoon, so I didn't have an opportunity to use the pool. Good luck finding any nearby restaurant, not to mention a reasonably priced restaurant or even one with good food. Within a mile walk of the front door of Caesars, there are two malls with fast food joints. I ate breakfast twice at a cafe in Caesars that wasn't too pricey - about $15 for breakfast, milk and coffee. My wife and I ate at Mesa Grill one night - this is not tex-mex food by any means and it's very expensive. My simple meal of one drink, a salad and a meat entree was $70. We went to see Jersey Boys one night. I paid $155 per ticket; it was a very good show. The acting and music were excellent. From what I could tell the instruments were live, but the lyrics on some of the songs were lip-sync'ed. With the reserved seats, we arrived 10 minutes before the show and easily found our seats, which were 4 rows behind the orchestra pit, except there is not an orchestra pit, so we were really in row 20. The yellow section noted on the Pallazio website is just seating for casino VIP's. We also went to see Vegas the Show for a discount price for general admission tickets of $64 per ticket. The dancing was very good, but the music was poor. They should add some cast members - anytime a black guy sings Sonny Bono songs and white guys are Pips, the presentation lacks some authenticity. Overall the music impersonations were poor - the women match the original artists sound quality, but can anyone really sound like Elvis, Dean Martin or Wayne Newton? But the dancing was very good. I'm not sure it's worth $64 dollars. With the discount tickets we were advised to get there an hour early to get in line. We were about the halfway point of the line, but after we were seated there was only one occupied row behind us - not sure what happened to others in line, but there was no advantage to get there early. My wife went to the spa one afternoon and really enjoyed the $200 massage - it's good to know my hard earned money is appreciated. We didn't gamble much, but it was interesting to see how people waste their day at a digital slot machine. You don't even have to pull a lever anymore, just push the button. The volcano display at the Mirage and the fountains at Bellagio are worth watching if you are walking by, but not worth a special trip. We traveled by foot to places on the Strip. Cabs are pricey and waits are long, the metro bus rarely travels by and the monorail train station is a 20 minute walk from Caesars. So you will likely be limited to how far you can walk to get to places.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LOVELYLSV
Reviews.Content: We always wanted to stay at Caesar's - heard it was the BEST. Our "Classic" rooms,booked through Delta, were nice enough (no view), but the elevators were out of order from the 5th floor - we complained the first day, but they were never fixed. On day 4 - time to check out - we had to carry our luggage down 5 flights of stairs. That was a negative. Nice place to stay, but next time we will try a newer hotel as there are many to pick from. Also, at the VIP pool, there was extreme rap music being broadcast at such a high volume, we could not relax at the pool next to it. Very annoying and many people sitting near us were complaining. It never ended. Also, people smoking and stubbing out their cigarettes on the pool deck where children were entering the pool. We complained, and the attendant took an ashtray over to them. Why is smoking allowed?! - especially at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “2nd thumbs up for 1st class hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: a1copyguy
Reviews.Content: mixed this trip between business and pleasure. this was a rare 2nd trip to vegas in the same year for us but we were never as happy to return to a location as we were to stay at cp again. from the het limo driver who picked us up at the airport to the young woman at diamond check in we were treated with excellent service and smiles. even the bellstaff seemed to enjoy their jobs since we had to wait for our room and left our bags with them. as promised we were called when our room was ready and had virtually no wait to get our bags. our room 2872 in augustus tower offered us a fantastic view of the bellagio fountains. even our room which was as close as you could get to the elevators was very very quiet,not once did we hear any noise in the hallways from partiers or the cleaning staff. personally the buffett may be the only thing at this property that in my opinion could use some improvment. drink service was excellant in the casino and all the employees we had any contact with were helpfull and seemed happy to answer whatever we were asking. without hesitation ceasars palce will again be my selection on our next rip to vegas. tips...if you can,consider hiring the het limo from the airport,saves so much time and was the best 50 dollars worth of comps ive ever spent. gift shops are now selling bottled liquer so check them out befor wandering to the strip to purchase your in room booze.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay but it's all about the Diamond Club”
Reviews.Author: mafresch
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in the Agustus Tower an were very impressed with the room. Very clean and spacious. Disappointed in the fact that there was no coffee in the room. There was a coffee maker but you had to pay $12 for the coffee - 4 cups. We also noticed that it was all about the Diamond Club. Service was so-so unless you showed a Diamond Club card. We were there in early October and were looking forward to some pool time. Unfortunately, there were limited lounges in the sun - unless you wanted to rent one of their plush lounges - which were plentiful and not being used.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: vancouverFD
Reviews.Content: travelled to vegas with my best girlfriend on the 17th-20th, Everything was perfect! checkin(upgraded us to a suite) great staff, central to everything! Lots of friendly people. Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “A great stay, aside from incorrect bus information from concierge”
Reviews.Author: Honeytripper
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel a lot. It was certainly good value for the money, if you want something more than a standard hotel stay. I agree with the previous review about the room in the Palace Tower (we stayed in that tower, too). Our room was an upgrade, apparently due to an overbooked night, so it was a very good deal for us. We wanted some time for relaxation and we found the pool area beautiful, though the sun beds (for a fee) hogging so much real estate is a bit of a downer. Staff were friendly and the buffet was wonderful (good, fresh food). We bought the 24 hour buffet pass and made good use of it, though the other buffets did not live up to the standard set by Caesars. Our only let-down was that the concierge service steered us wrong, not once, but twice. The first time we were told to catch the gold bus heading south on the strip at the Bellagio stop (it was a long walk there and it was closed for construction). We actually could have caught the bus out front near the Colisseum! The second time we were told we could catch the shuttle to the Rio in the Paris driveway. Uh-uh, the stop was in the Bally’s driveway, again due to construction (another long walk back and then we just missed the shuttle). We told somebody at the Concierge desk about these mistakes, and although we were told that this information would be passed along, we were doubtful that they really cared about it. Perhaps information about bus service is too low-brow to worry about. Aside from that, it was a very pleasant stay at Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MikeB12
Reviews.Content: It took them over 3 hours to ready my room. Granted I was there a hour before check in, but it took them 2 hours after the official check in time. I had reserved a suit. The room was fantastic with one small exception, There was no view from the window. The have build another building about two feet from the window, We were on the 7th floor and looked out on a block wall. The glasses in the room had lipstick left on them from the guests before, They were never cleaned during our stay. In addition we had a no smoking room that smelled like cigarette smoke.

Reviews.Title: “GRAND!!.Best place to stay in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: ShikhirG
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located on the Las Vegas Strip..Location is very central to the strip so you can almost explore the entire area with much ease!.. The rooms were amazing.. the architecture will take your breath away.. especially the main shopping area.. The hotel is huge..and beautifully done up!..It has one of the best and the most magnificent casinos in whole of Vegas. Their Nightlub "pure" was an amazing experience too with a free entry for all hotel guests..we tried two of the hotel restaurants which offered excellent food!!.. Highgly recommended for your Vegas Stay!

Reviews.Title: “Went there once, wont do it again”
Reviews.Author: golfhoundOntario
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 11am and room was to be ready by 2 and was not ready until 6 pm. Room was only reasonably clean and a food tray sat in the hallway outside our room for two days. If you like sun, forget it because the buildings block the sun until late in the afternoon. Three drinks poolside cost $60.00 like everything else there which was overpriced. After 15 trips to vegas, it was nice to say we stayed there but it wont happen again. It seemed that no one was in any hurry to help or serve you and when you go to the front desk to bring something up they make you feel insignificant. Definately not a true 5 star

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room, amazing view, amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paulster951
Reviews.Content: I had booked a classic room (cheapest basic room) but had read that a $20 tip on reception would likely result in an upgrade. Lo and behold, after asking the fantastic receptionist if there were any complimentary upgrades available she switched us to a room in the Augustus Tower, 44th floor with the view of the strip and the Bellagio Fountains! I had asked her specifically for this, aiming high and hoping for something to come of it. I've read mixed reviews on the other towers at Caesars but Augustus is the newest one and let me tell you, the rooms there are amazing! A huge, very comfortable bed, twin sinks, a large shower and a whirlpool bath, along with plenty of space and storage. The room was spotless and the A/C was so quiet we hardly noticed it was on. The best part though was the view, right down the strip past the Eiffel Tower at Paris to the MGM Grand and of course those magical fountains. That room and view really made our holiday special and we'd definitely go back. The hotel was amazing, the decor was incredible and the Forum shopping centre especially was spectacular with the fountain of the gods and the fun new fountain show by the Cheesecake Factory (yummy!) We looked at most of the strip hotels during our stay and for me the only ones to compare as far as decor and location go are the Bellagio, the Venetian or the Pallazo - all of which are pricier than Caesars. I've only knocked a point off for service as we'd asked for champagne glasses to be brought up ($1 charge for each) but he arrived with regular glasses. When he came back though he arrived with the glasses, 2 ice buckets, one of which he'd filled with ice, and an ice scoop so I let him off!!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace...Expensive but Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Mountain_Man73
Reviews.Content: Extravagant hotel. Beautiful people. Expensive, but my job paid for most of it so well worth it. The pools were as advertised. Checked out the Venus Pool (topless) one day. Didn't gamble much here, went across the street to O'Sheas. Did the $20 tip and got upgraded to a Junior Petite Suite. I will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “ahhhhhh! a very romantic place for lovers.”
Reviews.Author: goddesslisa12
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed a week at caesars palace; where i stayed the last three days there alone... sole searching kind of thing..you know. i felt very safe inside the hotel alone. we were treated so well there by the hotel staff.. the rooms were also very beautiful, clean and very romantic. the beds..plush and crisp. many different places to eat..and fun around every corner. my husband loved waking up and swimming in one of the many beautiful and clean pools first thing in the morning. the spa is a must do....at least once, and as far as the casino being very smokey? it was. but it is a casino. my husband and i are non smokers and we just accepted the fact that many people still are. we enjoyed cher..very much and as far as the sun not reaching the pool..............i bet it depends on the time of year your stay is. i for one dont like being in the sun......so i was happy about that. the hotel was also very happy to accommodate us when we booked the wrong room. we ment too book a room with a tub but booked a huge beautiful shower instead. the hotel gave us a room the very next day that just blew our minds. it was a bedroom and bath and shower that was fit for a prince and princess. it was clean , crisp, huge and plush and had a view of all the pools below. when my husband left...i ofcourse went shopping and walking all over the hotel..which by the way is the size of a small town. i got lost every time i went down stairs...and the hotel staff...always gave me directions happily. i also have to say that i am also the type of woman who can get lost in her own shower on a bad day ..they do have many.....YOU ARE HERE .. posters all over the casino that gives you VERY clear directions to every part of the hotel...also information on EVERYTHING that goes on in the hotel. Will we stay there again? yes.

Reviews.Title: “The Casino Decor will blow your mind”
Reviews.Author: mikeyone
Reviews.Content: We found a week in Las Vegas was insufficient to take in the countryside and city as well. The casino hotels are in most cases astonishing in their decor and customer service excellence. The Caesars Palace has astounding displays of Roman statues, columns and artifacts. Evening lighting enhances the interior for the photographically minded. The foot print of the building is enormous. We felt that we were in four or five casinos under one roof. A plus is the self-serve free parking as in most casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Willow070
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars Palace in a classic room in the Forum Tower from Oct 3rd to the 7th 2010. I have severe environmental allergies as well as other health problems. I cannot say enough about Sara Smith, head of housekeeping, and her staff. They went above and beyond to make sure my room was free of allergens and fragrances. The beds were unbelievably comfortable and I slept better than at home. we were fortunate to be in a quiet area so that sleeping was never a problem. It is not true that the casino was very smoky. The gambling areas were spread out and the ventilation was very good for an older hotel. The pool area was beautiful and the layout of the 8 pools made for some interesting photos. The entire staff at the hotel was friendly and would do anything to help you and make your stay enjoyable. The only complaint I have is not with the hotel but with the Donny and Marie show at the Flamingo hotel. Donny Osmond cut the show short because Marie had had a fall backstage and injured her arm. There was absolutely NO compensation for the patrons. I paid full price for my ticket and did not see a complete show. Marie was ok and performed the next night. When I asked if we could enter the theatre the next night to see the last part of the show, all they did was give me a form to fill out .

Reviews.Title: “a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: earwig1000
Reviews.Content: is it just me or is this hotel a little run down-the location is central but in all honesty given the choice again i would stay in a modern hotel which is not relying on past glories to define itself-there is a decent pool area here but that is destroyed by the fact that they have about 3 competing sound systems blaring different music which simply results in giving you a headache-music from one was so loud you could hear it in the bathroom in our room on the 7th floor of the palace tower we should have had a view of the pool area from our room but the window was so caked in dirt you could barely see through it having visited other hotels where everything is cleaner and brighter i would not stay here again-vegas is tacky and meant to be this hotel is just shabby

Reviews.Title: “Caeser's a palace NO MORE!”
Reviews.Author: mln10
Reviews.Content: We have been to Caeser's 3 other times in the past 4 years. The last time we were here was 2 years ago. This is our 4th visit and the most disappointing. The place has changed considerably. It is obvious there are cutbacks and they are affecting the hotel. When we checked in, we were told they were going to "upgrade" our room. We thought how nice that was. Well, "upgrade" was not the case. We went up to the room in the Palace Tower and entered the "Junior Suite" they supposedly "upgraded" us to. The closet door was OFF the hinges! It was a like a bad motel! I couldn't believe a hotel like this would check people in a room when the closet door was off the hinges. We called down to the desk to ask for a different room. I finally spoke to someone after sitting on hold for 10 minutes. I explained the problem and that we did not need the "upgrade" to the junior suite and really liked the standard rooms in the Palace Tower. The woman on the phone said there were no rooms left. Ahhh, the real reason for us being put in a junior suite. BTW, the room is exactly the same, the junior suite has two small bathrooms instead of one large bathroom in the regular Palace Tower rooms. We prefer the one large bathroom actually. They moved us to another "junior suite" where the room was just run down. The bed is not comfortable, the pillows are awful. The room was not clean, a lot of dust! Stains on the bedskirt. There is a hole in the blanket on the bed. And, there is some kind of rust on the door frame of the bathroom that is eating away at the bottom of it about 3 inches up. Very noticeable. My husband complained at the front desk and was completely blown off. We checked in on Wednesday and still today (Friday) there is dirty glassware on the floor of the hall in the corner that has been sitting there! I wonder how long it has been there? I called for room service yesterday, 3 times, and never got an answer! There is no longer a turn down service, as there was 2 years ago. Basically, I used to love this hotel. It has changed! I will never stay here again. There are so many wonderful hotels to choose from in Vegas. Ceasers is sadly no longer one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: audiogirl222
Reviews.Content: My daughter had her destination wedding at Caesars and everything was wonderful. Our hotel rooms, the ceremony and catering were the best. The pool area is truly unbelieveable...I wish we had had more time to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “very smokey.”
Reviews.Author: SBBaker
Reviews.Content: We had not been on a vacation by ourselves in 9 years and chose Caesars because of location and thought it would be beautiful. It is only beautiful from the outside. We had a poor room, to say the least, two DOUBLE beds, NO view, old decor, bedding, etc. Also, of all the hotels we went in Caesars was definitely the smokiest of all. It was awful and hit you in the face as soon as you walked in. If you have a problem and you need to call the front desk, plan on being on hold for at least 15-20 minutes or never getting through. When we first walked out into the pool area we were very impressed, until after sitting there for three hours and the SUN NEVER coming over the building! Shade until 3:00 in the afternoon and then still not full sun! Talk about not studying the sun positions when they put what seemed like 4 floors too many on the building. We to one of the smaller pools, but not enough seating and no music at the other pool. Anyway if and when we go back to Las Vegas we definitely will not be staying at Caesars. The only thing good that we found there was Payard's Restaurant. Absolutely the BEST breakfasts I have ever eaten.

Reviews.Title: “Not fantastic, not horrible”
Reviews.Author: mecmom11
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, not dirty as some have written. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was spacious. There was a lighted make-up mirror which was a nice plus. I never opened the refrigerator because of the warning that if you even touch it, you pay for it. I never used the internet as I brought my Blackberry. The room was quiet except for hearing the doors slam most of the night. The service was spotty. The concierge was helpful, but in the buffet they mostly ignored people and took forever to process guests. I have never seen such a slow buffet line. We were on a strict schedule with a conference and by the time we finally got in we had only a few minutes to eat. The check in and check out were fine. The pools are nice and the location is great. There is a lot to do at Caesars. The ventilation at the casino is awful, so if smoke bothers you this is not the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: hmmNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: I recently booked Caesars Palace with an internet company Hotelsvision.com. On arrival at Caesars the reception staff could not find a record of my booking but gave me room keys and took copies of my e-mail confirmation and said they would check it out. Unfortunately for my daughter and I it seems this company have vanished. The staff at the hotel were great they switched on free internet and gave us the room at a reduced rate which enabled us to continue with our stay there. However they also said that if we wished to check out the following morning, there would be no cancellation charges. We were definitely treated more than fair and are very grateful to all at Caesars who made it possible for us to enjoy the remainder of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on the strip”
Reviews.Author: ShannonJLongBeach_CA
Reviews.Content: I always love coming to Caesars Palace. Great location on the strip - centrally located to everything - and wonderfully maintained, attractive property. The redesigned pools are beautiful with swimup blackjack (so fun!) and there are lots of great restaurants and a fabulous poker room. Oh yes, and the rooms are great, too! They have hands-down the best pillows I've ever had in a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: glowlo
Reviews.Content: first time staying at caesars,had read some bad reviews prior to travelling but i can honestly say i couldn't fault the hotel!! plenty of room round the pool,play the 1c machines we got our money back and more. try the 7 buffets in 24hrs for $39.99 plus tax if you do the total rewards card BUT DON'T have the buffet in the paris terrible service and food!!! all in all would definately go back to caesars palace and try not to believe all the bad reviews!!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at Caesar's for 5 nights and...”
Reviews.Author: Tarpgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar's for 5 nights and had the most wonderful experience! Perhaps it helped that this was a work trip for my husband so we weren't footing the bill :) I wanted to write about our upgrade experience. I had read several reviews on here about tipping $20 to get an upgrade and I had thought about that...but when I got to the front desk that just felt wrong somehow, so I took a different tactic: I was myself, bubbly and talkative and took an interest in the man checking me in. We talked for several minutes about his life growing up in Vegas and my life growing up in the Midwest. Thankfully he liked me so he upgraded us to an amazing suite in the Palace tower...2 bathrooms, huge jacuzzi tub, grea view of the pools, amazing bed, etc. It was a $500 upgrade for free! I was so thankful I THEN tipped him $20 which he was very grateful for. The rooms were just amazing, no two ways about it. The minibar wasn't too expensive, the movies were pretty cheap to rent, and I found the noise from the hall and other rooms to be at a minimum. I felt like a Queen!!!! We ate at Beijing Noodle and it was to die for! We also ate at the Palm restaurant in the Forum Shops and it was so decadent...sinful. For gambling I suggest Bills across the street...$5 blackjack and good drink service. Also take a cab (about $20) to downtown freemont street..amazing casinos, $5 tables and I found the slots to be much looser there. I will definitely stay at Caesar's the next time I'm in Vegas! Everyone we came in contact with helped us have an amazing stay...

Reviews.Title: “Fab”
Reviews.Author: beenaroundagain
