Reviews.Content: We got a free upgrade as we were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary....and wow! What a fabulous room! The hotel was amazing, clean quite pricy but worth every penny. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Valentino1546
Reviews.Content: Hi All We stayed at caesars for the first time after previously staying at the Wynn and Bellagio in previous visits We flew virgin from London staying in the yo hotel at gatwick note rooms are very small and be sure to know ure room mate well as toilet door is clear glass was like sleeping in a bubble but worth it when you wake to being a few yards from check in. Get to check in early book extra leg room For price and location Ceasars is great it's where the shows are shopping are ladies take a cardigan gets a bit cool with air con in casinos my room was upgraded on request check in staying in the tower rooms which were faultless.pool area is fine lots of beds never struggled getting a bed.the buffett is fine and reasonable priced for breakfast ques move quick,cheese cake factory in Ceasars is great for food alongvwith magianos on the miracle mile for a special meal go to hugos below the four queens on fremount st it's lovely excellent service and quality service and food.A fab new show which is $40 is Matt Goss in Ceasars Matt has reinvented himself and will once again rise to the top with an amazing band dancers and show The show was so good I went twice, think of a dark jazz club with the rat pack playing and you will be entertained all night by Matt and the dirty virgins dancers Matt is at the Albert hall in oct check it out Across the strip next to Irish bar are duelling pianos great fun where you give a $ for a song request it's busy and rocks all night a great holiday on a serious note when checking in they take your card number and $200 for a tab which I think is acceptable unlike the Wynn who took $1000 for one week and they wonder why they are half full

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel! Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: sassychloe
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very impressed with this hotel. Rooms were very nice and clean. The showers were amazing! My kids enjoyed the t.v. in the bathroom. Must see pool area. I've been back home less than a week and I am ready to go back! Thank you Caesars!

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay”
Reviews.Author: VicGolfer
Reviews.Content: Once again I had a happy stay at Caesars. Stayed in the Palace Tower which was a really nice room with big jacuzzi tub and nice room decor. The palace tower is really good for those who like the pool and it is very quiet. Staff were friendly and spa was good again

Reviews.Title: “dirty rooms .....”
Reviews.Author: thegermanIlinois
Reviews.Content: dirtiest room I have ever stayed in!! Was there for my nephews wedding had a 2 bedroom 3 bath unit was filthy the toilet ran over a number of times and the furniture was so old they couldnt get it clean if they tried!!they need to reire the tower we stayed in and quit ripping people off by the way the wedding was a distanation for two hundred guests eveyone had alot to say nothing good!!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reviews, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: HappygoluckyFlorida
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room in the new tower,with extra price. When we arrived, couldn't find us a room for some time. We ask in advance for a coffee maker. The next day I finally received one with the charge of 58.00, if you want coffee with the maker. But the main reason I am writing is to let you know about the housekeeping! My housekeeper was very nice,but not trained to be clean. She came to our room because I called the desk and told them our sink and bathroom floor had balls of hair. Our maid cleaned the stopped up sink, our toliet, moped, then with the same gloves on she carried in our drinking glasses and towels. She then used the phone to let them know our sink was plugged up. I was just sick after watching her clean. I called the desk and ask if this was the norm she said well we need to do some training in house keeping. Well I think it was bad enough to wear the same gloves from room to next room. Usually there are good and bad reviews---- we go and have a great time--- but believe the bad reviews this time. Our room with a view was of the parking lot. Four phone calls later we still had a sink of backed up water with hair in it. The next morning at 7:53 Am the repairman came and fixed the sink. Wifi will be 14.98 a day. ,

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again - too old and uncared for”
Reviews.Author: NYerUWS
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious with nice jetted tub and comfortable bed. Quiet at night in the rooms. HOWEVER, dust on the lamps and in the clock. TV dating back to the 14th century taking a full minute to change a channel; ridiculous lack of a coffee pot in the room which every other hotel in Vegas supplies; crowded; insufficient staff at front desk requiring long waits to check in and out; bill not inserted under the door prior to check out to allow problems to be resolved early; casino needs a major scrub. My biggest disappointment was how early everything closes - hard to find dinner after 9 pm here or in other hotels. The Augustus cafe was a lifesaver a couple of times when my meetings ended late. Food there was quite good, as was the Beijing 9 noodle shop. Felt like I was in the burbs everywhere else. Very overpriced. Sorry, I won't be back. I prefer the 4 Seasons, Wynn, Encore or Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “A hot mess.....”
Reviews.Author: roxymusic54
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a conference in January for the September conference. Arrived at the hotel, were told to come back after 5 because they were not checking people in yet, we returned and waited in line for over an hour to be told that there were no rooms available, and that we would have to stay in the Flamingo across the street for the night-for 55.00, but we could have a room on the following day. We had to haul our bags across the street, wait in another huge line, and in the morning haul our stuff back over to Caesars, we were exhausted, and missed the evening events of our conference due to the hotel overbooking so badly. Customer service is NIL.-especially the front desk and management. You were charged 12.00 if you wanted to use the Keurig in the room for coffee. The website stated that internet was available for a 'nominal charge" 14.95 a day in room, if you wanted wireless throughout the hotel it was 24.95 a day. Very poorly laid out and signage was poor also. This hotel was not worth the money, and our group recommended that we not return here as more than one person was displeased with the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Well Done - Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many properties in Vegas, and I found my stay here to be among the best. The hotel is clean & safe, the staff is warm and helpful, the pool complex is amazing, and the location (middle of the strip) is great. My room was well appointed, spacious, clean, comfortable, and quiet. Plenty of space to stretch out. I would have enjoyed free internet and in-room coffee (which you will never get in Vegas), and I found the alarm clock a bit counter-intuitive to operate, and the TV was a bit dated/small, but those are minor issues. I'd recommend this property, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: soozieb
Reviews.Content: Did a 5 night stay in January for a friends 50th, and while without a doubt CP is an iconic, visually stunning hotel - the lobby, pool area and shopping mall all amazing - the sheer scale and vastness just makes it a totally impersonal experience. Others in the group who didn't want to pay CP prices, stayed at The Imperial Palace, and despite this hotel being in a totally different ( much lower!! ) class to Caesars, we all spent much more time drinking and gambling there, as the staff really made you feel welcome, gave you beaming smiles and actually chatted to you, and the drink prices WAY cheaper!! If we could have had a mix of the two hotels - the friendliness and bar prices of the Imperial with the gorgeous bedrooms/bathrooms of Caesars, we would have been well happy :) Maybe we built it up in our minds too much before hand, but everything considered we all said Caesars and Vegas was a bit of a let down. It wasn't all doom and gloom - trip highlights included Cirque Du Soliel 'O' at The Bellagio which was just Amazing, Drinking champagne in The Paris bar/restaurant watching The Bellagio fountains, Big Elvis at Bills Gambling Hall (possibly the best Elvis tribute in Vegas?) and finally An all night 'small time' gambling session at The Imperial Palace :) It's difficult to rate properly, we didn't have a bad experience at all, but we just felt it was an expensive average experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: haleakala
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for more! Checked in LATE on a Monday night/Tuesday morning. Seemed to be some hold ups, even wit the very few people checking in at that late hour. We waited... maybe 15 minutes. Then Douglas told us they had our room ready, with two queen beds. (we had reserved a deluxe in the Augustus Tower) Husband told him we had asked for, and preferred a king. He made a call and we ended up in a "mini suite". This was a wonderful corner room with the short end nearly all window and another long window (on the strip) along the side. TONS of space, luxurious bath with glass cubicle shower, Jacuzzi, spacious vanity with double sinks and separate room for toilet. Bed was comfortable, pillows and sheets great. Could have used a little more plush bath towels, but that is nitpicking considering overall satisfaction with the experience. We have previously stayed at Luxor and NYNY. Found this hotel amenities and location FAR superior. We left room mid morning each day, returned early to mid afternoon and it had always been cleaned upon our return. The Augustus Cafe was VERY pricey for the type of place it is, but had breakfast their first morning and it was good. Had a late night dinner at Munchbar that was EXCELLENT. Good drinks, good food, reasonable prices. Never ate at the food court, but prices and selection looked good. Overall, we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible srvice worst ever”
Reviews.Author: bigdogroid
Reviews.Content: First after paying 500.00 per night we were placed in a horrible room. The service was lackluster and the employees are downright rude. I can not believe that they act as if they are doing us a favor and that the customer is unimportant.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place to stay and get married !!”
Reviews.Author: gymsusie3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace for 5 nights in August. We booked our wedding with Caesars Palace, Brooke, the wedding co-ordinator was brilliant and organised everything right down to the flowers, which took a lot of stress out of it ! We had a room in the Palace Tower, they upgraded us when we checked in - free of charge. The room was fantastic, huge bathroom, great big comfy bed and views of the pool with floor to ceiling glass. It was furnished nicely and just oozed quality. We would definitely stay here again without a doubt, we loved every minute of it !!

Reviews.Title: “No Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: flograp
Reviews.Content: Air did not work in room,told hotel of problem nothing done,room card would not work at times so a nice long hike to front desk for a wait in line up to re do the card,we upgraded for a nicer room and found it to be old decor and not that clean,have made many trips to Vegas first stay here and that will be our last NEVER Again !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is a complete joke”
Reviews.Author: bt21
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels within Vegas and this was, by far, the worst hotel I've ever stayed anywhere in the world. At first, I was really excited to be staying at the famous Caesar's Palace but past its extravagant marble lobby and forum shops, the entire place is a total joke! My friends and I made reservations for a top notch room but were given a ghetto room in the centurion towers because they had "overbooked" the hotel and were even sending people to planet hollywood. By the time we got to our room, the room was no better than a motel. Basically, the point I am getting to is that Caesar's tries to accommodate everyone (based on their reputation) but in the end, it has become a run down hotel. The absolute worst is their customer service. While cashing out casino chips, the teller literally gave me cut-eye for 1 minute, for no reason whatsoever, until I asked her what her problem was. She huffed, demanded I.D. and I had to eventually tell her supervisor that she could have just asked me for that in the first place! When I had stayed at ARIA earlier, I thought casino employees were going to impregnate me with their smiles alone! This was the worst hotel ever, I regret gambling and spending so much money in their casino...never again, will I contribute to Caesar's again. Plus sides: their swimming pool, location (bridge to Bellagio) and their shops. This was the worst hotel ever...go stay at ARIA, it was amazing there.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: hccrn2
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the pool is very nice and elegant. In fact its the best part of the entire place. I realize most people don't spend a lot of time in the room, but for the price of this room I expected a little bit of luxury. The bed was hard and I could feel the springs jabbing into me all night. There was no coffee maker in the room, even motel six has a coffe maker in the room. The tub was right out of the eighties and if I wanted to sit in it I had to bend my knees. The tv was also from the eighties. The party from the casino spilled into the hallway and neighboring rooms all night long. The saying of vegas never sleeps is right even if its not by choice. I tried to get a cup of coffee before my business conference and the hotel cafe that had breakfast and coffee was over run with twenty somethings that were completely inebriated and loud; some laughing, some crying, some just completely falling down drunk. I had to wait over a half hour just to get waited on while the waitress dealt with the drunk people. You have to pay for your airline check in , which at most hotels today this is free. Wi fi available; again at a cost. If I ever go back again I will stay at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - budget rooms for budget people”
Reviews.Author: Exmoorgirl
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the MGM and the Luxor. We thought by going to Caesars Palace we were going upmarket. Not so. The lobby is fantastic - marble everywhere; really impressive. The breakfasts are expensive (we spent over $40 for three of us) but really good.....you have to do it once at least. We booked a good deal online and were really pleased with the rate but it seems budget people get budget rooms. We were booked into the Roman Tower. We took the elevator to the tenth floor and walked along the corridor. There was an awful smell of damp - as if someone had done some washing and left it wet in the machine for too long. I rang from the room immediately but a disinterested voice told me she would send housekeeping up "with a spray". We did see someone with an aerosol later on - spraying the door frames! I doubt very much whether the smell was emanating from the woodwork. There was a fire hose point where the smell was strongest. The most likely cause was a leak. The smell was only in the corridor the first night but on the second it had penetrated the rooms and was really vile. I was pleased to leave the room. The corridor itself did nothing to invite you in. Narrow, dingy, low ceiling - it looked more like the servants quarters. And there was a breakfast trolley left outside a room for most of a day before it was collected. The rooms we had were dated, tired and showing signs of wear and the bathrooms were small. They certainly were not what we were expecting from the icon of the Las Vegas Strip. Ceasars was a real disappointment. Maybe the Augustus Tower is better and maybe if you pay more, this assures you a good room. The MGM is class. This isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, very expensive!”
Reviews.Author: ngagirl
Reviews.Content: We checked in early and our room was ready! When we booked the room 3 months ahead of time, we were to be in the Forum Towers but when we arrived, we were downgraded to the Palace Towers. Not sure why that was, no explaination from the staff. The room was very nice except for the view, it was the back parking. Big bathroom, oversized room. The location was great, near other casinos and eating establishments. Everything you needed was under one roof, if you could afford the prices!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stepsi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our first trip together in Vegas and stayed at Ceasars Palace in the Augustus tower and were appalled about the quality of service and the cleanliness of the room. First night there woke up scratching my body to find myself full of little bumps all over, rash like and when we complained they did NOTHING!!! After we paid $40.00/night to have a room upgrade for what...no kitchenette or free coffee, just to have a jacuzzi tub....totally NOT worth it. Would NEVER stay there again. The front desk was no help at all, they just did not care

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GembopBrighton_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars Palace in July. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite in the Augustus Tower, which was lovely. The room was incredible - Really clean, spacious, with a living, dining & sleeping area, massive bed, even a jacuzzi & TV in the bathroom! It was so luxurious! To top it off we had a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains which was amazing, really gorgeous, espcially at night! Caesars Palace offers loads of places to eat, drink, gamble & party & it is in a perfect location at the heart of the strip! Also the staff were very friendly & went out of their way to make us feel pampered & welcome. The swimming pool is also the best i have ever seen, really couldn't get enough of it! I cannot rave about this hotel enough, it was absolutely perfect & I will definitely be going there again & again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, would stay here again and again!”
Reviews.Author: klacey11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the end of August/beginning of September. We arrived at 1 and a rude manager (I'm assuming) turned us away-- I've been told my room may not be ready, but I've NEVER been not allowed to check in early. She was very rude in the way she spoke to us. We killed time by eating lunch in the food court, where the chef at the Mexican place was also very rude and made fun of me for not wanting lettuce/cheese/etc. on my taco (???). After this though, our trip was 100% perfect. Upgraded to a GORGEOUS Palace Tower room with his/her bathrooms, king bed, LCD TV, and pool view. Pool was absolutely gorgeous! Rates were terrific for a 4.5 star hotel, location on the strip was AMAZING! Since CP is centrally located, we were able to walk to so many food/entertainment options (including the shops at Planet Hollywood, which are great!). On the casino floor, the cocktail waitresses were super polite and friendly. The workers in the stores were all really helpful and nice, too. We would absolutely stay here again!! Can't wait for our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amazing Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethA3
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is perfect. I was very happy with the service, ambiance, shops, restaurants, ect. It's a little pricey, but the experience was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “never again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: biburns
Reviews.Content: we went to Caesar's palace for a bachelor party in September.. the casino is great , the shopping is great but the rooms in the Roman tower were terrible.. very cheap looking, very dated and dirty looking. i was not impressed at all. I've been to Vegas many times and stayed at some great hotels but this experience was the worst. not to mention over priced. on the other hand some of my friends stayed in the Augustus tower and had a great room, but they only got that cause they gamble a lot....Bottom line is that Caesar's lost a good customer..

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TonyMCanada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ceasars' Palace hotel from Aug 08 to Aug 12 and we had an amazing time together. Everybody was helpful and respectful. The only downside is that we had arrived on Sunday around 5:30pm and I had a show to attend at 7:00pm. To our surprise our room wasn't ready yet. we did complained to them saying that was unacceptable and immediately they upgrade my room without charging us extra, which although disappointing from a very reputable hotel, but nice from them to immediately help us on this issue. Besides that, everything was amazing, the food was great, the environment very nice and lots of family. We loved the pool and wish could stay more. We loved the location as well, we were right in the center of the strip. We would definitely recommend this hotel and go back another time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: chadplusplus
Reviews.Content: I understand that the purpose of a casino is to take your money, but ideally, a casino would do so subtly while entertaining you and taking care of you. Caesar's has seemingly forgotten this second part. It all appears very nice and accommodating, but upon closer inspection, it reveals itself as merely a facade. Upon check-in, the desk clerk asks how your trip was and a few other pleasantries, which seems nice, until you hear the other desk clerks ask the same exact questions as if they're reading from a script. The casino floor is well lit, clean and inviting, but good luck finding your way around and ignoring the awful pop music blaring 24 hours/day. The restaurants all look delicious, but good luck researching them beforehand. There's a surcharge for wifi, menus weren't available in the room, and the interactive kiosks located throughout the casino floor provide little information beyond location and logo. Everything is designed to force you onto the casino floor. (FYI, if you choose to stay here, Cyprus Street (may be inexact name) is the food court for quick and cheaper meals.) Beyond that, my wife had a bad experience with a waitress at the pool area and I had a bad experience with one of the counter guys at the sportsbook. The first day there, we were exhausted from traveling and was looking for a quick meal. Unable to do any online research as to the layout of the hotel, I just tried to wander around looking for a place with take-out. I found "munchbar". Forty minutes after ordering, my $40 worth of burgers and fries were ready and when I arrived back in my room, I discovered that they had screwed up and put cheese on my lactose intolerant wife's burger. So yeah, that was awesome. In sum, Caesars looks very nice, but lacks personal touches that could have made our stay really enjoyable. Its difficult and frustrating to do anything other than gamble - but here's the hook to you Casino owners and investors: if I'm enjoying myself otherwise, I'm going to be more willing to gamble. You would have gotten more out of me if you'd had made me feel good in the process.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a king (or queen) at Caesars Palace...and still get by on the cheap!”
Reviews.Author: gamblingggirl
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I go to Las Vegas 2-3 times every year and we always stay at one of the Harrah's properties - we like Bally's, Harrahs, Caesars, and Flamingo. Of all the Harrah's properties, Caesars is our favorite! The Total Rewards program for members is great. As Diamond members, it's nice to feel special and our rooms and other perks are comped. The hotel and casino are beautiful and the pools and restaurants are outstanding. Service is always friendly and attentive. The casino host "assigned" to us before our trip was not all that helpful for tickets or for planning a wedding renewal. I am a good researcher so I planned it myself and we had a wonderful time once again at the wedding alter! Don't forget to check out Tickets 4 Tonight where you can get 1/2 price shows and dinners. There are several locations on the strip. Get there early before the lines. It is a great deal! We never pay full price for shows or a good meal at a fine restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevhfmnn
Reviews.Content: It's a nice Hotel but for what we had paid I would have expected more service, I am sure you get that once you are one of their VIP Card members, better Check in etc but still. Probably would stay at another Resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality and what a bargain!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jhayward10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superb and everything we expected and more. Despite the problems we had booking in we were upgraded from the Forum Tower to the new Palace Tower for our troubles. We were given a Suite that was massive with 'His' and 'Hers' bathrooms, with a jacuzzi bath and found having our own bathrooms pretty cool!!!The bed was so comfortable it was hard to get out of bed in the mornings! The hotel has everything you could ask for and like many hotels in Vegas is very cheap at around £55 a night. The hotel has so many swimming pools of high qualitiy and the standard of the hotel and cleanliness is next to none. We also found the shopping in the hotel to be fantastic and the service throughout the hotel was superb!!! The only negative was the business centre which was a total rip off, but everything else was fantastic. Everything surrounding the Caesars Palace is amazing. It's on the main Strip so is close to all the major attractions (e.g. MGM Grand, Venetian, Bellagio etc). The Bellagio fountain is an excellent spectical and very romantic (perfect for proposals!!!). The Grand Canyon is not very far and well worth doing the Helicopter option.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's will never get our business again---EVER”
Reviews.Author: AJM69064
Reviews.Content: We are local residents of Las Vegas and own a local business. We closed our store at 7 p.m. the night we were attending a show at Caesar's and did not have time to eat before we went to the concert. We grabbed a bag of organic almonds on which to munch on the way and then I put them in my purse for safe-keeping. When we arrived at the showroom, we were VERY RUDELY told to "take the almonds to our car or we wouldn't be allowed in the show room." I was never so shocked in my life - not only at the fact that a "hypoglycemic" was denied the right to have a bag of almonds in her purse, but, by the way we were treated. After all, Caesar's is supposed to be a class act! To add to our disappointment, when the concert was over and everyone departed, we all headed to the near-by restrooms....only to find them CLOSED FOR CLEANING! Who, in their right mind would close restrooms when a full showroom was being emptied??? Sadly, I must also advise you that there was not ONE employee in the entire casino who was "friendly" or "seemed to care about the customers". In these bad economic times, I feel it is even MORE urgent and important that we extend every courtesy to our customers/guests! We will not be planning on returning to Caesar's for now, anyway. There are too many other grand casinos to take our out-of-town company to in Las Vegas. And when I wrote to Caesar's, we got "blown off" with the usual generic excuses.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cath333
Reviews.Content: Booked with Expedia and had a basic room in the Forum Towers but what is basic in Caesar's is more luxurious than anywhere else I've ever stayed. The room was large with a king sized very comfortable bed. The bathroom had a TV in the mirror and walk in shower. No noise could be heard from other rooms. Was really impressed with the restaurants I ate in. Payard's is a bit expensive but well worth it for a delicious breakfast, We sat in the bistro but a take away option is also available which is cheaper although very popular. Also ate in Beijing Noodle No. 9 which we had to wait a while for a table but was well worth it. Serendipity 3 had the best foot long hot dogs. Been to the original in New York and this is every bit as good. Only went to the pool once but there is plenty of room for everyone and a choice of pools. The extra large jacuzzi was especially relaxing. The location of Caesar's is perfect in the middle of the strip. Connected to the Forum Shops. The Bellagio is next door and it is easy to access the monorail from Flamingo's opposite. Will definately be staying here on my next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The best balance on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: MikeInFLL
Reviews.Content: Reserved about 3 weeks in advance through Total Rewards discount offer by mail. Offered rate was not available but I was advised to call again to see if there were cancellations. After 2 calls, I got the rate of $117 Friday, $117 Saturday, Comp Sunday for a basic room. Checked in with Texpress, which does not allow you to choose your room/tower. Arrived at 10:30 am, keys were to be at bell desk by noon. Instead, went to lunch at Spago (try the Thai Chicken Salad) and went to the check in line at 1 pm (5 minute wait), did the $20 trick, and got an awesome room in the Augustus Tower. Accepted a smoking room; no smoke smell at all. Snack at Munch Bar (Fish tacos not good, regular fries and sweet potato fries perfect), some time at the Blackjack and Roulette tables (came home even; not bad). Dinner at Olives (don't miss!) then a casino tour. Stunned by Aria; I can't wait to stay here. Fun Pussycat Dolls tables outside Pure. Line going into Pure was not pretty. Awesome late night drinks at Shadow. Woke up Saturday with a tiger in the bathroom. Had a little room service breakfast, a nap, then went to the spa ($45). DO NOT MISS THIS SPA! Perfect hangover cure. Then out to the pool which was very fun, great Dragonberry Mojitos ($20 each?). Off to the Mirage to see Love (highly recommend) then SW Steakhouse at Wynn. Four guys shared the Porterhouse for Two ($100?) and left some on the table. Don't miss the truffled corn. Walked through Mandalay, Luxor, Excalibur. Not worth the walk. Back to Ceasars for more time at the tables. Slept in Sunday (great beds, quiet rooms, dark curtains, never saw housekeeping but room was serviced every day), lunch at Serendipity (just OK), walked to the Fashion Show mall and back, then a snack at BLT Burger at the Mirage (also recommended). A little nap and back to Aria for understated elegance, class and $10 Blackjack. Monday back to the spa (it was that good, also 2 for 1 with my package), lunch break back at Spago (also worth hitting twice), back to the spa then a walk across the street to Imperial Palace. Fun and a little trashy, but lost $200 there where I was even at Caesars and Aria. The cheap always becomes expensive! Grabbed by bag and off to the airport. Keep in mind that Caesars is huge and pretty impersonal. Not the best selection for a special event, romance, wedding or anyone who is looking for exceptional service (like at Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, etc.). Overall, Caesars has the best balance of location, price, room selection, pool, casino, food, bars and shopping. Bellagio and Wynn are nicer, but a little sterile. You could go a step down and save a little on the room, but you lose a lot. I would like to stay at Aria, but I think Ceasars is the best all-around casino/hotel in Vegas. I'm already planning my next trip in November!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not Great”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeAlum
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying at Caesars for our fantasy football draft; I still find Caesars to be one of the best spots in Vegas based on the location and its style. This is the first time I have stayed here and found the service to be subpar. An example was at the Noodle place on the Casino level... the hostess was not able to seat us (four people) for several minutes though there were tables open, it took more than 10 minutes for anyone to ask for a drink order and another 10 for them to arrive... 10 more to place our order, etc... the food was very good though! Same kinds of things with our room cleaning staff, the staff at the buffet, the concierge desk and the cocktail waitresses.... everything just seemed to take a bit too long... or be off of what you would expect. The one place we had great service was the Venus pool... bar staff and others did a great job. I stayed in a Senator suite in the Palace tower and found the room to be just OK. Carpet and furnishings were well used... TVs did not have high quality pictures... bed was very comfortable... bathrooms were clean, but little things like leaky faucets and shower doors... doors that don't quite close right... dining room table with heavy scratches and marks, chairs with old cushions, etc. I still love Caesars, just a little disappointed this time!

Reviews.Title: “Had To Leave - Couldn't Provide Requested Double Beds - Wanted to Give Us a Cot”
Reviews.Author: HoustonCountryMan
Reviews.Content: Staedy at Caesars twice before and the service was ok, but this trip ruined it for me. I have a Platinum Players Card that comped me 3 free nights. I was staying there 5 nights and was paying for the last two. I am traveling with my wife and friend, we to the front desk and they tell us there are no double beds in this entire hotel. Mind you double beds were requested upon reservation and confirmed over the telephone. The front desk rep in the platinum check in line told me there is never a guarantee on beds at this hotel and this is on there web site. I understood this, but never thought they would act like this. I was told We could get a king bed and a cot delivered. I refused and the rep called a manager on the phone and came back with the same. We took the room after being in line 20 minutes. Upon arriving in this small room where there was no where for a cot to fit besides in front of the front door, which is a fire hazard we called and requested a manager. The manager whom we spoke to was rude, nasty and even told me my platinum players card meantr nothing. He hung up in my face when I asked for his name. We called back asked for another manager that was better accomodating but still gave us no help. I asked for comps to accomodate the rudeness of the other manager and he wouldnt until he reviewed the call. I was glad he was doing so, but this was rude not believing the customer. . The manager agreed to comp $75 to the room, which is nothing. Still no double bed. Lol. In return I decided to leave and stay at a newer hotel which honered my comps with no problem and treated us excellent. I use to love Cesaers, but will never stay or gamble there again. Lesson 1 do not go to Ceasars If you want to gurantee your sleeping arrangement! Never had this issue at any other Vegas Hotels and we go alot. All other hotels have always accomodated our sleeping arrangements - especially having a players card. Good Bye Ceasars!

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel, lacked the personal touch”
Reviews.Author: ci1705
Reviews.Content: It's a very big hotel which makes it noisy, busy and lacking in the personal touch. The room was great, no fault there, bathroom was really big. As we arrived, there was no one to help us with our bags and check in queues were long. On check in we weren't asked if we needed help with our bags so we made the very long trek through the hotel and casino to our room without help. I highly recommend you get help with your bags as it is a large hotel and the palace tower is a hike from reception. Planet Hollywood restaurant in the Forum shops was great value for food when comparing other eateries at hotel. If you prefer a room with a quieter atmosphere you need to stay in the Augustus Tower as you don't need to walk through the casino as much.

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DW2_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars and were completely astounded by the beauty of this wonderful hotel. We checked in without any trouble and were upgraded to The Augustus Tower overlooking the Bellagio fountain. I don't know what the other towers are like but the room in the Augustus tower was huge and the veiw was spectacular. Would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peckhamgirl
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at Caesars from 17/08-23/08/2010. Have nothing bad to say about the hotel. Arrived and didnt have to wait long to check in, receptionist realised from my passport that my bday was in 3 days time and gave us an amazing room in the Augustus Tower. We were on the 33rd floor and our window over looked the Bellagio Fountains and of an evening with the lights and the fountains - the view is spectacular. Room was huge, massive bath and shower. Twin sinks and seperate toilet. Fully stocked mini bar - didnt use as its very expensive but thats to be expected. Casino - I didnt play the tables here but I did play the slots and I cant complain. One day I put $24 in a machine and won $558 and the next I put $10 in and won $111....all in all I was happy! Pool - Absolutely amazing!!! water is cold but it was so hot we didnt mind. The whirlpool is a huge jacuzzi and very warm water - lovely!! They have club days at another pool which I think you have to pay to enter - we didnt go in but you dont have to as you can hear the music at the other pools anyway! Food - Only place I ate in here was the noodle place with the massive fish tank at the entrance - food was delicious - would recommend the clay chicken!! The bar near reception is really nice - just opposite the bell desk. Really nice staff, nice and relaxed atmosphere. Pure nightclub is really good and if your a guest you can always get in but you do have to pay - queues are MASSIVE. Music and service inside is really good though and worth a visit. Shops - The shops are out of this world - cheesecake factory is a MUST!!! Best and biggest cheesecakes ever. Only complaint I have is that in the early hours of my last day I got into the fountain which is in reception for a quick photograph and got really told off by a large man who I can only assume is a manager.....whilst I will admit to be slightly drunk and yes maybe they dont want people in their fountain - he could have politely asked me to get out. Instead he told me to leave and even when I explained I was a guest he still told me to go to my room, get my things and leave! I didnt. I personally just felt that this was slightly over the top, I am sure I am not the first and I am sure I wont be the last person to get in the fountain. On top of this there are no signs asking people not to get in it and nor are there any barriers to prevent it. Anyway all in all thats the only negative thing I can say - I loved my stay here and would 100% advise people to book it up!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay in Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: vegaschick16
Reviews.Content: Everyone at Caesars was very friendly and helpful. Don't listen to all the negative reviews. I would really recommend getting the 24hr Buffet which can be used in 6 other hotels, Paris hotel has best buffet. The pool was great but get there early cuz it fills up pretty quickly. Shopping was great. I don't really recommend Pure nightclub, although my friend and i were treated well but we noticed some "less attractive" people treated poorly. Go to the Voodoo Lounge in Rio Hotel instead or even XS at Wynn Encore hotel. For shopping, take the gold line bus to down town and shop at outlet shopping mall, great deals! When you smile and are friendly you can almost get anything from anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: kitten81360
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice room comped for 2 nights. Tight slots. Buffet don't waste your time.

Reviews.Title: “Huge!!”
Reviews.Author: mixalakh
Reviews.Content: I was keep loosing my way. It is a huge hotel. I had a hard time to find my room almost every time.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a lot and got even more”
Reviews.Author: BigAlFromSoCal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars for my first time. Arrived and staff was very friendly. While checking in the front desk employee noted I was there for a week long conference and he moved our room to the tower that also held the conference centers. At the same time he must have upgraded us as I already booked a nicer than standard room however the one we had was a notch above that. Conference staff were very friendly and the hotel is a lot of fun. Plenty of great places to eat and tons of shopping. Pool is a little tame for Vegas however it's very family friendly. I will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Service”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler1980
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived at Caesars it took 20 mintues to reach the front desk becuase they were so understaffed. Then they told me my room that I had book was not ready and asked me to wait one hour. After returning to the front desk after an hour my room was still being "cleaned" and I was asked to wait anoter 15 minutes. There was no apology or comp. or any attempt to make up for their lack of service. The sofa in my room looked dingy as did the bathroom. Not dirty per se but not clean either. The only pro is that it is located in the middle of the strip so you can have easy access to the other hotels. Very poor service and casino is full of smokers. And do not be fooled by their no resort fee line. This just means they charge for gym, internet access and anything else they can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lkbNorthDakota
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights this month, and absolutely loved it! Check in was very smooth, and got the room we requested. Everyone was so nice and accomodating, from the bell boy holding our luggage until our room was ready, to all the waitresses we encountered. Hotel was beautiful, and very clean. Location was perfect, centrally located to everything on the strip. Taxis are always waiting outside if you need one. We stayed in the Augustus Tower, and would definitely stay there again. It was located close to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “My wedding outshined Chelsea Clinton”
Reviews.Author: WebD0ct0r61
Reviews.Content: My wedding package at the Classico chapel at Caesars was spetacular. This was absolutely a first class treatment that included a couple's massage,$200 in food credit, $300 in floral arrangement, limo ride to courthouse, photography package and a 2 night mini suite room which I extended to 4 nights. The photos with Caesars fountains and statues were breathtaking. Also a DVD and B/W photos were selected as well. Hail Caesar! My bride and I felt like stars. Thanks Melissa for being Caesars wedding coordinator.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay @ Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: Travellerforlife
Reviews.Content: We were booked for at the Forum Tower but got upgraded to the Palace Tower. The room was huge and very clean and modern-looking. The beds were very comfy. Big jetted tub, stand-up shower, nice bath accessories. Casino was not bad. Make sure you sign up for Total Rewards - it really pays off. Points can be used to pay off your hotel bill or help you get more hotel comps. Love the new Lord of the Rings slots. Fun slots that keeps track of where you left off.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded, tremendous stay”
Reviews.Author: HeyMac
Reviews.Content: Arrived and was immediately upgraded upon simple request to an Augustus Tower suite overlooking the strip. I had stayed in previous towers before, and wow what an upgrade the Augustus is. It's like a completely different hotel. Room servicing was prompt and unobtrusive. Room was very well appointed with gratis champagne delivered every night of my stay. This is the only place I will stay in Vegas from now on.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franki00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ceasars from the 2nd of August to the 6th of August and we were in the Palace Tower deluxe room and it was fantastic - large bathroom, comfy bed, lots of space to move around - housecleaning was great nice and clean every day early. My only complaint would be the pool and the complaint is that other people not staying at the hotel can use Ceasars pool so you have to get down to the pool area by 8:00 am to get your chair but other than that no complaints- check in was a breeze -fellow helping us was so nice. One really nice bonus was when my hubby picked our chairs by the pool we were in front of one of those lovely cabanas and very shortly later the individuals who had that cabana showed up - Rod Stewart and his family - he was so incredible - let me get a picture taken with him as well as numerous other people. He was very friendly with everyone. Since I am a fan it was a pretty special moment for me. Overall Ceasars is our choice to stay when we are in Vegas - they treat us well. One tip I would give is get a Total Rewards card - I think their comps are by far the best. The location is fantastic and even though it is a huge place eventually you get your bearings. Lots of food choices - food court is a good standby and the prices are reasonable. We are going back before Christmas or for Christmas and will be staying at Ceasars.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Caesar's, swim at the Pool, Gamble at the Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: heeler1
Reviews.Content: Once you are through a long wait to check in, Caesar's will be a haven for the rest of your Vegas experience. Make sure your room is not in the Roman Tower which is yet to be renovated. One of the deluxe rooms in the Palace Tower will be clean, well appointed, pretty sound proof with a large bathroom and simply the most comfortable beds and pillows. (an opinion shared by another couple on the trip with us, their room had equally comfy bed and pillow they say) In the mornings, do NOT go to the cafes in the casino for your overly expensive coffee and tasteless muffins, or spend 10 dollars for a yogurt parfait at one of the other coffee express places. Instead, sit down for breakfast at Payard's which is one of the restaurants near the conference center lobby. It will not be cheaper, but it will be better! Excellent coffee, delicious omelets for the same price as the coffee in a styrofoam cup and a muffin made out of mix #5. Plan on 20 dollars EACH for breakfast for sit down 15 dollars for a coffee and a muffin...you do the math. Make sure you take advantage of the pools at Caesar's. The main pool is enormous, you can get up early and secure your chairs for free or shell out a lot of bucks to rent a daybed that is yours and yours alone. Excellent poolside bar service and the lunch menu is affordable and GOOD, good value from the pool lunch menu for sure. If you are over 21, take advantage of the Venus pool club. There is often an expensive "cover charge" for using this private pool area, it accepts only 150 or so guests and allows topless sunbathing. It is much less frenetic than the main pool. IF you get there when they open, they often waive the cover and you can secure your pool side chairs for free, or rent a day bed for several hundred dollars or for nearly a THOUSAND dollars, rent a cabana (you don't need to, really!) Bar service is excellent although drinks as always are pricey. (by the way, the best cocktail they make is the MaiTai, but you can have anything you want). Bar and service staff are friendly, polite and go out of their way to help you out. Music by the pool is current and good, although occasionally loudish. Pool is clean and warm in the Venus area and security does an excellent job of ensuring that no drunken louts ruin your experience. People watching at Venus pool is entertainment in itself. We found gambling fun next door at the Bellagio to be a bit of a better experience than at Caesar's. Drink service was MUCH more prompt and friendly and the variety of tables and slots was more extensive, although we have to admit that the guys working the craps tables at Caesar's were friendly, knowledgeable and fun. Night club experience at Caesar's was hit and miss. Shadow bar is a waste of time after about an hour when the novelty of a girl dancing behind a screen has really worn off, with extremely poor drink service. Cleopatra's barge is busy high energy and dark with expensive drinks (all drinks are in Vegas) but pretty good dancing. PURE is the much advertised night club, but full of teeny bopper types, a VERY young crowd. (Isn't the drinking age 21?) If you are a shopper, the forum shops are heaven! We loved walking through and ladies, for a magnificent shopping experience with a very personal touch, go to Michael Kors Shoe Store. Without a doubt the best service we have ever had shopping. In the words of the manager "we know you can spend your money anywhere and we really want you to spend it here so it is up to us to look after you". Nirvana. However, overall we would definitely stay at Caesar's again, the value per dollar for the room and pool complex combined was good.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Tower very nice, good stay”
Reviews.Author: redheada1
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had three rooms in the Palace Tower. The location was close to the pool and restaurants, very convenient. The rooms were big, nicely furnished, and very clean. The mostly-marble bathroom was large with a separate toilet room and large marble shower. The jetted tub looked nice, but I didn't use it. The only thing keeping this from being really 4 stars in my book was the mattress. The bedding was ok, but the mattress was not of the quality of the Bellagio. Not the worst mattress I've had in a hotel, but not the best, either. We had no issues with service and enjoyed the pool. Too many kids at the pool, but that's to be expected in August.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: shakiraCrowborough
Reviews.Content: This hotel was my husbands choice, as it is iconic. I did say you pay for iconic and you do, through the nose. The beds were not comfortable at all, feather pillows, where the feathers kept escaping from! We asked for others and they duly arrived and were ok. Room was ok, good size, there was actually shower gel, products ok not brilliant. food very expensive in hotel a little pot of yoghurt was $4.00, we would have for breakfast a croissant each, 2 hot drinks and 2 juices and this would cost about $45.00, We did not have the WOW factor on entering the hotel, we looked at others ie the Bellagio and The New York to name a few and they were much more impressive. Rooms are fairly quiet. I was most disappointed with the pool areas, as one is not meant to reserve sunloungers, but the thing that happened was that people did not clear up their towels when they left so it looked as if the seat was still taken. The earea around the pool is not big enough and what there is was being taken over by their special beds, you had to pay extra for. They have these cabanas, a bit like a gazebo with 3 sides covered, you get a few drinks a few bags of crisps, a ceiling fan, this will set you back a neat $350.00!! The staff are unhelpful and there is a lot of mess around the pool, half empty drinks, spilled drinks food that has been left. I know it is due to people not clearing up after themselves but there is no staff to this either. Lots of gambling if this is what you are there for even in one of the pools. The thing that got me most as we Brits are used to non-smoking, is the smoking everywhere in the hotels and inside buildings, i had forgotten how awful this is. The hotel is too big, on our way out we found another part we did not even know excisted...

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel - you can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: ILLV
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and they upgraded us to a suite with a hot tub for free - without us asking. We stayed in the Forum Tower. The elevator to the room is right off the casino by the Forum Shops entrance. Parking is free as it is at every casino. Check in was very fast. I don't recall there even being a line. They had many employees open. The shops and restaurants are great. (Bobby Flay's) Mesa Grill is excellent. Cheesecake Factory is always nice for a quick bite you can share - portions are so large. Pass on Wolfgang Puck's restaurant. Nothing to write home about. Great location to shop and eat. Their theater is enormous. We have seen Jerry Seinfeld and Cirque's "O". Very nice hotel. Well worth the expense. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned after spending 7 nights in...”
Reviews.Author: Ihearttheusa
Reviews.Content: Just returned after spending 7 nights in Caesars palace. Booked this hotel as it was categorized as 'luxury', however we were very disappointed with what we recieved. We upgraded our room to a deluxe as we were informed it would include a spa tub, it didn't- not only that but the shower was one of those combi things over a bath that kept falling down whilst trying to wash as there was no power in the water flow. I dropped some crisps on the carpet on the first night there and they were still sat mashed into the carpet along with other bits of dirt and fluff on our last day! Which means our room was not vacuumed for our entire 7 night stay- not something you would expect of a 'luxury' hotel. My partner users a wheelchair and found it quite difficult to move around the hotl hotel due to it being entirely carpeted (other than forum shops area), also none of the disabled lifts worked throughout the hotel so we were forced to go long the long way round, which really is long as the hotel is huge. We booked a day bed at the pool at a cost of $200 and were promised a host would visit us every 10 mins to check if we needed anything/bring drinks. We saw him twice in 5 hours and were annoyed to find that a $30 gratuity charge was added to the bill. We ate in Neros on our first evening and found the service quite poor, our waiter spent whole time fussying around a table of business as he obviously saw a potential big tip. Found this quite annoying as meal wasn't cheap- £100 for 2 with only 1 glass of wine on bill! On a positive note, the hotel has excellent amenities, many restaurants of ranging price brackets and also has a cheaper food court for when money is getting low!. The forum shops area is great, all the big names and it's just like a dusky street indoors as the ceiling is painted to look like sky. There's a great fountain show near the cheesecake factory which runs on the hour. The location of the hotel is great - right in the middle of the strip, next door to bellagio and Mirage, and about 10 mins walk from Venetian and Planet Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “hmmm.... Not!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler9999999
Reviews.Content: our group was in the Roman Tower... someone left a rag in a shower curtain... it fell when the curtain was pulled. i found a receipt beside my nightstand. the jacuzzi exterior needed painting... it sounded horrible when i filled it with water, when it was running and when it drained. the mechanical portion of the jacuzzi had doors inside the bathroom... when i arrived one of the doors would pop open when you entered the glass bathroom due to pressure. someone else from our group.... their toilet somehow fell over with him... if it hadn't been such a small room, he would have been in the hospital from the fall. the attached to the wall hairdryer didn't work, but later found another one in the room. there was a frame to a vanity mirror that was no longer there. my room was smaller than the other two rooms... I had a view and two chairs... she had a couch and three chairs and a table with no chairs... and I think the other guy had the same size room as she had. he complained about the bright vanity lights... i had a lighted portable vanity mirror... she didn't, but i ordered her one at no charge. the weatherstripping was falling off the door across the hall from me. Two glasses sat outside for over 24 hours. The Augustus restaurant served $6 bowl of basic cereal... $15 grilled cheese, well... it did have Brie... the fries were cold and sometimes so was the burger. The food selections were much better next door at the Mirage. The best dinner there was at the Hyakumi Japanese restaurant had a wonderful Chilean Sea Bass. Caesar's is a far away walk from "across the street" from Walgreen's... I rubbed a blister on the bottom of my foot in tennis shoes. There are many pools to choose from... too bad it was 107 each day, plus it closed early at 8pm. You could actually gamble in one of the pools. The Forum Shops @ Caesar's are extremely pricey and quite a bit of "getting lost" in a mall without good direction... however don't miss going to Joe's Stone Crab and Steaks... The signage of the hotel was horrible! Visiting the Mirage, I saw much better signage. Also, don't miss the dolphins at Zeifred and Roy's Secret Garden next door. Taxi's were quick to arrive... really never a long line in queue due to the amount of taxis available. Getting to the strip is hazardous to one's health if leaving out the Shuttle Exit near Cher's. This was my 4th trip to Vegas... corporate, Stratosphere, twice to Golden Nugget and now on the strip... I do admit that I had a nice view on the 14th floor... and being the room immediately behind the elevator, surprisingly there was no noise to awaken me. I did experience youth in my hallway at 10:30pm taking photographs of their feet. I had to remind them they were entering the dorming areas of the hotel. I've stayed at better places and other places that were a lot worse. I say.... this experience was middling to fair.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but a long walk to room”
Reviews.Author: nevdestine
Reviews.Content: I originaly had 3 nights comped in the Forum tower. When I checked in i was informed I had been upgraded to the Augustus tower. I turned the upgrade down because I wanted the convenience of the Forum Tower but was informed my comped room had been sold. After hiking(yes hiking) back to self parking, I made my way to my room up top and down the very long hallway of the Augustus tower. The room was very nice and very clean. I always ask for a bottom floor near the elevator and casino. Usually I get this without a problem. Not this trip. Thanks goodness I brought my own coffee pot. Overall the hotel was nice, but I DON'T need a view or big suite when I am by myslef. All I do is sleep there. The next morning the bathroom lights did not work and the shower was a slow dribble. They were fixed by afternoon. The bed was very comfortable but the air conditioner did not work correctly, hot or cold no middle ground. The craps tables were fun. No luck on slots.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here !”
Reviews.Author: felko
Reviews.Content: This was the best stay we have ever have at a Harrahs' property. Check in was fast & courteous. We had an Augustus Tower room overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Very nice! Had a slight problem with the shower drain( a little slow) & maintenance was there within minutes. This is after all a five star resort. Expect to spend your money. There are lots of cheaper dining alternatives, you just have to look for them. No coffee pot? Purchase a small travel pot. We have one & it comes in handy. Fits in our carry on. We will be back, soon I hope!

Reviews.Title: “I Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: PaulT65
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Caesars several times over the past 5 years. If your priority in staying at this property is a large comfortable room, then you need to focus on the Augustus, Palace or Forum Towers. If you are budget conscience, and do not care about a modern large room, then a "classic or roman tower room" will be fine for you. My most recent stay was a room in the forum tower. It was spotless, spacious and comfortable....also very quiet. I think the fact that my room was not a 'connecting room' also helps with room noise. Check-in (11:30PM) was somewhat quick...they had 3 clerks manning the front desk. All seemed efficient and pleasant. Caesars used to have a feeder system at check-in, where guests lined up in one line and the next available clerk would assist the next person in line. This is no longer the case...you need to pick a line formed in front of each clerk and hope that your line moves quickly. I liked the old system better. During my stay housekeeping couldn't have done a better job. Bathroom was cleaned thoroughly, room vacuumed with a quick turn-around. Check-out was quick. Clerk asked me how I enjoyed my stay, if my room was comfortable and wished me a safe trip home. Overall, a very enjoyable experience, which is why I prefer to stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: kiet2010
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing, a must if you are in Vegas. Just be aware that this place is massive, so dont be in a rush to find your room when you first check in, the maps are not very helpful. Also be aware that sometimes the room keys do not work. Other then than, this place is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Big, impressive and good fun.”
Reviews.Author: MagpieJB
Reviews.Content: You're probably not always going to get the best service at a hotel this big, but Caesar's is still pretty good! Travelled with friends and it was great. Got upgraded to a very large and comfortable room. The rooms are great and not much more needs to be said there. My only real gripe was with housekeeping. We stayed for a week and only got our room turned 3 times. Friends staying in a different section hotel didn't have this issue so I can assume we were stuck with a lazy / incompetent housekeeping crew. We had to ring reception and ask for towels, toilet paper etc. Not what you would expect at a hotel such as this. Apart from that, go for it. Caesar's is awesome and plenty of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: lilacsanddoves
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in a classic room and did not see any bugs, but since our return home, we have found bugs in our suitcase and in the area we unpacked. We didn't see them until coming home late at night and turning on lights. My absolute worst nightmare! Old dated rooms the culpirt or the last day when we left our bags at the bell desk until our late flight out....either way, a horrible situation to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quick vacation - that didn't break the bank!”
Reviews.Author: ake987
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the forum tower in February of 2010 and had an amazing time. We couldn't believe that we could book a trip to Vegas at such a nice hotel for $500 a person INCLUDING airfare. We also thought maybe we wouldn't have a great room or great service since we weren't big spenders, but we couldn't have been more wrong. We did purchase a shuttle service from the airport which made getting to the hotel efficient and easy. Once there, check-in only took about 20 minutes and we walked into our beautiful and classy hotel room. Great beds, very spacious, great views, awesome bathroom with separate toilet, huge vanity and shower - unfortunately it didn't get great pressure but that was honestly the least of our worries. Bed was super comfortable and the blinds were remote operated and there was a thermostat in the room, along with a mini bar and flat screen television. I called the concierge for help picking out restaurants and they were so helpful, not only directing us to restaurants in their own hotel. I'm not a gambler but I did have fun in the casino and liked Caesar's better than the others we went to. There is a pu$$y cat doll's area that is more youth and inexperienced gambler friendly if you want to sit down at a table and play blackjack or poker or other games. The overall hotel experience was wonderful and Vegas was a great time. We ate at great restaurants (Nobu, Prime, caught a few buffets, Carnegie Deli..) and went to see Cirque de Soleil Love (the Beatles Cirque show) and was blown away. It was my third Cirque show (saw Mystere twice - Toronto and Vegas) and I'm not a crazy Beatles fanatic (boyfriend is - also loved the show). I do have to say the acrobatics were more impressive in Mystere, but that is not really the sole focus of this particular show. We also checked out the little "zoo" at the Mirage and it was worth the money, lions, tigers, dolphins, etc. Just a fun little spot. Really great vacation and the hotel made it that much more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed...hotel does nothing”
Reviews.Author: Nanfour
Reviews.Content: Arrived yesterday, waiting to check in, robbed in the casino bathroom. Security took a report but didn't offer anything for my loss. I thought maybe a food voucher or something. I am here til Friday so maybe they will find some kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Room Was Free”
Reviews.Author: ATourist6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesar's Palace with a friend who had a Jr. suite in the Augustus tower. The room was beautiful and roomy but I was soooo glad I wasn't footing the bill! I am used to looking for value for my money, and I didn't see so much of that going on. The things I like to have when I stay somewhere such as the coffee pot in the room and reasonably priced dining alternatives nearby are simply not part of the package here. I really balk at the $20.00 room service pot of coffee, or the $20.00 hamburger lunch in the hotel. I guess if you don't need to watch your dollars, the place has lovely rooms, a beautiful casino area, multiple pools outside, good service and a center strip location that can't be beat. On the down side, look forward to paying many extra dollars to have meals nearby, coffee, internet or any other extra service you can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad treatment. Be carefull with Caesars site!!!”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoRGarcia
Reviews.Content: My wife, a couple of friends and I stayed at Caesars for two nights at the "Forum Tower Executive Suite". We booked on line a room for four people with two queen size beds. During booking the site offered to us a upgrade and we accepted. When we arrived at Caesars we found that the room offered as upgrade do not have two queens size beds, but just one king size bed. We asked the check in attendant what could be done to help us, because we are four people and just on bed, and the hotel was full. He just said "YOUR PROBLEM CANNOT BE SOLVED", and then he gave to us four card-keys and called the next in the line. In the room we called a hotel attendant by phone e after explain a lot of times what happened we got one spare bed. So two of us slept on the queen bed, on the spare bed and other on the sofa. To complete our stay, we found hair on the shower and a dirty towel on the tube. Of course the Caesars location is fantastic and the hotel is huge and beautiful, but next time I will look for Paris or Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Littles07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars palace for 3 nights and loved it! The hotel itself has everything - pools, small boutiques, restaurants, bars, casino (obviously), spa and The Forum Shops. We were upgraded for free on our arrival from a Forum Tower room to a Palace Tower Delux Room which was amazing. Very spacious bedroom with sofa, desk and floor to ceiling window. Bathroom was huge, with a hot tub bath big enough for 2 people, double sinks, shower and separate toilet. This was the best hotel I have stayed in and would recommend it to anyone. There was no free internet in the rooms, there is a charge per day. You can also use the business suite for internet access but it is expensive!

Reviews.Title: “4 Fabulous nights at Caesars Palace Palace Tower”
Reviews.Author: Sherrikt
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had 4 nites comped at Caesars. We had a premium room in the Palace Tower room 606--view of the pool and the mountains. This was one of the nicest rooms we have ever stayed in, definitely the nicest in Vegas. The room had 2 his/her bathrooms. His bathroom, separate toilet room, sink and the bathrooms were connected by a dual shower. Her side of the bathroom had a jetted tub & separate toilet area with a bidet. The room was HUGE! Very comfy kind size bed, sitting area with a couch and desk. The closet area was really nice with built in shelves & safe. LOVED the location--close to the pool. I spent all day Saturday and part of Monday at the pool. The pool area is so nice. I rented a deluxe lounger for 35 on Sat b/c the pool was packed and the lounger was mine all day with pretty good cocktail service. Altho, I couldn't find her when we were ready to leave. The charge was to the room and the tip was included. The only meal we had at Caesars was at the buffet Sat a.m. and we were not impressed. We had 2 free buffets, so we were glad we didn't pay, but still it should have been better quality. We had to passes comped to the workout area which gave us access to QUA. I spent most of Sunday morning working out. Used the roman baths, sauna and arctic room--LOVED IT!! So calm, clean, great service. I highly recommend. Caesars is HUGE, but we learned our way around pretty quickly and really loved the property. It will be our new place when we go to Vegas. Love the location, the casino, the pool and our room was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Shopping and Gambling”
Reviews.Author: KatieP78
Reviews.Content: Loved it Loved it!!!!! I took my Hubby here for his 30th! And wow - we were not disappointed the Hotel was amazing, the rooms were huge, the casinos are out of this world and the shopping - fab!!!!! We ate at one of the many restaurants in the hotel! FANTASTIC!!! A must for Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed a Caesars Palace July 22-25...”
Reviews.Author: Mandyran
Reviews.Content: We stayed a Caesars Palace July 22-25. Our flight got delayed so we didn't get to the hotel until about 745pm, therefore, we only had to wait 5 minutes to check in. We stayed in the palace tower which was a great location for the pool and a relatively quite tower overall. Our room was supposed to have a couch but it did not. After two calls to the front desk we finally got a roll away bed about 2 hours later. We tipped the maids very well each morning and they left us every item listed on our note, which was only about 2 items each day. The pools were soooo crowded and the chairs were on top of each other. I guess anyone could come into the pool because they didn't check room keys or ids. I guess that is why it was so crowded. Very frustrating! The table games were pretty expensive, nothing less than $15 during the day and $25 at night. There were a lot of drunk people waundering around late at night, saw girls falling down, etc. Not cool! Overall, our room was clean and what we expected! We will return to stat at Caesars!

Reviews.Title: “Glad they could upgrade Obama”
Reviews.Author: vodkacranberry0
Reviews.Content: Wow - glad Caesar's could upgrade Obama when we couldn't even get in our room until 8:30 p.m. Booked our trip several months ago - 8 girls. We were supposed to have 2 adjoining rooms. When we checked in we were told they only had 2 rooms with 1 king size bed available. I told the gentleman that we had booked our package many months ago and that would not be acceptable as we had 8 women and 2 king size beds would not work. He said there was a convention and they were all guaranteed double beds. So pretty much sorry you're not with the convention. He made a call and told us there were 2 rooms available, but only one was clean and to come back in an hour to get the keys for the other room. We came back 3 hours later and the other room was still not ready. Came back another 2 hours later and even though they had put a "rush" on cleaning the room it was still not ready. He said there was a room down the hall that was ready which we took. The tower we were in (the only one apparently) had no soft drink machines or ice machines. We could get 2 buckets a day and after that it was $10.00 each! Caesar's made absolutely no attempt to do anything for us, comp us a drink or meal or anything for our inconvenience and Obama (who trashed people going to Vegas) gets an upgrade. The hotel was beautiful, but I was extremely disappointed in the way we were treated.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the best”
Reviews.Author: akhilbansal28
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded to the junior suite due to unavailability of standard room. Amazing modern interiors. Great breakfast layout. Best located on the strip. Unbelievable swimming pool area. Casino is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms. Very expensive amenities...”
Reviews.Author: Osidemike
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms. Very expensive amenities. Use of exercise equipment extra. WiFi $20/day to use in public areas; $30/day to use in rooms. Food 25% more than similar restaurants elsewhere. Good place to stay if cost is not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GabrielaR7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the classic room. Despite being fourth retired, seemed quite old. The bathroom had no door and there was no fridge. Perhaps the most expensive suites are better.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect.”
Reviews.Author: MABUsa
Reviews.Content: We go a real bargain in Las Vegas at Caesar's Palace. Terrific service, great food and beautifully decorated rooms made our stay fabulous. The price is reasonable for the quality you receive.

Reviews.Title: “I was hoping it would be nice”
Reviews.Author: LaLa033
Reviews.Content: Most Las Vegas hotels do not focus on the sleeping rooms and Caesars Palace is not any different. Hearing from my colleagues, I am assuming the rooms in my tower were not renovated yet because their rooms were nicer. In my room I had a maroon couch, normal tube TV, bathroom with peeling wallpaper, no robe, no ice bucket (there isn't even ice in my tower). My room didn't have a room service menu. The safe was all banged up. I spent 3 hours trying to get 2 small boxes delivered to me. I called several times and they said I HAD to be in my room to get the package - so I sat in my room for 1.5 hours. They quit answering the phone when I called continuously. Finally I went to the business center and asked them to have the package delivered to them so I could pick it up. The casino was beautiful, the lobby, the grounds, and pool are all beautiful. The fitness center had a $25 fee per day.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky Start but Great Ending”
Reviews.Author: sharpness
Reviews.Content: So for my first trip to Vegas it started off pretty bad. First off we were greeted by an employee who said we couldn't check in just yet because they were expecting a huge amount of people for a conference. Then when we finally got to check in we were put in a room in the Roman tower. Now normally we would have been very happy just to be staying at such a nice place but when we got off the elevator something smelled and it wasn't us. Upon entry to the room I checked the bathroom( tip I learned from cleaning cabins at a resort). Maid service had left cleaning rags in the bathtub. We notified them (they were just outside the door) and they blamed it on the night crew but recleaned the tub for us. As we were getting ready for bed I stepped on a beer bottle cap which was slightly under the bed so I can see how they missed it...but when my brother-in-law pulled back his covers to get in bed I realized the room had not been cleaned at all for at least a week. The middle of the bed was stained...think Vegas and you can figure out what kind of stain it was and a pill in the middle of the stain. Immediately I called down the front desk and told them about the bed and tub and asked for a cleaning crew promptly. However thirty minutes later no one had come so I called again and this time asked for a manager who after hearing what was in the room swiftly put us in a great suite in the Augustus tower for free. That room was impeccably cleaned. Seems they care more about their new stuff and high rollers more than the common folk.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaeljones46
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference in the hotel in mid July. We always book the Palace tower since the elevators open to the conference center and also the pool is accessed just off the elevator. Wife had free rooms in the Forum tower. I'd booked the Palace tower from work and the desk clerk recommended we just upgrade her reservation to the Palace tower and so we got the rooms for only $50 per night, saving my work $119 a night. The rooms are huge, with two bathrooms if you get the larger rooms on each floor. Huge 2 person jet tub and a two person shower. The separate bathroom at the front was nice for me to get up and get ready while my wife slept. We had a view of the great pool area, my wife loves Caesars for its pool. Food is expensive everywhere in the complex, best values are Planet Hollywood and Cheesecake Factory, both in the Forum shops. We will probably continue to stay at Caesars because the hotel is so lavish, and so convienent to all the other hotels like Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn, Mirage and Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome!!”
Reviews.Author: Eagles666
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at Caesars from 13juli -20juli and it was awsome! 5 minutes to check in and we got a better room for som smal money in the Agustus tower with a wiew over Belagio ant the fountains! :=) The room was very clean every day we came home and everybody was so friendly to us! Ok to eat and drink at caesars cost a little bit of money but i think its ok anyway! Ifyou dont have that money you can always stay at another place or eat&drink somwhwere else! A hotell in this standard cost money and thats how it should be for o 4.5 star hotel!If you cant aford it stay at´a cheaper hotel! ;=) We had a great week and will return to Caesars! :=) Thanks! Dan Ilbäcks (Sweden)

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, and in need of renovation.”
Reviews.Author: topherashley
Reviews.Content: We stayed a single night here and booked the highest level room on Expedia. As we were coming in from another property I called before booking to ask about the possibility of early check in. The person I spoke to said it was no problem and we could check in as early as noon, no later than 2. This did not happen. We arrived at the property around 12:30 pm and were told we could not even talk to anyone about check in until after 3. Spent some time at the pool bar, had a late lunch, and then came back about 3:30. Checked in, and even tipped the check in girl $20 to get a good view. She obliged but said no rooms would be available in the Augustus towers (the newer nice ones) until after 5. We had dinner reservations at 7pm and were in our pool clothes. Came back at 5. Room still not ready, come back at 5:30. Came back at 5:30, room not ready, come back at 6. FINALLY at 6pm we were able to check in. TERRIBLE SERVICE. Luckily, our dinner reservations were on site (MESA is wonderful) or else we would have been late to dinner, and late to our Cirque show. I was not impressed with the room. The view was amazing, but the room was not that great. I won't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay at Ceasars”
Reviews.Author: RickLeAnn
Reviews.Content: This is the first time writing a review. I have read reviews prior to all trips we take. I find it helpful.
