My wife and I traveled to Vegas to get away and enjoy our anniversary and to recharge our batteries. We both enjoy Vegas and Ceasars Palace. It is our third or fourth time staying there. Checkin: The first thing we noticed was the crowd at check in. There is nothing worse than waiting in line after flying half the day and all you want to do is relax. After waiting 30 minutes to get to the front of the line we were pleasantly greeted. Our reservation was confirmed. We booked using reward points for a generic Roman tower room. We explained it was our anniversary trip and told her that we enjoyed the pool and stayed in the Palace Tower,which is very accessible to the pool, our last trip 2 years ago. She congratulated us on our anniversary and told us she was getting us a room in the Palace Tower. The other good news, our room was ready. A great start to our vacation. Housekeeping: During our stay we had very good housekeeping service. We left a note and a tip for the housekeeper each day. We always had enough towels and supplies. Extra towels are a must during the summer, going from the pool to the shower to lunch, to the pool to the shower to dinner. Pool: The pool was very crowded. It was not a problem for us. We were up early each day anyway, going west 2 time zones. We moved a couple of different times the first two days until we found the pool and the music we liked best and chose that area the rest of the trip. The service at the pool was good considering all the people. The prices are extremely high. You could break the bank without even gambling if you want food and drinks all day. Gaming: We are not huge gamblers. We do like to play a little. The table minimums are high. We went acros the street to play the lower minimums. It just suits our budget a little better. We were there during the World Cup semis and the sports book was a great place to see it. Restaurants: We did the "Buffet of Buffets" one day. The pros are the choices and the price. The cons are the wait and the dessert choices. We waited 15-45 minutes to get in to each restaurant. We ate at Raos one night and really enjoyed the whole experience. The waiter was very good and the food was very good. The price was high but we expected that as well. Overall: A nice vacation. When we are on vacation, we are not in any hurry. We do that enough at home chasing 3 teenage boys. We know there are crowds and lines but we just take it in stride. A smile and please and thank you also go a long way. When we go back to Vegas, we will stay at Ceasars.

Reviews.Title: “The best of everything you want in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mikeyjhay
Reviews.Content: It really does have the best of everything. It's got a little bit of the Vegas quirkiness which you do want when in Vegas and you can't really get from the Bellagio or Wynn etc. And it's got great history. Great shops. Amazing location. Great pool. Food. Bars. Clubs etc. It's got everything. The only thing I actually didn't think was great was the casino. I went elsewhere to gamble. But the hotel was great. We stayed in the Palace Tower and had a great view of the Mirage, Wynn and Encore. The Palace Tower had great decor and was very very handy for the pool.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks - centre strip the only place to be”
Reviews.Author: davporte
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas 12 times in 10 years and i am from Australia, its a long way. Now it's only Caesars for me. Yes there can be some queues, but its a big place get over it princess ! You must always book in the Dulux rooms in the newer towers, the palace is right by the pool. I just love how its mid strip and so easy to get around from that location. Over the road is Bills with Big Elvis for free, great Karaoke ever night and Drias one great after hours club. Belagio next door, and one fantastic pool complex. Good on ya Caesars, still the best place on the strip !!! Oh and definitely do the Bootleg Canyon Flight Lines - flying at 60mph across the desert on a wire is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay for First time to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: atavistic8
Reviews.Content: I went on a business trip to Vegas July 7-10, 2010. I can say that I was totally pleased with the hotel. It seems to be in the middle of the strip and all the activities. I'm a frequent traveler to top notch resorts and hotels and Ceasars didn't disappoint. When we arrived at the hotel, the valet process was seamless. They took our bags out the car and gave us tickets to call when we received our rooms. Because we arrived at the hotel before the 3pm check-in, our hotel room was not ready. Also, during the check-in process they didn't have a clear setup of where the line started and stopped. Apparently, you just stand in front of the front desk person you want to see. Obviously, that means standing in the shortest line there is. There was a hotel staff member who walked around to let you know if another associate was able to assist you that you didn't see. So that was nice. I was assigned a executive suite in the Forum Tower. Apparently,these rooms are newly renovated. They were very plush. The suite came with a L shaped lounger sofa, round table with chairs, flat screens in the living room and bedrooms. There was a full size walk in closet. The bathroom was pretty large. It had a plasma tv in the bathroom mirror, a jacuzzi tub, separate marble shower with jets against the wall and 2 dispensers on top the shower (very nice). The few was of the strip. I did eat at Munch bar(snack./sandwich shop) and Messa(southwestern cuisine). The food at the Munch bar was decent although high price, which is normal for a hotel. For an example, it was a 14.00 burger. Messa was more expensive. I guess they are known for the steaks, tomales, and pork. Everything is a la cart. Meals easily go up to 100.00 for one person. We went down to the pool on Thursday at 10am. Absolutely all the FREE chairs were gone. I guess people get down early and just put there towels on the chairs to reserve them.The only things left were the beds you have to pay for. Those range from 150-300 dollars. This is for the Ceasars Pool. Right next to the Ceasar's pool is the exclusive pool that's 21 and up only and it allows you to go topless. I was originally offended by the concept. But, after walking around the regular pool several times with no luck finding a chair, I was able to sweet talked my way into the exclusive pool for free. I think normally they charge 30.00 to get in. They have a dj in that pool area and it's less crowded and very relaxing. Also there were plenty of chairs in that location. On friday night I went to PURE, which is the nightclub in the hotel. They give you free passes at the hotel concierge's desk to get in free. They play alot of dance and techno music. The place is 2 levels with an outside roof bar/dance floor. Lots of people go there and they get bottle service at the tables that ranges from 500-2000 dollars. If you don't have a table, then you are standing the entire night.I also signed up for the total rewards program. You can add your meals, casino games, and stores from Ceasar's Palace. When you sign up, they give you $5.00 of free money. I took the $5.00 to a penny slot machine and it won me $81.00 (not bad). Checkout was flawless since I left around 900am. I noticed that the hotel check in process for the weekend(fri/sat) is extremely busy. I check-in on a Wednesday so it wasn't that bad. I found a good breakfast place across the street that was relatively in expensive. It's directly across the street from the Bellagio. You can eat breakfast on the patio in the morning. They have great mimosas. It's called Mon Ami Gabi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Center Strip Hotel and close to everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: hugedevilsfan
Reviews.Content: We were greeted at the Valet in the front by a person that was especially nice and had our luggage taken right away. We had a reservation for two rooms and wanted adjoining rooms. The person that checked us in, gave us a double upgrade to a palace premium room. (we were origionally booked in a Forum Deluxe). We arrived at the hotel on Sunday, July 4th at noon. Check-in is not until 4pm. He checked us in, but we had to wait for the rooms to be cleaned. They gave us passes so that we could use the pool facilities until the rooms were ready. The pools were unbelievable. My 9 year old and 11 year old boys spent 4 hours per day in the pools. We were there for 6 nights. The service was great the entire stay! Every worker we had a chance to come in contact with, made sure that our stay was excellent. The concierge arranged dinner for us, and also arranged a babysitter to come to our rooms. We had no problems the entire stay and although the hotel is huge, all of the people that worked there, made us feel that we were important, even when the kids were with us!!! I would stay again, due to the service, location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: debholt
Reviews.Content: If you like being made to feel totally unwelcome, made to queue to check in (thats a first for us - waiting over an hour to check in to be told that the room isnt ready and come back in 3 hours ! ). If you get excited about joining the soup kitchen line in the morning just to get a sunbed by the pool and paying £5 for a small can of Bud which you collect yourself from the pool bar , then this is just the place for you ! On the plus side, good location. Avoid - there are much friendlier and better hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Second trip to Vegas - First Time at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: VBGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at Caesars beginning on 7 July. Check-in was relatively quick and even though we arrived at 10:00 am our room was available. The room was located in the Palace Tower, 22nd floor overlooking the pools...it was fairly large, very clean, with a flat screen TV, comfortable King bed and her/hers bathrooms (with jacuzzi bath). The property is located center strip which is absolutely perfect for seeing all of the sights. The casino is large but definitely navigable and not as smokey as other reviewers have noted. The pools are crowded but that should be expected when the temperature is 107 degrees before noon. We chose to relax at the Venus pool (service and drinks were outstanding) and met several couples. Shopping and eating at the connecting Forum shops was very enjoyable. On our first trip the Vegas we stayed at the Mirage and liked it very much. However, Caesars takes it to another level. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit. - Special thanks to Marko (check-in) for his help and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Lago buffet a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Kutless-inspired
Reviews.Content: This is a review of the buffet at Caesar's. The line was about an hour long to get in, with inadequate air conditioning. The selection of food was a disappointment. They have one of the higher priced buffets and this is Caesar's palace, where everything is done big. We were really underwhelmed with the size of the buffet. Would recommend going elsewhere for food

Reviews.Title: “great 43rd wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: biilljean
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have been coming to Caesars twice a year since 1988 and again we had a great time.Two emps who helped again and were wonderful 1) cheryl ippolito Casino host who set up our trip perfect. 2) Marc mercury front desk check in great job. These two emps always do a great job and are the reason Caesars is a great place to stay, we"ll be back in Jan thanks again Bill & Jean Wadsworth Romulus,Mich

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: cpilar
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in many things about this hotel. First, the place reeks of smoke. One trip thru the low- ceilinged casino will have you reeking of smoke - very poor air circulation and everything was so dirty - rugs, machines, etc. Out throats started hurting from the smoke and we had to gamble somewhere else. Also, we were very disappointed in the pool area. Very beautiful to look at, but try to find a place to sit. The chairs are jammed together, literally touching - I was so close to the guy next to me that I could hear him breathing - creepy! There is no shade anywhere after 10 am in the pool area and it is 105 degrees! To top it off, after a lot of walking up and down the strip after dinner, we come back for a swim and learn they close the pool at 8 pm! It is 100 degrees outside, million dollar pools, and a guard turning away tons of people who want to swim (some of the kids were crying). What a total waste. Finally, we were out of our room all day and nobody serviced the room. We came back around 7 pm to find the bed unmade (no big deal), but also no towels. We call housekeeping and there was no apology or acknowldegement, just a "do you want us to bring you some?" We are not picky people and understand this can happen, it was just the "I could care less" attitude that was so disappointing. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room not impressive....”
Reviews.Author: jett_9
Reviews.Content: The actual hotel was super nice. The rooms are outdated! My room did not even have a door on the restroom-- and the restroom is up by the front door.... This hotel did not serve it's purpose for us. We were looking for somthing nice and romantic and this we did not get. Go figure!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Stimpson
Reviews.Content: Hotel- very clean, staff are fast at reseting your room each day. Location is prime right in the middle of the strip across from The Flamingo. You will pay 1.50 for local calls and 1-800 numbers. WIFI is 15 dollars for 24 hours. Don't bring a car. Buffet- get the 24 buffet pass for 35 dollars, you can eat at 5 different hotel buffets for 24 hours. Food is quality except for Paris. Casino- Caesars has one of the nicest lookin casinos next to Wynn Encore. However you will not find 5 dollar blackjack. Go to circus circus for cheap table games. OSheas across the street is good but the casino looks dumpy and is smoky. Shuttle- Shuttle from the airport is 7 dollars one way. If you want to travel up and down the strip fast buy a 7 dollar for 24 hour bus pass. The bus will take you all the way downtown to Fremont street, which I think is worth it for a day. Don't go to Vegas on a long weekend, there is not more to do, just more people, trust me you can't even move on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: trisha84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I and another couple recently stayed at Casears and loved it! From the easy check in option of "texting" your check in to the easy checkout on the tv screen in our room, everything was fabulous!! We asked for a complimentary upgrade and recieved one to the Palace Tower, which has elevators that are directly by the pool, so convenient! Our room was beautiful and faced the Mirage/strip, what a great upgrade! The beds were sooo comfortable and the jacuzzi was nice too-all part of the upgrade, so just ask at check in! Their customer service was top notch also, never a problem, and always a smile. Oh, also, there were never long check in lines so the people writing about those on here probably did not use the convenient option of texting the check in OR they checked up during a large group check in. Also, why do people complain about no coffee in the room? NO Strip resorts have that, its to be expected in LV to go downstairs to get that. Also, eat at Spago and the noodle restaurant on site, delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: OhioTravelerZ
Reviews.Content: Service and friendliness there was fantastic!!! Had a great time!! Pool was fantastic and the restaurants were great!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Noni87
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel well before check in but our bags were taken away by the bell boys and we were free to use the pool area. The numerous pools are clean and in an amazing setting however there are too many sun beds crammed into too small an area so there is little privacy when sunbathing. Drinks service poolside is quick and convenient but expensive with the bar snack menu being basic but sufficient. Upon check in the queues where large with over an hour wait but the staff were efficient and apologetic, we were directed to our room and given a map which gives an idea about the sheer size of the hotel. The room was large and clean with a good sized bed and large bathroom with good facilities, the hotel also has a central location on the strip so all the major sights can be seen. Hotel restaurants were expensive so we looked for places to eat along the strip which proved better value, gaming was also expensive with a min of $25 bets, it was recommended by a relative that we took a taxi to downtown Vegas where min bets are from $3 so better value for money taxis also drive past all the wedding chapels which is a good sight for the full Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hail Ceasar!”
Reviews.Author: mhooker
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at Ceasar's Palace. Arrived at 10 am on Friday and the "greeter" suggested we check our luggage at the bell desk and head on our to the pool. She suggested I come back to the desk at 1 ish. I'm a Platinum Rewards holder, so at 1pm I walked right up and got our room within minutes. We were comped 2 days in the Forum Tower and paid $160 per night for the other 2 nights. Our room was wonderfull, other than the view, but we're not there to look out the window! The whole place from restrooms to our room is spotless! Took advantage of the buffet deal ($35 for as many buffets at Harrah's properties for a 24 hour period). We managed 4 meals including breakfast this morning before heading out to the airport. If you are thinking of doing the buffet at Paris, don't! Do go to Spice at Planet Hollywood though, and Ceasar's too. All in all, we will be back with the right offer. We're back at Flamingo for Labor Day as the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace is a fantastic place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: TexasCowgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar's Palace for four days and then moved over to the Bellagio. We wanted to experience two different types of hotels and casinos. We stayed in the Agustus Tower at Caesar's and our room was large, comfortable, and very clean. We had a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains from our room. We loved the swimming pools and were happy there was a walkway to the pools from the Agustus Tower so you did not have to walk through the common areas of the hotel or the casino. The Qua Spa was wonderful and very relaxing. We had a wonderful time at Caesar's Palace. The only minuses were that that the spa tub in the bathroom did not bubble and the make-up mirror's light was out. We were not in our room very much so those things never got reported or I'm sure they would have been fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, but.....”
Reviews.Author: IcedTeanCocoa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here multiple times and have always loved the hotel, but with the addition of the new tower things have gotten really busy. The pool use to be a great place to chill and relax, but now if you don't get there by 9:00 am you can't find two seats together. People stake out multiple chairs around themselves so they don't have to share space, then they don't pick up their towels when they are done and you can't tell if a seat is available or not. The rooms are nice, and we were in the older Roman tower, and still found the accommodations to be excellent and the housekeeping thorough. We did enjoy Mesa Grill here for lunch, have the burger, it is awesome, and the Cleopatra's Barge for a drink and some dancing (pricey, 30.00 for 2 cocktails). I agree with other reviewers in that they need to get their check in situation addressed, we waited about 45 minutes to check in on a Sunday afternoon, and they need more staff available at the desk for questions. Do not eat at the Augustus Cafe, it is a total rip off. We had 2 sodas, one onion ring and one club sandwich to share and the bill was 49.00. Total rip off, and the food was of poor quality and the service slow, and it doesn't compare to all night cafes at other locations. Go to the one in Planet Hollywood, it is way better. Also, they need to play regular music at the pool rather than all that techno junk. Modern music would be fine, but ditch the techno dance club stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation”
Reviews.Author: cali_teacher12
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about our stay except the high prices of everything on site. However, it's fitting for the center of the strip. I'm willing to spend the money to get away and relax with a little luxury, but be prepared. Caesar's is not the place to stay if you are looking for deals. The best thing about our room was the fact that it had two bathrooms joined by a large shower with dual showerheads. There was tons of space to get ready (adequate lighting and seating for applying makeup!) and the light-up closets were roomy. The pool area is spacious with a variety of seating options, and they have a waterfall/pool area where you can gamble, which was a lot of fun. Also, they don't harrass you if you want to bring a bag with you. That's a major plus since some of the pools search you before you enter.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: KavehK
Reviews.Content: Caesars doesn't cost so much during the summer and we even upgraded our standard room to a deluxe room with a jacuzzi for 40$ per night and it was totally worth it. The room was in the Palace Tower which means it's just by the pool and the buffet. And the buffet! If you get a free Total Rewards card in the casino you can buy a 24h buffet pass that you can use in all the Harrahs hotels for only 35$. If you adjust your schedule a bit you can fit four meals into those 24h. And the food was great at the buffet even though I recommend you trying out the other buffets at other Harrahs casinos as well. The room was great, nicely designed and really clean. We have two things to complain about though. First thing is that the shops in the hotel were very very very expensive. A bottle of water (when it was 110 degrees in Vegas) costed 4 dollars! In Excalibur the same water cost 2 dollars and in the shops on the Strip you could buy water for less than a dollar. The other complain is the WiFi. It was really fast and reliable, but 15 dollars per day!?!?

Reviews.Title: “Would get top marks but.....”
Reviews.Author: spicyhippo
Reviews.Content: Caesars is a great hotel, clean, lovely rooms, nice casino, good bars, pool is excellent, but where it falls short is the check in. In a total of 3 days I spent 4 hours waiting at the front desk. They seem to have no more than 3 staff on regardless of how busy the line is and after a 5 hour flight delay the last thing we wanted was a 2 hour queue. The reception staff were apologetic and gave us an upgrade to a suite for the 1st night but we had to move next day and more waiting in line followed, also had an issue that I needed to go to reception with and again another long wait. its a real shame as I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and even stay again myself but they desperately need to sort the staff at the check in out. Enough money goes through that place that they can have more staff on at busy times. Its this and this alone that spoils what is otherwise a fantastic and beautiful hotel which has probably the best location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: loubies2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, location really good in the centre of everything and all hotels within easy reach. Room was great, had view over the strip and the Bellagio fountains amazing. Only down side was the price of drinks in the hotel bars, but I suppose you are in Vegas. Would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Wow....the best hotel in Vegas by far.....!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: salfen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on the las vegas part of a California road trip for our honeymoon. At the check in desk we mentioned it was our honeymoon and we were upgraded from the Forum Tower room we had booked to the Augustos Towers, 41st floor, double the room size with a jaccuzi bath and a view of the strip looking right over the bellagio fountains....absoultely perfect!!! The staff were very friendly, the rooms and the communal areas were decorated to an extrememly high standard. The pool area was amazing and there was a good choice of restaurants and shops within the complex. We checked out most of the other hotels, Bellagio, Venitian, Mirage etc but we both agreed that none of them were anything like the standard of Caesars Palace....for us it was definately the best hotel there and extremely good value for money. We shopped around on line and got the room for £234 for 3 nights....excellent for this amount of luxury!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Glitz but not a lot of Substance!”
Reviews.Author: Colmoc1
Reviews.Content: This hotel pretty much sums up Vegas. Lots of sparkle but not much going on under the surface! The staff are very polite and efficient but it lacks the personal touch, it kind of feels a bit like being on a conveyor belt with as little human contact as possible! The room we got was amazing, lots of room and all the comforts you would expect from a hotel in this category - TV, Down Pillows, Minibar, Safe,etc etc... Unfortunately you can hear the nightclub downstairs through closed windows which is a little annoying. To get out of the hotel onto the strip can take a while, either straight out onto the grounds in the scorching heat or meandering through the Forum shops in the air-con. The casino is pretty much the same as any other on the strip with the same slots and games as all the rest. It is an experience to stay here once but don't really feel the need to do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay, would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: LizzieMc1972
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from a 3 night stay at Caesars and loved every minute of it. To guarantee a good room we paid a bit extra for a deluxe room in the Augustus Tower and ended up with a beautiful room. We were on the 38th floor and had amazing views. The room was very clean and had all the amenities you need. We absolutely loved the pool and the surrounding lounges etc. Our only negative for the whole stay was the breakfast buffet in the hotel. The line to get in was ridiculously slow when the restaurant was half empty and the food selection was minimal and it is laid out in a hard to access way. We also tried the breakfast buffet at the Bellagio and not only was it cheaper but it had a much better selection and the service was amazing. Would definitely stay at Caesars again but just probably wouldn't eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: vallen1038
Reviews.Content: Check in took forever, no idea what takes some people so long, but we were in line for over 30 minutes. When we get to the room, we find a filled ice bucket on the desk along with two glasses with ice cubes in them. I called the front desk to tell them they had given me a dirty room and they advised someone had been moved out of it a few minutes before and there was nothing they could do. The next morning I called the desk to find out the location of my meeting and they could not tell me and didn't try to find out. I'm used to being addressed by name when I call the desk from my room but that never happened here. Instead I was greeted by recordings and placed on hold for several minutes. We had to dodge cleaning carts in the hallway outside our room all day and night every day except Saturday. Ladies room near the buffet was not cleaned on Friday and only 1 stall had toilet paper - ugh. Final straw was when we tried to use the kiosk to print our boarding passes and we learned there was a fee for this. The original plan for Sunday morning was to gamble at the hotel until it was time to leave for the airport but we were so bummed, after checkout we went right to the bar at the airport and drank instead of gambled. The hotel is pretty and the room was ok but the same can be said of many other hotels in Vegas. This place is so huge and has so many guests, it's impossible to get good service unless you are a high roller. I would much rather go to a smaller hotel and get better service.

Reviews.Title: “A PALACE AS THE NAME SUGGESTS”
Reviews.Author: mekey
Reviews.Content: Though it has been around for sometime and there are newer and fancy hotels in Vegas, Caesar's Palace is yet one of the finer hotels in Vegas. It is quite grand and it is so big that most of the times i would loose my way. The food is quite good in the restaurants and it is also quite centally located. Rooms are unfortunately not as spacious as they should be for the price. It has some good shops too.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond Member - Caesars Could Care Less”
Reviews.Author: ToHaveFuninVegas
Reviews.Content: Last two times myself and family members have stayed at Caesars. As Diamond Members one expects a certain level of service. Both times we were told that they did not have our room preferences, it is first come first serve. So filling out a profile to help expedite our checking in is a waste of time with Caesars. Or a person that walks in without a reservation can get your room. And what does Caesars have to say about this? NOTHING spoke to a manager about some service issues in December and all he could say was he would send our issues up to higher management. Then they want you to fill out a survey about your trip and ask you for contact info. Filled out the survey for the December and June trips and have I heard from them about the poor service on either trip. NO- If a Diamond Member can't get good service from Caesars, what kind of service can other people expect. - I would not recommend this place to anyone. The flagship location of the company is the worst for customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: soonergirl23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas with friends and stayed at Caesar's Palace. This is the 2nd time we have stayed at this particular hotel/casino. We travel to Vegas about three times a year, usually for leisure and have stayed at various hotels on the strip. We had booked a standard room, but when my husband checked in, he upgraded us to a suite. We have learned that if you ask for an upgrade at check-in, you can get a good deal. Sometimes, we have got our upgrades for free. The suite had two bedrooms with a living room in between. Each bedroom had a flat screen telelvision and each of the three bathrooms had a flat screen television. One bathroom was located in the living room area. There was also a large bar with refrigerator in the living room. The suite was fabulous! It was located on the penthouse floor, which was a very quiet, You had to have a key to this floor for the elevator to access it. Housekeeping came into the room several times a day to tidy up and bring you anything you might need. There is a variety of restaurants in Caesar's with different types of food and a variety of value. Located at the entrance of The Forum Shops is a food court that serves fast food. Our favorite place to eat at Caesar's is at the sushi bar in the Japanese restaurant. Great sushi and great service! The Forum Shops is a great place to shop. There are standard shops (Gap, Lucky Jeans, etc.) and also a variety of higher end shops. There is also FAO Schwartz Toy Department store in the mall if you are looking for gifts for your children. Caesars has a great nightlife. We had passes to Pure Nightclub, which was having a special guest (the White House Crashers) the night we went. The place was packed! Even though the place is a "meat market," it was fun to go, since we had always heard so many things about it. We also attended the Bette Midler concert at Caesar's Palace, which was fabulous! She is amazing! Caesar's Palace is located centrally on the Vegas strip. It is a very popular hotel, and therefore, it is difficult to get a great deal here. It is not the best value on the strip. Overall, we had a great time at Caesar's and would definitely stay here again (if we could get a good deal).

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: tannn257
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have never gotten a phone call from a manager welcoming me to their hotel 3 days before arrival. Then after getting home receiving an email from the president. I was very impressed with the service. After reading some reviews I wasn't sure if I had made the right decision. This is the 3rd time I've booked with Caesers Palace and I told myself that I wasn't going to cancel this time. We arrived around 4pm. Check in was fast. The next day the line was very long a few times. We booked a smoking room but when we got to the room it was non-smoking. Called the front desk and they changed our room right away. You woiuldn't even know that it was a smoking room. Very clean. Since I booked the Augustus Tower they upgraded my friends at no xtra charge. Only down fall no coffee pot. The Augustus Cafe is right off the elevator. I had a beautiful view of the Belliago Fountains. The pools are absolutely beautiful. Just a short distance from the room. If you are in the Augustus Tower you don't have to go through the casino to go to the pool. The strip is also right outside the elevator. Service in the casino was ok. I only had to wait a short time. The food was good and a decent variety. Cheap Trick is a must see. Best concert I've ever seen. They are at Paris. I would definetly stay at Caesars Palace again. I was very happy with my stay and so were the other people in my party. If you have doubts like I did give them a try. You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Las Vegas by far”
Reviews.Author: RichardWiggett
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brill, As soon as you walk throught the entrance you are hit by the wow factor. We checked in and it was quick and easy (not sure where the long waits have come from!!) we where in the Augustus tower. the decor for the whole hotel is amazing so much detail from start to finish. The Room - was massive.. nice soft bed with a tv, sofa, table, along with a side table for any work if you should need it! bathroom was lush huge walk in shower and a jacuzzi bath with the toilet seperate from the bathroom. Room also has all mod cons that are free.. Iron, safe, hairdryer etc etc Pool - there are free sundbeds and ones you have to pay for which is fair enough the free ones are fine they are comfy and close to the water so when your to hot you can just jump in the pool and cool down, the towels you can grab any part of the day. food wise there are two shops (newsagent sort of style) where you can get drinks and snacks but also there is a hot food place called snackius maximus which is not badly priced. shops - there are a whole complex called the forum shops that has no end of choice as well as restaurants. Casino - you will be asked for ID so have it with you i had my UK driving licence on me and that was fine for the whole of vegas not just here. The table prices vary the cheap slots go from 1cent up to $5 a pull, and the blackjacket tables best i found was $5 a hand poker and roulette was the same $5 for both. Drinking - The best thing is getting drinks... play slow and steady on the machines no rush until one of the girls comes and asks if you can get a drink have what ever you want... beer, spirts or soda. we tipped well the first time and then every time they come back and ask you again just tip them $1 and they will look after you all night and if you want to leave the casino and have a drink dont worry about finishing it take it out onto the strip drink it walking down the road and take it into another casino they dont say a word. Overall i loved Vegas and the hotel we stayed in made it even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas - So far”
Reviews.Author: FraserB
Reviews.Content: We flew from Gatwick to Vegas with Virgin, i thought the service was poor, just like being on a Thomas Cook 747. I have stayed in a few Vegas hotels. The old and now gone Stardust, Luxor, Imperial Palace and the Flamingo. This trip to Vegas was different, it wasn't a holiday or a business trip it was to get married. I was lucky enough to be in Vegas last year on business and was able to sort things out first hand at Caesars while i was there. We still had a lot of contact with the Caesars wedding office staff via e-mail or on the phone and they were first class. We got married outdoors in the Venus garden (not something you can do in Scotland) and the whole day was brilliant. The only thing we really had to sort out ourselves was the wedding licence. We chose Raos as the reception which overlooks the Garden and that was excellent too. The hotel was great the staff were excellent and really great with our daughter. Ceasar and Cleopatra were a wee bit scary for her though. We didn't eat out as often as previous trips to Vegas but the buffet is still a bargain, Wolfgang Puck is still great and good value (brilliant meatloaf) and the room service if you have kids is above average. This won't be our last trip to Vegas, and I would stay in Caesars again.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars get better the more you stay there”
Reviews.Author: VicGolfer
Reviews.Content: Caesars is a very big hotel but I think the more days you spend there the more you like it. This was my third stay at Caesars and once you know your way around it, it really is a one stop shop casino. Its location is perfect and has all the things you would ever need in a hotel. Only downside is the Palace Tower Jr suites have the shower in between two bathrooms and someone couldn't figure out that a frosted glass would be betterwhen you go with another guy. Also the drain was a bit cloged and water leaked out on the bathroom floors which must have been happening for a while based on the stains in 940. Otherwise great stay. If you like to shop stay at Forum Tower, use the pool stay at Palace and the spa stay in the new augusta tower.

Reviews.Title: “Weekday stay here is a great value!”
Reviews.Author: SkyblueTN
Reviews.Content: My husband, teen daughter, six-year-old, and I stayed here in early June and had a blast! I had two free nights from being a Total Rewards member. I figured there would be some hidden charges, but there were none. Our room was in the Palace Tower. It was gorgeous, and the elevators took you right to the entrance to their lavish pool area. The pools were perfect in the mornings. Our daughters enjoyed themselves very much. As the day wore on and turned into late afternoon, the scene changes and becomes a little less family friendly, but it was nothing we found very offensive--just young people partying a bit loudly. If you're a Total Rewards member (Harrah's Casinos), check your email or online for deals! They do some fantastic ones. My husband and I have visited Las Vegas without the children, but this was the first trip with them. I was surprised by how much fun we all had. If you enjoy gaming, you'll need to make babysitting arrangements of course. We are fortunate in that our older daughter was happy enough to stay in the room with our younger daughter for a few hours in the evenings. It made for an enjoyable time for all! Be prepared for fairly expensive dining if you choose to stay in the casino for meals. Also, unlike cheaper chain hotels, they do not have many "freebies." There was a charge for internet use. There was a mini-bar with very expensive items. There was no in-room refrigerator, microwave, nor coffee maker. It was beautiful and very elegant. I can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “There is no-where finer to stay in Vgeas!”
Reviews.Author: Cyprusleeds
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th time in Vegas in 3 years so needless to say we love Vegas! We have stayed 3 times at Caesars and also had our wedding there 2 years which was fantastic and after also staying at the Bellagio ((never again!))and also the Mandalay Bay we would always go back to Caesars as by far the best hotel, most amazing pool and of course the shops! The Palace tower seems to have the best rooms and worth the extra to upgrade as the rooms are huge! Best point on the strip as so central and we would heartily recommend it to anyone who is thinking of going! P.S I am quite fussy but never had cause for complaint at Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “They were nice, but not friendly”
Reviews.Author: Ssmith52
Reviews.Content: We were at Caesar's Palace last weekend for a nephew's wedding. This was my first trip to Vegas and I probably won't go back for a while. Caesar's was expensive, even with our wedding discount, but our room was very dated and nothing special. The staff was nice but no one was friendly or went out of their way for anything. We had a quicker check in than most of our party. It only took us 20 min. Others took almost 45 min. The place was huge but not warm and friendly. We may have enjoyed ourselves more if we were late 20s, early 30s with lots of money! We liked the vibe at Paris better and would consider that next time.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy!”
Reviews.Author: francoisel
Reviews.Content: For an European citizen, this hotel is absolutely crazy! It's a mix between Walt Disney World and a 4 stars palace. Everything is funny because so fake that you can't believe it! The mall in the hotel is great and... absolutely crazy with their talking and moving sculptures.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little over it”
Reviews.Author: jengel1978
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at CP, but I'd been in it before. ROOM: We stayed in a deluxe room in the Forum tower which was lovely. Beds were great, brand new decor, marble bath-- but the phone was broken, the iPod aux cable didn't work. Overall, spotless and great. SERVICE: Not good. It took almost an hour to check in and the staff was rude when I brought it up. We called room service to get a bottle opener and it never showed up. The concierge however was very helpful and actually not snarky. FOOD & SHOPPING: We ate at Rao's which was great and worth every penny. The "casual" food options however were dreadful and overpriced. It was like eating at a ski resort-- 15 hamburgers. Nonsense. The Forum Shops are fun and the "art" available is hilarious. POOL: Fun atmosphere, but it's in the freaking desert and there is not a single umbrella. They want you to pay $500 for the stupid cabana in order to get any shade. As a pale redhead, I found this untenable. OVERALL: Good, fun, very Vegas. But overpriced ammenities, nickel&dimeing their guests, and crappy, surely staff make it less fun.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable vacation”
Reviews.Author: christmas1955
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here for my daughters wedding. It was just a spot on place to stay and would go back again if I was ever given the chance. There was a big choices of places to eat in within the hotel-it was quite mind blowing. The highlight of the hotel was the sheer luxury of the place.

Reviews.Title: “The Palace - Location, Glitter, Ombiance...”
Reviews.Author: Pottstown_PAKevinS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at several other locations, but always come back to Caesars... This was the first year we brought our teenage daughter (and her friend). The girls thought it was over the top and truly magnificent. Everyone loved the pool area and the weather could not have been any better. Shopping....the Forum area is a wonder all of its own. It is a fantastic place. We are already planning for a return visit. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “great location but not great service”
Reviews.Author: ladybug1022
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas multiple times and stay at a different hotel each time. Caesar's Palace is probably my least favorite so far. Tip #1 is to avoid the Roman Tower. This is the older section and the rooms are very worn. It also seemed to be the 'party tower'. There was alot of loud music and people that I could hear from inside my room. Our room did not have a closet, but a pole hanging in the bathroom instead. I heard that the rooms in other towers have been upgraded, but this one obviously has not. The front desk was not very accomodating at check in. They would not even talk to us about checking in until 1:00. I got in a 10 and checked my bags and headed to the pool instead. At 4 I went back to check in, waited in line for 1/2 hour and they told me that my room wouldn't be ready for another hour. The plus side of this hotel is the great location. There are great bars & restaurants & shopping attached to the hotel and it is centrally located, but other than that I wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Always a positive experience”
Reviews.Author: maryannGoffstown_Nh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Caesars many times over the last few years. Being a diamond rated player is definitely a plus. I have seen the lines at the front desk and would not want to wait that long to register. We have stayed at many hotels in Vegas and always get the VIP treatment here, from the marketing staff to the staff in the food court. The one very small negative is there are so many drunk young people on the weekends. We try not to stay after Friday night.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Room at the Augustus Tower”
Reviews.Author: Loves_2_Travel_19
Reviews.Content: I booked through Continental Airlines Vacation Packages - stayed in a beautiful Deluxe Room (upgraded from the Standard for additional $30) in the Augustus Palace (could not choose this online but requested by telephone later on) overlooking the Bellagio fountains and the Strip. Elevators to the Augustus Tower are located just to the left of the concierge/check-in area. And next to the Augustus Cafe (the only food you can get at Caesars apparently after 11PM). Very quiet area, yet just a hop, skip and a jump from the casino. This is truly the tower to book at if you don't want to walk through slot machines to get to your room, and want the added convenience of being closer to the Strip. There is a separate side entrance off the street if you want to take that route. The pool area (a must see) located conveniently down the hall from the tower elevators. Considering the age of the hotel, we decided to book these newer rooms. Very good strategy. The Palace Towers are also newer but we did not have a chance to check them out. The only downside to Caesar's is that the casino ceiling is lower than most (if you consider it is a 50 year old hotel) and that makes the ventilation a bit of a problem. Lots of smoke indeed. There are several beautiful pools located in the back of the hotel. We were unable to find chairs as we showed up around 1. Renting a regular lounge chair costs about $30 and there were none to be found at this time. The pool was extremely crowded. The more plush chairs were about $300 and the cabanas around $450. Both the cabanas and plush chairs were all empty with signs saying that you needed to pay to use them. We ended up laying on the ground on our towels.....(downside). Drinks at the poolside bar were expensive ($13 each) but the mojitos were excelent and well worth it!! Everyone seemed to have an excellent time - lots of nightlife at PussyCat Dolls and Pure. A big plus are the shows and the convenience of the Forum Shops.

Reviews.Title: “club pure is off the hookkkkkk”
Reviews.Author: markreynolds32066
Reviews.Content: if you stay in this hotel, the beauty of art inside is fabulous and and amazing staff and service is top of the line.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, not very good service.”
Reviews.Author: carolgiowa
Reviews.Content: My sister and I loved staying at Caesars. It was beautiful and the room was wonderful. The only downfall was that It took us over and hour in line to get our room and there were only about 10 people in front of us. Very slow service. It took a long time to get drinks while gambling. The cocktail waitresses were not very friendly at all. It's a great place to stay, but if you want to drink while gambling, I would go to another casino.

Reviews.Title: “It has it all; in the center of it all!”
Reviews.Author: upnorth98
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location in the middle of the strip. Palace Mini Suite was a well-appointed room with plenty of extra space. Staff was attentive when approached. Asked politely for a complimentary upgrade and received one upon check-in. Pool was open and water was warm. Wished more free lounge chairs were available in the sun. No need to ever leave the hotel but when and if you do it is in the middle of it all!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Review of CaesarsPalace”
Reviews.Author: barifuninthesun
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace Review – May 2010 Our recent stay at Caesars Palace started with the check-in of our room. Our accommodation was booked as a five day stay with three days complimentary of Caesars Palace due to our Rewards Card membership. After twenty minute wait within the streamline of customers patiently waiting for their check-in, we were comforted with a friendly staff member. Due to our 31st anniversary we inquired about an upgrade from our complimentary room. She introduced us to an upgrade room of over 2000 sq ft room offering a dining room, three bathrooms, a guest’s entertainment bar, living room and a grand master bedroom. First she offered the room for $100 per night, but her duty manager refused such an offer. She came back to us sheepish, quickly apologising letting us know that her boss wouldn’t allow such a price. We asked if he would accept $150 per night in which he rudely stated he could get a much better price per night. With that, embarrassed by the situation the girl attending to us, asked if we would accept $200 per night. We hummed and hawed over this price, as it was just too much, as I already knew that that our last night, Thursday night, would end up costing us the $170 plus $200 and an additional tax charge. Our Thursday night would cost $500 alone. With the overall costs I said, “No – that is just too much for us.” So I asked just for our complimentary room instead. As soon as I said that, our complimentary room turned into a nightmare of a room. The room Caesars Palace offered was on the third floor with only double beds, where we had reserved a King size bed. Suddenly I felt I was been taken for a ride and must of given the most discussed facial expression. She once again offered us the 2000 sq ft room on the 14 floor for $200 per night. My wife voiced her opinion and asked me to go for the upgrade, as it is our 31st anniversary. I decided to please my wives wishes, but still felt we were taken for a quick ride. From past experiences with complimentary rooms, they usually have offered us a deluxe upgrade at no charge. We were here to enjoy ourselves, so we left it at that, even though I knew our overall costs would be $1800 for just the room for five days. What really caught me off guard were the taxes with each night costing a whopping $100. Our room was enormous and apparently the original cost per night was $3600 per night. Mind you, we really didn’t have any use for three bathrooms or a large dining room table. Originally we were going to use the spa, fitness centre and go to three different shows, but after our upgraded costs of our room, we could not afford any of these luxuries. The next morning we did indulge in the featured Buffet of Buffets at a cost of $34.99 per person for reward card members and $39.99 for non-members. Knowingly we paced ourselves in order to go to all three buffets with Harrah’s Properties. Lago Buffet at Caesars Palace was our breakfast choice and was pleasantly surprised by great friendly service and inviting food for any foodies. You had a choice of freshly-made omelettes, baked ham, turkey or pork bacon, wide range of sausages, assorted seafood & potatoes and a fine selection of pastries. Our luncheon choice was going to be at the Paris hotel, but after seeing the overwhelming line-up we jetted over to Planet Hollywood and were glad we did. The Spice Market Buffet at Planet Hollywood featured Mexican, American, Italian and Middle Eastern food items. I stuck with the American food choices while my wife found fresh hot asparagus in the Italian section. Of course we shared the tasty asparagus while enjoying the beef and chicken dishes. We were seated in front of the Middle Eastern section and if only had room, I would have indulged in the pork kabobs cooking on the bbq. But I did leave room for the tantalizing desserts, like chocolate éclairs. After a long walk throughout the Vegas Strip we headed to our last buffet of the day, back to the Lago Buffet at Caesars Palace. Our choice of prime rib, crab and peel and eat shrimp, we barely made a dent. Needless to say we were FULL! Next morning we headed to the pool and found we were lucky to be poolside just before 9:00 am, as it quickly filled up. We decided to indulge into one of the bar drinks at a gasping price of $20 per drink, not including tip; needless to say, we had very few drinks at the pool. We quickly learned that any charges to our room would be topped off by a heavy tax. Mind you, poolside was complete luxury and worth the time taking in the sun rays. Throughout our days at Caesars Palace we took in the pool daily. Of course we took our turn in the casinos and knowingly spent our budget, but with a couple of noticeable wins. Smartly we re-invested our winnings back into the cost of our room. On Wednesday, we headed over to our reserved dining experience at the famous Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the Paris Hotel. Within minutes we were seated at our window seat over-looking the Bellagio with its fountain display featuring a beautiful view. Our selection of entrees envisioned a freshly cooked beef wellington with potato gratinee and hot asparagus. Unfortunately our entrees were cold with my beef wellington undercooked. I summoned our waiter, his eye brows raised as he looked at the raw beef within the pastry. He quickly took it away, with me thinking that I would receive a new freshly baked beef wellington. Astonished by the quick comeback of my dish, I noticed it was placed under a salamander to finish cooking. Shaking my head, I decided it was best not to say anymore, with them having no idea they were dealing with a retired Executive Chef of over twenty-five years of culinary experience. The view was great and the chocolate soufflé was wonderful. The rest of our stay at Caesars Palace was uneventful with good service from the casino to our room maid. In conclusion I would recommend Caesars Palace but do not suggest any upgrade, leaving them with the choice of upgrading for you at no additional charge. The food at Caesars Palace is acceptable with friendly service. Be aware that anything that you want to do cost extra, including the internet service of $14.95 per day, fitness centre at $25 per day and the spa service starting at $45 per person. It is to your advantage to become a Rewards Card member to entitle you to frequent offers either to your door or e-mail address. Vegas Reviews understands that a mega corporation like Harrah’s Properties really isn’t too concerned with customer’s reviews, as they rely on high-rollers and established guests that spend an average of $25,000 - $100,000 per stay. Spending $4000 is small potatoes to such a large corporation. I will keep you updated if Caesars Palace leaves a comment... You can check with us on Facebook - Vegas Reviews for updated reviews of hotels in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, disorganized mess”
Reviews.Author: dillonjohnr
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Las Vegas after a five hour flight and took a cab to the hotel. There were at least 50 people ahead of us on line waiting to check in. Check in time is 1 pm, we got on line at 12:17 and got to the front at 1:17. Our room was not ready yet, so we couldn’t get the key. We decided to grab lunch while we waited (at Caesar’s) and they wouldn’t let us in with our bags. We were told to check them. We had to wait on line to do that , too…and then back to lunch, where we had to wait on line to get in, wait to place our order and then wait to get served (one of our meals were wrong, too). When we were through with lunch, we had to wait on the “express” line again to get our keys and the room still wasn’t ready. After much begging, the desk clerk agreed to give us the key as long as we promised not to go to our room for one hour. An hour later, we went to our room and called for our luggage and – not surprisingly – had to wait an extraordinary amount of time for it to arrive. We made our way down to the pool and no one knew about the pool chairs we had called to reserve a week earlier. The life guard/pool maid at the Jupiter pool was extremely rude and explained that the chairs had to be paid for before we sat in them. Also, there was biohazard danger in the Jupiter pool, so no one was allowed to go in it. Other annoying things: 1. Buffet lines ridiculously long 2. No barber service on Sunday or Monday 3. Confusing casino layout 4. Unnecessarily loud and noisy 5. All spa services ridiculously overpriced This is just a taste of what we experienced and what you can expect if you stay at this hotel. When we go on vacation, we want everything to be as easy as possible. Everything that you want to do at Caesar’s either requires you to wait on line or pay extra money… and everything is a hassle. The staff is inefficient and rude. Don’t make the same mistake we did and stay at this hotel. We visited the Bellagio while in Las Vegas and they couldn’t have been nicer or more accommodating---and we weren’t even guests there!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: jamesyp1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed here (and got married here) in May 2010. Took a wedding package that let us stay in a massive suite in the Palace Tower, and this room was amazing, with two bathrooms, a massive bed and views over the pool area, as well as a plasma on the wall. All the hotels in Vegas are amazing but Caesars is definitely the best. Only negative is that it's maybe too big - it took 10/15 minutes to walk from reception to our room, and it is very easy to get lost!! The spa is AMAZING, well worth a visit. Great amenities, with loads of bars and restaurants, including a great food court for quick snacks etc. 3rd time in Vegas... this time was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, bit noisy, lousy pool staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: ralfvd
Reviews.Content: With these amounts of review on this hotel, most issues and cheers already have been expressed by others. I'll add mine to the long list of reviews. In general I liked my stay at Caesars and given the fact that I had business to attend in that same hotel, it was a good stay. Some highlights and things to improve: Positive: - Fast check-in: the line was not long and check-in was very efficient. In my room in about 5-10 minutes (can't remember, had a big jetlag during check-in) - Large room (Palace Tower De Luxe): I stayed for 8 nights, so some space is always welcome. - Enormous pool area. Looking at other hotels, pool/room ratio is great at Caesar's. - Good choice of food in and around the hotel, although pricey. Caesar's is smack in the middle of the Strip, so a good place to start your adventures in Sin City. - Parcel center/Business desk: good services to help you get your business done. Very friendly and helpful. Don't look at the costs of their services though ;-) - Hotel navigation: You will need to learn your way around the hotel, but you will learn this soon enough. Comparing with some other Vegas hotels, it is pretty simple. Negative: - Room location: I reckon I didn't have one of the best rooms in the Palace Tower ( 6th floor, not great views). Given the large amounts of nights, I would have expected something more. - Fitness: apparently common in Las Vegas: visiting the fitness area would set you back USD 25 . Opening hours very limited (6am - 8pm). If you are there on business, these times are not suitable for a work-out. And 25 USD _per_ day is just plain outrageous. I just went outside in the early morning for some running. - Internet: although the room description stated that Internet was included in my type of room, connecting my laptop would incur a 15 USD per day charge. Maybe that would be comped during check-out, but I didn't try. I can live without Internet, but maybe they could clarify their policy - Noise: Through the connecting doors a lot of "neighbor noise" was heard. I had a party group next to me a couple of days, they crammed with up to 6 people in a room at 5am. I had to call security one night. That was handled nicely and discreetly. But you know groups: after an hour, the volume went up again. The hotel wasn't full by any chance, so I would expect that the people would be spread during check-in. - Pool: Unlike other hotels, everyone can visit the pool, no guest check is executed. This leads to lots of locals spending their day off at Caesars, so no empty chairs anymore at 9:05am, unless you pay $$$ for the daybeds and cabana's. These prices are flexible and I heard prices up to 350 USD for half a day... - Pool service: After ordering a drink and some bites to eat (took me 30 minutes to get the attendants attention), I waited for an hour: no drink, no bite. I had to retrieve the credit card myself at the bar. No apologies. Still awaiting the credit card invoice whether the order was billed or not. Overall: a good hotel and after seeing some other hotels I was glad I booked Caesar's, but given their steep price, they should increase their service on some major points.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Venus Garden”
Reviews.Author: jaelsawa
Reviews.Content: We were married on May 15th, 2010 in the Venus Garden at Caesar's Palace. What an incredible experience! Everything was wonderful and beyond expectations. Our package included an hour's worth of limo use, so we opted to be picked up at the airport. We had my son and his girlfriend with us, who had never been to Vegas before. She was amazed as we drove the strip and were delivered by limo to our hotel. Our trip consisted of six nights, the first two were comped with my Total Rewards card, the second two were included in the wedding package and the third set of two were comped on my fiance's TR card. Six nights of luxury on the 24th floor of the Palace Tower. The room was very nice with marble floors and granite counter tops in the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and we did not hear any noise coming from neighbors. The view was to the north and at night we could watch the volcano show at the mirage from our window. The ceremony was great. I had read posts that warned that the noise from the pools would be a problem, with the garden wedding being right next door. That was not a problem as our wedding planner, Melissa, said they turn the music down during the ceremonies. Everything was top notch: the music, the photos, the video, the flowers, the location. We were very happy and received many compliments on how perfect it all was. Our reception was held in the Atrium at the Augustus Cafe. The food was absolutely incredible. I had the chicken with the best garlic mashed potatoes I have ever tasted. I was also told by those who had the salmon that it was the best they had ever had. We opted for the chocolate cake with cream cheese frosting and it was very delicious. We were very happy with our experience and would recommend using Caesar's for your wedding. Everything was wonderful and we would do it all the same way again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: katnj
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Vegas. After a 5 hr flight we had to wait on line at the check in of the hotel for over an hour. When we got to our room , it was just like any other cheap hotel room. Our closet and safe were in the bathroom. When I went to use the blow dryer it was broken and when I called to have another one sent I was told I "had to wait, because they had a long list of people ahead of me". Then one day they didnt even come to clean the room or make the bed. I was so dissapointed. The casino was so confusing to get around in, I would never go back to Caesars. And by the way dont stay in the Roman Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Still Charming after all these years”
Reviews.Author: jessiwel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here once many years ago, but didn't have much of an impression. Perhaps it was because I was with my parents. This time, my boyfriend and I had a room with a jacuzzi in the Palace Tower. It was unseasonably cold in Las Vegas this past winter. We spent a lot of time in the hotel, so it was important that the room was big and comfortable. Spent a lot of time soaking in the jacuzzi hot tub. The room looked a bit old, but was clean. Not musty smelling :-) The view from our room was great also. The location is good, being a the center of the strip. But then, this property is huge and it takes a while to get to the main strip. Spent a lot of time getting lost the first couple of days. Somehow, I always end up at the forum shops. Felt guilty spending so much money, but I have to help the economy. Hey, my boyfriend was doing his best to outdo me in the casino!

Reviews.Title: “Venus pool FAB, rest of it, ordinary ordinary ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Jodestar
Reviews.Content: I will start with the good: Venus pool was great, we went to a Thursday pool party and had a hoot. Staff at the pool all fantastic. Everything was outstanding. Food/Staff at Neros were also great. Very ordinary: Arrived in our room, no folder of hotel services. Rang reception, and the response was, we know, we have been trying to tell management. My husband needed to do some urgent business, internet service would not work, took 2 hrs to get that sorted, pretty basic hotel services I thought? Others in our group it turned out could log on straight away, yet for the hassel of spending 2 hrs following up with them, nothing. Large outdoor pool, fantastic, pool coctail staff should be fired. Took 30 minutes to get a drink, 40 minutes to get the bill when I closed out, this was all late afternoon and the pool was not overly busy at that time. Girl was uninterested to say the least. Heard others around us complaining as well. We had a room in the Tower. Woke up to girl having orgasm on one side, followed 10 minutes later by a gaggle of girls on the other side talking excitedly for approx 20 min on the shopping they were hoping to do. Both loud enough I thought they were in our room. Our door key also got wiped. They warn you of this when you arrive, dont put near anything magnetic etc. Stayed in Vegas 5 times and I travel for work so hotels frequently, never had this issue, but it seems at Caesars its common. Lots of fun walking back to reception at 4am to get that sorted.

Reviews.Title: “Found used bandage in bed”
Reviews.Author: spikeoscar
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at Caesars again! The room (in the Forum Tower) was dirty on arrival. When my wife and I decided to retire for the night I turned the sheets back and found a used bandage under a pillow. I rang "housekeeping" and complained. When a housemaid arrived I showed her the bed and checked the bed out closely before she changed the sheets and found human hairs ( I hope they were human) also on the sheets. Meaning, housekeeping had not even bothered to change the sheets prior to our checking in. We complained to housekeeping and the front desk but, truthfully, no-one gave a damn. Decor in most public areas was very impressive, generally staff attitude to service was apathetic (it was noticeable that many service areas were understaffed). The Bell Desk was very effecient and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “ugh...... stay elsewhere........”
Reviews.Author: aerainier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace for my sister in laws wedding. We arrived on May the 14th, only after waiting for 2 hours for a bus from the airport due to Greyline Bus Service.....first off, use BELLTRANS..... when you book online, dont book greyline. They are slow, late, rude, and you save no money by booking online with your trip. Just pay when you get to the airport. We waited for an hour for a bus to arrive to take us to the hotel, were ignored and to top it all off, a sleezy salesman boarded the bus with us to try and sell us show tickets and get us hooked into a timehare deal. Annoyed to say the least. Back to Caesars. Unlike a nice bottle of wine, not all things get better with time. Caesars is nice in some areas, then just rundown in others. We had 5 rooms for our party, had spent over 10,000 dollars on this trip alone for the wedding, and REFUSED to allow the hotel to hold 200 dollars on each of our credit cards. Initially when I was greeted, I heard the front desk person mention what tower we were in..... however, after we argued about the card being held, when we finally got our room keys we were placed in the ROMAN TOWER. The Roman Tower is apparently where they send people they do not like or care about because its crappy as any hour rate motel you will find off the strip. Its dingy, run down and the power went out in the bathroom while my wife was hurrying to get ready for a wedding. The call to the front desk to get some help was as pleasant as stepping on glass shards. The electrical outlets in the room didnt work, awesome for charging cell phones and laptops..... and to top it all off, the view included a rooftop and Donny Osmonds face. (Thankfully the Augustus Tower blocked Marie) The wedding was great, no complaints there...however the wedding video will include all the bass from the music being blared at the pool which is 25 feet away. The casino is run down as well. The workers look like a mesh of new casino college grads and beat up over the years veterans who can't work one of the nicer hotel casinos. The uniforms are dingy and outdated. The carpets are filthy throughout the hotel. The staff is rude. I'm sure if you are a high roller, you will be treated better.....we had already given them a huge chunk of cash so we were not important. We didn't spend a single dime in their casino or shops. We made the walk across to the Venetian and Palazzo (reviewed by myself also on my review page). If you have the option, stay elsewhere. The Venetian is much nicer, friendlier and full of helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but where's the exit?”
Reviews.Author: Floridashirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned after 3 weeks in USA, we started our vacation with 4 nights in Las Vegas staying at Caesars Palace. We found check-in to be easy, after reading reviews on here I was expecting to have a long wait but there was only three people waiting in front of us and five people already being dealt with, so that went smoothly enough. The check-in staff where polite and helpful, marking on a map how to get through the casino and to the elevators in the Palace Tower. We arrived at our room on the sixteenth floor with no problem. The view from the room was toward the Wynn hotel, not brilliant but not too bad either. I knew that the items in the fridge were weight sensored so we knew that if we had anything out of it that it was going to be expensive but we were warned that even if we moved anything it would be charged to us. My husband was so thristy so decided to have a SMALL orange soda and it was $4, so be warned. The room was lovely, very luxurious with two queen size beds and a large bathroom. There was lots of fluffy towels and everything was spotlessly clean. The food in the hotel was very expensive so we tended to eat off property and considering the queues in none hotel restaurants I think everyone was doing the same. The pool area is gorgeous, comfy sun loungers and lots of them but don't forget there are lots of people staying here so you did need to get your lounger very early on in the day unless you wanted to pay $50 for the more luxurious ones. There was loud music playing round the pool area every day, my hubby and I usually class lounging by the pool as a time of peace and relaxation but that was definately not going to happen so decided to have a few drinks to relax us. Waitresses in bikinis are serving drinks by the pool, I had a Pina Colada and my hubby had a soda and the check came to $26 plus tip. We didn't get drunk that day. The casino is a place you could easily spend full days in and thats just trying to find your way out, no windows, no clocks and no exit signs but if you asked staff for directions they were only too happy to help. The shops had some lovely wares, most of them designer names but it was nice to window shop in an incredible environment. We went on a helicopter tour of the Grand Canyon, spectacular is the only word to describe it, well worth doing if you are visiting Vegas. After 4 nights we were ready to move on to the peace and quiet of the Florida Keys, we had to check-out at 3am to catch our flight for Miami so obviously our check-out experience was one of not having to queue. If we return to Vegas we would probably stay at a different hotel, not because we didn't like Caesars but we just like to check out other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Hotel - Dos and Don'ts!!!”
Reviews.Author: chef082
Reviews.Content: I was assigned a room in the Roman tower upon check-in; the room was overdue for refurbishment and so I changed to the newer Agustus tower. The Agustus tower was much newer and modern. I was very comfortable there and the amenities/cleanliness were excellent. Problems: Be aware of your reservation and where the hotel assigns you. Not all rooms are the same at the same rate. the Roman tower does not stand up to their start rating !! Check in and check out was severely understaffed. Everyday during my stay I noticed the line extend past the Concierge desk and Guy Savoy Restaurant counter ( = 25+ minutes) Augustus café: There are two lines to be seated; one for regular guests and one for the seven star members. If you are in the regular line up and seven star members arrive, you have a very long wait in front of you, even at breakfast. The hotel should stagger guests in some way. Strong tobacco odor throughout lobby and casino: this is the same with all Vegas hotels. Internet $15/day : I rarely return to hotels that charge for internet; it's rediculous. Gym $25/day, also pool only open at 9AM. I went jogging instead.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: Mitchell73
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great view our window looked straight down the strip. Double Jacuzzi Bath. Rooms alittle tired still very clean but need alittle updating.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Be Back”
Reviews.Author: 270kentuckywoman
Reviews.Content: As I've read some other reviews - check was a nightmare. Rooms were already pre-paid and yet it was still messed up. Assigned two people the same room - had to get more help with this. Any time there was a problem e.g. room key didn't work, the smell of pot in your room, you had to stand in this line again - it's not right. The room was merely o.k. Certainly not outstanding. In the lobby/casino there was literally no place to sit unless you were gambling, well three benches near the bell station. If you were meeting someone you just roamed around if you weren't interested in the gambling. It got a little tiresome. This is a very large hotel. We could never find out way around and many people were asking for directions. You had to pay $5.00 to use a computer on the wall in a hallway to access the internet for 5 minutes. We used it to print off boarding passes. $5.00 is the minimum. Would have used the fitness area but it was $25.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's is the best hotel I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Tiffa130
Reviews.Content: We received a complimentary room upgrade (google $20 trick) and ended up in these great rooms with AMAZING bathrooms. The hotel services were great, all the staff was really friendly. Some things were expensive but not unlike anywhere else in LV. The only thing we didn't like was the restaurant (Augustus cafe) and the buffet, both I felt were sub par in such a great hotel. The food court at the forums is cheaper and tastes way better, or if you are looking for expensive but outstanding food try Mesa Grill (chef Bobby Flay). My parents went with us, it is their 4th time in Vegas, they have never stayed at the same hotel more than once (MGM Grand, Luxor, & Rio) but both agree they would come back to Caesar's. Oh and the pool was fantastic!! You really felt like you were at a bathhouse in Rome. My only complaint was not enough waitresses, it took too long to get a drink. Otherwise fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace Suites, The Best Hotel in The Las Vegas Strip.”
Reviews.Author: hsputri
Reviews.Content: My family have been a frequent travellers to this entertainment city. Over the years, Caesar's is one of our fave hotel in Vegas. Clean, luxurious, good services and foods made us keep coming back for more. The strategically located hotel (exactly in the middle of the LV strip) makes easy access to go everywhere. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: arant
Reviews.Content: I visit Vegas regularly and this was my first time to stay at Caesars Palce. I always thought it was a beuatiful place but once you go upstairs and go to your room forget it. I stayed in the Roman Tower in room 1179. The picture that was shown on the website was in no reflection what the room actually looked like. Which I can say is not the norm for a Total Rewards property I have been a member for several years and normally the room is as pictured. However the room was very very outdated. The bedding was outdated was not the norm pillow top that you expect to find in one of these properties. The TV was an old box with bad remote control. I do have to say everything was clean. This was also the first time I had travel to Vegas for a business conference and we paid full price for the room I would have expected it to be even better. Most comp rooms I have received at other properties have far exceeded full price at Caesars. Stay somewhere else and get your money's worth!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: cosmic19
Reviews.Content: Got to Caesars in the afternoon on a tuesday, absolutely no problem with checking in, patience is a virtue, people should remember this. Spoke politely and cheerfully to a lovely man who upgraded us with no problem at all, and no extra cost. We were given a room on the 34th floor that overlooked the beautiful Bellagio fountains, the Paris hotel and the strip, amazing! I did give him a tip, but just because he was so good to us. The room was huge and very clean, we were given a fridge free of charge and every day we left our maid $2 and she restocked towels and toiletries for us. The hotel is massive but just ask the staff for directions or any queries and they are more than happy to help. Being polite in the US and being English are the two things that will get you good service but most of all be patient. The hotel is well worth the money and yes tipping is required, but thats how it is, if you don't want to tip don't go to the States. This is my 2nd trip to Vegas in six months and i thought that after staying at the Venetian the 1st time i wouldn't be able to match it but i'm pleased to say that Caesars was on par and the hotel and staff were great and i would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino Hotel - but remember its a Casino first Hotel 2nd!”
