Reviews.Author: Gabbys79
Reviews.Content: Ok - Awesome and impressive. Ill say that. But given some of the reviews the best advice i can give is to first figure out WHY you are in Vegas. If you want the "Vegas" themed casino hotel, this one is it. If you want a Casino that is a maze and you cant get out from, this is it. If you want to be mearly a number in a 5,000 room hotel, this is it. Ok - We liked it didnt love it. Was absolutely a nightmare to exit becasue every casino is designed in such a way it is a science formula to try to get out. Long check in, no personal service. But lush room, really luxerious hotel. No personal services. Buffet was a nightmare. they were advertising one price and trying to charge another. Then would roll their eyes if i brought it up - not sure what that was about. The pool side is to be seen only - its one of those place where you need to become a hawk to get a good day bed. A cocktail poolside is $16. the waitresses wear bikinis and are all great looking so good for the boys. Anyhow - It is Vegas so if you dont like it dont go!

Reviews.Title: “not great , not terrible.... try someplace else first”
Reviews.Author: thedude1NewYork
Reviews.Content: two things i read from other traveller's : 1. long check in line... try a 45 minute to 1 hour wait ! .. just what i wanted to do after a 5 hour flight ... wait in line for 45 mins to check in .. 2. prepare to get nickel and dimed to death .. extra fee for the gym, everyone needs a tip, and extra for one of the pools, credit card operated safe....at least the towels at he pool were free... room was average at best ... old tv's, old grout on tiles, dated looking room .... staff was pretty nice overall, but my wife had her purse stolen from a restaurant in the forum shops by a bus boy... apparently these spaces there are only leased by Ceasars, so they couldnt do anything... but, it appears to be part of Ceaser's, so i still think of Ceaser's in a bad light..... location was good

Reviews.Title: “Recession?? you could'nt tell it from the prices being charged...”
Reviews.Author: MKillin
Reviews.Content: Took my Wife and 17 year old for some sightseeing in Vegas. I had been there several times before. Caesars Palace was nice to stay in, but check in lines were horrible. They did not have the room we had reserved, so they upgraded us... however the upgrade room only had one bed, not two as needed.. so the first night we had to use a roll-away-bed (not the most comfortable thing..) Then they were supposed to switch our room the next day - during which we were without a room for 7 hours (which is not good when your wife is wanting to freshen up before going to a show). Then - no-one had told the bell desk to move our luggage as they were supposed to do, so I had to do that too (or wait another 1/2 hour before they could get to it.)But at least the new room was very nice, 25th floor overlooking the pool. If your on a budget - the Buffet is the best deal - get the 24 hour pass for $34.95 (note - this price includes the $5 discount if you have a free players card... GET ONE free to save $5 per person). The 24 hour buffet deal is good at any of the Caesars properties including Planet Hollywood, flamingo, Harrahs, etc... NOTE - The buffet at Caeasar Palace is the WORST!!! Poor selection of food, cold food, dried out food, bitter coffee, etc. The Flamingo right across the street is VERY GOOD. Hard to believe that one company owns both hotels and such a drastic difference i the quality of the buffets. at least 300% better at Flamingo! As for the shows... Cirque de solei Mystere has been my favorite followed by La Rev (shown at the Wynn) or Phantom of the Opera (at the Venitian), Last place goes to Cirque's KA. KA was good, but not nearly as good as Mystere. Be prepared to pay $$$ for just about anything... couple good FREE things to see are Bellagio gardens, Bellagio fountains (at night), Lion habitat at Venitian, Sculptures throughout Caesars. Rent a car and drive to Red Rock Canyon or Valley of Fire State Park. Both are welcome distractions from the crowds and well worth seeing! Red Rock was free.. Valley of Fire was $10 for the carload. Both are about a 45 minute drive from the strip. Depending on how much you want to hike while there - you can see Red Rock in 1 hour or a full day. Valley of fire - 2 hours to a full day. Also VERY FUN is Pole Position Raceway... indoor go-carts about 2 miles off the strip.. Pricey at $25 per 8 minute race, but you usually can find a coupon for "Buy 2 races - get 3rd free" on the internet... These carts are FAST! I'm a tightwad.. but this was worth the $$ - even my wife enjoyed this! All-in-all it was a fun trip

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased, glitches were to be expected at a major casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesar's for 3 nights as part of a conference with over 400 attendee's. I am a frequent visitor to Las Vegas, but this was my first time at Caesar's and I would rate it as one of the better hotel stays. To get the negative out of the way first, the most glaring issue (and most expected) was a check-in line that took 45 minutes. This was at 4:00pm when attendee's from 4 separate conference were checking in. For a line as long as it was, it moved efficiently and hotel employee's circulated with bottled water. I had requested a King room in Augustus and was disappointed at check-in that not only was an August room not available, but nor was a king non-smoking. So I was given the option to wait an hour for an upgraded room on the 45th floor of Augustus, I waited, was able to use Platinum check-in and 5pm and was not disappointed whatsoever. The room was spacious to say the least. A large sitting area, good sized dining table in addition to the large king-bed. Enormous bathroom with separate jacuzzi tub and glass enclosed shower, dual sinks and a flat screen television. It was also spotless and cleaned on-time each day. All staff that I encountered were very friendly and I found that the dealers and pit bosses were among the friendliest I have encountered in Vegas. The conference hosted a reception at Shadow Bar on Tuesday night and that was one of the highlights of the trip. Playing blackjack in the pool on Thursday was up there as well. With poolside drinks costing well over $10, I was more than happy to play blackjack and get the drinks for free. The pool area is outstanding, "Garden of Gods" describes it aptly. My only other real complaints go to the quality of the conference food, which considering the 5-star restaurants on the property, left A LOT to be desired. That, and the smell of smoke throughout all the common area's - the hotel could probably use an upgrade to the ventilation system. I spent time at both Wynn and Encore and felt the smoke permeated those casino's much less. All-in-all, I would stay at Caesar's again if the price is right (sub-$200).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Grunt1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Caesar's on 4/25/10 at about 1:30pm and the front drive was a mad house, but the Vallets/Bellhops were handling every thing with a very professional and friendly attitude. It took us about 15 minutes to get the suitecases inside and the truck parked. The line at the reception area was also around the world, but being a Platinum card holder there was only one person in front of us. I requested an Augustus Tower room with a view of the B - fountains. The receptionist said she would see what she could do. We received room #4354 in the Augustus Tower and it had a great view of the fountains. I will stay at Caesar's again if I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: mexbound51
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights in the Augustus Tower..I can't comment on the other towers but my room was great..on the 39th floor overlooking the Bellagio fountain..super clean and the maid service was excellent...the elevators were very fast and no waiting...all the staff very friendly..ate at the Augustus cafe good for breakfast and dinner..the pool was great..good staff..had a cabana for 3 days and loved it..would go back again also great location no need to take taxis

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you like being gouged”
Reviews.Author: widebodydriver
Reviews.Content: Accompanied my wife who was attending a conference, and got what we thought was a reasonable rate on the room. While the room, and the rest of the property was very nice, the constant nickle and diming was unbelievable. Want to go work out at the workout facility? That is an additional $25 per person, per day. Want to take a shower after your workout? That will be an additional $25 per person, per day. How about that small bottle of water in your room, after your workout? What a deal! only $5 (plus a 25% 'restocking fee'). Internet usage in your room? $20 per day, per person. You get the idea. Plan on spending at least double whatever your rooms costs. I have done a lot of traveling, and I have never felt so ripped off. No wonder Las Vegas has fallen from favor. Shame on Caesars, and shame on Harrahs, the company that operates Caesars. I will NEVER stqy there again, or at any other Harrahs property.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace - The highlight of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: shazza_lc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars Palace for 7 nights in April 2010. We arrived at 12 noon after a very long flight from Australia and were told we couldn't check in until 3.00pm. The staff member suggested we come back at 1.00pm to see if our room was ready. We went back and the check in line was very long. Seeing we were so tried we joined the queue and waited 45 minutes to get checked in. Kevin (at reception) checked us in and we asked about an upgrade and for a minimal cost we were upgraded to the Augustus wing. It was a large room with spa and huge bathroom (with TV) and overlooked the Bellagio water fountains - amazing spectacle at night. We took advantage of the Buffet of Buffets offer through Harrahs and paid $29.95 each for 24 hour use of any Harrahs buffett. Great value! Our room was cleaned everyday and staff were always courtesy and polite. Check out was easy and we would definitely stay at Caesars again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ann2122
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights mid-April in the Augustus Tower. After waiting for nearly 30 minutes to check-in we got to our room which had a wonderful view of the Bellagio lakes. I noticed that the desk had something sticky on it and obviously had not been cleaned. Then I went into the bathroom and there was a wet towel in the bottom of the tub. My husband immediately called housekeeping about the bathroom not being clean and when we returned from dinner a while later, the towel had been removed. Since we had flown most of the day and were tired we decided to eat in the Augustus Cafe for dinner before going to the Donnie and Marie show across the street. We were seated immediately and the man that was also bussing tables got our drink order brought them to us. After 15 minutes, he realized that we still hadn't ordered and brought us some bread, then went to remind our server that we were there. She came to our table about 10 minutes later, apologized, then took our order. Food arrived about 30 minutes later, it was okay, but we were disgusted with the service, except that by the older man who brought our drinks and bread--he tried to make things better for us. The ventilation system at Caesar's doesn't seem to be up to Vegas standards. The lobby and casino were filled with smoke every time we walked through and it was almost unbearable. We went into the casinos at Bellagio, Mirage, Wynn, Pallazio, Aria, and Mandalay Bay, and we did not notice the smoke being anywhere near as strong as it was at Caesar's. One other note, we had to walk through the lobby every time we went to and from our room, and we noticed that there was always a line at the check-in desk--whether it was 8:00 a.m. or 8:00 p.m. or just about anytime in between--they definitely need more people working to get people ckecked in within a reasonable time. On a good note, we ate at Bradley Ogden's restaurant and it was absolutely delicious--we always eat there when we are in Vegas. We also enjoyed having dessert at Serendipty 3--wonderful. We have stayed at Caesar's several times, but were definitely disappointed with our stay this trip. We will go back to Bellagio next time we are in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Love Harrahs' properties”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraJL
Reviews.Content: We returned April 12th from a 5 day trip staying at Caesar's with our son and Daughterinlaw and two other couples. As always, our stay was great and we love the staff at Caesars. We go there once or twice a year and have never been disappointed. We like to stay in the Palace towers as it is close to pool and other parts of the property. We ask for what we want and everyone is always helpful. Like Diamond Lounge and the many restaurants available. As some reviewers stated, I can't imagine Caesars have rooms that are not immaculate and if they are not, that they wouldn't change it for you. Last year, we stayed at Paris and we had a wonderful room there also. We love all the amenities there and you can find something to do 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: IndyGirl00
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Caesars this past week. We tipped the check in guy and were given a room in the Augustus Tower on the 40th floor with a view of the fountains at the Bellagio. We checked in around 1130 and didn't have any problems with a long line or getting a room early. Our room was good sized, completely updated, huge bathroom, and worth every penny. It was also really quiet in the Augustus Tower. My previous Vegas stays were much noisier. One of the best things about Caesars is that you don't have to walk through the entire casino to get to your room. That gets so old at some of the other properties. We also had excellent meals on the property at Mesa Grill and Joe's Stone Crab. The pool was excellent, but it can be hard to find open chairs. It would be helpful if the staff (or the patrons) would pick up their towels when leaving the pool. It's hard to tell who is in the pool and who left for the day. Drinks seemed a bit pricey at $20/piece, but they are 32 ounces. A couple of $16 martinis at night and the pool drinks start to look reasonable. The snack bar was a bit pricey, but the fruit salad was a perfect lunch on a hot day. Yum! We spent our last day at the spa. The massages are 1/2 price on week days and totally worth it. The use of the roman baths, sauna, and steam room just make it even more valuable. It was a great way to spend our last day as we were given lockers for the entire day. We were also allowed to leave and return later to take showers. We were able to take the red eye back home clean and completely relaxed. Definitely money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: doeusa
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in a number of different hotels in Vegas. Was my first and last stay at Caesar's. Overall service was poor. Room routinely not cleaned until 5pm even though room was unoccupied all day. Annoying and Inconvenient when wanting to return to room to clean up and dress for dinner. Most every hotel offers complimentary coffee, but not Caesars! They offer complimentary coffee for ONE guest for ONE day. Anything beyond is $7 extra per day. Didn't expect to be nickle and dimed at a luxury hotel. Handle on light switch fell off. Housekeeping did not follow through and deliver as promised. Made several attempts to have concierge print boarding pass. Woman in concierge's office was unfriendly, rude and downright sarcastic. Worst concierge I have ever encountered! Restaurant service also slow and over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- huge property”
Reviews.Author: canadarose1
Reviews.Content: Our stay started badly with an almost 1 hour wait to check in on a Sun afternoon-too long by any standards. The front desk guy, however was helpful and pleasant. Stayed in a classic room, Roman Tower. While it wasn't updated, it was very roomy and clean. The bathroom door didn't shut properly, some of the furnishings were well used, no flat- screen, the bed was comfy- and the room was extremely quiet. The pool area was great, fun on a warm weekend, drink service speedy, and a good atmosphere. The property is huge, not that easy to find your way around. Staff were good, always friendly and helpful. Location is GREAT! Definitely best part of the strip. Would go again at a good rate. Really need to improve the check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: KJHBerkshire
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a one week stay at Caesars in Las Vegas, and I cant say enough nice things about it. We arrive at about 8pm to a small check in line, which moved quick enough. We gave the $20 tip for a room upgrade a go and it worked! We got a huge room in the Augustas tower, with 2 beds, massive bathroom with shower and jacuzzi bath. The view was part mountain and part pool, but was a little dark as it had another building infront of it, but when your on the 43rd floor who cares! The room was cleaned daily and if you leave a little tip every day you get plenty of goodies from house keeping. The robes were a nice touch and very handy. The room safe was small and well hidden, and beware the mini barn, it is very sensitive, just looking at it could set it off!. Room was quiet which is always a plus and we got a late check out of 1pm at no extra charge. The hotel itself is massive, you do get given a map which which is useful, but we still got lost! The pool is fab with lots of seating, but very close together with little room to move the loungers. If you want a bed, or cabana it costs and the VIP Venus pool was $20 to get into! Resturant wise we didnt eat here, but did use the Cypress Market Place for snacks which were a good price. Went to Pure on Saturday nite, it was rubbish, I dont get the hype at all. The club was packed, with no room to move or stand, and the rude bouncers pushed you out the way for standing in a hall way or by stairs. Huge que for girls and boys loos, we waited 20 mins! Drinks over priced and really aimed for those who can afford table services as they had loads of room. Casino wise it was good with plenty of choice and room at the tables, although its not for the faint hearted, we started playing roulette at a reasonable rate and then loads of people turned up and starting putting on huge bets, so we felt pushed out. Didnt have any problems with drinks ladies around the slots, always got a good amount of drinks and if you tip them, they do come back. Great location in the middle of the strip, would recommend using the free tram from Belligio to the Monte Carlo and if you want to travel to either of the outlet centres of down town to old Vegas use the ACE bus, they run all hours and are fast with good security. Saved us a fortune on taxis, shame it doesnt go th the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good service”
Reviews.Author: xeno111
Reviews.Content: We got a free upgrade from the standard room to the Forum Tower from the friendly clerk at check-in. Our room offered a view of the Strip, which was great. Most nights before dinner we had drinks there and watched the lights come on. We couldn't see much of the Bellagio fountain show next door. Other, pricer Caesar's towers get that view. The room was clean and well appointed. Great bed, a couch, chair, and even a sliver of a desk. Nice bathroom too. The ridiculous mini-fridge didn't have a millimeter of space to store anything. Every slot was filled with bottles, marked with a warning that if you pulled anything out, you'd be charged within 30 seconds. We never got around to requesting an actual fridge - not sure if there's a charge or not. Super-friendly staff that answered questions and brought requested items to the room quickly. Check-in line moved very quickly. As far as check-in, don't count on doing it before 1p. You'll have to hold your bags in the bell desk before then. The part that's a drag is once you've checked in, you have to be in your room to receive your luggage. We didn't feel like sitting in the room waiting, so once we had our room, we brought our bags up ourselves. The pool is great, with a specialty drinks menu that goes beyond the usual lame frozen drinks. Skip the sticky sweet stuff from the machines and get the bartender to make you something you'll actually like. The snack bar at the pool is mediocre, and fairly pricey for what you get, though the portions are large. The central strip location is convenient, and free shuttle buses can get you to locations further afield, like the Rio. The desk gave us a coupon book that offered $10 off the famed seafood buffet there - ask for one if you're planning to try it. You can view your bill and check out on your TV, so no need to spend any time in the line on your way out. Overall, great stay, no complaints. Only our second time in Vegas, so if we return, we might try a different hotel just for variety. But it's definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I still like Caesars, but it's not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Whathappensinvegas
Reviews.Content: So my wife and I had our 10th wedding anniversary in April, 2010. We had been planning this trip for 5+ years and always said we would splurge and stay at Caesars Palace. We booked 5 nights in a Deluxe Room in the Augustus Tower 8 months in advance. It's a good thing we did because, as the dates got closer, the room became $400 more expensive. Neither of us have ever written a review on tripadvisor.com but, since we used it so much while researching this trip, I thought I would write a little something. The Good- The mid-strip location of the hotel can't be beat in my opinion. I love the ancient roman theme. We both love the Forum Shops even though most of the stores there are out of our price range. As we had read in previous reviews, there was a long line to check in. The hotel had several (10+) front desk people working, though, and it only took us 20 or so minutes to get through. I used the "$20 trick", explained that we were there for our anniversary, and asked for any "complimentary upgrades" (specifically a strip/fountain view). We were placed on the 45th floor (almost the top floor) with an awesome view of the Bellagio Fountains. The room itself was nice even though my wife said the colors and patterns were tacky. We especially liked the large spa tub in the bathroom. I really liked how fast the elevators were going up so far. We hardly ever had to wait more than 30 seconds for one to show up. The Bad- First, the outlets in the bathroom did not work. None of them. We contacted the front desk and they said that they would send someone to fix it (yes, I tried pushing the reset button). We came back later in the night and they were working. The next day they weren't working again. We didn't bother calling the front desk again. Next, my wife and I came back to our room at about 2:30am and the door to our room wouldn't unlock. We went downstairs (from the 45th floor) twice to get new keys and it still didn't work. Security and Maintenance tried several different keys and finally had to use a jumbo slim jim type device to open our door. We waited more than an hour in the hallway before getting into our room. This was the morning of our renewal of vows ceremony and we wanted to get a good night's sleep. Then, there was one day that housekeeping did not clean our room (probably because we didn't leave it until 3pm) and we needed clean towels. I went to call the front desk and found that the phone didn't work. It worked fine the day before but now all I got was a busy signal. I commented several times to my wife that I never had these kinds of problems in the cheaper hotels that I have stayed at and I really hadn't expected them in a hotel with the reputation/cost of Caesars Palace. I should mention that we received a $50 comp for our issues with the door lock. Also, as the trip went on, it bothered me more and more that Caesars had stocked the fridge and one shelf in the room with mini bar type snacks and beverages. From reading tripadvisor.com we were aware that we would be billed for these items if they were removed from their positions on the shelf/fridge and we were careful not to do that. A couple of things about this.......1-It was not posted anywhere in the room that we would be billed if we so much as moved these items, 2-There was no room in the fridge for anything that we might have wanted to put in there and since we couldn't move any of the items.....3-This whole set up seemed like some sort of scam of Caesars to get more money from it's guests. If you are someone that was not aware of this and didn't carefully read your bill when you check out then you'd end up paying for things you never used. I'm sure Caesars makes a lot of money of these kinds of misunderstadings. A couple of other things of note.....there are no coffee makers in the rooms. We had to walk through the casino and past the sports book to a food court type area with a coffee/bagel place. I, of course, used this opportunity to place bets on games. This wasn't a big deal necessarily but how hard would it be to have a coffee maker in the room? The Red Lion we stayed at before flying to Vegas had one and it was a hell of a lot cheaper than Caesars. Overall, I still like Caesars and would like to chalk up the negative experiences to bad luck. However, we could have paid 1/2 the money and stayed in a nice room in one the several hotels across the street. I bet those hotels had working outlets in the bathroom, a working phone, and a door lock that actually opened when you put your key in. Maybe they even have coffee makers in one of them. When you shell out as much money as we did to stay at Caesars, you should at least expect the room to be in good working order. My wife and I will not be returning to Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars - meh.”
Reviews.Author: CarolannPhotos
Reviews.Content: Location - A+ that's about all i was impressed with. We had a "classic" room - meh. Nothing was TERRIBLE, but I don't think I'll stay there again. If we had paid full price I'd be choked, but since we got a hell of a deal i'm not going to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Dog Employees!!!”
Reviews.Author: llohrke52
Reviews.Content: We booked our room online and didn't like the view. So my husband went down in the morning and asked for a up grade. The lady said it would be $20.00 more a night. We thoght it would be worth it . She said she would call are cell phone by 1:30 when the room would be ready. All seemed to be going well. Well she never called so we stopped back around 4:00 and spoke to another lady. She said she didn't understand why she dropped the ball and never called us. She said because of that she would up grade us for no charge. We thought that was really nice of her. Well then came check out time 3 days later. And a charge of $67.00. We tryed to explain to the gal at the desk what the other lady said to us. She said I'll get the manager. He went around in circles till I said are you saying we are lying. Then he just wanted to get us out of there. He didn't charge. My advice is any change in a room or upgrade get it in writing with whoever did it sign there name. Best part of stay was getting into the cab and leaving. Next time back to The Belligio.

Reviews.Title: “JUST OK or a bit below”
Reviews.Author: Justyy
Reviews.Content: I really dont know what the people a raving about. Its just OK. The hotel is dated, and the rooms are 'outdated'. There probably are the 'budget' rooms and the 'highroller' rooms, but my budget room was comparable to a high class motel. The last night of our stay we HAD NO HOT WATER in the shower. Really? I expected more of a 4 star. We ended up getting a credit for our calls for the inconvenience, but plzzz. Very smoky .. but I guess Vegas is. oh...forget about the Caesar's buffet. I went to check out the food, and i had to ask where is the rest of it. They said..."no...this is it". ummmm for $30.00??? .. that was a shocker. Go to Rio's all day, all you can eat buffet for $24.00 with all you can drink champagne until 3pm Everything else was ok. We had a comfy bed - fully controllable temperature in each room ... clean (except for the stained ikky chair). I would stay there again...however

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace-HUGE HORRID HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mandyshandy
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is a must see place!...however stay away from Caesars Palace which boasts a million visitors per week.....you are number nothing!!! Although clean..a little dated but palatial its service hospitality and helpfulness is non existent. Instead you are faced with endless queues arrogant attitudes and expensive dineries. Its biggest insult to holiday guests is that the gamblers are given priority at every corner, they dont have to queue for meals but walk through. The lago buffet breakfast means a 15minute queue every morning...however when you enter the diner most of the tables are empty and reserved for the gamblers who no doubt have notched up a fortune in this hotel. Its a lovely hotel to walk through but not to stay at. We went for our las vegas style wedding, taking a party of 16 guests....not a flower did they put in our room which was an expensive upgrade viewing the strip. I had to argue for 16wine glasses to be delivered to the room, they wanted to charge a dollar per glass!!! I visited the wyn hotel which was smaller but far more elegant and friendly. The Caesars had an excellent location however. A MUST SEE IS LA REVE an experience you will never forget!! oh and take a travel kettle, coffee in the hotel is around 6dollars and the augustus restaurant conveniently situated by the front entrance will not allow you to sit just for coffee/tea!!! outside the serenity cafe opens at 11a.m.- a kettle and tea/coffee is a must. ALL THINGS CONSIDERED LAS VEGAS IS AN ABSOLUTELY BRILLIANT EXPERIENCE ----however be warned it is expensive. have fun

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not worth the price, poor amenities, but great location and views.”
Reviews.Author: cmw6v8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in the Roman Tower. Our room was not one of the newer, luxurious ones. I've stayed in Holiday Inn Express hotels that were three times as nice as this room. The bed seemed like it was twenty years old--uneven, stiff, and springy. While the room rate was affordable, it would have been nice to have a few amenities like a basic coffee maker in the room, which we did not. I believe the hotel also lists things like an iPod docking station, etc. which we also did not have. The fixtures in the bathroom were falling apart. I was surprised to see the exact same sink fixture that I had in my childhood bathroom, and wouldn't you know it--the handle fell off, just like it did in my own bathroom. The room did have a great view of the pool area, but that is about the only nice thing I can say for it. The hotel is a great location on the strip, very centrally located. We didn't eat in any of the hotel's restaurants because they seemed very overpriced and we heard bad reviews of most of them.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: CookieTeacher
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Caesars last week. Beautiful hotel. Awesome shopping and Spa. Very romantic, yet exciting. Suite was incredible... jacuzzi tub, lots of space, living room area and dining areas were very nice, too. Excellent service from all staff members... they went above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace - Premature Goodbye”
Reviews.Author: Melia21Montreal
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! We had a suite on the 30th floor of the Augustus Tower. The suite had a very comfortable and plush bed, a bathroom with double sinks, a jacuzzi and a glassed-in shower. There were floor-to-ceiling windows in the suite, as well. We were facing the Bellagio fountains, and could watch them "dance" from our suite. We had some meals at the Augustus Café downstairs, where prices were relatively reasonable and portions were generous. The "Garden of the Gods" pool complex was lovely. For the swimmers out there: Although the depths of the pools were 3 to 4 feet deep, it is still possible to swim laps. The hotel heats the pools to approximately 80 degrees Farenheit, so it is a comfortable temperature for swimming. Tips and tricks: -There is a "Tix for Tonight" booth at Bill's Gamblin' Hall which is almost directly across the street from Caesars, where you can get half-price tickets to popular shows and discounts to restaurants. Just be sure to go early (they open at 9:30 a.m.) for the best selection of shows and meals. -Ask for coupons at the front desk when you check in. We got coupons for savings on buffets, and 2-for-1s, etc.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE ROOM!”
Reviews.Author: doctorGo
Reviews.Content: Although I booked with our convention's block-of-rooms 3 MONTHS in advance the front desk said they did not have a room for us when we got there. They said we would have to stay in one room one night then move to another room the next 2 nights. I talked to the manager who said he would take care of the problem by putting us in a "suite", HOWEVER, there were no windows in our bedroom... just mirrors where the windows would have been! How disappointing... I book 3 months in advance to stay with our group and end up in a hole with no windows!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: noxinnhoj
Reviews.Content: my first trip to vegas in twenty years,wow has it changed!We booked a classic room,but at the front desk we managed to get a room upgrade to the palace tower,junior suite,really nice,900 sq.feet,2 bathrooms,jacuzzi tub and a full view of the new pools.No complaints about the room whatsoever,luxury!!The guy who cleaned our room was excellent,no waits for elevators,check in/out was quick and all of the staff were really freindly.I have read some bad reviews on here about rooms in the old tower,so,either book a better room or request an upgrade.Our hotel experience here made our trip!The only cons ,no coffee maker in the rooms,$8.00 for 2 take away javas in the lobby,$28.00 for two margaritas at the pool bar,but,the pools are to die for.I will definately go back to Caesars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace Was Great! 2nd Only to Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: starsmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casears Palace for 2 nights in March. We decided to stay here due to having tickets to the Lional Richie concert, which was great! We had been here for the Celine Dion concert in the past.We had a King Room in the Augustus Tower which had a great view of the Bellagio Fountains. Check in was a breeze! We must have gotten there at the right time. The service was fine. Our room was clean and comfortable.Nice linens and amenities. We ordered room service twice and the service was quick and the food was good. Had breakfast one morning in the Augustus Cafe. Very good! I found out from watching the reviews here to NOT stay in the Roman Tower. Many had stated that the rooms were old and worn. We have been to Las Vegas many times and usually stay on the other end of the strip at Mandalay Bay, Luxor or The Hotel. We think Caesars was a nice hotel and we would stay here again. It was very central to the strip and we walked everywhere we went. We did rent a car and found the Valet service to be quick and courteous. We will be back in 2011 to see Celine Dion on her return visit to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Siouxfan1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at Caesars. Booked a package deal with a local airline. With our package price our room was only $90.00 a night and I wouldn't pay more for a classic room in the Roman Tower. I've seen rates as high as $300.00 a night for a classic room. The Roman Tower rooms are in the orginal Caesars Palace which dates back to 1966. Negatives include - old and outdated room which included the carpeting, furniture and TV. Also, our view was concrete and the roof of the Lago Buffett. Couldn't see the pool or strip. Positives include - Roman Tower is near the casino, buffett and pool area. Easy to access all of these. Also, the bathroom seemed newer and the room was very quiet. Slept pretty good. Also, service was excellent. I would not pay $300.00 a night for this room! Go with the Wynn or Venetian if you plan on spending more than 200.00 a night. I hear the Deluxe rooms are a nice upgrade at Caesars. The days we visited no upgrades were available - big conference at Caesars (Wine and Sprits) and rooms were sold out.

Reviews.Title: “1st class room and great location”
Reviews.Author: a1copyguy
Reviews.Content: 1st stay at cp after 4 trips to vegas. had arranged for the harrahs limo service to pick us up at the airport and will say it was the best 40 bucks in comps i ever spent. despite being 2.5 hrs late our driver was there and stood by as we awaited the luggage. since i am a diamond card holder i was sweatihg out getting there in time to use the diamond check in,well we missed it but they had us use the 7star vip check in and had to be the last party of the night at 11:55 pm to check in since they closed at midnight. with a smile and a mention of a very long day of travel i was upgraded from a palace tower room,to an augustus tower room with bellagio fountain view rm3580 to be exact they were also kind enough to put my inlaws in the same tower. tipped her 20 bucks after the fact for being so sweet to both myself and inlaws. room was spotless and well furnished. definetly be aware of sensors on the wet bar snacks as well as the assorted items that tempted my mil to handle(she had a huge bill at check out because she handled everything anyway ,but we were able to get those charges removed. casino was soso, id rate it higher if i had any luck. only negatives were the buffett and augustuce cafe. both very soso food,much better buffetts in vegas. keep in mind that the property is huge,and its almost as if the casino is split in 2. palace and forum. the only reason its as if its in 2 parts is theres a long seperation between the 2 hidden by one of the clubs,we found the forum casino much more fun,its located next to the sports book. wife loved the qua spa, and housekeeping was almost invisable,not meaning they didnt do a great job,but i mean they werent knocking on your door early in the am waking you up. and almost without exception we were treated with respect and felt the staff were always sincere when we needed assistance with anything. we are already planning our trip on business next year to stay at cp eventhough our confrence is at mandalay bay. we found drink service to be excellent on the casino floor,and although at night when the nighclub crowds started rolling in it did get pretty noisey it was entertaining watching the younger crowd enjoying life and not a peep could be heard from our room . although i smoke ,my wife does not and she felt the casino at cp was much better at freshening the air of smoke than several other casinos we played in on this trip so she was very happy about that as well. would definetly recommend cp especially if you can get the newer towers,palace,forum or better yet the augustuce. from chatting with others on the ta message boards i know the roman and centurian are much older. and as far as the palace tower is concerned its a longer walk to the casino than the forum and augustuce towers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: blre
Reviews.Content: This was the first time when we went to vegas after asking lots of people and talking to friends we decided to stay in Ceasars Palace.We arrived at 3 p.m and check-in was good and staffs were very friendly. We got a room in roman tower , the room was really good. The view of the city was really nice specially in night time.Expedia offered a very good package for 4 nights. We liked the casinos as well as the nightlife of vegas. It is worth to stay in ceasars while you are in vegas. I would like to go to vegas as well as ceasars again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Exquisite Service”
Reviews.Author: Neutrogena06
Reviews.Content: Very luxurious and a great value! We were lost (unfortunately several times) in the casino. Whenever we asked someone for help, they not only told us were to go, the took us there personally. We felt truly spoiled. Cesar's customer service is from an era gone by. We loved our room, the view, and the food. We will be coming back again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “cool pool view, very far from entrance or parking”
Reviews.Author: ManicQueen
Reviews.Content: small room that has a lot of things going on.. not as what we expected..

Reviews.Title: “Great...once we got checked in!”
Reviews.Author: Abbielove
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time with the check-in process. The guy at the front desk didn't seem to care that we had arrived at the hotel at 8am and by 1pm still weren't anywhere close to getting a room. He offered to downgrade us and get us a room right away, and while we were discussing it, he said the room had been taken. So, he told us to come back later...but call ahead first to make sure our room was ready. We were so exhausted, but decided we'd wait for the room we paid for. We gambled for an hour or so and then just on a whim decided to stop by the front desk to check on our room on our way to lunch. We were helped by an extremely friendly and knowledgeable employee who immediately got us into a room and said she didn't understand why the other guy would downgrade us...if we were going to wait another 2 hours for a room, why wouldn't we wait for the room we wanted? All in all, we had a great time. The casino near the forum shops was uncrowded and the waitresses provided great service. The hotel is huge, but by the end of the first day we pretty much knew our way around. Our room was non-smoking and extremely clean. The bed was so comfortable! The first night we were there I fell asleep on the bed with my shoes still on and my purse still in my hand...I literally could not keep my eyes open once I got in that bed. I'd definitely go back but make sure that my flight doesn't arrive until closer to their actual check-in time to avoid dragging our suitcases around all day and exhausting ourselves out of frustratio. I also wish there were more fast food type restaurants...the only thing even close is the Cyprus Street Market which had bbq, pizza, hamburgers, etc..and $8 beer. And the service wasn't fast there either. In the 5 days we were there, we never dined at Caesar's, but instead at Planet Hollywood and the Harrah's buffet across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Better options on the Strip - Will not return”
Reviews.Author: jakobee
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I have been to Vegas a number of times and I typically vacation here a minimum of once or twice a year. Previously, I have stayed at the Wynn, Mirage, and Luxor and decided to stay at Caesars on this trip due to the status it holds as one of the classic Vegas casinos. One thing you should know if you choose to stay here, and before booking your arriving flight, is that Caesars will not offer you check-in until 1:00pm. They actually had a woman standing in the lobby questioning people in line if they were attempting to check-in and ejecting people from the line if they were not checking out. This was a first for me. I get the fact that they want to focus on the check-outs, but this employee did not even give a "welcome to caesars" and her stern demeanor set the tone for our stay. I get the sense (and was explicitly told by the Front Desk) that if you pay for an upgraded room, the quality of the furnishing and amenities is much nicer. I, however, opted to stick with my room in the Roman tower, and I have to say, even with modest expectations, was disappointed. The room itself was very outdated with scratches on the wallpaper and furnishings. The hallways in this tower were dingy and the elevators are in lackluster shape. On the positive side, Caesars has some of the most beautiful swimming pools I have seen in Vegas and the casino itself is very nice. You also cannot beat the location. Caesars is located centrally on the Strip and has one of the nicest (premium) malls in Vegas located directly adjacent to it. I would suggest skipping the buffet. The food quality and ambience were poor and it wasn't worth the cost whatsoever. Flavors buffet, located across the street at Harrah's, is considerably less expensive and with much more variety. Caesars Palace is actually owned by Harrah's and one thing they promote heavily in their hotels is the benefit of "no resort fees". One thing I can honestly say is that I would easily pay a bit more to have a much better room and more modern amenities. A better option at a lower cost would be the Mirage, which is located next to Caesars on the strip. The rooms are more modern and the restaurants are better, in my opinion. You also may be able to find the Wynn at a similar price to Caesars from time to time, which is hands down, the nicest resort I have stayed at in Vegas. Bottom line - if you are coming to Vegas for a special occasion or a vacation, there are probably better options on the strip. You may have a better experience than I did by booking an upgraded room, but I firmly believe that a "standard" room should at least meet "standard" levels of quality for a 4/5 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: travelprincess1
Reviews.Content: I grew up hearing how great caesars palace was from my grandparents and parents- I imagined that it was the epitamy of what vegas trully was. Our host set up our 4 day stay with what we thought was a great rate- needless to say it was 700% more. We waited in the check our line 40 mins to be told that. A manager was able to get it to about 300% of the expected price after our agent called again. Next day I ordered room service- American Breakfast-14., Carafe of coffee-7 Total 46.00 and some change- due to I asked for a side of peanut butter for my sons 2 pieces of toast- chg was 4.00 for a serving of about HALF a JAR-?? come on- talk about waste- gratuity was charged, service fee was charged, tax was charged.- and it keeps coming- The key didn't work for us coming back in the room from dinner- 50 min wait for a security guy to open the room up- then we were told to call the front desk to get a new one- so after another 50 mins since requesting one- The operator said it would be faster for me to pick one up at the bell desk, The safe didn't work- 40 min wait for someone to fix it- so we passed on that and hoped no one stole my purse while we were walking around. Housekeeping left dirty cup with lipstick on it- I don't wear any-they didn't clean the glass on the tables etc. Overall I was disappointed in the service- I was so excited to go there to have , what I had hoped, to be a real old school vegas experience from them- The hotel has been visited by 3 generations of my family that have played there and loved it- but I think the service has been lost with the growth and they have lost what is important- Its the small things- Service and making someone feel that they are wanted there even if they aren't a "whale". We head down to vegas once a month and try out different hotels, I was most excited about this one, but also the most disappointed. This is my experience and everyone will have a different one either the same or worse, but in these economic times , people want bang for their buck and even if its fresh fruit bowl upon arrival or just exceptional service ( that doesn't cost a hotel anything). It matters.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Roman Tower!”
Reviews.Author: dakula03
Reviews.Content: It was our first stay at Caesar's Palace. We were sooooooooooooooooo disappointed. We have stayed at numerous hotels on the Strip, and we would say this was the worst tower (room) we've ever stayed in. We were just glad that our room was comp, otherwise we would never stay there with the price they are charging for. No way! We've stayed at motels where it's 10x nicer and cleaner than this room. Our room was so old, the carpet was so dirty, there was no real closet (it's like motel closet-- no sliding door or anything) , the beds were small and tilted towards the headboard!! It was SOOOO uncomfortable!! Talking about motelish, there were housekeepers carts left on the hallways ALL DAY. I understand this is a big hotel but we've never seen a so-called classy hotel which wasn't classy at all!!!!!!!!!!!! We also heard the water faucet running from other rooms. This is a big hotel, so expect to wait at least 20-30 mins (if the hotel is busy, it will be longer) to get your car from Valet and the waiting area was so small, crowded and unsafe if you have younger kids. 2 positive things about this room---- there was a small (about 4x 6 in??) LCD TV monitor in the bathroom and the bathroom amenities were pretty nice..(shampoo, body lotion, etc etc) It might have been a better story if we stayed in a nicer tower.... but we will never stay here again even though we get a comp room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location - Great Hotel - Outstanding Pools”
Reviews.Author: Mcstx
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Caesars Palace, Las Vegas on several occassions and we have always been completely satisfied. Caesars is right in the heart of the action. With the overhead walkovers, walking to attactions on both sides of Las Vegas Boulevard is quick and easy. As a Diamond member, our checkins have been quick and courteous and the rooms have always been first rate. The newly renovated pools are an outstanding attraction and a lot of relaxing hours can be spent soaking up the April to October warmth and sunshine. While the buffet is slightly below par with other classy hotels in Vegas, there are plenty of other restaurants and a good size fast food area. Caesars always has a first rate entertainer on site along, a swinging singles club and sundry other quality entertainment. The Forum Shops have been expanded and are an attraction unto themselves. While some travellers like to nitpick about little things they don't like, my advice is to get over it. Caesars is a wonderful spot to stay while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience”
Reviews.Author: Zivana
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in 2 rooms at the Caesars Palace. With the help of other travelers reviews we tried the USD 20 trick and tipped the front desk, we got the free upgrade to a junior suite. We were staying in the Palace Tower. The friends joining us for that adventure wanted a smoking room at the check-in but after they entered the room the smell of cold cigarette was really unbearable, We asked to change the room and it was no problem at all. We have been to the Caesars a few years ago and the rooms have largely improved from that time, now still the feeling is the same. It is a really huge hotel but if you are to follow the signs you will always find your way around. The rooms are huge and the furniture is classic and nice. The beds are a dream to sleep in. The hotel pools are great and the rate of USD 25 for the cabana is worth the money. There is no complementary coffee or tea which is a pity for such a great hotel and the internet rate is a little high for what you get. The location of the hotel is the best possible, you are on the strip and everything is in walking distance and you should walk around!

Reviews.Title: “4 days of our lives we can't get back!”
Reviews.Author: lupuslady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed CP 6 years ago on our honeymoon and decided to "enjoy" it again for our anniversary. We were so disappointed by almost every aspect of out visit. Service at the hotel, especially the front desk (check in services) was the worst I've ever experienced. Arriving at 10:00 PM and waiting in their check in maze, it took 4 rooms in the first 12 hours before we were given the twice requested room. I have lupus and have some difficulty walking. There was absolutely no regard or sympathy for this situation and was told bluntly if I did not go back to my room for ID, I would be locked out of my room. CP is NOT a small hotel. I was at the desk to have them swipe my credit card for the 3rd time in as many days. They just could not get it right from start to finish and I am quite sure they did not care. My husband and I chose to spend every penny OUTSIDE Ceasars Palace. We will not go back again and frankly, have lost 4 days vacation that we could have enjoyed someplace else. We really felt cheated, disregarded. disrespected, used and abused. There are many nice places in Vegas where "HOSPITALITY" remains a priority, sadly, Ceasars Palace is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hidden costs and promises”
Reviews.Author: avidgambler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the airport and we had no limo to pick us up. This had been pre-arranged by a host. We paid for the taxi, arrived at Caesar's, of course the room was not ready. The diamond check-in was not open for business, but the gentleman behind the main check in was very nice. We pre-requested a coffee pot and and refrigerator to be in our room. Needless to say, that didn't happen. Upon checking with the Diamond Services, we were informed that the coffee pot would be $40.00, I didn't bother asking about the frig. Room service for a pitcher of coffee and two bottles of Lipton tea, ran 30 plus dollars. I have never been so disappointed with simple amenities. The room had a gorgeous view of Bellagio. Try Harrah's, at least the host, Charles Dunn, lives up to his promises!!!

Reviews.Title: “Son's 21st birthday”
Reviews.Author: SherriR3
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the incredible spa at Ceasars Palace. My future daughter in law and I had manicure and pedicures, while my son and husband enjoyed massages. We enjoyed a boxing match at Mandalay Bay. The rooms at Ceasars Palace were incredible, as well as the bars and the resteraunts.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas B-Day and Congratulations Trip”
Reviews.Author: santabarbaraserenity
Reviews.Content: I took my son to Vegas for his college graduation/birthday/got a raise at his job congratulations trip. He has never been to Vegas and I haven't been in 25 years. Driving in, if you are using valet, stay to your left at the end of Caesars Palace Drive or you will end up in the Forum Tower shops. I think you go right to self-park. We used Valet parking; just a note that the person who comes to your car is the first of two people that will help you, so when you tip be sure to wait for the actual person who will be taking care of your car and bags. I ended up tipping twice. The second person takes care of your car and getting your bags to the Bellman. $5 seems appropriate for that service. I think it may have helped to get my bags delivered quickly (in less than ten minutes after we arrived in our room). We stayed in the Forum Tower Royal Suite and it was very nice for the price; we paid under $600 for two nights (a Thursday and a Friday) on a 50% off deal (code-50SUITE). Our room 6306 had a peek view north on the strip and of the mountains in the distance. It would not have been worth the full price of $1200; there seem to be way too many other options at that price. Google "Forum Royal Tower Suite" and someone has posted a youtube video that shows exactly what you get. For the room, check-in was easy since we used the new system TEXTPRESS where the hotel sends you a text the day before your check-in; you check-in and they have your key waiting at the Bell Desk. It took less than 30 seconds because there was no line to wait in. The person behind the desk suggested that it will only work to speed up checkin as long as not too many folks utilize the system. Also there isn't really a chance for an upgrade because the Bell Desk doesn't have control over room assignments. In the suite there was a foldout couch but the couch was more comfortable; we ordered two extra pillows and blankets from housekeeping. He also brought sheets without my asking. I tipped him $3. Checkout on the TV was quick and easy, and we went down to get our car, handed the guy our card and tipped him. I do not think guests remember to tip him because he was very appreciative of the $2 I handed him and I could hear him put us in front of the line of people waiting for their car, had us wait in front of his desk rather than the Valet waiting area and had our car delivered to us there. I tipped the person who delivered our car $3. She was also very appreciative. I essentially tipped everyone who did just about anything for us. They count on that as part of their way to make ends meet. I did not tip the Bell Person who handed me my key and I didn't tip housekeeping because they just left the couch bed a mess with pillows and blankets all over. Had they done just that little bit, I would have left $5 for the two nights. THE TRIP: Night one we purchased a 24-hr pass on the DUECE (RTC transit) for $7 each (paid exact change on the bus in front of the Flamingo) and went to downtown Vegas to eat, see the light show (which is every hour on the hour starting at 7 PM) and gamble. We ate at the buffet at Main Street Station (see map http://www.cheapovegas.com/index.php) It was 15 dollars each and was just okay; sure it would have been fine if we had had a few drinks. Then we watched some street performances and the light show which was pretty cool---can't really explain it, you have to see it. After the light show we went to gamble for the first time ever for each of us. We heard gambling for first timers was cheaper, easier and more friendly downtown than on the strip. While we do not know what it is like to gamble on the strip because we never did, our experience downtown was great. We played blackjack at El Cortez, and the dealers were very helpful in teaching us the ropes. We gambled for a couple hours and came out a little ahead, tipped the dealers and headed back to the strip on the DUECE. It was a terrific first night. Night two, we explored the strip, ate lunch in the Eiffel Tower at the Paris hotel. It was good and cost us about $85 with no drinks. Then we hopped back on the DUECE and visited the Pawn Stars Pawn Shop. It was small and unremarkable. In the evening we went to eat at the Bellagio Buffet, but the line was way too long (maybe an hour, maybe two---my son stayed in line while I went to find an alternative). When I came back twenty minute later he had moved about a fourth of the way through the line-maybe a third. Regardless we were able to get into Le Cirque to eat at the bar. It is very tough to get a seat without a reservation on a Friday at the last minute. Picasso had a table but we didn't like their menu as much. The meal was very good; Jean was an excellent bartender and took good care of us, but at almost three hundred dollars with only one drink, it probably isn't really a good choice unless it is a super special occasion. In the end, sitting at the bar was more fun than sitting in the restaurant. Finally we saw the Blue Man Group. It got mixed reviews but we thought it was great fun. We were middle of the theatre in row F. It was a little too close. Would have been better to be about 4-5 rows farther back I think. Row H, seats 9-11 seemed the most comfortable, no one in front so good leg room and close enough to see the details of the show.

Reviews.Title: “Put on your walking shoes...”
Reviews.Author: rumridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Augustus tower , very nice room , view of the Bellagio fountains.The room had a king size bed , table and sofa , did not come with a fridge,but they sent one up.The bathroom was large, stand up shower with a large tub with jets.The pool is on the other side of the property probably a 2 mile walk through the casino and shops, Great pool , but don't forget anything in the room, All in all I would stay here again , Fun place ,

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Pharm214
Reviews.Content: After booking an extremely cheap package deal through Southwest Airlines, I read reviews of the room I had reserved (Classic) and got extremely nervous. After doing some research, I knew that I had to upgrade the room upon arrival. We arrived at Caesars at 11AM and were told check-in was not until 3PM, but the bell hop told us to try at 1PM. We came back at 1 and check-in began immediately. The line was massive, but moved pretty quickly. We were waited on by a nice young guy who was very friendly. He told us he would be able to honor our request for a non-smoking room with two queen beds (we added a third person to our room, but didn't bother to tell Caesars). I then tried the $20 tip trick for a free upgrade (which I read about in other reviews), but it didn't work. He did tell us, however, that we could upgrade to the Augustus tower with a Bellagio fountain view for only $40 per night. Since we had gotten the room for so cheap through the Southwest deal, we gratefully accepted the upgrade. We were given a room on the 40th floor with an awesome view of the fountains and the strip. The room was enormous, with two beds, a couch with a coffee table, a table with two chairs, and a desk with chairs. The room also had a decent closet and a gigantic bathroom (tub, shower, two sinks, and separate toilet room). Everything was very clean as well. We had no problem with noise. Room service was always excellent and timely. The elevators were speedy and the walk to the lobby of the hotel wasn't bad. The pool was good (half of the seating was always covered in shade, so we had to get there by 10AM to get decent seats), but the drinks were expensive ($15 for a pina coloda). The hotel is located at the center of the strip and was very close to many of the main attractions. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay with Ceasars and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!! Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Mx_10
Reviews.Content: Over all a great stay!! We arrived at 3pm an there was a line of 50 people waiting to check in, but in 14 min we where in our room at the Forum Tower, the room was great but had no view, but my gife loved the TV in the bathroom. The staff where allways helpfull in a friendly and profesional way, we had a package deliverd from amazon to the hotel and had no problem picking it up.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been More Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: mrsstewart09
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at numerous hotels in Vegas on The Strip, and knew what to expect from Ceasar's because we've also stayed at other Harrah's properties. I'll preface this by saying I would NOT pay top dollar to stay in their older towers (Centurian, etc.) because it's the same basic room you'll get at Harrah's across the street for a lot less. We booked a Classic Room room for one night at Ceasar's with our Harrah's Total Rewards card and it came out to $89. Upon arrival we slipped the guy at the front desk $20, and asked if there were any complimentary upgrades available, because we wanted to make this trip special. He typed away on his computer and said he had a suite available in the Augustus Tower, so we accepted without hesistation. Well, that was the BEST $20 ever spent in Las Vegas. The room was HUGE, 800 square feet, complete with it's own doorbell. Since it was a new tower room everything was immaculate and clean. We have a view of the pools as well as The Strip. The hotel itself is huge and I love all of the little details that they put into it. It's definitely a "Must See" on anyone's Vegas trip. The Casino seems tight, I didn't see a lot of people winning very much money, but I would highly recommend their food court "Market Street" on the casino floor. Yummy, and big portions for a relatively small amount of money (by Vegas standards anyway). I'd recommend this hotel to anyone, as long as they're going to try the $20 trick. But I wouldn't pay $400 to stay in an old room. Just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and great view from many of the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: FrisbeysTravel
Reviews.Content: When I stayed here, I had a great time. The people at the service desk did everything to be helpful during our stay, however some of the employees, such as the workers out by the pool or the waiters, were somewhat grouchy and not pleasant to be around. The room was very nice and had a great view. Down past the lobby, there is a very nice and very large mall with many interesting stores. This hotel also has a very nice casino. I think it was a good hotel and I would recommend this hotel to a friend, however the prices are a bit high and there are better hotels in Las Vegas, but this one is definitely a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “really a palace for ceasers”
Reviews.Author: deepzaveri
Reviews.Content: good ranked 4 or 5 star hotel. nice for stay in las vegas. casino for gambling in the best area of vegas

Reviews.Title: “Carries Wedding”
Reviews.Author: korenakay
Reviews.Content: Wonderful and beautiful place for a romatic wedding, Had a blast with my family and specialy with my daughter Amber...Carrie was a beautiful bride and I wouldnt change anything else in the world for such a great time at the pool and gambling was excititng, funny thing is, that I didnt know you get free drinks when gambleing at the slots!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas - Ceasers Palace”
Reviews.Author: jagmannnn
Reviews.Content: Just Spent 5 Great Nights In Las Vegas - Staying At Ceasers Palace In The Palace Tower ...Very Nice Rooms - With Great Service ... Very Expensive In Las Vegas - No Let Up - It Just Hoovers Up Your Money .... So Just Bite Your Lip & Have A Good Time And Worry About The Costs Later .... Seen 2 Shows - David Copperfield ( Brilliant ) & Matsuri ( Great ) ... Ticket Prices Are A Bit Of A Lottery - Buy One Get One Free - Half Price Tickets - Buy One Show Get Another Show Free ... So You Will Have To Do Your Sums To Get The Best Price ........... Drink & Food Is Plentyfull...And Realy Good

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Wedding in beautiful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: vegas4ever
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I travelled 7,000 miles to get married at Caesars Palace and it was worth every penny and the travelling! I had been in contact with my Wedding Coordinator, Melissa, for months prior to the wedding and she answered every question and query I had. She was brilliant! When we arrived at Caesars Palace the check-in was quick and efficient and we stayed in a Deluxe room in the Augustus Tower. They upgraded us to a Deluxe Premium room and it was amazing, I have never stayed in a room so big! The Augustus Tower is so close to the entrance that we were out and on the strip in less than 5 minutes. It was a perfect room and had views of the Bellagio fountains. We stayed for 5 nights in total and never once heard anyone on the corridors or slamming doors or noisy neighbours. On the day of the wedding I had my hair and make-up done in the salon and the girls there are really friendly and helpful and listened to what I wanted. I loved the manicure and pedicure sipping champagne it was bliss. We had 6 guests who came from the UK to our wedding so we booked the Romano Chapel at the hotel. It was a beautiful and intimate chapel. I had booked Julius Caesar to walk me down the aisle and he brought Cleopatra with him for my husband-to-be! They were absolutely fantastic and I would recommend them if you want something different at your wedding. The photographer was really good and took allsorts of different shots inside and outside Caesars Palace. Our favourite photo is outside the fountains to the entrance of Caesars Palace at dusk. We held our reception dinner in Neros Restaurant and ate Lollipop steaks. They are the biggest steaks any of us had ever seen! and were so delicious. Yes they were a little pricey but this was our wedding day and we wanted something special. The staff there were amazing too. If I only had one complaint it would be the price of drinks $15 for a Gin & Tonic seemed a little high for me but I wouldn't have changed anything about our wedding or our stay. We have booked again for our 1st Wedding Anniversary and plan to go back to Neros for another fantastic Lollipop steak. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas - Celene Dion Show”
Reviews.Author: vrk1951
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with still great amenities - great service and very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Centurian Tower is horrible. Low quality. Overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: TraveingMinnesotan
Reviews.Content: My stay at Ceasars Palace was horrible. Although I like the casino, I wasgreaty disappointed with our room at Centurian Tower. I have stayed at other casinos on the strip for much less and they have been much nicer and more recently renovated. Our room had a view of nothing ( the tower accross from us), our safe did not work, the t.v. was an old 27 in t.v. that had horrible "fuzzy reception", the furnature had obvious wear and tear an the night stand had hinges missing, and we could tell that some of the complimentry items had been reused becasue they had stans on the paper/evelopes. The decor of the room was a joke. The artwork...if you would even call it that...existed only on one small part of the room, the rest o the room was bare (the beds didnt even have a decorative headboard. There was no other mirror outside of the bathroom, so if you are traveling with anyone else getting ready to go out can be an issue. The carpet is in need of repair. Overall, I woud have been much happier at a much less expesive casino that would have had a much better room. DO NOT STAY IN CENTURIAN TOWERS! if you stay, upgrade or you will regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars is still a great Hotel Landmark for Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: whytegroup
Reviews.Content: While attending a conference in Las Vegas, I once again choose the Grand Dam of Las Vegas Hotels. I last stayed at Caesars 20 years ago, it was a lot of fun coming back and seeing how over the years the Palace still is as good as ever. When I checked in I requested to stay in the original tower where I stayed 20 years ago to see how the rooms looked now. Wow, My room was a great. It looked like the rooms were recently redone with a great bedding package. The room was very large and the all Marble Bath was very big as well. It had a huge tub and large stall shower. The 42 inch flat screen was new. The hotel as a whole is a city in its self. You really would not have to leave the Hotel for anything but if you are in Las Vegas you have to see Las Vegas. It is located right on the strip and with in walking distance of everything. My convention was at the Convention Center so the Monorail Stop for the hotel was a 5 min walk to the station. With all of the new hotels choices that have popped up in the past 20 years, a trip down memory lane was well worth it. You can't go wrong with a stay at Caesars Place.

Reviews.Title: “First class luxury and service.”
Reviews.Author: LawrenceHDenver
Reviews.Content: Even as one of the "older" hotels on the Strip, Caesar's lives up to the high standards of Las Vegas for luxury and service. The rooms are huge and sybaratic in pampering guests, as is the service.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Caesar”
Reviews.Author: Pneuma1
Reviews.Content: First visit to Las Vegas and could absolutely recommend Caesar's Palace. Had heard about the long queues at check in but we only waited 15 mins. We were immediately upgraded on checking in without asking or parting with any money. Staff were courteous and friendly. Hotel is very vast and you do need the map they give you to navigate. We stayled in the Palace tower and it was lovely. Our room was serviced every day and all toileties were replaced. The shops at the Forum were fantastic. The decoration in the hotel was opulent and bright. We were in Vegas for 4 days and during that time went to the Grand Canyon with Comedy on Deck tours. Very enjoyable day and our tour guide Robert was full of fascinating info - recommend this group. Be aware bring something warm as it can be cold at the Canyon. We also went on the Skywalk. It was a little expensive but in my opinion worth it. You can get reasonable tickets from the Tix for Tonight booth for the tour but you have to buy your tickets for the skywalk at the Canyon. During the tour you also have the opportunity to eat breakfast at the Boulder Hotel on route to the canyon. Historic hotel near the Hoover Dam. One tip for those visiting visfor the first time. Take the Deuce - which is the bus that runs 24 7. It cost $7 for a 24 hour ticket or $15 for a 3 day ticket and you hop on hop off at will. I would recommend that you take the whole trip to orientate yourself. Then use it to travel up and down the strip as it can take some time to walk up and down and you can loose time this way. Will certainly return to Vegas to see the more of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “If you stay here, ask for the new tower, unfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jay379
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for 2 nights back in February with a big group of colleagues and my feelings are mixed on the Caesars. First of all, I had a room in the older tower and the rooms were comfortable, but out of date. There was also a big hole in the wall in the hall way on my floor (14th floor) that was covered about by torn wall paper. I found that kind of out of place for Caesars Palace. I was speaking with some of the others in our group and some were in the newer tower and had nothing, but good things to say about their rooms. So definitely ask for the "new" tower if you plan on staying here. The service at Caesars I found to be real crummy. Most of our group would drink at the Sea Horse bar and the bartenders were lazy when it came to taking any orders for drinks. I almost felt like I had to chase them down to pay for a cocktail. I did gamble a bit at the bar and they would offer me a complimentary, but that was after 10-15 minutes of playing the machine. The bar staff were definitely not very attentive. The conference staff we had for our convention I found to be extremely rude. Many of the others in the group had very similar feelings. The wait staff were not very helpful when it came to the smallest requests. It kind of felt like by requesting something from them, they were doing you a favor. One of my colleagues told me that one of the staff serving soup was real rude by walking off when it was his turn to be served. The staff didn't comment to him about coming back, so he tried to serve himself and out of nowhere the staff member came back and scorned him. Table Games, too expensive for my taste so I went to other casinos. In conclusion, I'm glad I had the opportunity to stay at Caesars on a company sponsored trip. However, if I was forking out the bill on this trip, I would have been very disappointed. I come to Vegas a few times a year and I think I will pass on Caesars, the service alone was a real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property...Less than spectacular service”
Reviews.Author: Sirk98
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay, but very pricey food wise. I had the impression that they made things just comfortable enough but not so much that you would be tempted to stay in your room I think there were about 10 'free' cable channels. There was a $45 fee for a coffee maker!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars = Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mimbster
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Vegas a week ago. I travel to Vegas for leisure and have stayed at Caesars numerous times. The entire resort is huge! Size wise, it may be the biggest or one of the biggest in acreage. I stayed at all of their towers, Centurion, Forum, Palace, Augustus. As a diamond player, I normally get good rooms. It helps to know some of their staff on a personal basis and my hosts have been nice and rewarding to me. This last time, I split my 6 nights between the Flaming's 28th floor and Palace Tower at Caesars. It's true that Caesars has issues, but all casinos do. It is a 44 year old institution so some locations will show age. Some people complain about smoke, every casino is smoky in the smoking section. It is the most expensive of the Harrah's family of resorts b/c it is the flagship properties. To me, there's a lot of things to do and see at Caesars. So although I've been inside many, many times and stayed there often, I haven't seen some of their current running shows like Celine Dion. I never had a chance to see Elton John when he was performing. Also they have some fine restaurants. I must admit that Beijing Noodle #9 serves small portions. I haven't seen this changed. Two weeks ago I lost over a grand on one of their Jackpot Party "penny" machines. Meant to play $20 and ended up feeding it all night. So I am still bitter about it cus all these newer small denom video slots are tight everywhere in every casino. Going back there this weekend and will have a new review to come. Good luck to all out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation experience, wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: IslandBlue2
Reviews.Content: We booked in advance, paid an average of $119 for 8 nights including a weekend for a classic room with free upgrade to deluxe. On arrival at 10:30 pm had a 10 minute wait and then a pleasant check in experience. Told him we really wanted a strip view and handed him a $20 with the credit card. He types for 5 minutes before saying that although he did not have a true "strip view" he had a Augustus Tower petit suite high enough for partial view (45th floor) and a jacuzzi tub. Knowing how much more this room would be, we tossed him another $20. The room was great. There was complimentary water and fresh fruit, corner views of the strip and down into the pool area, and a really nice bathroom. The bed and pillows were comfy and the room seemed very clean. My only complaint was that the first time the room was cleaned, the staff took the hotel robes off the hook in the bathroom and inadvertently took my nightgown. So damn, I had buy a new one! The rest of the facility was nice, a little loud and smokey in the older part of the casino, but the Forum casino was very nice and cw's were very attentive. The Lago Buffet was reasonably priced and pretty good, although not as good as some I have had. Enjoyed dinner at Mesa and sushi at Hykumi (sp?). I had a terrible burger at the food court, though my husband had pretty good fish and chips, and he knows his fish & chips. Room service was prompt and polite, although of course pricey. I would not hesitate to return, although I would be likely to try another property just for the variety.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dmiller1974
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at Caesar's while in Vegas but we ended up spending a ton of time there because it was such a great place to go. The restaurants are great, the casino is great, their sports book is awesome...we watched the college football games there and had great service and great fun. I can't speak for the rooms, but if they are half as good as the rest of the hotel/casino, they must be very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars”
Reviews.Author: jrgt3000jlr
Reviews.Content: Super rooms and views! Restaurants of all types. Fun sight seeing and shopping. Center of the strip, good for day trips.

Reviews.Title: “Fit this goddess!!!”
Reviews.Author: canadiankim29
Reviews.Content: I booked with Caesars Palace as we decided to get married there in the Juno Garden.
