We booked with Westjet Vacations and got a really great deal for an "upgraded" room in the Palace tower. Our plane landed early so we attempted an early check-in. There was no wait in line and we got both of our rooms @ 11:30 am on a Wednesday morning. We had two rooms, one was two beds the other was one King room for my new hubby and I. The double bed room was HUGE. Plenty of room for the three guests. Bathrooms had a separate toilet closet and a jacuzzi tub. The tubs were well used to soak our bods after long days of walking. The resort is large but Vegas is large! We ordered room service for breakfasts it was easy simple and great service! You pay for it but I'm not leaving my room in my jammies to grab coffee and lay back in bed...I'm on holidays! Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, enough pillows, nice atmosphere! Overall, we loved our stay and we will come back again for many anniversaries to come.

Reviews.Title: “Front is beautiful; inside old and stodgy”
Reviews.Author: conjuror88
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas several times a year for business. This time stayed at Caesars. The entrance, outside is impressive. Upon entering the lobby is too, except for the wear and tear with age. I was given a roman tower room, furniture is old, as with the beddings, carpet shows wear and tear. Washrooms need to be updated, recaulked or altogether changed. As we has checked in late we did not bother to change. WHen we did complain, we were told the hotel was full, but I went to my laptop and checked availability and found several rooms available. So much for customer satisfaction. One positive was Bradley and Ogden,a Michelin rated restaurant, food was beautifully presented, fantastically seasoned. Service was excellent. Even the bread was fresh, soft. The price was reasonable for LasVegas standards. It was pure class, no rushing, no pushing of wine and most of all impeccable timing when to come back since we were on a business meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are dark, need updating. Be prepared to walk a lot!”
Reviews.Author: JKintheNW
Reviews.Content: Not bad to walk a lot, but be prepared as the property is huge! Stayed on 8th floor of the Roman Tower. Room has poor lighting (bathrrom mirror bright, but too far to use for makeup). Forget the tv and put a lighted makeup mirror in! Paint on the ceiling of bathroom peeling quite badly, got a shock when showering and a large piece of paint peel fell on me! Stuff was always in the hall! One cart with a food service tray was there from 2pm until at least the same the next day. No fridge, coffee, etc. Hairdryer was a little portable unit, but adequate. You have to pay via credit card to use the safe in your room. Next door room was a bit loud and we could hear everything! Very, very noisy actually. Beds were hard. Thus saying, we did enjoy the location. Oh, and if there for a business meeting or anything else, beware that the maps and directions are limited at best and most employees do not know where stuff is. Save time and call the front desk! I will go back to the Venetian or Mandalay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dont judge a book by it's cover!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferT15
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the outside & lobby. Otherwise the rooms are horrible & dirty. Not worth the money to stay. Would only recommend you visit as a tour to see all the beautiful Architechture and all the really high priced stores that you could only shop at if you make a definite 6 figures.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: Kagakiwi
Reviews.Content: Having just had a very pleasant stay at a small unprentitous off-strip hotel which provided free breakfasts and was a fraction the price of this place, I was expecting something fairly decent from the iconic Caesars Palace. However it failed to deliver in so many ways. I chose a room in the newly-renovated Forum Tower, as that seemed to be fairly well rated and was close to the Forum Shops. 1. Having to queue to check in. With over 3,000 rooms, and a limited check-in window, more than three desk clerks would be nice. 2. The room was quite small and while the beds were nice, the rest of the decor was cheap. The over-hallway aircon vent reminded me of a cheap dorm. However the bathroom was fairly nice. 3. The TV in the bathroom mirror did not work as the remote control panel was cracked. 4. We got shoved in a corner room which gave us an oblique view of the carpark. Not even a full view of the carpark. The hotel is large, and it takes quite a bit of time to get anywhere. Even though the Forum Tower was one of the closest to the carpark, it was about ten minutes. This got annoying, especially when the car park was too full to park close to the lifts. Pluses? Well, the room was quiet. Perhaps as the door appeared, by its weight, to be made of solid lead. There was no in-room fridge (aside from the drinks one), but one was promptly delivered, though took up more real estate of course. Check-in, when we arrived at the counter, was efficient and not too impersonal. The place is a Vegas icon, and I had to give it a go, but not again. Sure, the ambience of the lobby, the casino floor, and the shops were nice, but the rooms were simply not worth the price. I paid more for two nights here than five nights at the off-strip place, and expected a commensurate increase in luxury and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar himself would not have endured such poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: fizzgigg
Reviews.Content: Our nonsmoking room on the nonsmoking floor smelled of smoke. Complained to front desk and was told "just throw the ashtray away" & we'll spray the room with Lysol. We said no to the Lysol, so front desk offered to bring in an ozone machine to clear the air but we had to be out of the room. Left at 6:30p for an early dinner, returned at 11:30p, ozone machine was left in hallway & never plugged in. Had to use phone in another room to call front desk since ours was broken. Complained in person to a very annoyed front desk staff member. I should mention the room was not dusted during our stay nor were the 3 glasses with lipstick stains ever removed and the phone was never fixed. Hey Caesar, stop the charoit race and fix your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel, clean, fine staff, rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: kdbug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. We came in early ( 2 nights) for a convention (3 nights paid for by the company ) and booked the room on the hotels website. The total for the 2 nights was about 400. incl taxes,- Palace Tower Deluxe room, on my email confirmation. I read about the 'slipping the check-in staff a $20' and I tried it. I thought what the heck, maybe we can at least stay in the same room for the entire time, and if we get an upgrade..all the better. He took it without a misstep and proceeded to ' see what he could do for us'...we ended up with a Palace Tower Jr Suite ( king bed, larger sitting room, and 2 bathrooms, one with a spa tub and a huge shared shower). I did show enthusiasm and was very appreciative. However when I checked out..I saw that the room was half what I expected to pay! According to the bill at check out, each night was exactly half of what I thought I had to pay..I think I got comped without knowing it! I have been checking my credit card but so far (its been a week, ) but the only charge to my card was the original deposit back in December of half of the total estimated charges, and credit for a win that I left on my room account. I was really happy with the room, and staff and hotel in general, so now that I actually got the vacation for half price, I like it even more! The room, was very clean and spacious..The bed was very soft and comfortable. Feather pillows are not my thing, but you can get a different kind,. It had a safe, a large closet, iron and board, and robes. No coffeemaker. It looked just like the pictures on the website. It was a bit dated..you could see wear and tear on the rug and in the bathrooms, but not enough to detract from the decor. Our friends got upgraded to a huge suite in the Roman towers and that room was very large and VERY dated. A total flashback to the seventies..But they loved it! It was an upgrade they got just by mentioning celebrating a birthday. It had marble steps leading up to the room and then down into the room. Quite posh in its day I am sure. I called housekeeping twice and recieved my requested items ( a foam pillow, extra towels ) within an hour, despite the obvious number of rooms full due to the convention. I was careful not to use the refrigerator or move any of the items on the special tray. There was a note saying handling can result in extra charges. The location was super. Be prepared to walk. I bet it took 15 mins just to get down to and out the lobby! The Bellagio is next door..and their Sunday brunch was THE best meal we ate in Vegas (Emerils at MGM Grand was the worst) The Deuce Bus picks up just across the street at Paris ( dont miss the Eiffel Tower Tour or lunch at Mon Ami Gabi on the terrace out front ) to go up to Venetian (that was hands down the most beautiful hotel I saw) or in front of the Forum shops to go down to MGM Grand (dont miss the real lion habitat and if you like to give your opinions, the tv show screening ) or Luxor (whats up with no picture taking allowed inside the hotel??) The fountains at Bellagio were wonderful and so romantic at night. Dont bother with Sirens Something at Treasure Island. Not worth the walk or wait. Walk thru the shops at the Forum Shops just to see the grand fountains. And the Venetian for the gorgeous frescoes on the ceiling and architecture. The Wynn was a bit farther down and we didnt go beyond the Venetian/Palazzo, so all my 'bests' are from Luxor to Palazzo. Went to KA at MGM Grand. It was amazing. How did they get the stage to float like that? The engineering had the guys we went with wondering for hours. It was spectacular. I didnt think the story was that hard to follow. Buy the program and read it before hand. In fact try to get your souvenirs before the show, as after -its a people jam in that small gift shop. The program spells it right out for you. The music was enchanting and not distracting. A very very fine production indeed. Some friends went to the Beatles Cirque show and were not impressed like we were with our show. Some pools at Caesars were being renovated and you could only go in part of the complex. It was stil a lovely area and quite private, as the temps were not conducive to much pool time. The Lago Buffet at Caesars was a bit disappointing. For dinner, go next door to the Bellagio. Or to Paris. The breakfast was fine for the price ($18 PP I think). Considering a to go breakfast sandwich and coffee would set you back 10 bucks easy from the convenient and busy Payards bistro, it was a better option. The Asian Noodle place was okay, but not worth the price, we thought. Had lunch weekday at Mon Ami Gabi across the street at Paris. It was over $60 for 2, inc tip. ( soup and sandwiches, no drinks! ) Pricey but quite good. French onion soup was terrific. The waiter had such an attitude, we thought he didnt like us at first. We did get him to smile and say he just wanted us to have the most 'real' Parisian experience possible. Then he sighed and swiped up my husbands bread crumbs with a small brush and disgustedly put them on the empty plate before he cleared it. I think he made eye contact with us twice! When we asked questions about the menu, he acted totally bored and put out. We laughed - it was very fun playing around with him. Fitness center is not free..fyi. After all that good food though, I needed a good workout! We enjoyed our stay at Caesars Palace. Great location, great staff. Vegas wouldn't be my first choice for a family vacation or even a vacation for my husband and I alone. It was nice to go once, and that was enough. If I did go back, I would consider this a hotel I would stay in again. But for me, once is enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: suzimoates
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Caesars Palace. We try to always stay there when we are in Vegas for business and we are so glad that Celine Dion is comeing back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “TV in the bathroom mirror - cool!”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyM4
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were very nice. The pool looked great - just too cold to go in! A lot of night clubs within the hotel, so not much need to wander out.

Reviews.Title: “Weird rooms, uncomfortable beds, bad food and exorbinant prices”
Reviews.Author: pumpkinpasty
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again and, being a travel agent, I would NEVER send someone here. I was here as part of a conference (about 80 people in about 40 rooms) and was able to see several rooms. My room had no mirror in the bedroom and a terrible view. Some of my friends had no closet--just a bar in the bathroom. Others had windows into the bathrooms, or walls so thin they could clearly hear the conversation their neighbors were having. People universally complained about the uncomfortable beds. When checking in, the president of the company was advised that we could all check in at the special "diamond" line. But when some people tried, the desk clerk sneered and told them to get back in the regular line. If you aren't there to gamble, service is pretty poor. The hotel was enormous and very poorly signposted. It was easy to get lost and turned around. The conference room was freezing and the food was *atrocious.* Food that we paid for ourselves cost an insane amount--$24 for breakfast at the Augustus Cafe, for example. You had to pay for everything--the business center, to work out...everything. LAME. I really did not like it here. It was claustrophobic, service was rude, food was either disgusting or expensive, and the rooms were terrible. I thought my distaste was because I'm not really a Vegas person, but I spent some time at the Paris which I loved (and which was less expensive). The only thing I liked was the Forum...I'm a sucker for fake sky.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Eastergray
Reviews.Content: We had a great time there. Beautiful decor, friendly service...Totally awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Celebrations!”
Reviews.Author: pTrishi
Reviews.Content: This Place is Fantastic.. close to everything.. plus the food is outstanding!! I love the room service!!! yummy :)

Reviews.Title: “Great trip at a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkell5981
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights for our 30th wedding anniversary. Asked for an upgrade for the special occasion and was told that no upgrade unless I wanted to pay another 100 bucks/night. We had a nice room in one of the old towers, and the room had been remodeled. Hotel/Casino was nic but we would not return because we like the Bellagio better and will stay there next time. Worst part of trip was cost of cab from airpot....30 dollars and it was obvious the female cab driver delayed intentiaonally. I protested in the best way possible....no tip. The ride back to the airport was 15 dollars, which is the normal rate.

Reviews.Title: “March 2000”
Reviews.Author: Haifastlocos
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in Vegas, Would recommend the Voodoo Lounge on the 51st floor of the Rio. Excellent food and service. I would definately NOT recommend a wake up call in the middle of the night unless you are absolutely certain you will wake up for it.My wife and I didn't and voila we had hotel security and sheriffs department knocking on our door 30 minutes later to ensure we were actually ok.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous SPA”
Reviews.Author: CanadianKelownaBc
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my Mother in laws 70th birthday on Feb 13 and stayed at Caesars Palace. Had birthday dinner at Mesa Grill, food was good but very expensive. The best thing we did was spend an afternoon at the spa pools. Worth every penny, to go and relax and listen to the rain tringle down. Herbal room was interesting and sauna was hot and it was a rush going into the ice room after with snow flakes falling down and exfoliating with crushed ice. Although the hotel was beautiful it is just too big with all of the towers and you need 20 minutes to get anywhere in the hotel. It is exhausting after a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars has everything.”
Reviews.Author: TomDukeWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Vegas, this was exactly the hotel to stay in. Large room, king-size bed, plus chaise and chair for sitting. The bed was ridiculously comfortable. So much we we wanted to stuff it in our suitcase when we checked out. My wife is sensitive about cigarette smoke. We were on a non-smoking floor in the Forum Tower and there was no hint of cigarettes anywhere. Added to that, for the week-long stay we almost never heard people in the surrounding rooms. We were very impressed. Wide range of restaurants in the hotel. From not-cheap to expensive. Don't use the ATMs in the casino ($5 added fee). There's a bank machine in the lower level of the Forum shops which charged us only $2. And we were comfortably able to walk to just about everything. Even as far down as Mandalay Bay was walkable. You have to maneuver through the crowds, but no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for location”
Reviews.Author: Gooberlean
Reviews.Content: Spent time at Caesars for a conference that was onsite, so for this it was the perfect location since I did not have to travel that far. The hotel is very nice and my room was really nice. Other than that nothing really stood out, was one dirty towel in my bathroom when I checked in, and the staff were nice but nothing that I would remember or recommend. Would not be my first choice in Vegas but not the worst. Overall was nice stay for the business conference I was in town for.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic, flawed, but generally ok”
Reviews.Author: marksw
Reviews.Content: Nothing will prepare you for the size of this hotel it is never ending.. We went to watch the boxing as a group, and had a great time, the casino staff were fantastic, the front desk staff not so much.. they upgraded half the group to a better room but not the rest of us, then our first room had, randomly, the wardrobe door laying on the floor, not sure how housekeeping just hoovered up, changed the sheets, stepped over the broken door and carried on with their day?.. i rang down to reception to explain this but she didn't seem to gather the concept of a door laying on the floor too quickly, we were moved to a different room eventually. There was wet paint outside one day with no warning signs and i ruined a pair of shorts, no one from the hotel would accept responsibility for this, The cash machine in the casino only gave me $20 when i keyed in $50, and was subsequently charged for $50, again no one would take responsibility for this.. Pool area was poor, they, along with many other vegas hotels have private "european bathing" aka topless girls, which don't have to pay to go in, they then try to force guys to either pay to go in or use the bottle service for champagne etc etc, so the only remaining option for our trip was pretty much an all male free for all around a small round pool.. no shade anywhere.. there was construction work going on while we were there, so it was both noisy and dusty by the pool.. Pure, the nightclub, is good if you can get in, turns out having 10 people taking up 5 rooms isn't enough for the hotel to consider giving you any sort of preference on getting in, so again, for the guys you have to "buy bottles" which will start from $350 + tax + tip.. or que for hours with everyone else.. this was pretty much standard for all Vegas clubs if you are in a group of males though.. No free internet, it's actually £15 a day.. Clowns. If i go again i'd probably stay at the Mandalay Bay or the Venetian as they both just looked a bit smarter/newer

Reviews.Title: “roman tower bad, augustus tower better”
Reviews.Author: yafman
Reviews.Content: after all the legendary hype (augmented by its role in "the hangover"), guests should come to expect a four-star experience at caesar's palace; however what they don't tell you is that there are marked differences between the towers based on when they were built. for example, the augustus tower has lcd televisions, the roman tower has old school phillips tvs. the augustus tower has better water pressure, wireless signal strength and linens as well. during our stay in the roman tower we had to get the safe re-calibrated, the modem reset, the ethernet cable replaced and they even had to change out a valve in the shower before we were finally upgraded. the augustus tower would have been a welcome change except they assigned the same room to another couple while we were half naked getting ready for dinner! apparently this happens quite often so be sure and use your privacy lock if you still want to book a room at caesar's after reading this. personally, i will be staying at the newer luxury casino resorts from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!!”
Reviews.Author: Bikerscout
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights, Feb 11-12. Had a fantastic room in the Palace Tower with a view of the pool area. Couldn't get over the over-sized room, bigger than most other hotels I've stayed at on the Strip. Huge bathroom with whirlpool tub, glass shower. Got there at 5:00pm on Thursday, huge line at the check-in. Went real fast, only waited maybe 15 mins at most. Very friendly staff and super clean room. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Caesar's Palace, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: judi1955
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like a city within a city. You don't even have to go outside. It has food, shopping, casinos and entertainment. The rooms are beautuful and the service is wonderful. If i went back again I would stay there in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Frankly, I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: suzyhBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay at Caesars Palace. (2/9-2/13). This was our first time at the hotel but not to Las Vegas. We typically stay at the best deal we can get on Hotwire or Priceline. Frankly, I was disappointed. Hotel room: We stayed in a Classic room at the Palace Tower. (I think they will assign you there when buying through Hotwire). The room itself is outdated; a very old, gold finished ornate room- which has a huge jacuzzi tub in the bedroom with a lot of tacky mirrors. Pros: The shower was nice with a steam mist option, the housekeeping service was very good. Con: the mattress was like sleeping on a rock. Room service: We ordered coffee each morning. Yes, it was expensive. However, the service was OUTSTANDING. They have a very professional tone going on with all the service folks- making you feel like they are happy you are there. Even when call to just place the order. Great job to whomever is responsible for that program. Location: The location is perfect. You can walk to the Paris and Planet Hollywood in 5 minutes or the other way to the Mirage or Harrahs. Gambling: We gambled very little at the hotel. For me, it was too large and the tables were not full enough. We went to Planet Hollywood were the dealers are very friendly and we gambled at the Fortune Pai Gow tables most of our visit. Other comments: Regardless of the time, the registration line was always long; be prepared to wait. We checked in at 10pm however each day we would walk by the desk and there was always a line with no more than 2 people working. It seems like they need more help. The staff helping us get a taxi and the bell man were VERY helpful. Another standout team. Not that you stay in the room that much, however it is nice when the room is nicer than your home. It is not 4.5 stars- maybe a 4. We tried Caesars and wanted to be impressed, but I highly doubt we will stay there again, even with a decent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at Caesars Palace!!!!”
Reviews.Author: melbarottawa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my stay at Caesars Palace. We arrived at 1pm Superbowl Sunday and left on Friday the 12th. The weather was not so great but we still had lots to do. The lineup for the room was not too long but moved well. We were offered an upgrade due to the "poor weather" at $30/night and we moved from a classic room to a larger room in the Palace Tower. Considering I got a SUPER DEAL a few weeks earlier on their website, the cost of the upgrade was still peanuts in the long run! The room was wonderful with a HUGE king size bed, jacuzzi tub and separate glass shower. We never had to wait for the elevator until mid week when there was a Paul Mitchell hair convention and the hotel and elevators were PACKED!!! That only lasted a couple of days so we made sure to try to avoid the "gang". Overall, the hotel was wonderful!! Great location for catching the monorail on the other side of the street at Flamingos or catching the tram from Bellagios to Monte Carlo. Unfortunately, you get charged for local calls but unlike other hotels, there are no hidden resort fees that suddenly appear on your bill. Downfall to the strip, timeshare people are out in FULL FORCE!!! I have been to Vegas twice before and don't recall them being THAT BAD!!! Geesh!!! P.S...we rented a car from Dollar rental in Bellagio's, bring your passport!! For some reason, they are inforcing passports to be presented for car rentals. Just saves time running back to your room;)

Reviews.Title: “Another Delightful Stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: lsl327
Reviews.Content: My husband I travel often and we visit Vegas about twice a year. We are late 30’s and late 50somethings. We have stayed at most of the 4 star hotels on the strip. This was yet another delightful stay at Caesars Palace! When we checked in (@ 3pm on a Monday) the line was about 75 people deep but it went very quickly (about 15 minuets) and by the time we were headed to our room there were about 300 people in line and that line was there for awhile. We had booked a deluxe room and received an upgrade for the cost of a smile. We had a petite suite on the 42nd floor of the Augustus Tower and it was delightful. The room was tucked away in a back corner and it was silent. We never heard another soul; it was like we had the whole hotel to ourselves although it looked as if there were 2 or 3 conventions happening while we were there. The large room had 2 very large windows (one facing the strip and one facing the pools), dining table, sofa, chair and ottoman, king size bed, and a super huge closet. The bathroom was the same bath room you get with a deluxe room, water closet, spa tub, double sinks and glass shower. Really the very best thing about this room is how quiet it was all day and all night. The service is always great in this hotel. We had room service twice and they were helpful and speedy with the service. The maids were very respectful to our things and did a great job of cleaning and did not disturb us when we had our sign out. This is not always the case in Las Vegas hotels. Just one complaint about the hotel, they have closed Cleopatra’s Barge to make way for a lounge singer. I am sad to see it gone. It was one of the only placed in Las Vegas that you could find a respectfully fun over 30’s crowd and not have to listen to hip-hop music all night. I know the new act might be great for the masses but The Barge was always a great place to get your groove on if you are little old school and like rock-n-roll and a disco tune now and then. Farwell to an institution! We did find an ok substitution for dancing at the Bellagio’s Fontana Bar. I guess we will just have to give our money to them from now on. One more thing…if you are in town and want to see a great Latin-Classic Rock & Roll fusion concert…go see Santana at the Hard Rock’s, The Joint. If you like to dance get an isle seat. Great night and perfect early Valentine’s Day!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Somerset-RoadRunner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights in Caesars Palace on a late, cheap internet deal (£50 per night) and it was the most fantastic hotel experience ever! It was all done out for Chinese New Year, with lots of red lanterns and static displays making the place really opulent. Considering it's sheer size, everything is really well organised. The rooms are large, very well equipped, the beds just wonderful. You feel like a million dollars, even if you don't have it! Including the attached Forum Shopping Mall, there is loads to see and do, apart from the gambling. I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel and will be going back. Some tips: Have the breakfast buffet at Bellagio's (next door), for $14.95 it's just amazing. Visit the Cheesecake Factory in the Forum Shopping Mall and have cheesecake. Watch the "Fall of Atlantis" free show at the fountain outside Cheesecake Factory.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location - bad service”
Reviews.Author: dalgleish_michael
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were out for our 10th anniversary. We chose Caesars because of the proximity and we were curious about the only living Casino hotel from back in Vegas' heyday in the 50s. Check-in was a nightmare. We arrived on the 9th. We walked a mile or so from self parking, which was fine. As we approached the front desk, we noticed a line that wrapped around the entire hotel and out to the side entrance. 3500 hairdressers from Paul Mitchells school were checking in. Fantastic start to a new experience. On the casino floors, we played about 15-20 hours. We didn't win, and weren't expecting to, but we had free drink service once the whole time. Very poor service from the floor waitresses. This morning, we went to the concierge desk to see if they had a map for the Hoover Dam and Vegas strip area - the concierge desk was closed (8am) with a sign that asked you to visit the front desk if you needed anything. We went over to the front desk and the man behind the counter was rude, and told us he couldn't help us. I asked where we might be able to find some maps, and he said he had absolutely no idea. The room was nice, the atmosphere was relaxed, but the service has definitely shown me the door. We won't be coming back to a Harrahs' owned hotel if this is the kind of sloppy service they provide.

Reviews.Title: “It was fun but stay in different tower”
Reviews.Author: coolbabe1952
Reviews.Content: The room was clean ,liked caesars but would stay in different tower. We were in centeriuon tower it needs to be remodled the room looked old. We have stayed at belliagio which is has better rooms

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: CookingGirl73
Reviews.Content: Our stay was technically half business, half leisure. This hotel is really nothing to rave about, especially when compared to other hotels on the strip (Wynn, Encore, Venetian, Palazzo, Bellagio). Check-in is a nightmare. Everyone hovers around the front desk waiting for the line to open at 1pm. Luckily, we were towards the front of that line. If you were unlucky enough to arrive later in the day, the wait was nearly 2 hours. We were booked in a Classic room in the Forum tower and were told the hotel was fully booked so there were no upgrades available. We did the $20 trick and suddenly there was an upgrade available to the Augustus Tower. It should be noted that as the day wore on, they ran out of standard rooms. Other people in our group had to be put in suites because no standard rooms were available. That sounds great, except for the fact that they had to move after the first night to a standard room. What a pain. Our room was fine, but not as nice as the rooms in the hotels I listed above. Housekeeping was OK, but not as good as the other hotels. For instance, if I used the hairdryer and rushed out of the room in the morning leaving it on a chair, it would still be there when I got back, cord strewn across the floor, rather than being put away. The bed was made, but it was evident that less time was taken to “neaten” the room. Otherwise, Caesar’s is just depressing in comparison to the other casinos. It’s dark, incredibly smoky, everything looks old or worn and just less classy than the other casinos. We tried to find a super nice bar area that compares to the Baccarat Lounge at Bellagio or Parasol Up at Wynn, and nothing comes even close. We spent all of our entertainment money elsewhere. The pool area is nowhere near as nice as Bellagio or the other hotels, either. Caesar’s just ended up being a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Rain Man Suite”
Reviews.Author: davidsjonesii
Reviews.Content: We were able to book an upgrade suite that was fabulous when we arrived. Prices can be negotiated. Try it when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “One in a million!”
Reviews.Author: ghamaryllis
Reviews.Content: Have stayed twice at this hotel and I think the best in Vegas. From opulent rooms to very friendly check in, great Casino with helpful croupiers and room service food to die for. The pool is the best I have been inin Vegas and that includes The Venetian,Luxor, MGM. Just in a class of it's own. Worth paying the reasonable upgrade for a view of Bellagio Fountains as every 15 minutes there is the display which is fantastic. Going back this year and just can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “First Time”
Reviews.Author: Nfernoluv
Reviews.Content: Definitely returning! This was one of the nicest Hotels that I visited while I was in Vegas. 420 all DAY long!!! They deliver...EVERYTHING...So go...and ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Amenities need updated”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLady5320
Reviews.Content: Although I was visiting LV for Bette Midler's concert, our room in the Palace Tower, which was "upgraded" by suggesstion of the Platinum check in clerk (additional $25 dollars a day to get a jacuzzi tub), was nothing special. The bathroom was almost as big as the sleeping quarters. But....no complimentary coffee pot, closet doors were most difficult to open and close, shower stall needed recaulked and the door jam in the separate water closet had something "yucky" at the bottom -- maybe a repair gone bad? The room was quiet, but the hotel complex is HUGE! It makes for long walks and they don't have courtesy carts or vans to take you to the othe end of the forum to enjoy dinner and/or shop. The older Vegas and prices are a gone but not forgotten. Bring lots of money for food.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: travgal77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vegas just before Christmas for a little getaway without our little boy. We drove from Arizona and once we parked the car we didn't bother using it again. It was a tad confusing as to where you were suppose to leave your car when you checked in, but we found one of the valet fellows and he said to just park against the curb while we checked in. The line up for check in was quite long but went very quickly. Our reservation was for a standard Forum Tower room, but were upgraded to a Petite Suite in the Palace Tower by doing the $20 trick. I can't believe we did it as I wouldn't consider my husband and I very "smooth", but it worked and we got upgraded. Our room was very big with Jack and Jill bathrooms, which I want in my house now. My husbands bathroom simply consisted of a bathroom and sink while mine had a bathroom with a bidet and a jacuzzi tub. The large shower connected the two rooms. We didn't deal with the staff much but the fellow at the front desk and the lady that cleaned our room were both very friendly. The hotel is crazy big and trying to get out the first time was a bit annoying as we got mixed up in the forum shops and couldn't find our way out. Once you get your bearings it's no problem. My only complaints would first of all be the access to the parkade. Unless we went the wrong way we were stuck carrying our luggage thru the casino. Second complaint is the hair salon. I spent a small fortune for a very mediocre cut. I suppose another complaint would be the smoking in the casino, but that is for all of Vegas and not something I would expect to see change in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Met or exceeded all of my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: peterbob
Reviews.Content: My Uncle & I took an 1800 mile road trip & arrived in Vegas at 09:30 monday morning. We were hoping that we might luck out & get into our room early & Caesars did not disappoint. We were even upgraded to a Palace Tower room, which was more of a haul from the parking garage than the Forum Tower would have been, but we took the offer anyway. The room was great, dual sinks, jacuzzi, plasma tv, mini bar, etc. Housekeeping was in & out of our room by 10 or 11 am every morning. The selection of restaurants & shopping was incredible.... there is certainly something for everyone. This is an extremely busy place & there is a constant flow of people moving through the casino, either shopping, going to a show or restaurant, checking in or out, or just sightseeing. The place is a little difficult to navigate at first, but after a couple of days we were finding our way around pretty well. The real bright spot was the attention given to us by the staff. We are by no means "highrollers" but a few minutes after entering the casino, a couple of the slot attendants came over & introduced themselves & remained on a first name basis with us throughout the entire course of our stay. There were also a couple of cocktail waitresses & a slot tech that did the same. I really have to tip my hat to their personal & professional service, these folks really made us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years celebration!”
Reviews.Author: ColIndianaJones
Reviews.Content: We will definitely be back to this hotel! It has beautiful rooms and very nice staff. We had a great time and the New Years celebration the hotel put on was simply spectacular. Rooms are large and very comfortable. Stayed in Palace Tower. Pool area is beautiful. Food court open 24 hours downstairs. We didn't even need to leave the place. The access to the Forum Shops is right there at the door of the hotel. We did all our shopping and dining there and inside the hotel. Great buffet at the hotel. It was worth every penny, with crab legs and shrimp every night and a chocolate fountain for fruits and marshmallows -- my nine year old was in heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Exciting Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mikael92
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas with my family many times, me and my wife have two sons which love to travel with us, so we usually travel with them. We always stay in different hotels when we go to vegas to get some variety, and when we started at Caesars, WOW, what an experience. I don't think we'll be staying anywhere else from now on when we go to vegas! The room's were VERY WELL DECORATED, the bathrooms are fantastic, and the hotal overall is just amazing. the hotel front desk was very friendly, the lady was chatting it up with my sons and telling them about attractions in vegas and such! it was nice to just arrive in vegas after a long 9 hour flight and relax in a comfortable room. my wife really enjoyed the mall, they had Gucci, Burberry, Louis Vuitton all her specialty stores, and for us guys there was the Sony Store, and Abercrombie and Fitch!!!!! But other than that the hotel is amazing, and the next time we travel to vegas, hopefully May, we'll be staying in Caesars again!

Reviews.Title: “this place is amazing”
Reviews.Author: cansw83
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at caesars over new years for 4 nights, the room and bathroom were soo big and the service was great. We stayed in the augustus tower and i would not hesitate to stay here again. the forum shops were soo good! hope to return to vegas soon. C from Australia

Reviews.Title: “Terrific upgrade, excellent service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: mccolo
Reviews.Content: We booked Caesars through a package deal with a basic room. When we arrived we were offered an upgrade to a small suite (two bathrooms, jacuzzi tub, view of pool or strip) for only $40 more per night. We had a large room with two full bathrooms a nice view and comfy beds with plush bedding. The location of Caesars is great with easy access to walk to the mall, the Bellagio, etc. The service we had was excellent everywhere we went in Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom not in working order”
Reviews.Author: Drsugar
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and had a wonderful time, primarily because of Bette Midler's "The Showgirl Must Go On" concert . The front orchestra seats for her were expensive but worth every dollar. Unfortunately, I paid extra to be placed in a room in the Palace tower, but we were very disappointed with its bathroom. The sink faucets turned around and around and were very difficult to get to shut off. The towel racks in front of the sinks kept falling off. The whirlpool bath, shower, and amenities were great. The large room was adequate but had a Queen sized bed even though we had paid for a King sized bed. Most of the staff were friendly and helpful. The Caesar's casino and huge number of incredible restaurants were wonderful. Why go to a generic Las Vegas Buffet when you have the choice of numerous fine dining and superb quality/value restaurants in the hotel? Several of their restaurants are Michelin Star rated (2 Star and 1 Star). Nero's is a great steakhouse (minus the Michelin Stars). Two unique restaurant additions since my last stay at Caesar's Palace in 2008 are the Sea Harbor Seafood Restaurant from China and Serendipity 3 from Manhattan. We will certainly be back to Caesar's Las Vegas in the next several months, but will not stay there again after that if they can't bring the rooms and bathrooms up the the level of the hotel's reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: Sofiyas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar's for 3 nights. Prior to our stay we were notified via email that we could upgrade our classic room reservation to a deluxe room for $40 a night. Over the phone the telephone agent told us the deluxe rooms were newly renovated, had digital do-not-disturb signs, and doorbells. When we get to registration we are given a room in the Palace tower. When we get to our room there is no evidence that the room is newly renovated. The last time I checked “digital” do-not-disturb signs do not mean a little piece of cardboard that you hang on your doorknob. There was also no evidence of a doorbell. We were given a bait and switch. I have been to LV many times and I've never had the opportunity to stay at Caesar's before. I was thoroughly disappointed because of the price we paid for the room and the quality of the room we received. There was nothing wrong with the room but it was definitely nothing special. If this was an upgrade the classic rooms must be a terrible value. In addition, my husband complained about the bed being uncomfortable. Stay here if you like to get ripped off and don’t mind a hotel chain that lies to you about the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the middle of the strip!”
Reviews.Author: PerfectStay
Reviews.Content: I've lived at some different hotels in Vegas before (Circus Circus, Golden Nugget and The Hilton) and even if they are not competing in the same class I was really impressed with Caesars Palace. We booked a room trhu hotels.com and when we arrived I asked for an upgrade. I was presented with a catalouge of different room types and what prices I would need to pay to upgrade: I asked for a room overlooking the Bellagio fountains and that was also what we got. The room was big with a panorama window where we enjoyed a spetacular view. The hotel is clean, the service is great (but naturally not very personal in such a big hotel) and the pool area is very nice. The only drawback were that we had to pay to use the gym. The fantastic forum shops and all the restaurants is an added bonus. Would absolutley pick Ceasars for our next stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars - Viva Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: MelbNYC
Reviews.Content: One word to describe Caesars - BIG!!!!!! When we arrived at the beautifully opulent foyer/check in desk we were greeted by quite a large line- but luckily not long after a customer service rep opened another window in the permium section and served us. We were taken to our very LARGE "classic suite" rooms. Two BIG beds - lots of space - tv - closet, Beautiful bathroom with sepearte shower and bath, heating light and large vanity. Only downside to our CLASSIC room was our CLASSIC view - tin roof! Very ugly - but I guess you get what you pay for (and althought secretly wishing for an upgrade - it was only a dream). But its VEGAS ! How much time do you REALLY spend in your room. The hallways are long to the elevarors, there is an ice machine room on each floor. The pool area is Grecian opulence - but also a bit of construction work going on unfortunately. The lack of free wireless and EXPENSIVE business center was a downside. The downstairs bar "Cleopatras Barge" has a floating dancefloor with DJs playing the best of NOW and the daggiest of "drunk requests" hehe. They serve generous drinks and allow you the chance to meet other tourists. Caesar's is in a great location - go next door to Mirage for the best "all you can eat buffet" called "Craves"! YUM! Central in the strip - next door to bellagio. Everything in walking distance, close to bus and monorail. Definitely reccommend this palace away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice time!”
Reviews.Author: Bingersgirl
Reviews.Content: I went here with my husband on a business trip. I have to say I assumed this would be over-the-top and gaudy, but we absolutely loved our trip and thought everything was done inside with great detail but not tacky (like Excalibur, etc). The room was large & fabulous with a great view. The location is great, and lots to do if you don't really gamble! The room was clean & the food options were great - we enjoyed the breakfast buffet and Rao's! I'd absolutely return here and appreciated the trip! The pool area was great, but a little too cool to swin at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mikeros1
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at Caesar's and upgraded to the Augustus Tower because I wanted a view of the Strip an of Bellagio's fountain. The view was spectacular! Very large,well docorated room was impressive. Caesar's central location on the strip is great for walking around. Take the shuttle to and from the airport, only $6 per person. The restaurants are a little too pricey, although the Noodles restaurant is reasonalble. My one complaint is that I am an experienced blackjack player, and the casino rules for blackjack is better next door at the Mirage,so I played at both casinos. Overall, I really did enjoy Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade was worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Herkdrvr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the MLK weekend. We originally booked the "Hangover Package" which provides a classic room, $50 food/beverage credit, a t-shirt and a free movie. Check in went quickly and we were offered an upgrade from the Centurion Tower to the Forum Tower for $30 a night. The upgrade was well worth it, given that I compared rooms with some other family members in the Centurion tower. The upgraded room had a much larger bathroom, an in-mirror LCD TV, pillow-top bed and a great strip view. Caesar's loses points for sound-proofing. Club Pure could be heard throughout the night, and the noise from the strip bled in considerably...but, it's Vegas, so I didn't complain. Caesar's casino is extremely smoky and not as well ventilated as Bellagio or others, so we recommend getting away from the casino if possible. Overall, a fantastic stay value for $433.19 over a 3-day holiday weekend. We'd stay at non-casino property next time to avoid the smoke though.

Reviews.Title: “Attitude is Everything, Wonderful Stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: melendya
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are not high rollers or avid gamblers. This being our first trip it was to see Bette Midler|(who was fabulous) and experience Las Vegas. Check in went smoothly, yes, you have to wait, but when you see the volume of people coming and going it is understandable. With a smile, I asked the clerk if they had an upgrade, intending to pay the extra amount mentioned in these reviews. He upgraded us to a room in the Palace Towers, at not charge, which was awesome. The first room we went to was a little stuffy and the bathroom floor didn't seem real clean, but housekeeping immediately moved us and the next room was great. With a large hotel, things are bound to happen, but Caesar's bends over backwards to make it right. As far as the gambling, we had better luck down the street at the Mirage. Caesars jacked up the table amounts more than we wanted to spend. If you are in to blues bands, BB King Club at the Mirage has an awesome house band. They rocked. Keep a smile on your face and a positive attitude and your experience should be good one. Caesar's location is unbeatable and worth paying a little extra. One more thing, the Qua Spa was awesome. Had the Hot Stone Massage(awesome) and was given access the rest of the day to all the amenities of the baths, sauna, etc. I was in heaven. You should try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location on strip”
Reviews.Author: azroxie
Reviews.Content: If you haven't already signed up for the Harrah's Rewards Card, then be sure to do that before you put anymore money in the slots so you can start building up points towards free rooms, comp food, etc... We stayed here (via comped Reward points) and were upgraded to a bigger room in the Palace Tower. The room was very nice--loved the bathroom--big,, roomy, pretty, and had a spa tube. Our room was overlooking the gorgeous pool area. We came here because of an invitation for a FREE NCL cruise (we were going on anyways) offered by Harrah's (which owns Caesar's Palace and several other hotels on the Vegas strip). We didn't gamble here (never win), but it's a great location in the mid-section of the strip. We walk over to another Harrah's property (Imperial Palace or Flamingo) to play...then we took a complimentary shuttle over to the Rio (another Harrah's hotel) and enjoyed their famous World Buffet. The food is super expensive at Caesar's, even coffee (plain jane coffee) is $5.00 for a cup! You can take a complimentary shuttle over to the Rio and walk to the Palms or Gold Coast (off the strip) for better gambling,, less expensive delicious food, or catch a movie over at the Palms. Caesar's is nice...really depends on the room. I've stayed here at least 5 times and had a completely different room each time (from an ugly, outdated room to a very nice suite). There is a shopping mall at the Forum attached to the Caesar's casino.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Mod82
Reviews.Content: This place is no palace at all. Our rooms where disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SealCove
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend trip (1/8-1/11/10) at Ceasar's. We upgraded our room to the Augustus Tower and it was definitely worth the money. We were in room 3887 and had views of the strip and the pools. Our room was HUGE. A nice sitting area with a chair and small sofa, a round table with two chairs. The dresser had 2 long drawers and a small drawer but there were cubbies with doors in the top part that worked well for storing smaller items. We arrived early (around 11am) and checked our bags with the bell staff. Check in is not until 1pm. My husband and I walked around the hotel and then down the strip. We had a great lunch at Margaritaville - the burgers are yummy! (Huge but yummy!) We went back to the hotel at 1pm to check in. The line was a little long but it moved quickly. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Our bags arrived up to our room in about 10 minutes - we were very surprised it was that quick. If you are a non-smoker you need to check out Slice. It is non-smoking and has video poker/blackjack/slots at the bar. They also have Fat Tire on tap!! You can order pizza by the slice and it is pretty good. I wish I had found this area before our last day. Ceasar's is not incredibly smokey but there are times where you may sit by a smoker and it is a little bothersome - but expected at a casino. It's nice that they provide an alternative for non-smokers. We ate at Augustus Cafe - yum! Everything our party ordered was fantastic - cannot go wrong at the Augustus Cafe. George is a great waiter - very friendly and knowledgeable. We also at Rao's - it was good Italian - a little pricey for what you got and the service was not that good. We were a 6 top table inbetween two other 6 tops. We felt invisible to our waiter - he spent a lot of time at the other two tables but we hardly saw him. I also went to the spa. That was incredible!! I have been to a lot of spas and this is one of the best. The Roman Baths are unreal - so relaxing. I also had a Deep Tissue massage from Manuela - she is fantastic - highly recommend her. A great massage therapist. They also have an Artic Plunge room and Herbal and Cedarwood steam rooms. Great showers fully stocked and a nice area to dry your hair. Our weekend was a lot of fun and the staff at Ceasar's was so friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “At least Vegas loved me...”
Reviews.Author: DontaS
Reviews.Content: The weather was nice and it was the end of summer for many. The avenues were bustling with vacationers and taxis. This was my first time in Vegas and I went with $400 in my pocket, but because my host is so "familiar" with Vegas the entire trip was comped. I had a blast and the pictures to share. Enjoy Vegas even if you don't put your money on the table but know that we all gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace is worn out”
Reviews.Author: crazeeoldwoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed as Cassars because we had tickets to Jerry Seinfeld on Dec 26th. Reserved the Classic room until I read online how horrible they were. Spent additional $60+ per night for room in Palace Tower with 2 queen beds. When we got there we were told there were no rooms that were ready and could not be guaranteed the room we reserved would be the room we would get, or that we would get ANY room. The gray haired woman we spoke to was by far the rudest person I have ever met at any hotel. I asked, so you charged my credit card for the first night, but now that I have flown here from California and show up at your desk you are telling me you may not have a room for me? She said this is their STANDARD POLICY. Came back and the next person was very helpful...they had to "steal" a room from someone else who hadn't checked in yet. However, we would have to wait until the room was cleaned and told to come back at 2pm. Grateful to have a room at all we left and came back later to finally get our room keycards. The room was dated and worn out. There was mold in the shower and holes in the wall where the towel bar had been (they just put it up higher without fixing the holes). The room is a lot smaller than the rooms in the pictures. There was no couch or chair to sit on. Just two beds, nightstands, a writing table and an armoire with the tv. This was my first and last time I will ever stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room - Just What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Doug-62
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesers from December 25-29, 2009. This was my first stay at this property and I was comped the entire time as I usually only play at Harrah’s properties. I booked and was given a room in the Forum Tower. I stayed in room 5109. A couple of notes about the rooms in the Forum Tower. Rooms ending in odd numbers face in toward other buildings or the parking garage, and even rooms face toward the strip area. Also, it appeared that I had a room on a high floor. In actuality, the room numbers start at 5000 and you push “50” in the elevator, which is about the fifth floor in this building. Also, the Registration Desk is a ways from the Forum Elevators, and navigating this large casino can be confusing. The room was just as pictured on the website. I have also downloaded pictures of the room. It has recently been renovated and is in fine condition. The bathroom was spacious and nice, however there was no bathtub. Only a large shower, with two shower heads. This was not a concern to me, but may be for some people. The safe is in the closet, which was nice to lock up valuables, but it was rather small – it was tall, but not deep. The view from the room was nothing spectacular. I looked out over the roof of the casino toward another tower. I could see the Flamingo, if I turned my head just right. But as I wrote earlier, it was a free room so I didn’t expect a great view. The bed was comfortable and the flat-screen television worked well. Few channels, but this is Vegas and the casino doesn’t want to encourage people staying in and watching shows. The housekeeping staff was excellent. I usually leave a couple of dollars each day as these people are typically underpaid. I always found the room was well cleaned and items needed were replaced. I did have a light out in the entry way and called to have it replaced. The person was there in five minutes. I was impressed. Overall, the room was nice and comfortable. I found easy access to the casino, the food court, and the Forum Shops from the Forum Tower elevators. I would stay again in the Forum Tower.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: IRISH074
Reviews.Content: words can't give this hotel justice, you have to experience it once in your lifetime. amazing, from the hotel to the service. myself and my sister went there and had booked it through 1800hotels.ie as we got a fantastic deal. we'd booked a twin room, checked in and found it was a king bed. no big deal but as i'm like a star fish when i sleep we needed the 2 beds. rang down to reception and they couldn't apologise enough and immediatley upgraded us to a superb room overlooking the dancing fountains at the bellagio hotel which is next door. the bathrooms were like something out of a movie, massive shower, jacuzzi bath and twin marble sinks, amazing. bedroom had a massive 42 inch plasma tv, a plasma tv in the bathroom too, unreal ! room was massive, you could live there for the rest of your life ! it practically had a sitting room in the bedroom ! the service was second to none, nothing was a problem. the beds were literally a slice of Heaven, you just sank into them and the oversized pillows were to die for. pool is for guests only so you don't have people wandering in and out as you need your room key to gain access. the pools were great, you would think you're in rome, it had a poolside snack bar called snackus maximus, yummy isn't the word and they waited on you hand and foot. there's a fantastic chocolate cafe which makes its own chocolate, try the crepes, divine. shopping is fantastic in the hotel too. all in all the best hotel in the world, if you are going to vegas, make sure to stay in caesars, shop around for the best deals and book in. i cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it once was”
Reviews.Author: penguin066
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars for our honeymoon and decided that for our 20th anniversary we wanted to return. We are rewards members and booked through their site and were quite pleased that we could get 5 comped nights and only one night at a discounted rate in the Forum tower during the holiday season. We stayed the 24th through the 30th of December. We arrived a little before check-in time but were able to get our room without any problems. There were several people ahead of us to check in, but the line seemed to move quickly. I noticed a few people walking with canes were ushered to the front of one of the preferred lines, while my husband, who also uses a cane, wasn't given this preferential treatment. As we approached the front of the line, one of the desk clerks noticed my husband's cane and asked him to move to the front of the line. We declined since by that time only one other person was in line ahead of us. We had booked one of the upgraded rooms in the Forum tower and were offered an upgrade--I wish we would have taken it. Our room was nice, but we were disappointed that we didn't have a bathtub or a coffee maker in our room. We were somewhat disappointed in the quality of the cleaning crew, but I suspect most of that was due to the holiday season. On the 25th, only half the room was cleaned but we were in the room on the phone at the time and they probably just didn't get back to finish our room. On the 26th, we left our room fairly late because my husband was a little ill from all the rich food we had been eating, and our room wasn't touched by the cleaning crew that day. On the remaining days, the room was cleaned but wasn't clean early enough for us to come back to the room and take an afternoon nap. We thought that the rooms had been recently remodeled but there were scuff marks all around the bed frame and the leather chair at the desk seemed to have been used a lot. I noticed that some of the bed linens had holes in them and at least one had stains of what looked like coffee or soda. One little touch that I liked so much on previous stays was that the cleaning staff would have a fresh bucket of ice in the room when you checked in. In these days of water conservation that isn't acceptable any more. I wouldn't believe the card about if you hang up your towels you are saying that you'll reuse them--I noticed the cleaning crew taking neat, folded unused towels out of a room and placing them in with other obviously used towels. One thing to note about the key cards that they give you--one of ours ended up getting wiped out and we were told by one of the maintenance crew that they were very sensitive and even putting them next to another credit card could wipe them out. This was also confirmed by the front desk when we went to get a new card--maybe they should let you know about this at check-in because the registration desk is quite a hike from the Forum Tower. Unless you are up for an adventure, don't bother trying the self-park. My husband tried it thinking that it would be a little quicker than valet parking. After driving around the parking garage for 15 minutes without finding an open parking spot, we gave up and went to valet parking. More than once, we had to show our room key because valet parking was only accepting registered guests. Given the situation in self-park, I can understand why. Dining was good, but I'd like to see some sort of restaurant serving a full breakfast on the Forum tower side of the casino. There is a place to get coffee and pastries, but if you want more than that you have to go across the casino. We normally don't make dining plans and were disappointed that more than once we were told that we'd have a 2+ hour wait for a table without reservations. On one occasion when I did try to make a reservation, I canceled the reservation because I was required to choose the menu for the entire party when making the reservation. After the trip, we both agreed that while we enjoyed our stay we'll go to one of the other Harrah's properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Tricks to being happy!”
Reviews.Author: rockectman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars Dec 22nd to Christmas. Come to Vegas when it isnt very crowded and you will enjoy it more. As a platinum player, room was free. Slots were pretty bad, went to Flamingo across street, much better. Be prepared to pay 4 bucks for coffee at Caesars. Next to Harrahs is McDonalds and others that are much cheaper. Coming from the airport, take a shuttle, 6 bucks instead of 20 for taxi. Love the bathroom at Caesars, most have large jacuzzi tub and seperate shower etc. Room service is great. Great location for site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, big hotel, need a map where you are;)”
Reviews.Author: ICEGIRL75
Reviews.Content: We spent few days in LV and decided to book CP. We booked throught internet. After arrive we realized how huge hotel it is. We gave our car with luggage and went to the reception with handy luggage only. Nice receptionist offered ugraded room (suita with jacuzzi) after extra payment- we said OK! And it really was fantastic stay with a lot of fun and trip to Death Valley. The only complain was that we were waiting an hour for our main luggage and could not move from the room. I know hotel is huge and they had a lot of arrivals but it took too long time. Also the room was really clean, bathroom with "100" different shape and size towels, good cosmetics, generally well equipped. First night we spent in "our" casino with free drinks during plaing with machines. The other night we visited other casinos- I must say that with the middle price we paid for our hotel- I liked it and its interiors the most!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VIEW OF FOUNTAINS”
Reviews.Author: VegasChick1
Reviews.Content: We stayed Augustus Tower 4554. We are frequent Vegas visitors & always travel during week days for better service & room choice. This was a comp invitation & I did request this tower on check in & request a view of Bellagio fountains.Front desk clerk was wonderful & called room about 15mins after we arrived to ask if room ok. Had told me she would move us if not completely happy. Room was very clean & comfortable & all staff we dealt with were very friendly & helpful. Casino is dated, & was very empty. I play table games & found all dealers except one to be cheerful & want the players to win & have fun. Pit bosses also friendly, although I am totally not a big better. Drink servers on night shift made sure I always had a drink in front of me & were GREAT !! Qua was wonderful & relaxing. Holds its own when compared to Canyon Ranch etc.Therapist not as good as last trip. The staff makes a resort what it is & although we have stayed at Encore, Wynn & Palazzo in past, I would definately not turn away another trip to Caesars---Augustus Towers only,

Reviews.Title: “Not comming back to Ceaser's again.”
Reviews.Author: yerevan90
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ceaser's from Jan 1st to Jan 3rd. I reserved a room about 4 days earlier and I was told that our check in time will be at 4pm and the room will be ready. We arrived at the hotel at around 4:30 pm and were told that our room was not ready and we should wait an hour. Well long story short we finally got our room keys at 12:30am on Jan 2nd. I personally would come every hour and each time I was told that my room will be ready in an hour the most. The last lady at the front desk was VERY rude as I tried to explain to her that I am waiting for my room keys for about 8 hours. She had a major attitude and told me to calm down because she looked on her notes and supposedly nobody put a rush order to clean our room. When i finnaly got my room keys the floor was very dirty. The next day I tried to relax and forget about it. I decided to play black jack and proceded to seat at the pussycat doll section. The dealer was very rude. For the first 10 mins she never spoke a word of English. She was speaking spanish with one of the players on the table, laughing, making jokes and taking her time. After asking her to play and not take so much time talking to the other player she started rolling her eyes at me, told my friend to shut up because he wasn't playing then started yelling at me and my friend and cursing in spanish after I told her that she wasn't supposed to behave the way she is towards guests. For the last 3 years I've been staying at Ceaser's but yesturday was the last time I will be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-Scot
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Caesar's and I probably won't be back. We stayed in a classic room in the Roman Tower. I had read bad reviews prior to going but figured how bad can the lowest room in a 4.5 star hotel in Vegas be. Answer: Not good. The line at check-in wasn't long but the customer service wasn't good. The woman didn't really even look at us. We were in room 597 and walked the longest hallway of my life to get there. Our room was basically empty of furniture. We had 2 double beds, the stand with TV, one end table, one chair, and one nightstand. All the pictures online and the room description included a chaise lounge so we immediately called down and asked to have our missing furniture delivered. The front desk said there was no chaise lounges in any rooms that weren't suites but they would get us some furniture. In the next 24 hours we made 4 phone calls before we finally had a chaise lounge delivered. During the 3rd phone call my mom suggested bringing us one out of an empty room and the front desk responded that they couldn't do that because then that room would be without. What?? Even with all of our furniture the room was still not good. The beds literally turned up in the corners and everything is very old and used looking. Also note that the room was an adjoining one and there was absolutely no sound proofing between the rooms. My aunt stayed in a room on the same floor with 2 adjoining rooms and she barely got any sleep for 6 nights even though all her neighbours did was talk and not loudly. Caesar's is huge so be prepared to do lots of walking. I did like the casino and the Forum Shops being right there. Love the Cheesecake Factory in the Forum Shops so it was a great location for that. The room was always cleaned although some days they didn't always replace the towels so one day we had to call to have a bathmat delivered. The food options on site are very expensive. The Java Coast coffee place is $4 for a small cup of coffee. Overall I found Caesar's overpriced, the classic rooms were not even a 3 star room in a 4.5 star hotel, and the food prices were astronomical. I have read the great reviews and it seems you have to upgrade at Caesars to have the 4.5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for seeing Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Phill-D
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights from 19/DEC TO 23/DEC. Hotel is in a great position for seeing Vegas for the first time. Stayed in a Roman Tower room. Rooms are pretty basic but clean and as you should be out and about sightseeing most of the time they are fine. Caesars in general is llittle bit dated in terms of decor and the casino isn't as nice as most of the newer hotels. Shopping is great with the Forum shopping centre attached to the hotel. There is Deuce bus stop outside the hotel which makes it easy to get about. In summary if you want Luxury-stay at the Wynn, Ventian, Bellagio. If you want a nice central base for seeing everything stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Corny12
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, the service was excellent each person we spoke to was fantastic and went out of there way to help. Stayed in Augustus Tower and the room was exceptional. Only problem was we did not get the view we were promised when booking. We saw the strip, but was told at booking we would have a great view and it was not. We were given an option to change room next day so maybe I should'nt complain now; but after a 6hr. airport delay we were exhausted and wanted to start our vacation not play musical rooms. Bobby Flays' Mesa Grill veal chop was to die for. Pure nightclub closed for renovations, but the Cleopatra barge was amusing with the live music. Shadow bar very disappointing; bartenders was not doing tricks as other clubs were we went to. Someone wrote about the mini bar electronically charge and they were right. Ask for a fridge when you get there to save yourself correcting your bill because you used the mini bar fridge for personal items. I would and will stay here again. I'm looking now for deals for the fall 2010. It was surprisingly cold during our stay 12/09. Taxi driver told us weather was about 10 degrees colder than normal.

Reviews.Title: “Never again! This place continues to disappoint”
Reviews.Author: SheridonBuckett
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here eight times, and each time, it gets worse and worse. The new hotels on the strip are most likely causing this. The last time I was here, it was horrible - this time they comp'ed us completely over New Years. Even though the rooms were free, it wasn't even worth it. 1. They continue to understaff the front desk. Prepare to wait 30 or more minutes for checkin. 2. Gave us a key in the VIP Diamond room, went to room, walked in, other people in there. 3. 20 minutes on hold in the lobby to tell them, hung up on us 4. Gave us a new room - NO DOOR TO BATHROOM!!! Seriously. Last time we were here, they room wasn't cleaned on a stayover until 5:30PM Elevators not always working. Expensive for no reason. Example: Compare spa treatments from Caesers with Bellagio before staying here - they are half the price there, with better service. If you are looking for service and value - this is not the place. Bellagio is same price with better service, better spa services for better prices, friendlier staff, faster checkin and better housekeeping services.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DTaylor224
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at almost all the hotels on the strip. We have been going there every year for about 30 years. We were looking forward to finally staying at Caesars and were so disappointed. The room was small and nothing special. We could hear the people in the room next door clearly. Customer service was sad. I called the casino host to ask a question and he wouldn't talk to me because the card was in my husband's name. I have been booking rooms with my husbands rewards card at all the other hotels and they were always gracious, so that was odd. We have had nicer rooms at TI and the Mirage. For my money I will always return to the Venetian from now on.

Reviews.Title: “No Better Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dwife921
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone..CAESARS PALACE is the QUEEN of VEGAS! A beautiful hotel, with great staff, from concierge to room service .We have stayed at CAESARS at least 5 times,and will continue to return. The AUGUSTUS TOWER and, PALACE TOWER are incredible. I love looking at the fountains from our room....just awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Too big- bad service”
Reviews.Author: panictheory
Reviews.Content: Check in was a nightmare and the woman at the desk was incredibly rude after I had explained to her that hotwire had promised me a free upgrade. She also scoffed when I asked for a room with a view, like I was really inconviencing her to give me one. I felt like nothing more than a number to them. The room was really fantastic, however the huge casino made it a trek to get anywhere in good time. Their self parking is in no mans land and we had to drag our luggage almost a mile to get to check in. There is a nice french bistro style restaurant that is very reasonably priced on the way to our room that we patronized twice during our stay- that was probably the highlight of our trip at this casino. All in all, I wouldnt stay here again as Ive had a better time at smaller south strip hotels like the mandalay bay and the luxor

Reviews.Title: “Did Caesar actually live here”
Reviews.Author: coastalbrett
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Vegas for a long, long time and had never stayed at Caesars. Booked it with Rewards so I didn't know what to expect. We were greeted at the desk and immediately asked if we'd liked to upgrade. Generally I'm apprehensive of this "sell" however I did so anyway. What a great decision. They put us in the Augustus Tower with a stunning view of the Bellagio fountains. The Tower has all the amenities including the best Vegas Spa we've used. Granted, the property itself is a little long in the tooth but it can still hold it's own. We'll be back soon and maybe run into the Hangover boys.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed. Definitely won't return to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: theahappyone
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th time to Las Vegas but the first time staying at Caesars Palace. The previous 3 time we also stayed at the 4+ stars hotels on the strip. We booked the Classic Room for 5 nights. When we got to the room, we were very disappointed with how old and dated it was. The room looked like it belonged in a 3-star motel instead of a 4+ stars Vegas hotel. Even the beddings looked like they had been used for 20 years. The lady at guest service/concierge was rude and unhelpful. On our second last day of stay, we asked for information for the airport shuttle and were told that we should have booked the return shuttle at the airport. She said that since the shuttle company is not affiliated with the hotel, she was not able to make reservation for us. She didn't even provide us the shutlle phone number to call. Her tone of voice and body language told us they she didn't even want to talk to us. At the other 3 previous hotels we stayed, they were more than happy to help us make the reservation. Failing to get the information we needed, we went next door to the Bellagio and was able to get the help we needed even though the staff knew that we were not their hotel guests. Don't eat at their buffet restaurant. The hot food quality is poor, the selection is 1/4 of Bellagio's buffet and costs more than the Bellagio. Overall we were very disappointed with the hotel service and room quality. We defintiely won't return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BLOWN AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: PDXbree
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas a couple of times and stayed at the Stratosphere (ick) and the MGM Signature (nice). Caesar's Palace is so beautiful from the moment you walk into the lobby. We recently saw the movie "The Hangover" and loved it so it was great fun to see it in person. At check in we were offered an upgrade from our priceline booking for an extra $40 per night which my wonderful boyfriend accepted. We were put into a gorgeous room over 600sf with a whirlpool tub and an amazing view of the strip. The bed and linens were so comfortable i wanted to stuff the whole thing into my bag and take it all home with me. The whirlpool tub was a great treat after hours of walking around and drinking, and it was actually large enough to fit the both of us! He loved that there was a small plasma TV in the RR to watch as well. The hotel, casino and the forum shops are filled with amazing artwork in every nook and cranny. After strolling through all the other hotels on the strip we both agreed that our hotel was the most impressive with the Venetian and Bellagio a close second ( however we did not see the rooms in those hotels) One important thing to remember which may be in many of the hotels is that if you move any of the mini bar or conveience items from their place they are automatically and electronically entered onto your bill as being used. If you touch anything there, go through the checkout line and check your bill closely to ensure that you were not charged for anything you didn't use. We had moved everything out of the little fridge to make room for our liquor and the initial bill was over $200 when in reality we only had used about $20 worth of items. The checkout clerk did remove all the other items from our bill with no problem. I imagine if you are not familiar with this and do quick checkout you wil have an unhappy surprise on your card statement when you get home.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: specman02
Reviews.Content: The place is amazing, its so big but comfortable always something going on, its brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Trauma critical care 2009”
Reviews.Author: Christopher006
