Reviews.Content: Almost everything was great. Average food, good shopping. The hotel was centrally located and this made getting around very easy. The shows were too expensive! I look forward to going back. :)

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: wildlotus2482
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made reservations in early December for a week in a Classic Room having never stayed at Caesars Palace before. We got an awesome deal online and I thought it would be great to stay there because of it’s awesome location and because of the Forum Shops which houses more high fashion designers under one roof than any other place in the world. After making our reservation I came to trip advisor and was horrified at the reviews and pictures of the Classic Room. I told my husband about the $20 tip I read about and said we needed to upgrade, even if we had to pay for it. When we arrived at the hotel at 1:00pm there were about 50 people in line in front of us but it only took 20-25minutes. My husband put the $20 between his credit card and ID and told the man we were there celebrating our first anniversary and was wondering if he could help us out with an upgrade. The man said, give me a second, I want to get you something good.” Believe it or not he upgraded us all the way to a Suite in the Augustus Tower! There was NEVER a wait at our elevators! It was so quiet and peaceful in our room. The only noise we ever heard was when people were using water in their room. The room was very nice but I have to say I would not pay full price for it. Although it was decorated very nicely and was very roomy, there was also some wear and tear. The floor boards had scruff marks everywhere, the carpet looked a bit old as did the sofa, the wood furniture has pieces of wood missing like it needed to be sanded and stained again and the caulking around the edges of the shower floor was black and grimy. It’s not that big a deal but if we had paid thousands of dollars for a week stay in the room we would have been a bit disappointed. Thank goodness it was free! The bathroom was wonderful! There were actually 2! My husband had a sink and toilet in his and in my bathroom there was a sink, toilet and bidet, and LARGE Jacuzzi tub! Plus there was a 2 person shower! The bed was comfortable and the linens were very nice. The fridge was stocked with alcohol and drinks and when we called housekeeping to ask for it to be emptied they said they couldn’t do that because the fridge was not for personal use. An orange juice one morning for $6 and a coke was about $8. If you go down to the casino level to one of those little stores that has medicines, bathroom necessities, and snacks you can get the same size coke for only $2. Anything you take from the fridge will be replaced by housekeeping the next day and they keep a record of what was removed. We were very impressed with our housekeeping. About 1 hour after we got in our room our housekeeper came to introduce himself, asked if we needed anything, mentioned the normal time he would clean our room and if that would work for us. He was very good at his job. Caesars Palace is large but I can’t understand why people complain about that. It’s Vegas and most of the hotel/casinos are big. In Vegas you do a lot of walking and that’s just the way it is. Luckily Caesars didn’t smell as bad smoke-wise as other places. As for gambling--I don’t gamble but Caesars had a lot of machines and tables and people having a good time. The hotel/casino can be a bit confusing but take some time to look at the map you get when you check in and then walk around a little. You’ll get it in no time! I was disappointed in the food court. It is expensive, small portions, and doesn’t have a broad selection. There is a pizza place where a slice of pizza and drink is about $15. There was no McDonalds, Subway or what you would expect in a normal food court. We tried the food court once and didn’t go back. The Augustus Café is like an expensive Dennys/IHOP. We tried it for lunch and were pleased and FULL. The portions are big. I got a roast beef dip for $16 and my husband a bread bowl with soup for $12. Even though it was tasty and convenient we decided not to go back but instead, for the same price, go to buffets along the strip for lunch which normally go for about $16 a person and you get a huge variety plus a drink. I tried the Caesar buffet for dinner one night and was disappointed. I wrote a separate review for this but let me say I’ve tried almost every buffet in Vegas and this by far had the smallest selection. I thought to myself, “is there another section of food somewhere that I am missing?” The food was decent but was nothing special. It’s a lovely place and they don’t cram the place full of tables like other Vegas buffets, but the food is not worth the $38 per person. Other buffets seriously have 3 times the selection of Caesars. Qua Baths and Spa is wonderful. I wrote a separate, more detailed review for that too. Give it a try and you won’t be disappointed. There is a separate men’s and women’s spa and there is a “clothing optional policy.” Day passes are $45 and give you access to the gym, Roman Baths, Steam Rooms, Tea Room and you can also help yourself to snacks, fruit, coffee, tea, and fruit juices. Well worth the $45 but if you are considering a massage try to go Monday through Thursday when a classic massage is only $90. It’s a good massage but nowhere near the $140 I paid for it. If I found a good deal I’d definitely stay at Caesars Palace again. The Spa and Forum Shops make it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Jtorsney
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace is a bit of an odd duck, because there are a bunch of things that I like and many others that I did not. Check-in was quick but I was given a non-smoking room without being informed, which was a minor annoyance. My room in the Forum Tower had been refurbished but looked a bit frayed around the edges in places. On the plus side, the room had some nice amenities like guest robes but sadly, no bathtub. Also, the tv embedded in the bathroom mirror was a neat touch. The property itself has sprouted up willy nilly over 40 years ago, to the point that it's almost impossible not to get lost. The swimming pools were an incredibly long walk from my room. Again on the plus side, Caesars has an incredle array of restaurants and shops. Service was also pretty good all around. I think that I paid something like $180 total for a Thursday and Friday, which was a nice deal. Generally, I would prefer to pay more and go next door to Bellagio. Pros: Great restarants, shops, and very good value Cons: Older, far flung property that's almost impossible to navigate

Reviews.Title: “Spotty Service”
Reviews.Author: grumpel7
Reviews.Content: We did not have any particular expectations about Caesars but based on a family's recommendation and memory from a Las Vegas trip 10 years ago, we did not anticipate such a spotty service. Then again, in hindsight, it made sense as this hotel seems to have grown beyond its capacity and without much thought about quality maintenance. We arrived at the hotel at 11 pm after a long flight and lined up at the check-in for 20 minutes to be then told that they had given away the non-smoking Augustus room that we had booked months in advance, and that they only available room they had was a smoking room in the Forum Tower. We were offered an apology and an upgrade to a junior suite in the Palace Tower and a free mini fridge rental for compensation. To the hotel's credit, all the staff at the registration were friendly and helpful - even though one managed to authorize and get a denial when he accidentally re-authorized the card, asking us for another credit card to authorize in the end (we didn't find out until days later that that was what happened). We ate a late dinner at the 24-hour place (not worth the price - Caesar restaurants were on average $3-5 more expensive than other places; a hot chocolate and croissant was easily over $10, and a normal breakfast was over $40). Our smoking room at the Forum Tower was ok save for the broken TV in the bathroom mirror. The next morning we inquired about our new room and were told that we had to check out of the current room by 10 am and check our luggage with the bell desk until we could get the key cards to our new room between 1-3 pm. Because we already had tickets for a show from 1 - 5, we decided to go to the desk before 12 pm and ask for a room, and we were lucky enough that another junior suite had been cleaned at that time. When we went to ask for our luggage to be sent up from the bell desk, we were told to go to the outside one (valet / luggage) to retrieve it - and there we were told that we had to wait for them to be retrieved from the basement... all this despite the fact that we told them that we were not checking in / out. Finally, at my partner's insistance, the bell service agreed to send someone up with our luggage (a very friendly and helpful hotel clerk). Our hotel staff the night before had recommended that we take the Junior Suite at the Palace Tower over the Deluxe Room at the Augustus Tower - so we went with his recommendations but I cannot help but wonder if we would have enjoyed the smaller but newer room better - The Palace Tower room was spacious and nice, but at closer look you could tell that it was worn - the corners of the door frames were frayed and discolored; one of the faucets (we had two bathrooms) was loose and made it hard to shut the water off; and it took forever to get hot water in the shower. Overall, our stay was just ok - most of the staff that we interacted with were helpful and friendly (especially the registration staff, the cleaning staff and the bell person who brought our luggage up), but a couple of them were just plain rude. Given all the other choices on the strip, we will be definitely not returning.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beds in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: McGeepers
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Forum Tower for 4 nights. The beds and pillow were the most comfortable I have ever experience in my many trips to Vegas. But it doesn't end there. The room is tastefully decorated, bathroom has a tv in the mirror and a rainfall shower head. We checked out the Qua Spa with a Roman Ritual pass and it was a pure luxury. The pool area is fantastic and the buffet surprised me with the range of food and quality. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money - even free upgrade”
Reviews.Author: RickLa
Reviews.Content: I visit Vegas about 3-5 times a year since the last 7 years. Stayed in almost all major hotels starting from some of the less expensive ones like Luxor to the most expensive and the best like Wynn / Encore. I always shop for good deals. And this time I got one Ceaser's Palace. I went there with my fiancee and stayed on the Thanksgiving Night of 2009 (Nov 2009). I requested a upgrade during checking and the front desk guy did it happily - free upgrade to a spa suite room with strip view. Huh! Nice surprise. It was a 600 sq ft room with a spa tub. Very spacious bathrooms (similar to the ones in a more expense hotel like Encore/Wynn) with nice bathrobes. Didn't use any of their services other than the front desk interaction which was great. The only thing I didn't like was the longer that usual walk from the parking lot to the room (which is not unusual in Vegas Strip Resorts - but I thought the walk was longer and it was difficult to find your way out though the casino). Overall excellent stay. I paid only $90 including taxes for a Thursday night stay. It was definitely worth more than a $150 stay. I will stay here again - no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: alvarezgranda
Reviews.Content: For me, this is the best hotel in Vegas along with the Wynn. The queue for checking in was tiny so 15 minutes after checking in we where in our room. the staff is really friendly and polite. We were upgraded for free to an Emperor room that was absolutely amazing and huge. The room is really trendy, clean, big and functional. The batroom is very big, with a walking shower and a great jacuzzi. It was expotless all the time as the maids come to clean everything the second you leave the room. Once they came up to 4 times in a day. The variety of restaurants and shops can be a bit overwhealming but everything has been decorated in such a beautiful way that you can´t get enough of it. The only thing were were not totally kee on was the swimming pool because it gets too crowded in the weekend. You have to go very early in the morning to get the good sunbeds because from 12 onwards half of them are on the shade! Besides that, they have pop music paying all day long at full blast which is not very relaxing to say at least... It was really hard to concentrate on my book. We have been to the Bellagio and the Venitian before but they are not as good as this one, i highly recomend it if you can upgrade to an emperor room as I have been told that the stadard rooms are rather small and plain.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: BLC1411
Reviews.Content: I attended a business function in CA and the closest airport was Las Vegas. I decided to make a weekend out of the trip. I only made a reservation to stay at Caesars Palace for one night as I had plans to see the Grand Canyon and come back to Vegas for two nights at MGM before returning home. Thankfully I only made plans to stay at Caesars one night in advance or else I would have been scrambling to find other lodging after my return from the Grand Canyon. My one night experience has deterred me from ever staying at this resort again. At check-in I decided to pay the extra for an upgrade. When I got to the room everything looked clean and nice until I went into the bathroom. I looked in the tub (separate from the shower) and found a significant quantity of a substance that appeared to be blood or vomit or possibly even a combination of the two. I immediately called the front desk. The staff was very accommodating and said that someone would be up to the room immediately to clean the tub. I was also offered a $50 voucher for food/gaming to make up for the inconvenience. I had no intention of using the tub regardless of it being clean or not – so I accepted their offer. I decided to take a quick shower and unpack before housekeeping made it up to clean the tub – I was almost finished in the shower when I turned around and something caught my eye about 6 inches above my head. I looked up and hanging on the shower wall was a used bandage tape, about 4 inches long. I was absolutely disgusted. I got out of the shower and called the front desk to have my room switched. I had to repack anything that I already unpacked and walk back down to the lobby and wait on line for almost 20 minutes to get a room change. The staff again was accommodating and upgraded me to a nicer room. I got to the new room but didn’t have time to unpack or shower – at this point I had already missed most of a dinner with co-workers and barely made it to a 7:00 showing of “Le Reve” that I already had tickets for. When I got out of “Le Reve” my girlfriend called – her plane had just landed and she would be at the Caesars within an hour. I went back to Caesars and was still disgusted; I called management to have them verify that their records showed that everything in the previous room had been cleaned even though they missed the bandage and the substance in the bathtub. After my girlfriend arrived we took a walk around Vegas and played a few games. We had a nice dinner and a few drinks and returned to the room. At this point I was almost getting over the mess I had to deal with earlier that afternoon. I took another shower, checked the cleanliness of the bed and watched TV as my girlfriend showered. When she was done with the shower I heard a yell and jumped up to see what was wrong – the towel she grabbed had a dead bug stuck in the fibers of the towel. The bug was about the size of a housefly. I called management to again express my dissatisfaction. This was absolutely the worst experience I have ever had in a hotel – not to mention that the Casino and restaurants were not impressive at all. I already have a trip planned for Vegas not even 2 months since the aforementioned experience and I will not be stepping foot into this establishment and I highly recommend that anyone going to Vegas seek alternate lodging – there are plenty of places to stay in Vegas and a lot of great deals – Caesars is extremely overrated!!

Reviews.Title: “Get a room in the Augustus tower”
Reviews.Author: JumboMcNutt
Reviews.Content: It appears reviews of this hotel vary depending on room type and the tower you get. Obviously conscious of this when I checked in (reserved a Deluxe room) I said my friend had not been to Vegas before and would appreciate a good view of the strip. As the check in girl had nothing in deluxe available that she thought was a "great view of the strip" she put us into a "Luxury" room in the newer Augustus tower - she even told us how much more that would have been if we paid for the Luxury room - but she gave it to us for no extra charge, which after we had got the room so cheap on getroomscheaper.com seemed even better. Now it wasn't particularly busy queue checking in at the time we did (about 5pm) but the Rodeo finals were on so they must have been close to capacity I would have thought. The room was excellent. Too large twin bed configuration, sofa, coffee table, dining table and a view looking down onto the Bellagio fountains and south strip. Paris, Planet Hollywood could both be seen as we were on the 42nd floor. It seems that if you ask you often get if you are polite and friendly. As the hotel is so big you can sometimes imagine that not everyone feels that it is a friendly place or that they cater to your needs but I failed to see that here. Before I have stayed at the Luxor, Excalibur, Green Valley Ranch, and apart from the later (which is nowhere near the strip) Caesars excels in service. The entertainment concierge booked us our golf, and gave us VIP passes to Pure Nightclub. Food options caters too all. 24hr cafe is fine for eating a quick bite at odd times. The food court just off the gaming floor is your typical fast food affair, although the options to vary from those you get in USA Malls as it was caesar's own brands. Pulled Pork, Tex/Mex, Asian, Pizza, Salad Bar. The Forum shops connected to the hotel offer your usual outlets for fashion. But the Cheesecake Factory restaurant in there has an extensive menu - and cheesecake is only one of a million things they do well, highly recommend you eat there if very hungry. The bars in Caesar's are ok, but some other hotel's have better. Pure Nightclub is one of the more popular clubs so get there early. If you like gambling, the casino floor is an odd layout for my liking but it offers pretty much something for every type of gambler....It's Poker is certainly one of the better rooms on the strip. We booked our room via getroomscheaper.com , so as well as being upgraded when we got there we had already got a good deal on a deluxe room via searching on that website.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Vegas - What an experience!”
Reviews.Author: happytravellers79
Reviews.Content: Wow - where do I start! Stayed at Caesars palace during November 2009. First time in Vegas so when we arrived at the airport early evening -weary and tired - we spotted the Shuttle bus and got a return ticket (pickup on departure as well) for 28 dollars return. Our driver Jen was fabulous and after explaining we were here to see the Pro Bull Riders final at the Thomas & Mack center she said she was shuttling the Riders from Mandalay Bay to the event and if we needed a ride give her a shout. So we did! I though just as well to pay Jen as to pay a taxi and we met some fantastic people. Anyway back to Caesars - when we arrived I couldnt believe how grand it was. There was no check-in line. I walked straight up to the attendant who was most helpful. She asked for my Credit card number, just to keep on file, and I handed over our passports with a 20dollar note and asked if there were any comp upgrades. We were originally booked into a Forum Deluxe room however she gave us a room in the Augustus Tower - over-looking the Bellagio fountains! Incredible room - 2 Queen beds, table & chairs, sofa, large flat screen tv, massive walk-in shower, jacuzzi, his 'n hers sinks and of course the fantastic view. I dont know the layout of the other towers but the Augustus was very easy to find. Just off the front desk area. No need to walk through the casino and our room was literally 5 minutes from front entrance to our door. We did breakfast first morning at Caesars in Cafe Lago. Great breakfast - quite expensive but def the best we had. It was the only morning we didn't have a coupon to use other than that we had 2 for 1 and buy one get one half price. We also eat at Imperial Palace (twice), Mandalay Bay and Mirage. Lots of choice we didnt have a problem finding anything to eat. The buffet kept us going all day and we then found eveing meals - choice in abundance. The Outback Steakhouse is the best ever. As for trips we did the Grand Canyon Sunset Helicopter tour with Maverick - this was incredible - expensive but incredible. I booked the tour before I left the UK and paid when we arrived for the trip. I would not have missed this for the world. Maverick were brilliant - very professional. We were also in Vegas for the Pro Bull Riders Final at the Thomas & Mack center. Again a brilliant experience with amazing entertainment. We had the pleasure of travelling to the event with the professional riders. Originally we only had tickets for the Friday night however we purchased tickets to the final whilst we were there. We are so glad we did. The atmosphere was brilliant - we felt like true cowboys! Other than that with only 4 days in Vegas we only scratched the surface and crammed as much in a we could. When I attempted to ring the shuttle company to book our return journey my phone card would not accept the number so I went to the front desk and a more than helpful attendant rang the company and even booked it for me. Our 8.30am check-out was quick and smooth. Shuttle bus took us straight to the airport and dropped right outside our terminal doors. All in all we had a the most fantastic time. When I return I will probably do things slightly differently. The majority of hotels on the strip are all of a high standard and I think as long as you've got the central location i would stay anywhere and have equally as nice time. This is by no means any reflection on caesars - we absolutely loved the place - just next time I would spend a little less on the hotel room and a little more on the gambling! I would def go for a week next time but we were flying onto Hawaii this time so it was a short stop. I would highly recommend Caesars. We were made to feel very welcome by everybody. One tip: Make sure you wear comfy shoes - you will need them!

Reviews.Title: “"My first time and last time staying at Caesars"”
Reviews.Author: letsjusplay23
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at much better hotels in Las Vegas. When we arrived they put us in the wrong room because they overbooked and they were going to refuse to move us unless I had documents showing that we booked elsewhere (luckily I had all my paperwork). It took until the next evening around 7.pm. before guest services moved us to a better room. The staff is quite rude! Once we got there everything seemed pretty great. However it took room service 2 hours to bring our food one night. Caesars is extremely too big, it takes forever to get anywhere. I would not recommend staying here to anyone. Its not worth the hassle and it almost ruined our entire vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Ceasars palace”
Reviews.Author: KrishnaS3
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Staff very helpful and room is very large.

Reviews.Title: “ask and you shall receive”
Reviews.Author: smiley2269
Reviews.Content: I traveled to caesars with 6 friends each obtaining a different deal. So here is what I learned, ask....ask....ask. I checked in at front desk who told me no rooms available and I could upgrade for $40 a night. While walking around I saw a total rewards Diamond check in, I popped in there and got a free upgrade and a room right away. Could it be the total rewards status sure, but it is the same hotel is it not!!!! I think the classic room is old and not worth the money (if I had to pay) but the delux was wonderful, really made a difference. In NJ you can go to diamond lounge for food and drinks and bring several guest....vegas drinks only and 1 guest. If you are not a total rewards memeber become one while out there and upon check out give them your card, it may get you a discount. Hope this helps all!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LaurieSusan
Reviews.Content: Loved the room. Up on the 42nd floor facing the Bellagio's Fountain (loved the fountains at night...beautiful). Got a call from the desk checking to see if we loved the room. My cousin also got a nice gift for her birthday which was in a few days. TV in the bathroom with a jacuzzi. Very nice. The buffet was lovely and the food was very well prepared and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong”
Reviews.Author: LessThanEd
Reviews.Content: Caesars doesn't really need much comments. It lives up to everything. Location is definitely good. Nothing really bad about my stay. They ran out of double rooms in the tower we had an upgraded us to a more expensive room that had two double beds without a hassle. Even if the tables are too expensive, you can walk across the street to Bill's Gambling Hall and O'Sheas to get some of the more cheap spots.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Pool”
Reviews.Author: anasan1216
Reviews.Content: My Maids of Honor took me there as a surprise for my bachelorette party and it truly was a blast! We upgraded the room for a small fee (it was off season) and it was the coolest room I have ever stayed in. It was very clean and our view was spectacular. The resort location truly is the best. We were right in the middle of everything which allowed us to walk everywhere. If you like to party make sure to check out Pure. Show proof that you are staying in the hotel and they should let you in without paying a cover (This is what we did). The downfall to the hotel is the food they serve in the food court is just awful. Also, a drink by the pool and room service is extremely expensive. For a normal sized margarita by the pool was $20! So get ready to splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Tower - As dirty as Rome”
Reviews.Author: levbar
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Caesars Palace. Having stayed at other upscale hotels in Vegas like the Mandalay Bay, the Venetian, Paris, and Luxor, I expected to get at least the same type of room if not better at the Caesars. Boy was I wrong? We stayed in the Roman Tower on the 14th Floor and all I can say was that Motel 6s I've stayed at during my younger days were cleaner and more up to date. First of all, the TV was a tiny 20" Tube sitting in a cabinet that had to be at least 20 feet away from our bed due to the weird L shape of our room. There was no real closet in the room, the safe was awkwardly sitting on the floor in one corner looking like someone could just pick up the whole thing and walk away. Furthermore, one of the light bulbs in the recess lights right above our bed was missing and the entire socket appeared to be covered with what looked like mold. The bathroom was extremely old, with cracks on the vanity and mildew looking stains on the walls.... disgusting! The room was EXTREMELY NOISY. Every time one of our neighbors flushed the toilet, ran the sink, or took a shower, there was a sound of water running through the pipes that was so loud in our room, we couldn't hear each other talking. I'm not exaggerating, it was THAT loud. We only found the hair dryer on the last day when checking out. It was hidden a lower drawer below the TV. Why it would be there I have no idea. In any case, if staying at the Caesars, make sure it's not the Roman Tower. I don't know what their other Towers are like but I'm hoping they're better than this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - I plan on being back if they comp me again”
Reviews.Author: NorthDakotaDickinson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Nov 22 thru 27th, 2009. Our first time staying at Caesars and we had gotten comped for all five nights (keep in mind this is a slow time for Vegas), because of our play and stay at other Harrah properties. Check in was about 20 mins, we had a comped room in the forum tower, I did the $50.00 tip and got us upgraded to the Augustus tower with a view of the bellogio fountains. We definately recommend this tower, rooms are awesome. We did not eat at Ceasars, we have other favorites around town. We bring our own water/coffee heater with cappicino when we go to vegas with cereal and pick up our water/pop/milk at Walgreens or the ABC store at Planet Hollywood with a collapsible cooler along. We highly recommend you go on line and google "floor plans for vegas casinos". Knowing your hotel and casino before you get to vegas will save a lot on foot power. Yes we did come home a winner, just remember always play where the people are. The most people were in the forum casino playing the pennies, just keep in mind you can play up to $5.00 a spin on the pennies.

Reviews.Title: “wheres the ice!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnnym11
Reviews.Content: arrived at ceasers on wednesday the 25, 09 and stayed at the centurian tower it was not what i expected. I like to have a drink when i get to a new place unpack and unwind well there was no ice bucket i call room service and they said no ice avaiable in the entire tower they bring it up from the basement to your room i called twice i thought they got lost i said ill go down and get it but they were onthere way sure enough there my bucket of ice 1 hour later no refer in the room no coffee pot its just not what i exspected from ceasers never stayed there befor never will again 23 inch pioneer tv give me a break i really like the forum shops though get a ice cream cone 13 dollars a scoop i licked it really slow what a joke its just not the same out there any more no comps no ICE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars VERY overrated”
Reviews.Author: kharding83
Reviews.Content: Paid $206 (including tax) for a deluxe room at caesars on lasvegas.com for 1 night on 11/26/09. The price was fair in my opinion for what i was SUPPOSED to get which was a room in the AUGUSTUS tower with 2 queen beds. The day before i was supposed to arrive i got an email stating that my flight would arrive 3hrs earlier than first projected, so i called caesars to ask if i coulf possibly check in early, "shouldn't be a problem, happens all the time", she said. So i arrived approx 1130 am thursday, and as im pulling in to the VALET there is a sign that reads " VALET FULL. please self park". So as im about to backup and find the "self park" a parking employee informs me that "if your checking in that valet should not be a problem", that they only put out that sign to "detour locals, and non hotel guests". So i proceed to the valet, where i promptly let them know im checking in. Once inside i proceed to the hotel guest check-in. Upon arriving to the line im met by a CP employee who is telling everyone that "early check-in doesnt start until 1pm", so i tell her that ive already contacted the hotel and they know i will be arriving early. She wants none of it! Tells me to go check my bags at bell station and to come back at 1. So i proceed to walk about 50ft away to some sofas and wait. About 15mins later she disappears so i take the opportunity to jump in the line.. What do you know they have some rooms available!! Gee imagine that! The man at the desk informs me "im upgrading your room for free".. Ok now im starting to forget about everything and warm-up to this place. After informing me that they would charge an additional $200 on my debit card for "incidentals", he informs me that im staying in the PALACE TOWER room 1038. COOL. So instead of walking 50 feet to the AUGUSTUS tower elevators i walk about 300yds to the PALACE tower elevators which are in no-mans land it seems. Im located on the 10th floor. I open the door, and to my displeasure im greeted by 1 KING bed (i had booked 2 Queens). Now if i wasnt staying with my 55yr old mother, i wouldnt have been to pissed. But being that im not 11yrs old anymore, sleeping with your mother is alittle weird in my book. So i call to the front desk and ask for someone to talk to.. They transfer me to call HOUSEKEEPING. I talked to someone and they inform me that a ROLL-AWAY bed will be an extra $30 dollars! So i agree, and within 30mins a man knocked on the door with the bed. About 730-8pm we arrive back at CP from having a wonderful Thanksgiving dinner at "The Tillerman" steakhouse on flamingo rd, only to be told that since we arent "checking in" that we would have to self park. We explained that we were guests of the hotel and that we had valet'd earlier without problem. After getting serious additude from the valet kid (string bean white kid) we talked to a "manager" that told string bean to park our car. So at CHECK-OUT the next morning i explained my situation to the clerk, and she managed to adjust the $30 roll-away charge OFF my room's bill. Ive had better customer serive DOWNTOWN for 1/3 the price. Will not return. Btw, our room did overlook the 7 pools that no one seemed to be at.

Reviews.Title: ““Definitely the best holiday I have ever been on and probably the most fun week I have ever had.””
Reviews.Author: OLPOL
Reviews.Content: Coming from the UK to Las Vegas In a small group. Earlier this year we decided that for my dad’s 60th we would all go on a trip to Las Vegas. This trip was to spend quality family time and to have a whole lot of fun. We looked up and down the strip, checked websites, read blogs and there were pros and cons to every hotel. Some are newer, some have particular features, but in terms of location, amenities and what the hotels have to offer for entertainment and dining, we selected Caesars Palace. Having spent some time trying to organise the trip from the UK, making transatlantic phone calls and surfing a host of websites trying to book, I was introduced to Harrah’s Total Experiences programme where we had a dedicated member of staff to assist in organising our trip. Prior to departure we worked jointly to plan an itinerary, and when we arrived everything was sorted and reserved- we were put in a good room, no cheeky $20 at the desk! As a group of four we all had different plans in what we wanted to do during the day. Timothy played poker tournaments, Orry and Robin took advantage of the golf courses and the perfect sunshine and being centrally located, I could wonder about, do some shopping and admire the other hotels the strip. We could enjoy ourselves safe in the knowledge that tickets were booked for the best seats, reservations were made in the best restaurants and no time was wasted, as we skipped every queue to sit in the best VIP areas of nightclubs and not just in the Harrah's properties. We were treated like royalty, and I am sure people were asking, “who are these guys with the best seats in the house?” but I was not totally surprised, as we look a bit like a boy band as you can see in the photos! There were so many highlights in the 6 days, but it would be remiss not to mention a couple of special things. • The Qua Spa at Caesars is among the best in the world. I was so relaxed, I didn’t want to leave. Planned to go once, went 3 times and worth every penny. Wish I discovered it earlier in the trip. • The cooking at Bradley Ogden was great. Some restaurants have more Michelin Stars, but this is proper cooking for proper people, with the best service in Vegas. We went to Robuchon at MGM, and although French Cuisine is great, you can get it in London (or indeed France!) • It was a dream come true for my dad to meet Bette Midler and get his photo taken with her. Her show was a medley of songs, jokes, stories and dancing and only possible in Vegas. Three weeks later and the photo with Bette has replaced my mother’s picture on his office desk! • I have a soft spot for old Las Vegas and the “neon flashin’ and one arm bandits crashin’”, so taking a wonder down Fremont Street ignited a feeling of nostalgia of a bygone era. Would recommend it to all travellers! • On previous visits to Las Vegas, we just couldn’t get into Pure and other nightclubs being a group of guys. As we booked with Total Experiences, Harrah's arranged for us to be VIPs, dancing and singing with Shaggy on stage, cool! • Having dinner at Paris in the shadow of the Eiffel Tower and with the backdrop of the Bellagio Fountains was a perfect way to spend our last night. So that’s it. As Robin said, “Definitely the best holiday I have ever been on and probably the most fun week I have ever had.” i would recommend the hotel, but moreover recommend booking through the Total Experiences programme if you are a group planning a trip, or a stag or a golf break, as they just sorted access and everything we needed on the trip for us, including nightclubs, golf etc. Having organised stag trips from London to Vegas before, I know what a chore it is. They have a website- google, harrah's total experiences or if you are in the UK send me a message and i'll pass on details to Dani who organised our trip (probably not best to pass on personal details on an open forum!!!) OL

Reviews.Title: “First and Last time staying at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: vegasfool
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Vegas every fall. We had never stayed at Caesars, so we figured we would give it a try. We were in the Palace Tower. The room was clean and very nice, but the only view we had was of another building. We didn't have a room service menu in the room, so I called down and they said they would send one right up. Well, we never did get our menu! The ice machine on our floor and also on 2 other floors would not work and we called the front desk twice about this before it was fixed. The coke machine also didn't work on 3 different floors that we tried and they took our money. The buffett is way overpriced for what they offer. The breakfast buffett was good, but not worth the price. Expect to put on your walking shoes because it takes forever to get anywhere in the hotel, especially from your room to the casino. This was also one of the smokier casinos that I have been in. We smelled like walking ashtrays the whole time we were there and we do not smoke. The only good thing I have to say about Caesars is that we did win some money there! But we will not be back!

Reviews.Title: “Part of the Las Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: Peter Mills
Reviews.Content: A stay at Caesar's Palace should be an essential part of a visit to Las Vegas but, be warned, compared to most of the other casinos, it is very expensive. We got a very good deal which included tickets to Bette Midler plus a nights stay for a reasonable price but we tried to book an extra night and found a fairly standard room to be $200 with no chance of a discount. In the end we booked across the road (literally) at Hurrahs and got a superior room for a quarter of the price! That said, the one night we had was a great little bit of luxury which added to the whole experience of being in Las Vegas. It was good to see the (wonderful) show and then just go up in the lift to bed. The room had all we could ask for and more with a great view and so was worth paying a bit over the odds just for one night. I think Caesar's Palace play too much on their name to keep prices artificially high, so be aware you can get much better deals in equally good accomodation elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: moo1986
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels on the Las Vegas strip, within walking distance to all the main attractions like the Pirate Show at Treasure Island, The Bellagio Fountains, Paris and the Miracle Mile shops. Caesars Palace is huge, you need a day in your itinerary just to walk around the hotel and the in hotel "forum shops". We arrived and were presented with an option to upgrade our room for an extra $140 USD for our 3 night stay, which we did. The upgrade took us into one of the towers overlooking the Bellagio fountains. We had a double shower, jacuzzi, huge TV, couch and table. I recommend you talk to the person who checks you in and see what upgrades are available at the time of check in. Overall this hotel is great, the food in the hotel is devine and the shopping is fantastic. You will lose yourself in a world of luxury.. without paying too much money for it! You will feel like a celebrity!

Reviews.Title: “Pay for the upgraded rooms if you stay - classic rooms not worth it”
Reviews.Author: lynnysungoddess
Reviews.Content: I thought I would splurge for a nicer hotel for my 25th birthday, instead of TI, MGM, definitely am not a fan of luxor. I thought Caesars would be nice, classy, and the rooms would be more impressive than what we have usually gotten year after year. Not the case. We were in a classic room not in a newer upgraded tower. If you stay here make sure to get a new tower room or suite, otherwise the rooms at TI and MGM are 10 times better. The bathroom was horrible, so small, little closet space, beds and linens horrible quality. Luckily the shopping and entertainment are all there so it does have a good location. Overall it was an ok stay, but I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First time at Ceasars - and last”
Reviews.Author: packofwolfes
Reviews.Content: Went to Ceasars for a convention and booked 2 extra days to enjoy Vegas. When we checked in we were told that we were booked into their smallest room and we "may not find it adequate". We were offered an upgrade to a nicer room for an additional $40 per night which we declined. I asked about an in-room coffee maker and was told "No, but we have 24 hour room service available" (a 3-cup carafe of coffee was $12.00). I asked about the fitness facility and was told "Yes, we have a world-class fitness facility available to guests for $25 each per day or a 3 day pass is available for $50 each". I asked about the pool and was told that the pool complex was closed (mid-November but 80 degrees and sunny) but there was a pool available to hotel guests for $10 each M-F or $20 each SS. I asked about wi-fi access and was told it too was available for $10 additional per day. Our room was in the Roman tower. It was dated with peeling wallpaper, and there were peanut shells on the floor which I was able to find with my bare feet. The room had a strange layout with no door on the bathroom. It had a nice view of the roof of the adjoining building. All this for the reduced rate of $250 per night (regularly $400). Needless to say, I let my employer pay for the two days there to attend the conference and then switched my remaining two days to a neighboring hotel on the strip for half the price and enjoyed a nice room with all the amenites that cost extra at Cesars for free, including a great pool. Cesars enjoys a great reputation as one of the premier places to stay on the Las Vegas Strip. From my experience, this reputation is not well deserved and a stay at another property is recommended. Thanks for reading and enjoy your stay in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth of the price tag and it lacks the class they aspire to”
Reviews.Author: seidelhuber
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 floor up in the Palace Tower. The room retailed for $500 (we were on a company discount). Adequate room for a $200 per night hotel but no were near the $500 price tag. The worst part about this hotel was the 30-45 minute waits when checking in. People got in from their flight and had a hard time making it to conference events on time. it was like this every day we visited during the week. Not enough staff. One person in line said they had overbooked and started sending patrons down the strip to stay at the Rio and other hotels. Talk about inconvenient - and this they found out after standing in that line. Also, they closed the main swimming pool for some inexplicable reason (claimed it was for a special event that never happened). The service was basically rude and nonresponsive. They acted like you should feel privileged just to be in their hotel. Major thumbs down and not worth the money. Everything cost extra - use of gym, business center, etc. super high prices at the spa.

Reviews.Title: “waiting in line”
Reviews.Author: kosBayArea
Reviews.Content: We watched the check-in line for awhile, but since it didn't seem to get any shorter, we got in line. It took 40 minutes! Surely a big hotel like this can do better than this! The hotel itself is situated in a great location. Restaurants are good. Shops & the in-hotel "mall" are beautiful. Its reasonably priced (for Las Vegas).

Reviews.Title: “fantastic vegas”
Reviews.Author: ForsterSheffield
Reviews.Content: Arrived on halloween at about 4.30pm.we had booked a triple and a double room in the roman tower(got a great price) at checkin were greeted by a man called jonathon and nothing was to much troble for this guy. After asking for an upgrade he moved us to 2 mini suites in the palace tower overlooking the pools(all for a very small tip)we had a fantastic week would have no hesitation in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: beqbeq
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars as sad as this may sound because of the Hangover. Had I had my time again I probably would have chosen to stay somewhere else as I feel I could have got a lot more for my money elsewhere. Sure, the hotel is beautiful and the rooms are elegant and classy etc but I think for the price I paid at Caesars I could have got a lot more elsewhere. You can get great deals in Vegas on Hotels however when I was booking it seemed Caesars were the only ones not doing "great" deals. Caesars is central to everything which is also a positive. There were no negatives really to staying at Caesars as we had brilliant views from our room etc however when booking tours DO NOT go through your Hotel - go through the vendors on the strip - they are so much cheaper and will actually give you EXACTLY what you want. The Lady at Caesars when booking our Grand Canyon tour booked us in for a plane tour rather than a helicopter tour even though when specially said over and over we wanted the helicopter tour. I was furious when we got there and was told we had been booked for a light plane trip around the canyon. They said we couldnt do the helicopter tour as it was all booked out for that day but they could get us on the next day - we were going home the next day so it really didn't help! If I came back to Vegas I would stay at the Venice themed Hotel or perhaps MGM that being said, Caesars is a wonderful place to stay just a tad pricey and with one incompetent staff member. Beatles LOVE is also awesome - GO SEE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Careful which tower you will be staying......”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveler56
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas for a convention, held at Caesar Palace. The rooms (standard and suite) in the Roman Tower were kind of tired and worn out. The standard room lacked of a minibar & coffee making, but was pretty large. The safe was not working. We were told that the Roman Tower was one of the old areas of the hotel, and other towers have better amenities (and carpet, furniture, etc.). What made my stay not enjoyable was the smoking allowed everywhere, with the only exception of the Forum Shops. The location is exceptional, and you can easily walk to the Venetian, Treasure Island, Mirage, Paris, etc.

Reviews.Title: “First time at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: realtor99
Reviews.Content: We got there a little early and was not able to check in yet, so stored bags with them and went off to have some fun. Around 1:00 went back to see if we could check in and was able to. We were comped a room in the Augustus tower. Very nice room, large and clean. Right away, we tried to store my purse in the safe and it was not working, so we called and someone came up to fix it. The tech said it was working and left. Again, when we tried to lock up my purse it was doing the same thing, so I just decided I would keep my purse with me. The beds were a little uncomfortable (felt like either really cheap mattresses or mattresses that needed to be replaced) The bed pillows were worn out too. The overhead light in the bathroom did not work and the first night, the jacuzzi tub would not work (but it did the second night-so it may have been something I was doing wrong to try to get it on). One evening we tried to rent a movie and had trouble getting that to start, so called the desk twice and they said they would reset something and they did and the movie did start after that. These are my only complaints about the room. Other than that, we were comfortable in the room, it was quiet, never heard any noise. Ordered room service for breakfast both mornings, took 45 minutes to an hour to arrive, but they told us that when he placed the order. It was a little on the high side, but was worth the convenience. Food was good and plentiful. Ate in the Augustus Cafe for dinner one evening, food was good. We also ate at the food court for lunch one afternoon. It was good there also. Everyone on this site has been complaining about the prices of food, but my opinion is when you stay at a higher end hotel, you really need to expect the food will cost a little more. By the time we left, we had enough comp points to cover the extra costs we incurred. Although I enjoyed the hotel, I do not know if I would stay there again. I was really disappointed with the casino, so many older machines that are literally worn out. We like to play bar poker and was not comfortable at any of the bars. The casino has a lot of wasted space, could fit in many more machines, maybe some new ones. We played bar poker at the Venetian as well as Bellagio, had much more fun there, the bars were quieter and not as brightly lit up. We like to choose a hotel that we can come back to in the evening and spend a few hours gambling there and then only have to walk a short way to our room. Although I had walked through that casino before and probably played a little along the way, I guess I never really paid too much attention to the condition and state of their machines. For that reason, I will probably stay somewhere that we can enjoy the casino more.

Reviews.Title: “It is Vegas, but when it comes to customer service don't take your chances.”
Reviews.Author: goblue56
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Caesars Palace and was quite disappointed in my choice. I had believed that this hotel could be mentioned with the better names in the area, but did not find it to meet my expectations. I had decided to give the hotel a shot when I saw a promotion that was being run over Halloween weekend on Twitter. It sounded like it would be a fun time and what put me over the top was when I saw that the first people to sign up for the promotion would have their room upgraded. I was worried about my upgrade so I sent a tweet to make sure this upgrade was still available (was I in that first X number of people to sign up). They said yes. I still didn't trust it, so to confirm I contacted the hotel through their website as well. When I went to check-in the clerk saw there was a note that I had asked about this upgrade...however, they told me this room was no longer available. I was disappointed and hoping they would care enough to make this up to me in some way. They didn't. I was thinking about staying an additional night beyond what I had reserved, so I asked them if they could do anything for me in this area (the list price for the room for this extra night which was a Sunday was $250- in comparison I knew I could get a room at the Bellagio for that night at $118, so I figured there might be some room to work). No luck. I headed up to my room. It looked ok- nothing special- not terrible, but not worth the price I paid. I checked out the bed- not that comfortable. Later I went to take a shower- handle is broken so it doesn't stay at the hot water side of things. Ok, so I'm stuck with a bad room- maybe it could at least be clean? Housekeeping comes by- my friend is in the bathroom, can you come back in 10 minutes? Ok. We leave. Back in 6 hours...still dirty. So we've stayed two nights, want a third, but there's no deal so we're off to the Bellagio. Time to check out. The clerk asks how the stay was, but obviously doesn't care. I started to say 'actually it wasn't very good...'- but he wasn't really interested. I continued to explain what had happened with the room at check-in...yeah, whatever, you have a $3 balance- shall I put that on your credit card? So that last part kinda sums it up for me. Will everything go right on every stay? No. But what's the attitude when it doesn't? We couldn't wait to get out of there and so we left the hotel at 8am on Sunday and went to the Bellagio. We knew it was very early but asked if we could check in. The clerk said 'I don't think we can do that for someone who is only staying one night'...before laughing and finding us a room. We may have been lucky that there was something available, but from the friendly service I knew they would do their best to take care of us. It was like the opposite of being in Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: RLA443
Reviews.Content: We arrived early afternoon and found a check in line that stretched across the lobby and to the far hall. As I entered the line a man came by and told us that another check in was down the hall with no line. I immediately went there and found it was the executive check-in. I tried anyway and the desk clerk was very gracious. I tried to ask for an upgrade but she said they were full. I asked if being a total rewards member helped. I had written the tower recommendations from trip advisor on the same sheet. She said she thought she could help with something. I did tip as trip advisor said and landed a Palace tower room up from a classic. The Spa tub is the best thing for all the walking in the resort and on the strip. The room was nice with a flat screen TV with many channels and a huge two sink marble bathroom with separate spa tub and shower. Be sure and try Serendipity 3 just in front of Caesars from 3-5 when they have great happy hour prices. While we didn't use the pool, it was huge, but twice the main part of it was reserved for private parties. The food court is nice, once you find it with a good selection and has some of the best food prices.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: UkNofrills
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace is the stuff of legends. Everything is right about this hotel, the location, the pools, the rooms, the views, the service, the restaurants etc. We took our two small children (7&6) and stayed in a huge room in Augustus Tower. Plenty of room for all 4 of us and very accessible. Places to eat with families are Planet Hollywood and The Cheesecake Factory (in the Forum), Cheeseburger (in Planet Hollywood), NASCAR Cafe (near the Sahara), Carnival World (at the Rio), Rainforest Cafe (at MGM) and Beijing No 9 for a nice change (Caesars). Great things to do with the kids are Lake Mead Paddle Boats, Circus Circus Adventuredome, King Putt Golf (two of those), Red Rock Canyon, Eiffel Tower, M&M World, Gameworks, Build-a-Bear Factory (Planet Hollywood but take your credit card!). OK things are all the hotel freebies i.e Volcanoes, Fountains, Lion Habitat. Fantastic family holiday - recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel room was dirty and unkept”
Reviews.Author: Vivian077
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night in Las Vegas at Caesar's Palace. When we went to check in there were 1600 people checking in that day so we stood in a queque for 40 minutes waiting to check in. The person checking us in was apologetic, but the check in was rushed and devoid of any niceties. We wandered about until we found the elevator to our room. The room was not in a hallway, but around and about as though going to a hidden closet. The view from the room looked at other walls and airconditioning units. The lighting was inadequate. The furniture was well worn and the carpet was filthy. The bed had one thin sheet over a bare mattress which made me afraid of my skin touching the mattress by accident. There were no amenities, like water or a coffee maker. The only redeeming feature was the bathroom which was quite nice. I definitely will not go back and would not recommend this to anyone even for free.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic stay at caesars!”
Reviews.Author: Googs
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I really enjoyed our stay Oct. 18 -23. We checked in at 12:30 p.m. and the check- in lines weren't very long. We were able to use the Platinum line and we were up in our room by 12:45 p.m. (However, an hour later the check-in line was very long). We upgraded to the Augustus Tower for $50 a day and were so surprised at how spacious the room was. The bathroom was huge. I used the ironing board one day and set it up in the bathroom and still had room for 8 people. We had 2 queen beds, a sitting area with a loveseat, chair, coffee table & end table, a dining table with nice comfortable chairs. All the employees of Caesars that we came in contact with (the front desk, housekeeping, cocktail waitresses, waiters, Bellman, etc. were very nice. They also have a good selection of restaurants and great location! We will definitely be staying at Caesars on our next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: uptowngirl1
Reviews.Content: After staying in vegas for two days last year we decided to come back for longer this year. Arrived at caesar's late afternoon and checked in within a few minutes. Did the $20 tip at reception, asked if any complimentary up grades were available and got a Palace Tower room over looking the pool area. Large room, huge bathroom and all spotless. We didn't eat here as we had heard it was expensive for what you got but did have a lovely english breakfast at Planet Hollywood in the forum shops with endless coffee and tea for two for less than $30, it set you up for the day. Ate at the grand cafe lux at the pallazo...massive portions, lots of choice and very reasonable. The pool area looked great but unfortunately the weather was against us. This is a great hotel conveniently place on the strip I would recomend it to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kilty249
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas quite a few times, and always try a different hotel. This was our 1st time at Caesars' and we were delighted with it. Our (Augustus Tower) room was lovely. Room serivice was excellent and the 2 restaurants we used were great too, the best being Nero's. My only gripe was the 40 minute wait to check in. They REALLY need to do something about that. But next time we're in Las Vegas, we will return to Caesars'.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Nice”
Reviews.Author: NcTripGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ceasars Palace in October for 1 evening and I was very very dispointed. We have a crappy room. It was old and cheesy. The walls are paper thin as all night long we could hear the couple next to us fighting about her cheating husband. Would not recommend this place. It has gone down hill. Stayed there a few years ago and it was very nice. For the money stay somehere else. The hotel staff were also very rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference trip”
Reviews.Author: labrt2004
Reviews.Content: Have decided to write reviews for all the places I've stayed in Vegas, but be warned that my stay here was over a year ago, so things may have changed. I was apprehensive about coming here because I've heard things about how campy and outdated they are. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. Yes, there's an awful fountain of naked muses in the lobby right when you enter, and there are similarly bad imitations of Classical sculpture everywhere in the hotel, but it's Vegas, so that's to be expected! I was there for a conference and my employer had already pre booked everything. The check in staff were very pleasant and offered a tempting upgrade to a better room for a mere $30 a day. I waffled, then agreed to the offer. When I got to my room, I was stunned--what a great bargain! It wasn't the largest room in the world, but it was around 500 sq. ft, VERY ample space. The decor did not make my eyes hurt. The bathroom was huge and had a TV as well as a jacuzzi tub. And it only came for $30 more! I slept very well--it was quiet and the air smelled clear (rare in Vegas). The conference center was also a pleasant surprise. Very well appointed and large. It was hard to get to from my rooms though. And it was so big I got lost. The casino was average--seemed a bit empty, but the economy had just tanked when I was there (October 2008). The one restaurant we went to, Rao's was good but pricey. I think they were trying to capitalize on their reputation as one of the hardest restaurants to book in New York. I'm still very much an MGM Grand fan when it comes to restaurants, though. Maybe I am limited, but it just seems easier and more dependable, since they've managed to amass just about every noteworthy chef on the face of the earth over there. My colleagues was a bit annoyed with the catering staff at this hotel for our business luncheon, and I must say that they were pretty rude to her regarding her gluten allergy. But that aside, I had a very nice experience here, certainly better than the Venetian, which is supposedly a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Learn the ropes here in Vegas,TAKE CARE OF THE EMPLOYEES”
Reviews.Author: michiganangel
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visiter to Las Vegas,I noticed certain behaviour in some guests,Well lets start,the hotel was great! We also got a great rate for being a repeat customer! We have gotten to know a few of the customers by name.What we noticed noticed was some customers were down right rude! If someone is helping you ,be nice.if someone is helping you to have a great visit,make sure you tip them.We have learned that if you do the employee goes above and beyond,to make sure they take care of you.I have learned most employes depend on that.Ive also heard the ludacriss remark they dont back home..well guess your not back home.This is a list my husband and I agreed on tipping which is very reasonable. Bell desk-1-2 dollors per bag room upgrade -20.00 Concierge-Dinner rez 5.00**Dinner & show rez 10.00---Boarding passs 3.00**cocktail girls 1-2 a drink**Clubs and table passes come on people their saving you 30.00 a person.Tip them out! And above all be polite when asking for their help.Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Amazing Holiday !”
Reviews.Author: Parky04
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night party with friends and have to say Caesars is FANTASTIC! Check-in smooth and speedy, upgraded to palace suite (2734) WOW! Housekeeping perfect, turn down and chocolates. Great location at the centre of the strip and most venues a short walk or $6 cab ride. Pool is amazing, yeh the drinks can be pricey but you dont have to buy them there. Great choice of bars and food but have to say the best meal of the trip was at FiAMMA Trattoria inside MGM. Food was Oooooh and the Sommelier complimented our food perfectly. All in all would stay here again without a doubt, LOVE IT !!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: rosencreuz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very good location on the strip. The room was very clean and elegant. We felt at home. Comparing to other hotels, I can say Caesars is the one we liked most. The only negative is the dining prices (as in the other big hotels). There're many restaurants in the hotel but all of them are expensive. We had to go out all the time for food.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace Is GREAT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: msdenisec
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars Palace Oct 15-18 for my 26th birthday and I was very impressed. After reading reviews I came expecting a very long wait at check. Yes the line was long but it went by really fast. I was upgraded to a room in the Augustus Tower 41st floor room 4190 (one of the newer towers). The room was amazing. Very nice size to accommodate myself and three friends. Large bathroom with a walk in shower, double sinks, large tub, separate toilet and a flat screen TV on the wall. There was a flat screen TV in the room, couch, table and chairs. The fridge and mini were stocked (beware of this because when you move items on top of the bar and inside the fridge your room is billed. We were billed 75.00 for these items but it wasn't a big deal because upon check out the clerk removed the charges.) The Augustus Tower was the closest tower to the exit so if you can get this tower you won't regret it. The Caesars Palace is HUGE. The pool area is amazing; the central strip location is great too. Puts you in walking distance all the other major casinos. I can't wait to go back to Vegas I loved it so much.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at Caesar's Palace on labor day weekend !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Juttie1923
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I recently took a trip to Las Vegas. We stayed at Caesars Palace Hotel. We enjoyed every bit of our stay. We loved everything about the hotel. We go to Las Vegas every year and stay at a different hotel . I look on the travel advisor to find out reviews about hotels when I want to stay at them.. I read a review someone had written on Trip Advisor he said ask about the FREE UPGRADE when checking in. Well, we did. We had gotten a great hotel rate on Expedia with a free day. When we arrived we checked in with no wait time. The Front Desk lady tht checked us in was very nice. I told her about the Free Up grade and she said ok. We stayed in the Agustus Towers and it was huge and very nice and so pretty . The bathroom the Jacuzzi the enclosed toilet that no one see you in ther, e it was just great. I would definitely stay there again. and the gambling we won every night. I did not expect to win anything but the slots is whatI played and it was very loose. I played at other casinos too but I always ended up making Caesars my last stop. I would definitely say this is a place to st ay if you find a great deal like we did. We stayed for 5 days. AWESOME HOTEL> STAY INTHE AGUSTUS TOWERS.

Reviews.Title: “Will pass next time around”
Reviews.Author: Samwise001
Reviews.Content: Location is great, it's in the middle of the strip. So you don't have to travel (car or walk) far to either end. Spa was nice. But room was ok at best in the Roman Tower. I'd rate it a 2 star. It's really worn down. Some mildew in the shower. Service is terrible. The line to check in and out was horrible, at least 45 minutes. Told the check in receptionist that they need to get more people working the check in line and she just said "it could be worst." Yes, she did just make it worst.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shopping and food.”
Reviews.Author: Moonlight
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to all the action on the Strip, We have already stayed at this property four times this year. On each of my stays, the daily visits to the fitness room and Qua spa- relaxing in its Roman pool - are one of the highlights for staying at the Caesars. The down side is, with each visit, there is a notable decline in promptness of service provided at the poolside, the casino, and also for room service. But, that seems to be the case with every other hotel casino in Las vegas right now due to the recession. The Forum shop is great with a variety of stores for every taste and desire, while the restaurants like Guy Savoy, the Palm, and Joes' Steak and Stone Crab, are just simply delicious and always consistent. Caesars has everything one needs on a vacation. Once I checked into Caesars, I rarely leave the property to go anywhere else in Las Vegas Why would I?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kiyafox
Reviews.Content: Our trip was really enjoyable. The hotel is situated greatly - right in the middle of attraction area. The hotel staff is smiley, polite and very helpful. Rooms are clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. The hotel has a huge territory with restaurants, shops, nice small gardens and fountains. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace Smells Like an Ashtray”
Reviews.Author: PigeonCove
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed there for one evening. The room was fine, the service was fine, the restaurants were all good, but the whole place stinks of cigarette smoke. You couldn't get away from smoke; I felt like a smoked ham after only one day. The other thing is watching people who obviously couldn't afford to lose money, losing money. There may be high rollers in LV but I didn't see any. More like the people you would see at Walmart (nothing wrong with Walmart) rather than at a casino in Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “had a great stay with a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: guest1967
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 4 night stay at Caesar's. Husband and I made our first trip to celebrate our anniversary and my birthday. we arrived a couple of hours before check-in and were given a room right away. just be prepared for the hike to the towers. we were there 2 days before i discovered the forum casino. actually did well on the slots. had a wonderful dinner our last night at Nero's steakhouse. very pricey but worth every penny. our waiters Michael and Enrique were great. had no bad experiences with the staff. food is pricey everywhere. and remember to eat early (before 10 p.m.) because all of the decent places shut down early on weeknights. went to fremont st one night they have an awesome light show. took in two shows; Terry Fator at the mirage was fabulous. O at the bellagio, don't waste the money or time. we were very disappointed. had other family and friends with us and all felt the same. all in all our trip was great and we can't wait to do it again! also bring comfy shoes!!!! i came home with blisters. although everything is right next door, you have to walk a mile or two to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on the company dime.”
Reviews.Author: tenaciousd68
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in Las Vegas for a change. I'm not much for the night life and the casino. This hotel is huge. My room was huge. It seemed a little dated but still very nice. My room had a comfortable king bed, large shower with two shower heads, two bathrooms (one on each side of the shower), large jetted tub, sofa, etc. Everything was clean and in working order. I had a room at the end of the hall and it was actually quiet. So nice. The only staff I dealt with was the front desk at check in and check out. Both were courteous and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Seasoned Vegas Traveler - Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: bv22
Reviews.Content: When I arrived on Sunday mid morning I was told no rooms would be available until after 1pm, "unless I wanted to spend $$$ for an upgrade", I elected to wait. I was there for a show and needed to get into my room. I went back at 1pm and there were approximately 150 people standing in line to check in, I could not wait as I was involved in the conference setting up etc. I did not get my room until 7:15pm and after speaking with others there was as much as a 2 hour wait in line. Valet parking was full as well at 4pm in the afternoon. When checking out I was told I could bypass the line and fill out a card including my email address and they would send the bill in email. After waiting 24 hours I called, after being on hold for 10 minutes I spoke with a billing specialists and they had my email as someone else's. Caesars was the worst experience I've ever had in Las Vegas and I travel there 4-5 times a year. I will never stay there again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “best holiday ever”
Reviews.Author: runnerjTipp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in caesers with another couple for 10 nights,a bit pricey but no other complaints,cheesecake factory is the best place to eat,good food and big portions reasonable price,perfectly placed on the strip.excellent experience will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but extremely expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: lovie8
Reviews.Content: Stay at Caeser's from September 28th -Oct 3rd. When we arrived at 7:30 Pm I was told that our room was not ready yet. We then decided to go to the Diamond lounge and get a drink and something to eat because we were starving with the long flight from Phila. After going back to check on our room they said it would be another 1/2 hour, so we went to look around the hotel. The hotel is huge and has allot to see. we wanted to get aquainted with our surroundings since we heard is was difficult to navigate. In reading past reviews we were a liitle bit nervous with our room. We finally got our key's and went up to our room to be very happy. We were in the Augustus tower room 3370. It was right near the elevator and had a wonderful view of the Bellagio fountains outside our window, The rooms are like mimi suites. very large, has a couch and a few chairs, and the bathroom was awsome. Had a juccuzi tub, shower and TV in the bathroom so when you are taking a bath you can watch TV. rooms were very clean. As for the prices of food, come on give me a break!! I am by no means a cheap person, but $17.00 for a cheeseburger at the Cafe is crazy. Needless to say we ate elsewhere.As for the pool the way they designed the two newer towers is rediculous. You don't get any sun at all at the pool until 12:30 Pm. I sat at the pool for over 3 hours waitiing, and waiting, and waiting. They don't have enough chairs either. If you get down there in the afternoon to go to the pool, good luck trying to find a lounge chair. and oh by the way the drink prices are crazy too. $14.00 for a small drink and $22.00 for a large. That's why I brought a few beers in a small bag with ice to the pool. The sports book is huge and had allot of fun there. If you play keno they give you free drink coupons which came in handy considering the prices of drinks. All in all it was a great place to stay, very clean and comfortable.We were celebrating our anniversary and had a great time. Vegas will wear you out so bring good walking shoes and be ready to party!!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxe suite makes stay superb”
Reviews.Author: TravelingScotty
Reviews.Content: We were booked into a luxe suite w/ foyer, powder room, wet bar, living room, dining room, large bedroom, and large bathroom. My partner is well loved by the casinos and they offer fine things to keep you coming back for more. This suite would do it for me. The view wasn't the finest, but the room was absolutely superb. It was in one of the older towers near the Cleopatra Bar barge, but it was updated, contemporary, and s p a c i o u s. A bit of a walk to the pool, but no problem. I want to replicate the shower in my home--good size and well laid out. A walk-in closet in the bathroom made our few hanging items look like they were in an in-room suite. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great,just don't gamble here!”
Reviews.Author: hudsonrlm
Reviews.Content: Spent four days at Caesar's with husband and another couple. We have been to Vegas several times before and decided to stay at Caesar's because we never had and wanted to experience the kitsch. :) (like Disneyworld for adults) The place is very impressive and more to see than we had time for-and unbelievably HUGE! I knew not to take my "pretty" shoes,but rather the walking shoes-good thing,too! From our room in the Palace Tower to the Flamingo,across the street was about a mile hike. Our room was large,lovely and comfortable. Beware the weight-sensitive mini-bar and amenties on top of the bar they want you to buy. $8 m&m's,seriously! With this type of luxury place you don't get a coffee pot,micro or fridge (that's dedicated to the mini-bar). My dear hubby hiked down to Payard's each morning and got me a $6 cup of coffee. Everyone was friendly except for the dealers who seemed not to like their jobs. Hubby plays craps and there was never anything but $25 tables. I never saw them busy or noticed anybody winning at anything,actually. We went across the street to the Flamingo to gamble where it was much more exciting with $5 and $10 tables. The craps crew at the F were surprized when we told them about the (mostly empty) $25 tables at Caesar's! They are both owned by Harrahs,I understand. We also went downtown to gamble and hubby won big at his favorite-Binion's. We had brunch at Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill (at Caesar's) and it was good-not as good as last time's meal at Wolfgang Puck's Bistro,tho'(at the MGM). All food we encountered at C's was very expensive. We were seated at Beijing Noodle #9 for dinner and after about 10 minutes with no service at all got up and left-they never even noticed. At the Seafood restaurant we were warmly welcomed and had great service and good food,tho' it is more Asian than seafood. Another meal was at a diner type place at the Flamingo-we were ready for a burger and it was good. We had dinner at Caesar's Augustus Cafe one night. As far as I know,it is the only 24-hr place to eat at C's. It was not very good with fair to poor service. Notes: It is very dry in Vegas,I couldn't moisturize enough,or get enough to drink. A 16 oz. (I think) soft drink at the shop in the lobby is $3.95. I tried to buy soda out of the machines on 2 floors-neither worked. Could they be trying to force you to buy those $6 drinks from the mini-bar? We rented a car because we went to Hoover Dam one day. Driving on the Strip is horrible-take a taxi or limo if you can. It took forever to get our car from the airport rental place and make it to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surreal experience”
Reviews.Author: marks46
Reviews.Content: It took me a long time to understand this whole 'Vegas Experience' , but it was certainly not what I expected. I booked Ceasars simply because of the name and the history. I expected high rollers, tuxedo's, show's starring Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin, that sense of a real piece of American history, that I as a European had not experienced before. At first I was bitterly disapointed in Vegas, there was no glamour, this really is a Kitsch city, and caesars the most kitsch hotel I have ever stayed in. The mental picture of glamour was instantly replaced by poor Mexican's handing out leaflets advertising porn and adult services, the tuxedo's relaced by baseball caps and shorts, The million dollar gambling tables replaced by 1000's of 25 cent slot machines. The beutiful people replaced by average americans with their large cups full of quarters. Then I got it, Las Vegas is not meant to be glamour, it is meant to be kitsch, infact it is meant to be the absolute pinnicle of kitsch, and you know what Caesars delivers it perfectly. Caesars and Vegas delivers a completely different experience to anywhere else in the world, complete with talking statues. You can see why this place is so popular with ordinary people, stag and hen parties, and the bemused foreigner, it provides a totally different experience based on excess, and fantasy.
