The rooms were fine, quite ordinary compared wit the rest of the hotel, and the service completely corporate and delivered to perfection. With the strength of the Euro against the Dollar, I found it to be reasonably priced, and we ate well in the various restaurants. Was it all for me? well no, and I have no intention of ever going back to this city. If you want this whole 'Vegas Experience' then I would actually recommend Caesars, it delivers it perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Rain Man Suite at Caesar's”
Reviews.Author: texasmomx4
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to the Rain Man suite and it was amazing. They do provide you with many outlets to make noise, ipod stations, big screens, but they will send security if you are too loud. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomidations”
Reviews.Author: Cmichalari
Reviews.Content: Room service was great, limo pick up etc. Hotel pool was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “At Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: JoseP3
Reviews.Content: Probably you just heard about caesars palace as a box arena, but it was the best hotel creation around greek and rome culture... each place in the hotel remembers this... statues, colosseum, mall, all of them are stunning... In addition, you will be correctly placed in the vegas strip! near to all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay..”
Reviews.Author: Wetrug
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Forum Tower in one of the newly renovated rooms. The room was great, no complaints, except maybe the view of the parking garage, but it didn't bother us. Housekeeping, drink service, and front desk all went above and beyond. Did Caesars buffet, it was OK, nothing special. The food court is convenient when you want to grab something quick. Overall, we had a great stay at Caesars and will be back. You will not be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with wonderful theming, but incredibly expensive”
Reviews.Author: ladydanger
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an Augustus Tower room back during my first (and until this November, only) trip to Vegas for a wedding. The rooms were ungodly expensive, even pricey after dividing the price by 3 since I shared a room with two friends. Still, I must say the rooms were incredibly impressive and worth every penny. Extremely spacious and elegantly decorated. The bathroom itself was nearly as big as my bedroom at home, and had an enormous jetted tub, walk in shower, vanity with two sinks and a separate closet for the toilet. It was one of the the best hotel rooms I've ever stayed in, though the mattresses could have been a little softer. That said, from what I saw of a regular base level room (which they call Classic), I can't imagine that it'd be worth staying in this hotel if you weren't splurging on one of the more expensive rooms. The base level rooms weren't much better than a room at any run of the mill chain hotel yet are rented at rates higher than much of the strip. Caesars has one of the greatest locations of any of the resorts on the strip. Right in the middle of everything so walking to other resorts isn't as arduous as it could be. And that's if you even decide to leave the resort. Caesars has some of the best shopping in the area, the Forum Shops is easily my favorite shopping center on the strip. Lots of great restaurants are here, the spa is absolutely fabulous (even just paying the $45 to use the facilities at Qua is worth it, though for that much you ought to just get a treatment as their staff is wonderful), the pools are gorgeous and their show rooms host plenty of big name entertainers. It'd be very easy to check in here for a long weekend and never find a reason to leave the property. All and all, I'd have to say this is an excellent resort, though probably out of the price range of many travelers (myself included) as there are plenty of hotels nearby that offer rooms that are just as nice (or in the case of base level rooms, much better) for less. If you do have the opportunity to stay here though, I'm sure you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Caesars.............”
Reviews.Author: MarlowIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights at the end of Sept,Palace tower, very large room.2 queen beds and asked for another, no problem, delivered in mins,.Towels changed every day and beds changed on request,excellent service.Ordered room service for breakfast 2 mornings,delivered in 30 mins.We has 5 nights comped so didnt expect to get such a nice room.The Palace tower was nearest the pool which was wnother bonus.Plenty of towels at the pool,but be down early to get a bed.Really enjoyed our stay and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephs1120
Reviews.Content: Caesar's Palace was a great hotel to stay at. We stayed in suites in the new Augustus Tower. It's really convienently located and the room was beautiful. I'm a fan of any place with a television in the bathroom. We had a great view of the Bellagio fountains. The room was very big and had a whirlpool bathtub. The tower had it's own smaller casino, and was connected to all the other areas, including the pool (which was great) and shopping. As to be expected with any hotel in Vegas, it's smoky and loud downstairs, but we had no such troubles in our room! The staff was great and incredibly helpful in finding directions and shows, and bringing extra towels! The service is very quick. I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a lot to offer!”
Reviews.Author: EPmomof3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! The rooms were spacious and beds were comfortable. There were several swimming pools as well as the Forum Shops and plenty of restuarants and nightlife. The only thing that we didn't care for was the smoking. We got a non-smoking room, but you could still smell smoke in the room. Overall, a great vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, friendly staff. Uneven service”
Reviews.Author: CaribPete
Reviews.Content: Our clerk at check-in was friendly, funny and helpful. He upgraded us to a mini-suite in the Palace Tower since our reserved deluxe room in the Forum Tower was unavailable. The room was very large and well-appointed with a great view of the pools. Two bathrooms, too. We used room service twice and the servers were also friendly and helpful. Service issues: 1. There is only one person stationed at the "Leisure Concierge" desk. There were often lines and we gave up waiting on one occasion. Caesar's should have tripled the staffing to match the size of the hotel. 2. Our room service tray was left in the hall for at least 36 hours. With old food on it. Otherwise we had no problems. Other: This hotel is expensive. Drinks, food, shops and table minimums. Be prepared so you aren't shocked. We played blackjack across the street at Bill's and enjoyed it there.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Seaside0506
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars Palace a few years ago while attending a conference and was very impressed. This time, I was very disappointed. The carpet was frayed, the bathroom walls had not been cleaned, I had to call room service for ice every day, the ethernet did not work, etc. When I checked out and expressed my disappointment I was given petty excuses.

Reviews.Title: “going downhill”
Reviews.Author: mabbsy
Reviews.Content: We`ve been to Caesars every year for the last twenty-odd years, so it pains me to write this but.... It seems to me, that unless you`re part of a huge group, or willing to pay out for lots of extras, they`re not really interested anymore. For example, if you want to sit by the pool, there are plenty of sunbeds but they`re all behind the double beds and canopied beds that, of course, cost extra. Also, one afternoon, we went down for a swim at around 4.50 pm to be told that all the pools and the whole area was closing at 5pm for a private function. This has happened to us before and I urge you all to complain to the duty manager if it happens to you. We did and received 100 dollars to spend on food and drink as compensation, but it really isn`t good enough. There are 4 pools - why not just close one or two. Yes, the rooms are lovely (we stay in the Augustus Tower) and the location is great, but next year we`ll be looking at alternatives because we`re fed up of being treated as if we`re not important.

Reviews.Title: “Pools and Cabana Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: Judy222222
Reviews.Content: Husband and I went to Caesars Palace for the experience of the new pools at the god of the gardens pool complex. What a joke ! The new pools, which were the only ones in the sun ( and it was very cool in the shade) were closed the whole time we were there Monday thru Thursday. People were wrapped in towels at the pools in the shade hoping that the sun at some point would be over them. We paid $300.00 for a cabana that did not even have a thin rope to separate it from the public. People were sitting right on top of us. One woman tried to sit on one of our chairs. (because there were no chairs available at the five pool complex) So Disappointed ! Thank God for the Spa ! We ended up spending most of our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice big rooms”
Reviews.Author: rijets
Reviews.Content: The room we had was with two queen size beds and still the extra space was more than enough to accomodate the five of us in the room. They also had a nice shower head where you can use as a hand held shower head or attach it on a small pole and move it up and down to fit you from head to toe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit with beautiful room, casino, and grounds”
Reviews.Author: baseballdc
Reviews.Content: Arrived Sept. 23 for a 5 night stay. Check-in and Registration person was great and pleasant. Stayed in an Augustus Tower Room. My room's location had great day and night views!!! of the Bellagio and the Fountain Show, Bally's, Paris' Eiffel Tower and their Balloon/Globe, Planet Hollywood, the newly almost completed City Center, and a distant view of the MGM Grand. My room had a King Bed, brown-velvet sofa with coffee table, a comfortable chair with ottoman, 36" diameter wood table with 2 chairs, desk with chair, 2 LCD TVs (one in room and other in bath), 3 1/2' x 7' gold-framed mirror, 6' Wooden storage base with Refreshment Bar, a 10' x 14' well-appointed marble bath with coffiered ceiling, jetted? soaking tub, separate 3' x 4' glass-enclosed shower, a separate commode are with door, 6' Granite top Vanity with double sinks along with Twin Mirrors with 3 light Sconzes and many towel racks. After getting to my room, I noticed there was not a mini-fridge in the room. Before I called downstairs, the front-desk person who checked me in called my room phone to ask if I liked my room. I said everything was perfect, except I noticed there is no mini-fridge and I like to have one in a room. She immediately had one sent up to my room which was delivered (to my surprise) within 10 minutes after our phone conversation. Now that is what I call Great and Considerate Service! Housekeeping services appeared sufficient; always had fresh towels. However after the first couple of nights I had to leave a note requesting more soap which was a first-time experience as a guest. Housekeeping then left in the bathroom a plastic bag filled with a bunch of soap...LOL...all I wanted was a couple new bars. Pool area was nice, but chaises are too close to one another. Advise you get there about 9:30 a.m. for a spot. This establishment's grounds and facilities are beautifully done and maintained in my opinion. Huge wide-open rotunda in Registration area with center statutes. Convenient front-entrance taxi/shuttle services...no walking to some far and obscure area. I can't comment on Caesars Palace's dining establishments. I dined at my favorites. For you younger folks, there are a number of nightclubs/bars at this establishment...very active especially over the weekend...which seemed monitored by security personnel. Slots are very tight with little or smaller payouts than other casinos within Las Vegas; plentiful table games open. I saw Cher at Caesars Colosseum; great show and costumes though I was a bit surprised it only lasted an hour and fifty minutes. I hoped it would go over two hours long. Otherwise, very well put together and highly recommended. If you get to the Palazzo/Venetian, see Jersey Boys (based on Franki Vali and the Four Seasons) if you haven't yet seen it. The show is based on their life story and includes all their songs. However, see this show when Rick Faugno is performing (Friday's and Saturday's) as Franki Vali because his voice is much more spectacular (his vocals stand out more) than the other performer's voice. I really enjoyed my vacation stay here at Caesars Palace. The only negative I have is that I seemed to have better players luck at other establishments and very little or none at Caesars; maybe this experience here I was unlucky. Just seemed rather wierd. That's Vegas for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but easiy not the best anymore!”
Reviews.Author: Globewandering
Reviews.Content: Great Location on the strip,but I agree with a previous reviewer,you get what you pay for,it was somewhere to put your head,and lets face it you dont go to Las Vegas to sit in your room! and we stayed here mainly as we were seeing Bette Midler at the colosseum.The rooms arereasonably clean with okay service.nothing to shout about if you have stayed with other hotel brands around the world in my opinion it is very average and needs a lot of updating.Food prices are the usual rip off although it is possible to eat for a reasonable price if you look around.Las Vegas is great though for a few days though

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel at the heart of Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: CC-and-LJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Caesar's Palace for two nights of our seven night trip and it was probably our favourite hotel. It is just as you imagine - great service in a very grand environment. The staff were all very friendly and helpful; the bathrooms were enormous with huge baths and seperate showers; the casino is massive and there are many events to see (we recommend Cher even as non fans she was amazing!). The Forum shops are part of the hotel and there are loads to choose from. There is loads to do at night including the shows, clubs, bars and the casinos. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a brilliant holiday!!!!”
Reviews.Author: N0vice
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend in Vegas with my husband and friends. It was a fantastic trip and could be rated as one of my best holidays! We stayed in Caesars Palace and after reading the reviews on here I was very worried as to what to expect. There were several reviews saying how grubby and run down it was???? Not our experience - on arrival I asked for a complimentary upgrade and they said one had already been applied. The room was lovely, clean, modern and although our view was of the back of the hotel, it was still a view. We stayed in the palace tower and paid about £350 for 3 nights through a travel agents. The hotel has a really nice vibe, people are very friendly and it went on for miles! Being a bit of a self proclaimed snob, I found that being one of the pricier hotels attracted better clientel. After looking round the other hotels, I would suggest Caesars, The Venetian and The Bellagio. Drinks are really expensive at about $9 each, so make sure you make the best of free drinks when gambling. Places to visit - Caesars Palace - The cheesecake factory. Either eat a main or dessert, nnot sure you will manage both! The Venetian - The Gondola rides. Very expensive and short but worth a look at the indoor canals, beautiful! The Mirage - All you can eat champagne breakfast. Not posh but fab food and we didn't need to eat until 11pm that night! The exploding volcano, outside and explodes every hour from 8-12. The Parisian - Mon Ami Gabi. The best breakfast I have ever had, great service and bottomless drinks. I had the chocolate and bacon waffle which stunned me into silence, a real must-try. The MGM - Free lion attraction, great for kids and big kids alike. KA the show, pretty expensive but mind blowing and had us gasping for breath at the stunts. The Stratasphere - The rides at the top are great, do them in the dark for best effect. We also had dinner at the 'Top of the World ' restaurant. Great views, good service but really pricey. $300 for 4 of us for just mains and a bottle of wine. Try it as a treat if you dont go on a helicopter. The Bellagio - The fountain goes off through the day, but come alive at night! They go off every 15 mins and are fabulous, another freebie! The dress code in here was a bit more upmarket and most girls were in dresses. One last top tip - the taxi from the airport to caesars cost us $30 on the way to the hotel and $11 on our trip back.... done over as usual for being a tourist. Ask for the direct route and say that you have been before so they dont con you. p.s. everyone wants a tip and some will ask you for one. Dont be a woss and pay a taxi driver if he doesnt do a good job, we had one who wouldn't accept our payment until we added a tip - tell them where to go, you wont see them again! All in all, we would go back tomorrow. Fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Catherinesdaddy
Reviews.Content: The reception process was a brutal and bruising experience. We were not given the room that had been reserved on our behalf by our UK tour operator. The room that we were given was 633 in the Palace Tower, not the expected room in the Forum Tower. The furniture in 633 wasbattered and bruised, the paintwork was covered in a thick layer of dust. One of the wardrobe doors was hanging off. The coridor immediately outside our room was variously strewn with dirty plates empty beer bottles, and for a long time there was a "Commode" was left in the corridor. To get to the Palace Tower elevators outside the Palace Pool area, we constantly had to fight our through large groups of drunken men, intimidating guests going for the elevators. The House standards were disgraceful. This Hotel is so grossly overpriced for the service for the level of service displayed it is insulting to any visiting tourist. NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “SHOCKED & SHOCKING”
Reviews.Author: allindaz
Reviews.Content: Booked for 7 nights the room we booked was totaly unexceptable, shower blocked then all this black junck coming up through the drains! no backs on the the draws so clothes just fell through to the next draw, the entrance door was not fitted well with a 2 inch gap at one end.We were then upgraded to a great room with extra cost incured by US.Upgrade was great untill we tried to sleep. The suite next door was party central for a least 4 of the 7 night stay with the music not loud but blaring.After the last complaint to reception the extra cost for the upgrade was wavered.At no time were we contacted by any staff member in any position to see if the situation could be resolved (The duty manger was even invited up to our room by us to wittnes the party going on next door, that was a no show.) At last checking out, the receptionist was not aware of the room waver and put it on our account after she was informed by me of the waver, she then had to contact whoever to sort this problem out WHAT A MESS. At no time were we asked by any staff member at Ceasers about our VERY VERY unsatifactory stay, o'h i lie a female valet attendant did ask us about our stay when she retrived our car.This was our third visit to vegas, and we did splash out to stay at Ceasers. "NOT HAPPY JAN"

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel anywhere”
Reviews.Author: JinxyCork
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you could possibly ask for. It's an amazing place and won't let you down. No pictures, movies or internet sites will do this hotel justice. Seeing is believing and it is a must for everyone. The location is perfect, the staff are brilliant, the casino is exceptional and the clubs are fantastic. I was blown over and still reeling now I'm home. If I'm lucky enough to get back to Vegas I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service...Will not reimburse unauthorized purchase”
Reviews.Author: RyanCanada77
Reviews.Content: I returned from Caesar's palace and found that $75 was charged to my Visa from the snack bar snackus maximus even though I did not make any purchases there and wasn't even in Las Vegas the day these were charged to my Visa. I was extremely disappointed when I contacted Harrah's my only two options for filing a complaint were through email or via a voicemail. I have contacted them numerous times without a response. I will never again stay at a Harrah's property. I am lucky I was only $75 was stolen from my credit card. By the time I noticed it on my Visa it was two late to launch an investigation. If this is how they treat customers, imagine if how they will treat you if a more serious problem occurs.

Reviews.Title: “Not Safe Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: SC1Ireland
Reviews.Content: Do no stay here, that’s my advice. It’s not a safe hotel. While asleep someone entered my room with a Hotel key and robbed me. The Hotel claim it’s not their fault, despite the fact a Hotel key was used. I had my key so the only answer is the Hotel the allowed someone gain access to my room. I have received no compensation in any form from the Hotel. The hotel claim I should have used the safe, but who uses a safe at night to put your wallet , purse and watches away while in the room? I was lucky I was asleep during the robbery if I woke up anything could have happened to me. If you stay here you may not be as lucky…. Do not stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location, pity about the service”
Reviews.Author: c1d
Reviews.Content: If you're staying in Vegas then Caesar's is probably in one of the best locations, roughly in the middle of the strip. While there is a bus service that stops at all of the casino's on the strip its often quicker to walk, which made Caesar's a winner in that regard. The rooms were well kept, even had a little TV in the bathroom! Very spacious and a massive bed. The pool was amazing, with a true Roman feel and plenty of places to just relax and unwind. The hotel itself is very grand and the internal architecture is quite impressive. However, you should forget about using the internet to check your emails etc unless you're happy to fork out $0.50/min. Unfortunately we found the service at Caesar's to be almost non-existant. If you want to speak to the concierge expect to wait on average 20 minutes, and in all instances but once they were far from helpful. How a hotel the size of Caesar's can only have 1 concierge is beyond me! After our room key malfuntioned it took approx 40mins to eventually get into the room after waiting at the front desk and then waiting for security - a process that would take most hotels no more than 10 mins....

Reviews.Title: “Great pool but hotel is old and it's obvious--not the best in vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Reese409
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Caesar's Palace while in town for my cousin's wedding. We were very excited to stay here, especially since the movie "The Hangover" and had just come out. Needless to say, the movie makes the hotel look a hell of a lot nicer than it is. Don't get me wrong, the lobby is pristine, the pool is immaculate and the forum shops are of course amazing. We spent almost every night dining at some of the fantastic restaurants in the forum shops, like Il Mulino, Boa Steakhouse, Sushi Roku and Spago. If not for the forum shops we would have been very disappointed. Our room was old and not kept well. It was a standard suite, and had a great view of the pool, but the bed was uncomfortable and had an old pink comforter like a motel. The bathroom was all marble and beautiful, except for one major problem---there was no door!!! Thankfully my boyfriend and I have been together long enough for this not to be a deal-breaker, but we were still uncomfortable with using the facilities with the other person in the same room and no door. Also, one afternoon water started pouring out of the ceiling vent above our toilet. We called down immediately and maintainence told us that it was from the room upstairs' tub overflowing. Obviously there was nothing they could have done to prevent this, but it still left a bad taste in our mouths. The spa there was amazing. It had several roman baths and jacuzzi's, and even had an arctic room which is set at 55 degrees and has fake snow! It was incredibly beautiful and relaxing. We were expecting a lot more from Caesar's Palace and unfortunately our expectations weren't met. The first night we arrived there was a group of housekeeping carts being stored on our floor right by our room. We called down to let them know and they said they would move them. The same thing happened the second night, only the carts were never moved. This happened every night of our 5 night stay and we complained several times. The casino was old and dreary. All of the dealers looked as if they had one foot in the grave (or wished they did) and the whole set up was very cheesy. The forum shops casino, however, was beautiful. The regular caesar's casino had very low ceilings and not a lot of things to do. The location of Caesar's was great--it's right in the middle of everything. But for the location, the Bellagio right next door was ten times as nice. My dad and his girlfriend were staying there and we wanted to be there all the time. The casino was beautiful and huge, the restaurants were yummy and trendy and it even had a better nightlife than Caesar's. We also visited the famous club Pure at Caesar's but it was not much to look at. It was extremely crowded and filled with really pretentious people. We are from Boca Raton, FL which is arguably one of the snobbiest places in the country, so we are definitely familiar with this crowd, but still had a hard time stomaching the one in Pure. Wouldn't recommend it but it was great for the awesome $90/night rate that we got. If you want luxury, stay at the Bellagio, Wynn, or even the new Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Spa!”
Reviews.Author: cwberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars recently for my husband's birthday with four other couples. We have stayed at most of the major Las Vegas hotels over the past 15 years and liked them all, however Caesars was a step above the rest. The pool was gorgeous, and not as hectic as some of the others. The Spa was unbelievable, and completely transcended us off the Vegas strip. The Roman bath was fabulous, and especially the Arctic room, where moisturizer fell from the ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: OhioBlonde
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Deluxe room in the Augustus Tower 9/20 through 9/24. The room was large with TVs in both the bedroom and bath. Shower, double sinks and tub . Clean room with nice toiletries and robes. Check In clerks were very nice and helpful. Casinos were nice and clean as was the room. Room Service was great and the food expensive but tasty. Service through the stay was great. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Room & Pool”
Reviews.Author: baltenburger
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Sept 16-20. When we got in to check-in we had a room reserved in Forum Tower after giving the clerk my credit card gave her the $20 trick for an upgrade and got upgraded to the Palace Tower. While our room was already comped $20 got us a fabulous room with jacuzzi and marble bathroom view of pool and slighted view of Bellagio watershow. Best part was our elevator door was a short distance to pool. Didn't do any gambling in casino loved blackjack at pool it was great. Overall very expensive but just a short walk to Harrahs where we did most of gambling O Sheas and Flamingo close by. Caesars is expensive but you dont have to make it break you there are other options nearby for food gambling and fun

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Sucks Bigtime....biggest Ripoff in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Polyarny
Reviews.Content: I paid $495 for the worse room I have sleep in for some time. I checked in late (about 11.30pm) I had been travelling for over 40 hours. The shock came after opening the door to my room on the 6th floor .The towels were dirty...the bath had grime and a layer of dirt I had to clean before taking a shower. There was NO door to the bathroom...the shower was not working. The room was musty and dirty...I took one dirty towel to the check-in desk and the girl who checked me in had a stupid silly smirk all over her face. She told me there were NO other rooms available...I found out in the morning this was a lie. I had booked via a 1-800 number (free) only to find they bill you $11.50 to take a reservation over the phone!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Caesars offered me a Stunning room upgrade if I booked a $100 room on a mail piece they sent me (I have previously stayed at this hotel) .......what I got was a dirty, old style TV, filthy, no bathroom door pace that I would think twice about leaving a dog there. The view from my window was the waste pipes coming from toilets of other rooms. of 294 hotels listed here on Tripadvisor ...........I rate Caesars as last card in the pack.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jill48Md
Reviews.Content: Our trip started out with not being able to check in until almost 5:00 p.m. We arrived in Vegas at 11:30 a.m. and got to the hotel shortly thereafter hoping to be able to check in a little early. Unfortunately, that was not the case. We waited in line only to find out that no rooms were ready and still in the process of being cleaned. We check back twice and finally were able to check in. The next problem was that there were six of us and we wanted three rooms together which they were unable to accommodate. The desk clerk told us the hotel was completely booked. Two rooms were in the Roman Tower and if at all possible, do not stay there. The rooms are a notch BELOW a "old" Holiday Inn. The carpet was worn, we had no view other than a roof top, the pillows were old and lumpy along with the beds, towels worn and scratchy. It was nothing I would have thought. We thought of asking for other rooms, but didn't want to waste any more time with waiting in line and dealing with unfriendly staff. We had to pay $4.00 for a cup a coffee at one of the bars. We had breakfast at one of the restaurants and it end up costing $33.00 for two. We did find the food court and it still was pricey for what you got and nothing special. The other two people got a room in the Centurion Tower and their room and view was a little better. However, their tv went on the fritz and they ended up getting "free" porno - how nice was that??? Especially for two women!!! We couldn't check out via the TV so again, we had to wait in a long line to check out. While I know you don't spend a lot of time in the room, I had really expected a lot more from Caesar's. We did manage to get a fairly good deal using Expedia for the hotel and airfare but our next trip to Vegas we will be staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.”
Reviews.Author: stotd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars over the weekend of 9/18. No wait at check in. We wanted to upgrade from the classic room. I thought they might just offer it but ended up paying an extra $40.00 a night for the room. Room and bathroom were nice but tv in the bathroom did not work. Food, gambling and items at the casino were crazy expensive. Slots seemed very tight and drink service was mediocre. Pool was nice with no construction noise that I noticed. At the end I would have rather paid less and stayed at NYNY, Monte Carlo or the like.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: MadHatter08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay at Caesars Palace. I've stayed at the property twice before, but this was my husband's first time. We both had a wonderful stay and loved everything about Caesars Palace. Our room wasn't available when we went to check in so, we were upgraded to the Palace Tower. Our room was great! It was clean, updated, quiet and very comfortable. The room was cleaned early every day by the maid service. One of the best things about Caesars is it's location on the Strip. It's very centrally located and close to all of the casinos that we wanted to check out - Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn, etc. We loved our visit to Caesars and will definitely stay here again whenever we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: yoursdi
Reviews.Content: If you're under 30, you'll probably enjoy Caesars Palace. If you're like us and in your fifties, looking for class, courtesy and good hospitality... you won't find it at Caesars! The majority of the staff, won't give you the time of day; treated folks like a cheap airline, just trying to see how many they can squeeze in. If you're gambling; you're lucky if you see a cocktail waitress any given amount of hours, and then hope they return. If you order any room service, you'll wait over an hour, hope you get what you ordered. It just felt like they don't care or need any business at all. We would "never" book there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fancy place with a lot of action!”
Reviews.Author: chepdk
Reviews.Content: During my three visits to Las Vegas so far, I've stayed twice at this hotel and both times in a Deluxe Room in the Augustus Tower. The first time I opened the door to my room, my jaw dropped. While I've stayed at a fair number of fancy hotels all over the world, I'd never stayed in such a nice room before and the view through the panorama windows was awesome. I should, however, mention that one of my colleagues stayed in one of the other towers (can't remember which one) and his room was nothing special. The hotel is over-the-top and has some fantastic restaurants, bars, and shopping. The casino is definitely not one of the cheaper ones so unless you've brought a nice wad of spending money, you probably want to go elsewhere for a casual game of BlackJack etc.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Vegas everyone should experience at least once”
Reviews.Author: dave1545
Reviews.Content: Mixed views of this hotel. Overall I would recommend, Impeccable rooms, great location on the strip. Classic Vegas style that needs to be seen to be believed. Unbelievable Night clubs and bar scene, great restaurants and the best shopping out there. Just make sure you bring a boat load of cash as EVERYTHING and I mean everything comes at a premium. The service was good but they did not go the extra mile not what I would consider a 5 star hotel level service. Free room upgrades mid week forget it. My vacation package came with a complimentary room upgrade upon availability. I asked for a suite as it was my sons 21st birthday, they wanted an extra $500/night for this... out of my price range. When I didnt agree to his second offer of a different room for $250/night increase he told me that we would have to wait until 5PM to check in ( it was currently 3PM ). Eventually I got a semi upgrade for $80/night and agreed to it to get us checked in. Food wherever we ate was great but overpriced. Fitness center was $25/day or 3 day pass for $50, facilities were good and always had machines available.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace is Vegas at its best”
Reviews.Author: Brettno1
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at Caesars Palace at least twice a year for the last 25 years and it continues to be one of the best hotels on the strip. The rooms are modern with all the amenities you need for a comfortable to luxurious stay depening on the type of room. I always stay in the Augustus Tower and have never been disappointed. Everything is spotlessly clean and in good working condtion. The bathrooms have a jacuzzi tub and an LCD TV. The property itself is a combination of old Vegas and new Vegas so you get the best of both worlds. The pool complex has just recently been renovated and is easily the best pool complex in Las Vegas . It's a must see if you're staying at the hotel. There's even blackjack in the pool! This is in addtition to some world class restaurants and night clubs. Really, you cant go wrong staying here. I'm looking forward to another 25 years with my favorite hotel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected and wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_KCMO
Reviews.Content: Found on Hotwire for $99/night and decided to surprise my mom with a stay here. She had wanted us to stay at the very budget friendly Bill's Gambling Hall across the street, but I just couldn't let that be her first real Vegas trip, so I booked Caesars as a surprise. After reading reviews here I was worried that due to our booking method we would be relegated to one of the older towers and a room in disrepair. At check-in, I slipped $20 between my ID and credit card and asked if any rooms in the Augstus tower were available. We ended up on the 7th floor facing the Bellagio fountains, the room was wonderful with two queen beds, sitting area with a few small chairs, couch and coffee table, and a small dining table as well. Bathroom was spacious, separate shower and DEEP jacuzzi tub were both in good working order. She was shocked and delighted with the surprise switch in accommodations, and overall we couldn't have been happier with the room. Breakfast buffet was pretty good, would recommend heading over to Mirage for the Cravings buffet instead, its about the same price with much more variety and I think higher quality overall. Did not spend too much time on the gaming floor as I go to Vegas mostly to sightsee and go to shows. Hotel valet was quick and courteous and only once was it full during the Cher concert. Not sure if this would be the case during the peak summer months, but you wouldn't catch me dead in Vegas in the 100+ heat anyway! All and all, this was a great stay for a mother-daughter weekend and I would not hesitate to stay again. While not the newest or classiest hotel on the strip, Caesars is a place where you don't have to spend a ton to be treated like a first class visitor, and of course the location can't be beat for the Vegas sightseer or first time visitor!

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRinck
Reviews.Content: We come to Vegas a few times a year and this was our first stay at Caesar's Palace. We had gambled enough back in March when we stayed at Paris, Las Vegas (both are member's of Harrah's Total Rewards) that we were able to stay for free. So the value of what we got for only paying about $36 in taxes for 3 nights was pretty high. We were given a room in the Palace Tower on the 23rd floor that overlooked the pools. A good view and the room was very nice with a large bathroom. The best thing about Caesar's Palace is that it is in a great location, right in the middle of the strip. If you want to venture out it's a great starting point. But also, at the same time, if you don't want to leave there is more than enough right there to keep you plenty busy. We like the casino and the large sports book at Caesar's. We're in our 30's and Caesar's has done a great job of infusing youth with their clubs with the older generation that has been coming back since the 1970's. It was packed from when we got there on Thursday to when we left on Sunday night. The pool area is very nice and the pools were heated even though it was over 100 degrees outside, which we liked. We were able to stay cool by the pool since half of the pool area spends most of the day in the shade, which has its pluses and minuses. It was impossible for 4 of us to find spots in the sun but we were able to stay cooler in the shade and hand out in the sunny side of a few of the pools. We bought a few rounds of beers at the store right by the entrance of the pool area instead of from the waitresses to save some money and make sure we didn't have to wait too long for the next round of drinks. Overall, I would say that Caesar's is right on par with some of the nicer Vegas hotels we stayed at but still a small step below a 5 star, maybe a 4.5 or a 4.75. We will definitely come back. It's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: werena_song
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace for five nights in September 2009, the hotel is incredibly centrally located on the Strip and is in an excellent position to walk to most of the main hotels on the Strip. We were allocated a room in the Centurion Tower which is through the casino and appeared to be one of the older towers, however, the room was fine. We had a great view looking straight at Flamingoes over the road and the room was clean and comfortable, but a little dated. One thing we noticed was that the room did not have a fridge/mini bar although this was not a major problem for us. We spent one day by the pool, which was great. There are tons of places to eat, I would definitely recommend the cheesecake factory in the Forum Shops. Overall we enjoyed our stay, a couple of things stopped me rating the hotel higher. The queues at reception are ridiculously long and our room was quite dated. One day we came back a clean room, but they had forgotten to give us any towels so we had to call down for some. They did arrive promptly though, so perhaps I'm being a little picky.

Reviews.Title: “Ceasars Good but Pricey when compared to others on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: HuntfromOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 5 night stay through Vegas.com about 4 months before and it seemed a good deal with rooms in the Roman Tower. However, after reading some of the reviews of the Roman Tower just before we left we made a mental note to check out upgrades when we arrived and we got a lovely room in the Palace Tower for an extra $35 per night. I did get a feeling though that room rates could have been negotiated when we arrived and next time I would just turn up (unless there's a special event on in Vegas etc). The hotel is fabulous expecially the shops. Dining there can be expensive but we had a lovely meal at the Sea Harbour restaurant with 20% discount, we also had a fab meal at the Japanese restaurant with a buy one meal get one free deal. You do need to have money when here as it is expensive. Having stayed at the Luxor a few years ago for a much lower rate, I personally think Ceasars is over rated. The pool area looks lovely, but the pool was dirty and with building works going on around the pool it was quite noisy. The Strip is growing all the time and perhaps Ceasars has just grown too big to be competive with their pricing!!

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: omega5
Reviews.Content: Everything is extra at this hotel. We were clearly in one of their low-end rooms (upgrades come at a cost, even mid week) -- the room was quite nice, but the bathroom had a handprint on the wall that looked like CSI forensics must have been through the place some time ago. The shower had a dodgy curtain and the only wardrobe space was in the bathroom! $14 per day wifi access in your room for ONE device only...an old television...no coffee maker...and no refrigerator (although some rooms must have a mini one, because down the hall there was a rusty one sitting there for several days). No mini bar snacks or anything. A vending machine down the hall sold pepsi, pepsi, pepsi and water.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place to Stay but the slots are tight!!”
Reviews.Author: JLC740
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there Sept. 5-9, 2009. We have stayed here many times over the last 8 years. The pool area is now complete and is absolutely beautiful, well worth the wait. Plan on spending about $15-$20 for a mixed drink and $9 for a beer at the pool/casino. Our room in the Augustus Tower was very nice. The slots were very tight, just like they were when we went in April, 2009. The $1 Wheel of Fortunue slots at Caesars do occasionally hit the $1,000. We also tried Harrah's and Flamingo and can honestly say we didn't see anyone winning large jackpots. In fact we only saw 2 people in 4 days win hand/cash pays. Also, Slots of Fun has upgraded their slots, this was one of the few places left that actually still used coins - now it's paper just like the rest. It was kind of sad to see all of the old machines gone. The slot tournament at Caesars was very nice (over 1,100 players). Also, Penazzi Oyster Bar at Harrah's has excellent food and the prices are reasonable! Good luck if you go, just plan on not bringing much money home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: susan777
Reviews.Content: Me and BFF always wanted to stay at Caesars and are fans of Bellagio. Glad we tried it! Arrived at 8AM on a Sunday morning and they had a Fountain View room available in the Augustus Tower. The room was perfect for 2 women. 2 queen beds, large bath room with jetted tub and the view was wonderful. Plenty of room for both of us to get ready. Beds were very comfortable. Hallways clean and maid service was excellent. Plenty of towels and goodies everyday. The pool was still under a bit of construction, but very nice for traveling without children. Kids would not like this pool. Drinks were expensive but STRONG and worth it. Very tasty Mango Margarita's! QUA spa is the best in LV. The Roman tubs, Arctic Ice room and steam were heaven as was the spa treatment. We did not eat any meals at Caesars so i can not rate that. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: JoanneV095
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights starting from Sunday during Labour Day weekend. We were originally given a Classic Tower Room and we extremely disappointed. We were expecting more from a 4-1/2 star hotel. We checked in right away even though it was only 12:30 which surprised us. But that's because the room was very old and badly in need of renovation, especially the bed. We left our luggage in the room and went to the pool. What a beautiful pool area - probably the best in Las Vegas. We stayed for a couple of hours talking about our room and decided upgrade for an extra $40.00 per night. We got a beautiful Deluxe Forum Tower room - it was like night and day. It was a lovely room - kingsize very comfortable bed, nice, clean linens, t.v. in the mirror, flat screen t.v. in the living room, seating area, drapes opened by remote control and got a great view of the strip. They gave us a $50 food and beverage credit which is gone in a day if you eat or drink anything in the pool area. Quite expensive - a beer is $8.00! We went to the PURE Nightclub the last night - well, if you're not VIP in that place, you are nothing. Caesar's is money-hungry. It's great, but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LouWales
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas in October. We stayed at Caesars and it was fantastic. Upon arrival, we asked to be upgraded and the reception clerk could not have been more helpful. We got to our room and it was amazing, best hotel room we have ever stayed in. It made our holiday even more special. The room was huge, it was more like a suite with a bathroom just as big. The hotel is massive, as they all are in Vegas but it was just wonderful. It was our first visit to Vegas and we cant wait to go back. We stayed a week and it just wasn't long enough. All staff at the hotel were so helpful and friendly. We booked to see Cher ain concert but she cancelled on the day, we were refunded the same day so can't fault that. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location Great pool”
Reviews.Author: Karkstraveltips
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel about 3 months in advance and got a fantastic deal it was preety much half price through Expedia.com. Ceasers Palace is smack bang right in the middle of The Strip. it is not far from the airport (like most of The Strip Hotels). It is a stunning looking hotel and reception area is easy to find. On checkin we signed up for a casino rewarder card which is free and gives you a $20 dinning voucher so that was good value. The hotels location is so good for it is close to the other hotels that hold attracts eg Bellargio fountain display right next door and the pirate show held at treasure island just down the road. The room was in the roman towers and really large with 2 double beds. The bathrooms and really large with a bath and a shower and plenty of room to put you items. Fresh towels daily and they dont start cleaning until after 10 so good if you have a lie in after a big night. the pool area is great no much shade and they were doing the other pool area up while we were thers so maybe this has changed. Drinks are quite expensive by the pool and inside the casino. The Pure nightclub is pretty cool and free if you are a guest but there was no where to sit if you are not in a VIP area so can get really tiresome if you have to stand all night. Did I mention drinks are expensive. You can get a strip bus to the shopping out lets. I would recommend only going to the Premium outlet for it has the same stores as the basic one and also much better ones, also it is easy to get back to the strip from the premium outlet. The only downfall is that the view was not great and the service in the buffet area not great. But all in all a highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rather Okay”
Reviews.Author: BrianMa
Reviews.Content: We arrived after midnight and should have been heading for bed. We decided to go down to play slots "Just for a little while". This was our first night in town this trip and we didn't get to bed until 5:30. Drunk..............And Broke........... I couldn't believe how crappy the payouts were at Caesars. We went fot breakfast across the street at Imperial Palace. Still not a very good buffet. Two bloody Mary's there.....Drunk again............. Back to bed and up at 4:30 to head to Excalibur for the Tournament of kings show(which was okay). We headed downtown that night and had a pretty good time. While visiting the pool at Caesars(which I figured would be one of the more enjoyable things to do there) I was pretty disappointed. I could hear this pounding base music from the bar close by which sort of over-rided the relaxing pool music we were supposed to be hearing. I just couldn't relax and ended up going across the street to get our show tickets for that day at tix for tonight.(Legends in concert 2for1 and George Wallace) Both shows were pretty good. When I got back to the pool my wife wasn't very happy because of the distracting sounds from over yonder. (Base from bar and construction). We headed out for a nice lunch. The room we had reserved was the Forum Tower Deluxe but when she found out we were Diamond Club members she automatically upgraded us to the Augustus Tower which is very close to the Diamond Lounge. I was really expecting something special because I had heard that the Forum tower rooms were quite good and the Augustus tower is a lot more expensive. My wife was very happy with the room and I have to admit I was pleased as well. I remember the shower havig multiple shower heads and there was a jucuzzi tub as well. Lots of stone and marble. Great TV. We could see the Bellagio Fountains (or at least the top of them) as our window was facing south. I just enjoyed looking outside to sort of get a feel for what was going on out there. We could see the busy Flamingo/Las Vegas Strip corner and all the people walking around. I don't want to stay at this place again as I prefer to come down the elevator and be able to walk right into a casino or go right out to the street without having a stroke. Next time it's back to the Flamingo for a little less luxury and a lot less wandering through seemingly endless walkways, entrances and rooms. Also for a tip. I'm pretty careful not to lose money on the slots, but at Caesars and Paris its almost impossible not to. Didn't eat at any of the restaurants. The Diamond club in Atlantic City has a full meal to offer and luxurious surroundings. The Diamond clubs at Vegas have chicken wings and chips and dip. Overall I still love Vegas and can't wait to go back next March!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: Desi_Jatt
Reviews.Content: Room - Augustus Tower 2 Queen bed corner room 3 nights Having been to Las Vegas four times it was about time I stayed at Caesars Palace. I Have stayed at all the major 5* hotels on the strip like Venetian, Wynn, MGM, ect. I booked the room directly from the hotels website with a special room rate code I found on the internet. upon checkin, which was about 11pm there was a short line. The clerk at the desk gave us a corner room which is located at the end of every corridor, the corner rooms are much bigger then a normal room and i would defiantly recommend asking for this room when you checkin. The rooms are nice and big with a huge bath tub. I would say rooms are just nice and they don’t have the WOW factor like the rooms at the Wynn. I was happy with the rate I paid for the room, but had I paid normal Caesars rates i would of been a bit disappointed. The Casino is big and a bit hard to navigate at first as you find your self going round in circles. The slots in Caesars are probably the tightest i have played and you’ll find your $20 gone in about 2-3 mins. As for the food, make sure you try the serendipity3 restaurant which is located just outside Caesars, the food is amazing and the deserts are even better. make sure you ask to sit outside and enjoy your food while sitting in the middle of the vegas strip. As for the restaurants in the hotel, we tried the Augustus cafe for breakfast and was not very impressed. The pool area is also just OK and also a bit outdated, they are currently in the process of building a new pool which should be opening soon, even though their is construction pool side, you wont notice it. Make sure you take ID with you to the pool as you cant order anything on the room without it. All in all, I enjoyed my stay at Caesars and would recommend staying here if you get a good room rate. Also remember that this hotel is right in the centre of the strip which makes the location ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lindsaym11
Reviews.Content: 7 students. 4 guys and 3 girls... stayed at Caesars Palace from a Sunday to a Thursday because of the cheap rates. Most amazing trip of our lives. I'm not someone for the bar scene and the clubs were soooo much fun!! Even though we went on weekday nights the bars were still packed! Caesars was very accomidating... they allowed us to switch rooms because we wanted the two rooms next to eachother. It is a pain waiting in line to check in and out... but oh well. The Pools are beautiful.... I really cannot describe them. But we spent everyday by them. Pure NightClub on Wednesday Night was wild and amazing. Money rained from the ceiling all night and partying on the roof was AMAZING!!! We also checked on Jet at the Mirage which was a great club.... 3 rooms and the music was great. Everything from 80s, to hip hop to Michael Jackson of course. LAX wasn't that good because alot of it is roped off so people just keep walking and no one really dances... I got burned by a few cigarettes that night :S Denny's is great for breakfast (middle of the strip). And there is a small casino next to Denny's and it has $1 beers and $1 Magaritas. ... Imports are $1.50. We pregamed here every night!!! Also my friend won $500 here and another won $250. There is a ticket place IN VEGAS on the strip that gives you 50% off tickets... so DO NOT buy your tickets in advance. Show tickets are always available. Spend the extra $7 to get the VIP up to the Eiffel tower... otherwise you will be waiting like 2 hours.... as opposed to 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's is there to make you stay fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMan48
Reviews.Content: Nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. Best service I have ever received. Received a GREAT rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: MissMandyinLeeds
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to Vegas, previously having stayed at Luxor, TI and The Mirage. We don't gamble much, just a few $ on the slotties, so we never get comps or anything, so I am commenting on the hotel as a tourist rather than on the casino etc. We stayed for 4 nights, having got the 4th night free through our booking with the UK travel company. The really pleasant guy on the check-in said he would upgrade us to the Palace tower, and our room was lovely. On the 15th floor, with a partial Strip view, very spacious, and a huge bathroom with a double Jacuzzi. It was bright and spotlessly clean. As usual, the mini-bar was extortionately priced, but this is the same the world over, and there was a large ice-bucket and plentiful ice available to chill your own wine that you've bought from the store for a few dollars. Coffee making facilities would have been nice, but that's my only very small niggle about the room. The lifts (elevators) were almost instantaneous despite being on floor 15, and all of the public areas were clean and well maintained. The concierge was very helpful when we wanted to book a show but there was a long queue as there was only one lady on the desk. We didn't eat in the hotel apart from by the pool one day, and although expensive, the portions were huge and very tasty; I had a mozzarella salad which was enormous and covered both my lunch and, as we English say, high tea ;-). Again, the drinks around the pool are way over-priced with two small tins of Corona beer coming in at around $15 plus tip! My only complaint about Caesars is the pool area. The pools themselves are lovely but if you don't get there early in the morning, 9.00am latest, you will struggle to get a sunbed. There is work going on at the moment which probably adds to the problem. Because of the high rise buildings around the pool, some beds are in the shade most of the day whilst others are in the sun with no shade at all; there were no parasols available or any tree cover, unless you paid the ridiculous sum of $250+ per day for a gazebo with sunbeds inside. Don't be fooled by the poster in the pool lobby which says these start from $25 per half-day. That probably means between the hours of 01.00am and 07.00am in January... Slight niggles aside, we loved Caesars. It is absolutely centre-strip which makes a real difference as you can do a hell of a lot of walking! And go to Jimmy Buffett's MargaritaVille directly across the road, not only for great Margaritas (of course) but they do a fabulous breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Room”
Reviews.Author: Kathiie
Reviews.Content: Room - Augustus Tower Deluxe Room - stayed 2 nights Check in clerk was very nice and when we asked for 2 queen beds instead of 1 king, immediately changed our room – no problems at all. Warned us to be careful about using the mini-bar. Check out was very easy over the phone. Room was very beautiful and impressive. Bathroom was huge, 2 sinks set in a beautiful bureau. Small flat screen television in bathroom, along with a separate toilet room (with phone), Jacuzzi and separate glassed-in shower. Flat screen television in room, huge floor-to-ceiling windows with a view of almost the entire Bellagio fountains! Round table with 3 upholstered chairs, plus a coffee table, couch, and another armchair. Robes and safe in the closet. Beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “augustus tower worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: dldorset
Reviews.Content: clean,comfortable beds, great space,great location at front of hotel,they should police smokers a little more (found a girl smoking at the elevator on my floor), towels need a little more fluff,overall good experience

Reviews.Title: “Caesars scores again.”
Reviews.Author: user906098
Reviews.Content: My wife, son, and I visited Aug 21-24th. Had two rooms in the Palace Tower. Wife, a non-gambler, enjoyed the easy access to the pool and the spa. Rooms were clean and well-maintained. The housekeeping staff was friendly and helpful with our requests for pillows and towels. The only draw back was a request for a frig for my diabetic meds. It was delivered the afternoon of our last day. We enjoyed Payard for their crepes especially the chocolate sauce. Chocolate truffles from the clock were excellent. We had a minor complaint with the Cafe Augustus. We had ordered breakfast...and wound up waiting 1/2 hour. Luckily, we are on vacation and did not complain. The waiter was apologetic and did not charge us for the coffees, which I thought was only right. Been to Caesars 4 times and our only complaints have been minor ones. Would stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “worst won ton soup "probably in the world"”
Reviews.Author: wontonVictoriaBc
Reviews.Content: Sea Harbour restaurant in caesars palace has to be the worst restaurant that i have ever eaten in anywhere in all the cities ,towns , or countries I've eatin in. My son and I had one order of what was supposed to be wor wonton one order of spring rolls that were ok water and tea. no booze . The bill was over $70.00 bucks . The service was very good but ,the nite before we went to china town and had a meal and wor wonton and a couple beers for $40.00 and it was very good . This place is a black eye to Caesars were we were not staying there but did stay in 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond Player is NOTHING if you arent 7Stars at Caesars..poor service”
Reviews.Author: idbman52
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Vegas I average 4 trips a year....I normally stay at Paris/Rio/Ballys where I have never had a problem...I thought I would give Caesars another chance after a bad experience about 3 years ago.....well I made a POOR choice...the only thing I can say was my ROOM was nice....The main problem came when I tried to have a friend wire me some money...on his end Western Union was closed and being Sunday so were the banks...So he found a Moneygram service and sent me extra cash to GAMBLE with..After walking about 2.5 miles to get this I was told the Moneygram service at CVS only dispenses money orders...I thought this wouldnt be a problem to cash at the Casino based on my history with Harrahs....was I WRONG....not only would Caesars NOT CASH it they wouldnt even help me try to solve this problem...I spoke to a Casino Host and she just said "there's nothing we can do...we dont take money orders" WOW....didnt even spend 5 min trying to call anyone to help solve my problem.....so I was in a BAD situation...I went to Paris/Ballys to meet with my Host CHRISTINE MIKHAIL...not only did she spend time helping me she comped a LIMO to take me to cash my money order, along with the LIMO driver DAVE PEGULA....my crisis was solved and I WILL NEVER STAY/PLAY at caesars AGAIN......PARIS/BALLYS this is customer SERVICE.....to a Diamond Player...not 7stars as caesars only cares about.....even at check in/check out if your not 7stars FORGET ABOUT SERVICE.....at CAESARS

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected...”
Reviews.Author: duo_travelers2
Reviews.Content: We booked a package deal with Southwest Airlines and our room was in the Roman Tower. Boy, this was a plant for an upgrade for sure. Had a musty odor, window was directly in front of a concrete wall, lamps very dusty, carpets dirty and the mattress looked like it had a lump in the middle. When we called the front desk, we were quickly upgraded to a much better room in the Augustus Tower. The TV didn't work and after two calls, it was determined an electrician had to fix it, so we asked for another room and were granted one directly below (5 floors) our room, which was much better. Everything worked and the room was clean. The line is long at the front desk since they have check-in/out combined (unless you're a high limit player). I may stay there again if there was an option to pick the "tower" for an upgrade within a package deal... I don't like being given an undesirable room knowing you would have to upgrade. If this is a 4.5 star rated hotel, then all rooms should be as such or better.

Reviews.Title: “Many better hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Stu_and_Jane
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a three-night stay at Caesar's Palace staying in one of the recently refurbished rooms in the Forum Tower. Having visited Vegas over 10 times we both agreed that this stay was probably the most disappointing visit we have had. Let's start with the room, refurbished and spacious yet the corridors were dirty and the cleaning trolley was permanently parked outside our room - nice! The room itself had the handle hanging off one of the cupboards, the main light in the bathroom was not working, the fan in the toilet was permanently on (not great for sleeping) and the air conditioning started making a very strange noise after being on for a little time and the only way to stop it was to switch it off, so no air con when sleeping. The location of the hotel is fantastic, right in the middle of everything. Restaurants were all very good (especially the Mesa Grill) although all somewhat expensive compared to our previous trips. Regarding the Total Rewards card and the comps, we were both a little surprised at how little we were comped against our room bill. Having stayed at other casinos in the past this was certainly not our experience, All we can conclude is that Caesar's is trading on it's history and is in a position of strength therefore does not need to take much care nor does it need to do much to attract visitors. We will not be returning again to Caesar's - plenty more choice available elsewhere offering much better value.

Reviews.Title: “No Place Better”
Reviews.Author: astempuzis
Reviews.Content: Completed another trip with a stay at Caesars. Can't say enough about the property. From the desk clerks to just about every employee, nothing but superb service. The Augustus Tower is quiet and roomy, just what you want at the end of the day. The bars are fun with great employees who have been there year after year. The location is the best, especially for first-timers.. You can walk to the 4 corners from the hotel without venturing too far. Bally's and Paris are always fun. Bellagio has a great restaurant in Olives and has Coca-cola products and local newspaper (suits at harrahs ban these on their property). Otherwise, Mesa Grill, Neros Bar, and my favorite Casa Fuente make this the premier Vegas property. The complaints I read about can be easily resolved with the right people at the hotel. I have never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “First Time In Vegas... Caesars Did NOT Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: CancunNewlyweds2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Vegas for the first time August 19-21. My sister and brother-in-law joined us and we all had a great stay at Caesars. Many thanks to the reviews suggesting you inquire about the "complimentary upgrades" upon check-in. We reserved and paid for a Classic room and took our chances that we'd be upgraded. I folded up a $20 bill and held it in from of my id while checking in and asked if there were any complimentary upgrades available. I saw the lady glance at it and she said "Let me check." She was able to find us a suite in the Palace Tower and told me I really didn't have to tip her when I handed her the $20 (of course I did anyway.) She was very nice and professional about it. My brother-in-law planned on doing the same thing when he checked in, but forgot to use the word "complimentary." Instead, he was offered an upgrade to a 4000 sq. ft. suite (compared to our 2000 sq. ft. suite) in the new Augustus Tower. I think he paid around $160 total, which included 2 nights. They told him it was normally $200+ per night to upgrade, so it sounds like he got a good deal too. We reserved a smoking room and were very pleased with everything. The room was clean, very nicely decorated (see attached pics, I love blue & brown) and stocked with plenty of towels, etc. I did notice the next morning when I woke up that the room smelled like an ashtray, which was weird because it hadn't before. Then after the maid cleaned that day the smell was gone, so they must have a very powerful deoderizer. We were in the Palace Tower, Room 1742 and had a view of the pools, which open at 8:00. We went out right after 8:00 and had no problems with chairs. We only stayed 1 hour so I don't know exactly when it got crowded, but when I looked down around 3:00 or 4:00 I only saw 1 or 2 open chairs and they were not together. We ate breakfast at the buffet and it was great. Some people say there's not a large selection, but I'm not sure what you could want for breakfast that they didn't have... eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits & gravy, muffins & other pastries, french toast, pancakes, cheese, fruit, etc. It was $18.95 if I remember correctly (definitely under $20) and worth it. We booked through Expedia and received a $50 food & beverage credit that could be used at any Caesars restaurant or bar, so our breakfast was "free." We tried the buffet at Terrible's for lunch and it was good enough. Pretty decent for what it costs - I think only $7 pp. We ate dinner at Joe's Seafood Prime Steak & Stone Crab in the Forum Shops mall and it was really good. Prices you can expect for a nicer Vegas restauraunt (anywhere from $30-$50 per plate plus extra for sides, salads, everything.) All in all, we had a great time in Vegas. Next time I'll want to stay at least one more night. We arrived late Wednesday and had to leave early Friday so we really only had 1 full day. The staff at Caesars were all very friendly and helpful in our experience. I would definitely stay here again if the price were right, but there are other places on the strip I'd want to try out too (Bellagio for one.) Make sure to catch at least one Bellagio fountain show. I think they run every fifteen minutes at night and they're really neat. P.S. I can't speak much for the gambling at Caesars b/c I only played the slots there, and did no good. We (all of us) had good luck on the Blackjack tables at O'Sheas though.

Reviews.Title: “Another great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Slayden
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Ceasars Palace. As with the first trip, we were offered an upgrade and the room was great. All of the staff was friendly and willing to help in any way to make our stay pleasant. Even with pool construction, it was a great experience. Cannot wait to go back and see the finished product. Great location and wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Review of the Rain Man suite.”
Reviews.Author: MGoBlue99
Reviews.Content: This is strictly a review of the Rain Man Suite at Caesars, where I recently stayed for a bachelor party. This suite was based on the fictional one in the movie "Rain Man". Per the Las Vegas Sun, the suite in "The Hangover" was also partly based on this room. It's on the 69th floor (top floor) of the Forum Tower. The suite is bi-level, and has up to 4 bedrooms (if you use the connecting neighboring rooms). We used one of the connecting rooms, so we had 3 bedrooms and 3.5 bathrooms. The living room is huge. It has a circular sofa on both sides, and a 52" HDTV in the middle of the room that revolves 360 degrees. There is a great 2-story view of the Strip. There are speakers built into the ceilings and walls on both floors, and you can attach your IPod and blast your music through-out the entire suite. The TV also has access to both DirecTV and Dish Network, and there's also a Blu-Ray player in the room. There is a fancy remote that controls all the lighting (different moods), and the curtains. The suite also has a dining table and kitchen area. The bedrooms on the top level are huge, and have luxurious bathrooms. There are even TVs built into the bathroom mirrors. Because you need to be able to watch SportsCenter while you are shaving. The Suite is just awesome. We got numerous comments from other riders when we hit the 69 button on the elevator. One girl even jokingly accused me of trying to impress her by hitting that button. A few other people asked us for tours. The list rate on the room is $6,400 a night but you can easily get it for much cheaper if you gamble a lot. This room is ideal for a bachelor party, as you can easily fit up to 20 people in the Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: hszumowski
Reviews.Content: If you like hanging by the pool, shopping at pricey shops, and great enterainment. Caesars is for you. The food is good, but expensive...$3.50 for a black tea. $15 for breakfast, even at their food court. I would stay there again but look else where to find food. SPA was amazing!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: julz_000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at CP with 3 of my girl friends, aged 24-25 from July 2 – July 5, 2009. We booked w/ Sunwing Vacations and paid $650 CAD each. We booked the Classic Room (which is the older tower, and had heard pretty terrible reviews of it, mainly that it was rundown and such) so we were pretty worried. We arrived at the hotel at 10am and left our bags w/ the bell desk. We returned at 1pm to check-in and were offered a free upgrade by the front desk. We got upgraded to a Palace Tower room – which is the tower closest to the pool entrance. We heard from people we met that they were not offered a free upgrade, in some cases even after offering a tip to the front desk. Seems to be hit or miss w/ the front desk, or perhaps it depends on your attitude when you get up there! The room was spacious, beds comfy, flat screen tv. Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom, double sinks, separate shower. There was a separate vanity area outside the bathroom as well. Bathrobes are provided in the closet, and extra towels and bathrobes were brought up promptly both times that we called for them during our stay. Maid service was so-so. It appeared that our bathroom floor was not mopped daily. We were not picky about this. The beds were made up nicely and the towels refreshed daily. The complex itself is pretty massive. The walk from the room to the strip was about 10 minutes. In terms of restaurants, we ate at Noodle 9 – it was fairly priced but the food not the greatest. I wouldn’t recommend it. There is a food court between the casino and the Forum Shops – you could get good food for reasonable prices, and not have to go to a sit down restaurant. Highly recommend the burger place as the food is fresh and delicious! The pool at CP is very nice – you need to get out there before 11am in order to get lounge chairs for your group. And even so, this took some effort in moving lounge chairs around so that we could all sit together. By afternoon guests spread out on the deck wherever they can find space! The pool is great b/c it gets sun ALL day, vs other hotels where the sun might be blocked by the hotel during certain times. I probably wouldn’t stay here again, only because there are so many other great hotels along the strip that you could probably get for a similar price – it’s always good to try something new!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Nice & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: oilmaven51
Reviews.Content: As with all stays there are Pros and Cons! Be prepared for LONG, LONG check-in lines. There is not enough staff nor self check-in options so you stand in a Disney type loop line for 20-30 mins just to check in. Our last trip was a year ago plus a few months to see Elton John. This time we came to see Bette. We stayed in the Augustus Tower last time and this time they wanted to upgrade us to a one bedroom suite in the Forum Tower. The Forum Tower has been complete redone and is very nice. However, if you are going to use the spa you have to walk through the casino for quite some time to reach it. It is in the Augustus Tower. The last thing you want after a great massage is a 20 min walk through a smokey casino. So book accordingly. Our room had last been inhabited by a bachlorette party and their balloons were still up in the room We found more behind the couch. Strange.Otherwise the room was large, clean and well kept during our stay. Caesars is convenient to the Flamingo, Harrahs, Imperial across the street as well as Ballys, Mirage, Treasure Island and the Bellagio. Nice little walkways and escalators whisk you to these other hotels. We like to eat and gamble at different places so we liked being able to go in a different direction and find new casinos. A number of these casinos are part of the Harrah's network so if you are a Total Rewards customer you get points at all of them. Let talk food: breakfast buffet was cold. Servers were very nice tho. The slice next door is expensive but great for a food court. We had hamburgers one day and pizza another and both were good. The Java Cafe is good for a quick breakfast, but again pricey. Better to go out to Serendipity which had several specials running while we were there including buy one margarita get the second one free. Serendipity is right out the front on the second level outside. The show was great Bette Midler stuff but I was disappointed in the audience. I had seen Bette 33 years ago at Caesars and that audience rocked. We were on the front row and we had four people next to us in shorts who kinda scowled during the whole show. Bette's busting her butt up there. Anyway, she was great and we went backstage afterward which was great fun. Rita Rudner was backstage waiting on Bette. I didn't recognize her as I am not a big comic fan, but my friend did. The gambling is good. Very professional dealers or you can go mechanical! There were booths where you could play 21 with an automated/televised dealer. That was fun. And there is a Rapid Roulette which gets rid of all the shoving at the tables. You have your own roulette table TV screen and about 40 seconds to place a min bet. That was fun too. The slots were tight BUT find the old machines and these pay out better. EVERYONE was playing penny slots. I don't get that. The casino was very very smokey and cocktail waitresses were overworked. They need to put on about 3 more in the evenings. The internet was expensive: $14.99 per day. With as much money as they are raking in downstairs you would think it would be free. Even though this trip was great, I would probably stay somewhere else next time. I am intrigued by the whole Fremont St. experience and the efforts hotels like the Golden Nugget are making to attract customers. So, might try that next time. If you want a great old time Vegas hotel with great amenities, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS, MARVELOUS AND OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: St0rm777
Reviews.Content: My husband was there on buisness and I was there to tag along, we stayed in the Augustus Tower and I can not come up with the words to describe the room, the service and Omg the view from our room was breath taking, but I can finally say after many years of vacationing I had the best time of my life there. I have been to vegas many times before but never stayed at Caesars. I will never stay anywhere again but there. Food was expensive but if you gamble enough its all free. LOL

Reviews.Title: “Caesars was a great value!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelerJJ
Reviews.Content: We were unhappy with the view from our room and were upgraded within minutes of complaining. Service from the front desk was prompt. The hotel and casino were clean and in good repair. The catered food and service at all events/meetings/receptions was excellent. Dancing at 'Pure' was awesome! My only complaint would be that the service staff in the casino is obviously older. The 45 yr old waitresses should be wearing uniforms more appropriate for their aging figures!
