They could also be quicker and friendlier. Other than that, I was very happy with the location, shopping, gambling, food, drink and service that was provided. I was also pleased that the hotel seems to cater to adults. I found the presence of children at other hotels (pools/lobby/shopping) to be a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be - many better choices for the non-Harrahs junkie”
Reviews.Author: wandoisback
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at Caesar’s at the conclusion of a 9-night business/pleasure trip to Vegas in June. The good: Beautiful, large room in the Augustus tower Lovely spa and decent gym Next to overpriced forum shops (but a pretty mall) “Diamond” lounge access for semi-big-shot gamblers like I used to be Convenient location Hyakumi all-you-can-eat superb sushi/sashimi The bad: Long lines unless you are a preferred gambler Rao’s restaurant is average and overpriced Long taxi and valet lines (again, short if you have “diamond” status) Bad odds on the video poker, slot machines, and only average BJ unless you play high limit. If you are given a free room, or somehow can get a good deal and stay in the lovely Augustus tower, this place MAY be worth a visit although there are better choices. As part of the Harrah’s chain lots of folks like to come here and keep their loyalty. But gambling odds are better elsewhere (try the Palms or the Wynn). I had dinner one night at Rao’s. Kind of like Buca di Beppo (a chain) without the super-oversized portions and way overpriced. Service was average. One great thing – all-you-can eat top shelf sushi at lunchtime for $28 or $38 at Hyakumi Harrah’s clearly stacks the deck in favor of its frequent gamblers making short lines and free amenities available to them alone. But you have to gamble so much to get this status it will cost you thousands for these benefits. Spa charges $45 for the day (but only $25 for the diamond-card gamblers). All the luxury amenities but the layour somehow just didn’t “feel” right easy to get lost compared to other upscale spas I have been to. I had spent 2 nights at the Wynn/Encore (my favorite) with a friend, and then 5 nights at the Palazzo/Venetian for a conference (huge rooms and nice sportsbar) and I would recommend either over Caesars UNLESS you have the diamond card given to Harrahs big gamblers. Caesar’s used to be the best place in Vegas. Now as an independent tourist I’d choose Wynn/Encore, Palms, or Palazzo/Venetian – none of which part of the big chains. Or I’d go offstrip to the Marriott, RedRock or M resort. The Harrahs properties are for the birds.

Reviews.Title: “Overated, look for better values in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: yngprofessional
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and I will not be going back to Caesars. First of all, the check-in process was horrendously slow--it made the Post Office look like first class service. For such a big hotel, they need more than 3-4 people working the front desk. We booked the "newly renovated" Forum Tower, but when we checked in they gave us a room in the Palace Tower which was supposed to be an "upgrade." I didn't get to see the room in the Forum Tower, but I have a hard time believing that the Palace Tower was an upgrade--nothing special other than a jetted bathtub. The hallway on the ground floor from the casino to the Palace elevators had a very unpleasant odor. Caesars was a disappointment compared to what I had heard, Caesars was a disappointment and I will probably be staying somewhere else next time I go to Vegas. When I got to Vegas I spent some time going around to other hotels that were about the same price as what I had paid for Caesars--I kinda feel like I got cheated since there are better values for the same amount in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Isn't Caesars Supposed to be the Creme de la Creme?”
Reviews.Author: MeekoFabulous
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we had ever stayed at Caesars Palace and were truly excited to be staying at one of Las Vegas' most luxurious resorts. We totally set ourselves up for disappointment. First off, there was a hole in the wall. Like some drunken fool had punched it or kicked it. Second, the unit that holds the iron in the wall, almost fell out. Third, every time there was too much white on the TV, the TV would make this buzzing sound and then shut itself off. Fourth, our heater didn't work. I know a heater in the middle of summer? I turn the heater off in the morning during my shower. I like to step out into a warm room. Well after taking our complaint downstairs, we were graciously upgraded to a nicer room. All was well with the new room (there was even a hot tub in it), except for the fact that they didn't even come clean our room! When I got back to my room later that evening (much later that evening) I had to call and ask for fresh towels. I was completely disappointed with Caesars Palace. It's supposed to be the creme de la creme in Vegas and it totally fell short. We will definitely not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average, not "super fancy" etc. as told”
Reviews.Author: Anu_Finland
Reviews.Content: I´m a little bit confused, how people rate this hotel as "super" or "great", or other synonyms describing how wondeful this hotel is. Maybe this is because some of the review makers have been only in few hotels and has not been travelling too much - or maybe the hotel rooms are all very different from each other, these are the only reasons I can think of. For my opinion, this hotel is a little worn out, and has certainly seen it´s best days. The public areas, as the lobby and the casino, have had their shining star times long ago. The carpets look old, and the service in front desk is poor. When we arrived the hotel (late at night) with our friends, we were asking to be located to the same floor (we both couples had forum tower de luxe rooms), but this could not be arrenged. Ok, I understand that in a big hotel full of guests this can be hard. But the thing really surprised me was that the clerk at the front desk gave us our keys and guided us to our rooms through the longest way - through the whole casino. He propably thought that we would be more anxious to come back down stairs to play in the casino, than if he would guided us to go via the shortest way to our rooms. I just found this irritating. By the way, no chance having the bell boy taking your luggage to your room- you have to do it your self...at least if you don´t have to change the rooms you were just given...then you can get the bell boy carry your suitcases, at least this was our experience. When we got to our room, I first discovered dirty towels on the floor. As I walked through the room, there were two dirty wine glasses and an empty bottle of wine, and other trash lying on floor, on the bed and on the table. Also the bed was obviously used. Disgusting. I called the front desk immediately to have an other room. And I had to call there 4 times before anything happened. We were waiting with our lugagge in the dirty room for 35 minutes before somebody came. With a long way back to the reception and with 3 big suitcases in the middle of the night, that was really the only option - to wait. After several hours travelling in the middle of the night, it didn´t feel nice at all. Well, the bell boy finally came, with new keys to our new room - in to a new floor again. He was terribly sorry, and really nice. He was shocked how we were given this dirty room, and said that this wasn´t the only time this sort of thing had happened. When we got to the new room, he checked it first, and let us in after looking that everything was OK in the room. He was really nice, and the only person that apologised for the inconvenience. The next day I went to the front desk to say that I found last night waiting and poor service from the front desk terrible, and were given free of charge for 30 dollars of the drinks from the minibar. OK, that´s fair enough, I thought. Well, that would been just too easy - as we cheked out later on, again an other clerk at the reception accused us to have been taken some nuts from the minibar, which I told was impossible, as myself and my spouse are terribly allergic to nuts! And yes, we had noticed that when you move or touch the minibar goods, they go wright away to your check, so we didn´t even touch anything else than the drinks that we were having (and the nuts were in a different place, not even in the fridge!)- free of charge up to the 30 dollars given. Well, finally they believed us, and said it´s OK. For me, this was just another experience of the poor service in this hotel. Our friends room was otherwise OK, except the smelling of cigarettes & tobaccos in their room. They have Forum Shops mall area in the hotel, which was nice and convenient. Also a lot of restaurants to choose from. Casino was average. The hotel is very good situated. We went elsewhere for breakfast, as having heard some bad reviews of the hotels own breakfast buffet, so we didn´t try that at all - so can´t comment on that one. Las Vegas was nice, and we might go back some day, but definitely to an other hotel. This is not a 5 star hotel. I would give it 3 stars, average. Some improvement to the service and the public areas, and some promptness to service, and this hotel could be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Did not like the big bait and switch!”
Reviews.Author: pammcpat53
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation through Expedia and requested a room in the Palace Tower with 2 beds because I was meeting friends and was going to be sharing the room with a friend, not family. When my friend and I arrived at the hotel around 7:30pm and tried to check-in, we were told that we would be given a room with a king bed and a roll away. I said that my reservation was supposed to be for 2 queen beds, but since we were checking in at 7:30pm we were told that the king and roll away qualified as 2 beds! I slept in the roll away and gave my friend the king. We were able to move to a new room the next day that had 2 queens but what a hassle. My advice would be not to stay at Caesar's if you will arrive late and are looking for 2 queen beds. I did not feel that 7:30pm was that late but apparently it was for this hotel. One friend wanted to use the fitness center but was told that there was a $25 fee per day to use it! Also our room had a in room safe that did not work and the handle of the shower door was broken. With all these problems I do not believe that paying over $250 a night was justified.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wolvesgirl09_9
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace was the most fabulous Hotel i've ever had the pleasure of staying in! It was my first time in Vegas and it definately won't be the last! Cannot fault a single thing about the hotel, staff, facilites or anything! Rooms were huge, very clean and had a maid service daily. I will be returning to Caesars! I love it!!! All i would say is that if your not going to have anything out of the mini bar, don't even touch or lift anything off the counter as it'll get charged to your card. We were told this on check in too.

Reviews.Title: “service disgracefull”
Reviews.Author: nithotep
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk were extremely rude & didnt care about helping me despite the fact that i was staying there for a week much longer than the average person & that i was an overseas visitor who comes to Vegas every few months for a couple of weeks I now tell all my friends to avoid Ceasars

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: u55275
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Las Vegas 2-3 times a year and this is the first time we chose to stay at Caesar's Palace. Caesar's is a 5-star hotel/casino which has been around longer than others but has never lost it's class. We stayed in the Forum Tower and the location was perfect. We were close to the casino action, forum shops and restaurants. Our room overlooked the strip but was very quiet and secluded. The decor was contemporary and the room was spotless. Housekeeping never failed to clean our room promptly and always left extra amenities, towels, etc. The casino has a good layout and plenty of slots and table games. The cocktail waitresses are excellent when you're at the table games but can be spotty when you're at the slots. The mimosas and mojitas are excellent! The table games have higher limits during the weekends but we wandered directly across the street to O'Sheas where they have low table limits and they honor the "Total Rewards" players cards. The restaurants can be a bit pricey but the food is A-plus with large portions. Overall we had a great experience and will definately stay at Caesar's Palace in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Venus Pool Party - Too Good!”
Reviews.Author: claire_owens
Reviews.Content: Went to the Venus Pool Party at Caesars Palace on Sunday... was so great. It was off to the side of the regular pool, no kids of course, and full of beautiful people. They only let enough people in to fill the lounge chairs and VIP beds/cabanas...drinks flowing, tonnes of waitresses (all good looking btw). There was a good DJ playing top 40 hip hop and some pop. They have bottle service at the beds. This was one of the best Sunday parties I've ever been too... can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: peo1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend at Caesar's Palace, we enjoyed everything, no waiting to check in, Joanie checked us in and could not have been more helpful. Room was in the Augustus Tower and no complaints, room was large and clean (could use a coffee pot) and looked just like the pictures I had seen on internet. Restaurants are pricey, but had to remind hubby that we don't do this very often, so enjoy it! Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wife Loved It; I Was Overwhelmed; Look Out for the Rooms with NO Bathroom Doors!”
Reviews.Author: Frqflier
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of Las Vegas hotels in recent years, making it a point to always break up a stay in Sin City with multiple nights at different hotels. Caesar's is an expensive, big, glitzy Vegas hotel. If you want to be in the middle of the Strip, this is your hotel. If you're coming to Vegas for a convention, Cher or a specific event at Caesar's then by all means stay here. Pool is definitely a scene filled with plenty of young hotties, male and female. The architecture is as Vegas as it gets. People everywhere are shooting pictures. The shops are legendary, the restaurants are top notch and priced accordingly. Even if you don't stay at this hotel, you'll have to vist the shops and casino during your visit to Vegas. It's definitely a desination. We had a weird thing happen. We were initially assigned to a bedroom in the Roman tower that had NO bathroom door. Not because it was taken off the hinges, but because that was the way it was designed. Now I suppose if you're getting a king room you're probably going to be pretty intimate with your bedmate. But call me quaint. I like MY privacy in the bathroom and I know my wife well enough to know that she likes HER privacy in the bathroom too. We asked to be moved to a different room and they accomodated us to a room on the same floor with a bathroom door. Might be worth asking before you check in if this is important to you or if you're staying with someone you're not that close too. We paid about $130 a night, a rate that included a $50 dining credit in the hotel restaurants. I'm not going to choose to stay here again based on the sheer size of the place. Way, way too overwhelming for me. But again, I had absolutely no complaints other than tight slots and I stress my wife really liked the place. One big tip. You can access the parking garage from Frank Sinatra Way which runs parallel to the Las Vegas Strip. It's a huge timesaver coming in or out of the hotel. Enjoy your stay... and just ask about the bathroom door thing!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: aycarumba
Reviews.Content: We moved to caesars after a couple of awful nights at Excalibur. The check in clerk upgraded us to a mini suite in the Augustus tower when he learned of our bad experience down the street. Our room was fantastic, it even overlooked the Bellagio fountains. We coudn't have asked for more. Ok there was some construction going on around the pool area, but the disruption was minimal. We loved the forum shops and the restaurants. We would definately stay at caesars again when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl078
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at Caesar's Palace in July and had a fantastic experience from start to finish. We recieved a complimentary upgrade to the Augustus Tower. The room was immaculate and had an amazing view of the Bellagio Fountains and the strip towards Paris. The room came complete with a Jacuzzi tub, minibar and bathrobes. The service we recieved from every staff member at Caesars should be applauded from the front desk clerk (Karla) to the maid to the restauants to the dealers, we had no complaints. We ate at Mesa Grill(great job Brian), Augustus Cafe and Joe's in the Forum Shops. Meals were excellent as was the service in all cases. We typically stay at the Venetian but would have to say that Caesar's is our new home in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Roman Tower”
Reviews.Author: sailorg
Reviews.Content: If you like me think Vegas is about enjoying a bit of luxury then avoid the Caesar's Roman Tower. I was totally underwhelmed. You get a better room at the average Hilton by the interstate! The hallways in the tower smelled. The bed wasn't the fancy pillowtop cushy mattress I usually find in a nice hotel, nor were the linens any nicer than what I have at home. The bathroom wasn't terribly nice. No fridge, coffeemaker or microwave. Put it like this: this room didn't make we want to hang out in it, which is my test of how nice a room is. As for the Caesar's Pool: I believe half of it is closed for construction because it seemed smaller than what I saw in pictures. They also blast music and you can hear some of the club music from the Venus pool so if you want a place to relax, forget it. Maybe they have the volume turned up to drown out the construction and the interstate that runs right behind the pool. Anyway, I went out there looking to relax and left after about an hour. If your room faces the pool (like mine at the 13th floor) you can hear the dim "thump, thump" from the pool music all day! Casino: I'm not a gambler but it was kinda smoky (I'm sure there's places worse and better on that mark) and it annoyed me that the layout of the ground floor had me dodging friggin slots anywhere I had to go. Bellagio and Wynn are nicely laid out where you don't have to walk through slots and tables if you don't want to. There also seemed to be a lot of kids in the place, which seems absurd to me. The Las Vegas strip is not for kids!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sunluvva
Reviews.Content: ROOM 1454: Jacuzzi in bedroom. Mirrored ceiling over king-size bed! Transparent doors to washroom and separate toilet and shower. No fridge or coffee/tea facilities. No access to balcony. Toiletries aplenty. HOTEL: Pool with fountains (cold) and lots of sunbeds (no shade) and free towels. Pool at top (warm) with option for luxury double sunbeds. Buffet breakfast available before 11am with various choices (no soya milk). AREA: Excellent central location within the Strip. Next to Bellagio which have superb fountain displays. Venetian Hotel is worth visiting, as well as the Luxor and the top of the Eiffel Tower have excellent views. MGM have lions behind glass which have luxurious surroundings. David Copperfield is an awesome entertainment. Mirage offers a Cirque de Soleil show 'O' which is breathtaking. TOURS: Fremont Street is great, busy night life with vibrant ceiling light shows. Helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon is a memorable trip where Sundance Tours lands in a beautiful spot to take photographs and have a champagne picnic lunch and 'Fred' the pilot gives great commentary and music. A HOTEL YOU MUST EXPERIENCE.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, met all out expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveHolsLondon
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, superb rooms (we had the Augustus tower) great service, lovely pool. We also saw some great shows and met some lovely people too. Vegas is a crazy place to visit and you may need a holiday to recover but you have to go at some point in your life as its totally unique.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service for what is supposed to be class hotel”
Reviews.Author: RalphKramden
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 5 p.m. and told room wasn't ready. Back at 7, 8 and 9 p.m.and not ready and no explanation. After four hour flight to get there, I was getting quite antsy. Desk clerk didn't seem to care or be particularly concerned. Finally went to the floor where the room was and found the lone maid who was still cleaning rooms at 9 p.m. She was at least an hour away from our room but immediately cleaned it when I explained the situation. Perhaps the maids should run the hotel. They seemed to be the only ones who cared. Finally got in and went to bed only to be awakened at 4 a.m. by two drunks screaming and swearing at each other down the hall...Never will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very expensive for what you get...”
Reviews.Author: joeMichigan
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at CP this trip. LOVED our room. We were upgraded to a petite suite in the Palace tower. Room was gorgeous. His & her bathrooms, shower for two, jacuzzi tub... but NO coffee maker. My girl loves her coffee in the morning so this was a big inconvenience each morning. We enjoyed our first stay at CP but we won't go out of our way to stay there again. It takes forever to get around there or to get from your room to the strip. Check in was pretty quick and the staff there were very friendly. My room was comped but I don't think I would stay there again if I had to pay. We have stayed at just about all the Harrah's properties and while CP is beautiful, we enjoy ourselves just as much, if not more, at their other properties. The pool area is still under construction but we did enjoy our time spent by the pools. We stayed by the main pool most of the time and enjoyed it. We did not order any drinks due to the high prices and chose to drink just before or after going to the pool. We did not eat once at CP as they were so much more expensive than neighboring casinos and the reviews have not shown me that they are justified charging those higher prices. our Friends ate at Ogdens and spent about $400 on dinner. They said it was really good but not sure if they would ever do it again. Did not have any luck in the CP casino. So ventured off and hit just about every hotel on the strip the first two nights. We wound up hitting Slots of Fun two nights in a row. It was so much fun to be able to play with actual quarters or dollars on the slot machines so we hit there twice. There is something about that place that is fun. Circus Circus apparently took over ownership of Slots of fun on July 1st so I hope they keep things the same. It is nice to see that on the strip amongst all the giants that are there. We also ventured downtown for a day and had much more luck playing down town. Was disappointed to see the downtown mall is closed up. Looks like it had just closed in June as there were posters for the movie theatre of movies that came out this past June. I saw Dodge Ball there for the 1st time a few years ago with my kids on a past trip so I was bummed to see that it closed. After spending some time at the Golden Nugget, I think we may stay there next trip. Some times I really enjoy spending time downtown and they have the best pool area so that is next on my list. I can't wait to go back to Las Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank god for the complimentary upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesar's for a three-day meeting, and the rate couldn't be beat. After checking into my room on the 15th floor, I found out why. It was dirty, nasty, and the cleaning staff had obviously lacked attention to detail (see pictures of the holes in the wall, cracked tissue box, missing light bulb, and the tellingly-stained desk chair). The deadbolt on the door didn't work, either. At first I thought I could stand it. Then I waited for two hours to get a new lightbulb and the lock fixed. But I couldn't take my eyes off that gross chair. I went down to the front desk armed with my pictures, and they upgraded me to a gorgeous suite. Thank god.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vianni911
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why there are even any negative reviews at all... I'd like to say that I absolutely one hundred and 10 percent loved our hotel and our room. First of all, the location is PRIME, it is on the mid - strip location, right next to the Bellagio and VERY close to Paris and Planet Hollywood, and on the other side, the Mirage... I think the location itself is ideal, as most other hotels lie south or north of the strip and can be a good walk to get to. I personally enjoyed Caesars decor and just the hotel itself better than the inside of the Bellagio and certain other ones, you tend to find that most look alike inside (casino areas, etc). We were fortunate enough to get upgraded to the Palace Tower, even though I had booked a Forum Tower, and I didn't even have to ask, she just implied that we had booked the Palace Tower (which is one of the newest towers). We arrived fairly late, at about 11:30 so there virtually was no line to check-in (during the day the line is pretty long... this is a big hotel, so it's expected). Furthermore, the room was amazing. Big king sized bed, the views of the pool (Palace Tower is right next to the pools) and the bathroom had a nice big sized jetted tub in it as well. Also, there is construction going on in the pool area, however, much to many complaints I have seen, I didn't think the construction bothered us at all, they play music and it kind of surpasses the construction noise, I thought. Also, it does get pretty full, we went right when they opened at 8:30 (it's GREAT at this time because you get to pick where to sit, ample options, and the heat isn't unbearable). The pool area was by far my favorite of the hotel, very classy and nice. Also, we had breakfast at Augustus' Cafe (about 36 total for 2 people) and it was probably the best breakfast I've ever had! (No joke) Taxis to and from the airport to this location on the strip are about $12-15, so not bad at all. All in all, this hotel far exceeded my expectations, and you'll LOVE it!!! ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: WaterColorKate
Reviews.Content: We loved the room,.and we got a great deal. There was a nice jacuzzi in the room - love it. Staff were friendly, buffet was nice. Great swimming pool, but was crowded because it was summer.

Reviews.Title: “stayed for a great rate”
Reviews.Author: travelmanSouthwest
Reviews.Content: surprised at reasonable rate, went to restaurants and shops, saw rest of strip hotels. lv was better than we thought it might be.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME ROOM - BRING LOTS OF MONEY FOR FOOD!!!”
Reviews.Author: thespawn
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter (12 yrs. old) and I arrived at McCarran from Newark around 11:30 am - bumpy flight. We were picked up by Presidential Limo (stretch). Very nice! Stopped at liquor store on way for supplies. Room: 5 Nights Comped at Forum Tower Deluxe (thanks to my Atlantic City Harrah's Play). Upon arrival at Caesar's, there had to be about 50 people in the check-in line....so the wait began. Finally, I "tipped" the check-in clerk $25 to get an upgrade from our Forum Tower Deluxe room to an Augustus Tower Deluxe Room (we had a great view of the Bellagio Fountains! Room 3782). We had a refrigerator brought up (free of charge) and unpacked. Walked around hotel a bit....ate some lunch at Augustus Cafe and had a very nice lunch (expensive, though). Gambling Highlights: Played mostly 3-card poker, VP, and Blackjack. Went up and down on the table games, although I did get three "6's" - the sign of the beast, which paid 30 to 1 on my $25 bet. Not too bad, but I ended up giving it back eventually. VP machines at Caesars were scarce, so I played at the VP Bar by the Sportsbook. They sure know how to pour drinks over there....I don't remember getting back to the room that night....and YES I LOST AGAIN! I did have fun and met some nice people. My husband played in a few poker tourneys, didn't win either. We have a curse with Harrah's properties, as we never win at any of them (even in Atlantic City). We are good with Boyd/MGM though. Went to Bellagio and won $250 within 5 minutes on a $.25 slot! Go figure! Food: Went to Bellagio Buffet. Had to have the giant Alaskan King Crab Legs and the Prime Rib. Excellent! We all got our money's worth that night for sure! Caesar's Food Court: Beware! Food isn't bad, but God forbid you want a slice of pepperoni pizza, you'll pay $6.50 for it! Or how about $4 for one bagel? Rao's: Inside Caesar's. Very nice meal - excellent food. It should be for $160.00 (without liquor)! Otherwise, ate at Caesar's Cafe Lago Buffet for breakfast only. I heard it sucked and it sure did. Awful - stay away. The eggs were runny, no selection, too expensive, etc. Mostly went to the Payard Pattisere coffee shop for breakfast sandwich/coffee. Ate at BLT Burger at Mirage one night - very good food and reasonably priced! Went to Joe's Prime Steak and Stone Crab on our last night (Fri.) for our 15th anniversary. Excellent steak and crab! Yes, you sure do pay for it, but the food/service is excellent. I think I saw a few celebrities there as well! POOL: The pool at Caesar's is still under construction. You don't hear the noise too much, as they play loud music. 2 main pools are open, but we pretty much stayed by the round main one. No, there was no styrofoam or dust or dirt from the construction in the pool at all. Get there before 9:00 for decent seats. It opens at 8:00 a.m. Tip: Don't order a beer at the pool - it's $8 for one, or $18 for a frozen drink. Ouch! We learned early and brought water most of the time. Fun: I had to take my daughter to the NY/NY Rollercoaster or I would never hear the end of it. $28 later, we rode it (I shut my eyes the whole time - I don't like heights!). We went to their arcade, Rainforest Cafe for lunch at MGM Grand. I took my daughter across street to Flamingo Wildlife Habitat - Nice birds, turtles, Koi fish! Went shopping. Went to the Dirk Arthur Extreme Magic Show at Tropicana - very nice magic show with Lions. Good value at $30, as well! QUA SPA: I had my husband booked for a massage for his early birthday present. They run a $99 special Sun - Wed. with full use of the spa/gym all day and a massage. He enjoyed it up until the end when he slipped and fell in the steam room. He hurt his back. They did fill out accident report, but that's about it. No follow up calls to see how he was doing or anything. I did enjoy the spa baths and steamrooms (especially the artic ice room), however. Thus, with my husband layed up with a hurt back, we couldn't go see Love as we had wanted to. Next time for sure. He's feeling much better now! So, that pretty much sums it up! Much drinking, gambling with little wins, a couple of nice restaurants, alot of pool time, and the token arcade/magic show for the little one. We all had a good time and Caesar's took an extra $150 off the final bill in comps~!

Reviews.Title: “STILL AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: politepete
Reviews.Content: Its location still makes this the best hotel in vegas. And dont be put off by the renovations ,this is still the BEST pool in VEGAS.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only for the location”
Reviews.Author: curlycocunut
Reviews.Content: Caesar's is an ok place to stay, but I certainly wasn't blown away by anything there. I've had better service other places. We were given an upgraded room, but had to switch rooms and were downgraded again. We were there for a conference and I think its hard to go to Vegas for a conference, because you have to be up at 6 am to attend. We ended up having to switch rooms because we were on a nonsmoking floor and there was a HUGE party of young men in the room across the hallway smoking like chimney's in their room and Security wouldn't do anything about it. They were also in and out ALLLLL NIGHT LONG. Which is to be expected in Vegas so we couldn't really hold it against them for having a good time. But, we could not sleep with the smoke and noise and had to ask to be moved. EVERYTHING is a ripoff at Caesar's. If you stay, make sure you have deep pockets. I need not bore you with the details. Rooms were VERY CLEAN. We stayed in the forum tower. Housekeeping was good/friendly. The elevators are nice and quick...never had to wait. The location is one of the best on the strip, but I think I would try another hotel in the same area next time. I don't think it is worth the price because who wants to be in their room in vegas anyway? Pool construction is still going on, but there are a couple of pools open.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: james9191
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Brilliant location for exploring the strip. So many amenities with great shopping and eating at the Forum Shops.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special!”
Reviews.Author: veggienb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesar's Palace for three nights. The only reason I stayed at Caesar's was because we got a fantastic deal. Enjoyed my stay, however I would likely not stay here again unless it was super cheap. Here are the pros & cons in my opinion: Pros: - Spacious Room - Jacuzzi Tub in Room - Clean - Overall, great customer service. - Toileteries replaced everyday Cons: - Long line-ups upon check-in - Pool under construction, you can't relax by the poolside due to the jackhammers! - Takes forever to exit the casino/hotel because the towers are far away from the entrance/exit - No mini bar/fridge in room - Late checkout only 1 hour later - Noisy AC unit Overall, I enjoyed my stay. It served it's purpose to sleep and shower while we were in Vegas. However, I prefer smaller sized hotel where you don't need to walk 10 mins just to get outside.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation Heaven”
Reviews.Author: magmeister
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Vegas several times a year for over eight years and I stayed at Caesar's for the first time on this trip. I was able to register early and after I asked the desk clerk upgraded me to a beautiful room in the Augustus Tower with a view of the Bellagio Fountains. If you can manage a room in this fairly new tower DO IT. The jetted tub was sensational, the bed heavenly and room service was prompt and pretty reasonable. There is a 5.00 service fee and an automatic 18% gratuity so it may not be for everyone, but I was traveling alone and so it was fine. The Cafe Lago breakfast buffet is good but limited. The coffee was great though. The best part of the whole trip was Qua Baths. There is a 45.00 entry fee per day, but it entitles you to the use of the workout facility and the incredible spa for the whole day. If you use a spa service (Salon services like pedicures do not count) use of the facilities is included. I had a massage - ask for Kira M., she was really terrific. All in all it was a wonderful visit and I will be making Caesars Palace my new destination in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “All hail Caesar!”
Reviews.Author: UJ99
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Caesars Palace probably made this the best Vegas Vacation we have taken. Location – Best location on the strip, about midway up. Next to Bellagio, across the street from the Flamingo, which means the Venetian or MGM is only a 10 minute walk away. Even if you don’t like the casino at Caesars, you are very close to a range of others. And if shows are your thing, there is a half price tix booth right across the street at Bills. Check-in – We checked in at 1:15am (thanks crazy reduced airline schedules!), but this seemed to work to our advantage; the line was non-existent (just one person in front of us), and we got a free upgrade! The staff member was on the computer for 5 minutes or so with the occasional apology for the delay, but then declared that the rooms weren’t coming up so he upgraded us! We booked the Classic Room, but got an Augustus Tower room (needless to say, this review might have been different if we had got the room we paid for!). Staff member at reception was very polite and helpful despite the late hour. Worth noting that when we passed reception at other times, lines were huge, so if you are arriving at an earlier hour, bring a book. Room – Augustus Tower Rooms are marvelous! The décor is modern, with just enough hints of the Roman theme to fit without being tacky. The view was of the strip and the mountains, if you looked to the side of the window – otherwise straight ahead was just the roofs of the casino buildings (they should really think about putting solar panels on them – such a waste of space!). The bed was very comfortable, room was clean. Nice sofa and armchairs, so when relaxing one doesn’t have to sit on the bed like a teenager in his room. Closet had a safe, robes and slippers. The bathroom had twin sinks (always a wife-pleaser), a separate small room for the toilet, a TV and separate bath and shower, with the bath being a whirlpool bath! After reading reviews on this site I didn’t even touch the mini-bar fridge for fear of false billing. TV had a nice selection of channels, and was a new LCD. Restaurants – Every time we went past most of the restaurants, there was a line, so we ate elsewhere. Amenities – Casino is a nice size, but didn’t have a lot of Video Poker (our game of choice) so we ended up not gambling here at all. Have gambled here in the past, but there is just something that doesn’t make it appealing. Didn’t use the pools, so no comment on them. We did however use the Qua Spa, and I have to say it is phenomenal! You can use the gym for $25, or the whole facility for $45 – I recommend the $45 day pass! I was shown the facilities and given a locker, as well as robe and slippers, then set off for the gym. The gym is very well equipped and compares favorably to some private gyms, let alone the usual sad excuse for a hotel gym. Post workout, your options are incredible – plan to spend a whole afternoon here! Sauna, steam room (so steamy I couldn’t see anything beyond 2 feet), steam room with eucalyptus, and a cold room, with moisturizing snow! There is a hot tub, as well as roman mineral baths, of different temperatures. Showers have body wash, shampoo and conditioner in them as standard. Once done, you can shave in the well lit bathroom (shaving gel and razors provided), then relax in the tea room, which has a large TV showing ESPN, magazines for men, a range of five different fancy teas, as well as snacks, fruit and choices of water or juices. At no point did I feel pressured to leave or hurry up. If the rest of your vacation involves late nights, drinking and over-indulging this is the perfect recovery for you. The only time I got a bit miffed was with the staff at the gift shops, who really didn't seem interested in serving someone who only wanted to buy a postcard, to the point where I just walked out the first one after waiting a ridiculous amount of time. Checkout – I checked the bill online through the hotel TV, and there was almost no wait at reception to get a copy of the bill and hand the keys in. Bill was correct, staff very friendly. Overall, the best experience at a hotel in Vegas so far. If you are one of those picky people that want fresh soap every day, and new towels and your slightest whim at a moment’s notice, then you may be disappointed. As someone that just wants a nice clean room, working amenities and a correct bill, I was very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: chuckr35
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I traveled to Vegas because one of us was attending a conference. The rest of us piggy backed on his room. At check in we were offered an upgrade but due to using "company" funds he declined. Once we arrived in the "Romar Tower" room we promptly exited and went back for the upgrade. There's a reason there are no pictures of this room on Ceasar's website. It looked like a Motel 6 room. Once back at the check in desk we asked for the before mentioned upgrade. The clerk had already assigned that room so she gave us an even bigger room in the "Augustus Tower", for the same price as the smaller room. Lets just say we made a good decision. The room was clean, well furnished, great view, and we all slept well with no outside noise heard. As with most rooms in vegas, there was no coffee maker, no fridge, etc. Stay away from the food and drink bar. If you lift an item out of it's place, a sensor is alerted and you will be charged. We had to get creative when icing down our beer. The beds were very comfortable and AC worked very good. WiFi in the room is $15.00 a day. The restaurants at Ceasar's are very expensive, $77.00 ribeye is a bit much. We only ate at Ceasar's for breakfast, in the food court. Average price for a 3 egg omelet, 4 pieces of toast, potatoes, and large coffee was $14.00. A little high but we couldn't eat all we were served. We did have a late night bacon cheesburger combo one night, same food court, $15.00, and it too was huge. Very good food as well. I utilized the workout facilities for the three of the four days while there. It's normally $25.00 a day but they had a 3 days for $50.00 deal which was o.k. The gym was clean and the equipment was new but it lacked somewhat in space. It has a very small area for the hand weights and free weights. Other than that I was able to get a good workout in. If you plan on getting some sun by the pool, plan on getting down there before 1000 a.m. If you don't, you'll find yourself walking in circles waiting on a chair to open. Even though it was crowded the chairs are only 3 rows deep in most areas so it wasn't too bad. Drinks at the pool are around $12.00 for 12 ounce and $19.00 for 16 ounce. Some kids but not alot. That"s important to me as I don't want to listen to a bunch screaming and crying while lounging. Spoke to a security guard who told us that two additional pools are supposed to open in Aug. 09 but they may be running a bit behind. That would bring the total to 5 pools. The slots paid pretty well at Ceasar's. Three out of four of us took extra cash home from the slots. Can't speak for the blackjack tables or poker. All in all the hotel is very clean and well maintained. No complaints about any of the staff. Plenty of bar maids both in the casino and at the pool. I'm already planning another trip in Sept. of this year and I will be staying at Ceasar's Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: theresa1970
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights as part of my nine day stay and did enjoy it. The rooms were comfortable but a little dirty. The bathroom was awesome had a shower and bathtub separate. There was construction going on at the pool that was annoying couldn't relax. Lots of slots to choose from on the casino floor. Good drink service and nice costumes. The shops were fun lots and lots of them top of the line. I probaly would not stay here again but it was not bad I just didn't feel that comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “If you are going for the pool......wait a while”
Reviews.Author: jtown41051
Reviews.Content: Can't beat some of the rates in Vegas right now so we couldn't resist a quick week vacation. We picked Caesars Palace for it's great mid-strip location (we didn't plan to really leave the strip and did not want to rent a car). Here's how we found it: Location = Mid-strip can't beat it. You will do a lot of walking with thousands of complete strangers but....that's Vegas. The hotel is HUGE, lots and lots of walking so bring the right shoes. Rooms = We upgraded to the Palace tower upon arrival for an additional $25.00 a night. This is the closest tower to the pool and that was one of main reasons for going. The room was very spacious as was the bathroom, excellent jacuzzi tub and separate shower. We heard horror stories about the Roman tower and wanted to avoid it at all costs. Housekeeping = top notch, room was kept very clean and no personal items were disturbed. Prices = Food and drink are not cheap at Caesars; the food court is the best bet where most meals were about $10.00 each. Soft drinks at the pool are $3 to $4 a piece. Alcohol at the bars is armed robbery, one night my wife and I each had a simple shot and it was $30.00 for both! Pools = You may have heard the pools are being upgraded or rather new additions. They are in the process of adding new pools and finishing construction on a new tower and meeting facilities.....all of this is around the pool. Dust and construction noise surround 50% of the pool area and you can't help but notice them. The pool chairs fill up on the early side, we were at the pool by 8am and had no problem but by 11am you were out of luck. There are two main pools available now with a 3rd "European" pool available for an extra charge. Not enough chairs for the crowd that hits the area so get there early if you want to sit. Bottom line; nice and big place pick the right tower and wait a few months if you plan on spending time at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfact Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zero2ero
Reviews.Content: I had a great package deal at Travelocity (I booked about 6 week advance) for this hotel. Upon check-in, I asked the very friendly desk clerk if I can get any complimentary upgrades, and she upgraded us to a Forum Tower, which is one of newly innovated tower - everything in the room were cleannnnn!! If you don't ask, you will not get it. Don't ever touch anything in the fridge in your room, eventhough you don't open, they scan things that removed and charge you for it. We did not try the restaurents in this hotel (very expensive, but I am sure they are good), but we tried at Beijing Noodle 9. If you like a chiness food, you got to try! Handmade noodle and dumpling are just perfact! Average entry costs for 12-18 dollors. *** Try at "KOKOMOS" at Mirage Hotel - they have Pre Fixed Menu (you have to ask) for 29.99, and it was amazing!!! 3 course meal, nice atmosphere, good food.***Sushi Roku at Forum Shop - the best fresh sushi I never had. Try live sweet shrimp, the best!!! You will not see any $5 table game in this hotel. The lowest table I saw was $15. Most of them are $25 min. Shopperholic? Forum Shop got everything (all expensive designer handbags and cloth...you know the deal) I will recomand the Prime Outlet Mall - great deals on nice brand names. Overall, we just had stay at Caesars Palace and we will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Seablanco1
Reviews.Content: I had taken an early flight and arrived at Caesars at 10:30am. I was somewhat concerned because I knew that check-in was at 3:00pm. There were perhaps a half dozen folks also attempting to check-in early. The woman at the front desk was very friendly and accomodating. She was able to find me a room (and EVEN upgraded it at no cost). I was in the Palace Tower right near the pool. This was perhaps the easiest tower to get to. You must walk through the rather smokey casino to get to the elevator. I was on the 20th floor and my room faced the Strip towards the right and mountains to the left. Wow! The room was huge. The furniture was modern, but simple. The king bed had very comfortable sheets, pillows and comforter..lots of huge pillows. The matress was firm, but not too hard. The air conditioner system worked flawlessly. The thermostat is on the wall, my room was hot when I arrived so I cooled it down to 70 and it only took about 15 minutes to achieve this. The bathroom was about the size of my living room. A stall shower, two sinks and a sunkin jacuzzi. I had no idea where the toilet was. Aha, it was behind the door and included a phone. The tv was flat screen and received an impressive amount of channels. A robe was included in the closet. The toiletries had a tangy, orange scent. I loved the lotion. There was an ipod docking unit/radio, but the docking did not work and the radio only picked up a few stations. High speed internet cost $14.95 per 24 hour. At times the internet was quite slow. The room was incredibly quiet. I never heard a door slam or noise from another room. It was very clean. My only objection was the maid walking into my room at 9:00am and didn't even knock. I guess she must have assumed that I was still out partying/gambling. You can check the cost you have accrued to your room on the hotel's tv channel. In addition, you can check out after 6:00am utilizing the hotel tv channel. The casino is large and perhaps one of the more sought out on the strip. I have heard that many people come over to Caesars to play the slots and cards. The casino floor went on and on and on. Unlike Atlantic City (which has smoking sections), smoking is everywhere! Even if you just walk through the casinos on your way to somewhere else, you are bound to get smoke blown in your face. After you leave the casino you are immersed in a huge shopping area with some of the most upscale shoppes in Vegas. The stores go on and on and you can get lost trying to navigate from one side to the other. The price of a Coach purse actually was higher then it would have been at Macy's, but I'll always remember where I bought it. The ceiling is a distinct blue and the area is very posh and made to look like a Roman street. Caesars is one of the largest hotels and it takes about 2 days to figure out how to get from point A to point B. There is a LOT of walking involved. Some times I found it easier to exit and walk outside then maneuver the massive maze. The Coliseam is the theatre where the top stars like: Cher and Bette Midler play. I saw Bette and had wonderful seats and she put on an impressive show. The pool is waist deep(so don't expect to be able to swim). It is a large circle surrounded by fountains and sculptures of caesar. There is contruction going on near the pool (a new tower is being added). The music at the pool was so loud, it drowned out any of the construction noise. There were many young people when I was there in the pool and nearly all had drinks in their hands. It was hot and the pool was crowded. If you want to get some exercise, you can actually walk around the pool a few times. You have to get down early because the lounge chairs get filled up quickly. I tried to get my space staked out between 930-1030am. Those who came in the area after 1100 did not have much luck finding a place to lounge. There is also a "European" pool located just outside of the doors. This is an adult-only pool area and the women can go topless. The waitress/bar staff at the pool are agonizingly slow. I ordered a drink and it arrived about 45 mins. later. It just appears that they do not have the adequate amount of staff to services a large crowd. I treated myself to a massage near the pool (in the shade) for $50 for a half hour. The masseuse was fantastic and very friendly. The pool store is very overprised. Unless you want to pay $12-$15 for suntan lotion (bring your lotion from home). Soda's cost over $2.00 a bottle and snacks range from $2.00-$4.00. There are loads of restaraunts, but they are quite expensive. I ate one large meal at the Japanese restaraunt (which I was told had among the best sushi in Vegas). The sushi was by far among the best I have ever had, fresh and tasteful. The cost was $25.00 for two rolls. One word to describe the Caesars staff--Accomodating. The cost of the stay was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good but too big and generic.”
Reviews.Author: BallerStatus
Reviews.Content: Went for a bachelor party and while the hotel is good - it's far too big - takes ages to get from room to casino floor or exit or pool. The crowd is totally universal - families, old people, party people so it's a bit of mish mash. We got an upgrade and the room was HUGE but this hotel is not for 20 somethings. Still a good hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time July 4th weekend 2008”
Reviews.Author: Erick_9
Reviews.Content: I went w/ family from Miami -only been to Vegas twice and we enjoyed Caesars Palace that we (Girl Friend) and I will be staying there at the end of this month. You hear so much negivatve reviews, I truly think if you plan on having a good time you will, if not you wont-so the key is go to Vegas and just have a good time -Caesars is the best place to stay for the shopping extravaganga, if you are not a gambler- and the Food is great too!!!

Reviews.Title: “great 42nd wedding anniversity”
Reviews.Author: biilljean
Reviews.Content: two great employee's Cheryl Ippolito set up our 4 day stay and Marc. Mercury front desk help during our stay. Have been coming to Caesars since 1987 every Jan & June we had a great time looking forward to returning in Jan

Reviews.Title: “Blood on the sheets”
Reviews.Author: JoefromAZ
Reviews.Content: I found blood on my sheets after I had slept on them for 2 days. They acted like it was my fault and took a long time to come and replace them. I could tell that it was tried to be washed off. NEVER STAY HERE again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Caesars and Definitely Won't be the Last”
Reviews.Author: OhioTWalter
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Caesars Palace. We had 3 nights comped in the Forum Tower. When checking in, told the woman it was our 15th anniversary and she upgraded us to the Palace Tower when she found out my wife liked the pool. The room was the nicest non suite room we have stayed in before in Las Vegas. I enjoyed how quiet it was in the pool area, not a lot of kids like you get at some of the other hotels. The casino was even quiet, which actually was quite nice. The food is very expensive there so we ate elsewhere. We will definitely be returning next year to Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Really Poor service”
Reviews.Author: simannegeo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 1530hrs local.Having travel there with Virgin Atlantic where we received excellent service. Because my wife uses a wheelchair I emailed the hotel in advance to explain that we were travelling with our daughter and son-in law and because of the wheelchair and the help needed from them I asked if our rooms could be close, at least on the same floor. On arrival we again requested this. After a lot of them trying to get us to pay for an upgrade they said they had two rooms for us but one was not made up but would be done soon. We waited an hour and checked...still not made up. We went to eat and arrived back at 2000hrs still no room. After much talk with every one blaming every one else they agreed to give us another room in a different block. We said we still required the room and they agreed that it would be ready for us next day. After a long trip and being very tired this was the last thing we expected on arrival at a high cost hotel. We were not alone other people were in the same situation and were bitterly complaining. The service through out the whole hotel was very poor unless you were spending. But we explained that we had spent a lot with the price we paid to stop there. The Buffet here is possible the worst on the Strip and high priced to boot. We ate at The Luxor which we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hail Caesar...Emperor of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: VegasGirlandBoy
Reviews.Content: After booking our trip we were a little worried following some of the recent traveler reviews.... we booked a classic room and upon arrival (and only waiting for 2 minutes to get checked in) we got a recently refurbished Forum Tower room!!! The room was great, although the view of the back of the Colosseum wasn't anything to write home about... The pool area was a little more crowded than our last visit thanks to the construction work, that said we always managed to find 2 beds next to each other on the six occassions that we visited at various times of day!!! The waitress service was friendly, efficient and plentiful....... We ate a couple of times at the new offering Serendipity 3, which had a good menu and lovely food... Our only real constructive observation is on the table play, which could certainly have benefited from some lower minimums throughout our stay, which lead us to play mainly in other locations. Overall.....Hail Caesar...Emperor of the Strip...we would definitely stay here again...especially when the new pool area is finished....

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Bigward
Reviews.Content: Caesers was a great place. They made a few mistakes, but quickly recovered. I would highly reccommend anyone looking to go to Vegas to stay here. It ain't cheap, but if you want cheap, go somewhere else. First class in everything they did or tried to do.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed...room was old...bad customer service..not worth it ..!!!!”
Reviews.Author: weatseal
Reviews.Content: Well, me and my hb booked in one of their Roman Tower rooms.... Big dissappointment..very old and the aircon was scary..It had a loud sound during the night..did not sleep well. Furthermore, the tv armoire was not positioned well..we could see all the wirings on the back and almost blocking the bathroom door... So, we called their customer service to fix it but they just told us that it was really ike that...They did not even bother to check the room... Also, they double-charged my credit card..They charged me when I booked it and when we checked in they charged me again..of the cost plus $100 dollars for incidental exp... we complained after learning it...the customer service was not friendly..my hb has to shout on them just to listen to our complain...but until now they haven't credited back my credit card... It was not worth it for the price and for the hassle...we will never stay on this hotel anymore...shame on them!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Roman Gods would even love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rocko11
Reviews.Content: We had a party of 5 and 3 had never been to Vegas before. I wanted to make sure that they enjoy everything Vegas has to offer so I booked Caesars Palace. I like the location, center of strip, and the price was reasonable. I booked the trip through Expedia and originally had rooms in the Classic Towers. After reading reviews on tripadvisor, I knew that it would be wise to upgrade. Upon arrival I requested an upgrade and we were put in the Palace Towers(with tip only). The difference was like night and day. The rooms in the Palace Towers are fantastic and very comfortable. Our view was over looking the pool and it was good, even with construction. To me the construction is part of progress, so you just have to deal with alittle inconvience. The food and drink by the pool was somewhat expensive but it is the same wherever you stay on the strip. You do have to get out there fairly early because they will run out of chairs as the day goes on! Once construction ends there will be alot more room. The casino could have been laid out better, but once you get familiarized, it gets easier to navigate. It would also be better to have some lower minimums on some tables. Every kind of restaurant is available. Shop-a-holics would also feel right at home. You don't ever have to leave this hotel if you don't want to. Everybody loved Caesars and would come back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, a real shame!!!”
Reviews.Author: tamparkinson
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Vegas a number of times for leisure and business, I have stayed in Caesars palace in 2007 and had a wonderful time. On this occasion I went with my husband and parents, brother and family and said that Ceasars had been a really nice place to stay so we all booked in! The location of Caesars is ideal, right in the middle of the strip. The only negative point is that if you have problems with walking it does not have a sky train station, however there is one about 15mins walk away. The reception was busy as Vegas always is however there were only two people checking in at 1700. We booked the three rooms together and asked for them to be on the same floor, however the reception said they were unable to do this. We took a room on the floor below. Once at the rooms none of our card keys worked and we had to take them all back to reception to be re-programmed. The rooms themselves were a nice size and had everything you could need. However all our rooms had little problems. We had no batteries in our remote, no robes and no shower gel. My parents room had no slippers, three of the spotlights in bathroom out of order. My brothers had no toiletries and no toilet roll. The rooms were however clean. As the week went we had to ask reception for toiletries when we needed them, rather than them just being replaced by house keeping. It is not the cheapest hotel, but was still a mid-range and from previous stays I expected so much more!! The hotel buffet breakfast was probably the worst meal we had in Vegas. We arrived at 0900 to find tables as far as the eye could see of dirty crockery. Adventurely after the table had been cleared around us we ordered our coffee and juice. The coffee was warm and with no sugar on the table we took a bowl from another empty table as there were no servers around to ask. When one of the servers did arrive they told us those sugars were not for us and we would have to find our own server to get sugar! When we went up for food there was little left, and it was all cold and not particularly nice! We did not return to the Ceasars Buffet, instead we walked up to Treasure Island which was a pleasant stroll at that time of the morning. I am coming back to Vegas next month and staying at Treasure Island which I much prefer! All in all I was so disappointed with what use to be a truely fabulous hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Vacation! DCN in Texas”
Reviews.Author: DoraTexas
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Ceasars Palace. We usually vacation in Las vegas twice a year and have stayed at several other strip hotels. This was one of the best vacations we have had in Las Vegas. We checked in on June 10th around 7:30pm. The room was not available due to issues with the room key computer system not working. The front desk personnel were so sweet and apologetic. They offered to assign the room and have security meet us at the assigned room in 30 minutes. We chose to wait it out and enjoy the exciting atmosphere. In around 15 minutes we were told the system was working and we were assigned a beautiful room in the Augustus Tower. The beds were so comfortable and the strip view was amazing! We both had great luck on the slot machines (my husband enjoyed the craps table) the drink service was quick and friendly. We cannot say enough about the friendly staff we encountered. We had a wonderful vacation and look forward to returning again in July to celebrate my birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a couple days”
Reviews.Author: Sanmanz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Caesars for 5 days and our room was comped so I can't talk about price. Let's start with the good, Check in is fast if you're a platinum member We needed an extra bed cuz (of the room change) and they were at the room with the bed before we even put out bags down The cleaning staff was friendly and gave us extra towels whenever we asked. The waitresses were nice and prompt The location Variety of places to eat Now the bad If you're not a platinum member and you arrive at the wrong time of day, you're gonna wait in a line The pool is ordinary, just pools and lots of construction going on around you The food is very overpriced even in the "food court" For a slot player, the casino is small and doesn't have alot of options This is not a kid friendly hotel When we checked in I didn't get the room I booked,in the Forum Tower (hence the extra rollaway bed) The service at the Total Rewards booth was rude The room towers are far from check in Now that being said, would I pay for this hotel? Probably not. Would I go back? Maybe if I were without my kids. (comped) This year we've stayed in The Bellagio, Paris and MGM so I'm comparing Caesars to them. I'll put it third. Piece of advice, always use your players card, and if you're a party of 6, like we were, go to the front desk and check out the prices of limos to the airport home. It's cheaper than 2 cabs, because in Vegas you can't put more than 5 people in a cab, even if its a mini van. I give Caesars a 2.5 only because the beds are soo comfy and the rooms we had were awesome and the shopping is great.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: JennieD82
Reviews.Content: Well, we booked this with Lowcostvegas.com, and then read reviews about the rooms etc you end up with when booking through them which definitely worried me a little. We got there in the morning and the room wasn't ready (but it did say you couldn't check in til 1pm, so we didn't think it would be) and left our bags with concierge and went off for a wander down the strip. Came back at 1 and was told the room still wasn't ready, so we waited another 20 minutes, and was told it still wasn't ready, but they would put us in a different room to make up for it. We got there and it was fantastic, the room was immaculate, two double beds, the view was amazing (got half the mountains and the other half was the strip). The customer service was brilliant, especially since we had booked through that website, I thought they would possibly be a bit off, but they treated us like we had paid for the penthouse suite or something. I would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location For Our Stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MexicaliRose_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Las Vegas during Memorial Day weekend, May 22nd through the 27th at Caesar’s, which was our first trip. (Well actually it was almost 30 years for me, so I might as well say it was my first trip!) We had a choice for any comped room in the HET properties, so we decided to stay at Caesar’s for the location, and pool facilities. I must say, I was not disappointed with the hotel, nor was I totally satisfied. It was okay, but I would probably stay somewhere else next time we go. We arrived Friday night, landing about 10:00pm. We got our car, and proceeded to WalMart to buy a coffee pot. (They actually charge per night for a coffee pot, so we bought one for $10.00 and left it in the room when we checked out.) The walk from the self park to check in seemed endless. Yes, this hotel is enormous! I thought people were exaggerating, or didn’t like to walk, but they really weren’t kidding! My suitcase handle broke during transit, so it was difficult trying to drag the suitcase on the carpeting throughout the casino trying to find the registration desk. By the time we got to the hotel, it was already 12:00 midnight (3:00 am EST), so maybe I was a little tired and testy too. After doing the research on Trip Advisor, I reserved the Forum Tower above the Classic Room, and was a little apprehensive that we would lose this room due to the late check-in, especially since it was comped. But to our surprise, they up-graded us to the Palace Towers, 20th floor. The room was okay, had a nice unobstructed view, and we still received our requests of king bed/smoking. The bathroom was large, with a Jacuzzi tub, but we never used it. The employees were very friendly, going out of their way to say good morning and chitchat a bit. I have no complaints about the staff and housekeeping. The thing that I really did not care for, was how the hotel nickel and dimes it’s customers. I already mentioned the coffee maker, which annoyed me a little, but when we checked in they told us about the amenities/stocked refrigerator in the room. They said that everything is scanned, and even if you just pick something up and look at it, your room will be charged. Needless to say, we steered way away from all of these items for fear of knocking something down! I read this before on one of the reviews, but still, it was a bit disconcerting. They also charge per day to use the gym, but with all of the walking we did, the gym was not needed. Hotel Internet was also charged by the day, but my BF has an air card, so we did not need to purchase this. Since we did not pay for the room, I shouldn’t complain about the extra charges. But had we paid regular price for the room, I would not have been happy at all! Both my BF and I did not care for the Casino at this hotel. It seems there are two areas for gambling, one area was mainly tables with some slot machines placed around, and the other area was the slot machine area. Neither my BF nor I play the table games; we play the slots and my BF’s favorite is Keno. But at Caesar’s, they did not have the Keno machine he likes, so we spent most of our time out of the hotel. There was something about the layout neither one of us liked, and when I spoke to other people, they also felt the same. We spent a lot of time at Bill’s, which was right across the street. Kind of a locals type of place in the middle of the strip, and fun. For all the time we spent there, I only saw Big Elvis’ show once, at its tail end, but I think I would have really enjoyed seeing the whole thing. It was quite entertaining! The 99 cent Margaritas were pretty good too! Even though I picked this hotel for its pool area, we did not use it at all. In fact, we didn’t even look at it! I read that part of the pool area was under construction. With that in mind, coupled with the occupancy at the hotel, I thought the pool area would be wall-to-wall people, and not very relaxing. But Vegas is not a place to relax! We were on the go constantly, and it was a good thing I brought comfortable walking shoes. I think the best thing about the hotel was the location. It was centrally located between the Bellagio, and the Mirage. The Forum Shops are connected, although we never walked through them. We rented a car, but hardly used it. I don’t think we would get a car next time, unless we leave the city. The traffic was terrible; I think I could walk to most places faster. The last day we planned to go to the Lake Mead area, but found out that same day President Obama was staying at our hotel, which made for an even more chaotic atmosphere, and decided not to give up our prime parking spot. It must have been fate that we couldn’t go, because my BF won the jackpot at Keno at the Bellagio! One day we drove to Fremont Street (the old Las Vegas), and I loved it! They are celebrating Summer of Love, the 60’s. Blood, Sweat and Tears played during the afternoon, and they will have other relatively well known bands from the 60’s playing there throughout the summer. They also had another band playing 60’s rock, along with a jazz musician, and probably others that I missed. The light show was spectacular! I couldn’t describe it, but it was of course 60’s themed, and made the visit to Fremont worth the trip. That, and the 99 cent shrimp cocktails we had for lunch at one of the casinos. All in all, we had a really good time in Vegas. I did a lot of research, thanks to everyone’s input on Trip Advisor, so we were prepared with a list of things to do and see. We didn’t have the time to do and see everything, and at times I felt I was on sensory overload, with only 5-6 hours of sleep. I’m glad it was just my BF and me, because I think with more people, it would be too confusing, trying to coordinate times and desires. We spent about 4 full days there, and probably another day would have been good for us, being that it was our first trip. I guess we will have to plan another trip for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying there if only for the spa and location.”
Reviews.Author: BRose007
Reviews.Content: We just back from our first trip to Vegas. This is a beautiful hotel, but the service could be better. After we had waited in a very long line to check in, one desk clerk beckoned us to her station, only to walk away. So we were just standing there - there were a few guys in suits walking around behind the desk, not doing anything - certainly not offering to help. When someone finally did help us, they told us our room wasn't ready, but they had some upgrades available for an extra cost (of course). I wish we had taken her up on that, but I'll get to that later. Anyway, she wouldn't even pre-register us. We had to drop off our bags at the bell stand, then 45 minutes later, go stand in the long line again. The room (in the Roman Tower) was a good size, but a little tired. The white tile in the bathroom needs replacing, or at least the grout needs to be bleached. The carpet was coming loose at the edges in several places. The hairdryer in the room may as well have been someone with emphysema blowing on my hair, for all the power it had. And the shower - only a small soapdish for shelving. I had to put shampoo, conditioner, razor on the floor. The breakfast buffet at Cafe Lago was disappointing. Definitely go across to the Bellagio or Paris for their buffet. Casino: the dealers - except for the girls in the Pussycat Dolls casino, looked and acted miserable. Pool: lots of construction going on, but that didn't really affect our experience there. Other things did, though: very slow service at the pool bar- they seemed to be understaffed. We had a very hard time finding lounge chairs. We could have spent God-knows-how-much on a sunbed or cabana, but we were on a budget. We ended up finding two chairs that were not even next to each other. That wouldn't have bothered me so much, except for the fact that no one ever asked us for our name, room key, or anything to prove we were hotel guests. I wonder how many of the people taking up the lounge chairs had no business being there in the first place. Spa: The only reason I'd go back to this hotel. Qua Baths and Spa is amazing! Impeccable service, gorgeous facility. Be sure to take your bathing suit if you're modest, though. The amazing whirpool baths are bathing-suit optional. I enjoyed the herbal steam room, followed by the arctic ice room. Greg gave me the best massage I've ever had. He really understood what kind of pressure I needed, and where I needed the most work. Awesome. Ask for him! Another cool thing is all the toiletries they provide for your after-treatment freshening up. All you need to bring is your make-up - they have everything else. Cool spa gift shop, too - with reasonably priced merchandise. All in all, the spa and the location keep this from being a bad review. We chose Caesars because if its central location on the Strip, and that definitely made a difference for us.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience in a Palace Deluxe room”
Reviews.Author: sfman38
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience staying on a Hotwire-booked trip at Caesar's. I arrived at check-in around 1:30. I was told the official check-in time had not begun, but the woman at the front desk said she was able to find a room for me. She did not mention Hotwire, and gave me my key and directed me toward the Palace Tower. I was very pleasantly surprised to see I had been given a Palace Deluxe room. The room is very spacious for a non-suite, I would guess around 550 sq ft. The king-size bed I requested was very comfortable. A lounge chair and couch are provided, and they really add some comfort to the room. The desk is where I worked on my computer the little I had to, and it has a beautiful oval mirror above it. High-speed internet is $13, no surprise, and they do not offer wireless internet, at least in the Palace Tower. The television in the room is adequate, though I would have expected a bit more. It's a 26-inch LCD tv that did not display HD channels. The channel selection was good. The bathroom is incredible. A giant square mirror rests over two golden sinks, with a beautiful and deep tub to the right. There is a separate shower area which I appreciated, and the toilet is in a small room by itself. No tv in the bathroom. The bathroom's marble floors were the best part. The view from my window was of the incredible pool area below. Unfortunately, the pool was currently under construction so I had a good view of that. However, under normal circumstances, the view from my room would be superb, and I still enjoyed it myself. One negative thing about the room I can say is that it is not well lit, even during the daytime. I had all the lights and lamps on, and the blinds on the window fully open, and it was still rather dark in my room. This is pretty typical of many hotel rooms, but it's something I always notice. There is a fully-stocked minibar that, not surprisingly, is very expensive. There are also some chocolates, snacks, and beauty kits that you can take from the room, which are very expensive as well. A fair warning - I picked up several of these snacks and items to examine the contents. I discovered at check-out that there are sensors where the items are kept to tell the hotel what you have taken. Even though I am confident I put everything back in its place, upon checkout my bill showed two of the items. I told them I had not taken them from the room and they promptly removed them from the bill. The casino at Caesar's is very good. I do not play many slots, but prefer poker, and Caesar's has one of the best poker rooms on the strip, if not the best. They have a pretty good selection of high- and low-level games throughout the casino, though I had some trouble finding a blackjack game during the middle of the day that wasn't a $25 minimum. As stated before, I had the minor problem at checkout, but other than that it was fine. The lines were short for me both checking in and out, and even during a peak check-in time (around 4:30) I only saw a line of about four people. I was very pleased with Caesar's, especially the room I got for the price I paid. I would gladly stay there again. It is a cut above the other 4-star hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Ceasar's is disappointing in comparison to same or lower priced hotels”
Reviews.Author: RobLacroix
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Ceasar's Palace with a group of guys down in Vegas for a bachelor party. We were not traveling on a budget and frankly, without our women, we were more tolerant to problems. Here is honest balanced feedback of the hotel (can't stand people that find no positives): Check-in: Horrible. We arrived on Thursday night at 10PM and still waited 35 minutes due to the fact that there were only 3 people at the front desk. As well, we were told that there were tons of rooms with King sized beds available, but none with two beds. After ten minutes of explaining that non-gay guys on a bachelor party don't want to sleep with each other, we were told that there were some rooms that were vacant, and a rush could be put on them with housekeeping. Why would they not try to clean rooms with two beds earlier in the day to make them available? Anyway, we were told would need to come back in 2 hours. When we did, we had to wait another 25 minutes in the VIP line. The guys ahead of of in line were completely upset about the room they had been given and the guy behind us told us that he was livid with what he had been given. This validated for us that numerous people were having difficulty. On a positive note, check-out was a breeze, however the hotel was completely inflexible on having a late checkout....on a sunday! haha Rooms: Huge disappointment.
