We were given 3 rooms in the Roman Tower and they were 3 star quality. The beds and furniture were old and tired (the pictures on their website were definitely airbrushed to perfection as the reality is much different when you walk in the room). The bathroom would have been comparable to that of a motel.....and the clothes closet was located within the bathroom (have never seen this before). There were no minibar/fridges in the rooms. There really was no view of the strip from any of the rooms. Instead, we were staring at a bunch of pipes and maintenance buildings. Pool: Horrible. Not even close to enough pool lounge chairs for the size of the hotel. We had to grab single chairs from all over and start grouping them together in one location, but pool security got upset at that. When we told them that their lack of lounge chairs was ridiculous, they backed off and said they would allow it. There were hundreds of people that had no chairs and left the pool area frustrated or sat on the cement. On our second day, we decided to pay $30 each to go into the "Venus" adult pool area and avoid the deck chair hassle. Unbelievably, we got in there and there were no deck chairs at all. Basically, they wanted us to pay $1000 for a private cabana or sit on the cement on the edge of the pool. Shouldn't a $30/person pool entry fee implicitly mean that you would get a simple pool chair? Ridiculous! We ended up exiting the Venus pool to once again move a bunch of single chairs by the main pool and lost the $30/each. Location: Only good aspect of the hotel. It is right in the middle of the strip and there is some great shopping (The Forum Shops) attached to it. Service: Pool bar service was horrible. I felt bad for the waitresses because they were doing their best, but there was only two of them that we could see serving the entire pool of hundreds. We ordered large margaritas ($20 each) on the first day and it took 45 minutes for them to get to us. The lobby restaurant was poor as well. We went there for breakfast on the last morning. We were given our drinks and then it took them 20 minutes to come and take the rest of our order. Sidenotes: The Casino was fine, but you need to be ready to play higher wager tables. We ran into a few Vegas regular gamblers who were staying at other hotels and gambling at Ceasar's. We asked them why and they told us that Ceasar's used to be a great hotel, but since their new management took over they have let the hotel spiral downwards and become chincy. We couldn't have agreed more. All in all, you can get comparable prices for other hotels like MGM Grand, The Hotel @ Mandalay Bay, The Mirage....and fairly close prices for The Bellagio, The Venetian, Planet Hollywood, etc. The majority of us have previously stayed in Las Vegas at all of these hotels. Even The Luxor rooms are better than what you get at Ceasar's. TAKE MY ADVICE and stay at a comparably priced hotel that will have nicer rooms, a better pool, and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DenverScott63
Reviews.Content: First time to Las Vegas for my wife and I. We stayed four nights in the Palace Tower and had a great trip! The room was very comfortable with a jacuzzi tub and shower. Loved the Pool! I would have preferred it if the construction around the pool were finished but it didn't damper our enjoyment of the facilities. I can't wait to go back and see the finished Garden of the Gods Pool Oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: gatorgirl941
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars for the second time earlier this week. We had a room in the Augustus Tower with a great view over looking the Bellagio fountains on the 33rd floor. Overall the room was great: big bathroom with a tv, spa tub, walk in shower, closet, mini bar, comfortable beds, etc. There were a few spots in the room that were stained. Location was great, very close to everything we wanted to do. Free entry into Pure nightclub (worth it to avoid the huge line). We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of ancient rome in the middle of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NJdudette
Reviews.Content: Once again it was time for me to head out to Vegas for a little relaxation and for this trip I chose to stay at Caesars Palace due to the fabulous rate I received for the Memorial Day holiday weekend. I wasn’t expecting it to be too crowded due to all the economic reviews I’ve been hearing, but I was sorely mistaken. Valet parking was PACKED when I arrived at 10PM and it was closed to all but Diamond and Seven Star members. I remembered there was valet parking in back by the parking garage and headed back there. No crowds and I zipped right in. The downside is the long walk to registration. When I arrived at the front desk there were only a couple of people ahead of me and it gave me time to figure out if I wanted to give the $20 “bribe” a shot. I was undecided and I always wonder if I’d come off looking like a fool. I waited till the last moment and decided the heck with it. The clerk was real friendly and he informed that as a Platinum member I could have stood in a quicker line (which actually wasn’t moving so quickly). As of April 1, 2009 I was no longer a Platinum member and had been busted back down to Gold due to my lack of gambling over the past 15 months. My online Harrah’s account has me listed as a Gold member, but my reservation had me pegged as a Platinum member – go figure <shrug>. It all worked to my benefit because he upgraded me to the 25th floor in the Palace Tower. Granted it’s NOT the nicest tower, but it was close to the pool and I had a half-way decent view of the strip. The walk to the Palace Tower from the front desk is a bit of a hike, but it’s not too horrible. I arrived at my room and was pleasantly surprised – the room had been recently updated (1+ year or so), decent sized, and the décor was modern with a touch of class. The room’s most unique feature is its dual marble bathroom, united by a walk-in shower and featuring an oversized spa tub. The room was clean upon my arrival and throughout my stay. The room came with the following amenities: LDC Television, bedside clock radio with CD player, & MP-3 hook-up, Gilchrest & Soames bath amenities, wet/dry mini bar, 2 waffle weave robes, and an in-room safe. One thing I did want to comment about was the great job the maids did in keeping everything clean because many of the hotel guests did their best to trash the place. Each day the hallway was spotless, but by the next morning people had trashed it. Garbage thrown on the floor, cigarette butts snubbed out on the wall and flicked to the floor, not to mention the amount of empty beer bottles tossed about. People, I realize you’re on vacation, but does that mean you have to act like a bunch of slobs??? Off my soap box… As you can see from my pictures, there is a great deal of construction going on around the pool area which was a bit problemsome. I didn’t find the noise to be an issue, but the lack of chairs was a problem. I’m not sure if this is always an issue, but 15-20 minutes after the pool opened, all the chairs were taken. For the next few hours all you see are people walking around searching for a chair. During my stay, the hotel was extremely rigid in regards to when the pool opened. People were not allowed out into the pool area until 9:00 AM on the dot. Therefore, that meant people started forming a line at 8:30 AM. A word to the wise, forget about grabbing a towel right away. Go grab your chair and then head back to get a towel after most people have gone through the line or otherwise you’ll miss out on the prime real estate around the pool. Drink service was so so – I chose instead to walk up to the tiki bar and grab a brew rather than waiting for the waitress to come back around. The wait staff was working hard, they just couldn't keep up with all the demand. All in all I had a nice trip and would recommend Caesar’s Palace to many of my friends. It’s centrally located, nice pool area (when the construction is completed), nice restaurant and a large gaming area. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid until Building works are completed”
Reviews.Author: julieguernsey
Reviews.Content: May/June 2009 - is was my 4th trip back to Las Vegas.. This hotel was really nice although a bit dated.. This hotel is going through lots of development and will be massive once complete. Towers are being built and this is causing lots of noise and debris to fly around, especially around the pool areas.. I have uploaded 2 pics. Pool 1 was closed a few days due to the windy weather. Pool 2 was open and we ended up getting covered in building debris and grit in mour eyes. I would not recommend staying here until the building works are completed. Once the building works are complete this will probably be one of the best value hotels to stay in the center of the strip..

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace has lost some appeal”
Reviews.Author: jodmendez
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the deluxe towers. Very beautiful room with a full mini-bar, flat screen TV and a jumbo jet tub. The room had an ok view of the strip, but only from an angle not offering great views. The elevators to the towers were right in front of the pool entrance making it very convenient for swimming on the warm desert days. The next afternoon we visited Caesar’s Neptune Pool. The main pool offered a stunning circular wading area with many fountains. Unfortunately it was very windy and chilly so swimming was not called for. Another unfortunate event is the construction going on at Caesar’s. During the week they are rebuilding around the pool. During this time you will be deaf from the loud noises and expect to get flying debris in your eyes, hair, clothing and the numerous amount of it in the pool. So BEWARE! http://www.joreviews.com/travel/las-vegas-june-2009

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: WallyinPortHuron
Reviews.Content: I can't beleive all the whiners expecting something for nothing i.e. upgrades. We've stayed at CP over 30 times, usually checking in at the airport, and have had very few minor problems. When we've had a problem it's been taken care of promptly. A propery the size of CP is going to have it's problems but we always make the best of it and always return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Flaming
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Augustus Tower, which is an easy uncomplicated walk from the Front Desk, and easy to get to the Strip. Th room itself was exactly as pictured on Caesars website. Cleaning staff was very good, and bellman service was prompt. Eat in the Casino food court, it has a good variety, and it's alot cheaper than the restaurants. Although Caesar's Palace is huge, once you get to know the layout, it is very easy to navigate around. My only complaint is that we had to wait until 5:00 pm for our room to be ready.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great security and housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaCindy
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 45th floor of the Forum tower from 5/27-6/1/09. Michael checked us in with no wait and was very nice. The room was very clean and housekeeping did a great job of keeping it this way during the whole stay. We noticed security walking our floor during the day and night which made us feel secure. The pools are the best in Vegas and the pool hostesses made sure the guests had lounge chairs. We are Diamond players with Harrahs and we frequent many of their properties throughout the U.S. but the room in the Forum tower is the best. We can't wait to come back to Caesars!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I thought it would be!”
Reviews.Author: TheAirmeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars Palace in April, booked through Expedia. The only glitch was room wasn't ready, so we stayed in Forum Towers, which was newly remodeled, beautiful rooms. Huge Roman walk-in shower with rainshower sprayer on ceiling AND on wall. Sleek flat screen tv and our luggage was brought up very quickly. Rooms kept immaculately clean, very comfortable bed and short distance from our room to elevators. Just walking around there was amazing and beautiful. Cheesecake Factory in Forum Shops is a must. I highly recommend Caesars Palace!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location , no free upgrade but did it anyway , view was grrreat”
Reviews.Author: 3oldgals
Reviews.Content: 3RD TIME IN VEGAS , CHECK IN WAS GOOD , DECIDED TO UPGRADE AS 3 FEMALES NEED LOTS OF SPACE . THE VIEW OVER THE BELLAGIO FOUNTAINS WAS WORTH EVERY PENNY ! Facilities excellent . location of room (augustus tower great ) would recommend it , bit pricey but got everything we expected for the money. If you want to indulge yourself go to caesars ! vini vidi vici ! Even the president turned up for the night ! Grand canyon tour a must do .

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Vally29
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas. We had booked into the Bellagio for a couple of nights but our room was next to a construction site and we didn't like being woken by jack hammers and noisy reversing vehiles at 5.30 am so decided to stay at Caesars. We got an excellent internet rate and an upgrade when we stayed for 3 nights, check in was prompt and check out easy - we even got to keep our room key as a keepsake. The room was nice and quiet and the only problem we had was finding our way to our room when we left the hotel, the place is enormous. Perhaps the idea is to keep you in the place which would be no hardship as there is so much to do and see. We didn't even get time to use the pools which looked very inviting. We would definately stay here again. VJ Perth Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Part of Family History”
Reviews.Author: MCohen
Reviews.Content: I took my mom here. Check in was busy and she asked the floor manager what line should we stand in. Truth be told my grandfather used to gamble there every day. The staff knew him. We were upgraded to a suite. It was wonderful. The only downside is the walking and the buffet. However, we got a comp after explaining. Caesers Palace is Las Vegas and I love staying there. If you want to stay at Wynn or Encore expect "pretty things" but no value.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Caesar's Palace, Las Vegs”
Reviews.Author: LOUBABY52
Reviews.Content: CAesar's Palce may be big and Luxury hotel but they forgooten the simple things make people comung back. No shuttle service to other hotels and attractions. You have walk to Harrah's to get a shuttle. They give you directions to Harrah's but the long way to get there. 20 minute walk through the hotel forum shops. You only had to take a 7 minute walk through the main entrance. It seems they want to discourage you from leaving Caesar's. Buffet was a joke for breakfast for 2 at the buffet cost $38 when you can to the Flamingo for $21. I go to Vegas every 4 months. Was looking forward to my stay at Caesar's but was disappointed. If you are a average person go to Rio Suites they treat you great no matter what status you are in VIP,Rich or just an average person who want to have fun. Caesar' Palace SUCKS. Laverne

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: rowdyburns22
Reviews.Content: I recently returned to Las Vegas for a business trip, and luckily stayed at Caesar's Palace. Check-in was quick, as I checked-in around 9 pm and there was not a line. The place is huge, so it took a bit to find the elevator bank leading to my room. I stayed in the Forum Tower and had a really nice room. It was pretty big, clean, had a large flat screen Sony TV in the bedroom and a tv built into the bathroom mirror. The A/C worked great, but I didn't have much of a view. I checked out around noon, and there was a 15 minute line. There are several dining options in the hotel. In particular, I ate at Mesa Grill which is reasonably priced and offers very good food. It is actually one of Bobby Flay's restaurants, and he is a renouned chef. Overall, I think this is a nice hotel. It may be a little for expensive than others, but it is worth the money if you want a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “We were very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: landshark59
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Las Vegas last weekend for the Buffet concert. We chose to stay at Caesars because we got a great price with US Airways through Costco. After reading other reviews I was prepared to do what I had to do to get an upgrade out of the Roman Tower. To my surprise our room was in the Palace Tower, which proved to a great location. Since it was so hot, we took advantage of the pool and this is the closest tower to the pool. Our room was clean, quiet and we had no problem with any employees. The location was perfect, as we were right across the street from Margaritavile and it was easy to get the monarail at the Flamingo.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace, Las Vegas, May 2009”
Reviews.Author: travelermontana
Reviews.Content: We had a mixed experience with Caesar's during a visit from May 9-13th. We were making out first trip to Caesars (we usually stay at MGM Grand) and were there to celebrate our 25th anniversary. I checked many postings here before we left and was concerned about the situation at the pool and the construction. They had two pools open but for our intents only one since the other was "european" (topless). The pool was very crowded since it was the only one for the hotel, but worse than that was the construction that surrounded the pool on 2 of 4 sides. The noise and unsightly view lowered the satisfaction of the pool time a great deal. It was just plain ugly to look at. In addition we were hoping for the nice upgrade offers that we had read about, especially in light of it being our anniversary. We had notified the hotel ahead of time of this fact. There were three couples in our party (all arriving seperately). One couple got a free upgrade with little effort at all (and no tip required). The second got an upgrade for $40 a night. We were offered an upgrade (with a tip) for $50 a night. We declined their offer. This left a bad taste in our mouth. The people working the casino were very nice for the most part, and the store employees were very nice and helpful. The front desk just took away all the good will of the others. We will not go back to Caesars. Next stop, either back to MGM or maybe try the Mirage. Caesar's, not so much......

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here very much”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Pie
Reviews.Content: This is now the third time that we have stayed in Caesars Palace so you can see that we do like it. I feel that I should now give feedback to counteract some of the negative comments that others have left (although I do not dispute that they received poor service.) We booked the room through an online booking agency and the voucher said that the room would be 'allocated on arrival'. When we arrived I asked how much it would cost for an upgrade as I wanted to stay in the Palace Tower (where we had stayed the last time). The receptionist said that the room we had been allocated was in that tower anyway! I felt that we got a fantastic deal - the room had 2 interconnecting bathrooms, was beautifully furnished and was spotlessly clean. The hotel is big and impersonal but so are many of the other hotels in Las Vegas. The situation in the middle of the strip is excellent and you are within walking distance of many of the other large hotels. We also toured around Arizona and for our last night returned to Las Vegas as we were flying out the following morning. This time I booked on the Caesars Palace website and got a deal for a hotel room and 2 tickets for Elton John. This time the room was in the newly refurbished Forum Tower and it was very nice as well, although I still prefer the Palace Tower. This room was convenient for the show as it is just across the Forum Casino from the theatre. Would I stay here again if I went to Las Vegas? Yes - I personally have always found it to be very good value with lovely accommodation. The only disappointment was that the swimming pools closed early so don't leave it too late if you want to go for a swim!!

Reviews.Title: “gone downhill. stay away”
Reviews.Author: travelle121
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Caesars. Having stayed there many times before and always had good service, it became clear that they have gone very far downhill. The room was filthy. The bedding was dirty, the couch full of stains and looked like it was 30 years old. The carpet wasn't even vacuumed. There was food and nuts laying on the carpet. The aircon was unbearably noisy. We switched room when I complained about the filth and aircon. The new room was marginally better, but the bedding and furniture was still dirty (I got extra blankets to sit on the couch as it looked terrible). Then it got worse. The aircon was blowing smoke into the room at night so it was like sleeping in a nightclub. The plumbing was leaking in the bathroom and getting worse. We called 3 times with no one coming to fix it after many promises. Eventually, I told housekeeping that we had to leave to a show but that they should sort it out as it was now running onto the carpet. They assured us they would sort it out asap. When we came back to the room about 4 hours later, the whole carpet was flooded and the outside corridor was also flooded. They did however fix the plumbing. They simply left towels on the carpet in the room which were by then sopping wet. They didn't bother to move us or even make the offer to move us. I mean come on, how can you leave the room looking like that when your plumbing is busted. We checked out the next day. When we complained - they apologised only when I asked for someone that was more senior but did nothing to make up for it. Never ever heard from them since although they requested all our details. There are much better hotels in Vegas for the same price. Generally, barring the chambermaids, the staff at the hotel were arrogant and very unhelpful. I travel a lot to some crappy places around the world and to be honest have never ever come across such bad service as at this hotel on this experience. This hotel has become an embarassment. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: slw95756
Reviews.Content: A huge and magnificantly decorated property, but not the world-reknowned resort I was anticipating. The service and cleanliness were mediocre. All pools are open but construction continues overhead of two pools. The lounges around the topless pool were fantastic, but having to pay an entrance fee as a guest was not appreciated, and the loud hardcore rap music prevented relaxation. Finding our way around was a chore since no decent property map was provided and getting help was difficult. Not worth the weekend pricing, but a great deal for weeknights. Other resorts such as the Mirage or Venetian may actually provide a more pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed the experience!”
Reviews.Author: Projections2001
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of a 4-night comp w/2 tix to see Elton John. Brought my 16-year old. Had a "standard" room upon check in. Paid to upgrade to Augustus tower for $60/night. Room itself was quite nice,clean, well appointed w/great view of Bellagio Fountains below. Would have been nicer if the windows were clean. Bathroom was swank, w/jacuzzi tub and TV. Kid loved that! The only faulty issue was w/the glass-walled shower. Water kept leaking at the bottom of the foundation, leave over an inch of water. Kid went skidding across the bathroom! Maintenance tried several times to fix, but the problem persisted throughout the stay. Asked for a fridge. After it didn't arrive 3 hours later, called back to cancel. Didn't see any point in paying for it. However, they brought one in the next day, comp'd. Had also called for dry-cleaning pickup that never arrived. Front desk staff very pleasant. Had a great meal at the Noodle Restaurant. However, if you dine at the cafe in the main lobby, don't go for the surf 'n turf as I had to send mine back. I've had leather shoes softer than the steak! Valet was fine until Friday, where it turned into a madhouse...and only Platinum Rewards members could use it then. Slots are not as loose as Flamingo's. Concert was frikkin AMAZING...with two of the best seats in the house! Returning to Vegas in July, but still on the fence about where to stay. Caesar's is a sure bet...but have thought about trying out the other Harrah properties.

Reviews.Title: “Gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: Prestoni
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times before and have always felt it was about average for what they charge. It is an older property so its age is evident in many places. This time was one disaster after another. First we reserved this six months in advance as I was a speaker at a conference being held in the hotel. They immediatly charged my room when we placed the reservation as I recieved a receipt--that was alittle strange since normally it is a reservation and not a room purchase. Any way, several months later my bookkeeper notifies me we have another charge for the same room. They had charged twice. I had my staff get with them and finally we were ablke to get a credit issued before I arrived at the hotel. I had a long drive from a client location in California to Las Vegas so I get in at 10. My staff had reassured me it was a non-smoking king which is what they always order. After going through the pain of crossing through the casino to register (what a hassle but normal in these hotels) I get my key and we head back across the casino to the room in one of the towers. As soon as I open the room I could smell the stench of cigarette smoke. We wlak in and it looks like someone had laid on the bed and there were three cigarette butts in an ash tray. We were in a smoking room that was dirty (someone had removed all the amenities in the bathroom) so they must have come up after the room was cleaned and conducted their business on the phone while chain smoking and took all the amenities on their way out. We called the front desk. We were placed on hold for the longest period of time. They told us they would have someone look into it and call us back. Half an hour later we are still sitting in that stinking room. We call again--and again placed on hold. Finally we are able to speak to a human and they said they had no more available non-smoking rooms. We insisted. They finally found one in a different tower. They instructed us to meet someone over there. When we arrived we were surprised that the guard arrived only minutes after we did since we had expected to wait forever. He said he could let us in but had no keys for us and told us we would have to go all the way back to the front desk to get our keys. What a disappointment but it was now becoming par for this experience. We head into our room which was clean. We wanted to order two ice teas and a piece of cake since we had now been there for an hour. When we called, room service told us it would be another hour before they could have the two teas and piece of cake delivered--see a pattern here. It finally showed up and we got to bed around moidnight with the hopes the next day would be better. I called my staff the next day and told them of the situation and fiasco. My travel coordinator told me he was on the phone with the management and they would send up two keys. I decied to order room service. I was told it would take an hour and a half. Surprised??? Now what--do I wait a long time for my meal or a long time for my keys to be delivered. Finally my coordinator was able to reach someone at Caesars that seemed to care. They gave me a complaint number to dial. She apologized and comped the room. I stressed the poor service and slow service as a systemic issue. Apparently the slow room service is a staffing issue but I believe it, along with the other issues here, reflects poorly on Caesars Palace..

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre92100
Reviews.Content: Huge, huge, huge! Everything is big! the hotel is really nice and my room was big and super comfortable with a jacuzzi, overlooking the strip. It wasn't cheap but for one night it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your walking shoes!”
Reviews.Author: Susieq1047
Reviews.Content: First stay at Caesars' and the only real complaint was the long walks we had and the price of the food. Check in/out was seamless, room was as booked in the Forum Tower. The room was clean with all the amenities as described on the web site. Plasma TV, electronic drapes, TV in the mirror of the bathroom, very comfy bed and high quality linens and more! Housekeeping was very good. The cost of food, even the food court food was expensive. No evening buffet but that is Probably okay because the breakfast and lunch was over priced I thought. We ended up crossing over to Harrahs for our meals. (Not a short hike) Be prepared to walk! The floor plan was confusing. No real short or direct walks from the Forum tower room to the other parts of the property, especially the front of the hotel. Crossing the street was not as easy as it would appear. The Forum shops were very close to the room. A lot of club goers lined up at the clubs each night making it a lively atmosphere. Except for the costly food and the lonnnng walks I liked the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jennipoo82
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Caesar's before and I've always had a decent experience, at least no memorable complaints. A group of 14 of us stayed there last month for a bachelorette party and we just could not believe the terrible service we received. To preface--the bachelorette's mother did the booking and is a regular Caesar's visitor. Upon check-in (at the player's club VIP check-in nonetheless) she was told they were completely booked and the 3 rooms for our party (mom and friend had their own) would be spread out on several floors, unacceptable for a reservation made weeks before. An hour later (at 11p) they finally figured out they could get us a suite in the older tower with 3 rooms adjoining. However the adjoining rooms only had 1 king bed each so we needed 4-5 rollaways to sleep the remaining girls (12 total). Fine, actually it was quite nice when we got there, if a little cheesy. It was definitely older but it had a bar setup and extra bathrooms, which was great for the number of females in close quarters. We were easily satisfied and got to partying. None of the keys worked for the adjoining rooms (the suite itself was really just a massive living room/bar, no beds). A while later "Charles" showed up with our rollaways, 2 of them! We told him we needed several more, AND we needed someone to open up the adjoining rooms. He was very rude, told us he couldn't bring more and couldn't open the rooms. Mind you we'd been there over an hour already and had made the call for service right when we got there. After some coaxing we got him to bring a few more rollaways and open the rooms, when one of our nicer friends went to thank him--was actually even going to tip him after that service!--he walked off in a huff and say "yeah whatever". That was probably the worst of the service we got all weekend, but it was within several hours of arrival so we were even more keen to the crappy stuff that went on the rest of the weekend. Our room was never cleaned unless we asked--we literally had to ask for them to bring up more toilet paper after no one showed up to the room for the first 36 hours and the bathrooms/rooms/suite itself were never actually cleaned, just new towels and toiletries brought. They never got rid of the room service carts, at one point we wheeled out a dirty cart into the hall because we didn't want to see/smell the old food anymore and it sat in the hall in front of our door for 24 hours! Oh, and I had a burnt/tasteless burger at Augustus Cafe that was one of the worst burgers I've ever had, let alone it was $18! I am far from a food complainer, I eat everything and it's especially hard to screw up a burger but it was literally flavorless meat, charred to a crisp (the edges were actually shriveled hard and black). One highlight, we got the BEST server ever at the sushi place, Hyakumi, on our last dinner. She remembered everyone's name in a party of 10, was super helpful, sweet and attentive. We wrote her a glowing comment card (and big tip) but when we asked to speak to the manager to tell her how amazing our server was, she said she was busy and would be right with us...and continued to walk back and forth in front of us several more times saying "just a minute", we finally just left after we realized she probably wasn't going to stop. Maybe if the managerial staff at Caesar's spent just a little more time praising good work, the staff would have more motivation to actually BE good. Overall, I know our collective bad experiences were probably just unfortunate conicidences judging by all the other comments--and like I said I've stayed before and they were pretty okay (I'm really not just a complainer, I mainly just write good reviews on here). But for the price you pay, and all the other great choices in Vegas, you would hope they would go that extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel + free Upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: PackLitely
Reviews.Content: Ceasar's Palace: We were there on a comped room, however, we simply asked the person at check-in if there was an opportunity to upgrade and we were upgraded for free to a suite in the forum towers on the 68th floor - very nice room and bathroom, only problem, is there is no window - where there should be a window was a mirror....weird...but we got used to it! I absolutlely loved CP, I typically stay at the palazzo or venetian when i travel to LV for work, but I would def stay at CP again. Also very good food choices here as well.. The pool area is under construction, but the main pool is open and the sign said construction would be completed in summer 2009 - not sure if that will be on track or not. We did have to arrive at the pool at 9am when it opened to reserve chairs, after reserving our chairs we grabbed breakfast and returned to the pool. Night Clubs: We went to PURE, Poetry, and the Christian Audieger club at TI while we were there, we got tons of passes for other places, but were really worn out after the pool, sightseeing, etc each day. Buffets: We went to the TI buffet one night and to the Mirage another night - I like the Mirage the best, but discovered that I really don't eat enough food to make the buffet worth my $$. The best meal I had was a late night meal at Augustus Cafe in CP - steak and crab legs for $28 bucks - just enough. La Reve: Absolutely loved it. Was not sold out at all. We sat in the splash zone and would do it again - maybe about 10 water drops hit us. was great to make eye contact with the performers. I have seen O and Love as well. I like O better, but La Reve was definitely worth seeing as well. Slots: I hit for $300 on the Reel Winners penny slot in CP and also saw someone hit for $2500 on a penny slot in CP - not much luck other than that, a few bucks here and there with black jack... Wax Musuem - visited this for the 1st time and was really impressed. also they had a 1/2 off admission for mom's on mother's day, i thought that was nice. great photo ops with the celebs!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: LOVINGVEGAS24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars from 4/26 to 5/1/09 and renewed our 25th wedding vows in the Garden. Melissa the wedding planner was outstanding, the salon and spa, meeet my expatations. We have stayed at numerous Harrah's property and have not been disapointed with any except the IP. We had another couple who came with us and just loved Caesars. The trip was out of this world. I recommend Caesars to all.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful everytime we stay here”
Reviews.Author: blackjack6631
Reviews.Content: Ceasers is the best hotel in vegas.we haved stayed several different places and Ceasers is by far the best.staff great.restraunts great.the only bad dining experiance we have ever had is at Raos.We have been here three times in the last year and it gets better every time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars is average”
Reviews.Author: LPass16
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Caesars, found it great location but quite tacky compared to the Bellagio which we stayed in afterwards. The rooms were ok, pool was being extended so we had a view of the bulding work and the tiny pool (as most of the grounds were blocked off for the building). Caesars Shops were excellent and great location for the Bellagio and the Venitian so plenty to do. It was good but if you can afford it, choose the Bellagio over it anytime!.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: denniy
Reviews.Content: stayed from april 30 to may 5. We had a nice room in the augustus tower with king bed and hot tub double sinks and a great view of the belliago fountains ballys and planet hollywood.Room was comped and very clean, maid service was excellent and we won about five thousand on dollar video poker. We would stay here again in a heart beat

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, be prepared to walk”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: This is a huge complex. Be ready to walk. It takes 10 minutes just to walk from the froint desk to your room! Nice pool, good mix of food options. It is in the middle of the strip, so you can access other properties fairly easily. Nice rooms (ours had a jacuzzi), big bathrooms, nice rooms. Never went to the casino, or went to a show here. Staff is OK, but they get a workout with people asking questions.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place for business and exercise”
Reviews.Author: funtraveler37
Reviews.Content: I came here for business. I care nothing for the casino or the shows. Caesars Palace has very few of the amenities you would normally see in a business hotel. 1. There is no desk or table in the room to work from. 2. There is no in-room coffee. 3. The gym is only open from 6 am to 8 pm. My conference lasts roughly from 8 am to 6 pm every day. After the conference, you have to traverse the enromous hotel to your room, change clothes, then traverse it again to go to the gym. Then you're lucky if you have an hour. The hours are simply not long enough. 4. You have to pay $25 per day to use the gym. My company does not compensate me for using the gym. At any other hotel, the gym would be included in the enormous cost of the hotel. Not here. Bottom line is, the rooms are big and beautiful with big beautiful bathrooms, but they cost way more than I would ever spend if the company were not paying for it. I would prefer to have a room and bathroom 1/2 the size, include coffee, include a gym (included in the cost), with hours of say, 5 am to 10 pm or midnight. The food is ridiculously expensive, especially in this ecnomy. If you are thinking about this hotel in Vegas, for your conference, don't. It costs way too much, and your employee will constantly wish she was home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: noey22
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the friendly staff and cleanliness of the hotel. This was my first time staying here as I found an amazing deal on Expedia. I went for 2 nights with 6 of my friends. We had originally booked a room in the FORUM tower, but upon check in I asked if there were any upgrades available, and for $70 per night we were able to get an upgraded room in the AUGUSTUS tower with a jacuzzi bath, 600 square foot, with a view of the Bellagio fountains. It was definitely worth it! One down fall was that the pool area was being renovated and there was some construction, so some styrofoam was flying around. Besides that, upon check in they said our room would be ready in an hour and that they would text me when it was done. They never did this, so we waited three hours to get into our room, which I was not happy about. However, I did ask if they could do something for the inconveneince so they gave me a 25 dollar credit to use at the hotel. I thought that was nice. Overall, amazing hotel, and would definitely reccommend it! It has a great prime location and amazing pool area! They are planning on opening the two other pools in June, so that will make it even better!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: ptodd19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars 4/12-4/16/09 and it was great. Tried the 20.00 trick to upgrade to the Augustus or Palace towers and the clerk gave me back the 20.00 and said it was not necessary she would take care of it. She gave us a room in the Augustus Tower that was fabulous. We checked out the room and then went out to gamble some and when we came back there was a box and note in front of our room door. I had mentioned that we were celebrating by birthday at the end of the month and she sent up a note saying Happy Birthday from Caesars and a leather luggage tag and matching key chain. The service was wonderful and we totally enjoyed Caesar's.

Reviews.Title: “great vegas hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jase430
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ceasers with my wife for 3 days in July 2008 and thoroughly enjoyed it. It was our first time in Vegas ( from Australia) so it was important to be close to the action and Ceasers is! Its location is very central and convenient and the hotel itself was awesome although the staff did let it down on 1 ocassion. Our only regret was that we didnt stay longer but we WILL be back and when we are we will be back at Ceasers for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Our wedding”
Reviews.Author: Smurf_2009
Reviews.Content: We chose to get married at Casears Palace as we loved it so much the first time we stayed there. We got married in the Venus Garden outside, with the weather over there always sunny it's so worth it. Our Wedding Co-ordinator was Melissa and she was excellent. We also arrange our wedding reception in one of the ballrooms as we had 32 members of family joining us. The room looked fantastic and the staff on the night were great. Whilst arranging everything their communication was excellent even with the time difference, they were excellent with emails and replied to my queries within 24 hours. This made everything so much easier. If you forget to do something then they just take care of it for you. The photographer was excellent, professional and friendly. I would definatley recommend getting married at Casears Palace. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “As close to perfect as one could get”
Reviews.Author: tylerheredia
Reviews.Content: I checked into Caesars Palace on 4/12 and was staying comped till 4/17 .Years ago I used to be a gambler at Harrah's in Atlantic City so Caesars was willing to give me 5 free nights. I arrived at 10am and the gold card holders line was already filled with people checking in. I stood in line for about 10 min. A young woman checked me in. I mentioned that I was willing to pay extra for an upgrade. She explained that she could give me a Deluxe room in the Augustine tower for $50 a night extra. I kindly asked what was available for $100 a night. She said she could put me into a 1050 sq ft Royal Suite in the Forum tower. The room was fantastic. It was perfect for me, my wife, and me grandson. We all felt relaxed and comfortable, and the best part was we never got on each others nerves. The room had two minor problems. The LCD TV in the bathroom did not work, and I seemed to have gotten a bad rash on my feet, hands, and elbows from Caesars bedsheets. I think its the detergent that they use. For restaurants I recommend the Plam. I felt it was inexpensive for the quality food we ate.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: turco_fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars for three nights, April 11-14 and had a very enjoyable stay. They let us check in early and our room was very clean - the view wasn't great, but oh well. Caesar's is in a great location right in the center of the strip and we found that we were able to get wherever we needed to go easily. I also thought the service was great, our last night there this crazy couple in the next room started arguing very loudly at like 1 a.m. I called the front desk and within 5 minutes they sent someone up to the room to shush them. One thing I will say is that everything is SUPER expensive, but this isn't unique to Caesar's - I think everything in Vegas is that way. Two large mojitos by the pool cost us like $38! But it seemed like this was the case everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: cavs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay in Vegas, at Caesars. I was there with 7 other family members; celebrating a birthday and a marriage. We arrived late in the evening and were upgraded to rooms in the Palace Tower; twin bathrooms and a jacuzzi, as well as lots and lots of space. My sis and her bf were also upgraded, depsite having checked in a few hours earlier. Coming from the UK, the amount of space in the room was fantastic, as you have to pay through the nose here for good sized rooms. We were very happy with the hotel. We did the breakfast buffet one morning and were very impressed. My husband and I also ate at the Noodle 9 restaurant and were impressed with the food. The Paysard cafe was very nice, perhaps a little pricier than it should have been. All staff were very friendly and we had a great time. Would definitely recommend Casears and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: BobbyG16148
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with another couple stayed from April 8th to the 11th. and it was another fantastic time. We didn't arrive till around 930p and no more than a 10 minute wait to check-in. Even though our rooms were already comped, we were upgraded to a Palace Tower room which was nice. Since we aren't in the room very much, my wife and i didn't care how big or small or what view we had. Was happy that we had quick and easy access to the pool. Despite the changes and construction we were very happy that the pools were even open. Only negative was that despite the 75 degree and sunny day the pool closed at 5p and had last call at 4p. Another negative that we discovered was that most restaurants that we found were closed from 1000a to 1100a. We tried 5 or 6 in the area and couldn't get a meal. So if you want to eat get in before 10 or just wait till after 11. The gambling was successful. Enjoyed most if not all of the dealers, who seemed very professional. They even tried to help some very green blackjack players who were destoying our table with bad plays, knowing that it was costing us money. Overall, we had another great time in Vegas and hope to return sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!! Lots of Fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: castortopp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from Sunday April 5th- Thursday April 9th. We had 4 nights comped in a Forum Tower room. When we arrived at 805am, there was no line at the front desk. I asked how early can we check in? They said if we have a room now we can have it. They had a room and an upgrade too, we were placed in the Palace Tower on the 6th Floor. It over looked a roof and we could see The Mirage, TI and The Venetian. Not too bad!! Our room had a jacuzzi in it which we used once. The room was quiet and very nice. The only issue we had was a minor one, we asked to check out at 130 and all they could do was 1pm. So we had our bags by the Video Poker machines for a half hour, while we played. We tried the Cafe Lago Buffet for breakfast and we were disappointed. We also ate at the Cypress Market food court a few times which had a nice selection of food. We tried Serendipity 3 and got some late night snacks. We had a great stay. We would love to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... horrendous service!"”
Reviews.Author: pyromaniaq
Reviews.Content: As lovely as the Palace is, it is not very organized. Family sent UPS/FedEx shipments to me at great cost - only for the items to linger in Caesar's mailroom for days. In fact, nothing was delivered until I made inquiries. And inquiries my family submitted (to keep the shipments a surprise from me), were directed to the mailroom and ignored. Very disappointing, and certainly put a damper on my trip!

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: snoopers7
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and I have no significant complaints. The hotel was amazing. The first night we arrived we could not get the free upgrade offer and the room we were in was not very nice however they guaranteed us the upgrade for the rest of our stay. The next morning we went to the lobby and we were given our upgrade without any problems. Yes, it is expensive to eat or buy a coffee in the morning however I went to Vegas knowing this so I refuse to complain. The only bad experience was the last night of our stay we decided to eat at the Augustus Cafe and we were seated by the hostess and given menus, our beverages were served by the bus boy, 4 tables came in afte us, had their order taken and we were still sitting there. We decided to get up and walk out. Other than that our trip was terrific and am looking forward to returning next year and staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent from Beginning to End”
Reviews.Author: betsy7060
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars palace for two nights 4/1-4/3 on comps. We booked a room in the Forum tower based on the reviews here. Check-in at 7pm was a breeze, no lines at all. And Yes, the $20 upgrade trick worked. We were upgraded to the Executive Suite in the Palace Tower. This room was huge. It had 2 bathrooms, a living room, and the bedroom had a sitting area. A television was also in the bathroom mirror. 2 flat screen tvs. We had no compliants other than there was not a view from our room. Went to the pool and encountered tons of construction. There are no heated pools but the lifeguard told us that the new pools will be heated. Great stay

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at Caesars!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carol6894
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace is just sheer elengance and glamour, from the pools to The Colosseum, amazing. We stayed in the Palace Tower Duluex Room which was ver nice room with an over-sized shoer to sinks, a gold toilet and a jacuzza. We had a good view of the Strip, which was facing North Las Vegas Blvd.) We also had a great view of The Colosseum. We also went to Cher, was was fantastic my 15 year old son is a big fan, it was really good but she had the "Vegas" throat when we went, but you should go its a great expierence I would reccomened this hotel to anyone who wants a taste of glamour when they are in Vegas. I am going again this year and staying at Caesars Palace and see one of my sons idols Bette Midler!

Reviews.Title: “They don't tell you this”
Reviews.Author: tessdmint
Reviews.Content: My experience at Ceasers was not horrible, but we asked for a non-smoking room, which in most hotels is on a non-smoking floor. Apparently, this is not the case at Ceasers. We could smell cigarette smoke in our room...not stale, left-over, from a previous guest smoke, but like next door smoke coming through the vent or something. There are four boxes sitting on the dresser: chips, peanuts, cashews, poppycock and a Romance Package. There is no visible sign telling you this--the bellhop didn't tell us this--the front desk didn't tell us this--nor did the group we were with told us this, but if you even remove any of these boxes, you are charged for it. How do they know? There are sensors under them. Luckily, we called to find out what the deal was and if we were in fact charged for the things we touched, but didn't use. You have 30 seconds to look at it and put it back before you are charged. A small, single serve bag of Poppycock, nicely packaged in a fancy box was $10. Outrageous are the prices of this hotel! You pay big money for the rooms, which are nice, and then are so strengent about every little thing. There is no coffee pot in the room and if you use room service, be prepared to pay by the pot; $20. Don't order a soft drink, it's $4, but in the machine you can get it for $2.50. I wasn't impressed with the Shops at the Forum compared to the ones in some of the other hotel shops. I brought my computer so I could go online and research transportation and shows, etc. I could only get online with the hotel WiFi for $15. WIth the prices of everything else, they should provide this. Also, the ironing board stunk! No padding and very hard to iron on. They have a swimming pool, but there was so much construction, the jack hammers made laying by the pool impossible. I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “caesars was sheer elegance”
Reviews.Author: geo1952
Reviews.Content: caesars is a 10 star hotel,staff all round were superb.great rooms ask for upgrade wen u book in,a 20 dollar tip is worthwhile for upgrade americans were extremely helpful and so polite loved it

Reviews.Title: “RUINED my 7 Stars Annual Trip!”
Reviews.Author: pelicannut
Reviews.Content: The room was great; the location is great. A couple of the restaurants where we ate were good. BUT . . . I will NEVER stay at Caesar's again based on the experiences we had with the executive host, Total Rewards, 7 stars registration - etc. The people are condescending, inexperienced and/or uninformed. Their collective attitudes and lack of service ruined this whole trip. It is now 3 days later -- I'm at home -- and we're still trying to get my account corrected. NEVER AGAIN WILL I STAY AT CAESARS.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service - unfortunate”
Reviews.Author: tansh
Reviews.Content: Location is central though the sheer length of the Strip and the frequent construction/road works/congestion on Las Vegas Blvd means it might not necessarily help much - you should buffer ample time to drive out of the Strip or to other resorts towards the ends of the Strip (for shows that start on time). Rooms are decent but probably overrated. We were told ours would be a 'nice room' for honeymooners in the recently refurbished Forum Tower - while it is well-maintained and modernly furnished it had a poor blocked view and nothing to shout about. You would probably have to upgrade to get a themed room. The show stopper here is really the very curt service and indifferent staff who will not hesitate to say no and treat you like yet another guest passing through. Calls to guest relations/housekeeping/room service took 3-5min before they were answered; check-in/out queues were long and processed by unfriendly staff; and more often than not deliveries to the room took longer than half an hour, once never arriving despite repeated, futile reminder calls. The person on the line even said it was barely 3min since our last call (it was more like 10-15min) and promised that the shower cap requested would arrive if we waited - which did not happen! In the end my wife waited over an hour for nothing and that really ate into our rest time. The feeling came close to silent suffering..! I would guess that the hotel might be understaffed/overworked... Apart from the iconic theme and decor around the hotel, we have to give a thumbs-down - this is arguably the worst out of the 4 hotels we stayed in over the course of our holiday. Come with no expectations, or prepare to be badly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A ghost of its past”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: Coasting on a very yesteryear Las Vegas reputation, this now soulless edifice is like a ride at Disneyland that's had its day. Though the rooms are clean and comfortable provided one stays in only one of three towers Augustus,Palace or Forum (forget the rest-they are junk rooms) this once great casino is ludicrously overpriced for every little thing. ($14.95 for internet service for 24 hours, room charge of $8 for a slice of toast and a cup of coffee plus a $5.00 room charge plus 18% gratuity...etc) It is now only worth a quick walk through to ogle at the over the top excesses in decoration. Restaurants on the whole have become mediocre with only perhaps Bradley Ogden as the lone standout. Guy Savoy has a restaurant there where the set menu is $290.00 per person which in this economy sounds a tad over the top. Forget playing there as every machine and table game is outfitted with terrible odds stacked against you. In its day Caesar's Palace had charm in its gaudiness and its atmosphere was exciting. Now it is just aggressively tacky. As an example I wanted to purchase a local newspaper in one of the gift shops only to be told that none carry the local paper anymore. When I asked why, the lady behind the counter told me she had heard that management didn't want their customers to read about the much better and more reasonable offers that were to be had elsewhere in terms of food and entertainment. One can get a much better experience for the same or less money on the strip at Wynn's,The Venetian or the Palazzo where true luxury reigns as opposed to the ersatz luxury of Caesar's Palace.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travelermcb
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay from Tuesday to Friday, between March Madness games. We were able to get an amazing rate using a promo code tip from the Fatwallet forums at $75 a night for a Classic Room. I had read plenty of reviews saying that these rooms were horrible, but we never found out. We asked for an upgrade at the desk, received a Palace Tower room at no extra charge and tipped the clerk $20! The Palace Tower room was great for us, lots of space to spread out, which is a real luxury compared to your standard hotel rooms. The bathroom had two sinks, a separate shower and a jetted tub. Even though the elevators for this room seem to be a mile away from the strip, it was nice to step off the elevator and be right at the pool area. We lounged by the pool 3 of the 4 days we were there. Lots of construction going on, but definitely a nice pool area. My only complaint may be that the drink and food service poolside was spotty at best...there was only one girl working the pool....just too many people for one person to serve. We wandered the hotel and saw the casino area and all the shops, which was impressive, but I can shop at home and we are pretty low-rollers, so we gambled elsewhere. We joined the Players Club which got us two $20 meal vouchers for the buffet. We ate there for breakfast one morning. My husband thought it was amazing, I thought it was fine. I don't know if it would be my choice if we were paying for it, but for free it was great. Great location, centered on the strip. We would definitely stay here again, especially if we could get such a great rate again.

Reviews.Title: “How can you do Vegas & not stop here!”
Reviews.Author: Taffy&Yorkie
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, I stayed at Caesars on the 19th March for three nights as part of a stag night (batchelor party) we had already upgraded to the Palace tower with our travel agent however I did tip the check in guy $20 and this worked in the fact that our room went from been ready in two hours to "its ready now sir". Apart from been totally blown away by Vegas this hotel exceeded all our expectations. The staff were always polite, the place spotless and the location is fantastic. I cannot recommend this hotel enough, one thing I have decided is that I will be returning and I think that says it all! VIVA! By the way we flew with BMI from Manchester in economy, Never again, staff looked unapproachable, food & drinks at a minimum frequency. Ive flown across the atlantic with Virgin, BA , First Choice & My Travel and they are all far far better. If you get chance go on the helicopters to the grand canyon its an amazing trip!

Reviews.Title: “plush stay.”
Reviews.Author: doctobe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and the location and hotel itself were brilliant and could not be faulted. We had a room in the forum tower, which meant no views but a lovely, sleek, comfortable and affordable room. The one thing i will say is that currently, esp for british travellers, it is very very expensive in Las Vegas. For example a beer and vodka-lemonade cost us $17! in the hotel. We ate at the cypress market, Trevi restaurant and Susji Roku in the forum shops and enjoyed all of our meals- a little odd to be ordering a glass of wine rather than a bottle. All in all a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: busytravler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms. The bathroom was larger than some hotel rooms I've stayed in. Personally I hate Las Vegas and only go there for business. But Caesar's does make the trip enjoyable. It's a great hotel and the rooms are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “NCAA March MADNEsss at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: midwesttraveler44
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy. Room available without waiting. Room was VERY NICE with a view of the fountains at Bellagio. Something to be seen at night. Caesars was crowded with March Madness people. Normal hotel service was good. Had dinner at Bejing Noodle company. Service was POOR at best. Food was good. Lunch at BObby Flays Mesa....AWESOME as ususal and the bartender EFREM is great. BEST MOJITOs in the planet.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AnneM52
Reviews.Content: From reading the reviews on Ceasar's it seems it depends on where you stay in the hotel. My husband and I paid $200.00 a night to stay in the Roman tower and I was so disappointed when I opened the door. The first room had no bathroom door and I refused to stay in a room like that so we were given another room down the hall which was probably a little worse but had a BR door. Everything must have been there since the Romans. It was old with cracked paint and door casings in the hall the carpet was not very clean and you couldn't use a calling card from the room. I live in Nova Scotia which is big in tourism and you wpuld find a better roon at Comfort Inn. We made the best of it and had a great time but I would be more selective the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Its glory is past.”
Reviews.Author: klknut
Reviews.Content: The current treachery propagated by Caesar’s involves enticing unwitting victims to their lair with the promise of low rates. However, the rooms associated with these rates are so miserable and uncomfortable, the guests are forced to pay extra ($50-60/night) to upgrade to more civilized rooms. The bed in the cheaper rooms (Roman Tower) is as comfortable as a sandpaper toga. If this is what the Romans slept on, no wonder their empire fell. Also, the staff at Caesar’s Palace is as warm, inviting and communicative as the many faux marble statues scattered throughout the casino. Actually that is not fair - the statues never did anything to anyone. Finally, if you do decide to brave one of the rooms in the Roman Tower, either travel alone or with someone you know very well. Otherwise, the complete lack of a bathroom door will make you closer than you ever wanted to be. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was Very Shocked”
Reviews.Author: tisa86723
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Ceasars for three very LONG days. Our room was HORRIBLE! Our toilet was not attached to the floor properly. Our view was of the airconditioning system. Our room was located above a bar and the music sounded as if it was in our room. Our beds sunk in the middle. Took FOREVER to get HOT water in the shower! Upon checkout I voiced my concerns about the room and was not taken seriously at ALL. I am not one to cause a scene. So when I arrived hom I called Ceasars and asked to speak to a manager and was pretty much told OH WELL! My husband and I are going back to Vegas in two months to celebrate our 15 wedding anniversary and guess where we will NOT BE STAYING? Can you say CEASARS! NEVER again will I spend my hard EARNED money in such a crappy hotel. I have stayed at Best Westerns with NICER ROOMS and BETTER SERVICE! On a happy note my friend and I transfered from Ceasars to THE RIO, and were treated like QUEENS!

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent time - large group of parents and teenagers!”
Reviews.Author: mps03
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Augustus Tower, room 3691. We had an excellent view of the strip and the Bellagio fountain, in the other distance were the mountains. It was like a TV show at night with all the lights and fountain shows. Our room was large, with a nice table, couch, chairs, large flat screen TV, and 2 double beds, very comfortable and large. The bathroom was overthetop luxurious. The two pools were excellent. With a large group of teens I would suggest sending someone out to bring in pizzas, salads, drinks, bagels, and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Is At The Center Of All The Fun!”
Reviews.Author: ashley8_7_82
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at this awesome resort and will definitely stay there again. Check in was very quick, which I was a little nervous about because it is such a big resort. When checking in we upgraded to the Forum Tower which was great because it is right in the center of all the fun. Our room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. I have stayed at several Las Vegas resorts and the bed at Caesars was by far the best. The dining and shopping at the Forum Shops is great because there is a ton of variety. The only recommendation that I would give to someone staying there is if you want to go to the pool be sure and get down there early so you can find seating. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and invited us back which I am sure my wife and I will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, I couldn't have asked for more.”
Reviews.Author: marcnshirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars on a solo trip from March 3rd to March 8th in the Augustus Tower. My whole stay was very good. The room was large and very nicely decorated in neutral tones. The pillows, sheets and bed were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was large and fully marble and spotlessly clean. Caesars is slap bang in the middle of the strip so one can't ask for a more central location. The restaurants and bars, shopping and gambling options are almost endless. I would definitely reccommend Caesars Palace to family and friends. I had a bit of an incident in the poker room one night and at my request I was tended to by the Casino Manager who sorted out the issue promply and professionally. The waitresses and slot attendants were very friendly and efficient. As a female travelling alone I felt totally safe at this hotel. Over all Caesars is a pretty good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Some headaches, but overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: zaneopal
Reviews.Content: Overall, my Caesars Palace experience was a good one. I went with a group of college friends for a few days, as we got a excellent deal on the hotel room. However, we believe that since we booked our hotel on a discount site (hotels.com), we were viewed as less important than other guests at the hotel when it came to service. When we called to confirm our reservation, we requested two adjacent rooms. However, when we checked in, they didn't even give us the type of room we paid for, let alone adjacent rooms. They promised a room switch at noon the following day when we brought this up at the desk, and said they'd be adjacent. Noon comes around and we find the new rooms aren't even on the same floor. Finally, we get them to put us in adjacent rooms (deluxe in the Augustus Tower, which is what we paid for) and they promise to call us between 3 and 5. At ten minutes to five, as they haven't called our rooms or our contact person's cell phone, our contact goes downstairs to find our rooms were ready. If we hadn't claimed them by 5, they would have been given to other guests. The room change was a headache. But incredibly worth it. The views were spectacular (we had a great view of the Bellagio fountains) and Caesars is excellently located with respect to other hotels and casinos, right in the middle of the strip. The coupon book we were provided with at check-in proved to help a lot, as we're college kids (lots of free food or discounts on meals). Both rooms were very clean and quiet, and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom facilities in the first room (Palace Tower) were a little outdated, but still nice. The hotel was also very prompt in bringing extra towels and some amenities we'd forgotten (toothbrushes and deodorant). A small mix up also worked out in our favor. The previous guest in the first room we'd been assigned to had apparently spent a good deal of money in the casino and she'd been comped free food and bottles of water, all of which was sitting untouched and unopened when we arrived. When we mentioned this to the desk, they'd informed up she'd checked out and told us we were welcome to the food. Yay for free fruit and water after a long day of traveling! Additionally, the last full day of our stay, the pool reopened. Honestly, the pool alone may have made the trip for me, as I love to swim and Caesars' pools are gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Vegas”
Reviews.Author: goenywhereonce
Reviews.Content: We just came back from four nights in Vegas, first visit. Bought a very reasonable package out of Toronto, picked Ceasars Palace becouse I've seen pix in the magazines etc, and wanted to have a real Vegas Experience. We arrived at 9AM to check in, no line up, were told our package puts us into the old part of the hotel, tried the $20.00 trick to get a room upgrade to Augustus tower, somebody must've been watching, the young lady on the desk wouldn't go for it, so, after some negotiating we paid extra $25/nite for renovated room in the Palace tower, we got in right away! Nice, big, clean, renowated room with a double Jaccuzi tub, shower, lots of marble and nice towels and sheets too. 23 floor overlooking the parking lot, but high enough to see the pool at the Mirage and the Strip. Food at the hotel as elsewhere on the Strip expensive, but mostly good. The place is HUGE, takes 20 mins to walk from the lobby to the selfparking lot, we drove to the Red Rock Canyon, hiked for an hour, beautifull, then down to Hoover Dam, very intersting, all in one day, no rushing, recomend it! Also, spend an evening Downrown, after all the faux class of the strip, it felt somehow more real and a lot of fun, the light show on Fremont strreet is well worth the bus fare! Back at the hotel, check out the Forum shops, amazing details and workmanship, engeneering of the whole place is mindblowing, must have cost a fortune. We dont gamble, and after seeing what gamblers money can build, will never gamble for sure! We will go back in 10 years to see all the new buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Casears is Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DAG-5YrPlan
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Las Vegas, and we were very glad that we stayed at Caesars. You seriously cannot beat the location as it is in the heart of the strip and within walking distance to almost all the other hotels. We booked a bare bones room through a travel site and when checking in, slipped the clerk a $20 bill and got upgraded to a suite in the Augustus Tower with a beautiful view of the strip. You would have to be crazy not to try the $20 trick...it is Vegas after all and it runs on tips. I read all the other reviews of Caesars before coming and was a little wary, but it is a fantastic hotel and while not as extravagant as a Bellagio or Palazzo, it is still a Vegas institution and definitely recommend it. Also, Spago in the Forum Shops was amazing, go there for a meal, you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “new tower is very nice”
Reviews.Author: tinytinaskis
Reviews.Content: check in offered to upgrade to the new Augustus tower for $40 a night so i took it I am gald i did. The room was very large nice plasma tv very well decorated no greek theme I liked that it was modern and nice evevators were fast. A few things about the room it was a bit noisy from loud neighbors, the bathroom amenities were very nice but i missed having qtips. The Qua spa was beautiful A few tips I saw Cher and it was great just do not by the really expensive cocktails in the theater not great. The gourmet chocolate shop wonderful and the cool machine in it spits out free chocolates every so often for you to sample. Noodle place was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “It was better than I thought...”
Reviews.Author: STLfan420
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from Vegas, we stayed there March 4-7th. We ended up getting to the hotel to check in around 430pm and we only waited around 10-15min. The front desk person tried to upsell us a different room and we declined because my dad purchased this room for us and we didnt want to pay extra money. We stayed in the Roman Tower and when we got to the room, we had mirrors on the cieling and a hot tub in the bedroom. Oh and a see through bathroom (nice touch) Our view from the room was of the pool that had constustion but we could see the sunset and a good view of the Palms (which is where we will stay next time) and the Rio. When we got to the room it was clean and we had no issues. I lived in Vegas for almost 2 years and I still got lost in this hotel. I started to figure it out only one day in but still. This place is huge. The only things we played at Caesar's was penny/nickel slots. We went across the street to O'Shea's to play table games since it was cheaper. We didnt eat anywhere in this hotel so I cant say anything about that but over all it was a nice room and the people working thier were kind. Dont even think about checking out at the front desk on a fri-sun, for its WAY to busy. We carried all our stuff downstairs and then saw the line at the front desk and I wold have been in line for like an hour. So we went back to the room...checked our balance and checked out through the TV...much easier. If you have any questions you can always ask me. I am a travel agent so I will give you all the info I have. Peace out from Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Serious Security Problems”
Reviews.Author: xoxx
Reviews.Content: Checked in to a large comfortable room, I had good expectations for my stay. I was awaken at 4am by loud noises in the hallway and someone banging at my door. I called security and they said "no problem, they would check it out." I never heard back from security. When I came out of my room in the am, the hallway was littered with smashed ice buckets. Other guests on the floor informed me that this was going on previous nights. I contacted the manager was moved to a room on another floor. The next night, someone entered my room at 4.30 am saying they were checked into this same room. A few minutes later, the bellman came to my door to collect my luggage. When I called the manager, they said I was not checked into this room. The next morning, I talked to another manager about the incident and they reported that I was checked into that room. When I returned from breakfast to my room, the key no longer worked. The serious security issues and the cavalier way the management handled my situation indicates problems. I wouldn't recommend a place where I didn't feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and two-person showers - love it!”
Reviews.Author: KatieCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in Feb - it was a good stay. We were upgraded at check-in to a suite in the Palace Towers. Single LCD TV, jacuzzi tub, 2 bathrooms with 2 toilets and a large two-person shower... awesome. The Palace Tower is nice, although if you can get a suite in the Augustus Tower, that would be nicer for the views. Our suite was looking at the new Octavius Tower that's almost done... surprisingly, there's not much construction noise. Pros: - Nice upgrade and suite - Great central location on the strip - Love the Forum shops - It's classic Caesars... yes the Wynn and the Palazzo are swankier, but there's something nice about the history here. Cons: - They charge for everything... wish they would provide free internet - The fridge is filled with their items on sensor - we moved stuff aroudn for our own items and had to get the bill adjusted at the end - Pools currently closed for renos - I suspect it'll be nice when they're done I enjoyed it and was glad we got the upgrade after reading horror stories about the standard rooms. Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MGDay2
Reviews.Content: I was booked by my company to the Roman Tower. When I stepped out of the cab, there was no one to assist you. The nearest elevator from the Registration was broken. It was a maze and a long walk to the next set of elevators but no bell boy was in sight as I dragged my 45 lb. luggage. From inside my room, I can hear the slamming of doors outside, talking in the next rooms as well as the alarm getting off from the next door. The room is spacious though and the amenities provided were good. To use the internet, it costs $25 per day and to use the gym, it is $45 a day. I think these services should have been included in the per night cost. The hotel is gorgeous though but I value my room more since I don't gamble. I transferred to Stratosphere after my conference. I find it much better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay--would do it again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: MinnVegasmomma
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were in Las Vegas for a great 4 days. We throughly enjoyed our stay at Caesar's. I'm usually in Vegas two to three times a year and this was my first time staying at the Palace. The front desk staff was wonderful !!! Room service was great--our food came in less time than was predicted and was piping hot and very,very good. The location is great !!! When we were checking in we were given an upgrade to the Augustus Tower and our room overlooked the Bellagio Fountains---What a great view!!!! After a long day of walking the strip it was great to relax in the spa tub. I absolutely love Caesar's and will probably stay there again on my next trip out !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Trip Advisor Members: Caesars Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: mrgrasso
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to the Trip Advisor Members. I read many reviews before heading to Vegas and the tips really helped. ROOM: Requested Augustus Tower per your reviews. Room was modern and lovely. People were complaining about the Roman Tower but I wasn't there because of your reviews. HOTEL: Beautiful. Tables were mostly $25 blackjack but you're just across the street from O'Sheas. Your True Rewards card works there too so whether you want high end or low end tables, they are right across the street from each other. CHECK IN: As per your reviews, check in was a nightmare...but we were mentally prepared. They have clearly cut back on staff and waiting 45 minutes for your room (at 10pm) is never good, but after reading your reviews I expected it. Those who hadn't been forewarned were FREAKING OUT in line. Especially the older people, my god there were some people flipping. A hotel of this caliber shouldn't let this happen, but with the economy in the dumps (especially in Vegas) you've got to assume there are going to be some cutbacks. Again, inexcusable but at least a bit understandable. DINNER: Rao's. UNREAL. If you're trashing Rao's in a review then perhaps you didn't know what you were getting into. Food there is top notch. No one wants to pay $48 for Veal Parm but when it's the best you've ever had....$48 seems like $10.

Reviews.Title: “I like Caesar's”
Reviews.Author: wpier7
Reviews.Content: This was my third time in Vegas. Stayed at T.I. and Monte Carlo in the past. Caesar's was definitely my favorite of the three.
