I booked a standard room in the Roman Tower via hotel.com for $90/night. There seemed to be overwhelming disapproval of these rooms from other members on this site, so I upgraded at the front counter to the Palace Tower. We tried to talk the front desk attendant into a free upgrade, but to no avail. We paid an extra $60/night, which was supposedly a great deal - a result of the bad economy. Speaking of the economy, I didn't notice much of a difference in the amount of people visiting over the weekend. The nightclubs, etc. were still packed/hectic. Anyway, our room was great! Very spacious and extremely clean. I'm not much of a gambler, but the casino was essentially smoke-free compared to some of the other hotels. I always visit Caesar's for the mall and nightclubs, but had been unable to stay in the past due to the high rates. I was very excited to be able to stay this time, and would do so again if given the opportunity. (I'm giving the hotel 4/5 stars - but keep in mind this is based primarily off my Palace Tower room. If the Roman Tower is as bad as others' claim it to be, I'm sure my opinion would change. FYI the pool is closed. Try the restaurant across from the front desk for great late night dining.)

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's: overpriced, poor service”
Reviews.Author: victim99
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at Caesar's, the first hotel in Vegas that ever made me consider checking out early. It is amazingly overpriced - equivalent or superior rooms and amenities are available just about everywhere else on the strip. For the price, the room was very small. It also had a huge shower with more than enough room for a tub - something I always look forward to using on vacation - but instead there was only some pseudo-roman bathing bench. The TV was in pretty bad shape, about the worst signal I've seen on a hotel flatscreen. No changing of the sheets either, though unfortunately that seems to be the norm these days. When we checked in, we discovered that our minibar was not working. After three calls and at least two visits to the room, it was finally fixed. Upon checkout we discovered that we were charged $400 for the entire contents of the minibar - presumably when they removed the contents to fix it. Thankfully they were willing to remove the charge, but it was just another step in incompetence for this hotel. Service was generally terrible overall. We called for a wake-up call our first morning, but we never received it. Lines for everything are incredibly long and move slowly. There is also no security anywhere here apparently - I don't know if they've cut back, but every other hotel I've ever been to in Vegas had guards checking room keys at the elevator banks. Not so at Caesar's, and by the looks of some of the casino patrons, we didn't exactly feel safe. Some kids were having a party on our floor one night, and playing bass so loud that our room was vibrating til 4 am - no response from security there, either. And on top of all this, Caesar's somehow remains one of the higher-priced hotels on the strip. I don't know how they can possibly keep it up with the standards they display. You can do much better (for a better price) at most other hotels, especially if you shop around - the Mirage, MGM Grand, The Venetian/Palazzo, Mandalay Bay or Paris would all be improvements over Caesar's.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the luxory, but check your bill at check out.”
Reviews.Author: CCNV
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay to the fullest. The room was fantastic and the staff were very friendly and helpful. There are a few buts, so keep watch for extra and unnecessary charges. At check-in we were offered the upgrade to a mini-suite for only $62 and that would include certain extras and a jacuzzi in the room. We declined. Guess what we got anyway.....a mini-suite with a jacuzzi in the room. Then we got lost and ended up in the wrong tower trying to find our room. The most helpful employee offered assistance and took us through a maze of behind the scenes corridors, hallways, elevators and so on. Before we knew it we were at our room. All the staff we encountered were so friendly and helpful in all aspects. Upon checking out we had charges for the minibar on our tab even though we didn't use anything. Here's the catch! If you lift something up out of the minibar to even look at it, you will be charged. There are sensors that detect when something has been lifted up. Pretty amazing. They took the charge off immediately when we brought it to their attention. Also here is a first. We ordered a movie to watch in bed one night which was great, but you better plan on watching it all in one shot. You don't get it for 24 hours and are not able to pick up where you left off the next morning if you fell asleep during the first time you tried to watch it. No going back. That was a first and I must say dissappointing feature they have incorporated. And last but not least, the free valet parking is a real treat in all the madness of staying on the strip. Just loved that feature. All in all our first time staying at Caesars was most enjoyable. The accomodations were very roomy with lots of little luxories, great room service even though a little pricey, but hey, its Caesars and the breakfast really was delicious. We got a package deal on this stay which was one of the best anyone in Vegas had ever heard of. Oh yeah, the one real let down is the crazy fee they charge to use the fitness room facilities. $45 for an hour workout on their equipement. Sorry that is not a good service at all. We did not pay for that.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace is Extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: calgarytraveller26
Reviews.Content: Booked trip via expedia and was originally booked into a Classic room in the Roman tower. After reading many reviews about the older tower I knew we couldn’t let the hotel room ruin our very first Vegas vacation. Checked in late on Thursday night of the Valentine's/President’s Day long weekend. Check in line was short and we reached the front in about 10 minutes. I slipped the girl a twenty with my ID and credit card and asked if there were any upgrades available. To my delight we were upgraded to a Deluxe room in the Palace tower. The room was outstanding! What a fantastic upgrade. Two sinks in the HUGE bathroom, Jacuzzi tub, separate shower and private toilet. The bedding was very luxurious, carpets and linens were so clean! It felt like we were the first to stay in the room. The view wasn’t great, we looked out over on the pool construction and the Octavius tower construction, but that was a small inconvenience. The pool was closed for renovations, but it was not warm enough to be taking advantage of that anywways. Housekeeping were courteous and very friendly. Our room was immaculate each time we returned. Top notch staff at this amazing hotel! Had room service on the first morning for breakfast. Wait time was about an hour for the food, but it came up piping hot and delicious. Prices were a little high but this is Vegas after all. Payards Pastierre was also a great place to get coffee in the morning, line ups can get a bit long. But again, it’s Vegas and that’s to be expected. We signed up for the rewards card and got food vouchers for Caesar’s restaurants. Together with comps that we had gotten for playing at the tables one night, we had over $100.00 in food vouchers. We used them at Augustus Café, which is the 24 hour restaurant located in the base of the Augustus tower. The food was delicious and the portions were very large. We both had enough left over for a midnight snack and the meal was essentially free. Definitely sign up for the rewards card to get all kinds of coupons and savings at Caesars. The gaming area is huge, but the minimum bets on most of the tables are very high. We went across to the Flamingo for lower limits. Also checked out Pure nightclub with the VIP passes received at check in. Very swanky club, but the drink prices were astronomical. Will probably do a bottle service with more people if we return. Caesar’s location cannot be beat, right in the middle of the strip. We walked everywhere. The Forum shops were fun to walk through, very high end merchandise. The Fashion Show mall across from Treasure Island is where we did a bulk of our shopping. My boyfriend golfed at the Balli Hai golf course and raved about it the entire trip. It was the highlight of the weekend for him and he greatly recommends this course to golfers. It was a short cab ride from the hotel and club rentals are available. The only complaint I have about Caesar’s is that the mini bar in the room was sensored. I had been taking out items in order to store personal water bottles and food, but once an item is removed you are charged for it. I noticed this upon checkout and the charges were removed from the bill. I will definitely stay at Caesar’s again but will not settle for anything less than the Palace tower.

Reviews.Title: “do not upgrade”
Reviews.Author: genspec3
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to a deluxe room on hotels. com , for a 5 day stay, the front desk put us at the forum tower I told the desk clerk that this was incorrect I booked a room in the Palace or August Tower. After that I asked for a room on a high floor the clerk gave us the 51 floor really 2 floor. Treated like a second class no third class person because i booked on hotels.com. Overall the room was nice the TV didn't work the whole time. Room was extremely clean and maid was the friendlest person that worked their. After I got home have sent them a e-mail demanding a refund for the different rate in rooms. Hotel is nice just be careful at check in and demand what you paided for extremely arrogent front check in desk. Room was decorated nicely and the bed was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Gitcha A_ _ back in the room!”
Reviews.Author: mwillkie
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas 1 to 2 times a year for fun and business. We thought it would be nice to stay at Caesars, we had visited the property many times before, but had never stayed there. We checked in on Sat. afternoon, with no problem. The room was small with a view of a giant air compressor. All around the edges of the room you could see dust where they were missing it when sweeping. We called down at 5pm and asked for 2 more pillows, never got them. Called again at 11pm and they came up 20 min. later. We ate dinner at Hyakumi, one of Caesars premier japanese eaterys. We both got food pisening from their "Caesar roll", I know this becuase it was the only thing we both tasted. Back in the room, we now learned that the toilet was not flushing properly. This was unfortunate, oweing to our extensive use of it, thanks to our $150.00 food poisening! At 3:35 am we were disturbed by loud noise out side our room. It turned out to be some twentysomething kids, running up and down the hallways, and screaming at each other. This went on for 20 min., we called security. My wife opened the door, explained the obvious and was insulted for her trouble. A drunk hispanic man informed her that he was on vacation and could do as he pleasee, and that she should, " shut up and gitcha [--] back in the room. Unable to help as I was "again" in dispose in the bathroom, I could only listen. We called again and where in formed that security was on the way. By the time they arrived, the people had left, ofcourse. I called down to the desk and asked if I could check out early (we were scheduled to stay 3 more days. The clerk said we could, but they would be charging us for 1 night in addition to the night we'd stayed! In the morning my wife checked us out, and relayed our story to the day staff. They were apologetic and did not charge us an extra night. We moved to South Point and the rest of our trip was great. I've had my fill of the strip on the weekends, and will stay off strip from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's was great!”
Reviews.Author: allmagic
Reviews.Content: We booked a package through WestJetVacations.com. We chose Caesar's because we took it to be a fine hotel in the middle of the strip where all the action is. The hotel itself is beautiful although, in some places it is starting to show it's age. The check-in line was fairly long when we arrived but it went surprisingly fast and had to wait no longer than a few minutes to reach the desk. The gentleman checking us in was very friendly and offered a room upgrade for only $50 per night. We took it. They even let us check-in early by about 3 hours. This was a blessing in itself after a long day of travel. The room was very nice. Two separate bathrooms, a shower built for two, a huge jacuzzi tub and a very spacious room. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was inviting and clean. We loved this hotel and highly recommend it to anyone. We stayed in the Palace Tower. If the pool was open, the Palace Tower is the place to be, it is located right beside the pool area. The casino staff was fun and friendly. Check out the Pussycat Dolls area! The only thing I can say that was a pain was the distance to the tower but one could complain about that with any large hotel on the strip. Also the food and drinks were very expensive so I recommend eating and drinking elsewhere (unless your gambling). Again this is true for many of the newer, larger hotels. If you want cheap drinks and a great time, go to Freemont Street, watch the light show and listen to Carl 'Safe Sax' Ferris play his many different saxophones. That was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Love Caesars' , just a few things you should know”
Reviews.Author: hyethga4lyfe
Reviews.Content: Caesars' Palace is a Las Vegas legend and even though it doesn't have a 5 star or 5 diamond rating, i still consider it to be a very high class and luxurious destination. However, there are a few things you should know in order to make sure you have a good experience here. Let me start off with accommodations. The Augustus Deluxe, Palace Deluxe, and Palace Premium rooms are the best rooms you could find at Caesars' and are also the newest. The rooms in the Augustus tower are brand-new and the Palace tower rooms are remodeled to resemble the Augustus tower with only a few minor differences. These rooms are very nice, with spa tubs, and contemporary designs. The beds are fantastic and very comfortable. Also the rooms are a very good size, but you must know that the Augustus tower rooms have a different bathroom than the regular Palace room and the premium Palace room. The Augustus bathroom is roomier with a different design and a flat screen TV. The Palace tower bathrooms are the original Caesars' bathrooms from before the remodel which are still very nice but sometimes they are not in the best condition. The Palace Premium room is a very nice room, but in my opinion not worth the extra price per night, if you're comped this room then great, but otherwise it is not worth it. The only significant difference is that the Premium room has his and her bathrooms, no biggie. For some reason, Caesars' decided to go with the cheesy modern designs in the Forum Tower remodel just like the rest of Vegas is doing. I wouldn't recommend staying in these rooms unless you like the style or you get a very good deal, since at least they are brand new. Under NO circumstances should you ever book a room in the Roman or Centurion towers at Caesars', i am being very serious, those rooms are in horrible conditions, almost motel 6 status. If the "Classic" room is the only thing available, you should try the Wynn/Encore down the street, or Bellagio if they have a good deal. Also most of the time Caesars' is a little overpriced when it comes to rooms, be careful. Sometimes a classic room at Caesars' turns out to be the same price or more as a room at the Bellagio or a suite at Encore on a weeknight. Now lets move onto dinning. Caesars' has a very large selection of dinning choices. If you are on a tight budget however, i suggest either sticking to the Augustus Cafe, or dinning somewhere else. Because the fine dinning is amazing at Caesars' but the casual stuff, not so much. Stay away from the Cafe Lago buffet, trust me. It has a very small selection, overpriced, and isn't even that good. If you want great food try Spago, Sushi Roku, BOA, Trevi, Neros, and Bradley Ogden. Those are all great choices. As for the pool, its pretty chill and relaxing. Nice environment, large area, just nothing too special. Perfect place to lounge around and have a drink, or read a book. Also you should know that a tip a Caesars' goes a long way. When you're checking in, slipping a 50 or a 100 in with you I.D. and Credit Card could score you a beautiful suite. Most of the time if you ask "What can you do for me?" they'll even give you a choice. I have always had a comped stay at Caesars' but i have been upgraded by tipping a 50 from an Augustus Deluxe room to a one bedroom suite in the Augustus tower. It all depends on how you approach the front desk and how your attitude is. Be very friendly, and you'll always get what you want. That is about it, i know a lot about this property so please trust my advice and don't make any mistakes that could leave a bad impression of Caesars' in your mind.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: sjp1
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate on this hotel by monitoring the website. We booked once and cancelled to take advantage of better rates. We stayed in the Augustus tower checking in on a Wednesday and checking out Saturday afternoon. The check in was easy since it was 11:00pm. We got the exact room we requested. The Augustus Tower is in a good location compared to the casino/bars/restaurants/strip. We were on the 34th floor looking out at the Bellagio. We could see the fountain show and had a decent view fo the strip. Our room was nice. It had two beds, couch, cofee table, mini dining table and a nice flat screen tv. The bathroom was big and had a little tv in it, a seperate closet for the comode, and a seperate tub/shower. I have three concerns with the room: 1)The room did not seem clean. There was a lot of dust and the bathroom felt dirty. 2) The linens were old and worn. The bath towels were very old and borderline nasty. They reminded me of the towels my health club provides...not nice and very worn. The sheets were also worn and flimsy. 3) Room service was disgustingly priced. The delivery time was about 45 minutes and that I can understand. But to charge $70 for a few bagels/cream cheese and some juice and coffee is absurd and almost criminal:) The Casino was fun and we usually had no trouble getting drinks. We both broke about even playing blackjack and went on some legendary runs. Real fun. The restaurants were unbelievable. We ate dinner at Raos(pronounced Ray-ohs), Joes in the Forum Shops, and Bobby Flays Mesa Grille for lunch. I will be doing reviews of all three of them shortly so look for those but lets say they were all good with Joes and Raos being the best! The best thing to me about Caesars is the location. It is smack dab in the center of the strip and you can walk everyhwere. I would stay at Caesars again but only in a new room as I have heard the older ones are pretty bad. However, next time I go I will have lowered expectations of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “My Most Favorite Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TheValentineBride
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many great hotels but I will always love CP the best. The service is exceptional, they treat me like royalty (literally, red carpet and all)....the suites are great, the 2 floor Rainman Suite has wonderful rounded windows looking out to the entire city.... Pools & jacuzzis are grand. The hosts are simply the best. They make sure you are pampered and well fed :) AhSo's used to be my fave restaurant (10 course Japanese meals while you are surrounded by waterfalls and wild orchids). That has been replaced by Hyakumi. I love Neros as well... I have been to most of the large, advertised hotel shows but am fond of the smaller, local concerts. I lived in Vegas for years (Green Valley, Nevada~beautiful!) so I am very familiar with every hotel but when we visit, it is always Caesars Palace :) Need I mention the fabulous Forum Shops??? The malls in LV cannot be beat...If you are staying a while, check out the local hotels such as Sam's Town...I love Sams! Don't expect luxery & glitter but expect fun & cuteness. Their indoor atrium is very cool...love the mountain light show & my favorite howling wolf :) Mohegan Sun stole the exact show but I love both. Steakhouse has great coconut shrimp & don't forget to try their Strawberry TALL Cake~trust me, it's an experience! Get up to Mt. Charleston & rent a log cabin as a fun getaway..Bonnie Springs, Nevada has a zoo...I love Vegas and loved showing my husband all around Nevada.

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriends' Weekend at Caesar's Palace”
Reviews.Author: AgadorSpartacus
Reviews.Content: I was frankly a litle wary of staying at Caesar's Palace, based on many of the Trip Advisor reviews, but a girlfriend booked the trip, so off we went. I did pore over the many reviews available, and took the advice of so many, to absolutely not stay in the Roman Tower, and to ask for a room in the newest Augustus Tower instead. We checked in on Thursday, Feb 5, at around noon, and did not wait in line at all. Walked right up to the desk, handed the super friendly clerk a $20 with my drivers license and credit card and asked to be put in the Augustus Tower, Not only did we get a great room there, but we got one on the side of the Bellagio Fountain - lovely! The bathroom was huge, the linens were nice, and housekeeping gave us loads of extra towels. We spent a morning at the Qua Spa and got massages and facials. Very nice spa area. Massage was pretty good, and facial was fantastic. In the mornings, we went down to the Payard pastry and coffee shop and brought pastries, fresh fruit and coffee back to our room. Perfect, and way cheaper and less time consuming than a sit-down breakfast. We had fabulous meals at Bradley Ogden and Nero's, and a mediocre one at Rao's. Overall a nice hotel, and a very fun experience. Not the Four Seasons Hotel, by any means, but nowhere near the price of the Four Seasons, ether...

Reviews.Title: “Looking a gift (trojan) horse in the mouth.....”
Reviews.Author: lesterkitty
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home after 2 nights at Caesar's with my 21 year old son. My ex-husband (his dad) gifted us with the trip for Christmas complete with Elton John tickets. I usually research a trip to death but Vegas seemed a no-brainer. Caesar's seemed a wonderful choice. I've travelled a lot for business and leisure and well....I'm kind of a hotel snob. So yes, I should have researched and known better than to allow my trip to be marred by a room in the Roman Towers. Check-in took 45 minutes with no apologies at all. Please learn from my mistake and do not accept a room in the Roman Towers. There was no closet, the only place to hang clothes was in the bathroom over the ice bucket and safe. There was no full length mirror. The whole room was dusty and only semi-clean. Housekeeping did not leave clean glasses or pick up dirty room service dishes. And for God's sake, [-] ever happened to a cup of coffee in the morning that doesn't cost 20 bucks???!!!!!! Can't believe they are not embarrassed to put customers in the Roman Towers.

Reviews.Title: “On to be caesar”
Reviews.Author: deetravel
Reviews.Content: Firstly, can't believe I forgot to write review until now, most have been too busy telling everyone in person that we loved caesars! Stayed for two nights mid-week in November for our first trip to Vegas. Booked through travel agent, who booked through agency etc, so the hotel had problem tracking down our reservation initially. We appreciate these things happen, but the wonderful girl checking us in was very apologetic and got it sorted as quickly as possible. She also arranged an upgrade to the Augustus Towers overlooking the Bellagio Fountains for a knockdown price. The room, as mentioned by other posters is huge and the bathroom larger than many standard hotel rooms. So good we often felt bad for leaving. The rest of the hotel, if you can get around to all of it, is superb, and only regret is that we didn't have more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Inept Management, Don't Stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: JohnPorriello
Reviews.Content: I still find it unbelievable that I, and many others, had to wait over an hour to check in to Caesars Palace in Las Vegas on February 4, 2009. Hotel Management didn’t really seem to care that the line was extremely long. There was a hotel employee handing out water bottles, but when I asked for a cocktail or glass of wine I was denied. Would it have killed management to have the same employee pushing a cart with beer and wine for people waiting in line? When I finally got to the front of the line there was uncertainty related to whether I was going to get the room that I had a written confirmation for at the agreed upon price. The front desk employee told me that all of the rooms at “your price are sold out”, as if it was my fault. They asked me to pay extra to get into their next tier room. They still didn’t apologize for the hour-long wait. They didn’t offer a $50 hospitality credit to be used in a Caesars restaurant or bar for my time waiting in line. They were asking me for more money, which I refused. After a while they then “accommodated” me in another room, which was a normal room. It was as if Caesars had never checked in a large group of people before. It was amateur hour, and from speaking to other members of my group the line existed all day long. I thought I was in a Seinfeld episode. When the room was “cleaned” any dirty glasses or dishes were not removed from the room. The pool area was closed for renovation. Upon check out there was a $25 mini bar charge on my bill. I didn’t even open the door of the mini bar. As soon as I mentioned this, the charge was removed. Nice try Caesars, but I look at my bill. My advice to meeting planners, no matter where you stay, is to write in to the contract a penalty clause if the wait is over X number of minutes, the hotel owes each guest who waited longer than the agreed upon minutes a certain number of dollars. If the guest gets bumped to another hotel, their stay at the other hotel is free. In the age of computers there is no excuse to overbook a hotel and for there to be extra long check in lines. It is absurd. Caesars has clearly forgotten which industry they are in, it’s called hospitality. I would not recommend this hotel until it is sold to someone who cares about their guests. John Porriello Wethersfield, CT

Reviews.Title: “Long lines, no coffee, and upcharges for even the basics”
Reviews.Author: stairstepper
Reviews.Content: Stayed Feb 2-6. Hoping for some comfort at a first class hotel after a chaotic day of airports and shuttle busses? Not even close. I arrived to find a line at the check-in that wrapped back and forth thru the lobby then down the hall to the shopping area. Waited over an hour. Velvet ropes were set up to manage the crowd - apparently this is a daily event. No apologies to the guests; no refreshments while waiting; no management to acknowledge that this was apalling for a $250+ per night "first class" hotel. And where was the bell staff to help guests to their rooms? For business travelers here for conferences, not for leisure, the hotel experience falls way short of expectations. Many of the basics that business travelers expect are absent . No newspapers for guest rooms. Internet access is $14.95 for 24 hours. It's $25 a day to use the fitness center. It's $5 for a kiosk to print your boarding pass. Good luck getting a cup of coffee in the morning. There are no in-room coffee machines, no free coffee in the lobby, and the coffee shop didn't open until 7 AM, too late for most conference goers. The only place I could get a cup each morning was in a bar in the casino area for $4 plus tip. When I asked the desk, they suggested that I order coffee via room serivce - but it would cost $11 plus $5 delivery fee plus 18% gratuity plus taxes. Everyone in my conference of 300+ people was buzzing about the check in debacle, and many of them waited the hour in line just to find that the hotel was oversold and they were bumped to another hotel. Even our keynote speaker, an expert on marketing of service businesses, commented about the hotel's shamefully bad customer service. I believe that Caesars Palace was once a fine hotel with a reputation for luxury, but clearly it has lost its way. I would never consider a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: LANCSTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas, and decided to go to a great hotel, and great it was. Upgraded our room on arrival, although it wasn't overlooking the strip completely it was still a great room, probably too big. His and hers bathrooms, but only ever used one of them. Spent our time getting totally lost, makes all your usual holiday hotels seem TINY. Never went back to our room the same way twice! Colloseum shopping centre and all the fabulous eating places out of this world. Went to Bette Midler show, well worth the expense. SO glad we went to this pretigious hotel, although having looked around a lot of the other hotels on the strip too they all seem equally stunning, so would probably try one of those next visit. Loved the relaxed feel of the place, dress how you want, no pressure, but that applies to all Vegas. Can't think of anything negative to say (which is a first!), would recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: TheRanj
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Vegas and went with a small group of friends. We picked Caesar's because of the location on the strip (right in the center). We arrived late in the evening (8:30 PM), but there was no line at the check-in counter and they gave us a free upgrade without asking to the Augustus tower which is one of the newer towers on the south end of the property (closest to check-in counter) when we had booked a Forum tower. The room was a nice upgrade and we had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains. The room was great, can't complain at all. The Casino is probably my favorite one in all of Vegas, though my only complaint is that the Poker Room is an 'after though' with a separate maze to go thru to get to it. The food court in the Casino is a bit overpriced, but a better option then nothing at all. And the casino waitresses bring drinks by regularly. Pure is by the Poker Room and is the most happening club in Vegas, so that was a plus. Pool was above average, but nothing great. They only had one open at that time of year, so I'm sure it's better in the summer. I'm going again this May so will find out then.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Money & Time”
Reviews.Author: BOBILI
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel from Jan. 29-Feb. 1, 2009. This trip was meant to be a friend's birthday weekend celebration that we planned for months. One of the friends that came on the trip was stuck to a wheechair due to a leg injury a few weeks before. Our flight coming in arrived at 8:00am so we went to the hotel and tried to check in early. The line up was very long, but we did come early and a lot of people were checking out so that did not bother me too much. After about 20 minutes it was out turn and we asked if it was possible to check in early. They said that they would accomodate us for an early check in, and came up with 3 rooms on the same floor in the Roman Tower. I asked if there were any rooms available for an upgrade, and the lady said that they were full capacity due to the Super Bowl Weekend. We made our way to the Roman Tower and were disappointed from the time we stepped off the elevators. The hallways were very outdated, there was garbage everywhere, there was a glass in every single corner of the hallway and not to mention it smelled of mold. Our rooms were nothing short of a motel! The bedrooms had no closets, the bathroom door was glass as was the wall that looked into the bedroom, so if you took a bath or a shower, who ever is in the living room can see you. We were a little disappointed but kind of debated whether to say anything, we figured we would not spend too much time in the rooms. The only other issue was that getting around in a wheelchair was almost impossible because the hallways were tiny. We decided not to say anything and were tired from being up at 3am having to make our flight that morning. Within 30 minutes we realized that there was no way we were staying in those rooms. The floors were not vacuumed as there were sunflower seeds and chips on the floor. The bathroom had not been cleaned and had soap residue on the tub as well as the sink. There was garbage on the bathroom floor and the garbage cans were not emptied. One of the rooms had (I assume by the looks of it) pubic hair in the bathtub. The ceilings and walls were mirrored, and there was a thick layer of dust on everything in the room. We immediately got on the phone, complained about everything and were told that we had to wait until noon. During that time we went for some lunch in the food court and waited for the managers. They upgraded us to the Palace Tower which was a deluxe room, very nice looking and definitely clean! The only problem was that the Tower was on the whole other side of the hotel, and had to wheelchair her through the entire hotel and casino. We took it as it is and were extremely happy with the new accomodations. But only for a short while... Their housekeepers clean rooms starting between 7am-8am, every morning. They do not care if the DO NOT DISTURB sign is hung, they will still knock. Every morning I would open the door and say, please come back after 10, and they would knock half an hour later. At check out, we had not only been charged things that we did not even touch or were not there when we checked in, but they cut off our room keys hours before our check out time. Their staff is so slow and although they are semi friendly, they are not fit to run a hotel of that size with the attitude of "There is nothing we can do". I would advise to stay at the Caesar's Palace and only to the Palace or Augustus Tower if the prices are unbeatable. There are way cheaper hotels for the same location such as Bally's, Imperial Palace, and Flamingo, so why over pay if you are getting the same service as a lower grade accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok...Augustus restaurant made us sick”
Reviews.Author: meeksbay
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Super Bowl weekend. Room was not ready and we were told to return in 20 minutes. We were already given keys but they didn't work after returning 45 minutes later. Otherwise, the room was fine...beautiful roomy bathroom, excellent room service waiter. Maid service was extremely slow and we had to go to the maid for towels on the 2nd day as we were back in our room by 1pm and not cleaned. As for the gaming with it being a Super Bowl weekend the table limits were way too high so we spent most of our gaming time at Harrahs. The worst was dining for breakfast the day we left in the Augustus coffee shop. Both of us got sick. I nearly passed out waiting to get on the plane, paramedics were called and was therefore not allowed to board. Had to take a later flight which cast a shadow on the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Tower = Motel 6 with a Casino!”
Reviews.Author: SkippinWork
Reviews.Content: I thought the reviews of the Roman Tower must be exaggerated -- but I was wrong! I was part of a conference -- and paid more than $200 a night, and I travel frequently, so I had some concept of what $200 usually gets! Wrong! My room did not have a closet -- really. In the bathroom, there was a rack between the tub and the wall for my clothes, a la Motel 6. The safe was in the floor, and the glasses and ice bucket were on the safe -- so when I hung up my clothes, they hung down over the ice bucket and glasses! Amusing, huh? But I could live with that. That night when I took my shower, I pulled out the shower curtain -- the bottom was yellow and spotted with mildew stains -- a lovely contrast to the bright white of the rest of the curtain. Kind of disgusting, but it was bed time, so I just made it quick! Went over to turn on the bedside lamp -- no working light bulb. But it's bedtime, and I can't deal with changing rooms. So I call and leave a message asking for the lightbulbs to be replaced and the shower curtain to be replaced the next day. Of course, there's nothing that can be done about the huge gaping pull in the carpet, except maybe cover it with duct tape --- which would be a cosmetic improvement! At lunch, I came back to the room to work on my computer -- this is a business trip after all -- and guess what -- there were NO outlets anywhere near the desk. That was the last straw. So, I call down and ask for a new room. They are very gracious and assign me a new room in the Roman Tower -- I go down, get the new key, and check out the room before I move -- which does have a closet! But again -- No outlets by the desk. The only outlet on that side of the room is behind the armoire containing the TV. I go down again, and the young woman is very gracious and gives me an upgrade "at no cost, since I've had so much trouble". I go check out my new room in the Palace Tower, which is very nice -- complete with outlets by the desk so you can plug in your computer and Blackberry! I go back to my room to move my stuff -- I didn't want to wait for the bellman -- packed it all up, got back to the new room, and the key didn't work! The same key that had just worked! I had two keys, and neither worked. Housekeeping will not let you in and told me to call security, who had no idea when they could be there, and said it would be quicker for me to go back to the front desk. So, I trudged back down, the same very nice young woman ask how I'd demagnetized my keys -- no idea how I could have done that in 15 minutes -- but she redid them and sent me on my way! Finally! So -- only stay there if you are guarenteed that you are NOT in the Roman Tower! They should be embarrased to send guests there -- another woman told me there was no door on her bathroom! It is truly not an exaggeration to say that the Roman Tower is like staying in the Motel 6 with a casino! But if you are in any other other Towers, I think you would find them to be very nice and very much what you expect for a resort hotel or a conference hotel.

Reviews.Title: “How much was that room????”
Reviews.Author: backyarder1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to checkin at Caesar's Palace, there was a long line of people ahead of us. We couldn't figure out why the line was moving so slow until it was our turn at the front desk. We had booked an incredible deal for the room rate on the hotel's website. But the person at the reception desk seemed determined to make us spend more. He pulled out a book and started trying to talk us into different rooms. After flying for about 6 hours, we weren't really in the mood for this, but he was persistent. He finally showed us a room and said we could have it for $30.00. Of course, that sounded ridiculous, but I kept asking him over and over again and he kept saying $30.00. During our stay, I tried to check the room rate on the customer service channel and it never showed up. But when we checked out, we realized that they had charged us an "upcharge" of $30 per night for the room we stayed in. Two more things. Although listed as an amenity on the website, there is a charge of $14.99 a day for wireless internet. AND we were charged a room service charge for several items from the room that we did not use. (The customer support people on the phone were very cooperative about refunding us the money for the room service items). Was the room worth the money? Other than the fact that the shower didn't drain and we were standing in ankle deep water every time we showered, it was a pretty nice room. However, I doubt that it was really any nicer than the original room that we had booked over the internet.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: peaches76London
Reviews.Content: what a fantastic hotel! cant praise it enough....we stayed for week, wish it could have been longer, the room was amazing, huge bed massive bathroom (tv in the mirror etc) very plush, and to top it off we had direct views over the bellagio water fountains!! so if you book there make sure you ask for the augustus tower, as thats the newest one with all the amazing views of the fountain and strip.. its a very plush hotel but not at all snotty, which is a bonus. the decor is great it all looks fresh, the food was fantastic, portions are huge, casino is awesome..i cant say enough nice things about it, staff are very helpful and there is every facility available that you could need!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars was nice, but will stay somewhere else next trip”
Reviews.Author: SherryBraasch
Reviews.Content: My husband I went to Las Vegas October 1-5th 2007. We stayed all four nights at Caesars Palace in the new Augustus Tower. This section was very close to the main lobby and very easy to get to. Our room was beautiful and had a nice view of the strip. We could see the pool when looking to left out of our window. We ate at Rao's our first evening there, the restaurant was vey busy so we sat at the Bar and had a wonderful dinner. The bartender was excellent and very helpful with our ordering. We had breakfast one morning at the Payard Bistro. My husband and I both had chocolate and banana waffle. These waffles were soggy and dripping with chocolate. I do not recommend this Bistro to anyone. Menu very limited and expensive. We had a quick bite to eat at the Augustus Cafe located right next to the lobby. Very good burgers and appetizers at a good price. The pool at Caesars was a big disappointment. They are adding on to the hotel so they have barrier walls set up around the pool. In fact it seems the new addition is going to be blocking the sun from the pools. The pool does not see good sunlight until 1pm or so. We gambled at Caesars a few nights, the hotel is huge so it didn't seem overcrowded. Overall the hotel was nice, nice and bright, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Forget Hail Caesar, I suggest hailing a cab elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: TravelBoulder
Reviews.Content: I was at Casears for 4 days over New Years. I have stayed here before so I knew there is a MAJOR difference between their newer towers and their old towers in terms of rooms. The old tower is like a Holiday inn from the 1980's. Basic bed, stanky smell from years of smoking, even if you get a non-smoking room, etc.. I had booked a room in the newer tower upfront. When I checked in, there was no room available where I had booked AND prepaid. So, they said they would only charge me the going rate for the old tower they were putting me in. Say what? Are you kidding with me? ONly charge me for what you are providing even though what your providing isn't what I booked and prepaid for? They agreed to switch my room the next day. It gets better, they move me into a new room and when I get there someone else is in inside! I kid you not. I would NEVER stay here again. Go to Bellagio, Wynn, Encore, even the Venetian for a high end strip hotel. But I'd avoid Casears. If you do stay here don't say I didn't warn you. Upside is easy access to shopping.

Reviews.Title: “1st Trip To Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bly2006
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Caesar's from Jan. 10th Sat. until Jan. 13th Tuesday. We arrived approximately 4 hours early for check-in, but that seemed to be no problem. We received a free room upgrade(Forum Towers) and had no problems at all. The casino offered us $20.00 each in restuarant comps for signing up for total rewards. We decided to visit/gamble at several of the other casinos and found Caesar's to be in at least the top 3, if not the best. I recommend that staying at Caesar's should be top priority while in Vegas. I also forgot to mention that we arrived at Caesar's on Saturday and that we booked our entire trip on Friday. I could not have been more pleased that a trip planned a few hours before arrival went this well. Side notes: Casino- had fun, loved the wheel of fortune machines, but lost about $2,600. Restaurants- worst part about Caesar's, overpriced and bad food. Hotel Room- top notch. No other way to explain it. Hotel Staff- excellent, very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: nwwriter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caeser's for the first time and was impressed. Excellent location and the best for shopping. Had a very nice suite and enjoyed our stay. It was a decent value and reasonable cost to upgrade. PURE is a decandent club and we had fun there one night. We dined at a few of the restaraunts in Caeser's but was not impressed. There are better dining choices elsewhere. Overall a great time and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...Yet again”
Reviews.Author: coolio
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms at 5 nights each booked under a $75 special offer that included weekends, just before Xmas. I stayed here last Xmas and I love the location and rooms. At checkin (rooms booked under different names so 2 checkin experiences), everything was very smooth and very polite. Both tried the $20 trick and requested a room in the Augustus Tower. Got very high rooms, one looking over fountains, one the other way. Last year i stayed in the Palace Tower, but the view, and the room were better in the Augustus Tower. Housekeeping was perfect. The hotel is general is getting a bit dated, but then I find that with most hotels now in Vegas. It really is the best location and the Augustus is so easy to get out onto the strip from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuvSHOes
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Caesar's Palace the weekend before Christmas. We arrived at the hotel around 10:30 on Saturday morning, and asked if we could check in (very) early. Surprisingly, the desk agent said we could as she had a few rooms available. The agent did the $40 upgrade spiel (bigger beds) but we cheerfully declined saying we were just excited to be away from our husbands and kids for the first time in several years. The agent got a kick out of our excitement, and upgraded us for free. Our room was in the Palace Tower, and was definitely not a remodeled room. There is wear and tear in the tilework, the carpet and on the walls. However, it was spacious, very clean (especially the bathroom) and has the "signature" Roman-type bathroom, which we both really loved. The bath products (shampoo, body wash, etc) were great, and the hair dryer worked very well. The water pressure in the shower was fantastic, and we liked the fact that the toilet was in a separate closet, making getting ready in the morning very convenient. The beds were comfortable, and very clean. Our view was of the Mirage volcano, and the freeway. However, since we weren't in Las Vegas to hang out in the room, we really didn't care much about the view. The food court in the hotel is very convenient, and we both really liked the Asian place--especially the noodle soups. The only event that marred our hotel experience was that the alarm clock in the room next door went off at 6:30 in the morning on Sunday, and continued indefinitely. The room was obviously unoccupied and the previous occupant had left the alarm clock set. My sister mentioned it to the front desk that morning, and told them that may be something they should have housekeeping check when cleaning the rooms, as it definitely ruined our only chance of sleeping in. The desk said it was a security issue. What?! Having previously stayed at many of the other newer hotels on the Strip, I think Caesar's Palace is definitely showing its age. However, its location center strip is absolutely fantastic. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE & BEAUTIFUL ROOM”
Reviews.Author: wetpinkbunny
Reviews.Content: We syated at Caesars for a week and were getting married there. At check in, which took ony minuts, the wonderful lady upgraded us to the augustus tower which was stunning! One of my friends accidentally picked up the caesars palace golf balls (twice) and they were charged to my room but we had no problem getting them removed. The wedding personel was fantastic and very helpful (shani rocklands is awesome!) The grounds photographed beautifully! Every inch of this resort is spectacular. I hated to leave!! I also have stayed at Mandalay Bay and the Venetian and this was the most value for your dollar!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Augustus - Far Less Than Expected...”
Reviews.Author: rossbo1
Reviews.Content: My buddies and I stopped at Ceasars on a Sunday night before heading to the Fiesta Bowl. Caesars - their choice, not mine - was what it always is: old, while trying to be hip. Not to mentioned that the casino is dark, too spread out and smokey. And what about the fact that all the table mins were $25 on a SLOW Sunday night? What's up with that? We booked DLX rooms in the Augustus Tower (mine was comped) and thinking it would be on par with Bellagio or The Venetian, I was thoroughly disappointed. While the bathroom was great, the towels were scratchy, the soap bars miniscule, the minibar on the dreaded sensor, and the expected "plush" beds anything but. Plus, housekeeping left dirty towels in our room, used soap, a half-eaten burrito and a pair of dirty stocks - no kidding! The room was very large (nice) but the AC never cooled down properly (not nice). If this is the best Caesars has to offer, you can imagine that the other towers would really disappoint. Having stayed at Bellagio, The Venetian and The Wynn, I would never go back to Caesars if I had to pay, and probably not if it were comped again - it is way, way overrated...

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE UPGRADE”
Reviews.Author: mare592
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Jan. 1 thru the 4th. Check in lines were pretty bad. We were supposed to have 3 rooms for a special rate from Harrahs. Upon check in, I asked if we could talk about an upgrade. We had 8 people, so we were trying for 6 beds. I slipped the guy $40 using the credit card/license sandwich. We were promised 2 suites with 2 beds for an extra 100 a nite, and an upgrade to Augustus tower for one room. Only one suite was ready, so we looked at it. The room was in the Roman Tower. The suite was nice but old and dated. He also offered to give us a better suite the next day if we so desired, as the hotel was going to be clearing out and dozens of suites would open up. The one he gave us was clean and very roomy, with 2 double beds in one bedroom, a large living room/dining room combo, and 2 large granite bathrooms. There was no view, but I thought for the money it was a great bargain.( My brother decided not to change rooms the next day). I went down twice to get my room keys, but my suite still was not ready. Finally, the guy asked if I really needed 2 beds; I said no, and he said he had a larger suite with 1 bed for me. It was on the Palace Tower. The suite was AMAZING!! It was huge, with a plasma screen in the living room (50 in) and 42 in in the bedroom. We had a king bed, walk thru shower adjoined to another bathroom, whirlpool tub,toilet and bidet, and another bathroom off the front entry way. There was a small granite kitchen that oped up to the dining room. It was almost as big as my house. The floors were marble. The carpet new, and a nice view of the strip. I could not have been happier!!!! The casino was PACKED. Maybe because of New Year; The casino was packed from 11 am on. I'm talking about having a hard time finding tables and machines for gambling packed~ The place is VERY smokey. Everyone was correct in their posts; I don't know if Caesars has any nonsmoking areas. We did OK gambling here~ no better/worse than anywhere else. There were a few cocktail waitresses making rounds for gamblers, (costs $7 for a beer ,16 oz aluminum bottle, and $10 for vodka and cranberry juice) but not a lot. The forum was packed, too. We ate @ Spago and the Italian place in the mall. We ate @ Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill, and it was awesome. They were all good, but very pricey. We ate Breakfast in the foodcourt @ Caesars. We used our comps for free meals. They had a great breakfast sandwich deal for under $5. We used Concierge to print our airline tix home; they normally charge $5 a ticket for this service; my husband tipped the girl and she did it free. It would have cost $40 for our tix!! We rented 2 cars, and travel to Sams town and golf Mesquite, Rio and a nearby local course. Security was absent thru most of the hotel. There used to be guards at the elevators checking room keys; no more. There were hookers all over, just as observed by others. There are some shadey characters in the forum , and in the parking lots. Make sure you travel together and keep your valuables close to you or leave them home. We did observe security officers in the forum. We walked around to other casinos, and found them to be much less crowded and smokey. I find the cigar smoke to be much worse than cigarette smoke. The low ceilings at Caesars are the problem. We would stay here again. Most of the crowd are locals and visitors, as evidenced by an empty parking lot in the early morning. We really enjoyed our stay here, and were really pleased with the way we were treated.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars: Overpriced and Service That's Not That Great”
Reviews.Author: red8sox
Reviews.Content: I decided to go back and give Caesars Palace another try, after having stayed there several years ago. Upon checking in, during which there were ridiculous lines, we were badgered with room upsells. I went for the $40. upgrade and did receive a very nice room in the new tower. The thing that seems to bother me about Caesars is that you really do feel like just another face in the crowd while you are there. The hotel has lost any real connection with their guests. The long lines at check in, the incredibly overpriced food and the lack of any good level of service will stop me from ever staying at Caesars again. The only redeeming things are the hotel's location and their great sportsbook. I went across the street to eat every night and had my meals comped after only a couple hours of play. At Caesars, I played for days and was told that I had not earned any comps at all. There are much better hotels to stay at for the same or less money.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Nightmares”
Reviews.Author: Mark1600
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in we had problems. Wrong rooms, old rooms etc... Eventually got that sorted out - but would recommend you don't stay in the Roman Tower as the rooms are uninspiring to say the least. When I said we thought we had sorted the rooms out on checkout they had made the wrong changes in their computer system and were trying to charge us for 3 rooms instead of 2. This took some sorting out and eventually the intervention of a manager, who did give halve our spa treatment. If the front desk had been more customer focusec I am sure I woul have accepted an "I am sorry" but as they weren't I asked for compensation. They are doing themselves no favors! Otherwise the hotel is in a good place and the lobby, spa and forum shops are great. Would stay at the Bellagio, Venetian or Mandalay Bay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Marke18
Reviews.Content: We were really looking forward to staying here, but it did not live up to expectations. We came to take part in the charity Santa Run, which was good fun, and to watch the marathon. Check in was very polite and very quick, we were offered an up-grade at a reasonable price and accepted it, the room was large and the spa bath in the bathroom was relaxing, although the shower had very low water pressure. The beds were huge and very comfortable, with plenty of pilllows and the linen was clean. On closer inspection the room was not that clean, there were coffee stains (I hope!) all up the side of the bed, although I didn't really notice this until the night before we left and the carpet never appeared to have be vacumed properly, however all the other areas bath, shower, room surfaces etc were spotless. The buffet in the hotel was one of the worst I have tried in Vegas, the choice was very limited and it was very expensive (go to the Spice Buffet at Planet Hollywood instead). The bell desk could not answer any questions that we asked them, or would give incorrect information, for example they assured us that the marathon would be starting at 1pm, so we did not rush to get up and found out that it had started at 6am, so we missed a good part of that, we did complain at the front desk, but they were not interested, although we did, eventually, get to speak to a manager. The prostitutes waiting at the lift (elevator) entrances were very off-putting, and there appeared to be far more prostitutes in this hotel than any of the others that we have stayed at in Vegas, maybe it's the credit crunch! Overall it was an adequate hotel and did have some good points, but, in our opinion, it is not a 5 star, more a 3.5 star and I would not stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Have got to go back”
Reviews.Author: Capri1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 12/22 - 12/26 good deal from Expidia, free room upgrade package in Forum Tower. Early check in and very pleased to be offered upgrade to Palace Tower Premium Suite. An excellent stay, rooms were gorgeous, staff were great in all areas from casino to house keeping. Tell me what has happened to the turn down service and the chocolate on the pillow grand children most upset. Oh and no slippers either. How ever another great stay will be returning to Ceasers and would recommend to any others visiting Vegas especially first timers, good location, easy access to all other spots on strip. Food court very good value and casino slots very loose. There is building work to rear of hotel not too noisey or dusty but they do start work at 0330.Be warned. The City Centre site just down the strip is noisier and dustier they too start very early.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Onyxsoleil
Reviews.Content: After seeing some of the reviews posted in December for Caesars, we thought about switching to another hotel but ended up keeping our reservation. We had a great deal through Orbitz so we figured we would try it and see but did not have real high expectations. We are in Vegas usually 6 times a year, we normally like to stay at Venetian or TheHOTEL at Mandalay Bay but we could not pass up the deal at Caesars. We had no issues at checkin, it took all of 5 minues, we were not asked to upgrade, so we were on our way to our room in the Forum tower. We had a great room, looked like it was recently remodeled, bed was comfortable, huge shower with two showerheads. We heard no construction noise since the Forum tower is not close to where the construction is. The room was fairly quiet except if the heat came on, then it was a little noisy. The service at Caesars was good, no complaints. We would stay again if we got a great deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Book else where!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdowner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in December 08 for 4 nights and would never, ever stay there again!! Upon check in the receptionist asked if we'd like to upgrade our room. We poiltely declined but he continued to go on and on and on. He offered us every available room at every price but finally accepted we weren't interested to and gave up. He must have been on some sort of commission. The hotel had a lovely looking swimming pool but it was so cold there was no way you could swim in it. The hotel rooms are very dated and dark and dingy. The pictures on their website certainly make the rooms look better than they are. We had an comfortable bed but that was about it. The view from the room was non existant unless you count endless drink cans and food wrappers on the roof. The bathroom was ok apart from the toilet. It was a complete nightmare. It constantly blocked and we had to get someone out to unblock it twice! I just hope that once the new tower has been completed, they go back to the original towers and renovate all the exisiting rooms. I've stayed in numerous hotels on Las Vegas and considering this was one of the dearer ones (I could actually have stayed and the Bellagio for less) I was hugely dissapointed. This place is living on reputation alone. So take my advice and stay and a different hotel. Treasure Island, MGM or the Mirage are a milllion times better. Book another hotel or be prepared to be dissapointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Great Fun”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Caesars and it was great fun. Check in was quick and easy-I did the $20 trick and got upgraded from The Forum Tower to the Augustus Tower with an amazing view of the Bellagio Fountains and the strip. It was a smoking room and had a bit of the smoking smell but it was a King Bedded room and once again the view was unreal. The room was beautifully decorated and the entire hotel was very clean. The bed wasnt the best ever but it was comfortable and we slept well. Also the room was very well soundproofed which is very important to me. The bathroom was an incredible marble deal and we loved watching TV while the two of sat in the jacuzzi. The toiletries were nice too-I will have to agree with other reviewers that although the bed linens were great, the towels were the worst-I couldnt believe they had towels like that in the room. I asked housekeeping for extra towels one night and we never got them. They did clean every day though-I wish they had turn down service though. I asked for a late check out and got it. Qua Baths has to be the best spa ever-I cant say enough. All in all we really liked Caesars and The Augustus Tower is great. For the money it was a really great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews on the Caesars”
Reviews.Author: wbird
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Continental with our flight and got an awesome rate. Personally, I really enjoyed our stay at the Caesar. However my husband has asked that we try someplace else next time, simply b/c he thought it was nothing special. When we got there, I slid the person at the front desk a $20 tip to see if we could get a complimentary upgrade. We ended up in a renovated suite in the forum tower with a jacuzzi tub, dual bathroom with a dual head shower that connected them! Pros: Nice upgrade and renovated room Central Location on the strip Qua spa is wonderful! Poker room Cons: Current construction really takes away from the place Lobby area is really smoky Nothing spectacular (compared to the Venetian, Bellagio, Wynn) Most lower min blackjack tables were all 6:5 payouts Extremely slow service at the Augustus cafe

Reviews.Title: “Too big and over priced to enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Aces1212
Reviews.Content: Stayed Dec 12th - 14th, my birthday weekend. Well, all I can say is that I got to stay at Caesars comped, but after the losses on the machines, I guess I ended up paying way too much to stay here. I saw another review that talked about the walking, dear me, I must agree. The walk from self parking to registration is ridiculous, the walking from the Augustus Tower to the gaming area is ridiculous. The prices to eat, my goodness, we left to eat any meals. Give me a break, $12.00 for a waffle? I will say, though, the room was very nice. It's not often you get a sofa, coffee table and a table and 3 chairs. My floor was very quiet, so it was easy to sleep. Will I stay here again? No way, we usually stay at Paris, so we are going back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ceasars Famous Buffet- Yukkkkkk”
Reviews.Author: frankie-toronto
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for 17 days and met up with some old friends there from Australia who had never been. We thought we would take them to the lovely buffet at Ceasars Palace - the largest and most beautiful Hotel/Casino on the strip. Well we were shocked - the buffet had about 5 people there (around 7 p.m.) the choice was slim - the buffet area was almost non existent - the hostess was not polite - the lady who brought drinks was sweet and lovely. The food at the buffet was sloppy - all over the place - no presentation or display - nobody was there to cut - turkey for us we had to look for someone - when they did she just hacked a piece and threw it on our plates - no cranberries for turkey? How Un American is that. The food was no good - not fresh - and not even hot. We were highly disappointed and embarrassed with our friends - total cost for four of us was $116.00 US (we are Canadian) outrageous... The dessert areas had little or nothing and so much of it was dried out - and very poorly displayed - you could not even move - we had buffets in Mirage/Paris/Rio (the best)/Bellagio who surpassed this so called World Class Hotel by 110%... amazing - we would never recommend nor would we ever set foot in that hotel again... Dont eat there is my warning to you - and the cost of everything is insane in this economy. A regular visitor to Vegas....

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: DB41
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Forum Tower - large marble showers, large shower heads, 42" plasma set, very quiet except for self closing room doors causing early morning loud noise. The room was unusually good - beyond what was expected. On-going construction, but the only way we knew was a warning at check-in that we would lose power from 1-5 a.m. Unfortunately, the warning was repeated, but this time on a loud speaker system IN OUR ROOM. It was jolting, especially after the time change from NYC to LV. We complained, but no one seemed to care. Good place for people with walking problems. Electric scooters can be rented from the bell desk and can be transported in LV taxi vans that are common. But we had to find out about all of this on our own!

Reviews.Title: “All Hail Caesars's?...”
Reviews.Author: gottagit
Reviews.Content: Well, well, well, ...where to begin......perhaps it was the endless walk from the self parking to get to the registration desk.....perhaps the delightful smoke haze everywhere...including my non smoking floor...hmmmmm....perhaps the attitude of the desk clerk.....I arrived 45 min before the official check-in time....mind you....Vegas is a ghost town currently....NO crowds anywhere....so for Caesars to give me a hard time about wanting to check in early in view of the fact they too had few customers was just B.S......I paid for a deluxe from in the palace tower$200 a night..I requested a "strip" view on a high floor....so what did they give me....a low floor overlooking contruction....I was beyond furious....It was only after I said I was checking out and demanded my money back , did they magically find a room on the 25th floor overlooking the strip.....I just detest having to threaten to get service.....what a first impression! Even though it was a no smoking floor, one could still detect the essence of smoke everywhere....now some good news....the bed and linens were subblime....the marble bath with jacuzzi delightful, quiet and serene from the 25th floor....the elevators were super efficient. The good news is there is no need to go to their exercise room- because one has to walk walk, walk-oh, did I mention walking? Yup, endless walking to get to anything and everything. I was there for a science conference-but the level of noise outside of our conference room was unacceptable . The blackjack and craps table had high minimums..Enojyed a few good meals at their own Ogdens and Hakayumi restaurants...but the fees were out of this world.....there are many other venues in Vegas to enjoy good food as a reasonable price...all in all.....Caesars failed to deliver on the promise of a most excellent adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Hanger312
Reviews.Content: I booked a 'basic' room which was of a very high standard compared to what you get in Europe or London. Room was quiet at night despite being above a night club. Ceasar's Palace is huge and I was still finding places I hadn't been to on the last day! The hotel is ideally located for all the major attractions with the Bellagio next door (my favourite attraction in Vegas). On arrival we were advised that the room was a basic type and were offered an upgrade. If you plan to be out and about then decline this offer. As I said, the room was clean, comfortable and spacious, although we had no view which wasn't a problem. The hotel was very busy at the time of our holiday and we had no need to compain, other than losing everyday in the poker room. The hotel complex is massive. linking it to the Forum shops with all the major names there. I don't like shopping but was impressed. There are plenty of bars and restaurants within Caesar's as well to cater for most needs. The rooms were cleaned daily as you would expect. It is difficult to appreciate how much work goes on in the background to keep the place running so smoothly. My only gripe about Vegas is smoking is allowed everywhere except the poker tables. Having a public ban in the UK for the last year or so was really noticible. Other than that I had a great time and the weather late Nov, early Dec was blue sky, warm, 24 degrees centrigrade. Unlike Chicago, my stop off on the way home, which was freezing!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Di_and_Mike
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5-day trip to Caesars Palace and have had a most wonderful time. The hotel was fantastic - we had a room overlooking the Ballagio fountains - and the staff could not have been more polite and helpful. Unfortunately we did not win in the casino but this did not in any way affect what we can only describe as an awesome experience. Would not recommend eating at Planet Hollwood as we had a quite expensive meal there and it was awful. We did however find a lovely place to eat which was called Trader Vics (almost opposite the Bellagio) and we sat outside 2 days running and had excellent food with the added advantage of being able to see over the road to the fountains. At the risk of repeating myself, we could not have had a better trip. Everything was extremely well organised at the airport and hotel and the people were wonderful. Highly recommended - we will definitely be going back to the same place! Mike & Di 02 Dec 2008

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: rlowman
Reviews.Content: We loved our room however the service was poor in all areas. Check in took forever and they weren't busy. Our room wasn't ready so we went and ate and came back in about an hour. Clerk said our room was ready now and gave us the keys but when we got there it wasn't ready! It just went downhill from there. The place is too big! Next time will stay at the Wynn or Bellagio. Over-priced & poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: bellasally14
Reviews.Content: On arrival at Caesars palace i was very impressed. It was a very large beautiful hotel. We had booked for a 10 day break in a deluxe room, hoping to tie the Hatton fight and sight seeing in with some rest and relaxation by the pool. Our first disappointment came when we arrived in our deluxe room to open the curtains to a view of a building site. Caesars palace were building a further tower right outside our window. So we had no view of the strip just work men getting us up in a morning. Then we went to visit the pool 'Garden of the gods' which had been influential in booking this hotel to find a secuirty guard stopping us going outside as the pool was closed due to the building works! You can imagine our disappointment it was 80 degrees and we had no access to a pool! We had not been told this prior to us booking the hotel. To top it all off after being in the hotel approximately four days we received a phone call from the front desk to say they needed to move us out of our room as the electricity was going to go out due to the building works. I was not impressed we had to pack up again and move to the other side of the hotel and when you think this hotel is massive this was not a simple move. I was not impressed with the handling of this i made a complaint and said i was not happy but they said there was nothing they could do. Do yourself a favour and save your money as this hotel is expensive and not worth the money. Save yourself some money and book the Mirage next door, it is a beautiful hotel and guess what the pool is open!!! Oh and the food is nice and well priced in the Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Best Rooms so far”
Reviews.Author: Gadgetmadman
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th visit to Vegas from the UK and our first problem was cost - the rooms averaged about $260 per night but this was exaserbated by the value of the UK Pound against the US Dollar - $1.98 when we booked and $1.47 when we checked out - urrh. One of the problems with visiting Vegas from the UK is that you invariably arrive fairly late and that can prove troublesome as regards you room "request". It appears that what you booked is pretty much irrelevant and you have to take whatever is left! This happened on a previous visit (to NY,NY) but in this case our friends - who had arrived a couple of days in advance and stayed at the Flamingo across the road - were able to check in earlier and so when we arrived at about 23:30 they had our key. We had asked for adjoining rooms but of course this was not the case. We had, however, "booked" deluxe rooms in the Augustus tower and we had the perfect location overlooking the Bellagio fountains, just by the lift "block" and opposite the ice machine. They were located some distance away, in a deluxe room but overlooking the front of the hotel, but were able to move to the adjoining room a couple of days later so all was well (we stayed for 12 nights)! Both rooms were larger than most in the central "bulge" - lucky us! The condition of the rooms and bathrooms was excellent although I was concerned about the quantity of water required to fill the spa bath, anyone checked out the water level in Lake Mead recently - we did!! I would go out on a limb and say that the rooms were the best that we had experienced so far - better than the fountain view room at the Bellagio last year although you have the advantage of the fountain soundtrack from the TV there - no such luck in the Augustus rooms. The only niggle we had was the noise of the emergency service sirens which operate 24/7 unlike the UK where they cease after about midnight until 0700. Noise was well controlled otherwise except for the fountains firing away until midnight - OK if you are playing the tables until the small hours but not for us early to bed Brits. We are not really hardened gamblers and consistently lost on the slots. I had wanted to have a go at blackjack - hopefully to offset the extra cost of the hotel (over $1K) but I left it to the last night when the Comedy Festival was in full swing and the minimum bet was $25 - too steep for my "initiation" to the tables. Coming from the UK where smoking in public places is banned we were reasonably happy with the ventilation although we had to move slot machines if a smoker sat at the machine next to us. There is an awful amount of construction going on on the strip and with the current financial situation even Vegas is having to cut back - so I expect that most of the building work to take somewhat longer than normal. Having said that we saw two stories added to the building opposite during our stay. Not part of the $9.5 billion "City Center" construction site but between that and the Bellagio. Non of this impacts on Caesar's Palace as their new "Octavius" block is being built directly behind the Augustus Tower and as such was not really visible. Having familiarised ourselves on the sorry state of Caesar's Place overpriced food from Trip Adivisor reviews, we eat out on the strip at well known chains such as Outback and The Cheesecake Factory (in the Forum Shops) - you know what you are going to get and the price is right! You can use the unsecured WiFi at the Apple shop (also in the Forum Shops) to check your emails as the ridiculous price of $13.99 + tax per day internet access is outrageous in this day and age. All the hotels on the strip are the same so knowing about the Apple shop is useful - there is also one in the Fashion Show Mall. We took in 3 Cirque du Soleils - The Beatles "Love", "O" and "KA". We had seen the first two before and they remain our favourites. It appears that the new "computerised" mini-bars are another way of ripping off guests. We were caught out last year at the Bellagio for opening the door and chilling a can of coke. They charged us $20 for the privilege - took it off the bill when challenged and then re-billed it a week after we had left. Caesar's Place just blatantly added $49 to the bill despite us not even opening the mini-bar door. We had checked the TV readout of our bill and apart from a $23 addition for something we had not billed to the room and was removed when challenged; we had no extras and paid the night before leaving as we had an early start. We challenged the addition on our return to the UK and without any hesitation the operator refunded our card. Highly suspicious - I'll be keeping an eye on our credit card account. We rate our stay at Caesar's Palace vey highly - but we were lucky with the rooms. No problem with the maid service although it was pretty much late afternoon for our friend’s room but ours was always cleaned by mid-morning. They say that they only changed towels left on the floor but we were given fresh towels daily regardless. We had a small problem with one of the TVs - but a call to room service had it fixed within 10 minutes - excellent. We do recommend Caesar’s Palace based on our experience but as we like to sample a different hotel every trip I doubt that we will be returning there anytime soon. The Wynns or the Venetian will be our next target (when the exchange rate is more favourable).

Reviews.Title: “Love the Bellagio fountain view!”
Reviews.Author: Neatfeat
Reviews.Content: We are Harrah's Platinum Reward holders and our room in the Augustus Tower was a comp. We had stayed before in the Augustus Tower and we were with friends this time and we'd highly recommended the room. We were in a non-smoking room and they were in a smoking room. We arrived at 2pm and they got straight into their room but ours was not available. After repeated complaints to different members of staff we finally got into our 'non-smoking' room at 7.30pm! As soon as I entered the room I knew instantly that someone had been smoking and had to use my inhaler which I very rarely have to do! We asked for the manager to come to our room and she was with us within an hour. She offered to move us but couldn't move us that night but she would move us in the morning and the room would be humidified to try and get rid of the smell of smoke. We were then given $100 comp for food & beverages. As I say, we've stayed in the Augustus Tower on other occasions and the staff & attention to details has always been spot on with the room being turned down every night and chocolate coins being left for us BUT this time there was none of that, very disappointing!
