We were also not notified of the building works around the pool area, if you wanted to have a relaxing time around the pool there was no hope due to expansion works. I also agree with the other reveiwer that the Augustus Cafe was really expensive, we only ate in there once to use up the comp $100 but if we'd have been paying we'd have gone somewhere else, the service in the cafe was shockingly poor! All in all the best thing about the room is the view but Caesars need to up their customer service/friendliness of their staff to keep their loyal customers coming through the doors. Anita

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rooms Buttttt..”
Reviews.Author: Fortydeuce
Reviews.Content: I am a Harrahs Diamond Player so my room was comped and our tickets were comped for the Comedy Festival. I received a room in the Augustus Tower which was facing the Bellagio and the strip. This is the best view & room I ever had since going to Vegas since 1989. The room was immaculate. The only complaint I had was at least 2 lamps bulbs were blown out and I informed the cleaning staff. They said they would take care of it but they never did. One evening we returned to our room and it wasn't made up so we informed the only housekeeping person on that floor our room was not made up at all. She was surprised it had been missed. But she cleaned it while we were at one of the shows. The food was average but the prices were ridiculous. For example, for breakfast we ate in the Augustus Cafe. And, no, our meals were not comped on this trip. Between the 2 of us we had 4 Mimosas (champagne and orange juice) which were made to perfection, one cheese and bacon omelette, french toast (so, so) and a side order of bacon and coffee. Hold onto your hairpieces....it cost us $85.00. The Mimosas were $10 a piece. Now if I had gone across the street to Harrahs, my bill would have been 1/2 as much. No joke. One morning we ordered room service. We ordered a plate of waffles, a pot of coffee, hot chocolate, orange juice and bacon. It came to $55.00. They included a tip of $7.40 in the bill. My guest however was unaware of that and paid the waiter and additional $6. You think he would have warn us that the tip was already included in the bill. So my waiter skipped away with $13.00 in tips. Lucky him. We saw a number of celebrities at the Comedy Festival including Jamie Foxx. The casino is very smokey. I used my asthma inhaler more times in 3 days at Casears than I would have used normally in 6 months. Horrible ventilation system. All in all I enjoyed my accomodations but if I had to pay the prices some of you have quoted, I would stay at the Wynn by far. Next time I will go across the street to Harrahs to eat instead of Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Great central place”
Reviews.Author: TravelDreams
Reviews.Content: The first time I went to Vegas I stayed at one end of the strip,in a non-casino type resort. Very nice place, but we constantly had to do something to get to the meat of the strip. This time, staying at Caesars, I enjoyed Vegas much much more. Caesars has a great central location, and overall, it has a fun but classy atmosphere- not too stuffy like Bellagios. We stayed in the Augustus Tower in a Deluxe room. Without a $25 upgrade, I was told that these rooms only look toward the Caesars pool area- not the prettier Bellagio direction, but still a great view of the strip. The room was very spacious, the bed was perfect. The curtains blocked the light and sound perfectly so it was like a cocoon in the light frenzied, loud Las Vegas. The bathoom very nice, with great water pressure and spacious shower,and jacuzzi tub. I found everyone in Caesars to be very nice, fun, helpful. Check-in was easy- a little line because it was check-out time, but fun, as there was a celebrity in line to watch. Speaking of celebrities- Caesars seems to attract them- though maybe it was the comedy festival they were hosting, that brought them. My only complaints- - I don't often stay in luxury hotels- but I find it really annoying to have to pay for things that should be free- like WiFi access, a gym. To pay daily for the gym is ridiculous. Also the pool was closed while we were there- you would think they would have a 2nd pool- but no. My friend went to the spa and loved it, I have not heard anything bad about that place- except the cost. I LOVED Mesa Grill- ended up eating there a total of 3 times in 3 days!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: vpfreedude
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesar's in an upgraded Palacetower room in early Nov 2008. The room was nice enough & quiet comfortable. The bath tub was jetted for two people which was a nice touch. We got a "hot deal" rate of $275/night which when we checked in they tried to comp us a room at the Flamingo so they could charge out our room for >$500 a night to someone else. Other than the nice room, I was quite disappointed with my Casesar's Palace stay. Our group noticed an overwhelming attitude by the hotel/casino staff of "you are so lucky to be staying at Caesar's" and that vibe was hard to deal with. Personally we would stay at any MGM property over this one again if simply due to the more enjoyable staff and no snotty attitude when you ask for anything or try to contact anyone on staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: EAG20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar's from 11/07/08-11/14/08. Booked an Augustus Tower room. Paid an average of $200 per night. Checked-in early at 12 pm which was great! Check-in took 5 minutes total as they had every station open and the line moved very fast. Our room was perfect-not a single complaint. Our view was of Bellagio. The bathroom with the double sinks, separate shower and spa tub was such a treat for us! The flat screen TV in the bathroom was great. The bed was very comfortable as was the couch and chairs. Housekeeping was great. Our room was cleaned every day before noon. We never had to ask for anything. Room service was prompt and the tray/table was removed within 10 minutes of us calling for a pick-up. The concierge was very helpful when we needed our boarding passes printed out for the trip home. The hotel is big but, very easy to navigate. We loved meeting our friends every night at the Seahorse bar. Great bar for pre-dinner drinks. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. We had a blast watching the Eagles/Giants game on the big screen TV in the bar by the lobby. Check-out was easy. You can use the expess check-out on the TV in your room or go to the lobby. Took 5 minutes in the lobby as they had many staff working the line went fast. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MrKeno
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night stay and were pleased with all aspects of the trip. We qualify as Diamond level on Total Rewards and had the room and all of our meals comped. We reserved tickets to Bette Midler through a casino host and she was able to get us excellent tickets at the $ 140 price level. All info regarding the tickets were ready when we checked in the first night. The check in took about 5 minutes and the clerk was very pleasant and took time to explain some things regarding the property. We had stayed there before but a reminder of where things are located did not hurt. Our room was ready earlier than expected and we received a phone call in our room asking if we had any questions or if anything was not to our liking. The young man that brought our luggage was prompt and efficient and again asked if all was satisfactory. During the stay the casino was always busy but not overcrowded and drink service was good. We did lose at the slots but we did get good play for our money.The casino was clean at all times and the cleaning crew was always busy. I am a smoker, my wife is not and we were both equally satisifed with the level of smoke in the casino. Thank you for having someplace left in America were I can smoke and not be looked upon as an outcast. With the size of the casino you could choose to sit away from smoking if you desired. The Bette show was well worth the money and lasted nearly 1 1/2 hours. We always use valet for our rental car and never waited over 6 or 7 minutes for our car. We had to check out early our last morning due to flight time and it took about 1 minute and we were on our way. We do most of our gambling at Caesars Windsor Ontario but on our yearly trip to Vegas we hope to stay at Caesars Palace again. Mark us down as very satisfied customers.

Reviews.Title: “Room 10-Restaurants 3”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for five nights in Augustus Tower. Beautiful room,great bathroom but noticed little cutbacks such as no turning bed down in the evening and no chocolate on pillow. Worse, two of the best restaurants are closed permanently (Empress Court and 808) and the remainder are mediocre and/or very overpriced (Cafe Lago Buffet, Rao's and Nero's) or terrible such as the Augustus Cafe which is bad food, bad service and just plain bad. Bellagio next door has fantastic restaurants. and their buffet is amazing so that is where I ate last two days . Gambling there is also uninteresting because of the very tight machines and the very high minimum bets at the table games that offer dismal odds. Prices are pretty outrageous for pretty much everything with no sound reason other than to gouge. Such a shame to see a once great property so diminished.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: NielsKDK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars during the Labor Day weekend together with a couple of friends. The hotel and the casino is absolutely fantastic. Large, comfartable rooms and big, classy bathrooms with a nice big tub. The only thing that wasn't great about the rooms was the view, which was definetely not a pretty sight from our rooms. The casino and the Forum Shops are really spectacular and it is an adventure walking around inside this beautiful, roman hotel. Only downside about the hotel is the price, which I think was a bit high, compared to the other hotels on the strip. But all in all a fantastic hotel, casino and shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Hated The Lago Buffet At Caesars”
Reviews.Author: janettura
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to Atlantic City La Piazza Buffet, which we love, we decided to try Lago Buffet in Vegas, thinking it would be comparable, or better.Wrong! Price too high for the size of the buffet. Poor selection to choose from. Loved our trip to Vegas, but this was the low point of the trip, Our whole party was disappointed with this buffet, and food was not that good. Our next trip will definitely not include this buffet. jantrace@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “It's Vegas Baby!”
Reviews.Author: DumbDog
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights/three days midweek for a girlfriend getaway to catch some shows and enjoy the unseasonably warm (70s-80s) weather. Check-in was quick although the clerk tried pretty hard with the upsell to a suite for $30/night extra (which we passed on). Room was in the Roman tower and was very clean and had a partial view out towards the Rio and over the construction site. If you want to sleep in, be aware the construction noise starts right around 7:30 AM. Also be aware that the entire pool complex will shut down Nov. 18th all the way through the Spring of 2009 for construction. We noticed the casino seemed smokier than others we spent time in, maybe they need to pump in more clean air? Drinks are expensive in the SeaHorse Lounge downstairs ($15 per cocktail) but they made the best Sidecar here of any that I had during our trip. The Mesa Grill downstairs has awesome food--we had appetizers while at the bar on 2 afternoons and that worked as an awesome dinner. We paid $149/night booked 3 months ago. I think with the downturn in the economy you can get much better deals than that. Overall the room was clean and plenty large enough for the both of us with 2 queens. All of the employees were good, no bad experiences there. The location on the Strip can't be beat. My favorite hotel in Vegas is still the Bellagio though.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: BrandiNecole80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 3 ( of our 4 nts in Vegas ) at this property. We opted for the least expensive category the Classic room type. This is in the Roman Tower- the elevators for these rooms are right off of the casino floor. We had an ok room, the bathroom was fairly nice, a nice marble enclosed soaking tub as well as a separate glass door enclosed tile shower. There is also a small flat screen tv in the vanity area above the sink and mirror area. The room itself was ok,nothing spectacular nice furnishings, the view was of the pool area which as I'm sure has been previously mentioned, is now blocked by the tower that is going up as part of the new Caesars wing. On the otherhand I hated the layout, we did not spend much time at the resort itself, opting instead for neighboring properties. The casino was very smokey and the drink costs were much higher than most ( 6 or 7 $ for a domestic beer ). The location was great as we walked everywhere and were able to see most of the strip in the few days that we were there. I would say that this is an ok place, I just would not let anyone think that this is the Bellagio or Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “don't let the bellhop take your bags”
Reviews.Author: susano23
Reviews.Content: I brought my husband along to vegas while i attended a conference at caesar's (that's why we chose this hotel) and overall, we had a nice time. We were impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel and our room but were disappointed in how far everything is from everything else (i did not bring comfortable shoes and ended up wearing my husband's runners). At the checkout, we were charged for "using" the minibar when we had not, but we easily cleared this up without a problem. Our biggest complaint was that the bellhop offered to take our bags upon arrival and we handed them over. He told us to call the belldesk when we reached our room and they would bring the bags right up. Over an hour later, we still had not received our bags and couldn't really go anywhere until they arrived. So if you can manage, hold on to your bags and avoid the frustration. Other than that (and the shady pool), our stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Do Your Homework”
Reviews.Author: 2bamboo
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Las Vegas for my first visit specifically to see Elton John. Once I decided to stay at the hotel he was performing in I did my homework and studied up on the many different towers and options that Caesars offers. Throwing all caution to the wind for this very special trip I picked the Augustus Tower with a view of the Bellagio fountains. I also planned on visiting the Qua Spa, which is located in the Augustus Tower. The room was very spacious and comfortable and the view was worth insisting on at check in. Even though we could not hear the music from the room, watching the fountains dance was always entertaining. We were on the 41st floor and could also not hear any road noise. We walked to the Luxor and back, weaving in and out of the hotels along the way. In comparison I appreciate the lightness and openness of Caesars Palace instead of the darker, smokier, lower ceilings of other hotels. I roll Craps and the dealers were friendly and outgoing and 2 out of 3 nights the tables were full of fun energetic people. We ate at Mesa Grill, which was delicious and be sure to try the espresso martini! Spagos was good but running a bit on it's name. Here's my big review tip...as other's have already mentioned...BEWARE THE MINI BAR! I woke up at 3am and was SO thirsty that I sprung for a $5.35 orange juice. No prices are posted, but I asked at the desk the next day how much my big thirst cost me. The next morning, unannounced, the mini bar lady walked in to our room. We were still in bed asleep. Even when she noticed this she proceeded to go about her business, checking our mini bar and re-stocking, without any apologies or explanation. Bolt your door, put out the sign and throw the latch! We even contemplated how difficult it would be to push the desk in front of the door....just kidding but we did think about it. I ordered room service twice and the food was very good. I was surprised that the next day housekeeping did not remove the table that they roll in with your food. I called and asked for it to be removed but they never came to get it. The old food was beginning to stink up the room so I put the table out in the hallway, where it sat for another day. The next time I ordered room service I told them to take the food off and take the table with them. I mentioned my other table out in the hallway, and they Still did not remove it. I brought my own little coffee maker because TA reviews warned me that there is not one in the room. This got me up enough to go downstairs to the long line at the coffee shop. The spa was wonderful. Loved everything about it. See Qua review for more. Vegas is all about attitude. There is plenty to complain about, if you want to. Or, you can soak in all the oddities that make Vegas so unique, keep a positive attitude and others will respond in kind. And, by the way, Elton was fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “Over rated & Old fashion rip off”
Reviews.Author: Sophdobe
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas many times and Ceasar's is by far the worst hotel I've stayed in! It's definitely not worth the price you pay for!!! Stayed 4 nights in a standard room with my sister and her baby. The room was very very old & out dated. There was nothing in the room - no fridge, mini bar, coffee machine nor kettle (boiler) - just an old tv. With a baby, a coffee machine/ hot water boiler is essential, so we called room service for one and only to be told that it'll cost us $8! (I thought these kind of things should be standard in a 5 star hotel like Ceasar's!) and when we checked out the bill shows $18 because the room service lady has nicely tipped herself $10 - without our permission!!! very shocking behaviour!!! The hotel is very short staffed - there were only 3 staffs serving about 30pple at the check in counter, not to mention that everytime you dial front desk from your room, it takes a very long time to get connected - if it lets you that is! Sometimes they just put you to voicemail - what kind of service is that??? I've never stayed at a hotel where I cannot reach front desk nor room service nor house keeping! Or have to wait for 10mins on the phone to get some service in my room! House keeping also don't come cleaning your room on daily basis. They did not come tidy up for 2 days and we had to call them to get the room cleaned! - Again, for the amount of money paid, this should not occur. Over all, I had a really horrible time there and would never return again!

Reviews.Title: “CAESAR"S Is great as a comp!”
Reviews.Author: BoltonInxtc
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 days at Caesar's and 2 days at Paris this trip around. I found Paris too dark and dismal; casino a waste of time. Now Caesar's is very good to you when you have comp's. They are very quick to give you upgrade's or credits should you have a problem. Casino was too tight on their machines; waitresses too few and this is because one of them told me a whole bunch were laid off the week before due to the Recession in the States and and dollar going down for Canadians. So drinks were few. Staff and reception very friendly and efficient. May I add that the Augustus Cafe was a waste of money; your better off to go to the "Grand Lux Cafe" in the Venetian and order their caramel crispy chicken! Awesome!!! Very good value and comparable to the Cheesecake Factory. The breakfast buffet was okay not great; go to the Bellagio for that. All in all for what I didn't pay, it was great; pools are beautiful but no sun 'til 2 p.m. We ordered 2 beers for $14.00 US plus tip. Very expensive. So have a great trip and please write me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Not a guest, just a number”
Reviews.Author: Casualist
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is one big assualt on the senses, non-stop noise, bright lights and crowds. Caesars Palace being the classic Las Vegas hotel and established name didn't take anything away from this round the clock attack, from the huge snarl-up of cars, taxis and buses arriving to drop off guests at reception, to the airport check-in like queues when checking in, to the slalom around what seemed like hundreds of fruit machines and thousands of gamblers in between the hotel exit and the entrance to the lift. Noise noise lights lights. To their credit, the front door staff were always on top of the snarling mass of traffic on their doorstep, although it didn't encourage us to take a taxi from there. Also the staff were unable to tell us where to take a taxi to when visiting a Las Vegas Wranglers ice hockey match (its in the Orleans Arena, in a casino complex near the Rio Hotel/Casino, should anybody be interested in paying them a visit). Check-in was also very fast and efficient, given the huge number of visitors arriving. The rooms themselves are large, modern, but with no great surprises or touches, very business traveller hotel. I was kind of expecting some OTT Vegas touches, no chance. Although I'm sure some rooms have a view of the Strip, ours was of a concrete roof. Probably a ploy to make sure the guest spends as little time in the room and as much time downstairs gambling. The one nice touch was a TV in the bathroom. The hotel complex is, predictably, huge and the free map given to visitors is certainly needed. I only visited a fraction of the hotel area during my stay and I'm a person who likes to explore their hotel from top to bottom. Caesars doesn't have any great architectural pieces or stunts associated with it, in the same that say the Bellaggio has its fountains and Paris has its Eiffel Tower, what it does make a big deal of is the Forum Shops. In fact its not really much to write home about, there's a lame robotic show to watch, a TV projection of a sky onto the roof of one piazza area that changes depending on the weather or daylight outside, and an interesting Trojan horse replica, otherwise not a lot to shout about. There are plenty of big name brand shops, but anybody living in a big US or European city will have seen it all before. The location is pretty good, conveniently halfway along the strip. Think before taking the Skytrain, it might look on the map as if its a stone's throw away, but trying to reach it through the maze that is the Flamingo Hotel opposite is nigh on impossible. The hotel also has a piazza area outdoors which it reserves for staying guests on New Years Eve, from where its guests have a great view of the fireworks celebrations. Don't expect too many great things from these either, I've seen far better in my local park in England on November 5. Its one of the biggest hotels in the world, never mind Vegas, so its hardly surprising that one feels treated like a number rather than a guest. Everything runs like a giant machine, albeit efficiently. What the hotel lacks is a sense of belonging, it can't hope to match the likes of the Mandalay Bay or Bellaggio for class, neither can it match the Paris, Venetian, Luxor, Excalibur or New York New York for outrageous kitsch. Its neither a classy hotel, nor is it a cheaper one offering value for money such as the Golden Nugget or Flamingos. In essence its a name and nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: beachgirlLewes
Reviews.Content: We just stayed @ Caesar's 10/27-31/08..What a disappointment!We last stayed at this property 4 years ago and was great! This time, WOW was a degrade in accommodations..First, we "upgraded" to a "nicer room" because the room we were booked for "is 24 years old and it shows" the upgrade is "much nicer", ok, we upgraded, so when we arrived to our upgraded room, swiped our key and presto--they were already guest assigned to that room and were in the room!!! We called on the house phone and they would send up security to let us in our "new" room-security came but without new room keys!! So, we have to travel all the way back dwn to the front desk and obtain new keys because of their screw up-a major one, imagine having someone use a key and walk right into your hotel room while you are in their, especially for the big$$$ they charge..The slots were not abundant and were very cold machines..one cup of coffee is $4.00 plus tax when right across the street the same size is $2.25 and is Seattle's Best and tasted much better than Caesar's..Resturants were very pricey and upon check out--they tried to tack onto our bill for use of the minibar of which we NEVER used--they said "well, usually if the miniar gets bumped it will register that it is used" really, how does it know specially--as it was spelled out on the bill- what was used!! $20.00 removed because of this-yet another error- from Caesar's.. We will be returning the best all around BELLAGIO the next time we travel to Vegas as we have never had any problems with this great property..We took a chance on trying out another property and got what we asked for--much, much less and a disappointment @ Caesar's

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but very good stay.”
Reviews.Author: VPplayerPA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a mini-suite in the Palace Tower (Rm2601) from Oct. 27-31. Check-in went very smoothly in the Diamond registration area and upon arriving in the room we immediately received a phone call from the person who checked us in to ask if everything was ok......nice touch. Some of the negative points of this stay were: 1. No coffee maker in the room ($40 charge if you want one). 2. Pool area is completely shaded throughout the day due to new construction. 3. Very little choice in late night restaurants (it's basically room service or the Augustus Cafe). 4. Rio shuttle is a fairly long walk away from the location posted on the floor plan. 5. Strange floorplan in the mini-suite which includes two bathrooms joined by a shower (which you can see into the other bathroom through). Some of the positive points were: 1. Experienced very pleasant, helpful staff. 2. Clean, elegant hotel with beautiful flowers and statues throughout. 3. Nice selection of restaurants throughout the day. 4. Great shopping. 5. One of our group won $4K on VP. 5. Jacuzzi in the suite. 6. Housekeeping staff very throrough and pleasant. 7. Extra refrigerator delivered promptly on request. 8. Comfortable beds. Gambling issues: 1. Decent selection of video poker (not the greatest of pay tables). 2. As stated - one of us won 4K. 3. After CB won her 4K (at 3:30 am), a Caesars employee later came up to her in a different area of the casino to tell her she was the lucky winner of a special voucher. This voucher entitled her to 2500 comp points if she took it to another Harrah's property in Vegas and played some there. A very obvious attempt to lure CB to play back some of her winnings. Overall....Liked the hotel/casino very much but realize that even Harrah's can't make sunshine where there is none....so the pool will remain forever shaded. I think for that reason alone we might not be back. VPPlayerPA

Reviews.Title: “A Royal Bust for Caesar...”
Reviews.Author: swoodwor1
Reviews.Content: Highly overrated!!! Not an upscale place to stay in Vegas, for sure! The rooms are ill-maintained, burn stain ridden, missing basic items (light bulbs), filled with outdated appliances and without any signs to hang on the door. You swipe your credit card if you want to use the in-room safe and wait forever if you need any help. WOW! The pools don't get sun (unless you want to pay extra), the help is amateurish, indifferent and has uniforms that are all wrinkled and/or don't fit. I understand that Harrah's, the owner, is debt laden and likely unable to fix the many day to day irregularities that are becoming only too obvious. That's too bad, because this property, which nickels and dimes at every corner, is going to be driving customers away --- making it even harder to pay back debt and make the necessary improvements. After 3 days we checked out and went to another property --- much nicer rooms, friendlier staff, amenities that don't always cost and a price that is 60% of the lowest cost of Caesar's. C'est la vie!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well below premium almost a house of discount”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: This was a dissapointing weekend stay, I had long amired this hotel's reputation. It was a downer to walk away with a bad experience. Checkin was chaos, I have excepted that check-in at any hotel in Las Vegas would be a task since they deal with volume, but this hotel was having a very down day with their staff. I had a car since parking is free. I tried to valet, which it typically free in Vegas, but you had to be a preferred member of their loyalty program. The rooms was an old tower, the room previously was a smoking room. It was nicely decorated. The door had a space underneath the bottom so you could hear everything from the hallway. The walls are very thin so you could heat everything next door. The bed was the worst experience. It was harder than rock. Prison inmates have better accomadations. The bathroom was larger and the water pressure was strong. I did not use the gym as there was a $25.00 daily charge. The casino had a very poor choice of slot machines and tables that were crowed. There was a cheesy strip club called the pussycat louge which should be left to the sleazier part of vegas. The food was good in their restaurants and the prices were a bit over the top. If you are looking for premium service, pemium lodging and premium gambling this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: PickleBrighton_UK
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel, I work in travel so researched lots of hotels for weeks and choose this hotel due to its central location and standard. Most hotels in Las Vegas are of a good standard, but I would say the Caesars Palace is in the top 5. We stayed in a superior room with a great view of the city. The room was very big with two large double beds, flat screen TV and fully stocked mini bar. The décor was modern with a bright feel and good quality furnishings. The room had the biggest bathroom I have ever seen before, with a flat screen TV, Jacuzzi bath, and you could probably get about 4 people in the shower cubical! The staff were very helpful at all times, especially when you get lost in the hotel as it is so big. The buffet breakfast is really good, excellent choice of food; you could have anything you wanted really all for around $14 per person. Outside the hotel is the main strip and you really are central to everything in Vegas, it’s a great choice. I would definitely stay here again; if I couldn’t for some reason then my next choice would be the Venetian or Wynn Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little help!”
Reviews.Author: Mrsbeane
Reviews.Content: A great sized room beutifully decorated. However, the room seemed to be in some disrepair. There was a handle missing on one of the cabinet doors and a large chip taken out of a desk drawer. Caesars definitely needs to do some quality control with the cleaning staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Pt 1 - Roman Tower”
Reviews.Author: Sequim88
Reviews.Content: Our Palace Tower (PT) room was not available upon check-in so we had one night in a Roman Tower room before being moved (and upgraded for our trouble) to a Petite Suite in PT. We found the Roman Tower room (1074) to be quite acceptable. Decor was almost identical to the PT rooms and completely up to date with LCD TV. The alarm clock was old clock radio...not the newer CD player type with iPod input like in PT. One major quirk was the absence of a door of any kind on the bathroom although the toilet was around a corner and not viewable from the entrance way. Large non-jetted tub (with some enamel chips) and seperate shower. King bed was pillow top type and very comfortable but was very high so hard to get in and out of. Although we like PT better this Roman Tower room would be a great value if the price difference was enough.

Reviews.Title: “Gelato at Caesar's Palace and Vegas is Not for Children”
Reviews.Author: followingmomsadvice
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas. Everything was wonderful with just two exceptions: On our first day we decided to go to Caesar's Palace to shop and to try the great gelato. "Let the Buyer beware" should have been our mantra, because from the several sizes of cups on their display case, we chose the smallest (thinking it would not cost all that much). Our fault, we did not ask for the price until my husband went around to the other side of the counter and saw the sign and got his bill...$70 for four gelatos. We didn't want to make a scene and we ate the $70. Such a bad beginning! The only other problem was that the free shows, including Treasure Island, are very provocative and sexual and are not meant for children. In additon, walking down the street there are lines of card pushers, handing out escort service cards with nude women's photos on them. These cards, for the most part, end up face up on the sidewalks - really, not a kid friendly environment. What we LOVED: Bett Midler, Ellis Island, the Mariott Grand Chateau (outstanding staff and beautiful spaces), the boulangerie at Paris and the soap shop, the gelato at Paris and the Grand Canyon trip with Adventure Photo Tours. Vegas was even more and better than we expected - so much fun for adults, and you don't have to be a gambler!

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MichaelJ45
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4-days in Vegas. It was my sixth time in Vegas but me first time staying at Caesars, and I must say it was my most enjoyable hotel experience to date. Arrived on a Thursday afternoon, and was immediately taken with the stunning hotel lobby. Check-in was a breeze. I had booked a package that came with a standard Classic room, which I guess would have been in one of the older towers, but I was kindly upgraded to a room in the Forum tower without asking. The room, while not that big, was nicely appointed and the bed was great. Not much of a view from our room as we were on a lower floor, but we weren't planning on spending too much time in the room, so we did not mind. I was surprised to read some of the negative comments about the service at this hotel, because our experience was first rate. Everyone from the front desk staff to housekeeping to the casino attendants were pleasant. The concierge could not do enough to help us with two restaurants reservations and show tickets. There is some construction going on at the hotel with the new tower, but I really did not find it too intrusive. The pool area is the most impacted, but it is still a great area... over the weekend the workers were not there, so noise from construction was not a bother. The location can't be beat, and while I have always enjoyed playing at the casino at Caesars, recent renovations have made the space even better. Nightlife, shops, restaurants are all great ... had enjoyed them before from other hotels, so it was nice to be within stumbling distance on this trip. The location of Caesars is easily on par with the Bellagio in terms of service and room quality. Add to that the history of the place and Vintage Vegas feel of the place (for the lack of a better description!) and for me, Caesars is the place to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the Name”
Reviews.Author: TexasMaggieMae
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Palace Tower in a room with 2 queen beds and two bathrooms. Since there were 4 of us, the 2 bathrooms could have been a really nice addition but the problem was the two baths were connected by a large glass shower. Although the shower was nice with two shower heads, unless you wanted people walking by while you were in there, both doors had to be closed. There was a make up cubby which was an advantage. The beds were comfortable but believe they were only doubles, not queens. The room was nice and clean and really plenty of space for 4 since you aren't in the room that much. We had room service 3 times and although each time was a different person, they were the nicest room service personnel I have ever had. We arrived at 2:00, waited in the registration line for about 15 minutes only to be told the earliest we could get in was 4:00. The lady was extremely rude, even as far as mocking. When I told her I had a confirmation number she said "I told you, all I needed was your name". It was my first impression of the hotel and believe the front desk personnel should go to the same 'be nice' school that the waiters do. Now even though Caesars is a class act and I have always wanted to stay there, I was disappointed in the casino itself. It's cut into sections, so hard to find your way around and locate your companions. The ceilings are very low and the place just didn't seem clean. Most of the video poker machines were old, blurry or jumpy. After walking across the street to Bellagio, the difference in air quality, cleanliness and newer machines was immediately evident. I've had my stay at Caesars, glad I did but won't be going back when there are better places so close by.

Reviews.Title: “Busy, Smokey, Crowded Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacksprattoronto
Reviews.Content: We arrived around Midnight on a Saturday in October 2008. We were exhausted. We paid an extra $500 for the week's stay to have a room with a spa tub for my wife who has fibromyalgia, a chronic pain condition. Yes, we stayed a whole week so that we could enjoy our anniversary in Las Vegas and at Caesars. Here is what happened. I asked the Hotel Desk person to make sure we got the room with the spa as it was important to my wife, she confirmed, "yes sir, the Deluxe Room". We were given a room at the Forum Towers and walked across the whole hotel, which is quite a walk to get to the elevators for the Forum Towers. Finally we reached the room and my wife who was in pain due to the flight and late hour was so looking forward to getting some pain relief by using the spa tub before going to bed. As soon as we walked into the room it became apparent to me that the room was not what I booked. I quickly went to the bathroom to check out the spa tub and to my surprise, there was no spa tub or any kind of tub, just a shower. This was not the room that I had paid for and had asked the person at the front desk to confirm she was putting us in. My wife was very disappointed and I became very angry, called the front desk and the same person acknowledged that this was not the room we had paid for and that they did not have any left. I asked her why she did not advise me of this when we were face to face rather than sending us across to the other end of the hotel without any warning and getting us angry. It became apparent that they did not want any face to face confrontation so they lied to us and hoped that we were too tired to go back to the front desk in person to argue. They were right, my wife was exhausted and in too much pain for her to go and I did not want to begin my 25th wedding anniversary holiday by letting my blood pressure rise and getting even more upset. They did put us in the right room the next afternoon which ruined our first day while we waited for the room to get unpacked. Another most frustrating situation at Caesars was the construction and the lack of sun in the pool area. We were never advised that the pool area was reduced in size and that there was little sun in that area due to new buildings going up. The pool area was reduced to a fraction of it's original area and nowhere in the literature or at the front desk was anyone warned about this situation. We heard many many guests upset about this and swearing that this was their last visit to Caesars! Caesars main building and Casino was built in the 1960's and the low ceilings in the casino along with smokers, make the casino very uncomfortable and unhealthy for those who do not smoke. Extremely crowded and smokey casino, untruthful desk staff, no compensation for our trouble, double charges on our room tab for movies made this stay, and the closed pools and lack of sun in the pool area, would be our last visit ever at Caesars. Let me say that we have visited Las Vegas almost every other year in the last 25 years and stayed at Caesars every visit. Customer service is lacking in many ways with no sense of obligation to inform patrons of the construction ahead of time and with no sense of obligation to meet their reservation commitments. If you have booked Caesar's I strongly recommend you change your hotel before it's too late and your vacation is ruined!

Reviews.Title: “Caesers Pool will never be the same”
Reviews.Author: EddieTrina
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend our anniversary at Caesers Palace and I admit I should have done more research prior to booking my trip. The hotel is nice and the location on the strip is ideal. However the reason I chose Caesers over Bellagio or the Venetian was due to their pool. My wife and i wanted to stay at one of the Vegas hotels that had the best pools for us to spend our days after a night of running around the town. Because of the new tower construction, the main pools are completely blocked from sunlight this time of year. The lifeguard said that in the summer the main pools are not blocked because the sun was more over head than this time of year. I sure I wish I had checked Trip Advisor prior to booking this trip. Everyone was crowded around the Adult only pool while we were there and it was not relaxing. Their were people fighting over chairs and sitting on top of each other trying to stay in the sun. Bottom line is that if you are heading to Vegas and you care about hanging out at the pool, I would stay away from Caesers. The construction is awful and the pool is a major problem right now. It needs to be completely redone. Fortunately my beautiful wife and I still had a great time in spite of the lousy pool situation. We just would have had more fun at Bellagio

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: reuhl925
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. I have stayed at alot of the hotels on the strip and this is by far the best! No complaints out of the 4 times I have stayed here! Hotel staff friendly, great rooms, fantastic pool and shops! Big Tiffany and Co Cheesecake Factory Abercrombie Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: jessiegus
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks holiday with my husband - our first visit to Vegas. At first were taken aback at the size of the place but loved the atmosphere and excitement.. Check in took about 5 mins and after taking a tip off a previous review handed a 10 dollar bill to the receptionist who then couldn't do enough to accommodate us!! We were given a room in the Palace tower but after asking to change to the Augustus tower with a view of the Strip were changed the next day and the view from the 44th floor was fantastic - watched the fountains for hours!!! The room was immaculate and huge, the bed soo comfortable and the bathroom was to die for!!! The pool area, whilst undergoing construction did not bother us too much. The only critiscm was if you wasn't there early enough you didn't have much choice of beds. The only disappointment was that Cher cancelled and we missed her show. Would we return to Caesars - definately!!!

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower”
Reviews.Author: Poodles65
Reviews.Content: Booked about a week before the trip through Expedia which provided a "Classic" room. After reading reviews, I realized that we were booked in one of the older rooms, so I looked into upgrading. Got a great tip from another Tripadvisor member and when we checked in, I asked the front desk clerk for an upgrade and at the same time, gave her a folded bill on top of my credit card, and was politely upgraded to a strip view room in the Augustus Tower! Friends tried the same but on a busy weekend and although the clerk tried, couldn't get them anything better, so your best bet for an upgrade that won't cost you an arm and a leg is to try if you have booked on a weekday, or quieter weekend. The room was wonderful, roomy and had a great bathroom. Room service was quick and not very expensive - one night we ordered special coffees and dessert around 11:00 pm and watched the Bellagio fountains in the moonlight. So romantic! My husband even found a music only station on the TV and we turned all the lights out to get the full effect of the strip's lights. The high end restaurants were nice, we even did the Café Lago buffet for one dinner, which was also fine, but the Augustus Cafe was horrible. Bad service and bad attitudes, and it wasn't even busy. The pool was nice but only a few hours where it was warm enough due to the time of the year we were there (Thanksgiving). The heavy construction wasn't going on then as many other reviewers have complained in the past, so we were lucky. Casino was good, no blackjack tables under $10, which is normal these days, but as the casino got busy, those $10 tables soon became $25 tables. The slots were fine, I played for hours, going up and down, even won a small jackpot. Since Caesars is part of Harrah's, sign up for the Rewards card for some food coupons at the buffet's mostly, as well, they send you offers in the mail for free rooms at the lower end properties, but free none the less. Will definitely go again and maybe get into one of the Forum rooms which is closer to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars is first class but be prepared to pay for any extra amenities”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl202
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 night stay in Oct. and the weather was fabulous. (4 female friends (over 40) celebrating the good life) Yes, Caesar's is a 5* resort. All the public areas and restaurants are top notch. But if you are planning to visit in the near future and intend on using the pool area, I suggest selecting another property. The main pool no longer exists; a new one is under construction. Caesar's will advise three pools are open - YES - but all are quite small and shaded till after 11:30am because of the new tower being built. At the present time, it is not a relaxing enjoyable area with the construction and the lounge chairs have seen the test of time. Stayed in the Palace Tower - no complaints - very spacious & comfortable and cleaned to perfection. (I would suggest the Agustas Tower as it is easier to navigate through the casino.) The room contains a stocked mini bar (which I was aware of) therefore, ordered a fridge to chill water, etc. If you are a coffee drinker, there is no coffee maker in the room, therefore, you will need to order the service ($20) or trek downstairs to the tune of $4 per cup and stand in line. A complete inconvenience & rip-off when all you want is a cup of morning java in the confines of your room. Used the Qua Spa which was worth the $45. Did not elect a treatment service but the spa areas are gorgeous and relaxing - a nice indulgence from the Hustle Bustle. Downside - if you only want to use the work-out area, it is still an additional $45 per day. Come on Caesars, with the price of your room rates, give it a break..Yes, this is Vegas but enough is enough!! Enjoyed the Forum Shops (we are shop-aholics) and the restaurants - can't go wrong there - choices indeed. Would I stay at Caesar's again - probably not. Even though I wore comfy shoes, (ladies - I gave up the heels for well being) the long walks to and from anywhere were beginning to take a toll. I did not win in the casino -but Lady Luck has to be on your side wherever you go. Just depends what you want out of a property - the next time I will choose a smaller scale venue. If you don't mind walking and spending big $$$ on any extra, you will absolutely enjoy the thrill of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Put simply a dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: kaw118
Reviews.Content: Whilst the public rooms in the hotel were fine, the Roman tower room that we were allocated was "tired" to say the least. Lights didn't work & the view from the 6th floor was of the back wall of a partly built building & a workman's walkway. It is suppose to be a 5 star hotel - our room did not rate 2 stars! Whilst I realise that making an adverse comment is likely to be panned in the US - this hotel proved to be the most dissappointing out of 6 hotels/ inns on our recent trip. I would make one further comment regarding the swimming pool which is attractive, although many would say that the building work immediately adjacent is spoiling the complex. However, the new building gave the pool 50% shade - mid afternoon, which was great. Two years ago I made the same comment about the Mirage and the lack of umbrellas - have the people in Las Vegas not heard of skin cancer?

Reviews.Title: “If there's a line for check-in, the hotel is poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: j889814672
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival in a limo from the airport, I lifted my own bags out of the trunk as the limo driver was an older lady who weighed about 100 lbs and I didn't want her to hurt herself. As I was travelling internationally and had lots of bags, I was then standing in the middle of the driveway, surrounded by my bags, trying to summon a bellman and while there were several around, none seemed interested in helping customers. Several minutes later, after dragging my bags to the bell desk, I found my way to the check-in queue. I had to wait about 20 minutes just to check in... totally unacceptable! The room in Palace tower was about 2 miles away. Room itself is OK, but no coffee maker, no free water, and $13.99/day for internet. Daily room cleaning did not vacuum the room for my entire stay (12 days) and every time I put my own items in the fridge, they removed them and left them on top of the counter. Even soaps and shampoos in the bathroom were not replenished. Dry cleaning/laundry did not offer any express service... Food in the buffet restaurant was terrible, and the selection was poor. The coffee shop charges $6.50 for a latte. The gym costs $25 if you shower in your room or $45 if you want to use their changing rooms and showers. The gym has cheap and ergonomically incorrect technogym brand equipment throughout so really isn't worth it anyway. Better to get up early and walk or jog outside. I've stayed at most of the hotels on the strip, and as far as the room itself goes, these are among the best hotel rooms, however the entire package that is Caesars is the greatest ripoff on the planet when it comes to value for money. And to finish it all off you have to wait 20-30 minutes in another queue to check out!

Reviews.Title: “Like the location and the vibe!”
Reviews.Author: cwynj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesar's for a stagette in June. At first, we were put in the Roman Tower. For the $$$ and my expectation that this was one of the nicer hotels in Vegas, I was not impressed. We ended up upgrading for a small charge and we were put in the Forum Tower....much better! HUGE bathroom and a bedroom that actually looked trendy and up to date. The line at the front desk was long (almost an hour), but we did check in at 4pm, which is probably busy anywhere. Found the concierges to be super helpful for guest lists at clubs, tickets etc. Liked being in the centre of the strip and close to the forum shops. The pool was so busy you were lucky to get a chair and not as great as I thought it would be. The gym was well equipped but super expensive ($25 or $30?!)....not worth it! I think I'd rather save my money and stay at TI again (great value) ...if you're given a room in the older section, you're better off at the Monte Carlo...

Reviews.Title: “Customers always wrong”
Reviews.Author: Janant_8
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel are helpful until you show one ounce of negativity...then look out. Had an issue with there rewards system...After 4 days of playing 25$ blackjack and my wife playing slot machines our total rewards were $3.18. It does not make much sense seeing as a cup of coffee costs $5 anywere in the casino (and i'm not talking starbucks). but the staff completely ignored me when i clearly was unsatisfied. they made it clear that they only care about the celebs in the penthouse suite. Dont bother joining the total rewards program. Also if you stay there in the next 12 months there is major contruction going on so you better get your trip heavily discounted to make it worth while. The food quality is better at any of the other casinos on the strip. any good times for us were had at other places on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not for biz travelers”
Reviews.Author: popotest
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for a 3 days conference. Not on vacation or gambling. Being at a conference in a 5 star hotel you would expect a great WiFi service free of charge. However this was not my case. The quality of the WiFi was pure and it cost 16 USD. Also the gym was not free for the guests of the hotel and the charge was just incredible in my opinion - 25 USD. I am traveling on business quite often and in very rare occasions I have such bad experience in a 5 star hotel. The rooms were good but the TV channels were not enough especially for europeans like me.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: PadreLuis
Reviews.Content: I am a card member who booked my room through Harrahs.com. I stayed in the Forum Tower, deluxe room. It was a great room...I can't complain at all! The beds are soooo comfortable. (FYI - If you are a coffee drinker, you may be upset to know, there aren't coffee pots in the room.) Food - The first night, we decided to eat at the buffet in Caesars...big mistake. I am used to some of the great casino buffets in Atlantic City. This was not that at all. It is attempting to be "upscale" but instead it is just overpriced with very little to choose from. The next night we ate at the Rio's buffet (your comps are good there) and it was EXCELLENT. What a difference!!! I would recommend the Augustus Cafe at Caesars for a casual meal or for breakfast. The food was great and the service was excellent. Getting around - A friend told me about the Duece. It costs $5 for a 24 hour pass. It is a double decker bus that stops along the strip. Just a warning, there is a long stretch between each "duece" stop. Also, when it lets you off, it's a long walk into the casino. By the last day, we were taking taxis every where and wondering why we didn't do that sooner. The taxis are not that expensive and SOOO much more convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your walking shoes to Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: MSquared007
Reviews.Content: Wow.......this place is huge. The average walking time from our junior suite in the Palace Tower to the Mirage (right next door) was 20 minutes. Overall, our experience was great at this place.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favs in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jhender85
Reviews.Content: Since I've moved to the west side of the country 2 years ago, I've been to Vegas 5 times, but never have stayed at Caesars Palace. When Harrah's Total Rewards finally decided to comp me there, I went online and booked a forum tower deluxe room for 3 days. Journey from stepping off the plane to getting to the hotel in Vegas is always an unenjoyable one (confusing airport with no signs, long wait to get a cab at the airport, crossing your fingers that the cabbie doesn't try to take the tunnel, traffic jams, etc...) but that besides the point. When I got to the hotel, the check in wait wasn't bad (5-10 minutes) but the line behind me was building at an exponential rate. Got to the desk and before the clerk could say anything to me, I did what everyone who wants to get a good room in Vegas needs to do. Handed him my ID, my credit card and a folded up 20 dollar bill. He took everything, pulled up my reservation and once he saw my room, he said "we can do better than that." He upgraded me to an Augustus Palace room on the 44th floor with an incredible view of the strip, all without paying those ridiculous upgrade fees. Ever since my second trip to Vegas I've used the tip the front desk clerk trick before he helps me out, and without fail it has always worked to get me a free upgrade. Anyways, the room was beautiful, clean and spacious. Large LCD tv and very comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was even about the size of a standard room you'd find at any other hotel on the strip. The bathroom had a small LCD tv on the wall, an oversized jacuzzi tub, seperate shower and seperate toilet. All in all, one of the best rooms I've ever had in Vegas. As much as liked the room, I've never really been a big fan of the casino itself. Even though I play enough for the casinos to comp me rooms, I only play on $10-$15 minimum bet blackjack tables, and I only found one table that fit that description, however the line of people waiting to play there rivaled the wait to get into the Paris' champagne brunch buffet. You think they'd get the point by seeing all those people wanting to play at that table that they should open up more. Matter fact, for the amount of people in the casino, there were hardly any blackjack tables up and running of any bet amount. However, if you like slots like my fiancee does, there is a plentiful variety and also open seats at your favorite games. Also, in my opinion, the sports betting section is unrivaled by any on the strip, you have to see it to believe it. Never been a fan of the food at Caesars palace either, unless you're willing to spend the extra buck at one of their many higher tier restaurants. I, however only like one gourmet meal a vacation, and since Caesars palace more casual dining restaurants are below par, I normally go elsewhere to eat. Basically, its a great hotel, with great rooms if you can afford getting more than a classic room there. Lots of dining of oppurtunities as long as willing to splurge and lots of options to for gaming as long as your not cheap like me when it comes to blackjack! Most importantly, the staff here is willing to make your stay here a great one, as long as you let them know you have the money for it. To put it simply, if you have the money, stay and play here, if you like to hold on to your money for other things, book a room here to enjoy the experience, but spend your time at other casinos!

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: bigmoumout
Reviews.Content: I still think this is an expensive hotel but we were four in our room. There was plenty of space in the room and bathroom for all of us. The private whirlpool is very nice. Everything was very clean. I'm glad about this experience but we don't stay that much inside the room thus I prefer to sleep somewhere else with cheaper rates (Golden Nugget for example).

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: GeminiVesp
Reviews.Content: Overall not very impressed with this place. Value for money is extremely poor. We stayed on one of the lower floors of the Roman Tower and had a great view of airconditioning units and trash - we were moved after complaining. Hotel staff did their job but were not very friendly - quote from the check in clerk: "I can't check you in with this (my official identity card in 4 languages) I do not understand it, give me an official document" to which I reply "Which part don't you understand?", 15 seconds of silence later: "I understand it now." On the positive side the rest of the hotel is very nice, good shops, restaurants and plenty to see. Great location for exploring the rest of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Samsara353
Reviews.Content: For such a large hotel I have to say that everything ran very smoothly. We had a room in one of the towers near the pool. It was kept very clean and cool, which was important since it was 107F outside! I went with a friend who had to go to Vegas for business so my days were spent pretty much on my own. Since I'm not a gambler or a real Vegas fan, I spent most my days at the pool. It was so God-awful hot that I usually sat on the shaded steps in the big main pool reading my books and magazines. The Pina Colada drinks are horrible - especially for $12 a pop. Besides it was so hot that all I could really drink was water. They did have drink and food service, and girls that would come around with frozen grapes. There was a private "European" pool for (I think) $20 per person. European = topless. Overall Caesar's is a good choice for its location, amenities, shops, restaurants and entertainment. Not sure about value since I did go with my friend who was on business. Tip: If you're on a budget, pack your own breakfasts and snacks, i.e. granola/fruit bars, apple sauce, crackers, etc. A coffee and yogurt at the Cafe cost me $13.75. Across the street is a Margaritaville Restaurant - good food at good prices. There's usually a long wait for a table, but if you can, hike up to the 3rd floor where there are plenty of tables open on their outside terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Caesr's Palace - a unique casino!”
Reviews.Author: vierannie
Reviews.Content: Caesar's Palace is unique in that it really has the feel of Rome, Italy, complete with beautiful fountains and sculptures. We stayed in the Palace Tower and had absolutely no complaints about our room. It was beautifully furnished, and we enjoyed the Jacuzzi after our first long day going up and down The Strip to see the other casinos. Everything we saw convinced us that we had made the right choice to stay at Caesar's Palace. The breakfast buffet was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated Forum Deluxe Room”
Reviews.Author: strssr99
Reviews.Content: We are Total Rewards members and were lucky enough to have our 3 night stay comped, in the newly renovated Forum Tower rooms. Having so few pictures or reviews to go off of, we decided that since we spend so little time in the room anyways, there would be little disappointment if the rooms turned out to be less than expected. However, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The rooms may be small compared to the Palace or Augustus Tower rooms, but they are fine. These new rooms have nice touches, like the extra soft pillows, the CD player in the alarm clock, and the Caesars robes waiting in the closet for us to wear. We really enjoyed the shower, which features dual rain style showerheads and is very large. You can use both showerheads at once, or turn either of them off and just use a single showerhead. I quite liked using both of them, but my husband is far more traditional and liked the "regular" one the best. The beds were heavenly, with plenty of soft pillows, and we slept well all 3 nights. Noise was minimal - we didn't hear anyone in the adjoining rooms. Our room was fairly close to the elevator and we never had more than a 15 second wait for an elevator to arrive. Staff were all pleasant and accomodating, and many were very interested in talking about where we were from, what we were in Vegas for, talking about our children, etc. We did not have single experience that was negative, and most were exceedingly positive. We have stayed in many hotels in Vegas, and truly felt the service aspect at Caesar's was far above what most places offer. We absolutely plan on coming back to Caesars again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience At Caesars”
Reviews.Author: cnphilly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars from September 1-4. Booked an Augustus Tower room for a very good rate of $170/night through the hot deals section of the website. I find some of the reviews a bit exaggerated (good and bad) when it comes to specific elements of a stay, so I am going to give a general review (without sensationalism) that may be more helpful to those visiting Vegas or Caesars for the first time. Checked in around 1:30pm. Nobody was in line. I asked if there were any rooms available in the Augustus Tower with a great view of the Bellagio fountains, and was given a room on the 36th floor of the tower directly overlooking the fountains. This could not have been any better. We greatly enjoyed watching the Bellagio fountains throughout the day and night. While we considered staying at Bellagio just to have a good view of the fountains, I am glad I stayed in the Augustus Tower at Caesars and got the view we did. It meant the Augustus Tower room gave us more bang for the buck than a similar room (Salone Suite) at Bellagio with a fountain view, which was nearly double the nightly rate. The Augustus Tower rooms are incredible. They are spacious, around 650 square feet, and have everything you would need in a hotel room. The bathroom is fantastic, as is having the extra sitting area space. All in all, a room in the Augustus Tower alone, assuming no problems with the room, would merit giving the hotel at least a 3* review. The Augustus Tower is the closest of Caesars' towers to the Bellagio, and Caesars is connected by a walkway to the Bellagio that allows for very easy and convenient access to all Bellagio has to offer. I would note that we ordered room service one night and it was delivered promptly and the food was good. I didn't think it was overly expensive for room service, and the food quality was good and I was happy with the experience. We ate at the table in our room while watching the Bellagio fountains at night. Other than that, I would note that Mesa Grill is fantastic. We had lunch there one day and it blew us away. I don't know that I would go there for dinner (there are so many places in Vegas for a great steak, etc.), but for lunch it was very, very good. There are some "cons" to this hotel, and I will note my observances here. Again, I am not being too specific, as these seem like pervasive problems at Caesars that everyone should realize before booking. Also keep in mind that many of these "problems" are shared by other hotels in Vegas, are not unique to Caesars, and would not keep me from staying here or enjoying my experience. First, the Caesars casino is bifurcated into the Forum Casino and the Palace Casino. It is not a very convenient setup, and makes for a lot of unnecessary hassle. Second, the Harrahs bureaucracy makes simple things related to service difficult. For instance, we wanted to get a total rewards gift certificate to give as a gift to others before we left. We were told the business center could do that for us. The business center's computer system was down when we went to get the gift card. At the time we were trying to do this, 9:30am, no other person or department in the hotel could do it (concierge didn't open until 10am, and they were the only other ones who could do it). I am always amazed when businesses make it difficult for me to give them my money. Simply put, and it is probably obvious to most, but personalized service is usually, but not always, directly related to the size of a hotel. The bigger the hotel, the less great service you will get. This rings true here. Third, the construction going on right now hinders the pool experience. While we are not big on the pool, I realize some people are. While I wouldn't say it was crowded by any stretch of the imagination, or that it would have been difficult to get a chair (plenty were available), it is tough to relax at a pool when there is major construction going on all around it. Fourth, there really isn't any good reason for Caesars' table game limits to be $25 at 9am when Vegas is very slow and there is nobody playing. I don't understand the rationale behind having multitudes of empty tables with limits like this rather than having full tables with $10 limits. Most other casinos including the Venetian had lower limits. While I play higher limit tables a majority of the time, I could see where others would be disenchanted by this. Other things people have written about I didn't find troublesome on my stay. That would include a review that suggested the air quality in the casino wasn't that great. I am very, very sensitive to bad air, and I find the air in any Vegas casino to be less than preferable. I played at Caesars, however, for three days and didn't experience a problem like the kind mentioned. Further, I find Las Vegas casinos on the whole have gotten much less smoky in my last several visits over a period of 3 years. Another review suggested you might get lost in Caesars or would have to walk for 30 minutes to get from one end of the casino to the other. Having stayed at many Vegas hotels, I would note that most all of them are quite large. While the casino separation is not ideal, I find it hard to believe it would take very long to figure out exactly how to get where you need to go. This is not MGM, and the hotel does not require more walking many others in Vegas. Further, walking from one end of the casino to the other takes 5 minutes, rather than the 30 suggested in another review, unless of course you are stopping for lunch or to gamble along the way. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Caesars. On this trip, my biggest priority was the room, and the Augustus Tower has fantastic rooms that also can be, depending on the rate, an excellent value in Vegas compared to other hotels including Bellagio, Venetian, etc. I hope this review is helpful in selecting a hotel for your next Vegas stay.

Reviews.Title: “Filth, Bugs & Building work”
Reviews.Author: MuppetHull
Reviews.Content: In an 8 night stay we changed rooms twice. The first room (in the Roman Tower) was filthy with months worth of dust around the edge of the room and underneath the television stand. The second room (in the Forum Tower) had insects crawling across the floor and building work going on in nearby rooms from around 7:45 in the morning. The third room (in the Palace Tower) was fine, but looking a little weathered. The staff acted like it just went over their heads when we complained and seemed to wait for us to offer a solution to the problems. They never informed us of any building work either around the pools or in any of the rooms. The hotel does have its positives, ie. location, shopping, food outlets and a good casino, but you get the impression that unless you have money they are not interested. Las Vegas is a wonderful place with lots of great hotels, but I shall not be rushing back to Caesars Palace. I think they could do a whole lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Going Downhill Big Time”
Reviews.Author: Vegas222
Reviews.Content: Caesars is out of step with the times. Pool area is under construction and no place to sun unless you arrive by 9 am. No mention of this on their web site. No Cabanas except three for the high rollers. Trying to get some food from the pool restauarnt is nuts. One window to serve hundreds of people. Buffet is slipping fast. Better food at the Stratosphere or Sahara!! I have had better maid service at Motel Six!! Not enough towels ... no toiletries ... lights burned out. Casino area is outdated and minimum bets are $20.00 even at 7 am. That is why you can shoot a cannon through the place. The Mirage, Palazzo and Venetian are jumping at that hour because of the lower bets. Getting drinks at the Caesars slots are tough even at the one dollar machines. Bottom line is while Caesars is still a great location try some of the other Casinos for a more enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bring a GPS Unit”
Reviews.Author: 60nikita
Reviews.Content: I arrived three hours before the 3 pm check-in time for a Classic room. I was quickly rerouted to the Platinum members area and assigned a deluxe room in the Palace Tower for $40/night extra. Most excellent, although I hardly spent any time there! I originally went to Vegas to see Cher (very worthwhile), but ended up doing day and night tours of Vegas with Grayline and a journey (14 hours) to the Hoover Dam and Grand Canyon. The resort is vast and I must admit to being dazed and confused and totally lost half the time, but there was always someone - employee or guest - to help you out. One hardly needs to leave Caesars as there are plenty of restaurants and shops to keep you busy. I had a great time! No problems encountered at all with the room or service!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, poor air quality”
Reviews.Author: Pippa-7
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here in January for a special birthday celebration. When we checked in they did not have the smoking room one pair of us had requested. Mum and I asked for a room close to elevators (to cut down on walking) and so we were ALL moved to Deluxe Rooms in the Palace Tower. This turned out to be a great decision. Our room particularly was HUGE (it was a room for handicapped access). It was beautiful, freshly decorated and very clean. Great location, close to the pools ( for a summer trip) and several great areas to eat at the foot of the tower. I loved Payards French deli place for breakfast and Rao's for coffee. We had an absolutely delicious meal at the Empress Court Chinese Restaurant-the best I've had anywhere. The casino I didn't like. The air quality was TERRIBLE, very smoky and my allergies really acted up. I had to head over to my favourite Planet Hollywood where I had my usual great luck on the craps tables there (pay for my trip and then some). I complained to the management at Caesars about the air and received no reply. While in Vegas we went to Cirque de Soleil's show "O" at the Bellagio which was great but I prefer "Love" at the Mirage. Ceasar's had good points and bad but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room/Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Velvendo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the rooms in the Augustu's tower. It was unbelievable. Clean, spacious, flat scrren t.v in room and bath. View was amazing. Had a full view of Belagio fountains. The room was spectacular.....but everything else was horrible!!! Room service! Forget about it. Way too expensive. Bufetts, horrible not worth it! Casino...Horrible!! Play at Bally's Harrah's Flamingo and of course the Belagio. From the moment we checked in, the gentleman in the diamond check in was the rudest person I have ever met. The diamond lounge, horrible. Same food everyday. Nasty!! Basically you are treated like royalty if you spend thousands and thousands of dollars. The people are stuck up and the staff could give a crap if your not seven stars. All in all, I would stay here just for the room. Don't gamble/eat here its not worth it. Casino is very big. To get from end to the other, you would be walking for 30 minutes. Lots of walking, so if your old or have children go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Go to Ceasars for the shopping, not the hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Michelle92010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ceasars for two nights. You couldnt pay me to stay at Ceasars again. The bathroom had no electricity for curling irons or hair dryers, the lights were flickering due to dying light bulbs, the TV and main standing lamp were unplugged, it took me 30 minutes to wash my hair due to the extremely low water pressure, the iron left calcium deposits all over my clothes and the sheets were so rough they exfolated my skin...maybe that was suppose to be a perk?

Reviews.Title: “Vegas baby”
Reviews.Author: treatmenice
Reviews.Content: Ok...so you can't beat this place for location...right in the middle of the strip, and the ammenities in this hotel are brilliant. I came here with my boyfriend, who is a keen poker player. The poker room was great for him..the pool...not so much for me!!!! The only downside to it all is the massive renovations going on by the pool!!! They are building a new wing on the hotel so as you can imagine...it's like a building site. Diguised well, but you can't disguise the noise!!! If it had been anywhere else in the world I would have gone mad!!! But hey....It's Vegas and Vegas is forever expanding! Service is fantastic, and the casino is always full of action! Pure, the Night club, with The Pussy Cat Dolls is brilliant too...even if it does take you an hour to get in!!! (funny..when I came here with another gal pal a year ago...we were walked straight through to the club, and treated with much more respect!!!) All in all...I love Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “New Year in Caesars”
Reviews.Author: lilscally
Reviews.Content: Checked in to caesars on the 26th of December 2007 and asked for an upgrade. Had to wait for a while but got a great room, not much of a view but the room was lovely and we had a great bathroom. Overall caesars was a nice hotel but not as good as i had expected. You can get same standard of room for the less the price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but horrible service”
Reviews.Author: mellemel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights from August 22-25 2008. We requested two rooms connected with two queen beds in the Augustus tower. We arrived at 11:am and did not get our rooms until 5:00pm. The front desk took our cell numbers and told us they would text us when the room was ready. I asked several times was our room ready and the answer was NOT YET. Now it is 5pm and we never got the text. So, instead of asking was our room ready we decided to go to the pick up keys desk and finally we got our rooms. Good: The rooms were huge and beautiful. Each room had a spa tub, dining table with three chairs, couch and two queen beds two sinks and a marble standup shower. I really like having the toiliet in a different area of the bathroom. Bad: One of the bed sheets had several holes in them and in my friend room, there was a splat of blood stain on the throw pillow. At least it look like blood. The remote for her TV was missing so we had to call for one. The rubber on the bottom of my room door was falling off. Room service was horrible. Our room wasn't cleaned untl after 2pm. Warning Do not pick up the room products located on the top of the dresser. Well, you can pick them up but put them back unless you are going to purchase them. They can tell what you picked up and what time you pick them up because they have computerized magnets on the bottom of them. You will be charged for those items if you don't put them back. Caesars is a beautiful hotel. But the poor service brings down the value of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not as good as Bellagio!”
Reviews.Author: ellenost
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesar's Palace from 8/20 - 8/23/08 for a good friend's birthday celebration. I chose the Augustus Tower since it is the newest, and you don't need to walk through the casino to get to the elevator to your room. My room wasn't ready at check in, so I left my luggage in another friend's room in the Roman Tower (those rooms need to be upgraded). When my room was ready at 4:30, I checked into a lovely room on the 45th floor overlooking the Bellagio fountains (my request). The room is actually nicer than those at the Bellagio. There was ample seating (a sofa with a table and a chair with an ottoman as well as a table with two additional chairs) with my king-size bed. Plenty of room to walk about. Plenty of drawer and closet space. Good number of removable hangers. I loved the flat-screen TV in the bathroom. Jetted-tub and glass-enclosed shower with great water pressure. Toilet was in its own private room--nice touch. No evening turn-down service (no chocolates either). Really disappointing thing (and the one reason why I class the Bellagio as better) is there is no security at the elevators to check for room key. As a woman traveling alone, I appreciate a hotel that values its clients security. No scary incidents to report. The 24 hour cafe is dumpy compared with the Bellagio 24 hour cafe (where I went for breakfast).
