I had a fabulous lobster omelet with impeccable service at Bellagio compared with the barely adequate omelet with almost non-existent service at Caesar's. The casino area at Caesar's is almost unbearable due to the smokiness compared to the almost perfumed aroma at the Bellagio casino. The one thing that I loved at Caesar's is their Qua Spa -- cannot be beat. It was an experience in true luxury. Next time I'll stay at Bellagio and go for my spa treatment at Caesar's. I haven't been to the Bellagio spa in 5 years so it may have improved.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: luvlasvegas22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars from Aug 20 through Aug 26 and enjoyed it. After reading many reviews, I was nervous about my stay, but it turned out to be one of the best times that I have had in my many trips to Vegas. I am a Diamond member and was able to check in very quickly without any hassel or issues. Room was in the Forum Tower, 6305 with a partial view of the strip facing Paris and Bellagio. The rooms in the Forum Tower are newly remodeled rooms with a large flat screen TV, large shower, and a TV built into the mirror. Rooms were very clean and never experienced any issues with housekeeping. Staff was extremely friendly and drink service was the best out of all of the hotels that I visited during my stay. Yes, the resteraunts are pricey, but so is every other hotel in Vegas. Overall I would recommend a stay at Caesars and I know that I will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “THANKS FOR A GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: crauto1
Reviews.Content: My son turned 21 in October of 2007 and we booked a trip over his actual 21st birthday. When I called for reservations, they asked if we were there for something special and instantly upgraded us to a beautiful room overlooking the pools. Everyone there were so helpful, even when quite busy at times. Anything we needed, they graciously delivered. Such a great experience that we are going again this year in September. We can't wait. This will be my eighth time at Caesar's and evertime it just seems to get better.

Reviews.Title: “If you want value and service don't stay here...!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marshalagunaniguel
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, but the service is absolutely terrible. We are Diamond members and so have stayed at all of their hotels and this one was the most disappointing. The service was really bad, no matter what you asked for the answer was no. We asked for a little pot to boil water to be sent to the room and they said they could rent it to us for $40.00. That was only the beginning, everything in the hotel is $$$... and the prices are twice as high as everywhere else. If you are looking for those $1.99 breakfasts, hold your hats, the prices are now $22.00 and the buffets are sparce at best. I started to watch a movie, in all the other hotels you can press pause and watch it at a later time. Not at Ceasers, you have to pay the price of the movie, shut it off and then pay again if you still want to watch the end later. All in all Las Vegas is now a very expensive place to visit. A taxi cab to downtown cost us $40.00 round trip. We were expecting exceptional service from all we had heard about Ceasers and found just the opposite...!!! Friends stayed at the Palazzio and the rooms were much nicer, the meals were better and the service was definitely far superior.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dennikseb
Reviews.Content: I was there for a Convention last October. I woke up in the middle of the night feeling extremely itchy. I found a bug and advised the font desk so they changed us room in a more luxurious room in another tower. Little did I know that this room was also infected with bed bugs. The hotel did nothing to apologize for this problem. Thing is, I brought them back home and it cost me over 2000$ to get rid of them. When I contacted teh Caesars about this, they denied everything, even denied that I had complained while staying at their hotel. They said they had no record of us ever changing rooms during our stay. Furthermore, things were charged to our room that we hadn't taken (ie, movies). So I had to argue about this to get rid of the charges. Do not trust this hotel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “luxury with style”
Reviews.Author: burnski
Reviews.Content: Had reservations when we learnt of construction of next phase of caesars palace nextdoor, but only inconvenience was building site was bit of an eyesore when lazing around the pool, that said, the luxury, friendliness of the staff, and locality of the site was outstanding.Rooms were clean and spacious, though view was limited from our room in the Augutus tower block,food was good , though limited choice at the buffet, bars were friendly and no more expensive than anywhere else on the strip. Visit Pure and Pussy Cat Dolls lounge a must on your visit. All in all an experience not to be missed, and allways to be remembered. Burnski.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: oc_traveler2
Reviews.Content: (My review is long, but if you don't have the time, just scroll down to IMPORTANT PART) Well... what can I say? To start off, I am a fan of Caesar's Palace. There's no doubt about it. I have been here many times before and loved it. This time, well it was very different. To start off, I'll first say that Caesar's is the perfect example of Vegas Opulence, in the very best way. The decor is truly a sight to see. Beyond that, this place is HUGE! Caesar's has grown so much that now it is absolutely massive. The only trouble is, they don't yet know how to handle their many guests. In my opinion, they need to stop building and adding, and take some to learn how to handle their current crowds. Okay, now to the actual review... We arrived at about 2pm. There was no line at check-in, but through the stay I saw times where there were LONG lines. We reached the counter and was told by the lady that the room type we booked was unavailable. We booked online 4 months prior to arrival and were shocked by this statement. Appearantly, selecting an Augustus Tower is just a REQUEST, NOT A GUARANTEE. I've never been told that the room I booked is not a guarantee. Luckily, one "magically" came up after we rejected her explaination. So it worked out. Or so we thought. She said the room was just being cleaned and should be ready in 45 minutes. We went to lunch and returned. Once again speaking to the same lady, she said the maids had not yet reached the room. Once again, we were told to wait. The website guarantees a check-in at 4pm. We were not allowed to go up to our room until 5:30. After more than 3 hours of waiting around (keep in mind we could not gamble because our 13yr old son was with us) we were FINALLY allowed to go up to the room. That should be the end of the troubles... but hardly. Upon entering the room we waited so long for, we arrive to find it is FILTHY. The coffee table had been pushed to the center of the room, the beds had been partially undone, an OPEN Redbull was sitting on the dining table, the toilet paper in the restroom had been ripped off, a half used pack of cigarettes on the desk, an item was missing from the minibar, and someone's room key was on the desk as well. At this point I had enough. We proceeded to call the front desk and they sent up the maid. When the hotel's maid is shocked at the condition of the room, you know there's a problem. They cleaned the room, and by that time it was nearly 7pm. Keep in mind we had all been driving all day to get to Vegas. We finally sat down and realized something.... Our Luggage hasn't arrived yet. So of course, we made yet another phone call and the luggage was rushed up to our room. An hour late, but when it comes to luggage, it's better late than never. Once having the luggage arrive and the room cleaned, we decided to rest and order something to eat. I'm sure you can guess, something went wrong. There was NO MENU in the room. We called down to Room Service and requested a menu be delivered to the room. After waiting another 45 minutes, we called down again. We asked to be updated on where our menu was and they said they have no record of any request. The man said they are too busy to get a menu up to our room and offered to read us the menu over the phone. ARE WE KIDDING HERE? READ US THE MENU? OVER THE PHONE!!!!! After now 4 hours from arriving to ordering food, I was not about to be dictated a 15 page menu via telephone. We agreed and quickly sent up a photocopied menu. We ordtered our food, and was told there would be a 45 minute wait. We had no problem with this as they can't control the fact that they're busy. The food came on time. WHAT A MIRACLE? But, oh no. We ordered a drink, which did not arrive. The delivery woman went to get us the drink and come right back. We had completed our entire meal and the drink had not arrived. Once again, we made a phone call and they said it would be right up. A couple minutes later, the same lady arrived with a tray of 6 bottles of soda and 2 waters. It was an amazingly nice gesture and we truly appreciated SOMEONE understanding our troubles. The amazing part is she would not even accept a tip. That is great customer service. We finished our dinner and went to use the phone. This time instead of using the phone by the bed, we went to use the data phone on the desk. But of course, it was broken. We called the front desk for the 4th or 5th time and they sent up a hotel manager to fix the phone, as the technical staff had gone home for the night. He fixed the phone but it was now very late and we were fed up with it all. We complained to anyone who would listen and were given a $100 food and beverage credit to our room. It was a nice gesture but at that point $1000 didn't seem enough for 8 hours of trouble. We accepted the comp and moved on. My wife went to gamble and won $400 on slots that night. A decent ending to a horiffic day. The next day, we decided to take a drive around the strip and have fun in the other hotels. As it was over 100 degrees outside, walking seemed impossible. Upon arriving back at Caesar's, we were informed that the Valet lot was FULL and we would have to park on the opposite side of the hotel. We informed him that we were staying in Augustus Tower (which is literally on the opposite side of the parking area) and he agreed to take our car. ----IMPORTANT PART:---- If I had any advice for travelers is if you have to travel here on a weekend in the summer, be ready for crazy crowds. Don't always accept the first answer as the FINAL answer and ALWAYS call if something's wrong. The one thing about Caesar's that I can say I'm happy with is their ability to right a wrong. For everything that went wrong, after calling, Caesar's made it right. So for that, I give them props. The decor is amazing as usual, and if you can, get an Augustus Tower room facing the strip. It's breathtaking. If it weren't for this hassle, I'd have given a perfect review.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: Estells
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars July 31, 2008 in an Augustus Tower Room. The room was amazing. So nice I had to take a picture before the luggage came. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was sublime. The casino is very nice as well with friendly and helpful staff in the gaming areas to assist and help you learn what to do if you want to try something new. We ate at the restaurant Bradley Ogden and I would really recommend that to anyone staying at Caesars. I expected nothing but the best from Caesars and am happy to say that I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “8th time in Vegas, 1st time at Caesars: Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mrcruz23
Reviews.Content: I read ALL of the reviews on Caesars Palace and was very nervous about staying there. I'm in Vegas once a year with work or pleasure and have stayed at a variety of hotels on the strip. We selected Caesars Palace because of it's great location on the strip and ability to shop at great stores without leaving your hotel. We arrived at noon but check in was not until 2pm. Not a problem they held our bags while we ate lunch at Mesa Grill (best lunch during our trip!!!!). We came back around 3pm and it looked like a long line (20 people ahead of us) but moved very fast (15 min.). The front desk staff were extremely friendly and very accomodating. We got to our room but was a smoking floor so we called down and requested a non smoking floor. They moved very fast and made adjustments to get us in right away. At my request for an upgrade they gave us a great deal on the Pent House suite (2000 square feet, 2 master suites, seperate living quarters on the 28th floor of the Palace Tower, hundreds less than normal per night, I know this because I tried to reserve it earlier this year and it was over a $2000 per night). At the pool you can see the construction of the new tower but unless you paid close attention you would not notice it. We did not hear the construction or anything like that. The Venus pool was private and the music was not that loud. I guess if you were looking for complete silence at a pool or just didn't want anyone around you then this place would not suit you (try a private island or a bath tub). We kept in mind that this is Vegas and you are supposed to have fun, be loud, and don't worry about things you don't have control over. Overall we loved Caesars and would go back very soon. I have stayed at the Venetian, Bally's, Green Valley Ranch and New York New York but Caesars is on my top 2. Great service, very clean room (I'm a germ freak and this place passed...Bally's on the other hand, not so clean), great location, great food, and very convenient to everything. By the way my wife travels 1 week a month for work and stays at top rated hotels, she loved Caesars and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “COULD NOT HAVE FAULTED IT”
Reviews.Author: tesscountydurham
Reviews.Content: we were a party of seven and we had booked to stay at ceasars palace in the classic rooms. After two very long flights we just wanted to get to our rooms and crash. We arrived at the hotel and were seen straight away and was told that both our rooms had been upgraded free of charge to the augustus suites which obvioulsy we were thrilled about. Both rooms were beautiful and we had fantastic views of the strip we could not fault the rooms at all and felt quite spoilt. Every evening our beds were turned down and chocolates left on our pillows. The hotel is extremely large but they all are and we did not feel that we lacked anything, the staff were polite and willing to answer any of our questions and gave us good advice. We had our breakfast in the hotel which was lovely and plenty on offer and as we were the early we never had to wait but lines appear after about 8.30 but they did seem to move quite quickly we never felt that we were rushed. My son and his friend loved the swimming pools and would of happily of stayed there all day if we had let them. we would stay at ceasars palace again and would not hesitate to recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: Harleyscal
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I, along with our 18 year old Son checked in about 4pm on Sunday, the 27th of July and it took only about 10 minutes to get to the desk. I noticed on our 4 day stay that there were times when the check in line might have taken you 2 hours. That's a real downer but a lot of these Strip Hotels can take you some time to check in if you get there at the wrong time. Same old routine at the desk. They will offer you a Bellagio Fountain view room or strip view for about $30 a night more. I did this for $40 a night at the Paris last year and well, I am tired of staring at that noisy fountain so I declined and took the 6th floor room at the Augusta's Tower overlooking the roof and could see some of the Strip to the north. The room we had was very spacious and you need space for all the stuff you bring with you. Like most Vegas Hotels that have a mini bar, your room will be charged even if you pick something up just to look at it. I am not a poor man but I will not pay $5 for a small bottle of Gatorade unless I am dying of thirst. No fridge in the room unless you pay extra and if they have any available. We brought all our drinks and munchies and such to save a few bucks and were at the ice machine quite often. I brought my own portable coffee maker so I did not have to walk a mile to the Java place and wait in a long line to get a $4 cup of Joe. Don't get me wrong, I love Caesars but I am a savvy traveler and refuse to throw money away needlessly when you can plan ahead. The best Buffet within walking distance is at Harrah's Casino. Make sure you sign up for a Total Rewards Card (free) and get the booklet to save money at the nearby Buffet's. Like the other guy said, the pool at the Flamingo looks way more exciting and inviting than the pool at Caesars. I like to stay at the nicest Hotels that Las Vegas has to offer and Caesars is without question one of the best but in order for me to stay there, I cut a few corners and refuse to let them nickel and dime me to death. I stay there for the very nice room and do my gambling elsewhere. Wild Bill's Gambling Hall is right across the street and they will let you hold your cards while playing and have tons of $5 tables. Did I mention Caesars has some of the biggest and cleanest rooms in all of Las Vegas? I love it there but let's plan ahead and save a few bucks to spend elsewhere unless you truly are a millionaire.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, long lines and poor value”
Reviews.Author: poppy36
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, (Palace Tower Rooms) however the attitude of most of the service personnel that I encountered was rude overall. Yes, there were a few pleasant people, however the bad attitude prevailed throughout. (Front Desk was pleasant, and even though there were 150 people in line in front of us when we arrived, it moved quickly and it didn't bother us). Over the four day period, I encountered one rude individual after another, mostly in the restaurants, cafes, service personnel. By the last day it actually became amusing and I came to expect it. Everywhere we went there were long lines and inefficient systems in place to deal with the large crowds of people. Value: Nightly room charge $240 - a bit expensive, average cost of breakfast for two was $50 with a side of attitude. The minimum table bet was $50. While I don't mind working up to this, I would rather have the option to start at $10 or $20 and work up from there. Pet Peeve: No coffee makers in the rooms was a real inconvenience. When I asked about coffee makers they suggested I call room service. I could not pre-order the night before as this service was not offered. The first morning we called and they said it would take 1 hour so we ran downstairs, waited in a line of about 50 people, all wanting the same thing and paid $8.08 for two regular coffees. The next morning I called again and it was a 90 minute wait. When I commented on the long wait, they replied this was normal. Once again, we ran downstairs to get our own coffee. At the coffee counter there were five people behind the counter yet only one to serve customers. The other four were cleaning, re-stocking or busy talking to each other. On the last morning there, I made a comment about the poor service to the hostess and she replied back " yea, and it is getting worse every day"! Highlight: The fountain in front of the Bellagio. Wow, this continues to be the best and most beautiful show in town. Best view is from the Bellagio lounge with a balcony overlooking the lake. When you fist enter the music is very loud, however if you continue on through to the back balcony you come upon this beautiful little outdoor patio and the only sound you hear is the music from the fountain show. Very romantic. They don't serve food, but the drinks were good and for $14 each it was the best value in town. Later we walked over to Mon Ami Gabi at Paris for some dinner. They have a great indoor/outdoor patio area that you can sit and people watch with a view of the fountain in the background. Food is excellent, but the wait is long. Overall Experience - I think I will cross Las Vegas off my list for a long while. Good service is important to me as well as value.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a royal guest at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTexanYFP
Reviews.Content: Opulent, Grand, Ginormous, Amazing, Fabulous are just some of the words that came to mind when I walked into this.... mega monster of a hotel. I really was awestruck with the grandeur. It was incredible! It's new, very clean, the staff were so friendly and accommodating even though there are tons of people here, the staff is relaxed and professional. My room in the Palace Tower was fabulous! I love the decor, the bathroom and jacuzzi made me feel like Caesar himself would have hand picked this sort of an experience just for little ol me. I don't gamble so I was really not sure if I could find something to keep me busy during down time at my convention but I was wrong. The Forum Shops sounded like typical hotel shops but turned out to be an entire mall with all the big names. I HIGHLY recommend this place. I know Vegas is a fabulous place but I've seen it myself and it is incredible. I had a wonderful time and definately want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sara_and_Paul
Reviews.Content: Our room was large, modern, comfortable and clean - but a good 20 minute walk from room to the parking lot! Although a little more expensive than other options in Las Vegas, you are staying in a quality hotel, superbly located on the strip. We only stayed here for one night at the end of our trip, so can't really comment on other aspects of the hotel but our brief impressions were positive.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible pool; stank of smoke; horrible hotel manager”
Reviews.Author: cardguy
Reviews.Content: First off, the pool has no shade. Also, there is renovation going on next to the pool so you're treated to jackhammers all day long. If you want to pay $25 extra, you can go to a place that has umbrellas -- but when we went they were sold out; there were no lounge chairs available. Second, the whole hotel stank of cigarette smoke, unlike any of the many newer hotels we visited. Finally, when we did experience problems, the hotel management -- especially hotel manager Kaitlin Riggio -- was especially unhelpful and condescending. They bank on their name and don't care about their guests. There are so many nicer, cleaner, less smelly, accommodating hotels on the strip. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Tower visit”
Reviews.Author: earboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Roman Tower, 14th floor, in mid- July. It was around 110 degrees outside during our stay and we noticed that the hotel had no water fountains and no room mini-fridge. The front desk said that those amenities would probably be added in the upcoming renovation. It would be nice to be able to chill down multiple bottles of water. It would have cost $20 to upgrade to another tower with plasma/LCD TV but we stayed with what we had booked. Most yseful amenity was the iron and ironing board; oh, and the ice machine. Internet access [to print boarding passes] was $5.00 plus a per minute charge and charge for paper. At least toiletries were included in the room price. The bathroom was pretty nice in spite of some mold on the shower tile. The king bed was comfortable. We did hear some annoying thumping one night coming from somewhere unknown. The noise lasted several hours. It was easy to miss the sign for the Roman tower. The casino is sprawling and navigation is difficult. The restaurants were decent but kind of pricy. Ate at the Bellagio buffet for lunch one day. $25 buys lots of good food there. Never made it to the pool but the pool at the Flamingo looked much more interesting and fun. Caesar's also has a "European-style" topless sunning pool and area. We arrived early morning and only had to wait 20 minutes before the room was ready. Normal check-in is 4pm I think. Local calls are over $1.00, don't use the hotel phone for that. Didn't see any big winners at the casino either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Relaxing Honeymoon at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: courtz1977
Reviews.Content: We chose Vegas for our Honeymoon because it was a quick jaunt away from where we live and it would be fun. We booked Caesar's Palace because I have always wanted to stay there and we did not want to cheap out on our Honeymoon. Caesar's is a great place to stay. The location is fantastic and the service was great. They upgraded us to a Suite when they found out it was our Honeymoon. The room was huge with his and hers bathrooms and a jaquzzi. We are not huge gamblers so we spent most of our days by the awesome pool! You need to get there early to find a good spot but you should always be able to find a spot. It was starting to get busy closer to July 4 so we were glad we left on July 4 because it started getting a bit crowded. That is not the hotel's fault. Also the only negative that we did not like is Vegas is getting very expensive. Some of our breakfast's cost us close to $50 US. Other than that we had a really nice, relaxing time, we highly recommend Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stavanger99
Reviews.Content: We ordered classic rooms at Caesars, but got a good price on upgrade to Petite suites. And that did it! Great rooms with jacuzzi and a lot of space. Very clean and nice staff. The hotel-complex has everything of shopping, gambling and dining and if you want to you don't have to leave the hotel at all. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “oh dear, what a mistake”
Reviews.Author: sfdavesfdave
Reviews.Content: what a dump. even the non-smoking rooms are smoky. with so many upscale choices we ended up at caesars because we are going to bette midler's show and wanted to walk. don't do it. plus the $250 tickets ended up costing us $600 a piece to get prime seats because caesars sells all the good seats to scalpers. ripoffs. the rooms (we have four) are old, the registration staff unaccommodating and snooty. my room doesn't even have a closet -- hang your clothes in the bathroom -- it's like a cheap motel. what a mistake/never again. last time i was here in vegas i stayed at the palazzo and it was first rate. this doesn't even have a decent bathroom -- chipped tub! dinged furniture and wall covering.... old televisions, view of construction. if we hadn't prepaid for one night we would all walk. stay away. adding insult, they charge 13.95 a day for internet access.... how lame.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay July 1-4, 2008”
Reviews.Author: KingsJackspay
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Caesars on July 1, 2008 at about 1:30 pm and checked in at the Platinum desk (no waiting). We were staying on a comped 3 night deal so we were put in the Augustus Tower. That is what my reservation said, but the desk clerk said that he was able to move me from the Palace Tower to the Augustus. I told him I was already booked and reserved for the Augustus Tower-- and he said no more. Our room faced the opposite direction from the Bellagio, but is was not so bad. I mean how much of the time are you in your room? The room was large and clean and quiet. The housekeeping staff was very courteous and always had the room cleaned up when we returned. We ate at the food court (good), the Palm (excellent), Augustus Cafe--Breakfast only (good) and I hit the pastry shop over by Rao's a couple of times for coffee and pastry snacks (excellent--but pricey). We also ate at the Venetian (Postrio--Excellent) and Planet Hollywood in the Forum Shop (very mediocre). We spent several days at the pool during the week and the crowds were not that bad. Pool is a mess though. Dirty water, brown tiles--but I knew that going in since the construction is going on--so I guess I was forwarned. Our cocktail server Maria was excellent. After the first day she remembered my wife and me and knew what we were drinking. Gambling--I play only video poker and there are not enough machines at Caesars. The ones they do have are stuck all back by the garage entrance and there is constant traffic walking by there at all hours. Some other machines are by the sports book, but it is colder than Montana in winter over there. I ended up finding a few up in the Palace casino area (the old casino). None of them are full pay, but this is the Strip so I never expected full pay. I held my own pretty well on the fifty cent and dollar Double Double Bonus machines. Finally hit the Heart Royal Flush on the last day of the trip early in morning while I was drinking my coffee. My wife found the penny Dean Martin and Wizard of Oz machines and had a blast playing those. She actually won money on a penny slot--amazing. We went to LOVE at the Mirage and thoroughly enjoyed the show. The sound is awesome and the Cirque perfomers are top notch. I would highly recommend this show to Beatles music lovers. I did not encounter any rude or surly staff on this trip. Got a late check out by nicley asking the hostess in the Platimum check in area. No problem even though is was the 4th of July and many people were checking in. Check out was a breeze. All in All we had a nice relaxing stay at Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Experience...but never take a connecting flight!!!”
Reviews.Author: JeffPToronto
Reviews.Content: I went to Caesar's Palace on the July 4th weekend for UFC 86 at the Mandalay Bay and a boy's weekend getaway. I frequent Vegas and usually get down there at least once a year and always have a great time, but a few lessons were learned this trip. To begin with, NEVER, EVER TAKE A CONNECTING FLIGHT IF YOU CAN AVOID IT!!! I flew out of Buffalo and was supposed to connect in Cleveland to Vegas. Well, the plane was supposed to pick us up from Cleveland and then return but it was over an hour late. Consequently, I missed my flight to Vegas that was departing at 12:45 and had to walk around Cleveland airport for SIX HOURS!!! until about 7pm when I had to beg the agent to let me on standby. Now normally I would just chalk this up to one bad experience but the last time I went to Vegas (March 20/08) the same thing happened at Washington DC airport. The flight back on that trip was fine but the flight back on the July 4th weekend was again guess what.....LATE!!!! I almost missed my flight again!!! Anyways the point is, if you can fly direct do it and just pay the extra money. I tried to shave a few bucks off both times I tried connecting flights and you know what? Both times it cost me almost an entire day of an already short vacation!!! As for Caesar's, a beautiful resort with great nightclubs, restaurants and bars. The pools were under construction so I look forward to better scenery next time. Also, on Friday the 4th the pool closed early at 4pm for a private party so we had to leave which was really uncool. Meaning, we're paying for this resort and all of it's amenities but had to leave. Pure was as always a great club with a beautiful view from the patio upstairs and the bars were always well staffed with great drinks. As for food, Caesar's is known for it's restaurants but I must say that one of my most pleasurable meals was eating at Payard near the pool. It's a beautiful bakery with wonderful pastries and fantastic coffee. We wanted to eat at BOA for steak and lobster but couldn't seem to find it in the Forum because it's not clearly marked on the maps. Spago was good, but not great and really not much better than The Keg. Our room was in the Roman tower and although the washroom was nice, the room was nothing special with a very unimpressive view of the AC units on the roof right below us. If you don't mind spending a few more dollars and also spend a little more time in your room than we did, spend the money on a room upgrade with a balcony. I would suggest the new to be constructed Augustus tower. The only other advice I would offer in regards to this particular weekend was that as always, I love Las Vegas and always will. This may have been the wrong weekend to go as it was sooooo busy being the 4th of July. However seeing UFC 86 at the Mandalay Bay made all of the crowds worth it...Vegas Baby Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time”
Reviews.Author: mittmott
Reviews.Content: We are Harrahs total rewards diamond members. We chose Caesars after being told it was the nicest of the harrahs properties in LV.When I booked, I made it clear that I didn't want to wind up in their standard rooms (heard bad things about them), and since I was being comped for a few days, I would be willing if I had to , pay the difference if this is what I was going to get. They assured me over the phone, that diamond members are put in the newer rooms, and even upgraded automatically if upgrades are available. Well, imagine my surprise after arriving late at night, from a long flight, to be told, you are in the standard rooms. I almost passed out. After much back and forth with the check in young man, we were put in a nice room. After that everything else was very nice. I went into diamond check in the next morning and told them what happened, and they put a food comp on my account. We had a lovely time there, and we were even comped all of our meals that were signed to our room, when we left. The rooms in the palace tower, are very nice, usual harrahs decor, very large room, and marble, and granite bathrooms. I hope they re do their classic rooms, as when you stay there, you expect some amount of luxury, and from what I heard those old rooms, are worse than small motel rooms, but I can tell you the other rooms in the forum tower, the palace tower, and the augustus tower, are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wait until the buildings over”
Reviews.Author: hepb
Reviews.Content: Just had a week at the augustus tower. BEWARE!! Major building work. One third of the pools have gone, pool facing rooms at the forum tower overlook a large building site with the wall-less shell of the new tower (next to the augustus tower) obliterating the view. Very ugly. We first were put in a substantial room in the forum tower, but didn't like it due to the view so got switched to a top floor augustus tower room above the belagio pool - fabulous. This does mean a long walk through the casino to and from the pool (the old walk-through is being built on). The pool - same number of holidayers, a third less pool, so busy. Half surrounded by pounding construction work all day. Huge new tower in line with augustus tower dominates the pool area - currently a concrete set of floors and piping. Caesars tries to cover with even louder poolside music, but workers also playing own music loudly so just a noise all together. Poolside covered in fine concrete grit/dust in mornings. Check all bills. Complicated and staff seem to find understanding queries a problem. They start with "No, we're right" and take some persuading. HOWEVER it is still a good place to stay. Solidly built means little noise from neighbours, the place is clean, impressively large and the buffet food great in value and quality. Generally I'd avoid until late next year when the building's done. Then it will be unbeatable. Meanwhile try elsewhere for fuller satisfaction

Reviews.Title: “Started bad but ended good.”
Reviews.Author: AngieKansas
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 4 p.m. Waited in line about 15 minutes. We had been comped our room and we had made reservations on Harrah's website for the Augustus Deluxe room. I gave my name and was told that I would be in a classic room. Needless to say this did not go over well with me. I was told by this very rude man that since it was comped and I no longer had diamond status that was what we get and to bad! Plus the room was not clean yet and would be a hour before we could check in. I was fuming. I went to the casino host and was told the same thing(I was dropped back to a gold member in March because we no longer have a Harrah's in our area). So we wandered around for a hour and went back to the check in desk....This time I saw a younger lady so I headed for her. I told her our situation and she said she would try to get us something better...Sure enough she clicks away and says she has a room in the palace tower....I thanked her and she said to just wait a sec and she would see if she could get us the Augustus...At this point I told her if you get me that room you are getting a tip. I know long story but we did end up in the Augustus and I did tip her. I did not get her name which now I regret....I was so excited about getting the room I forgot. Now we have the room....It is a really nice room. We went to the casino and played for awhile and it was really small....We didn't realize until the next day that there are 2 casinos there...The palace and The forum casinos. I did pretty well at the palace casino. Food - We ate breakfast at the buffet....Not good. We had lunch at Cafe Lago husband and I both had chicken and it was $55 with 2 cokes....Overpriced and chicken made husband sick. Tried 3 of the food court places off the forum casino all over priced and not good. We did eat at the Flamingo buffet for dinner and it was good. We ate at the Golden Nugget...not good. And The Paris buffet was excellent. I highly recommend the Paris buffet. Back to the hotel. All I can say is WOW! This place is wonderful. You can walk for hours and hours and never see everything they have. Even though the food was bad and bad experience with check in the rest of our stay was great. We were in room 4283 and did not hear any construction. We did not get to the pool area. We were in Vegas 5 days and did not have a spare moment. As everyone says wear goodwalking shoes. Also be aware that a bottle of water is $3-$4 a bottle and also soda runs the same price. If possible bring some with you. The Duece is a bus that runs up and down the strip and also downtown. Take advantage of this. You can buy a 24 hour pass for $5. You can purchase this right on the bus. There are alot of bus stops so you don't have to walk to far to find one. This will be the best money you spent there. Fremont street light show well worth going downtown to see. Belligo water show excellent. Wax museum...save your money it is $25 a person and not worth it. Sorry this is so long but I hope it will help some first time Vegas goers ( Like I was).

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Athens85
Reviews.Content: I stayed trhee nights in June 2008 at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas. We were in the Centurion Tower. The room was simply terrible like a room of Motel 6: furnitures of the '80s. The room was not very clen especially the bathrooom. There was a lot of noise from other rooms. Staff not very friendly at both reception and Valet Parking. For the price that you pay at the Caesars Palace is better to add something and book at the Bellaggio or Venetian. Never again! The only postive thing is the Forums shops: they are simply fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Gelato Cafe in Caesar's Forum shops”
Reviews.Author: JJJTC
Reviews.Content: The Gelato Cafe in the Forum shops is the biggest rip off. I have traveled all over the world and the U.S.A. and expect to pay more at tourist places. But this place is set up so the gelato is on the outside counter with cup sizes displayed.. I chose the regular which was shown as the smallest. You go to the inside counter to pay and for a 3-4 oz cup it was $12.99. There was a small listed on their price list by the register, but they do not show that cup size near the gelato. Just want people to be warned-go to the register first to look at prices and don't be drawn to the gelato first

Reviews.Title: “Warning....”
Reviews.Author: WildtravelerSD
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 Augustus tower rooms, 3 nights for the in-laws 50th anniversary. I was never told of the construction (new wing) when booking through the hotel directly and was sorely disappointed when I stepped out to the pool to find the noise deafening- saws, hammers, welders. We came for a relaxing time by the pool and what we found was complete annoyance from beginning to end. I did ask for a Bellagio fountain view...and got it, yet was not told I'd also be staring into 14 building cranes for City Center. Also, the hotel did nothing for the 50th anniversary. The in-laws were not impressed to say the least. I was ashamed to have brought them there. We should have checked out after day 1, but they didn’t want to repack and move. The pool itself had opaque water, a greasy film floating on it and cigarette butts littered around. You must pay for drinking water (in 115 heat you'd think they'd give you water to keep you from passing out), and pay for a pool float if you want it. If you want shade, you best be the first at the pool or pay some more money to get some. The pool closes at 7pm…. It's 105 at night, the sun sets at 8 and they close the pool at 7? What's up with that? I had to hunt long and hard for lounge chairs (on a weekday) and due to construction there was a lot less room (I was told) so the lounges don't have an inch between them. There was a sticky mess below the lounge I did find one day- no wonder no one took it. And I ended up with a case of athletes foot.....bring some flip-flops and don't take them off! Better yet, don't go. And the 7 month pregnant waitress in a bikini didn’t help the ambience either. I drove in on a Sunday, mid afternoon, and the valet sign said it was full...unload and go park it yourself. Yet it seemed empty. It was hit and miss whether or not the valet would take your car for the 3 days we were there. Some of the room decor did seem new and updated but one wooden chair looked like it came from the swap meet... it was so banged up and abused. Several light bulbs were burnt out, the towels were better at a Holiday Inn Express we stayed at, and the toilet ran all the time. I did complain about the pool noise and lack of notice and was told 'too bad, nothing we can do about it". On the upside the beds were comfortable and the AC worked well. I've stayed at the Venetian and it's, by far, light years ahead in service and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: brenhanna
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is beautiful. We booked our room through the hotel website. We requested a room in the Augustus Tower with a view of the strip. We were even allowed to check in early at 10 am. The room was spacious; the bathroon was gorgeous. Que Spa was unbelievable. I can't say enough great things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room!! Great Service! Expensive Food..”
Reviews.Author: ENTM
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at Caesar's Palace in June, 2008. After a very long flight. I arrived at approximately 2:00 a.m. on Monday morning, and found the bell staff very friendly, and very helpful. Upon check-in at the reservation desk, the woman was also very friendly, and very accommodating. I asked her for a "nice" room. She checked what she had available, and asked me for some preferences. (i.e. nicer room or nicer view, closer to the pool or closer to the front entrance, etc. etc. ) Since I was there to attend a conference, my preferences were; nicer room rather than nicer view, and closer to the front entrance. She placed me in the Augustus Tower, and the room was GREAT! Everything seemed brand new. It was very large, very clean, and beyond comfortable. AND, I would love to have that bathroom at home! While I was there, I ordered room service quite a few times, the food was decent, and it was delivered quickly, and with great service. I did also try the Augustus Cafe. I have to say that was very disappointing. It was VERY expensive, and the food was terrible. I should have stuck to room service.. My only negative comment about staying at Caesars was the sheer size of the place, it is massive. It's a bit confusing to get around, and it is quite a hike to get anywhere within the hotel, as well as anywhere on the strip. If you plan on staying at the hotel a lot, it's got everything you need right there onsite. If you like to walk the strip and get to the little side-streets, you'll be walking for quite some time just to get to the street level, let alone to any of the smaller venue's Vegas has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Gamblers Dream”
Reviews.Author: Serialglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: First of all Las Vegas is not for everyone. However, the strip and the themed casinos are a sight that is not to be missed. Caesars Palace is ideally situated to explore the surrounding area and dominates the casino strip. As with most large hotels in Vegas it’s more a case that they are casinos with rooms added and once through the reception area the ground floor is dominated by slot machines and card tables. That said the room we booked was lavishly laid out with marble finishes, effective air-conditioning, extremely clean and virtually the size of a suite. There also is plenty of variety when choosing where to each with over 20 eateries to suit all budgets, health spa and four swimming pools. The one drawback during our stay is that despite the US economy suffering, construction work is still moving apace and a new wing of the hotel is being built which is stuck right in front of the Palace Tower accommodation. Nevertheless, noise and dust didn’t prove to be a major problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Prettyvegasd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Augustus Towers, make sure you ask for a strip view. I didn't think it mattered, but it does. We over looked the Bellagio fountain and every day they change the pattern. What a view, it was so nice at night coming back to our room and watching it with a glass of wine. The room was nice and clean with two sinks which comes in handy if you would like to fill one with ice and have cold drinks. The bar fridge has no room for your own stuff. I had heard that there was no coffee makers in the room so I brought my own. You can go down to Walgreens and purchase one for 10 bucks and it will save you a long walk in the morning searching for your fix. You could order room service but you will PAY $4 a cup. Maid service came in twice a day. the lobby and casino were clean and well kept. Drink girls were really good, it didn't matter if I was playing a pennie slot or a dollar one. Food in the resturants are expensive so bring lots of money for food. Over all a great place to stay. Very centalized and you can catch the bus to go up and down the strip out side the forum shops. Make sure you bring your running shoes because there is alot of walking to do.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go again...”
Reviews.Author: KFDG
Reviews.Content: At first, I sort of liekd the room I had in the older part of the complex. Room didnt have and iron (which I needed badly). Then I noticed there was no door to the bathroom....sorry but when youre with others on vacation some business is meant to be private! I went down and complained, got upgraded to the newer room and at no charge...yet upon checking in they were trying to get me to pay extra to move into the same room. Room service was very expensive here. I must say though the grounds were gorgeous, the mall is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & Luxurious Place”
Reviews.Author: CanuckleHead12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars Palace (CP) from June 27- July 1, 2008 and had the most wonderful time. I was really worried after reading some of the reviews online but I did not encounter any problems. CP really defines what luxury is and I found it to be the most beautiful hotel and casino of all the major ones on the strip. Our check in was a breeze took about five minutes and we checked in at about 3 p.m. The hotel staff was friendly. Our room was in the Palace tower on the 19th floor the room was just amazing. It was clean from the bed to the carpet to the jacuzzi tub to the shower. It was all top notch the decorations the room had plentiful mirrors to get ready and washroom was very spacious and clean. The beds were great but after a long day I could have slept anywhere. We put a do not disturb sign on the door knob so were never bothered by the cleaning staff who start cleaning at 8 a.m we used to get the room cleaned later in the day. The cleaning staff was courteous and were willing to pass you extra towels if required. We had the partial view of the strip, and a complete view of the pools which looked great from the top. We went to the pool on most days it was busy on the weekends but you could still find chairs and on Monday the pool was a lot quiter. The service at the pool was good although food is expensive but it is easy to find a waitress to address your needs. The pool was clean and a very fun place. I am surprised by people complaining about staff being rude as we found all the staff friendly and helpful. You get treated the way you treat others so be polite and respectful you will get that back. I found our room to be great if you are bothered by a chip in the paint or other little things then good luck.. We never heard any construction noise in our room may be because of the location, we did hear the construction noise a few times when we were at the pool. All over CP they have great statues of various Roman characters decorations and fountains to complement, all this adds to your experience. The forum shops are a great viewing experience but prices are way too high.....The pure night club is really rocking and with a large patio you can enjoy the sights of Vegas and party at the same time.. .I would return to Caesars in a heartbeat and I am astonished at how some of the reviews found everything negative in CP. This is a great place to stay and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: RAK60090
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Cesar Place for 3 nights in June 2008 and I was bitten on both sides of my body on the side under my arms down the side by bed bugs. I told the hotel manager and they told me that they will block off the room and check it.They advised me 2 weeks later via a phone call that the room did not have bed bugs. I took pictures of my bites and they still say the room don't have bugs. No way to prove it unless I went back to Las Vegas and asked to see the room, but that would cost me air fair and not worth spend the money. If you get bit at a hotel take pictures of the bugs if you can or better yet kill one and take to the manager and put it on his desk. I suggest you stay away from Cesar Place since they will just lie about it if you get bitten by bed bugs in their hotel. the bit took about 2 weeks to heal up. The idea of Bed Bugs bitting me makes my me sick!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so-so rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelguy20
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and has great shopping and restaurants within the hotel. The rooms are not as nice as other properties on the strip; they are just dated and in need of remodeling. Other towers were being renovated so I imagine this is coming soon to the entire hotel. The salad bar in the food court is excellent for a quick meal. A good place to stay, not as up-scale as the Bellagio or Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace was really nice!”
Reviews.Author: MissyVirginia
Reviews.Content: I read so many negative reviews about Caesars's Palace and was starting to have second thoughts about staying there. My husband and I went for 4 nights and just got back yesterday. We could not have been happier. We arrived at about 3:30pm on Thurs. June 26th. Check -in was a breeze. We asked the very sweet girl (Joy) if we could get a room upgrade because we were celebrating our Anniversary. We were told for $60.00 extra dollars a night we could have a room in the Augustus Towers. We were immediately relieved because we booked through Expedia for a classic room and read that they were very sub-standard. We waited 30 min. while they got our room ready. When we got up to our room, we were extremely happy. We were in room 3262. It was Gorgeous!!!! We had a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip. We were very impressed with everything -jacuzzi tub, marble floors, double granite top vanities, 2 flat screen tv's a sitting area, mini bar and most of all, it was very clean. We never heard a peep from anywhere, not construction or neighbors. It was great! The only problem we encountered was with our tv remote(didn't work at times), but no big deal. The Pool was beautiful and we only had trouble finding chairs on Sat. when it is definitely more crowded. No trouble any other day. Drinks are very expensive, but what can you do. You have to drink at pool because of the heat. We have two children and love kids, but we did find it a little annoying that there were children in the pool as we were there to relax without kids. We loved the forum shops and we shopped for hours. We ate at Spago which we found to be out of this world good! We informed the waiter that we had a show to get to and he rushed our amazing meal out to us in no time. We weren't that impressed with Cafe Lago(Caesar's Breakfast Buffet, so we tried the buffet at the Bellagio and it was very, very, very good!! We ate there 2 mornings. CheeseCake Factory is good too for a cheaper dining experience. Also Margaritaville(across the street) was quite good for a cheaper meal. We saw two shows- Blue Man Group(very good) and Carrot Top(very funny) We checked out several other hotels while we were there and to us, Caesars appeared to be one of the nicer ones. We are very glad we stayed there. Every single staff member we came in contact with was extremely nice!! I hope this review helps other people make up their mind about where to stay. Yes, some things at Caesars's are pricey, but you don't have to be wealthy to enjoy staying there. We did and we aren't

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Karara
Reviews.Content: After travelling from San Francisco via Carmel, Santa Barbara, Laguna and San Diego this was to be our last stop and we decided to blow the budget and stay at Ceasars (last time Circus Circus and awful!!). We checked in and got a king room in the Roman Tower. It was really nice. Good quality bedding, tv in bathroom and huge shower. We heard no noise and the blackout curtains meant we had the best sleep of our whole trip. I really liked Ceasars and would definitely return. We found all staff really helpful and I even got sent to Platinum check out as the queue was big when we left. We ate at Spago, and had the nicest waitress of our whole trip. Please don't be put off by some of the other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: richygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Caesars Palace for the fourth year in a row and will not be returning. The first year it was very nice. I love the ambiance and the actual physical appeal of the property. I also love the location...very close to everything. However, once you check in, the service ends...literally. The second year we went back and things were o.k. We had a nice room, but received no comps--you get very little back unless you are a "high roller" i guess. The rooms were also less than clean, even though we have always stayed in the Palace Tower. Last year, everything was terrible--the room was never vacuumed, there was a lampshade missing in the room the entire stay (think Motel 6), the whirlpool tub was literally filthy and never cleaned even though we asked repeatedly. So I complained at checkout and received a form. I filled it out and sent it in. A few weeks later i received a note apologizing and giving us two free nights. So we decided to give it one more try. Well, we just got back and that's why i say...never again. This time, they gave us an upgraded "mini-suite", which basically was no different than the room we had the last time, only higher on the Palace Tower and it broke one big bathroom up into two. Since it was my birthday, we requested (thanks to notes on this forum) to stay in the tower away from the construction that is taking place behind the property. Well, the person at check-in said there were no rooms available and, besides, there was "no construction"...we would love it. Well, i was awakened every morning at 6 a.m. to the sound of the imaginary construction. It went on all day. Plus, the room was never vacuumed, again, and one day we had to call at 4 because the room was never cleaned. The pool area was very dirty and crowded, no service, and you had to listen to the construction that was literally taking place steps away. Less than relaxing. Slots are old and recycled...better selections and payouts elsewhere. Although I would love to recommend the hotel, i just can't. There are many other choices...we'll be going elsewhere next year. Caesars has potential, but when you stay someplace for the ambiance and luxury and feel like you'd be treated better at the Hyatt, it's time for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: BeerMeMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars Palace from June 23rd-27th 2008. Arrived at Hotel at around 1:30pm. Check in, took too long because of long lineup. Inside of Hotel is very nice, over the top decorations. Was checked into Roman tower Room with 1 King Size bed. Room was not renovated, the only thing that looked updated was bed covering. Room was quite large, bathroom was large with separate shower, small bathtub, and toilet. Only 1 sink in bathroom. Had two light bulbs in bathroom that were burnt out. Bathroom was fairly clean, shower looked old, saw some mold and mildew in shower. Had a small LCD (about 4 inches) beside mirror, screen was barley visible. Room had a small desk, a chair, small one person couch and a stool at end of bed. Bed was not comfortable at all. Bed covering and decorative pillows did not look like they had been cleaned in a long time. Carpet had stains. TV was old, and had very poor reception. View (basically no view) from window was of the other older tower next door to Roman tower. Air conditioning in room was not very good, No temperature control, only a switch to move from hot air to cool air, and a Low, Med, or high fan setting. Also when air conditioning was on, a faint clanging/banging noise was apparent in bathroom, and could be felt in room also. Had an In-Room safe that was probably there from the sixties(actually came in handy though). The final problem with this room was it had adjoining room doors in it, 2 of them! On either side of room there was a door connecting to the next room. I was able to hear almost every word spoken from the rooms next to us. One more thing, the housekeeping staff likes to start cleaning very early, at about 8:30am they start knocking on doors. They were very banging into walls with their carts and talking very loudly. They knocked on our door at about 9am, even though we had a "do not disturb" sign hanging. Not very impressed with Caesars Palace at all, will not be staying here again. One other note, everything is way overpriced here, payed about $10.00 for a sandwich in Market place, although the Buffet was alright. Do not stay in Room 681 in Roman Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: tilly12324
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Vacations suites before when visited Las Vegas, but wanted to treat ourselves for a few nights at ceasars!!!! It was shocking and would prefer the vacation suites anytme. We was given a room on the 9th floor in the Roman Tower- nicely overlooking another building so the room has no natural light- the other light bulbs were also out so the front desk was called-aking 2 hrs to change the light bulbs. This was after an herrendous que to check in- which you could do without after a 10 hr flight- another 1.5 hrs to check in to a sh*t room. Construction going on round the pool- so as long as you dont mind the view of a building site, and noise at all hours then this will be fine. we did complain and got offered to be moved but we were only staying 3 nights so couldn't be bothered to re pack- but if your not happy complain and they are more than willing to help. e prepared to drag suitcases all over the place too- no one wants to help- you are a number in this hotel and you will know it!!! good weather thou but won't be staying at CP again.

Reviews.Title: “Ceasars Palace”
Reviews.Author: tripppppper
Reviews.Content: After a stay at Ceasars Palace in May be prepared for a noisy experience if you are going to use the swimming pool area the noice from the building works (not informed at time of booking or on arrival)and the loud music from the Venus pool so load on the weekends that we had to leave the the pool, and even worse nobody available to do anything about it at the weekends the rest of the hotel was very good

Reviews.Title: “Caesar lived up to his reputation!”
Reviews.Author: roderules
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace was certainly a palace alright. The only thing this hotel needs is an internal transportation system to get you from on end of the property to the other. Sheesh from the Forum shops to the Augustus Tower where I stayed it had to be a 15 minute walk, not including detours when you got lost. The room itself was excellent. I had been booked in a standard room for a convention, but for $40 more a night I upgraded to a room in the Augustus Tower. From the 38th floor, the view was somewhat obscured by construction of a building behind Caesars, but oyu still could see hotels like the RIO and the mountains in the distance.The bathroom was super with glass enclosed shower with marble walls, a separate jacuzzi tub, double sink and vanity, LCD panel TV's in the bathroom and main sleeping area. Bed was a bit on the soft side for a firm mattress fan like I am. The bed linens and comforters luxurious. Here's a helpful hint. It you want a small refrigerator ask for it when you check in. If they ask if it's to keep medicine in, say yes. Otherwise they'll charge you $10.00 a day. For some people snacks and juice can be considered medicinal! Mostly ate breakfast at the Cafe Lago, Excellent service and costs in line with what you'd expect for B'fast ($17.00) Definitely use the valet parking at the main entrance, Self parking is miles away.

Reviews.Title: “The Pros outweigh the Cons”
Reviews.Author: sjmatuska
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 4 days at Caesars and have to say, while some things were a bit sketchy, the overall experience was pretty great. Check-in was quick. We got upgraded to a suite for no added cost. The room was amazing. Great view of the pools, super comfy beds and two bathrooms with a walk-through shower and jacuzzi tub. Maid service concerned me a bit - i made sure to zip up my luggage before we left for the day and when I came back my bag was wide open and my things were on the floor. They took my white towel out of my bag as well - it didn't look anything like the towels in the room. So that was frustrating. Luckily nothing else was missing - BUT - for some reason when we left there was a thong, pair of shorts and t-shirt in our room....none of which belonged to us. Still haven't figured that one out. The Venus Pool was amazing. Didn't like the main pools at all. Too crowded and too many kiddos. We got into Venus without having to pay the $25 cover both days, but it would have been worth it even if we had to. My roomate ate at a restaurant in Caesars and they tried to steal her money, so be careful about what they are charging you and if you get your change back. We also had issues with the bellhop - he forgot to put one of our bags in the cab on our way to the airport so we had to turn around and come all the way back. Ended up being a VERY EXPENSIVE cab ride and Caesars wasn't willing to pay for it even though it was their fault. Luckily our flight was delayed or we may have missed it! Shopping was great, as was Pure. Overall, great experience. Just be cautious!

Reviews.Title: “Don't spend your money here - too many better options”
Reviews.Author: tikcho77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Vegas a couple of times each year and we've stayed at pretty much all the large casino hotels. After staying at Caesars a couple of years ago and being placed in a terrible smoky and old room in the Forum Tower we swore we will never come back. However, my company's annual conference this year was there and we were all guaranteed a Palace Tower room so I figured it couldn't be that bad. I was traveling with my brother this year so we had reserved a room with two beds. We arrived at the hotel around midnight due to major flight delays and were told that they did not have any more rooms with two beds but could put us in a king room for the first night and then move us to a double the next day. I was not very happy because I was going to be busy the entire day and did not want to deal with moving rooms, etc but the check-in clerk said he would upgrade us to a room at the Augustus Tower the next day and he told us it will be a high floor room with a view of the Strip to compensate for the inconvenience. We thought that was a great deal and agreed. The room in the Palace Tower where we spent our first night was renovated and really nice - flat screen TV, modern furniture and soft beds. The bathroom was huge, with a Jacuzzi tub, double sinks, marble and granite, very tasteful. The next day my brother moved our stuff to the new room in Augustus and when I got to the room in the evening I was not pleasantly surprised. The room was identical to the one we had in Palace although a bit larger and had a small sofa and coffee table by the window. The bathroom was also the same as in the Palace but had a small TV above the sink. Exact same furniture and decor as the Palace room. My surprise came when I looked through the window and instead of a lovely Strip view saw a construction site a few feet away from me. My annoyance grew when we were woken up around 4 am the next day when the construction crew began working and we could hear all the sounds loud and clear. I'm sure they "upgraded" us to this room because no one paying over $500 per night would accept that. The construction was pretty much non-stop between 4 am and about 4 pm every day so sleeping late was not an option unless you have ear plugs. The pool area is really nice but again, the new tower is being built right next to the pool so all the sights and sounds of building a 50-story tower are present at the pool. In addition the staff at the pool was rude and would not allow us to charge drinks to our room without an ID even though we offered our room key (we had charged many other things around the hotel on our room but the waitress at the pool would not let us buy a $10 drink). At the pool, the first row of chairs has a constant "Reserved" sign even though most of them sat empty. So not only do you have to pay $300+ per night to be at the hotel but you have to pay extra to get a chair right by the pool. We tried going to the Venus pool and were told we can only get in if we bought a cabana or sat at the bar (and spent money of course). You could see the pool was not full at all but they are trying to make it look like it's packed judging by all the security outside. They have also closed the entrance from the Augustus tower to the pool because of the construction so you have to make a 10-minute trek through the casino now. Again, the pool area is not bad but with all the construction and the snobby staff attitude it was just too much for me. The casino is just OK although after 8 pm all the tables have minimums of $25 or above (compared to the Bellagio and Mirage where they had plenty of $10 and $15 tables every night). also, at the slot machines at night it took forever to get a drink as the servers were not abundant. We played at several of the nearby casinos during the week and the service at Caesars was probably the worst. Then comes the problem with the Valet. Either their parking lot is tiny or they have a policy to say their valet is full for no reason because every single night we stayed there (7 nights) in the evenings they would put up a sign that the valet is full. When we mentioned we were guests they would take our car until our last night when they told us they only accept cars of Seven Diamonds members even though we are guests of the hotel. When we complained to the manager, he said he was sorry, they should have taken our car, but he did not offer any real resolution, he just looked like he did not want to deal with us. Then, we came to find out that Caesars is the only hotel where the Valet bears no responsibility for your car even if they damage it or it is stolen from their valet lot (just look at the valet ticket if you do not believe me). We checked all of the other valet tickets for the other hotels where we hung out and Caesars is the only one with such a ridiculous policy. In terms of restaurants and shopping - there are many options at Caesars for pretty much every taste so at least you won't be disappointed in that. We saw Elton John at the Colosseum - he was great and definitely worth the super expensive tickets ($300 pp). However, his run is over in a few weeks but I know Beth Middler and Cher are coming after him so if you like them, definitely see them, it's an experience to remember. So, overall, is it a bad hotel? No. Is it worth paying hundreds of dollars a night to be nickel and dimed for everything? NO! Is the Augustus tower worth the extra money? Absolutely no! But do not stay at the Roman or Centurion towers - one of my co-workers was put in the Roman tower and those rooms look worse than Motel 6, Caesars should be ashamed!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Caesars Summer 2008”
Reviews.Author: ChicoGuy
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in the Augustus Tower, but it was not available. We were told the rooms in the Palace Tower were the same, they are not. Service was bad. Only 2 bath towels in the room... you cannot take a shower before you go out at night and another in the morning unless you re-use your towel. Room was sub-par. Was not cleaned until we made a specific request. Pool experience was horrible. They have much of the pool area closed off due to construction. Too many people crammed into a small space. Nearly impossible to get a chair. The pool was so full of people the water was cloudy and dirty by the afternoon. The ONLY good thing about Caeasars is the location. Do yourself a favor, pick a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel this old hotel person has stayed in in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sassyredhead
Reviews.Content: In all my years of traveling to Las Vegas I have never stayed at Caesar's Palace and I will never go to Vegas again without staying at the Palace. From dawn to dusk, every person I encountered was not just pleasant but treated me with unexpected enthusiasm. As a former hotel person and a current travel consultant at www.4moretravel.com I have never experienced such a luxurious stay in Las Vegas. As a professional I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Room was perfect”
Reviews.Author: LisaVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were booked at Caesars this time around for 1 week in a $100 classic room. We were upgraded to a room in the Forum Tower. It was brand new but the size of a closet. No bathtub and it faced the construction and a cement wall. I asked for an alternate "upgraded" room and was given a room in the Palace tower. Excellent. Flat screen TV, Huge hallway with tons of closet space, mini-bar, safe, vanity and best if all the bathroom. Separate shower, double sinks, separate toilet closet and a massive roman hot tub. Fits 2 no problemo. If you've never been to Caesars, the shopping and drinks are very expensive. We hiked over to Planet Hollywood just to get beer and wine at the ABC store there because we couldnt find any stores near our room. I like the rooms at Caesars but I would try the Mirage or Paris next time, or else go back and stay at Planet Hollywood again.....for the convenience of the mall and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: 88whiteM3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our fifties, but act like 30 somethings most of the time. We're from Toronto, Canada. This was a five night stay at CP's Augustus Tower 42nd floor, overlooking the Bellagio Fountains, Las Vegas Blvd, Paris, and more! Loved the big room, with comfy King bed, and a wonderful bathroom (spa tub, separate shower, two sinks, lovely marble design). Fast elevators, lovely architecture throughout, extensive (but expensive) shopping at the Forum Shops, good selection of restaurants, nice pool area. Casino just average, but clean. Very efficient Valet service! Great central location! Saw Cirque's "Love" show next door at the Mirage (10/10). A visit to Bellagio on the south side was great. Check out the shops and the Conservatory. Very good Buffet. Nice casino. The fountain shows are a must. Across the street is Paris, which had the best Buffet we have ever tried. We also spent 3 nights at the Four Seasons. While it was very nice, with excellent service, we enjoyed our stay at Caesars more!! This applies to the Augustus Tower in an upgraded room, though. Well worth the upgrade! (We got a deal through a family member , a Diamond card holder, of $850. for the 5 nights, including the weekend. Great deal!). We understand that some of the other towers at CP are nowhere near as nice. Overall, we can hardly wait for a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 30th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: GoldieinLondon
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 days in Las Vegas to celebrate my 30th birthday. I had 10 people travel from all over the world to join me, and we all had a wonderful stay at Caesar's. Check-in was simple and easy, and most of us took the option of the upgrade. Having seen the rooms of those who did not take this option, I must say that I am glad we did. Our room was huge, with 2 queen sized beds, a double bathroom, jacuzzi bath, flat screen tvs (including one in the bathroom), and a view of the Bellagio fountains. We found out later that one of our party had been offered their upgrade at a lesser amount than we had been. When we raised this with the front desk they agreed instantly to drop our rate as well, which was very impressive. We ate at quite a few restaurants in the hotel and the Forum Shops. Hyakumi, the Sushi restaurant, was lovely, but beware that it is pricey. One problem is that in Las Vegas, the tips are expected to be at least 20% on top of relatively expensive food + tax, which means that it can appear that you are paying above the odds for what you get. But when in Rome ... We also ate at the Cheesecake Factory (yummy and huge portions ... when will they open one in London??) and Spagos (great food, great cocktails, excellent service). Cafe Lagos for breakfast was amazing! I have never seen such a massive and varied buffet in my life. I seem to remember that it is £17.99 for all you can eat, and I strongly recommend doing this if you're looking to have a 2-meal day. I was stuffed all the way til dinner. Augustus Cafe was a good option for breakfast if you didn't want to gorge on an all-you-can-eat buffet, althought the service struggles when it is busy. It is also a good spot for a light bite during the day (I can highly recommend the Matzah Ball chicken soup). The Forum Shops are an excellent shopping venue. You will find all the usuals here, but be warned, things in Vegas are a little more expensive than in other places in the US. If you are prepared to pay (and have a good exchange rate), it is a great shopping experience. Other people have told me that the budget malls on the outskirts of town are great value if you're prepared to travel to them. We went to the Fashion Mall past Treasure Island and had a great time in there as well. As far as the casino goes, I would agree that it is smoky and appears a little run down in parts. However, every casino I walked into in Vegas was smoky, so until they catch up with the rest of the world and ban smoking indoors, you just have to live with it. The only exception to that was the Palazzo ... but until I win the lottery, I can't afford to stay there! Pure nightclub was a great deal of fun, once you got in. In Vegas, all of the best clubs are in the hotels and none of them seem to have any idea about how to control a queuing system. You get free entry with your hotel key but you still have to attack the bouncers with the same gusto as anyone else. Definitely worth going to for a boogy with your friends, but I hear the drink prices are a bit extravagant (we didn't bother trying to get near the bar). All in all, I spent an amazing 30th birthday in Vegas, and I like to think that staying at Caesar's played a part in that. The location in the centre of the strip is second to none - and was the reason I chose here rather than NY, NY or the MGM. Oh and the pool area is cool too - we spent a few afternoons lazing around, and even the food and drinks that they serve at "Snackus Maximus" were surprisingly good. Would recommend to anyone who asked me for a place to stay in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OttawaJay
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying…I had reviewed at least 100 negative reviews and was so worried….until I found a site where I could see reviews from Canada, UK and Australia and wow what a difference…nothing but positives which is exactly what I have to say. Caesars Palace was a treat….it was like staying at an Adult Disney Land. Check-in We arrived at around noonish and check-in is not until 3pm. So the hostess directed us to the Bell desk where we could check our bags for free. Everyone was quite friendly…great start. We went for lunch and came back an hour later and they had a room ready. I booked the free room upgrade promotion through Travelocity (based on availability) and was quite worried I would not get the upgrade….again not a problem. The person at the front desk was very friendly and helped us pick our room (room 731 in the Palace Tower), a deluxe room!! Room The deluxe room was exactly as advertised from the reviews. King bed was amazingly comfortable and the room was very spacious. The bathroom was awesome – two sinks, modern standup shower, jetted whirl pool tub!! Room was non smoking and we could not smell any smoke in or around our room. Cleaning staff was consistent and had rooms cleaned by 2pm every day and did a great job. They were very friendly and even initiated conversations which I can say I have not seen in any other hotel. They supplied us with extra towels when we asked as well. Restaurants Ouch..talk about pricey!! This didn’t both me too much as I had done my research and figured as much. However, if you are looking to have a cheap breakfast in the morning or a light/not so pricey lunch - forget about it. The Café across from Rao’s restaurant for two Tea’s and two breakfast Sandwishes $25. The other restaurants we tried in the hotel were in the Forum Shops. We tried Spago, expensive, food was ok and service was not good at all and I would not recommend. Trevi is Italian and again expensive and ok, food was good but service was just average at best. Had a great steak dinner at Boa’s Steakhouse (3rd floor of Shops). Service was amazing, atmosphere is not stuffy and is perfect for couples. We ordered four drinks, Oyster on the Half Shell, NY Strip, Petite Filet and our dinner was about $200. Well worth it!!
