Cheesecake Factory was nice as well and as you can imagine my wife loved the desserts!! Shopping Forum shops are entertaining but again are very expensive…no deals or sale prices here. Great for people watching. We looked around for fun, but actually did our shopping at the Fashion Show mall and the Vegas Outlet Mall (South end of strip). Location PERFECT – There is no better located hotel on the strip. It is like they started with Caesars and built hotels on either end so it is perfectly placed in the middle. Pool Yes….its under construction but not once did any type of noise bother us and the pool area is still spectacular looking. They supply free towels and we went to the pool at various times of the day ranging from noon to 5pm and always found a good place to sit. Bars/Clubs We did Shadow bar and Pure within Caesars. Shadow Bar is nice and casual and they have topless dancers behind a screen so you can only see their shadow (thus the name)…pretty entertaining, even my wife was amused!! Drinks were pretty pricey but not crazy at about $7 a beer. This is a low key sitdown place and not a place really to meet people or party. Pure was out of this world…I am not much into the club scene these days, but this place was awesome. We purposely went on a Sunday night as Friday and Saturday night there were at least 400 people in line!! Also we went at around 8:30ish and we were given free passes so we didn’t have to pay the crazy cover charge of $60 between the two of us. The club itself is on the roof of Caesars and the view is amazing, the music was also great and the people are hot!! Drinks are the most expensive I saw while in Vegas at $10-$12 a drink. We still had a great time!! Casino I am not much of a gambler at all. I prefer poker with a few friends rather than with strangers at a casino…with that said we really just stuck to the slot machines. The casino itself I found quite smokey and uncomfortable. The min bets are pretty high at this hotel as well for the tables. Slots did not seem to have a huge variety. I did go to other Casino’s on the strip and this is one area I believe that caesars is behind in as Bellagio was much nicer with better servers, more variety and more free drinks  Check-out Very painless as I used the automated TV check-out service….no lines no issues and they let you keep the room keys so you do not have to return those either.

Reviews.Title: “Only Good Thing About Caesars Is The Location!”
Reviews.Author: Leasha
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Caesars as part of our 3 week Honeymoon. Booked with Expedia (who we will never use again) who booked the wrong room direct with the hotel. This is not the first time this has happened. Funny enough the staff tried their selling upgrade to us as many other advisors have mentioned about this hotel. Bascially got put in a room that had views of the hotel car park & kept us up morning & night with the hotel renovations. We actually got put on the floor that was being renovated. In saying that our recently renovated room was lovely & quite large & we didnt complain as we really didnt spend too much time in the hotel room. Caesars is in a great location if you are happy to keep up with the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: vacationhereIcome
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and was greatly displeased. Let me first say that Vegas is not my thing, so perhaps that clouded my opinion some. However, there were some fundamental problems that need to be mentioned. The Rooms: Since we were not paying, we had been booked in the "classic" room by the travel agent used by our district. Just so everyone knows... "classic" means the cheapest and OLDEST room. The bathroom was o.k., but had some problems. It was quite large and was "cleanish". There was a separate shower and tub. The tile in both had a lot of mildew and was kind of gross. There was a little walled area for the toilet. On one of the walls it looked like someone had wiped blood or some kind of bodily fluid - yuck. The sink area was the cleanest part and had marble counter tops with good lighting and a newer sink and faucet. The beds were old and lumpy. There were FILTHY throw pillows and a comforter that didn't appear to have been washed since Caesar's time - Again, weird stuff wiped on the walls around the bed area. The ancient looking velour sofa had miscellaneous stains all over it. Lighting was poor with only three very dim lamps. During the day we could open the drapes for lighting, but at night it was difficult to see much. I think they built the walls with rice paper. Every night (three nights) from 1-3 a.m. we could hear our neighbors as they brought their party to the room. It was as though the party was actually in OUR room. There was yelling, banging on doors, and people coming and going constantly. I know this is Vegas, but I was appalled at the lack of consideration that others had. Some people do come to Vegas for more than just partying and do appreciate sleep. There was also loud thumping from music all night - possibly from the night club?? With all of the smoke from the casinos one would hope to, at least, have some respite while in the privacy of his/her room, but NOT here! We had reserved a non-smoking room. However, smoke was clearly embedded in every fiber of the room and it had that stale ashtray smell. The surrounding rooms must have been smoking rooms because several times we could smell the smoke as it wafted through the walls and under the doors - DISGUSTING! I just don't understand why some hotels think this is acceptable. Smoking rooms should NEVER be on the same floor as non-smoking rooms. The doors to the closet seemed like they were going to fall off of the wall each time we would open them. There was a large hole kicked in the wall too - classy. The safe looked like something from twenty years ago and they charge you to keep your things in it - just ridiculous. Houskeeping: We did not find any major problems with housekeeping. They restocked everything as needed and cleaned/mopped the bathroom floor daily. While they certainly need to do a good scrub down of the shower/tub, wash the bedding tops, and wipe the walls once in a while, they did a pretty thorough job overall with the basic stuff. The Common Areas: The casino is... well, a casino - smoky, dirty, and crowded. The conference areas were all very nice and had clean restrooms with people constantly touching up for cleanliness and restocking needed paper products. The forum shops were great and there were several good places to eat throughout the hotel (Spago, Mesa Grill, Cheesecake Factory, Chinese food by Wolfgang Puck, etc.). The pool area was nice, but the water looked cloudy and dirty. They have pool attendants and towels available for guests. Just note that the area surrounding the pool is under construction, so it is not the most serene of places. The pool closes at 7 p.m. This seems a little early to me, but I'm sure they have their reasons (Drunk people and water - not a good combination?) Checking in/out was fast and easy. They even let us leave our bags in our room past our checkout time until our conference ended. In sum, I was not happy with Caesar's Palace. If you don't mind smoky, dirty, old rooms with paper thin walls and you don't wish to sleep, then stay here in a "classic" room. If you care about fresh air, like to retreat to a clean, quiet room sans other people's left over body fluids, and you treasure a good night's rest, then find someplace else to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: minniemoomoo
Reviews.Content: We went for our 28th anniversary to hear Elton John and decided to stay at Caesars this time. We had a wonderful stay. We upgraded our room when we arrived. We had a great king bed room in the Palace tower overlooking the pool on the 14th floor. We had room service serveral times. It was served promptly, and was delicious each and every time. We also ate in 3 of the restaurants there. Each was very enjoyable. I visited the spa on property. I received a Lomi Lomi treatment and it was exceptional. The spa was nice, clean and the staff was very polite and knowledgeable. We had two complaints, one was the bed was a little hard. The pillows were fabulous, but the bed was a little stiff and hard. Not much cushion there. Also, our visits to the pool were very difficult. The hotel didn't seem to be that crowded, but the pool was overly crowded. All the chaises and chairs were full very early in the morning and many folks left because there wasn't any place to "be". My advise would be to defintely get to the pool early if you plan on enjoying it. Otherwise, our stay was very romantic and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Amanda0803
Reviews.Content: I love staying at Ceasar's! The shopping is great, the pool is beautiful, and you are located in the middle of the strip close to everything. My husband and I travel to Las Vegas once or twice a year, and we stayed at Ceasar's Palace during our last trip. We had a lovely room in the Palace Tower. The room was quite large, and beautifully decorated. I would definitely recomend staying at Ceasar's.

Reviews.Title: “Only way to go”
Reviews.Author: mrolfes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesar's Palace for a long weekend in the Absolut Vodka Pick Your Flavor 4 bedroom suite with a bunch of girlfriends. It was amazing. Can't wait to do it again. The suite is huge, 2 story, Here is a video link for the suite. [--] There are 6 areas- When you walk in the door you are in the Mandarin area. It has a bar, with every flavor of vodka stocked, entry way and bath. Off to the right is the Ruby Red Bedroom. The best in my opinion. The bathroom is amazing, jacuzzi tub, bidet and all. There are 3 closets in the room. All rooms have flat screens and electric blinds with different scences. Each room is also a good size. We had extra cots placed in many of the rooms to fit extra friends. Plenty of room. Of course all the bedrooms have their own baths. To the left is the Vanilla Room. It is the least impressive, but very comfy to stay in. I believe you can rent just this room because there was a door out to the hallway and double doors to lock from the room to the suite. Past this is the Rasberry party area. It is 2 storys, dance floor on the main level, we even had a karaoke machine. Tons of seating, then another bar on the upper level. We referred to this as the VIP lounge. Upstairs there is the Citron room. My least favorite because of the supper bright yellow walls. Other than that, the room is just as nice as the Ruby Red room. Also upstairs is the Peach room. Really fun. Jacuzzi tub right in the room. It looks like the room is water, and the bed is a raft in the middle of the room. I also believe you can rent this room out by itself because of the double doors and exit to the hall. You may also be able to rent out the suite as 2 bedroom. It really was the perfect party pad. The service was amazing. The only negative to the suite was there isn't any comfortable seating. There is lots of seating, but none of it was comfortable. The party was going all day and night, since we had so many people, some went to bed when others were just waking up, but once you closed the bedroom door, you couldn't hear anything. It isn't a cheap place to stay, but we actually spent less money than normal for us in Vegas, because it was like we had our own personel club, no need to leave. If you have a big group, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, But Hotel Has Gone Down Hill A Bit”
Reviews.Author: wwills
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to write a comprehensive review for Caesar's Palace because of two factors: 1) hotels of this size have so much to offer that you cannot participate in everything and 2) you will have a different opinion on Caesar's based on whether you frequent these types or resorts or not. Here's hopefully a balanced review: First,the trip from the airport to the hotel. There are numerous options to get you from the Airport to the hotel, including shuttles, limos, and cab rides. A cab ride will take about 20 mins (depending on traffic) and cost about $20. A limo takes about the same amount of time, but costs around $65. Shuttles run frequently to the hotes, and these will cost you $6 to $8. I chose the shuttle. The shuttle was clean and the driver was nice, however I ended up being the last stop and so the ride took nearly 1.5 hours! My suggestion is to check the order of dropoff and decide then whether a shuttle is in order. Once I arrived at the hotel, it was of course extravagant with Roman statues and gold leaf on the walls. Since this is a casino, all traffic is guided thru the gaming area. So to get from one part of the hotel to the other requires that you walk through the actual casino. Upon entering, I was hit by a wall of cigarette smoke. If you've never been to Vegas, and don't smoke, you're in for a shock. Many of the smoke-free casino areas that were introduced years ago have closed. When you gamble, you will be engulfed in smoke smell, will breathe tons of second hand smoke and your clothes will stink of smoke. Bring a bag to seal your clothes in so that they do not make the rest of your suitcase smell. Also, gamble early in the morning to avoid the strongest smoke. In Caear's case, while standing in the check in (which is near the casino), you begin to be inundated with smoke smell. Note: there are some casino's like the Paris or the Venice that try everything from huge filtration systems to perfume smells to reduce the smoke in the casino. They have varying degrees of success. Construction alert!: the hotel is undergoing massive expansion by adding another tower to the property. Starting at about 9am until late afternoon, you will hear the construction going on. This also overlooks the pool area - which makes it less attractive and cluttered. Try to ask for a room facing the strip so that you do not hear the noise. The line at check-in was long. It took 30 mins to make it to the desk. The desk person was friendly and gave me good directions to my room. The hotel has a number of "towers" located at different corners, connected by the Casino. There are also nice shops and a mall (the Forum) adjscent to the Palace. I was in the Palace Tower, on the 7th floor. There's a walk way over the main road that's easy to use. Most of the roads on the strip now have metal barries that keep people from jay-walking. The room itself is comparable to other Vegas rooms - which means it's fairly large. My room had two full bathrooms and a large shower with two shower heads. There a separate vanity and a Roman Tub (what else?) with jets. Warning - when taking a shower, if you turn on the water full blast, the bathroom floor fills with water. The room itself is in average condition. It was worn in places, the roof in the shower had a large dark water stain, the shower has some mold in it, etc. (see my attached pictures) There's a bidet (sic?) in one of the toilet stalls. There is a desk for your laptop, a sofa couch, table and chair. The King Size bed was comfortable. There's a wetbar absolutely crammed with snacks, champagne, etc. - all of which are expensive, of course. There's a small Sony flatscreen TV with few free channels on it and lots of pay channels. After all, they want you in the Casino and not watching movies in your room! There's an ironing board and a very small safe. I'm used to safes large enough to put a laptop computer in. This safe was about 6 inches by 3 inches by 4 inches (cube). There's tons of closet space. The room has wired and wirelss Internet, but it's $20/day. There is no coffee maker in the room. Room Service was prompt and courteous, the food was reasonably tasty but very expensive. French Onion Soup with Iced Tea cost $31. Three-cup caraffe of coffee with a bowl of cereal, glass of orange juice was $34. The room itself and the hallway did not smell of smoke thankfully. It was very quiet; I couldn't hear anyone around me and surprisingly the halls are quiet at night. You do not get a newspaper each day, nor do you get a printout of your hotel bell the last night; you must get that from the checkout area. There is a Spa, which supposedly includes a fantastic fitness center with virtual cycling and a rock climbing wall. However, this costs $20/day and there's no free mini fitness center. The pool is free, however, but from what I could see, it was fairly crowded with sunbathers (and few swimmers). There are no kids at this hotel. Kids are not allowed near the gambling area and will be asked to "move on" if seen loitering or pausing (even if the parent is doing a quick pull of the slot machine). Plus I don't know if I would want my kid sucking down tons of second hand smoke. One odd thing - the alarm clock is insanely complicated to use. No instructions - so it took me 20 minutes to figure out how to use it - and how to dim it at night. The rooms are not serviced until very late afternoon, so if you leave in the morning in hopes of returning to a fresh room to clean up (from the smoke!) at 2pm, you'll be met with the same mess you left. You can call for a sooner cleanup, and they will clean your room, but in my case it caused confusion and a second maid service showed up, who insisted that the room had not been cleaned (despite me showing her that it had!) The casino staff was friendly and courteous (as expected) and patiently explain the various betting rules. There are many tables with only a $10 minimum. In summary, the hotel was above average. There are just so many newer, nicer resorts in Las Vegas that Caesar's is starting to lose its luster. If you've never been to another Vegas hotel, you'll likely be floored by Caesar's. But if you've been to the Bellagio, the Paris, etc. you'll find it "okay". End Note: I just read the previous review that was posted about a stay around the same time as this stay. Wow! I'm not surprised because you could sort of tell that Caesar's is slowly on the way down hill. I left my laptop in my room (hidden) one day - and thankfully it was not stolen. I'll never do THAT again. Good post, previous poster!

Reviews.Title: “Worst travel experience ever had”
Reviews.Author: GTNGHCHEDNVGS
Reviews.Content: Please be aware that even though Caesars is not in a needy country, the custodial staff find it within their right to help themselves to your personal property when you have left the room. Not only that, but the most intricate measures are put into place to protect the hotel from any liability. I was just recently told (after 3 months of attempting to retrieve my belongings and cash) that I can go (--) myself in almost that exact wording by their insurance company, and that Caesar's is not responsible for their staff behaviour. This amongst many other problems including room reservation issues, cleanliness of the room, the worst customer service I have ever encountered, the poorest response time of any security, constant problems with room service and our key cards to name a few, will ensure I never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Adored it-my favourite Vegas hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HolidayGirl1979
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Caesars several times since 2005 and I find no other hotel quite compares! Water is handed out upon arrival if there is a queue for check in. Stayed in the Petite Suite which is just lovely. Massive bed, double bathroom, huge bath and sofa, couple of desks, table etc. Very luxurious-would love to know what the next suite up is like!) Can't fault it. Lovely lovely pool complex (4 pools in total I think, one of which is 'European bathing' which you have to pay to enter, but the service is top notch and you even get offered Evian facial spray!) all with waitress service and food available. Got married here in 2005, it was so well organised and so stress free, the best thing I have ever done. The photographer was lovely and walking round the complex having pictures taken was a fab experience in itself and having a strawberry daquiri at the Cleopatra bar in my wedding dress was funny-the sweet waiter was scared to death I would spill it down my dress! I think I have stayed here 4 or 5 times and I just love it. My memories of staying here are some of the best I have.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: shawbee99
Reviews.Content: I was here as part of a convention and loved the hotel. I had a beautiful room that looked out over the strip, probably the biggest “standard room” I have ever stayed in. Separate soaking tub, giant flat screens I mean this place had the works. Room service was great and you can walk through the lobby smoking a cigarette if that is your thing. I walked around and only saw probably one other hotel on the strip I would want to stay in so I would definitely recommend Caesars. It did not have the nickel slots type of people many east coasters imagine when thinking of Vegas. The line for Taxis was horrendous though, go down a good 20 minutes before you actually want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar Would Not Be Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: mlcw
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-night stay at Caesars Palace in Las vegas to celebrate my husband's birthday. We understood that the check-in time was between 3 p.m. and 5 p.m. We arrived for check in at 3:30 p.m. and, after waiting in a substantial line, were told no room was available and we would be text-messaged when a room was ready. At 4:40 p.m., no message was received. Called to find out the status and was told our room was, indeed, ready. We never did receive notification via text message to our cell phone. Needless to say, we were quite peeved that no room was ready at 3:30 p.m. and believe that this is unacceptable practice. We have stayed in Vegas numerous times for special occasions or just a quick getaway ... never have we encountered a room not being available by 3:30 p.m. on check-in no matter where we stayed. Also when we checked in I reminded the person that it was my husband's birthday we were celebrating with them. Her response was "what do you plan to do?" That's it! As for the room, once in, one could say it was quite large. Ours was located in the Centurion Tower. However, it was less than impressive. The walls were very bare and it was sparsely decorated. One lamp shade was torn and well worn as were the drapes. The carpets were very thin and badly stained. Although the bathroom was large, it was again unimpressive. There was a significant amount of mold in the shower and in the corners on the floor. Yuk! The toilet ran often and we finally had to call for someone to come and stop it. When people flushed toilets or took showers in other rooms or on other floors, the pipes in the walls were so noisy they woke me up several times during the night! As for food ... stay away from the Agustus Cafe. The service is painfully slow and woefully inadequate. Although someone comes to take your drink order right away, the wait staff responsible for taking your actual food order can take up to 20 minutes to show up and actually take the order. Then it's another 20 minutes before the food actually arrives. I'm not sure whether they have to go to another casino or restaurant for the food or what! The restaurant itself is also horribly overpriced for what you get, but then that seems to be the norm for Vegas nowadays. If you can find another place to get breakfast or a late night snack I suggest you do so. Aside from that our stay was quite pleasant. If you can, take in a meal at Mon Ami Gabi at the Paris hotel ... fabulous as always. Also, Spago's is quite good in the Forum Shop area. This was the first time we stayed at Caesars and I can assure you it will be our last!! We come to Vegas at least 2 times a year, if not more and we will not return to this hotel/casino again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Isn't Even Enough to Describe!!!”
Reviews.Author: SlotPrincess
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond member at Harrah's so I recieved 4 free nights in Palace Tower ONE. It was absolutely beautiful!!! The marble accents, the jacuzzi tub and OUTSTANDING service makes this hotel one of the BEST in Vegas!!! I will definitely stay here again! I highly recommend going to Bobby Flay's MESA GRILL as it was amazing!!! You won't regret one bit of your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “only pick up what you want to pay for!”
Reviews.Author: schoong324
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in LV and saw opening night Cher...stayed at Caesar's. Yes we saw a tiny sign in the fridge that said you will be charged immediately for anything you eat or drink from the minibar but it also includes the food up top on counter. ANYTHING you pick up, including the inspection of the Love Package Box, you are instantaneously billed for. That little item was over $80 even tho we simply took a look at the outside of the box. Don't even move something around to get at the water...you'll be billed in a heartbeat! I did notice when checking out that the pool boy upped his tip from $25 to $150 but the counter person refunded my money. It seems this wasn't the first time someone had mentioned this "error". Bobby Flay's restaurant was great, Cher was fabulous, but you had better have plenty of money along.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was broken in to and robbed while we were sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: 411onCeasarsPalace
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 was staying at Ceasars and while we were sleeping, someone broke in to our room and stole our wallets and purses. Clearly, they are a professional because they went unheard and took the wallet out of the pants of my son. I was actually down getting breakfast and left my wife, son and daughter in the room. This could have turned into a very scary situation. Security came, scoured the hotel and found our items in the trash cans - not sure if it was on our floor (10th) or somewhere else. There were no finger prints taken - they didn't really care about solving this problem. There are no cameras to secure the floor. This enrages me to think they will go to no end to protect their money with cameras and unlimited security, but they do nothing to protect the guests. The hotel manager gave us a $50 comp but didn't comp our stay. It's just really scary to think Ceasar's rooms are not secure and when breached, they really do nothing to investigate the crime.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: DasEFX
Reviews.Content: I love Caesars Palace. The place is amazing. It's not as beautiful as the Belagio or luxurious as Mandalay Bay, but it's close. We stayed in the Augustus tower, which was great! If you tell the cab driver you are staying there, you will get a discount/cab fare waved from the airport. The rooms were HUGE and beautiful! The bathroom had a spa tub which we used quite a bit. It took awhile to fill, but so worth it! Don't use their bathroom products. They were horrible. The shampoo and conditioner were worse than any two-in-one product. The food at Caesars was pretty expensive and poor. The only place I can recommend is the pastry shop. The pool at Caesars was awesome though. They have three pools and plenty of places to sunbath. They do bring drinks to you--the bar is a cash bar. Also, you can sun bath topless if you like. They have a secluded area and they do card which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Construction alert!”
Reviews.Author: burnedin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar's from May 12-15th and I should say at the outset we were comped, otherwise we would have stayed at our very favorite, Bellagio. The good: the rooms in the Augustus Tower were very nice and spacious and our room had a wonderful view of the fountains. I saw the water show about 2-3 times a day. Spectacular! The Palm in the Forum Mall is a wonderful restaurant and we loved it. Also, the Qua Spa is an excellent place to spend time ( although, be warned, you will pay 45 dollars to use all their facilities, but, I think it was worth it!) The so-so: The casino itself has a meandering kind of layout to it and it was hard for me to orient myself at times. I did a lot of walking around that first day! Like a lot of the higher end casinos we found we didn't have alot of luck there and didn't gamble too much. ( We had great luck at Bill's and O'Shea's) The bad: the pool area is under construction and it is right on top of you! Noisy, ugly and not very relaxing. Getting drinks poolside is problematic as well. So, a large part of what we enjoy when we go to Vegas was effectively cut out. We've always found it so wonderful to spend time around a beautiful pool, reading, relaxing and sunning and that was not to be. Also, the chaise lounges were filthy and the towels were in pretty sad shape. Seems like Caesar's needs to refurbish some of the essentials. Overall, an average experience and I seriously doubt we will be back, there are just too many other options.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Bunnye1223
Reviews.Content: Before I chose this hotel, I checked out the comments on Trip Advisor (a source with which I can rely on for the most part) My son was coming to California, and I wanted him to be entertained. I booked this trip for one night through Perfect Escapes. I was told, if available, that I could get early check in (10 a.m. and late check out 4 p.m., and a $25 resort credit. Well I arrived at the hotel about 3:45 p.m. and was told that i would be put in one of their Classic roman rooms. (That didn't work for me) Then I was told for $180 upgrade I could be at the Palace Towers. I told them I booked a room and it indicated that it would be in one of the refurbished towers. The hotel staff made a phone call, and the $180 upgrade was waived. The room was beautiful, however, there was dust on the mini bar furniture. In addition, I booked the room for 3 adults and said I needed an extra bed, but it never did come, so my poor son had to sleep on the floor. The other thing is that the pool area closes around 5 p.m. and there is major construction going on, which is a noise nuisance and an eye sore. So, all in all my son was happy with the stay, I of course could have used more luxury and refinement, but all in all a decent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Opulence and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Kavya
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Caesar's over the weekend after I attended a conference in Las Vegas. We loved it. Our Forum Tower room was large, with a very comfortable king size bed and a jacuzzi (despite the website saying we'd only get double shower heads). The furnishings are very stylish and we had a great view from the 23rd floor over the pool and across Las Vegas. We paid $US300 a night on average for our stay. We had a fabulous meal in one of the hotel's restaurants, 808, and boogied the night away in Pure nightclub after seeing the Las Vegas Pussycat Dolls. The location of the hotel is unbelievably good and they have a very extensive selection of shows and shops. Service was fantastic - they let me check in early and when we forgot to remove the "do not disturb" sign, they came and cleaned our room especially while we ducked out to the pool. The only down side was the construction going on in the grounds next to the pool (a new tower, I think), but we didn't notice any noise and it didn't disturb our enjoyment of the pool or hotel at all. All in all, it was a very fun, stylish and luxurious place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, no issues”
Reviews.Author: joyboy
Reviews.Content: Lots of reviews here so I'll keep it short. Quick and easy checkin, after reading some reviews I was worried about that. We were in the Palace Tower on the ninth floor looking north, great room and room layout. That's up high enough for a good night view, higher would be even better. The Palace tower has the meeting rooms in it so it's very nice if you're there for a convention. Also it's the best for getting to the pool area. I was worried about the size of the place but it's easy enough to get around in and there are signs pointing you in the right direction. Beers - expensive $6 and up. Food expensive. Here's my tips: At the end of the Forum shops, across the street there is a Casino Royal (I think that's it) that has $1 Mich bottles. There are two package stores (that I saw). One across from Caesar's entrance with $16 12-packs (not bad) and another south of Planet Hollywood. Bring a cooler and dollar cost average you beer costs. MESA great food, expensive. Joes Crab house, great food, expensive. Stage Deli (Forum shops) great breakfast and HUGE sandwiches, reasonable. Also great Clam chowder at the Forum food court, reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: bunatexas
Reviews.Content: We went to Caesars for a conference. The wow factor when you come in is amazing and then.....we went up to our excellent hotel room in the Augustus tower. Everything seemed good until we went to the pool the evening after my conference. It was 5:30, the sun was still up and shining bright. Perfect time to chill out. We walked up to the pool boy and he told us that the pool was closing in 20 minutes. WHAT! Sure enough, 20 minutes later a life guard walked up behind our chair, blew the wistle in our ears and screamed "pools closed". Very rude. On Saturday we went there and there were NO CHAIRS at the pool. We had to stalk people for an hour until we got a seat...and then the pool was closing, on a Saturday, at 3 p.m. for a special function. This is crazy. We waited for a while to have dinner at Augustus, and no one came to see us for 20 minutes, finally I went to the front to ask for someone to help us. Our rude waiter asked how we were paying and then didn't come back for another 20 minutes. We left and spent $120 on a meal for 2 people, but we appreciated the service. Caesars was very disappoionting. Still love Vegas, will just never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Tower - Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: lasvegastrip08
Reviews.Content: After reading so many bad reviews about classic rooms at Caesars, we were really anxious to get there and see what we got. I had practiced my lines to get an upgrade at check-in, but, to my surprise, they had our keys ready when we arrived!! (we were a group of 30 traveling together for a convention and our company booked all our rooms and paid for them) We were given a corner room on the 8th floor of Roman Tower and to tell you the truth, I was relieved after walking in: no murphy bed, no mirror over the bed, no dirty linens, no stains on the carpert or bed covers (as other reviewers have complained about), on the contrary, the room was clean, the bathroom appeared newly renovated, we had plenty of room for our luggage, AC worked great and housekeeping did a good job. I do have a few complaints: the room décor was plain and simple, the bed was not very comfortable, no mini-fridge and no guards at the elevators to control who goes up to the rooms. The hotel is so impressive and huge, has plenty of eating options, Forum Shops are great and next door and the location on the Strip is unbeatable. We didn’t gamble so no comments about the casino. Bottom line, classic rooms at Caesars may not be the best for honeymooners and for those looking for luxurious accommodations and great views, but if you want to stay at the most colossal and famous hotel in the middle of the Strip, you can save the extra money and book the cheaper rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Chinese New Year”
Reviews.Author: peacefultravelers
Reviews.Content: We went for a conference held at Caesars Palace and it also happened to be Chinese New Year. The location is great; we enjoyed the proximity to shops that one can find in major cities like NY, Paris, etc. The food was excellent at the restaurants in the hotel, but we also recommend sampling the restaurants in the surrounding hotels. Also, Caesars is within walking distance to Bellagio where we saw "O" by Cirque de Soleil. The main drawback we found to our hotel was that the cigarette smoke was toxic in the lobby and walking through any public area indoors. However, our room was on a non-smoking floor and was very quiet, so that was nice. The room itself was very comfortable, quiet and clean. It was a good hotel to attend for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Chicagokris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with a convention my husband attended. I was not that anxious to be staying here as I thought the property would be way too large for my liking, but I found it to be very manageable. Our room was in The Palace Tower and was quite nice. We were only on the 11th floor and had a terrible view, but the room itself was large, the bathroom was very nice and the bed was very comfy. One of the nicest hotel beds I've ever had. I liked the Palace Tower as the elevators left you off right in front of the doors to the pool area. Which as others have said is under major construction. I didnt let it bother me, though and didnt have a problem finding a lounge in a nice area. But I was out early every day-later in the day may have been more difficult to get a good lounge. THe price of the large drink poolside was $19 for a Pina Colada. Very pricey, but it lasted a long time and was quite tasty! The snack bar at the pool also was quite good. The hamburger here was excellent, and my friend had the grape leaves and thought they were very good. Check in went easily, although we had to wait till after 4 PM to get our room. (This was a Saturday afternoon, though) The hotel itself was easier to navigate then I thought it would be. I did find the casino a little too smokey and didnt see much video poker. I only ate at the buffet here,once for luch and once for breakfast. Both times it was ok. Not out of this world great, but good, decent food and enough of a selection. I would definitley stay here again, but only in the Palace Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Wedding”
Reviews.Author: LeePee24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Caesars Palace for 5 nights in April and we had our wedding there in the Venus Garden, it was fantastic! The hotel is huge and we loved it! Our room in the Augustus Tower had a great view over the Bellagio fountains. We had our wedding meal at Nero's and all I can say is wow! The steak was sublime! The whole meal was a delight. Go and see the Cirque Du Soleil Beatles Love show at the Mirage, it was excellent! I have stayed at Wynn and Luxor also, no comparison to Caesars in my opinion, Caesars is what Vegas is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Ok !!! Just ok !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tumbum
Reviews.Content: I expected alot from Ceasers but they just did not deliver !!!! Maybe I expected too Much ! I have to say check in went ok I did the 20 trick and he said he upgraded us but I dont really think it was an upgrade ( at least it was good service ) plus when I looked at my bill it seemed like i was overcharged but i had nothing to prove my rate so i am calling them as I am typing... Ok the good first - Mesa Grill ( the burger really is worth 15 bucks !! Good !!! Breakfast brunch buffet very good ( try the peanut butter cookies ) !!!! Room Service - food was sub par !!! why does everyhotel burn your breakfast potatoes ???? Maid Service- left us alone so good ! Room -2760 Agustus luxury suite very Nice and clean ( see pics ) Now the bad !!!!! Expensive WOW WOW WOW Everything is getting to expensive ! When we got there I ordered a bud light and a margarita at the bar and I think it was $22 with a $2 dollar tip ! I dont know the break down but I think the beer was $8.00 and the Margarita $12.00 I think this is a bit over the top caesers !!! You are not hurting for money can we at least get a 5 dollar beer ??? This continued throught the entire strip ( not just caesers ) and really annoyed me these casinos just cant get enough of our money !! At some point it makes the trip less enjoyable ! THE TABLES at ceasers !!!! WAY TO HIGH LIMIT ----- If you are not brining $10,000 or more dont expect to gamble here . The minimum Craps at night is like$50 dollars so if you have a passline , backup pass and cover the numbers you have got like $300 on the table every second . unless you are hitting points all night long your losing about 1800 and hour ! we gambled at Ballys and Planet ! I found the same thing in blackjack and three card poker ! It was just to high for us and we usually play $10 to $25 dollar tables . If you are going to put $300 on a table you need a host ! Roulette was a $10 minumium at some times but who wants to play that boring game all night ! Venus pool - would not let us in ! the dorky doorman checked me and my wifes id asked us if we wanted a cabana or couch ( which range from $600 to $1500 dollars ) . We said we would just like a seat and he then said they were all full for the day ! I could see they were not full from where I was standing ! And if they were full why did he make us wait in line and why did he check our id ... We were only going to venus for seting and music not nudity . I live in miami I can go to south beach if I want nudity . Seemed like just a money scam ! We then went to the regular pool and it was way to crowded . probably because they want money for the venus pool so everyone goes to regular pool ! Tip to Caesers if your ging to have a hotel with 5000 rooms dont have a pool with 500 chairs ! other than that the pool was good - I got into a showdown with the towel girl because she said that we were only allowed one towel per person and because I went to get both and only had one hotel key i could not have 2 . I Just kindly said to her "would you like me to walk all the way back to get my wife and have her walk all the way back over here and get one towel " for some reason she saw it my way ! I sugest ordering the emporers punch it is very good Visit from April 23rd 2008 - April 27 2008!!

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower, Caesar's Palace”
Reviews.Author: Linda K
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at Caesar's Palace. The Augustus Tower rooms are more spacious than the Palace Tower & have a flat screen TV in the bathroom. The beds were very comfortable, but don't touch the mini bar unless you want to pay. Also there is a charge for local phone calls. The location of Caesar's (middle area of the strip) is a big reason we stay there. (However, there is currently construction on a new bldg. near the pool area. The construction was never a bother to us. The work stopped about 2pm. daily.) Caesar's is directly across from the Flamingo & Ballys and next to the Bellagio and the Mirage. We were able to get show tickets from the casino host for Rita Rudner at Harrahs (including a meet & greet) and for Jubilee at Ballys. We enjoyed both, but Jubillee was a better deal considering a 2 for 1 ticket price of $90. (My husband's comp. pts. covered both-he's the gambler.) The shopping is great with new areas opening all the time. I enjoyed the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood. Food choices are everywhere and so are the prices. We enjoyed Cheescake Factory and Spagos (Wolfgang Puck) in the Forum Shops area. The Bellagio Buffet is very good ($14.95 breakfast). The Cypress Street food court is very nice for a meal on location at Caesar's. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace - Pool area update”
Reviews.Author: DPenkala
Reviews.Content: Once again, another great stay at C. Palace in the Augustus Tower!!! You just can't beat it!!! The weekend I was there was perfect for laying out by the pool area, which is now pretty small because of the new tower being built. The Neptune Bar is gone as well as the cabana area and an additional pool that was located in the now construction area. For the summer, I guess we'll have to deal with the dust, noise and crammed pool area, but I was told by one of the waitresses, that the pool area is expanding and that 3 additional pools are in the works. She did not have a time frame as to when all the work would be completed, but she did sound excited about how nice everything is going to be once finished. She also mentioned that a temp. bar is going to be constructed so they (the waitresses) didnt have to go such a long way for drinks. I hope everything goes quickly and smoothly during the tower/pool construction...summer months are going to be here soon and the Caesers Palace pool is a great place to get some sun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be!”
Reviews.Author: LAgirl76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early April and couldn't have been more disappointed with the place. On walking through the lobby on arrival you do think that you have walked into some kind of palace but once you get into your room it is another story. On checking in we was offered an upgrade of $60 to stay in the new part with a view of the strip. Unfortunately we didn't take it as we were only there for 3 nights. We were allocated a room in the Centurion Tower and on arriving in it you wouldn't have believed it was the same hotel. It was absolutely disgusting. The view out of the window was another of the hotel's tower block - it was that close that when you looked out of the window you couldn't even see the sky. I decided to go back down to reception and see if we could get that upgrade that we had previously been offered. Asked at reception if we could pay the extra to be upgraded and was told that this had now gone up to $120 and it wouldn't be with any kind of view. When i said that we had only been offered the original upgrade 5-10 minutes ago, the Receptionist said it must have gone!!!!!! Totally disappointed we went back to the room and on further inspection of the room it was worse then originally thought. There were stains on the furniture e.g chair, footstall and sofa and on the carpet. Luckily we were hardly in the room and didn't spend much time in the hotel at all, but i definately won't be staying there again if i do go back to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you have the $$$”
Reviews.Author: jasonc0604
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed here for 3 nights in late April 2007 and it was our first trip to Vegas. Thankfully our rooms were free as they were given to us as they had free rooms comped and had to use them. This is a fabulous hotel that is just brimming with Vegas history. We stayed in a standard Palace Tower room on the 7th floor facing the north. We had a great view to the left of the western mountains and a great view back toward The Mirage, TI, The Venetian and The Wynn. Everything about the room says comfort, the beds were some of the softest hotel beds I have ever slept on and even though we didn't get much sleep we would wake up feeling refreshed every morning and ready to go. I absolutely loved the look and feel of the room and it's "modern" decor. The only drawbacks were that the minimums at the table games were way above my range and the slot machines were a little too tight for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Eugie1981
Reviews.Content: I checked in Caesars for a 3 night stay due to a convention being held there. The room I had in the Palace Tower was beautiful. It overlooked the strip and had been completely updated. The staff was always cleaning and the property was kept up beautifully. Having access to such a great casino and the Forum Shops was great. I didn't enjoy the pool area for extended periods of time, but it was gorgeous. The bathroom was beyond luxurious and the spa tub was a nice and relaxing after a lot of walking. Check-in and Check-Out went perfectly and the staff was extremely helpful. The only negative was the buffet was not very good. However, the food court in the casino and all of the restaurants in the Forum were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome To The Good Life”
Reviews.Author: BIGNasty321
Reviews.Content: First of all, thanks to everyone who wrote a review prior to mine. Those reviews helped me once I got to Caesars. I requested the Augustus Tower as others have suggested in their reviews. Yes, it did cost me an additional $80 per day, but it was well worth it. The room was huge and the view was to die for. We didn't have many of the problems that others have encountered while staying at Caesars. The found the staff very pleasant. Check-in was a breeze, maid service was nice, and the amenities were great. Here are my knocks on Caesars: $25 Charge to use the gym $14 Charge for internet use $$$ Charge for local cals

Reviews.Title: “good location, great pool, but check the nonsmoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: docneneng
Reviews.Content: i stayed here last month during a conference at this hotel in las vegas. we got a block of rooms at the older section of the hotel so the "nonsmoking rooms" were probably previously smoking rooms and unless you are pretty sensitive with smell, it is hard to detect. our luggage and clothes reeked of tobacco smoke the next day. otherwise, the location of the hotel is pretty good because it is in the middle of the strip and walking distance to the nicer hotels (bellagio, wynn) and the fashion show mall and planet hollywood shops. dont miss out on the pool too. really nice landscaping and layout.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: GRGT96
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Augustus Tower. Our room was huge...sitting area, plasma tv, huge bathroom - all marble, great view of the Bellagio fountains. It was a great experience. The location of the hotel is perfect, I really enjoyed the sports book area, the casino itself was also very nice. The Forums Shops were all ver nice as was the Trevi restuarant in the middle of the shopping area, next to the huge Roman gods fountain.

Reviews.Title: “good but needs more attention”
Reviews.Author: TCWOZ
Reviews.Content: I have long wanted to stay at the famed hotel and it was great to be a part of it. The good things are nice, large rooms and good bathrooms, plus if you shop at the Forum its so easy to run your purchases up to your room rather than lug them around town. The casino is one of the more smoky ones (maybe because its busy, MGM is also quite smoky). The bad - major construction right beside the beautiful pools completely ruins this area, the noise, the workmen and of course no mention of this prior to arrival. Disappointing! Housekeeping is way below standard with average quality sheets that did not quite fit the Kind bed. One night there was a gap of at least 4 inches from the sheet to the end of the bed and the underlayer is rough and scratchy. terrible. No robes, no mini bar and no replacement water in the room. The attention to detail by this department is poor. TVs are the big old style and not in line with the newer hotels in this price category. It was good but not great. The Spa QUA however is stunning, one of the best I have ever been to. Spacious, luxurious and good attention to all areas except the main lounge where there is too much talking! Mroe space and chairs here would work better but overall, exceptional facilities in the spa - treat yourself to this spa and they will make you feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wendyjo98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars from April 6-8, 2008. Booking through Expedia, we paid for the classic room rate but the special included a deluxe room upgrade at time of check-in to be in one of the towers. We have stayed at many different hotels in Vegas since we have gone to Vegas at least once a year most of our lives. I had heard about the fact that some rooms are in need of redecorating but our room in the Palace tower on the 25th floor was absolutely beautiful. New modern decor with 42" LCD TV. The bathroom was beautiful with jacuzzi bathtub and large walk-in shower. Double sinks with separate toilet room (with a phone). The lobby was pretty empty when we checked in late Sunday afternoon (which was nice). The staff was courteous. The only thing I wish I would have researched was the fact that construction IS going on there. We didn't hear any noise at all on Sunday, but by Monday morning, we woke up to pounding and jackhammer type hoises above our heads. Not a nice thing when you want to sleep in from being up late the night before. Our room overlooked the pools and we could see that a new tower is being built on the other side, but it sounded like work was being done on the floor above us. As we left to go home, we could see crane type things on the roof. Niiiice. We didn't spend much time in the room after that until we came back to get ready to go to Phantom. More noises the next morning. The only problem was with one of the sinks in the bathroom. I couldn't turn on the cold water faucet. It just spun around and round. Makes you wonder why the maid didn't notice this when she was cleaning the bathroom? I finally spun it around counter-clockwise and got it to tighten up. But every so often, you'd turn on the water and then couldn't turn it off.......it would just start spinning around again. Later that night I could hear the drain making a glub-glub noise. Finally the water wouldn't drain out. So this was on the last night of our stay. I'm sure if I would have called, they would have fixed it, but since there was another sink to use and I really didn't want them to come in while we were relaxing, I left a note when we left *LOL*. While it is beautiful, we felt it was just a bit too large. Some of these hotels get to be a bit too big. I stayed there probably 15 years ago when they had not expanded so much and it was just right back then. Yes there are a lot of shops to go in, but most of them are a bit "uppity". If that is your thing, it will be great for you. While it is beautiful and the rooms were VERY comfortable (nice beds and bedding in our tower and room anyway), we will probably stay somewhere not so big next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel; Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: wanderlusting5
Reviews.Content: After reading several of the reviews on this website, I became a little anxious for my trip because I wanted it to be a positively memorable trip, rather than negatively. I was more than pleasantly surprised that my fears were in vain once I arrived at the hotel. Everything from the lobby, to the casino, to the rooms, to the pool was gorgeous! The hotel is HUGE... and I believe that to be an understatement. I could have spent my whole trip in the hotel and not been disappointed by the amount of things to do and see. On to the rooms. Our room was located in the Palace Tower, which was quite a walk from the main entrances, but it was worth it. Plus it was directly in front of the pool so we didn't have to walk through the hotel/casino in our swimsuits! We stayed on the 17th floor and had a great view of the pool area. Our rooms were good sized with plenty of room to move around and not feel cramped. The bathroom was very large with a separate room for the lou. The shower and the tub were separated and we had a jaccuzzi tub (which was awesome) and a double sink in the bathroom (that came majorly in handy). The beds were very comfortable from the mattress to the pillows and bedding. Everything about the room was clean, minus the floor could have used another vacuuming. I was overall very pleased with the room. The pool. AMAZING... I think that's the word to describe it. It was magnificently beautiful with all of the Romanesque statues and columns. The wait staff was very friendly and the pool grounds and pool itself was very clean. We went to the pool around 10 each morning and there were very few to no children in the pool, so it stayed pretty quiet. The pool snack shop "Snackus Maximus" was reasonably priced and included a wide variety of foods for different palates. The only bad thing about the pool was the fact that the hotel is building another tower and you can watch the construction from the pool (and hear it). But that did not deter us from enjoying the pool to the maximum. The hotel/casino: Everything about the hotel was very well planned and executed. The facilities were very clean and the service was friendly and helpful. The casino off of the lobby was small in comparison to some of the other hotels, but if you were fortunate enough to explore the entirety of the hotel, there was another casino that was much larger and nicer toward the Forum Shops (which were impeccable). The restaurants in the casino were very nice and there was a wide variety. We ate at Bobby Flay's Mesa Grille and was very pleased. The club PURE that was in the casino was very pretty, but very small compared to the others. If you were on the VIP list (which we definitely were) it was worth it, but if not there are others to check out. (I suggest Tryst in the Wynn and The Bank in the Bellagio) Over all it was a great trip and I would definitely stay there again, if there weren't so many other hotels to try out!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Ceasar's...except at the Blackjack table”
Reviews.Author: KJR0711
Reviews.Content: I had a conference in Las Vegas and brought my wife along. We were early checking in and apparently the front desk attendant was dealing with really miserable people all day. We were understanding and polite when told our room wasn't ready and said we'd come back in an hour...she stopped us and said she thought she could find something. When we got to the room, it was a suite! Moral of the story: good things happen when you're nice to the desk clerk! Our stay was great. The room was terrific, the staff was friendly, my wife spent most of the time at the pool, and there is SO much to do you can't fit it into a 5 days trip. The only negative is that they charge you $25 if you want to use the fitness center. Obviously, the casino is the big draw, but the restaurants are great: Mesa Grill for dinner and Payard for breakfast were our favorites. The Forum shops range in "class" from the highest-end designers to fake purse vendors...you will certainly find something that interests you there. We had a great time at Ceasar's and highly recommend it to any visitors to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls get away”
Reviews.Author: BCSimplylaura
Reviews.Content: Went with 5 girlfriends and had a blast. We had all stayed at luxury hotels in the area such as the Wynn and liked the ambiance of C.P. much better. The spa is unbelievable, one of the best if Vegas. We booked a standard room with Expedia. If upgrades are available, they give them to you because you book through Expedia. We got an upgrade to the Agusta tower room and it was heavenly. I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: MPLSKevin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days around St. Patrick's Day. The hotel is ideally situation, right in the heart of the strip. The room was reasonably priced, for Las Vegas. But, the hotel felt a little run down. There was a hole in bathroom wall, where the handle of the door had broken it... There were burned out lights in the elevators and the hallway leading to my room. The bed was stiff. Nothing terrible mind you, but not really a luxury experience. And, there was an additional $25 per day fee to use the exercise room, which seemed excessive...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic luxury experience”
Reviews.Author: Roger-Jen
Reviews.Content: Booked room directly with the hotel over the net , price for 3 nights was $760 at that time. We kept an eye on the price, eventually paid only $140 per night for 3 nights, the phone staff quite happily reduced the price on our booking when I phoned, easy to deal with. Checked in early around 1pm, no problem. Offered an upgrade for $100 per night but didn't take it. After some friendly conversation got a free upgrade to Palace Tower, fabulous room and bathroom with spa bath, lots of space, king bed, non smoking as requested, nice and clean. Received A1 service throughout the hotel during our stay from housemaids, barmen, waiters, front desk and bellhops, everyone was helpful and friendly. Went to Bette Midlers opening night and it was a great concert in a great venue. The hotel and Forum shops are a wonderful experience in luxury and opulence. The whole place lives up to it's name and we had a fabulous stay there. It is right in the centre of the strip, a top location. We would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I was expecting, but not terrible by any standards.”
Reviews.Author: Maizie3213
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew out with 2 other couples for our annual Vegas Vacation. Check in was a breeze, and we did get an upgrade from a classic room to a deluxe room in the Palace Tower. The room was very modern, but showing some signs of wear and tear. There was a large stain on the carpet, and peeling paint in the bathroom. The bathroom was excellent, a private toilet, separate shower and jacuzzi tub. The tub leaked water through the wall and onto the bedroom carpet. The bedding was very very comfortable, Housekeeping wasn't up to the standard I was expecting. Once they didn't replace the tissues, another time they didn't bring fresh towels. One day, they didn't come at all. When we returned to the room before dinner to shower, we discovered that there were no fresh towels. We called the housekeeping dispatch, who did send up several towels within 10 minutes, however the woman on the line didn't know why our room wasn't cleaned that day. They offered to come up later that evening, but we declined since we already had our showers. I did go to the pool several times and enjoyed every minute of it, even though there was a lot of construction in the pool area. We enjoyed our stay, but think that next year we will try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: WhereToNext01
Reviews.Content: Arriving late in the evening, check-in was a breeze. There was no line, the desk staff and all other staff we encountered was courteous, and we received two for one show tickets for a show of our choice. The room was ready, clean, and incredibly comfortable. The king bed was the BEST bed I have ever slept in. The bathroom was indulgent with a two person whirlpool tub, separate shower, and it was marble-based. Plenty of clean towels were supplied daily. Our view from the Palace Tower was a quiet one of the the mountains, but we spent enough time on the strip that we did not care. The maid was thorough every day making sure everything was clean and in it's place. We wanted for nothing while in the hotel. The casino and Forum Shops kept us busy and a bit turned-around...this is a small city unto itself. The dealers at the tables had great personalities and enjoyed their work...it made losing money more fun! The Stage Deli in the Forum Shops was great for breakfast and lunch options : great portions, reasonable prices, and great service! Try the cheesecake! Be sure to take the Deuce (24 hour double decker bus): don't pay for taxis. $5 for a 24 hour pass is well worth the wait you experience sometimes. The pass allows connection to east-west buses as well as running to downtown and all along the Strip with stops in front of the major hotels. The best buffet had to have been at the Bellagio...a bit pricey, but totally worth it. Need souvenirs? Head to the little shops north of the Sahara. The best prices and plenty of selections...not just based on one hotel. $1 for 4 postcards, $10 tshirts...can't go wrong. 3 days was not long enough. We cant' wait to go back. We'll be staying at Caesar's again!.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: surferchik
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Caesar's palace recently. I was attending a medical conference while they came along for shopping and fun. The good things about this hotel were the prime location on the strip, and excellent service. Everyone was friendly, from the front desk, to the sales clerks at the stores and business center. Our room was quite clean. It was a good size, and the bed was comfortable. Pool was beautiful, and not very crowded (it was too cold for swimming). Nice palm trees and sculptures. Facilities at the conference were fantastic; good food and coffee, plenty of bathrooms, nice display area, ample seating and tables, good lighting and tech support. Downsides: everything smelled like smoke, including the casino, and the hallways in our tower. Our room was a non smoking room but still had reeked of cigarettes. I think we were staying in the older part of the hotel (centurion tower). There was a shabby red velvet couch that probably retained the cigarette smell. The walls were very thin and I could hear toilets flushing and people showering on either side of my bathroom as well as other activities. There were doors slamming open and closed all night, and people yelling up and down the hallway. in the middle of the night (probably drunk). Every single night! On thursday night there was a live band playing somewhere and although I was on floor 31 (actually it was probably the fifth floor or so) and wearing earplugs it was still so loud I couldn't sleep. I complained and the music stopped shortly afterwards but this was probably a coincidence. I had been offered an upgraded room at the time of check in and this would have cost an extra $80 a day. I refused at the time but iin retrospect this might have been a good idea. Even with the conference rate I was still paying over $200 a night but the room certainly was not worth it. One of my colleagues who arrived later to the conference was upgraded (initially he was told to pay the $80, but then given the room for the same conference rate as there were no more of our oom type available). He was put in the augustus tower and said this was much nicer, didn't smell of smoke, and he had a flat screen tv. Nor did he notice any loud music or slamming doors. The other downside of this hotel is that there was not wireless internet access. It cost $11 a day to have internet access in the rooms and I had forgotten my laptop so I used the computers in the business center which is only open till 6 pm on weekdays and charges about $1 a minute for internet, which is a bit ridiculous. There was some fellow who wanted to send an urgent fax to europe and was told it would cost $12! There is no internet cafe nearby although i saw one about four hotels down on the strip near the hawaiian marketplace (past planet hollywood). It probably would have been a good idea to go there instead, if you have the time and don't mind walking a few blocks. Needless to say, I will not be staying at this hotel again. It would be fine if you were going to have a wild party weekend and didn't care if you were going to get sleep or not. This was a substandard hotel for conference or business travel and certainly not a four star hotel in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: pruske25
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at a luxurious hotel & that is what we got & more. We were celebrating the big 50 for me & our 15th wedding anniversary. I can't recommend Caesars enough. It is a huge hotel & casino but that is what I loved about it. There were so many great choices in where to eat. The forum to do some great shopping. They have 4 magnificent pools that makes you feel like you are in the tropics. The adult pool is also fantastic & very relaxing, huh I wish I was there now. Speaking of relaxing, you must do the SPA QUA Baths at Caesars, there SPA is out of this world & mix with a little luxury & I feel this is an absolute must do. Now for the rooms, our room was spotless, tastefully furnished, so quiet, & very spacious. The sitting area was very roomy with a great view of the strip. A huge closet with a light, robes & slippers. The bathroom was huge, it was like having 2 bathrooms since you have a private toilet area & a way from the vanity area, huge jacuzzi & stand alone shower. The bathroom amenities were superb & along with the TV in the bathroom. The rooms & hotel were so lovely that we had to drag ourselves away to go on the strip & couldn't wait to get back to the peace & tranquility of our luxurious room. The staff was so friendly, very helpful, & always had a smile on their face. The service at this hotel is incredible, we will definitely be back & I had what I wanted for this special occasion. It was absolutely magnificent & so luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace - a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue5409
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace for 10 nights at the beginning of March. I've never been to Vegas before, but my partner had, he choose this hotel as it has a central location. Upon arrival we checked straight in (they even opened up a new check in desk so we didn't have to wait) we were upgraded to a fabulous room in the Augustus Tower on the 44th Floor overlooking the Bellagio fountains which was amazing. The room was excellent, very clean and the huge spa bath and TV in the bathroom were pure bliss! I can't recommend Caesars enough; we didn't really do too much gambling, but enjoy a little go on the slots. The forum shops were excellent and there was a fantastic deli that we enjoyed eating at. We took a taxi out to the two outlet centres (one by McCarran Airport the other near Fremont Street) which were excellent and we go lots of bargains. I would also recommend visiting Fremont Street the light show was excellent. I loved Vegas so much I can't wait to go back and highly recommend Caesars because it is such a fantastic hotel coupled with its central location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Favorable”
Reviews.Author: EMA375
Reviews.Content: My husband found us a great deal at Caesars Palace and booked immediately. Our weekend stay was fantastic! I can't remember what tower we stayed in, but our room was highly favorable. The room was large, spotless, quiet, tastefully furnished, exceptional view of the strip and substantial sized bathroom. We had one minor problem which was fixed within 15 minutes. Incredible service for an immense hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: laurapok
Reviews.Content: First time visit to Las Vegas. Got a good deal thru Travelocity with free upgrade on check in. Had a great room in the Augustus Tower. Large, clean, fab bathroom with jacuzzi and huge shower. 2 flat screen TV's, decent strip view. And it was quiet! Two minor issues in the room that were handled immediately. It was amazing that the service could be so attentive in such a mammoth place. That really is the only drawback, the place is ginormous! But so beautiful and the location was superb. We had an amazing time at Caesar's and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Deluxe Room”
Reviews.Author: jmpg
Reviews.Content: Two forty something parents and 17 year old daughter stayed in a "deluxe Palace Tower" room on the 5th floor. It was a large room with two queen beds and a view of the roof. The view didn't take away from the fab room. Room had mini bar and flat screen tv with some nice cabinetry The bathroom area was HUGE and included nice toiletries and was very pretty. There are two separate areas separated by a walk in double shower that connects the bathrooms. One bathroom has a vanity area and a toilet. The other bathroom has that and a bidet and jetted tub. The only thing about the bathroom set up is that if you are sharing the room with anybody other than close family members the shower layout may be a problem. The shower is part of both rooms and has glass doors and that makes the shower and bath not private. We would book this room again in a heartbeat. Casino was okay and one of the bars we stopped in had terrible service. (Hey, $15 drinks deserve better!) The sportsbook area was really nice. Food court area was better than average.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: billiverstravels
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in at least eight other hotels in Las Vegas and, after my second stay at Caesars, I can definitely say it is my favorite casino hotel. We stayed in the Augustus tower. I think that is the newest one. The rooms are exactly what I look for: quiet, spotlessly clean (don't you hate those hotels where you don't feel comfortable to sit on any piece of furniture?), tastefully furnished, a beautifully tiled, large bathroom with separate w.c. and a great shower (I want that shower head!!!); a terrific bed with soft sheets with no tears, spots, and tatters, thank you, fluffy towels in the bathroom with no hint of weird smells, a flat screen TV with a good range of pay programs, and a terrific view of the Strip. The only bad mark was a slightly long wait for the luggage to get to the room. Caesars Palace is perfectly centered on the busiest part of the Vegas Strip. Even if you want to go to Mandalay Bay, you can walk just across the street to the monorail at Bally's or Harrah's. The restaurant selection is great. I liked my meal at 808 Pacific Seafood best (6 appetizer taster to start, scallops for the 'main'). The flight of 3 sakes started the evening just right. Guy Savoy is truly top notch and has my highest marks for impeccable service and many amazingly flavourful dishes, but, unfortunately, I cannot recommend the Dégustation Menu, "an epic culinary journey spanning ten amazing courses". There were too many rich courses. It was amazing for the first 5 courses, but then became overwhelming. I wish we had had the TGV Menu which would have been more reasonable. You don't want to overdo a good thing like the cuisine of Guy Savoy. I'd love to go back for an evening of less excess. We did not get to the buffet, but we heard it was terrific. The cafe off the lobby of the Augustus tower has a great Club sandwich. For gamblers, Caesars is part of Harrahs group with about 7 or 8 other Vegas casinos, so you can wander and still build up those comps. The casino is hard to beat. It is such a contrast to the casinos where you have to wonder when they last vacuumed or how many decades it was since they last changed their carpeting (like Treasure Island). No such concerns with Caesars. It is a huge casino (2 actually), so you can spend a lot of time checking out all the different areas. The Forum Shops are a shoppers wonderland. I just realized I sound like a paid reviewer for Caesars. Sorry. I just really enjoyed it. Oh, and I almost forgot the pools! In a word "beautiful".

Reviews.Title: “very nice an classy”
Reviews.Author: vacationchicky
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and classy. Caesars Palace is in an excellent location in the middle of the strip. It has a grand pool, nice forum shops and night clubs (Pure is awesome). The hotel staff and concierge were warm and very helpful. The restaurants inside were were very tasty and affordable. This hotel is definitely worth the price and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hail Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: Scruffy50
Reviews.Content: Our recent visit in Las Vegas was made even better with our stay at Caesars. The service was impeccable and prompt. Room service was delicious everytime! And the staff was friendly. The room was extremely comfortable and the bathroom....to die for! Bottom line, we were treated like kings (or queens). Thank you Caesars!

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: brentford
Reviews.Content: what bcan i say. I looked at some of the other reviews and thought what the hell am i going to. Well firstly when we arrived we had to wait about 30 seconds to book in, not to long hay. We were given our room with a free up grade in the palace tower, on the 17th floor . When we got in the room which they called small suite it was massive. We had 2 bathrooms 2 loos and a walk in shower. Thw view was overlooking the swimming pools. There is buliding work going on past the pools but this did not bother us. The casinos are just out of this world but I would say that we won more on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday. Lost the rest on other 2 days. The buffet breakfast is great to start the day. We had dinner in the cheescake factory in the forom shops (This you must try). The weather was great about 80 and sunny. Try and get tickets for Dirk Aurther at the Tropicana hotel they are buy one get one fre and the show is a hour but fab.

Reviews.Title: “Split personality”
Reviews.Author: royalgreymini
Reviews.Content: Your experience of Caesars Palace will depend on what tower you wind up in. When I arrived, I declined the offer of a paid upgrade and they put me in the Centurion tower. The bed was terribly hard, with only a thin blanket on it. The mattress pad I requested never arrived. The room had a plush velvet couch that I liked, but otherwise the room was nondescript, with a needlessly large bathroom (what, am I supposed to do gymnastics in there or something??). The biggest problem was that the room was terribly humid. When I turned on the air conditioning to dry out the air, the room got cold. Those were my options: dank or freezing. One of the three elevators serving the Centurion tower had broken down, and then the next day, all three elevators were out of service -- guests were being ferried up and down in a freight elevator. I went down to the front desk and literally begged them to put me in a different tower. Eventually the clerk took pity on me and gave me the one room she said was available in the Palace Tower. It was a "smoking optional" room (huh), and when I got up there, it was clear that the previous occupant had opted to chain-smoke for their entire visit. The smell was dizzying. But other than that, the room was great -- a jacuzzi; bathrobes; an LCD TV (not high-def, unfortunately); and a wonderful bed piled high with a down comforter and fluffy pillows. I slept like a baby for the rest of my stay and soaked in the jacuzzi every night. The floor I stayed on was served by six fast elevators that were actually in service. Other than the smoke smell I actually preferred this room to the room I had at the Bellagio on my previous visit. So, the first room was wretched and the second room was lovely. I wouldn't want to stay at Caesars again unless I could get a room in the Palace or Augustus Tower. The difference was night and day.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, perhaps has the best restaurant”
Reviews.Author: islandhopper21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in December right after Christmas. We stayed in a classic corner room for about $200 a night. 1. Service ranged from poor to great. Room service was very quick and professional. Maid service was a little slow to get to our room. But it was explained to me that they do the rooms that will have new guests first. I can appreciate that. See Restaurants below for more detail. 2. Food was excellent. Again room service food was great. Still arrived warm/hot. Quality was extraordinary for a big strip hotel, any hotel for that matter. Would recommend it at least once. 3. Room was nice, decor was pleasant and fit the theme, bathroom was not a surprise but not a disappointment. If you go to Vegas for a bathroom impression then you'll probably always be disappointed unless staying in one of the suites. We did like the MOEN shower head so much we bought one when we got home. 4. Slots, because we didn't lose any money. 5. Restaurants. We went to Nero's and Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill. We loved the Mesa Grill food and flavors. We liked Nero's but I think we felt we overpaid for the food. Service at Mesa Grill was an 11 out of 10. It was that good. I could go on all day about their food. They have one of the top pastry/desert chefs in the world, the special creation she created for the day we were there was absolutely fabulous.
