I had a steak with yam side dish, both were just to die for. My wife had a cioppino soup, that was tasty as well. Nero's on the other hand was quite different. We wish we had gone to Mesa Grill again after the experience at Nero's. The service at Nero was Zero. They bumbled around us like we were in the way. Our table was off balance so it would rock a little. That's a little weird to be honest. If you pay over $50 for an entree, you would think they could make the table not rock? They had a problem at the end with getting our check so we had to wait another 10 minutes for that. There was a table of 10 that got all the attention of course. Since we were just 2 of us. Bottom line, I give Nero a 5 out of 10. Quality of food was alright, service and experience did not match price. BTW, we almost ate at Wolfgang Puck's restaurant, but didn't like the menu. Yes that's right. Didn't like the menu. So we headed over to Mesa Grill and never regretted it. 6. Shops. We had been through the forum shops before but when you stay at the Caesar's Palace you appreciate them a little more when you can just walk down from your room. I'm curious how the new Hotel next to Venetian will impact Caesar's though. The forum shops still seem to be the place to go. Although we did find some things at Planet Hollywood shops we didn't find at Forum shops. Different crowd too. 7. Location. your feet will thank you. Things that bugged us. 1. The bed. The bed was extremely hard. My wife had a tough first night so I called and asked for another room. They could only offer a mattress pad. This took a couple of more follow up calls but finally got it. However, they didn't have a king size, only a queen or full, I can't remember. I just remember the king turned into a smaller bed from the width of the mattress pad. Shame on Caeser's. 2. View outside from inside. I felt caged in like an animal. There was some decorative bars going across all our windows which was a little distraction, not too bad to make me move once we looked at them from outside. However, I did feel like a monkey in a cage. 3. Casino. There is a lack of different slots and newer ones at that. They need to do something about this. We spent gambling time at Belagio and Venetian. Both feel more upbeat and have better slot variety. And we won at Belagio! Other things to recommend. 1. Wayne Brady Show at Venetian. Not sure how long this was going to be showing but he is A) really talented and B) really entertaining, Oh did I mention he's really talented and entertaining? Paid about $100 a ticket, sat on right side up front. I would recommend sitting in front 15 rows. The very back of the theater looked a little disconnected from the show. I would obviously try and sit center if you can. We still had a good time though. Other things to avoid. 1. Wynn buffett. Overpriced, and overpriced. Quality alright. Didn't impress. We paid $75 for two for their holiday buffett. What a rip off it was. Long line. The chefs looked depressed like they were imprisoned slaves. Are you paying them enough or what's the deal? Sorry Wynn but you won't be getting anymore money from me in your fake Belagio hotel. 2. Summer time. You can walk around a lot easier in the cold than you can in the 100+ heat. There's just no pools open ;-) Bottom line: 1. I would stay at Caesar's Palace again but I would try another tower and room. 2. I will only eat at Mesa Grill for dinner. Sorry Emeril and Wolfgang but Bobby Flay is the man and he picks the best employees. 3. Gamble at Belagio not Caesar's.

Reviews.Title: “Average Las Vegas Big Hotel, ready to find something else”
Reviews.Author: advcardio
Reviews.Content: We ended up moving 3 times, as the first room on the 5th floor had a big dark material stain on the white duvet-yuk (hello.. houskeeping), the second room was already occupied and finally the 3rd room much higher on the 24th floor and was just fine. The beds were comfortable and the room was quiet in the Palace Towers. The showers offered hot strong waterflow along with different settings. The buffett inside the hotel offered quick service and had excellent fruit including very fresh berries- a treat in the middle of winter. The 1 small pool was open but had limited hours. ***Note to anyone who wants to swim, they are going thru major construction around the pool area so it's noisy and flying dirt when the wind picks up. In a nutshell, "been there done that" with this hotel no real "wow" factor here, but slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ray21Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed between 4-10 Feb. Central strip location is spot on. Room: On arrival (about 6pm) check in line was only 10 mins max. The very nice lady on the desk upgraded us to an Augustus tower room for free just by asking if any available. We were located on a smoking floor (room 2793) but no sign of an ashtray and no smell of smoke. Bonus! As we had a corner room we had two hugh windown overlooking the Palms and the Bellagio lake. Bathroom was great, double spa tub, seperate shower, double vanity and LCD TV. Had to have two baths a day it was that good. Warning - Don't pick anything up in the mini bar if you don't want to pay for it. Casino: The casino is big but don't let that put you off. We didn't venture onto the tables but had lots of slot play. The cocktail waitresses are plentyful, just remember if you don't tip they won't be heading in your direction too often. Don't bother signing up for a total reward card if you're not betting big bucks. Comps in ceasares are rubbish. We only tried the Augustus cafe which was OK, nothing to write home about but nice enough. If you fancy a cheap meal I would recommend the Bellagio & Wynn buffets. Sign up for a Wynn red card and you'll earn enought points for 2 buffets in no time. All in all loved the hotel and would go again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “the fantastic caesars palace”
Reviews.Author: ltj4u
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 days at caesars palace 02/2008 and i can only say that the level of service and accomodation would be hard to beat. from the check in clerk to the lounge waitresses to the fabulous restaurant 808, This hotel has their staff at a high level of understanding the meaning service with a smile. I would not even try to find a better place, if there is one.

Reviews.Title: “Check In and Feel Cheated”
Reviews.Author: bottledagua
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to an Augustus Tower room on a relatively high floor. The room was nice, not incredibly big but modern. I have big gripes and felt the hotel stay to be very disappointing. 1. Three words: Roach in oatmeal. -- at breakfast in the Augustus cafe, the 24 hour restaurant off the main lobby area. After alerting the wait staff of the discovery, chef came out and claimed that the red pair of legs was actually a rare herb that happened to fall into the oatmeal. expand and then turn red upon heating. Insulting? just a little. The waitstaff then proceeded to charge me for the meal. I complained and the oatmeal was taken off the bill, however, still charged for rest of the meal. I had to speak with the cusomer service manager of the hotel about the incident and they eventually removed the charge for the meal. Are things that bad these days that the hotel staff would not think to do this for me initially? And as if that wasn't enough... 2. Check in marathon: We arrived late morning and I did not expect to get a room right away. I asked for a paid upgrade in the Augustus tower (smart move) after reading reviews on this site and I was not surprised when the front desk staff told me that the room was not available yet. The staff offered to text me when the room was available which seemed reasonable. 4 hours without a text go by and we approach the same front desk staff member who apologizes, tells us that she "gave our room away" and then assigns us a new room on a higher floor. Would have loved that text message... after a night's stay I can only infer why there is a lag in the room assignment. We came back to our room in the early evening the following day and found our housekeeper was waiitng out in the hallway for about 20 minutes for a manager to assign her to rooms to be cleaned. Seems as if our housekeeper was on time but the middle manager was just someplace else....probably trying to walk the mile and a half it takes to get to rooms on the other side of the property. 3. Upon reaching our room, we call the bellmen for our bags to be delivered. The response on the phone..."this is the first time you called, right?" Enough said. 4. Flakey concierge -- Before we finish speaking to the concierge she is already speaking to the next person in line. This is after they inform us that they charge 5 dollars to print out your boarding pass for your flight the next day. That was not advertised anywhere in the hotel or online (after we paid 18.95 for 24 hours of internet service). The room itself , the only saving grace, was comfortable but it felt lived in. Two light bulbs needed to be replaced, there were personal notes on the desk from the last visitor. The entire stay made me feel like a goat rather than an emperor. customer service non-existent, housekeeping spotty, and the property seems to be too big for the management to do their job appropriately. The hotel reminded me of a bad airline: sure they put a roof over your head for a ridiculous price and then charge you little things here and there for a less than mediocre experience. Honestly, I would not stay here again if someone paid me. I have been to Vegas once before and stayed at the Venetian. If you can afford it, I would go there. If you can't afford it, save your money and go to the Venetian when you can. I felt that this was a 2 or 3 star hotel in a 4 star shell. Had a great time in the city itself but was not happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace--recent stay”
Reviews.Author: cdsyii
Reviews.Content: A staff member and I recently attended a conference at Caesars with our spouses in tow. Having arrived 3 hours late (arrival at 5 pm), we did not need to have the outside bell captain check our bags only to check in unabated 3 minutes later. Our error. Both check in and bell delivery times were very timely. We were lodged in the Palace Tower, which the front desk clerk explained has been renovated and which was convenient to the conference center ($228 per night conference rate). The rooms were OK--no sofa and coffee table, but a chair and footstool to accompany a desk. Flat screen TV's with a built in stocked fridge--lift any beverage from the fridge and incur a room service charge! Large bathrooms wih shower and jacuzzi with uneven housekeeping attention--found someone else's razor left in the shower and the numbers of towels varied. There was a magnifying make-up mirror and a hairdryer, but no coffee pot. Even the Flamingo put coffee makers in their rooms a couple of years ago! And Caesars is the flagship of the Harrah's properties? The restaurants were hard to find--the property is really big and the maps are written in 4 point type. The slot machines were tight and the table dealers were bored. The conference area is most adequate. On a plus side, 54 degree weather in January did reduce the numbers of tourists. I personally prefer the smaller venue of the Flamingo for a stay and gambling at O'Sheas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Vegas Casino Resort”
Reviews.Author: kimkru
Reviews.Content: This is the quintessential old school Vegas casino. The room in the Augustus Tower was fairly new and awesome, bathroom was great!!! The shops and restaurants were great as well. The tables and slots were fun, my only complaint is the table limits are so high!! I prefer a place like the Paris or the Luxor for the down to earth table limits and a more comfortable environment. But if you are looking for some "Ritz" this is a good choice. Would return if I'm traveling with my older relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: smakawhat
Reviews.Content: I luckily was staying here for a conference and wasn't paying for the room. If I was I would have been disappointed. For the amount you pay for a basic room, it's pretty no frills. Clean sure, but few amenities, cruddy pillows for sleeping, no full length mirror, closet in the bathroom??? The hotel is also just too massive. Things aren't layed out the best, and the casino caters to high rollers with high table minimums. Staff were fine and courteous, but I have spent less and gotten more.

Reviews.Title: “Not Much of a Palace”
Reviews.Author: KenVicLee
Reviews.Content: Once upon a time this palace really was a palace. Before the Bellagio, the Venetian and the Wynn, Caesars was considered the premier property on the strip. Even today, on first appearance, you might believe this to be the case. They house the only 3-star Michelin restaurant in town (Guy Savoy), and Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill as well as Bradley Ogden aren't slackers as 2-star Michelin restaurants, but that is not where the problems lie. The problem started with the reception. I had booked on-line using the convention rate of $178.00/night before tax. The young man who greeted us at reception area did a quick up-sell on us to convince us we could, for a modest increase of $50.00 a night, get a far better room in the newest tower, Augustus. Since my wife was with me, I agreed. What apparently this used car salesman.....errr, reception dude, forgot to mention was that the room was on the fifth floor overlooking the construction site of the even newer tower they are in the process of building. And that construction starts at 6:00 am "to minimize the inconvenience for our patrons." After we discovered the problem, my wife said not to make a big deal about it. And I didn't. But I burned for three days thinking that this guy was no better than a barker at the carnival trying to get me to buy three darts for $1.00 to win my girl a teddy bear. The room was over-sized but not a suite. The bathroom was plush with dual sinks, walk-in shower and jacuzzi tub but that stuff is pretty standard nowadays. Yeah, a flat screen TV in the bathroom and a phone in the toilet stall but how did those things overcome the noise and view of the construction site just below, overlooking the 15 Freeway? Thirty years ago, when Caesar's Palace was a palace, I couldn't afford it. But I am betting back then if you booked at Caesar's they treated you like royalty. There is a sense nowadays that the Harrah's corporate mentality on this property is, "If you don't like it, lump it." When my convention comes back to Caesar's next year I will stay at the Rio. Better room, a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: allenha
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Caesars for 3 nights Thurs-Sun and had a great time. We were in the Roman tower. The rooms were not as big as others I had stayed in while in Vegas. I have stayed at the Venetian a couple of times but that was on business so when it is for pleasure I am paying for it. To be honest though my wife and I were only in the room for the 3 hours of sleep we got each night! Rooms were fine the shops and mall area at the hotel were great. Overall it is a great location central to seeing much of the strip and the fountains at Bellagio. While there we saw went to the Improv at Harrahs- well worth it. We also went to the dueling paino bar at Harrahs we didn't find that to be worth it. We had the buffet at Caesers for breakfast each morning and it was great. We also had a great time at Margaritaville across the street too. The tables at Caesars do have higher limits but if you go across the street to the Flamingo or Caesers you can fine $10-$15 tables. We didn't go to the Pussy Cat dolls lounge but if you plan to you should get there early there was always a very long line!

Reviews.Title: “Homeless people urinating”
Reviews.Author: Spoonire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at caesars palace last week to attend a conference taking place there. On the first night of my stay I rounded a corner near Caesars outdoor bar, at the intersection of Las Vegas Blvd. and Flamingo Road, and nearly walked into a homeless man urinating (fortunately he was urinating in the other direction). He then staggered onto the bridge connecting Caesars and the western themed casino on the other side of Las Vegas Blvd. and passed out next to a garbage can. When I reported this to the bartended, he said there was nothing that caesars security could do about him since he had wandered off caesars property (by about 30 feet!!!!!) If I wanted to be around homeless people urinating publicly I'd go to New York or San Francisco. Beyond that service at the property was considerably below par from what I expected. Many of the staff seemed to be have snooty attitudes. Sadly I cannot recommend this hotel property to anyone. That is unless their objective is to encounter homeless people urinating.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied Vegas stay @ Caesars”
Reviews.Author: Guzgui10
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed over at Caesars Palace during the three day national holiday in Las Vegas at Caesars Palace hotel. We chose Caesars Palace because we found a wonderful rate of $150 (average/night). When we arrived the hotel at 9AM, I went to see if the rooms were available but they weren't, but instead the front desk rep had offered us an upgrade for only $75/night to the Deluxe Palace Tower rooms, which we went for...they usually go at $259 avg a night...they were very courteous at front desk, and even told us to just come back at an hour to see if the rooms were ready. They were so generous to give us these two complimentary bar coupons which were useful! We checked into the hotel at 10AM at the Deluxe Palace rooms, and upon the entry, we were stunned...gorgeous room! There were everything we could ask for, from the plsama TV, very comfortable beds, a big bathroom (walk in shower, separate entry to the toilet, big jacuzzi tub), and although the room was a bit far to the casino because it was located away from registration, it was nice to not deal with so much noise. The view of the room wasn't what we expected, but we never requested for a view room so it worked well. The room was clean, and nothin' to complain about. During our stay, it was nice that the location of the hotel was convinient to the Harrahs properities, as well as the Bellagio, and walkin' distance to Wynn, Mirage, TI, and Venetian. The staff at this hotel was wonderful...Although we didn't really dine at the hotel, I'm almost positive that they would have great restaurants. The trip was very short...only 2 nights, 3 days, but it was a very satisfying stay at Caesars and no doubt I will be staying there again. I have always stayed at LV Hilton, Mirage, or Paris but there is no doubt that this hotel is one of the best on the strip. I was very happy with everything from the beginning to the end of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surpised with Caesar's Palace”
Reviews.Author: madubo
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. We stayed in the old part, but this has been renovated, and was extremely comfortable and clean. Check-in was organized, and the location is great. The only drawback is the high minimum stakes at the gambling tables. We went to the other hotels to play blackjack!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: kg145
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to my stay in Caesars but was very disappointed. The room we were given was clean but very outdated - the bed cover came complete with cigarette burns!! I did have some problems when changing rooms while I was there and I have to say the hotel did virtually nothing to help me or answer my concerns. I particularly found security control lacking in any kind of customer relations. After I came home, I wrote to Caesars to voice my concerns and they didn't even grace me with a reply. The only saving grace is that their amenities are fabulous, particularly the forum shops and restaurants but even so, I'd never be tempted to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGXFrance
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean and very beautifully designed in the style of Romans. The staff is very efficient and helpful. The hotel's territory is huge, so you can find lots of things to do...casino, shopping, restaurants and shows etc.

Reviews.Title: “Big Room, Big Breakfasts - BIG Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globbo
Reviews.Content: In town for a wedding, we booked a classic room at the AAA rate and were upgraded at check in to a larger room in the newer Palace Tower. After the 30 to 45 minute wait to check in, it was certainly nice to have a larger room at no extra cost (they'll ask first if you want to pay for an upgrade - don't do it!). Our room was on the fifth floor, and as such did not have much of a view. No matter really - we had a nice sofa and armchair, a flatscreen TV, a big comfy bed, plenty of closet space, an iron (thank God) and a big marble bathroom with two sinks, a two-person Jacuzzi, a separate shower and a separate toilet stall. If you book in the Palace Tower, ask for a room on the garden/pool side, because these seemed universally larger than the rooms on the other side. The room's decor felt new, but the room itself was already showing some signs of wear; the toilet was broken when we arrived (it was fixed promptly), and the shower didn't really feel immaculate. If this is your first trip to Vegas (it was ours), also be prepared for this hotel to be HUGE. It took us a good six minutes to get from our room through the casino past the entry to the sidewalk. Breakfast at the Augustus Cafe was a little pricey, but you get big portions and surprisingly tasty food. A comfortable experience all around, but hotels with 4000+ rooms are a little big for our taste.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt stay here again even if it were free!”
Reviews.Author: buzzandbaloo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 3 nights over christmas on a casino rate. We were given a room in the new tower, which was very nice at first look. The housekeeping in this hotel is beyond awful. There were spots of blood on the backsplash in the bathroom that seem to have been wiped off with some water that peeled the paint a bit. It was clear that no chemicals had been applied. They absolutely REFUSED to give more than one of each towel (2 washclothes) despite specific requests. I question this policy considering that they knew that there were two adults in the room! The tile in the shower was moldy and the smell was overwhelming. Again, it seemed clear that no chemicals were used to clean. The tiles had clearly been applied so as to make it difficult for the water to drain properly. The rooms were loud. The casino was even worse than the rooms. There were almost no pits open and finding a table was pretty much impossible. This is the first time I have had to leave my hotel to go play. There werent even many slots! The dining in the hotel was terrible. Without a diamond rating the lines for all restaurants, including the coffee shop were 45 minutes or longer. They do NOT give any benefit for those staying at the hotel as other casinos do. If you're not a high level gambler they really dont seem to care. I wont even mention the nearly 2 hour line to check in... and once you got there the staff was RUDE and uncaring, even when it was their mistake (such as blood on the walls). I think I spent a total of 4 hours just on lines trying to get a clean room. There was no entertainment available in the hotel itself - and even when Bette Midler opens up I still wouldnt consider that something to do. In short, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: orangenwhite
Reviews.Content: My wife, and I stayed at Caesars over Christmas. We really enjoyed our stay. Our room was in the Augustus Tower (Floor 33) overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The room was nicely equipped (even an LCD TV in the bathroom) and the staff very friendly. The casino is nice, the restaurants are good, and the forum shops were fun. The only complaint I had was the TV Remote kept messing up. Housekeeping came right up and fixed the issue and advised what to do if it happened again. It happened 2 more times during our stay. Other than that no complaints. I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: hooper33
Reviews.Content: We arrived on New Years Day. Check-in line was not crowded at all. The front desk was very nice. They tried to get us to upgrade for 100 bucks a night but that was to much extra to spend. I did tell the guy that we were there for my husbands 30th birhday. He asked if we cared about the view and I told him, no. We ended up in the Roman Tower in a suite. Still had a view of Las Vegas and the room was huge. Had a tv in the bathroom large shower and huge bathroom. Free safe in the room. This room was much larger than the other ones on our floor. This place is huge. It quite a walk to get to the street. We didn't eat at any of caesars, but they looked very nice. Some very expensive. Gaming was okay. As others have stated the table limits are very high. We went across the street and played at some of the older places. Liked Bill's table games. Overall we had a blast and will be back. This was our fourth trip and we are already looking forward to our fifth.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: lindagalint
Reviews.Content: Fantastic break @ Caesars, lucky enough to stay in the Augustus Tower with fantastic views of the Bellagio fountains and south strip. Breakfast in the Augustus cafe excellent every time and staff friendly and courteous. Room service very prompt and couldn't fault at all. Ideal location, excellent shopping on site (Forum Shops) and good variety of eating and gambling options. Have stayed in several other hotels on the strip but would definitely recommend Caesars and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fab 40th in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: guidedug
Reviews.Content: Spent my 40th Birthday with my wife in Caesars Palace, Las Vegas , absolutely fantastic time !! The hotel is huge and the casino is always busy but the service was excellent and the staff friendly , approachable and helpful ! The hotel is in a great location for all of the sights in Vegas , the pool area is quite big and impressive . We had a corner suite which was very comfortable and quiet haven compared the hussle and bustle of the town itself . Overall a great hotel , great location and certainly a 40th to remember !

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: wendi17
Reviews.Content: Great room, great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Lives Up to Its Reputation”
Reviews.Author: TrippingRound
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Caesars. Having found a great rate for Christmas, we couldn't pass up the opportunity. When we arrived on the 23rd @ 10:30, we were dismayed to find out that the hotel had run out of rooms with double beds and rollaway beds, so we were put into one of the mini suites in the Augustus Tower. It was very spacious, but the cost of the plasma television in the washroom could have been spent on a pullout sofa bed. The front desk was very apologetic and upgraded us to a larger room with double beds for the remainder of our stay. Our new room in the Palace Tower was terrific in every way, large washroom with jetted tub, plasma television, comfortable beds, etc. The room had been updated recently and was well-maintained. Though the Palace Tower is the farthest away from the casino, it is conveniently located to the pool area, steps away from the elevator. Some people find the size of the hotel and casino daunting and overwhelming, but I love its location and amenities. For the $119/night we paid, we definitely enjoyed our stay at this LV landmark.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CE-CMtrip
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and given that it was the most expensive place we stayed during our 4 week trip we were disappointed. We arrived by car and did receive help with our 2 large suitcases out of the car but that was it. It was hard work making our way to check-in not to mention lugging our suitcases through the casino trying to find our tower where our room was located. I appreciate that I booked a standard room but I felt our room in the forum tower was very plain and needed a facelift. The bathroom was large but outdated. The beds were just ok, but only had one pillow each. The sheets and towels were rough. Our room was at the end of the hallway and we had a buzzing noise 24/7 which may have been the airconditioning motor. I didn't feel at all like I was staying in a plush hotel. Both my Mum and I broke out in a rash all over our bodies while staying here. We enjoyed Las Vegas, but if I visit again I will try for a renovated room or probably try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Frustration turned satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: tzsuie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights during the Thanksgiving weekend at this supposed to be fabulous and noble hotel fit for royals. I booked online for a standard king room and it was a pretty good deal, or so I thought. I guess I expected too much. The room was very ordinary and disappointing. It was definitely not something I expected from a prominent and classy hotel like the Casears. I know it's just a standard room, nevertheless, it could have been a lot better. Unfortunately, or should I say, fortunately, on our first night, an untoward incident happened, which later on turned out to be an advantage for us. We can’t get into our room. There was something that was blocking the lock from inside. Housekeeping was not able to open it either and had to call the hotel’s locksmith. We were pretty tired and the last thing we wanted to do was stand outside and wait. An idea suddenly popped up. I went to the front desk and (politely)complained and asked if we can be compensated for the inconvenience at least by giving us a free upgrade. The front desk gentleman spoke to his supervisor and after a brief discussion went back to me and agreed. This time it was a much better room, bigger, nicer, equipped w/ a plasma TV, and a huge jacuzzi tub. So in a nutshell, although we were disappointed at first, we were definitely pleased at how accommodating and considerate the staff were which totally made up for the inconvenience and frustration.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: big_D123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars Palace over Christmas (Dec 22 - Dec 25). I have been in Vegas many times but hadn't stayed here, so this was a first. We stayed in the Palace Tower in a very nice room on the 11th floor facing north (Mirage etc.). Arrived at the hotel around 6:30 pm and check-in at the Diamond Lounge took but a few minutes. Room is very spacious, huge (marble) bathroom with separate shower and tub and separate toilet. Entry hall with large closet and safe, ironing board. Well stocked mini-bar, plasma TV and very very comfortable bed. Wonderful stay. Room very quiet, did not hear anything from neighbors or from the hall way. Maid service prompt and excellent. Room service prompt and food excellent. Forum Shops are wonderful. BOA Steakhouse, expensive but excellent quality. Lago Buffet good quality but too crowded. Location on the strip cannot be beat. Wonderful pool area. Will be my Vegas hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Married at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: FSUAly
Reviews.Content: We got married at Caesars almost 2 years ago. This a very romantic hotel with a beautiful garden setting available for ceremonies. We had about 50 guests at the wedding. Most things went smoothly, but we had problems with being mischarged at restaurants during our stay and some other billing issues. However, the salon services and room service were wonderful! Overall I would recommend this hotel to stay at for a romantic getaway, but just be prepared to double-check everything. I have also stayed at the Wynn and would recommend the Wynn more if you want a "trendier" and more modern hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrezLondon
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 1 week in december 2007. the hotel staff are very friendly. upon arrival we upgraded rooms to the augustus tower with views of the bellagio fountain-this was spectacular. Downsides are no kettles in rooms to make coffee-bit of a downer for the room price. Cab drivers take long routes from airport to hotels and to outlet stores-they charge a lot! would come back here again. very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Screwed at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: JayMagic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a terrible experience at Caesars. I had booked and had confirmed a deluxe Augustus Tower room in July for a Dec. 8-10th stay. The booking was online via Caesars website. When we showed up, we had been downgraded to a room in the old Centurion Tower. When I complained and asked what happened to the reservation for the Augustus Tower (which still showed on-line that morning), I was told that " I didn't read the fine print and they have the right to change rooms without notice." The room they put us in had peeling wallpaper, you had to literally walk into the bathroom to get in or out of the room (due to the room's entrance design), there was no guard around the door handle on the back of the bathroom door (got a cut on my hand). And, the view on the 30th floor was a view of a bunch of construction junk on the adjoining tower. The check in staff told us they had a lot of high rollers in for the National Finals Rodeo and a Harrahs Total Rewards Event called the Great Gift Wrap Up, and we simply didn't gamble enough to avoid getting bumped to what even the check in staff agreed was not one of their " better " rooms. They were extremely dismissive of our concern. They just didn't care. We ended up refusing to stay at Caesars Palace. My wife did not want to spend a penny there -- now or ever. We contacted a host over at Harrahs, and although they were officially sold out for the weekend, he got us a decent room and the attitude of their check in staff was great in trying to help two people who were totally frustrated by our experience at Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service As Always”
Reviews.Author: Icmeler
Reviews.Content: Arrived here for 5 nights after staying 5 at PH (read other review) and couldn't wait to check in. We had got a great deal but was put in Roman Tower and we had always stayed at Palace Tower so tried the $50 trick (2 rooms) but it seemed we had chosen one of the busiest times of the year and wouldn't work so we opted for the $80 per night upgrade and enjoyed our Palace Tower room. Service in the casino from the waitresses is excellent and the drinks are genuine and very strong and kept us going all through the wee hours while we were winning at the slots. Never played the table games as minimum was $15 so went to Oshea's to play those and also to sit at the bar and play video poker. We won a few times in Caesars as in the odd $2-300 on slots and the last night the wife ended up $900 clear and the previous night I hit the $1 video poker while waiting for her to get off the slots for $2,000 with 4 aces and a 3 kicker. I picked the money up the next day and in Caesars they filled in tax forms for me as a gesture and I never had or will have to in future pay the 30% tax. All in all another excellent stay at this hotel and as we can only make Vegas once a year at this time due to other commitments we will be booking here again but for the full trip next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ScotandHelen
Reviews.Content: A great Hotel full of tradition. A great pool area with multiple pools that are not as busy as some in LV. Plenty of eateries and a LOT of great shopping. Caesars Palace is a world of entertainment, do yourself a favour and check into this hotel

Reviews.Title: “So, so...”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker012
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to let people know that the rooms at Caesar's Palace are not all that great. The standard rooms look like a room you could find at any hotel all over the country. When I booked at Caesar's i expected it to be fantastic and I have to say that i was very disappointed in the rooms. I was in a group of 28 women, all of whom were staying at Caesar's and they were all equally disappointed. I booked a executive suite for 1 night of my stay and that was fantastic, but it also costs quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: Shu82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing and it was well designed and place in the middle of the strip which was perfect. We stayed there for 5 nights from 22/11 - 26/11. We originally booked to stay in the classic room and when we checked in I cheekly asked for a room upgrade but they told us it would be an additional $80 per night but we didn't want to pay extra so when we arrived in the room it was lovely but we was facing some large industrial pipes so we phoned up reception and told them that our view wasn't that great and if we could be moved to a higher floor. We was told to come down to reception and they offered us the Deluxe suite in the Palace Tower with no extra charge. The room was fantastic it was big and it has a Plasma TV, Jacuzzi and Mini bar. The bathroom was big and well designed. I enjoyed our stay at this hotel and the service was exceptional. The nly negative point is that the Palace Tower took about a ten minute walk from the entrance so if you have forgotten something in your room then it would take 20 mins to do a return journey! I would definitely recommend anyone to stay there as it was in the perfect location on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Gorilla71
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Roman Towers. Asked for an upgrade but they said it would be $80 more per night so turned it down. The bathrooms do NOT has doors. We had traveled with two other parties. Did not feel comfortable asking them to come to our room to relax and enjoy a drink when there was no door on the bathroom !!!!!! They said none of the rooms had bathroom doors not just ours. Also no coffee pots in the room. No outlets by the desk which was major disadvantage for us. No soap dish in bathroom. Very disappointed. For $227 a night and all the other hotels in Vegas, we would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: catgurl
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights midweek in Augustus Tower room with king bed. Large room with plenty of room for stetching out on the sofa or in-room dining at a proper table. Bed soft and comfortable with good quality linen. Room temp easy to adjust and maintain. Large bathroom with huge jetted tub and separate large marble tiled shower. Clean and well stocked each day with personal products. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Every service person who showed up at our door handed us a handful of chocolate coins, and the evening maid service left chocolates at the bedside. Twice daily maid service kept everything stocked and very clean. Room service quick and ok, the food was not hot & didn't seem too fresh. Hallways quiet and clean. Elevators quick and never crowded. Casino huge; prepare to walk forever to get from one side to the other. Husband and I only play slots, machines not too tight, had to move around quite a bit to find the looser slots. Cocktail waitresses plentiful. Also lots of great bars with quick & (again) friendly service. Ate dinner at Rao's. Excellent food and wine, but place very busy (on a Tuesday night) and noisy. Valet & taxi service wonderful, always greeted with a smile. Did not use the pools or the spa. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the pictures and hype”
Reviews.Author: deethetraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas over a dozen times and usually stay at the Ventian, MGM Grand or Mandalay Bay. I decided to venture out and stay at Caesar's which is rated as a 4 star hotel. We walked into a luxurious, spacious lobby and smiled at our choice. We all knew the room was going to be heaven. WRONG> When I finally found the Forum Tower, dragging my luggage through the hotel, (no bell man was available to take my bags up) I was looking forward to relaxing before hitting the black jack tables. When we got off the elevator, we were worried. The hallway was smoky, dingy and old. The doors of the rooms we passed were dirty, worn with nicks and dings missing paint. The carpet was dirty and stained with breakfast dishes still in the hallway even though it was 3:00 pm. We prayed our room would be better and match the pictures on their site. Well, as life goes, our room matched the hallway. It was small with two double beds with thin bedspreads, two small foam pillows sat proudly on the hard mattresses. No desk or mini bar. They shoved a small chair in the corner for a "relaxation area", but what was the point? The bathroom was right out of the 80's. The large pink spa tub was worn and scratched. The sink faucet was installed too far back so water ran onto the counter everytime you turned it on. There were cracks in the marble floor and the ceiling looked like it had been patched. This was a $300/night room that looked like a $50 2 star hotel. Harrah's at half the price is a nicer room. My friends in the Roman tower reported the same thing. If they have the rooms shown on the internet, they must have been saved for high rollers. I have never seen a hotel that was this mis-leading. After two days of sleeping on a hard mattress, I checked out and went to the MGM Signature. Maybe Caesar's should take some of the money they spend advertising Celine, Elton and the Pussy Cat Dolls and actually remodel their rooms. Go to Caesar's for the shows, the forum and restaurants. Take your money and go to MGM, Venetian or Mandalay for a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing missing were the roaches”
Reviews.Author: deethetraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas a dozen times and usually stay at MGM Grand, Mandalay or the Venetian. I was traveling with a group and we decided to stay at Caesar's. BIG MISTAKE! You walk in to a beautiful, but very confusing lobby with signs pointing every which way. Check in was fast, efficient and we were excited to get to our luxurious rooms. WRONG> As soon as we got off the elevator in the Forum Towers, we were disappointed. The hallways were dingy, with stained carpets, a heavy smoke smell, and worn, dirty paint on the doors and hallways. Several doors were nicked and dinged like a $50/night hotel. We prayed our room would be better maintained than the hallways and doors we passed. Unfortunately, the room was small with two double beds with thin bedspreads, two foam pillows on each bed, no desk or area to relax and a view of the Rio. The mattresses were hard and thin and I kept thinking why are we paying $300/night for this. The bathroom was worse. The faucet was installed too far back, so water ran on the counter everytime you turned it on. There were huge cracks in the marble floors and the pink 80's tub looked as old as the hotel. The pictures on line look nothing like our room. My friends in the Centurion tower reported the same thing. During the day, room service trays from breakfast littered the hallway and weren't picked up until way until the afternoon. Maybe they should spend some of the money they throw at advertising Celine and Elton on refurbishing the rooms and remodeling?? I checked out after two days and went to the MGM where I slept like a baby on my pillow top bed enjoying breakfast in my room at my desk overlooking the strip. Save your money and time and avoid Caesar's unless you are coming to see one of the great show's there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: JulieAp
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights at Caesar’s. Our room (in the Roman Tower) was large with a nice bathroom that had a small TV and separate tub and shower. Although the room was fine, it needed a face-lift. It was clean, but for the price that we paid I expected to be impressed a bit more. The casino is fine, but again, is a little drearier than some of the new hotels. The forum shops & the pool were great and you can't beat Caesar’s location. We had dinner at The Palm at the Forum Shops, which was just mediocre. One steak wasn't cooked properly and although the rest of the food was fine, it wasn't anything special. We had lunch at Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill, which was fantastic. However, those that ordered hamburgers thought they were good but nothing unique. So choose something special! The breakfast buffet at Cafe Lago was very good, but service at the Augustus Cafe was very slow. We had no problem with the hotel's service. In fact we were able to check into our rooms before 11:00am. We had a great trip, but I expected to be "wowed" more by the room and Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: lllavinia
Reviews.Content: This was to be my first stay on the Strip, and if this is what you get for your money, I'll go back to staying at smaller properties off the Strip. My friend had made the reservation. Because of flight delays I arrived first. Despite having the confirmation number and giving my credit card, I was refused access to the room. For hours. An upgraded suite had been reserved; we were given a standard room. We ate at the hotel that night and the next day my friend had food poisoning. When I went for breakfast on my own I was asked in a very unfriendly manner if I was charging to the room. When I said yes I was asked for the room card, which I had, then picture ID was demanded. When my ID didn't match the name the room was reserved in, I was refused room charging priviledges. There was no information in the room regarding internet services, no card to request bed linens to be changed, and the room in general was not very clean. The concierge was as unfriendly and unhelpful as the front desk staff. Staying at Caesars Palace was an all around unpleasant experience. I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and modern”
Reviews.Author: Teresa567
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at Caesars Palace. We had our wedding ceremony there so we had the chance to see two different room types. The Augustus Tower (newer rooms) have rooms both with or without views, but are the same room style. The views are of the Bellagio fountains which is pretty nice. The room itself is LARGE with a great bathroom and whirlpool tub. The decor is very new, modern, and comfortable. In the Palace Tower, we had a petite suite. These rooms were also rennovated and are located close to the pool. No real "view" rooms. The room itself was large, about the same size as the Augustus Tower room, but had two bathrooms....joined by a shower. It sounds weird and it is...unless it's a couple staying...then it becomes a great his/her bathroom. The shower is large with 2 shower heads. There are two separate toliets (each with a door) and a jacuzzi tub in one of the bathrooms (very nice). Each bathroom also has a sink and storage area. The buffet at Caesars is lacking, but they do have other good fine dining restaurants. Overall, I was more impressed with this hotel than I thought I'd be....I'm kinda of a hotel brat, and I'm into newer, modern properties (vs older, classic victorian styles). I would go back. The table limits are high throughout the day and night and slots are tight!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!! (Augustus Towers)”
Reviews.Author: moniquec68
Reviews.Content: This being my first time to Vegas, I wanted to have a really great memorable first time experience. I was torn between staying at The Bellagio or Caesars Palace, but chose Caesars after reading reviews about Bellagio catering to the older crowd (I'm 38). After vising The Bellagio I have to say I am very happy I chose Caesars Palace. Bellagio is an awesome hotel, just not my taste or vibe. The overall atmosphere at Caesars was a lot better than The Bellagio. I checked in at Caesars a half an hour before check-in time and went straight to the hotel registration, no lines, no hassles, nada, and happily greeted wherever I roamed in the hotel everyday of my stay. Upon entering the room I was ecstatic. I booked a room in the Augustus Tower, non-smoking, king bed and received exactly what I reserved. I couldn't get enough of how huge this room was, how clean, the bed linens, furnishings, flat screen not only in the room but also a smaller one in the bathroom so if I'm watching CNN but need to go and put my make up on for a night out on the town I just go in the bathroom and watch it in there too not missing anything, lol. The bathroom is awesome! Very very clean. Separate shower, jacuzzi tub and separate toilet. My view was of the strip, fantastic! Elevators were quick. Cabs were quick. Valet was quick... everything about this hotel was just on point. Caesars is beautiful... it's a BIG hotel, so take some comfortable shoes, you'll need them just for the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: LaMarianina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a work conference. The experience was fantastic. Check-in was smooth and efficient. They offered me an upgrade to the Augustus Tower (the newest part of the hotel) if I was willing to take a smoking room. I said yes and to my surprise the room was spacious beyond belief and the ventiliation system made the room seem pretty much smoke-free. The facilities and the rooms are luxurious. Caesar's has everything. The pool complex is brilliant and large- but it is far tamer and tends to be an older crowd than say The Palms or Mandalay. There is so much to chose from in terms of restaurants and shopping- you never have to leave the complex. The Forum Shops have some of the best shopping in the country. I would easily return here again.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vegas-Caesars was Perfect...almost”
Reviews.Author: ARKSugarLand
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a five day conference and as it was being held at Caesars, I stayed there. It was a bit intimidating pulling up in front of the hotel ( I rented a car which was the best for getting around the city) but the valet quickly handled things and my luggage was whisked way to await my call. Check-in was great and the clerk upgraded me to a wonderful room in the Palace tower (much nicer the standard room booked with the convention agency). No charge- I just asked nicely-two others checking in next to me both demanded an upgrade and received one-for $80 per night. Pays to be nice to folks in my opinion. Room was impeccably clean and the bathroom over the top. I was a little small for the tub but loved it nevertheless. I was surprised at how reasonable room service was and the food was good. Everything about Caesars is over the top. I can't help but laugh at the "elegant" shops and patina of "class" on this grand ole dame of a gambling hall. But it did spoil me. I ventured out a couple of times to other casinos (across the street to the Flamingo, Planet Hollywood, Bills and drive to Rio) and must say...I got back to Caesars as fast as I could! Being a woman travelling alone I certainly felt the safest there. The staff was so nice and over the few days began to recognize me and went out of their way to be helpful. I was turned off very late at night when I wandered downstairs and found a little bit of a rowdier crowd. They were a rougher bunch-young and blingy-and it was the only time I saw the casino look dirty, ashtrays overlfowing, empty drinks, etc. Parking was easy and I preferred the Palace tower as it let right down to the gorgeous pool area. Quieter at night as well. Beautiful view of the strip and mountains. The whole experience was a bit surreal and after two days home, I am still not sure what I think of Sin City. I am no prude but it all seemed a little sad underneath the glitter...but I sure had a blast riding down the strip in my little yellow PT cruiser convertible feeling like I knew where I was going (not a clue- got lost but finally figured out things the day before I left)> The Rio was pumped up quite a bit but the crowd was a bit rowdier and atmosphere was not so much hip as advertised but crazed. So, I guess I was spoiled by the fancy-fake of CP. If one is ever going to go to Vegas this would be the place to stay, at least once. Make a day trip out to Mount Charleston-10,000 feet up and the temp dropped 20 degrees. It only took 30-45 minute ride to get there and wow, it was something to see. Everyone raved about the lodge near the peak which really was kind of crappy to be honest, but it had a great view and always has a fire going in the middle of the place. I sat on the patio and pondered how I had managed to land up on top of mountain with barely a sound around me after the chaos of Vegas. It was funny listening to other folks there complaining about it being too quiet on the mountain and that there was nothing to "do or see" on the mountain. Oh well, some folks need disney all the time. It was a welcome break for me. Do not be afraid to ask for deals at the hotel and definitely ask the staff for tips on where to go around the city. The bellhop is the one who gave me directions to the mountain. Another filled me in on where Marshalls and TJ Maxx where (ahem, stores where I can actually afford to purchase more than a key fob...the shops in the hotels are rather over the top...but I swear I will one day own a pair of Christian Laboutin shoes!-Although if I had not become a penny slot addict I figure I could have bought at least one pair and still had some change left over:) Forget the buffets-they were all bad (at least at Flamingo and Rio). The Bellagio is supposed to have a good one but I don't believe it. Buffet food just doesn't work. Go to Hard Rock cafe and the Mr. Lucky coffee shopand ask for Gambler's Special $9.95 or 11.95 for a steak/potato and salad. Forget about the 14.95 steak dinner at bill's across the street from caesars///a sad little dank place and a nasty meal. If you need cash for heaven's sake do not use ATMs-$4.95 per pop. The cashier at Caesars will cash a check for free for hotel guests...good thing I found that on my way home....:) ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to ask for renovated room”
Reviews.Author: mononofu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at not-renovated-room.... It was bad. Actually they were renovating the tower... Make sure to ask for renovated room. It's so much different.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Bellagio!”
Reviews.Author: lilypookie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my family in July. Huge hotel if you don't mind walking from one end to the other. Nice that it's connected to the shopping stores: Forum. If you get a room facing Bellagio with the water show going on throughout day - the best! Gorgeous view, so romantic! Bathroom marble nice size. Staff accommodating and friendly. Food court is nice. If you want to walk on the strip, it's a far walk towards other hotel/casinos esp with kids in the hot dry sun.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shaybaby25
Reviews.Content: What can I say – it is Vegas & a super cool hotel. It is soooo big you can easily get lost. There are great bars, clubs and restaurants. When I checked in they offered to 'upgrade' my room for $40 - I declined and still got the upgraded room!!! The newer towers have super nice rooms. The older tower rooms are ok, but out dated in my opinion. This place is so cool. I saw several celebrities. The staff is nice but sometimes difficult to find if you are at the front of the hotel. This is the only down fall – if you are on the other side of the hotel and have an issue, you have to hike all the way back to the front desk. The pools are great!! I could have spent all day out there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: DrinkandbeMerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and had a very good experience and pleasant stay. Room was located at Palace towers, overlooking the pools. Room was very comfortable and the very clean. The decor made it luxurious. Two slight downsides were: the tub and TV. The two person tub as I concurred with the previous posts is not that comfortable. The jets were not at the right spots and I have been in better tubs. But I didn't go to CP to lay in tubs. The flat screen TV wasn't all that sharp in watching some TV but watching my friends' TV the other tower, it was better and sharper but I didn't care as I just watch 15-20 minutes of TV to catch the news. The hotel service was impeccable. The dealers at the Casino were awesome as I have nothing bad to say. I like the airy and spacing environment CP offers at the casino. They treated me with a lot of professionism and class. They greeted you with kindness and smile. I was very comfortable at the pool and find it relaxing and enjoyable. It will be interesting when CP builds the new Tower in the next year and how much it block the sun. The barmaid service was very slow and had to walk to the bar several times to get drinks myself. What made CP stand out as it has all the amenitities (shops, entertainment, pool, casino, restaurants and nightclub) and is probably at the prime location on the strip. Very conveinence to North or South side of the strip where you get to experience all of the actions outside of CP. With 10-15 minutes walking distance to Venetian (North) and 15-20 minutes to NYNY (south) Honestly I think I would try staying at the Augustus Towers next time for the view of the strip. Palace Tower is great but do caution that it is further away from all of the action and is a long walk to casinos and main entrance. That can get tiring by day 3...

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms but bedding could be better”
Reviews.Author: pjeanne
Reviews.Content: The room was very large and the view over the strip spectacular, but the bed was not great. Actually, the bed was folded against the wall when I arrived, so of course, the level of comfort is more limited. However, the jacuzzi en-suite was very much appreciated after the long journey from Europe... Although there was a strong smell of smoke when I arrived, the staff managed to get rid of it through an ozone generating machine on day 2.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but nothing out of the ordinary - for Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: H&SP
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Saturday which we knew would be busy but only had to wait about 10 minutes max in the check in queue. Did have to walk miles (slight exaggeration!) through the casino with our bags from the car park which wasn't great particularly as it was so busy. I had wanted to upgrade but we weren't even offered this as the hotel was so busy. We had a room in the Colosseum tower (I think) which was at the front of the hotel and had a partial view of the strip. The room was obviously in the older part of the hotel but was in no way tired looking or drab. All the decor and fixtures were clean and up to date. Having stayed in the Luxor I didn't think it was anything fantastic but then not really sure what I expected to tell you the truth. We had a room with an adjoining door to the room next door. This wasn't a problem but the guy next door was pretty noisy. It was ok though you couldn't hear him at night and we really weren't in much during the day except to get changed and rest our feet for a bit. Don't mean this to sound negative as we had a really good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Caesarrs has some problems”
Reviews.Author: litecast
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at this hotel as part of a package to see Elton John.When we arrived we were offered an upgrade to a larger roon for $80.00 per night. The room was big and had a 2 person hot tub. The tub leaked water into the room and soaked the carpet every time we used it, When we complained we were told that it happens all the time. We also had a problem when the people in the room next door got into a fight at 3:30 in the morning.They were screaming,throwing each other into the wall We had to call security along with several guests. The Hotel did not ask them to leave. Their solution was to ask us to pack up and move to a different room. The Palace Tower where we stayed was far away from all of the hotels main attractions. The shops at the Forum were amazing and the show was great. We took a helicopter ride to the Grand Canyon that was the highlight of our trip. We rented an exotic car for a day from Rent a Vette and drove out to Lake Meade and the Hoover Dam. We would noy stay again at Caesars. If you do go Don't waste your money on the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Perth-home
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. Great location on the strip. A few pointers for you if you care: 1) Taxi from the airport, beware, if they ask you if you have ever been before say YES, if not they take the loooonnnngggg way costing $28.00 instead of what it should cost $14-$16.00, depending on traffic. Caesers Palace is very close to the airport. To think I even tipped him on top of it, makes me sick. As soon as you leave the airport make sure they don't go under the bridge, it's a big scam. We found this out when we left to back to the airport. Our cab driver told us it's a scam many of the drivers unfortunately pull. 2) Use the bus system. It's cheap for a day pass. $5.oo for 24 hours. You can ride it all day as much as you want. Street by street. Save your feet and legs, by the 3rd day it all really catches up to you. Besides, lots of great characters on the bus, great fun. Unfortunately we weren't aware of this till the last day. By the 3rd day I could hardly walk. The tram is neat but takes so long to get to it. It's $5.00 for one trip or $9.00 for the day. 3) Dress comfortably. Shoes especially. So many girls wearing heels. I haven't a clue how they managed. Their feet must of been killing them. Anything goes in Vegas, so go comfortably, you will be happy you did !! 4)Take the bus down to Freemont st. in the evening. This is the oldest part of Vegas. The largest tv screen you would ever see is above you covering a full city block. Very cool, light show with music. Lots of shopping for cheap souvenirs also. Worth the tour for sure. 5) David Copperfield- So Cheesy !!! $100.00 per person and was the worst show I had ever seen. Unfortunately this was the only show we took in. We didn't have enough time for everything. A 1 and 1/2 hour show. A 20 minute video to start (very boring) but a great filler for him I guess. It seemed to go on and on. Then he picks all of the big busted bimbos wearing mini skirts he can find for his props. Too many stupid jokes and not enough magic which is what we came to see. I believe he was once very good, now he is flying by his name, certainly not his show. A real dissapointment and waste of money. We were told the Cirque shows are amazing. I wished we had gone to one of those instead. All in all we had a great time. So much to see. Free things to see at all of the hotels but you need to search these out. Ask around, people will tell you where they are. -Our room was in the Forum tower. King size bed (the mirror above was pretty cheesy too). 2 person Jacuzzi tub in the bedroom. Nice marble bathroom. The room was quite old but clean. We were asked to upgrade but chose not too. An extra 80.00 per night. ahhh, we didn't even use the tub. There is no time for that. Too much to see. Hope this helps and have a great time

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: Deeliteful
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 9 celebrating a brother's 40th birthday. We decided on Caesar's as two of us had stayed before and we wanted to be right on the strip and where the action is. Service was faultless from check-in to check out and all points in between. The pool area is fabulous and not too crowded even through the weekend. Pool service was also good as were the cocktails and snacks served. We ate breakfast at Cafe Largo and it was consistently good and excellent value too. We would all highly recommend it and hope you stay lucky when you stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: LondonClive
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 guys from england, we stayed in the new augustus tower and had a view of bellagio fountains (just). I have stayed at most upscale resorts on the strip and this ranks up there amongst them. The drinks girls are probably the oldest/least attractive of all the hotels ive stayed in as are the croupiers. Went to see Elton John at the collosseum and have to say it is a great show. On the tuesday evening we went to Pure nightclub in the hotel, we paid about $400 for a bottle of vodka and mixers which gets you vip entry with your own private minder in a cordoned off area, this saves you queing and was well worth it. A great club, ask for a table outside and enjoy. Spago restuarant just as you go into the Forum shops is awesome and definatley worth a meal. Played golf at their club, Cascata, which even tho it is $500 for a round is well worth it, absolutely breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: PoshbirdWednesbury
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas on October 4th 2007 and stayed at Caesars for 7 nights. The room was a classic standard and was massive, there really is no need to upgrade as the standard is spacious, clean and full of character. The casino was amazing and so were the restaurants, not to mention the Forum shops!! This hotel is brilliant, we were told of some building work before we got there but didn't see a thing! There are lots of construction work going on in Vegas anyway at the moment, to be fair it didn't have any effect whatsoever. Celine Dion had to cancel a few nights of her concert as she was ill, there were a few unhappy faces as some had travelled a distance to see her but it couldn't be helped!! I went to Vegas 2 years ago and stayed in the Luxor, Caesars is much much better and didn't think i would say that as i enjoyed my stay in the Pyramid. Well worth it!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice room, great bathrooms - subpar food.”
Reviews.Author: ParkSlopeBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars for three nights in early October. I was there for a conference and usually stay at Paris but ended up staying here because the conference was also being hosted at the hotel. Check-in was very quick and the staff were very friendly. I got a standard room and it was quite spacious, especially the bathroom which had two sinks, a shower and a huge tub. The casino is decent. It’s fun to play blackjack at the Pussy Cat Dolls section…trust me, check it out. I also went to Pure nightclub, which was crowded but the lots of fun and the DJ played great music. My only complaint is the food. I ordered room service one night and the food was very stale. I also ate the buffet on another night and compared to all the other buffets around town, I would rate this one the worst. Basically, great hotel…go somewhere else for the food. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved ceasars”
Reviews.Author: madd77
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Ceasars Palace Las Vegas and found the hotel was the best on the strip. The more we looked around the more we found, it is HUGE! The only complaint we had was that the room in the Palace tower was quite a distance to walk to, makes you think twice about going back to your room to rest a bit. Everyone who checks in is offered an upgade, don't take it, its not worth the extra money for the amount of time you spend in your room! We also found the restaurants and stores very expensive. Augustus Cafe - regular coffee -$4.00. Stick to the buffets in Vegas, lunch buffets are the best buys!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: celinedionfan
Reviews.Content: After having read lots and lots of reviews about Caesars (and especially the Augustus Tower rooms) we decided to stay here during our Vegas-trip, but was prepared for smaller disappointments. But everything (and I do mean everything) exceeded our expectations. Check in - went smoothly (noone in line) and the staff was very friendly Room - we stayed in the Augustus Tower and we were amazed! So impressive, don't stay anywhere else, you won't regret it! ;) Housekeeping - did an amazing job, was always around so always had new towels, schampoo, soap, whatever we needed help with Restaurants - we only tried the Augustus Café & Café Lago, both of them were very good (personally I loved the buffet at CL, even though I've heard many complain about it) Nice staff and good prices too. Very easy to find your way around the place, and if you don't there are small folded maps you can keep in your pocket or purse :) I will definitely come back to Vegas and there's only one place I want to stay - Augustus Tower/Caesars Palace!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: MILKMAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars for 5 nights. Upon arrival at 9:30 am we had to wait for 3 hours to get our room which is expected at that time of day. Checked our bags and went right to the sports book to bet on football for that day. Excellent help at the sports book. When we did check in for our room, we asked for and received a complimentary upgrade from a classic room to a room in the Augustus tower. Room was beautiful, clean, huge, and had the best view possible. The beds are sooo comfy there. Slept better than at home! The toilet is separated from the shower, powerful hot tub, and two sinks. Had a big flat screen, plasma tv in the room and a little one in the bath. Had a snack & drink fridge which all is on sensors, so dont touch or move them if you dont want to pay for them. My husband did but they removed the charge right away, no problem. The housekeeper was always in the hallway if you needed anything extra. They do have good shampoo, cond., lotions, and soap, so no need to even take those. Also has a nice hair dryer. Very generous with them also. Easy access to the pools from the Augustus. We never had to pay to get in the Venus pool. Very nice beach towels. No need to take your own. Good drink service at all the pools. You did have to show your key to the guard to get to the elevators after a certain time in the evening. The casino wasnt anything special IMO. Could use the update that they are going to start on soon. It is nice to have the Forum Shops so handy. Did not care for the breakfast buffet at Cafe Lago. Not nearly as good as the Paris buffet. But that's the nice thing about Caesars, you are close enough to walk almost anywhere else you might want to go. I would definately stay here next trip, everyone was so nice, it is so clean and beautiful. The Milkman's Wife

Reviews.Title: “Great, great, great, and great”
Reviews.Author: svandenhoven
Reviews.Content: Our stay there was fantastic, you get what you pay for ! We stayed in the Augustus tower, and we had a wonderful view over the strip, specially by night. The pool is amazing. Everything was just..... great ! (the reception desk was a bit crowded so we waited a few minutes to check in, no matter...)

Reviews.Title: “Nice but unsure”
Reviews.Author: Carolind
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace in Aug - we had never been to Las Vegas before so wanted a big name hotel, with good reiews and lots of amenties. When we arrived at Caesars we had booked a basic room and were offered an upgrade to an Augustus Tower room for an extra $100 per night. We said ok. We got up to the room and it was nice and big with a good view but was still sort of small and we couldn't take the items out of the mini bar and use for our own purposes because the bar is sensored and if you pick anything up it will automatically charge your account. To have another fridge brought up was going to be another $30 per night!!! We were a bit annoyed at paying ALOT more for not really more amenities. We rang front desk to ask to see a basic room, to see what the difference in $100 per night is and they said we are all booked out of basic rooms so no, you can't see one and I said ' well we were just charged an extra $100 per night for the upgrade - I'm not going to pay the extra if our basic room was booked out anyway ' He said he would transfer me to the manager but hung up on me instead. We headed down to the front desk and spoke to the girl who had originally served us. I told her what the guy on the phone had said and she told us he was lying just so that we couldn't see the basic because they don't do room shows. But she gave us a key to a basic room and saidf we could quickly have a look. The basic room was the same size, had a tv in the room as well as the bathroom - the only difference was it wasn't as new and we didn't have a view. We asked to go back to the basic room because we couldn't relly see what we were paying an extra $100 per night for. Once we were settled we were able to have a look around and Caesars is MASSIVE. Every time we left our room to go somewhere we got lost. There are so many restaurant, casinos, clubs, shops - you don't have to leave this hotel if you don't want. The hotel itself is beautiful, lots of fountains and statues, the pool areas are really nice. The only thing which we didn't like, but I'm sure that this is everywhere is Vegas, is it was so busy. Like you have busy, and then there's is just so over the top busy it annoyed us a little. We also had a little incidence where we decided to go out somewhere on a Saturday night and we drove there. We got back to the hotel around 10pm (after taking 1 hour to drive 500 metre down the strip). Once we got there valet said they were full. We said well, we're staying here so just park the car. He said you'll have to go to the Forum Shops valet. We went there but they just had signs everywhere saying they were full too. So we had to try to self park, but self parking was full too! I was really really p****ed off and annoyed that they do not have guest assigned parking. What were we meant to do if we couldn't park??? Were we meant to go to another casino, park our car there and then go back to our room at Caesars??? That really put Caesars on my bad side. In the end, after driving around the car park for ages, we were lucky to catch someone leaving and got a spot. So after arriving at the hotel at 10, we got into our room at midnight. NOT HAPPY. This hotel is so big they don't care if one customer isn't happy (unless of course your a high roller). We won't be staying at Caesars again, we will be trying one of the smaller, cheaper hotels next door or across the road. The money you pay for the basic room is definately not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and an excellent LV Strip location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdvice101
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! Mind you -- it is HUGE and you WILL get lost in it. Nonetheless, awesome experience staying in. The rooms are beautiful and have everything you would never need. We stayed in a Club Suite so it had a flat panel TV and an extra large bathroom. The beds are amazingly comfortable. Room service is pricey, but definitely convenient and tastes great at all hours of the night! Lots to do within this hotel itself -- you barely need to even step outside. Check out the Caesar's Forum Shops, hottest nightclub Pure, or a performance at the Colesseum. Don't forget your swimsuit! The FOUR pools (yes, four!) are simply awesome. Poolside bar is also available.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bylmd
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Vegas and we had a fantastic time. Booked a deluxe room with relaxabroad.com and paid an excellent price. We asked for a room in the Augustus tower when we arrived and were accommodated straight away which was just great would'nt happen in England. Room was very spacious and had two huge beds. Pool area is just amazing and nice to get away from the hustle and bustle. The hotel is right in the middle of the strip and close to the Forum shops. Think the hotel is excellent value for money and would definatley recommend. We will be going back but might try the Bellagio as a treat depends on the cost of course.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: Umba
Reviews.Content: you are obviously paying for the 'Caesars' name and it is a great hotel with every amenity you could wish for but we did have a few problems. When we arrived we were offered an upgrade to the Palace Tower for an extra $100 per night which we took. The Palace Tower rooms are bigger with a spa bath, robes & a pool view etc so they are better than the classic room, however, they are quite a long way from the main hotel so be prepared for a longer walk. We were pleased with our room but we did have some problems, the toilet blocked which could have contributed to the leak that soaked the carpet & damaged some of our possessions! Caesars were apologetic & gave us a free night when we complained. I think I would only recommend Caesars to either someone who loved the pool scene (which sadly we didn't take advantage of) or someone who has an above average budget (we don't!). We really did notice the difference of the cost of food & drink in Caesars compared to some of the lower budget hotels, which is something we would bear in mind when we go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: corkmike
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Caesars Palace. Location was perfect in the middle of the strip. Got upgraded for free when we arrived at the hotel because the room we had been given at check in at the airport wasn't ready. It was a smoking room and we had asked for non smoking so somebody was sent up to change the filter in the AC immediately. View from the room was great and the bathroom was nearly the same size as the bedroom! Staff were very friendly and eating at the hotel was great too. The hotel looked fantastic and there didn't seem to be many people walking around it compared to the other hotels which was a bonus. Pools are amazing but there wasn't much shade for the 110 degree heat. Overall I would recommend Caesars and definately return there.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelling87
Reviews.Content: From A to Z, everything was perfect! The hotel was really great...You have everything you need there: Restaurants (about 30), casinos, shops...EVERYTHING! It's really a luxurious hotel but at a good price..We had a junior suite and wow....The pool is amazing... If you have to choose a great hotel in Las Vegas, go to the Caesars you won't be disapointed..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great pool!”
Reviews.Author: Macklin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1st-6th September with my daughter. Enquired about upgrading, but not worth it as we didnt intend to spend much time in room so stayed with our original booking of standard room in Palace Tower. We were amazed! Lovely spacious room with 2 queen beds (oooo so cumfy mattress). Spotless bathroom, wonderful shower with head the size of dinner plate! Free safe, 2 hairdryers, iron and ironing board (???).Can recommend for anyone not wishing to spend precious time in room (who needs plasma TV?). Not far to pool either. We can certainly recommend this hotel. Staff ultra helpful, we had no queue for check in/out. Concierge very willing to make our phone calls and answer queries.WONDERFUL pool... BUT only downer was the fact that the poolside bar closed at 6.30 and one night when we rushed to get back for poolside drink at 6 it had already closed, along with one pool for wedding reception. Long trek from hotel bar with plastic glasses!! But we were thrilled with the location on the strip... one of the best.
