Didn't have any problem with "upfront payment from credit card" which I had read about here. Nothing was taken from my account. Only charged me for a phone call made from room. I would certainly go back. WORD OF WARNING.... one pool was closed the day before we left. We were told it was because they are building another tower (block of rooms) and the pool area is all being re designed. So anyone going from now on may encounter some disruption there. Dont miss the free fountain show. at CP .There are 2, one cost $14m a few years ago and the new one cost $24m. Quite amazing. Get to it by going up by the side of Gucci in the Forum Shops. We got to visit many of the other hotels and the only ones we would stay in (out of those we visited) are this one, Bellagio, Venetian, Rio, Ballys, Paris and Mirage. Had amazing meal in Eiffel Tower Restaurant in Paris Hotel, overlooking Bellagio fountains. (Very romantic for couples). Also don't miss Treasure Iand show and Mirage erupting volvano. Mandalay Bay was lovely but very much away from the main strip - pool looked crowded. Avoid New York, New York, Monte Carlo, Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “If You're Used To High Quality You'll Be DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: MelindaJ
Reviews.Content: We're Diamond Level Players (play a lot). Used to a very high level of quality and service. Caesars tries but falls short in some key areas. Employee Service: the "regular" employees - casino wandering-around basic staff, daily housekeeping folks & waitresses are good. They try hard and take their "customer excellence" training seriously. The middle-management level: POOR. Take themselves too seriously yet are not empowered to make the most basic decisions. Example: a Diamond level registration clerk who can't remove an erroneous show ticket charge without making several phone calls and making us wait 20 minutes. Another example: our room (in the Augustus tower) was dirty. The daily housekeeping stuff was fine, but root-level DIRTY. Filthy looking carpet (just needed to be replaced). Worst, weird stains on the drapes. Looked fine when drapes were open but beware when you close them. Looked like someone had projectile vomited all over them (really). The chair at the table next to the drapes had suffered the same fate (gross). The other chair at the table was missing a big button and looked basically dirty. I complained to my host and guest services and they treated me with doubt and nothing was ever corrected. Also, no hair dryer in the bath vanity drawer. No big deal but I called housekeeping to bring one up and was questioned for 5 minutes about how carefully I looked for it and made to check again. I did, no dryer. Finally brought one up after 1/2 hour and another phone call. I don't need to steal a cheap hotel hair dryer if that's the problem. Casino was fine. To me they're all about the same. You play your games and take your chances. Let's face it, whether you win or lose is skill, chance and largely luck. The service and cleanliness issues really bugged me. If you're used to high quality (and spend accordingly) you'll be VERY DISAPPOINTED.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Great...”
Reviews.Author: DL-Platinum-Esq
Reviews.Content: I just finished a Sun. to Wed. trip to CP for a work conference. The facility was great, but a little more work and service would make it great. LOCATION: While almost every place on the Strip is close, CP is located close to the heart of the action. ***** CHECK IN/CHECK OUT: Considering I arrived around prime time for our convention and the lines to check in were long, the staff moved us along quickly. Rates were accurate, and one of my earlier arriving employees suggested that they take good care of me. I was upgraded to a Jr. Suite in the Palace Tower. The experience checking out was the same, but it would be nice to have an option to skip the front desk to leave. **** ROOMS: The room was well appointed and very comfortable. I had plenty of room, a very large bathroom (2) and nice electronics (flat screen). The lines, carpet and tilework were impressive. My only complaint was a strange oil stain on the bed skirt, which was eventually replaced. **** SERVICE: The operator never let the phone ring more than twice. The staff was all very friendly and seemed to be eager to please. Unfortunately, I had to make each request (changing the bedskirt and ordering room service food) took a subsequent call to get results. My late night food order was supposed to be delivered in 30 minutes. After 1.5 hours, I called again, and it was delivered in 19 minutes. They did comp the meal. ** FACILITIES: The casino, shops, lobby and pool were all very well done. This is a massive property with something for everyone. My feet were worn out before I could cover the whole property. I didn't use the gym, as it was a substantial extra charge. The convention facilities were first rate. Air conditioning was as cold as desired. The new Venus pool is also apparently bikini-top optional. **** RESTAURANTS: Outside of the food court, the restaurants are on the pricey side, but were reasonable for the fare. We ate at 808, the Chinese place next to Rao's and Chinois (W. Puck's). Chinois was my favorite, although all were very good. For the top restaurants, try to make reservations as soon as you can plan your dinners. ***** CASINO: I am not much of a gambler, but the casino has as many options as you would like (other than cheap tables). While there is smoking in the casino, the air filters work well. I like the new receipt system for slots (I left up $120!). **** OTHER: Par for the course on the center of the Strip, not much is cheap or free, including sodas ($3), shipping ($25 to receive 2 small boxes for a convention and $10 to have them hand one box to FedEx), and expensive WiFi. The taxi stand moves quickly and it is pretty cheap to get about town when you aren't up for walking. *** OVERALL: I had a great time, but a little more effort on the service/room keeping side would have been a plus. I still, however, recommend CP. It is on the same level, in my opinion, as Mandalay Bay and the Venetian, where I have also stayed. I give it a very solid recommendation for convention planning. ****

Reviews.Title: “Plastic Covered Elegance”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Caesars Palace for a convention for four days. Rooms - The rooms, while roomy and nice, give you the feeling of cheap. I stayed in the Palace Tower and the room was definitely roomy with a king bed, sofa and desk. The room had a plasma TV and the bathroom was bigger then the room. The AC did not work very well, I could never get the room to cool and I heard many people say the same thing. The shower pressure is so bad you have to jog around to get wet. The tub with jacquizzi is very nice and works well. The room, while it looked recently renovated was cheap, the sheets were cheep, the furniture was cheap even the in room safe is too small to put anything into. There is no coffee maker in the room either. I have definitely stayed at nicer rooms in Las Vegas at Mirage and Bellagio. The price for the rooms is not cheap so you should expect better. Service - Absolutely horrible. You wait in line for EVERYTHING down to coffee in the morning. Everything is under staffed and all the staff act like they have done you a favor for serving you. The prices are ridiculous bordering on absurd down to the $7 for coffee. It takes an hour to check in, no one helps you with your bags and the line for cabs goes on forever, but of course Las Vegas is more like Disney World now then a gambling mecca so it fits with the theme. Casino - Save yourself the time and set your money on fire at the door. You dont even have a fighting chance in there

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice rooms, but it REALLY lacks service”
Reviews.Author: sadiepoosammamish
Reviews.Content: Wow, seeing the deals other people got makes me embarrased. I booked a room 5 weeks in advance for Sept 1 - 4 and booked it for $500 on Saturday and $130 for Sunday and Monday for a standard room. Upon check-in we decided to upgrade for an additional $150 a night - not as great as what others got. They said we had a view of the strip but it was more of a partial view because we faced the Bellagio. The room was 570 sq feet w/ a big bathroom. The bathroom was my favorite because it had a small flat screen TV in it. Both TV's only had about 15 channels to choose from which is pretty lame. When we checked in we were told it would be 60-90 minutes until our room was ready. We came back 2 hours later and were told it would be another 2 hours. We said we would skip the upgrade and take the standard room. We got up to our standard room and it was dirty from the previous guests; the maids told us they hadn't even cleaned it yet and said it would be a while. We went back to the front desk and were told that our upgrade was available and that the front desk person who had said it wasn't ready didn't know what they were doing. They gave us a $25 credit for the inconvenience. We spent a while each day at the pool and the service is non-existent. We saw a server 2 times in 3 days. A double rum & coke was 19 bucks and a bud light was 8 bucks. I ordered a 12 ounce pina colada but she brought me a 32 ounce for 19 bucks because it was a better deal. The 2 times we got service within 3 days we tipped hard core hoping they would come back, but right after we tipped them both said their shift was over. Every time we called concierge there was no answer. We left a few messages but no one called us back. This was our first time at Caesar's and I only liked it for the location. We've stayed at MGM Grand several times and never had as many problems. Another thing is when we checked out I saw several $5-$6 charges and asked what they were. They said we had taken Gaterade, juice, and a starbucks drink from our fridge. I told them we never drank them but moved them to put bottled water in the fridge. They said their fridges are censored and charge you even if you pick up something to look at it, but they waived it since we didn't drink them. Since I just read the deals others got it makes my impression of this hotel worse because they could have given us a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Canuckscout
Reviews.Content: The beauty of this hotel ends with the impressive public rooms. There are aspects of this hotel that would cause us to not stay here again. The room was large but the carpeting was extremely badly stained. We felt we had to wera our shoes all the time. The middle drawer would not open. Lots of noise can be heard from the room next door. Not loud music but just people talking can be heard right through the walls. The room attendant never did quite restock our suplies once correctly. It was really hit and miss what would be missing. We had a package shipped to the hotel for our arrival. They charged us $40 handling fee. This was excessive considering the Flamingo only charges $5.00. The pool closes at 7:00 which is way too early when the temperature is 109. The only safe time to swim is the evening. Other hotels keep their pools open much later. Also the access to the pool is through part of the casino and through the Apian way shopping area. Since this hotel attracts masses of tourists who are just looking around everything is very congested. When we arrived the valet could not handle any more cars so we were directed to self park. The elevators down (2 sets of them) were so crowded there was a line up winding into the hallway to get one which took about 10 minutes. The buffet is way over priced with limited selection. The quality was good but uninteresting items. The TI, Paris or Bellagio has much better food. If I had anything good to say it would be that the beds were clean and comfortable. The pool area is very nice but lacks shade during the high sun hours. We have been to Vegas about 15 times and can advise to stay away from the low end places like Circis Circus, Imperial Palace and all the Station casinos. However paying a lot of money does not guarantee you a great experience either. We will try the Wynn next for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Hail Caesar!!”
Reviews.Author: Coylie14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at CP Aug.29-31st. We absolutely loved it. Having stayed at 8 or 10 hotels in Vegas over the years we had lots to compare it too. Upon arrival at the airport we checked in and asked for an upgrade. We had booked a $100/nt deal on a spiritair special. We were offered an upgrade for another $80/nt and decided to take it. What a great room!! In the new Augustas tower with an awesome view of the fountains at Bellagio!! Big bathroom with LCD TV and marble everywhere. Beautiful glass shower and nice big jecuzzi tub. The bedroom area was also quite big with lots of room to mull about and filled with wonderful furnishings!! The hotel has a good selection of gambling, although admittedly I prefer lower limits so I tended to play in nearby casinos. This place is like a resort. THe forum shops are awesome with extra food choices like the Cheesecake Factory (outstanding food, large portions, very reasonable prices). The pool is spectacular with 4 different pool options all within a few steps of one another!! Employees were pleasant everywhere we went! We will return again to Caesars for sure!! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: bilashk
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay with tripres.com. They had a deal that gives you a free upgrade to a tower room for $140 per night if you use American Express. We were booked into the palace tower. We asked the young lady at check in to be moved to the Agustus tower and she found us a room on the 44th floor facing the Bellagio Fountains. The room was wonderful. The bathroom was huge with a seperate shower and jet tub. There was a small LCD TV over 2 sinks. There are sensors under everything in the fridge that charge you when you pick things up so just be careful. The staff were all great and we always felt welcome and special. Caesars was everything we dreamed it would be. A fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definately a Palace”
Reviews.Author: LaurieandTom
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace was a beautiful hotel! We arrived at the hotel at noon and our room was ready. There were only 4 people ahead of us in line. The front desk at check in was quick and helpful. We were truly in awe at the hotels beauty. Our room was very impressive. There was a very large bathroom, seating area with couch and 2 chairs, my favorite was the vanity with a make-up mirror in the hallway. I loved it! I will definately stay there again. I have to wonder about what people expect when they go to a hotel. After reading some reviews about Caesars Palace, I was a little worried about the service. There were 2 points I should mention, not about the rooms, that's for sure. The pool bar had one particular bartender who was in a very bad mood. He was actually throwing things around! I could not believe that. Fortunately he never served me. The concierge I am a little disappointed in, as they were misleading about a limo rental. Just be aware, and contact the limo service yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the most part.”
Reviews.Author: Danielle1700
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars August 28--September 1, and it had pros and cons. Booked a Classic room, but paid for an upgrade to Palace Tower on arrival. Did not like the fact that they wanted $50 more per night for the Augustus Tower upgrade than the Palace, despite the fact these two towers are the exact same rate on the Caesars' web site. When I mentioned this, the clerk implied that was not true, but anyone can check their web site to see that it is. The clerk had a very patronizing attitude, while being totally incorrect, and it bothered me that they were either not being honest with me or extremely ignorant regarding what the room rates are on their own website. I was also taken aback that the Augustus Tower had an elevator security desk, but there was absolutely no elevator security at any of the other towers (including the Palace). It was as if the safety of the Augustus tower guests was somehow more important than that of the other guests. Had I been staying alone, I would not have felt all that safe going to my room late at night, as I did see some odd characters wandering the halls and elevators. The first room we were given after we upgraded was overlooking a construction area and reeked of smoke (called a non-designated room). Went back to desk and it was exchanged for a non-smoking room overlooking pool, but they were not very gracious about it, despite the fact that when we booked the room months ago, non-smoking was requested. The room had a nice and large bathroom, but the actual room was nothing special. The inner and outer drapes were both broken, with the plastic rods lying on the floor. We just pulled them back and improvised to keep them open. The desk had a large black stain (whether from age or something else, I had no idea), and the desk drawer knob was missing. The tv was a modern flat panel, but the remote was a piece of junk that barely worked. The carpet was unattractive and rough, and the closet doors were ancient with a bad paint job. The service was what you would expect at any of the nicer hotels on the strip--polite and helpful. The lobby and other areas were beautiful and clean, and it was very nice having so much under one roof in the 107 degree heat. The pools (my main reason for choosing Caesars) were quite beautiful, but the lounge chairs were awful. The cushions were very old and frankly, filthy, but you could cover them with towels. The metal on the chairs became so hot you could not touch it. They really need modern lounge chairs made from more appropriate materials. I also had the feeling they were trying to wring every extra dime out of the guests that they possibly could. A well drink at the pool was $12 (plus tip), which is a little extreme even for Vegas. Overall the property is nice and the location is excellent. But my impression is that it is a 4-star resort that thinks it's a 5. If you get a great rate, it's worth it, but it is not worth the rates they are asking for in season.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: LSUdav
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at numerous properties and enjoyed our experience at each, but we like to try them all. This time it was Caesar's Palace and we would go back. We got a great rate on the hotel web site and were put in one of the older towers (Roman). After reading the reviews of the Augustus and Palace Towers, I know we were missing out. Our room was basic, but met our needs and had a good view of the pools. This trip was about R&R therefore we took advantage of the pools. They are all great, but we enjoyed the service at the Venus Pool which requires patrons be over 18. It is free access every day except Saturday. Great service which included frozen grapes, cold orange slices, iced towels!! Great nightlife at the hotel and the Forum Shops can keep you busy. As is stated in other reviews, the restaurants are expensive but the food/service was excellent. We are looking forward to our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: shopgirlblonde
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Caesars four times in the past three years, but this visit was by far the best. They (Harrah's Group) really seemed to have amped up the emphasis on customer service - everyone, from check-in to check-out, went out of their way to be warm, welcoming, and helpful. I booked the room through Expedia, as they had a fabulous exclusive offer: book a "classic" room and receive an automatic upgrade and a $25 spa credit. If you can find this deal again, go for it: the upgrade resulted in a truly wonderful room in the Palace Tower - all marble and bright and spacious in the bathroom, with jacuzzi, double sinks, huge shower, etc., plus spacious bedroom, flat screen tv, premium bed and bed linens - basically, exactly like the photos at expedia.com! What a deal! Room service breakfast is surprisingly reasonable and quite yummy - it is a good idea to order the night before, and it will arrive at exactly the specified time. Caesars is located in the middle of everything - had a great time at the Bellagio (about a three minute walk) shops and casino, and, of course, the Forum Shops. Dining options abound: loved, loved, Mesa Grill and the goat cheese queso fundito; Spago in the Forum Shops has a killer skirt steak quesadilla and, of course, their signature thin-crust pizzas; and The Palm in the Forum Shops has the greatest servers and sinful steaks, obviously, but the salads and soups are spectacular, too. (Spago and the Palm are located just outside the casino entrance to the Shops.) One small quibble with Caesars: my traveling companion and I are both fond of a good Chardonnay and - yikes! - try to find it at any of the bars in the casino. Forget getting anything drinkable as a comp for playing - it's really bad, hangover-inducing, stuff. Even the bartenders know it. (This is odd, given the caliber of the hotel, don't you think? I mean, the Bellagio serves Ferrari Carano!) Bottom line: Caesars delivers fabulous four-star accommodations in the perfect Strip location, with bountiful dining and shopping options, friendly staff and prompt service. Getting a great deal is the icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful time of my life... so far!”
Reviews.Author: travelwhenwecan777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married at Caesar's Palace on 07-07-07 in the Venus Garden. It was a beautiful, amazing experience that could not have gone better. The ladies in the Venus Salon were extremely attentive, and payed close attention to my every desire when it came to my hair and make up. The wedding coordinator was amazing and took care of every minute detail from across the country. I was surprised by how beautiful our room was, including the view that we enjoyed immensely. It was so great to have a full bath as well as a second bathroom. Plenty of room to get ready! We did not have time to enjoy the pool, but we enjoyed room service as often as we could! We felt that room service was very well priced considering what you would pay downstairs at a restaurant. Our room was beautiful and comfortable. In fact, if it were possible, we would like to "buy" our room and return often! If you want to be married in Vegas, I highly recommend Caesar's Palace and their amazing staff!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Caesars!!!”
Reviews.Author: shavett
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas August 22nd-26th to celebrate my 30th birthday. We booked through Wyndham Resorts so got a really great price, and I was pretty skeptical that we would get an upgrade for the price we paid. Got to hotel around 1:00 a.m. and there was 4 of us, and the desk clerk said that all the rooms with 2 beds were gone and I would have to get a room with 1 bed and they would bring another. He looked at me and asked if that was ok, and I was like I don't have any other choice. So he punched a few keys and said, ok this is what I can do. I'm putting you in a King Suite that normally goes for $2000 a night in the Palace Tower, and tomorrow your room should be ready by 1 pm. that will also be in the Palace Tower. King Suite it was!! Just grand and huge and I wish I could have stayed the whole weekend in it. When we got to the door, we were like, ok this is going to be nice. There were double doors and upon entering, a nice entry hallway. I'm like, "Oh my god!!" We walked into a huge sitting/dining area with 2 huge picture windows that had a magnificant view of the Strip and the Caesars pools. Bar area, 2 large walk in closets, a bathroom with a whirlpool and 2 head shower, 3 private toilets, and a king bedroom with huge windows. 2 plasma tvs and surround sound system, cd player, and I felt like a celebrity. Ordered me up some room service the next morning for my birthday and had it wheeled right in my room. Of course, we were kicked out that morning, and our other room was the size of 1 side of the suite. Still beautiful and nice though. Changing rooms and checking out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brightonsnowlover
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to 'Vegas' Very impressed with the size of hotel. Room was great on 20th floor of Palace Tower. View over the 4 pools. Room nicely decorated and clean Only criticism - the room had been used by smokers I think, as everytime we opened the door, we could still smell cigarettes. The bathroom was lovely - all marble with jacuzzi and seperate shower. Bath robes. Flat screen tele. Very comfortable bed. Loved the forum shops laid out like Italian streets. Great retaurants. Just wish US catered more for vegetarians. Would definately stay here again, well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “No need to leave the building!”
Reviews.Author: tb_74
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Vegas, we selected Caesars as our hotel base. Our trip was only a short one, but we decided to upgrade to the deluxe room for the extra comfort. Upon arriving, we asked to be booked in the (new) Augustus tower, where some friends had already settled. We were quickly accommodated, AND upgraded to a Luxury room, with an amazing view of the Bellagio fountain and the mini Eiffel tower. The rule in Vegas is to ask for anything and everything, you'll find you get more than you thought possible! The room itself was beautiful and CLEAN, with a whole new set of toiletries and fresh towels each day. Due to a room mix-up with our friends, we were given free passes to the gym/spa, which we took advantage of one morning. Although the gym looked inviting, we were on vacation, so no workout for us! The spa, however, was spectacular, be sure to take advantage of the Artic ice room, where you can sit on a heated bench in the ‘snow’. The pool deserves its own review in Travelocity, it’s absolutely stunning. The fountains and surroundings are breathtaking, and there were always lounge chairs to be found. When at Caesars, be sure to stroll along to the forum shops, it is by far the best shopping in Vegas. (Be sure to go all the way to level 3 and hit the Vosges haut Chocolate store for some truly sumptuous chocolate!) We didn’t actually eat in any of the restaurants in the hotel, but our friends did and had all nice things to say. When you consider the quality of the rooms, the ample shopping, beautiful pool and restaurants, there is no reason to venture outside Caesars! (P.S. Word of advise, have cash on hand at the airport, taxi’s do not take credit cards, which can be quite a shock after standing in a 30-minute line in the blazing hot sun.)

Reviews.Title: “Not as impressed as I thought I'd be...”
Reviews.Author: BizTooMuch
Reviews.Content: Not as impressed as I thought I'd have been, given the reviews. Traveled for business; Room was in the Roman Tower (old!) with one King bed. Had a sofa and coffee table, but NO DESK/table for working on my laptop. The VERY UNCOMFORTABLE bed had HUGE space behind head so you couldn't prop yourself up against the headboard. Not to mention a "dip" on one side - too soft! My friends in two doubles had "hard" beds - should have done that. ***Wished I had upgraded for the $50!!!! To a newer tower. Do it! - POOL: Definitely wished I had spent the cover charge (not sure how much) for the Venus pool (even though it's European/topless) The service would have been much better than the regular pool and they have a DJ. **Note: bring a few photo copies of your photo ID - they wouldn't let you charge drinks to your room without photo ID (but who's going to bring their Driver's License to the pool to potentially get lost??) Very friendly staff!!!! Sorry about the neutral to poor review, but two weeks ago was there for business and stayed at the Wynn. I'm sure everything will pale in comparison after a WONDERFUL stay at the Wynn. If choosing between CP and Wynn, definitely choose the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Help,when you needed it most”
Reviews.Author: mrrick51
Reviews.Content: On June 10, 2007, my wife and checked in at Caesars Palace / Las Vegas. We were assigned a great room in the Augustus Tower and look forward a terrific time in Vegas. These happy thoughts did not pan out because, 2 days later, I was having severe pain in my leg and needed medical assistance. My wife approached the Caesars concierge who provided the following services : 1 . obtain the name of a clinic which led to the discovery of a blood clot. 2. assisted in check out/ transport to a hotel near the hospital for my wife. and 3. obtained a refund for the 2 tickets we held for the Celine Dion show and 4. provided comfort and understanding for my wife who needed a little support in this stressful time. ///// We live in Chicago and have been to Las Vegas at least once a year for 18 years. We never never needed help before but we extremely glad we stayed Caesars because of their concierge !

Reviews.Title: “Truly superb a magnificent hotel resort”
Reviews.Author: PH&LH
Reviews.Content: The moment you arrive at Caesars Palace you can not fail to be impressed. Situated in a great location midway along the “strip” just 10 minutes taxi ride from the airport its convenient for all the main attractions. Check in was swift and I would recommend upgrading to the Palace or Augustus Tower as they have the best bedrooms and views . With two WC’s, twin shower, double jacuzzi bath, plentiful towels, bathrobes and quality toiletries your off to a good start. 25 paces from the bedroom door to the window overlooking the swimming pools gives you an idea how large the rooms are with a very comfortable a king size bed and large soft pillows. Plasma TV, mini bar, radio alarm clock, free room safe and masses of wardrobe space with an iron and ironing board, desk & chair and a three seater sofa complete the furnishings. Each floor has several ice machines so you can fill up the ice bucket provided in your room. I liked the Palace Tower location because opposite the lifts is the pool area where you can get unlimited supply of towels on your way to the sun beds. Buffet breakfast in the Café Lago is excellent value with a vast choice from fresh fruit, cereal, pastries, bacon, sausage, waffles, pancakes, hash browns, French toast and every type of egg combination freshly made at your request The Caesars Palace Hotel is like a mini city with 3500 bedrooms ,4 swimming pools, 6000 staff, a theatre, hundreds of gambling machines and tables , 3 wedding chapels, a five floor multi story car park, an Amphitheatre, 12 restaurants , 8 lounge bars, 18 conference rooms, 4 ballrooms, a Spa and Fitness centre, an Events Centre and add to that shops on the lines of the Manchester Trafford Centre and that will give you a guide to the size of the complex all on the same site. Its beautifully decorated and furnished in a Roman theme with ornate ceilings and statues. I went to most of the other hotels along the strip to compare the décor and none came close to the Caesars opulent but comfortable feeling apart from the Venetian Hotel. Stunning, awesome, mind boggling, jaw dropping are just some ways to try and describe the unique phenomenon that’s Las Vegas but none come close to captivating the truly magical experience that awaits visitors to an unforgettable destination and Caesars is the icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “Favourite in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: El_Turista
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Excalibur, Flamingo, and Mandalay Bay before, Caesars really impressed us. The hotel is very clean and the air insided the casino is probably the best in Vegas, great ventilation (just go to the casino across the street at Flamingo to compare). We payed 169 a night for what we thought was the cheapest rooms. We checked in really late and somehow we were upgraded to a newly renovated wing of the hotel. The room very spacious and very nicely designed with a plasma tv on the wall. The bathroom was also very spacious and had a spa. The location of Caesars is great, middle of the Strip which gives you many alternatives for dining, gambling and shopping. +Clean air +Newly renovated room +Great location -Pool area much too small -mini bar that charge you if you move something around -Room rates usually on the high end

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous at a great weekday deal”
Reviews.Author: closetartist
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on TripRes.com, for $140/night with a free upgrade to a room in the Palace Tower. Our room was gorgeous. The room is immense and the bathroom was so large that it could have held a bed in it. Very tastefully decorated, in blue and gold, with nice dark hardwood furniture and plasma screen TVs. The bathroom had a huge shower, separate toilet area, double sinks, and a jacuzzi tub. We didn't use the tub but the shower was so nice. Couple of other points about Caesars: - We really liked the ambiance but we stayed from Monday to Wednesday. When we came back to Caesars on Saturday night, the place was a zoo. - We LOVED Mesa Grill. The food was exceptional though the drinks were unnecessarily expensive. The restaurant decor is a little strange, though, because you look out through windows into the main sports gambling area, and while we were there that night, they were showing some lingerie shows on the giant TVs, which didn't particularly whet my appetite. - We ate at the buffet for lunch, which was a good value, because we had $10 off coupons, but I would not waste my money there for dinner. All in all, if you can get a good deal, it is well worth staying there and we loved our experience. I would not spend the $350 to stay there on the weekends, since it is easy to find reasonable hotels at better prices in the same area (though not nearly as fancy as Caesars).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place - for the Rich and Super Rich”
Reviews.Author: wdkirk01
Reviews.Content: Lets just start from the beginning. The hotel is beautiful, clean and has very friendly staff. Arrived by chartered van to a side entrance for vans. No one asked to take our bags for us. I felt like a servant coming in the back door. The front entrance has excellent service though but I didn't get to experience that. Take an SUV taxi or Limo (both are $6 to $12 per person) from the airport to get front door service. Expect a long wait at check in. Even though the check in area is huge, they never had more that 4 people taking care of everyone. The desk area looked big enough for 12 people to be working it. (Possible money problems for the hotel and not wanting to overstaff for the sake of their guests????) The lady was extremely nice at check in though. Our room, not an expensive one, was clean and comfortable. The beds were comfortable as well. Don't drink the bottled water in the room. It is $4 a bottle. This room was very similar to something like you would get at a Hampton's Inn. The main casino is beautiful and clean but a little smoky which I expected. Lots of slots and table games to choose from. There are plenty of place to eat and drink but they are VERY EXPENSIVE. The buffet breakfast on Saturday morning was $23.50 per person. WAAAAAYYYYYY overpriced but the food was good. The pool area is beautiful. There is a topless pool area that is hidden at ground level but is definatley viewable from some of the rooms on the upper levels. Lets talks clubs, bars and dance clubs. All drinks at bars are expensive beyond reason (most hotels do this). Not all dance clubs (PURE being one) are accessable by hotel guests. You can and will be turned away if you are not, young, hot and single. I think this is a bad idea to turn way guests at a dance club that is inside the hotel you paid money to stay in. (Other Hotels do the same thing.....like the MGM grand). There are no excuses for this. If you are wearing a wedding ring, don't expect to be able to get in to some of these dance clubs. Lots of rich and super rich people stay here from what I could tell and because I did talk to alot of them. Don't expect alot of courtesy from guests. It seems that being rude on vacation is acceptable here. The hotel is situated perfectly on the strip and you can reach 1 of 7 different hotels in minutes. My advise if you stay here, go to the CVS or Walgreens drug stores up near NEW YORK NEW YORK to buy water, beer, snacks.....and anything else you need and bring it here to your room. They have almost any bottled beer, so it is very easy to bring a couple from your room to the casino floor. If you want to gamble, the slots at Caesars are not very generous. Play the table games or go across the street to Bills Gambling Hall and Saloon (was Barbary Coast). They have .99 cent Margaritas and $1.50 Beck drafts. The gambling and atmosphere are more fun at Bill's as well. All in all, I think it is a good choice to stay at Caesar's because it is clean and the room pricing isn't that bad for a standard room. You will be clean, comfortable and safe. I recommend spending your money at another casino for food, drinks and gambling. It takes alot of money for the hotel to make a profit is the bottom line. Make no mistake, this hotel caters to the rich, weathly and super rich. There is nothing wrong with that unless you are not one of these. You will find your self paying for food that is too costly as well as drinks that are too costly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: bourets
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Caesars Palace during the week (Standart room) and we were very lucky to be upgraded to one of their largest Suite. The room was simply amazing, lots of luxury, space (1,200 sp.ft.), amendities (plasma TV, jacuzzi, steam room, etc.), wonderful view on the main strip. In addition the staff, from the check-in desk to the room service, was very frinedly and professional. We will definitly go back to this hotel next time we go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel...ever!”
Reviews.Author: DrumHearts
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived here, it looked so impressive I coldnt believe I was staying here. We had booked a regular room and were put into the Roman Tower. Our room was nice. Big bed, reasonably sized jacuzzi with red lights, and a tiny tv at the sink, but there was no door to the bathroom, it was all open plan. It was nice but we wanted luxury and as we were staying for a week we were offered a verrry good upgrade price. Moved to the Palace Tower, floor 11, and honestly, I have never seen anything so amazing. The bed was enormous! So comfortable and loads of pillows. There were 2 seperate bathrooms joined by a double shower. One bathroom had a huge jacuzzi in it too, big enough for 4 if you had wanted it! Tv was a big flat screen and choice of channels was fantastic. Our view was of the 4 pools and the belagio founatins. What more could you want. Front desk is so good. The concierge helped us very much when our car broke down and check in staff did everything they could to help, despite the hotel being so big. Dont hesitate to take the upgrade. Best money ive ever spent!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC. loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: Juce112
Reviews.Content: As 3 single girls starting off a tour of the coast of Califormia, we were spoilt at CP and didn't want to leave! The room was brilliant - huge with plenty of space for 3 adults. The bathroom was ideal, and the jacuzzi bath perfect! The staff of the hotel were mostly always friendly and polite - although in such a big hotel, you rarely see the same person twice (one thing the hotel is missing is the personal touch, but you can't have everything!) After a long trip from England we devoured the mini bar in the room, and spent quite a bit around the hotel on the room during our stay, however we were pleasantly surprised on check out on the reasonable(ish) cost of things. We would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone, and vegas has something to offer everyone. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Married at the Palace!”
Reviews.Author: amancini
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding at Caesars Palace on the busiest day of the year, 07/07/07! The hotel was busy but you would have never realized it by the special attention we received during our stay! Take advantage of every aspect of Caesars. We had a Palace Tower room with a view of all three pools. We had a huge soaking tub, glass enclosed shower for two, and double bathrooms! Have breakfast at Augustus Cafe, eat lunch at Cafe Lago, dine in the evening at Bobby Flay's Mesa Grille for those of you who are meat eaters or head to Hyakumi for sushi. Stop by Shadow Bar for a cocktail. Ask John to make you a "Pineapple Upside Down Cake". Delicious! Keep in mind..they don't call this place a Palace for nothing. The property is massive and difficult to navigate. Also, be prepared to stand in the taxi line for a while. With four towers, Caesars has quite a few guests on any given evening.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not a 5 star Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tdottraveller1
Reviews.Content: I always thought this place was 5 start judging from the grounds...turns out it definately is not, it only pretends to be. Having stayed at Bellagio and Venetian, this hotel is no where close in their league. Casino is just average; some parts feel like a dirty property in downtown Vegas; just feels very ordinary. Lack of security; Mirage, Venetian, Bellagio all have security by elevators - not the case here. Just a bunch of little problems; oh yeah side note, can't believe they don't have a $10 craps table - this place pretends to be something it's not. For the price you can do a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Do They Clean Rooms????”
Reviews.Author: julie0331
Reviews.Content: Caesar's did not live up to our expectations or their reputation. We were extrememly disappointed from check in to check out (Monday - Friday stay). We went during what is known as the slow time of year (first week in August) and for our anniversary. At check-in we were told they could not upgrade us which we were surprised about - but headed to our appointed basic room. While unpacking I stepped in something wet on the floor - which turned out to be spilt beer. When I went to call the front desk to alert them - all the buttons were missing from the phone. We were moved to another room in another tower (NOT UPGRADED) and couldn't believe our eyes. The bathroom had a used bar of soap at the sink and a dirty towel on the counter. The garbage can had the previous guest's garbage still in it. Including stuff with her name on it. The bed had not been made from the previous night as well. We called the front desk to alert them. They told us to call housekeeping - housekeeping stated the room was showing "dirty" in their system.....but they sent no one to come and clean it until 9:00 p.m. at night. They did not move us nor did the front desk check back with us. All I can say is this is not what we expected from Caesar's. The casino was extremely smoky and dark. Slots were not paying anything to anyone. And table games were $25 minimums. Servers were no where to be found either. Cafe Lago - $23.50 for less than mediocre food and the service was ridiculous. I don't know if they were short staffed but we waited forever to get a server to our table. The best part of the week was the pool. The pool hosts were spectacular and the drink servers were constantly stopping to ask if you'd like something to drink. One day they did run out of pool towels by noon. Glad I already had mine. The night before we left we stopped by the Casino Host (as recommended by a gentlemen we met at the pool). We explained about our room(s) on the day we checked in and the lack of concern by the front desk or housekeeping. The casino host was very gracious and in awe that we were not upgraded after the 2nd dirty room. She comped us 2 nights of our 4 night stay. All in all - I would never recommend this property - They need to be more concerned about customer service - I truly felt they didn't care unless you were spending $10,000 in their casino!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but Lacking Ammenities”
Reviews.Author: CLMA_GA
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and very large. There was, however, no hair dryer or coffee maker. In recent years, I have seen very few hotels that did not provide these. As to cleanliness, everything was okay, with the exception of an intake vent on the left side of the bathroom vanity, which was filthy. The on-premises restaurants gave very large portions with an accomanying VERY high price. An ordinary breakfast at a cafe there, cost $46 for two. There was no internet service provided in the room, unless you brought your own laptop, which would cost $36 to hook up. We had to pay $5 for a 5-minute minimum at their business center. We had no complaint with the service at the hotel other than when we were checking in, an Asian employee decided I needed help walkng from the front of the line to the desk clerk, and nearly tripped me up trying to "help" me. Since I am not crippled or anything else, I don't know why this happened! The service otherwise was fine. The pool was fine, but the accompanying whirlpool spa had very hot water, and the temperture that day was around 100 degrees. I don't gamble much, but from what I could tell, there were no problems with the casino. Smoking needs to be better controlled in the nightclub areas. We declined to go to any because of the smoke. The Forum mall, of course, is wonderful. I never get enough of it!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what more anyone else can deliver”
Reviews.Author: Fletch32
Reviews.Content: Stayed August 2-7 at Caesars, my wife and I on an anniversary pleasure trip. We checked in after 11pm and got a room in the Augustus Tower. I'm not sure if it was an on-spot upgrade, or if was part of the deal I got for the room. I was not comped a room, or set up as a high-roller, but got a work-related discount. I tipped the girl $20 anyways just because I was already prepared to. We were on the 36th floor, so our room overlooked the Bellagio and the fountains. The first day we kept the drapes open to remind ourselves of the novelty of our Vegas trip and the killer view we had of the Strip. But, we quickly learned our lesson. It's August in the desert, and though the windows are tinted, they give off heat like a baking dish out of the oven. The drapes stayed closed the rest of the trip, except a little at night, and we made the mental note of not caring what view we had next time we book a room in Vegas. Huge bathroom in the Augustus Tower, with separate jetted tub and shower, plus a separate room for the toilet and double sinks. Outstanding set-up - just like home, plus a mini flat-screen TV. The highlight of our Caesars experience was the pools. We were there every day for at least 3 hours. It was no trouble getting a good spot by the water, other guests at the hotel were friendly and we watched each other's stuff if someone went to the bathroom or snack shop, or for a swim out of eye-contact from their belongings. Prompt service sold beer by the bucket and mixed drinks from a full-service bar. We were all amused by the Venus Pool scene. We never actually went in the European-sunbathing "club" pool, but ads would suggest that it is some in-scene with half-naked celebrities and models. My wife and other neighboring women at the pool watched the Venus entrance and saw college-aged guys filing in, one after another, with an occasional 30-ish couple. Not to take pot-shots at Caesars and the image they want that pool to have, but what we saw from the outside on a Friday, Saturday and Sunday afternoon was a Spring Break sausage party that might make the most robust exhibitionist a little squeamish at dropping her top. Speaking of celebrities and in-scenes, Pure has become the new place to be in the Vegas scene. It's quite an interesting scene around midnight when the line to get in wraps around the sports book and Pussycat Dolls area. We ate at the 808 (Asian-Pacific seafood) and the brunch buffet at Cafe Lago. The brunch was $23.50 a person, which you eventually learn is pretty much the going rate in the heart of the strip. Crab legs and salmon were among the marquee items offered along with eggs, omelettes, pancakes, waffles, etc. Our dinner at 808 was absolutely outstanding. The Cypress Street area was a very under-rated experience of Caesars. It's their "mall food-court" area in the casino and we ate there more than we would have anticipated beforehand. Plus, the Java Coast coffee shop was open and serving great coffee on both mornings when I was up and about at 5:30am. I worried when only one restaurant was deemed with 24-hour service since I'm an early-riser who likes coffee. We saw Jerry Seinfeld perform live at The Coliseum, which was an excellent venue - and of course, the show was very memorable. The casino layout was fantastic, with a monsterous sports book area. Caesars now has a little novelty area where the Pussycat Dolls deal blackjack and dance in little cages. It creates quite a scene in there. Very Vegas. We thought the service in the casino area wavered between adequate and outstanding. Just when you realize you hadn't seen a cocktail waitress in more than 10 minutes, three come within 5 minutes. (At Bellagio, there to watch "O", we got there early to gamble and have some cocktails. Not one waitress was seen in 20 minutes in the slot area. At the sports book, I sat at the bar and played video poker and ordered a beer. The bartender then handed me a tab - saying I needed to put at least $20 into the machine and bet at least $1 per hand to get a free drink. I laughed and asked about the guys riding a $2 Hollywood Park horserace wager for a half-hour and three stiff drinks. He shot me a dirty look and told me the penny slots were wide open. So by those snobbish standards, Caesars was even more warm and welcoming.) There are cheaper hotel rooms with more modest accommodations, and more tables with minimum bets lower than $25. But even after having visited The Mirage, Bellagio, Venetian, New York, Paris ... I can't see what anyone else can offer that tops what Caesars has. If any of those come close, Caesars runs away from the pack with that intangible feel of old-school Vegas, but with all the modern toys and perks of a 5-star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Gives High Roller Treatment to a Low Roller!”
Reviews.Author: LtColBuckRobley
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights comped at Caesars in a Standard Room beginning on 7/29. We used the airport check-in and were placed in the Forum Tower, but were told the room wasn't ready and we could pick up our keys at the keys and mail desk when we got to the hotel. Two huge conventions were in town and many strip hotels were completely sold out. When we got to the hotel we were told the wait for a room was two hours. I have a Total Rewards Platinum card and decided to check in at the platinum desk and see if anything might be available. We're not what I call "hotel divas" and don't complain about much. However, my wife had read some of the reviews of the older towers and asked if we could be placed in a remodeled room. Expecting to be turned down politely we were stunned by the response. The young lady at the front desk smiled and replied: "you guys are lucky you found me." Wow! She gave us a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite in the Augustus Tower with a view of the Bellagio fountains on floor 39. When we tried to tip her a twenty she just waved us off. Needless to say the room and service were incredible! The room itself had plasma televisions in both the bathroom and living room area, plus a couch and sitting area. The bathroom had not only a shower, but jacuzzi tub. Two sinks in the bathroom are great when you're trying to get ready at the same time. It was immaculately clean. Plenty of towels and bathrobes hanging in the closet for our use. My wife loved the turn down service with the chocolates on the bed at night. In short, it made you feel like a high roller and we really aren't huge gamblers. We only ate at one of their restaurants, a food court near the sports book. It was excellent and reasonably priced. Their other restaurants were a little more expensive than we were willing to go. The pool area was incredibly beautiful and not crowded at all. My wife spent two afternoons there and loved it. The casino is huge, but navigable. I placed some bets on baseball in the sportsbook and was given some complimentary drink tickets. Didn't win anything in the casino, but I didn't lose much either. Table minimums start at 25 dollars and head skyward from there. So I stuck mostly to video poker and sports betting. When I asked a gentleman for directions to the promotions desk he didn't tell me or show me where to go. He walked me there. All in all, I couldn't have asked for a more pleasant stay. I've stayed in many places in Vegas but have never had an experience that compares to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Nick2
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to go back to Ceasars Palace. I booked my stay directly on Ceasars' web page. I avoided the older towers, as reviews indicated the rooms in the older towers have problems. Upon checking in, I was given a free upgrade to a junior executive suite in the Palace tower. The room was excellent; way above 5 Stars !! A very comfortable king bed, in a large suite. The bathroom was a suite in itself; 2 separate toilet/sink areas linked by a double (i.e. two head & control) shower, with a double wide jacuzzi tub. The room was clean and well furnished. Note: My stay was mid-week during the so-called low season. So, while the upgrade was very nice, it was not too surprising. I would not expect an upgrade over a weekend or during the busier seasons. I used the gym and spa, both were very, very nice. The coed gym has a large collection of mid-grade aerobic equipment, an excellent circuit of high quality weight machines, and some free weights. I got a massage ($140 for 50 mins), which was nice and included use of the spa area. The segregated spa area included several steam rooms, many hot tubs, and a tea area with TV, juices, and tea. The staff was very attentive and professional. It was a great place to relax. The much hyped arctic room, however, was a chilly room with soap bubbles used to simulate snow. Kinda a joke. But that's the only thing anywhere close to being negative about the spa. The outdoor pool areas were very nice and kept orderly by the staff. As one must be over 21 to go into the Venus pool area (as topless sunbathing is allowed), it was a nice place to go and be assured there would be no kids around. In contrast to the quality of everything else, the buffet was a disappointment as it was only "okay." Nothing really bad, just not the high quality of everything else. The desk staff was very nice and helpful during both check in and check out. For check-out (normally 11 AM), I requested a late checkout (1 hour late at 12 noon), which they quickly approved. I cannot recommend Ceasars highly enough. I can not wait to go back to Ceasars !!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: black743
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and had the perfect location. Easy walk to major Vegas attractions. The attached Forum Shops meant never having to leave the hotel for lunch/dinner if you didn't want to...lots to see and do inside the hotel and Forum Shops.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: sbworcs
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Caesars in early July. Was more expensive than other hotels on the strip but thought we would book Caesars to get the full Vegas experience. As we were on Honeymoon, the receptionist gave us an upgraded room in the Forum Tower that included a Jacuzzi in the middle of the room. Great, we thought. However, once you get past the novelty of having a Jacuzzi in the room I found it to be little more than an average accomodation. The room was rather small with little storage space. The bathroom was nice but this seems at the expense of the bedroom. The sound insulation of the room was really poor. We could hear every conversation, TV program and visit to the bathroom that the people in the next room made. The cleaner did not do a partucularly great job each day either (toilet rolls not replaced, sheets not fitted properly) Loved Vegas but next time I go I would not waste money on Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: NovAbroad
Reviews.Content: We booked a family holiday on the West Coast of US and stayed at Crowne Plaza Garden Grove, Caesars Las Vegas, Crowne Plaza Union Square San Francisco and Crowne Plaza Redondo Beach LA. I am a Priority Club member that is why my preference for Crowne Plaza. There were 7 of us in two rooms at each hotel. We wanted to splurge a little in Vegas (not gambling) and were offered an upgrade at the Caesars reception desk which we accepted (for a fee of course). This gave us a Junior Suite in the Palace Tower on the 14th floor and it was well worth it with two bathroom accesses and more floor space for the big family. The finish in the rooms was first class. View over the pools was great but couldn't see much of the strip. We only stayed 3 nights (in the middle of the recent heatwave) but found the location a great central position for our planned stay. Would stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Spilled Steak Sauce All Over Me”
Reviews.Author: NorthShoreLI
Reviews.Content: One of my best friends took his 21 year old Son and 6 college friends to Caesers this past weekend. I came along to hang out with my buddy as the college kids kept their own late hours of 6 & 7 AM returns to go to sleep. We had nice, clean, serviceable rooms in the Roman Tower which worked out great. We rented a cabana for two days which made all the difference during the day for everyone, since it was 109 degrees outside. The gambling was fun, but the 21 year olds ended up gambling quite a bit somewhere else as the minimums were pretty much $ 25.00 during the weekend. The big problem we had and which really has soured me on this hotel is that while eating dinner at the very ordinary, but dressed up Nero's a waiter from another table dropped steak sauce all over my back. Now instead of stopping and apologizing right away, one of the other members of our party who witnessed the action, heard him say, Oh, $%^& and proceed to head into the kitchen quickly. We called for the manager and he then called security as that is how they handle these procedures. Then I had to fill in an incident report, which was submitted and I was told they would gt back to me. The steak sauce ruinde my shirt and pants, I had to change into my last days clothes a day early to continue our evening and then when I asked about it at check out they told me that the incident report would be in the incedent reports office and they would contact me. The front desk apologized for the incident. Today I called the hotel and they said it will take a week for someone to get back to me as they are backed up with investigations. They did not ask for my incident, but said all incidents take this long. I am extremely dissastisifed with how they are handling this and their indifference to the whole thing. My cleaner said the stains will not come out, so I am out some pretty expensive clothing and lots of time trying to resolve this matter. Caesar's Palace has really dropped the ball on this one and made a very nice stay into a customer who will not return and suggest to all of you to beware of this indifference and to stay away. And by rhe way, my Prime Steak at Nero's was a piece of choice meat I could get at any grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “a palace in the desert”
Reviews.Author: man_from_Brum
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel that we really looked forward to staying in we got a very good price $150 a night with a upgrade to a jucuzzi room that also included free passes to the spa (all thanks to expedia). the lady on the desk gave us a strip view on the second highest floor that was great,The room was big and very clean with mirrors everywhere to give the impression of size (including one over the bed that was fun). All in all we injoyed the,stay the gambling was great the staff was helpful and there was no timeshare sellers there like most other hotels on the strip (excalibur hotel etc) the only problem was when the next room use there sink it came up into the room we was staying and made a horrible noise from the plug hole and also dirt appeared in the sink,the hotel tried to fix the problem but it carried on for the two days we were there, also try eating elswhere the food is expensive and not the best on the strip (i didnt go into the spa but was told it was worth going to)also try seeing the celine dion show it is worth it (she is only on stage for 75 minutes but is worth the price)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMR
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay over the 4th of July. We got a great internet rate, which made this hotel affordable. Stayed in the Palace Tower which has very good access to pool area and short walk to forum shops. As a tip, check in at the airport baggage claim area to avoid long check in lines at the hotel. Staff at the airport was very helpful in providing a room earlier than normal check in time. Our room was very comfortable and clean. No problems with staff or service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: irishgal82
Reviews.Content: Wow is all I can say. I was staying in Vegas with my 15 year old brother as we have relatives there and I had booked two nights for him to experience the strip. We didnt check in til 9pm on the Sunday as we were busy but when we did I decided not to try the $20 trick. I just asked if there was any possibility of getting a strip view (we had a classic room booked) While we didn't get the strip view we did get a pool view and got upgraded to a junior suite in the palace tower. Naturally I gave the girl the $20 tip. The room was just fab with two bathrooms and a connecting double headed shower. I just loved the jacuzzi bath too and the turn down service with the chocolates on your pillow was great. Ate in the buffet once for breakfast and it was good. Spent an afternoon by the pool which was nice but the main pool wasn't open. Also be warned the portions at snackus maximus are huge - you could really share! Only did a little gambling like 20mins each night on the slots didnt really win anything but it was fun! Overall next time im in vegas I would have no reservations booking caesars but might try somewhere else just to experience it!

Reviews.Title: “Best pools in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SanAntonioStyle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four days at Caesar's Palace and loved it... especially the 4 pools. There were always places to lay (even on Friday and Saturday) and the service was exceptional. The Palm Restaurant in the Forum Shops was fabulous--huge portions. My wife and I saw the Celine Dion Show...simply amazing, and I am not even a big fan. This show (singing, dancing, acrobats, props/design) is definitely for husbands to take their wives, even if they have never heard of or like Celine Dion. The service at Caesar's Palace was also great: there when you needed someone, but not in your face. Try to book a corner room (where the hotel's architecture bends) since it is bigger than a standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: zak276
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palce is a jaw dropping hotel, it is sooooooooo beautiful, Everything was perfect in this hotel i couldn't fault anything - and i mean that. The forum shops are amazing you have to walk through them, The restaurants are great and generally everything is Fabulous you'll love it without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Katimae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our fist and last trip to Vegas. Caesar's was just like everything else in Vegas, all surface with no substance. When we arrived we were very disappointed with our room, it was much smaller and less attractive than we expected from such a big name (and for the prices we paid!) Finally, after the second night of sheets and towels with holes and being miserable and uncomfortable my husband complained and we were upgraded. The new room was MUCH nicer, but still we've paid less and stayed in nicer resorts in Mexico. Our number one complaint though is the pools. They had 4 pools, one had a cover charge of $20 a person and the other three were constantly closed. When they were open they were full of badly behaved children and floating garbage. We didn't realize Vegas has gone from "sin city" to "small children with no parental supervision city". Also, all of the pools are only 3 1/2 feet deep, little help in 117 degree weather!

Reviews.Title: “Will not return to Caesars”
Reviews.Author: lcdckc
Reviews.Content: We just returned on July 5 after 4 days. We were disappointed. I have to say we read the negative reviews and we tried it anyway, we should have listened to the reviews. Our room was dirty. The employees seemed nice. All our problems were taken care of. We had to be moved because of room cleanliness. It was way to overpriced. The food was not good. For 4 people to eat the lunch buffet was 84.00. Rip off. We will stay somewhere different on our next Vegas trip. We gambled at alot of the casinos and Caesars I have to say was the worst. There machines and table didn't pay out even a little to keep you going for a while. Never go in July 116 degrees. We will go next time in the winter or spring. If you don't have alot of money to spend this is not a vacation you want to take. We found nothing cheap in vegas. I thought July was off season but the crowds were incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Upgrade, not so fantastic gambing!”
Reviews.Author: furiousgeorge
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just come back from 12 nights in Las Vegas - we spent the last 3 nights at Caesers. We had booked a Classic room, but having read the reviews thought we would try for an upgrade. When we checked in I asked the clerk for 'a favour as it was our anniversary - could she give us a nice room?'. She made a call and booked us into a petit-suite on the 25th floor of the Palace Tower for no extra charge. The room was lovely with a fantastic view of the pool area, and the bathroom was huge! His and Hers bathrooms with a double walk-in shower in the middle. Whirlpool bath & loads of toiletries too. The Palace Tower was right next to the pool area - just straight down the elevator and out. The pool area was nice - 4 to choose from - but there weren't many parasols so you had to be quick if you wanted one. Sounds obvious but you're better getting drinks yourself from the snack bar 'snackus maximus' rather than from the pool servers. We said 'yes' to an offer of water and were charged $5 for a bottle of designer water from a server - you can buy bottles for less at the snack bar. We were also charged $20 for 2 margaritas - but the price was the same for virgin versions! Be careful with the mini-bar and souvenirs in the rooms - they are on sensors so when I lifted something up it was instantly charged to our bill! A call to room service and housekeeping corrected this. The Palms restaurant in the Forum shops was excellent - great steaks and we got a free slab of gorgeous cheesecake! Bradley Ogden inside the casino was also lovely - menu was limited but they have different dishes every day apparently - also got a free mini-pud there too! The Augustus cafe (by the check-in desk) was good for breakfast - you get a real plateful. Gets pretty busy though - we went there on sunday after we checked out and waited for 20 mins only to be told we couldn't go in as we had our luggage with us. We were told we could leave our luggage at the bell-desk and come back, but there's no way we were going to start queuing again! Overall we really liked the hotel and location, and were delighted with our upgrade. Unfortunately the casino slots were tight and we didn't win a thing, I also lost at Blackjack so they got their money's worth from us after all!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the casino, shopping, hated the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: crapsbaby
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night. The casino was nice and clean with lots of tables and slots. There were lots to do. Many restaurants to choose from and so many shops. The pools were beautiful. My family stayed in the Centurion Tower and I believe it's the older of all the towers. There was no ice machine anywhere on that tower. I was told the new towers have them. I like to get ice whenever I want and not wait forever for it. We ordered a mini refridgerator for $10 a night, but after 6 hours of not getting it, we cancelled the order. We had two rooms and the carpets had alot of stains in it and the curtains had a hole or two. The furniture was in good condition. One of the mirror lights in the bathroom sink was not working and the shower water temperature was barely warm enough. The bathtub water and sink got to be much warmer. Dunno why. But it's 115 here, so a cold shower isn't bad. If you do stay in Caesar's try a different tower. If you like a view of Bellagio's fountain I believe the Augustus Tower has a great view. And I think the Palace Tower has a view of the pool area. The maid to my mom's room opened her door and saw my mom before knocking and asking if she needed more bottled water. We thought that was sort of weird. There were no security guards manning the elevator's entryway checking for room card keys like most other hotel casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Our Wedding at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: coopertrooper2001
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding at Caesars and it was perfect. We had it in the Venus Garden and it was a perfect setting. For us we were glad we did it outside as the chapels (although nice) were not for us. We also checked out the intimate garden and would recommend you stay away from this as it was very noisey from traffic and a big extractor fan. The wedding co-ordinator was fantastic (Shani) and the catering co-ordinator (Nicole) was great, we had a super meal at Neros. Our room (Palace tower spa room) was first class! Absolutely great times had at Caesars (15 of us stayed there). Couldnt recommend it more highly the memories will stay with us forever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: karigirlfriend
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars from June 28th-July1st and it was awesome. The room in the Augustus Tower was huge and clean. The housekeeping service was wonderful. We went to the Venus pool and the Neptune pool. Both were crowded (weekend) but lovely. This hotel is pricey but I expected that before I came. Dinner at Rao was great. We went to the shadow bar which was different. Overall we had a great stay at Caesars. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Caesar's”
Reviews.Author: ACmama
Reviews.Content: I went out for a fully comped trip from June 18-24, never having stayed at Caesar's Palace. Check in was very quick and pleasant, our room was on the 42nd floor of the Augustus Tower overlooking the fountains in front of the Bellagio. Truly beautiful view. The room was enormous and quite clean although there was a bunch of items for sale on top of the dresser which, when I went to move them out of the way, revealed a 1/2 inch of dust bunnies. I came to learn on check out that these items sit on an electronically sensored tray which charges them to your room if they are moved. Likewise with the refrigerator. We weren't told until checkout that we could have requested housekeeping to bring us a refrigerator for our own use, so we were using the honor fridge for our own water etc. The front desk cheerfully and promptly removed all the charges for this, but we would have liked to know about the fridge ahead of time. We were there for almost a week, after all. Thankfully we thought to bring our own coffee pot since there isn't one in the room. The pool complex is outstanding. We ate at Nero's and Rao's which were worth the money. Cocktail service on the gaming floor was prompt. The staff was uniformly pleasant and helpful and I would say this is a very well-run hotel. Great location and free shuttles to the Rio. Very quiet room - didn't once hear other guests, housekeeping or doors slamming. Nightly turn down service with fresh towels, chocolates and trash emptied.

Reviews.Title: “DOn't stay at Ceasars!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1703a
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ceasar at June 2007 for a week. I was thinking for the price I paid (even thought I was getting a group discount), there should be some value. I was wrong. The service was horrable. The houskeeping would forget to clean your room, or if you are "lucky" it will get cleaned around 6 pm. I tried few restourants and the food was not goot at all. They even charging for the internet $13.00 per night! They are making money on everything. You can stay at Ceasars if you coming to play and go to the bars (they have a lot of them), but other then that I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. It is a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ldlowe04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very pleased with our stay here. We were upgraded to the Augustus Tower, 45th floor and the room was very nice, modern with LCD TV, sleek linens, marble bathroom with mini LCD TV. I have seen many negative reviews about the Classic Rooms in the Roman/Centurion Towers so I would suggest to all travellers to request a Palace or Augustus Tower room when checking in. Also, I find that in Vegas, you get a better room if you arrive/check in late (11PM) and it never hurts to ask for what you want. We were also very impressed with the 24 hr. Augustus Cafe. The food was delicious, however, the prices were the same high prices as every other 24hr. hotel cafe on the strip. Our bill came to $120 (4 people) for cafe food, but to no surprise. The breakfast buffet at Cafe Lago was just ok. Your typical buffet style food. Nothing to write home about. The best item would probably be the freshmade omlettes. We were a little disappointed with the spa treatments but very impressed with the overall spa amenities. I guess having travelled to Thailand for an exotic real Thai massage for $10/hr., you can't really justify in your own mind paying $210 for a service which was just mediocre. A bit pricey for what you're getting, nonetheless. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Caesars and would probably try Wynn and Venetian next before coming back here. Out of all the hotels we've stayed at in LV, Bellagio is still the best, but Caesars would probably come in 2nd.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars”
Reviews.Author: Jackie-London
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day stay at Caesars Palace and loved it. We stayed in the Augustus Tower which was fabulous. We had plasma screens in the bedroom and the bathroom, a huge jacuzzi style bath and a double shower unit. Everything about the hotel is classy. The swimming pools are amazing and never crowded. We had 2 days by the Venus pool which is for over 21's and had a great time, what a beautiful pool. All of staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and welcoming. We found the prices very reasonable, it was a lot cheaper than we expected. This was our 9th trip to Vegas and we normally stay at the Paris (which is also fabulous) this was our 1st stay at Caesars. We will definately stay here next year. Cant fault the hotel at all. Will definately recommend it. Ignore the negative comments. Caesars was fabulous

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful luxury hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Ronin27
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two days at Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas, having had a wonderful experience. The hotel, gaming spaces, and attached Forum Shops mall were all beautifully appointed. My room in the Palace Tower was lovely, with a very comfy bed, huge bathroom, and oh so tempting mini-bar. Spent an afternoon at the huge, beautiful pool and felt like I was truly at a luxury resort. The thing I liked best about Caesar's was the sense of tranquility. Even though it was a busy time, with lots of people all around, I never felt overwhelmed and annoyed by the crowd as I have at other, lower tier hotels during previous Las Vegas stays. The staff were all very helpful and very polite and treated me like I was an important guest, even though I am very much middle class and wasn't throwing money around. The thing I liked least about Caesar's was the cost of food. Yes, I understand that it is a higher class of place, but $25 for the dinner buffet ($15 breakfast and $17.50 lunch) was absurd, even though it was very, very good. Prices were unrealistically high at the other restraints as well, forcing me to look elsewhere for a reasonable meal. That being said, Would would I return to Caesar's Palace for another stay? Absolutely! My time there was fun, relaxing, and entirely worth every penny (especially since I wrangled a greatd eal at their website).

Reviews.Title: “Best spot on strip”
Reviews.Author: brooke16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars last august and I did really enjoy it. It has the best location, because its right in the middle of the strip and and is a very busy spot with both the giant fabulous mall and many restaurants. We had a room in the old tower, i cant remember the name, but the room was spacious and clean. It was a little outdated but the bathroom was modern and lovely. I had a friend staying in the augustus tower who had a beautiful renovated room but when in las vegas you do not spend too much time in the room so it was a little unnessecary for me. The only thing that was odd about our room was that you used the key intially to obtained access to a hallway and then at the end of the hall were two doors. One led to our room and the other was just a door that didnt need a key card it was a deadbolt that we could open. I tried it to see where it lead and it brought me into another room witha a piano and a man was in there. It was rather embarrasing. Besides this Caesars is a great place to stay while in las vegas. I also would not recommend their buffet

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: dm721
Reviews.Content: This property was a major disappointment - the room decor is dated and tired. The service was terrible. Had to change rooms because the first room in a non-smoking tower reeked of smoke. I would have thought the maid would have noticed, but she left the last occupants dirty sox hangin in the shower too! The service at all the bars and restaurants was extremely slow - more than once we had to go ask someone to find our server. Their business model is obviously to overcharge for food & beverage and skrimp on staff. I travel for both business and pleasure all the time, and I thought I was used to how hotels tend to nickel & dime you - but this place has taken it to a whole new level. Plus the staff was generally surly and couldn't even answer simple questions about the property (more than once we were mis-directed to restaurants or shops by staff). The Roman empire is obviously in decline.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time wasn't a charm”
Reviews.Author: tlkdw5
Reviews.Content: 1st stay was nice. 2nd stay we had our children with us, so we requested 2 adjoining rooms. We had to wait in an extremely long line to check in, then had to wait an hour for the rooms to be cleaned.
