We immediately had to call maintenance because the pipes in the kids' bathroom were making a terrible noise. That never stopped! Ice machine was broken. And then on the last day we were up very early to catch our flight. We woke to no hot water and when we called about it, all they said was they knew there was a problem. (In other words, we were just out of luck!) Our rooms were in the Roman Tower which, in my opinion, needs to be torn down and rebuit. Will not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonH1981
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in april, it was fantastic, the rooms were huge the bathroom was massive with a hot tub big enough for 2. the casino area is great. All the staff are very helpful and always egar to please. the pool areas are great, with loads of sunbeds, she shopping area in ceasars is amazing, its huge and really grand. i will definatly come back to vegas but properly stay at the bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: jewelsmum
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to our stay at Caesar's as friends had recommended it as "one of the best places to stay" in Vegas. I was disappionted. We were in the older section in a very strange little room. The bathroom had NO doors what so ever, even on the toilet! We've been married for 12yrs but this was a little more "togetherness" than we wanted! The housekeeping staff were so friendly and sweet, but the cleaning was a bit lax. There were fuzzy dust bunnies on the ceiling above the bathroom lights, and peanuts on the floor in the corners of the room (that weren't ours!). The linens were clean and nice quality, and the bed comfortable. The door to the adjoining room must be made out of cardboard. We could hear every conversation the neighbours had, and when they came back to the room at 4am (2 nights in a row) drunk and partying, woke us up. The final straw was when their pot-smoke came wafting under the door into our room. We decided to spend a day at the Venus Pool and splurged on "day beds" which were $150/day. I didn't realize that the pool was run by the nightclub or I might have not bothered. It was full of so-called "beautiful people" (ie/surgically or steroid enhanced) trying to hook up. Our friends waited over an hour for the guy to bring an umbrella (we tried to move one ourselves and were told not to). The music was good but very loud, the drinks were ridiculously expensive, and the water was from Norway at $6 for a small bottle (no, seriously). They messed up my lunch order and made no effort to compensate for their error. By the end of the day the water was a disgusting cess-pool of tanning oil and who knows what else, we didn't even want to go in. The final insult was when we received the bill at the end of the day ...and they'd tacked on about $75 in "gratuities"...we'd already tipped everyone in cash!! The location is good, right in the center of things on the strip, but we left feeling a bit ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SurferBetty
Reviews.Content: I was expecting so much more from this hotel. It wasn't terrible but as I said, my expectations were so much higher. Honestly, I booked this hotel due to Jerry Seinfeld's appearance and what I saw and read about the pool. Check in at the airport was quick and simple. Booked a roundtrip shuttle as well. We arrived at the hotel and went directly to our room. Caesar's is very spread out and the staff's directions are extremely vague - which is actually much like Italy (hahaha..smirking to myself right now). Our room was in Palace Tower. The room was decent size, but I think probably typical room size for Vegas. The bathroom was good size. One light over the sinks was broken. The bars in front of the sinks were broken. Jacuzzi tub did not work. No biggie, but I figured housekeeping would catch these. The TV stations were terrible. I realize you aren't there to watch TV, but we were hoping to catch the Sopranos finale. The pool area was OK. Pool side service was terrible. Very hard to get a drink. We gave our order to a server and after an hour later we got our own drinks at the bar. The 2nd day we rented a bed by the pool. It was pricey but it was nice luxury. The cabanas were too expensive for just 2 but if we were traveling with another couple or two, it would have definitely been worth it. Courtney, our server the day we rented the bed was great! She was so attentive and on top of things, unlike the regular bar servers. I thought the pools were small and they seemed dirty. The tiles were slimey. My husband liked the hotel and said he'd stay again, however I'll try another place. Like I said, it wasn't terrible but I just expected a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip - Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: 2getaway2
Reviews.Content: Transportation: The taxi ride to the hotel was $15. Another option you could use is the shuttle service from the airport $7 per person. Arrival: Check in was easy. Front desk staff were personable and professional. They upgraded my classic room to deluxe free of charge and I didn't even ask for one. They were aware I was attending a conference and pointed me in the direction where the conference was being held and other attractions at the hotel. Room: The room was gorgeous...the best I've ever stayed! Decor was modern and clean. The view of Vegas was amazing. The marble bathroom was huge with double sinks, shower and spa tub. Vanity was just outside the bathroom. There was a plasma tv and well stocked mini-bar. (warning: mini-bar had sensors and sometimes charges just for picking up things as I found out during check-out...I was not charged in the end and staff were very nice about it) The bed and linen were the luxurious and comfortable. The only fault in the room that I could find was that the closet door was coming off the hinge slightly and jammed once in awhile, but that's being really picky. Pool: There are 4 pools and more than enough area to relax. Beautiful pools, even better than the pictures online. One pool was designated European sunbathing/topless. Activities: I was there on a business trip, but Caesars is such a huge place you really don't have to leave the hotel. Everything is there: pools, restaurants, shopping, shows, casino and clubs. Caesars is well known for the Forum shops, Celine Dion, Pure and PCD Lounge. Restaurants: I went to Spago and Mesa Grill. It can be a little noisy at Spago, since it is in the Forum shop area. Service was excellent at both. Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill was worth the wait...book early if you can. Location: Very Central. Walking distance to a lot of other hotels. I wanted to check out other shops, restaurants, and shows and had no problem walking. Service: Excellent! Overall: Will be back....this time for a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Hail Caesars!!”
Reviews.Author: Eunice2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars during our 17 night holiday in Vegas. We also stayed at the Nugget and Wynn. I agree with the comment from another Brit - if you have a problem with Caesars try staying in a supposedly 4* hotel in the UK - no comparison. We booked our hotels with Expedia and got a free upgrade and 2 free spa passes at Caesars (which we didn't use, funny how you can run out of time even in 17 days!!) Stayed in the Palace Tower which was so handy for the pool, room was good really spacious and clean (again the UK really falls down badly on room sizes and clean bathrooms!). Found the casino really manic especially after Wynn but as it is centre strip what do you expect. Didn't eat at Caesars except at "Snaxus Maximus" by the pool this was very reasonably priced. Drinks service at the pool was excellent given that it was so busy. Oh, we also ate at the Augustas cafe which was also pretty good Had a few bottles of Champagne at the Seahorse Bar which wasn't too packed. We just love Vegas there is nowhere else where you can sit in the sun all day if you want to , shop all day if you want, to gamble all day if you want to, eat anytime of the day or night, see the best shows ( we saw Stomp Out Loud, Love and O) all fantastic. Free live music in the bars - brilliant - especially at Paris The weather was great very hot, have been to Vegas 4 times before and this the hottest time yet, I love that it isn't humid at all and NO FLYS!!! We did hire a car for the duration of our holiday which we always do, even the new car hire centre was great - no queues We also went to Laughlin for a few days for a bit of a break Americans - you don't know how lucky you are having all this without needing a passport. All in all Caesars was a great base for the last week of our trip. We'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but still nice”
Reviews.Author: givemethemusic
Reviews.Content: I made a lot of mistakes in planning my first Vegas trip, and the mistakes didn't stop once I arrived. My fiancee and I had to extend our one night stay to two nights, and when the MGM Grand couldn't accomodate us for another night, I called around to all the hotels on the strip to find a new room. I spent $313 for a Palace Tower room with a whirlpool spa and king size bed at Caesar's. Should have taken the Wynn Executive Suite at $350, but I'm a schmuck, or at least shouldn't have let the Caesar's reservation agent talk me into the palace tower instead of the regular room at $180. Specifically requested non-smoking, didn't get it. Oh well. I was pissed and had stopped caring. The hotel is faux beautiful. Not beautiful like Bellagio or the gorgeous Wynn, faux beautiful. The pools were nice, but as a 6'2" dude, I longed for something deeper than 3'6". We checked in around noon and were given our room immediately, always nice. Big property, but after dealing with MGM Grand, this place was a mini-mart. The room was very pretty, but very small for the price. Was expecting something much bigger, considering I got a cushy suite at MGM for less than half what I paid here. Here's my advice: If you're gonna spend $200+ on a hotel room on the Strip, get a super nice room at MGM or Mirage or ti, or go to Bellagio or the Wynn instead. This place just isn't worth it. Maybe it's because Harrah's owns it. Not a Harrah's fan.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room”
Reviews.Author: Philly_Romantic
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a complimentary stay (5/26-6/1) at Caesars in their Premium Palace Tower Room. Although I have been to Las Vegas several times in the past, I had never stayed at Caesars. The room is beautiful. I loved the upgraded amenities such as the flat screen tv, the spa tub, and the extra room for entertaining. The only major problem I experienced is that the room had not been dusted in about 10 years. I actually blew dust off of the the mini bar items and from the entertainment unit. I also cleaned the coffee table that was in the room. With such a beautiful set up, I can't imagine why the housecleaning staff has not been instructed to really dust the rooms from time to time. The bed was extremely comfortable and I had a wonderful view (17th floor) of the Caesars pool area (one which is for European bathing). The service at the pool was great and timely (try the Angus Beef Nachos-great!). I also had services at the Salon. Everyone was very nice and the services were not that costly. I enjoyed my stay very much. Caesars is a huge facility. It is very easy to get turned around in the Casino since it is so big. Besides that and the dust, I enjoyed my stay and would recommend it highly in the Augustus or Palace Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, clean hotel, casino, pool is tops in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wakefieldfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Palace Tower room which is a deluxe room. It is the same price as Augustus tower which I think is slightly nicer deluxe room as the rooms are new versus renovated. We requested Augustus but it was not guaranteed and for Memorial Day weekend they were full. The Palace tower room was very modern, unbelievable bathroom and constant service going on in the rooms, always clean towels, trash removed chocolates, etc. The view from this room on the 24th floor was good view of strip and The Mirage. The great thing is the proximity to the pool. If you stay in Augustus tower you will have to walk through casino to get to the pool. There are 5 pools and they are all gorgeous. Outstanding service. We spent a lot of time at Bellagio hotel as well and we like Caesars a bit better as we are in our late 30's early 40's and there just isn't as much happening over there. Casino at both Caesars and Bellagio were much nicer to me than The Palms, Paris or Ballys. Venetian was comparable and also seemed like a nice hotel although I didn't see the rooms or pool. Highly recommend Caesars deluxe accomodations, I think the reviewers that are unhappy were in standard rooms.

Reviews.Title: “As Expected”
Reviews.Author: prs2007
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas to see the UFC Championship fight and stayed at Caesars Palace for two nights. I had not been to Las Vegas before this and wasn't exactly sure what to expect. Here are my observations. 1) Vegas is not a family place. It is what it is. You go for the gambling, the shows, the partying. It is never someplace I would take my kids. I was surprised at the number of kids I saw. 2) Vegas is not cheap. Somehow my impression of Vegas before I went was that it wouldn't be overpriced. Food would be reasonable and rooms reasonable. Food is expensive. Breakfast onsite consists of a $10 muffin if you want quick and cheap. There are a couple of Denny/IHop type joints within walking distance but their prices are a little higher then the usual fare at home. All of which is fine, but I expected different. The rooms during the week are a little less about $180 a night and reasonable for the 'class' of room we stayed in. The same room went to $400 a night for the weekend. Definitely not cheap. 3) Caesars has a nice setup at their hotel. There is a shopping forum with any and every imaginable retailer located there. All pricey and most of us did alot of window shopping only. Their pools are very nice. One is 'european style' so be aware of that. They have cabanas (some air conditioned) and the usual bar/food available. Vegas is HOT. Most bathers were in the pool at 9 am and out by noon. Back in around 4 pm. Between 11 am and 4 pm most people were in an air conditioned building somewhere. Caesars also have very good bell hop and front desk setup. Well marked, and broken into various services: 1) key/mail, 2) check in, 3) check out, etc. Easy traffic flow. 4) There is a 'monorail' that runs along about 8 stops/casinos. It does not go to the airport, so you have to use a cab (about $13 one way), a shuttle (about $7 one way) or a car service (about $50 one way) for airport transfers. However, the monorail was a great option for us to get from Caesars (the stop is across from Caesars at the Flamingo) to the MGM Grand for the fight we saw. It was $5 a person and only a 5 minute ride. One more comment on the airport - it is only about a 10 minute cab ride away which is very convenient. We ate at two onsite restaurants at Caesars: Spago and Mesa Grill. Both pricey. Spago was a waste of money. We had dinner there and it was very very noisy. You could not carry a conversation. The service was excellent but the food was lack luster. I had a salad and a salmon dish. The salmon was surprisingly salty. Anyway, we walked away feeling like we'd had a "olive garden chain" quality meal, at very high end prices. It wasn't that the food was awful, but with the atmosphere being bad and the food "ify" we weren't pleased. On the other hand, Mesa Grill was awesome. We had lunch there. Atmosphere is much better. We had a pleasant time talking. The service was excellent and the food awesome. By far the best meal I have had in a long time. I had a corn/tomatoe soup and a spicy scrambled egg dish. Unusual and very worth it. We felt it was worth every penny we paid. Caesars has all the gambling you'd expect. Every conceivable game. The hotel and all its various areas were very clean and nice. It is glitzy but you expect that in Vegas. The bathrooms were clean too. I have no inclination to visit Vegas again but that is mostly because gambling is not my thing. It is VERY HOT there too. It wasn't that my experience was bad, it is just that Vegas is not my cup of tea so to speak. But if it is yours, then I could easily recommend Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Roel2
Reviews.Content: Best place to stay in Vegas, at least, for the right rate. Caesar's is located right in the middle of the action on the Vegas strip. We payed just $165 per night incl. taxes for our king-size bed room. The room was a simple and standard, but yet very comfortable, clean and spacious 5-star hotel room. The hotel pools are great, the parking free, the service excellent and the rest of the hotel astonishing. I might have liked the Venetian or the Bellagio just as much or better, but they simply could not beat the rates that Caesar's charged for the room. Will definitely pick Caesars again on my next stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wowwwwwwwww!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mistyxx
Reviews.Content: After having read negative reviews about Caesars I feel that I must add my own contribution from a British point of view. I have recently returned from a fabulous week staying there and can't find anything what-so-ever to complain about. If you have stayed here and have been disappointed with the standard of the hotel, then please don't ever come to the U.K. as you will be horrified with the standard of the hotels here compared to the Caesars (in a nutshell, there is nothing here that can compare!)! My friend and I arrived at around 1:30pm, tired after having had an 11 hour flight. The line for check in seemed long but only took around 15 minutes. We had booked a basic room and were offered a room upgrade for $120 per night, we declined and the price was reduced to $80 per night, which we gladly accepted. Our upgrade was for a room in the Augustus Tower with what I can only describe as the best views on the strip! It overlooked the southern end of the strip and the Bellagio fountains, wowww! (Worth the $80 per night for the view alone). Our spotlessly clean, immaculately presented room had 2 super comfy queen size beds, large jacuzzi tub, settee, small dining area, 2 plasma TV's (one in the bathroom) and Caesars Palace robes)! There is no refrigerator in the room but I read that one would be made available if required (although I didn't do this). Bar prices in the room are $4 each for soft drinks and water and $6 for a beer, Room service is very swift and I thought reasonably priced compared with British hotels of a much less standard. One night we were sent the wrong order, we were promptly sent our correct one free of charge and even had a telephone call from the restaurant manager to apologise for the inconvenience, now that's what I call service! The hotel itself is huge (about the size as the village I live in)! The pool complex is magnificent, if you wish to go in the adult area remember to take ID, my friend was declined admittance as she didn't have hers with her, shes 41! The overall feeling of the hotel is one of grandeur, right from the lobby all the way through to the Forum shops (upgrade your credit card if shopping here)! We mainly ate in the Cafe Lago which is situated close to the pool entrance. The buffet meals there are excellent, $15 for breakfast which consists of just about every breakfast food you can imagine, the freshy squeezed orange juice is to die for! We had the breakfast buffet ($15.50) one morning at the Bellagio and neither my friend or I thought the food or the service could compare with Caesars. The hotel is situated in prime position mid strip (next door to the Bellagio and across the road from Paris). The strip itself is huge, make sure to take comfortable shoes and plenty of elastoplast! My friend and I weren't daunted by this, no cabs/buses/monorail for us, we walked everywhere, mainly to enjoy the sunshine as it was far too hot to lie in (late 90's). We tried to see as many attractions as we possibly could in the week we were there, I particulary enjoyed stroking the stingrays and small sharks in the Shark Reef at Mandalay Bar ($14.95 entrance fee). Look out for the ticket booths located up and down the strip, they have fantastic deals on most shows and attractions, ie: we paid $24 each for entrance into the Titanic exhibition, we could have bought them at these booths for $11 each! Also, look though the brochures that are in left in your room, they have great 2 for 1 show offers and a few $'s off some of the attractions. For me, my favourite attractions were the one's that were free! I just loved the Bellagio fountains and could have stayed there all day watching them. The light shows at Fremont Street are another must see, they are amazing! A cab will cost around $15 each way but it is well worth it, the drinks here are less than half of the price of what you will pay on the strip. The airport is situated only a few miles away from the strip so if travelling from the UK don't be fooled into booking an expensive package holiday. You will get (like I did) a much better deal booking a flight and the hotel separately. I searched the net for months trying to find the best deals and I found that the best rate was directly with the hotel. I would like to thank all the staff at Caesars for making our stay such a memorable one. A big thank you also goes to all the Americans we met, you guys are just so friendly! :)

Reviews.Title: “Live like Royalty in August Tower Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: RissesPieces
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5/18-20, 2007. This was my first stay at Caesar's and I'm spoiled for life! The 650-ft deluxe room in the Augustus Tower is gorgeous and the views are a winner! We were on the 45th floor overlooking the Bellagio lake/fountains, and the Strip south of us. Room: decor is contemporary and very luxuriously understated. Large Plasma flatscreen TV, cozy sitting area comfortably seats 5 people, even for rooms with 2 super comfy queen beds (4 feather pillows per bed). Bathroom: similar layout to the deluxe rooms at the Venetian and the Wynn (separate water closet, glass shower beside bathtub, double sink, telephone, small flatscreen tv), but this is the first vegas hotel room I've been in with whirlpool jets in the bathtub - a fantastic alternative to facing the heat of the desert sun just to take a dip in the pool or jaccuzzi. Pool: area is impressive and a place to be seen, but not high on adventure. Crowded during the day, and not much shade. The taxi line is LONG all day long except between 3am and 9am. Seems almost everyone who stays here flies into town and doesn't bother with a rental car. The only relief you'll get for the taxi line is to be a Harrah's Diamond-level Total Rewards member. The valet line isn't as long. The weekend casino crowd and nightlife at Caesar's is HOT and the people are more beautiful, and more affluently youthful than at any other casino resort on the strip. The new Pussycat Dolls dealer area is smart and sexy! And Pure lounge is still one of the hottest clubs on the strip, top 2 or 3 anyway. If you're planning to stay here...make sure you bring the best that your wardrobe has to offer -- or your high-limit credit card...The Forum Shops have all the designer stores you need. :) Everyone in Vegas dresses to the 9s, especially at night. There's no such thing as overdoing it in Vegas. The weekend rate is pricey...and it's not much cheaper to stay here during sunday-thursday, but you get what you pay for. Final Answer: The Augustus Tower rooms at Caesar's are a great place to live like you own the palace--if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars - just got back - lots of detail!”
Reviews.Author: Sue_in_Van
Reviews.Content: CHECK IN Process was super fast at 8pm on a Thursday night. However, since we were there mainly for the pools, which we expressly told the desk clerk at check-in, we took the $80/night upgrade offered for the Palace Tower as that's just across from the pool entry. Of course, only after we were done with the process were we told that all but one of the pools would be closed the next day for a special event!!! GRR. One pool was open but it got crowded pretty fast and lots of people were out of luck. THE POOLS The pool complex itself is *gorgeous*, really amazing. TIP: People go in at 8am when the pool opens, pick out choice deck chairs and reserve them with towels, and then take off for hours, leaving many people looking around wondering why so many chairs are unused but off-limits. I think that's rude but that's what happens. Maybe not such a big deal when all the pools are open but it's annoying when not. FYI, occasionally someone in gold will walk by and ask if you want a drink from the bar, but the pool snack bar ('Snackus Maximus' ) doesn't open until 11am. We didn't get to the Venus Pool during our stay but noticed the lineup for it (this pool opened at 9:30am -- the rest of them open at 8am) consisted mainly of guys. Who knew so many of them like to pay to see each other topless! :) THE ROOM From the 26th floor of the Palace Tower we had a view of the Mirage and Treasure Island and could see a bit of the 'fire show' at the Mirage at night. I think the other side would've looked over the pools though, which might be nicer. The room itself was better than average. Large space, crisp white linens on the bed, flat screen tv. I thought housekeeping was great -- better than the Luxor, that's for sure. The room got made up nicely each day between noon and 5pm and they offered turn-down service, towels, and little chocolate coins each night. THE GAMBLING AND DRINKING The slots are Caesars aren't as generous as they are at Bally's across the street -- and the waitresses there are way faster with the drinks! -- so we headed over there a lot. Bally's is in the same casino 'family' so the rewards card is the same, which is nice. THE FOOD 1. Augustus Cafe -- Service was pleasant but the food was mediocre and overpriced. Coffee is $4 and fries (also $4) are not included with a sandwich ($12-$15). 2. Rao **for lunch** (you need to book well in advance for the evening) -- It was BEAUTIFUL: food was great, setting was amazing, and service was outstanding. 3. Spago (Forum Shops) -- Busy and loud, but both the service and the food were great. TIP: You get a discount here if you have your casino rewards card! 4. Cypress Cafe -- Food court option. I liked it fine. THE ENTERTAINMENT Due to a carding issue with a bartender on the first night (TIP: have your i.d. on you even if you're middle age!), we got VIP passes to Pure, the high-end nightclub at Caesars. We were a little dubious about how well these would work since you see people handing out 'VIP' passes for various things all over town, so I called down to ask that my name definitely be at the door so we wouldn't waste a bunch of time in line for nothing. Whether it was the particular passes we got or the call, I don't know, but we were treated like GOLD. There was a huge lineup of beautiful people but we got to hang out at the front and the security guys were so nice! And then we got comp'd admission to the Club (regular) and the Pussycat Dolls Lounge -- which was really amazing, the highlight of the trip. More on that in a second. TIP: Rest before you go. You're going to wait in line at least 15 minutes before you get in, and if you want to sit when you get in the club, you have to buy a lot of champagne and/or buy a seating area in advance. The couches and tables are all roped off, which makes negotiating the interior a little hard, but the club itself is beautiful and then you go upstairs and there's this outstanding outdoor patio...really nice experience. PLUS, the dj was awesome, which made for a super fun dance floor! TIP: See the Pussycat Dolls in the lounge! These are not the PCDs from the videos -- it's the local franchise -- but these girls are also really talented. The singing was great, the dancing was athletic and creative, and the show beats any of the topless shows in town (apparently) for sex appeal. Funny thing was, most of the audience when I was there was female...clearly this is the population missing from the Venus Pool! :) Aside from that, we didn't have plans for the second night so thought -- naively -- we'd 'drop in' to see Celine. Ah, no. The show ticket person just laughed at me when I asked for tickets that night. Sold out in advance and a lineup of 'standbys' besides. But what the heck, you're at Caesars!--the centre of the glittery-concrete universe--so go for a walk and check out what's down the street.... CHECK OUT Tried (begged?) for a late check-out and was met with more resistance than the French showed. Made for a long hot day waiting for the plane, wishing I was beside the pool again.... SYNOPSIS Hot and cold: High-end amenities but some service problems. Can't beat the location though, and when it works, it REALLY works.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time at Caesar's”
Reviews.Author: Member_Too
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar's over Mother's Day weekend. The check-in went smoothly, walked right up. The attendant was very friendly. The 20$ tip seemed to work (Thanks Tripadvisor members). We got the options requested. We stayed in the Augustus Tower overlooking the Bellagio lake. The room was very nice and large with a sitting area next to the full length windows. The bathroom had seperate shower and toilet areas and the tub was large and jetted. Two sinks and a flat screen on the wall. I hope this catches on elsewhere. Larger flat screen in the armoire. The appointments were very nice. The down side that we found were that there were two bulbs out in the bathroom. We asked them to replace them, but they never did. The housekeeping wasn't quite up to par (dust on some things), shampoos and lotions were not consistent from one day to the next. They left a cleaning bottle on the counter of the bathroom one day. They did bring hypoallergenic pillows when requested. The air conditioning was not quite as cool as the digital thermostat said it was, but it was liveable. The lobby, ground, and Forum Shops were all very nice. The Venus Pool with "European" bathing was closed. The other pools in the Garden of the Gods looked very nice and comfortable. Harrah's/Caesar's needs to completely re-do the Roman and Forum Towers since they are old and get consistent poor reviews. We booked using the free Harrah's properties Total Rewards card from the hotel website and got good rates. Overall, the place is great. Perfect location on the strip. Look for an inside view on the fourth from the last episode on "The Soprano's". If it's good enough for Tony Soprano, shouldn't it be good enough for you?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rayjay80
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed in the Augustus Tower and it was just as fantastic as the first. We highly recommend staying at Caesars. The new spa area, Qua, in the Augustus Tower is better than the previous one that was in the Palace Tower. The mineral baths and Arctic Room are really nice. Have not seen that in any other Vegas spa. The service was incredible. The Front Desk staff was very helpful in assigning me a room based on my stated preference. There were four of us in the room and Housekeeping always kept us supplied with extra towels. With all the wonderful restaurants in the hotel plus those in the Forum Shops we always had numerous choices for dinner. Try Sushi Roku in the Forum for a unique meal. The pool area was huge, with four different pools to choose from. We tried the new Venus Pool area run by the Pure Nightclub, and this is our only compliant. We were not allowed to bring in any food/drink from outside. They actually made us step outside their area to eat our take-out breakfast we had bought inside the hotel. And the pool area doesn't even sell breakfast items. Their drinks & food are highly overpriced (even by Vegas standards). When we moved the chairs to get into the sun, they made us move them back into partial shade. In order to sit up along the pool edge, they wanted us to pay an extra charge. So I'll log these compliants here enough though Caesars has no say in how this pool area is managed. But since Caesars allows the Pure management/staff to treat its guests in this manner is the only reason why we are not giving Caesars an excellent "5" rating. So if you stay out of the Venus Pool area, you will absolutely love staying at Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Average, not luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: chacco
Reviews.Content: When we walked through the door, the security guard tried to prevent us from checking in since check-in time was at 3pm and we arrived at 11 am. We told him we would take our chances and proceeded to the front desk. The lady at the counter told us to try back at noon. It's a good thing we didn't listen to the security guard. When we returned at 12:30pm, there was already a huge line of guests waiting to check-in. Fortunately, the process did not take too long, and they even passed out bottled water which was a nice gesture. Our rooms were in the older tower and signs of aging showed. The carpets looked a bit worn as did the furniture. The jacuzzi in the bathroom did not work even though it still had an on/off sign for the switch but the switch was taken out! The room service was pretty quick, and the food was delicious. We had lunch at the Pool Cafe which is right outside of Cafe Lago. After we were done, we tried to reenter the hotel via the connecting door to Cafe Lago, only to be met by a rude waiter who said we can only enter thru that door if we were dining there. It would've help if they put a sign up stating so. Overall, I think the hotel is overpriced. For around the same price, I rather stay at the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Ceasar's was great!”
Reviews.Author: vetten
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Ceasar's very much. We stayed in the Forum Tower. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. However, they are in need of updating - bedspreads, marble in bath, fixtures, etc. The bath was spacious with seperate make-up vanity and stool which I liked. I think next time I might would try and get a room in the Palace or Augustus Tower although I am sure there is considerable difference in price. We booked our room through the booking agency handling convention arrangements. The hotel was great - lots of action - in the center of the hub of the strip. Only complaint - not any $5.00 or $10.00 black jack tables. Food excellent. Reasonable priced ($15.50)and excellent breakfast buffet. Try Rao's if you can get reservations. And saving the best for last - the pools are the best. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: Thirtysomething
Reviews.Content: Thankfully, we stayed at this property due to a business conference (which means we did not pay out of our pockets). First the good... Common areas are very nice, Forum shops are great and close by, casino is very nice with attentive servers, beautiful lobby, airport check-in. Definitely good location within the strip. Now the bad.... HATED the room. It was old and ugly and tacky. It looks like maybe the room would have been nice in 1978, but definitely not now. But setting aside taste preferences, it was also dirty. Dust everywhere. We even found some papers on the nightstand that belonged to the previous guest! The bed was not comfortable, the sheets were thin and had a hole on them. The bathroom was also old and run down (and could use some better cleaning). You could hear noises coming from the pipes at night and the toilet would also flush constantly (and I am not a light sleeper). The room had a jacuzzi and I did not even try to get in it because everything looked so old/dirty I was afraid I might catch something! I can not believe the company paid almost $200.00 a night for this hotel. It is DEFINITELY not worth it and I will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: stdaveuk
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at Caesar's Palace, you realise that this is one spectacular hotel. The hotel is huge, and spread over a vast area. Once we checked in we were taken to our room by the bellboy, who gave us a quick run through of where everything was located. We were staying in the Augustus Tower, and our room was fantastic. The bed was huge, and so was the Tv...then we entered the bathroom ! We had a gigantic spa bath that could've easliy got 8 people into. There was also double sinks, and 2 toilets, and a great shower area with really powerful jets. We were really impresses by the room, so was looking forward to exploring the rest of the hotel. We walked through one of the gambling areas, with hundreds..probably thousands of slot machines, and we found our way to the shopping arcade. There are a number of clothes stores, and some of them are very...very expensive. There were lots of stores that you can wander around, and dream of buying the expensive items they have on display. There's a planet hollywood in this area, which is said to be regularly visited by famous people. We didn't manage to see any though..damn ! You must do the buffet in Caesars...you wont believe it until you see it. We queued up for a short while in the morning, and when we got in we were amazed by the food on offer. There's breakfast foods, steaks, seafood, delicious desserts, all different types of foods. It was amazing what you can get in there. The pool area is very clean and laid out around a few different pools. I managed to find a quiet area, and soon had a very beautiful white bikini clad waitress serving me drinks..i thought i had found heaven ! I will definitely go back to Caesar's Palace, as it was just a magical place !

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay at Caesars again”
Reviews.Author: COhappytraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 1456 in the Roman Tower. The room was noisy. We assume it was something banging around in the the elevator shaft. The toilet spontaneously flushed all night long and the bed was hard! We will not stay at Caesars again. Our money would be better spent to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Upgrade at Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: Midlandcat
Reviews.Content: This is part of my trip report from the Las Vegas forum. Arrival: Wednesday, April 25 Early morning flight into Vegas on Southwest Airlines. Very uneventful, pleasant flight with beautiful weather. Getting our bags was easy, although I was amazed at the size of the baggage claim area. Cab was easy to find and almost no wait. Ten minute ride to Caesars (no tunnel, didn’t ask, just wanted to see which way the cabby would take us) in an SUV cab cost about $12 for us with two other people from our group. Caesar's Palace: Beautiful place. Loved all of the marble. Sure there is a slight cheesiness factor with the Roman theme, but I really liked this place, way more than I expected to. Of course, the sweet suite upgrade they gave us probably biased me a bit, more on that later. Customer service was stellar and very friendly throughout, from the bellhops to the front desk to random employees I stopped and asked for directions. Since it was only about 9:30 in the morning, and we were told we couldn't check in until at least 1:00, we decided to do a little exploring with our group of 5. Wandered through the casino, which was pleasantly light on smoke. It was there, but wasn't overwhelming and never bothered me. Spotted the sports book and placed a $20 bet on Liverpool in their Champion's League semifinal matchup against Chelsea, and then headed towards the Forum Shops. Forum Shops: A very nice upscale shopping mall. Again, lots of marble, some cheesiness with the sculptures and fountains, but really quite nice. We avoided the high end stuff, but my wife needed a dress so she and her friend hit Ann Taylor and Banana Republic where they found some decent sale prices. We had planned to hit Sushi Roku for lunch and were all hungry, so we headed to the new end of the shops to check it out. We were a couple of hours early for lunch, so we decided to take a load off and start to some serious drinking. Found a cool little spot to drink called . . . Casa Fuente: a cigar bar on the lower level of the newer end of the Forum Shops. They made some great mojitos and some drinks we’d never had before, and we tried them all. Drinks were in the $10-15 range, beers $6-7. Got quite liquored up before noon, which was fun. While we were there we saw Steve Garvey signing autographs at the nearby sports memorabilia store and got an autograph. He was very nice and willing to chat about some rather odd things with a bunch of drunk lawyers from Texas, so I became an even bigger fan than I was from my days as a teenager growing up in Southern California and watching him play with the Dodgers and Padres. It was noon, and we were drunk and hungry, so time for some sushi upstairs at . . . Sushi Roku: nice sushi with an even better Strip view. I’m not a sushi aficionado, and this was only my second time to try it, so I can’t help with much of a food review. The sushi/sashimi was very good and fresh to this amateur and the tempura was nice as well. We ordered a sushi combo plate, a sashimi combo, and two tempura combo plates for the 5 of us, along with some warm saki and huge Japanese beers. This was enough for a decent meal, not overly filling, but great for a lunch. I think we spent $175 including tax and tip, which didn’t seem bad for 5 hungry drunks. The restaurant is a modern space with dark furnishings and one huge wall of windows with a spectacular view down the Strip. I can only imagine how cool the view would be at dinner time. I would definitely return, although I don’t think my wife will as she is just not a fan of raw seafood. Even more drunk, but nicely filled, we head to check-in to get our rooms. Our room: Wow! That’s one huge line! I’ve never seen a hundred plus people in line to check into a hotel before. The line went quickly though, and within 15 minutes we were talking to our nice check-in clerk. Thought briefly about the $20 trick and decided against it. We had a reservation for a Palace Tower Room at $180 thanks to a post I’d seen on this forum or on the Fat Wallet forum. I asked the clerk nicely if she could get us a view of the pools (while secretly hoping she’d give us an Augustus room with a view of the Bellagio fountains) and also told her this was our first time in Vegas. She said “let me see what I can do” and started clicking away and then called someone on her phone. She then said “I think you’ll like this, you may not want to leave your room”, but I figured she was just blowing smoke and didn’t believe her. Boy was she right! Wow again! She gave us a huge 1500 s.f. suite on the 28th floor of the Palace Tower. The décor of the hallway to our room was so beautiful I could’ve slept out there. The suite was spectacular with brand new furnishings, marble everywhere, 3 bathrooms each with their own TV, with two huge showers and a Jacuzzi tub that fit two very comfortably, a large living room with 40” flat panel TV, wet bar, dining room table, great view of the Bellagio fountains around the corner of the Augustus Tower, very comfortable king bed with nice linens, etc., etc. We were stunned and just started giggling. We later learned that this room typically would cost $2,000/night and we got it for under $200! Really took the sting off of losing that $20 bet on Liverpool earlier in the afternoon. By far the nicest hotel room I’ve ever seen, let alone slept in. Breakfast: was coffee and pastries from Rao’s which was serviceable and reasonably priced in line with what Starbucks would typically cost. There was a huge line for some buffet which I had no interest in. Bellhop provided prompt pickup for our bags, checkout was very fast and we were immediately ushered into our taxi. Curbside checkin at the airport was very quick and I highly recommend it over waiting in the long lines at the counters. Overall grade: A+ We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but Not a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: PackerBacker101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar's Palace to attend a 2-day conference that was held at the hotel. Our room was located in the Roman Tower, which is a couple of tiers below their nicest accommodations. The room was nice enough and the bed was comfy but I felt wasn't worth anywhere near the $250 per night we were charged. Most disappointing to us was the lack of amenties - there weren't even any drinking glasses in the bathroom! If you wanted a drink of water, I guess you are supposed to either order from room service or pay $4 for a bottle of water that was available in-room. Also, there was no coffee maker in the room. Coffee was available at one of the shops downstairs near the casino for about $3.50 per cup. Of course, you could always order coffee from room service but I can only imagine how much that would lighten your wallet. In contrast, Hampton Inns have far better in-room amenities at a much lower price. The rooms at Caesars are definitely not a good value in my opinion! The public areas of Caesar's Palace were plush and impressive; the casinos, restaurants, and shopping mall (Forum Shops) were all very nice and were all what I would have expected from a kingpin property on the strip. The conference facilities were also excellent in my opinion, as was the food at the Cafe Lago buffet. We've never had a better buffet - it was really good. Cost with beverage was about $25 per person. However, several other restaurants at Caesar's are extremely high priced. For instance, we saw more than one restaurant charging $65 and higher for a steak! But you can have a meal for $25 per person at Caesar's if you look around. And I'm sure you could dine for substantially less money if you dine off of the Caesar's property. Gaming was expensive for a casual gambler like me. Most card tables started at $25/hand on weekends, though I did see the occasional $10 table. I've since learned, however, that this has become standard pricing on the strip so I guess I can't fault them for it. It just strikes me as an awful lot of money for a hand of blackjack. All in all, I've stayed at equally nice hotels with far more useful amenities for a lot less money but the Caesar's property itself is huge and very impressive. If we ever decide to return to Las Vegas, we would find a better lodging value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: ashevalley
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at Caesars. Check in at the airport was quick. By the time I had checked in hubby had bags. Off to Ceasars we go. Our room was in the Augustus tower and completely met my expectations. Very comfortable bed, sitting area, and nice bathroom. The room was clean and kept well stocked. Turn down service and chocolates were provided each evening along with any cleaning and restocking that we needed. There are in room safes. I would not consider a room without a safe. Its just not safe for me to carry all my gambling money. I could spend it all in one day. We ordered room service several times and it was quick and very good. Only in Vegas would I order a $50.00 breakfast. Our stay was totally comped except for tips. We had decent luck on slots and hubby came out ahead on tables ( Hold-em and Let it ride). This was an excellent stay and I cannot wait for our next trip,

Reviews.Title: “Hail Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: crystal63
Reviews.Content: We got back from a two night stay at Caesars and enjoyed it enormously. Per the suggestions of other TripAdvisor folks, we used the airport check in, which is really time-saving. Our flight arrived at 10:00 a.m. and we were able to take a shuttle and put our bags in our room by 11:00 a.m. We had a deluxe room in the Forum Tower. Granted, the view was of a rooftop and a side of the Mirage, but who cares? The room was purely for showering and sleeping and it was perfectly fine for those purposes. One of the strong suites of Caesars is it's location. It's so central to everything and while most of the Vegas hotels try to be all-inclusive, with restaurants and shops and such, I think Caesars trumps them all because there is a nice variety. If you want high end, there's high end. If you want inexpensive kitsch, it's nearby. I would HIGHLY advise the ABC stores down the street for stocking up on snacks/drinks/aspirin. The bottled water in the room was $4, so needless to say, we didn't partake. Also, I can't comment on room service or the pool cause we didn't either, but the staff were helpful when asked and the room was kept very clean. My only criticism is the check out via the TV in the room was not functioning on our check out day and this made things a little inconvenient. However, I would recommend Caesars highly and hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay in room 1475! Noisy”
Reviews.Author: mtetrip
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in need of a re-vamp, it's ok but not palatial. Our room, 1475 has great views, but when we arrived the bulb in the toilet area was not working (so much for them checking everything!) and the jacuzzi bath had a mark.stain where water has continually dripped from the tap - it makes it look really dirty even when it probably isn't. The noise - hideous - imagine a water cistern/boiler filling up - it takes 15 minutes, is really loud and you will know when it has finished as it sounds like somebody dropping a brick in a tin bath - one almighty loud clunk! We stayed 4 nights, out of which I had to take sleeping tablets on 2 of those; my husband slept fine, he might have had some help from Jack Daniels :-) Pool area is nice, waitress staff get to you eventually. Rao's terrace area great for afternoon drinks in the shade. We stayed in Luxor on our last 2 nights - better rooms, MUCH better sleep! Fuscia restaurant is great - ask for Gerard to be your waiter - you'll see why, the mans a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Palace Tower Room!”
Reviews.Author: sb52pkn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a palace tower room from 13th April for 4 nights. We Paid 180 USD per night. The location of this hotel is brilliant centre of the strip and every where is an easy walk. The room was beautiful very big , big plasma screen, massive bed and very comfy. The bathroom had seperate shower and toilet hidden behind a door. Big Jacuzzi with double seats that filled up suprisingly quickley! The casino is massive. Pool area was always quiet no problems finding a sun lounger and they had nice thick mattress's. Would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Rules - Best of Vegas ”
Reviews.Author: ninjastar247
Reviews.Content: I booked a standard room at Caesars and at check in I decided to upgrade to the Augustus Tower. It was a lil pricey but worth every cent. The room was amazing. It had a jacuzzi, plasma tvs, minibar, comfortable beds, beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains. The place is huge - it has everything. You can kill hours just walking around the Forum Shops. Went to Pure nightclub, really cool place but its hard as hell to get in, very crowded. Ate at Raos, the italian restaurant which was really good. Staff was really helpful and very friendly. I have to say the highlight of my trip was that they were shooting the final episodes for season 7 of The Sopranos and I got to see James Gandolfini aka Tony Soprano. Love Caesars, cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay at Least Once!”
Reviews.Author: ShadyShores
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Caesars Palace and had a great weekend getaway! My review will probably sound like alot of the others but I still wanted to share our experience! Although we knew Caesars falls a little short of newer resorts like Bellagio and Wynn, it's just one of those landmark places you have to try at least once, and we were glad we did! We stayed in the Augustus Tower and had a direct view of the Bellagio fountains - that's the way to do it! Just call a week or so before your stay if you want a particular view, most booking sites have a special request section but those aren't usually received unless it's through the hotels website. The rooms in the Augustus Tower are suite-sized, great space for familes although I wouldn't necessarily recommend bringing children here just because of the sheer size of the property. In my opinion, the Augustus rooms are nicer than the smaller rooms at Bellagio. The rooms have a large LCD TV and plenty of storage space. Beds had nice linens and were comfortable, but I wouldn't say it was the best nights sleep I've had. The bathrooms were typical Vegas; very large and lots of mable, but had nice extras like a small TV and jetted tub - great place to relax! The property itself was so enourmous it is pretty much a vacation in itself. The architecture is stunning and if you want to be in the middle of the action you really can't ask for a better location on the strip with Bellagio and The Mirage on either side of the hotel. Right off the casino is The Forum Shops, which is a must see and shop destination. From what I can tell only MGM has a larger casino. Most of it is very airy and open; the original casino hasn't changed much since its opening, which I guess can be a good or bad thing. The sports book is one of my favorites in town and I recommend the Total Rewards card, especially if you like to play slots. It's free and can't hurt! We also got discounted rates and other good stuff for signing up in the mail. There were alot of dining options here, the only place we tried was the 24 hour Augustus Cafe and Nero's. We really only ate at Nero's because it had the shortest wait. The food was fine but the restaurant is dark and very dated. The premier restaurant is Guy Savoy...much more than what we were willing to pay for food but from the looks of things it is first class all the way. The good thing about Caesars is that if you don't feel like dining in the hotel there are many other, more familiar options at the Forum Shops like the Cheesecake Factory. Then there is the nightclub PURE. Very trendy and obviously not for everyone. PURE is a popular attraction for the well heeled, celebrities, wannabes, and highly metrosexual men. It's a place to see and be seen and if you're into nightlife it doesn't get much better. Just a word of caution - while in the casino I noticed alot of low life coming from the streets looking for someone to take advantage of....and some succeeded. As for transportation, taxi rides were less than $20 from the airport. I'd recommend that over the shuttles that some travel sites try to lure you into. Our last trip to LV we stayed the the Wynn. The Wynn is my favorite and is beautiful in pretty much every way; the beds are amazing, casino is bright and the standard rooms are as large as the rooms in the Augustus Tower...but when you put together the all the history , location, grandness and the AMAZING Garden of the Gods pool...you can't beat Caesars Palace. Anyone going to Las Vegas should stay here at least once!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Caesars Palace!!”
Reviews.Author: ManhattanNYCity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace from the 24-28 of March and had a wonderful time. We stayed in the newest “Augustus Tower” which was brilliant. The room was massive with two large double beds, seating area, a round table and three chairs, a wide screen TV and a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower at the “Paris Hotel” and we could also see “New York New York” and “The Bellagio”. The bathroom was large with two sinks, a big shower, a spa bath and separate toilet room, there is also a flat screen TV on the wall which was great! The 24-hour café in the “Augustus Tower” was good also! We went to the “Café Lago” for breakfast twice during our stay and once for dinner. All were great and the waitress was very friendly and served us well.....asking if everything was OK and topping up coffees and orange juices in the morning. Could not have asked for better service. The whole atmosphere of Caesars Palace is amazing. We also went to see the “Elton John And The Red Piano Show” and it was amazing. He did all his classic songs and he was very funny too. Our seats were at the very back of the hall but there is no bad seat in it as we could still see him clearly enough. The pool was great as well and the sun loungers were very comfortable and clean. The waitresses at the pool were very good and helpful asking if you wanted any drinks from the pool bar! The casino was always very busy and there are waitresses there too and seemed helpful enough. The shops were fantastic and the sky ceiling was unbelievable! You got mixed up whether you were inside or outside!! Caesars Palace is definitely the best hotel we ever stayed in and we recommend it 100%

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace, not so Royal”
Reviews.Author: peache68
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spend a night at Caesars palace as a treat to ourselves. We paid a fortune for it!! We were charged $380 for a room that you could get at the Motel 6 down the road. I don't particularily care if the bathroom floor was made out of marble, I don't get to use the marble or take it with me. Marble is also slippery when wet. The bathroom was cramped and small. It was not very well appointed either. We had spent a few nights earlier at Hooters Casino and that bathroom was stocked with more items than Caesars was! The room did not have an ironing board, although there was an Iron. I asked the front desk to send up an ironing board and was met with irritated hostility, they didn't even try to mask their displeasure with my request. The checkin desk was staffed with two girls who were not the least bit interested in actually checking us in expeditiously. The room had a lousy view, no coffee maker, no ammenities, very plain and the sheets on my bed were ripped. I called the desk and asked that housekeeping change my sheets, to which I was told that the housekeeping staff was very busy and they would get to it. They never came. While we stayed, we saw a film crew filming one of the final shows of the HBO program The Sopranos. That was a treat to see the show being filmed and James Gandolfini came over to shake hands and was very generous with his time. The casino is gorgeous and was nice to shop at, however we could have done that without having to pay for the room. The food, shops and souvenirs were ridiculously expensive, not a good value. I think Caesars was once the echelon of Vegas, but it's slipped. It's just not worth it anymore.

Reviews.Title: “just got back”
Reviews.Author: earing
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Ceasars. Stayed in the Augustus tower, really was absolutey beautiful. loved the tv in the bathroom, great shower and tub, really loved the bed. The only down side was the fact that we picked up the camera on the desk above the mini bar and somehow it sent a message to the front desk that we had picked it up for more than 15 seconds, presto, you buy it. Warning, don't pick up the smoked almonds or if you do put it down fast! We just loved it. There were some hairs on the floor and tub, but i only learned how to complain about that here. had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazee4trains
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to vegas. Not knowing where to stay, we searched for many reviews (including trip advisor). The reviews for Ceasars were consistently good. We stayed in the deluxe palace tower room for 4 nights. Fantastic room. My wife loved the soaker tub. Clean hotel. Very quiet. Great central location. Staff was courteous and helpful. The casino was large and the games were varied enough for all of us. The buffet was great and reasonably priced. We definitely will go back to vegas and would hope to stay at Caesars again. Excellent and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace is BIG, but well organized”
Reviews.Author: mommaneedsatrip
Reviews.Content: I arrived at CP Friday, March 30. From Las Vegas Blvd. I entered the self parking lot. This was very easy to navigate, good signage. From the parking lot to check-in is quite a jaunt. But it is well marked. I reserved a deal through their website, 2 nights and $25 dining credit for $240. This was supposed to be for a 'Classic' room, which from the pictures I've seen looks pretty standard. At check in I was given an upgrade, a king bed "Palace tower" room. I arrived in my room, and was very surprised. The Palace tower rooms are NICE! The room was very 'modern' with flat screen TV, uber comfy king size bed, and equally comfy chair and ottoman. The bathroom featured a jetted tub (fantastic!), double vanity, seperate lavatory area, and shower. Service at CP was, in my experience, top notch. I ordered room service Friday evening and it was FAST, and the food was delicious and hot. I am a pretty frugal person, but to recieve great service and to stay there on a Friday and Saturday night for only about $120/night was FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Title: “New Augustus Tower Rooms are Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie28
Reviews.Content: We booked a classic room and after reading reviews here, I asked to be upgraded to a new room upon arrival. The front desk people were super nice and were happy to accommodate my request. The room was wonderful, flat screen TV, super plush bedding, Jacuzzi tub and great view of the strip, couldn't have asked for anything more. I am kinda picky about the mattress I sleep on and I have to say honestly, I slept better there than I do at home in my own bed! If it's nice out, be sure to spend some quality time at the pool. We picked Caesar's because of the pool upgrades that were done recently. It is fantastic. There is a large round pool with fountains in it and a statue of Caesar in the middle. Then there is a smaller pool (which, while we were there is where the kids were) and then there is a very large rectangular lap pool which almost no one used. I like to swim laps and this pool was perfect for that. Even in March all the pools were open by 8am. I'd say the only downside is how large the property is. My feet were pretty sore from just walking from the hotel room to Mesa Grill for dinner (which was delish by the way). I am a Vegas regular and we always rent a car, but even with minimal walking, we probably clocked a quite a few miles on out feet. All and all, I'd definitely stay at Caesar’s again, although only in the Augustus Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: tai4de2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at Caesars Palace. My wife and I really enjoyed the experience. Caesars Palace in general has the feel of "class Vegas, updated". It's the quintessential Vegas experience. We booked a "class with free room upgrade and 2 Qua spa entries" package from Expedia. When we got to the hotel, we were double-upgraded to whatever 2 categories above 'classic' is and we were quite pleased. The room was on the 5th floor of the Palace Tower and was very large with a *huge* bathroom. A previous reviewer described a "petite suite" in the Augustus Tower and posted pictures -- ours was exactly the same as that. Jetted tub, double shower, x-shaped lamps, very clean, long entryway, just excellent for the price we paid. On the negative side, the ceilings in the casinos are a bit on the low side, making for a very smoky experience -- non-smokers beware! We got used to it but it might be a problem for some folks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: VoyageFromNYC
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at Caesar's Palace and was very happy with the hotel overall. While the room I received wasn't exactly what I requested, it did turn out to be more than nice enough. I stayed in the Augustus Tower in a two queen bed (asked for king) smoking (asked for non-smoking) room. The room didn't smell of smoke though, so I was OK with it. Great view of the Bellagio fountains and a very large and clean room. Room service was efficient, prompt and pretty good. All the other services were very good as well. I would say that the accomodations are just a slight step below Bellagio & Wynn, but not by much. I do enjoy the casino set-ups at the other properties, but Caesar's is more than nice as well. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCraig
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive you know you are in Vegas. My room was in the new tower Augustus, excellent. The AC worked perfect, didn't need to be adjusted once in my 7 day stay. Room service quick and good and not a bad price. Hotel room has all the goodies including 2 LCD tvs, large soaker tub and what a view, only dissapointment like most Vegas hotels NO COFFEE MAKER in the room. Please I need my coffe to get out of bed. Craig Vancouver B.C.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KeenTraveler84
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was lovely. From the moment we arrived the staff were very polite and helpful. We booked a Classic Room on the Hotel's website and got a fantastic price on a promotion for $390 for 3 nights which was a bargain. When we arrived we were offered to upgrade to the Augustus Tower for $60 a night plus tax but although we felt that this was a good price we decided to just stick with the room we booked. Our room was in the Roman Tower. The room was lovely, very clean and spacious with a jet spa in our room. The décor was a bit outdated but it wasn’t really a problem for us. The bathroom was very nice (see the photos attached ). The only bad point about the room was that it was a bit noisy at night due to the elevators and that the rooms aren't very sound proof as sometimes you can hear the people in the next room. However I do feel that this was because we stayed in the older part of the Hotel and had we stayed in the Augustus tower it probably wouldn't have been a problem. The Hotel is in a great central Location with Bellagio being right next to it. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from and lots of shops in the Caesars Palace Forum. For all you football fans Caesars Palace is one of the only Hotels that has the Fox Sports Soccer Channel in your room which shows premiership football matches and sometimes the Sky Sports News Channel. Overall the Hotel was fantastic and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in the Palace Tower”
Reviews.Author: mmlm01
Reviews.Content: I got this room for $180/night. It was a good deal at that price - I would not pay full price for this room. After landing at McCarran I was able to take advantage of airport check in which was very convenient. At Caesar’s it was nice to be able to head straight to our room – Palace Tower 2418 (non-smoking floor). I notice on our way to our elevator how clean the property is. Room itself quite nice. It is clean, spacious, with a pleasing color scheme. It is understated, which is a nice contrast to the chaos downstairs. Bathroom huge and lovely. Tub with spa jest big enough for 2 a nice extra. Excellent water pressure all week. Quietest room I’ve every stayed in. Did not hear other guests, plumbing sounds, housekeeping, or doors slamming my entire stay. Bed was very comfortable, air-condition unit worked well. As a rule we leave the DND sign on all the time, and just call for housekeeping services when we want them. Each time we called our room was cleaned thoroughly and promptly. Bad cell signal the entire trip though (had to use my phone out by the pool). But my Sprint card (wireless internet access for laptop) worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, new, clean, great view”
Reviews.Author: JennyBear13
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Augustus tower at Caesar's Palace. This is the newly renovated tower and you can really tell. The room was beautiful. Very modern with a great bathroom. Huge tub that can easily fit two people. I had friends that stayed in another room in another tower. Although their room was massive with separate bedroom from the living area, complete with baby grand piano,.... it was not as nice as our smaller room. It was dated and well used with no view. Our room in the Augustus tower had a breathtaking view of the Bellagio fountain. Ate at Wolfgang Puck's Chinios which was awesome and Spago which I felt was overrated. Although I had a reservation we had to wait for 25 minutes at a crowded bar that had no seats. No complementary drink due to the wait. Food was mediocre. Service was dull. Overall Caesar's palace rocked and I would go back but I would be sure to stay in the Augustus tower with a view!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rjoc
Reviews.Content: First time in Las Vegas and the best thing about it was the hotel. In hindsight we should have used the check in facility at the airport where there were only about half a dozen people in the queue. When we got to Caesars Palace we had to wait in a long queue for about 30 minutes. After quite a long walk with our luggage we got to our room on the 22nd floor of the Palace tower and to be fair we were not disappointed by the room. Big comfortable bed, flat screen tv, jacuzzi bath and all the usual facilities like a safe, iron, etc. The swimming pools are no doubt one of the hotels best features and beautifully designed. Even if you're a non swimmer it's a lovely place to sit and relax, particularly in the mornings. The hotel is designed so as you need never leave the building during your stay as everything you need is contained within it's walls. Excellent choice of shopping, dining and of course, gambling. One thing I did find very off-putting was the arrival of the weekenders to the complex. I'm by no means a snob but late night Friday/Saturday I felt the areas around the bars became quite sleazy but from what I can gather, this is a common theme across the whole of Las Vegas on the weekends. I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I Expected More from Ceasars”
Reviews.Author: zebra_focus
Reviews.Content: Okay so Ceasars is a big wig in Vegas, and most people at some point want to experience staying there at least once when they go to Vegas and I say save your money! My Aunt is a Diamond member in Total Rewards which includes Rio, Harrah's, and Ceasars among others. She was offered a free weekend stay at Ceasars and we jumped all over it! I was a bit disappointed with the room. It was just average for me and we stayed in a Junior Suite which seemed no bigger than a normal hotel room. The only thing different between any other hotel room I have stayed in and this one is that the room had a flatscreen tv, other than that the rooms were just average. The beds were very comfy and soft and the room was well maintained. I guess I just had some idea that Ceasars was going to blow me away with style and over the topness that I was let down a bit. The main reason I will never pay to stay there is that the staff is extremely unhappy there! The buffet workers and management were rude to us after we had been finished eating for almost 20 mins and we requested to please just have our bill, and the cocktail staff on the floor is minimal. I was there 3 nights and had only one drink served from a cocktail waitress!!! I say save your money and go somewhere else on the strip, or go to the Rio!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: TKIRK
Reviews.Content: Caesar's is very nice. The beds were super cozy as was the bedding and pillows!! We asked for a room with a view but we couldn't see too much, we could kind of see the Volcano at the Mirage but nothing to write home about. The room was nicely done, I'm pretty sure we were in the palace tower but the room doesn't look quite like any of the ones on their website. The bedding looks the same as in the Deluxe Palace Tower room but there wasn't a couch, just a table with two chairs. The bathroom was nice and spacious with a tub and seperate shower. The TV was your average TV.....don't remember getting alot of channels if I remember correctly though. Size of the room was average with above average bathroom. Room service was prompt and great. Room was always made up/turned down nice. It was a long hike to and from the room and I got lost pretty easy, though I could get lost in a cardboard box I am sure.....thankfully I had my husband to guide me! Liked the food court there, lots of reasonably priced items to choose from. The buffet lines were always huge it seemed, though I can never eat enough to make a buffet really worth it. LOVED Joe's Crab and Steakhouse, everything including the sides were DELISH! Would go back there for sure. Also liked the vibe and atmosphere of Planet Hollywood, the bartender was very friendly and helpful. (You're not in Canada anymore honey, we don't have gravy and we don't have Clamato!, LOL!) Didn't sit by the pool but it looked really nice. Loved all the shops, though I could not afford to shop at any! Had fun chatting with the bartender at the Galleria bar (Caesars 24/7!) he was very funny and told us great stories! Also loved chilling at the Spanish Steps, great frozen concoctions! Husband came out about $1000 ahead on the slots, not sure what exactly he was playing here and there but I was quite happy with his wins! All in all this is a great hotel. I will try somewhere different next time though, just because there is so many to see! Location of Caesars is also great!

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: raquaman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed all across the Las Vegas Strip and I stayed at Caesar's for the first time in March 2007 on a trip with my family. The price of a room at Caesar's is comparable with prices at Bellagio/Wynn/Venetian but Caesar's did not quite live up to the 5 star standards of these other hotels. I checked in at the airport early in the morning which was VERY good and I had a room in the Palace Tower, which, while newly and very nicely renovated and clean, was smaller than at the 5 star hotels on the Las Vegas Strip. My complaints are minor, but include the following: 1) Taxis can only drop you off at the old and cramped casino entrance and not the nice new lobby entrance; the lobby entrance is reserved for limo's only--very pretentious. 2) The room was a bit small as mentioned before. 3) I was on hold for several minutes while trying to call the front desk (on a Sunday evening) 4) Certain extensions listed in the hotel book lead to a busy signal or an answering machine 5) One of the Player's Club signup employees was curt and rude with my Mom. Again, I had a good stay, certain amenities are good and the location is great, but for the same price I would stay at Bellagio/Wynn/Venetian or THEHotel at Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room...”
Reviews.Author: pachelad
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a convention. I was upgraded to a room on the 18th floor in the Palace Tower. For $201, I received a room with a his/hers shower, two vanities, two toilet rooms and a jetted tub. Great view of the Bellagio fountain the Caesar's pools. It was a really large room. Internet was blazing fast. Only drawback was that Caesar's keeps you on hold for a very long time when you call the front desk or operator for a wake-up call. No big deal...lots of guests to deal with. I used the alarm feature of the cell phone instead.

Reviews.Title: “CEASARS PALACE MAGNIFICENT!!”
Reviews.Author: louwa
Reviews.Content: WOW.....WONDERFUL!!! My husband surprised me with a visit to Ceasars from March2 to March 6 and it was wonderful. We had a suite in the Augustus Tower with a magnificent view of the strip and the Bellagio fountain. Everything was perfect... from our check in, our beautiful suite with its jetted tub and seperate shower, the very comfortable king bed, the room service and the hotel itself - it was PERFECT and made our stay in Vegas absolutely amazing. Thank you Ceasars! We will for sure be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Hail Caesars”
Reviews.Author: samsdad
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a great trip to Las vegas. Managed to get a fantastic rate for at Caesars ($180/night) for a room in the Palace Tower. Got this deal through the Harrahs website as I had previously signed up for notification of special promotions etc. Decided against checking in at the airport and went straight to the Hotel. The line at check in was non existent so we were given our room keys within minutes. I mentioned to the check in guy that it would be great to have a view of the Bellagio fountains and he upgraded us to an Augustus Tower room there and then. Bearing in mind how much we paid for the room I couldn't believe our luck. The room itself was huge with a great view of the strip and the fountains.The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was fantastic. Great shower and spa bath. It's amazing how quickly you can get used to watching TV whilst lying in the bath or having a shower! We spent a lot of our time visiting the other Hotels on the Strip and I don't think we could have picked a better place to stay than Caesars. It's centrally located and the Forum Shops are just amazing. We ate in Spago's, the Cheescake Factory and the NY style diner which are all located within Caesars. The food in all 3 was great, especially the NY diner for breakfast. I would happily recommend a stay at Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Zabka
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with one night stay at this hotel. We were told that we were upgraded - but we've heard it so many times in different hotels that we didn't pay too much attention to it. After entering the room on 23rd floor we couldn't believe our eyes!!! It was wonderful. We got room in the 'Premium Palace Tower' - there were two bathrooms - connected with huge shower room, two queen beds and views of Bellagio and the rest of Las Vegas. The bed was very comfortable with loads of pillows. I wished that we could stay more nights here. We spend loads of time in the grounds of this hotel even before check in and after check out (we stayed only accross the road in Barbary Coast for the rest of our holiday). If we got special rate for this hotel on our next visit, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled for anywhere else now”
Reviews.Author: gallegoschris
Reviews.Content: An old friend and I decided to have a girl's trip to Vegas. I have this need to try every hotel on the Strip. Want to stay in them all. We decided to try Caesar's this time. I might be tempted to not stay anywhere else. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon and checked in at the airport. The shuttle bus left us off right at the Augustus Tower and we went right up to our room. We had an absolutely gorgeous view of the south Strip and the fountains. The room was was so lovely. I especially loved the bathroom with it's double vanity, glassed-in shower and the jacuzzi tub. Remember not to put in too much bubblebath as it will really make lots of bubbles. As you can guess, I learned from experience. It was still a wonderful bath. Watched TV from the flat screen that was in there. The bath amenities are luxurious. Our maid was wonderful as she gave us double, when she found out that 2 ladies were sharing the room. The beds were perfect and the linens to match. The one thing that impressed me about the Augustus Tower was how nice and quiet the rooms and halls were. The room where the ice machine is has it's own glass door. We felt perfectly elegant staying here.
