I ordered coffee and pastries from room service every morning and we enjoyed eating at the Augustus Cafe. I had the opprotunity to enjoy the QUA Baths at the Spa. It is a beautiful place to relax and the staff made it extra special. I would stay here again......and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!! Hotel and a Perfect Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: tyragirl
Reviews.Content: We got married at Caesar's Palace in the Venus Garden on February 25, 2007. To say that the day was perfect is an understatement. The wedding coordinator planned everything perfectly and to my specifications. She was helpful and friendly -- and I'm so grateful for everything she did for me over the past 6 months. Every vendor that was provided by Caesar's was top notch. The minister was entertaining and performed the sweetest most romantic ceremony I could have ever imagined. The photographer was AMAZING! My pictures were ready the next day and they were perfect. The photographer knew all of the most beautiful locations around Ceasar's and he brought out the best of us and our guests in every single picture! We had a room in the Palace Tower and it was beautiful. It was very convenient to the pool and the garden where our wedding took place. The Salon was fantastic when it came to doing my hair and nails for the wedding! I couldn't thank them enough for everything they did for me the day of the wedding. Caesar's made our wedding perfect and we can't thank them enough for making it so memorable. If you are looking to get married in Las Vegas you should put your trust in Caesar's!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: jsundy29
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars February 8 - February 12. Airport check in was a breeze. Booked a great deal through travelzoo and got a free upgrade to a deluxe tower room. Room 2726 overlooked the pools and you could just see the corner of the Bellagio sign and water. The room was huge and the bathroom equally spacious. Everything felt clean and brand new. Be sure to sign up for their total rewards program. You'll be able to use your card at any Harrah's property. Ate at Cafe Lago for the breakfast buffet twice and it was fantastic. About $18 and worth every penny. Every single item on the buffet was top notch, including the coffee serve in the carafe. My favorite part of Caesars was the location. You are centrally located on the strip and close to all the hot spots. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace - A Grand Experience”
Reviews.Author: trigger2212
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesar's Palace from Saturday 17th February 07 through until Friday 23rd February 07. I've never been to Las Vegas before so I only vaguely knew what to expect from TV and things people had told me. My first Impressions of Las Vegas were amazing (and that was just the airport terminal where you pick up your luggage!!!) When we drove up the strip to the hotel I was like a kid at the sweet shop window glued to the bright neon lights and the sheer size of these hotels!! The number of cars and people was unreal - probably not helped by the NBA All-Star Weekend being in town - this is one time a lot of people we spoke to said it was best to avoid Vegas!!!! The entrance to Caesar's is impressive and you are thrust straight into the Palace Casino once through the doors. Little tip, take advantage of the check-in facilities at the airport, will save you a lot of time and use your map of the hotel to familiarise yourself with various places, as it is very easy to get lost in here!!! Our room was room 491 on the 4th Floor of the Roman Tower - the room was only a couple of minutes walk from the elevators so not too far! The size of it was impressive, not much of a view but then again we didn't ask for a room with a view; the bathroom was splendind, huge sunken bath and an enormous shower, think the only problem (not really a problem just a minor grievance) me and my partner found about the bathroom was the fact that there was no door between the room and the bathroom - and there was an awful lot of mirrors in there too! The room comes complete with an iron, an ironing board, lockable safe (operated by swiping your credit card to open/close) and air con. It is very spacious and there is more than enough space in the wardrobe and drawers for your belongings. The Food in the hotel was superb and at what I deemed a resaonable price too, we mainly ate in Cafe Lago for the breakfast buffet; our main meals on the night were at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Caesars Palace!”
Reviews.Author: thak98
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3-night stay at Caesars Palace and we had a great time! We booked directly through the [--] website using a limited time offer code that we found on a travel forum site called [--]. This gave us a Palace tower room for $180 a night (Reg Price was around $450 a night). We were able to check-in at the airport with no problems, it was about a 10 minute wait in line and they gave us exactly the kind of room we wanted (King bed, Non-smoking, high floor). It was worth the wait since we were then able to get our bags, get our rental car, drive to the hotel and go straight up to our room. The room was amazing! It was HUGE and had very nice amenities - flat panel TV, spa tub, separate stand alone shower, and most importantly a cozy, comfortable bed. Our room was on the 24th floor facing the Bellagio and overlooking the pool area. A nice benefit of the Palace Tower is that it is the closest to the pool, just get off the elevator and the pool entrance is right in front of you. I highly recommend the Palace Tower at Caesar's Palace to anyone planning a trip to Vegas. You can find some great deals if you do your homework, the accommodations are 5-star in my opinion, plus the location is the middle of all the excitement!

Reviews.Title: “Shame on Caesar's Palace”
Reviews.Author: Cullan
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I know how it works.. NBA Allstar weekend is a busy time in Vegas. BUT...Even with that in mind, I have to say that Caesar's did absolutely nothing to make us feel appreciated as guests, even though we paid as much as $700 a night to stay in a "Classic" room (ie. old and crappy). The tub was peeling on the bottom and the room generally looked like it had hosted many, many parties. I understand that we weren't upgraded even though we tipped the front desk (worth a shot) because the hotel was full, but the room was in no way remarkable. We made our reservations 5 months ago, and the week before our departure I noticed on their website that the rate for one of the nights we were staying there had dropped from $700 to $400. I called the hotel, and they initially refused to change my rate for the night in question. After I pushed, they finally relented. Now, my husband is a blackjack player, and while he didn't drop $100,000 that weekend, he has gotten his entire weekend "comped" at many other properties for the same amount of play. Caesar's gave us $300 credit for the weekend, even though we stayed four nights, ate several meals and generally partied pretty hard at the property. Also, the casino host "was not able" to help us get any tickets to Earth, Wind and Fire for any of the nights we were there, even though we were there 2 nights before the crowd arrived for the NBA events. The management made it very clear that they cared nothing about our return business, which they will never get. =)

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace - V.nice”
Reviews.Author: Fullbrook
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after three weeks with a Contiki tour in NZ. So the accommodation was perfect, eventually. The first room we viewed had not been serviced. So we went all the way back to reception - this hotel is HUGE, so finding the reception desk was a bit of a nightmare! Anyway, then they gave us $50 to spend in the hotel to apologise, and gave us more room keys. The second room wasn't great as we were right above the air con unit - so I complained again and this time asked that someone come to the next room. I'd been on the road for nearly 36 hours and was desperate to find a nice room. So we were 'upgraded' - it wasn't amazing, but it was nice. We finally settled in the third room. We were only at the hotel for three nights, but it was very comfortable. Amazingly we didn't do any gambling - we shopped 'til we dropped! Caesars Palace has a fantastic shopping mall. It was probably the best one around. Unfortunately we didn't get to see/view all the hotels on The Strip, but without doubt, I think CP is the best. I was disappointed went we walked around The Venetian - there was hardly any shops, and the boat rides don't come cheap. For ease, we only ate within Caesars Palace shopping Mall (The Cheesecake Factory) and had several meals at the buffet restaurant in the actually hotel that over looks the pool area. The food was great and very reasonably priced. There was something for everyone. We hired a car from the Hertz desk in the hotel - it was very new, so we had a problem locating it! Anyway we had a long drive to Hoover Dam and the Grand Canyon. My advice is stop over night - it's a long way and you enter the mid-time zone of the US. We stupidly didn't know this, and wondered why everything was closing early! We saw the Grand Canyon as the sun was setting and it's truly breath taking. My only regret is not walking along the Hoover Dam to admire the engineering. I will definitely do this on my next visit! Las Vegas is an amazing place - I'm definitely going back and will try to stay at CP again.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhh - it is indeed a Palace!”
Reviews.Author: Kbell
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend 2/9-2/12. We arrived fairly late on friday - around 10:30-11ish. I'll try to stick to just Caesars in my review. Check-in was easy - no line at that time. Our reservation was for a Palace tower room booked through a package promotion with a 25.00 dining credit. We were asked if we wanted to upgrade (for a price of course) and we declined. I figured the room should be nice enough & I was right. The room: We were given a room on the 19th floor with a great view of the Caesars pools. I though the room was fantastic & quite roomy. Very clean and modern. The bathroom was huge for a non-suite room. It had a giant jacuzzi tub, seperate glass shower with great water pressure. The commode was seperated with it's own door. His & her marble sinks with more than enough counter space. This is the exact bathroom I only wish I could have at home! In the hallway was a big closet with a safe, iron & ironing board. There also was a vanity here with good lighting & a make-up mirror. The room had a plasma TV, mini bar (expensive - 4.00 bottles of water which we couldn't help drinking!) , desk with its chair, velour loveseat, table & a comfy chair. We thought the bed was amazing - one of the, if not the most comfortable hotel beds we've slept in. Comparable with the Hilton, maybe better. There were extra pillows set aside in all sizes. Pillows were very comfy as well. All & all we loved our room. Room service - we used twice. The 1st time was bad. Approx 8:30 am we called for breakfast. By 9:30 no show. Called again to be told they had no order - re-ordered. Finally showed up around 10:15-10:30. When it did arrive - the presentation & food was very good. The 2nd time we ordered at night - around 11pm. Came in under 1/2 hr - great. We ordered a cheese pizza and unfortunately it was not very good - the sauce was terrible. My advice is not to order pizza from room service here. The casino: We signed up for the total rewards right away. Mostly we play backjack & the minimum was always 25.00 so we played at other properties the entire weekend. The one time I did play here I lost 100.00 in about 60 seconds. Enough of that. I did win 110.00 on a penny slot near the lobby. A slot I had no clue how to play and it took about 5 minutes to win. That made up for my blackjack loss. All weekend I had been cashing in chips from other casinos at Caesars - Flamingo & Harrahs with no problem. The last day however, I was given a slightly hard time about cashing in Flamingo chips. The woman did do it - but nothing had ever been said to me before. I guess it depends who you get. The forum shops were amazing. It had to be the most beautiful "mall" I've ever seen. Lots of upscale shops - and your regular stores too like the Gap. I went to Juicy Couture and bought myself a leaving Las Vegas present. We ate at the buffet twice. Once for the Champagne buffet and once for the regular breakfast buffet. Both were very good. We used the credit on our rewards cards toward one of our meals. I have to say, Caesars is really HUGE. I know a lot of the strip hotel/casinos are - but I mean huge. Thankfully, I enjoy walking. The bell service was great, friendly & prompt. Check-out was faily easy - the line was short. They applied our dining credit to room service. We loved Caesars palace to stay at - but not to gamble in because we like lower limit tables. It's very easy to cross the bridge though to the Flamingo or other casinos. We would stay here again but there are so many other hotels to try! Overall - I do highly recommend the Palace tower rooms. We had a fabulous trip & can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: waggy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caesars Palace in December with friends. The place is just HUGE. We had a fantastic deal in the Palace Tower for an incredible 60 pounds a room (twin) through the Harrahs website. It is a beautiful hotel, luxury bedrooms, great central location and spotlessly clean. We stayed on 6th december for 5 nights. We were sunbathing by the pool in the morning, gambling and drinking in the afternoon, then watching the truly awesome xmas trees lit up at night! It is a fantastic time to visit. Stayed at Mandalay previously, which again is beautiful, and spotless, but further down the strip. Visited the new Wynn hotel, which I am definately staying at on my next visit. My friend retuned to stay there in January and said the place is stunning,as it was when we visited and struggled to leave! it is so nice! Anyway back to Caesars, yes, top hotel, top location, and of course the Colloseum to watch Elton or Celine, I was lucky, I took in Stevie Nicks show, brilliant.Guess what....I love Vegas I do!!!!!!!! Ps. shows to take in the new beatles show looks good, we saw terrific beatles tribute band, big Elvis is a must see, the Spazmatics in Mandalay Bay, and the truly fantastic Mac King....seen him twice and he is a funny man....watch out for the bear!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend at Caesar's”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars last weekend, and had a fabulous stay. We booked a non-smoking, high floor, king size bed Palace Tower room, and that is exactly what we were given. We had a great view of The Venetian, TI, Wynn, and The Stratosphere. My husband loved the flat screen tv and jetted tub. I loved the vanity table, magnifying mirror, bed linens, dual sinks, closet space, and the turn down service with wonderful chocolates!!! We had dinner one night at The Mesa Grill and loved our food, wine, and service. You order everthing a la carte and it wasn't that expensive - I believe around 165.00 total including the tip. Worth every penny! We are not big gamblers, but while we were waiting for our table for dinner, we ventured over to some slot machines and put in a 20.00, and within 3 pulls I had won 65.00! Drink service was also prompt during gambling. Lastly, our check out bell man was excellent. He loaded everything up, showed us how to check out on the TV screen, and even called down to have our call pulled around from valet. By the time we got downstairs, our car was waiting and almost all loaded up. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated for the Money”
Reviews.Author: himark35
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Vegas twice a year, we've stayed at nearly every hotel on the strip, and this was our first time at Caesars. We were really disappointed in the place, although the drink service in the casino was very good. Something about the property has a disorganized feel to it, kind of like someone who just keeps adding rooms to their house without an overall plan. Our room was in the Roman Tower, and it was well below average for Las Vegas. If you decide to stay at Caesars, refuse to accept a room in this tower. A few examples: in our room, #1471, one of the electrical outlets was hanging out from the wall, there was a dirty towel on the floor upon our arrival, the sheets were thin and nearly transparent, and the furniture was worn. There was a mirror on the ceiling, which was interesting. My sense of reading the other reviews and seeing the photos of the fancier towers leaves me to conclude that there is a stark difference in room quality between towers. It looks like Caesars has very nice hotel rooms, but we sure didn't get one, and I prefer not to gamble on what my room might look like. While there are nice aspects of this property, the bottom line is this: if you're not getting comped, Caesars is simply an oversized waste of money compared to the plentiful, fabulous other options available in town. If you're already planning to stay there and plan to park your own car, here's a tip. Try to avoid the entrance on the Strip, as the pedestrian traffic makes for slow progress. Along the back of all the Strip properties, there's a street called Frank Sinatra Drive, with entrances to all of the parking garages. You see lots of cabs and shuttles back there, because they know it's the fastest way up and down the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest!”
Reviews.Author: Wilksey1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Caesars four times now and each time it has reinforced that we dont want to stay anywhere else in Vegas! The Augustus Tower has only added to what was already an amazing hotel. The rooms in that tower are luxurious and worth every extra penny. Each visit to Caesars is different and there is no other hotel on the Strip that can offer shopping like the Forum Shops. The hotel location is fantastic if you want to see all the main attractions - although if you are anything like us you will find it hard to fit in all that Caesars has to offer - let alone the rest of Vegas! For a great treat have a steak at Neros- by far one of the best meals we have ever had! Also, Empress Court is a hidden gem and very reasonable in price by Vegas standards. There may be many other hotels in Las Vegas but Caesars definitely stands out from the crowd as being the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaWalnut
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Rio because I am a total rewards member, but since I was going to Vegas on business, I wanted to stay on the strip and decided to give Caesars a try. Wonderful place. I arrived on a Thursday afternoon, and was quickly processed through the reception desk. The check-in agent gave me a room in the Palace Tower and told me the room had been refurbished about 6 months ago. The room was beautiful. It had an enormous bathroom with a jetted tub and separate shower. The bed was comfortable, but not as comfortable as some other hotel beds I have slept in recently. The casino is very large, but I started finding my way around easily by the second day. I ate at Nero’s one night and it was very good. The only negative was one night when returning the front valet was full - even for hotel guests. The valet agent told me that they were only taking Diamond and 7 stars members and that I had to go around to the Coliseum Valet. I was a little irked at first, but then found the Coliseum valet to be very convenient for the rest of my stay since there was hardly any other cars back there. Much quicker than the madhouse at the front valet. Overall a great stay and I even won some money at Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice experience, but wished for more at the place”
Reviews.Author: 24Traveller
Reviews.Content: Just to put a perspective on things: I am a very well travelled person, I've been to many places in the world, stayed at some great places, had some excellent foods, so I have a certain bias to quality, okay? Stayed here from Dec 28 - Jan 3, over the New Year's Eve weekend. HOTEL: I got a fairly decent deal online at the Harrah's Caesar's reservation website - there is a link called "Hot Deals" and I happened to save $700 in comparison to other sites like Expedia, Orbits, etc - I happened to hit the link and check prices at the right time, I guess. I stayed in the Augustus Tower - Deluxe Room on Floor 29. That doesn't mean that it's on the 29th floor, however, it's just the hotel's classification number. As I reached the Front Desk on arrival, I handed the lady $20 with my ID and credit card (as advised by one of those "special tips" sites telling you what you can get for doing the right thing in Vegas) and asked for a view of the Bellagio fountain - and I got a good room, right on the corner of the building with a perfect view of the Bellagio fountain! Nice. Remember: always tip everybody in Vegas, and you'll be rewarded. The room was as expected - I'm fairly used to this level of comfort, so there was nothing unusual here. The fridge was placed in the cabinet underneath the LCD-TV, and the cabinet also had some drawers for clothes. The closet had hangers enough for 8 jackets, which was good, because between my wife and I we had just that many for the 6 days we stayed there. Unfortunately, the bedding was not as nice as I wanted them to be - the sheets and pillow covers were all too crisply cleaned - they were nice and clean, but I prefer the excellent beds and sheet sets they have over at a place like the Hilton. The bathroom was just the way we like it - lots of room for both of us at the 2-sink counter, a nice jacuzzi tub to fit the two of us nicely, and a glass shower stall. I just wished that the shower was a little more powerful, but it was hot enough so it made up for the difference. But, the room was quiet, and I was able to get some excellent sleep. The room service lady was polite and would always call late enough to check to see if we wanted service. CASINO : I was actually disappointed - it used to be much better back in the day. There are not as many Machines or Tables as compared to other places like the Mirage, Bellagio, or the Wynn - in fact, the Casino floors had so much room, I wondered how the place makes money compared to the other places! But then again, Harrah's owns so many others now (Paris, Bally's, Flamingo, Rio, Harrah's) and the Total Rewards cards work at any of those other places, so it makes up for it, I guess - all you have to do is go across the street and you can have a variety of games. The dealers at the tables are very nice - but they always are extra nice especially if you're a guest at the hotel. So once you get your Total Rewards card, always say that you're a guest there, even if you're not. And make sure you tip them and put up some money for the dealer too. They treated us very well, always making sure that we were happy and entertained. That was enough for me to keep playing, even though the cheaper rated tables were at other casinos. On this trip, I broke even, so that's a good thing, as I probably amassed a lot of points on my rewards card. FOOD: The food in Caesars is a little over-priced for the quality they claim - they could knock the prices down just a tad and I think they would do much better, I think - but then again, they are trying to project that classy image, so may be they can't. And there is not enough of a variety, nor do the restaurants stay open late enough - Caesar's only has one Cafe that is open 24 hours and they choices are very limited. They ought to keep the food court area open at least until 2AM. OVERALL: Anyways, we had a decent time, got to see a couple of shows, and the New Year's Eve Fireworks was pretty good. Will I stay here again? Hmmmmm.......... there are so many other hotels to experience, so unless I get really great deal for the next time, I probably will go somewhere else - and I say that about every place I've ever been. I just like to experience different things - it's nothing against Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars & Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Curly73
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas - I went with my mum for her 60th birthday - this was her present from me and my sister. The main reason for the trip was for my mum to see Barry Manilow - I booked 3rd row tickets before going to make sure we got good seats!!! He was brilliant -want to go back again just to see Barry. Anyway onto Caesars Palace - we arrived at the hotel about 7pm and there was not one single person in the queue which was good. I asked if there was any chance of an upgrade but they said no - was pretty gutted about this as so many people had said they managed to get upgrades. We were put in the Roman tower which I wasn't very happy with as was hoping for the Augustus (!!) but when we went up there I was happy with the room. It was very spacious and had two big double beds and the bathroom was a good size with separate shower and big tub. Everyone was very friendly at the hotel. We ate at the Cheesecake Factory in the Forum Shops which was delicious. The portions are so huge me and my mum could have shared one of our meals and still not been able to eat it all. We did manage to share a piece of cheesecake for dessert though!! Also went another night just to get take-away cheesecake. You must try some - there are so many flavours though you are spoilt for choice!!! The shopping in Vegas is brilliant - we spent most of our days shopping as everything so cheap compared to London. Arrived with two empty cases and took two full ones home!! Got some good bargains at the Premier Outlet - we got the bus there which was OK even though we had to wait quite a while for the bus and you have to change buses. I must admit we didn't do any gambling at all. We are not really into gambling but I really wanted to have a go while there but we just run out of time - there is so much to do and just not enough time to fit it all in. Also wanted to do the Grand Canyon helicopter trip but we left it too late and couldn't get booked. If you want to do this I would recommend booking as soon as you get there or you could be disappointed (like me!!). We went to see Tony & Tina's wedding which was really funnny. It is on at the Rio hotel and Caesars have a free minibus that goes there every half hour or so. Would quite liked to have seen The Beatles Love show but didn't have time for this - hopefully next time. Overall I absolutely loved Vegas - and so did my mum. Can't wait to return but have promised my boyfriend he can come next time seen as he missed out on this trip. He wants to go for a big boxing match!!! Would recommend Vegas and Caesars for a great holiday x

Reviews.Title: “Augustus a must”
Reviews.Author: brytpa
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I shouldn't share how much I like the Augustus Tower rooms because too many people might try and book them! hehe I travel out to Las Vegas to gamble about once a month, and after having my fun with Wynn LV and The Venetian (where I always stayed, without exception, for all trips over the course of a year or so) gave the Harrah's properties a shot. Actually, I was primarily giving Total Rewards a shot, as some fellow gambler friends insisted it treated them well. Given the Harrah's properties all over the US, I figured it'd be a good way to go as I could gamble and earn points all over (especially since there are Harrah's properties in many of the cities I travel to on business, beyond just pleasure). Mind you, Caesar's can be quite pricey for a weekend! So be wary of that! If it's a peak night (especially Friday and Saturday nights) be prepared to spend a bunch! The first time I'd stayed in an Augustus Tower room at Caesar's it was 800 for the first (Sat) night, then down to 300 for the second (Sun) night. Somewhat difficult to justify those prices for just a regular room - especially when Vegas is jampacked with wonderfully luxurious suites at other properties for the same price or less. However, I reached Total Rewards Diamond status soon after that first stay, and have been getting comped Augustus Tower rooms since then. That definitely helps! Rooms are modern, spacious with sitting area, comfortable, great beds, great bathroom. Have had a couple housekeeping issues here and there (dirty comforter... ew!) but a quick call downstairs got that sorted out right quick. Minibars, good views (especially higher floor rooms on the south side of Augustus, overlooking the Bellagio fountains), the Diamond Lounge is there in the Augustus Tower. I've definitely noticed wonderful treatment since, thanks to my Total Rewards status, and so whereas this review might not be too helpful if you're just looking to visit Vegas for a quick trip and gamble once a year or so, if you're a regular Vegas visitor/gambler, definitely give Harrah's/Total Rewards/Caesar's a shot. Caesar's is the nicest Harrah's property in Vegas (in my opinion), and it's very close to other Harrah's properties like the Flamingo, Harrah's, Bally's, Rio (via free shuttle). So... stay at Caesar's and gamble at any and all Harrah's properties!

Reviews.Title: “a grand adventure!”
Reviews.Author: usawannabe
Reviews.Content: 5th trip to Las Vegas in 6 yrs having previously stayed at The Aladdin twice and The Excalibur twice. Got a good rate for 3 nights in a shopping package at $120 night including a Friday night! Just to surprise a lot of you - 5th trip and still haven't gambled!! Always travelled with adult daughter who's still underage by American standards and we find more than enough to do without stopping at the tables!! It was a good experience staying further up the Strip although we still tended to spend our time up the end we're more familiar with. The rooms are well appointed, first time we've ever had a television in the bathroom and the bath was a treat BUT upon arrival, the bleach smell was soooo strong we wondered (as keen CSI viewers) how much blood they must have cleaned up!! But upon closer inspection, who only knows why there was so much bleach smell, the rest of the bathroom had dust balls and given the time the room must have been empty for them to accumulate we can't understand why maintenance didn't do any repairs - to the hole in the wall behind the bathroom door, to the television cupboard door hanging off its hinges etc etc. But I'd probably give them another chance if the price was that good again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Susiesoo
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a fabulous time in Las Vegas and loved this hotel. The staff were very helpful and courteous. The room was well appointed and very clean. All food budgets were catered for, but the buffet breakfast in Cafe Largo surpassed all our expectations. We would recommend Caesars Palace to anyone considering a trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: yoshapman
Reviews.Content: Got the Palace Tower for 5 nights through Travelzoo for $540 total, totally worth it - nicest room i have ever stayed in. Flat screen tv, huge room, comfortable bed ( I didnt wanna leave, the bed was sooooo nice to sleep in, and so many pillows and high quality sheets, blankets ),amazing view of pools and part of the strip. Even though when I called before about getting a fridge in our room they said itd be $20 a day, when I came and inquired at the front desk they said no problem, didnt charge anything. Very helpful front desk. Also, we got a $25 credit with the booking which we used today for room service - crazy expensive, as cereal for 2 and 1 cup of orange juice was $25, but hey, free is free. Bathroom was spacious, 3 separate parts. Maids did a great job cleaning everyday. Hotel is really nice, a little below Wynn and Bellagio but great location. We actually went across the street to gamble at Barberry Coast since limits on slots and tables were much lower, which was convenient. All in all had a great time, would go back in a sec if the price was right....

Reviews.Title: “Better this year”
Reviews.Author: dane1606
Reviews.Content: Hello all. Just returned from a 5 night stay at Caesars.WOW. Last year we also went to caesars and stayed in the much acclaimed Palace tower.Frankly ,i was a little bit disapointed by the room quality.Not this year though.The room we were in this year was terrific.Amazing beds,lovely flat screen tv in a sleek unit.A well stocked,reasonably priced fridge bar.I even purchased a few presents from the gift selection to take home.Of course the hotel and casino are huge but thats whats Vegas is all about ,isnt it ?.You could almost spend an entire week eating,gambling,shopping drinking ,without even leaving the hotel!! The weather was lovely while we were there and on 3 days we spent a couple of hours by the pool .For position,nightlife,food options,.which range from cheap snacks to high end dining, and general alround buzz i doubt Caesars can be beaten.Im sure i will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love Caesars!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShoppingTheWorld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace Dec. 14-17. We booked through the hotel's website with an upgrade to a Palace Tower room. We were very pleased to see a plasma tv on the wall, plush bedding, and a well-appointed bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. We'd seen the pictures online, but they don't compare to what you get in person. We found everyone at Caesars to be very nice. The valet service was extremely fast for a hotel of this size and with the number of people that they service. Check-in and check-out lines moved very fast. We don't have anything negative to say about our stay here. We stayed our last night at the Venetian (just to try someplace different), and found that we missed our room at Caesars. The hotel celebrated its 40th anniversary this year, and it just keeps getting better! We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace was incredible”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyInVancouver
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Vegas. My husband was attending a course there and we (myself, 15 yr old & 11 yr old) decided to tag along. We arrived the last day of his course and he stayed on for a further 5 days after his training. For our first night we stayed at his hotel, Orleans, as that was where the training was held. Do not stay here, it's off the strip and the "free" shuttle service was nowhere to be found, even after asking 3 different employees (each one sent us in a different direction - very frustrating!) and it is extremely smokey. We took a taxi to and from the Strip (appx $10 each way). The next day, we checked into Caesars Palace and our holiday began. We arrived 3 hours early to check in and were provided with our room in the Palace Tower anyways. No wait to check in, the clerk was friendly and helpful. The hotel room was modern and spacious, lots of drawer space and closet space, big bathroom (huge jacuzzi tub, large shower, separate toilet area, double sinks), everything was very clean. The hotel itself is massive and its easy to get turned around but after the first day, you'll be fine The pools were incredibly beautiful, I hear that they are the best in Vegas (no arguments here, we had pool side drinks and soaked up the sun as much as we could). We had housekeeping service twice a day, in the morning they cleaned, new towels, made beds, etc., in the evenings, they turned down the beds, new towels again and every night they left chocolate medallions (yummy!) for us. NOTE: The mini-bar and the tray above it is motion activated so if you touch it, it shows up on your room charge right away. But the check-in clerk did advise us of that in advance. There is a convenient and inexpensive food court style area (Cypress Street Marketplace) which we frequented as the quality was good. The Forum Shops attached to the hotel is so beautiful, its a must see. When we return to Vegas, we will definately stay at Caesars again.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Towers one of the best but..”
Reviews.Author: BrassBryan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Augustus Towers @ Caesars . The room is huge. The view is fantastic (I got the room facing the Bellagio.Got to see the fountains anytime i wanted. :) ) The bed is quality linen , so are the bathrobes. The sofa was so comfortable I could fall asleep in it. They have two TV's,one in the room and one in the toilet. The Jacuzzi in the toilet is much stronger than just any other Jacuzzi I experienced in other lodges/hotels/etc. I highly recommend ordering room service at least once because they deliver it to you on a nice table and you can eat while watching the fountains. (I stayed on the 42nd). Who needs to visit the restaurant at Paris when you can have this in the comfort of your own room. One bad thing is you can hear the traffic downstairs.And if you have the ventilation open you can hear the fountains but not the music accompanying the performance.Other then that I love this room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie50
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars Palace for 5nights in November 2006 as part of my birthday celebrations. The front desk staff could'nt have been friendlier or more helpful. There were no queues on either check in or check out. Our room was in the Roman Tower which I understand is the older part of the hotel but was clean and comfortable. As a first time visitor to Las Vegas I was amazed by the casinos/shops/lights etc. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lncbert
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Caesar's Palace for the Ahern Company Holiday Celebration. We go every year and this year our accomodations were the best yet! We were given a free upgrade and stayed in the Palace Tower - our room was clean, well appointed and tastefully decorated. There was a huge bathroom with jacuzzi tub, comfy king size bed with down comforters and pillows, a wide screen tv and mini-bar, iron/ironing board, safe, lots of closet space, high-speed internet access and floor to ceiling windows with a great view of the Strip. We also had our company dinners at their event center. The food and service, as well as the facility, was very good. The staff was friendly and informative. I liked the overall atmosphere of this hotel. I think the company got it's money's worth. Overall, it was just a great experience and I hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: linzy707
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Palace Tower at this Hotel and let me tell that our room was awesome!!! We had a huge bathroom with a jacuzzi tub and plenty of room for the 3 of girls to get ready. Very comfy beds. this place was perfect and I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler3
Reviews.Content: I had a room on the 43rd floor of the Augustus tower. Very lovely decor, with two LCD televisions (one in the bathroom!). I arrived on a Sunday evening, so check in was extremely quick, unlike other times I've arrived in Vegas on a weekend evening. The staff was helpful, and the dealers were extremely friendly as well. I was there for work, so my rate was reasonable ($149).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: TrustySam
Reviews.Content: I think most of us probably expect that if we pay top dollar for a hotel room, we're going to get top notch service. However, in the case of Caesar's I think they're able to command the premium largely on the basis of their great location, reputation, and the access they provide to a wide variety of well-known restaurants, shops, and shows. So maybe if you decide to stay at Caesar's and go in adjusting your expectations, you'll be less disappointed (?) That's what I tried to do after having read these mixed reviews and after having some problems with my reservation prior to my stay and I ended up having the time of my life. The front desk people, concierge, bell desk, wait staff, room service, chamber maid, valet parking, security staff were all very friendly. I think where some people might encounter problems is if something goes wrong and the staff may not necessarily have the authority to solve the problem (?) Otherwise the service was great! We also stayed at an off-peak time (mid-week the week of Thanksgiving) so it was much less hectic and people probably had the time to devote more attention to guests. Also the payouts seemed to be much more generous in the off-peak time, so we actually made a little money with the gambling. Plus, because it was off-season I was able to get the 'trip advisor special upgrade' to an Augustus room - thanks for the tip everybody . . . I never would have thought to ask otherwise :)

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel fine for us!”
Reviews.Author: JenIttels
Reviews.Content: Arrived about 2pm on 22nd November to a very short line and a pleasant check in man. No problems with the early check in which we were relieved about. We don’t like using valets or bell boys due to cost and so had to drag our luggage a long distance from the self parking garage, through the casino, into the palace tower via various steps and shops which was more than tiring after a long day! However I think that was probably the worst thing about our stay here. Much quicker taking our luggage through the front of the hotel to a taxi when we checked out though! The room was very pretty - on the 21st floor with a dandy view of the wynn and mirage. No smell of smoke, as hoped for a non-smoking room! Everything was clean and well set out and felt very luxurious. You could see a little wear and tear in the bathroom near the skirting boards etc but it didn’t slightly detract from the room! I have to admit we used the mini bar fridge to store a few of our own drinks and so weren’t surprised when, on check out, they tried to charge us for several items. This was quickly cleared up by me signing a statement that promised I didn’t remove anything and leaving a contact number. One of our large suitcases broke and after replacing it we asked housekeeping if they could dispose of the broken one which they did promptly and easily. Additionally after checking out we left our luggage with the bell desk then later need to get back into it to search for a missing item. The bell desk were very helpful and allowed my husband into the storage area to open and check the luggage out of the way. We got this room for 2 nights for £130 total on a deal which I think was a bargain compared to some hotels I’ve stayed at. I’m pretty sure we couldn’t afford the full price on the room though! As part of the deal we were meant to get $25 of credit for a Caesars restaurant which they didn’t give us, but we weren’t bothered about it and didn’t ask them about it – just check this detail though if you’re on the same deal. I recommend taking a walk through the hotel grounds – they’re stunning imo. Also I love the cheesecake factory there!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome!”
Reviews.Author: kggp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful inside. The room was beautiful, new and clean. Me and my husband stayed there for my birthday. He got a jr suite. I really recommend spending a little extra to get the jr suite. It's pretty spacious and the decor is modern. Nice large steam shower. We loved everything about our stay there. The room service was prompt and the food good. The day we were there it was pretty packed and yet the valet was on top of things. We never had to wait long for our car. The shopping is great. So many stores. It's a huge mall inside. Loved it. I did most of my shopping without ever leaving the hotel. Would definitely stay here again. And recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: porschelady
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Augustus Tower with two double beds. The dust ruffle on one of the beds had stains on it and so did the blanket, the decorative pillows, and a tear in one of the sheets. When I spoke with front desk, the employee responded with "Eww" Indeed. She then tells me that someone will come and change the linens. I spend my entire day out, sightseeing and so fourth. I return by 10 PM. My room appeared to be made and cleaned. Good, or so I thought. The next morning I awake and my arms itch. There are raised bumps on my arms. I lift my shirt, and there is an (literally) 8 inch in diameter raised rash on my stomach. Sure, it could have been something I ate, but all I ate the day before was at SW, Steve Wynn's retaurant at The Wynn hotel. I am not the type of person that has allergies...at all!! I immediately call front desk, they send up a Casino Police Officer and EMT. Right then, I notice the SAME EXACT stain on my blanket that was there the day before!!!!!! Apparently, they DID NOT change the linens!!! The Policeman takes photos of the stains and of my "rashes" Please do not waste your money and stay here. I'm sure you'd be better off at Motel 6. I too took photos. I will post them when I can, or, if you wish, I can send them to you. I just wanted to let everyone know that this place is (expletive) filthy, overrated and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Our worst trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sydny
Reviews.Content: Well I must start off by saying that I had not been to Vegas in about 10 years but we have travelled extensively many of which destinations were in 5 star hotels however we have also stayed in some 2, 3, and 4 star facilities depending on the area. I must say that Caesars Palace is surpassed by even some 2 star hotels that we have stayed at. Let's begin with the check in...waited in line for almost 1 hour. The room in the Palace tower was nice enough but considering the $700 plus price per night, way below what we expected. Now to the really unbelievable...we had wired in a substantial amount of money prior to our stay (5 digits) and could not believe that we were not even contacted by a host even though we had requested to speak to one on several occasions.(second let down). We did go there to gamble (that's the only reason that you should go to las vegas) so we hit the roulette tables. We were betting at least $200.00 per hand. We ordered a glass of wine (had to ask at least 3 times) and received it only after about 30 minutes! The service continued to decline...One evening, we had reservations at Nero's for 5 PM and realizing that we may be about 15 minutes late,attempted to call the restaurant to advise. However since the restaurant only opened at 5 and we called at 4:50, we were transfered to the Hotels restaurant reservation center. When we asked them to advise the restaurant, they said that they could not contact them since they would not be answering their phone and we were strongly urged to be there on time! Not once did the attendant offer to contact the restaurant on our behalf. (even after we asked her to do so) Anyway we rushed to make it down by 5:15 only to find an almost empty restaurant. Anyway, almost as soon as we sat down, we were solicited by the photographer who offered to take photographs of us. After dinner (which was mediocre considering the $250.00 of which only $50.00 was allocated to wine) the photographer returned to offer us the possibility of purchasing the photographs. We declined. After seeing the disappointed look on her face, we decided to purchase 2 wallet size photos. Didn't change her mood much! Now's what really got to me... When we returned home, we realized that a few items were missing (namely souvenirs that we had bought for our young daughter, no big commercial value but very important to my daughter) ..after questioning our daughter, we soon found out that she had hidden them in the room and obviously we were not aware of it and immediately contacted the hotels lost and found department. We called 5 times over a 2 day period with no calls returned! I finaly tracked down someone (but only because I had called a sixth time). The gentleman was nice and said that they would attempt to contact the new room resident and get back to us. Well, they did not so I called again a day later and was told that the new resident had not called them back and since he was a "VIP" there was nothing more that they could do until he checked out. So what are we "chopped liver". Anyway, I could go on and on about the service at Caesars palace but in a nutshell, if you have some money to blow and want good service, DO NOT STAY THERE! There are many other places in the world and Vegas for that matter who will make you feel welcome and appreciated as a patron!

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace - Augusta Tower”
Reviews.Author: wwscharffe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are frequent travelers to Las Vegas and we never had the opportunity to stay at Caesar's Palace. They sent us a promotion to stay at their new Augusta Tower and we jumped at the chance to do so. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like we were high rollers. The hotel staff greeted us and gave us our room 2 hours before check in. We also needed a freezer since one of our travelers needed an ice pack to nurse a sore neck. 10 minutes after we arrived at the hotel, they delivered the freezer and did not charge us extra for it. The staff at the food court was very professional and friendly. The food at the Caesars was very good and the casino was very clean. Our room had a great view of the strip and was very roomy. The sheets on the bed were clean and so was the bathroom. We would definitly stay there again and highly recommend it to anyone. Thank you Caesars! Bill Scharffe

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Baznsuze
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the States, we stayed for a week in Ceasars, took an upgrade to a Palace Tower room at an extra $40 per night which was well worth it. The hotel was excellent the food fantastic, way beyind our expectations staff were helpful and friendly, facilities especially the pool area were great. Only minor down was min bet on tables was higher then most other hotels, we did most of our gambling elswhere. Truly our best holiday ever by miles.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time....”
Reviews.Author: holycow709
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 6 days at Caesar's Palalce, boy this place is huge!! Tagged along with my husband to his convention. Stayed in the Palace Towers,and the room was beautiful, had a huge bathroom w/jacuzzi, large bedroom w/flat sreen tv. Staff was very friendly. Loved the airport check in. Also liked that the hotel had a computer to confirm our flight home and get a boarding pass.Be sure you have your walking shoes,will need them to get around the hotel,as well as the city. This hotel has a bunch of fancy resturants,which you'll need a reservation to get in,but also has cheaper places(for them) to get a bite to eat. Also has a shopping mall, but as you might expect for CP they were not cheap.We went to Celine Dion's show, and it was worth every penny we spent. My husband was not eager to go,but by the end of her 90min show he was raving about it. Did not gamble,coming from CT. I can gamble at Foxwoods or Mohegan Sun anytime,but did notice the casino's were pretty smokey. Liked that the hotel is in the middle of the Strip,but its still quite a walk to visit lots of the other casinos. And the monorail itself is a walk,would be nice if they could connect it to all the hotels. Nite time on the strip is really busy,especially on weekends. We visited Las Vegas about 15yrs ago when it was trying to be more family oriented,but certainly isn't this way know,was suprised to see young families there...I certainly wouldn't bring young kids there,but it is a good place for an adult weekend,just be sure to bring plenty of money....you'll need it!!!! Overall I thought this Hotel was really beautiful...over the top beautiful, but this is what their image is suppose to be. Had read reviews before we went, and was really nervous....most people either loved it or hated it. The ones that hated it, I don't know where they stayed,because our room was beautiful, so be sure to read all the reviews. I heard they have been re-doing the rooms...maybe they stayed in one of the older ones?

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant Staff”
Reviews.Author: Wisky
Reviews.Content: My buddy & I are fairly big players (Seven Star Club Members) and had some problems the first day of our stay at Caesars'. We went to a Casino Host and were told "that's the way it is" and then found other players receiving different (preferential) treatment which were outside of their "rules". We went over to The Mirage the second morning of our stay to play and by that evening had two rooms and dinner comp'ed and did not play at Caesars' anymore. I will never step inside Caesars' again. Additionally, Caesars' LV is one of the only properties that I know of that does not offer "cash back" rewards to their slot/video poker players. (I received $552.00 in cash back rewards from The Mirage while I played their for approximately 10 -12 hours over the next day and half.) Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Not Like It Used To Be”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: My, how the mighty have fallen. We stayed for two weekend nights on the convention rate. At check in we were strongly encouraged to upgrade to the new rooms - at an extra $70/night. When I said no the attitude suddenly changed and we were put in a room in the old Roman Tower. The tower is very convenient, but the room was shabby. The next morning I noticed that the paint in the shower was peeling and there was mold on a large portion of ithe tiles! When I asked to be moved the front desk clerk was indifferent and, instead of appologizing, he said "sorry, no upgrades" (no, I did not ask but that would have been nice after witnessing the disgust). Instead of saying it would be fixed he noted "dirty room" and had us moved to another, which was fine. Poor people who get room 994. You can't beat the location, and the casino floor and action is still the best on the Strip, but obviously the hotel guests are no longer a priority. Shame.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyabe Stay But Better Alternatives”
Reviews.Author: MortyCanada
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Las Vegas airport at 9 PM expecting to check-in there, but found it was closed. The check-in for the MGM, located nearby, was open. Seemed strange that it would be closed so early. We have reserved a room with a single queen or king bed in the Palace Tower, but found that the only avialble room had two queen beds, and very little else. So, we paid $55 to upgrade to the Augustus Tower, which is the newest tower and not yet complete. This is the most expensive of the options offered there. The room was huge (maybe 600 sq. ft.) , with a king bed, a couch, a chair with ottoman, a table with two chairs, and a bit flat screen TV. A desk and chair completed te furnishing. (Internet cable was available for $12 per 24 hour period. The furnishings, except for the bed, was more in the Roman style than designed to be comfortable. The bed was excellent. The bathroom was large with a jacuzzi tub, seperate shower, two wash basins and a seperate room for the stool. Took a call to housekeeping to figure out the shower - must pull the handle out from the wall and then adjust the temperature. Could not fiture out how to activate the tub. A call to housekeeping found that they had a manual but really no clue how to find the switch that started it. The room was nicely cleaned every day, and the bed was turned down each evening. We ate breakfast in the room - pastery and coffee arrived about 45 minutes after ordering. We played table games in the mornings as the limits were too high for our taste in the evening. The dealers were experienced, and so a bit jaded. Drinks were freely available. We ate at the Augustus Cafe, which offers s simple meat and potatoes menu, and found it a reasonable alternative - two could eat for $30 to $45. Ate breakfast at Cafe Lago, the buffet and found i acceptable, but not great, for the $16 price. Ceasar's Palace has been built over a 30 or 40 year period, so it is very spread out with hotel towers that are a long walk from the other side of the casino. It is a very 'plastic' or pretensious place, which we found not to our liking. We have stayed at several hotels in Vegas and two or three are more to our taste. Paris Las Vegas is the best value for money, with excellent dining alternatives. Mon Ami Gabi is a delightful restaurant for lunch or dinner on the patio.

Reviews.Title: “Way Too Smokey”
Reviews.Author: Corgipilot
Reviews.Content: I have visited LV before and was looking forward to staying at Caesar's Palace. NO More. The room had a view of a concrete wall. Real attractive for what we were paying. The ventilation system needs to be totally redone. We left the hotel for other venues with less smoke. Room service for Breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “30th Birthday Trip Report Caesars Palace and Paris”
Reviews.Author: kidkind
Reviews.Content: Hi all, First off thanks to my wife Sloane and our friend Connie who both made my 30th birthday incredible. Could not have asked for two better party animals to help celebrate with me. On to the good stuff. Day1 Caesars Augustus Suite Left Ft Lauderdale non stop to Las Vegas on Usair. Arrived at 10:30 am Vegas time and met up with our friend Connie from New York who's flight got in a few minutes before ours. Met our Limo driver from Caesars and we were off. Check in was a breeze we had two rooms reserved in the Augustus Tower one comped under my card and the other comped under my wife's. Since it was my Birthday my host had ugraded my Augustus room to a corner suite over looking the Bellagio Fountain. Connies room was two floors under ours. Awesome room we loved it. Decided to go down stairs and make a deposit at the machines for the nice rooms they gave us We got some drinks and headed over to th Mirage, Wynn, and TI. After drinking and losing in all these fine places we cabbed back to Caesars to get ready for Dinner at Nero's which we never made. Had some drinks at the seahorse bar and met up with some friends we had not seen in 6 years that were in Vegas for there last night before going home. We all decided to get some more drinks and some smokes up in the suite as well as put a nice dent on my room service bill. Day2 Paris P Room Had to stay at Paris for one night as Caesars was sold out for Nicky Hilton's birthday. No problem for us as they got us shipped over to Paris in a cab. We decide to share a room for the night. Paris was nice they gave us a premium room which was so so, but who cares it was free so no complaints right. My wife and Connie went down to the pool and I went to place some action in the sports book. I played some more slots and did not make anything but donations, So I decide to fold up shop for a bit. Later that evening we went to the Rio for dinner and to play some more. We had a blast and cabbed back to Bally's/Paris at around 2 am. Day 3 Back To Caesars Palace Tower Suite Got some nice rooms in the Palace tower upon arrival back to Caesars. Both comped same way was before with one under the wife and one under me. They gave us a suite for my room and it was beautiful. The ladies went to shop in the forums and I decide to Play some slots for a bit. Stage deli for lunch was excellent. After that some more slots then dinner at Augustus Cafe before we got ready to go to Pure. Pure was a blast Connie and my wife got plasterd as did I. Think I had about 15 beers that day between playing on the slots and then Pure. But it was my last day of being 29 so I enjoyed myself. Shadows Bar after Pure for awhile, Got the ladies up stairs and decide to go play down stairs till about 4am. Had a blast. Day 4 Hyakumi and My Birthday My 30th Birthday. My wife gave me a nice present from my doggies back at home. Slots that day were on them. The ladies were feeling the night before and we did not get going until late. Margaritaville for lunch then some playing at Flamingo. I love this place for some reason. After that back to Caesars for dinner Hyakumi. My favorite Japanese restaurant in Vegas. We had a lovely dinner that our host picked up which was very nice. My host Cheryl always shows us a great time. Some more drinks for me not the ladies after dinner, and a little more gaming then up to bed for the evening as the wife was starting to get a cold. Day5 Back To Ft Lauderdale We left around 1030 pm on the red eye back to Ft Lauderdale. We had a great time on this trip. We did not win anything this time, but we had done well the time before this so no big deal. We are heading back for New Years Eve so watch out !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hurry back”
Reviews.Author: Numbers_Guy70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesar's for a conference for three nights. Check-in was the first problem, with the line stretching out of the reception area. It did move quickly, however, and a staff member provided bottles of water while we waited. I checked in at about 3 p.m. and was told that if I wanted a room immediately, I would either have to upgrade, or accept a smoking room. I accepted the smoking room and, in the end, it wasn't too smoky. It also had a jacuzzi tub and seperate shower, which was nice (although there was mildew in the grout between the tiles in the shower). The remainder of the room was standard. There was no desk, and the TV was not a flat-screen or anything special. I tried to use the internet (for 12 bucks) but was never able to connect. The best things I can say was that the beds were comfortable and the room was quiet. I didn't eat at any of Caesars' restaurants. I didn't spend a dime at the tables. I saw a couple of tables with $15 minimum but the majority were $25 and up. I did play in the noon poker tournament, which I highly recommend. The poker room is a quiet oasis just off the sportsbook and the tournament room is an amazing place to play. If you are going to play just one tournament in Vegas, play it at Caesars (though I did play at TI and Harrahs as well, both of which I was more successful at). Overall, I would not recommend Caesars, but that may be just personal preference. I'd rather go somewhere more relaxed and a little smaller (I thoroughly enjoyed the few days I spent at TI).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TB123
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Vegas and I certainly wasn't disappointed. Initially I'd wanted to stay at either the Venetian or the Bellagio, however friends advised us that Caesars was now every bit as good. We got a great deal on an Augustus Tower Deluxe room, via the 'hot deals' section of Caesars website - go mid week for the best prices. The room itself was large clean and comfortable everything you'd expect. Every single member of staff that we came into contact with was friendly and professional (British hotels take note!) During our stay the weather was good; the temperature remained in the high 70's ideal for enjoying the fantastic swimming pool areas. All in all the three nights at Caesars couldn’t be faulted, a wonderful luxurious sanctuary in the middle of possible the most bizarre city in the World.

Reviews.Title: “Deceitful and Dishonest”
Reviews.Author: strawberries01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently made a reservation at the Caesar's Palace through a website at the advertised price. We immediately booked our flights and got time off from work for our trip. I just received an email from the hotel cancelling our reservation due to an "error", stating that that rate was never supposed to go up. Instead of honoring the rate they had posted, they offered me a "free upgrade", though still with a price FOUR times more than what we had originally booked. The manager was not willing to give a us a reasonable rate compared to what they had advertised. I find this to be very dishonarable on their part, considering it was their mistake. Although the upgrade they offered would have been great under any other circumstance, Caesar's Palace chose to not grant their advertised price, or offer anything even close to it, due to their own incompetence. I'd rather pay twice as much at another hotel that I know ensures customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Fernuch
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms booked at Caesars Palace from the 10th September for 4 nights in the Palace Tower. Upon arrival the line was quite long and only took about 20 minutes to check in. We were offered a upgrade to the Augusto Tower with a view of the Bellaigo Fountains for a extra $65.00 per night + tax, we decided to upgrade as it was our 1st time in vegas. The room was fanastic, 2 plasma tv's, 1 in the living room and 1 in the bathroom which was handy when you were having a spa. The view of the fountains was incredible my husband positioned his chair and watched them over and over again everyday. Staff were always very friendly even in the gaming area, the drink waitress were always there the more you tip the better service you get. Pool area was great and plenty of chairs and towels. Would definetley stay again at Caesars Palace it was all 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “The Palaca Tower is Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: karkura
Reviews.Content: We reserved a Palace Tower room at the Caesars Palace and were definitely pleased with what we got. The room was very modern with a flat screen TV and modern furniture. The beds were extremely comfortable and the huge jetted tub was so relaxing. Double sinks and a private toilet area were also great. There was even a sitting area to apply makeup, etc. Our view was of the pool and the Bellagio. A gorgeous room, but unless you have a special you will pay out the nose for it. Very friendly check-in experience and great interactions with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Two bad experiences -Beware”
Reviews.Author: 57Lulu
Reviews.Content: This is the second bad experience I've had with Caesars. I arrived at the airport with a confirmation at 5:30pm and was told they were oversold - sorry! They didn't even offer to assit in finding me another accomodation! The last time I booked tthere - here's some advice. Stay away from having a room in the Roman Tower. It's the oldest tower and is really beat with chipped furnature, cigarette burns, etc. even in a non-smoking room. I had a room with a Murphy bed which is basically 2 mattresses on the ground that you have to pull out of the wall yourself. There are no lights to read in bed by. Better off in the Palace or Augustus Tower. Remember, in LV, the hotel only confirms a room - not a type or a location. So, you could be out on the street like me trying to find a room on a Saturday night. They don't even honor the confirmed rate anywhere else. My best advice is to arrive early.

Reviews.Title: “Best Yet!”
Reviews.Author: Heavens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during September of this year for 3 nights. We had managed to get a FANTASTIC rate online direct with the hotel and were really looking forward to our stay. We had stayed at other properties on the strip (TI, Luxor, Excalibur) before but never Caesars. We arrived at 3pm and checkin was great. We were due to stay in the Palace tower but were upgraded to a suite in the Augustus Tower. The check in girl did this as it was my husbands 30th and our 5th wedding anniversary. The room was AMAZING! The bedroom and living space were very tastefully decorated and the bathroom was HUGE. THere were plasma TV's in the bedroom and bathroom. A lot of thought has certainly gone into the decor of the rooms. We had fantastic views of the pools and The Venetian. Housekeeping were great. so quiet! We never got distrubed by maids hoovering etc like we have in other hotels. And the turn down service each night was a lovely touch with 'Caesar's coins' being left on your pillow each night! The Caesar property is massive. There is so much to see and do. The Forum Shops are a real treat and make sure you sample the Cheesecake Factory. The Cheesecakes are a real treat and taking one back to your room is also recommended! Give yourself plenty of time to read the menu though! Would I stay here again? Yes! Caesars has everything. Value for money and the location is superb!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST !!”
Reviews.Author: franandhow
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Caesars Palace and it was the very best hotel we have stayed in. We stayed in the Palace tower ; which is very near to the pools, as it was 96 degrees everyday that was very handy! it saves you going around the hotel to get to your room, as the Palace tower lifts are right be the pool. All the staff were very polite and afficant, did not encounter any rudeness from anyone. The room was very luxurious, on 14th floor with great views of the pools (ask for a pool view, if at the palace tower.) A king bed, very over stocked mini bar, with very expensive prices to match, beware, if you so much as pick anything up you will be charged, as they work on sensors. The bathroom was superb, with huge whirlpool bath, very large, walk-in shower, and double sinks, toilettries were of a very high quality. Housekeeping was excellent and done nice and early, if you lie in, remember to put the 'do not disturb' sign out. By the pool there are as many towels as you need, so dont bother taking your own. Four pools, three 'normal' and the Venus, which is a topless pool, you have to pay for it at the end of the week. We went in one day and is is beautiful apart from the VERY loud music booming out, which makes it very hard to relax. There are very beautiful people there, and staff come round during the day with iced flannels, grapes and oranges, pure luxury! The position of Caesars is fantastic, right in the middle of the strip, next to the Bellagio and across from Paris. The Forum shops attatched to the hotel are seen to be believed, as is the whole of Vegas. Everywhere you go there are shops and restaurants. You MUST visit The Cheesecake Factory in the Forum shops, and go very hungury. All in all a fab place to visit, I think Caesars is one of the best hotels in Vegas, On my return I would stay nowhere else, take some good advice and stay there in the palace tower, you won't regret it!! ENJOY.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay”
Reviews.Author: beachmomri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar's from Sunday to Wednesday. We arrived at 11am on Sunday - which is the most popular day to arrive for conventions - and had to check our luggage with bell services, which was painless and well-managed. We spent a couple hours at one of the many bars watching the football games, then secured our room in the Palace Tower, eighth floor. The room was fairly spacy - supposedly 600 sq ft - with king bed, desk & chair, plasma tv and a very large bathroom with jacuzzi tub for two, glass shower, double vanity and separate toilet. The room was nice, but really smelled of smoke - this was supposed to be a nonsmoking floor. We called and they offered to ionize it, after also offering to move us. The ionization helped somewhat, and you got used to the smell after the first whiff upon arrival. The pool area was very attractive with lots of chairs and very friendly pool boys, but a scarcity of waitresses. The hot tubs were somewhat disappointing in that they weren't that hot and the jets weren't too powerful. There is a topless area of the pool deck which is separated by topiary, but not secluded enough for my liking. Also, on my way to a convention meeting on the ballroom floor, you can look out the windows right down to the topless area. The casino is large and confusingly laid out. I use the Bellagio as my benchmark because I love the paths they laid out through the casino to guide you. Caesar's is just too large, and to top it off, there are at least three different towers, the forum shops, Appian Way, all with bad signage. I got lost a few times. The restaurants were great, if pricey. We went to the steakhouse, Nero's, which was delicious. We hit Mesa Grill, which we loved. We went to the Shadow Bar for drinks and Cleopatra's Barge for cocktails and dancing We had a great time and I would recommend this hotel. I would return if necessary, but still prefer the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury”
Reviews.Author: DollyGill
Reviews.Content: Absolute luxury. We had a room in the Augustus Tower room, and it is the best room I have ever been in. It was huge, plasma tv, sitting area, plasma tv in bathroom, jacquzzi, huge bathroom, turn down service at night, chocs on pillows. The service here is second to none. The location is excellent, very central and attached the the amazing forum shops. Make sure you visit the cheesecake factory, but if you want the cheesecake(which is a must), do not order any food first, the portions are massive. The 1c machines are well worth playing, your money lasts forever and the winnings are great. Would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: EvieM
Reviews.Content: Perfect place for celebrating our anniversary! The room was absolutely beautiful and big - the bathroom as well - separate shower, toilet and jacuzzi bath. Also living room and plasma tv and very very comfortable. I ended up calling the hotel because there was limited rooms available with last minute notice and was going to stay at Ballys, which they are affiliated with, as well as a few other hotels, like Paris. But the girl at the reservation desk (so nice) found out it was our anniversary and she gave us a great deal of $160 a night -including a weekend which is usually $300 or more during conventions, etc.. at Ceasars and it was perfect! I loved Ceasars - it is so big - you can't possibly see it all in a few days! There is definitely alot of walking from the front desk to the elevators, but worth it. (las vegas itself requires alot of walking!) We were in the Palace Towers - very modern and very clean! We were also close to the swimming pools - our room view was facing them as well and they were so beautiful! We ate in their food court and it was pretty good and enjoyed a few buffets on the strip - mainly Aladdin which was the best one within walking distance. The best show was of course Celine Dion - she is incredible and the best comedy show was George Wallace! Go to the 1/2 price ticket place by the coke bottle and get a good deal on some of the shows. Las Vegas was fun and staying mid strip at Ceasars was perfect - would do it again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing !”
Reviews.Author: CWS
Reviews.Content: Just returned home after staying at Caesars Palace for our anniversary. Stayed there before about 10 years ago and wow its evolved way beyond how anyone could imagine. We booked everything direct with hotel. Would recommend as not only did we receive a great rate but also upgrades. Our $40 town car from the airport turned out to be a super stretch limo & our Palace Tower room was upgraded to a petit suite. The room was fantastic complete with his and hers bathrooms. Everything was luxurious and looked clean like brand new. BTW our rate was $160 per night incl Fri & Sat for 5 ngts, some kind sole posted a promo code on this site (search under prom codes or fat wallet.com). After checking out most other hotels we agreed Caesars seemed to have been a great choice. There is a real buzz about the hotel and casino which alot of the newer hotels don't seem to have for example one min we were chatting to Pete Rose, then tow mins later we were standing besides Sandra Bullock ! When we arrived Prince & Justin Timberlake had just arrived at the Pure nightclub....life in the fast lane. See attached pics of the pool taken from a heli tour...yes the pools are great. Some tips if you are planning a trip: - search this site & fat wallet for promo codes and book direct. - stay in a Palace Tower or Augustus Tower room (PT has easier access to pools) - Found no line at hotel check in (7.30pm Fri night). If you book a limo book with hotel & ask driver what the check in line is like as you can check in at the airport. - Forum shops are fantastic ...suggest you keep a close eye on your wife ! - We booked tickets to "O". The restricted view tickets are $93.50 buts theres really no difficulty seeing everything on stage (people next to you will be paying $150). Theres a great pre theatre menu at in the Bellagio at FIX restaurant at $40 per head. Great meal. - our anniversary dinner was at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. The chefs tasting menu was perfection on a plate. Its a bit pricy but well worth it. Can't wait for our next return to Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace IS Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: OCSteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the new Augustus Tower. Fabulous! Very spacious room with double vanities in bathroom along with VERY large separate jacuzzi tub and granite tiled oversized shower. There was a 17" flat screen TV in the bathroom and a 40" HDTV flat screen TV in the main room. The room was extremely clean and fresh, while the view was truly spectacular. When I opened the curtains it was like being in a movie. From the 29th floor I had a closer view of the Bellagio water show than guests of the Bellagio across the street had. To my left was the Paris resort, so my view included the Bellagio water show, the gold Eifel Tower and giant neon blue balloon at Paris, as well as great views of New York New York, MGM Grand, Mandalay Bay, etc. Unbelieveable. The restaurants and bars were all first class, while the Forum Shops are grander than ever. All the pools are all very clean and there is no shortage of plush towels. Caesars Spa is a very clean and large facility as well, one of the nicest hotel spa facilities I've been to. Caesars Palace is a first class luxury resort, without being as stufy as a few other high end resorts on The Strip. In my opinion it's the best resort to stay at in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up To Its Hype”
Reviews.Author: Waverunner
Reviews.Content: I surprised my hubby with a short trip to Vegas for his 40th birthday. I chose Caesars due to the location of mid-strip and the fact that my husband is a Total Rewards member from visiting the Grand in Tunica. I was able to get a lower rate due to his membership. It was still $263 with tax per night, but I was prepared for higher rates on the weekend. We checked in at the airport Friday evening. I asked if there were upgrades available. We did get a better room than booked in the Forum Tower. We were one floor below the penthouse with a great view looking North up the strip. The room was done in neutral colors with a whirlpool tub, seperate shower. The marble bathroom was very large. The bed linens were not luxurious, but it didn't really matter since we didn't spend much time sleeping. The bed was firm, which we like. The Forum Tower was close to the Forum shops and the Coloseum where Celine performs. We visited the pool area on Saturday morning, but did not swim since it was a little too chilly. Caesars has an awesome pool area. There seemed to be lots of lounges available, but, as I said, it was chilly. We did have drinks at the pool bar. My hubby had a Bloody Mary and I had a Pina Colada. It was the best Pina Colada I had ever had. We felt that Caesars had one of the best casinos of the ones we saw. Granted, we were only there from Friday to Sunday. Other casinos we visited were; Harrahs, O'shea's, Paris, MGM, Imperial Palace, Flamingo, and Excalibur. Caesars has several casinos corresponding with their hotel towers. I highly recommend Caesars.
