We would like to get back to Vegas, and would easily stay at Caesars again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: rain2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Labor Day weekend for 3 nights. We were with 2 other couples so booked 3 rooms at the lowest rate they had. My husband and I checked in at the airport (thanks to other reviewers) and decided to pay $50 per night to upgrade to a newer room in the Palace Tower. So glad we did! Our room was much nicer than the people we were with....their's looked like it hadn't been updated since the 60's or 70's. We also mentioned (well I insisted) one of the package's they had on their website (same price per night), and ended up getting $50 in food/gift shop credits...which was nice. The hotel is nice, great location. The pool is great also. My only complaint is there were not enough umbrellas available to rent by the pool, and the 105 degree heat got to me. Oh, and both breakfast spots (1 is is buffet) had long lines and I was starving!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars. Fall River MA”
Reviews.Author: JAS5498
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for the first time on September 3rd-10th. I loved it!! We stayed at Caesars Palace which was an excellent choice first off because it was beautiful and secondly it was located on the center of the strip. We did the airport check-in which I HIGHLY RECOMMEND there was no line, but when I got to the hotel the check-in line was never ending. The pool area was great the rooms were nice. The only problem I had was my first room #390 in the Roman tower had no bathroom door, which may not be a problem for some of you but I like my privacy and also the view of the wall in front of me was awful. So I called the front desk the next morning and asked to be switched to a room with at least a bathroom door. The view I could deal with seeing I was not planning on checking out the strip from my room. The girl at the front desk was very helpful and told me I could change rooms later on once they were clean and that the rooms in the higher numbers like 80's and 90's didn't have doors WARNING. They moved me to room #1457 in the same tower and it was beautiful it had a tub in the room seperate toilet and shower area and an amazing view of the strip. I couldn't of been happier. I would definately go to Caesars again I loved it there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay at the Palace”
Reviews.Author: 3MMartin
Reviews.Content: Caesars was ok. We stayed in one of the older rooms so the room was disappointing. The group we were with had the newer rooms, and said they were fantastic. I would suggest you ask for a newer room when you check in or make reservations. The hotel is huge and has a lot of action. There is no cheap eating in Caesars anywhere. You have to go to the mall to find reasonable prices for dinner. The service at the hotel was ok as well. Not awesome- just ok. All and all if I ever went back to Vegas I would try another hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Teeter21
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the JW before checking into Caesar's for husband's conference. We arrived at 11:30 and were surprised that we could actually check into our room, but the biggest surprise was the room. What a DUMP! We were in the Forum Tower and the view was the top of another building and the air conditioning/heating units. The room was tacky and obviously had not been renovated since the 1980's. Mirror on the ceiling over the bed, old bedspread, old carpet and old small tv and the mattress was as hard as a brick and the room smelled musty! The round bathtub/shower was in the middle of the room! I've stayed at Holiday Inns that are nicer. It was definitely a let down after staying at the JW! Some of the people in our party were upgraded to the Augustus and Palace Tower and were very pleased with their room, so if you plan to stay at Caesars make sure you are NOT in the Forum Tower. I will admit that the location of Caesars is great and we did enjoy the Forum Shops and dinner at the Cheesecake Factory. All the employees were very nice and the pool was fantastic although a bit crowded on Sunday afternoon. We were so disappointed in the room that we would have checked out and tried to find someplace else except for the conference being at Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: E.Clements
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to USA , one of our stops was Caesars Palace where we stayed for 5 nights. It certainly didn't let us down.Huge bedrooms with 2 double beds (I was there with my son) even the bathroom had a t.v. and phone.Plenty to see in Hotel alone without going outside.Staff in all parts of hotel were extremely helpful. Right in centre of Strip for visits to other Hotels. Hope to return in not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: googoos
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at Caesars from 9-4 to 9-8 2006. We booked a package (air & hotel). We had 2 carry ons and getting through the airport was a breeze. Cab lines were empty at 8:45 PM and 15 minutes later we were at Caesars. Check in was less then 5 minutes. I asked if any free upgrades were available using the 20.00 trick and got one (Palace Tower 25th floor partial view of the strip and the rest of the view were of the mountains). We had an odd numbered room and evened numbered rooms had views of the beautiful pool. The room was 600 square feet with a king sized bed, 42 inch flat screen plasma tv,and a 2 person bath/ hot tub we loved the room. Every person we encountered that worked there were helpful ,as this hotel is huge and at first easy to get lost. (Of course it was my wife that got lost and had to ask directions, men never get lost. LOL). I am a member of on and on and on as my wife has told me so suffice it to say, Caesars was great. We bought tickets to CELINE DION and wow what a show. Now on to buffets we ate at Bellagios buffet and it was very good but the next night at the Paris hotels buffet and it has our vote for number 1 in Las Vegas. Can you guess where we ate breakfast 4 days in a row? your right Paris hotel cooked to order omlets,crepes, fresh home made breads etc. i am drooling as i type this. Great time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower Stay was nice!”
Reviews.Author: WMiller86
Reviews.Content: I usually go to Vegas once per year with buddies, but this was a trip for wifes birthday, with two other couples. Stayed Labor Day weekend. Arrived at airport at 10:00 PM and tried to check in at the airport, but computers were down. The cab line was 35 minutes long out front. Finally arrived at around midnite at front desk. No lines. Asked for an upgrade to Augustus Tower with strip/fountain view and was told it is $50 more per nite. Since I already had a good deal on the room, I accepted the upgrade. The room was very nice, with a great view. (see my pics) We stayed in room 3892. Ordered room service desserts late upon arrival, and the Tiramisu was stale, but wifes cheescake was good.($30 total) Saturday morn we walked arond the strip and went into Venetian. Did a gondola ride. It was very romantic. Ate at Voo Doo Cafe Sat nite and is was fantastc. Great food and great views. But the drinks were very weak. .Went downtown and it was not great. Hard to get a drink while at Binions craps. Walked the strip and since it was a holiday weekend, the crowds were terrible. Everywhere was crowded. Sunday afternood we went to Margaritaville and just sat the bar. Had a great time , and got kinda blotto. Nap time! Sunday nite we saw Celine and her show was very enjoyable. But I don't think I will pay $175 to see it again. Bottle of 16 ounce water was 5 bucks in the show. Program was $25. wow. Ate a late meal at Cheescake Factory and as usual, they were awesome. Ended up gambling late at Imperial Palace and hadsome fun at the dice and black jack tables. Even won a little. Overall stay at Caesars was only good, not great. . The pool area was so very very crowded, that we only stayed there an hour. Cocktail waitress at the pool ignored mine and my wifes request for a drink. She was a snotty little witch. The breakfast buffet was good, but not great. Dealt with concierge desk twice and they were very helpful. Overall, I enjoyed my stay, but will probably not spend this much money to stay there again. I like to try different hotels. There are too many others I have not yet tried! But it was worth trying once!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Believe My Suite!”
Reviews.Author: leo21
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay for the Summerfest slot tournament for a Premium room. When I arrived, I checked in at the airport and found out I had received a Palace Tower Petite Suite! The room features his and hers bathrooms connected by a huge double shower. His bathroom was more like a powder room while the hers bathroom had a jacuzzi bath for two and even a bidet. All this before I even saw the actual bedroom, which featured a ultra-comfy bed and a flat panel TV. My room was south facing so I had a partial view of the pools and there was ample space for my clothes. The casino took a little bit of effort to get used to but after walking in circles a few times I got the overall lay of the land. Service was helpful and friendly and not snobby like it had been when I visited the casino in the past. The slots were a bit tight though, including in during the tournament! I hope to get the chance to stay here again. I wish I had more time to try more of the restaurants on property but that didn't work out for me this time.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough”
Reviews.Author: kitandkat
Reviews.Content: Well we stayed at Caesars for my husbands birthday which was a surprise to him. Originally booked with Ballys but Caesars sent me an offer since I'm a member through Harrahs rewards which I'm so glad they're joined now. Just awesome rewards through Harrahs properties. I can tell you though Caesars has the best customer service ever from the first phone call and they changed my reservation for me and she was happy to do it. I loved feeling important to someone who has so many people to help and that's where it started. We were given a room in the Augustus tower, OMG, just beautiful. Floor to ceiling windows overlooking the Bellagio fountains,2 flat screen tv's and the only bed I've found I can really sleep on. So comfortable. Anyways back to the people and casino. Cocktail service: great and happy which was so nice, Dealers: Hue was one of my dealers(pronounced Way) she may not smile but she is just so sweet made some friends there and just had a great time. My husband played poker in the poker room, and if you play poker this is the only place to play. Huge room with great tournaments. He won the first night we got there and stayed in there MOST of the trip thank goodness I made some friends. Room service mostly every night, and that was fast and good. One place we did not like and only because of the people not the food was the Augustus tower cafe. Great, Great food rude,rude workers at the front podium,who could care less if your there. On my last day it was nice to sit down for the last two hours and play,win some good money and get on our plane ride home. Brought home money, had a wonderful time, great food, good drinks, great people. Remember to use your rewards card, it's one of the best comp systems. And have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “You Should Like It!”
Reviews.Author: thode
Reviews.Content: In selecting a hotel in Vegas, we looked at many reviews. After selecting Caesar's, we did wonder how it would be based on some of the negative reviews online. Stop It! This is a fine hotel. Our room, the lowest rated Classic, was just fine - clean, comfortable and spacious. The only strange thing was that the marvelous, marble bathroom had no door? I have never stayed in a hotel with no bathrroom door, but it could be the trend! Actually, I prefer a door, but the bathroom was as spacious as the room and equally clean - plenty of mirrors and lights and a separate shower and tub - quite nice. We loved the friendliness of staff once you got past check-in. There we were subjected to an upgrade spiel, which, after he experienced a 'no,' caused the check-in guy to go into a sulk, or so it seemed after his previous friendly, chatty nature. BUT, the staff we met in the hallways - probably getting MUCH less pay than the check-in guy - was always friendly as were the room service people. Someone at Caesar's is doing a GREAT job with staff. We even had a need for an engineer to address the shower. He arrived quickly - as did room service - and was as friendly and helpful as could be. Really, I don't understand the negative reviews on this hotel. I would recommend it to anyone. One other plus: its central location for all the fun on The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldtwo
Reviews.Content: We checked in on 8/22/06 for two nights. This is our first time staying on the eight floor of the Palace Tower. Even there is no view, but the room is super nice. The funiture, decoration and the room is supper clean. We enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service, Good Food, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: averagefamilyguy
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at this hotel. I attended a conference while my wife, 1 year old son, and my 2 in-laws visited. We had 2 joining rooms (not guaranteed, but requested and granted). The location of Caesars is phenomenal - it is right in the middle of the strip. Easy walking to all the other Casinos and shops. I was plesantly surprised to find every staff we spoke to from the waiter to the hotel desk, to housekeeping were all very friendly and extremely attentive. The Blackjack dealer even gave me tips on how to increase my odds and win. (and I won...) The casual dining restaurants were very helpful with our baby and all the food was really good! The pool was great and I always had a drink in my hand thanks to the pool staff. I peeked into thier nightclub and it is typical of the one's on the strip - a little pretentious - but we're "been there done that" - so I can't say much for it. Above all - a great place to visit for couples and families. We'll go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good visit, but better hotels available”
Reviews.Author: darrennelson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars for 4 nights in August, this being the 10th visit to Vegas in the last 5 years. Overall Caesars was good, but we definitely have enjoyed some of the other hotels we have stayed at more. The room was small, outdated and quite dirty actually. Quite dissappointing, and this was after they upgraded us. The pool area is good and was the reason we picked Caesars this time but isn't enough to make us want to stay again. We did hit the buffet a few times, and it was OK. As for entertainment, we did quite enjoy going to PURE and will visit again regardless of where we stay next time. One thing going on the hotel for sure is the location (middle of the strip).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars, stayed in Augustus Tower”
Reviews.Author: Paula S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at Caesars recently, with our family and LOVED it. This hotel is amazing. We had originally booked a room in the Palace Tower, but paid for an upgrade $50 a night to be moved to the Augustus Tower. We had a fabulous room with an amazing view of the strip and Bellagio fountain. Room service was spot on, reception and bell service was swift and professional. I am astounded that some people write some bad reviews about this hotel. DO NOT LISTEN. It is truly amazing. The pool area is beautiful, the pools are breathtaking and there is always plenty of beds and towels. The service is first class and we were made to feel very welcome. We would definately stay here again. The location is right in the middle of the strip, with Mirage and Bellagio as neighbours. The forum shops were brilliant. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfan_1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caeser's with friends and had an overall positive experience. Most important to us, the location is perfect--right in the center of the strip. The rooms were standard for the Vegas strip-clean and large. The "shopping mall" in Caesar's is extensive and there are some decent restaurants in that area (although we mainly ate outside of Caesar's). The pool area was GREAT--many different pools and poolside drink service. The casino was the biggest let down. Although I don't gamble, my friends couldn't find many $10 min. tables (and NO $5 min. tables). They gambled outside of Caesar's for the most part.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: nvagirl
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night from a 3 day stay in Las Vegas. Overall, our stay at Caesar's was great! Caesar's is the best located hotel on the strip-right in the middle of everything. The property is beautiful and every staff memeber we encountered was very nice, something you often don't find at large properties. The only problem was at check-in they did not have any rooms with 2 beds left, so we had to upgrade to a executive suite, which only had 1 king bed plus a sleeper sofa. However, the hotel waived the upgrade fee and we were able to switch rooms the next day, so it worked out. The pool is great-very spread out, but get there early to get a chair. The pool staff is very friendly. We did get stuck with a terrible waitress who never once waited on us, so that was disappointing. And it did seem like they were short staffed b/c it looked like it took a long time to get drinks. We did go to Shadow, a fun lounge and PURE one night and it was amazing. We skipped the line and were let right in (group of 4 girls). The music selection was out of this world and everyone was having a great time. We also had the breakfast buffet and it was really good and very reasonable. We went at 9:30 and only had to wait maybe 15 mins. for a table. We also ate a few times at the food court inside Caesar's which was great when you are on the go and don't feel like having a sit down meal. Housekeeping was a little slow at times, but nothing to get upset about. We were there to have fun and we did, thanks to a great stay at Caesar's. I will definately stay there again on my next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: Henrik22
Reviews.Content: Caesar's Place was a great experience - all the way through. Check-in was fast, and although we didn't get a room with a Strip-view (as requested) we got a nice and large room with two double beds. The hotel itself has a lot to offer (even if you, like us, couldn't care less about the gambling activities) - but the hotel's location right in the middle of the Strip makes it easy to go out, day and night, to explore the other hotels and resorts in this odd and fascinating city. The pool-area is simply the best, nicest and most impressive we have seen at any hotel anywhere ... and the guests at the hotel wear everything from cut off jeans to evening gowns, and it looked like everybody felt good about this relaxed atmosphere. We will definitely stay here again if we come back - because of the great location, because of the great pool and because of the great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Oh, What a Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Artemus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at CP July 23 and 24. In a word, all I can say is Excellent. Everything about our stay was first class. Checkin was flawless, no line. Stayed in standard room in the Centurion Tower it was very nice. Great bed and very good pillows. The staff, and I mean everyone we were in contact with including bartenders, casino staff, checkin staff, maids, security were as nice, and pleasant, and accomodating as they could be. The pool area was incredible. The entire resort was beautiful and almost over whelming to be there. We did seem to get lost sometimes due to vastness of the resort. Ate at the Augustus Cafe a couple of mornings and it was very good. Hoping to get back soon. Can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Fantastic Pools, all very Posh!!!”
Reviews.Author: CP2004
Reviews.Content: What a hotel!! :o) While check-in could be long and slow - sometimes we walked passed huge check-in lines, we had nil, we arrived late, about 7pm and walked upto desk, in two parties. We each went to a diff clerk, and said we were together, we had paid for a "delux" room via Virgin Holiday uk - which from all the room descriptions I guess you could get anything, depending on availability, and whether clerk likes you - they seem to have authority to upgrade anyone to anything. We both got high level rooms in Palace Tower. I had paid for 2 rooms, as I didnt want to share with my kids. We got connecting (great as I didnot know US hotels did these), both had two bathrooms, two wc (four in all - one each !!!), huge shower. Floor to ceiling windows overlooking pool, with fountains in distance. WATCHOUT for mini bar, you are charged if you even BREATH on an item, even the stuff on top, on desk - they all sit on sensors, touch it, move it, and you get charged. $4 for a kitkat!. They will cancell charge once someone has been up to check it, a real pain though. If long stay, get them to empty bar. Beds VERY COMFY, duvets weigh a tonn though. Wall Plasma great for kids. Pools great for adults but boring for kids, they will tollerate a ball, but you feel like a lepper bringing kids to this hotel. Unless in the shops. Boy the shopping Mall is so classy - make sure you see ALL the animated shows and statues. Us the Mall to get further up the strip, saves on road crossing a a/c all the way. Food, use the hotel buffet, as stated $14 bkfts (kids $7), $18 Dinner - great, but lines can develop. We went Midweek, so guess weekend much worse (no room upgrades at weekends). We too trecked down to other buffets, not worth the $2 saving. It takes ages to walk anywhere in Vegas, everyhting looks close by - it aint. Soo many road crossings - dont J Walk !!!, so many crowds. Expect half your time to be walking/waiting for crossing signals. For kids buy Gater-aide - like UK Oasis, or they will only drink Soda. Buy it at the 7Eleven, huge bottles for what you pay for a tiny bottle elsewhere, they only place to get ice drinks too (crushed ice flavoured). Wear hats all day/suncream, you can get seriously burnt just walking for 10 min. LV is great for kids, just choose your entertainment carefuly. See the fountains at least 3 times, always different routine, great at night. Kids can walk through casino with adult, but must not stop. Do prebook shows at ticketmaster, kids will adore Mystere, its soo funny. There is a McD overroad at exit of Forum Mall -unlimited soft drinks!!, and a/c too. Pay the extra go to Ceasers for POSHNESS! - they really do make you feel like a Prince. The kids will love they dressed roman centurans for pics. Dont expect to WALK the Strip, end to end. Take the monorail, or a taxi. The middle area is quite rough -peddlers handing out girlie cards (porn), dont walk your kids in this area!

Reviews.Title: “A real let down”
Reviews.Author: Jo28
Reviews.Content: I've just spent 11 nights at Caesars Palace, Las Vegas and had a fantastic holiday but no thanks to the hotel or casino itself. Having stayed in Vegas before I was expecting the 'tacky' yet amusing theme to the hotel but did not expect the extremely poor level of service I encountered on many occasions. I must add that a minority of staff were great - the bell staff, reception and room service all living up to the service you'd expect from such a well-known, established hotel. However unfortunately their efforts were somewhat tarred by the discourteous, flippant attitudes of a number of others. Fortunately Las Vegas is such a great place with so many distractions that it was easy to escape Caesars and enjoy our holiday elsewhere. Next time I'll be staying at Wynn!

Reviews.Title: “Finally Stayed Here!”
Reviews.Author: Generalang
Reviews.Content: Finally stayed at CP from July 18th to July 20th, 2006. I decided to see if I could get a comp room here as a Harrah's platinum member and they graciously fulfilled my request. Delano at the main check-in desk was very helpful. They only had a room left in the Roman Tower that overlooked an air conditioning system, but I only wanted to stay there to use the pool. I had a room at Flamingo anyway. Who stays in rooms in Vegas anyway? It was nice though having a TV in the bathroom and French doors separating the seating area from the bedroom. One nice feature of the Roman Tower is its close proximity to the pool, check-in desk, and the buffet. The pool is awesome and you feel like you are truly a guest of the gods. The pools in the back of the complex are a bit hot in the summer since there is not much shade, but the main Apollo pool is quite comfortable. No problem getting chairs later in the day. Snack bar is expensive but they had good food offerings. Forum Shops are huge and diverse. Truly a classic hotel that does not look like a day over 40 years old. Will try to get another comp room the next time I get to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: annekr
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 4 night stay in a 'deluxe' room through a UK website for a reasonable rate. On arrival (by taxi - no tunnel) we asked about the Palace Tour but the receptionist said our reservation was valid for the centurion tower however they didn't have a room available there. She noticed we had asked for non-smoking but asked if we would accept a smoking room in the Augustus Tower. She didn't need to ask twice! The room didn't smell of smoke and was huge with views of the Bellagio and Paris. First morning we ate at the lobby restaurant which was fine. Second morning I trecked for miles to the marketplace for very expensive croissant and coffee. Then we discovered the buffet which was brilliant for $14 and set us up until dinner. The pool was lovely too and we had no problems getting seats although we were there Sunday thru Wednesday. Caesars is in an excellent location for visiting the strip and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: TRKC2006
Reviews.Content: I booked a rock bottom air/hotel package thru SWAVacations and was pleasantly surprised with my stay at Caesars. We checked in late and requested an upgrade from our standard room to the Augustus Tower. The desk agent cheerfully agreed to our request and asked us if we prefer a strip or pool view. The room was 650 sq ft and still in new condition. The bathroom had an oversized 2 person jacuzzi with flat screen TV. Everything was in new or nearly new condition. The king bed was extremely comfortable and we heard nothing on our floor. Housekeeping was done before 11AM and we had chocolate coins on our pillow each night. The pool area was very nice and we were albe to get chairs if there by 10AM. The only negative was at check out our comps were not on our bill so we spent time waiting for that. All the employees we encountered were helpful and nice.The Augustus Tower is an easier walk and close to Bellagio and the pool. I felt the casino and surrounding areas were too smokey. Other than that, I would highly recommend Caesars and will go back if returning to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Disteveofoz
Reviews.Content: Last year stayed at Caesars Palace and loved it. Once again this year we stayed at Caesars and were not disappointed. We had a slight problem with the plumbing and were immediately moved to the Augustus Tower. What an amazing room. Fantastic King size bed that we did not want to leave. The room was beautiful and as is usual for Caesars, the service was top notch. The temperature in Vegas was a record high for the time of the year so we spent a lot of time at the pools. What a way to spend the day. Also saw Celine for the second time, the show is spectacular. We hope to return to Vegas next year and will never stay anywhere except Caesars. Cannot be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Crewguy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Las Vegas for a few days over the 4th of July. We arrived early in the morning on July 2nd and went to drop our bags off with the conceirge. Imagine our suprise when we were able to check into our room! There was absolutely no line at check-in (this was around 0930) and we were in our room and heading for the pool by 10am! We were staying through a Total Rewards offer for a discounted room and were placed in a room in the Centurioun Tower. This is one of the older towers and it faces Las Vegas Blvd (albeit set back from the strip) with nice views. The rooms have been renovated and were very nice - the carpet was nice and soft, but it could have benefited from replacement. There was a full-sized velour sofa, chair and footstool in the room along with two end tables and a cocktail table. There was no typical "desk" like you see in other hotels. The tv was 27" (wish it were bigger!) and was ensconsed in armorie which had drawers at the bottom to hold your clothing. The closet had dual wooden doors which opened to reveal a large closet complete with safe (the safe was opened and closed using the swipe of your own credit card - no more having to remember combinations!) The bathroom was outstanding! There was a small television attached to the wall beside the large vanity/sink. There was a separate glass walk-in shower which had a place for sitting or shaving. There was a separate tub and a partially closed off area where the commode is located. There was actually a telephone mounted on the wall next to the toilet paper hanger. The pools were wonderful! I think there were 4 of them - one even allowed "topless" sunbathing. It was surrounded by tall hedge and there were staff members there to ensure no underage customers wondered in. It is recommended to get there early to get one of the better chairs and to snag a towel. The last day we were there they actually ran out of towels! The only negative thing about the room was the internet access. It is a wired service (but if you travel, purchase the Apple Wireport - it turns "wired" connections into "wireless"!). The lan cord had the clip broken off the back which caused it to pull out of the computer easily. This was a great hotel room and I will definately check out Caesars again when I go back to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “First-rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: glendale-member
Reviews.Content: First-rate hotel. Like most of the good hotels on the strip, the rooms are quite spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Are there amenities????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Obviously I was not in the "right" tower???? I was there as a business traveler, and so a block of rooms was reserved for the conference. We were given a "complementary" upgrade. Yeah, big, big jacuzzi, but little tiny full beds and no big screen TV. Furthermore our room looked out over the top of the Forum where Celine sings, and the only strip lights were those of the Flamingo. There were no towels in the room, the hallway was dirty. We watched the same orange M&M move up and down the hallway for the two nights we were there. I had to call about the maid cart and garbage all over the hallway (and they still missed that M&M.) The worst part was there are no coffee brewers in the rooms. This may not matter to some, but if I could have coffee intravenously fed to me in the morning - I would do it. There is room service AND then and additional charge for your cup of $2.50 and any one else's. I was told at the desk that NONE OF THE ROOMS had coffee makers. However, you can dry your hair and iron your pants for free. The full beds looked like the masses had slept in them. There was a dissolving Flinstone vitamin under the bed with lint bunnies. The sheets and blankets are OLD. The plus side of that is that we were comped $100.00 and ate at the Lago which was a solid "10" for foodservice. Actually, eat desserts anywhere - and, ask for Andrew M. at the front desk and Tommy at the Bell desk - there are some excellent staff representatives. The conference center is very nice, at least an 8, with two exceptions. Again, Caesar's skimps in the food department. The fruit was at least a day old and cut up (but I finally got coffee). Lunch was in one of the restaurants - very nice, but apparently, they ran out of food to serve - I had to send a prepaid UPS package back to the office. The business center will charge you $5.00 per package - handling charge. We did not gamble at Caesar's - the atmosphere is antiseptic and no one looked like they were having fun - I strongly recommend instead the Venetian or Aladdin's and a trip to the Stardust which won't be there much longer. Harrah's Casino was fun, but a lot of truly "drunk" people. In summary, for all the casino money Caesar's must haul in, they must be paying Celine and Elton John a boat load; they are truly bourgeois and veryCHEAP, and I would recommend the Venetian, Flamingo, or Paris instead.

Reviews.Title: “Double Bay-Simple Elegant”
Reviews.Author: coach_saint
Reviews.Content: Caesars is class, simply Classy!. The Registration area is very Elegant. I agree with several other posts. Do not check in between 11am-5pm. Lines are too long. I already had a suite room and it was comped so I did not ask for an upgrade or anything but if I had I can not imagine a better room. The Double Bay Suite is really awesome. It's about 1400 Sq, Ft. 2 bathrooms, 4 phones. It had a separate wet bar, 3 high stools with a marble bar and a mini-fridge. They brought us up chocolate covered strawberries and champagne at no charge, guess thats what you get for being pleasnt at check-in. Had a separate little media room with huge plasma tv with DVD, CD, VCR and Karoake machine. Had a wrap around coach in that area with coffee table. Huge living room area. Large coach, 3 comforatble chairs and a chaise longer/ 6 chair Dining table. The Master room was awesome as well. Two longers in the room with 36 inch Plasma tv. The bathroom had a small TV. Between the bathrrom and bedroom was a awesome two person sized jacuzzi tub. Had a two person shower/sauna with large marble bench. Had Caesars men and womens cologne with robes and slippers. It was in the Forum tower and showed some age but the tile floor was elegant. Carpet in bedroom was perfect and extremely soft and felt great to walk on. There were large windows in both rooms with a nice view of the strip. As far as eating, gambling and shopping in Caesars it's just out of my range. I like the clubs and bars. Lots of fun and expensive but you expect that. The Sportsbook is nice but did not have a good feel to it. It was too open being close to Pussycat Dolls etc. I will stay at Caesars again but gamble and play elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Visit To Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: kat650
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas with my boyfriend. We got a good deal on Southwest which was both air and hotel included. After reviewing all the hotels online, we decided to go with Caesars Palace. CHECK IN Check in at Caesars was a long line. There were probably at least 40 people ahead of us (this was around 2 pm on a Monday) but luckily since there were so many check-in people, the line moved fast. And to our very good fortune (or hotel karma!) we were upgraded to the penthouse level in the Palace Tower. PALACE TOWER The Palace Tower is the 2nd newest tower. While far from the casino, its elevators were directly across from the main entrance to the pool which was convienent. Plus it was a good location for easy access to the Forum Shops and Cypress Marketplace. PENTHOUSE SUITE Obviously with a suite, the review can't be that bad. The suite was amazing. Complete with living room, dining room, his and hers bathroom along with a full guest bathroom. It was very luxurious and very nice. Plus all the Aveda products were great. Perks included a large jacuzzi, 2 head shower, tvs in the bathroom and a very comfortable bed. The view wasn't spectacular. It was also very quiet being that we were on the 28th floor (out of 29 floors). DINING We ate once at the Augustus Cafe which is located near Augustus tower (the newest one) and the lobby. The food was good although a bit overpriced but we learned that was the case for everything! We also found the Cypress Marketplace, a fancy name for a food court. They had a coffee house, hot turkey/comfort food, fish and chips, burgers, chinese, pizza, build your own salad and wraps. The prices were better here. This is a good place if you want something easy that won't break your wallet. We also had the lunch buffet at the Cafe Lago (it was around $21/person). Luckily we got there in time when they were still making eggs to order. Both the omelet and eggs benedict were great. The selection for the buffet was great from shrimp to crab to prime rib to sushi to hand tossed salad and a great variety of desserts. This was a very good buffet. If you can wake up late enough to visit the buffet, you can save by eating both breakfast and lunch at the same time! If we had had the time, I would have liked to try Spago. ATMOSPHERE Obviously you can smoke almost anywhere in Vegas which took some time getting used to. We wandered in a lot of hotels but we felt that Caesars was by far one of the more smoky hotels. Almost everywhere in the hotel, someone was lighting up. Perhaps it was the circulation of the air, but other hotels didn't seem to smell as much. OTHER The pools were great - it was great that they had 3 of them. They even have a pool for "european" sunbathing. I also liked that they had the Forum Shops which is essentially like a mall. They had all the stores there, too many in fact! I don't think I got to see them all. They had high end stores all the way down to places like Express and the Gap. Be sure to check out the Bellagio fountain show at night. It was fantastic. The water in our "minibar" was priced at $4 a bottle. A total rip off! We walked down the strip toward CVS (there's also a Walgreens across the street) at Monte Carlo where you can easily buy six bottles of water for $4. It's also a good place to stock up on snacks, etc. If you are traveling around to other hotels that are far from CP, I'd get an all day bus pass. Just find the bus stop and ask the bus driver for a pass (need exact cash). This can get you from one end of the strip to the other and even to the Stratosphere or downtown. The buses are air conditioned and that's definitely nice!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Room!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was by far the most luxurious room we have ever stayed in Vegas. Try to stay in the Augustus, if you can. Adam (at check-in) was very courteous and we were able to check-in early. We stayed in the Augustus Tower July 3 & 4. Unbelievable room!! Overlooked the Bellagio and we saw the water shows all day long. The room (and the bathroom!) will leave you speechless! My 7 year old loved the flat-screen TV! The pool was great but not kid-friendly (no slides, etc). A pina colada will cost you $10, even the non-alcoholic ones. Cafe Lago buffets were not that great-not the best buffet in Vegas. Also, very expensive considering the limited choices on the buffet menu. Take the free shuttle to Rio and try the seafood buffet. Everyone at the hotel was very courteous and helpful, except for one of the concierges (who I thought was a little stand-offish) and one of the waitresses at Cafe Lago, who didn't look like she was enjoying what she does. The slots were tight but had some luck with the $1 machines. The Forum is huge! Take the kids to FAO Schwartz. But not a really kid-friendly hotel. Not much for kids to do, except the pool and the stores that cater to kids. Stayed in Vegas 6 days this trip and at 3 hotels. 2 nights each at Circus Circus and Excalibur. Will stay exclusively at Caesars from now on. Other hotel rooms do not compare!

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle12091967
Reviews.Content: Traverling to Las Vegas from Autsralia for the first time was very exciting. Accomodation where do i start, i thought. Vegas.com was FABULAS. All info was there, which lead me to Ceasars Palce. The pictures on the web were correct, the hotel lived up to them and more. Ceasars is very upmarket, but dont let that put you off. I had heard so many wonderful things about it that i was staying there no matter what. Its very pricey per night. i was in Vegas for eight nights and couldnt afford the 8 nights. I went through the web info that i had and picked the nights that were the cheapest, just to experience the hotel. As much as i would live to have stayed there i couldnt. Every thing is what you would expect from an upmarket hotel. I did have the cheapest room that you can get $250US per night, but there was nothing cheap about it. just beautiful and big. Shopping within the hotel top off the road,resturants yummo. And the POOL area. WHOWWWWW. I felt like a queen. There was an open bar, two very large pools, and two hot tubs. Plenty of beds to lie on, with the odd bride passing by to get married. I stuck my head into the chapel (yes it too was dreamy). The whole experience was just grand. I would go there in a minute if i ever had the chance again. All Good.

Reviews.Title: “Good... but not great.”
Reviews.Author: Esper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Caesars Palace from 6/27/06 to 7/2/06 and the experienced was mixed. First of all, let me state that the experience overall was satisfactory. It was far from perfect however. Allow me to list the positives and negatives. Positives: (1) Location: The location of Caesars Palace (henceforth referred to as "CP") is excellent. In the middle of Las Vegas Blvd (aka "The Strip") you are within walking distance to most of the major attractions and resorts on the Strip. In terms of Strip resorts, CP probably has one of the best locations (along with the Mirage, Venetian, Bellagio and Paris Las Vegas). Centrally located and in the center of all the action/activities. (2) Staff: The staff of CP was professional, diligent, competent and eager to serve. They really took care of our needs with a courteous and friendly attitude. The staff at CP is top notch! I can't say enough good things about them. I would also like to note that while there were issues with our room (see Negatives), the maid made sure our room was clean and tidy every day. (3) Forum Shops: The Forum Shops at CP are excellent with stores and restaurants that can fit every price range. Just walking through the shops is an experience in itself. I highly recommend checking out CP's Forum Shops, even if you aren't staying at the actual resort. Negatives: (1) Room Issues: Our room was located over one of the nightclubs (Shadow Lounge) so at night, we could feel the bass beats and hear the music through the floor. We had to turn on the television to a music station so it would block out the club noise. Also, our toilet tended to make noises at night which also added to the 'negatives' of the room. It seemed that it was 'always running.' (2) Casino: I am a regular visitor to Las Vegas and I do engage in gambling. I do not like the casino at CP. There seems to be a shortage of table games and what they do have is, in my opinion, overpriced. Even on a Sunday morning or Thursday early-afternoon, the tablegames (especially blackjack and craps) were too expensive. This is subjective and just my opinion. The minimum price I found for the average tablegame was $25. The 'old' casino area (with the majority of the craps, roulette and tablegames) tended to be very crowded. (3) Basic Services Charged: If you want to use the gym... you pay for it. If you want to send an email... you pay for it. My wife and I wanted to log-on to our airline to print our boarding passes and it the fee was $5 for 5 minutes in the business center. I would like to think that certain services would be inclusive. Note: If there is a long line for a taxi, you may get offered by a CP-Staffer to an immediate 'anywhere in Vegas' ride for $35. Don't take it. From CP to McCarran Airport, Freemont Street or Downtown is less than $20.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: foodie75
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Forum Tower room during the extended Fourth of July weekend. These rooms have not been updated in awhile and looked somewhat worn. The first room we got was directly over the lounge "Shadows" and we could hear the music (especially the bass) in our room. Also, there was no door separating the room and the bathroom (the tub/shower was practically in the middle of the room) which allowed for little privacy. After we complained, the front desk switched us to a room two floors up in the same tower. This room was better in that we could no longer hear "Shadows" and there was a wall separating the bathroom. However, the toilet in the room kept "bubbling" and made "gurgling" noises in the middle of the night. While not in use, some water would randomly splash out as well onto the toilet seat and floor. My spa experience was mediocre. I was not given a tour of the facilities and the changing area was really crowded. I did not think the massage was worth $135 and felt compelled to tip more than I wanted to because my therapist waited for me to tally the total charged to my card. The fitness area was nice as well as the pool area. However, one of the waitresses by the pool was really pushy and kept trying to convince me (several times) to order food when all I wanted was a drink. Although convenient for its location and Forum shopping, Caesar's would not be a top choice for my next trip to Vegas, especially considering what you get for the money (dated rooms, average service, mediocre spa, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable pre '4th of July' weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caesars Palace on June 29 - July 2, 2006. After reading the other reviews, I was very excited about what was to come. As the reviews noted - if you're looking for an upgrade, check in at the airport and discreetly slip the agent $20 and they'll upgrade your room. I booked this trip through travelocity and we paid for the most "standard" room offered. When we arrived we were upgraded to the palace tower, which was beautifully decorated and a plasma tv. We decided to take advantage of the spa, which i recommend to only do if you are in desperate need of a massage. Its really not worth the $135 per person ( 50 minutes). The food and drinks were great and the pool was really nice. If you like to shop, make sure you check out the forum- lots of designer. Overall we had an amazing time and would stay at the Caesars again. FYI: Do not get swindled by the cab drivers. Please request that they take the Swenson Ave. route from the airport to the hotel- averaging $13.00. If they take the tunnel, the ride will cost you $25.00. We learned the hard way! Also, If you have a few more inches to spare in your suitcase, you may want to consider packing bottled water as the water will run you $4.00 at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars/ Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: roxfan65
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at Caesars. Arrived on Monday the 26th and got an upgrade to the Palace Tower. Awesome room! Great bed, Plasma TV, Jacuzzi, plenty of room. The 15th floor was eerily quiet the whole 4 days we were there. Rarely came across anyone at all. The staff was great and helpful. The pool was great. Valentina at the pool was the bomb! All in all, the stay was great! Definitely will be back to Caesars Palace!

Reviews.Title: “One word--Opulence!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas 7+ times I feel at ease giving Caesars an excellent rating. We stayed in the Augustus Tower June 12-15, the tower had only been open 7 months. This was the best room I have had on any trip--including international!! Plasma TV's in the bedroom, the bathroom--I could hardly get my husband out of the room. My aunt was staying at the Wynn and our room was 10 times better than the Wynn. Pool area was clean, not over-crowded and easily accessible. Food--The Stage Deli is a must--WONDERFUL!! I had read a review that the gambling wasn't great but I found it to be okay--don't get me wrong, we didn't win a jackpot, but we held our own. I highly recommend this property!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend”
Reviews.Author: coronamama
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ceasar's Palace June 23-25. We were a bachelorette party of 8 girls. I booked two premier palace tower room at a great price in January. I drove in from LA area and had to pick someone up at the airport so while I was there I checked in. There were only 3 people in line and it went very quickly. One room was ready on the 9th floor but the other on the 10th floor was not. I commented with a smile that I only need one room now as I need to decorate and set-up for a "bachelorette weekend". She then told me she had another room that was not "non-smoking" but it was on the 26th floor and wouldn't be ready until 4 or 5 but it was a better room if I wouldn't mind waiting. I happily took the room. When we got to the hotel I valeted my car and a bellman promptly brought my SEVEN bags of "party supplies" up to my room and then came back two hours later to move it to the other room. Same bellman, smiling and friendly the whole time and even gave us some short cuts to get from one room to the other. I did make a second run at 10pm to the airport to pick up my bacherlorette. When we got to the hotel valet was full. I pulled up and nicely asked if I could still leave my car I was already checked in. The valet gentleman paused for one second and then said with a smile that he would take my car, he hailed a bellman who again took our bags quickly to our rooms. Quick, efficient and friendly all the way. The rooms were beautiful and the bathrooms glamorous. The beds were very comfortable especially with the down comforters and pillows. The petite suite was awesome as it had two bathrooms that were joined by a double shower. Great for 4 girls to get ready in to hit the town. On Saturday, we had a cabana reserved at the Neptune pool and were told we were lucky that we hadn't been bumped by the casino as a lot of other groups had. I don't know why we were so lucky but I booked early so maybe that helped. The cabana was perfect. The misters kept us comfortable even though it was at least 114 degrees that day and our cabana host, Laurie, was incredible. She was very friendly and kept us stalked with cold water, sodas, fresh fruit, chips and pretzels, ice, cups and towels that were all included. When she brought the bill it was for $325 and I told her that I was quoted $275, she said that they had just raised the prices but if that is what I was quoted then that's what I would pay so she promptly fixed the bill. The drink and food service around the pool was very quick and friendly. Everyone we met during our stay was helpful, friendly and professional. Except for the a limo tour of Vegas and visit to see the chippendales which was magnificient (we never made it to the club, bumme,r but oh well) we never left the hotel. It was a dream weekend everything went above and beyond our expectations and we can't wait to do it again just for fun at Ceasar's of course.

Reviews.Title: “Not my Idea of a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalucas416
Reviews.Content: This hotel will consistently disappoint if you had any expectation of quality or value for your money. Our room was very dusty; the carpet stained and threadbare; there were broken pieces of glass in the bathroom from the previous guest(s) that were never picked up by housekeeping during our five night stay; the bedspread could not have been resold at a garage sale as it was so faded and stained -- need I go on? OK, I will -- On to the food: $6 for what was supposed to be Irish Oatmeal. What came to the room looked like they had split one packet of instant oatmeal between two bowls. It was runny, with no consistency of oats -- disgusting slop. We had the same Irish Oatmeal which is distinctive in texture in one of the same resort's restaurants -- no comparison -- it was just fine. And, that is the problem -- there is no consistency or attention given to the level or delivery of service. I tried to buy a souvenir from one of the shops that was marked $8, but it rang up for $10. The girl at the register tried to tell me that if I wanted it that I had to pay $10. Before she "obliged" me by calling her manager, she pulled off one of the tags in effort to accuse me of retagging the item -- the tag under it said $8 as well. Finally, a manager told her to give me the discount. DUH! No apology for the overcharge or insult. This attitude of overcharging is the norm and must come from the top on down. The hotel offers NOTHING for free. Use of the gym is $25 per day, use of a wireless connection is $12 per day -- no coffee pot in the room. Had to ask them to bring up an ironing board, which should have been in the room to begin with, and the housekeeping delivery person loudly complained that I did not tip for them restocking my room with this essential. On to the casino: I did not know that Las Vegas had turned into a family destination with children on the casino floor. I also did not know that gambling was legal for those under 21 years of age. The slot machines were so tight that the only screams you heard were from drunk frat boys videotaping their antics on the casino floor, or the loud wailing of infants in strollers as their mothers played the slots. What a disgrace -- I will not be returning to Caesar's Palace (or the Strip) anytime soon. And, yes, I did lose at the slots like everyone else, but this is not sour grapes. I was entirely disgusted by my experience at Caesar's Palace -- would have been even if I had won $200 (which was probably never likely to happen there anyway...) Lest you think me completely negative -- the pool area is very beautiful and well-maintained with nice thick towels. The gym has state of the art equipment and both the workout room and the spa were clean and inviting. Overall, I think attention to the little details is needed for most of the hotel or it should be downgraded to Three Stars to reflect its condition and offerings...

Reviews.Title: “upgrades”
Reviews.Author: louise12399
Reviews.Content: stayed at caesars palace on june 15th - 20th 2006. When we arrived I expected to see a long line to check in as I had read a few reviews on this website before travelling, but even though there were about 20 people in front of us we only had to wait about 10 mins. Looked for the check in at the airport but be warned if you arrive from the uk you wont be able to use this service because it is in another terminal, this was quite dissapointing as we wanted to use the hotel shuttle bus but instead had to pay $25 for a taxi instead. Anyway when checking in at the hotel I found the staff to be very polite and helpful, I slipped a $20 bill to the receptionist and asked if any upgrades were available and was offered and upgrade to a suite in the palace tower on a high floor with wonderful views of both the pool area and the bellagio fountains for only $55. Amazing how a room can be available if you ask nicely!! When we got to the room we were delighted with the size and quality of the suite, lovely comfortable super king size bed, living area and best of all the bathroom was enormous with a whirpool bath made for two and a double glass shower. Found all of the staff in this hotel to be very friendly and polite and eager to help. Had a meal in the steakhouse across from cleopatras barge with a bottle of champane, and was impressed that the staff were so attentive and the steak was the most delicious I have ver tasted. Would definetly stay at this hotel again the next time I visit vegas and highly reccomend it to anyone thinking of staying there, just keep your plastic at home because the shopping is too tempting!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ladyirish874
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesar’s Palace Las Vegas Sunday June 4th through Friday June 9th of this year. We were married on Monday at The Little Chapel of the Flowers, and thought Caesar’s would be the perfect place to stay and for our honeymoon. From check in to check out, the entire experience was incredible. We checked in at the airport, and got through surprisingly quick despite the long line. The young lady at the counter was very friendly, and to our pleasant surprise, upgraded us to the Palace Tower with only a smile and a congratulations. Then she helped us with the transportation via shuttle to and from the hotel. Since this was our first trip to Las Vegas, that was a huge help. When we arrived at the hotel, we were completely amazed. Then when we got to the room, even more amazed! It was absolutely beautiful. A few weeks before we left, I had spoken on the phone with Asia, who was extremely helpful, efficient, and patient. She took a room service order from me to be delivered when we arrived. A delightful fruit and cheese basket was there waiting for us, which was nicer than I had expected. For our wedding night, I had preordered chocolate covered strawberries and Champaign. The strawberries were the size of the palm of my hand, dipped in chocolate, then sprinkled with chocolate shavings. Everything was done beautifully. The bell desk where my husband picked up his tuxedo and the concierge desk I needed to call a few times for questions were so polite. The cocktail waitress at the slots and the pool were Johnny on the spot. Our housekeeper was very sweet and efficient. The young lady who checked us out was very courteous and polite, which was very nice seeing as we had to check out at four o’clock a.m. because of our flight. When we did leave, I realized that I had forgotten by bridal bouquet in the room. I didn’t have time to run back because our shuttle was picking us up soon. I called the front desk, who said she would contact the manager to see if he could help me. After only a few calls back and forth, I did speak with a front desk manager who informed me my bouquet was in the mail and on its way to me. What excellent service! Everywhere we went everyone was very polite and very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace was more than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: supreme1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Las Vegas for our first time during April 2006 and stayed in the Palace Tower at Caesars. What a perfect choice since the suite was beyond our expectations! The baths were marvelous…especially with the dual walk-in glass shower. I had booked a regular room in the Palace Tower and paid extra to upgrade to the suite…well worth the extra money! Caesar’s location in the center of the strip is perfect. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Our 2-cents”
Reviews.Author: Toi-Singha
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace was once an absolutely grand place to stay, but as is the case with larger corporations, customer service has given way to the "bottom line." The number of rooms and the lack of trained staff has caused many of us to seek out other accomodations. In the "old days" if you booked a suite you were all but assured of quality attention and service. However, with 3,000 rooms at many of the hotels, it now takes an army to clean rooms and provide service all the while more planes are landing with more people anxious to check in. Rather than bash Caesars, let me offer some advice about vacationing in Las Vegas. Always stay at the most exclusive hotel that you can afford in the most room that you can afford, even if it means not having as long of a trip The reason is that those rooms (i.e. you too!) seem to receive the most attention. Also, no matter how tired you are, always smile and speak to the desk clerk as though he/she is the most important person you will meet that day. Speak to them by using thier name and asking how they are doing that day. Try to get them to smile. Believe me, at the time of check-in, they can set you up nicely (upgrade) or send you into the "back of coach class" with the click of a mouse. More advise, DRESS the part. If you are checking into a junior suite, look and act like you belong there. Nothing looks more stupid than a person complaining about this and that while looking like they got off of a banana boat booze cruise. Try to set your arrival on a Sunday or Monday. Show some appreciation by tipping for good service. 90% of any problem can be solved by knowing how to speak to people. You will be amazed how well you are treated if you are courteous. On my very unoffical list of hotels that still have good service in the order in which I prefer: (1) Four Seasons LV (2) Wynn LV (3) Caesars Palace (4) Golden Nugget or Mirage Hotel Best to everyone, and good luck at the tables !

Reviews.Title: “Hail Caesar!!!”
Reviews.Author: maggierae2583
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars from June 4-5 and were very impressed with the hotel. Upon check in we were offered an upgrade for $80 a night which we took because we were going to get a room that was double in size to our original and that had two bathrooms and was poolside. It was located in the Palace towers and the room was very nice. The bathroom were beautiful and came in handy since they were four of us. The two bathrooms were joined by a common shower that had glass doors. The room was worth every dollar of the upgrade. We really enjoyed this hotel and especially loved the pool. The only downside of the pool was that it was hard to find our waitress. Even when I got her attention she never came over and the place really wasn't that busy. The other down side is that if you go somewhere to have lunch and don't return to your chairs within 30 minutes, the pool hosts will take your towels and the chairs become available again. We ate at Bradley Ogden our first night (I wrote a review for that) which I don't recommend. For breakfast we ate at Cafe Lago, which is a buffet for $14.50 per person. The buffet was delicious and very reasonable priced for the quality of the food and the fact that you're in Vegas. We also ate at Neros Steak and Seafood which was also very good. At check out time we had a little problem with our bill as it seemed they overcharged for a couple of things, so check your bill. We cleared up the problem but I am still waiting for my credit card bill to make sure that I wasn't overcharged. Overall, we had a great time and loved Caesars Palace. We enjoyed walking through the Forum Shops and hanging out in the casino. We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Get the Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Madipuppy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at CP May 28-31. We booked a room at the airport and got a horrible room in I think the Roman Tower. It looked like a hotel 6 room. We were paying a lot of money so we called the desk and upgraded for $50/night into one of the newer towers. We were allowed to keep the room until later when ours was ready. When we went to exchange the keys, we were told we had a pool view which we didnt want. We were finally upgraded to the Augustus Tower which was absolutely beautiful. You could fit our entire first room into the bathroom of our newer room. You must get this Tower and pay the extra if you can! The Pools there were fantastic,3 big beautiful pools and never a problem getting lounge chairs. I find it hard to understand how reviewers find no places to eat. When in doubt go to the Forum Food Court which has everything at reasonable prices and great food. They have people there to give you plates, cups etc so its not like a Mall type of place.There are also plenty of places in the Forum Shoppes, expensive and reasonable. . The gambling is expensive, always $25 or more tables at night, during the day you can find $15. You can go over to the Mirage where there are plenty of $10 tables. CP has an excellent sports book too.

Reviews.Title: “Request a room in the Augustus Tower!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are many rooms in Caesars Palace Las Vegas, along with the different towers can make it confusing for anyone just to get to your room when you check in! My family's first stay at Caesars was excellent! They booked us in the Augustus tower. It really was a "suite" room! The bedroom and bathroom both had a plasma TV in it. Full size amenities. The beds were so soft with down comforters and pillows. The best part was the view from our room. We had a direct view of the Bellagio water show - every 15 minutes in the evening. It was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Palace Tower- won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MarilynFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from May 29-June 2. If people would do a little research before booking then they won't be disappointed. The 3 old towers (Roman, Centurion and Forum) are to be avoided. Stick with the Palace or Augustus (if you can afford it) and you will be just fine. We were in Room 1511 in the Palace Tower. Beautiful room. Great location - close to pools. Loved the pools and had no problem finding lounge chairs (the frozen pink lemonades were to die for! We aren't big gamblers and spent most of the time on penny slots still managed to earn enough points for a travel bag and 2 radio cooler bags - VERY COOL! Can't comment on the restaurants as we only ate at the marketplace here - pizza place was great. Can't beat the location on the strip. My only complaint is they took out the Marilyn Monroe slot machines :) --- P.S. Take advantage of the Best Rate Guarantee. Found a low rate on the web and they beat it by 25% - saved $500.

Reviews.Title: “I concur, what a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: LA_Gals
Reviews.Content: I have Caesars, I always wondered at the hype so I stayed this Memorial Weekend. We stayed in Cleopatra tower (I guess the old tower, but near the center, who wants to walk all over the place). It ran $400/night. For that price, I expected a decent hotel. Though we booked over a months in advance, we got a smoking room. Yuck. I used to smoke, but even I can't stand waking up to the staleness. Could I list the lack of amenities, I stayed at Monte Carlo that had more: Smoky room No ice bucket, no ice on the floor Needed to call for ice (room service for everything) Dingy bedroom linens Horrible toiletries The spa, had even less: 1 jacuzzi The spa is away from the pool No place to eat (need to call room service) No place to lounge (in the same place as the lockers) Yes, it is less about the room and more about the casino. But I even hate that Caesars have such steep minimums. $100, $300 minimums. Even Bellagio mins stay at $10 ALL NIGHT LONG. Absolutely ridiculous. Poor customer service at the Players Club. They forget to rate the tables, try to fight that one out. The only redeeming factor about Caesars is Pure, but it is just impossible to get in. Hmm, reservations don't count, guest lists don't count, not even for their guests, being girls (still had to wait), $200 bribes. Will never stay at Caesars again. Too many other great choices, Mandalay Bay, Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn, W (can't wait), Hard Rock, Palms

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: LaraF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in an executive suite in the forum towers. The are the oldest towers and I honestly believe they haven't been touched since they've been built. We got a great rate through the hotel for this room and honestly couldn't beat it anywhere else. Man, were we ever dissapointed. Room 7328 is a dump. Cigarette holes every square inch, dirt in the seams of the carpet, bleach stains all over. I had to check to see if the mattress was actually on the bed or it was the box springs I was sleeping on. We will never stay here again. I'm sure there are nice rooms in this place but we got the worst! We also stayed at Hooters and Rio while in town and will definatly be returning to those two. This joint is an overpriced dump!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by Caesars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace May 15 thru 19, 2006. It was a disappointment. Our room was supposedly Non-smoking but still smelled like a old ashtray. The carpet was stained and everything was worn or worn out (Roman Tower). The staff simply didn't care about the guests. As an example, during a windy day by the pools ashtrays were blown off tables scattering cirgarette butts everywhere. The staff literally kicked the ashtrays aside and continued on there merry way. If you want to gamble, expect atleast $25 minimums and dealers that act like you're just a bother. Spent more time gambling at other Casinos that were fun. We wanted to try Caesars and now we can say we did. We can also say we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious upgrades”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the middle of everything -- even though it's old, they've done a great job keeping up with the newer hotels around it. We booked through Expedia and got a decent room with a fabulous bathroom. After the first night, we wanted an even better room, so we upgraded to the Palace Tower. The upgrade was worth every penny -- the room and bathroom were much better than I could have expected. We were close to the pool (which is amazing) and to the nicer casino area. The hotel service was good, but I think it is in most places in Vegas (if you smile and hold back on the attitude, people will generally treat you with the respect your looking for). One of the best parts of Vegas is the shows -- We went to two Cirque de Soleil shows and loved both. There are several other cirque shows in the city, so be sure to check at least one out. Be warned, to experience the best qualities of Vegas you'll need to bring a few extra dollars. This is a city built around people dropping loads of cash.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lefty0418
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 2 nights at Caesars. We stayed in the new Augustus tower. It was very nice. We've stayed at a number of hotels in Vegas and this was one of the best. The room was nicely appointed and bed was extremely comfortable. We did not have to wait for check in, but it seems that's hit or miss....the same time the next day, the line was very long. The breakfast buffet at Cafe Lago was very good. Just keep in mind that they only serve the buffet at breakfast, so don't wait in the long line to find that out.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: bolin3876
Reviews.Content: we stayed at caesars for one night as we were flying back to england on 13th may, we never used any thing but after seeing my bank account details this morning we seemed to have been charged about 4-5 dollars for something, not a touch on mgm, where we stayed when we arrived. wont be going back here.

Reviews.Title: “Moving on up! Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: compassquest
Reviews.Content: Just left the Augustus Tower yesterday! So sad to go! Room number 4368 was out of this world. We had spent the three previous days at West Wing in MGM Grand. Liked it before, but the room seemed like a cave this time. Hubby agreed to switch to our comped room for two nights in Augustus. Getting to the room was a pleasure, as the Augustus Tower is very close to the lobby. Everthing seemed grand and gorgeous. As we entered our room, we exclaimed over the fabulous view of the Bellagio fountains. Watched the shows many times. The room was very well appointed and HUGE after the west wing. Bed was extremely comfortable and furniture was all top quality in sitting area. Large plasma TV in room and smaller one in bathroom. Bath has huge jacuzzi, wonderul glassed in shower and lots of marble. The toilet area was separate with a door. Everything was very much to our liking. First night traveled to eind of Forum shoppes for Cheesecake Factory. Most other times ate at Augustus Cafe off the lobby. All meals comped and we are not big gamblers. Staff was efficient and friendly. Will surely return, but only to Augustus Tower. BTW, this is a huge hotel and can be difficult navigating. I found the business center after several tries, but it took several tries on my second venture. Lots of conventions here, and thankfully hardly any strollers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: JCD
Reviews.Content: The room was large with a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower. We stayed on the 14th floor in the Roman Tower and had a nice view of the city and the mountains. I have to admit, however, that I was a bit disappointed in this hotel. For over $300/night, I thought there might be more amenities. We waited in a long line to check-in and then there were no bell hops for our bags. When we inquired about the gym, we found out it was $50/day if we wanted to use the facilities. We decided to go for a walk instead. When we went to leave, there was also a long line for a taxi to the airport, but it did move quickly. I guess the lines are to be expected, since the hotel is so large. We did see Cirque de Soleil's "O", which I highly recommend, and Danny Gans, who was entertaining. For shoppers, this is a mecca, although there aren't any bargains. .

Reviews.Title: “Caesars a great time!”
Reviews.Author: eoetourhost
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars for three days over a weekend and had a great time. After reading reviews here I opted for the augustus tower room. Great room with lots of space. Very quiet even though the hotel was sold out. We traveled with friends who stayed in the centurian tower and were not impressed. No ice machines, no mini bar. Loved the pool. Really enjoyed the Augustus Cafe where the food is just excellent. Try the vanilla soaked apricot crepes or the eggs Benedict. Friday we entered the Pussycat Dolls Club. As guests of the hotel we flashed our room key and were escorted past several hundered people waiting to get in just in time for the show. Very hot. Ate at Boa and Spago in the Forum Shops. Both excellent choices. Placed my bet on the Kentucky derby at the sport book saturday morning and watched the race with about 2000 other people that afternoon. Yeah, I won. Really have nothing to complain about. Thanks to everyone who gave me all the good info on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful appointments, rock-hard beds”
Reviews.Author: greenturtle2
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful, as are the rooms. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is filled with Aveda products. Also, the hotel is in a great location on the Strip, and the Casino/Forum Shoppes are must-see. The one-drawback: rock-hard beds. I was truly suprised how uncomfotable the beds were; if you stay here, be fore-warned.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe it's Vegas - But the Room Wasn't That Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at the Las Vegas Convention Center. Ceasar's Palace was to be our homebase for the conference. I waited in "Disneyesque" line to get a cab to the hotel, then waited in another line (almost as long) to check in at the hotel! The Bellman convinced me that I might not want to tote my bag through the entire property, but I later regretted when it was midnight and no bag! I fell asleep waiting for my luggage to come. I've yet to stay at a Vegas hotel that has a coffee pot in the room and/or good room service. The room was clean and neat, but I've been to other venues without the hype that are much better for the money! Even for a nongambler - there is nothing cheap about Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicbev
Reviews.Content: WE have just returned from a 6 night holiday to Las Vegas with a really cheap hotel rate for Caesars palace which we found on the internet. We wondered if there was a catch after getting the room so cheap (but there wasn't!), but we were put into a room in the Roman Tower, but unfortunately our room overlooked the top of the air conditioning units outside which were really noisy. So we asked if we could change our room the following morning, and a few hours later were we given a room in the Forum tower which was an even better room. Our original room in the Roman Tower was more modern - this tower must have been recently refurbished and new baths/showers put in with a TV screen in the bathroom, but the bathroom in the room in the Forum Tower had a jacuzzi, walk in shower, 2 sinks, so overall this was nicer with a view of Flamingo Hotel opposite. This was my first time to Vegas and the hotel didn't disappoint. We didn't eat in the hotel, but did spent an evening in Cleopatra's barge watching the band play who were very good! Also the pools are lovely, although does get really busy at weekends when people arrive for a long weekend. We went to see 'O' at the Bellagio which is a very good show (in another lovely hotel!) Wish I was still there!

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace is now our home in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: wackyjack
Reviews.Content: Being a Harrah's Diamond member, we were comped. rooms at Caesar's Palace in April for our 10 year wedding anniversary. Using Harrah's points, I also had free air fare on Southwest out of Houston. $240 in meals were also comped at Caesar's. So, it was virtually a free trip, EXCEPT for the gambling. The hotel is HUGE. We were in the Palace Tower with recently renovated rooms. It was a little smaller than I expected, but the bath was huge and all marble with a jacuzzi tub for two. Very nice room. Quite a distance to get to the casino. But once there, I hit several jackpots! I find the vp machines to pay pretty good. Hubby liked the new Poker Room. We ate at Nero's which was wonderful! Lobster Bisque and Filet Mignon were excellent! Augusta Cafe was so-so. Room service breakfast was great on last morning. Cocktail service was very good in casino. Didn't have to wait long, like at others. We checked out the pool area and it looked very nice. Handy to the Palace Towers. We saw Celine Dion, and her show is a MUST SEE. Wonderful! Although, be prepared, I am not a small gal, and the seats in the colosium are very cramped! We have a trip planned in July and were booked at the Paris, but hubby had me change it back to Caesar's. All in all, a wonderful anniversary, great trip and Caesar's was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple recently spent 4 days/ 3 nights at Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas. Because it's Las Vegas, the trip was obviously a blast. Our opinion of Caesar's, however was more modest and mixed. The four of us are all between the ages of 40 and 46. The girls were primarily looking for a vacation with good restaurants, a nice relaxing pool, a spa, and some nightlife. The boys wanted to do it all. Three of us had been in Caesar's before, but none had actually stayed there. First the plusses. Caesar's and it's affiliate hotels have an airport check in. Not all of the resorts do. But it can be very hard to find in the airport. Depending upon when you arrive, you will probably be better off trying to check in at the airport than at the front desk of the resort. They will try to sell you a ride on their shuttle for $6 a person. I suggest passing. A cab ride for 4 to the hotel costs about $16-17 with tip. The pool is fantastic. If you like "European" style bathing (topless) they have a separate adults only pool that is divided off of the main pool complex by some vegetation.
