There are drink servers always available (quite attractive) and you can get extra towels if you ask. The drinks are $6 for a beer, $11 for a mixed drink like a mai tai. You can charge them to your room if you bring your room charge card with you. The complex itself is enormous. There are plenty of spots to gamble. A lot of high end shopping in the Forum Shops district. The sports book is the "NORAD" of Las Vegas sports books and shouldn't be missed if you are into that sort of thing. The service by Caesar's employees was good. All were pleasant and friendly. No complaints. For poker players, the new poker room is gigantic and well run. However, it was generally dead during the 4 days we were there. Play on no more than about 1/2 to 2/3 of the tables in the main room, at most, during most of the day and night. Really died out during the 2-3 hours around dinner. Others have told me the room is generally more active. Our rooms were average. I've stayed in nicer at the MGM, Mirage and Aladdin. Absolutely no view, but I don't go to Vegas to sit in my room and stare out the window, so I have no real objection regarding the rooms. I do have an objection regarding the room service. The first two days we were there our room was not cleaned until after 5 pm. This is totally unacceptable. Then the last morning we were there, the room service attendant came bouncing in at 7:45 am. This got a big "thumbs down" from this Roman. We were also disappointed in the restaurant/bar situation at Caesar's. The first night we ate at Spagos. Food was fine, but not spectacular. Service was excellent. Wine was grossly overpriced (but not the food). We ended up eating the other two nights at the Venetian and Hamada's, off the strip. But our biggest complaint, and the reason we all agreed we wouldn't go back, is the nightclub/bar/lounge situation. After our nights out eating, or going to shows, we all wanted to just return to Caesar's, sit in a bar or lounge, and have some cocktails and talk. Forget about it. First, some of the spots simply closed down around midnight, even on a Friday and Saturday night. But a bigger problem is that there will be no spots available. If your idea of a Friday night is to put on your Lebron James "third" jersey, your powder blue truckers cap, oversized Nike's and 48 lbs. of jewelry and "roll" with your pals, Caesar's is the place to go for you. The half a dozen locations in the complex that will still be open at midnight are for 50 cent and Ludacris fans only. No drinking, just standing around looking cool. At Caesar's you will observe odd situations like a bar with 50 people at it, one bartender, and no one purchasing a cocktail. Instead, everyone stands around with their cellphone plastered to their ear, scoping out the others doing the same thing. We did go into Pure one night, but I can only describe that as lame. They've got an act they call the Pussycat Dolls who leap up on a stage and dance around for a couple of minutes in skimpy outfits. But they do it in an area "reserved" for people other than you or me. You can try to look around a corner to see what is going on as you nurse your $10 beer. The only benefit is that you aren't directly in front of the speakers spewing their godawful "singing." I had heard that Las Vegas is developing a bit of a "gang" problem down on the Strip. In fact, the weekend we were in town there were apparently some confrontations at the MGM. I can see that Caesar's is on their way to the same situation. For my money, I recommend the Mirage. It's right next door so you get the benefit of the same great location Caesar's has. The basic rooms are nicer, the pool is great and the atmosphere will probably be a little more to your taste if you have outgrown the 20-something scene.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: BrettT
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay in the Augustus Tower 4/21-4/23. I have stayed at many hotels on the strip and Ceasars by far was the best. I loved everything about this hotel from the large and very comfortable rooms, to the shopping, food and casino. Upon check-in, we found out that the date of our arrival date had been entered into the system incorrectly (Thurs instead of Friday) and therefore, we initially had no room. The front desk staff went to work and after a few moments we had another room in the Augustus Tower. Hat's off to everyone that helped us out! The casino was large and exciting and most of all, "friendly to my wife and I." A waitress seemed to come by every 10-15 minutes so getting beverages was no problem at all. The forum shops were great - a little pricey - but great nonetheless. I had been looking forward to this trip for months and I wasn't dissapointed. I highly recommend Ceasars Palace and will definately make this place my "home away from home."

Reviews.Title: “Hated the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Caesar's Palace on a business conference in April 2006. The hotel was overbooked for my last day in Las Vegas. The hotel therefore changed, without my consent, my departure date. The reservation change resulted in a change in my departure date of Saturday to a departure date of Friday. I discovered the error upon check-in. The hotel employees blaimed the error on my travel agent. However, I showed them a copy of my confirmed itinerary, which identified my departure as Saturday. They did find a room for me. However, it was not the King non-smoking room I requested. Instead, it was a smoking Parlor with a Murrphy bed (pull down bed), which was rock hard. Also, I am allergic to smoke. Once I discovered that the room was a smoking room, the housekeeper had to Ionize the room, which was done. Also, there was a small couch/chair in front of the pull down. The housekeeper was called to move the furniture and to add soap to the bathroom (there was none in there), which was also done. I complained again upon my check out and the hotel employee indicated that Non-smoking rooms are a request that may not be honored. And that Ionization can be done to help. This dones not totally eliminate the problem! Luckily I am only a little bit allergic. If I was servely allergic, I would have spent my time in the local hospital instead of my conference.

Reviews.Title: “Dun Roman - and it was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: tim_m
Reviews.Content: Found 2 nights this April on the Internet at under $200 total and wondered what the catch was! Arrived having read reviews and expecting long check-in to be seen immediately and in a very friendly manner. Upgraded to Palace Tower for next to nothing with fabulous 22nd floor view of the Strip. Still wondering about the catch, spent incredible afternoon by (and in) the pool, before returning to in-room jacuzzi to get ready for cut-price Celine Dion show - utterly mind-blowing. Took shuttle to Rio for perhaps the best sea-food buffet in the world, then back to extremely luxurious bed. Everyone we met was kindness itself. You could spend a holiday just exploring the hotel (even if to my classics-teacher eyes some of the decor was a little far-fetched - at least it was home from home!). If you ever get the opportunity to stay here at an affordable price, grab it with both hands; this was the best hotel experience of my life (challenged only by the Lindos Mare Hotel in Lindos, Rhodes).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomwildman
Reviews.Content: Just got back from las vegas on the 19/04/06 we stayed at caesers palace and it was very nice. The hotel is very big and has lots to do and plenty of shops and restuarants. The room we got was standard with a double sink/jacussi and a walk in shower. The bed was very comfy and also their was sky tv including premiership football channel. The hotel staff are helpful and everything is done as it should be. The pool area is lovely and if its hot a great place to sunbath. snaxmux maximus does good food around the pool The Forum shops are very nice and there is good places to eat in there try not to go to the ultra expensive resturaunts as the reasonable priced ones are just as good. In the casino the table games are not very good if your a beginner or if you dont want to gamble $100 plus per sitting The slots are good but you never win they are a good excuse to get a free drink in the casino though Celion dion is worth the money even if you dont like her much. The location is the best on the strip and if you want to be near all the best hotels stay here... The best hotels are the Bellagio (next door) the venatian and the paris... Wynn is nice too

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Caesars Palace for two nights. I booked our trip three days before leaving using a last minute travel site. I had no idea what to expect, as the trip cost was so low, but decided to trust the reviews on TripAdvisor. We arrived around 10:30pm, and there was no line at check in (the day check-in line was HUGE!). When we checked in we were told we had been upgraded to a palace tower room, which had only been opened two weeks prior. We got to our room and we were pleased to say the least. The bathroom was huge, with two sinks. We had a whirlpool tube and a seperate shower, an extremely comfortable king size bed with a down comforter and down pillows, and a nice sitting area within the room. The staff we interacted with were extremely polite, and we truely have no complaints. The hotel is immense, and I know we did not see nearly everything there. This only means we must go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: Zoe-Peter
Reviews.Content: Despite a long queue at check in we had a fabulous stay here. The room was fantastic with a step in jacuzzi located in the centre of the bedroom. Neros restaurant within was a fine dining experience - recommend the steak! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: East_coast55
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Ceasars Palace for four days for business. I had noted the reviews and when the clerk initially tried to put me into the Roman tower, I asked if it had been recently renovated. The clerk said that he would find me a newer room and put me into the Palace tower. In other words, its possible to get a room upgrade without a hassle or tip. A friend who doesn't use TripAdvisor did stay in the Roman Tower and was very unhappy with the room. Palace Tower rooms are very large with a small foyer, mini bar area, huge bathroom with a spa tub,large separate shower, and separate toilet area. I had a double bed but it was very comfortable. My room overlooked the pool area. The rooms have all the amenities that you would need, e.g., lighted makeup mirror, upscale toiletries,etc. When I discovered that I only had 1 clothes hanger 15 were brought up right away.(In other words the service was great.)The room service was also very prompt and while expensive was excellent. Be advised that in Las Vegas, you will not find an in room coffee maker, because they want you to be out of your room to gamble, so either bring one or order room service. The shopping is fantastic and there are many restaurants on the property. For people who have not been to Vegas, I would not recommend renting a car if you intend staying on the Strip because there is a cheap and conveient transit system that connects all of the major hotels, and it is impossible to drive due to the traffic anyway. The taxi from the airport is only around $8.00. So if you go to Vegas, stay at Cesars and feel like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower room was spectacular”
Reviews.Author: klzg
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room in the Augustus Tower which overlooked the Caesar's swimming pools on one wall and the strip including the Bellagio fountains on the other. The view was more than you could ever asked for! The room was huge, luxurious and spotless. The service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights Palace Tower Suite”
Reviews.Author: monroe2020
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in a Palace Tower suite. The room is referred to a "Studio Guest Room" on the Caesars site. The bellman told us the the rooms had recently been remodeled to bring them up to par with the newer Augustus Tower rooms. All the funishings and finish items did look new. Room was large with a sitting area (couch, upholstered chairs, coffee tables, and desk. Our room was on the 14th floor. View was limited to overlooking the Garden of the Gods pools and the mountains in the horizon. Bed was wonderful with down duvet, pillows, soft mattress and padded head board. Renovation included adding a flat screen TV. Refridgerator was the computorized type that charged you every time you moved something. I did remove some of their items to make room for my own (water and cokes) but simply called the front desk the morning of check out and had them remove the "purchases". No problems. Suite had his and her bathrooms. His had a sink/vanity and water closet with toilet. Her has a sink/vanity with water closet with toilet and bidet. Hers also has a oversize (two person) jacuzzi tub. A large shower (two shower heads) adjoins both bathroom with a door opening to either side. (you could walk though the shower from one bathroom to another). Only complaint was the road noise at night. Sirens from Flamingo Road woke us up a couple of times. But I imagine the noise is even worse in the Augustus Tower rooms facing Bellagio since they are next to the street.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Rooms vary”
Reviews.Author: booyakid
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd time staying in the Palace Tower and the 3rd time I got a completely different room. One thing they all have in common, is GREAT Bathrooms. Whirlpool tub, separate shower, double sink vanity. The actual room I stayed in this time was nothing special. Definitely not worth the $50 a night extra I paid at check in time. Nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Place, no better in vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Tosber
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay , 27th -31st. Its a huge place to walk around and find your room, much less trying to find a shortcut, but it soon comes. By far better than any of the others around the strip. I will stay there again , but just wish there was more places open late on to get something to eat without having to call room service . 10/10 .

Reviews.Title: “Definely Stay Here Next TIme”
Reviews.Author: Sherpakirk
Reviews.Content: Just home from 4 nights stay at Caesar's Palace, Mar 26th to 30th. Check-in at Airport was a breeze, though I'd hoped we could dump our luggage here too, but not a huge concern. Originally assigned a room in the Palace Tower, we were up-graded to a suite in the Forum Tower, when we picked up our key at the hotel. The room was huge - size of a small apartment, including bar with fridge, nice sitting area with sofa and two large, luxurious lounging chairs, a separate table area with four chairs and a huge bath, with double sinks, shower, separate WC closet and double jacuzzi tub. Hotel itself confusing the first time through it, but easy to find your way around after a day. Had no concerns at any point during our stay. All staff we had contact with were excellent. Had no trouble getting bar service at any of the slots or tables, and everyone was very helpful and courteous. Shopping in the Forum Shops is very good - lots of variety and choice, but leave lots of room on your VISA - most stores are very high-end. Found excellent shopping at Desert Passage at the Alladin and the new Fashion Mall (it's huge) opposite The Wynn. Overall, our experience at Caesar's was great and can't wait to return. (Saw Blue Man Group and Mystere - both worth seeing)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shoechick
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girls trip to Caesars (Friday - Tuesday.) This was my first trip to Vegas without my husband...much more shopping this time, less gambling. We booked into the Palace Tower, a room with two double beds. It was lovely. One of the nicest rooms we've stayed in at Caesars and that includes the Augustus Tower. The room had a lovely view of both the pool area and the Bellagio fountains. The bathrooms...notice I said roomssss.. there were two of them we're great. They connected by one very large glassed in shower....two women, two bathrooms, can't go wrong. We ate at Cafe Lago twice, both very good. Each time we ate on the deck which is such a lovely setting. Spent one day by the pool. Lucked out and got one of those queen size lounge beds with curtains at the side of the pool...wow. Pool service was great, the drinks were nice and strong and the food good and pretty reasonably priced. Absolutely loved it...I'm back in 5 weeks time with Hubby, hope they treat us so well next time.

Reviews.Title: “surly staff, long lines”
Reviews.Author: Carcajou301
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Monday-Wednesday for a conference. I point this out, because I was told that waiting in long lines for everything was much worse on Fridays to Sundays. We encountered long waits and lines for virtually everything in the hotel- taxis, bell man, meals, etc. The staff were uniformly surly and unhelpful. Our room in the Augustus tower at $330 [conference rate] was moderately luxurious and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Do people not realize this hotel is 40 years old?!?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed @ Caesars twice (in 12/04 and 8/05), I can say that the high majority of my expectations were met. Granted, both stays were on very slow days, which equalled super-low rates and no long waits anywhere. With that said, I'd like to remind everyone that this fabulous hotel/casino opened in 1966. Not 1996 or 1999, but Nineteen hundred & sixty-six. It cracks me up when people pitch fits about a hotel room not being up to their luxury standards when it's almost the same age as they are, or older. For the age of the hotel, I think it's remarkable that it's in such good condition. Caesars deserves to be commended for only utilizing the wrecking ball in a significant capacity when they added on the mall and the newest Augustus Tower. Specifics on the accommodations, you say? Well, on the first stay, I was in the Forum Tower in a "Jacuzzi Room," which translates to a 70s-ish room with a mirror on the ceiling above the bed, and a large, I mean LARGE, circular tub in the bedroom. Yes, there was no wall between the bathroom and the bedroom, but I'm an odd soul who likes to play "If These Walls Could Talk" in my head alot of the time, so I found the room quite charming overall. I have to admit that I felt like I was taking a shower in a nursing home bathroom, what with the wrap-around curtain in the big circular tub (which did not have any Jacuzzi jets--this room was built in '74, I believe...). But there was a separate water closet and the vanity had 2 sinks and the requisite marble all over the place, so I was pleased. What flabbergasted me was (a)how incredibly heavy the door was to the room (in case there's a fire, according to the bellman), and (b)how the halls look like they haven't been touched/redone since they were built. According to other Vegas travellers I've talked to, this old-feeling, back-in-time-looking detail is referred to as "Las Vegas charm." So I discounted that solely for that reason. On my second visit last August, again on a very slow day, the check-in line @ the airport was unusually long, so I went ahead to the hotel and checked in there. I checked in the next-to-last day that they were still at the old front desk right inside the main casino, and things were a bit "transitional"-looking. But the desk clerk was as sweet as could be (as had been the other one in December), and I told her I didn't care what kind of room I had as long as it wasn't smokey. This time I was in the Roman Tower, which I believe was built in '69 or so (the Centurion Tower is the original '66 tower). I'd heard that this tower had been totally renovated, and the room showed much proof of that. This room was what I'd call a junior suite, in that it was a good deal larger than the normal room, and it also had a separate walk-in shower and Jacuzzi tub (with jets!!) in the nice, walled-in bathroom. There was one main sink and another lower, vanity-style sink (with a chair to sit in, I guess for ladies mostly), and also the water closet. This room had a perfect view of the Garden of the Gods pool(s) area (I took a tip back down for the front desk clerk to thank her), and the window to the "faux balcony" was open. WARNING: Don't try to climb out the window onto the walled-in ledge of the building!! Not that most people would be idiotic enough to try this, but I did and I swear I thought I wasn't going to be able to get back in b/c the window's so high off the floor. The only downside to the room was that the Jacuzzi "timer button" was on the wall as you go into the bathroom--in other words, you had to turn it on and then run around the corner to keep the water from spraying everywhere, unless you had the tub really, really full before the jets turned on. There was also a small flat-screen TV in the bathroom, which was fun, but not very practical, in my humble opinion. Overall, this property has everything going for it--location, classic Las Vegas vibe, wonderful pool/outdoor hot tub oasis, and The Forum Shoppes attached. People can complain until the cows come home about the dated rooms and the long lines and the smokey casino, and the answer that I'd give them is, "Go to the Venetian, Paris, MGM, Mirage, etc. and see if you don't find the same issues there in one form or another." People are flocking in herds to Vegas now, and as long as the hotels can fill the rooms most every night, there's not going to be time to renovate (until the older rooms are hurting their business alot). I work at an extremely large hotel myself and that's exactly the situation we're in right now, trying to renovate 1500+ rooms without losing business. You've now got Bellagio (the first and only 5-diamond hotel in Vegas) and the Wynn giving the "older" hotels a run for their money, not to mention the dozen or so other hotels being built and planned on the Strip. Competition=Renovation, it's that simple. But the rates are going to continue to rise as long as people are willing to pay them, and the smoking's going to continue, even in non-smoking rooms, until people realize that second-hand smoke really does kill. I'll get off my soap box now and add that as far as the food goes in Caesars, I personally feel it's much more worth it to walk over to Bellagio's buffet, or to one of the cafes @ Paris, or even to take a cab to one of the "old school" places downtown, where they do still actually have meals under $10, like old Vegas used to be famous for. Hope I've covered everything here, and I might add that it pays to be gracious to the desk clerk who checks you in. A nice attitude and a non-fakey greeting, even after waiting in a long line, can go a long way, for both the desk clerk and the guest. The infamous $20 trick never hurts, either!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Mediamonkey
Reviews.Content: I loved Caesar's. Stayed in the new Augustus towers, which give you a wonderful view, and are really classy. Fantasticly comfortable bed, lovely sofa, great TV (including a flat screen in the bathroom) large shower and tub... really wonderful. The resort is incredible, amazing staff, wicked pool, great casino, top class poker room, and great dining (Bradley Ogden's is beyond words) the location is perfect, and the Forum shops are worth a visit. You just can't go wrong with this hotel, it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: TheScotAbroad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesers Palace for a convention, while it was fine for business I would not recommend it for pleasure. I stayed in the Roman tower, hardly luxurious, the carpet and sofa had burn marks and stains on them and the door looked as if it had been forced open and then been hastily repaired (to the point where it was easy to leave the room and the door not to lock properly). Caesars Palace is vast and if you have time (and money) to kill would be great; if all you want to do is get from A to B and grab a bite to eat on the way then it is awful - the queues at the Cypress Street Market restaurants get long at lunch times, it can take half an hour to get served "fast food". As with all casino hotels, signs can be confusing and for the first few days getting around is not easy - every journey seems to require crossing the casino floor - I wonder why that might be... Generally food was good, room service was good, toiletries were very good, staff were helpful, check in/out was reasonable. Room was "tired" and could have been cleaner, sheer numbers of people means you sometimes have to wait in long lines (Cypress Market and the buffet brunch) If you really want to stay at Caesars Palace then go for it, however, if you want a luxury hotel on the strip then maybe this isn't it anymore?

Reviews.Title: “Observations from a 1st timer”
Reviews.Author: telecombeta
Reviews.Content: Trip to Caesar's Palace 2-22 thru 2/25. I used these forums to do so research but was still amazed by the walking distances involved in just my hotel and on the STRIP. Couple of average 50ish folks for our first trip, ever, to Vegas. We were in the Roman tower, 12th floor, and the room was nice and probably recently refurbished. Liked: Variety of shows, people watching, food. Disliked: $12 margaritas, $1.50 nit picking charges to use the phone, slobs everywhere. I am amazed at a venue like 'O' with a guy/girl that looked like they pick up trash for a living and just came from work. Probably won't go back. We saw 'O' and it was great as well as the old school Follies Berger at the Tropicana. The casino at the Tropicana was more our level with $5 blackjack. As regular people we were able to dine at nice places for lunch and got prime seats simply due to being dressed for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kruzlady
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesar's 2/21-2/25. Our superior room was in the Palace Tower (odd number). We had a room with a view of the Mirage and the mountains in the distance. Friends stayed in an even number room and had a view of the pool. Both rooms and views were great. The pool view rooms are a little larger with a sofa , our room just had a chair, but it was still huge. The bathroom was large and nice with double sinks, large shower and separate whirlpool tub. There was a small refrigerator in room, in-room safe, and ample closet space. I suggest check in at airport if arriving by air(no wait). I noticed lines at the check-in at hotel. Also, we bought our shuttle transfers through Caesar's but would have saved a few $$ if we had just walked outside and purchased. Friends had room service and they were always prompt and food was hot. I called for a robe and they delivered promptly(within half an hour). I would definitely stay here again, can't comment about casino, did not use it. The Cheesecake Factory was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Turbulence at Take Off, then Flying High!”
Reviews.Author: gs32794
Reviews.Content: Thanks to this website, I had a few tips about dealing with Vegas desk clerks. We used airport check-in. Nice and quick. Tipped the clerk and received an upgrade to Jacuzzi room with strip view in Roman (an older) Tower. Nice room, but heat didn't work (46 degrees outside). After calling desk twice, waiting 75 minutes and having it inferred that I didn't know how to operate a themostat, I went to front desk and complained. Was upgraded to a Spa Suite in Forum Tower. Very Nice indeed. From then on, everything (service, facilities, etc) was great. Despite mixed reviews here, I enjoyed the breakfast buffet. Don't know about other Caesar's restaurants because we dined out every night. Came back and had drinks in the hotel though. We really appreciated the 30+ age atmosphere at Shadow and Cleopatra's Barge. We played at several casinos. Had great luck at the off-strip Coast Casinos, but really liked the much less smokey air at Caesar's. I left with the impression of wanting to come back for another 4 days and never leaving the proerty! Two suggestions: (1) Use the very convenient valet parking; (2) Check in at the main hotel counter, I get the impression that they are more empowered to do upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs is going to ruin this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night. The Caesars Connection Card program was great but now they have changed me over to the Total Reward Card which ----. Much harder to earn comp $ and confusing. The room was nice in the Palace Tower and the staff at Caesars are wonderful but they seem to have cut back. Lewis and Clark could not have found a cocktail server in the Forum casino. They come around very rarely so you better bring your own bottle of water. Many of the video poker machines at Caesars are getting old and in disrepair. Loose or broken buttons and burned in screens. I like Caesars but they seem to be trying to cut costs because things seem to be going downhill. May not stay there next time. Jeff

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tappy Feet
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay. Weather was sunny but the resort was simply beautiful. We stayed in the Roman tower but didn't like our room as the area smelt smokey and we had requested a non-smoking room. The front desk assured us that the floor was non-smoking but upgraded us to a Palace Tower room - wow. Their service was prompt and very courteous. The room was wonderful. Two toilets, two sinks - one in each toilet area, double shower and double jacuzzi bath. Gold chocolate coins left in the room each evening. We loved the Forum Shops - marble everywhere it's just stunning. From the car park elevator we hardly walked through the casino but through the shops in the Appian Way. Again, marble everywhere in beautiful colours. Our lift exited at the pool entrance. The heated pools were just amazing. The pool towels were so fluffy. We saw Elton John - what a show - he is such a good entertainer. Would advise eating off the strip as the service is better and the places are less crowded. We visited Red Rock Canyon - breathtaking - the Ski and Snowboard resort which although small was great fun. We also dove to the Grand Canyon on Valentnies Day - well worth the drive as words cannot describe the beauty. We also saw Mystere at Treasure Island which was excellent and Mamma Mia at Mandalay Bay which we also enjoyed. This was our second trip to Vegas but our first to Ceasars. We've visited other resorts but for the service and location you cannot find fault. We would recommend it and hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: menelso
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas - we stayed at The Bellagio, but decided to stay an extra day, so moved to Caeser's since Bellagio was booked. At Caeser's we got twice the room for the same price as Bellagio (I do have to say I loved Bellagio!). Our room was in the Augustus tower. We were supposed to be in a no smoking room, but when we got to the room, it smelled smoky, and there were a couple of clean ashtrays in it. I called the front desk, and they quickly remedied the situation and upgraded us to a Lakeview room. The room was huge, and the bathroom impressive (plasma TV, whirlpool tub, separate toilet). I wasn't crazy about the decor, maybe too modern for my taste, but the furniture and the bed were very comfortable, and it was nice to have so much space. The service was good all around, people were friendly and efficient. I LOVE the Forum shops, got some great deals on skirts for my girls at Bernini, and some nice shoes at The Walking store. We also saw Celine Dion, her show was wonderful! I would definitely recommend Caeser's - stay in the mid to upper floors of the Augustus Tower with the Lakeview (aka Bellagio fountains).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best experiences of my life! Fit for a King.”
Reviews.Author: RNinatl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Augustus Tower in january 2006. I love everything about this place. PROS: Augustus Tower is superb! It is breath-takingly beautiful as soon as you walk in the new lobby. Clean and spacious. Staff is very friendly...more than helpful!!! Our room was not ready when we got there, we checked our bags and walked around for a while. Went back a couple of hours later...room ready. Augustus Tower, non-smoking, Bellagio view. STUNNING! just stunning. Huge room with a king bed, sofa and small dining table. Large flat panel plasma hanging on the wall. Nice sized closet with bath robes. Lots of big fluffy pillows in the bed. I think we had a down comforter with a duvet cover. Not a hint of smoke in the air. Bathroom was nice spacious with marble floors. Twin sinks (nice!) and a jucuzzi bath. Seperate closet for the toilet. Nice big walk-in shower. And a nice additional (smaller) flat panel plasma haging on the wall. The outside wall of this room is full windows... Great view of the strip and the mountains. I loved watching the Bellagio fountains!! We had turn down service every night... nice to be re-stocked with new linens. We didn't hear any noise from neighbors. Cons: I can't think of any... but if I were petty... let's see.... maybe...hummmmm ..ok the 'toilet closet' doesn't have a fan. That's really the only thing I would change. I love this tower and will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars is no Palace”
Reviews.Author: nigsprncs
Reviews.Content: Caesars was terrible, my husband and I were there at the end of January. The check in lines were long, and the staff was rude. I was hoping to use the spa however I was told I was not allowed to view the facility. I didn't want to see treatment room however I did want to see the area I was going to spend over 200.00 dollars for. The rooms in the Roman Tower are old and dated. I would compare the room to your average Best Western, with a lot higher price tag. I would also not call them clean. My very large bathroom had hair in the tub, I also found a used condom in the room. When calling the front desk, they told me they were soory and would get somweone there to take care of it. I was also given a 50.00 food and beverage credit. When I asked them about a new room they told me none were available. I will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Garbage.. might as well stay @ Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good lunch buffet, and that's what brought me into into the Caesar's hotel lobby, because afterall, it's supposed to be a 4-star hotel. - the lady at the concierge had a haughty attitude as she pointed me to the buffet restaurant - the line-up outside the buffet restaurant is set up poorly. I stood in line with my friend. When we got to the front, the lady asked if we wanted to sit out on the patio, since that had immediate availability. We didn't want to, so we said no, and moved to the side which turned out to be another line. We waited and waited, and we saw the lady started seating people from the first line (who were behind us) who also didn't want patio seats. That's how we found out she was completely ignoring us and seated other people who had the same preferences as we did but who came later in the line. When we complained to her, she was snobby and simply said that we didn't let her know... but we DID... we said we didn't want a patio table. Turns out the second line we stood in was for large parties... but the lady saw us standing there all the time, and she knew what kind of table we were waiting for, yet she did nothing and completely ignored us until we complained. All this frustration and ill-treatment, just to find out the food is terrible, the selection is TINY, and yet it costed $20+ per person! - the shops at the Caesar's had poor service as well. I walked into a store and picked out a few items. A lady came up and asked if she can start a fitting room for me, so I said OK. I handed the items over to her, and continued to look around in the shop. When I was ready to try things on, I walked to the fitting room section, and apparently, my items were no where to be found. The lady who helps out in the fitting room area walked around the store and asked each of the sales clerk whether they say my items, and she came back saying nobody saw them! So I just left. Bottom line: For 4-star hotel pricing, this is so NOT worth it! The service was horrible! Might as well stay at the Bally's!!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kellywelly
Reviews.Content: Just checking the otehr reviews here and am shocked at some of the bad ones. I stayed here for a week over Easter last year and totally loved it. We had a forum tower room, the room itself was not massive but the bathroom was! It had a giant shower, the bath with jacuzzi was also huge, just what you need after a long day in the forum shops! The hotel really is HUGE, ate in a few of the restaurants and went to a couple of the bars which were both really cool, especially liked the Seahorse bar. Check in was fine we arrived about 10.30pm Vegas time time after being up for almost 24 hours and all went smoothly. You do not need to be into gambling to go to Vegas, you can spend days just looking around the otehr hotels as they all have something unique to offer. Did the Grand Canyon day trip which was awesome a real must do. Found all the dtaff to be nothing but polite and helpful. Oh, i can recommend room service breakfast - makes you feel really grand! All in all i have to say BOOK YOUR TRIP NOW!

Reviews.Title: “worse than a motel”
Reviews.Author: KathiL.A.
Reviews.Content: Need to let you know that the physical "ammenities" of the Palace Tower rooms at LV's Caesars Palace are no longer even as welcoming as any motels!!!!!!!!DO NOT RECOMMEND CAESARS PALACE TO YOUR CLIENTS! Felt like we were in Russia: no hot shower water before our morning meetings, smells of cooking/roasting restaurant foods wafting up thru the vents all the way to our 9th floor room all night long...today was GARLIC! One bar of soap between two sinks, no shower caps/mouthwash/q-tips, coffee pot, robes, etc. Housekeeping service kept the room clean -but we had to live with the stained upholstery & carpets & broken lamps despite their service. CP's "glory days" are certainly over..... When an elevator-full of people start to share queries like "YOU have hot water..?" And we sit in world-renowned restaurants at top dollar in the evening discussing the sorrowful conditions of our CP rooms..... Well, I just had to fill you in-! Addressed our unhappiness and displeasure to CP's management office, as well as the checkout desk at the end of our stay. Told them we felt like we had just 'vacationed' in old-world Russia instead of posh and glitzy Las Vegas... No offer of any sort of compensation! Most of our 500-member annual convention members have said they will book their rooms in other nearby LV hotels next year. Both Bellagio and Paris beat Caesars' Palace room rates-

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars!”
Reviews.Author: ILVVACA
Reviews.Content: All the girls loved Caesar's. We've stayed at Flamingo and Bally's but, we love Caesar's. The pools were great and clean. They have girls that walk around and give you frozen grapes. Caesar's is a great location, right in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Lots to do!”
Reviews.Author: VEGASRUSS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ceasar's for 2 nights durning the Holiday. Our room was located in the Forum Tower which is a little older but very well kept. When we checked in everyone was very friendly and they upgraded us to a suit. The views from the room were beautiful. Ceasar's is in a perfect location on the strip, we parked our car and were able to walk to everything we wanted to see and do. We loved the shopping at the forum shops and there was not a bad choice when it came to resturants. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “not imposing anymore”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It needs some attention this dated Hotel...defenetly not 5* Rooms acceptable but not wow...what i would expect from 3 star....the lobby is the casino...the pool is fantastic.. Vegas defenetly not a good place for trendy funcy hotels...the only one is "the hotel"

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: martdm
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at Caesar's recently and were very happy with our stay. The mid-strip location is very convenient for getting around to other establishments and the hotel is very easy to navigate around and it's also easy to access the street. We booked what they call a petite suite, but which is referred to a studio suite on their website, which was in the Palace Tower & consisted of 2 bathrooms, a bedroom area, and a living area. It was clean and well kept throughout our visit. Bath 1 had a spacious counter around the sink, water closet, and access to the double shower stall shared by both baths. Bath 2 had the same but was larger, including a two person jacuzzi tub. There were two large closets which included a safe (a teeny gripe was that it was not of sufficient size to accomodate our small notebook computer). The bed was extremely comfortable with nice linens but the pillows had little substance which made them flat & uncomfortable (piling them up with the extras delivered at request by housekeeping alleviated the problem). A TV armoir provided four additional large drawers of storage. The living area consisted of a couch, armchair, coffee table, and desk. All were acceptable but we did find it odd and annoying that the internet connection was cabled into the TV armoire, requiring us to run the cable over the the desk to use it. Overall, the service we received ranged from good to very good. Airport check in was a snap & the staffers there were very friendly. Likewise with checking out at the hotel desk upon our departure, where the staffer quickly handled applying our comps to the bill & provided updated paperwork in a flash. The housekeeping staff did a good job of keeping up the room each day & provided turn down service with chocolate "gold" coins in the evening. We ordered from room service a total of three times and thought the food, speed of delivery, and service provided to set up/take away the carts was very good. We actually didn't find the casino to be one of our favorites. It was unbearably smoky most evenings and always crowded, plus we didn't have great luck with our money. After enjoying Paris' casino one evening, we tended to be drawn back by the good atmosphere, service, and luckier gambling. They are affiliated with Caesar's so the comps still applied to our stay which was great! Having stayed at the Venetian, we much preferred Caesar's overall. The room was similar, if a bit older, and had the advantage of the additional baths, shared shower, & jacuzzi and about three times the closet space. It was easy to get in/out of the hotel and to/from our room, without feeling as though we had navigated a labyrinth each time as we did at the Venetian. The only real complaint we had with Caesar's is that there is only one location to grab a quick cup of coffee in the morning and it was a hike from the room and usually had long, slow moving lines. Annoying, but not enough to mar an otherwise great visit. The hotel is showing it's age in some places but these things are very minor and easily overlooked in the face of all the advantages we felt this hotel provided. She's sort of the old grand dame of the strip and we really found that to be charming on top of the previously discussed positives.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay-but no hot water!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at Caesars Palace during the Christmas holiday (Dec. 23-26 2005). I booked a package that included an upgraded room (Palace Tower) and a $25 gift debit card. I was assigned room # 2731 in the Palace Tower which is considered a mid-grade room. My room was over 500 square foot and came with a king sized bed with down duvet and a marble bathroom with a two person soaking tub. According to the bellman who checked us in, the rooms on the 27th floor had just been renovated and our room was in excellent condition. The room had new carpet and a fresh interior. Our room looked out over the parking lot so please book an even numbered room if you prefer a pool view. Now for the problems. Within five minutes of checking in our room the half door that covers the heating vent fell of its hinge. A call to housekeeping corrected the problem almost immediately. Several days later we woke up to a room without hot water. That morning numerous guests were complaining in the elevator about the lack of hot water in their rooms. The problem was fixed later that day. When I eventually checked out of the hotel I mentioned our problems to the front desk agent. She said she could do nothing for us. I replied: "Wrong answer!" The front desk manager did do the right thing and gave us a $50 breakfast comp to the Augustus Cafe. I did dine at the Palm Steakhouse and had a good meal with great service. Our server even waived the corkage fee on two bottles of collectible California Cabernet I had brought from my cellar. Yes, he got a large tip for that. I also had tickets to the Jerry Seinfeld Show which were expensive and he was funny. Be aware that about 40% of his stand-up routine I had heard several years earlier at a different venue. Overall I enjoyed my stay at Caesars. To their credit when a problem arose they took care of it to my satisfaction. As a previous guest noted, once you check in to Caesars you're on your own to have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Cleopatra's Barge”
Reviews.Author: aarrtt
Reviews.Content: I visited the lounge named Cleopatra's Barge in Caesar's Palace Thursday night (1/5/06) and can't remember the last time I had such a great night out. This fantastic band, The San Fernando Band played all the old-school R&B dance music that I liked. They played until 3 am and I was still ready for more. I highly recommend checking out this band whereever they are playing. Check out their website at TheSanFernandoBand.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower all the Way!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We only had 1 night in Caesars after staying the Bellagio, we fancied a change! We were not dissapointed, we paid an extra $80 for an Augutus Tower Room...it was superb! This part of Caesars has only recently been built, the rooms are a fantastic size, huge bathrooms, flatscreen T.V, massive floor to ceiling windows (our overlooking the Bellagio fountains) We enjoyed the pool area as well, it was a great time of year, warm..not too hot! Thouroughly recommneded

Reviews.Title: “Get Your Key and Fend for Yourself”
Reviews.Author: beefeater34
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Palace Tower Deluxe Room from 29/12/05 to 4/1/06. Check in was efficient by a very helpful and friendly lady. The room was fine, a bit sparce decent view of the North end of the Strip from 23rd floor. Big comfortable bed, good sized bathroom, desk, TV, 3 phones etc. There was no minibar, no robes/slippers, no writing paper.. Whenever I phoned for service be it room service, house keeping, laundry or concierge you enter a queuing system.. most calls are answered reasonably quickly. The concierge service at this hotel is the worse I have ever encountered. They couldn't book a hire car for me, they couldn't organise an airport transfer for me, they couldn't get tickets to a club for me (but offered to transfer me to the club!)... very poor. It is a very very impersonal hotel - I know many of the large resorts in Vegas are, but this was an especially baron place. The facilities of the property are immense but as a hotel it never made the grade. I'd call it a casino or convention centre with rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Attention single ladies...you have found your shangri-la!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a 38 year old single woman who's a fairly frequent vegas visitor and i have finally figured out where to stay. I have stayed at several other hotels, venetian(families) mirage(elderly) mandalay (business). Let me fill you in girlfriends, all the single guys are at caesars. i attribute this to their phenominal sports pit and the pussycat dolls nightclub and other great clubs. there is way more of a sexy vibe going on at this place, check it out. the regular rooms are nothing special, the palace tower rooms have great bathrooms with a pool sized jacuzzi tub you will want to take home with you, but the new Augustus tower is where it's really at! Caesars is not cheap so consider staying somewhere else but hanging out here. they have all the best shows too! my sister and i were there for the comedy festival and it was awesome, celebrities everywhere. the shops are o.k.... when will all these places realize they have all the same stores! enough with the designer shops allready! get some more original boutiques. We ate at Mesa grill and it was fantastic, Bradley Ogden, not so much...so ladies, go, you'll have a blast...and guys, I'll see ya there!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace 12-/16-12/18”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had my first chance to stay at Caesar's this past weekend. Through my companies internal travel agent I was able to get rate that was $10 dollars lower than any other advertised rate. Checked on Friday at around 3 pm, with no lines. I was offered up-grades, $50 more per night for a "suite" in the Place tower and $120 per night for the Augustus tower. I had read that upgrades may not be the best use of your money unless you really desire/need the best room in the house so we declined the upgrades. We had room 1157 in the Roman tower which I believe is the oldest tower at Caesar's. The room was more than adequate and quite large compared to normal rooms. Our room at had view of the strip through a large floor to ceiling window. Bathroom was fine not opulent and did have a small TV. The one odd thing was that there was not closet, rather there was an any area in the bathroom to hang your clothes. In this area, behind the door, there was also a safe and place to store a bag. No big deal. Also, no mini-bar in the room, but not a concern w/ me. All of the employees where professional and nice, and responsive when necessary. Had some noisy neighbors and security promptly addressed the problem. We did eat at the sushi bar and it was great, not cheap, but the quality was first rate, sat next to a fish supplier and he said it was one of his favorites. Kats the Sushi chef was great, make sure and set in his area. Did have a chance to go the popular night club Pure. It has a nice location, but plenty crowded, difficult event to dance, it pays to go to the club in the afternoon to find out the best way to get in as this place is extremely busy. The Club age ranges is the 20's so if you are an older folk like me, you may prefer the Shadow lounge. We had a great time at Caesar's. With its combination of location and amenities, I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Huge Disappointment, Once Exclusive Now Showing Age”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel for business extensively and just returned from a stay at Ceasar's. There were no non-smoking rooms available, so I took a smoking room which usually does not bother me. The desk clerk was nice and efficient and upgraded the room for me in the Forum Tower. The room's environment was barely tolerable from the smell and my clothes came back from the trip as if I had been in smokey bars throughout the trip. I have stayed in smoking rooms before but this room was pretty bad. The carpeting was old and had stains throughout the room and the bedspread and blanket were questionably acceptable. I had a hot tub in the bedroom area and large bathroom, but the shower area had mold all up and down the walls. It literally looked like the room had not been updated in thirty years! Very disappointing. Being on business for the week I was in the room very little and did not have time to request a room change although the hotel was full. I found the staff I did come in contact with after my first encounter at registration to be aloof and unavailable. Others have mentioned before the prices charged for food and sundries which are aggravating for what you receive but are becoming more expected today. I presume Ceasars is letting itself go with age as the newer more exclusive hotels on the strip outdo it. I will acknowledge I was surprisingly disappointed by the stay. It is possible the new Augustus Tower is updated and it might be suggested you ask for a room there if you are staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Size isn't everything!”
Reviews.Author: cabushka
Reviews.Content: No doubt that Caesars Palace is visually impressive & huge, but it is unimpressive from the service standpoint. I checked in at the airport at 10:30 AM and was assigned a room immediately. On arrival at the hotel, there was no bellman to greet us, so I was left in the lobby of the Augustus Tower not knowing where to go. My room was in the Palace Tower, so when I found the main lobby, I asked one of the desk people for help & was told "they shouldn't have checked me in at the airport". Nice welcome! They did give me a map & I schlepped off with my bag to the other end of the hotel to my room. The room was large & lovely with a great view of the pool area & the strip facing the Bellagio & MGM Grand. But the bedspread was very soiled & torn, & smelled of BO! I've never had the experience of being afraid of the bedspread in a $200 per night hotel. I called housekeeping & they changed the bedspread, but the new one was still a bit shabby though clean. The bathroom was beautiful with a jacuzzi tub. The hotel is huge & overpriced. I could not get the soda machine on my floor to work & ended up paying $4 for a bottle of water! I recommend stocking up somewhere else. My room had no minibar. I was here for business & the conference center was just downstairs from my room in the Palace Tower. Very convenient. At the end of the conference, I used the Business Center to ship my books back home. They totally blew that one. They managed to lose $600 of books & fortunately after several phone calls they were able to locate my books in the nick of time before they were shipped to someone else. I was still charged for the "service". Be careful of your bill on checkout. They had precharged me for one night's stay on my credit card, but did not credit this back to me on my bill. The shopping mall was awesome, but not somewhere I could actually shop. More of a curiousity for us regular people who don't regularly shop at Armani, Gucci,Dolce & Gabanna. All in all, the hotel is magnificent, but I prefer smaller hotels with better service.

Reviews.Title: “tip top hotel all round great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic, its got everything. The check in was fast very very polite people and freindly helpfull staff, The hotel is clean, and the rooms are just perfect. The locaction is great its on the strip where it all happends. When staying here youve got a added advantage not only have you got great staff looking after you huge swimming pools blinding food you more than a 100 shops to have a look at.If you go to Vegas stay at the palace and if anybody else tells you to stay at another hotel tell them to "Do 1"it aint worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Some real plusses, some real minuses”
Reviews.Author: Ktoo
Reviews.Content: Plusses: Very nice environment, hotel and casino very clean and well kept and pleasant. Everybody I encountered (casino staff, wait staff, cleaning staff, front desk, concierge) were friendly and efficient. Airport check in very convenient. I had to wait a few minutes for check in because of a computer glitch, and the very pleasant desk person upgraded my room at no charge because of the (minimal) wait. Great bathroom with jacuzzi tub and lovely toiletries. Minuses: The buffet at Cafe Lago is just horrible. It's small and the choices are minimal, and very very mediocre. Avoid that and if you want buffet go down the street to the Mirage, it has a much better buffet for the money. I don't expect Caesars to be cheap, but I do expect value for my money. The breakfast buffet had smoked salmon, tomatos, capers, onions, cream cheese, lots of breakfast pastries but no bagels. When I asked where they were I was informed the server would bring me one. He certainly did bring me one, a nice toasted bagel: at an additional $3 upcharge I was not made aware of until the bill came. I think for 18 dollars, when the buffet contains bagel accoutrements, it should also include bagels. The Cypress Street Marketplace is good for a quick and inexpensive (the term inexpensive being relative) bite to eat, although even here, which is basically a food court environment, the setup is such that a server brings you a napkin and your cutlery, so that you're forced into an additional tip in what should functionally be a fast food area. However, the made to order salad was fresh, tasty and huge for 8.95, and I also enjoyed a hot smoked turkey plate with mashed potatos and green beans for 8.95 as well. But by the time you add a $3 drink and another $2 tip, you're up to $15 in the blink of an eye. The Augustus Cafe was also good for a quick bite, with good sized portions. Plan to spend a minimum of $20 here. There is a good range of other restaurants, most requiring reservations, that had good menu choices but at high prices. The slots are tight and the table stakes are high. Unless you are playing $5 slots or are playing very early in the morning or very late at night, you stand a better chance of seeing the Easter Bunny than you do a cocktail waitress. The nightclubs are rowdy and raucous. Very few places to have a quiet drink with friends or colleagues. As in most casinos, the sundries shops charge excessively for things like bottled soda or water, snack items, etc. I recommend keeping your water bottle, bringing some of those single serving drink flavorings and keeping yourself hydrated from the tap without spending nearly $3 every time you turn around. The forum shops area is exquisitely decorated with blue sky rotundas and gorgeous fountains, and are fun to walk through but its doubtful that many of us just plan to run into Versace, Rolex or Gucci to pick up a little something. I can recommend Penhaligons for excellent English perfumes that can't be found often in the US, starting at $60. If you search really hard there is a Bath and Body Works and a Gap in the Forum Shops. What you won't find amongst the hundreds of stores is a bookstore: I guess Caesars doesn't want you spending your valuable casino time in reading :) Generally speaking I found it a nice property if a bit overpriced to the point of annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: corsdad
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Vegas (first time there) Thanksgiving afternoon (after a 5 hr delay in Philly, but that is another story!) for a 20th anniversary celebration. Checked into Caesars at airport - very convenient! Received room keys, etc right there. I highly recommend this. Reservations clerk Janna was awesome - upgraded me from basic room to a new Augustus tower room with just a little bit of very gentle arm twisting. When we got to the hotel, the check-in area was very busy, but we just bypassed that right to our room. What a room! Bathrooms was larger than many of the hotel rooms I have stayed in! Jacuzzi tub, 17" flat screen TV on wall, glass enclosed shower, marble floors. Room was huge - King bed, sofa, chair w/ ottoman, and table and chairs. View was fabulous - looked out over lower buildings right onto the strip. Very clean, comfortable and spacious! Right next to elevator area, but never heard the elevators even once. Actually was very good since we didn't have to walk down a long corridor. 30" flat screen television has alot of hotel information, and you can see your bill and check out right from your room. All of the grounds, casinos, common areas, etc were very well maintained and spotless. Not a big gambler, but casino was very elegant. Location of Caesars is a big plus - right in the middle of everything. Short walk (once you get outside )to Bellagio, Harrahs, FLamingo, Mirage,etc. All the restaurants and shopping you could want - all located under one very large roof. Many casual dining options for those not into spending $$$ for every meal. Had one dinner at Neros Steak House - very good meal, not bad price, but did have to sit between the two kitchen doors - not the best seats in the house, but not unbearable. Great service. Shows: Saw Celine Dion - worth every penny. Zumanity (Cirque de Solei) at NY, NY was interesting - not for everyone, but still an outstanding and fun show. Jubille at Ballys - very good. Great costumes, music, etc. Dirk Arthur at Tropicana - very good if you like magicians. One thing about Vegas - wear your walking shoes! Every hotel we visited, and we hit most of the newer ones, are so large that even though they are close together, you still had a major workout to get from one end to the other. Rode the Monorail a few times - not the most convenient because of its location behind the resorts - had to hike through a huge casino and usually the shopping areas to reach the station. By that time you could probably walked to your destination. Would absolutly go back and stay at Caesars again.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower: 5-star quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the Augustus Tower over Thanksgiving. The room was very well appointed, with a quality table, LCD television and comfortable bed with over-sized pillows and comforter, which is great because I am not a fan of bedspreads. We stayed at Wynn for two nights after this, and the two are very comparable. While Wynn probably wins out marginally based on details and quality of furnishings, you get a slightly larger and jetted tub at Caesars, and you can get a great view of the Bellagio water show. We also feel that Caesars' location is stronger than Wynn. You can go straight from check-in to your room; being able to avoid walking through the casino every time was a perk that we underestimated. If you are looking for an all-in-one hotel and money is not an issue, I would give the nod to Wynn (or the Bellagio), as the quality of the bars and the restaurants is higher than Caesars. On the flip side, Caesars (with the Forum Shops) offers a wider range of food choices, from cheap (e.g., La Salsa) to expensive (e.g., Bradley Ogden). While Caesars' Forum Shops are a nice plus, the Fashion Show Mall is directly across the street from Wynn. Although the casino ambiance at Wynn is more upscale than Caesars, we enjoy the "Vegas" feeling at Caesars. Dealers at both casinos tended to be nice and helpful. The on-line pictures of the hotels at both casinos are accurate representations of what you can expect to see. I should note that when we checked into our room at Caesars, there was a bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries that were not intended for us. When we called down to inform them of their error, they told us that we could keep them. That was a nice gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Hail Caesar!”
Reviews.Author: KATenn
Reviews.Content: We just returned tonight from a long weekend at Caesars. I've never been to Las vegas before so I admit that I was overwhelmed with the over the top madness of it all..and I loved it! We upgraded to a suite in the new Augustus tower which was very nice indeed- big plazma T.V. in the bedroom, a smaller T.V. in the large bathroom, lots of marble, twin sinks, jacuzzi tub with separate glass shower, a stunning view of the Strip, large couch, extremely comfortable king size bed, and a small dining table. There's no coffeepot, however, so we had to call room service every a.m. because I need coffee first thing. I'll bring my own coffeepot next time. The Mesa Grill (Bobby Flay's restaurant)and 808 were excellent restaurants and the service in both was outstanding. A word of warning - don't take the Vision air/land tour to the Grand Canyon. We booked our reservations at Caesars on a wellknown internet travel site and added on the side trip. We took off with a lot of disgruntled fellow tourists about two hours late from a local airport. When we got to the canyon airport the tour company served a really horrible lunch, gave us 25 minutes to eat it, and then we sat on a tourbus for 70 minutes to go one mile to the park entrance because of the traffic. We were left with only a half hour to see this magnificent natural wonder before we were all rushed back to the plane. We would book a different tour next time or rent a car and go on our own. The highlight of our trip was the Celine Dion show at Caesars. It was magnificent and should be a "must see" for everyone. We'll go back to Caesar's again- it's expensive and is a huge property with lots of ways to get lost when you're trying to navigate from one section to another, but I wouldn't have missed the experience for the world.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Augustus!”
Reviews.Author: wrigleykitty
Reviews.Content: Once again I'm amazed at some of the negative comments on this site re Caesar's. I've returned after my second visit this year and both times couldn't have been better. Stayed at the new Augustus Tower for 3 days in October and loved it! I'd booked Palace Tower and upon arrival was instantly upgraded to Augustus (and it didn't cost me a dime; I simply told the clerk I was happy to be back at Caesar's). The room was luxurious, very elegant in style, a plasma TV in the room and another (smaller) in the bath. Loved the whirlpool bath and separate shower. How nice to find that Augustus' elevators are located right off reception, no more shlepping bags through the casino! The Augustus Cafe, also located right off reception, had excellent food; room service was prompt with good food, too. Before closing I'd like to say that every employee I encountered at Caesar's was friendly, smiling and polite. Just wish the casino had more $10 blackjack tables! Here's hoping....

Reviews.Title: “Worst Holiday of my life, beware of any wedding package”
Reviews.Author: JamesandJill
Reviews.Content: I got married on 10/22/05 in Caesars Palace. I chose to have a Vegas wedding because we had guests traveling internationally and I wanted everyone to have a good time and I was assured by the Caesars wedding coordinator that a Las Vegas wedding at Caesars was much less stressful. She assured me Caesars would do all the work. Room was nice and clean but nothing else went right. First the wedding coordinator insisted that I have my wedding dress cleaned and pressed. Then the hotel lost it. It was found about 3 hours before my wedding. The hotel lost several packages I had mailed to myself with gifts for my wedding party also finding them a few hours before the wedding and then charged me a $20.00 service fee. My husband arranged transportation to and from the tuxedo store and the hotel forgot to pick them up, leaving them stranded for 2 hours. I also finally met my wedding coordinator 5 minutes before the wedding started. A majority of the stylists that work in the salon are rude and unprofessional. The maid service threw away some of my personal items. The average waiting time for room service is about 2 hours. A warning, all the nice things that are in your room, such as the mini bar, bags of nuts, golf balls, disposable camera that are extremely overpriced, all you have to do it pick them up and it gets billed to your room, even if you put it right back. When we received our final bill, it took my husband over 3.5 hours to get everything corrected and we still were overcharged $226.00. This 5 diamond hotel disappointed me in every aspect. I have stayed in hostels in third world countries and had a better time. The actual complaint letter I sent to the corporate office was 5 pages long. My actual wedding was very nice but it was due to the massive efforts my friends and family did. Caesars did nothing to make my special day, special

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Palace”
Reviews.Author: Rennie-7
Reviews.Content: We were excited about staying at Caesar's Palace but ended up being very disappointed. To begin with, our flight was delayed two hours so all we wanted to do when we arrived was check-in quickly, unpack and look around. There is an extremely long check-in/check-out counter in the registration lobby but it was seriously under-staffed. We joined the snake line and shuffled along with our cases a few paces every ten minutes or so. At the end of the line we were greeted by a hotel rep who thanked us for our patience and told us to "Smile" - which we might have done if there had been more staff to check people in faster. Only once during our week there did we see the costume characters of Caesar, Cleopatra and a couple of Gladiators. It would be far easier to "SMILE" if these characters came and entertained the guests in the long line ups at Reception!! Our room was a disappointment as the brochure said Deluxe but it was in fact a Standard - with no coffee maker and no view, also other missing perks the brochure mentioned. Our travel agent is looking into this for us. There were seven hangers between two of us so I asked the maid for more and she gave us plenty - but unfortunately the hooks were too small to go over the rail !!! The bars were VERY noisy and one had to shout to have a conversation. The service was not very good in the Piano Bar. Two other points - we found the Forum Cafe - exit the hotel into the Forum Shops, walk a few yards and down the escalator - sharp left - you get great coffee and bagels for breakfast (seeing there is no coffee maker in the room!!) But if you dine at Bertolinis - be warned - if you get a waiter called Rufus - he will not offer you iced water but ask if you would like bottled water and thus charge you about $7 when we noticed other tables got the choice of iced or bottled water. Ho took his time at bringing us the bill but took pains to explain the tip was NOT included!!! However the food was great. What we enjoyed most was seeing the new hotels and stores that had been built since we were there in 1999. We saw four shows - Barry Manilow was great but 90 minutes was certainly not long enough for the price of the tickets. Even Manilow said "You paid that much for a ticket - holy ----!!" So Mr. Manilow if you are so shocked - reduce your prices!! Legends in Concert at the Imperial was excellent and for under $50 we got a buffet meal and front row seats! The performers were superb. We saw We Will Rock You - also a good show set to Queen's music. This was on at the Paris Hotel - that place is amazing, and may be our choice hotel next time. But the best one was Tony and Tina's Wedding - that is an interactive show where the audience are guests at the wedding - it's an absolute riot and I'd go again in a minute! This was at the Rio Hotel and the carnival show that goes round in carriages and boats suspended on rails from the ceiling is truly awesome! I'm saving for my next trip to Las Vegas! Hope this review is of help to some people.

Reviews.Title: “A great first stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although we've been to Las Vegas many times, we had never stayed at Caesars until Oct. 24-28. Our stay there was one of our most enjoyable. We checked in at the airport which we feel is a must!! While I got the luggage, my wife checked us in and asked about a room upgrade. For $50.00 per night we given a pool view room in the palace tower. After we arrived at the hotel, we were told the room was not ready yet and to use a house phone to call the front desk in a couple of hours. After lunch and playing some slots for a while, my wife called the front desk again. Our room still wasn't ready so we wre offered another upgrade to the Augustus Tower. Rm. 3588 was terrific!!!!!!!! Strip view, Beleigio fountain view, quiet, two flat screen tv's, comfortable bed and pillows, spacious. We had everything we could ask for and more.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: goldfish1
Reviews.Content: First time at Caesars (and also Las Vegas) and it won't be the last. Hotel was pretty luxurious - we had a suite. Huge beds, huge bathroom (with a TV). Huge hotel - you could do with a map to find your way around. Felt this hotel was a good location for other attractions. Going back next year and looking forward to it. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “First visit - would happily return to Caesars”
Reviews.Author: CoralReef
Reviews.Content: Just back from Las Vegas, Thursday 10/13 through Monday 10/17. Since this was our first time, we planned to stay mainly on the Strip. We wanted a centrally located hotel/casino, good quality but not super-expensive, with a nice pool that would still be open in mid-October, and if possible a “classic” Las Vegas property with a glitzy theme. Caesars Palace fit the bill, and turned out to be even better than we expected! We had a blast, and plan to go back. We booked our nonstop flight and hotel through Southwest Airlines Vacations. This was a convenient way to set up a first trip, but I probably would not do it again. We got a good price (and I found a promo code on the Las Vegas Talk board, which knocked an additional 10% off the price). But I could probably get just as good a deal by calling hotels and setting up flights online. What I didn’t like about SW Vacations: 1. They issued us printed tickets. So, while ticketless passengers could get their boarding passes 24 hours in advance, we had to check in at the airport. This virtually guaranteed us being in “C” group. Yes, it was one short flight, and no airplane seat is going to be great—but I didn’t like not having the option to get an “A” boarding pass. And I hated standing in long check-in lines while e-ticket holders breezed past us to the self-serve kiosks. Southwest should either go entirely ticketless, or allow ticket holders to check in electronically. 2. Southwest’s website stated that all rooms at Caesars Palace had coffeemakers. After I booked, I discovered from trip reports that all the coffeemakers were removed months ago. Now, I don’t have a lot of quirks—but I really need a cup of coffee in the morning before I go out. Room service coffee would have cost $8.00 plus $2.50 service fee plus tip. I ended up buying and packing a little coffeemaker. Not a huge inconvenience, but if Southwest had provided accurate information in advance, I might have chosen a different hotel. Caesars airport check-in was very convenient; we had our room key by the time our bags came up the carrousel. A cab from the airport to Caesars cost us just over $12. A shuttle would have been $5 each and probably would have stopped at other hotels. This hotel was great! We booked the basic Run-of-House room, the Deluxe. I was a little nervous after reading some reviews of this room category. If you want luxury, go for a more expensive room. But if you just want a comfortable, pleasant room for a good price, the Deluxe was perfectly fine. We were on the 7th floor of the Roman Tower, with a small view of the Strip. Our room was much bigger than a comparably-priced business class hotel room (Marriott, Sheraton, etc.). It had a chaise longue, coffee table, desk and two desk chairs, a wing chair, and a vanity stool in the bathroom. It was elegantly decorated, and clean except for some dust on the shelf above the clothes rod. Caesars supplied quality toiletries (no shower cap), a card-operated safe, and three towels daily. (Four would be better for two people.) CP’s large swimming pools and hot tubs were beautiful. Thick towels were provided. There was a poolside café that provided food, and servers constantly circulated with food and drink service. The fitness center was nice, but cost $25 per day or $65 for three days. Ouch. One day our room was not cleaned until 3:00 and the bed was not made, but the other days, service was prompt and complete. There was no snack vending, the soda machine on our floor and on the 6th floor did not work, and the bottles of water in the room cost $4 (good joke, Caesars). But other than that, we loved this property. It is elegant, glitzy, has tons of shops and restaurants, the casino has good ventilation, and you can’t beat the location in the middle of the Strip! We visited numerous properties: Wynn, Venetian, TI, Mirage, Imperial Palace, Bally’s, Paris, Bellagio, Monte Carlo, MGM, Luxor, NYNY, and Mandalay Bay. Caesars was a good starting point, and we ended up liking it the best. The only other properties I liked enough to stay at were Bellagio (more expensive) and Mandalay Bay (way far south).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: kmarsh99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesars on Labor Day weekend and had a great stay. Check in was fast, however I heard the Augustus Tower was the best tower and asked if we could be upgraded - the clerk said no problem for $100 extra per night. I said no thank you and she did upgrade us from a Deluxe room to a Palace Tower room for no charge. The Palace Tower room was very nice - I did not see any signs of age. The view was not spectacular - we could see about 1 foot of the pool and an air-conditioning unit. The room was very clean and the jacuzzi tub was great. Overall the hotel was very nice, although it was VERY crowded - but I'm sure it was just because of the holiday weekend. We would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Augustus Tower”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Caesars Palace -- This is my 40th trip to Las Vegas and my 30th visit to the Palace. Usually I stay at the Palace Tower but this time an offer from Caesars came with an upgrade to Augustus Tower. Beautiful rooms, great beds with lots of pillows but smaller storage with bureaus and closet. Liked the view of Bellegio Fountains but honestly when I return I am going back to the Palace Tower. The health club is in the Tower, the pool is closer to me and I like the bathroom better. I would like Caesar to upgrade televisions to the Plasma ones but who watches television in Las Vegas. This is my favorite palace and I am now looking forward to another visit soon. Looking forward to seeing how Harrahs Entertainments will treat the royalty of Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Vegastvl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Vegas hotels but this was our first time at Caesars! We were in the Augustus Tower so I don't know about the others but we loved the Augustus Tower! We had a view of Bellagio on the 45th floor so we were spoiled! Service was great at the hotel! Ate at the Augustus Cafe and the servers were nice but food was just average! Nice place though! Pools were great but on our last full day there, they closed them all at 3pm except for the topless pool. It's a pretty small area so it was packed. Lots of disappointed people! Great weather and to not have a pool from 3pm on, was not good! Think they had some type of event going on for a company?! Would stay at Caesars again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
