Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors of Caesars and enjoy our stay all the time. We were upgraded to a junior suite and was pleased to have a small view of the pool. The Roman tower is their oldest tower, so don't expect a great view or very flashy rooms. Overall though, the staff is average, with a few exceptions here and there. I love the feeling of Caesars and being so close to the Forum Shops. The lobby shops are minimal, but you can find what you need. If you have small children, the no refrigerator thing may be a small problem! We had a small battle with that!!

Reviews.Title: “Better then Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. I have stayed in over 7 hotels on the strip and this one is by far the best. I was upgraded to the Palace Tower on check-in with no extra charge and no tip! Just smile a lot, that seems to work! The Palace tower is beautiful! We had a wonderful view, the room was very large and the bathrooms were stunning, double vanities, spa bath, seperate bath and shower and seperate toilet. We saw Celine Dion who was amazing, fantastic show, worth the money! We also saw Elton John who was NOT worth the money. Bad show with these annoying blow up objects that took ages to get up! Does not sing many of his hits and he seemed very ' been here done that' sort of attitude! I have heard some rooms are not that good, so try and get in the Palace Tower or the new tower. If you do they are better then Bellagio!

Reviews.Title: “caesars is the best!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the new agustus tower on sept.9th...just great..could see billagio fountains..marie...cheshire,ct

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's does not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: Timinator.3000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar’s from 9-18 through 9-22. We tried to get a free upgrade at the airport check-in but were told that they could put us in the Augustus tower for an additional $100 a night. I refused. Check-in was a breeze and we paid $44 for the roundtrip shuttle for 4 of us. ($5.50 each) I definitely recommend the airport checkin. Upon arriving at the hotel I went to the Information desk and asked about an upgrade. They said for an additional $70 I could be put in the Augustus Tower. I refused and went to our room in the Roman Tower. It was fantastic. On the 11th floor with an obscured view of the strip. The Imperial Palace to the left and Paris could be seen to the right. In front of our window was another tower. Small TV in bathroom, big tub and separate walk in shower stall. Phone by toilet. Very nice. 2 mirrors and 2 sinks. Room had no bad odor and everything about the four days we stayed there was good. The one exception to that I will make is that we did not get maid service one day and had to call at 5pm to get fresh towels. Also, on second day some bottled water showed up in the bathroom by the tub with a tag that said they were $4 each if they were removed. When we checked out we were charged for them even though they were still there. I called the front desk and they quickly took it off of our bill. Caesar’s is HUGE, the Forum Shops are HUGE. The Cypress Market place was a quick and easy way for me to get breakfast and bring it back to the room for my wife and kids. Planet Hollywood in the Forum Shops was awful. We ate there our last night and the food was lousy and overpriced. The pools are beautiful. (Well, I did not get to see the Venus pool since it is TOPLESS and secluded.) The closest monorail station is across the street from Caesar’s all the way through the Flamingo and out the back door of the hotel. I would only recommend the monorail if you are trying to get to a hotel on the East side of the strip. (Caesar’s is on the West side of the strip) Otherwise take the strip trolley or get a cab out front of Caesar’s. It is worth the extra money for a cab. DO NOT TAKE THE BUS! It took us 30 minutes to go from Circus Circus to Bellagio. Plus we were crowded into a standing room only bunch of stinky people. I thought we were going to be crushed. Also, North strip is a dump mostly. Not much to see after the Wynn hotel. Look forward to going back to Caesar’s in a few years. Great central strip location.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay at Caesars again”
Reviews.Author: Wester1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ceasar's Palace from the 21-25 of September 2005. This was the first time that we have been to Las Vegas. We flew out to Vegas for my brother-in-law's wedding. From what I had read on Trip Advisor, I was hesitant about Ceasar's. When we arrived at 3PM for check-in, we were informed that our room would not be ready for another hour and half. We were a little disappointed but was able to stow our bags with the bellhop and walk around the hotel. The hotel is very nice, probably one of the nicest on the strip. We were able to always find something to do there. We were finally able to check in to our room. We stayed in the Roman tower. We thought that was pretty decent until we found out that almost 90 percent of the other guests of the wedding were upgraded to the palace tower without charge. We were asked if we wanted to upgrade but it was not going to be free. I was a little upset with Ceasar's at the time, but again, I feel that it was no one's fault. The people working at Ceasar's were friendly and the bars and restaurants were great. We ate at the Mesa Grill. Very good. Make reservations in advance. Overall, the hotel was perfect for my husband and I. If we ever make it out to Vegas again, we will stay there. They did an awesome job on my brother-in-law's wedding. My husband and I have just learned to check in to the hotel as late as possible because it appeared to help with getting a free upgrade and you would not have to wait around for your room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Augustus Tower”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we were booked for the Palace Tower for our 4 night stay. We had won the trip on a lottery ticket and decided to use it for our honeymoon. When checking in at the hotel, they had us in a room with 2 double beds. I mentioned that it was our honeymoon. She said that she would take care of it. She made a call and upgraded our room to the new Augustus Tower. When we got to our room (30th floor). We were amazed! the room was huge! 650 sq. ft and a wonderful view of the fountains at the Bellagio and the Strip, 2 plasma TV's , gorgeous bathroom, high end decor, 2 robes, fruit cheese basket, interactive phone with TV/PDA display. The bed was very comfortable with down comforters and down pillows. Caesars makes it very difficult to leave the complex, so much to see and do...loved it, very memorable...

Reviews.Title: “All we wanted and so much more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful - quite simply the best hotel we have stayed in, and we have stayed in a few! We had a room in the Palace Tower overlooking the garden of the gods pool area. The room was huge and the bathroom superb - his & hers showers & a Jacuzzi to top off the feeling of decadence! The staff, particularly the room service guys and a gorgeous waitress in the seahorse bar, were all exemplerary. We were there for 4 days. During this time, we visited most hotels on the strip, including the much hyped Bellagio - we did not regret our decision to stay at Caesars for a second. The food is amazing, with so much choice on offer. If you do not want to bust your wallet, I would urge you to try Joe's seafood restaurant in the Forum shops. Their crab cakes are well worth a visit. A big thank you to all the staff - see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “amazing! what else can you say!”
Reviews.Author: bigdaz107
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we decided to check in at the airport. This was quick and convenient and on arriving at the hotel we are glad we did, the queues for receiption were huge our entire stay. At the airport we were offered an upgrade to the Augustus Tower for $50 (usual price $100 upgade) per night. We would recommend everyone doing this. It has only been opened a few weeks. The rooms are huge and the bathroom has all the amenities you could need. Even better, you did not need to drag your suitcase through the casino as the Augustus Tower is next to the entrance/receiption area. If you can drag yourself out of the room, then Ceasars has all you could dream of without having to venture outside. On checking out other hotels during our stay, we felt that we had made the best choice of hotel and if we return to Vegas than this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect Wedding Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: bear1528
Reviews.Content: My Fiance' and I got married at Caesar's this past weekend. The wedding services were excellent!! I would recommend the Passione Package to anyone who asks. The only drawback is the hotel room itself was not all that great (for a 5 star hotel) We were placed in the Palace Tower. The best place to be right now is the Augustus Tower. Other than that, there are no complaints. You definitely don't ever have to leave the hotel. A must try is the Stage Coach Deli--They have the best sandwiches and 3 days after our wedding, they still gave us free cheesecake!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the extra money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and three of my friends stayed at Caesers over Labor Day weekend and absolutly loved it! We try to stay at a different hotel every Labor Day weekend when we come but we will definitly have to return to Caesers. I recommend staying in the Augustus Tower which is the newly built tower and it was amazing! Our room which was just a normal double room had 2 flat screen TV's one in the bed area and one in the bathroom! The bathroom was huge with a jacuzzi bathtube, separate shower, and seperate toilet. The beds were extremely comfortable and the linens were great not your normal hotel linens that's for sure. There was also a couch, chair and table w/ chairs. The room was more than I expected even from a great name like Caesers. The pool area was nice plenty of seating but did get a little crowded in the afternoon that was understandable since is was a holiday weekend. There is plenty to do at Caesers we hardly left the hotel with the mall and the clubs there was really no reason it had everything we needed! One thing I wouldn't recommend is club Pure the line was outrageous, luckily we were girls and were staying at the hotel. It was overpacked, you could hardly move in that place we actually only ended up staying for about an hour because of that reason. But over all I give this hotel 5 stars it was GREAT and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars Palace!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went Labor Day Weekend. Being as busy as they were, we probably waited in line 10-15 minutes. They took are bags when we get there and held them until we received our room. Our check in time was 3:00 p.m. and we got our room at least two hours early. We stayed in the Forum Towers and had a beautiful view out our window. The casio was huge and very clean, as well as the forum shops. The people at the Craps tables, saw that I didn't know how to play, and had no problem teaching me, as well as letting me throw the dice next. I had a wonderful time in Vegas and I can't wait until I get the chance to go Back. I would defnately stay at Caesars Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: arudeawakenin
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked 2 rooms for a 3 night stay from fri-sun. To my surprise we had 2 new rooms in the Augustus Tower. absolutely Beautiful, clean rooms, smelled nice. 2 plasma tv's in each room. 1 in the bath, 1 in bedroom. the pool was beautiful as well, however it was very crowded and the waitress never came by us, when I finally stopped a waitress, she replied "there will be another waitress coming by" and just walked off. the water in the pool was kind of oily. I'm assuming it's from suntan oil/lotion. the restaurants were ok, a little pricey, more like diner food. with the exception of Viale. I thought the food and service was about average. I would recommend it. the bartenders, cocktail waitresses were horrible!! if they didnt want to be there, then they should find another job. just bad attitudes, possibly overworked, stressed out. they didnt care about you unless you tipped very high. once I started tipping over 20%, I got much better service. overall, caesar's was a nice hotel but I wouldnt stay there again. I had more fun at Rio a few years back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars Palace...........Definitely Not a 5 Star Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made reservations thru Expedia for a stay at Caesars Palace this week. We had gotten a room with King size bed for less than $180.00 per night. I guess I got the cart before the horse.....because after getting the reservation, I checked this website for reviews. Boy, was I sick...the reviews I found were all bad. Nothing else to do but go. Well, we are so glad we did. We had a great time and our room was fantastic. When I checked in I told them about reading the reviews and that we had come in spite of everything we had read. We were upgraded to a suite and WOW.....It was great! The room had a wall bed(king size) and at first I thought bad of this idea but it had a regular mattress and was very comfortable. We stayed in the Forum Tower....Thanks Caesars for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Food Stinks”
Reviews.Author: spanky11
Reviews.Content: My Family and I went to visit Caesars Palace and take in the sights. As we were staying at the Monte Carlo. We were all getting hungry and decided to eat at there buffet. Mistake the food was awful and the service was even worse. For the price go some were else. We ate at the Luxor and there Buffet was excellent and the same at the Monte Carlo the prices were even better.

Reviews.Title: “Ceasar's Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ceasar's Palace Aug. 16-19 and had a wonderful time. We checked in at the Airport registration desk. It was around 11:00 am and it took about 25 minutes. You can pay for round trip shuttle to the hotel at the Airport registration desk and it was $11 per person. The staff in the reasturants, lounges, and shops at Ceasar's were very nice and helpful. The bartenders at the bar in the pool area were very courteous and friendly. The pool area was gorgeous. The only complaint was that there are far too few waitresses serving the pool area. We were in the Forum Tower. The room was small but nicely decorated. We had no view but it didn't matter because we were in the room so little. The Market Place was a nice place to get a quick bite to eat for lunch with lots of choices. We saw George Carlin (somewhat dissapointing) at The StarDust. Also saw Mystere at Treasure Island which we highly recommend. We did the airplane tour of the Grand Canyon with Scenic Tours and it was fabulous. We booked the 6:00pm flight, got to see the sun set on the way back, and flew over the strip after it was lit up. This was one of the highlights of the trip. The website is [--]

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's service stinks”
Reviews.Author: awaintroob
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at Caesars Palace a couple of months ago. When we drove in, the check-in scene was chaotic. There were long lines and everyone's check-in took forever. After standing in line for more than half an hour, we finally reached the desk. We were informed that the hotel had overbooked and we would be re-located to the Paris at their expense. We accepted and were given two vouchers for "breakfast" at Viales. The young man at the reception desk was quite clear--the vouchers were for breakfast. We found out the next day that Viales isn't open for breakfast. Caesar's is obviously busier than it can handle. It needs to hire more personnel and train them better.

Reviews.Title: “PALACE TOWER UPGRADE”
Reviews.Author: DOCTORTEE
Reviews.Content: AFTER SEEING THE BAD REVIEWS ON DELUXE ROOMS I WAS ON A MISSION TO GET UPGRADED. I USED SOME OF THE IDEAS I READ ABOUT IN PAST REVIEWS. I check in at the airport and told the clerk it was our 40 aniversary and did they put my connection card number on my reservation.I got the number on line before my arrival. The clerk said i have a room in the forum tower. I then pulled out a twenty with a five inside from my pocket and showed him the money he said did you say it was your birthday not listening to word i said before, i said it was our aniversary. He then told me he found a room and could upgrade me to the palace tower. This proves that desk clerks have the authority to upgrade guest but they need a reason to put in comments on the reservation. So tell them this is a special occation and get a players card even if your not a gambler I stayed six nights on vacation. To my surprise ceasars had 25 cent 9/6 jacks or betters vidio pocker slots. This has the best odds with perfect play of any game or slot in the casino. The pool area is fantastic,go in the morning its less crowed and not as hot. If your on a budget eat in the forum shop or on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar doesnt hail here!”
Reviews.Author: aussieward
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Caesars back in June 05. There is a huge difference between "suites" and the entry level "deluxe rooms", we had to change rooms 3 times before they finally upgraded us for free to the Spa Suite room. PAY EXTRA AND STAY IN THE SPA SUITE. The deluxe rooms we're old, smelly, no view and filthy. A 5 star hotel should have at a mininum, a clean and modern room. We had to wear sandals the carpets we're so gross, the 2nd deluxe room was no better, tired, noisey and filthy. It wasnt until we changed to the Spa deluxe room that I appreciated Caesars palace. They have built a new tower but have forgotten to fix their original rooms, even the grime and grease on the elevator buttons we're not cleaned. On the upside, the casino itself is amazing! I suggest visiting the casino and staying somewhere else. I cant believe we chose Caesars when Bellagio was the same price for the same weekend. We've stayed at Mirage, Treasure Island and MGM. I would rate Mirage my fave to date. Good luck! :(

Reviews.Title: “Could have had a better time”
Reviews.Author: vermagnuson
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at Caesars but after this trip I'm up in the air if I'll stay again. We visit Las Vegas two or three times a year but had never stayed at Caesars. We arrived late on a Friday night and were assigned an accesible room. This room was quite a disappointment but we didn't plan to spend much time in the room. The forum shops were great as usual and the casino was ok. The Venus pool was another story. They should start charging for this pool like the Moorea Beach Club to eliminate the gawkers. The way these boys acted they should have been removed from the premises but the grape goddess didn't seem to mind and in fact joined their lewd behavior. It was like being with a bunch of kids at spring break. Caesars is a beautiful resort but they need to step it up a notch.

Reviews.Title: “New Augustus Tower Opens”
Reviews.Author: Henny27
Reviews.Content: Like many Las Vegas visitors, I had been waiting to see what the new Augustus Tower at Caesars Palace would be like......a competitor to Bellagio, Wynn, Venetian or Hotel at M-B, or just another Las Vegas disappointment. First off, for those who have not been to Caesars Palace in several years, the renovation investment has been terrific. The casino's are brighter, the addition of the nightclub, Shaddow Bar, Mesa Grill, Bradley Ogden, 808 really help make the place a destination. Arrived at 11 am and was able to check in at 1 pm to the new Augustus Tower on opening day -- knowing that employees have been staying in the tower for the past 3 weeks "breaking it in". Upon arriving in the room, I called the bell desk for my 1 bag -- after 6-7 calls and 3 hours later, the bag arrived (they wanted me to stay in my room to wait for my bag). As it turned out, the "older bellman who was slow so they would appreciate my patience" signed out for my bag but left it in the cloak room. So, I missed 3 hours of either pool time or work-out time. Back to the new Tower: Room is large (>650 sq ft) with a contemporary feel -- with some Barbara Barry design influences. The tower is just off of the new Caesar's reception area -- away from the Casino floor so you feel you have "escaped" the madness a bit. The tower has a seperate walkway for the pool as well --again avoiding flip-flops vs. slot machine conflict. Frette-equivelant linens, down pillows, pillow-top bed, LCD TV's in main room and bath. Bathroom is large (double vanity, large spa tub, seperate shower, hidden toilet area. Right before leaving for dinner, I called housekeeping to request turndown service and was informed that "since the tower is new, they don't have turndown service set-up yet". So I requested that someone bring a new set of towels up and remove the used ones (since there are only 2 sets in each room) so a fresh towel would be available in the AM. Upon returning to the room late, that request was completed. Dining/Entertainment: Had dinner at BOA in the Caesar's Shops -- hip, trendy, with terrific service -- food very acceptable -- 2 appetizers, shared salad, two entrees, 1 dessert and 1 moderate priced bottle of wine was $250 for 2 -- on the pricier end, but no more that NY or LA. We went back to Shaddow Bar for a drink before heading to a 10:30 pm show -- very cool place -- we walked in just as the flair bartending show started with bartenders doing a rehersed synchronized juggling, tossing set with bottles, shakers, etc. The Shaddow go-go dancers make it a more "adult" bar, but since you only see their shaddow, it is very subtle and refined. Breakfast the next morning was at the new Coffee Shop -- Augustus Cafe. Breakfast for 2 was $30 (full breakfasts) and the only negative was that the gentleman who took our order then went on break and the "hand off" was not communicated too well -- 1 hour for our food, which arrived cold but was then replaced. Summary: Great new room, great entertainment, inconsistent/poor hotel service. I would stick with Bellagio or the Venetian if the rates were the same -- but give the Augstus Tower a try if it is the better rate.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star dump”
Reviews.Author: I_Travel_Much
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at this infamous Vegas landmark 2 weeks ahead. I was always impressed with the architecture and the attractions of this venue. Finally I was in a position to stay at the hotel of my dreams for the first time in my life. I arrived very excited on a Tuesday afternoon at the airport. As advised by the hotel staff I proceeded to the Airport check-in and waited in line for 15 minutes. No problem I thought to myself, just a minor delay on the way to bliss. The clerk at the airport did take my request for a room on a higher floor, but suggested a pricier room they had available. Oh well as long as I am on vacation I can pay a bit more. Unfortunately the room was not available and I received a “hold this” piece of paper. Upon arriving at the hotel, the room was not yet available thus storing my luggage with the Bell Captain, I headed off to survey the Empire. The property is quite large and I did a good deal of walking before I was able to see the small city they call Caesars Palace. At 3:00 PM I returned to inquire about my room. To my surprise there were enormous lines of people bitching and moaning of how long they have been in line or how many hours they have been waiting for a room. No problem I told myself I’ll keep an open mind, after all I have been in town for 4 hours now. My room must be ready and I can finally change and relax. Oh well no such luck, no room is available and “we don’t know when you can have one”. But what about my waiting in all these lines all the time? What did you expect, to just waltz in here and get a room any time you want? I thought that after 2 weeks notice and $300 / night I can expect some kind of service from a 5 star hotel. Eventually around 5PM I received a room and was able to change. The room was not bad, but a bit run down. I took a shower and went about my business the other 3 days of my stay. On the day of the checkout I had a later flight and called down for a late checkout. “Sorry Sir, we are overbooked and can’t let you stay past 11:00 AM” So I packed my bags and called a Bell to get my luggage. Downstairs the Bells at the front entrance were so busy it took 10 minutes to get my bags. After such a wait my taxi almost left without me. The moral of the story is: Caesars Palace is, but a shadow of it’s old self at the same rates they used to charge for top notch service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, I was apprehensive having read some mediocre reviews. I had no need to worry. Firstly we arrived at midnight without any luggage (it was still in Chicago!). Bad start. I have never had the brass neck to ask for a free upgrade anywhere in my life, but I tried it here - Only got a couple of King suites for our first night!!! should have cost £2700 per night - each!! I got to see how the other half live for a night. Three bathrooms, massive bed. kitchen, huge marble dining table and eight chairs, art on the walls.....Floor space bigger than my house - and more!! I was scared to touch anything. I thought I was going to be disappointed with my 'standard' deluxe room for the remainder of my stay. NO WORRIES. still got spa bath, huge bathroom - SPOTLESS.... I will definitely be back.....can't speak highly enough of the staff and hotel... I had the time of my life there

Reviews.Title: “Missing coffee makers, take a kettle!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Caesars in two years so clearly i've nothing bad to say about the place. Our only suprise was that they have removed all the coffee makers from the rooms. This is an incredibly clever money spinner because if like us you like a coffe/tea when you get up before even considering which buffet to go to for a small breakfast!! you now have to get dressed and go to the in house coffee shop and blow $10 each morning. everyone going up in the lift each morning had a tray of coffees and a just got out of bed look to them. as for the hotel we wouldnt stay anywhere else in Vegas because it has the best location and has the feel of old and new Vegas, just remember the travel kettle!

Reviews.Title: “Letdown at the Palace”
Reviews.Author: golfertom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesar's for 4 nights last week. The airport check-in is a great idea but the service left a somewhat bad taste in my mouth. The gentleman at check-in was very uncooperative. The young lady at the main hotel check-in was very personable and helpful. Our suite in the Palace Tower was excellent and very clean. A little trouble cooling it but it was 115 degrees. The main pool was closed but the others were filthy. Scum and oil ring around the top. No clean up. Empty cups, towels and trash all over. Water was bathwater hot, circulating the water some during the daytime hours would lower the temperature some. Don't know if the Harrah's takeover had anything to do with it but the casino personnel were all in a bad mood. Very little of the banter you come to expect back and forth between gamblers and dealers. I have been told it is all about getting money out of the players and any interaction is discouraged. Drinks and food all high. Go across the street. $1.00 for a Bud rather than $5.00 at CP.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: Iamatrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars July 4-8th. After reading some of the previous reviews, I was apprehensive about my choice until I saw the room. We stayed in the Roman Tower and it was very clean. The bathroom is beautiful and spacious. The staff did an excellent job each morning freshning it up while we were out. It could use a little decorating update. Some new bedspreads and new carpet would make a difference in the sleeping area. The casino is huge and that was the only problem. I like a smaller casino area. I enjoyed the Forum Shopping mall and it was easy to get to. Not having to venture out into 106 degree temperatures to look for a shopping area was a plus. Cafe Lago has a great breakfast and dinner buffet. The service was excellent and the food was great. For good coffee first thing in the morning, there is a spot right next to the Cypress Street Market Place that makes delicious coffee. The pool area is something to see. It's gorgeous. Four beautiful pools with plenty of chairs and plush fresh towels. I would definitely stay at Caesars again.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Road for Strip”
Reviews.Author: RobinBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Roman Tower. Nothing special and older room that's a little tired. It's a place to lay your head nothing more, nothing less. However clean and neat with very good daily cleaning. We checked in @ airport and shaved 1+ hours off our time. I checked in while my girlfriend collected the luggage (on same level of airport). We politely asked for upgrade possibility and the check in girl politely mentioned a large price. Also mentioned no freebies unless "Rated". The place was about half capacity and we were a little surprised by that. Don't pay for a shuttle service! It's easier and quicker to fetch a cab for the same price. We called the shuttle service (which we already paid for) for pick-up and they we're very difficult and wouldn't arrive when we wanted. We ate the cost and grabbed a cab (painless and quick). Caesars is right in the middle of everything and easy walk to anywhere. Caesars best asset is the pools, very nice and relaxing, main pool busy if you want to see and be seen. The others quiet and casual. The pool staff is a little understaffed. Takes 30 paces and your at the bar to get your own drinks again quicker and easier. The gym is $25 a day per. Very pricey but nice. What we didn't realize until too late is you can buy a 5 day pass for > half the price. A well kept secret at our expense. The staff @ Caesars is top notch from cleaning to the gaming folks. We visited and toured every resort on Strip and found Caesars OK or Average. We liked the rooms and layout of property of Paris better for less money and same location. We have booked another trip in December and for comparible money we didn't hesitate and booked "The Wynn". Beautiful place top to bottom (only downside is the location on one end of Strip). Not a sales pitch just an observation. During the day when killing time most resorts will let you see there rooms. Again no real complaints and you won't have a bad stay at Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “A total gem on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Geordiegirl35
Reviews.Content: We were very fortunate and spent 7 nights of a holiday to the USA here at Caesar's Palace and we were not disappointed, having been to Vegas before and stayed at the Luxor we decided that Caesar's location was better. I would advise you to use the check in desk at the airport whilst you are waiting for your cases, as the wait can be a long one, and this will utimately save you time when you reach the hotel, where the queues are quite big. We were in the Roman Tower, and as the hotel is so huge it is easy to loose your way. The room was great, probably not as spectacular as I had hoped, having read such great reviews, none the less there were no complaints. One thing we found very odd was that the bathroom had no door, now the bathrooms are big and even have a TV, but not to have a door where the toilet is (it is round the corner from the shower cubicle so hidden away) we found this strange, and as I was with my husband it was OK for us, but I imagine if you were with a friend or new partner this could be a little uncomfortable. I missed being able to make coffee in my room in a morning, but the hotel want you out spending money so they aint going to provide stuff that keeps you in your room any longer than necessary. Also the room we were allocated had a connecting door to next door and the noise travelled through this door quite a bit, particulary when we had American neighbours who talked loudly at 5 am. The pool area is fantastic and they will provide however many towels you want, which is very generous. However be warned it was hotter than hot and there is very limited shade, unless you want to use one of the double four poster beds that have canopies (and look silly in my opinion!) or pay for a cabanna. We had to use natural shade provided by the foliage, again probably a hotel ploy to get you into the casino and spending your dollars. The hotel does take your breath away and the shops are the best on the strip. We ate many meals in the hotel and we loved best the restaurant Boa which is on the top floor in the forum, couldn't fault a thing, great steaks, and fab martinis, wonderful setting with a balcony to view the strip if this is your thing, it does have cool air blowing out so that you don't get too hot. Book your tables as the queues and waiting involved for tables does get lengthy particularly about 8pm onwards, I find this frustrating as often I don't know what I want until I have a look around. The Empress chinese restaurant is fab also, you can't see this from the Casino you have to get a lift to it, but once there it is a beautiful place and ultra trendy. Be warned if you book a table and don't show up, the hotel will charge your credit card with $50 for the no show. The hotel has quite a few talking statues that come to "life" on the hour, Bachus and Neptune, both worth watching. The pool side snacks were good value and huge, but not that great in taste and service for drinks very slow, to be fair they waitresses didn't have an easy job to serve loads of people in 110 degree heat. We did venture out at night, but the temperature was so intense that you couldn't wait to get into a hotel, it honestly felt like someone had a hairdryer on top speed blowing in your face. We went to the Imperial Palace to see Legends in Concert which are allegedly lookalikies, well not as the case may be....our advice, give it a miss, go to see one of the more classier shows on the strip, more money but better spent. Imperial Palace is so run down, and the show hasn't had any money spent on it, costumes were tatty and falling to pieces, the dancers were unprofessional and kept laughing and giggling with each other...we laughed more at the acts rather than with them. I probably sound harsh here, and in their defence some of the acts did have very good soundalike voices, in particular The Coasters and Elvis. I believe the show changes from time to time, presumably so you will go back and see a different show during your stay (yeah right!) Must see's are, Wynn's resort, fabulous new hotel, Views by night from the Stratosphere, and Paris hotel. Obviously the Grand Canyon by helicopter, and a good classy show. Things to give a miss, Imperial Palace shows, Freemont Street in Downtown Vegas there are laser shows that last 5 mins on the hour, they are good, but not worth the trip in a taxi, or the wait for the hour to start, loads of dodgy looking people hanging around the area. Overall I would definatley stay at Caears again, and would recommend this to everyone, a little pricier but when you look at the others in the lower price range you realise why. It has everything you want, need plus some.

Reviews.Title: “A more accurate review-- "Depends on which Tower"”
Reviews.Author: variedtraveler
Reviews.Content: If you wonder why some reviews about Caesar's can be so positive while others so negative, here's why. Where you stand depends on where you sleep, i.e., it depends on which tower your room is in. I've stayed here countless times, with some great experiences, and some not so great. The have 5 towers. The 3 oldest original towers are the Roman, Forum, and Centurion towers. Although all three have been renovated, the Centurion is easily the worst of the three. My travel is usually business, which includes getting a room at the conference rate. This typically results in a room in Centurion tower (unless you are fortunate enough that none are available), which is consitently below average. My last stay was June 22-24 '05, and the carpets in my room were stained, the impractical shower stall has no where to put you shampoo, conditioner except on the floor of the stall, and the separate standard 60" tub does not invite a soaking session (can't imagine someone soaking in the same small type tub you have at home). It may be coincidence but I've noticed that front desk and room service are slower in this tower! Forum and Roman towers are somewhat better. The palace tower is outstanding, and the Agustus tower, which opens in August '05, promises to be exceptional. Aside from the "crap shoot" of which Tower you wind up in, this truly is the quintesential Las Vegas Experience. Great location, Great casino, Exceptional shopping in the forum shoppes has to be the best on the strip, by far. Hotel pool is truly Roman picturesque. Check-in is challenging here, really bad at busy times. Decent value- again depending on which room. Just avoid the Centurion Tower if you can, or if you plan on relaxing in your room for extended periods of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Choose rooms carefully have a good stay”
Reviews.Author: sailingboat
Reviews.Content: Caesars was undergoing some renovation when we stayed for a conference (hence good room rates). The room we had was acceptable, larger than the normal king size room but without any of the "wow" factors others in our group found in their rooms--jacuzzi tub in the bedroom floor, etc. One off-putting note, only a filmy (and rather cheap) plastic curtain separated the toilet area from the rest of the bathoom. But I was told by one of the workmen I encountered in the hall, that they were busy putting doors in (turns out most women did not like the curtain arrangement). Otherwise the bathroom was handsome with marble tub and counter, plenty of towels, and nice toiletries. Despite the renovations, Caesars has a somewhat hard, brassy edge one associates with the old Las Vegas. I guess I would have been happy enough at Caesars had I not gone across the street to take a peek at the Bellagio, which I found much prettier and softer. The pool areas at Caesars are fabulous--you are completely shielded from the noise and bustle of the street and surrounded by statues and greenery. Plus, there are several pools, which help disperse the crowd and a couple of hot tubs tucked into cozy nooks. Though Caesars is located smack in the middle of everything, be prepared to walk. The hotel is set well back off the strip which means a bit of a walk to get there -- but then Vegas is all about walking. Forum shops are nice, but again, competition from the shopping arenas at Paris and the Venetian is stiff. When we were there, Caesars was in the middle of adding even more shopping to the Forum, so you know they have an eye on their competitors. Our room was clean but had none of the added amenities you get in hotels such as the Westin (home of the heavenly bed), or other luxury hotels, and most "extras" are just that, extra. Still, if you get a good room rate, a stay at the legendary Caesars should not disappoint. If I had a choice of comparably priced rooms however, I'd probably head to the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad room”
Reviews.Author: Essie16
Reviews.Content: First, the positives: It's centrally located along the Strip, and I liked the Forum Shops and the restaurants. I paid only $120 a night midweek. But I would seriously hesitate staying here again because my room (in the Forum Tower) was disgusting. The decor was seriously 70s: not in a funky retro way but in dire need of a renovation way, with a threadbare, unappealingly gray-green carpet and bedspread. I could live with that if the houskeeping were up to par. It's not. At check in, the previous occupants' trash was everywhere. Even after the room was "cleaned," some of their half eaten takeout and pepsi bottles, plus copious crumbs on the floor, were still left. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caeser's from June 12-16th of this year for the Ramada Worldwide Conference and I must say fromt he moment I stepped into my room I knew I was in for a week from hell. Our room upn check-in had stained carpets, a dirty bathroom with pubic hair on the floor, toilet and in the tub and the room smelt like smoke even though it was non-smoking. We has a group of approx. 700 people at the hotel and we were given NO concessions, we were charged for internet in our rooms, local phone calls, we were all given rooms in the OLD Roman Tower and our rates were the same that anyone else would pay. After spending one night on rock hard, thin pillowed beds we decided that even if we had to pay more we would upgrade or checkin to another hotel. The Manager put us into the Palace Tower in deluxe room with a Jacuzzi Tub which was nice and the room was much cleaner. The rest of our stay was enjoyable but after spending a night touring other resorts, I will definitely stay at another hotel on my next trip to Vegas. The Wynn is remarkable as is the Venetian and the Bellagio. Another part of the stay that was bad was the Events Centre where we had our meetings, the building is located far from the hotel, and you have to walk through the topless pool to get there, not that I am complaining but it is hard to go through in a suit and be professional when there are so many halk-naked beautiful women around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great pool(s), and lucky machines”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a extended weekend trip to Las Vegas for a bachelorette party. We stayed at Ceasars and our overall experience was great. Upon arrival, the staff at Ceasars upgraded us (without asking) to a mini-suite in the Palace Tower. We had been scheduled for deluxe room in the same tower. Ceasars is clean and in good condition, especially as compared to other hotels on the strip. The only thing we did not like about the room was there were not enough towels for two people to take two showers a day. We spent several days at the pool and one day we rented cabana #24 at the Apollo Pool. We had great service from our pool host, Laurie, and our server, Lindsey. Make your reservations early for the cabana because we waited until the day before and we got the last one. We ate twice at Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill. I highly recommend it. The food and service is excellent. Make your reservations earlier because select reservation times fill up fast. We have been so pleased with our experience that we are planning a return trip for later this year.

Reviews.Title: “loved caesars”
Reviews.Author: angelika0368
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I drove up to Vegas for two nights the last time we were in L.A. We stayed at Caesars. They gave us a free upgrade to a spa room which had a lovely jacuzzi. The hotel was perfect. Room service and restauraunts we great. The Forum shops are amazing. Plus not too many kids running amok like in some other hotels. I would recommend Caesars as one of the Strip hotels you should definately try.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynn B
Reviews.Content: Caesars is well located and nice and central on the strip. It is very nice inside and has lots of nice touches in the rooms, nice toiletries, jacuzzi bath etc. The views are not always guaranteed but this did not bother us. It is reasonably priced and wll worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Beware ! Check Your Reservation”
Reviews.Author: nordbabe
Reviews.Content: Back in November, I booked all of my managers at this property to attend a convention. 5 of 6 of the attendees were fine, but one got his reservation cancelled. I used the same corporate travel system for all of them, but Caesar's CLAIMED that his Visa card was no good, and that his deposit didn't go through and they cancelled his reservation. A second phone call from our travel provider, and they were told a different story: that his card was run a couple of hours before check-in, and it failed, so they cancelled him( he was in the air at the time). Yet they could offer him a $700 a night room with the same card ! NO notifcation, either written or verbal was given to this man in the several months before his arrival. And there were no problems with his card - he travels frequently and had no problems with the card prior to or since this incident. He wound up having to move to another property mid-trip. It was embarrassing and frustrating. Someone at the hotel messed up and gave his room away and then tried to blame a perfectly good Visa card. As a corporate travel planner, I can assure you that I will not take the chance next year and will book my group at a different property. This is unacceptable and inexcusable. If you make a mistake, at least don't lie about it.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: prolook
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but overated. maybe becasue the buffet there was BAD. We wanted the Belagio buffet, but the line was 30 min, 1 hour before it opened up for dinner. So we went to Caesars, the surf buffet was better. for what we paid, it was highly overated. world traveler

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - but not for business”
Reviews.Author: msucheer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - it was in a fantastic location and the rooms were gorgeous. The staff was courteous and even bumped most of my party up to suites because our rooms weren't ready. The hotel in itself is an adventure - lots of shops and restaurants - truly fabulous. I was very impressed with the furnishings of the rooms and the bathroom. The only downside was there was no Internet! Even 2 star hotels are now providing free Internet for their guests. They did not even provide it for our conference room. Big minus for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Disliked the buffet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and casino but the buffet was definitely not worth the $20.00. We have been to several buffets in Vegas over the past 10 years and this was the worst. Will stay at Caesar's again but will eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I travelled met up with a group friends at Caesars on May 12-15, 2005. The two of us arrived at 11:30pm on Thursday night. We had no problem with check-in, and we were upgraded to a "jacuzzi tub" suite, although the room was still in the Forum Tower (I believe that is the oldest tower). Also, it was on a "smoking-optional" floor (when did they stop calling it a smoking floor?), but the gentlemen at the reception desk assured us that housekeeping had some sort of system to air out a room, and if we found our room to not smell fresh enough, someone would be up within ten minutes to take care of everything. We arrived at our room, and to our relief, it did not smell like smoke. The furnishings in the room are comfortable, but not fancy or extravagant in any way. The bathroom was huge, big enough for four people to get ready in at night! If you are in the forum tower, I would ask for a room at the very end of the tower closest to the Strip. We had an amazing view of the Strip from our room, but I think if you were just a few rooms away from us, you would only see the other Caesars Towers. Because we arrived so late, our dining options were limited, and we decided to check out the Cafe Lago restaurant. I know you shouldn't expect too much from a 24-hour casino restaurant, but we really didn't enjoy our meal. I wouldn't recommend going--I have had late-night dinners at Bellagio's 24-hour restaurant, and the food there was MUCH better, not to mention a nicer atmosphere! Our friends arrived the next day. They had reservations for the Palace Tower (the newly renovated tower), which they had paid for in advance. When they tried to check in (at about 2:00 in the afternoon) they were told that due to something that came up that morning, they did not have any available rooms because they were renovating. They offered to put our friends up at the Flamingo for free. Our friends said no way, the Flamingo is not comparable to a room in the Palace Tower. Eventually our friends wore them down, I guess, because a room was miraculously available in the Palace Tower. Lesson learned: stick to your guns. From what we could hear going on around us, we suspected that many people were having plans changed because Caesars overbooked that weekend. Just be prepared if you come on a weekend! Friday we stuck by the pool, which was great! It's a great set up there. The food at the pool is pretty decent, but drink service can be a little slow. We ate at Mesa Grill Friday evening--it was outstanding! I highly recommend that restaurant for a meal. Saturday night we ate at Mon Ami Gabi at Paris, which was also great--and you can't beat the patio view of the Bellagio fountains. For our breakfasts, we walked over to Paris and got things at the little cafes. The lines seemed to move quickly there. This was my second trip to Vegas. My first trip I stayed at Bellagio, which I am afraid has spoiled me for life. Anyway, if you can get a deal, I would stay at Caesars. It's not as high-brow or elegant as some other places, but it still provided decent service and a clean, comfortable room. The location is wonderful. The pool is great. It has a young, fun, vibe. If, however, you are used to excellent hotels and accommodations, I would head to Bellagio. Much more elegant and classy.

Reviews.Title: “All Hail Caesar”
Reviews.Author: michmouse
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay in fabulous Las Vegas! Caesar's Palace was centrally located, and we absolutely loved the "Garden of The God's" pool. Restaurants are excellent, with tremendous variety. There were many choices from fine dining to quick sandwiches. The Mesa Grill, though pricey, was the best meal we have ever eaten, and worth every penny. We got an excellent rate at Caesar's, and were offered a free upgrade to a spa room. We atayed in the Forum Tower, which is an older tower, and definitely in need of some TLC. However, for the price we paid ($140.00 w/ tax) it was a great value. I could see someone being disappointed in the room quality if they were paying $350.00 a night for this room.....And many people were! We watched the prices go up higher and higher after booking our room, and people were paying more than two and a half times what we were paying, for the same night, at the same hotel, in the same tower. Book your rate at Caesar's. Sign up for their emails, and have your rated reduced like we did. Caesar's was over the top Vegas glamour and gaudiness, but also rich with history. Really! The perfect place to introduce yourself to the fabulous city of LAs Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of a let down”
Reviews.Author: ErinSM
Reviews.Content: We had made plans for a large group of us to meet in Vegas and celebrate a friend's birthday. She picked Ceasars and made the arrangements. We had specifically requested adjoining rooms. When we arrived, the first rooms they assigned us were spread out, they complained and the staff sent us to rooms somewhere else. Unfortunately, those rooms hadn't been serviced yet. So then they upgraded us to spa rooms, at least they were all on the same floor in the same tower. The bathroom was the highlight. Beautiful. Large enough for 4 women to primp in. The bedroom was fine. Not exceptional in any way, but clean and reasonably comfortable. The pool area was lovely. The Cafe Lago had a fine breakfast buffet. The casino was nice enough. The Forum shops had a nice selection of stores and restaurants. We ate at the Stagedoor Deli (delicious) and the Cheesecake Factory. All in all, I thought it was an okay stay, but I won't return. I'll try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Caesars Palace in good location”
Reviews.Author: Veronica05
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a trip to Las Vegas on business. I had the pleasure of staying in Caesars Palace in a tower room with a view of the Mirage and of the new hotel , Wynn. The room had a beautiful view, the staff was wonderful, the location was probably the best in Las Vegas. I love the central location of Caesar's Palace-the restaurants and the shopping are wonderful. As a travel agent, I look for the things my clients would want and Caesars meets all the expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas without gambling!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from spending 4 nights at Caesars Palace. What a great time. The hotel was fabulous. Very well kept and lots of real character unlike the more sterile "Disney" feeling we found at others like Bellagio, Venetian, Paris, and Aladdin. The pool was wonderful. There are 4 pools and 2 hot tubs. All the pools are different in atmosphere so you should be able to find something that suits your mood. One pool allows European Sunbathing (topless) and is secluded by vegetation. No children allowed and it has a quiet tasteful adult atmosphere. All pools have waitress service for food and drink, but you may have trouble finding one at times as they seem to be short staffed in this one area. (This being the most critical reason why my wife gave this an "above average" rating as otherwise I think we would have gone with "excellent" ... she just confirmed that I'm correct on this assumption .. and hit me telling me to stop adding this sidebar) But otherwise the pools were wonderful and we did spend many hours there. We had the basic room. It unfortunately didn't have much of a view being on the 6th floor and looking at another building, but since we wanted to check in early we could not be too choosy. However we were not there for the view from the hotel room so this was not an issue. Aside from this the room was clean and quiet. The bathroom was nice with seperate shower and tub with marble floors. One odd thing was that there is no bathroom door. Not even for the toilet. Given that we have only been married 10 years (together for 14) we have not yet reached the point in our relationship where we can be that open with each other as to not have a door for the toilet. This lead to a rule on one staying in the bedroom area while said toilet was in use! The bathroom is completely seperated and has a doorway. Just no door. The shopping was good. There was a mix of stores that can be found in most malls (Bath and Body, Victoria's Secret, GAP, etc) as well as many very up scale stores. Fashion Show Mall is a short walk north on the strip if you're looking for more shopping. The casino was nice, but we didn't gamble even a penny. We went to relax and see the shows in Vegas. But it was a nice casino. The food was fabulous. Caesars probably has the best selection of eating establishments and although not cheap the food is excellent. Much better priced then Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caesars Palace during the first week of March, and it was really quite nice. They were running a special deal on a "spa room" (with a whirlpool in your room) for $160 so I went for it. Usually it's a lot more! The bedroom part was clean, but it was an older room in the Roman Tower and could use a little renovating. My room was very large, though. I liked the little sitting area with a chair and a chaise lounge, which was very comfortable. I appreciated the in-room safe. The bathroom had been renovated, looked very new. It was really terrific, with plenty of towels, two sinks (one was a little vanity with a magnetized mirror and a stool), and a small TV to watch the news while you shave, brush your teeth, etc. The whirlpool was steps from the bed, and it was a bathtub, not round, so a bit smaller than one might expect. It may depend on where you stay, the Roman Tower, or one of the other areas of Caesars Palace. Room service at Caesars Palace was GREAT. We ordered it twice while we were there and the food was delivered quickly, presented beautifully, and it was fresh and fabulous. All of the staff I dealt with were very cordial as well. Nobody gave us a hard time about anything, or acted snooty or disinterested, like you get at some hotels. The hotel is huge, as most people know, but after a day or so I felt it was easy to navigate. Some people might differ on that with me, but I like to walk, so I honestly didn't mind hiking from the forum shops to the casino, etc. All-in-all, I'd go back. But the prices are usually WAY too high (like $300-$500 a night, so I'd only go back if there if there were a special $160 or under deal for a "spa room."

Reviews.Title: “Great room, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Richardson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caesar'a Palace in a Palace Tower Room. The room was fine. A very comfortable King size bed. The bathroom was to die for. Double Jacuzzi Tub. Glassed in marble tile shower room. Double Sink vanity. Seperate Toilet room. There was no in-room coffee machine as stated and the ironing board was broken. The room was clean and we heard no noise in the halls or coming from other rooms around us. We found the best place to eat was the Cypress Market in the Casino. The other restaurants in the hotel and the Forum Mall were just OK as they are churning so many people through the food was not as good as hoped for. The slot machines appeared to be broken as they took all our money :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Caesars”
Reviews.Author: Esmel
Reviews.Content: Despite what other reviews on this website state, I have no bad words to say about Caesars Palace. My husband and I took my daughter to Las Vegas as a 21st birthday present and booked our room a year in advance. Upon arrival at Caesars we were advised that they were overbooked and the only room available was one which had 1 king sized bed which clearly is not appropriate when 3 adults are sharing a room. Without getting angry with the receptionist, but voicing my disapproval, we were upgraded to a penthouse for 2 nights, had champagne and strawberries waiting for us on arrival in the room and due to the initial inconvenience we were upgraded to a superior room for the duration of our 14 night stay. Having travelled extensively around the world, it amazes me how anyone can criticise a hotel who goes this far out of their way to appease themselves. Caesars Palace can hardly be classed as an inferior hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Selsilem
Reviews.Content: We went for the Elton John show and were not disappointed in any way by Elton's Performance. Our rooms were just about the nicest that we have ever stayed in. We have stayed at the Monte Carlo, the MGM, the Stratosphere, the Venetian and the Vegas Hilton. Our room at Caesars had a Jacuzzi tub inside a large bathroom area. Our view was toward the Vegas strip as it leads to the Stratosphere. The Hotel staff were friendly and upbeat. But it all ends at the door to our room. You get used to the doors closing themselves all the way and locking behind you. They did at all the other places we stayed at, so there should have been no worries at Caesar's as well, right? Wrong! All they had to do was push on the door to gain access to my laptop computer, some handheld video games, a digital camera, and a video camera. I only brought my puter so we could upload photos for printing later when we returned home. Photos from our helicopter ride to the Grand Canyon, photos from the Eiffel Tower and the Stratosphere... all gone. And Caesar's claims to have no responsibility in our losses. They are so worried about checking people in and out of their facilities that they don't care about the up-keep and normal wear-and-tear of the Hotel itself. We are out about 3 G's in personal items, because of our own belief that the door would close and latch itself behind us. All the other hotel doors have closed properly, from Southern Cali to Hawaii to Alaska and the other Vegas hotels I have stayed at. We never had any problems until Caesars. Hindsight truly is 20/20, and we found out the hard way. I would like to recommend Caesar's, but please make sure to check your doors and make sure they are closed all the way. I plan to see Elton John again sometime, but I don't plan on staying at Caesars because of their poor attitude in replacing our belongings. It kind of put us off all together on Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Next time I'll stay longer...”
Reviews.Author: bmacbc
Reviews.Content: After years of wanting, I finally had the chance to stay at Caesar's Palace, albeit only for one night. We had just spent the four previous nights at the Flamingo across the street and ended up staying on in Vegas for an extra night. Seeing as it was just for one extra night, we decided to give Caesar's a try. It was a bit pricier than we were paying at the Flamingo, but we managed to get a Spa Package for $150/night, which included two spa admissions and complementary champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries delivered to your room that evening.(we would have paid $260 to extend our stay at the Flamingo, compared to the $65/night rate we had just paid... it was spring break) We got a room in the Roman Tower overlooking the pool area. Check-in was a breeze, even though it was busy. The room itself was quite nice, but pretty standard as far as LV goes. (It is funny, but you come to expect more from a hotel room in LV.) The bathroom had been recently renovated and was very nice in sparkling white with silver fixtures; even had a small screen TV in the make-up/sink area. The room was quiet and I had a great sleep after a long night in the casino. In the morning, we decided to get some use out of the Spa passes. I booked a short massage (extra cost), which was fantastic, and then luxuriated in the sauna, steam and whirlpool area. I felt very well taken care of. I think I will be taking advantage of Hotel Spa areas more often. My stay at Caesar's was great, even if for one night. I have loved and admired it for a long time, just from the times I have spent there in the past. Dining at Mesa Grill, Bradley Ogden or Joe's Stone Crab is exceptional and well worth the cost. Viale is a great place for lunch or a mid-range($) dinner. Also saw Celine Dion a couple of years back at the Colosseum, which was a sight. Caesar's Palace is it's own little universe, where if you don't have to or want to, you might never need to leave the property. Everything and more is here to meet your needs-- rooms, shopping, dining, entertainment, gambling... I found all the staff to be courteous and friendly and prompt, from the check-in staff to the cocktail waitresses. I've seen a lot of complaints about Caesar's on this website, but am left shaking my head. My stay here combined with all the other times I have set foot in the Empire, have only left a smile on my face. I will be back... in fact I am thinking of spending the big 4-0 here next year, perhaps in the newest Augustus Tower opening in the fall. It sounds spectacular... The room I mean. Being 40? I will see...

Reviews.Title: “Rude”
Reviews.Author: resikobi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Hotel but walked across the street to Caesar's Palace to see their hotel and shop and have some breakfast. There was some construction going on and the hotel is very gorgeous but, it is quite a hike getting to the casino and shopping area itself. The shops were too high-priced for our budget and about the only thing we did enjoy was the aquarium. The kids loved looking at that! On our way out, we stopped to eat some pastries and have coffee at one shop then further on out, we stopped for a coke at an outdoor bar/snack joint. Talk about rude, they told my husband that he had to keep our kids out of the area. It was an outdoor type seating area and the only way to order drinks was to go up to the counter. My husband was very upset. He grabbed his coke and we told ourselves we'd never go back there. We thought that Vegas was starting to cater more to families and children since most travelers take their families along. We didn't get that feeling from our recent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Live like an King in Caesars Palace”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowgirl
Reviews.Content: What can we say, it was fantastic! We spent four nights in March 2005 and had a petite suite in the Palace Tower. It was a special trip for our anniversary and Ceasars' were very kind to us. The place is amazing and if you can afford it then it is really worth saving the extra and staying here. It is the most spectacular hotel on the strip. No words can explain the enormity of the this hotel, or any of the other hotels on the strip. Caesars staff were extremely helpful and kind. The room was fabulous, immaculate and very spacious. We felt as though we had been transported back into another time, one of opulence, splendour and illustrious surroundings heralding the imoprtance of each guest. The hotel staff and musicians were brilliant. There is so much to do and see within the hotel itself we really had to steal ourselves away to actually go outside Caesars. Everyone should experience Caesars once in their live (or twice if they are lucky!)

Reviews.Title: “Caesars is not a 'view' hotel???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at Caesars/Las Vegas in March '05 - we stayed in the Centurion Tower which for some reason does not have an ice machine - anywhere! We had to go to another tower to get ice - or get room service - & if you've stayed in any of these hotels, everything is very distant! Room service however was very prompt. The pools were heated which was very nice - the snack bar was not open due to some re-construction but it's early in the season. We asked the pool staff where the hot tub was & they really didn't know then mentioned one on the 2nd floor in the 'spa' area - the hot tubs were in back of the pools! I still don't know why they didn't tell us that. The rooms were very nice - upon check in i requested a view & got to look out the window at pipes & the other tower! Called the desk & they mentioned they were NOT a 'view' hotel...???? --- When our room was ready after 5, our room looked out at the Flamingo - i thought they weren't a view hotel? & there are rooms that overlook the beautiful pools -????? whey didn't they mention this? It seems like if you're not spending an enormous amount of money, they don't care. We had a pkg. deal so maybe this is part of that..... a very beautiful hotel w/lots of shopping!! Not very many full breakfast restaurants however & the restaurants are a bit pricey - but that's Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “cheap, smoke everywhere, horrid”
Reviews.Author: spahotel
Reviews.Content: we were upgraded to a "spa" room. basically had a jacuzzi tub. However in exchange we were NOT on a non-smoking floor. Smoke was everywhere. Cigarrette burns on the carpet. We were in the Forum tower. Horrid. would not recommend staying here. Small dark room. Not business-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: PenguinLuver23
Reviews.Content: I think I have stayed at just about all of the strip hotels and have never felt compelled to write a review, until now. The accomodations here are not worth the price. Granted it was Nascar weekend and they raise the room rates anyway, but still. Stayed in the Palace Tower, but you'd never know it was the "newer" tower. The furniture was well worn and the wood was even broken off of some things. The bedspread needed to be replaced and the pillows were the worst. The bathroom was nice, but was only supplied with 2 towels. Go figure. I will admit that it was nice being so close to the Forum Shops, but that was the only advantage to staying here. Next time, will book again with the Mirage or Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: Scout77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace from 3/10/05 - 3/13/05. It was great! We arrived at the hotel about 1pm and were able to check right in. I asked if there were any upgrdes and she said yes. I can upgrade you and wave the $30.00 a night fee. We stayed in the Fourum Tower on floor 76. The bathroom was huge with a spa tub that fit two people with no problem. The only problem with the room was the grout in the shower. It was a little discolored, but its a old hotel these things happen. We loved the pools and the night clubs. There was some construction going on so one of the pools and the hot tubs were closed. The food at Cafe Largo was great. The drinks at Neptunes pool bar hit the spot. Some people say the hotel was to big and hard to get around. We had no problem finding things at all. It was one of the happening places at night, lots of people. We were there for a wedding at the Viv Las Vegas Wedding Chapel. I do not recomend this place at all!!!! Went to the Cirque show Mystere at Treasure Island and that was awesome! I also recommend the roller coaster at NYNY if you are into that. We had an awsome trip, but next time will try another hotel that might be alittle cheaper but just as nice. Like NYNY, Paris, or Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “Check your bill”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 9 - 12, 2005 The weather was fantastic! Checked into the hotel at the Airport --- Highly recommended! Took about 5 minutes. I did request the Palace Tower and it was not available. We were given the Roman Tower. Cab fee from airport to hotel was $10.60. Make sure your cab has the charge listed on side of vehicle. Our first cab driver did not have the prices and when I asked him how much he said about $16 - $18 PER person! I should have reported him. Our room smelled HORRIBLE.......thick, stale, smoke (non-smoking room) We ended up changing rooms. The rooms are nothing special for the price you pay. Upon check-out, we asked for an itemized bill. There was an added expense of a massage with a $25 tip from the Spa that we did not have done!

Reviews.Title: “Fit for an Emperor and Empress”
Reviews.Author: johnnyvan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Palace Tower. View was wonderful! Bathroom was a Palace in and of itself--I have lived in apartments smaller than this bathroom! The casino had the nicest vibe of any in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous shopping, not so fab odour of the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just finished a week's holiday at Caesar's Palace. I was especially impressed with our view, and the beauty of the architect. However, I only found a couple of flaws. Our room smelled like dead animal when we first arrived, the carpet on the jacuzzi tub reeked of mildew, and there was no coffee pot. On our way back to Canada, we stayed at a Best Western and found much more cleanliness, better beds, a coffee pot, and a more comfortable atmosphere. Perhaps next time we go to Vegas we'll stay at the Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “The rudest staff, the worst business meeting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a company meeting at Caesars palace last November. I had materials shipped to the hotel ahead of time and asked the hotel staff to bring it to the meeting room when I checked in. The experience at check in was a disaster. I did not get directions to our hospitality suite. The directions to my room were at best vague. I had to find the meeting space on my own. Hotel staff was very unhelpful and rude. The material was not brought to the meeting room at all during the meeting. Lots was going on and we forgot to ask AGAIN so after we left we called the hotel to retrieve it. The shipping was charged to my credit card instead of the corporate account by the business services staff. Someone promised to look into it and did not. Accounts receivable just signed for me and that was it. I would discourage anyone from staying at this hotel. They have no notion of service or customers.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's SUCKS”
Reviews.Author: vacationsalot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were just married at Caesar's palace Las Vegas on February 21, 2005. The wedding service and cordinators were great but our stay at Caesar's was very disappointing and terrible. We arrived at the hotel on Sunday February 20th, 2005. We arrived at the valet area around 12:30 p.m., the valet attendants were a little friendly, but could have been better. When we went to check-in we only waited for about 10 mins. We thought that our suite would not be ready until 3 or so. The front desk person said that there was not a room ready, and that it would not be ready until at least 5p.m. I told him that check-in time is 3, and that I needed it to be ready by 4. We were scheduled to have our wedding party, up to our suite at 4. He said o.k. and gave me a number to call back in a little while to see if the room was ready. That was fine, we had planned to go have lunch with our family and friends at the Rio at 1:00pm. Well as we were leaving I sat down for a few minutes, because I had just drove 7 hours to get to Las Vegas. The front desk gentleman (Adam) came to find us, he said that they had a room ready, and we could check-in and go look at it. He said that we could have the bell-men take up our belongings while we were gone at lunch. We thought everything would be fine. Well we got our room keys, and went up to suite 482 in the Roman Tower. When we steped in, lets say that it was not pleasant. It had 2 nice marble steps to go in to the roon, and a huge marble floor once you stepped in. After that the first thing we saw, was a huge stain in the carpet, that looked almost the color of I don't know what. I thought, well maybe they can cover it with a rug. Then there was a huge round table, that was proble nice when they first got it, as you got closer it had a lot of big gashes in it. A lot of the lights and lamps did not work, and there was actually broken glass from a light bulb on a table, not to mention the broke off bulbs that were still in some of the lamps. When you walked to the right where the bar was, the marble bar was very dirty, and stained. My husband went in to the master bathroom, he went to turn on the water, and the fixture came off. Well my friend that was with us called down to the front desk and talked to Adam. He was quick to help, and still very nice. Well by this point we had to call our families and friends to tell them that we would not make it to lunch, and we still had not ate that day. Adam took us to the same suite on the 5th floor # 582 to give it a look. My husband and our two friends looked it over, to make sure non of the other problems were in this suite. It was good, so we said o.k. They brought our luggage and things up, and then we left to get some lunch, finally around 2:30p.m. So, we had already delt with the hotel for 2 hours. We called our wedding party and said 4o'clock was still a go in the suite. So everyone got there while I went to pick up my sister/maid-of-honor. When we got back I had to run to the restroom, when I came out, I saw my daughter open a cabinet under the sink, then she began to scream histarically. Then she yelled" ROACH", I thought I was hearing things, and my best-friend, the god-father of my children began to chase it , and kill it. How bad is that? My friend who had already delt with the hotel people, called down to the front desk again. Whoever answered was very rude, and said that they would send someone right up. After 25 minutes, my sister took the napkin that had the roach in it to the front desk, and asked them what they would like her to do with it? The lady looked at her crazy, and grabbed it, and tossed it in the trash. Then offered a $50.00 food and beverage credit, that I already had. She continued asking my sister and friend what they wanted her to do about it, while I and the rest of our wedding party waited for the person they were sending up. When she got there, she looked quickly, and briefly, and then said I do not see anything. One of my bridesmaids asked her to check again, she said o.k., o.k. meha, I look again, very rudely. My sister and friend went to check out suite 1082, same tower. It was o.k., but I had to go down and get the new keys. So, my husband, sister, best-friend, best-man, and about 6 other friends went down to talk to a manager. Well after we asked for a manager it took about 30-40 mins before she came, and the front desk peoole kept saying, oh, they do this to us all the time. They don't worry about us or the customer waiting. Well by the time she can, I very very emotionally drained and upset. My friend had to talk to her, because I was so upset, I could not talk. My friend proseeded to tell her what we had been through all day, and that I was mordified by what I went through, and how bad it was for roaches to be in my room, and for all of our wedding party to witness it. She kept asking, what do you want me to do? Then my friend said to her, instead of asking me what I want you to do, why don't you tell me waht you are gonig to do to make it better? I guess she finally remembered how to do her job, and what she was there for, and finally offered to move us, and comp us for our last night, that we were going to have to move to a smaller room for. So, in total we spent about 7 hours dealing with our room, and all of our plans were ruined. My whole wedding party, were yelling at eachother, and upset with me. All beacause Caesar's Palace put us behind schedule. I almost did not get my marriage license in time. When I woke up in the morning, I looked like a mess, because I had been crying so much, thank god, my wedding did not start until 4:00p.m. Oh, by the way, they did not refund the rest of my cash deposit either. I put down $200.00 and only used about $90.00 of it, so they still owe me $110.00 for my deposit. To sum it all up. I do recommend the wedding chapel, it was beautiful, unfortunalty my wedding cordinator did not work that day. As for the hotel, I give it a F-, a straight failure. I forgot to mention that the valet yelled at my friend right after she picked up my car from then, even after she tipped them quite generouslly. So, my advise is go the the New York New York , MGM, Mirage, Luxor, even Imperial Palace if you want good sevice, because Caesar's is truely not a Palace fit for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Caesar's Not A Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed to make a quick business trip to Vegas last weekend so we thought we'd try Caesar's Palace. We'd never stayed there.but we were confident we would have a very nice experience. Wrong. I have stayed in literally hundreds of hotels (I'm a flight Attendant), from Holiday Inn's to Four Star Properties and the bathroom in our room was the dirtiest I've ever seen! The grout in the shower was so moldy it was black in some places! I immediately called the front desk to request an upgrade or a different room, but the best they could do was to offer a suite room for fifty dollars more! We were paying 199.00 and at this point I was so unimpressed by our room and the way our situation was being handled I said "no thanks".
