Needless to say, we will stay somewhere else the next time we go to Las Vegas. FYI, our room was called the "Spa" room, i.e. jacuzzi tub for one!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PKM10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 days at Caesar's Las Vegas. The staff was professional, helpful and courteous. Our Palace Tower room was very large and the bathroom (jacuzzi tub) was beautiful as well as clean. We were given access to our room a couple hours prior to check-in time and the bell staff was so efficient, they almost beat us to the room with our luggage. Needing a couple extra pillows, one call to housekeeping had two pillows delivered in about 5 minutes. Food was wonderful and the jazz entertainment in the Terrazzo lounge was top tier. We've stayed in several Las Vegas hotels and Caesar's is our first choice at this point. We will definitely stay there again and I would recommend it to anyone with no apprehension.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: liv4vegas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at Caesars. We go to LV at least two times a year for last 10 years. This was first time at Caesars. Was the best so far. Have also stayed NYNY, MGM, Luxor, etc. Everyone was very friendly and helpfull, the Palace Tower room was execptionally comfortable, The Brady Ogden and Terrazza dining was delicious. Will definately be going back to Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “don't go”
Reviews.Author: seetheUSA
Reviews.Content: lChecked in Valentine's Day to celebrate our wedding anniversary: long lines at check-in; rude personnel; couldn't get room service/concierge service or front desk to answer our calls; plumbing made clanking noises at all hours; hotel reeked of tobacco; staying at Caesar's almost ruined our anniversary celebration. There are many other hotels on the strip that look and smell cleaner, don't go to Caesar's.

Reviews.Title: “Aint That Good!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CAtravel07
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas. Heard this hotel was very good.This hotel is not as good as you might have heard! I stayed here during April and had a Delxuxe room with a very nice bathroom and a view of the strip. The housekeeping seemed to just pass by our hotel room!!! The tub was very dirty and the shower too. Some parts of the casino are very smokey so try to avoid going through the casino. Elevators were kinda slow and staff was not that nice. My friend had another room and we booked it at the same time but when we arrived at the check-in, we had to wait about 30-45 minutes for them to clean it! And my friend had to wait about an hour! I would not stay here again. I ould try The Venetian next time.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad views”
Reviews.Author: gmboilers1
Reviews.Content: There is no view out the window, but quite a view from the toilet. From our window we could see extension cords, HVAC units, other balconies, and not much else, even after "upgrading". From our toilet, we could see everything since there is no door.... My wife and I have stayed at 11 different Vegas strip hotels, only staying one time at the same hotel (Mirage). Our 13th (unlucky) trip was to Caesars this January. Believe me, we have something to base our review on! Caesars Palace is a wonderful, large, somewhat confusing property. The casino skews to the higher roller, but has plenty of quarter machines. You would have a tough time finding any $5 tables, and probably no seats at the $10 tables, but I didn't notice any crowding at the $5000 minimum tables. The restaurants are numerous, particularly if you count the many quality places in the Forum Shops, which is attached. We ate at two, the PALM and TERRAZZA, and were very satisfied at both. Prices tend to be steeper for the quality than we have found elsewhere, but perhaps the "Caesars" name can explain that premuim. Check In was efficient. However, our room was a disaster. The room we were originally given looked out on a roof, with a distant view of more roofs, a partial view of some other room balconies, and a lot of pipes, a ladder, one bright orange extension cord, and, if you got down on the floor and peeked up through the very top of the window, you could see a sliver of the sky (I think). We, being incredibly fussy people, for the very first time in our lives, went back down and requested a better room. We were paying about $190 per night. Maybe at Caesars that is "chump change", and we have certainly paid more (and a lot less) for a room, but what they offered was a joke. Unfortunately, the room on the 10th floor we were "upgraded" to was a laugher as well. The "partial strip view" looked through a tunnel of guest rooms, where we could see the Flamingo sign, a few of the Flamingo rooms, and a peek of the mountains behind. Mostly we just looked across at more rooms that had even worse views that we had (they had to look at me, the poor slobs), and a higher up view of the roof. Now I have used TRIP ADVISOR before, and I am NOT one of those gloomy negative guys that blow every little thing out of proportion. There are a LOT of great things about Caesars. But as I looked at this property, some things just became obvious to me. First, most of the mega-resorts on the strip were built complete, and were designed to take the most advantage possible of the views available in as many rooms as possible. Caesars, being the grand-daddy of the mega-resorts, has had to continually add construction to keep up. This new construction appears to have surrounded the old construction, but they still have many, many (thousands?) rooms in the "old" towers, and these rooms, which probably used to have great views, now have absolutely horrid views of the wonderful "new" towers (and Celine's ampitheatre and the new Forum shops, etc. etc.). It also appears that many of the "new" non-strip facing rooms have poor views, unless you are on a floor high enough to look over the old towers. Good luck getting one of the rooms in the new towers facing the strip, I am sure they are the most primo and hard to get rooms, unless you're a "whale" (huge gambler). So if you are a "view" person, which we are, you are taking a big risk booking at Caesars. Obviously there are some rooms at Caesars with great views, but there are A LOT more rooms at Caesars that have crappy views than there are at most of the other mega-resorts. Make no mistake, this is a first-class property. Anybody who says its a dump is pyscho. I am fairly certain that our room had to be toward the lower end, but everything in it was clean, well decorated, comfortable, just what you'd expect from a high dollar resort. But what are they thinking? Our bathroom was nice, with a double sink vanity area, marble floors, a large garden tub and seperate glass shower area. But the toilet was next to the shower, in view of the vanity area AND THE FRONT DOOR and HALL, and there is no door, no way to close off the area. If you are in the room alone, no problem, but my wife and I were with several other people at times, and not having any ability for privacy was definitely a nuisance. In our room and the other 3 rooms I saw when I was there, there were no doors. Another couple we were with, while they did not have a door either, saw some rooms being made up that DID have bathroom doors. So if this is important to you, you had better check this too. In nothing I saw on Caesars website, on any travel website, or in the numerous travel guidebooks I own is this mentioned, which was surprising to me. The last thing my wife wants to see while she is doing her hair is me sitting on the toilet. (In fact I'm sure it's the last thing ANY sane person wants to see...) Maintenance service was poor as well. The first night, our A/C started some kind of vibrating hum that sounded like a cross between someone playing the same note on a bass guitar and a sick ghost. Fortunately it was not hot, so we just shut it off, and called in the morning. "Engineering" said they'd send someone up. We lived our lives that day, came back, and once again it woke us up. We shut it off again, called the next morning, and that day we received a nice note asking us to call the engineering department supervisor. We did that and he acted like he had no clue what we wanted, but promised he'd have someone right up to fix it. We wrote a note trying to explain what was happening, which we left on the thermostat (where they had put their note). Third night, same thing. We just gave up after that. Speaking of guidebooks, I was surprised at how high Caesars was generally rated for rooms. They cannot possibly take into account the average view. Caesars simply cannot compete with the other hotels, such as Mirage, Treasure Island, Mandalay Bay, etc. for quality of average room view. The cheapest place we have ever stayed in Vegas was the Boardwalk next to Monte Carlo, and the views out our window just blew Caesars away. The room was not as nice, but it was more than adequate (it had doors on the bathroom), and for much less than half the price, it was just better than Caesars (although the Boardwalk facility doesn't hold a candle to Caesars or any of the other mega-resorts). One of the people we went with on this trip was a "big-player" who was fully comped by Caesars with a free room, all their meals, etc. Yet his view was poor as well. This is a guy who Caesars knows, he's constantly offered freebies from Caesars and Harrahs, and he STILL got a nasty view. That is another reason I believe that Caesars just doesn't HAVE that many rooms with good views. This guy is rated on Blackjack at over $150 per hand and had 40+ hours on the table at Caesars in the 3 days he was with us. Of course, maybe at Caesars that is a "low-roller". I am working on him to take his business to Harrahs or another place, I feel fairly sure that he'll get treated better. Maybe you need to be one of those $5000+ per hand players (that I never saw) to get the good rooms at Caesars. I will typically bring anywhere from $5000 - $15000, but I think I must be too conservative to ever really get the "good" comp deals (although I do get an awful lot of mail from Harrahs/Rio). I guess I am telling you that if you think your "play" is going to get you a good room, be sure of that before you go. My other buddy was rated at $47 per hand for around 12 hours of play (plus a lot of video stuff), and they offered to knock $9 (nine dollars) off his room price, which they didn't even do when he checked his bill. So know what you are going to get before you go. Other places might give you a lot better deal for the same level of play than Caesars seems willing to do, I don't know. So in conclusion, if you want to stay in a world-famous, world-class resort, and are not concerned with a view, or privacy on the toilet, or responsive service for maintenance issues, Caesars is your place. The facilities in the casino are top notch. The decor and theming are fun and exciting. The employees are generally friendly and helpful, except when improving your room view. But perhaps they can't help that since they just don't have a lot of rooms with good views. The restaurants we ate in provided good service and good food, at a slight over charge, but generally were excellent. Their casino took our money, but they all are very good at that. Definitely a higher-roller casino, I felt more comfortable at Mirage or across the street (Barbary Coast, Flamingo, O'sheas, Harrahs, etc.). Overall, however, we were extremely disappointed, staying at Caesars was not at all what we had hoped. I am fairly certain we will be staying where we can have a better view next year. If you are going to Caesars, be really clear with them what your expectations are, and be sure that they can accomodate you. If they can't, spend your money in one of the many other mega-resorts. We now have 12 of them "under our belts", and Caesars was the most disapointing for us.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: smorela
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jan 4-7, 2005 and stayed in the Palace Tower. Nice room, but nothing spectacular. We've been to Las Vegas before and stayed at the MGM, Mandalay Bay, and The Lexor but this time chose Caesars Palace as this was where my husband would be attending a conference. While he went to the conference, I walked and walked; casino floor, forum shops, etc. One thing that struck me odd is that none of the staff smiled. Even when I made eye contact and smiled. One time I went to the consig. desk for assistance booking a bus tour to the Hoover Dam, and felt like I was more like a nusiance to them than a guest. That certainly didn't make me feel like a valued customer. I enjoyed the layout of the casino and figured out the exits/entrances so I could walk the strip with ease, too. Really enjoyed the central location. There was construction going on but I didn't even know it until I got on the bus to head to the Hoover Dam. It took forever to get out of that back drive and through the garage. When I got back I really wanted to take a nap, but housekeeping hadn't arrived and I didn't want to be woken in the middle of sleep, so watched some TV. By 4 pm they still hadn't come, so I wandered the halllway till I found a cart, then stood outside the open door till I caught the housekeepers attention to let her know we needed assistance. We had looked online for Celine Dion tickets before we arrived, and they started around $200 so we decided to skip that; but when we were there a friend said she got tickets under $100 at the box office, so we checked into it and did the same. The show was AMAZING. The only drawback is the drink holders don't hold cups well. The person seating guests kept saying, like a mantra, "hold on to your drinks, they don't sit well in the holder". Well, the guy next to me didn't speak english, and was a bit tipsy already, and spilt his drink right away and splashed some on me. You'd think when they built the place they would have figured out the small details, or at least once the problem was discovered, changed the shape of the glasses the beverages are served in. I loved the food I ate at Caesars, and loved the addition to the Forum shops since our last visit to Las Vegas. I was pleasantly surprised overall, as I had expected Caesars to be a dump just due to it's age, but it was far from it. My husband wants to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Choice”
Reviews.Author: sdjlindsay
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas about 20 times over the past few years, and my trip to Caesars in December '04 was one of the best. It was middle of the week, so they upgraded me to an open suite that could have housed a small family. The hotel is in the perfect location to explore the best part of the strip, and the sport book in Caesars is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “So caring and considerate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a rather unusual review but I had to rave about the service at Caesars Palace. My family (mom, dad, 2 small kids), actually stayed there in July of 2004. Unfortunately, the very first day of the trip, I became very ill. Upon arrival at the very convenient airport check-in, I was feeling very bad. I hoped that maybe lying down for a few hours would the trick. We had reserved a regular room in the Palace Tower but I asked for an upgrade and explained that I was feeling unwell and would probably be staying in the room more than anticipated. I got the upgrade and was also able to rent a motorized scooter to get to our room. Well, the mini-suite was absolutely gorgeous!! 2 bathrooms with sparkling gold fixtures and clean marble. Our two kids ran into the room and jumped on the beds screaming "we're rich, we're rich!!! Unfortunately, I did not begin to feel better. Caesars had a medical service where you could call and speak to a doctor and get medical advice. In the end, the doctor advised me to go to a hospital emergency room. Guest services sent 2 security people upto the room to escort me downstairs in a wheelchair. They then provided me with a free car ride to the hospital. Upon arrival at the hospital, the driver gave me a card with a number to call when I needed a ride to come back to the hotel! Unfortunately, that never happened as I was really deathly ill and had to eventually be medevaced back to NY (my hometown) to get treatment. Needless to say this was not the greatest vacation, but staying at Caesars made the trip as good as it could be. I truly believe they helped save my life. I have to go back soon and spend a proper vacation there. They were absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: pointedview
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas, and Caesar's Palace was a very good experience. From the convenient airport check-in and shuttle service to the marble-topped double vanity in the bathroom, the hotel offers many amenities. We stayed in the Palace Tower, which was the newest at the time of our visit. The room was clean and the bathroom spacious, with a jacuzzi tub and separate shower. Loved the tub; it was the perfect size for two adults. Every staff member we encountered, from cashier to bellhop, was friendly and efficient. Like most Strip hotels, Caesar's Palace is mammoth, and sprawls every which way. It can be a hike to get to parking, shopping, and the like, just because the place is so large, but from what we saw, that's true of most of the hotels in that area. One minor disappointment was Caesar's buffet, which is served in Cafe Lago. It's okay, everything tasted fine, but the assortment of options was fairly average. However, there are several fine restaurants in the Forum Shops area, so there's no need to stick with the heart of the hotel for food options. Another small, tiny quibble was the casino. Rather than stretching and sprawling around into the shops, I would have preferred for it to be more localized. They also didn't seem to have a poker room, like the Bellagio and some of the other casinos, but perhaps I missed it. However, I'm not much of a gambler, so the only reason for it coming up on the radar was that it made navigating that space to get to parking and such something of a nuisance. Perhaps the very best thing about Caesar's Palace is the location. If you stay here, you're in the heart of the Center Strip, close to key shows and attractions. I would have no problem at all with staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “les94111@yahoo.com”
Reviews.Author: jlatels
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Vegas and hit all the major casinos, including Caesars. The construction going on right now made everything a giant mess. While we got used to the long walks from parking lots to casinos in general, Caesars was like a marathon -- took a full ten minutes to get in the casino. The walkways also weren't clearly marked, and you're walking through a construction zone, so half the time you're afraid you're headed the wrong way. This casino was also the most difficult to find parking. We ended up having to go all the way up to level 7. Finally, it took us another 10 minutes to drive out of the parking lot, because of traffic. That plus the 10 minute walk and it took almost half an hour just to leave the casino!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars During CES”
Reviews.Author: tkhong
Reviews.Content: Just got back from CES, the biggest tradeshow in Vegas these days. Caesars was packed, but still great. We took an option to upgrade to a petit suite in the Palace Tower, newest one (though the new tower is getting close). The Suite was great, it had two bathrooms and a double shower that you could enter from either bathroom. Kind of different and fun. The jacuzzi tub was also huge. All the service was great, they went the extra mile to fix our high speed internet. Wish is was warmer, the pool looked amazing, but too cold to swim. The architecture is also amazing. Caesars isnt the best hotel on the trip, but it has an amazing location, with the Forum Shops attached and right in the middle of the stip. We loved our trip, though my wife still prefers the Venetian and I really want to stay at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Noble Guest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you book online with Caesars in any subsequent emails you are refered to as Dear Noble Guest & that's exactly how you are treated when you stay there. Apart from a few communication problems at the check-in desk (apparently English people from England are difficult to understand) it was a breeze from start to finish. We stayed here from Nov 2nd '04 to Nov 5th '04 & took a standard room in the Roman Tower. The view was obscured by the addition of another new tower (there's a lot of building going on around Caesars at the moment) but the sheer luxury of the room made up for that. Lots of space, great bathroom (check out the laser-strength, variable level water jets on the shower!) & a TV & phone on the bathroom too. Some good bars in Caesars too - the Shadow Bar & Seahorse Bar are particularly good. If you want to shop then Caesars is the place for you as the newly extended Forum Shops are spectacular. In terms of what was good to see & do in Vegas I'd recommend hanging out in the Fontana Bar at Bellagio to get a great view of the Dancing Fountains which seem to get better every year. A couple of friends went on the terrifying X-Scream ride at the Stratosphere but it was such a chore getting up there (the queue to go through security took almost an hour) that any enjoyment was short-lived. Went on a fantastic helicoper trip to Grand Canyon booked through Heli USA, organised through an agent situated between Bellagio & Monte Carlo. $289.00 got us a ride (including pick-up from the hotel) to the Canyon where we descended & landed at a working Cowboy Ranch. After a breakfast we were given the option to ride horses around a trail & then we were flown back via a fly-over the Strip. Whole trip took about 3 hours & was the highlight of the holiday apart from a trip to Club Paradise which is another story...!

Reviews.Title: “Can't see the problems myself”
Reviews.Author: tlj
Reviews.Content: 2nd trip to vegas, 1st in Caesars. Played the 20 trick like a pro and got jacuzzi room, strip view and gifts, and vip gold keys. Everything was clean, staff were great, even the engineer turned up 10 minutes after calling to change a lightbulb. Thanksgiving was a little busy for my tastes, but still got to eat where we wanted. Tried most of the resturants, all good. Room coulod be considered a little tired if i wanted to be ultra critical, but aprt from that, didn't see any of the issues everyone else is moaning about.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: DBW
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars from Nov 28th til Dec 2nd.We stayed in room 1249,it had a horrible view,the shower had no water pressure and the toilet backed up.The entire floor reeked of smoke and was just old.I thought this would be a step up from the Paris but it was not. We saw the new Cirque Du Soleil show KA and it was amazing.This time of year in Vegas you will need a winter jacket and hat it was cold.

Reviews.Title: “COULD HAVE BEEN BETTER”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars on Thanksgiving day because we had tickets to Celine, fabulous show. The room was not bad but when I opened the curtain all I could see was a big pipe and a lot of cement, not a good site at all so I kept the curtain closed. In the bathroom I kept hearing a banging out of the bathtub, I tried to keep the door closed so it wouldn't bother us too much but compared to the price we paid at the Venetian and the Paris I feel like we didn't get a very good deal here. It was nice getting ready to go out and being able to watch the little tv in the bathroom, but compared to the other rooms I would say this room doesn't even compare. The only explanation the girl at the desk could give for the banging was they are doing some remodeling, we were on the third floor, I feel as tho we should have been told prior about the remodeling and the pipe out the window. . I just don't think its a good way to introduce a new- comer to your hotel and it leaves me not interested in going back.

Reviews.Title: “we stay there every trip”
Reviews.Author: nurseteresa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Vegas. We have stayed at other hotels before, but not after we found Caesars. Yes it is getting older---aren't we all! The rooms were fine. It was a little late one day getting our room cleaned, so what, we are on vacation. Spent very little time in our room anyway. We went to the drag races one day. The highlight of my trip---I got to see Elton John!!! We had seats in row 10, which were fantastic. As I said, we stay at Caesars every trip to Vegas. They give us free nights, free food, and if we go in Oct. or Nov. we get a $200.00 gift certificate for my husband's birthday to spend on one meal---haven't accomplished it yet, 1st year spent $160.00 and this year $170.00. We like the old elegance of Caesars, nothing wrong with the newer hotels, just aren't our style. Someone in an earlier review remarked that there is nothing for children at Caesars. There are a few hotels that cater to children, stay at one of those. Caesars does not advertise that it is a family hotel, it is a casino and casinos are for adults!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: DrNeil
Reviews.Content: With dozrns of trip to Vegas under our belt, this was our second trip to Caeser's Palace and it won't be our last. We actually had our stay fully comped because of a mistake that was made at our wedding last year at Caeser's. They handled the mistake professionally and welcomed us back with four free nights in a small suite. They gave us a nice little gift in our room as well. We love the forum shops and the pool which is very elegant. The bell service and valets were superb.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: labo213
Reviews.Content: Caesars Palace was great! Petite suites are very nice especially the bathrooms . The maid services were excellent. We had a room on the 17 th floor the view was perfect. Caesars is all around great .

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Caesars”
Reviews.Author: Canuck74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Caesars for the Labour Day Weekend (9/3/04-9/6/04). We checked in at the airport, which was a breeze. Our room was average, but that is what we wanted and paid for. The room was clean and the maid service was prompt. The casino, the restaurants and the Forum Shops were excellent. Check out was even easier via TV. I've read several bad reviews of Caesars, and while I agree that some have probably had horrible experiences here, I just wanted to say that our stay at Caesars made our entire trip to Vegas that much more enjoyable. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: janed9388
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nites at Ceasars Palace, 16 sept. There were no checkin problems, no queue at all. We checked in at noon, and as our room wasn't ready (it wasn't supposed to be as checkin is not till 3 anyway) our luggage was stored and we got a key so we could go out to the pool and a number to call to check if the room was ready rather than having to walk back to reception. The room in the forum tower was great, not exactaly newly refurbed, but clean and huge (spa room), the jaccuzi was wonderfull. Couldn't work out why all the jets were at the "feet" end of the bath, but after a day walking up and down the strip it made far more sense. The cocktail waitresses were attentive, brought plenty of drinks even though we were mostly playing the 5c / 25c machines and the reception staff were very friendly and helpfull (my purse got stolen, not in the hotel, with all my ID and credit cards but they sorted everything out for me and were very attentive) Definately would stay here again. The negative reviews on this site had me worried, but if you are going soon, I wouldn't be at all concerned. The only thing that annoyed me slightly was the pool was closed one afternoon due to "inclement weather", OK so it was a bit windy, but it was still 90° plus. They should try UK beaches even in the middle of summer !

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Caesars is fun to gamble at, but the layout is very confusing. We stayed 3 nights and never could figure out where we were (yes, we were sober). The rooms were just OK. Checking in and out was a nightmare. We had to store our luggage upon check in and when we tried to get it out, it took over an hour to find. They never had enough people at the desk and they were in no hurry to speed up the process. I like to game here, but would stay other places before I returned here.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (we got married there) stayed at Caesars Palace from September 16-22, 2004. We had a great time! Everyone was so nice and helpful. I don't understand why people would complain about this place. Housekeeping was great, desk staff was great and so was our wedding coordinator. I would go back today if I could. They also have a wonderful selection of restaurants. This is a definite must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Caesars and had a wonderful time. Upon arriving we were upgraded to the Palace Tower (I don’t think they had any more rooms of lesser value, which worked out great for us). The room was great! My husband and I both loved the 2-person tub and we had a nice view of the pool. Check-in was fast. Staff was pleasant. We ate breakfast at the buffet and it was good but try the Paris it was incredible and I think it was a couple dollars cheaper. Gambling is expensive here unless you are a high roller but very easy to walk to another casino. My sister and her husband had tickets to Celine Dion the same night as the previous poster and they were very disappointed. Just wish she would of cancelled earlier in the day so we could of made other plans. I would highly recommend Caesars to anyone going to Vegas. However, if you have kids I would think about staying somewhere else as this is more of an adult hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! The best of the best!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip out west... We stayed at Caesar's 1 night. We (dh, me and our 2 year old) had booked into a Palace Tower room, a step up from the basic for our last night of our trip. We valeted our car very quickly. They bused our bags to our room without a hitch. Our check in was fast and easy. When we got to our room it wasn't clean... we called down, they apologized over and over and then re-booked us into a Petite Suite in exchange at no extra cost. Our first room was great but the suite was perfect!! We were thrilled. The crowds are a bit overwhleming and the gaming is a bit over our price range on the weekends (dh did win 7.50 on slots) but we enjoyed our room tremendously and the service was exceptional. We ate in the forum shops and had a wonderul meal at a good price. I then took the 2 year old back for a bubble bath in the whirlpool tub. He loved it, I loved it and the stand alone marble shower. Having 2 seperate baths was also great for me and dh in the morning. And the view!! We had room service for breakfast since our flight was so early. Service was prompt, food good.. I highly reccomend it. It wasn't that much more than a sit down place downstairs. The kinda corny kinda cute atmosphere is great. Caesar (a recording of him) calls you to give you your wake up call... dh got a big kick outta that. All in all... perfect. Loved it. I will stay at Caesar's again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fit for Caesar”
Reviews.Author: bigeasy41
Reviews.Content: Just got back from conference held at Caesar's Palace. It was excellent from beginning till end. The food and service were outstanding. When we checked in we found ourselves in a very beautiful room but we were above the nightclub so the music was loud in our room. Well, despite the fact that the hotel was very full they moved us into a luxury suite immediately at no additional charge. The pools are the nicest I have seen in Vegas as well. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor maid service”
Reviews.Author: jerzzgirl33
Reviews.Content: My husband tagged along with me to a conference I attended in Vegas. We figured while we were there that we'd get married. I loved the hotel - so big I just started to get the hang of it at the end of our week stay! The room was nice with a jacuzzi and mirrors on the ceiling. The maid service was not so good. One day they forgot to give us toilet paper another day it was towels. When we left to get married around 6:00 p.m. the room still had not been cleaned so we asked if they could come and do it. We got back after the ceremony and dinner around 11:00 and the room still had not been cleaned so we just asked for them to bring us up clean towels and toilet paper. Nothing like having to straighten up and make the bed on the night of your honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Must stay in Palace Tower.”
Reviews.Author: will_the_thrill
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. We stayed a Palace Tower room on a high floor overlooking the pool and the Bellagio fountains. We checked in at the airport and flashed the check-in person a $20 for this room request. She had to call a supervisor to grant our request, but believe me, a view of the Bellagio fountain from your room is awesome at night. Nothing like taking a whirlpool bath with your sweetheart and then kicking back and watching the show. The whirlpool bath is big enough for two normal sized people (I'm 6', and my wife's 5'7''). Overall, the bathroom is really nice. The room was pretty classy, too. We had trouble with the internet service (as did another reviewer). They sent a service tech up, but he couldn't get it to work either. A little frustrating, but I wasn't in Vegas to surf the net. I always wanted to say I stayed at Caesars, and I'm sure glad I did. I stayed at the Mirage a couple of years ago and it was nice too. But, Caesars is hard to beat if you get a good room. Oh yeah, I almost forgot. One downside is they are always doing construction work at Caesars. Which kind of stinks, but it wasn't that bad. I'm sure the old towers will go sometime soon and be replaced with a new tower. Then maybe they'll be done for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Words can't do it justice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Caesars as the first leg of our honeymoon recently. We found the whole experience of Vegas absolutely amazing, and staying at Caesars was at the heart of the stay. All the staff were helpful and corteous. We stayed in a "Deluxe Superior" room in the Palace Tower on the 24th floor. The room was beyond our wildest dreams. Great view of strip and pools. Spotlessly clean, with all the amenities you could imagine. I would recommend Caesars to anyone, as it made our honeymoon so very special for us.

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: DallasMatt
Reviews.Content: Lived in Vegas during the mid 1990's and thought CP was an old school dump then. Just returned from a 5 night business trip (50% work and 50% play) and found the updated CP to be outstanding in every way. Paid for an upgrade to the Palace Tower on check-in (at the airport) and was very pleased with the large room given. Staff, food, facilities, and pool are pure quality. From a person who stays in hotels 4-5 nights a week, this joint is a now a winner.

Reviews.Title: “We really will go back”
Reviews.Author: holidaymakeruk
Reviews.Content: This was our sixth visit to vegas in four years - we love it. We have tried to visit a different hotel on each occasion. We stayed at Ceasars from 5th- 12 the August and found it a wonderful experience. After reading some of the comments on this site I was concerned that we would find the staff, aloof/ unhelpful but we were more than happy with the service we received, and the room and facilities were superb. On booking in we were offered an upgrade to a suite which our budget wouldnt stretch to, however our receptionist kept looking and found us a mini suite that we could afford, so we accepted the offer and were not at all disappointed, in fact we couldnt take the grins off our faces for days. The pool areas were clean, quiet and relaxing and unlike most of the hotels weve stayed in the room was so quiet we could have heard a pin drop ( and this room was next to a lift) We also splashed out to see Elton John (even though hes much cheaper to see in UK) and again the experience was an unforgetable one. The show was simply fabulous - where else could you see people dance on the stage with Elton still playing his piano? The show is must to see!!!

Reviews.Title: “Caesars was fine - will go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caesars Palace in Vegas for 3 nights at the Palace Towers. Not sure what "the complainers" are talking about as we (2 couples) had a terrific time and were well treated. Not quite the panache of the Bellagio but more fun, exciting, and sexier than its neighbor. Palace Tower room was terrific, casino personnel were fine-my only complaint as a black jack player is the different rules at the lower stakes tables as the dealer must hit on a soft 17 (house edge)- house stays on a soft 17 at the higher limit tables. Pool areas were fun and not crowded-nice not having too many little kids around. Lots of well dressed, in shape couples in the 30-55 range. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay and had a great time! We've stayed at other hotels in Vegas before (MGM, Paris, TI, Luxor) and wanted to try Caesars this time. First of all, I wouldn't come and stay here if I had my son with us. (there's no arcade, pool doesn't have anything "fancy" going on for it). IMO, other hotels are better if you are bringing kids. But for us grownups, the pool was heaven to lounge by in the 111 degree sun. No problem finding lounges, etc. The whole hotel was not crowded this week at all. Non exsistent lines at check-ins, table games, and restaurants. Stayed in the Centurion Tower in a refurbished room. Did hate the fact that there was no fridge in the room, no ice available on the hotel floor and only 1 mirror in the room (over the vanity). Good location though. Got the layout of the hotel down very quickly and never felt lost or that I was walking football field lengths. We liked the buffet in the cafe. Had dinner there and really enjoyed all the entrees. Was it a big, giant impressive thing of beauty? No, but at 10PM for dinner for $20 is was just fine. This hotel has a great location and all of the employees we encountered were courteous and very helpful. Would we stay there again? Probably. Not because of anything negative, only because we like to experience different hotels and definitely not with our son.

Reviews.Title: “Never again . . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read all of the horrible reviews before we left, but I figured that some people are just never satisfied. How I wish I would have listened and made reservations at another hotel!!!! The airport check-in was awesome; however, we DID NOT get our non-smoking rooms as promised. Instead, we got two grungy, smoky rooms overlooking a parking garage. We asked to move and were told there were no other rooms (which we later found out was not true). My sister actually had an even worse experience than mine - - Even though she booked and paid for the same kind of room, she was initially put into a Forum Tower room with a view of a wall (literally). The beds were as hard as a rock. There was not even an icemaker on their floor and when they had to call room service to get some, they were treated like third class passengers on the Titanic. She finally called so many times, they moved her over to the Palace Tower on the second night. If you book it INSIST they give you a Palace Tower room. Other problems we personally experienced include the fact that the A/C was unable to get the rooms below 73 degrees, we had to stick our hands in the back of the toilet to get it to stop running after each flush, and they even forgot to put sheets on one of the beds one night!!! There were no hangers in the closet and no robes to use (usually provided in nicer rooms). We had a broken refrigerator, so they had plunked one down on the floor on top of a wet towel (YUCK!). The hallways were always littered with dishes, roll-away beds and food because the maid service rarely comes around. In case you're wondering, we stayed in a "Superior Deluxe" room in the Palace Tower. There was nothing superior about the accomodations. The pools were nice, but be careful if you have kids with you as there is topless bathing in the Venus Pool (hidden by a few potted shrubs). Please, please believe me when I tell you to stay at Bellagio or the Venetian. They are comparably priced yet they are so far superior it's not even funny.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fabulous, very child unfriendly! The room was beautiful and comfortable. We paid less than $100 per night - excellent value! The only negative was the staff. They were very unhelpful. Overall, a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “No problems here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 5 days at Caesars and we are very picky about cleanliness and relaxation on holidays! We found that five days are plenty if your just staying on the strip. There is always something to do and see and we always felt safe any time of the day or night! The only negative thing about the strip is the people handing out stripper cards and brochures at every corner and sidewalk (IMPORTANT TIP)...If your going to walk the strip during the day, you HAVE to wear light colored shorts and shirts that are breathable (Try Nike Dri-Fit or Underarmour-type clothing) We saw hundreds of people with black clothing and pants that were struggling with the heat and were sweating like pigs! I don't know how they do it!!! Don't even think about packing pants and long tops unless your are eating at a classy restaurant!!! We had no problems with this hotel! We stayed in Palace Tower with huge room, two beds, two sinks, jucuzzi tub, big closet, nice big windows and the works. View of pools and strip was great..(TIP - You have to ask for a high floor, non-smoking, and view of the strip or they won't offer) Otherwise, we would have been on 4th floor with no views). Shuttle to hotel was easy, as we were first to be dropped off! Check in was quick and easy. Very friendly at counter and even sent up a carepackage because it was our anniversary!..That is classy! Elevators were always fast, hardly no wait!...Pools - 4 nice sized pools with a lot of room and chairs. Lots of service people around to keep things neat (TIP - You have to be down there around 10am to get good layout spots).. This casino is huge and properly organized to keep you there and spending! Small coffee shops to eat breakfast/lunch and easy on your food budget! Cheesecake Factory is top knotch but be prepared to wait during dinner/lunch prime time! We ate at other places on strip, so I can't comment on their buffet! Forum Shops - Tons of "high-end" stores and novelty shops, but can be a little intimidating to go into!...Neat little attractions in Mall to keep you occupied if you don't shop! OUR TOP FOOD PICKS 1. C. Factory 2. P.F. Changs 3. Jimmy Buffet's 4. Bellagio Breakfast Buffet 5. The Steak House at T. Island OUR TOP ATTRACTIONS 1. Lion exhibit at MGM 2. Effel Tower 3. Pirate Battle at T.Island 4. People Watching on Strip! If your into shopping, Vegas is for you! There are 3 huge malls on strip! Fashion Show Mall is quiet, clean and safe! After reading many, many of these reviews, and now that we went there, we believe that: A) YOU CAN'T PLEASE EVERYONE. B)YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR. C) VEGAS ISN'T FOR EVERYONE!

Reviews.Title: “Great fun but a bit of refurbishment needed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 3rd time to Caesars. Stayed in a suite at the Palace Tower. Guess that its age is showing as the suites have 2 closets and sinks but only 1 large bath and rooms dont really compare that well to the newer hotels any more. They need updating and a bit of refurbishment. Shame that the new tower being built blocks the view of the Bellagio Lake now. Service though was excellent as always and the restaurants and nightlife inside are as good if not better than anywhere else. Little need to go out anywhere else in the evening. Also the layout of the hotel not being just 1 large football pitch like many are makes it far more interesting and atmospheric. Pools are lovely, although Cabanas at the Venus pool are poor quality. Good deal by using their internet booking. Value for money still excellent but 5 years ago they were the best by a long way, now its more of a lvel playing field.

Reviews.Title: “Get Ready for a long check in lines”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was just at a convention in Vegas and stayed at Caesar's Palace. We waited for 1 hour in line to get checked in at the front desk. I am sure it took some guest over 2 hours. They only had 12 front desk clerks checking in guests. They use to have 25 but reduced the number to 12 due to the construction. I was at another convention in Vegas in April at Mirage and check in was a breeze. Another real problem was none of the managers did anything to help. The maid service was also very slow. I heard some rooms were not cleaned until 6:00 pm! I am not sure how they are going to handle more rooms. I will stay somewhere else in Vegas next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “A greatplace to stay.”
Reviews.Author: hapf
Reviews.Content: People who are unhappy with Caesars did not do their homework. If you are bringing children, stay elsewhere such as MGM, Circus Curcus etc. If you do not have enough towels, housekeeping will bring you more than you need, provided you ask in a normal voice. Re buffets, research would tell you that Bellagio, Paris, & Aladdin have great ones, & they are in easy walking idstance. Caesars is large, & that is a great big positive, not a negative. It is a destination unto itself. I find the facilities excellent, employees helpful, & the restaurants fine. We were last there in Feb.04, & had no problems that were not easily solvable. The buffet was closed, but that was no loss. We go to Caesars every year, except when they were owned by Starwood, & will return in 2005

Reviews.Title: “great location & leave the kids at home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stop bringing kids to Vegas! The city has gone back to the original marketing campaign for adults. No arcade is one of the reasons that make this a comfortable atmosphere for kid-less adults. I told them in advance of my husband's birthday but they didn't give us anythying special, like an upgrade. We checked in at the airport at 10pm on 7/2/04, so I knew most of the "good" rooms would be given away by the time we arrived. The airport check-in made it very convenient. FYI- it closes at 11pm. We got a room in the old tower, but the room wasn't as bad as others on this website have made it seem. Bathroom was large. Room was large. I didn't require a jacuzzi so the lack of one was not a problem, but I was surprised at the poor quality of bath products. I was also expecting turn down service, or at least leave me a chocolate every night. In summary, the location was best for those who like to shop at the Fashion Mall, Desert Passage, Venetian, Bellagio, & Forum Shops. And it's convenient for those who go to high-end shows.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Care For It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I never stayed at the hotel but I have bet on horses in their sports lounge. It is about the best on the Strip. Eating a breakfast buffet is another matter. When you fill your plate there is no exit from the buffet line. You have to turn around and walk out the way you came in. It is usually crowded. The quality of the food does not make up for this inconvenience. The service is not good. If you want to eat a nice breakfast buffet on the same side of the street go to the Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: tweetyanr
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start to say everything that happened to us on this so much waited for vacation to Ceasar's Palace. My husband , my kids and I have been to Las Vegas 3 times before, but always stayed at the MGM so we decided to try Ceasars Palace. It was horrible. First, they have no entertainment at all for the kids. We felt horrible because my brother, his wife and their two kids also went. They have no Arcades, they have no place for the kids to hang out, so that the parents can play at the Casino. We had to reserve two rooms because they don't allows 5 people in a room so I asked for them connecting and my brother's room on the same floor. We get there and we have nothing, so they gave us a Penthouse Suite, big deal! They kept on mentioning that they had given us suites like if we cared, we just wanted our rooms after a five hour trip and be able to get unpacked. A suite with 2 bathrooms is great, but one bed doesn't really do much for a family of four and another family of five separated. 1 bed for my brother's family of four and two rooms for me. We couldn't unpack because the next day we had to get moved to another room. I got my rooms across from each other and of course my brother on another floor. Which he had to wait for his room because it wasn't ready. The pool was closed at 5:00. so that was another thing the kids couldn't do at night. We tried hanging out and just sitting in their lounge chairs and we got thrown out. The Restaurants were always full and extremely expensive. They have everything set up for people that are able to afford those prices (rich people), but don't they realize that rich people also have kids. The towels were hard, the pillows were too soft, the bathrooms need repair, the grout on them is all cracked and whenever you open the water faucet on the sinks the water goes all over the counter top because they were installed too far back.. It was a horrible vacation. We had better times at the New York New York, Excalibur and Mandalay Bay because they had things for the kids to do and better restaurants. I will never stay at Ceasars Palace again and whoever asks me I will thell them that it's not worth it. P.S. we had to pay a full day on a room since our flight left at 11:00 p.m. (you would think they wouldn't charge us since they gave us so many inconveniences) I kept one room and checked out the other and when we went to get in our room after being out the whole day the keys didn't work so we had to call security to come open the room for you. Also, you put the Do NOt DISTURB sign up and the maids take them off and go in your room anyways. So many other things happened but I just can't remember all of them. Alot of other things happen

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations! Excellent Customer Service!!”
Reviews.Author: AMIBeachGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesars Palace the weekend of July 2-5 and had a fabulous time! The hotel was beautiful (great location), the rooms were lovely, and above all the service was excellent! At check-in, when I presented my i.d. to the representative at the front desk, she immediately noticed my birthday was that weekend (without me mentioning it). She then took the initiative of sending me a complementary gift, with a personalized card. I was quite surpised as the gesture was completely unexpected. I was impressed with the attention to detail. Our room was in the Forum Tower (I was pleasantly surpised after reading previous reviews). The room was large and included plush velvet chairs and a generous bathtub. The pool area was beautiful and the hotel offered multiple restaurants and shops for every taste. The customer service at Caesars exceeded my expectations. We had a great time and look forward to visiting again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i absolutly LOVE caesars. we have also stayed at mgm(decent) and i am looking forward to staying @the rio next month. ( girls trip yeah!!!) let me say that our time at caesars was fantastic. check-in was a little long, however they totally took care of us with free drinks and were so friendly. the room was beautiful and very romantic with a huge roman style tub and mirrors on the ceiling(haha). the pool area was stunning and we even saw a wedding in one of the gazeboes ( this was January by the way) if i ever get married in vegas i would totally consider caesars pool. overall amazing time. our favorite so far. p.s. if you can, go see the shows . it really does make the experience. over the last 2 trips we've seen blueman group (interesting ) mystere & "O" both are so ..... I' cried both times. yes they are expensive but so very worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the stay at the hotel was wonderful we were upgraded to a mini-suite so that was a wonderful suprise we totally loved it. we dined at the buffet for lunch it was good but not much selection other than that it was great. very elegant I recommend you stay there. we were there from june 20-june 22. it is the best hotel we have stayed at in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Treated horribly”
Reviews.Author: cuteemt
Reviews.Content: We were sooooo excited to stay at Caesars and made our reservations in February for a May 30 very special one night stay. We had traveled from Baltimore to visit Arizona and our Las Vegas night was at the end of our trip. I can't describe the disappointment we felt when we arrived at the reservation desk and were told that those who were only staying for one night were being shuffled to another hotel since they were overbooked. I could not believe this could be true. I started to cry while others who were checking in for more than one night were cheerfully given their room keys. The manager was called to make her apologies, but it was more than obvious this was a very standard procedure at Caesars. They don't need to be kind or care about how disappointed you are since they have a booming business without providing true hospitaliity. The manager did offer to have us back at a later time and pay for our room ~ did she really think that would make everything alright? I had read Trip Advisor commentaries about this very thing happening never dreaming in a million years it would happen to us. I would really think twice about booking at Caesars. Yes, it is a big name and it has been on the strip forever, but if you read the Trip Advisor commentaries about this hotel or the comments in the Fodors or Frommers Las Vegas books, you will read about all the elaborate facilities, but rarely a good word about their service. On a positive note, we were moved to the Westin Hotel off the strip near Balley's. It was absolutely wonderful. Management greeted you while you were in line at the front desk and you were actually made to feel welcome. Our room was excellent and the beds are unnbelievable with pillow top mattresses and heavenly sheets and linens. p.s. Have dinner at Lowrey's Prime Rib Restaurant. There are only 4 in the US. This is the best restaurant I have eaten at in my whole life. The service and food are truly extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Pass”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the mediocre reviews. I do like airport check-in and didn't expect an upgrade or extras, so we were doing good so far. The room was even a nice size (bathroom, too..seperate tub and shower), but that was were it ended. No mini-bar. You had to pay to use the safe (like I hadn't given them enough of my money already). Small closet, and only three drawers (my closet wasn't in the bathroom, so I must have been in a different tower than the other reviewer). But, my bathroom didn't have a door. Nice! Didn't want to hear or see that (our friends room even had solid mirror on the back wall of their bathroom so if you accidently happened by while someone was in there...you saw everything (you could see the shower, the tub and the toilet by looking in that mirror). There was no counter space in the bathroom yet two sinks. No need for that at all. I would have liked to have been able to put my vanity stuff out, but had to dump it all in the second sink. Very odd layout. Must have been done by a man who doesn't need 16 things to get ready. The worst part was that we had only two towels, two washclothes and two hand towels when we first go there. Not a problem until the housekeeping department didn't replace them when they cleaned the room. Of course I didn't notice any of this until I was in the shower. My husband and I had to share a hand towel to dry off for the night. No wash cloth to wash my face. Not good. Called immediately after getting out of the shower for towels and they didn't come (apparently this is a regular occurance since the other reviewer noted the same thing). Finally they brought us 100 after our second irate call. Someone told me it was because I didn't leave a tip. But they cleaned the room immaculately. And it was our first night. I don't tip until I know my team is good enough to deserve one (i.e. the second night). Other hotels I've stayed at in Vegas clean the room and have turn down service to insure you have enough towels (this is a two shower a day town with the all the sweaty walking during the day and smokey environments at night...apparently the Caesars isn't aware of that). I've even stayed at other Park Place (now Caesars Entertainment) Hotels and they did a much better job. You would think they would have similar procedures. Other problems (one small breakfast restaurant for all those rooms...come on, do they not want your business). They forced us to eat elsewhere. The layout is horrible. Very choppy and confusing. Bally's/Paris (another CE property combo) is layed out so well, it was surprising. I'm sure it's only going to get worse with the new Forum extension and the new hotel tower. Then the pool. Though beautiful, we were turned away because it was full! OK, our payment included use of the pool but we couldn't use it. Not good. There was plenty of room, they were just out of chairs. We lied and said our party was already out there and they let us through (just use that line if you get stuck...tell them your party is out there and they have a pass for you...it worked for us). Apparently this happens all the time during peak times. Not good. Now they are building another tower. I'm sure the food and pool problems will only get better. Anyway. Stay somewhere else! This is the intersection to stay in, so I would choose Bally's/Paris. Bellagio is overrated. Not nice enough for the premium you have to pay. Not as interesting as Caesars and Paris. Plus Bally's and Paris are very easy to navigate (one main walkway connects the two). Stay at Bally's (it's cheaper and has bigger rooms that were renovated not that long ago) but eat/entertain at Paris. The Paris rooms are nicer overall, but you get a better deal at Bally's. And if the Paris lines are too long which I have never experienced but might happen (they have a buffet and a seperate sit down restaurant for breakfast and a seperate pastry area), just go to the Bally's breakfast restaurant. That's my two cents. Hope it helps. P.S. Not one person we told about our towel problems and other issues cared or apologized. That was two calls to the operator who was told both times. Two transfers to the head of housekeeping who was told. The Bellman who asked how our stay was and the Check out cleark who asked how our stay was. Not one of them said I'm sorry about that. The later just handed us a comment card. They really cared, can't you tell. They just want your money folks. We thought for sure that they might issue us a small credit on the room or something. Nope!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Barney
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at Caesars, stayed here for 2 nights 19/20th May - wished we'd had longer, but unfortunately couldn't afford to stay the weekend here as the rates jumped through the roof! We had an excellent room in the Palace Tower, double jacuzzi bath, separate shower, separate toilet and double his and hers sinks - the bathroom here was as big as some hotel rooms I've seen. The bedroom was spacious with an ok view (some construction work going on) but we had a side view of Bellagio Fountains and also view of the pools. There was a lovely floow to ceiling window which was great - I couldn't fault this place, didn;y try the buffet, but would recommend the cheesecake factory in the forum shops for quality and good value. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I can say is, I'm glad my husband's office paid for this hotel or I would have been more upset with everything. We stayed in February 2004 for five nights. When we first checked in at the airport, it took forever and nothing extra was offered. The other three parties checked in at the hotel and all three got upgrades on their rooms. Who wants to wait an hour to eat breakfast at the small buffet and pay $25 per person for it? There were only two places to eat breakfast in the whole vast openess of Caesars Palace, a buffet or pastries. You had to hang your clothes up in the bathroom, so if you didn't want them steamed every day, you had to hang them up on the lamp. I guess the only good thing about the Palace was the size of the rooms. I don't think I would go back even if the company was paying the bill.

Reviews.Title: “It's not all it's cracked up to be...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Vegas for years and I have stayed at lots of different hotels over the years. This is the worst place I have stayed at yet. The room was very old and outdated looking. The room (carpet/bedding) was dirty, dusty, and run down in general. The shower door had to be forced open and shut. Our view was of the parking lot. The ice machine on our floor was not working and I called the front desk the first day we were there, four days later it was still not working and management never addressed the issue. In addition, at 3:30 pm one day we returned to find our room had not been cleaned for the day, we phoned housekeeping to get towels. They never brought them, we had to go and find a maid to get towels ourselves. On day two of our stay, 2 of the 3 largest pools were closed at 1:30 to set up for a private party. The pools were packed and they forced everyone to crowd around the smallest pool. It was very crowded in as well as around the pool and everyone has to run to find a chair. I would not recommed staying here to anyone. In fact I am regrettful that I stayed for 4 nights and didn't check out after one.

Reviews.Title: “Everybody should see it once”
Reviews.Author: Scot_Wha's_Away
Reviews.Content: Tacky with class: if that's a tough one to define, visit Caesars Palace and all will become clear. From the ornate stone fountains to the sky-colored ceiling which changes with the progression of the day; from the faux Roman outside pools to the haggard old waitresses in skimpy Roman mini-skirts; from the cigarette puffing tourists throwing their holiday money on the gaming tables to the black stretch limos dispensing the serious players: it's breathtakingly awful, but it's SO well done. The rooms are big: ours had a jacuzzi (tacky) and a 26th floor view of the dancing Bellagio fountains next door (class). Breakfast is an ordeal because of the line outside the restaurant; it's not that there's a shortage of tables, but somehow the process of seating people is dreadfully inefficient. The food is excellent when you get there. As in all the Las Vegas casinos, the slot machines (2,000 of them in Caesar's) are ultimately a sad sight: hordes of women in their 50s and 60s dolled up in their Sunday best clothes hitting the Max Bet button again and again until, after a few glimmers of false hope in the form of minor paybacks, the meter runs out. That elusive $9,000,000 progessive jackpot remains, well, elusive. On the up side, those Roman pools I mentioned are huge and spotlessly clean, and there's no shortage of sunbeds around them. The Forum shopping mall has the best of brand names for those who still have money after the roulette. On the downside, the whole place is so big that it's totally impersonal; from the moment you wait in line at the row of desks marked Registration to the moment you wait in line at the separate row of desks marked Check Out, you're just another revenue source in a one-industry town, there to have your hard-earned cash teased from you at every turn. Everybody should experience Caesar's Palace once - you can't help marvelling at the scale, the ambition, even the sheer nerve of it all. But I'd be surprised if you come back.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: whiskeymittens
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here late July, 2003. We booked a Spa Room and were offered an upgrade to a Petite Suite at check-in (without even asking). The front desk people were extremely nice upon check-in and check-out. It was a fantastic room with a vew of the Caesar pools and Bellagio fountain. The bathroom was the nicest I've ever seen - his and hers with a glass shower in between. Marble everywhere. One bathroom had a bidet. The jacuzzi tub was more than big enough for both of us. The only thing I would improve in the room is that because it is SO LARGE it could have used some more furniture - maybe a small sofa. The luxuriousness of the hotel and the friendly staff have made loyal guests out of us. We will always try to stay at Caesar's when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth the wait”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a waste of time. My husband won a trip through our state lottery which gave us a 4-day, 3-night stay at Caesar's Palace. When we arrived at the hotel, we were told we had to wait for a room. I was amazed that each desk clerk was offering customers free upgrades and immediate access to their hotel rooms. We ended up waiting 5 hours to get into our room! The only upgrade we were offered was in a smoke-filled room for an additional $50 a night!! What a joke! In the time we spent waiting for our room, we were not allowed to get our luggage so we could change into cooler clothes or go check out the pool (since we had no room key!) One of the pools was even completely drained!! While waiting tirelessly for our room, we were told the room had recently been renovated. Another joke!! The ceiling in the bathroom had water stains all over it and the grout in the shower was cracked. The walls are so thin in this hotel, I didn't even have to turn the volume up on my tv -- the guy next door provided the audio from his tv just fine. I have to laugh thinking that the clerk told us our room was worth the wait since it was a "really nice room." This hotel is nothing more than a glorified mall and the entertainment they offer is overpriced as well. It amazes me that people shell out that kind of money to see overpaid celebrities sing a few songs!! All I can say is thank god that our trip was free. I could never see paying good money to stay at a hotel that sucked. If I ever have the opportunity to visit Las Vegas again, I would avoid Caesar's Palace altogether.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to Caesars??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow - Caesars Palace has went downhill the last 6 years. Their first mistake was building that huge arena for Celine Dion (Miss Pointy Chin herself) and taking up 25% of the casion space for that. Second mistake was keeping union waitresses that are old enough to be my grandma. Seeing some old bag come around the blackjack pits offering cocktails is not the Vegas image anyone has! Lastly, I don't know what happened, but the friendly dealers are all gone. It is a real chore just to sit there and play with these faceless, emotionless, robot dealers that they have now. I will never spend one more minute in this place. The owner's have ran it into the ground.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch In All Regards”
Reviews.Author: stevenap2000
Reviews.Content: Went to Caesars recently. I had been there a few years ago when the towers were going up. I have to say: Caesar's is back. As far as the whole package, I don't think anyone in Vegas does it better. (Have stayed in a number, but not all, of the big properties). Great choice of restaurants. (Incredible sushi bar!). Beautiful bars. As far as gaming, nice sports book, lots of machines. Not really a table player, but the quantity of tables is impressive. The service is great. Room in tower is clearly the nicest room I've ever had at a Vegas casino. By a mile. Had a jacuzzi, large shower, marble bathroom, etc. Although my birthday has passed, and I hadn't been there in 4 years!, the front desk sent up a small birthday gift. The outside pool area is really nice. I could stay at Caesars for days, and other than wondering the strip, would have no reason to go to another casino. I guess that's the idea. Bravo to the people running this joint. Classy, well run, and no need to go anywhere else. If Caesars doesn't do it for you, you just aren't a casino person. (Footnote: in reviewing reviews od casinos, please disregard the people who are angry the lost money, didn't get comped well enough, etc. Those are individual issues. Although comping is a whole separate topic, everyone loses money at casinos i the long run. Otherwise you wouldn't have $2500 worth on marble on your bathroom floor!)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought Caesar's was wonderful. I read everything I could about Vegas before I left and I think that helped a lot. We checked in to the hotel at the airport, which only had two other people in line. Arrived by shuttle to Caesar's and a Bellman took our luggage to a holding area because our room was not ready at 9:30am yet. We walked the strip and returned at 3 to pick up our keys. We stayed in the Palace Tower and the room was so gorgeous. I booked on-line for $125.00 a night and couldn't believe what a nice room we had for that price. From what I have read you should ask for a Palace Tower room. I did find some of the staff a little snobby but your at Caesar's where the "elite" are so I think it should be expected. Most other staff were friendly but did not go out of their way. It was difficult to find a cocktail waitress while at the slots. Only had one come up to us in 5 days. We spent most of our time outside the hotel checking out all the other hotels and casinos so it was all good. There is a lot of walking and distance to anything in Caesar's and most other hotels down there. If you know this before you go it's no big deal and should be expected. Same with the Buffet lines anywhere you go you will have to stand in line. I knew it, so we got there and stood in line sometimes we stood for 15 minutes and sometimes it was over an hour. All and all I loved Caesar's and would book it again at a good rate.

HotelInfo.Name: Caesars Palace
HotelInfo.Address: 3570 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109
